The lemon ricotta pancakes... mouthwatering.
moist, rich, slight hint of cheesy texture, slight sweetness from the lemon.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Lyn M.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Came to plow after a recommendation from a family member. I'm not a huge brunch/breakfast person, but I'd change my mind for Plow.

Getting there at about 8:30am on a Saturday, we waited a good 20 minutes to be seated. It's definitely busy, with crowded seating indoors and just a few tables outdoors. We didn't mind the wait - the weather was spectacular and the view was pleasant. There was no issue finding parking, and we had fun parking at a 90 degree angle to the street.

Servers are casual and attentive. There was overall a relaxed atmosphere. The coffee was wonderful. I had their Plow, scrambled eggs with chicken apple sausage, lemon ricotta pancakes, and crispy potatoes. I personally wasn't a huge fan of the sausage, but my husband loved it. The scrambled eggs were cooked appropriately, but nothing really to write home about. Their big 5-star review items are the crispy potatoes and the lemon ricotta pancakes. The potatoes are perfectly crisped and salted, very hearty. The lemon ricotta pancakes... mouthwatering. moist, rich, slight hint of cheesy texture, slight sweetness from the lemon. This place gets 5 stars for that alone!

To top it off, the restaurant derives its products from local markets and farms, which i LOVE. There's nothing like supporting your local farmers. Their menu changes daily, so be aware that they may not have the same thing two days in a row.

excerpts: I ordered the plow that came with lemon ricotta pancakes, sausage patty, over medium eggs, and the plow potatoes.
We got to see how everything was made and were anxiously waiting for our food to come.
Let me first start off by saying, everything tasted so fresh and delicious, that I am currently drooling while typing this review.
Everything was perfect!
The potatoes and pancake were my favorite.
The potatoes were nice and crispy and had a really nice flavor to them.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Lisa H.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
This place is the best place to get brunch while in the city. I always wanted to try this place but I always see a long line and sometimes the wait can be 1-2 hr wait. So finally one day, my bf and I have decided to wait it out and see what they hype was all about. When we got there on a Wednesday around 11am, we only waited about 20 mins before getting seated. I sat at the counter with my boyfriend and we had the best view in the restaurant. I ordered the plow that came with lemon ricotta pancakes, sausage patty, over medium eggs, and the plow potatoes. We got to see how everything was made and were anxiously waiting for our food to come. Let me first start off by saying, everything tasted so fresh and delicious, that I am currently drooling while typing this review. Everything was perfect! The potatoes and pancake were my favorite. The potatoes were nice and crispy and had a really nice flavor to them. The pancakes were very soft and flulffy!

It is a lot of food for one person but I couldn't put my fork down! This is a really great place for breakfast and lunch. Definitely come here early to avoid a long wait. Service is pretty good here too, the waitress is attentive and refilled our waters when empty. Will come back again and try their other items.

excerpts: And don't even get me started on the lemon ricotta pancakes.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Jennifer K.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
I remember adding Plow to my Yelp bookmarks about a year ago, and laughing at this photo: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/plow-san-francisco?select=AQQHQEMRFHofOnyRFOBWCA&utm_campaign=www_photo_share_popup&utm_medium=copy_link&utm_source=(direct)

"Silly San Franciscans," I thought. I mean, brunch is great and all, but I wouldn't think twice before opting out of a rain-soaked meal.

Then my boyfriend and I went to Plow this past weekend. Waited 2 hours in line. (Actually, drank coffee and read magazines at Farley's down the street to help pass the time.) Was finally seated! And ordered the following:

+ Buttermilk biscuit with honey butter
+ The Plow
+ Fried egg sandwich with bacon and avocado

IT WAS ALL DELICIOUS. Usually, I find brunch spots specialize in making one item their "thing," but everything we ordered was incredible. The buttermilk biscuit was crunchy on the outside, and the honey butter that came with it? I'd bathe in it, if I could. The Plow potatoes were ORGASMIC. (I usually hate using this word, but I don't know how else to describe those taters.) The house made pork sausage patties were as flavorful as a mudder fudger. The fried egg sandwich was a no brainer. And don't even get me started on the lemon ricotta pancakes.

And, the staff was great! The host didn't even get annoyed that we switched back and forth between indoor seating and "first available" three times.

So, yeah. I'll be back... with an umbrella and raincoat, if necessary.

excerpts: The lemon ricotta pancakes are as good as everyone mentions in their reviews.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Marc H.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
This might be my favorite breakfast/brunch place in SF. I've been here a couple times, and it does not disappoint. Although many of the reviews comment on how long the wait typically is, if you go during the week, the wait is not nearly as long (I've never had to wait over 15 min which sounds crazy compared to what most reviews mention). However, it is still very crowded even during the week day, so expect to wait a little bit and make sure your entire party is present. 

Parking is essentially just street parking around the area. As expected, it can be a bit tricky in SF some times, but there usually seems to be spots relatively close by.

They have indoor and outdoor seating, with a nice comfortable feel to the interior. Seating is a bit cramped inside, but doesn't feel uncomfortable. Although there is only one bathroom, it is nice that it is clean and tidy.

The service was very friendly from the moment we walked in to our actual table service. 

Like many others, I have had the plow. The portion size is pretty generous. The lemon ricotta pancakes are as good as everyone mentions in their reviews. The plow potatoes are also nice and crispy and well seasoned. I also had the chicken apple sausage, which was another plus to this dish. 

We also had the french toast, which was surprisingly thick yet cooked nicely all the way through. The strawberries were fresh and, when topped with the syrup, was a perfect sweet start to the day.

I've also had the breakfast sandwich which was also delicious. Adding the bacon to it made it even better (obviously!). 

All in all, great breakfast/brunch place in SF. Be prepared to wait (especially if you go on the weekend), and it is a little pricey, but the food, service and ambiance will not disappoint!

excerpts: Homemade sausage patties, scrambled eggs, lemon ricotta pancakes and crispy smashed potatoes with rosemary.
It was worth the wait.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Michael C.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: I visited this place on a Saturday morning around 10:30am. Wow, the wait was long...1.5 hours long. The weather was nice that day so standing around wasn't an issue. Once seated I ordered coffee and The Plow for an entree; it was delicious. Homemade sausage patties, scrambled eggs, lemon ricotta pancakes and crispy smashed potatoes with rosemary. It was worth the wait.

excerpts: The Plow which comes with two eggs (over medium for me), potatoes (which are REALLY good, by the way), two lemon ricotta pancakes (which are amazing!) and a choice of their housemade sausages or bacon ($16.50).
My friend got the salmon benedict ($18)with potatoes, and we shared two pieces of their french toast with carmelized apples and mascarpone ($11.50)
Fluffy, I have to admit!
I would come back for their lemon ricotta pancakes for sure!
Their brunch is a little on the pricey side of things, but it's worth trying.
I pretty much stayed full for the rest of my day.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Kathleen S.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Lately my best friend and I have been on a brunch craze and I've been wanting to try this place. We finally did!

I have known this place to be somewhere with a good hour or so wait especially on weekends. A popular thing people seem to do is put their name on the waitlist, and then wander off in the neighborhood for some coffee or pre-brunch snack. We waited about an hour and a half for a table inside. Due to high demand, it's possible you will be seated at a "community" table. Make friends with strangers, woohoo!

Now onto the food, it seems they change their menu based on what's available during the season and what is popular. I got The Plow which comes with two eggs (over medium for me), potatoes (which are REALLY good, by the way), two lemon ricotta pancakes (which are amazing!) and a choice of their housemade sausages or bacon ($16.50). My friend got the salmon benedict ($18)with potatoes, and we shared two pieces of their french toast with carmelized apples and mascarpone ($11.50) Fluffy, I have to admit! All in all, the food is delicious and filling. 

I would come back for their lemon ricotta pancakes for sure! Their brunch is a little on the pricey side of things, but it's worth trying. I pretty much stayed full for the rest of my day.

excerpts: I was able to try the lemon ricotta pancakes and thought they alone would make for a very satisfying breakfast.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Harry S.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Heard good things about this place from a friend living in SF. 

I thought I would try it out on a Monday morning and there was STILL a line here. Luckily we were okay with sitting outside and did not have to wait for a table for two. They also provide throw blankets when it is colder outside. 

We ordered the steak and eggs, plow breakfast and a side of Hong Kong toast. 

My steak was good, but THOSE POTATOES. So delicious, especially with a little spicy ketchup. I thought the meat was a little overcooked from the medium rare I ordered but tasty nonetheless. The side of Hong Kong Toast was a must order for me as I love condensed milk based desserts. I was able to try the lemon ricotta pancakes and thought they alone would make for a very satisfying breakfast. 

If you can get here and not wait too long then I think you would be very satisfied with your meal. If the wait is 1 hour + I think you might be better off going somewhere else. This is not to say the food isn't excellent and worth the expected high prices, but I just on principle don't wait an hour or more for food.

excerpts: We shared the lemon ricotta pancakes, it was over hyped for me wasn't bad, but wasn't as good as I had expected.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Stephanie L.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
I really enjoyed Plow for brunch. Now that wait can be quite disappointing, especially since there's not much you can do around there to kill time. I brought my dog out that day and since the wait was 45 mins and we told them inside or out, whichever was first available was fine with us. Since we had time to kill, we took the pup to a dog park near by in dog patch area. But I hear there's a coffee shop not too far. We came back just in time and our table was ready as they quoted around 45 mins. 

I got their fresh squeezed orange juice. yummmmm, very refreshing. I ordered their fried egg sandwich, really good. The egg was perfectly cooked and runny. It was kinda messy, but delicious. The bf got the crab scramble which he really enjoyed. We shared the lemon ricotta pancakes, it was over hyped for me wasn't bad, but wasn't as good as I had expected.

Now the highlight, why it's really worth the wait. Their potatoes, those CRISPY POTATOES. Nice crispy on the outside and fluffy potato goodness on the inside. They come out real hot too. I LOVE POTATOES and to me, they're definitely worth the wait.

Service was decent. Didn't have anything to really complain about. Food came out a bit slow.

excerpts: You get two eggs, crispy potatoes, chicken sausage, & lemon ricotta pancakes.
The potatoes are so good!
Perfectly crisp and seasoned with salt and rosemary.
It went well with the runny egg yolks and chicken sausage.
But I was surprised at the lemon ricotta pancakes.
I'm usually not a lemon-flavored pastry type of person but the pancakes were so fluffy from the ricotta and refreshing and light from the lemon.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Ralph N.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Plow has been on my "bookmarked" list for quite some time. I've been wanting to go here for so long but I always end up backing out due to the long line. But there's something so catchy about Plow that further ignited my curiosity. Number one...long lines. Number two...great reviews. And number three...the pictures on Yelp look amazing!

Finally I was able to pay a visit with a few friends from SoCal after picking them up from a 7am bus ride from LA. Since we were there around 7:30am, we were seated very quickly. It wasn't empty...but wasn't packed either.

Ambience: Very relaxed. It's like waking up and stepping into a friend's kitchen while being strikened with a whiff of bacon and eggs cooking in the background. It's not huge but just right. I love how the tables are wooden...it provides the perfect touch to my pics for Instagram and Yelp lol.

Food: So many choices to choose from! I wanna try the Corned Beef Hash, the Egg Sandwich, and the Crab Scramble on my next visit.  But for starters, I had to get "The Plow". What a huge serving! You get two eggs, crispy potatoes, chicken sausage, & lemon ricotta pancakes. The potatoes are so good! Perfectly crisp and seasoned with salt and rosemary. It went well with the runny egg yolks and chicken sausage. But I was surprised at the lemon ricotta pancakes. I'm usually not a lemon-flavored pastry type of person but the pancakes were so fluffy from the ricotta and refreshing and light from the lemon. I think they used just the lemon zest because they seemed perfumed with a lemon essence that I fell in love with.

Overall Plow is a great place for breakfast. It's a little small so it's intended for smaller groups. Parking isn't too bad either...primarily residential parking spots. Just be patient and you'll eventually find one. I'll admit it's not the cheapest breakfast spot but it's totally worth every penny. I can't wait for my next visit.

excerpts: My boyfriend and his sister each ordered "The Plow," which came with 2 eggs, 2 lemon ricotta pancakes, plow fried potatoes and sausage.
You can choose between chicken apple sausage, pork sausage or bacon.
I can't recall what sausage they chose, but I do remember it having a bit of a spicy kick to it.
The lemon ricotta pancakes tasted a little much like a cookie to me..
I will probably try their featured pancakes next time.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Kate A.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
This is the cutest little breakfast cafe! They seem to always be busy and I'm not sure if they take reservations, so be prepared to wait about 15 minutes or so. The wait is worth it, I promise! 

I had the soft scrambled eggs with oyster mushrooms, goat cheese plow fried potatoes, toast AND bacon. This entire plate of deliciousness for less than $15 and washed down with an equally delicious coffee. 

My boyfriend and his sister each ordered "The Plow," which came with 2 eggs, 2 lemon ricotta pancakes, plow fried potatoes and sausage. You can choose between chicken apple sausage, pork sausage or bacon. I can't recall what sausage they chose, but I do remember it having a bit of a spicy kick to it. The lemon ricotta pancakes tasted a little much like a cookie to me..I will probably try their featured pancakes next time. When we went they were pumpkin pancakes, and had I the room, I would have ordered them as well.

My coffee cup was always as full as the tummy I left with. Great, friendly service. I will definitely be back to try more items!

excerpts: The lemon ricotta pancakes were not fluffy or good.
The eggs were unseasoned.
To be honest, the best part of the dish were the potatoes which were not even that good.
I felt like I wasted my money and time.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Cynthia L.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: I was extremely excited for this place and I couldn't stop looking at the pictures on yelp. My friends and I came here on a Tuesday and we waited close to an hour for a table of 3. The hostess was also rude and the vibe we got from her was kind of snobby. Once we got seated we were served fairly quickly. We all ordered the The Plow and got our food in about 15 minutes. Right away we noticed that the portions seemed way smaller than in the pictures from previous yelp reviews which was annoying cause the entree was $17. The lemon ricotta pancakes were not fluffy or good. The eggs were unseasoned. To be honest, the best part of the dish were the potatoes which were not even that good. I felt like I wasted my money and time.

excerpts: The food came out: we ordered lemon ricotta pancakes, a breakfast sandwich and French toast.
All of the food items were awesome!
I couldn't stop eating.
If I were to go back I'd order the same items again!
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Anonymous T.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Amazing place! Went for a run from twin peaks to plow, the wait was about 1hr40 min, which is typical. The hosts were cool, they put up with "mr questions"(me)... 

Finally grabbed a seat next to this really eurotrashy group, who tried seating 5 at a 4 top...(trump executive order?)...one of the members got kicked out for being trumpy towards one of the busboys. 

The waitstaff was awesome and I felt bad they had to deal with such rude patrons. 

The food came out: we ordered lemon ricotta pancakes, a breakfast sandwich and French toast. All of the food items were awesome! I couldn't stop eating. 
If I were to go back I'd order the same items again!

excerpts: The plow was the perfect dish for breakfast: 2 eggs, plow potatoes, and 2 mini lemon ricotta pancakes.
If I were to go back again and get a dish solely for me, I would get this.
The eggs were cooked perfects, the potatoes were just the right amount of crispy and had great seasoning, and the pancakes were soft, fluffy and just melted in your mouth.
If you can't tell already, order this dish!
There's definitely a reason it's named after the restaurant itself.
The summer melon salad was beyond fresh and tasty.
It had many crunchy melon pieces alongside lettuce, onions, cheese, and corn.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Malika R.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
It's no joke that you usually have to wait 1.5-2 hours to get a spot at this small but delicious brunch spot in potrero. It's just something that most San Franciscans do on a weekend morning, wait in line for one of the famous brunch places in the area. I've done it before and I'll do it again - although the wait seems far too long, Plow is mouth-watering good! 

Right on the 2-hour mark, our name was called and we were so excited to finally sit down and eat! For 3, we ordered the plow (they substitute avocado instead of meat if you're vegetarian), summer melon salad, almond flour pancakes, and the cornbread muffin. It was a LOT of food! 

My favorites were the plow and the summer melon salad. The plow was the perfect dish for breakfast: 2 eggs, plow potatoes, and 2 mini lemon ricotta pancakes. If I were to go back again and get a dish solely for me, I would get this. The eggs were cooked perfects, the potatoes were just the right amount of crispy and had great seasoning, and the pancakes were soft, fluffy and just melted in your mouth. If you can't tell already, order this dish! There's definitely a reason it's named after the restaurant itself. The summer melon salad was beyond fresh and tasty. It had many crunchy melon pieces alongside lettuce, onions, cheese, and corn. I loved the combination of all these ingredients, but this is probably a supplement to your meal, I don't think this would fill you up.

The almond flour pancakes were just ok - they tasted more like regular pancakes to me and there wasn't really anything special about them. Same goes for the muffin, we honestly just ordered this because they told us they were running out of them and there was only a limited quantity so we had some high hopes. I didn't really like the texture of the muffin and the taste was just ok as well. 

Service is great even though they're busy for at least 7 hours straight (7am-2pm). If you're willing to wait, go here! It's some good quality, hearty, delicious brunch food. I wish there was a shorter wait so I could keep going back again and again.

excerpts: Incredible lemon ricotta pancakes, flaky biscuits, solid bacon and sausage as a unique French toast made for one of the best breakfasts I've had.
I hope to return next trip to the Bay Area.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Liam H.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: Incredible lemon ricotta pancakes, flaky biscuits, solid bacon and sausage as a unique French toast made for one of the best breakfasts I've had. I hope to return next trip to the Bay Area.

excerpts: The lemon ricotta pancakes were delicious and had the perfect texture.
The potatoes were super fried and seasoned well, really tasty.
Overall, great food and friendly service.
Is it worth the 1+ hour wait?
I'm not sure...

The place is small, quaint, and very clean.  Service is friendly and efficient.  Love, love, love this place!

Will hopefully be back soon
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Jessica E.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Brunch is a meal I often dream about. That's when I knew I had to check out this popular brunch place. I came in during a weekday, to avoid the weekend rush, and only waited 10 minutes for indoor seating. The place is pretty small and our tavle of three had to squeeze into a table set normally for two. After glancing over the menu, I ordered the Fried Egg Sandwich because eggs are egg-celent in my book. The other two ordered the Plow and the Dungeness Crab Omelette. The food took a while to come, around 15-20 minutes. Nevertheless the presentations were nice. We ended up sharing a majority of our dishes.

I ended up really liking my dish. The egg was warm and runny and the bread had a soft, crunchy texture. However, the best component of my dish were the house potatoes.  Mmmm... mouth watering and crispy, a reminiscent of french fries. These potatoes were out of this world!

In regards to the other dishes, I didn't really like the omelette  and the Plow was good but not spectacular. I really enjoyed the lemon ricotta pancakes. Overall the food impressed but was a little on the pricy side.  Good thing everything came in big portions! Will hopefully be back soon

excerpts: The lemon ricotta pancakes were good
but I think I was a little too full to enjoy them as much as I should have.
I probably wouldn't order the sausage again.
Highly recommend coming here if you have two hours to kill for breakfast!
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Karen L.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Brunch in San Francisco is the best and Potrero Hill has the best parking in all of San Francisco. I found an unmetered street parking spot within a few minutes of spotting the restaurant. 

The wait for breakfast early in the morning on the weekend was one hour but it was worth it. I ordered The Plow and the eggs and potatoes were my favorite parts of the dish. Best eggs and potatoes I've ever eaten! The lemon ricotta pancakes were good but I think I was a little too full to enjoy them as much as I should have. I probably wouldn't order the sausage again. Highly recommend coming here if you have two hours to kill for breakfast!

excerpts: It consists of eggs, a meat, potatoes, and lemon ricotta pancakes.
Te best part of the dish was the lemon ricotta pancakes!!
So moist (I hate that word but had to use it) and delicious!
I selected the house made sausage...definitely a winner!
Try this even if you don't like sausage!
The potatoes were perfectly seasoned and crispy.
I could have an entire plate of this.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Alysa N.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
This is probably one of the best breakfast/brunch places in SF. I got here around 740 on a Saturday and was seated immediately when they opened. Keep in mind, I was maybe 10th in line and there was a huge line behind me before 8AM. 

The coffee was just okay. Nothing too special. I ordered the Plow breakfast. It consists of eggs, a meat, potatoes, and lemon ricotta pancakes. Te best part of the dish was the lemon ricotta pancakes!! So moist (I hate that word but had to use it) and delicious! I selected the house made sausage...definitely a winner! Try this even if you don't like sausage! The potatoes were perfectly seasoned and crispy. I could have an entire plate of this. It was a very large plate overall but totally worth the money! 

I'll be back to try more items.

excerpts: Both my friend and I ordered the plow which consisted of a choice of meat, 2 lemon ricotta pancakes, two eggs, and crispy potatoes.
Let me just say, the wait is totally worth it.
My friend and I felt indifferent about the meat (she got the chicken apple sausage
and I got the homemade pork sausage).
I thought the sausage was kind of dry and was over it because everything else on the plate shined brighter.
The pancakes are sooo good.
They are cakey and moist, and just heavenly.
The potatoes, were some of the best potatoes I have ever had.
They were super crispy and seasoned well.
I recommend getting the crispy potatoes and lemon ricotta pancakes; they are just out of this world!
I recommend getting the crispy potatoes and lemon ricotta pancakes; they are just out of this world!
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Vivian Y.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
I have been waiting to try Plow out because of it's ratings and reviews here on Yelp, and the fact that I have seen the name in numerous sources. Came to Plow on a saturday morning with my friend. We decided to brunch and catch up before she headed back to school. We waited a good 2 hours before we were finally seated, so either bring something to do, or get ready for some good conversations with your group. 

Ambiance/ Appearance:
Plow is located in Potrero Hill and it felt very hipster and homey. Plow is on the corner, which is a good thing because it needs all the waiting area space it can provide. There is a few tables of outdoor seating on the side of the restaurant. Inside, there aren't too many tables, so most likely you will have to share with others. There was a slight rustic feel inside, but it felt very lively because of the music and background conversations. 

Service:
The service is excellent. Servers and staff are super nice and made sure you felt comfortable.

Taste: 
Both my friend and I ordered the plow which consisted of a choice of meat, 2 lemon ricotta pancakes, two eggs, and crispy potatoes. Let me just say, the wait is totally worth it. My friend and I felt indifferent about the meat (she got the chicken apple sausage and I got the homemade pork sausage). I thought the sausage was kind of dry and was over it because everything else on the plate shined brighter. The pancakes are sooo good. They are cakey and moist, and just heavenly. The potatoes, were some of the best potatoes I have ever had. They were super crispy and seasoned well. It had some shallots or onions and other herbs. 

With tax and tip, I think it came out to $20. Overall the food was bomb dot com! I would totally return again (but probably not on a weekend or at later times in the day to avoid the wait). Even with the wait, it is totally worth trying out. I recommend getting the crispy potatoes and lemon ricotta pancakes; they are just out of this world!

excerpts:
Food:
-Ordered the Plow breakfast which comes with lemon ricotta pancakes, your choice of protein, potatoes, and eggs.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Chhaya N.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Let's start off by saying the Plow potatoes were by far my favorite part of my meal. 

Food:
-Ordered the Plow breakfast which comes with lemon ricotta pancakes, your choice of protein, potatoes, and eggs. I also ordered a rolled Jasmine tea.

The portion size is huge, so I couldn't finish everything but that works if you'd like some leftovers.

Atmosphere:
-The place is well decorated meaning colors are soothing and match the wood theme throughout the place. 

The music is a little odd. Blend of house and jazz. 

Parking:
-There are side streets to park but no parking lot that belongs to the restaurant. 

Wait times:
-The place is small so be prepared to wait. Especially on the weekends. They have small benches to sit on outside while you wait so you won't have to stand. 

Cleanliness:
-The place as a whole is very clean, including the restroom. However there is only a single stall for both men and women. 

Overall a great brunch place.

excerpts: Came with 2 eggs, 2 lemon ricotta pancakes, potatoes, and choice of meat.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Aerin Y.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
DEFINITELY got lucky. Among ~10 breakfast spots in the city, this was our pick. And we left satisfied. 

Came on a weekday @1PM and there was only a 15min wait. Easy...we went for a walk and checked out the shops in the vicinity. Table was ready in no time. (~10 tables, half indoors/half outdoors)

We got the Plow so we could try a little of everything. Variety is the spice of life and all that shizz. Came with 2 eggs, 2 lemon ricotta pancakes, potatoes, and choice of meat. Not bad for $16!

So the food...Let's start with the NEGATIVES. 1. Compared to the banana pancakes at Bill's Cafe in SJ (A+), the pancakes are on the smaller side. And as we all know, #biggerisbetter...always. BUT if you're #qualityoverquantity, flavor is just right...enough lemony goodness without being overpowering.

2. Baked goods were all out by the time we got there. +They must be damn delicious! -Get there early (definitely before noon)

The POSITIVES. The eggs were perfect..let's be real, it's hard to get eggs wrong. Potatoes were nice and crispy. Now the meat. For all you meatatarians, if you're not a bacon lover, please do yourself a favor and go with the pork sausage. I love me some bacon but after tasting my sister's pork sausage, I spent the whole meal secretly wishing I could steal her plate. Don't make the same mistake.

Overall, a memorable breakfast. I'll be back!

excerpts: -Get the lemon ricotta pancakes!
Do not get them in a combo because it won't be enough!
Get a whole plate of these bad boys!
-The tomato sandwich was BOMB.
The tomatoes were so good they were practically sweet!
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Vivian C.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
SERVICE//
Three words: Randall is awesome. 

AMBIANCE//
-This place is tiny. There is outside seating and indoor seating. Inside there are only about six tables. I personally preferred indoor seating because outdoor seating is next to everyone who is waiting and the food gets cold faster!
-We waited for 1.5 hours. Make sure your entire party is there!
-There are some cute seats along the restaurant for people waiting, but definitely not enough for the huge crowd.
-There is only ONE single stall UNISEX bathroom. That is not enough for this restaurant! Especially with the long line. You have to eye the bathroom like a hawk in order to get in there and its behind this weird curtain. 

FOOD//
-Free coffee while you wait, with cream and sugar in super cute cups! That's so nice! But the wait is super long. 
-Get the lemon ricotta pancakes! Do not get them in a combo because it won't be enough! Get a whole plate of these bad boys!
-The tomato sandwich was BOMB. The tomatoes were so good they were practically sweet!
-Everything else was pretty standard. 

I like this place. But, I almost thought that I was at Kitchen Story, the set up is VERY similar: street corner at the bottom of a steep hill, long line, great for breakfast/brunch. Kitchen story has an Asian flare, with its millionaire's bacon and fabulous french toast. I hope that Plow can give Kitchen Story a run for its money, especially now that this area in SF is getting more developed. But, like everything else in SF this is steep, total $70 for three people.

excerpts: I had the plow which included potatoes (a bit overfried and standard tasting), eggs (scrambled done perfectly) chicken sausage and lemon ricotta pancakes.
The lemon ricotta pancakes are the most delicious thing I have ever tasted.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Sarah S.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Simple. Carefully made. Local.

First time to Plow with colleagues. We started with a round of grapefruit mimosas. They were fantastic and don't skimp on the champagne.

We shared a biscuit with homage butter and it was to die for. I could make a meal of those biscuits.

I had the plow which included potatoes (a bit overfried and standard tasting), eggs (scrambled done perfectly) chicken sausage and lemon ricotta pancakes.

The pork sausage is way better than the chicken.

The lemon ricotta pancakes are the most delicious thing I have ever tasted. Next time I'll get those with a side of sausage.

Service was good. Menu was delightfully small. Wait on a Friday morning was pretty long. Get in early.

excerpts: The lemon ricotta pancakes are solid (though not the best I've ever had) and the potatoes and crispy and delicious.

The lemon ricotta pancakes are solid (though not the best I've ever had) and the potatoes and crispy and delicious. If you want to put you name down on Sunday morning, then go get mimosas elsewhere for two hours, I say go for it. Or you are one of those people I envy that can "brunch" on a Wednesday (I hate you), also go for it.  The food is worth it. But if you're just looking (or in this city, desperately searching) for a place enjoy some quality brunch food on the weekend within 2 hours of the time you began this quest, I say skip it. Return when you've made your millions and can brunch on a Monday.

lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Julia C.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
While I was visiting San Francisco late weekend, my friend took me here for brunch. Thanks to my friend who put her name on a wait list a couple of hours ahead, we were able to sit almost right after we showed up. 

I had 'the plow' that came with two eggs, potatoes, lemon ricotta pancakes and bacon. At first, they didn't look too different from other brunch place, but were x100 tastier!! The eggs were soft but perfectly cooked, and potatoes were well-seasoned and very crispy. I probably could have had 5 more pancakes. Lol. 

Our server was super friendly and attentive as well. Strongly recommended!

excerpts: We've tried the Plow with the lemon ricotta pancakes, the Hong Kong style toast, the egg sandwich with avocado, and the french toast.
Everything we've ordered thus far has been delicious.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Anne Y.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Oh Plow, I'm starting to fall in love with you. I was forewarned by the Yelp reviews about how long the wait is, so each time I've been here, I made sure to try and get there shortly after they've opened to beat the hour long wait.

I'm writing my review based on my latest visit. I have a 10-month old baby who gets pretty fussy if he isn't kept entertained, so I'm always apprehensive about taking him with me when dining out. This past visit, my hubby, son, and I were seated at the bar. I love that their high chair attaches to the table. Our server was so friendly and engaged with the baby, which to me was a plus. Not to mention the hostess, who noticed that we were beginning to struggle with the baby. She brought over a little toy to keep him entertained so that was really sweet of her.

Now to the important part... the food. BOMB! We've tried the Plow with the lemon ricotta pancakes, the Hong Kong style toast, the egg sandwich with avocado, and the french toast. Everything we've ordered thus far has been delicious. The quality of the ingredients is great, even down to the cup of coffee.

I'll continue to frequent this place. Highly recommended for anyone who likes breakfast. Just as a head's up, come early to avoid the long wait.

excerpts: The lemon ricotta pancakes were rich but light.
I would love to try them with be berry compote that comes with them when ordered alone.
The potatoes were the real star of the dish they had rosemary on them
but it wasn't overpowering
and they were crispy but not greasy.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Julia M.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Delicious!!!

Great food. Great staff. Great atmosphere. Great spot. 

I highly recommend this breakfast joint. This is a great neighborhood place. 

The staff was very friendly, kind and attentive. I split the plow plate with my mom and they were happy to provide and extra plate to do so, which I really appreciate. 

We went on this Wednesday morning a little before 8am and only had to wait about 15 mins. I would recommend getting your name in a few minutes before 8 since some people who were meeting each other for breakfast got there right at 8. 

The drip coffee from Plow was rich and flavorful. And the servers are great about keeping it full. 

The plow plate is well rounded and delicious. I enjoyed splitting it too. The lemon ricotta pancakes were rich but light. I would love to try them with be berry compote that comes with them when ordered alone. The potatoes were the real star of the dish they had rosemary on them but it wasn't overpowering and they were crispy but not greasy. The bacon was excellent! 

Definitely would come back!

excerpts: I ordered "The Plow" which was with 2 eggs, 4 chicken apple sausage, potatoes, and 2 lemon ricotta pancakes.
The pancakes were delicious- pretty strong on the lemon flavor.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Taylor M.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
One of my new favorite brunch spots in the city. I went here on a Thursday around 11 with no reservation and waited for about 10 minutes. We were seated outside. It was a bit chilly but they offer blankets which is a nice perk. 

I ordered "The Plow" which was with 2 eggs, 4 chicken apple sausage, potatoes, and 2 lemon ricotta pancakes. The pancakes were delicious- pretty strong on the lemon flavor. I also had a side of bacon, and shared the French toast for dessert.  

I enjoy the true "farm to table" vibe, which makes it worth the slightly higher price point. But for 3 entrees and one side, one mimosa and 1 orange juice, we paid $100 including the tip. 

I will definitely be back the next time I am looking for an excuse to treat my self, which will be sooner than later I am sure.

excerpts: It's two eggs, choice of house made pork sausage, nueske bacon, or chicken apple sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes, crispy potatoes
and it comes out

I loved everything on my plate and it was one of the best brunches I've ever had but
definitely the lemon ricotta pancakes get a shout out.

lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Jingxi Z.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Ugh, the hype here is as real as it gets. Came for an early afternoon brunch on Sunday and because we came in so late, the wait was only around 15 minutes! Although I have heard nightmare tales about the wait here at peak hours so definitely try and come either really early or really late like us haha.

My friend and I both ordered The Plow, which I feel like everyone gets here haha, but for good reason! It's two eggs, choice of house made pork sausage, nueske bacon, or chicken apple sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes, crispy potatoes and it comes out all photo shoot ready for your Instagram shot :) I loved everything on my plate and it was one of the best brunches I've ever had but definitely the lemon ricotta pancakes get a shout out. I'll be back for sure!!

excerpts: Three words: lemon ricotta pancakes!
I'm not a big fan of pancakes, yet I'd be willing to order a full serving of these amazing lemon ricotta pancakes next time!
I recommend "The Plow" -- two lemon ricotta pancakes, crispy potatoes, two eggs (any style), and a choice of bacon, house pork sausage, or chicken apple sausage.
This dish is huge, very satisfying, and has variety.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Priscilla W.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Three words: lemon ricotta pancakes!

They're delicious. They're lemony without tasting like dishwash detergent and the ricotta isn't too heavy. They're dense and fluffy at the same time, with a mousse-like consistency. And they're good enough on their own that the side of pure maple syrup, served in the most adorable little dispenser, isn't necessary. I'm not a big fan of pancakes, yet I'd be willing to order a full serving of these amazing lemon ricotta pancakes next time!

I also love Plow's crispy potatoes. Every time I'm given a choice between side salad or side potatoes, I always opt for salad to be "healthier". Plow only offers potatoes. But I'm glad that's my only option or else I'd feel more guilty for not eating my veggies. The potatoes are so crispy! They're packed with flavor and I love the generous amount of dried rosemary used to season these carb-loaded tubers.

I recommend "The Plow" -- two lemon ricotta pancakes, crispy potatoes, two eggs (any style), and a choice of bacon, house pork sausage, or chicken apple sausage. This dish is huge, very satisfying, and has variety. You'll unbuckle your belt and roll down the hill after you've devoured everything and licked the plate clean.

The Eggs Benedict with smoked salmon is also tasty. The muffins are too thick and too large, proportionally, compared to the salmon and eggs. The salmon is salty and flavorful, and it pairs nicely with the beautifully poached, ooey-gooey runny eggs. 

Our host was extremely friendly and our waitress was nice, but service was poorly timed. It took a few minutes before we got our water and for her to take our orders. We arrived at 1PM on a Saturday and were seated outside within 30 minutes (inside would've taken at least another 10 minutes). Plow is on a hill with a slight incline, so it felt a little awkward eating on slanted tables outside. Therefore, I recommend dining inside. And I can't believe I'm saying this, but parking is VERY easy in this neighborhood. I will definitely be back!

so I thought I'd try it.

lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
The lemon ricotta pancakes are amazing!! I came here randomly after seeing it posted on thrillest as best brunch in the city so I thought I'd try it. I told the waitress that I'd never been before and to bring me something popular that would fill me up for a while. 

I had the pancakes eggs potatoes and fresh sausage. Everything was so fresh and delicious. It was SOOOOOO filling but not heavy which I really enjoyed. 

They had this amazing south American coffee as well. I always like to drink it black so I get the full flavor and let me tell you....this was flavorful!!!

excerpts: 5 stars for the Lemon Ricotta Pancakes!
Lemon Ricotta Pancakes:
Oh so soft and perfect... mouthwatering delicious!
My new favorite.
Housemade Pork Sausage Patties: had that homemade fresh, feel.
Soft Scramble: Delightful combination of eggs and goat cheese.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Josh L.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
5 stars for the Lemon Ricotta Pancakes! 

To celebrate my girlfriend's birthday we came here on a Friday for brunch. I was surprised at the amount of people here being that it was a weekday - we waited for about twenty five minutes for a table inside. Well worth the wait!

Lemon Ricotta Pancakes: Oh so soft and perfect... mouthwatering delicious! My new favorite.
Housemade Pork Sausage Patties: had that homemade fresh, feel.
Soft Scramble: Delightful combination of eggs and goat cheese. The crispy potatoes are a must eat!

The hostess and our waitress were both friendly and attentive. The ambiance has a casual, refreshing feel with light wood accents, but the space is very small and cozy. Be prepared to share your table if there are open seats next to you. There are tables outside and some small benches to sit on while you're waiting. If you don't want a long wait, I suggest coming on a weekday. Parking in this area is a breeze.

excerpts: My husband got "the plow" with the special lemon ricotta pancakes.
