lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Amanda H.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
It's been less then 12 hours and I'm already wanting to go back! The breakfast here is on point! Love the fresh ingredients! 
Got here on a Saturday morning at 8:45. Yes, the wait was long..like an hour, but it was so worth it! I got the French toast with strawberries. It was hands down the best French toast I've ever had. The syrup is the bomb! My husband got "the plow" with the special lemon ricotta pancakes. You can really tell the ingredients are fresh!

excerpts:
the rest of the plate was good with two poached eggs, lemon ricotta pancakes (very unique!), and house- made pork sausage, 

we also got a plate of french toast!
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Sandy Y.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
The Plow is a cute little place with indoor and outdoor seating. The first time I tried to go to the plow, I was told it would be a 1 hour wait on a Sunday morning. However, after waiting 1 hour.. I went to check up on the wait list and was told it would be 1 more hour. At that point we were just too hungry so we decided to leave and try somewhere else. A few weeks later, we decided to go back and give it a try, and waited 1 hour to get in. 

we got "the plow".. and let me just say.. those crispy potatoes doe. i know everyone's raving about those..  they're almost like those typical potato hash pieces brunch places serve.. but fried to a crisp perfection. as a huge fan of fries, im in love with these! the rest of the plate was good with two poached eggs, lemon ricotta pancakes (very unique!), and house- made pork sausage, 

we also got a plate of french toast! the french toast here was unlike any other french toast that i've had before. the outside was what you'd expect- toasted bread. but the inside of the toast was what surprised me. it was super moist and soft.. and it basically melted in your mouth. it was a really interesting juxtaposition of textures. 

overall, food was really good.. but the wait time is a bit too much for me

excerpts: I ordered the lemon ricotta pancakes and a biscuit.
I had tried the pancakes the last time I was here a few years ago and remember not liking them.
However, they're so hyped that I thought for sure it must just have been an off day or something.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Gowri R.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Hadn't been to Plow in a few years because the hours long wait is always a little daunting, but today I decided it was time to give it another try.

We waited ~1.5 hours and then were ultimately seated at the bar. A little disappointing to wait so long only to be crammed in at the bar, but it's fun to watch the chefs at work in the kitchen. There was catchy music playing and the folks in the kitchen were scrambling eggs and tossing pancakes to the tunes. They were clearly enjoying their work, which was kind of awesome to see.

I ordered the lemon ricotta pancakes and a biscuit. I had tried the pancakes the last time I was here a few years ago and remember not liking them. However, they're so hyped that I thought for sure it must just have been an off day or something. Unfortunately, I have to say - not sure exactly what it is, but they're just not my thing.

I also got a biscuit - that was pretty good. The soft scrambled eggs were slightly better though I wasn't much a fan of the potatoes they came with - super large potato chunks and not particularly crispy. 

Overall, I left feeling marginally unsatisfied. It might be another 3 years before I give plow another try.

excerpts: The lemon ricotta pancakes are Plow's star dish, and they were indeed delicious (almost like a very light cheesecake in pancake form).
But the breakfast sandwich with avocado was so surprisingly perfect and flavorful
and it was the thing I want to eat every day for the rest of my life.
Also good:
The two slow scrambled eggs and the iced chai latte.
Service was friendly and fast once we were seated, and the atmosphere both inside and out (on a nice day, anyway) is lovely.
I'd love to come back, but the wait is just too long!
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Gaelen X.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: I wouldn've given Plow 5 stars if not for the fact that we waited almost an hour for a table for 2... on a weekday! But we had a nice time walking around Potrero Hill while waiting (it was a warm day) and the food was phenomenal. The lemon ricotta pancakes are Plow's star dish, and they were indeed delicious (almost like a very light cheesecake in pancake form). But the breakfast sandwich with avocado was so surprisingly perfect and flavorful and it was the thing I want to eat every day for the rest of my life. Also good: The two slow scrambled eggs and the iced chai latte. Service was friendly and fast once we were seated, and the atmosphere both inside and out (on a nice day, anyway) is lovely. I'd love to come back, but the wait is just too long!

excerpts: We ordered the Plow breakfast (with lemon ricotta pancakes, eggs, potatoes and chicken apple sausage), and the seasonal pumpkin pancakes.
The lemon ricotta pancakes were beautifully golden brown.
They had a definite hint of lemon, but I thought they were a little bland.
Not enough sugar in the batter perhaps.
The potatoes were extra crispy on the outside, tender on the inside, and perfectly seasoned (no ketchup required).
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Keys W.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Visited during Saturday brunch hour. Waited over an hour, and probably would not have gotten a table if hadn't spoken up, as they seated people who came after us before us. 

However, the food was perfectly cooked, the atmosphere and service are friendly, and the coffee while you wait was a caffeinated perk. 

We ordered the Plow breakfast (with lemon ricotta pancakes, eggs, potatoes and chicken apple sausage), and the seasonal pumpkin pancakes. The lemon ricotta pancakes were beautifully golden brown. They had a definite hint of lemon, but I thought they were a little bland. Not enough sugar in the batter perhaps. The potatoes were extra crispy on the outside, tender on the inside, and perfectly seasoned (no ketchup required). I highly recommend the potatoes. 

I also recommend the delicious pumpkin pancakes. They were like pumpkin pie in pancake form, topped with delicately flavored pears. 
 
If you can visit during an off time, do. They make a great breakfast, however I don't think it's worth the wait.

excerpts: The lemon ricotta pancakes that came with the dish- out of this world.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Mina K.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
I've wanted to try Plow for a while, but was apprehensive about the infamously long 1.5 hour+ wait on weekends. But when a friend visiting from out of town requested Plow, I eagerly hopped on board. 

I went at 11:30 am on a Saturday to place our party of 4 on the list. The hostess said it would be a 1.5 hour wait. We came back in 1.5 hours, and they had already called our party, but gave us the next available table. 

We all ordered the Plow, which came with plenty of food but not overly so that I felt uncomfortably stuffed. The lemon ricotta pancakes that came with the dish- out of this world. I never knew pancakes could taste so lemony and fluffy! 

The potatoes were also delicious. I usually do not eat all my potatoes, because let's be real, they usually suck. But not Plow's! They have perfected their potatoes to crispy bites of enchantments. 

The service was also impeccable. Our waitress was friendly, as was the general manager (I think his name might have been Randall?) of the establishment. SO friendly. I really enjoyed interacting with the manager. 

Overall, a lovely brunch with excellent food. However, I don't think that it is worth the 1.5-2 hour wait. I recommend writing your name down and coming back later on the weekend, or going in on a weekday if somehow possible (I know, most of us have this inconvenient thing called work...). A friend of mine went in on a Thursday morning/early afternoon and he was seated with no wait!

excerpts: Lemon ricotta pancakes, eggs cooked perfectly, homemade sausage (it shows), and excellent deep fried potatoes with rosemary.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Shayna B.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
The plow breakfast may have very well been the best breakfast I've ever eaten. And I really, really like breakfast. Lemon ricotta pancakes, eggs cooked perfectly, homemade sausage (it shows), and excellent deep fried potatoes with rosemary.

They serve Youk's hot sauce here, which I was unaware of until now, but is apparently my favorite hot sauce. Especially for eggs.

Prepare to wait to be seated. A while. It's small. They'll allow you to put your name in, take a walk and/or grab a coffee nearby and come back though.

And once you sit down, service and the kitchen are super fast.

Seriously, you MUST go here if you're in the Potrero Hill area and don't get put off by the wait. It's WELL worth it!!

excerpts: The lemon ricotta pancakes were bursting with flavor.
(Note: if you don't like lemon, don't get it, obviously).
The breakfast sandwich, add bacon,
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Blake M.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Everything positive you hear about this place couldn't be more true. We came and was told there was a two hour wait, which we expected based on other reviews, so we dug in and started watching some Beyoncé videos from the concert the night before. We were called 58 minutes later. A lot of people leave so it's easy to get in much sooner than they say. 

Now about the food. I ordered the breakfast sandwich and my friend ordered the pork chop. Both were a breath of life. The pork chops flavor was out of this world and when people rave about the potatoes, they're right. #life The lemon ricotta pancakes were bursting with flavor. (Note: if you don't like lemon, don't get it, obviously). The breakfast sandwich, add bacon, no more words necessary. 

On to the service, its what made this rating 5 stars. My biscuit was delivered to the wrong table and without a second thought our side pancake was free and we got some free banana bread. 

Mexican coke is great, don't forget about that. 

Come here and live. It's worth it.

excerpts: The roasted potatoes were the best thing I ate, but the lemon ricotta pancakes were a close second.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Ashley R.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: Long wait but definitely worth it! The roasted potatoes were the best thing I ate, but the lemon ricotta pancakes were a close second. Generous portion of eggs make The Plow a delicious and filling choice.

excerpts: I have gotten the lemon ricotta pancakes some way or another every single time.
The first time-
it was SO good, super lemony and it had the perfect amount of sweetness.
The second time- had a weird taste at the end that I can't put my finger on.
The third time- barely any lemon flavor.
I have to say it was nice and moist all three times though.
Maybe the batch differs by whoever that makes it?
But the taste has not been consistent.
They cook the eggs well-
some places are too oily or buttery.
The sausage patty tastes homemade but came out burnt last time.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Michelle M.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Oh, plow. How I've struggled to get to you before the rush times so I don't have to wait an hour+ 

I've eaten here three times now. I've tried a lot of the things on the menu because I have gone with a group two times out of the three. 

I have gotten the lemon ricotta pancakes some way or another every single time. The first time- it was SO good, super lemony and it had the perfect amount of sweetness. The second time- had a weird taste at the end that I can't put my finger on. The third time- barely any lemon flavor. I have to say it was nice and moist all three times though. Maybe the batch differs by whoever that makes it? But the taste has not been consistent. 
They cook the eggs well- some places are too oily or buttery. The sausage patty tastes homemade but came out burnt last time. 
Okay the plow potatoes- am I missing something??? They're okay- I personally don't think they have much flavor. 
Open faced sandwich- my BF is a fan of. Get it if you are a fan of prosciutto! 
Chia seed pudding is a great healthy option but I wish it was a little bigger.
The fried egg sandwich- meh. You're in SF! Why you get this. Just no. 
The French toast with balsamic strawberries- the bread itself is super thick so it wasn't cooked all the way through last time. 

Grapefruit mimosa is good and it's a good amount but it's a lil pricey. The strawberry lemonade is waaaay too sour. 

The waitresses are nice and attentive- I have no complaints. 

Do yourself a favor and get here before 9 AT LEAST. Parking is actually pretty easy- plenty of spots.

To be honest, it is overhyped but it's definitely worth a try. I think I've had my share of plow for now.

excerpts: I had the Plow with chicken Apple sausage, sunny side up eggs, breakfast potatoes, and lemon ricotta pancakes.
The food was pleasant and well flavored and fresh...
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Lori S.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Bottom line: tasty food, but not worth the hype. 

Twice, the boyfriend and I have headed to Plow for brunch, and twice we balked at the multi-hour waits and went somewhere else. This time we put our names on the list, held back a wince when we were told a 2 hour wait, and went to a coffee shop to pass the time. We came back two hours later and were seated promptly. 

The staff was nice and the food was good. I had the Plow with chicken Apple sausage, sunny side up eggs, breakfast potatoes, and lemon ricotta pancakes. The food was pleasant and well flavored and fresh... But nothing to write home about. 

Basically, it was a solid breakfast option but certainly not worth the insane wait time.

excerpts: The best thing though hands down are their lemon ricotta pancakes.
Each bite is like a little taste of heaven.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Kayla M.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
I love Plow so much. 

This tiny restaurant is PACKED at any given time of the day. I always like to show up when the doors first open to avoid the 1+ hour wait time. But boy are you in for a treat once you're finally seated. 

I've tried pretty much everything on their menu at this point and NOTHING disappoints. The best thing though hands down are their lemon ricotta pancakes. Each bite is like a little taste of heaven. I order the Plow ( eggs + pancakes + potatoes) each time just to make sure I get a little bit of everything. Their crispy potatoes are also delicious. Customer service is always on point. Feel free to ask for a mimosa or a cup of coffee while you wait. They'll gladly oblige. 

Can't wait to go back once I'm in town!

excerpts: I ordered the plow which consisted of lemon ricotta pancakes, house potatoes, chicken sausage (or bacon) and eggs with their iced chai tea!
I wasn't a fan of the lemon ricotta pancakes, I thought they were a little too dense.
I'm not really a pancake person, so when I do have them I expect a lot.
I'm also not a chai tea person, but the chai tea was really good!
I ordered it with almond milk instead of regular milk.
It had a very strong spicy taste to it.
My friend ordered the chia pudding, a side of the Hong Kong style toast, with their strawberry lemonade.
All I remember is seeing her food then seeing nothing but an empty plate & bowl!
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Vangielynne P.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
I came here with a friend for my birthday brunch. It was a random Wednesday around noon time. I was expecting there to be a long wait but nope! It was probably a 15-20 minute wait which isn't bad at all! 

After putting our name down, we were able to get a copy of the menu and decide what we were going to eat. Even though, we both already had something in mind from all the pictures on Yelp! 

Once we got called, we asked to sit inside rather than out because it was still a little chilly in SF. We sat at the bar & were amazed since we were able to watch the chefs cook! Everything they were making looked delicious!! I ordered the plow which consisted of lemon ricotta pancakes, house potatoes, chicken sausage (or bacon) and eggs with their iced chai tea! I wasn't a fan of the lemon ricotta pancakes, I thought they were a little too dense. I'm not really a pancake person, so when I do have them I expect a lot. I'm also not a chai tea person, but the chai tea was really good! I ordered it with almond milk instead of regular milk. It had a very strong spicy taste to it. My friend ordered the chia pudding, a side of the Hong Kong style toast, with their strawberry lemonade.* All I remember is seeing her food then seeing nothing but an empty plate & bowl! So I'm pretty sure it was really good!! 

The service was very good! The setting of the restaurant was very warm and cozy. There's an option to sit outside, inside, or along the bar area. The price for each dish is reasonable. When looking at the menu some of the dishes had an * next to them. Looks like some dishes they only serve until they run out, so heads up! 

Definitely coming again to try the fried egg sandwich!!

excerpts: So to sum up, lemon ricotta pancakes were awesome.
Scrambled eggs were fluffy and pretty good.
Sausage and plow potatoes failed.
Wait is frustrating.
Prices are right.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Gokhan T.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Okay, I understand all that hype about the lemon ricotta pancake but seriously, waiting hours just for that? I certainly have more important things to do in life.

I went in on a Friday morning before I go to work assuming that things will move fast and boy, was I wrong. I sat at the bar, ordered the plow with beacon and found out that they don't have beacon. Uhm..., so you don't have the most consumed product in your menu at 9am? Well, then I went ahead with the chicken sausage per their recommendations and it took exactly 45 minutes for me to get my food. If on a normal Friday morning things are moving that slowly, I can't imagine how it'd be like on a weekend. 

So to sum up, lemon ricotta pancakes were awesome. Scrambled eggs were fluffy and pretty good. Sausage and plow potatoes failed. Wait is frustrating. Prices are right.

excerpts: The Plow which consisted of the legendary lemon ricotta pancakes, home fries, sunny side eggs and chicken apples sausages.
It was a great introduction to this restaurant because you aren't just getting the lemon ricotta panakces, which everyone comes here for.
A friend got the same except with bacon.
The moment we got our food all the waiting was well worth it.
Everything was perfect.
Next time I will definitely try to get different things because everything looked amazing.
Particularly the french toast and the banana bread.
The chicken Tinga also looked great.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Thielson D.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Lemon. ricotta. pancakes. Just about every other review will talk about these so needless to say they are awesome! Came here for the first time (of many to follow) this last weekend. I don't think they take reservations so we rolled up and were quoted about 1.5 hours to be seated on a Sunday. We ended up waiting for about 2hr:15 minutes to actually be seated, so expect that or go as early as you can. 

I got The Plow which consisted of the legendary lemon ricotta pancakes, home fries, sunny side eggs and chicken apples sausages. It was a great introduction to this restaurant because you aren't just getting the lemon ricotta panakces, which everyone comes here for. A friend got the same except with bacon. The moment we got our food all the waiting was well worth it. Everything was perfect. Next time I will definitely try to get different things because everything looked amazing. Particularly the french toast and the banana bread. The chicken Tinga also looked great. We ended up being seated at the counter and got to watch all the workers do their thing and jam to the music that was playing (literally everyone was dancing). 

The one thing is that there isn't much to do in the surrounding area while you are waiting. So you have to rough it out and stand in front of the restaurant until that fateful moment when your name is called. Then again, maybe there is and I just don't know the area. Find a way to keep yourself entertained while you wait.

excerpts: The lemon ricotta pancakes were my fave!
I can see how this place would have a line out the door on the weekends for brunch.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Cynthia T.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: Came on a weekday for lunch with some friends, and when we arrived there was no wait, but we couldn't get seated until our other party arrived. Such a cute little place on the corner! The hostess checked on us to see if our other party had arrived as we waited, which was nice and appreciated. We sat outside on the sidewalk, and our waitress was charming, witty and attentive. We all ordered the plow as suggested by our friend, and it did not disappoint. The lemon ricotta pancakes were my fave! I can see how this place would have a line out the door on the weekends for brunch.

excerpts: For me, the lemon ricotta pancakes weren't worth the hype.
They were good, and I like the unique combination, but they didn't wow me.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Courtney K.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Bottom Line:  The food is delicious, the interior is cute and the service is friendly, but I don't think I'd typically wait more than 30 minutes to eat here.

My friend lives two block from Plow so as foodies and elite Yelpers, we had to give it a try.  If you are thinking about venturing to Potrero Hill yourself, here is some information that I hope will help you decide if Plow is worth the trip and the wait:

- The Wait.  My take away from reading many Yelp reviews is that the wait runs one to two hours.  I really can't imagine waiting that long and luckily I didn't have to.  I arrived a few minutes before 8am on a Saturday and only waited about ten minutes for a party of two.  Since the restaurant doesn't open until 8am on Saturday, and we were able to get in on the first seating, we only had to wait long enough for the hostess to get to us.  It helped immensely that there were only two of us.  

- Size Does Matter.  Plow is small and if your party is big, Plow won't be a good fit for you.  My recollection is that there are a handful of four-top tables but not many bigger options.  In fact, there website says they can only accommodate parties of six or less.  If you have a small party and want to sit at the counter, you can probably get seated faster.  And if you are a party of one, don't let the wait deter you, because you can probably snag a seat at the counter rather quickly.  

- Food.  The food here is really good but not so good that I'd wait hours for it.  I do like how fresh their ingredients are and the uniqueness of some of their items.  You can definitely taste the quality of the ingredients they use and I fully appreciate their efforts to source their ingredients locally.  Also, they make many items, like their ricotta and pork sausage in house.   Because I was starving, we (and by "we," I mean "I") ordered lots of food.  

   - Breakfast Dessert!: We were seated at the counter overlooking the freshly baked breakfast desserts so of course I had to order the chocolate chip walnut coffee cake to start.  That probably isn't the right name for it, but just know those breakfast desserts are good!

   - Eggs Benny:  Plow's rendition of the classic Eggs Benedict was wonderful.  I did it with the Fra' Mani ham (Fra' Mani is a fancy pork company out of Berkley that sells its products wholesale and to Costco).

   - The Plow:  Probably the most popular dish on the menu, my friend went with the Plow.  She started it and I finished it!  (Hey, I said I was starving.)  Even though I am not much of a breakfast potato person, I thought Plow's crispy potatoes were delicious and I ate way more of those potatoes than I would anyone else's breakfast potatoes!  I also really enjoyed the sausage.  I am sure it helped that I had been in town for a vegetarian wedding all weekend and was craving meat like a cave man.  The homemade pork sausage had great texture and flavor.  For me, the lemon ricotta pancakes weren't worth the hype.  They were good, and I like the unique combination, but they didn't wow me.  Nevertheless, I think Plow makes their own ricotta which is very cool and admirable.      

- Service.  Service was friendly an attentive.  Despite a line out the door, the staff remains calm and keeps on plowing through the service.  I also like that they kept my coffee full and didn't rush us out of there.  

- The ambiance is very cute and the décor is well done - hardwood floors, marble counter top, big windows and an open kitchen.  

- Extras.  Plow is a very cute, cohesive, well-thought-out place.  They also have a great, classy web site.  I can tell the owners put a lot of love and pride into this business and for that I applaud them!

excerpts: Lemon Ricotta Pancakes

+ +: 
Pancakes were a little crispy outside, fluffy and airy on the inside.
I felt a flavor of lemon.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Hiromi S.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
This restaurant is located in Potrero Hill of San Francisco. 

I and my husband have tried several times to have for brunch on weekends.
There are always a long lines, so that we gave up every time.
We retried at 8:15 in the morning on Thursday.
Fortunately, we can sit down without any line!
  
The atmosphere in the restaurant makes me comfortable and cheer up.
The service is great who everyone is friendly and kind.

We ordered two dishes with two cup of coffee.

(Rating: +++ is perfect)
Lemon Ricotta Pancakes + + +: 
Pancakes were a little crispy outside, fluffy and airy on the inside. I felt a flavor of lemon.
This pancake I ate is the best in I have ever had in my life.

Two eggs +++:
We ate scrambled eggs that it was perfectly my favorite texture. The muffin is crispy outside, chewy on the inside. The crispy potatoes felt a flavor of rosemary.
 Chicken apple sausage of house made is unique taste and made me cheer up.  

How well organized everything!

excerpts: But the Lemon Ricotta Pancakes screamed at me, so I went with that and a side of bacon.
Their LEMON RICOTTA PANCAKES?
Best pancakes of my life.
BACON?
Extra crispy/crunchy just like I like them.
The hot sauce?
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Jennifer M.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Despite the crowd, this place is amazing!!!! We came here on a Sunday morning roughly 25 minutes after their doors opened (8am), and restaurant's first seating was full! (Man, everything good in SF requires a line!) The conservative wait time for us was 45 minutes for a table, which at the time had me concerned since my boyfriend and I had to meet up with a tour at 10am in Union Square. Immediately after the hostess told us about the wait I had asked about outdoor seating. She said that they would be seating people outside shortly, which concluded to me that our 45 minutes would be the extent of our wait if they had about 8 tables out on the sidewalk open.

My boyfriend and I had to strategize. If were were going to be seated before 9am, our order had to be ready buy the time they directed us to a table. So we went through the whole menu.  It was short and sweet which indicated to me that all of these dishes had to be good.  But the Lemon Ricotta Pancakes screamed at me, so I went with that and a side of bacon. My boyfriend, the Egg Sandwich with potatoes.

We were finally seated at 8:55, with our orders submitted by 8:57 (Hell yea I was watching the time!) Refills on our coffee and two waters followed at 9:02 and 9:05 respectively.  Our server also mentioned that seating outside generally starts after indoor tables' food tickets' have passed through the kitchen, which in my opinion was reassuring to hear.

Our orders -  finally delivered by 9:15 with the bill ready in hand without even having to ask!!! 

Their CRISPY POTATOES? Uh-mazing! Their LEMON RICOTTA PANCAKES? Best pancakes of my life. BACON? Extra crispy/crunchy just like I like them. The hot sauce? Local, made by Youk's 

What I did notice about Plow that put them at 5 star was that they gave out blankets to the customers who sat outside!! Wasn't too sure if that was upon request or just done out of hospitality, but knowing that they were available just topped my cup off.

excerpts: I had the Plow breakfast: 2 eggs, 2 lemon ricotta pancakes, 2 plow homemade sausage patties and the best breakfast potatoes
I've had the pleasure of tasting.
The lemon ricotta pancakes!
I can't wait to have them again.
Plow has something I'm not sure I can describe.
It's a feeling, a good feeling emanating throughout the small dining room and counter space.
The staff appears to genuinely enjoy their job and their kindness comes through in how they move, how they talk amongst themselves and how they interact with the patrons.
And to the one staff member, owner, chef, manager (I'm not sure) who was smiling the entire time I was dining, thank you, you made my day.
Thanks, Plow!
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Don A.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Went today, a Tuesday, and there luckily was no line. Service was very pleasant and the food delicious. I had the Plow breakfast: 2 eggs, 2 lemon ricotta pancakes, 2 plow homemade sausage patties and the best breakfast potatoes I've had the pleasure of tasting. The lemon ricotta pancakes! I can't wait to have them again. 
Plow has something I'm not sure I can describe. It's a feeling, a good feeling emanating throughout the small dining room and counter space. The staff appears to genuinely enjoy their job and their kindness comes through in how they move, how they talk amongst themselves and how they interact with the patrons. And to the one staff member, owner, chef, manager (I'm not sure) who was smiling the entire time I was dining, thank you, you made my day.
Thanks, Plow!

excerpts: My favorites include "The Plow": two eggs, two lemon ricotta pancakes, their DELICIOUS potatoes, and choice of bacon, chicken apple sausage, or pork sausage.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Tomas K.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
One of my favorite breakfast places in SF, Plow serves delicious and reasonably priced traditional American breakfast in Portrero Hill. Bacon, eggs, pancakes, sausage, potatoes, and toast thrive here on a raw yet refined menu featuring all of the classics and then some. 

What makes the Plow different and "better" than other traditional breakfast joints is the high quality of their ingredients. The eggs, produce, dairy, breads, and meats served at Plow are sourced carefully and their superiority to the cheaper ingredients used by other restaurants is apparent both visually and in taste. 

The restaurant is small inside although they do offer additional outdoor seating. The interior decorum is clean and modern with stainless steel bar and stool seating at the kitchen counter as well as table and chair seating in the dining room.

My favorites include "The Plow": two eggs, two lemon ricotta pancakes, their DELICIOUS potatoes, and choice of bacon, chicken apple sausage, or pork sausage. I order "The Plow" when I am very hungry as this is a VERY filling breakfast. When I am a little less hungry I order the "open-faced proscuitto + gruyere sandwich" which is basically a piece of brioche toasted and topped with a garlic fried egg, gruyere cheese, prosciutto, frisee, parsley, and chili flakes. This also comes with a small side of their DELICIOUS (I'll say it again) potatoes. 

By the way, did I mention the breakfast potatoes here are DELICIOUS? You've got to try them.

excerpts: My breakfast was delicious (ordered The Plow meal - eggs, bacon and lemon ricotta pancakes - YUM) and the coffee strong!
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Sarah F.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Favorite breakfast spot that I've found so far in San Francisco. Perfect hipster vibe with the wood tables and white linen napkins. 
My breakfast was delicious (ordered The Plow meal - eggs, bacon and lemon ricotta pancakes - YUM) and the coffee strong!  Service was very friendly and timely. 

I will go back and you should, too. :)

excerpts: We ordered a buttermilk biscuit, soft scrambled eggs with potatoes and toast, and the lemon ricotta pancakes to share.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Casatrina L.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
I'd heard many great reviews of Plow before coming and it did live up to the hype, although I wouldn't wait an hour for it. Came here at 11 for brunch on Saturday - my friend had put our name down at 9.45 and was told that it would be an hour's wait. We were finally seated at 11. 

We ordered a buttermilk biscuit, soft scrambled eggs with potatoes and toast, and the lemon ricotta pancakes to share. Everyone seems to rave about The Plow but we decided that it would be too huge a portion to finish (which was a good call since we couldn't finish the potatoes from our order)

The food did take a while to arrive. The buttermilk biscuit came with honey butter. It was decent, though not worth the price ($4.25). The pancakes ($13.75 for 3) came looking nondescript, but they were custardy, not overly sweet, and absolutely delicious warm. Definitely lived up to its name of being Plow's must-order dish! The soft-scrambled eggs ($13) were pretty good, with generous fillings (goat's cheese, asparagus, spinach, mushrooms). That said, it wasn't a particularly memorable dish. I'm not a huge fan of potatoes to begin with, and so wasn't blown away by their famous potatoes.

Service is great, and the servers were attentive and really friendly, which is fantastic, especially having waited for an hour for your table. Our total bill added up to $40 (for the above 3 orders and a coffee) including tax, which is pretty affordable for such a popular place. Love the farm to table vibe of this place, and I'd be back if not for the long wait. Perhaps on a weekday :)

excerpts: We waited almost 2 hours to get a table at Plow, but those lemon ricotta pancakes made it soooo worth it.
They had a great lemon flavor and it kind of melts in your mouth.
Honestly, I'm sad that I'm not still eating it.
Absolutely make that part of your meal.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Emma M.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: We waited almost 2 hours to get a table at Plow, but those lemon ricotta pancakes made it soooo worth it. They had a great lemon flavor and it kind of melts in your mouth. Honestly, I'm sad that I'm not still eating it. Absolutely make that part of your meal. (I ordered the Plow and while the other components of the meal were also delightful the pancakes are the component that are going to make me come back for more!)

excerpts: I enjoyed the lemon ricotta pancakes, but beyond those the rest of the plate (eggs, potatoes, chicken sausage) was not particularly noteworthy.
Fresh fruit was great- mix of peaches, plums, pluots, and fig.
Would be worth trying on a weekday when it's (presumably) less crowded.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Melissa P.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: Food was good but still not convinced it was worth the 1.5hr wait. We put our name in and walked across the street to get a cup of coffee and keep warm while we waited. We ordered the plow to share and a side of fresh seasonal fruit. The plow is a nice dish to try if you want to sample a little of everything- I enjoyed the lemon ricotta pancakes, but beyond those the rest of the plate (eggs, potatoes, chicken sausage) was not particularly noteworthy. Fresh fruit was great- mix of peaches, plums, pluots, and fig. Would be worth trying on a weekday when it's (presumably) less crowded.

excerpts: And for me, the thing to order is The Plow: an assortment of their offerings, including house made pork sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes and plow potatoes.
And all of it is fantastic.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: David Z.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
This is my favorite San Francisco breakfast! I've been here twice, once for a long line for a table of four on the weekend, and once in the morning on the way to drop a friend to the airport before driving back to Los Angeles. While I will gladly admit that it's great to be seated at Plow immediately (and a 7AM breakfast will allow for that), this is a place I'll wait in line for any day!

And for me, the thing to order is The Plow: an assortment of their offerings, including house made pork sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes and plow potatoes. And all of it is fantastic. Rarely do I not try new menu offerings on a return trip to a restaurant, but I can't imagine doing better than this plentiful platter.

I'll be back to San Francisco soon. Rest assured, I'll be returning to Plow.

excerpts: , I always appreciate a good plate of breakfast potatoes,  and I'm still thinking about the Lemon ricotta pancakes.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Nick H.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
I don't know how I more or less randomly picked the most Midwestern brunch spot possible on my vacation from Chicago, but I did. Plow is that spot, and I mean that in the best way possible. It was a little pricy for my tastes (Although I understand that is standard in SF) but the sausage was delightfully un pretentious, I always appreciate a good plate of breakfast potatoes,  and I'm still thinking about the Lemon ricotta pancakes.

The downside? You're gonna have to wait for it. I was alone so my wait was ONLY 20 minutes, but people were being told to expect 1.5 hours! I'm not sure I'd wait that long, but the wait is totally rewarded with a solid plate of breakfast.

excerpts: It has the famous lemon ricotta pancakes (excellent soft and super tasty), pork sausage (freshly made, not frozen or prepackaged), home fries(freshly cut and tossed, tasty).
Blood sausage is good if you like that stuff.
Big downside is the long wait, be prepared for an hour wait most weekend brunch time.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Sridevi K.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
The plow is a great dish for first timers. It has the famous lemon ricotta pancakes (excellent soft and super tasty), pork sausage (freshly made, not frozen or prepackaged), home fries(freshly cut and tossed, tasty). Blood sausage is good if you like that stuff. 
Big downside is the long wait, be prepared for an hour wait most weekend brunch time.

excerpts: Friends got the Plow dish with their lemon ricotta pancakes + apple sausages, and my gf got the french toast.
All around everything was deliciously carb-tastic and amazingly fatty goodness.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Lorrie M.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
I am usually not one for places that are hyped up. They are often ... well ... hyped up? Too many people show up, too much line waiting occurs, and everyone leaves annoyed and low on patience. 

Except Plow. Oh Plow.

I have to say, I don't know what kind of expectations I had. And despite having waited 1.5 hour for a brunch date of 4, in the freezing cold and THEN had to sit outside for the duration of our brunch, I am impressed that I am giving Plow 4 stars.

So then it must be a real testament to their food! I have to say, their food is delicious, simple, and yet so very worth while. I got the salmon benedict with a side of their seasonal pumpkin pancake. Friends got the Plow dish with their lemon ricotta pancakes + apple sausages, and my gf got the french toast. All around everything was deliciously carb-tastic and amazingly fatty goodness. Seriously, every bite was brunch heaven. 

I know this sounds ridiculous, but have someone come here early, put in your name, go sit in Farley's and grab a latte while you wait. It's worth your time!

excerpts: The Plow is a giant dish of potatoes, two eggs, meat, and lemon ricotta pancakes.

Potatoes- really dang good potatoes, well-seasoned and very tasty
House-made pork sausage- meh, kind of dry and bland
Eggs-
it's eggs
Lemon ricotta pancakes- meh
, I'm not sure why everyone loves lemon ricotta pancakes.
I've had them at some other places, and every time, they don't really do much for me.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Alice T.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Sorry, Plow... I like you, but I'm just not blown away.

My friend and I agreed that we wouldn't wait more than 30 minutes to eat here. Luckily, she got there right as they opened so we were seated pretty quickly. I've walked past Plow around prime brunch times (10-2pm), and there's always tons of groups waiting outside.

The service was awesome and very attentive. The food was good and fresh. The restaurant is super cute and makes a perfect brunch spot. So why only 4 stars? I just didn't feel like any of the dishes were really unique or amazing. Don't get me wrong- everything was executed perfectly, and I definitely appreciate that what they do, they do really well. I was just expecting.... more?

As recommended by all the reviewers, I got the Plow. The Plow is a giant dish of potatoes, two eggs, meat, and lemon ricotta pancakes. 
Potatoes- really dang good potatoes, well-seasoned and very tasty
House-made pork sausage- meh, kind of dry and bland
Eggs- it's eggs
Lemon ricotta pancakes- meh, I'm not sure why everyone loves lemon ricotta pancakes. I've had them at some other places, and every time, they don't really do much for me. You can taste the lemon, but the ricotta always seems to dull the pancakes.

My friend had the benedict, which was very tasty, but I've never said no to a benedict. We also shared the chocolate chip walnut cake, which tasted as good as it looked. Overall, I'm glad I tried Plow. I'm just not sure I would want to go at 8am or wait two hours to eat there again.

excerpts: The lemon ricotta pancakes probably would have been delicious if I didn't eat the fabulous French toast
first - they were just a shadow of the French toast after the fact.
Oh, and eat the potatoes as soon as they come out.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Robbin A.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
The only reason why I went to Plow is because our friend lives right up the hill. Being the pal he is, he walked down, put our names in, and told us to come back in about two hours. That is friendship right there.

We were seated outside. It was nice of them to have blankets out there, though I personally would never touch them, because I have a problem with germs and stuff. The wait staff is super nice and friendly!

I wanted to come here to try the hash that my coworker told me about. Sadly, they did not have this hash. Fortunately, everything else on the menu sounded amazing. I basically wanted to order everything and eat it all.

The boyfriend and I were strategic about what we ordered. There was a matcha mochi cake, which I obviously had to try because MATCHA MOCHI sounds so fantastic. I got the Plow, because hey, this place is called Plow. Boyfriend got the 2 piece French toast vs. the 3 piece because we saw that there was HK toast. So...yes. All the toasts! They also serve Five Mountains tea, which isn't bad. On the bright side, they serve it in heavy iron tea pots.

The food itself was so very tasty. The French toast with strawberry and lemon curd on it basically made me cry. That's how good it was. I think I like it more than Curbsides, which is blasphemous in itself, but oh my goodness, I haven't had French toast that good in a long while. The Plow was delicious. I asked for my eggs to be hard-scrambled, but it was still on the soft-side - I guess that's what they're known for. I had to explain my messed up allergy but they were really understanding and fixed that for me in a jiff. The bacon was delicious and super crisp. The lemon ricotta pancakes probably would have been delicious if I didn't eat the fabulous French toast first - they were just a shadow of the French toast after the fact. Oh, and eat the potatoes as soon as they come out. That is when they are tastiest.

I'd definitely come back, but I don't know if I'd wait for 2 hours for it.

Also, don't park at the bottom of the hill. That's where all the car thieves are, according to my friend.

excerpts:
I opted for "The Plow" which came with two eggs, your choice of meat (I went for the chicken apple sausage, yum!), some AMAZING POTATOES, and two really really yummy lemon ricotta pancakes!!!

I have zero regrets getting the plow because it was just that good!!!
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Kary Y.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Being raised the city has really raised my standards for good brunch places. But I really think if you're in the mood for some hearty brunch, Plow is the place to go.

My boyfriend and I arrived on a Friday afternoon at around 12PM. We waited around an hour and 10 minutes to get seated outside. The overall feel of plow is rustic and really clean. I love the wooden tables that had some amazing hot sauce!!!

I opted for "The Plow" which came with two eggs, your choice of meat (I went for the chicken apple sausage, yum!), some AMAZING POTATOES, and two really really yummy lemon ricotta pancakes!!!

I have zero regrets getting the plow because it was just that good!!!

On the other hand, my boyfriend didn't really enjoy the fried egg sandwich as much as he hoped he would. He said it lacked a bit of flavor even adding avocados in it, but the house potatoes were perfection!

excerpts: It came with 2 eggs, super delish potatoes, some meat (bacon, or 2 types of sausage if I recall correctly), and 2 lemon ricotta pancakes.
The pancakes and potatoes were superb!!
The service was good.
Only complaint is that there's only one restroom and it's unisex
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Toni J.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Went for breakfast with 2 friends. The wait wasn't too bad.. approx 45 minutes. 

All three of us got the signature dish, The Plow. It came with 2 eggs, super delish potatoes, some meat (bacon, or 2 types of sausage if I recall correctly), and 2 lemon ricotta pancakes. The pancakes and potatoes were superb!! The service was good. Only complaint is that there's only one restroom and it's unisex so there's usually a wait.

Would definitely go again and would recommend to anyone within a 50 mile radius of SF!

excerpts: The lemon ricotta pancakes are yummy, sweet and fluffy.
The avocado toast was lemony, tangy and the bread crispy and flavorful.
They have homemade salsa which wasn't spicy but added a burst of flavor.
The coffee was good
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Esmeralda Q.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: Came here today on a Wednesday and there was no wait. It was still pretty busy and got even more packed 20 mins after ver arrived, closer to 11 am. We sat outside, it was a cool breezy day but they have blankets that you can use to keep warm which I think is a really nice touch. My husband ordered The Plow and I ordered the avocado toast with a side of sausage. My husband devoured his breakfast, and said everything was delicious. The lemon ricotta pancakes are yummy, sweet and fluffy. The avocado toast was lemony, tangy and the bread crispy and flavorful. They have homemade salsa which wasn't spicy but added a burst of flavor. The coffee was good it's Equator coffee. Definitely recommend this place, only downside is that I wish that the avocado toast included 2, other than that great service, great food and nice area. Found parking easily which is a big plus anywhere near the SF area.

excerpts: In addition to eggs and your choice of meat, the plow also comes with two mini lemon ricotta pancakes and a generous helping of potatoes.
The eggs and the sausage were good but nothing out of the ordinary.
The lemon ricotta pancakes, on the other hand, were ah-MAY-zing.
They tasted like lemon meringue, and weren't too doughy or flaky, which is something I often don't like about pancakes.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Michelle L.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Plow is a great weekday brunch spot, with a clean and cozy atmosphere, and awesome food! As a brunch-loving out-of-towner with only one day in San Francisco, I chose to make Plow my first stop for the day after getting off the Caltrain at 22nd Street. My brother and I arrived at the restaurant around 10:45am on a Thursday morning, and had to wait about 10 minutes for a table. We ended up with a table outside - perfect for enjoying the beautiful weather.

My brother and I both ordered the plow. I ordered mine with scrambled eggs and chicken apple sausage, and he ordered his with sunny side up eggs and pork sausage patties. In addition to eggs and your choice of meat, the plow also comes with two mini lemon ricotta pancakes and a generous helping of potatoes. The eggs and the sausage were good but nothing out of the ordinary. The lemon ricotta pancakes, on the other hand, were ah-MAY-zing. They tasted like lemon meringue, and weren't too doughy or flaky, which is something I often don't like about pancakes. The potatoes were also delicious - salted, with lots of crispy potato skin.

The service was great, and our server came outside to our table often to check on us and the other people sitting outside. If I lived in SF, I'm sure Plow would be one of my regular brunch places!

excerpts: If you can, get the avocado poached egg toast and try the lemon ricotta pancakes, but go on a WEEKDAY!
On the weekends, you're one brave soul to bare those lines.
The wait is genuinely two hours!
But it's that good -
I'm just not one to wait for eggs, but if you can check out Plow during the week when the crowds aren't around.
The space is gorgeous and it's generally sunny in Potrero Hill, so
I could totally see myself sitting outside and getting some work done while nommin' on these goodies!
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Frankie I.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: Plow is incredibly good for breakfast - by breakfast, I mean late brunch since I'm slow moving in the mornings. If you can, get the avocado poached egg toast and try the lemon ricotta pancakes, but go on a WEEKDAY! On the weekends, you're one brave soul to bare those lines. The wait is genuinely two hours! But it's that good - I'm just not one to wait for eggs, but if you can check out Plow during the week when the crowds aren't around. The space is gorgeous and it's generally sunny in Potrero Hill, so I could totally see myself sitting outside and getting some work done while nommin' on these goodies!

excerpts: Everyone is right about the lemon ricotta pancakes.
They are amaze balls and quite special.
For all you anti-lemon people out there, trust me when I say these fluffy babies will change your mind!
If anyone here has ever had three twin's lemon cookie ice cream, it reminds me of that.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Kero D.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
I was INCREDIBLY lucky. Came here with my coworker/lova and we only had to endure a measly 15 minute wait. At 12:45 pm to boot! So if you want to test your luck, come here on a weekday afternoon (happened to be a Friday for us) and maybe the pancake gods will take mercy on your pitiful mortal souls!

Everyone is right about the lemon ricotta pancakes. They are amaze balls and quite special. For all you anti-lemon people out there, trust me when I say these fluffy babies will change your mind! If anyone here has ever had three twin's lemon cookie ice cream, it reminds me of that. The lemon flavor isn't citrusy or sour...it's more floral and subtle if anything.

I got them in combination with "the plow" which also comes with SUPER DUPER crispy potatoes, eggs (I'd go sunny side or over easy) and your choice between bacon, pork sausage, and apple chicken sausage. I opted for the chicken sausage and it was delightful! The smoky apple aftertaste was tasty. 

Plow is charming, homey and a little bit rustic. The rave reviews are well deserves, and if fate is kind enough to bring me back one day, I would love to try out the pumpkin pancakes as well! :)

excerpts: My dad gave me some lemon ricotta pancakes from his dish, the Plow, and I thought that it was SO good, just like the custard French toast, and my mom gave me her
I think it was called Skirred Eggs, and that was bomb!
I thought that it was the best brunch place I have ever had!
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Pil C.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: I thought having Plow for the first time was one of the best breakfasts I've ever had in my life! The wait was about 30-45 mins., but I didn't really mind it. I ordered the custard French toast and I thought it was killer! My dad gave me some lemon ricotta pancakes from his dish, the Plow, and I thought that it was SO good, just like the custard French toast, and my mom gave me her I think it was called Skirred Eggs, and that was bomb! I thought that it was the best brunch place I have ever had!

excerpts: The famed lemon ricotta pancakes were good, but can't say I was blown away.
And the eggs were good, but pretty standard.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Rita K.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Best biscuit I've had in SF so far, maybe on the west coast all together (and I have high biscuit standards being from Georgia). It was buttery, and soft and moist, and with a proper crunchy top. The honey butter that came with it was good, but I might ask for plain butter later as I was wanting something more savory than sweet. 

The potatoes are super good too. Very crispy. 

The famed lemon ricotta pancakes were good, but can't say I was blown away. And the eggs were good, but pretty standard. Overall a very satisfying brunch experience. 

The staff was very friendly. Also, if you sit outside on a dreary day like today was, they'll give you a blanket which is very cute and sweet and thoughtful. 

A practical tidbit of learned wisdom: we tried getting there pretty early and got there at 8:30. And the line when we were leaving around 9:45 was about the same as when we got there. So unless you get there at 7:30 (before they open), it's not worth rushing.

excerpts: The lemon ricotta pancakes were AMAZING.
It was like biting into a fluffy lemon cookie.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Breniel L.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Today a Christmas miracle happened; my friend and I got in the door and had a table within 5 minutes! 5 MINUTES! That never happens in San Francisco, especially at a place as good as Plow. The party of two that was before us on the list did not show up, so they sat us first (which was fantastic). I know that it was a weekday morning and Christmas eve, but still, that's pretty amazing.

The first thing I noticed about this place was that the tables were pretty close together. We could hear the conversation of the table next to us and if we stretched our arms out, we would have definitely hit them. I did not mind this all too much, since the people sitting next to us were super friendly. 

Now, the food/drink. I got the coffee while my friend got the 12-hour cold brewed iced coffee. He says that if you really need to wake up, the iced coffee is the way to go. We both ordered the plow. He got the chicken and apple sausage while I got the house made pork sausage. We also ordered a side of bacon. Everything was great! The potatoes were nice and crispy and the scrambled eggs I had were not dry. The lemon ricotta pancakes were AMAZING. It was like biting into a fluffy lemon cookie. The serving size was great for what we ordered because we got to try a little bit of everything.

I will definitely be coming back. The service was great. I will definitely appreciate the Christmas miracle of having brunch within 5 minutes of putting my name on the list since this will probably never happen again.

excerpts: Finally, to top it all off, are 2 lemon ricotta pancakes (6/5).
These pancakes are not your average fluffy pancake.
They are slightly denser, but packed full of flavor.
I'll be honest, I'm not a pancake person normally.
Waffles win it all for me, but when it comes to these lemon ricotta pancakes, I would eat a hundred if I could.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Diana C.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
This is my all time favorite brunch place. Hands down. I try to make a trip up for brunch every couple months or so. The lines here get super long especially on weekends, but trust me, it's worth the long agonizing wait. If it is your first time here, I would order the plow (5/5). It is just their breakfast platter with a little bit of everything. On my numerous trips back to this place, I also tried the fried egg sandwich (4/5) and their crab scramble (3/5). 

The plow is basically the most amazing breakfast platter you will ever eat. It comes with a heaping pile of potatoes (5/5). The potatoes aren't your average hash brown or the soggy potatoes that come with a diner breakfast. These potatoes are super crispy and brown on the outside, soft on the inside, and seasoned to perfection. You can hear the crunch as you bite down. You also have the option of bacon (4/5) or sausage (5/5). You really can't go wrong with either option. Their chicken apple sausage is the perfect amount of sweetness and savory. The bacon is fatty and rich. My only qualm is that the bacon is a little limp If you're really feeling hungry, get both! Why not! Also, with the plate comes the standard 2 eggs any way you like, I personally prefer them poached soft so you can dip the crispy potatoes and meat in the runny yolk. Finally, to top it all off, are 2 lemon ricotta pancakes (6/5). These pancakes are not your average fluffy pancake. They are slightly denser, but packed full of flavor. I'll be honest, I'm not a pancake person normally. Waffles win it all for me, but when it comes to these lemon ricotta pancakes, I would eat a hundred if I could. 

As for the egg sandwich, they fry the egg to perfection. Yolk is perfectly runny, acting as a great sauce for the sandwich. The only reason this got a 4/5 in my book was due to the fact it really needed the addition of some meat. If you do get this sandwich, spend the extra couple bucks to add in some of that delicious bacon they have. Trust me, it'll take the sandwich to the next level. 

The crab scramble had way too many green onions for my liking (I personally hate them and will pick them out given the chance, but this had way too many to do so). It covered up the taste of the crab a bit. There were large hunks of crab throughout the omelet which is great, but there were quite a few pieces of shells too, which made it a bit annoying to eat.

Amazing food, great service - nothing more you could ask for.

Cons: 
- long wait on weekends and in the mornings 
- restaurant is small, so if you sit on the patio, it does get very cold

Pros: 
- brunch food here is A+ - everything is cooked to perfection
- service is fast and friendly

excerpts: I've had their fried egg sandwich, avocado toast, lemon ricotta pancakes, french toast, and the plow.
Everything so far has been great!
Parking in the area is a bit of a challenge especially if you come on a busy time.
Prepare to walk.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Ardielyn F.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: A great breakfast / brunch spot when you are in the area. The place is small so be prepared for a wait or come when they open. They have some tables outside as well.  Their crispy, crunchy, oh so yummy potatoes is a MUST order. If your getting something that doesn't come with it, order it as a side. Trust me! You can thank me later. They get most or all their ingredients from local farmers. Coffee is always good when it comes from Equator. I've had their fried egg sandwich, avocado toast, lemon ricotta pancakes, french toast, and the plow. Everything so far has been great! Parking in the area is a bit of a challenge especially if you come on a busy time. Prepare to walk.

excerpts: Food: I tried The Plow, which comes with two eggs, mini lemon ricotta pancakes, house made potatoes, and your choose of sausage, sausage patties, or bacon.
The eggs and the house made potatoes, which were in bite sized pieces, we're perfectly cooked!
The potatoes were nice and crispy.
Don't bother with their bacon here.
Unless you like the thin, cheap cuts of bacon that's burnt.
The lemon ricotta pancakes were the clear stars!
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Kay A.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
3.5 stars. 
Pretty good breakfast place! 

Tips: 

-Menu changes daily, so what you want might not be there. Benedict and strawberry French toast wasn't available on the day I went. 

-Be prepared to wait. We had a 45 minute wait for just two people. 

-you might possibly have to share a table with another party. This place is pretty small, and they've tried to seat more people than they should. 

Food: I tried The Plow, which comes with two eggs, mini lemon ricotta pancakes, house made potatoes, and your choose of sausage, sausage patties, or bacon. 
The eggs and the house made potatoes, which were in bite sized pieces, we're perfectly cooked! The potatoes were nice and crispy.  Don't bother with their bacon here. Unless you like the thin, cheap cuts of bacon that's burnt. The lemon ricotta pancakes were the clear stars! Tasted out of this world!  


The reason I knocked this place down a star is because their waitresses were very pushy and seemed to be rushing us. Also didn't like the fact that the place was really crowded! Like elbow to elbow with the party next to us.

excerpts: The lemon ricotta pancakes had a nice, light lemon flavor, but the texture was rather eggy.
Halfway into my first pancake, I felt that it was a little too heavy for my taste.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Tes Y.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
3 stars for my main dish. The lemon ricotta pancakes had a nice, light lemon flavor, but the texture was rather eggy. Halfway into my first pancake, I felt that it was a little too heavy for my taste. I guess I prefer it the old fashion way where it's fluffy, airy and light.

The crispy potatoes must be the best potatoes I've had for brunch.

The green tea is brewed with tea leaves and comes in a teapot- good!

It was about a 20 minute wait on a Wednesday morning.

It was a bright, clean, boisterous place; I had a good time catching up with an old friend.

I was surprised that parking was so easy to come by!

excerpts: I'd like to be different, but like everyone else, I agree, the lemon ricotta pancakes were simply delicious.
It was so good
, I looked up the recipe online and made them myself!
This place is solid, but the wait is kinda ridiculous especially on a weekend.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Meshell C.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
I'd like to be different, but like everyone else, I agree, the lemon ricotta pancakes were simply delicious.  It was so good, I looked up the recipe online and made them myself!  This place is solid, but the wait is kinda ridiculous especially on a weekend.  I'm not a fan of that, but I guess I can't hate on them for having business.  

The pumpkin spiced muffin was perfectly warm when our server brought it out.  The plate is a generous portion, so I got 2 meals out of my brunch plate.  Oh yah, the potatoes were perfectly seasoned too.  Watched them toss is while we sat at the counter.  

No sure why other people are bitching and complaining and I don't care, I like this place and I'll be back!

excerpts: He always gets the lemon ricotta pancakes.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Mina F.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
My husband loves this place. He always gets the lemon ricotta pancakes.

I love the chia pudding and the Hong Kong toast.

The service is a little slow on the weekends but they get pretty busy so it is understandable.

excerpts: Lemon ricotta pancakes - fluffy and zesty.
Smoked salmon toast - great bread, but the fish could definitely use some seasoning/spices.
Stack some crispy bacon and over easy eggs on that, and you've got a winner.
Overall great service and really good food.
Plates are about $12-15, so it's not cheap, but you're getting quality stuff here.
Getting their housemade patty next time for sure.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Danny C.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: Oh, Plow, how delicious you are. Sure, the wait is brutal, and you're probably going to be sitting in the cold outside (heaters, please, in the future?) after standing around getting cold for an hour or so, but the food is great. Plow potatoes - crispy, airy, and hot. Lemon ricotta pancakes - fluffy and zesty. Smoked salmon toast - great bread, but the fish could definitely use some seasoning/spices. Stack some crispy bacon and over easy eggs on that, and you've got a winner. Overall great service and really good food. Plates are about $12-15, so it's not cheap, but you're getting quality stuff here. Getting their housemade patty next time for sure.

excerpts: The "plow" breakfast - This allowed me to try everything everyone had told me about: the crispy potatoes (good, but not mind-blowing) and the lemon ricotta pancakes (great!).
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: David B.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Showed up just before 9 am on a Saturday morning and was shocked to hear that the wait would be an hour. I figured Sunday, yeah. Or 10 or 11 am, yeah. But 9? But we were in for the food and waited patiently. 

It was probably about 45-50 minutes before we got seated, and there was some sort of snafu where they seated some other person with the same name ahead of us. It's good I went to check our place on the list because my name (with last initial!) was crossed off. 

On to the food:
Buttermilk biscuit - we shared this, and it was great by itself and even better with the accompanying honey butter.
The "plow" breakfast - This allowed me to try everything everyone had told me about: the crispy potatoes (good, but not mind-blowing) and the lemon ricotta pancakes (great!). Meanwhile, the housemade pork sausage patty was flavorful and the eggs were, well, eggs.

While I'm not sure I'd go back and wait an hour to do this again, the food was definitely very good overall and I loved the atmosphere of the place. Friendly service, nice ambiance...a good place.

excerpts: but the lemon ricotta pancakes were ON POINT!
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Eileen W.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Tried this place out again on a weekday lunch because my girlfriends wanted to go against my wise advice ;)

I don't know happened this time or last time but the lemon ricotta pancakes were ON POINT!

I'd go again but NEVER on a weekend, unless I was being held hostage against my will.

FYI line at around 11:30 on a Tuesday was about 25 minutes

excerpts: I liked the lemon ricotta pancakes, but not as much as everyone else does.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Gabrielle C.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
I love Plow, but I hate the crazy waits. Food is seriously good though. 

Breakfast sandwich- Amazing. I love it so much. It is seriously perfect. 

Shirred Eggs- These are good. I had to try them because I'm a sucker for eggs poached in a tomato sauce, but haven't gotten them since. Prefer the breakfast sandwich.

The Plow- This is a good plate to try a bit of it all. Their house made sausage, is killer. I liked the lemon ricotta pancakes, but not as much as everyone else does. 

This place is great. Try going during the week, but menu is a bit different on weekend.

excerpts: The best thing on the menu is the lemon ricotta pancakes.
The texture was softer and crumblier than a normal pancake and the flavor was outstanding.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Bailey Z.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
I am not easily impressed by overpriced brunch spots, but today I was an exception. It's funny that everyone emphasizes organic and locally-sourced ingredients these days. Eating organic isn't enough anymore, but you now must do society and your community a service by supporting local farms, etc. I hate it for the most part only because it usually means pricier bills for mediocre food. Plow keeps their menu simple, but they do it well.

I got the fried egg sandwich, constructed with two eggs, aioli, frisee, cheddar on an Acme bun. Pay the extra couple bucks for the Nueske bacon; you will not regret it. The sandwich was the perfect answer for breakfast. The bun was soft and airy, and the combination of melted cheese, fried eggs, and crispy bacon was heavenly. The crispy potatoes on the side were amazing. The best thing on the menu is the lemon ricotta pancakes. The texture was softer and crumblier than a normal pancake and the flavor was outstanding. It was probably one of the best pancakes I've ever had. 

Overall, I loved the breakfast here. The prices weren't cheap ($13 for the breakfast sandwich and $15 for the plow). I wouldn't normally pay this much for breakfast, but if it's done right, it's hard to pass up.

excerpts:
- chicken sausage was average and burned
- lemon ricotta pancakes were ok, but not above average
- the potatoes are better than at an average diner but nothing special
- the eggs were ok

Overall, 2 stars.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Greg T.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
TL;DR Wait over an hour in the cold for average diner food that is $30+ per person.  Save your time and money.

Maybe it's the ever-present 1+ hour wait that raised my expectations, but I have no idea why there is always a line at this place.  People must just like the scene.  Given that there is always a wait (even on a weekday), they should come up with a better scheduling system.

The good:
4/5 stars for service.  The staff were mostly friendly and attentive.  The atmosphere inside is cozy.

The bad:
1/5 stars for the long wait.  You have to put your name on the list and you wait on some tiny benches outside in the cold.  (They recently added a single heat lamp outside for people to gather around).  I wouldn't mind waiting if the food was really good, but...

1/5 stars for the food (at the price)
I know this is SF and everything is expensive, but I'd rather pay an additional 20-30% if it meant having better ingredients.  We ordered "the plow", OJ, coffee, tea and a fruit plate.
- $4 for a tiny glass of OJ that's not fresh squeezed - don't bother ordering
- $5 tea in tea bag that's so old there's very little flavor
- $4 for coffee that was burned - at least they give you free refills
- $7.5 for fruit plate served with pieces of brown fruit
- bacon was not high quality.  It was burned yet somehow still fatty.
- chicken sausage was average and burned
- lemon ricotta pancakes were ok, but not above average
- the potatoes are better than at an average diner but nothing special
- the eggs were ok

Overall, 2 stars.  

To be fair, I guess the bar is pretty low when it comes to breakfast and brunch in SF.  I can't think of many spots that I would consider good for the price.  (Olea used to be good, but their ingredients took a step down).  Overall, Plow will leave you feeling like you ate at a greasy diner, but somehow overpaid by 2x.

Example good brunch spots: La Note in Berkeley, Square One in L.A.

excerpts: Truth was, I NEEDED to try the lemon ricotta pancakes everyone was talking about!
Now on to the food...we ordered the plow with the lemon ricotta pancakes and another with caramelized apple french toast.
TOTALLY worth however long we waited or were going to wait!!
The food tasted fresh!
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Mariana C.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
After a couple of days in San Francisco and the regular union square spots, we somehow encountered this location. I read online that the wait time was a long time...as we pulled up, I realized this wasn't a joke. Truth was, I NEEDED to try the lemon ricotta pancakes everyone was talking about! 

Let me just say that the wait was COMPLETELY worth it. We were advised the wait would be around 45-1hr for a table for 2. Thing was that people are impatient and about 3 couples ahead of us choose to leave rather than wait, so our actual wait time was only 25 minutes!!! I think we got lucky, a local way saying it is always crazy, so if you plan on coming out, expect the delay. 

Now on to the food...we ordered the plow with the lemon ricotta pancakes and another with caramelized apple french toast. TOTALLY worth however long we waited or were going to wait!! The food tasted fresh! From the sausage patties to the bacon, you can definitely taste the natural.

Every single person that makes the staff up is super nice! Which also made the experience a wonderful one! This place is awesome! Next time I'm in town I'm coming back! That is for sure!

excerpts: The Plow is brunchy bliss comprised of two eggs, your choice of house made pork sausage, Nueske bacon, or chicken apple sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes and crispy potatoes.
I went for the house made pork sausage but was able to steal a chicken sausage link off my buddy's plate -
both were awesome!
Nine times out of ten I'll order anything but pancakes but seeing as these were part of the "package deal" I approached with not only an open mind, but also an open mouth.
I was told that the lemon ricotta pancakes "are a make or break item" leaving you loving or conflicted on the breakfast.
Truth be told, they were a big win in my book but the true star of the show were the crispy potatoes.
Kissed with a hint of rosemary and crisped to the point that they're crunchy, but not overcooked or burnt.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Brad B.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
I was given strict instructions when I went to Plow. They were short and simple, but were sure to provide me an experience that could not be flawed.

1. Don't look at the menu
2. Order "The Plow"

Easy enough right? Right! I did as I was told and had an exceptional breakfast, which admittedly was a little out of my wheelhouse, (not a huge breakfast fan), and resulted in the plate basically being licked clean. 

The Plow is brunchy bliss comprised of two eggs, your choice of house made pork sausage, Nueske bacon, or chicken apple sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes and crispy potatoes. I went for the house made pork sausage but was able to steal a chicken sausage link off my buddy's plate - both were awesome! Nine times out of ten I'll order anything but pancakes but seeing as these were part of the "package deal" I approached with not only an open mind, but also an open mouth. I was told that the lemon ricotta pancakes "are a make or break item" leaving you loving or conflicted on the breakfast. Truth be told, they were a big win in my book but the true star of the show were the crispy potatoes. Kissed with a hint of rosemary and crisped to the point that they're crunchy, but not overcooked or burnt. Be sure to ask for a bottle of hot sauce if you want to take them to another level and wash it all down with a cold glass of orange juice. 

Thanks Plow!

excerpts: Lemon ricotta pancakes were ok
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Cee M.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Came here for breakfast and ordered the plow. My plate looks good by looking at it but when I started to dig in....it was just average to me. Lemon ricotta pancakes were ok, the crispy potatoes are not so crispy, Sunnyside up was a tiny bit raw and with the apple sausages was good.

For a weekday around 930ish am was busy and i waited about 20 mins to be seated. Yes, this place is too hipster for me and the prices on the menu are pricey. Got fooled by the yelp reviewers and I do not plan on coming back here.

excerpts: The Plow - two lemon ricotta pancakes, two housemade sausages, two eggs and the crispy potatoes.
The pancakes were really amazing.
The lemon wasn't too strong and the flavor combined with the Vermont syrup was perfect together.
The sausages have a little kick to them.
I'm not a spicy eater
so these were just the right amount combined with the savory flavor or the pork.
The crispy potatoes were also just good, very good.
I'm not sure how they get them so fried and crispy like that.
Shirred Eggs - also a must get, two eggs in a tomato based concoction where the tomato doesn't overpower the dish and combines with the egg to produce a very smooth flavor.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Ander C.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
This place was really good. I came in on a weekday morning and there was still a line, albeit not very long, but it was surprised to see this place packed.

The Plow - two lemon ricotta pancakes, two housemade sausages, two eggs and the crispy potatoes. The pancakes were really amazing. The lemon wasn't too strong and the flavor combined with the Vermont syrup was perfect together. The sausages have a little kick to them. I'm not a spicy eater so these were just the right amount combined with the savory flavor or the pork. The crispy potatoes were also just good, very good. I'm not sure how they get them so fried and crispy like that. I was nibbling down to the very last little bit on those.

Shirred Eggs - also a must get, two eggs in a tomato based concoction where the tomato doesn't overpower the dish and combines with the egg to produce a very smooth flavor. It's limited due to the fact they serve it in a hot dish so get this if you can.

Overall it was really good place for brunch and I hope to definitely come back!

excerpts: ALSO MUST TRY LEMON RICOTTA PANCAKES!!
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Chloe S.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: It's a very cute place, but very small for amount of people who come here. I waited almost two hours but it was totally worth it. The waiters are really nice. I ordered The Plow and my boyfriend ordered the Benedict and both were really good. ALSO MUST TRY LEMON RICOTTA PANCAKES!!

excerpts: I ordered the lemon ricotta pancakes and they were "to die for".
Because I stick to a vegetarian diet, I asked if there was something they could substitute in lieu of the bacon or sausage offerings.
I was pleasantly rewarded with a 1/2 of an avocado.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Patrice F.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
The food is outstanding!  I ordered the lemon ricotta pancakes and they were "to die for". Because I stick to a vegetarian diet, I asked if there was something they could substitute in lieu of the bacon or sausage offerings.  I was pleasantly rewarded with a 1/2 of an avocado.  Not only is the food good, but the presentation is that of a  restaurant.  

We were a party of four and it took us 1 hour 45 minutes to get a table.  This was on a Sunday morning and the only downside to our experience.

However, if you are on a visit to The City, and this is your only chance to try this lovely eatery, it's well worth the wait.

The potatoes alone are worth the wait!  The wait staff are on top of business and exceptionally pleasant considering they never stop!!!

We hope you will enjoy your experience.

excerpts: I had the Plow with bacon, eggs, lemon ricotta pancakes and plow potatoes
and it was amazing.
There are so many great options on the menu
I wish I could have tried it all.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Kelsey L.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: Expect to wait a while to be seated for brunch on Saturday or Sunday but I promise it was worth the wait. I had the Plow with bacon, eggs, lemon ricotta pancakes and plow potatoes and it was amazing. There are so many great options on the menu I wish I could have tried it all.

lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
-Arrived at 12:00PM on a Wed, seating in 5 minutes. It was a beautiful day so we sat outside
-Great service and friendly staff.
-Of course I got the PLOW: Two eggs, choice of house made pork sausage, nueske bacon, or chicken apple sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes, crispy potatoes
