excerpts: I had the plow which comes with eggs, a side of meat (sausage,bacon), potatoes and lemon ricotta pancakes.
Good amount of food offered since it was like $16.00.
But of what was offered the potatoes were the most memorable.
2nd to that was the pancakes which I had as my dessert, light and sweet.
Good solid brunch spot, but can get a bit tight during busy hours, as seating can get pretty "friendly" to your neighbor.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Julie B.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
5 stars for their potatoes
How do they make these wonderful potatoes?! 
So crispy and crunchy yet soft and tender on the inside. They are brunchtastic magic!

I had the plow which comes with eggs, a side of meat (sausage,bacon), potatoes and lemon ricotta pancakes.
Good amount of food offered since it was like $16.00. But of what was offered the potatoes were the most memorable. 2nd to that was the pancakes which I had as my dessert, light and sweet.

excerpts: I love lemon ricotta pancakes and heard this place is one of the best spots for that.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Veronica T.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
I've wanted to come here for a long time. I love lemon ricotta pancakes and heard this place is one of the best spots for that.

We came around 1030am and waited for nearly an hour. It's quite small inside so you wait outside. We quickly figured out you can go inside and get a cup of coffee while waiting. AWESOME.

After our wait we finally got seated at the counter. It was so fun to watch all the chefs in the kitchen. They're amazingly fast and talented at preparing delicious looking and smelling food.

Food was amazing. I ordered the plow w/scrambled eggs, add cheese. So good and enough for two people easily. Maybe it's not your most creative breakfast food, but it sure was satisfying.

excerpts: The husband ordered "The Plow"- eggs, sausage, potatoes and lemon ricotta pancakes (our friend had told us these were unbelievable and she was was right!)
I had a dish which was so amazing
I have completely forgotten the name (amnesia induced by bliss).
It was a slice of toasted brioche bread, gruyere, prosciutto, frisee, and a garlic pepper fried egg, served with their oh-so-delicious plow potatoes.
The coffee kept coming and we had reached breakfast nirvana.
We will be back and we will not bitch about the wait :-)!
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Lisa W.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: Well wow! Just heard about this place from a friend and hopped right on it -- we are breakfast-obsessed after all. Got here on a Saturday morning at around 10, no trouble at all finding parking, and were told it would be an hour wait. Now I'll admit that in 95% of restaurants I've found the host/hostess will overstate how long the wait will be, so I assumed we were looking at less than 45 minutes. Credit to them - they know their customers -- it was one hour exactly. Nice little neighborhood to stroll around in while you wait and friendly, relaxed crowd to hang with on the sidewalk (there are a few places to perch yourself if you'd rather not stand). Really cute place, and about 10 tables out on the sidewalk as well. We were taken inside at the one hour mark and they had coffee in front of us with lightening speed - high marks for that. The staff was incredibly nice and on top of everything. The husband ordered "The Plow"- eggs, sausage, potatoes and lemon ricotta pancakes (our friend had told us these were unbelievable and she was was right!)  I had a dish which was so amazing I have completely forgotten the name (amnesia induced by bliss). It was a slice of toasted brioche bread, gruyere, prosciutto, frisee, and a garlic pepper fried egg, served with their oh-so-delicious plow potatoes. The coffee kept coming and we had reached breakfast nirvana. We will be back and we will not bitch about the wait :-)!

excerpts: My girlfriends got the egg breakfast sandwich and the lemon ricotta pancakes.
They loved both.
I was able to try the lemon ricotta pancakes and these are a little slice of heaven.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Coleen K.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Came here for brunch with two girlfriends while visiting San Francisco for the weekend. We found this place via Yelp, and it was a big hit!

We went in on a Monday morning at about 9AM and we were able to snag three bar seats without a wait. The place is really small, ~10 tables, so definitely be prepared to wait. Our bar seats were great-- we had front row seats to look at the open kitchen and watch the chefs cook. Very cool to see them making the homemade pancakes, potatoes and eggs. 

I tried the plow 2 egg breakfast, complete with two eggs sunnyside up, the handmade pork sausage, the famous plow potatoes, and toast. The winner of this meal, and perhaps the restaurant in general, were definitely the plow potatoes. Fried to perfection. The pork sausage was nicely seasoned, but a tad bit dry. My girlfriends got the egg breakfast sandwich and the lemon ricotta pancakes. They loved both. I was able to try the lemon ricotta pancakes and these are a little slice of heaven. Sweet and savory all in one!

One thing I'll say is that breakfast seemed pricey. Dishes were about $14-$16, which seems steep. That being said, San Francisco is more expensive than Chicago!

excerpts: * two delightfully sweet and light lemon ricotta pancakes
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Connie L.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Having read reviews on Yelp, I knew that the wait would be long, especially on a Sunday that was Father's Day! For our group of 5, we waited for around 1 hour and 30 minutes - luckily the SF marathon passed us just one block down the hill, so we were easily able to entertain ourselves that morning.

Plow has this great, welcoming, and airy ambience. It's small, so small you squeeze up against the waitstaff and other customers every time you get up out of your seat, but also so clean and cozy it feels like you're dining in a cloud of pleasantness and good intentions. It is a little loud, but comfortably so.
 
Per Yelp's recommendations, we ordered four Plows and one fried chicken sandwich: two with bacon, one with pork sausage, and one with chicken apple. Each was amply sized:
    * two delightfully sweet and light lemon ricotta pancakes
    * two eggs cooked as you liked them (I had mine scrambled: so fluffy!)
    * your meat option (the chicken apple sausages are nicely sweet)
    * crispy potatoes. Might I mention that if you come here for nothing else, you order    
    these potatoes. You wait an hour for these potatoes because they are WORTH IT. Just the right amount of batter, salt, and seasoning to make me forget about how much starch I'm consuming and wallow in happiness for the rest of the morning.

The fried egg sandwich, which my mother ordered, seemed kind of messy as the yolk managed to drip out all over her hand when she first picked it up.

Otherwise, I have no negative comments about Plow. The service is great, the food is outstanding, and it is worth the wait and the hour long drive we made to get there. C:

excerpts: and I said "lemon ricotta pancakes
" and he just looked at me funny.
We went there and after he tasted them, he was pleasantly surprised.
It tastes like a dessert but not an overwhelming sugary dessert.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Sasha P.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Best breakfast/brunch food ever. 
I told my friend about this place and I said "lemon ricotta pancakes" and he just looked at me funny. We went there and after he tasted them, he was pleasantly surprised. It tastes like a dessert but not an overwhelming sugary dessert. These pancakes hands down the best I've ever had - so light and fluffy.

Same goes for the sausages - they have fennel in them and are the absolute best sausages I've ever had. 

I would recommend "The Plow" with the sausage!

excerpts: Can I just say the crispy potatoes did not disappoint and the lemon ricotta pancakes were Aaaaaamazzzing!!
I've definitely never tasted something like that before.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Jennifer F.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
One of my favorite brunch spots. Wish they had this in San Diego! 

I ordered the plow... Can I just say the crispy potatoes did not disappoint and the lemon ricotta pancakes were Aaaaaamazzzing!! I've definitely never tasted something like that before. Also, the biscuit with honey butter melts in your mouth; I'm drooling as I type this.

I definitely recommend this spot if you're into the savory kind of breakfast and if you have time (long wait, but worth it!) When I visit SF again, I will def be coming here!

excerpts: The Lemon Ricotta pancakes melt in your mouth and taste like dessert.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Jenny L.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Came here 10 minutes before they opened on a Saturday and the line wasn't too bad at all.  Ordered The Plow and it was enough food to share with my friend...with leftovers.  Portions are huge and delicious.  

The Lemon Ricotta pancakes melt in your mouth and taste like dessert.  

Got the chicken apple sausage and it didn't disappoint.  Will need to be back to check out the rest of the menu!

excerpts: The potatoes were flavorful, the bacon was smoked and the lemon ricotta pancakes melts in your mouth.
Delicious!
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Samantha N.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
I finally got to try this place and the food was good.

The line of course is always out the door, even on a Tuesday at noon when we thought there wouldn't be. The woman taking names down was the only reason why I didn't give this place 5 stars. I have her my name and party number and later realized we needed a high chair for my niece so we went and told her to add it to our party. When we were called I walked over to our seats as my sister in law got something out the car. When she met me at the table we pulled up the high chair thinking the woman had forgot, but she quickly came and rudely said "I'm sorry ladies I can't do that!" We explained to her that we had told her to add a high chair to the party and she told us to wait outside until she could get a bigger table. She then showed us she had two Samantha's and that she called the other Samantha. I'm convinced she just didn't hear us when we said to add the high chair to our party, and added our names to the list as a new party which made the wait time even longer.

What saved that encounter was a really sweet busboy who came and asked what name our party was under to see what the wait time was because he had noticed every one being called except us. He came out and told us the big table was close to being available and then asked us if we wanted a drink while we waited outside. He kindly brought us coffee which was just awesome. He was the best, amazing customer service from him.

The wait time for our food was also a little over an hour but we were very satisfied with the food. The potatoes were flavorful, the bacon was smoked and the lemon ricotta pancakes melts in your mouth. Delicious!

excerpts: I guess its the curse of Yelp that once someone recommends an item everyone orders it - but the Lemon Ricotta Pancakes are worth every review written out here (must try!!).
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Preethish S.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: Be prepared to wait for your food for a really long time but the food's really really good. I guess its the curse of Yelp that once someone recommends an item everyone orders it - but the Lemon Ricotta Pancakes are worth every review written out here (must try!!). Ordered the Plow, French Toast and the Fried Egg Sandwich as well and pretty much everything tasted great ( plus the wait makes you super hungry as well :P )

excerpts: Everyone comes here for the lemon ricotta pancakes.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Angela K.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Plow sits in the up and coming Dogpatch and I'm really loving this area. That being said, I was really excited to try this place. The only catch - it's basically a 2 hour wait.

The food is good, definitely. As all the Yelpers recommend, get the Plow. I agree - it gives you all the breakfast basics: eggs, sausage or bacon, pancakes and crispy potatoes. Everyone comes here for the lemon ricotta pancakes. Being that I'm the stranger person that does not like lemony baked goods, I went with the almond flour pancakes. I was a big fan of the almond flour pancakes and the crispy potatoes. Everything else was made well and overall, it was a fulfilling breakfast.

But it is NOT worth a 2 hour wait. If you're an early riser, then definitely come when they open. Otherwise, plan to put your name down, walk around grab a snack, take your time and come back 2 hours later.

excerpts:
Our table ordered the following:

Lemon Ricotta Pancakes - these were good, but not fantastic.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Joanne Y.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Maybe I over-hyped it. Maybe 7x7 over-hyped it. Maybe my friends over-hyped it. Or maybe Yelp just over-hyped this place. All of the above? I don't know, but I left somewhat unimpressed.

Our table ordered the following:

Lemon Ricotta Pancakes - these were good, but not fantastic. I'd say maybe too lemon-y and a little dry.

Fried Egg Sandwich w/Bacon - while this was good, it wasn't mind-blowing. It's just an egg sandwich in bread nicer than toast. The potato wedges were great though.

Dungeness Crab Scamble - This was my favorite dish, however $17 was a tad expensive IMO. I liked that they put a decent amount of crab meat, but it could still use more. Nothing really special about this scramble either except for having crab meat.

We came here on a Wednesday afternoon around 10:45am and for a party of 4 we waited about 20-30 mins. Not a bad wait, so hearing about 2 hour waits on the weekends makes me wonder why people would wait that long for the food here. Don't get me wrong - their food is good, just not great or better than many other brunch places in the city. I'm glad I finally tried this place, but I probably will not return anytime soon. Bummer.

excerpts: but the marvel of the dish was the lemon ricotta pancakes.
I dont know how to describe how well this hit every piece of my pallate.
Little zest, not overly sweetened, creamy yet firm.
The Plow or Lemon Ricotta Pancakes
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Reena B.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
This place is spot on for the food/service/atmosphere.

To start off, I had a minor celebrity spotting while I waited for a table.  I found it even more entertaining when they seated me AHEAD of the minor celebrity because I came in first...well done for service and treating everyone equal.  

I tried the Plow, anything named after the restaurant has to be their signature dish and SOOO GOOD.  It's a little bit of everything and guaranteed to hit the spot.

The homemade sausage patties were out of this world, rosemary potatoes some of the best I ever had..but the marvel of the dish was the lemon ricotta pancakes.  I dont know how to describe how well this hit every piece of my pallate.  Little zest, not overly sweetened, creamy yet firm.  Wow wow wow!

Service was also impeccable.  Friendly and made you feel like a guest in someones home. My coffee cup was NEVER empty and you could tell that they all kind of loved being part of the team.

Food Recommendation: The Plow or Lemon Ricotta Pancakes

lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Elaine N.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Came here with my fellow foodie Fanny W., we found parking across the street (that never happens...), walked in and were seated right away at the last table available, sweet! There's nothing like a bright and sunny morning in SF, I mean how often does that happen honestly? Good thing Plow takes full advantage of whenever the weather is beautiful with its huge storefront facing windows. 

We opted for the Fried Egg Sandwich and THE PLOW. I thought the Fried Egg Sandwich sounded a bit ordinary, but it was far from it! Equipped with  two eggs fried, aioli, frisee, Vermont cheddar, Acme bun. The aioli puts a nice twist on the egg sandwich, and to top it off with Acme bun made fresh in the city, I could not resist. 

The Plow is a must order at Plow -- two eggs, choice of house made pork sausage, Nueske bacon, or chicken apple sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes, crispy potatoes. We went with the two eggs, house made pork sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes, crispy potatoes. Man-oh-man was this dish delish. The pork sausage was nicely seasoned, not too salty (which is a huge plus to me), the lemon ricotta pancakes were AMAZING it made my mouth drop (and this is coming from a girl who doesn't like lemon zested anything...), and the seasoned house potatoes sounded average, but they definitely weren't. 

Overall we had a fantastic experience here at Plow. Parking was easy (no meter), we were seated right away (rare moment), and the service/ambiance screamed brunch, what more could you ask for. One thing bothered me though, there was a huge mix up with the check, we were charged an extra $20... Something was obviously wrong here. I've been reading about restaurants scamming their customers a lot lately down in Santa Ana, so I was extra careful to check the tab. I'm sure it was just a mistake, but for it to happen to both our table and the table adjacent to ours? Kind of strange, I think Plow needs to figure that one out... Nonetheless Fanny W. and I really enjoyed our experience here and hope to be back real soon!

excerpts: The lemon ricotta pancakes were also to die for, seriously.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Lina T.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
YUM.

It's one of the best places for breakfast in San Francisco. If you are planning on going to San Francisco anytime soon, bookmark this place and come early! We came super early on a weekend morning on our way to a retreat. We were one of the first groups in line so luckily we didn't have to wait very long at all. Even if there was a wait it would be absolutely worth it. 

The place is quite small, they have a bar which seats singles or for those who don't want to wait for a table and are just there for a quick bite to eat. I think the biggest table they have seats four people. The decor is quite simple, a hint of an industrial and a touch of farmhouse chic, super cute. 

So you may think that it's such a simple egg sandwich, which it pretty much is. But it's soooo much more than that. The bread is very slightly sweet and buttered and crunchy. And the sauce that they pair with the frisée doesn't overpower the true taste of the egg. The egg is cooked to over-easy perfection and the yolk turns into this messy deliciousness. Probably the most delicious egg I've ever eaten. Simple and clean flavors, everything works so well together. The lemon ricotta pancakes were also to die for, seriously.

And makes me so hungry just thinking about it.
The waffle was so fresh, the fruit and everything else complemented each other so well.
The potatoes had the perfect amount of salt and spice and CRUNCH.

oh my god.

lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Lauryn S.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
This place is so amazing. I ate here a couple months back, but I just recently started reviewing on Yelp & came back across this place on the "Yelposphere." 

If I could give this place 6 out of 5 stars I totally would!  It's pretty popular, especially in the morning time, but it's earned its name. My family, boyfriend, and I went around 9:30 ish in the morning (party of 6) and had about a 20-25 minute wait from what I could remember. We were starving but the wait was totally worth it. 

First off, the service is great! ABSOLUTELY WELCOMING! Everyone there is super friendly and smiling, and always willing to offer you a helping hand, regardless of your needs. 

The food was so delicious. We all nearly melted in our seats. I forgot what it was called, but I ordered the waffle with the strawberries & potatoes on the side. And I also tried my boyfriend's Lemon Ricotta pancakes. SOOOO GOOD. And makes me so hungry just thinking about it. The waffle was so fresh, the fruit and everything else complemented each other so well. The potatoes had the perfect amount of salt and spice and CRUNCH. I could cry just reminiscing. The pancakes too, oh my god. So much flavor. Lemon ricotta was such a good idea. 

The decor was just a plus. Super clean, sleek, and modern. The clear windows allowed lots of sun to shine through which was nice. 

I will definitely be coming back in the near future. 10/10 would recommend!!!!

excerpts: The lemon ricotta pancakes are a popular choice.
Very fluffy and light with tons of lemon flavor.
I love the texture, but the lemon was a bit to strong for my taste.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Daisy T.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Crispy potatoes... *drool*.... mmmm, mmmm good!

Yes, there's a ridiculous wait for this place on the weekends (up to two hours), but it's totally worth it! Though I do suggest that you try to hit up this place during the week. The wait time goes down to 30 minutes. 

This cute little place is located right at the corner surrounded by FREE parking. Just hope that you can find a spot! The place is small. Maybe no more than 20 people can sit down at a time. But there are a handful of seats at the counter where you can watch the magic happen.

The menu is small but features locally sourced, high quality ingredients, making even the simplest dishes stand out in comparison to the basic breakfast joint. Choose from a warm mushroom salad to a dungeness crab scramble to chia seed pudding.

The lemon ricotta pancakes are a popular choice. Very fluffy and light with tons of lemon flavor. I love the texture, but the lemon was a bit to strong for my taste. I suggest getting The Plow combo if you want to enjoy these. That way you can get it with two eggs any style and your choice of housemade sausage, Neuske bacon or chicken sausage. Some salt to balance out the sweetness.

My fave is the fried egg sandwich! Two eggs over easy sandwiched by soft, toasted Acme bread with frisee, aioli and cheese with the additional Neuske bacon (everything is better with bacon!). The creamy egg yolk mixes with all the components and makes it finger lickin' good! It also comes with a side of their infamous crispy potatoes!

They're serious about their potatoes. Smashed red potatoes flavored with fresh rosemary and onions and fried to perfection! They managed to find a way for you to have your hashbrowns and country potatoes together as one! You can't find potatoes like this anywhere else!

By the way, if you like scrambled eggs, they know how to do it right. Super light and fluffy yet still creamy. I don't even like scrambled eggs, but I love them here!

Good thing I don't live next to here or else I'd have a muffin top full of crispy potatoes and bacon!

Lastly, the scrambled eggs.

and I definitely got way more than the two the menu said I'd get.
WIN.

Best brunch I've had in a long time. While the menu appears to have simple, classic brunch items, Plow really perfected all of the items on my plate. I got 'The Plow' which features the best of sweet and salty breakfast options. The lemon ricotta pancakes were perfectly fluffy and were complimented well with the little pitcher of maple syrup. The home fries, oh the home fries. These were very well seasoned, crispy and golden on the outside, soft on the inside. A separate waitress made sure we had little dishes of ketchup to go with our potatoes. Lastly, the scrambled eggs. These were also very yummy and I definitely got way more than the two the menu said I'd get. WIN. I got the chicken apple sausage and recommend it.

You won't regret going here!

excerpts: Highlights were the lemon ricotta pancakes (best pancake I've ever had) and the pork sausage (great blend of spices and crispness).
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Clinton L.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Finally made it down here after living in Potrero for over a year. Went on a weekday to avoid the long lines but still had to wait 30 mins. 

Highlights were the lemon ricotta pancakes (best pancake I've ever had) and the pork sausage (great blend of spices and crispness). Everything else was solid but not wait-worthy. 

Friendly service and they comp'ed our buttermilk biscuit because our food took a long time to come out.

Will be back again but not waiting more than 30 mins!

excerpts: The star of this place is the lemon ricotta pancakes.
They are as good as other reviews have said.
If lemon ricotta pancakes are your thing or even if they are not - give these a try at least once.
Those pancakes are the only thing that brings me back to this place.
The rest of the food appears fresh and is good, but can also be inconsistent.
Bacon has been overcooked on more than one visit(leaving it on the dry side) and potatoes have gone from crisp on the outside, steamy good on the inside one visit to a greasy soggy mess on another.
Sandwiches have been good.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Jorge M.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Lots of rave reviews for Plow, tho depending on what you value in your dining experience it could be a good or poor experience. 

Service. I'm rating not only the service in the restaurant but on the phone as well. Service I'd give as 2-stars. Not that it hasn't been good it has, but it's also been inconsistent and poor - at times staff overwhelmed with the crowd or inconsistent messaging when calling in an order - sad to observe but sometimes the service is more along the lines of what's convenient for the staff, not the customer. 

Food. I'll never review a place I haven't been to at least 3 times and in the case of Plow it's 6+. The star of this place is the lemon ricotta pancakes. They are as good as other reviews have said. If lemon ricotta pancakes are your thing or even if they are not - give these a try at least once. Those pancakes are the only thing that brings me back to this place. The rest of the food appears fresh and is good, but can also be inconsistent. Bacon has been overcooked on more than one visit(leaving it on the dry side) and potatoes have gone from crisp on the outside, steamy good on the inside one visit to a greasy soggy mess on another. Sandwiches have been good.  The guys in the kitchen are hustling and doing a good job of getting dishes out, just need to focus on the consistency part. 

Ambiance. Plow is a cute clean place on the outer edge of shops and other restaurants on its street. It has a smallish indoor dining area and a handful of tables along the outside of the restaurant. They also have a counter space where you can see most of what's going on in the kitchen. The seating outside is plagued with people waiting, watching you eat while they suffer thru that long wait. Not uncommon to have 15 - 20 people milling around outside this place.  Lastly, it can get cold outside(most time you are in a shade), they offer blankets for folks sitting down to eat at the outside tables.  

Recommendation. The place gets busy busy busy. If you don't mind waiting for an hour plus then line up, if you don't, then try to visit during the week(tho still busy) for those pancakes and see if they measure up. Or try coming by yourself and see if you can score a single seat at the counter quicker(this has worked but not always). Lastly, if you do hate waits, this place is not for you - I've seen people get worked up and not enjoy their breakfast/lunch.

We got lucky and were seated quickly considering they have limited seating. I got the fried egg sandwich with bacon. It came with their fried potatoes, which were fried to perfection. Very crispy outside, and soft on the inside and well seasoned. The sandwich was a delight. It had cheese and a expertly fried egg. The bacon acted as the sprinkles on a good cupcake! Really good! We shared some of the Almond flour pancakes, which were surprisingly light and fluffy. 

I got to try some of "the plow", which had their house made sausage, lemon ricotta pancakes, and crispy potatoes.  I really liked the lemon ricotta pancakes, too! They had a little citrus flavor that went well with a little bit of syrup. They don't have an extensive menu, but it is like that for a reason. They do what they do well and that is all you need to know!

lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
This is a really cute place and the food was pretty tasty. I ordered the two-egg breakfast and my table shared pumpkin pancakes. We did have a pretty long wait for 4 people (almost 40 minutes on a Thursday morning), but that was to be expected from other reviews as well as the size of the restaurant. 
The reason it is 3 stars instead of 4 is because my hot tea was served tepid.That sounds really picky, but I was sitting outside and it was chilly, so it would have been really nice to have "hot" tea. 
I do want to go back and try the lemon ricotta pancakes, and give Plow another shot.

lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Linz C.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: Got here around 12:45 on a Friday and it was a full house but we only waited about five minutes for a table of two. For drinks we ordered a root beer and a homemade strawberry lemonade. The lemonade was adorable and came with one of those old school paper straws with red stripes on it. It was a little on the sour side but was still refreshing. My boyfriend and I ordered the plow breakfast combo which came with two eggs, two lemon ricotta pancakes, REALLY REALLY BOMB ASS crunchy potatoes, and two pork sausage patties. The lemon ricotta pancakes were sooo flavorful and really moist. We also ordered a French toast which came with marscapone cream and strawberries on top (also bomb). Everything was absolutely delicious!!  Would definitely be back again to try their weekend brunch menu.

excerpts: The food is forgettable, except for bad things: the much-ballyhooed lemon ricotta pancakes taste like soured lemon square dessert with a strangely unwelcome doughiness to it.
If you want lemon square dessert for breakfast, save yourself the hassle of the wait and go buy lemon squares.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Esther M.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Holy Overrated, Batman! Everyone told me this place was gangbusters, and the long line I saw outside seemed to confirm it was worth waiting for. 

Let me tell you: it wasn't. I live in Potrero Hill and I will still never be back. The best thing I can say about this place is that the hosts and hostesses are very, very nice about managing the very, very long wait. 

The food is forgettable, except for bad things: the much-ballyhooed lemon ricotta pancakes taste like soured lemon square dessert with a strangely unwelcome doughiness to it. If you want lemon square dessert for breakfast, save yourself the hassle of the wait and go buy lemon squares. They will taste better.

The egg sandwich was the greasiest thing I have ever had. I LOVE a good breakfast sandwich and have never been so completely, utterly disappointed. I was unable to finish it as I began to feel queasy halfway through from all the butter that was making my hands shiny. I saw someone refer to it as "Southern" in another review. I used to live in Louisiana, and let me tell you, there was nothing Southern about this oily, sickening monstrosity.

The potatoes were fine. They tasted like I expect breakfast potatoes to taste. All of you who think they are God's gift to breakfast potatoes, where do you normally dine? Because anyone operating a restaurant ought to be able to produce a decent breakfast potato exactly like these very normal breakfast potatoes. It's a pretty basic side item.

There is a stunning dearth of restaurants with nice atmosphere in San Francisco, particularly given the upscale clientele and general quirkiness of the place. Plow is a nice place to sit - and easy to talk, especially when your table is next to a couple where the girl is taking selfies on her phone the whole time and not saying a world to her boyfriend who works on his laptop the whole time. And if you don't mind the sensation of knowing that there is a crowd of people waiting for you to hurry up and get out.

I'm glad that Plow is doing well as maybe more brunch places with thoughtful decor will appear. But unless the idea of eggs drizzled in at least half a cup of movie theater popcorn butter is appetizing to you, skip it.

excerpts: Lemon ricotta pancakes are good too, if you're into that.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Tish M.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: Probably the best egg sandwich I've ever had. Pork sausage is also awesome. Lemon ricotta pancakes are good too, if you're into that.

The sausage was nice, but dry.
Not my favorite sausage.
Though the crispy potatoes were lovely and the Lemon Ricotta Pancakes were perfect!

lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
We walked here from the 16th St BART Station. Not a good idea. I didn't think to check the distance (1.6 miles); it seemed so close on the map. It's not that a 32-minute walk wasn't good for me (I totally earned my breakfast, not), it's the unsavory characters that you encounter. So, don't do what I did. However, the meal was worth the trouble!

We arrived around 9:30 on a Tuesday and it was much busier than I expected. Fortunately not busy enough that we had to wait because thankfully, there were two seats available at the bar. Some helpful notes: they will not seat you unless your entire party is present. Even if it is just one other person. No exceptions. Also, there's only 6-7 seats at the bar and roughly seven tables (very small space). There are a couple tables for outside dining as well.

Owner/Chef Maxine Siu was directly in front of us busily preparing dishes in their small partially-open kitchen. She was careful not to make eye contact with any patrons. Totally understandable, but it would have been so much fun to talk food. 

Ruben started with a cup of Equator Coffee ($3.50) and we shared a Cinnamon Brioche ($4). It was a delicious rendition of a cinnamon roll and the center was perfectly gooey and flavorful. I selected The Plow ($16) with sunny side-up eggs, housemade pork sausage, two Lemon Ricotta Pancakes, and crispy potatoes. The sausage was nice, but dry. Not my favorite sausage. Though the crispy potatoes were lovely and the Lemon Ricotta Pancakes were perfect! Ruben had the Fried Egg Sandwich with Nueske Bacon ($13.50), two soft fried eggs, aioli, cheddar, and frisée on an Acme bun. This was also tasty with the addition of the "Food's Best Friend Lucky Dog" hot fire-roasted pepper sauce.

Our server was really friendly and everyone was very pleasant. We didn't loiter much since there were several people waiting, but it's a nice setting to hang out and catch up with friends. The decor is fun with many pigs around! Oh, the important question - would I wait for 1+ hour(s) for a table? No, but that is why you plan ahead!

excerpts: Lemon ricotta pancakes (2 small) were very good in some bites (depending on where the ricotta is), but it was a bit dry overall and had a very faint lemon flavor.
I usually don't use syrup with my pancakes but for this, I had to dip a bit to add some sweetness to it.
[+] Potatoes were on point.
I love the crispy, herby tastes and it was not overly salty either.

[+] Chicken-apple sausages (4 links) were very enjoyable and did not taste overcooked from the "recooking"
[+/-
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Sandy T.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Plow was pretty good, but was it an hour wait long good? Ehhh, let's just say I'm not in a hurry to come back. And an hour is on the SHORTER end of the wait time frame!

Decided to make a trip here for brunch on "Spring Forward" DST day, hoping people were thrown off by the hour that disappeared from the day. Was intending to get there by 9:45am but lagged myself until 10:30a (oops, darn DST lol). I was almost dropped off to get our names on the list but I rushed out my house blind (without contacts on) so we had to go find parking first (again, oops lol). Good thing parking was easy to find! We got a spot right around the corner and then the hour wait commenced...

We were seated at the bar, which I love because of the open kitchen, and this is how I learned that:
[+] pork sausages are uncooked, hand-formed and cooked only when ordered
[+/-] chicken-apple sausages are cooked a bit and "reheated"/"recooked"
[-] bacon is cooked beforehand, sits in an open metal pan, and simply "reheated" on the flat top griddle (albeit it is most efficient this way, considering how busy it is here)
[+] everything else is cooked only when ordered
[+] the cooks have a very organized system so, props to those guys!

THE PLOW ($16)
[+/-] Lemon ricotta pancakes (2 small) were very good in some bites (depending on where the ricotta is), but it was a bit dry overall and had a very faint lemon flavor. I usually don't use syrup with my pancakes but for this, I had to dip a bit to add some sweetness to it.
[+] Potatoes were on point. I love the crispy, herby tastes and it was not overly salty either.
[+] Chicken-apple sausages (4 links) were very enjoyable and did not taste overcooked from the "recooking"
[+/-] Eggs are made to your liking

CORNED BEEF HASH ($15)
[-] Yes, it comes with potatoes but it is NOT their signature crispy, herby goodness! You've been warned.
[+] Corned beef was corned beef. Good and thinly-sliced.
[+/-] Comes with 2 slices of lightly-toasted rustic loaf
[+/-] Eggs are made to your liking

SERVICE
[-] Took a while to get our waters after we were seated
[-] Waitress/server totally forgot I asked for a box, even after giving us our check
[+/-] Was never asked how we were doing, but maybe because we were at the bar?

We finished our meal around 12:30pm and there was STILL a long wait. I don't know how people wait so long for this place! It's good but I'm not blown away. If I'm going to wake up early and wait at least an hour for food, I expect nothing less than awesome. Until next time, Plow. And maybe on a weekday morning for a shorter wait time.

excerpts: I always get the plow at plow (haa) since my love for lemon ricotta pancakes is just as strong as my love for nueske bacon.
The fluffiness of the pancakes are just not recreate-able.
If they were, I'd be making them every morning.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Nina S.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: This is one of the cutest brunch places I've been to. The inside is just so French, like effortlessly cool. And the food is simple but elegant in a rustic way. I always get the plow at plow (haa) since my love for lemon ricotta pancakes is just as strong as my love for nueske bacon. The fluffiness of the pancakes are just not recreate-able. If they were, I'd be making them every morning.

excerpts: It came with a little bit of everything, including apple sausages, eggs, potatoes, and lemon ricotta pancakes.
I am a huge fan of their potatoes, sausages, and above all, their lemon ricotta pancakes!
Usually the lemon/ricotta flavor is subtle and I can barely taste it, but Plow did a great job in making a flavorful pancake with amazing hot fried potatoes that filled me up!
The waiters were also super friendly and attentive, which made me love the place more.
If you love brunch, you have to try this place out!
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Hana C.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: Came here with a few friends on Sunday, and I loved it! We made a reservation for 5 ahead of time, so I'm not too sure on the wait, but if you did make a reservation, make sure your entire party is there or they won't seat you! (They usually have a long line, I've heard.) The inside is a bit smaller, but not crowded at all, but we just preferred outdoor seating. We got the "Plow" plate (look for "Plow" on the menu), which was apparently one of the most popular, and so glad we got it! It came with a little bit of everything, including apple sausages, eggs, potatoes, and lemon ricotta pancakes. I am a huge fan of their potatoes, sausages, and above all, their lemon ricotta pancakes! Usually the lemon/ricotta flavor is subtle and I can barely taste it, but Plow did a great job in making a flavorful pancake with amazing hot fried potatoes that filled me up! The waiters were also super friendly and attentive, which made me love the place more. If you love brunch, you have to try this place out!

excerpts: 7x7 released a few months ago the recipe for Plow's lemon ricotta pancakes
and I took a stab at making them.
The Plow is two eggs, two lemon ricotta pancakes, house potatoes and your choice of bacon, housemade pork sausage, or chicken apple sausage.
I chose to get the pork sausage.
I was so excited when our plates were finally in front of us.
His crab scramble was plentiful too and had a lot of fresh crab in it.
The creme fraiche was the perfect addition for the scramble.
He loved the house potatoes which was served with his meal too.
The toast it was served with was standard though.
As for my Plow: The eggs, which I chose over easy were perfectly cooked and the yolk just oozed all over once punctured.
The house potatoes were so crispy.
The lemon ricotta pancakes were fluffy, moist, and lemony; they were to die for.
The only thing that killed the breakfast was the sausage.
We were surprised that they were made into patties, and it did have some nice seasoning but they were so dry.
We had to dip the pieces into the egg yolk or pour syrup on them.
Perhaps they didn't put any fat in it and that's why it was so dry?
I can't wait to come back for more lemon ricotta pancakes and house potatoes!
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Cat C.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
I've had Plow bookmarked for quite sometime, but since I am an impatient person, he & I have stayed away due to the long waits.  Yesterday morning though, we both woke up early and decided to try our luck.  Parking was pretty easy as we got a space across the street. We arrived about 5 minutes or so after opening and got seated at the last table, which we shared with a couple that got in right before us.  Of course I was afraid that it wasn't going to live up to the hype, but it did!  7x7 released a few months ago the recipe for Plow's lemon ricotta pancakes and I took a stab at making them.  So, naturally I had to get The Plow ($16) & he instantly gravitated towards the Dungeness crab scramble ($17).  The waitress was coming around asking if we wanted coffee with her big pitcher.  Bf said yes and I declined since I'm so picky with coffee.  However, he (usually drinks black) and I (usually gets vanilla lattes and macchiatos) thought the coffee was quite good even with just a little bit of sugar, it was pretty mild.  The coffee was Equator.  

The Plow is two eggs, two lemon ricotta pancakes, house potatoes and your choice of bacon, housemade pork sausage, or chicken apple sausage.  I chose to get the pork sausage.  I was so excited when our plates were finally in front of us.  His crab scramble was plentiful too and had a lot of fresh crab in it.  The creme fraiche was the perfect addition for the scramble.  He loved the house potatoes which was served with his meal too.  The toast it was served with was standard though.  As for my Plow: The eggs, which I chose over easy were perfectly cooked and the yolk just oozed all over once punctured.  The house potatoes were so crispy.  The lemon ricotta pancakes were fluffy, moist, and lemony; they were to die for.  The only thing that killed the breakfast was the sausage.  We were surprised that they were made into patties, and it did have some nice seasoning but they were so dry.  We had to dip the pieces into the egg yolk or pour syrup on them.  Perhaps they didn't put any fat in it and that's why it was so dry?  The dry sausage was really the only thing that killed the breakfast and prevented us from deeming Plow a 5 star breakfast.  

Okay, I think even by SF standards the dishes are a little pricey for breakfast, but they're so worth it.  I'm gonna say a little gripe though, what I don't get is that, they offer free cups of coffee (refills too) for those stuck waiting for a table outside, but will ask around patrons dining if they'd like a cup...thought it may have been free, but was surprised to see the $3.50 charge on the receipt.  Bf was more optimistic than me though (even though he paid) and said, "Well at least they kept filling me up.  Not all places give free refills."  Plow is a solid 4.5 stars.  I can't wait to come back for more lemon ricotta pancakes and house potatoes!

lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Jamie Y.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Raving about the fried egg sandwich and the potatoes!

I didn't think the lemon ricotta pancakes were to-die for; might be because I'm not that head over heels for ricotta or lemon. It was fluffy and not overly sweet, which is a good thing in my book. I much prefer the banana wheat germ pancakes over at Stack's.

But the fried egg sandwich is delicious! I have never golfed down a sandwich (or even breakfast) that quickly before. The soft sweet bun added the perfect taste and texture to the savory fried egg and the aioli. I don't remember the last time I was so ecstatic eating a fried egg sandwich.

The potatoes were fantastic! Crispy and flavorful - definitely added crunch to the soft potatoes. Great service and casual ambiance. 

I came on a weekday before 9am and there was already a 15min wait! I know Plow is known for the ridiculously long wait, but hey, if you can cheat your way out of it and come here on a weekday, I highly recommend it!

My bf and I hoped that there wouldn't be as long of a wait in the morning as there would be during brunch, but we thought wrong.. Arrived there at around 9am and there was still a 45min- 1 hr wait.

excerpts: Had the plow with sausage and lemon ricotta pancakes.
The Lemon Ricotta Pancakes were a surprise.
Not as good as they were hyped up by my friends
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Adam Y.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Amazingly popular place. Even on a Tuesday morning,t his place was packed. Had the plow with sausage and lemon ricotta pancakes. Literally everything was delicious. 

The sausage which I heard is made in house was hearty and salted perfectly.

The potatoes were made just how I like them: with a lot of crunch yet soft on the inside. Like a french fry but round. They really do a great job with the potatoes here.

The Lemon Ricotta Pancakes were a surprise. Not as good as they were hyped up by my friends but they were still rich, creamy and lemony.

Service was slow but they recognized it and gave us a lemon scone.

excerpts: They make bomb lemon ricotta pancakes.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Pamela B.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Oh so yummy. I don't usually eat pancakes, but when I want some, I go here. They make bomb lemon ricotta pancakes. I MEAN BOMB. and those crispy potatoes?! FANTASTIC. Great, welcoming vibes, great smells, awesome brunch spot.

Downside? The wait. To get a taste, I waited in line for 1 hour and 25 minutes for my first try. The second time around, I waited 45 minutes. So if you're starving and need to be seated immediately, don't come here. You'll be raging hungry and throw a fit before a table frees up. But if you can stand to wait, I think it's worth waiting for.

excerpts: For breakfast, I ordered the Lemon Ricotta Pancakes.
They were bland and overly sweet
all at the same time.
I know that Plow focuses on natural ingredients, but the lemon tasted very artificial.
I know it wasn't, but it tasted that way.
I found the pancake consistency to be very heavy and dense.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Jeff L.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
I really wish this would have been a different, better experience for me because there are so many good reviews on here, but it was a very unpleasant experience.

First off, tip for everyone considering Plow, the wait is unreal.  We went there on New Year's Eve for breakfast and the wait was over an hour and a half.  I was starving and freezing by the time we got seated - outside.  Seriously, it was no higher than maybe 50-55 degrees and we were sitting outside.  Not pleasant.  I would advise them to stop seating people outside and just do indoor seating, but there is a very small dining room so that would not work.  It was not pleasant.  The seats were cold and not comfortable.  Plus, the seat we ended up sitting in was vacant for 20-30 minutes before we finally got seated.  What were they waiting for?  

For breakfast, I ordered the Lemon Ricotta Pancakes.  They were bland and overly sweet all at the same time.  I know that Plow focuses on natural ingredients, but the lemon tasted very artificial.  I know it wasn't, but it tasted that way.  I found the pancake consistency to be very heavy and dense.  I couldn't finish the 2nd of 3 pancakes, although this was mostly due to taste.

The straw that broke the camel's back is that our bill was $40 - for breakfast.  When you're not ordering meat, you shouldn't expect to pay that much for breakfast.  I was not impressed at all.  Perhaps I caught them on a bad day, when it was really busy, and the kitchen was rushing to get food out, but this was not the experience I heard all my fellow yelpers raving about.  I feel like I got cheated.  

My advice is that if the line looks long - go somewhere else.  If you're lucky enough to get there with a minimal wait, then maybe it's worth another try.

excerpts: I probably love the lemon ricotta pancakes here more than I love Nicole Kidman.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Jack R.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
I probably love the lemon ricotta pancakes here more than I love Nicole Kidman. Or at least, it's a close call.

Came here on a date, not with Nicole Kidman, but a blond nonetheless. 

This is one of my favorite breakfast joints. I love this place so much that my co-workers buy me gift certificates to PLOW because they know I'll make good use out of it. One year I received $100 bucks in gift cards. Enough for 4 meals, I joked.

I love their ricotta pancakes, their crab scramble, their potatoes, their sausage...basically I love everything on the menu.

So my date kept saying over and over like a broken record, "I work for Twitter." As if I'm supposed to be impressed by this? 

"How do you like the food though?" I asked.

"You know the best thing about Twitter..." and that's when I tuned out. 

I started thinking about Plow's specials, that day they had a special muffin and sausage something. I thought about the times when I had their almond pancakes, and thought, wow, these are really good too.

Thank goodness for those ricotta pancakes, which gave me a feeling of serenity and happiness, which is more than I can say about the date.

"Did you hear what I was saying?"

"Yes," I said. "Twitter."

"Yes, how'd you know?"

"Just a lucky guess," I said, wishing that I was like that Twitter bird, and could fly right out the window. Or jump. Jumping is an option too I thought....

excerpts: I had the plow with scrambled eggs, chicken apple sausages, lemon ricotta pancakes and their house potatoes.
It was delicious for such a "standard traditional breakfast".
I did pass on the house made pork sausages because a lot of reviewers said that they were dried.
The potatoes were seasoned with rosemary and had a nice crisp.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Laura T.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
"The Plow", need I say more? 

I have tried to dine here for brunch 3 times in the past and have always given up because the wait is 2 hours+. One Tuesday morning, I finally scored a table outside with no wait. As many Yelpers advised, it is better to dine here on a week day versus a weekend. Right away I already knew what I wanted. 

I had the plow with scrambled eggs, chicken apple sausages, lemon ricotta pancakes and their house potatoes. It was delicious for such a "standard traditional breakfast". I did pass on the house made pork sausages because a lot of reviewers said that they were dried. The potatoes were seasoned with rosemary and had a nice crisp. I really liked the lemon pancakes because they weren't too sour or doughy. 

I would come back but hopefully there won't be such a long wait.

excerpts: The lemon ricotta pancakes are worth the visit.
In LA, there's BLD for lemon ricotta pancakes, but I wanted to try Plow's first because they looked so delectable.
The small portions for the pancakes allow you to enjoy them with greater appreciation.
Great consistency with the batter and not too thick, and the combination of zesty lemon and creamy ricotta works well!
I prefer these compact, slightly fluffier pancakes over thin, wide ones.
Really, the syrup is not necessary.
People who complain that the pancakes are not sweet enough are crazy.
He, too, found the lemon ricotta pancakes to be delightful.
However, the french toast--as much as it was fluffy and not heavy--it wasn't my favorite.
Nothing compares to the brioche french toast I had at M.Henry in Chicago.
Regardless, Plow offers a solid plate of french toast!
Now, the coffee here is a whole other matter.
I downed 3 cups because I hadn't had my coffee in the morning, but I suggest you skip it if possible...
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Christine K.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Portero Hill is a bit out of the way, but I was willing to make those transfers to grab brunch at Plow. The lemon ricotta pancakes are worth the visit. In LA, there's BLD for lemon ricotta pancakes, but I wanted to try Plow's first because they looked so delectable.  The small portions for the pancakes allow you to enjoy them with greater appreciation. Great consistency with the batter and not too thick, and the combination of zesty lemon and creamy ricotta works well! I prefer these compact, slightly fluffier pancakes over thin, wide ones. Really, the syrup is not necessary. People who complain that the pancakes are not sweet enough are crazy. Honestly, you're asking for diabetes if you're wanting something outrageously sweet. 

My brother enjoyed Plow's take on the traditional herb roasted potatoes by lightly frying them but didn't seem impressed by the sunny-side up eggs. He, too, found the lemon ricotta pancakes to be delightful. However, the french toast--as much as it was fluffy and not heavy--it wasn't my favorite. Nothing compares to the brioche french toast I had at M.Henry in Chicago. Regardless, Plow offers a solid plate of french toast! Now, the coffee here is a whole other matter. I downed 3 cups because I hadn't had my coffee in the morning, but I suggest you skip it if possible...

A taste of the salmon Benedict from her friends plate and then enjoyed my scrumptious Farro Salad. Atmosphere is great along with the staff. 4 stars only because of the limited space.

lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Mandy G.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Arriving on a sunny, windy weekday afternoon, we entered Plow at around 1pm. The restaurant had quite a number of people, so we were kicked to curb, to wait in the wind. By kicking us to the curb, I mean they told us to step outside to wait till we're seated because they don't want it cramping up by the entrance. I like this idea because it makes the dining experience more enjoyable. They told us to wait about 5 mins, but we were seated within 3 mins. 

Located on the corner of Mississippi St and Texas St, this place can easily be missed..only because it's located in a residential area. They do have a sign sticking out that says "The Plow" though. Parking wasn't bad for my friend and I because we found one quick, right across the street. 

Seated in the back, service was still prompt and good because they would come check on us quite often. The food came out fairly quick in about 10 minutes. For my drink, I ordered the housemade strawberry lemonade ($3.75) [http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/plow-san-francisco?select=idHQVocGRxfnUjULoUkgDA#N3EwXeV_dXhdgR037ddEUw]. The drink looks adorable and instagram-worthy with its cute striped straw and lemon on the side, but don't let that fool you! I like the looks of it, but the straw is made of paper which can make it soggy. That's the only thing that irks me because the longer it sits in the lemonade, the faster it becomes soggy and the harder it becomes to drink. 

For my dish, I ordered The Plow ($16) [http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/plow-san-francisco?select=idHQVocGRxfnUjULoUkgDA#NYJXSTwF-Ugv0vFpKULyvQ] and a side of Nueske Bacon ($5.50) [http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/plow-san-francisco?select=idHQVocGRxfnUjULoUkgDA#fzy-q83TFoTe12n157Wu4Q]. The Plow was delicious! It consisted of  (2) small Lemon Ricotta Pancakes, Crispy Potatoes, Eggs, and House made pork sausage patties. I ordered this becuase it basically consisted of everything from the highlights on the Yelp page! I highly recommend ordering this for your first time because you get a taste of everything. Going from the lemon ricotta pancakes to crispy potatoes, to eggs and the house made pork sausage patties, everything just tasted so different from each other and unique! It changes your taste buds! 

The side of nueske bacon was a recommended dish in the highlights and as a fan of bacon, I just haaad to order it! I don't think it was all that special, but it was decently good. It was also pretty oily. 

If you can't finish your meal and plan to take the leftovers home, skip the crispy potatoes...it won't taste crispy anymore, haha. 

Overall, I enjoyed my experience and would definitely come back again..on a weekday! ;)

excerpts: The lemon ricotta pancakes were delicious!
It had potatoes, eggs, lemon ricotta pancakes and a meat selection.
My fiancé got that
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Emily K.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Great breakfast spot! I recommend getting there early, the wait can be up an hour or two!

The lemon ricotta pancakes were delicious! What I noticed is everyone got the plow. It had potatoes, eggs, lemon ricotta pancakes and a meat selection. My fiancé got that and he liked it.

Enjoy!

excerpts: The LEMON RICOTTA PANCAKES are the perfect blend of zest and depth for a pancake, this is definitely a must try!
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Veronica L.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Plow is the epitome of what it means to be a brunch spot. I wish I could stop coming here but their food really gets me every time. 

I usually opt for THE PLOW when I come here. The LEMON RICOTTA PANCAKES are the perfect blend of zest and depth for a pancake, this is definitely a must try! The NUESKE'S BACON and HOUSE MADE PORK SAUSAGE are both delicious, but I wouldn't recommend the Chicken-Apple. The potatoes are always fresh and crispy and eggs how you like 'em. The FRENCH TOAST w/ bananas is a great way to end brunch on a sweet note. Coffee, grapefruit juice, and the ginger beer are all great pairs with their dishes.

Things to keep in mind: The wait is going to be long. I was lucky to come by here when the wait was 15-20 minutes, but I know the wait can be up to 1.5-2 hours depending on the day and time you come by. You won't miss this place because of the large crowd standing at the corner of the block waiting to eat at this place.

Service is always great and friendly. Food doesn't take long despite the popularity and seating is both indoor and outdoor.

excerpts: Lemon ricotta pancakes (2 silver dollar-sized) did not have that refined, think crispy buttery edge with super fluffy, melt-in-mouth feel.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Jana C.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Generous 2.3 for brunch very recently. Bookmarked for 3 years----crestfallen experience on a warm afternoon.

I was stuck on the Bridge; plenty of empty tables available outside. My friend was forced to stand and wait until I arrived in order to sit down somewhere. Joking me?? I understand upholding that when there are not a minimum of 6 2-tops open! Off-putting

The plow breakfast ordered was such a letdown, upon immediate glance of small plate. Crispy potatoes tasted stale to both of us, and instead of properly cut small chunks, we got little bits and bobbles of leftover pan. Couldn't even spear them with the tines of a fork. Resigned, we just wasted an already small plate of food for $16.

Lemon ricotta pancakes (2 silver dollar-sized) did not have that refined, think crispy buttery edge with super fluffy, melt-in-mouth feel. Lemon was very nice on the tongue, but it certainly was the only positive attribute to them.

Nueske bacon fine.

After within the month, going to many brunch places, I find the food way overrated. Way.

excerpts: The lemon ricotta pancakes are also very unique, and the husband enjoyed his fried egg sandwich.
Delicious brunch everyday!
We'll definitely be back!
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Archana P.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: The potatoes here are just so perfectly crispy, it's really amazing. Sooooo rosemary! The lemon ricotta pancakes are also very unique, and the husband enjoyed his fried egg sandwich. Delicious brunch everyday! We'll definitely be back!

excerpts: Plow included the lemon ricotta pancakes people rave about.
The pancakes people rave about is just ok.
Seriously.
If I didn't know it was ricotta in there, I'd think it was under cooked.
I still have my doubts on the full-cooked-ness of these pancakes.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Lily W.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
I came here expecting really great foods...and was a bit disappointed.  I mean, not enough to tell people NOT to come, but enough to not put it higher on my recommendations for good brunch in SF.

I came here with my sister on a Friday morning. Knowing there was going to be a line, we budgeted a 30 minute wait. We seemed to have come in right before they opened the outside dining, which was cool because that shortened the wait significantly. Then again, they still staggered us (which, I assume is to not over burden the kitchen). And plus...the outside seating is on an incline. Made for some awkward sitting. 

We had the french toast and the Plow...which was good, but again not amazing. Plow included the lemon ricotta pancakes people rave about. The pancakes people rave about is just ok. Seriously. If I didn't know it was ricotta in there, I'd think it was under cooked.  I still have my doubts on the full-cooked-ness of these pancakes. Outside was crispy, inside was goopy. 

The rest of the food was pretty solid. I like that they don't shy away from making the scrambled eggs JUST done. Like seriously, a second less and it'd be runny. But I kind of like my eggs like that. 

The pancakes dinged it a bit for me...and also the service. Oh, the people were relatively nice and all. But my coffee (which I legitimately LIVE for) I had to flag down folks many times for refills (I nearly told them to leave the carafe. And had pre-warned them of my caffeine needs). We were ready to order right when we sat down, and they acknowledged this and still waited quite some time to come back.  

I'm usually one that's willing to wait for good food, but I don't think I'd crave Plow enough to wait in a line longer than 30 minutes. =/

excerpts: You get a bit of everything, including two of their famous, melt in tongue, lemon ricotta pancakes.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Claudia N.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Thought there would be a long line, but we were seated almost immediately, though we did come on a Friday (near closing time). 

This is hands down one of the best brunch places I've encountered in San Francisco. Located in a beautiful neighborhood with quaint little cafes and shops across the street, Plow fulfills the definition of what a true brunch experience in the city should be, fresh and local. 

I highly recommend "The Plow" with homemade pork sausage. You get a bit of everything, including two of their famous, melt in tongue, lemon ricotta pancakes. 

Don't forget to drizzle your sausage with some of their Lucky Dog hot sauce. 

So amazing!

excerpts: It's a bit of everything -- 2 eggs, 2 pieces of bacon or sausage, 2 lemon ricotta pancakes, and the smashed potatoes.
While the pancakes are so soft and fluffy with just the right amount of lemon flavor, the real winner is the potatoes.
Imagine potatoes that are smashed and deep fried so that it's extra crispy!
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Xinxin W.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
The wait is wayyyy too long here but if you come before 9am, it's not so bad. 

The egg sandwich is delicious but I wish it had a different bun! The bread is a let down. If you're super hungry or just like diversity, get "the plow". It's a bit of everything -- 2 eggs, 2 pieces of bacon or sausage, 2 lemon ricotta pancakes, and the smashed potatoes. While the pancakes are so soft and fluffy with just the right amount of lemon flavor, the real winner is the potatoes. Imagine potatoes that are smashed and deep fried so that it's extra crispy!

excerpts: Comes with your choice of meat, eggs, potatoes, and their famous lemon ricotta pancakes!
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: L F.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Yum! Order the PLOW. Comes with your choice of meat, eggs, potatoes, and their famous lemon ricotta pancakes! 

The only downside for this place is the wait! There's always a wait, no matter what time of day. I've waited an hour at most, but today we got seated within 10 minutes. 

Regardless of the wait time, were always down for some plow.

Plow also offers side orders of both items.
I really enjoyed everything, especially the pancakes and potatoes.
