lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Since I read such amazing reviews about the lemon ricotta pancakes and house made pork sausage and wanted to try both, I ordered the plow (2 eggs, house made pork sausage, 2 lemon ricotta pancakes, and crispy potatoes).   Plow also offers side orders of both items.  I really enjoyed everything, especially the pancakes and potatoes.  Unless you dislike lemon (the pancakes really are pretty lemony), I highly recommend you at least order the side dish for your table to share.  

Meanwhile, one of my friends ordered the french toast, which was good, but in my opinion not as good as the pancakes.  Another of my friends ordered the chia seed pudding which though I did not personally try, had a gelatinous texture (due to the chia seeds) that she did not enjoy.

excerpts: Everything tasted great, but one thing I want to come back here for is the lemon ricotta pancakes!
The ricotta cheese doesn't have a strong smell or taste to it and neither does the lemon.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Jane S.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Perfect suburban-lookin' breakfast joint in the city!

My friends and I were told that our wait would be about 30-45 minutes. We were a little hesitant to stay, but we decided to stick to our itinerary. We could tell the workers were trying to be really accommodating to us throughout our entire wait . We appreciated their hard work in wanting to find us a table as quickly as possible!

Besides the great service, the food here is enough to make you want to check this place out. 

Everything tasted great, but one thing I want to come back here for is the lemon ricotta pancakes! The ricotta cheese doesn't have a strong smell or taste to it and neither does the lemon. The taste of both flavors is subtle and each bite is full and hearty, but not too heavy.

The place is small, so try to avoid coming in big groups (anything more than 4).

excerpts: Loved the lemon ricotta pancakes were a first for me and were bomb.com and eggs and potatoes were on point!
Homemade sausage patties were delicious when drizzled with yolk from my sunny side eggs.
My two year old enjoyed almost all of our Nueske's bacon...
I was a little mad at this but what can you do.
I am coming back for more and to try it all.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: David N.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: Loved this place! I came here New Years Eve for brunch with 2 month old, 2 year old, and wife! Super accommodating and the friendliest hostess Jess, who is really kid friendly even when it was really busy and crammed! The food was delicious! Loved the lemon ricotta pancakes were a first for me and were bomb.com and eggs and potatoes were on point! Homemade sausage patties were delicious when drizzled with yolk from my sunny side eggs. My two year old enjoyed almost all of our Nueske's bacon...I was a little mad at this but what can you do. I am coming back for more and to try it all.

excerpts: Hubby and I found the lemon ricotta pancakes to be whatever and scrambled eggs were standard.
I wouldn't wait for a table here, but the service is great and outside seating with the heavy blankets is perfectly ok....
but we probably wouldn't be back.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Hanster P.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: Another over-rated, trendy restaurant. Potatoes were the best part of my meal. Hubby and I found the lemon ricotta pancakes to be whatever and scrambled eggs were standard. I wouldn't wait for a table here, but the service is great and outside seating with the heavy blankets is perfectly ok....but we probably wouldn't be back.

excerpts: The lemon ricotta pancakes here are RIDICULOUS.
That said, don't expect to a) find a parking spot close by, or b) wait any less than an hour, even with reservations.
Cute bookstore down the road if you need to kill some time.
Don't come hungry because the smells from the kitchen will drive you insane.
Service is fine; they're very busy and don't have time to really chat with you.
Sit outside if you can!
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Katie G.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: The lemon ricotta pancakes here are RIDICULOUS. That said, don't expect to a) find a parking spot close by, or b) wait any less than an hour, even with reservations. Cute bookstore down the road if you need to kill some time. Don't come hungry because the smells from the kitchen will drive you insane. Service is fine; they're very busy and don't have time to really chat with you. Sit outside if you can!

excerpts: It's fascinating watch them make the eggs, fry the potatoes, cook the lemon ricotta pancakes, and dole out all the other goodies in very organized and efficient fashion.
I have to say, the lemon ricotta pancakes really were not my favorite.
I did appreciate that they were crispy-edged pancakes and the lemony flavor was spot on..
but I didn't quite like the ricotta texture in my otherwise fluffy pancakes.
I didn't feel like the cheese added anything...
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Ruth C.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Plow plow plow!  Eat The Plow at Plow!

Showed up at 11:30 with Ingrid C on a Sunday for brunch... we were told the wait would be AN HOUR.  WOW.  So popular!  But since all my Yelpy friends said it was worth the wait, I was very excited that the wait was really only about 35 minutes.

Sitting at the marble? counter is an excellent experience.  The 3 guys pumping out the brunch menu for 40+ occupants really know what they're doing.  It's fascinating watch them make the eggs, fry the potatoes, cook the lemon ricotta pancakes, and dole out all the other goodies in very organized and efficient fashion.

Tasty mimosa, tasty coffee.  I have to say, the lemon ricotta pancakes really were not my favorite.  I did appreciate that they were crispy-edged pancakes and the lemony flavor was spot on.. but I didn't quite like the ricotta texture in my otherwise fluffy pancakes.  I didn't feel like the cheese added anything... but then again, I'm lactose intolerant and don't really enjoy cheese anymore...

LOVE the potatoes.  Super fried and delicious!  Seasoned perfectly.  The bacon was tasty but not memorable.  I tried Ingrid C's pork sausage and that was flavory herby goodness.

Definitely worth the wait.  There are plenty of cute shops to browse around including a bookstore about a block away.

My favorite brunch is still St. Mike's in Palo Alto, but this is pretty damn tasty if you're up in the city.

Extra bonus love to all the piggy figurines and piggy symbol as the restaurant mascot.

excerpts: Their lemon ricotta pancakes are amazing and no matter which protein you pick it will be delicious.
Recently they've started having an eggs Benedict ($17), which makes me the happiest person around!
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Emily S.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
I'm going to say it - and I may get some flack for it, but this is by far and away, in my opinion, the best brunch in San Francisco. Yep, I said it!

The wait: It's always long, even on a weekday which leaves me wondering - what do all these people do for a living if they can wait in line for brunch at 10am on a Tuesday?! But then I realize I'm right there with them :)

The food: Get the Plow ($16) if you've never been before. Their lemon ricotta pancakes are amazing and no matter which protein you pick it will be delicious. Recently they've started having an eggs Benedict ($17), which makes me the happiest person around! But the soft eggs scramble ($15) is always amazing!

The service: always efficient and friendly, but not too friendly where you feel like you've gained another table mate. 

The restaurant: it's decorated in such a way that I feel calm and relaxed despite the crowded small space full of hungry diners.

excerpts: Ordered The Plow and liked Lemon ricotta pancakes:).
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Asato T.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Went there for b-fast on Wednesday morning like 7:30. I know this place is been very popular with locals and packed on weekends, so thought today was a perfect timing to swing by.  There's 3-4 tables were taken already at this point!
Ordered The Plow and liked Lemon ricotta pancakes:). I didn't like crispy potatoes that much because they were too crunch and crispy and had barely portion to eat.

Will come back for the full portion of pancakes again!

excerpts: The lemon ricotta pancakes were pretty good.
But they were a little bland and undercooked.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Chris L.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
We were the first ones seated at opening at 7 a.m. on a Friday morning.  The lemon ricotta pancakes were pretty good.  But they were a little bland and undercooked.   The corn hash was ok but had these fat bubbles on them, a little smaller than dimes, tasted kinda gross.  

I don't know why people would wait over an hour to eat here.  The interior was nice - it  is quaint and cozy, think Chevron grey and white with canary yellow highlights (kinda French but still a little urban).

The service was ok.  The coffee was ok.  I had two cups because I was so tired.  I am clearly not a morning person (unless I'm on vacation!).

excerpts: We really enjoyed the Salmon Eggs Benedict and The Plow (lemon ricotta pancakes, eggs made to order, choice of pork sausage, chicken sausage or bacon, and potatoes).
Seating is cozy but the staff was pretty friendly.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Rose A.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Every time my husband and I try a new restaurant, we always ask each other if we would be willing to come back .  In regards to Plow, that would be a yes.

We really enjoyed the Salmon Eggs Benedict and The Plow (lemon ricotta pancakes, eggs made to order, choice of pork sausage, chicken sausage or bacon, and potatoes).  Seating is cozy but the staff was pretty friendly.

excerpts: The lemon ricotta pancakes were really good and tasty, however, my favorite of the dish was the pork sausage.
Very well made and tasted almost "burger-like" - but in a good way!
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Sam B.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Had breakfast here today. Was there right when they opened, so didn't have to wait (didn't get to experience that long wait that everyone keeps talking about). 

Boyfriend had "The Plow" w/their home-made pork sausage. The crispy potato was good, but nothing super special in my opinion. The lemon ricotta pancakes were really good and tasty, however, my favorite of the dish was the pork sausage. Very well made and tasted almost "burger-like" - but in a good way! (maybe the patty shape had something to do with it)

I had the Gruyere with prosciutto and chili fried egg sandwich. It was big, but not too overwhelming. The bread was pretty thick, so I had to eat it with a fork and knife. It also came with leafy greens. It was very delicious and tasty, however, you can't really go wrong with fancy cheese + proscuitto + fried egg can you?

Overall, I thought that the food was good, place/vibe was excellent, however, it didn't really live up to the hype. I'd go back here again if I'm lucky enough to not have to wait in line again for sure, but it hasn't convinced me that it's worth the 45 minute wait.

excerpts: Eggs and their signature lemon ricotta pancakes.
Charming spot in Potrero area.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Stacey K.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: Fabulous brunch. Worth the wait since it's a small local spot. Plow breakfast is best of both worlds. Eggs and their signature lemon ricotta pancakes. Charming spot in Potrero area.

excerpts: Omgosh, crispy side potatoes, sausages, eggs, and lemon ricotta pancakes were on point.
I think I fell in love with their french toasts.
It's hard to find good french toasts, and I think this is the place!
We tried ordering their cornbread but they were out :(
So sad, oh wells, next time!
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Anna L.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
This place "plowed" me away! Haha, get it? 

We waited 45 minutes to get seated. It wasn't bad since me and my friend went a little crazy taking pictures on the hill right around the corner. I have weird knacks for hippy like brunch places. I loved the interior design and everything that was there. Definitely a small restaurant, but it was spacious and not cramped (at least where I was sitting). I kinda wish they had more than one restroom though because homegirl over hurr had to go and I couldn't wait! 

Food wise. U H M A Z I N G!! 

"The Plow" review: 
Omgosh, crispy side potatoes, sausages, eggs, and lemon ricotta pancakes were on point. I think I fell in love with their french toasts. It's hard to find good french toasts, and I think this is the place! We tried ordering their cornbread but they were out :( So sad, oh wells, next time!

excerpts: I ordered the pork loin sandwich with a side of lemon ricotta pancakes.
The lemon ricotta pancakes are also a popular choice at plow.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Ryan R.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
I just got plowed (no homo)

After months of being on my bookmarks i finally made my way over there. This is probably my first time eating in that area of small restaurants and shops. really cozy. I find myself going here on thursday and it was fairly full about a 20 min wait and parking was relatively easy to find, but i would imagine it would be hard to find during the weekend.

I ordered the pork loin sandwich with a side of lemon ricotta pancakes. 

The pork loin sandwich reminded me of a similar sandwich from roli roti except roll roti does not use fresh jam to offset the savory. It was a different take from the very familiar pork loin sandwiches that are served out there. I still like roli roti better but this one is not far behind. 

The lemon ricotta pancakes are also a popular choice at plow. I personally the non lemon versions of ricotta pancakes like the ones served at kitchen story, but plow is just as fluffy and soft and tasty. 

Overall, i enjoyed myself here and i recommend it anyone who enjoys a good breakfast!

excerpts: Their lemon ricotta pancakes will change your life.
Ridiculously good coffee as well.
I'd recommend to go early to avoid the crazy line as the facility is very small.
The only reason I'm not giving it 5 stars is because the customer service the last time I went could have been a bit more attentive.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Eliza A.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: Their lemon ricotta pancakes will change your life. Ridiculously good coffee as well. I'd recommend to go early to avoid the crazy line as the facility is very small. The only reason I'm not giving it 5 stars is because the customer service the last time I went could have been a bit more attentive.

excerpts: The lemon ricotta pancakes were not fluffy whatsoever, which is how you imagine ricotta pancakes, but were somewhat hard.
The flavor was good tho.
My scrambled eggs were good and my friend enjoyed the poached eggs.
The highlight were the potatoes.
So crispy, perfectly seasoned, and full of rosemary flavor.
My friend doesn't like rosemary too much
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Cheryl Q.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
To avoid the extremely long wait time, my friend and I got here 10 minutes before opening, on a Saturday. About 6 people were waiting before us and by the time the front doors opened, there were just enough people lined up to fill the first seating.

We both ordered coffee and The Plow. My friend got it with the pork sausage and I got it with the chicken sausage, which are like meat patties and not the hot dog shaped ones. The chicken sausages were extremely dry and a little hard to swallow. The lemon ricotta pancakes were not fluffy whatsoever, which is how you imagine ricotta pancakes, but were somewhat hard. The flavor was good tho. My scrambled eggs were good and my friend enjoyed the poached eggs. The highlight were the potatoes. So crispy, perfectly seasoned, and full of rosemary flavor. My friend doesn't like rosemary too much so she wasn't fond of them, but I lovedddd em.

Our coffees were never refilled and had to ask twice before it was. Since we woke up early, I NEEDED that second cup! 

I wouldn't wait the crazy 2 hours.

excerpts: The sausage and lemon ricotta pancakes were delicious too.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Megan C.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: Loved this place for a more traditional breakfast option. It's in a great location and I'll definitely be back. I got the plow breakfast and loved the potatoes, super crispy. The sausage and lemon ricotta pancakes were delicious too.

excerpts: The lemon ricotta pancakes live up to the hype ($13):
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/plow-san-francisco?select=um-AE1XJC_0QFdltGIEllA#Vk1YdvVHw8-TIIdGSTOcfw

And it's even better than it looks.

lemon ricotta pancakes.review:

And it's even better than it looks.

excerpts: My favorite were lemon ricotta pancakes!
Must try...
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Jenny I.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: We waited in line to check it out! Coffee was strong and very good. My favorite were lemon ricotta pancakes! Must try...

excerpts: The most original and unique item on the menu is for sure the lemon ricotta pancakes.
These pancakes are really something else.
They are so fluffy and taste fabulous.
Don't come here without trying them that's for sure.
These pancakes are for sure their signature item.
Now, this doesn't mean the rest of the food isn't good.
All the food is good, but really the dish that makes this place so special is the pancakes.
Yes, their potatoes are good and nice and crispy on the outside and soft in the inside.
My second favorite dish has to be the fried egg sandwich.
It's simple and great.
Every ingredient compliments each other perfectly.
After that my favorite dish has to be the salmon Benedict.
So, if you come here, then make sure to get one of these items to really understand what's so great about this place.
Yes, the wait is long, but all brunch spots in the city have a long wait, so I guess we are just accustomed to that now.
I'll be back for those pancakes for sure!
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Ahmed H.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: This place is good. The most original and unique item on the menu is for sure the lemon ricotta pancakes. These pancakes are really something else. They are so fluffy and taste fabulous. Don't come here without trying them that's for sure. These pancakes are for sure their signature item. Now, this doesn't mean the rest of the food isn't good. All the food is good, but really the dish that makes this place so special is the pancakes. Yes, their potatoes are good and nice and crispy on the outside and soft in the inside. My second favorite dish has to be the fried egg sandwich. It's simple and great. Every ingredient compliments each other perfectly. After that my favorite dish has to be the salmon Benedict. So, if you come here, then make sure to get one of these items to really understand what's so great about this place. Yes, the wait is long, but all brunch spots in the city have a long wait, so I guess we are just accustomed to that now. I'll be back for those pancakes for sure!

excerpts: -Famous Lemon Ricotta pancakes - VERY good, but I felt like it was more a dessert dish for me.

So I prefer the
-Almond Pancakes - Amazing!
LOVE this!

Goes perfectly along side your main breakfast dish =)
-Corned Beef Hash - last but not least, one of the best corned beef I've had.
Crispy crunch on the outside and juicy, flavorful and tender on the inside!
Paired with poached eggs - what an absolute delight!
Great food, great service, location is nice and atmosphere is warm.
What's not to love?!
(July 2013)
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Charlene R.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Plow definitely hits the spot for all your breakfast lovers! This was my first time here, and I am def going back! They do not take reservations so be prepared for that. I went on a Tuesday,in the early afternoon, so the wait wasn't bad at all. 
We ordered the:
-Fried Egg Sandwich - delicious - but I wouldn't get it again just because I would rather try their specials. 
-Famous Lemon Ricotta pancakes - VERY good, but I felt like it was more a dessert dish for me. So I prefer the
-Almond Pancakes - Amazing! LOVE this! Goes perfectly along side your main breakfast dish =)
-Corned Beef Hash - last but not least, one of the best corned beef I've had. Crispy crunch on the outside and juicy, flavorful and tender on the inside! Paired with poached eggs - what an absolute delight!
Great food, great service, location is nice and atmosphere is warm. What's not to love?!
(July 2013)

excerpts: The lemon ricotta pancakes were not for me, though most Yelpers love them; they tasted like soggy Pledge polish to me.

The kitchen was working hard to get the dishes out, and I appreciated their labor, but pork sausage needs more fat or something -- and I will leave the famed lemon ricotta pancakes to the other people who adore them.
Cute place, great service, but next time, I would stick with the classics: eggs, potatoes, bacon, coffee.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Sarah J.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Had breakfast-for-lunch this Tuesday about 11 AM, just me. Can you call this meal brunch if it's not the weekend? Hmm... 

About 8 people waiting outside with me. I sat about 10 minutes sitting on an outside planter to get counter seat after putting my name on waiting list. Once in, I appreciated the pretty table setting with pressed striped thick cotton napkin folded between silverware, well-used coffee mug adding honest patina to marble counter. Heavy glass embossed salt & pepper shakers plus "raw" sugar in single-pour dispenser. It's the little things.

Ordered: 

Banana Cardamom Bread - DELICIOUS. Having it grill-fried only makes it more so. For sure get this if available. Really. Monkeys would be in eeeping nirvana eating this.

The Plow - I got this with over-easy eggs & pork sausage. Great news: Eggs perfect. Rosemary potatoes very tasty. Bad news: the pork sausage was well-spiced but dry; I recommend avoiding. If I am going to eat pig, a lovely animal, it should be worth it ;-) The lemon ricotta pancakes were not for me, though most Yelpers love them; they tasted like soggy Pledge polish to me.

Grapefruit Mimosa - Served in a pretty champagne flute but a bit $ at $10.50. I'd skip this next time.

Coffee - Tasty, smooth, subtle coconut flavor. Yum! 

Service - Excellent! Friendly & quick from Angela. Thanks!

The kitchen was working hard to get the dishes out, and I appreciated their labor, but pork sausage needs more fat or something -- and I will leave the famed lemon ricotta pancakes to the other people who adore them. Cute place, great service, but next time, I would stick with the classics: eggs, potatoes, bacon, coffee.

excerpts: you'd like, choice of pork sausage/bacon/chicken sausage, crispy potatoes, and of course their popular lemon ricotta pancakes which are fluffy, moist, and scaled to perfection on taste.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Mike D.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Set high in this quaint little neighborhood in Potrero Hill that has a great view of the downtown SF is this wonderful breakfast/brunch joint. 

I've been here twice and both times were equally amazing in food quality and service. I would rate this place higher if I had the option to. 

The last time I was in attendance to have brunch here, I ordered The Plow which consists of 2 eggs prepared anyway you'd like, choice of pork sausage/bacon/chicken sausage, crispy potatoes, and of course their popular lemon ricotta pancakes which are fluffy, moist, and scaled to perfection on taste. 

Needless to say, this is one of my all time favorites in the city. 

WORD OF ADVICE: COME EARLY!! The wait is usually pretty hardcore, but don't worry... you can order a mimosa to ease the pain while you wait outside. I'd recommend the grapefruit option over orange. Also, as much as I love sitting outdoors, I'd choose to sit inside on this one. The bus stop is right next to where you're seated... "I'll have The Plow please. Hold the dust."

excerpts: Omgggggggg lemon ricotta pancakes are fluffy, moist, light, and perfectly lemony.
I could inhale this forever.
Perfect potatoes are perfect.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Hayne P.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Got here at 8:30 am and didn't get seated until 9:30. SF brunch game is too strong. 

Boyfriend got the Plow. Omgggggggg lemon ricotta pancakes are fluffy, moist, light, and perfectly lemony. I could inhale this forever. Perfect potatoes are perfect. Delicately crispy on the outside, soft and creamy on the inside. 

I got the eggs benedict with mushroom and spinach. Egg was poached perfectly, the sauce was creamy and rich with a little bit of tang to keep things interesting, and the English muffin  was to die for. I'm craving this for reals. 

I'm coming back for you. Soon.

excerpts: My buddy had "the plow"--2 eggs, bacon, and lemon ricotta pancakes.
Pretty good.
the ricotta pancakes...were good.
don't get me wrong, but I did have better--at Zazie's in Cole Valley.
Sorry!
I'd still come back if I were in the area!
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Mariel A.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Came here on a weekday with my brunch buddy, the best kind of buddy there is. Found parking pretty quickly. Parking on these steep hills always freak me out, though.

Only had to wait about 20 mins. Not bad!
The space and decor that they had was nice..reminded me of NOPA's interior. The nice light wood tables..big windows that let in natural light. Made for a pleasant dining experience. We had to sit directly next to another table though, because of space, but I didn't mind too much.

Had the fried egg sandwich with bacon. Pretty good, but honestly the highlight of the meal was the potatoes. Holy crispiness. Haha, so herby and delicious! If you're a texture freak like me, then I think you'd appreciate these as much as I did. I liked how crisp they were, like super fried but it didn't feel greasy which was nice. :]

My buddy had "the plow"--2 eggs, bacon, and lemon ricotta pancakes. Pretty good. the ricotta pancakes...were good. don't get me wrong, but I did have better--at Zazie's in Cole Valley. Sorry! I'd still come back if I were in the area! :D 

Service was good. Left happy. Prices weren't too bad for what you got. Until we meet again, crispy potatoes...

excerpts: Their lemon ricotta pancakes are amazing!
I just can't get enough.
Every time I'm in the city, I need to make a pit stop here!
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Judy S.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: Their lemon ricotta pancakes are amazing! I just can't get enough. Every time I'm in the city, I need to make a pit stop here!

excerpts: This brunch item had a bit of everything:  two eggs (poached), some pork sausage, two small lemon ricotta pancakes, and the infamous PLOW POTATOES ($13).
The potatoes have ruined me for all future breakfast potatoes because the bar is now sky high.
They were really soft inside yet very crispy on the outside and sprinkled with great rosemary and salt seasoning.
The Fried Egg Sandwich came with two eggs over easy on a soft n' squishy Acme bun ($9).
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Amy C.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
I plowed into the Plow at Plow.

This brunch item had a bit of everything:  two eggs (poached), some pork sausage, two small lemon ricotta pancakes, and the infamous PLOW POTATOES ($13).  The potatoes have ruined me for all future breakfast potatoes because the bar is now sky high.  They were really soft inside yet very crispy on the outside and sprinkled with great rosemary and salt seasoning.  And don't forget to try the locally made Youk's Hot Sauce!

The Fried Egg Sandwich came with two eggs over easy on a soft n' squishy Acme bun ($9).  The eggs were nice and runny and went great with the cheddar cheese, aioli, frisee, and Plow potatoes on the side.  

The bright space has a clean look with large windows and a cute sign that said, "No cell phone.  Please."  It's a small place though and busy for a weekday lunch.  I probably wouldn't brave the long wait on the weekend.

Unless "Plow Potatoes by the Bucket" becomes a menu item.  Then it's on like Donkey Kong!

More info here:  http://goo.gl/rnt4y

excerpts: The lemon ricotta pancakes are delicious, but the star of The Plow has got to be the crispy potatoes with rosemary.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Helen Z.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
This is easily one of the top brunch places to go to in SF. If you get The Plow, which is basically their breakfast sampler, skip the sausage patty (very dry), and go for their bacon (nice and crispy). The lemon ricotta pancakes are delicious, but the star of The Plow has got to be the crispy potatoes with rosemary. Yum. 

They have some staples on the menu like the fried egg sandwich, which is very good, but they also have great seasonal dishes. I tried the salmon tartine last time and it tasted delicious.

Pro Tip: Come on the weekdays to avoid the ridiculous lines.

excerpts: I decided to get the Plow as it has a little bit of everything - eggs your way, choice of pork/chicken sausage or bacon, two lemon ricotta pancakes, and crispy potatoes.
Come hungry!
The crispy potatoes are seriously the best - absolutely MUST HAVE.
The lemon ricotta pancakes were really good too.
I had my eggs poached and the chicken sausage, both of which were good.
Although, the potatoes really stole the show!
The fresh orange juice was delicious.
We were seated outside and it was cute to watch people walk up and down the hill as we enjoyed our huge brunch.
It's dog friendly which is nice.
A bit more expensive than other places, good food, and friendly service except for the long wait.
Will go back for the crispy potatoes!
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Jaya P.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Best brunch I had in SF! Being from DC, I was kind of disappointed with the SF brunch scene but Plow definitely changed that. Yes, the wait is long and kind of annoying depending on when you go, but it's worth it, and definitely better than some other touristy brunch places (looking at you Mama's). Plow is in Portrero Hill, a mostly residential neighborhood and there are some cute stores, restaurants, bookshops around the block that you can check out while you wait. 
I decided to get the Plow as it has a little bit of everything - eggs your way, choice of pork/chicken sausage or bacon, two lemon ricotta pancakes, and crispy potatoes. Come hungry! The crispy potatoes are seriously the best - absolutely MUST HAVE. The lemon ricotta pancakes were really good too. I had my eggs poached and the chicken sausage, both of which were good. Although, the potatoes really stole the show! The fresh orange juice was delicious. We were seated outside and it was cute to watch people walk up and down the hill as we enjoyed our huge brunch. It's dog friendly which is nice. A bit more expensive than other places, good food, and friendly service except for the long wait. Will go back for the crispy potatoes!

excerpts: I got the Plow breakfast (hey-- when in Rome, right?) which came with two eggs (over-easy for me), 4 things of chicken apple sausage, 2 lemon ricotta pancakes (yes!
and yes!), and a big hoppin' load of crispy potato chunks (it's a bit ginger-y, so be advised).
I loved The Plow (get
yer mind outta the gutter...lol).
I believe the gal pal loved her pancakes too.
I only wish my lemon ricotta pancakes had some blueberry compote (sp?)
like the ones in the regular lemon ricotta pancake entree.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Melody W.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
I came here with a gal pal on a Thursday lunch break (~12:15pm). Parking was easy (say what the what? It's never easy in SF). Since I was in great company, the wait wasn't long at all--probably 10-15 minutes max for first available seating. We got seated outside, which was fine. The weather was amazing, so we didn't mind. 

She ordered a side of scrambled eggs with the Almond Flour Pancakes. I got the Plow breakfast (hey-- when in Rome, right?) which came with two eggs (over-easy for me), 4 things of chicken apple sausage, 2 lemon ricotta pancakes (yes! and yes!), and a big hoppin' load of crispy potato chunks (it's a bit ginger-y, so be advised). Oh-- and a cup of Equator coffee to wash it all down. I loved The Plow (get yer mind outta the gutter...lol). I believe the gal pal loved her pancakes too. I only wish my lemon ricotta pancakes had some blueberry compote (sp?) like the ones in the regular lemon ricotta pancake entree. And, I think the crispy potatoes were a little over-powering with ginger taste. All in all, I loved the dish and the experience. 

This place is worth a visit in my book.

excerpts: A plate of crispy potatoes(crack), Nueske bacon (crack), lemon ricotta pancakes (crack) and eggs (cracked =P)
My GAWD this was delicious.
The Nueske bacon was simply the best bacon I've had.
The lemon ricotta pancakes were heavenly.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Herman E.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
This place serves crack.

I swear.  Pure craaaaaaaack!

This is a plate of crack:
http://www.yelp.ca/biz_photos/plow-san-francisco?select=AQQHQEMRFHofOnyRFOBWCA#ToiZprRvyLu9we-MuuTI8g
It's the signature dish, the Plow.  A plate of crispy potatoes(crack), Nueske bacon (crack), lemon ricotta pancakes (crack) and eggs (cracked =P)  My GAWD this was delicious.  The Nueske bacon was simply the best bacon I've had.  The lemon ricotta pancakes were heavenly.

Cold smoked salmon, fromage blanc, pickled red onions, capers, grilled Acme rye:
http://www.yelp.ca/biz_photos/plow-san-francisco#OZ955kbTXWpM8skTrkEXEw

This was good.  Ingredients were fresh.  My only complaint would be that the smoked salmon was not smoked enough.  I come from the land of smoked salmon, and this needed more smoking.

Also ordered a side of house made sausage patties.  Again good, but, yours truly makes a better version.  There were chili flakes and fennel in the spicing mixture.   So attn,  Management of Plow, you wanna pack 'em in even more?  PM me and maybe I'll share my sausage spicing recipe with you.  Pfffffffffft......

One real stand out.  Coffee.

I should have asked where they got their coffee, b/c this is a first!  And I really do mean first.  I do not like sour coffee.  I drink it black.  The coffee they served here was amazing.  It was fruity and citrusy with nice acidity WITHOUT being sour.  I have not encountered coffee like this before.
-----
Update:  Just found out the coffee is from Equator out of San Rafael!
-----
Plow, I'll visit you again.  2 hour flight, rental car, 30 minute wait, and all.  I'll come again.

excerpts: You can never go wrong with their basic breakfast sampler of crispy seasoned potatoes, eggs any style (I get them as whites scrambled with cheddar) with your choice of apple chicken sausage, nueske bacon or (...can't remember the other choice) along with 2 very perfect lemon ricotta pancakes with real maple syrup.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Cameron T.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
My favorite breakfast in the peninsula, well actually, in the whole Bay Area. Very simple and delicious menu. I've tried the eggs Benedict with smoked salmon. Wow! What I'm having today and on most visits here is The Plow. You can never go wrong with their basic breakfast sampler of crispy seasoned potatoes, eggs any style (I get them as whites scrambled with cheddar) with your choice of apple chicken sausage, nueske bacon or (...can't remember the other choice) along with 2 very perfect lemon ricotta pancakes with real maple syrup. Yum! 

It's always busy here but well worth the wait (usually 45min-1hr in the weekends)

excerpts: LEMON RICOTTA PANCAKES
I ordered the lemon ricotta pancakes while my cousin had the sandwich.
Both were good.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Tommy L.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
LEMON RICOTTA PANCAKES

Came here on a wet weekend for brunch with my cousin. It was already packed when we got there and it was only 10am. Make sure to put your name down. They tell you how long it might take. Told us it would take 45 mins so we decided to make a short trip to Trader Joe's for flowers. 

By the time we came back, we didn't have to wait long to be seated. The seating area inside is super tiny, most likely you'll have to share tables with someone. We sat next to these two old gay men who were probably a couple. Didn't bother me at all. 

I ordered the lemon ricotta pancakes while my cousin had the sandwich. Both were good. I think the best part about it were the crispy potatoes. They were really good and probably super unhealthy! They are super fried. 

Parking isnt too bad. You'd have to park residential. I parked on a hill. I know some of you tourist aren't used to parking 90 degrees on a hill in SF but luckily I grew up here and I'm used to it :)

excerpts: I opted for "The Plow" which came with two lemon ricotta pancakes/maple syrup (so good), two eggs (got mine just pure egg whites which were perfectly prepared), bacon (it wasn't the best, I should've just got the chicken apple sausage), and potatoes (which were the highlight of my meal --
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Jorel C.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Plow is located in a convenient spot off of 280 in Potrero Hill.  There was easily found street parking nearby when I went so I think parking shouldn't be much of a problem.  

Keep in mind I did not dine in for my meal during this visit to Plow, just a simple takeout request since I was alone.  

I opted for "The Plow" which came with two lemon ricotta pancakes/maple syrup (so good), two eggs (got mine just pure egg whites which were perfectly prepared), bacon (it wasn't the best, I should've just got the chicken apple sausage), and potatoes (which were the highlight of my meal -- I wish I ordered more because they were made to absolute perfection, crispy and all with just the right touch of rosemary).  

If you're in the area this place is so worth trying out despite the wait I've heard it has.  They've got some top-quality eats and excellent/friendly service even though my experience was brief inside the restaurant since I was just claiming my takeout order.  Definitely plan on returning soon!

excerpts: I loved the lemon ricotta pancakes.
The favor was light and not overpowering
so I could easily see myself eating many of these.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Nguyen L.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
I like the clean & simple neighborhood feeling of this restaurant. Waited an hour on Saturday but it wasn't that bad since the weather was nice and I had a Mimosa in my hand. 
I ordered the Plow with my eggs over medium and chicken apple sausage. My potatoes were a little too extra crispy. However, others that had the potatoes didn't suffer the same fate I did. I loved the lemon ricotta pancakes. The favor was light and not overpowering so I could easily see myself eating many of these.
Soft scrambled eggs - Who knew that stinging nettles and goat cheese went together so well. The eggs had that almost cooked looked like it was a little runny but when I ate it I tasted perfectly that way. 
Service- Hostess and servers were very nice.

They didn't have the monkey bread on the menu that day so I missed that opportunity.  If I was around Potrero Hill area I stop in again.

excerpts: Lemon ricotta pancakes, potatoes, bacon, eggs, you name it.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Kaitlyn M.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
After we got married, we ended up in the heart of San Francisco being the tourists we are. Thankfully we stumbled upon this charming little quarter. It is worth every single second of the wait...odds are there will be a wait! I'll save you some time ordering though -- Get the plow breakfast! You get the best of all worlds. Lemon ricotta pancakes, potatoes, bacon, eggs, you name it. The almond flour pancakes are also incredible, my hubs ended up stealing mine because he doesn't like lemon pancakes. They make everything fresh and you can see them cutting potatoes or squeezing orange juice when you walk in the door!

See the link below for my top 10 favorite Breakfast Spots//Coast to Coast --

http://www.kaitgmiller.com/healthy-eating/10bestbreakfastspots
kaitgmiller.com

excerpts: two eggs, some really delicious Rosemary country potatoes, awesome sausage pattys, and to finish off, what I came for, Lemon Ricotta Pancakes!
If you visit for the pancakes alone
it's worth it.
They were fluffy , light and just lemony enough to not be overpowering and the ricotta, well let's just say I'm adding ricotta to my pancake mix from now on.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Javier A.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: So we took a Cousin here during a 12 hr layover. We had seen the vids on YouTube about it and we were pleasantly surprised. Sunday morning about 9am the wait was about 45min. But worth it. I had "The Plow" plate which incl. two eggs, some really delicious Rosemary country potatoes, awesome sausage pattys, and to finish off, what I came for, Lemon Ricotta Pancakes!  If you visit for the pancakes alone it's worth it. They were fluffy , light and just lemony enough to not be overpowering and the ricotta, well let's just say I'm adding ricotta to my pancake mix from now on. Also delish was the corn millet muffin.

excerpts: It has 2 fried eggs, 2 lemon ricotta pancakes, 2 house made pork sausage and crispy country potatoes.
First, the lemon ricotta pancakes were sooo good!
They were light and fluffy.
It has a unique taste that you just just have to taste for your yourself to truly appreciate it.
Second, The crispy potato is amazing!
Country potato is normally roasted and are soft with a texture to more of bake potato.
But the crispy potato at plow is so different.
Has tons of flavor!
Third, The house made sausages were really good too.
Full of herbs and spices.
Making your own sausage in house, gives you a clue at the quality of the food you will be eating.
If fresh food with great flavors is what your looking for, then plow is the place to go!
Will definitely be returning to try other things on the menu!
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Roger P.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
The plow is such a good place to have brunch. The food is great. I ordered the plow. It has 2 fried eggs, 2 lemon ricotta pancakes, 2 house made pork sausage and crispy country potatoes. First, the lemon ricotta pancakes were sooo good! They were light and fluffy. It has a unique taste that you just just have to taste for your yourself to truly appreciate it. Second, The crispy potato is amazing! Country potato is normally roasted and are soft with a texture to more of bake potato. But the crispy potato at plow is so different. Has tons of flavor! Third, The house made sausages were really good too. Full of herbs and spices. Making your own sausage in house, gives you a clue at the quality of the food you will be eating. 
If fresh food with great flavors is what your looking for, then plow is the place to go! Will definitely be returning to try other things on the menu!

excerpts: I was able to try their Lemon Ricotta Pancakes.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Phillip D.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Wow this place really impressed me. I came her for Sat brunch (10:30ish) before a Giants game.  After waiting 45 minutes for a table, I was really hoping it would live up to the hype from the Yelp reviews I read.  I must say it impressed me in all levels. 

Ordered a couple pastries to start, a Raspberry Galette and a chocolate scone. I am not sure which I liked better because they were both delicious. I could have eaten that alone and have been fine. 

I ordered the "Plow" with a side of bacon and it definitely did not disappoint. I was able to try their Lemon Ricotta Pancakes. I normally hate anything lemon, but this made me a convert (at least for that day).  

The service was pretty fast and very friendly. We had about 3 different people help us and one of the guys even chatted with us about the Giants. 

The only drawback I had was towards the end of our meal, there was a group of 5 seated on a table really meant for 4 to my left.  The seats were so close together that the 5th girl was literally straddling between the tables. It was definitely a little AWKWARD.  If I was still eating, I'd be quite irritated that they even let someone do that (as well as the fact that I'm left handed and would have probably bumped arms with her).  

I'd definitely recommend coming when it first open to avoid the wait. Otherwise expect to wait 45 minutes - 1 hour with the rest of the peeps!

I'm coming back here again (but earlier!)

excerpts: The lemon ricotta pancakes really are every bit as good as all these reviews make it out to be.
Try it or regret it FOR LIFE.
I'm just kidding, do what you want
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Chia L.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
The lemon ricotta pancakes really are every bit as good as all these reviews make it out to be. Try it or regret it FOR LIFE. I'm just kidding, do what you want, I'm not your mother.

Another pleasant surprise were the breakfast potatoes. So crispy on the outside, just perfectly chewy on the inside. Repress your healthy conscience and don't wonder how they got the potatoes to be so crunchy and enjoy that heavenly mess. Pork patties were tough and bland. Definitely choose chicken apple sausage over the homemade pork patties.

The biscuits and gravy were disappointing. Having grown up in the South, I never turn down a chance to try biscuits and gravy. The biscuits were a bit stiff. The gravy on the sweeter side, with a really heavy aftertaste of the sausages.

Wait was 35 minutes, but this was 9:30 am. Pancakes and potatoes are well worth waiting in line for.

excerpts: The lemon ricotta pancakes were of course delicious as well.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Sungeeta A.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Wow is this place popular!  I came here around 8:50 on a Sunday morning, thinking there was no way there would be a huge wait. Was I wrong! I guess San Franciscans really like their brunch!

I have to say brunch was worth the wait. I got the Plow, which includes 2 eggs, your choice of meat (I got bacon, obviously), crispy potatoes, and 2 small lemon-ricotta pancakes. It was the perfect amount of food for someone who has been waiting for a table for 1 hour! It was also delicious. The crispy potatoes were mixed with onions and both were extra crispy. These are probably the best breakfast potatoes I've ever had! The lemon ricotta pancakes were of course delicious as well. The only negative was they were a little on the luke warm side. 

Next time I come here (and there will be a next time) I'm going to get here right when they open at 8, or come on a weekday.

excerpts: The lemon ricotta pancakes were good as well, but I got easily tired of it.
I will probably try to come back again on a weekday.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Erika-Kelly C.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: Long over due for this review.. Plow on the weekends is a 1-2 hour wait. Surprisingly, the parking is not bad. The interior of this place is " cozy ". And for the food, it's just a little different but not bad. I got the plow and I loved the potatoes! The lemon ricotta pancakes were good as well, but I got easily tired of it. I will probably try to come back again on a weekday.

excerpts: And lemon ricotta pancakes actually had more of a lemony taste to it vs the first time I had it.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Jennifer W.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Came on a Saturday morning at 11:15am and was told it'd be a hour wait. So took a walk to nearby neighborhood for maybe 25 mins or so .. Come back to check in, it'll be another hour. Umm say what?!?! I know it's crazy here but .. That's a crazy long wait! Luckily, we decide to stick it out and wait. By 11:50, they were starting to call out parties of 2! Turns out that everyone either left or went for a walk and we got so lucky to be seated before 12! 

It was my second time here but the first wasn't memorable. This time .. It kind of really blew my mind! I got the plow with house-made sausage. The potatoes were amazingly crispy but not in the oily tasting way. House-made sausage blows the chicken apple sausage out of the park! And lemon ricotta pancakes actually had more of a lemony taste to it vs the first time I had it. 

Overall, it was a pretty awesome brunch. But if I had a choice, I'd avoid this place during the weekend! I think we just got lucky with the seating. It's probably easier during the weekdays!

excerpts: 5 stars for the lemon ricotta pancakes and the eggs benedict!
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Arel O.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
5 stars for the lemon ricotta pancakes and the eggs benedict! And those potatoes were fried to crispy perfection!

5 stars for the friendly staff (despite my annoying questions about the wait...everyone has a smile and the energy of people was cheerful)

Overall, a delicious brunch experience...just a little bit too long of a wait. Would definitely go back, but probably at 9am to avoid the rush.

excerpts: the bacon was good, the potatoes were good, and the eggs (we got them poached) were also good, but the real winner (to me) was the lemon ricotta pancakes!!!
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Ashley N.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
After having Plow on my list of brunch places to try in SF, I was luckily able to convince my boyfriend to get up at an ungodly hour on a Saturday to venture over here with me. Why ungodly? Coming from Berkeley, we knew we had to get up, at the latest, by 06AM in order to make the commute via BART to Plow. You bet I would have been disappointed if this brunch wasn't any good. 

Sadly .. we still didn't make it by 08, hahaha (although to be fair, I was taking a little longer than I needed to get ready). We arrived around 8:45AM probably, and were told it would be a 45-60 min wait for two. There's not much to do around this neighborhood while you wait, sadly. You could walk a few blocks more to meet a freeway overpass (a little scary). There were a few shops around the area, but they were closed since it it was pretty early still. I think you get free coffee inside as you wait (I didn't get it myself .. because I didn't see it until we were already seated..).

We got our seats after about an hour, right at the counter. Pretty cool to watch the chefs pump out Plows like clockwork. It made waiting for our food not as bad! 

BF and I ordered:

+ The Plow (of course): the bacon was good, the potatoes were good, and the eggs (we got them poached) were also good, but the real winner (to me) was the lemon ricotta pancakes!!! 
+ Dungeness Crab Scramble: so happy this was on the menu on this visit :) I never imagined mixing crab with eggs, but it worked so well! I loved it. Also came with the potatoes, which I was really happy about because they were well-seasoned, and muy yummy :) 


Service was fast and efficient as it could be. 
Parking on the street, didn't look like it would be too hard to find, at least on a Sat morning. 
Restaurant is tiny, so yes, if you don't want to wait.. getting here early is important.

excerpts: My friends and I also shared an order of the lemon ricotta pancakes.

I'm generally not a fan of flavored pancakes, but these were the best pancakes I've had in recent memory -- perfect thickness, wonderfully soft in the inside, slightly crisp on the outside, with a subtle lemon zing.
For meat lovers, I'd recommend the pork chops.
The meat is tender and perfectly greasy; it was a favorite at the table.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Grace S.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
My two friends and I arrived for Sunday brunch at 9:35 and didn't get seated until close to 11.  Yes, the wait was long.  (The place is tiny; definitely not a place for large groups).  However, Plow's location in a charming neighborhood of coffee shops and boutiques gave us out-of-towners a nice way to pass the time as we waited for a table. We grabbed coffee at a nearby coffee shop and said "hi" to the occasional dog that sat outside the various cafes, patiently waiting for their owners.

And the wait was so worth it. 

Our food came quickly once we ordered. I had the eggs Benedict with smoked salmon. It was a very generous portion with a side of perfectly crispy potatoes. My friends and I also shared an order of the lemon ricotta pancakes. I'm generally not a fan of flavored pancakes, but these were the best pancakes I've had in recent memory -- perfect thickness, wonderfully soft in the inside, slightly crisp on the outside, with a subtle lemon zing. For meat lovers, I'd recommend the pork chops. The meat is tender and perfectly greasy; it was a favorite at the table.

excerpts: The Plow: two eggs, choice of house made pork sausage, Nueske bacon, or chicken apple sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes with pure maple syrup, and some crispy potatoes.
The boy got his with the sugar pie pumpkin pancakes (instead of the lemon ricotta) and they were just as heavenly--if not better.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Adena B.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
"Hour and a half wait," says Randall.

"No worries, we'll wait it out," I told him. He smiled and handed me some coffee to pass the time. He also pointed down the street and shared a tip: "Rico makes some killer Bloody Marys. In case you're interested."

Of COURSE I'm interested, Randall. We wasted a good 45 minutes at Blooms Saloon, (http://www.yelp.com/biz/blooms-saloon-san-francisco#hrid:g60JAte3LvIB4-uJ8CCUXw) then headed back to wait out the remainder of the time. 

EATS
+The Plow: two eggs, choice of house made pork sausage, Nueske bacon, or chicken apple sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes with pure maple syrup, and some crispy potatoes. The boy got his with the sugar pie pumpkin pancakes (instead of the lemon ricotta) and they were just as heavenly--if not better. We both opted for the bacon--and it was just OK; kinda smokey.

DRANKS
+Mimosas: watered down and not that great; especially not after that spicy Bloody Mary.
+Coffee: San Raf's finest, Equator coffee. Excellent.

Service was good, Randall made it great. Will I be back? Probably not, but happy to have tested it out to see what the hype was all about.

excerpts: ordered the plow: 2 lemon ricotta pancakes, 2 eggs any style, crispy potatoes, and choice of home made pork sausage patties, bacon, or chicken sausage.
I got sunny side up and bacon.
the plate was a lot of for me
and I couldn't finish.
LB got the fried egg sandwich with added avocado, side order of pancakes and the pork sausage.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Jules L.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
came on a Tuesday around 11am, there were about 5 parties ahead of us. ask them to put your name on the list. some people tried to just sit themselves onto open tables. it is not open seatings. they have little benches for you to sit on as you wait. they will ask if you prefer outdoor or inside seatings or whichever is first available. around after 12, the crowd dies down and not much of a wait. they are open till 2pm though and closed on Mondays. took around 20 mins to be seated. 

ordered the plow: 2 lemon ricotta pancakes, 2 eggs any style, crispy potatoes, and choice of home made pork sausage patties, bacon, or chicken sausage. I got sunny side up and bacon. the plate was a lot of for me and I couldn't finish. LB got the fried egg sandwich with added avocado, side order of pancakes and the pork sausage. he can eat and was not able to finish too. 

food was pretty good. not mind blowing. some of the potatoes are extra crispy like potato chips, egg yolks was small, bacon had a smokey taste, pancakes was alright. I made the mistake of eating that last and it has gotten cold. I do taste the hint of lemon. 

service was good. LB's coffee got refilled 3 times. they asked if you want water also, but we declined. When food arrives, waiter will ask if you need anything else like ketchup or hot sauce. they did not check up on us afterward. the food took a bit to come out, around 25 mins. so don't go hungry. 

a little pricey breakfast, but you're paying for the quality of the ingredients. their juices are not freshly squeezed though, came from bottled jugs. I got the grapefruit juice. Comes in small or large. 

plenty of parking around the neighbor. not metered. nice view as you wait. right off the 280 freeway.

excerpts: We had the egg sandwich (+bacon is a MUST), french toast w/ vanilla braised pears and mascarpone cheese, coffee cake, and lemon ricotta pancakes.
The lemon ricotta pancakes are semisweet and have a fresh, light lemon essence without any bitterness.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: James W.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Serious brunching action at Plow. Very little fancy foodwork, just a singular focus on using high quality ingredients to make simple, high quality dishes. We had the egg sandwich (+bacon is a MUST), french toast w/ vanilla braised pears and mascarpone cheese, coffee cake, and lemon ricotta pancakes.  

The homestyle potatoes alone are worth coming here for - perfect amount of salt and savory seasonings, then fried with onions until they're all encased in a crispy shell without being greasiness. The little bits at the end are sheer happiness.

The lemon ricotta pancakes are semisweet and have a fresh, light lemon essence without any bitterness. Definitely try these.

The french toast is very traditional, and while it was delicious, the thickness of the slices made the inside slightly soggy, and the mascarpone cheese didn't shine through. Admittedly I approached these a little critically as I was comparing it to the french toast l'orange at Snooze. 

Coffee cake was well made, but nothing too special. 

Overall, excellent brunch spot. Prices come to about $10-20 per person, which is reasonable for the quality of the food.

excerpts: Lemon ricotta pancakes, pork sausage patties, scrambled eggs and the most amazing potatoes
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: K W.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Lemon ricotta pancakes, pork sausage patties, scrambled eggs and the most amazing potatoes I think I've ever had. 

I don't give 5 star ratings flippantly. But, breakfast at 1:30 in the afternoon with outdoor seating on a crisp autumn day was just what the doctor ordered. 

Service was on point, and the food came out amazingly fast. 

I wish I knew how they made those potatoes. What's their secret?

excerpts: Lemon Ricotta Pancakes!
I not even a huge pancake fan but these things killed Mama's and Dotties pancakes.
Yes, that's right...
they're better than both Mama's and Dotties.
(Dear Dottie, I love you too, so
It's a great plate that gives you two silver dollar sized lemon ricotta pancakes, eggs, crispy potatos (wow) and your choice of meat.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Leanne S.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
This is one place that seriously lives up to all the hype. Hello...Lemon Ricotta Pancakes! I not even a huge pancake fan but these things killed Mama's and Dotties pancakes. Yes, that's right...they're better than both Mama's and Dotties. (Dear Dottie, I love you too, so don't worry I'll be back)

The eats - I had The Plow. It's a great plate that gives you two silver dollar sized lemon ricotta pancakes, eggs, crispy potatos (wow) and your choice of meat. 

Service - Great, everyone is really friendly and seemed to be happy. The wait wasn't even too bad for a Saturday morning. I think we only had to wait 30 minutes which is pretty fast considering how busy this place gets.

Atmosphere - I love the open kitchen concept and enjoy watching the chefs prepare food. The decor itself is warm, modern and bright.

excerpts: The lemon ricotta pancakes were some of the best I've ever had (and I'm one of those people who must have them if they're on a menu, so
I have a good basis for comparison).
Will go again...
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Suzy W.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: I am almost afraid to write a review for this place out of fear that it's going to get even more popular. It's absolutely delicious food - so well thought out and well executed. The service was also impeccable (which is sometimes very hit and miss in San Francisco). The lemon ricotta pancakes were some of the best I've ever had (and I'm one of those people who must have them if they're on a menu, so I have a good basis for comparison). Will go again...

excerpts: Those potatoes and lemon ricotta pancakes and French Toast are my favs.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Jennifer H.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: If you are brave enough to wait through those long longs on weekends (and weekdays for that matter), you are in for a treat.  Their breakfast is amazing.  Those potatoes and lemon ricotta pancakes and French Toast are my favs.

excerpts:

-silver dollar lemon ricotta pancakes -
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Shannon L.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
SO SO SOO AMAZING! This is my new favorite brunch place. My friend and I came on a Thursday around 12 noon so there was only a five minute wait, but that's probably nothing compared to how long it is on the weekends. I can't even imagine how crazy it is then. As for the food, we both ordered "The Plow" which consists of their:

-silver dollar lemon ricotta pancakes - I'm not normally a fan of pancakes, but these blew my mind! Probably my favorite out of everything on my plate. Eat them slowly and just taste all the flavors in these light and fluffy pancakes! Still thinking about them...so good!
-crispy potatoes - all I can say is crispy and oh-so-delicious, just the way I like it. 
-nueske bacon - can't go wrong with bacon. 
 
I'll definitely be coming back to try the almond flour pancakes and french toast!

excerpts: The lemon ricotta pancakes are pretty good too, but the ricotta can get slightly overwhelming after a bit.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Angela K.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Came here for breakfast and got the egg sandwich and it was uhhh-mazing. The bacon was perfectly crisp and the egg came runny. The lemon ricotta pancakes are pretty good too, but the ricotta can get slightly overwhelming after a bit. 

A quite hefty breakfast, but totally worth it. A cute spot to start the morning.

excerpts: When I come here I ALWAYS get the Plow and the lemon ricotta pancakes are such a treat.
A great place to bring out of town guests.
I would give it 5  stars if the wait wasn't that LONG.
It can be frustrating
but once you are seated and you get your delish food all is forgotten.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Schisandra S.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
I love this place!
The food is great and the space is awesome! 
When I come here I ALWAYS get the Plow and the lemon ricotta pancakes are such a treat. 
A great place to bring out of town guests.

excerpts: The Plow ($16) : 2 eggs, choice of pork sausage, bacon, OR chicken apple sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes, and crispy potatoes.
Everything was good, but wasn't a big fan of the lemon ricotta pancakes as I thought I would've been.
Customer service was attentive and friendly.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: B. R.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Waited 45 minutes and ordered "The Plow." 

The Plow ($16) : 2 eggs, choice of pork sausage, bacon, OR chicken apple sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes, and crispy potatoes.

Got seated outside on a cold morning. You can ask them for blankets since there's no patio heaters outside.

No tobasco sauce here. Only serve Youk's hot sauce -- wasn't that spicy for me.

Everything was good, but wasn't a big fan of the lemon ricotta pancakes as I thought I would've been. Customer service was attentive and friendly.

excerpts:
What I've tried:
LEMON RICOTTA PANCAKES:
First time I had this, I didn't enjoy it.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Sunny W.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Been here twice, both times were to take friends visiting the area. It's good, with all the other amazing breakfast/brunch places in SF, I may skip this place next time.

What I've tried:
LEMON RICOTTA PANCAKES: First time I had this, I didn't enjoy it. Second time was much better.

FRIED EGG SANDWICH: My only grip with this dish is the bun used. I guess I'm picky about my carbs....

SOFT SCRAMBLED EGGS: asparagus, oyster mushrooms, goat cheese. One of my favorites from Plow --I would reorder next time I visit.

EGGS BENEDICT: I got the spinach/mushroom combo. The english muffin must be bought at a nearby bakery --thicker than your usual. Flavor was a little lacking, would pass on this for the SOFT SCRAMBLED EGGS.

Of course, the CRISPY POTATOES are as good as everyone says it is.

PARKING: If you come at the right time, you should be able to find street parking.

FIRST TIMER? Walk through the crowds near the entrance and put your name down with a staff. Expect to wait at least 45 min on weekends. There's bar and table seating inside, as well as a handful of tables outside.

excerpts: The eggs were definitely just your average eggs, but boy the lemon ricotta pancakes and crispy breakfast potatoes were something SPECIAL.
If you're dying to try the pancakes, but also want to (
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Rachel L.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Based on their infamous long wait-times, I was really hoping Plow would suck and I wouldn't have to continue to plot ways to survive the line. Unfortunately, Plow fully and completely won me over. Two hour wait for some of their crispy breakfast potatoes? Sign me up.

After rushing over and putting my name in at 9am on a Saturday morning, I proceeded to pick a friend up at the airport and by the time we made it back, our name had already been called. First thought was: NOOOOOOOOO. Fortunately, being the awesome servers they are, the Plow peeps sat us right away at an awesome table outside! At this point, I was already sold.

We both ordered "The Plow," based on excited reviewers who claimed this was the first-timer's MUST ORDER. The eggs were definitely just your average eggs, but boy the lemon ricotta pancakes and crispy breakfast potatoes were something SPECIAL. If you're dying to try the pancakes, but also want to (/NEED TO) try the potatoes, the Plow was definitely a good way of getting the best of both worlds.

Definitely go early and put your name in with an hour - two hour interim plan and definitely try the potatoes.

excerpts: If you come here, just get the lemon ricotta pancakes!
The lemon ricotta pancakes have a strong lemon flavor, which I like.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Margaret L.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Do I need to say more?

If you come here, just get the lemon ricotta pancakes!

We got the plow and the tuscan kale salad. Both were delicious. The lemon ricotta pancakes have a strong lemon flavor, which I like. It very distinct and the pancakes are fluffy and soft.

I came here on a weekday and the wait was not long. 

So it looks like a lot of food but I actually feel like it's not a lot of food compared to other brunch places (ie Zazies). The food is good though! This places reminds me of restaurants/chefs who perfect their dishes and only give you a little of it to try to satisfy your palette (like what you see on iron chef)! The portions are decent though, but you won't leave here super stuffed and full, just satisfied!!

excerpts: The lemon ricotta pancakes were amazing and the crispy potatoes are a-maz-ing.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Sarah G.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Great spot for breakfast in SF! We stopped here on a brief visit to the city, and it was well worth the wait 

The lemon ricotta pancakes were amazing and the crispy potatoes are a-maz-ing. 

It was 20 minutes on a Thursday, so I'm thinking the weekend is a nightmare. I'd recommend getting there early.

excerpts: THE PLOW: 4 stars: Lemon Ricotta pancakes were sweet, full of lemony flavor & fluffy.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Emily C.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
3.5 stars.

THE WAIT: About 40 minutes around 12:30p on a Saturday. 

THE FOOD: 
|| THE PLOW: 4 stars: Lemon Ricotta pancakes were sweet, full of lemony flavor & fluffy. The crispy potatoes were PERFECT, as they were crispy on the outside, yet retained the potato texture and flavor on the inside (I hate when a crispy potato becomes unrecognizable in flavor other than a fried mess)! The pork sausage was good. The scrambled eggs was unfortunately disappointing because it was soggy. 

|| DUNGENESS CRAB SCRAMBLE: 3 stars: The eggs were again soggy, but the scramble preserved the crab flavor. Good dish if you really like crab without much flavoring added to it. 

PARKING: Lots of parking, since it is Potrero Hill, your car will likely be parked at a 45 degree angle. 

ATMOSPHERE: Small restaurant with cute, clean decor (pottery barn-esque). Seating is limited inside and our table of 2 was awkwardly super close to the table next to us (so censor your conversations :P). 

SERVICE: Friendly and with a smile.

excerpts: Anyhow the Lemon Ricotta pancakes, chia seed pudding, egg sandwich, biscuit and potatoes are all super tasty.
Overall a good brunch spot to go to-not frequently but maybe once of twice a year if you live in the city to be honest.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Lynn J.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Lucky I live in the neighborhood-
Food is not worth 2 hours like the usual wait but maybe 40 minutes.  
Anyhow the Lemon Ricotta pancakes, chia seed pudding, egg sandwich, biscuit and potatoes are all super tasty. Overall a good brunch spot to go to-not frequently but maybe once of twice a year if you live in the city to be honest.

excerpts: The lemon ricotta pancakes are melt in your mouth good as everyone recommends.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Viv T.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: 3.8/5 stars. Solid breakfast/brunch spot. The prosciutto and Gruyere toast is divine. The lemon ricotta pancakes are melt in your mouth good as everyone recommends. Get the Plow so you get a full hearty eggs, sausage and potatoes to go with it. Favorite part: the potatoes included the crispy bits at the bottom of the pan that I love to scrape off and eat myself, but much better done here. Wish coffee selection was a bit better. A cappuccino would've been a nice compliment but a-ok drip coffee suits, too. Long lines...good spot, but I probably wouldn't wait longer than 30-40 min for it.

excerpts: Great house made sausage, crisp potatoes and Lemon Ricotta pancakes.
Also had great service
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: David S.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: Great breakfast despite the hour wait for a table. Great house made sausage, crisp potatoes and Lemon Ricotta pancakes. Also had great service

excerpts: The lemon ricotta pancakes and potatoes are just incredible.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Kelly R.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: The lemon ricotta pancakes and potatoes are just incredible. I had The Plow, and while I was not especially impressed by the pork sausage patties or eggs, I was absolutely blown away by the rest of the plate. We waited for quite awhile on a cold Saturday morning (seriously, that wait!), but once we got inside, the restaurant was beautifully bright and adorable. Perfect place for brunch if you're willing to wait!

excerpts: I ordered the lemon ricotta pancakes and she order the plow which comes with two eggs, chicken apple sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes, and crispy potatoes.
We basically split everything, and I finished my own set of pancakes.
The pancakes were so light and fluffy, but you could taste the lemon and ricotta in every bite - exactly how it should be, right?
Everything in my cousin's dish was delicious - the crispy potatoes .... to die for.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Kathleene E.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
My cousin and I came to the Plow a few months ago, and I believe it was  Friday morning. We had to wait about an hour, but it wasn't a big deal because we walked down the street to this super cute coffee spot and the wait went by super quick. 

The restaurant is small and quaint, one of those small, cozy (as another yelper said) restaurant. It has a lot of bright open space, so if you're feeling a little vampirey and antisocial not wanting to share your space, I suggest you do not go here! Lol, onto the food.

I ordered the lemon ricotta pancakes and she order the plow which comes with two eggs, chicken apple sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes, and crispy potatoes. We basically split everything, and I finished my own set of pancakes. The pancakes were so light and fluffy, but you could taste the lemon and ricotta in every bite - exactly how it should be, right? Everything in my cousin's dish was delicious - the crispy potatoes .... to die for. The chicken apple sausage was yummy as well. 

Bottom line - it was a fun experience. Good food, good service topped with a beautiful sunny day in SF. But since I was having a leisurely day and not pressed on time, I was okay with waiting the hour to be seated. I wouldn't wait an hour if I had other things to do - i thought this was important to add :)

excerpts: The LEMON RICOTTA pancakes were just divine.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Gina G.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
I absolutely LOVED this place. I highly recommend getting "the plow" your first time there. You get a good assortment of different items on the menu (sausage, pancakes, exquisite potatoes, eggs).  The LEMON RICOTTA pancakes were just divine. I'm still dreaming about them...

My bf had the egg sandwich with bacon added. He claims it was the best egg sandwich he's ever had. 

The wait was a bit long (about 45 min at around 9am on a sunday) however, you can get a cup of coffee to sip on while you wait. I liked that, especially since it was a bit chilly when i went. And the host was just a doll, very nice lady :)

Also extra stars for the awesome busboy that brought my pup a bowl of water! 

I can't wait to go back!!!
