excerpts: I opted for The Plow ($16) which came with 2 lemon ricotta pancakes, 4 modest sized chicken/apple sausages, 2 eggs done your preference, and breakfast potatoes.
The pancakes were so heavenly...like biting into a meyer lemon cupcakes.
It was more dense than I imagined, but still very delicious.
The potatoes are done to a crisp and has some sauteed onions mixed into it.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Elaine Y.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Came here at 9am and was still hit with a 45min wait. Pretty modest at Plow. But once inside, the atmosphere was modern, yet cozy. We were seated at a table meant for two, so it was a little cramped, but we made it work. FYI though, Plow does not seat for parties more than 6 people.

I opted for The Plow ($16) which came with 2 lemon ricotta pancakes, 4 modest sized chicken/apple sausages, 2 eggs done your preference, and breakfast potatoes. The pancakes were so heavenly...like biting into a meyer lemon cupcakes. It was more dense than I imagined, but still very delicious. The potatoes are done to a crisp and has some sauteed onions mixed into it. It was really good, but some of the pieces were very large and too potato-y for my liking.

All in all, the meal was very delicious and filling. Seriously, it's been over 4 hours and I still feel stuffed...

excerpts: My partner ordered the lemon ricotta pancakes and I decided on the corned beef hash with yukon gold potatoes, chillies, and two eggs.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Simon K.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
I was craving a very good breakfast, flying in the night before and dodging all the Black Friday madness of everyone shopping my cousin and her husband brought us here for a good start to our day. Lacking sleep already and a night of turkey I needed something to bring a good morning 'ring' to my day as I was tired, and mediocre was not going to do, thankfully I have a cousin who knows about food, and still remembering from years before on how she took me to places, I could put my faith in her to deliver.

She said that this place usually has line-ups going up the block (as this place is located on a hill), so to get here early, we arrived at 8 AM, the place was not empty, but it wasn't packed, probably being a holiday. It was a charming little place with real high ceilings, very bright white walls, defined by natural wood tables. It's a very happy, bright look, with the open kitchen concept that seems standard nowadays with new restaurants.

Once we sat down, we were presented the menu, and looking at that pageful of items to order, the problem was to decide on what to order. From pancakes, eggs, bacon, granola, sandwiches and salads, everything looked so good. My cousin and her husband had 'the Plow' which consists of two eggs, two pancakes, and they decided on the Nueske bacon. My partner ordered the lemon ricotta pancakes and I decided on the corned beef hash with yukon gold potatoes, chillies, and two eggs. As it wasn't that busy when we were here, the orders came quite quickly.

Speaking on my dish of hash browns, this was pefectly done, little bits of pefectly cooked potatoes mixed with strands of corned beef, and this was the stuff on the bottom of the plate. You could taste the freshness of the ingredients mixed with some chili to provide a kick, this was under the two sunny side eggs that were laid on top of the hash, welcoming me to breakfast like a set of eyes. Two small pieces of bread were laid on the top side of the eggs and I was ready to devour like a monster looking at this thing. My partner's pancakes were fluffy and had a good dense chew. I remember a smile everytime I took a bite, and I also remember my partners fork constantly coming over to my plate picking at little pieces of potato and meat.

Another thing that was damn good was the bacon here, whatever farmer they are getting this stuff from, it's like crack. I love the look that my partner had when she took a bite. One of those breakfast joints that if I was to be back in San Francisco I would check it out. From what I heard from my cousin, come early, or wait, but when was waiting for good food wrong.

excerpts: We are somewhat automatic in what order: lemon ricotta pancakes, almond flour pancakes, and several times the French toast.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Al G.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: My wife have eaten at Plow 8 times in the last 3 years- all breakfasts/brunch on weekends. We are somewhat automatic in what order: lemon ricotta pancakes, almond flour pancakes, and several times the French toast. On two occasions, I  have personally order The Plow. We generally get there early- between 8am to 8:30am, so that we do not have to wait in line. After 9am, you expect to wait in line about 10 mins to 30 mins depending on the size of your party. What we've always enjoyed about Plow is its consistency with how simple and how good their food is. The service is pretty good and fairly quick. Surprisingly enough, we've never had any challenges with finding parking within 2 blocks.

excerpts: It includes two eggs, two lemon ricotta pancakes, potatoes, and choice of meat.
The pancakes were an absolute standout.
My husband is the meat eater between the two of us and said the house-made pork sausage patty was delightful.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Roxanne S.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
My husband and I waited quite some time to eat breakfast here on a Saturday morning. We arrived at 9 AM and were met with a one-hour wait, which we never tend to mind. We sat at the bar and it was fun to watch the cooks prepare the orders (also a good way to decide on different menu items because you can see them being prepared).

We got the Plow, which is their breakfast plate. It includes two eggs, two lemon ricotta pancakes, potatoes, and choice of meat. The pancakes were an absolute standout. My husband is the meat eater between the two of us and said the house-made pork sausage patty was delightful. We also shared a biscuit with honey butter and enjoyed it immensely!

Be aware that the menu items were pricey. We paid $4.50 for the biscuit, which felt high (especially compared to other restaurants where we typically get a biscuit on the side). Would highly recommend and would go back!

excerpts: The lemon ricotta pancakes were exquisite alongside the dungeness crab eggs which were also bomb.
Definitely will be coming back again!
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Carla T.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Came in at 9am on a Saturday and we were told it was going to be an hour and a half wait (be prepared to wait that long, specially on the weekends). We live conveniently close to Plow so we put our name on the waiting list, went home and got ready and came back, and they had just started calling my name. 

The lemon ricotta pancakes were exquisite alongside the dungeness crab eggs which were also bomb. Definitely will be coming back again!

excerpts: Let me say the ONE and only bad thing about this place--the lemon ricotta pancakes.
I'm sorry, but it tasted like old lemon cake.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Aly A.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Let me say the ONE and only bad thing about this place--the lemon ricotta pancakes.  I'm sorry, but it tasted like old lemon cake.  The consistency was wrong and the flavor was too sweet, not tangy enough--and just off.  

I was going to ask to see if we could sub for the Almond pancakes, but I forgot....damn.

The coffee? Delicious. The french toast.  Oh god, the french toast was sooo good.  The potatoes were fried well.  The fried egg sandwich--delicious delicious delicious.  The poached eggs? Perfectly cooked.  

The wait is long--about 30 minutes for Sat around noonish.  There is a cute bookstore about a block or so away if you want to walk around.

excerpts: Lemon ricotta pancakes and the potatoes are something you wouldn't want to miss.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: E U.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: If you can stand the waiting in line, then definitely try it. Lemon ricotta pancakes and the potatoes are something you wouldn't want to miss.

excerpts: Wonderful meal, wonderful service and this lemon ricotta pancakes...
Amazing!!!
If you are in the neighborhood, or even if you need to drive a little, don't miss this gem.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Karen M.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: Wonderful meal, wonderful service and this lemon ricotta pancakes... Amazing!!! If you are in the neighborhood, or even if you need to drive a little, don't miss this gem.

excerpts: The lemon ricotta pancakes were amazing!
I've never had anything like them.
They barely need any maple syrup.
The bacon was nice and crispy.
The potatoes were well seasoned with rosemary and had a nice crispy texture as well.
The wait can be long
but it's worth it.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Cyn L.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: Our service was great, and the food was good. I had "the plow". The lemon ricotta pancakes were amazing! I've never had anything like them. They barely need any maple syrup. The bacon was nice and crispy. The potatoes were well seasoned with rosemary and had a nice crispy texture as well. The wait can be long but it's worth it.

excerpts: Their lemon ricotta pancakes are very special but the rest of the menu is decent.
The wait staff are friendly and the service is decent.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Hema P.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
When I wait for an hour and a half for a table, my expectations are pretty high - I expect the food to be exceptional. It's extremely good but not exceptional. Their lemon ricotta pancakes are very special but the rest of the menu is decent.  The wait staff are friendly and the service is decent. I just don't want to wait an hour and a half for very good or decent.  

Universal cafe is a far better choice to plow - never waited there for more than 30 mins and the food is organic and pretty damn good.  Far better trade off.

excerpts: Simple order recommendations: the plow and the lemon ricotta pancakes.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Meghana D.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
A recent visit has me downgrading this storied brunch spot from a 5 to a 2. 

Why? Service, service, service.  Yes it was Sunday, and yes it was brunch. I'm well aware of the standard busy-ness and crowds. I know how it works .

It's never an excuse to be abjectly rude to your customers or actively dissuade them from enjoying yoru cuisine. Many many instances occured during our wait and meal that shocked me vs. my last experience (the differential perhaps being the increase in popularity recently).

Now, all of this is sometimes still worth it if the food is epic (a la soup nazi). Unfortunately, it's no longer the case. Upon our seating, we waited 40 minutes for our [very simple] orders. not only that, the food arrived very cold. 

At one point in time, Plow was worth every second of the wait and / or mild disrespect. I'm sorry to say that's no longer the case. Hop on over to Radish, Foreign Cinema, or really, anywhere else instead. 

--
No questions on this rating. Absolutely one of the best brunch places I have ever been to and a must-visit for aspiring foodies 

Get ready to wait-- 1.5 hours @ peak time. The hipster coffee shop around the corner provides ample opportunity for people watching and general credibility-building in the area ;) (let's just say our designer handbags and celebrity-gossip infused conversations got us some looks at first, but my friends and I are quick learners and briskly changed the subject matter) 

I digress. 

Simple order recommendations: the plow and the lemon ricotta pancakes. Divine. 

Happy eating. I'm jealous from afar.

excerpts: I got "the plow" dish, which comes with eggs, chicken apple sausage (there are other meat options), PERFECT POTATOES, and lemon ricotta pancakes.
My friends got the breakfast sandwich and also raved about it.
The place is very cute.
Even though the prices are kind of steep, the food is so tasty!!
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Michelle K.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: Absolutely delicious and well worth the 2 hour wait, despite it being a weekday morning. I got "the plow" dish, which comes with eggs, chicken apple sausage (there are other meat options), PERFECT POTATOES, and lemon ricotta pancakes. My friends got the breakfast sandwich and also raved about it. The place is very cute. Even though the prices are kind of steep, the food is so tasty!!

excerpts: We had the famous lemon ricotta pancakes, and I also ordered a side of eggs and fruit which were both fresh and delicious.
My daughter ordered from the kids menu, and even though she was the only child in there, she was treated wonderfully.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Erika B.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Aside from the people walking by outside and giggling at the name (not easy to explain to my 7-year old), our experience with Plow was unparalleled. It is a small place in a discreet neighborhood but the ambiance and friendly service more than make up for the ride from the center of town.  

We had the famous lemon ricotta pancakes, and I also ordered a side of eggs and fruit which were both fresh and delicious.  My daughter ordered from the kids menu, and even though she was the only child in there, she was treated wonderfully.  I would say that while this place is friendly towards children, err more on the side of slightly-older, well-behaved children who can sit still and order politely.  

We arrived at around 11:30 on a weekday so we were seated after only a 10 minute wait, but with it being such a small establishment I can understand why the waits on the weekends get so long.  

Overall, one of the best breakfasts I've eaten, and with a wonderful atmosphere.  I'm not sure if I would go out of my way again to eat here if I was just visiting, but I'm sure I would be here regularly if I was local.

excerpts: Your lemon ricotta pancakes are sheer brillance... with or without the love of Vermont maple syrup...
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Christine K.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Dear Plow,

You are, dare I say, the epitome of why I go out and pay money for brunch... You provide an experience of flavors, quality, and sheer size that knocks everyone else out of the water.

Your staff is friendly and quick to take care of me as I walk in...

Your lemon ricotta pancakes are sheer brillance... with or without the love of Vermont maple syrup...

Your soft scrambled eggs with oyster mushrooms, lambs quarter, and goat cheese is sheer heaven... being light and satisfyingly rich of flavor and texture.

Your eggs benedict with ham is sheer perfection...

And the potatoes!  Fried crisp on the outside with the potato-y soft goodness on the inside.  I could've eaten these on the side of everything!

My only complaint is can you make all the other people go away, so I don't have to wait in line?  No?  Okay, I'll just come early for easier parking and the ability to walk right in and enjoy my coffee.

Much love and full of deliciousness,
Christine

excerpts: The lemon ricotta pancakes are the best I've ever had!
Definitely coming back here!
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Shira G.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: This place is well worth the wait.  The lemon ricotta pancakes are the best I've ever had!  Definitely coming back here!

excerpts: The lemon ricotta pancakes are still stuck in my mind six months later as are the, "... the best crispy potatoes I've ever had.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Justin S.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
How could I have forgotten this review? 

Go here now!

The lemon ricotta pancakes are still stuck in my mind six months later as are the, "... the best crispy potatoes I've ever had." They are amazing.

Also coffee in line while you wait, is an excellent idea.

excerpts: I ordered the Plow, which came with 2 eggs, choice of Nueske bacon, house made pork sausage, or chicken apple sausage, 2 of their famous lemon ricotta pancakes, and crispy potatoes.
I chose the pork sausage.
The portions were just right.
My 2 eggs were nicely formed in a circle that they must have used a circle mold.
The pork sausage were basically patties, but they were really tasty.
You can taste the fennel with a little spice.
The best part was the lemon ricotta pancakes.
They were EXCELLENT!!
It just melted in my mouth; very moist.
With just a little bit of syrup, it's like dessert.
I had seen Yelp reviews about them and they were right!
You HAVE to try these!
Potatoes were nice and crispy.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Erica S.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
My friend picked this place for a recent brunch.  It was a 45 minute wait, but it was DEFINITELY worth it!  They don't accept reservations so you either have to wait or eat elsewhere.  Seems they're only open for brunch/lunch, no dinner.  

The interior is nice and clean.  Service is pretty friendly although I was slightly bothered when our female server decided to take my guy friend and my husband's order before mine.  What happened to ladies first?!

Started off with coffee and their fried doughnut holes.  One order came with 3.  They were good, but nothing too special.  Let them cool before you munch on them.  

I ordered the Plow, which came with 2 eggs, choice of Nueske bacon, house made pork sausage, or chicken apple sausage, 2 of their famous lemon ricotta pancakes, and crispy potatoes.  I chose the pork sausage.  The portions were just right.  My 2 eggs were nicely formed in a circle that they must have used a circle mold.  The pork sausage were basically patties, but they were really tasty.  You can taste the fennel with a little spice.  The best part was the lemon ricotta pancakes.  They were EXCELLENT!!  It just melted in my mouth; very moist.  With just a little bit of syrup, it's like dessert.  I had seen Yelp reviews about them and they were right!  You HAVE to try these!  Potatoes were nice and crispy.  Everything was so good, I finished my whole plate!

My husband had the Short Rib Hash and that was tasty as well.  Have to come back again!!!  Thanks, Richard for taking us here!

excerpts: The lemon ricotta pancakes are to die for!
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Annie L.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Plow is simply amazing. I'm never one to wait any amount of time for a restaurant, but I will wait for Plow...even if it was an hour + wait. -_- It's worth it. If it's your first time here, definitely get "The Plow". You can't go wrong with this. The lemon ricotta pancakes are to die for!  I've also had their dungeness crab scramble, which was also amazing.

Service is great. Even though this place is always packed, the employees here are super efficient. While you wait outside, you can always order your drinks/coffees first. Also, sit at the bar area so you can watch all the action.

excerpts: Every element comprising it from the lemon ricotta pancakes to the crispy potatoes to the bacon to the eggs are made to perfection.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Em F.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
The key is to either come 2 hours before you're hungry or between 8am-9am. Anytime after that and be prepared to make long conversation with your friend/voices in your head. 

I've somehow had brunch here 5 times even though I make it a point to try new places in the city and lines make me crotchety because it. is. just. that. good. That's about 10 hours of my life spent waiting in lines, and yet I have no regrets. The Plow is to die for. Every element comprising it from the lemon ricotta pancakes to the crispy potatoes to the bacon to the eggs are made to perfection. It's like sushi in a way - simple-looking but each component has been carefully prepared and a lot of care has been placed into each element, creating one amazing meal. 

Ditch your acquaintances because this place is rather small, and it will elongate your wait time.

excerpts: I tried some of the lemon ricotta pancakes that came on The Plow, and they were deeelish.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Miss H.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
I haven't been to a good brunch place in a while AND I haven't written a Yelp review in a while... but Plow was so good that they broke both streaks!

They close at 2, and we got there at 2:05... and there was still a line... luckily, the host & hostess felt bad that we had trekked so far to go there and there were "only" 4 tables ahead of us, so they put us down anyway. We ate "brunch" at 2:30 - better late than never :)

I had the fried egg sandwich and opted to add sausage instead of bacon (even though they only list that you can add on bacon) and my friend got The Plow (which is pretty much your basic breakfast combo plate). We were both very, VERY happy with our choices. The fried egg was perfectly cooked with a still runny yolk and the crispy potatoes were SO GOOD. Usually, I think of potatoes as an extra filler and try to not get too full off of them so I can finish the main part of my dish, but they were super crispy and tasty so I couldn't help myself! I tried some of the lemon ricotta pancakes that came on The Plow, and they were deeelish. I normally don't like ricotta, but it added a nice texture to the pancakes and the lemon flavor was just right.

Next time I'm in the city for brunch, this is where you'll find me!

excerpts: The lemon ricotta pancakes are killer and the house made pork sausage is so interesting.
I'll definitely be back for more.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Andrea J.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: Amazing potatoes!! Wear a jacket because you may have to wait awhile, but it's well worth it! The lemon ricotta pancakes are killer and the house made pork sausage is so interesting. I'll definitely be back for more.

excerpts: The potatoes are perfectly crispy, the lemon ricotta pancakes are just the right amount of lemony, the homemade pork sausages flavorful.
.the
only downside is ours no secret how good it is so there's always a line, when before it opens!
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Kat R.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: Plow is my favorite breakfast in SF. The potatoes are perfectly crispy, the lemon ricotta pancakes are just the right amount of lemony, the homemade pork sausages flavorful. .the only downside is ours no secret how good it is so there's always a line, when before it opens!

excerpts: For instance, they have lemon ricotta pancakes, super crispy (and well-seasoned) potatoes, and Equator coffee.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Sarah G.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Plow is such a cute little neighborhood spot. 

It's a great breakfast/brunch place that has a lot of familiar breakfast foods done a little bit better. For instance, they have lemon ricotta pancakes, super crispy (and well-seasoned) potatoes, and Equator coffee. Overall, the food was very well-executed here, and is delicious. 

I also enjoyed sitting at the bar during my meal. I was watching the cooking staff, and they were dancing and seemed really happy. Some were even saying thanks to the customers as they left. I definitely enjoyed this happy vibe. 

The only disclaimer is that this place is super busy, so be prepared to wait. Don't come starving (and expecting to eat as soon as you arrive). Otherwise, you'll be very unhappy to hear your wait time.

excerpts: I had the plow, which included lemon ricotta pancakes, eggs, potatoes, and bacon.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Katherine C.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
The rating isn't for the food. The food was great. I had the plow, which included lemon ricotta pancakes, eggs, potatoes, and bacon. My boyfriend had the eggs benedict, which he also enjoyed. 

When we first showed we were expecting to wait awhile. We arrived about 11am on a Saturday, and of course, there was a mob outside the restaurant. When we asked how the long the wait was, the girl said an hour and a half. We were about to leave when someone else came up to her and said it was more like 45 minutes. Well, we believed him, and we should have left because an hour and a half later they called our names. We got a table outside in the shade which was at an angle because of the hill. This made it very awkward for me to set down my mimosa glass. 

Food was yummy, but I won't be waiting an hour + again. I will always remember being hangry. Maybe if I'm ever free on a weekday?

excerpts: My favorites are the lemon ricotta pancakes and the crispy potatoes (included if you order "The Plow" or you can just order the pancakes by themselves).
Seriously, they are incredible.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Ashley K.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
A must.

One of my go-to spots for breakfast in the city. There will be a wait (typically longer than an hour on weekends). The wait will be worth it. Casual ambiance perfect for brunch on weekends. My favorites are the lemon ricotta pancakes and the crispy potatoes (included if you order "The Plow" or you can just order the pancakes by themselves). Seriously, they are incredible. Service is always friendly and prompt.

I'll be back. Early!

excerpts: A very long wait time of 90 minutes for a tasty set of lemon ricotta pancakes, perfectly seasoned country potatoes, light fluffy crab scrambled eggs, and my personal favorite: the fresh salmon and capers on toast...fantastic for the 2 of us.
Would we go back knowing this 90min wait is average?
Nope...
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Lauren N.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Not bad Plow, not bad. 

A very long wait time of 90 minutes for a tasty set of lemon ricotta pancakes, perfectly seasoned country potatoes, light fluffy crab scrambled eggs, and my personal favorite: the fresh salmon and capers on toast...fantastic for the 2 of us. Would we go back knowing this 90min wait is average? Nope...but we enjoyed our meal absolutely. 

I will say that the 2 female hostesses could've been much more personable, one slightly rude. You are the first impression customers get when eating at such a highly rated spot, I'd expect the quality of food to match the staff.

excerpts: The lemon ricotta pancakes were fluffy and not too sweet and balanced well with my hickory smoked bacon and eggs.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Joann A.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Husband and I hit up this place after reading the Conde Nast article on Plow, entitled "San Francisco's Best Brunch. It's Worth the Two Hour Wait." I think the title is a bit generous, I mean its a very good brunch and maybe worth a 15 to 30 minute wait, but 2 hours? Folks, this is not manna falling from the sky. 

We arrived exactly at 8:00 am on a Saturday, because any later you will be stuck in a line for at least 45 minutes. Service was great, providing fresh coffee and water as soon as we sat down. My husband got the steak and eggs and I ordered the Plow. Both were equally delicious, with the crispy potatoes being a highlight of the meal. The lemon ricotta pancakes were fluffy and not too sweet and balanced well with my hickory smoked bacon and eggs. All in all, our meal here was good, not the BEST, but I would definitely come here again, at 8:00am. 

Plow is like the Ariana Grande of SF brunches. People says she sounds like Mariah Carey, but when you hear her, she's good, but she ain't no Mariah Carey.

excerpts: The Lemon Ricotta pancakes (I'm wrong-
these are actually pretty disappointing- too much ricotta)
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Ritu K.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Plow you have broken me down. I'll admit it- I'm a fan. Partly thanks to my laziness and partly in large part to my love of brunch I kept returning to Plow hoping to find that magical brunch item that would make me love this place. And yes I've found it in the most unsuspecting item- Muesli. Yep I said muesli. I know that sounds boring and not fun (i.e. not fattening at all), but I love muesli and I especially love Plow's version. I order a almond flour pancake (yum) on the side so that I can pretend I'm enjoying a gluttonous breakfast, but the main attraction is the muesli.

I've tried 
The Plow (akin to a Denny's grand slam although perhaps a bit more refined). its kind of messy and I wish it was a little more refined for the price.
The Lemon Ricotta pancakes (I'm wrong- these are actually pretty disappointing- too much ricotta)
Two eggs (good when dressed up with ketchup and hot sauce- they're soft scrambled btw)
And the Plow version of bagel and lox (its toast with lox and pretty boring)..

So there you have it- I'm a fan but still avoid this place like a plague on the weekends. Definitely not worth an hour plus wait....

excerpts:
The menu comes with a variety of choices, with the most popular being a combo plate ($16) which included the lemon ricotta pancakes, eggs, fried potatoes and choice of sausage patties, bacon or chicken apple sausage.

While the potatoes were truly excellent, the eggs came off a little too runny, the sausage patty too lemony and the famed lemon ricotta pancakes had the excitement factor of mochi.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Pantera W.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Once a place gets mentioned as being among the best brunch places in SF, it becomes critic proof. 

And if a line forms shortly after opening, so much the better. It must be fantastic!

Being a badge collector and seeing as this place was voted number one brunch venue in SF, I thought it had to be worth a visit.

The parking was decent on a Thursday morning at 8am with no line in site. But walking up to the venue, you could see it was pretty full already.

The space itself is quite small, with a counter on the right and a selection of smallish tables on the left. Best tables are at the window, mostly so you don't get bumped by the waiters.

The chairs are metal, making them cold and hard, evoking memories of Moscow style canteens.

The menu comes with a variety of choices, with the most popular being a combo plate ($16) which included the lemon ricotta pancakes, eggs, fried potatoes and choice of sausage patties, bacon or chicken apple sausage.

While the potatoes were truly excellent, the eggs came off a little too runny, the sausage patty too lemony and the famed lemon ricotta pancakes had the excitement factor of mochi. 

The missus ordered sides of bacon and eggs for herself as she didn't want carbo action included. Which then came on two little side plates. Weird. The bacon was ok and had some name that nobody knows but looks interesting on the menu.


The coffee they serve here is truly excellent. 

Best brunch in SF? Will keep looking.

excerpts: I always get The Plow, which comes with eggs, your choice of meat, lemon ricotta pancakes, and crispy potatoes.
Though I'm not particularly a lemon or ricotta person, the lemon ricotta pancakes were SO GOOD!
I could eat them all day.
The pancakes are fluffy on the inside and delicately scented with lemon, mixed with the taste of ricotta.
I've also never had potatoes quite the same as I had at Plow, they were perfectly seasoned and just crispy enough.
I've tried the house sausage and the chicken-apple sausage here.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Joy C.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
This is my favorite brunch place in the city so far. The place is very cozy and small, resulting in a long wait, but it is worth it. The place has large windows and reminds me of a farmhouse, which definitely matches the food they serve there.

I always get The Plow, which comes with eggs, your choice of meat, lemon ricotta pancakes, and crispy potatoes. Though I'm not particularly a lemon or ricotta person, the lemon ricotta pancakes were SO GOOD! I could eat them all day. The pancakes are fluffy on the inside and delicately scented with lemon, mixed with the taste of ricotta. I've also never had potatoes quite the same as I had at Plow, they were perfectly seasoned and just crispy enough. I've tried the house sausage and the chicken-apple sausage here. Both were good, but definitely overshadowed by the pancakes and the potatoes.

Service here has always been friendly, but the staff are definitely busy. The food is simple yet heavenly. My only complaint is the wait, but it is definitely worth it.

excerpts: and I'll order the lemon ricotta pancakes again and hopefully whoever I go with will order something new : )
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Benny N.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Best brunch I've had all year!

Great little place. Even though this is hipster central, I didn't feel like my pants were too baggy, or my bike had too many speeds, or that my jacket wasn't vintage enough to be there. 

Basically everything I ate here, including off my friends plate was amazing!

How good was the lemon ricotta pancake? I literally started experimenting with pancake recipes the following weekend, and I never make pancakes! 

Sub 20 minute wait on a beautiful Sunday afternoon. 

I'll be back and I'll order the lemon ricotta pancakes again and hopefully whoever I go with will order something new : )

excerpts: The Plow with the two eggs, Nueske bacon, chicken apple sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes and potatoes was a total brunch that had everything you need and desire.
The bacon and sausage were good salty, sweet and meaty, while the pancakes definitely were the highlight.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: T L.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
(See pics) Review #1192. Great all local purveyors ingredients brunch that brightens up any gloomy day or energizes a sunny day.

The day we visited, they were out of monkey bread so we opted for corn millet muffin which was good.

The Plow with the two eggs, Nueske bacon, chicken apple sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes and potatoes was a total brunch that had everything you need and desire. The bacon and sausage were good salty, sweet and meaty, while the pancakes definitely were the highlight. Eggs were prepared perfectly to my likeness.

As mentioned many times in my other reviews, I love locally roasted beans. Equator coffee was earthy and was happily light roasted.

My friend had the fried egg on Acme bun that was hearty and freshly tasted.

Mimosa was nice but more orange juice than sparkling wine.

Many had wondered about the San Francisco style long wait and yes even on a rainy weekend we we visited. However, the server was extremely helpful and actually told us not to go get coffee up the street because there would be a table coming up shortly and if those who were not there while called, they would lose the spot. Amazing enough, we only waited for 10 minutes. While the place was completely packed, service was super friendly and perky, we were never rushed to finish, though we were considerate to not hold up the tables.

Do wish they were closer to public transit stops.

excerpts: We ordered the chia seed pudding, fried egg sandwich, lemon ricotta pancakes, and the eggs Benedict with salmon, and it was all delicious!
Definitely going there again when I visit SF.
The wait could be anywhere from an hour to two but completely worth it
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Karan G.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: We ordered the chia seed pudding, fried egg sandwich, lemon ricotta pancakes, and the eggs Benedict with salmon, and it was all delicious! Definitely going there again when I visit SF. The wait could be anywhere from an hour to two but completely worth it

excerpts: I am in love with their lemon ricotta pancakes and potatoes!
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Shirley N.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: My first brunch spot in SF and I am very happy i chose Plow! A little pricey but it's a given when you're dining in SF. I made sure my bf and i made the first wave of people for their 8am breakfast but unfortunately we arrived at 8:10am and they already had a 45 min wait. What the heck! lol That clearly meant this place is amazingly delicious and i couldn't wait to try it! :D We sipped on their complimentary coffee while sitting on some cute benches on the side of the building. I was ready to eat and placed my order as soon as i sat down =P I ordered "The Plow" which was a little bit of everything! I am in love with their lemon ricotta pancakes and potatoes! I am a fan of sweet and salty so "The plow" was a great combination of everything. My bf ordered the fried egg sandwich. This place was packed with flavor and if you love runny eggs like my bf, this is a great dish! Love this place.

excerpts: My boyfriend is in love with the lemon ricotta pancakes, they taste like cake.
I think they smell better than they taste
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Alexandra C.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
My favorite breakfast in san francisco!
Fried egg sandwich YUM add avocado YUM

My boyfriend is in love with the lemon ricotta pancakes, they taste like cake. I think they smell better than they taste but i'm not a huge fan of dough.

The wait here can be SO ridiculous, I try to come on weekdays around 10 when less people are usually in line. Even though Plow on the weekend is like a total dream come true. 

The crispy potatoes are SO crispy and have crunchy carmalized onions mixed in with them...sooo good! I'm not even a huge fan of potatoes and I eat some.

excerpts: They had me at "plow," the signature dish of this fine establishment: a decadent and solid combo of eggs (any style), bacon/sausage, fried potatoes, and 2 lemon ricotta pancakes.
Hellooooo nurse!!

I can only hope that the rest of the patrons were making fun of the way I was dressed, given that a) I was wearing a horrific suit, and b) I'd been all judge-y and deserved as much - but I didn't care.
The bacon was crisp, the eggs perfectly cooked, the potatoes crunchy and well-seasoned, and the pancakes were among the best I've ever had.
Perfectly sweet and substantive, not too heavy, lovely and lemon-y.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Ray J.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
I was warned when I first arrived in Potrero Hill that a lot of the people in the neighborhood were "visitors," and that if they looked hip or trendy, they were probably heading to Plow. Because people actually dress up to come here. 

I therefore avoided this restaurant. 

UNTIL!!! I'm 13 days and 15 interviews into my trip, and have just completed my final interview after a grueling commute. It's mid-afternoon, and I haven't eaten breakfast or lunch. I'm tired, I'm hungry, I'm grouchy, and my host isn't answering his phone (or his buzzer). HALP! I'm stranded on a hill in Potrero Hill without a pair of sneakers!!! 

So I slouched over to Plow, which, amazingly, didn't have the standard line out the door, and peeked at the menu. And immediately started salivating.

They had me at "plow," the signature dish of this fine establishment: a decadent and solid combo of eggs (any style), bacon/sausage, fried potatoes, and 2 lemon ricotta pancakes. Hellooooo nurse!! I can only hope that the rest of the patrons were making fun of the way I was dressed, given that a) I was wearing a horrific suit, and b) I'd been all judge-y and deserved as much - but I didn't care. The bacon was crisp, the eggs perfectly cooked, the potatoes crunchy and well-seasoned, and the pancakes were among the best I've ever had. Perfectly sweet and substantive, not too heavy, lovely and lemon-y. I savored them until the last bite.

At the end of the day, it's back to the lesson most of us learned long ago: if there's a line out the door, the food is probably worth the wait.

excerpts: Beautiful and tasty food -- go ahead and get those lemon ricotta pancakes and the pork sausage patty shaped like an overstuffed slider.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Andrew S.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: Awesome breakfast and ambiance. Beautiful and tasty food -- go ahead and get those lemon ricotta pancakes and the pork sausage patty shaped like an overstuffed slider.

excerpts: And yes, if you haven't already heard, the lemon ricotta pancakes are the bomb.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Ryan L.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: A small modern rustic restaurant that serves a solid American breakfast. The food is fantastic and the mimosas were spot on. Yeah, dropping $20+ for brunch shouldn't be a surprise, make it $30 if you want a few mimosas in you. Came with a party of five and waited like 40 minutes which wasn't too bad. I ordered the plow, of the meat choices I'd recommend the chicken apple sausage then the pork patties - the bacon is just bacon. And yes, if you haven't already heard, the lemon ricotta pancakes are the bomb.

excerpts: And while the French toast was just okay, the lemon ricotta pancakes that came with the Plow were easily the best part of the meal - light on both the lemon and ricotta, they reminded me somewhat of fluffy lemon cream cookies.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Johnny W.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
A bit of clarification first - Plow is indeed not wheelchair accessible, as there are a few steps up into the restaurant. However! They have outdoor seating on nice days, and that IS accessible, albeit requiring that one deal with the slight incline of the hill on which Plow sits.

Showing up around 9am last Saturday, my friend and I were eventually seated after a ~45 minute wait. Part of this was due to having to wait for an outdoor seat though - had that not been necessary, our wait would have been about 15 minutes shorter. After perusing a fairly succinct menu, we ended up ordering the Plow, Dungeness crab scramble [ http://flic.kr/p/c2HfrY ], and an order of French toast to go.

The crab scramble wasn't bad, and most enjoyable when the scramble was eaten along with the accompanying toast. I was slightly turned off by how fishy the dish was though - while it WAS seafood, the taste was far stronger than one would expect of fresh seafood. The crispy potatoes that came as a side of that dish were pretty good though, albeit a bit too salty for my tastes. And while the French toast was just okay, the lemon ricotta pancakes that came with the Plow were easily the best part of the meal - light on both the lemon and ricotta, they reminded me somewhat of fluffy lemon cream cookies.

After all is said and done, with tax and tip, expect the meal to come out to about $20 a person for a single entree. Service is friendly, and while I suppose the local ingredient sourcing is a nice touch, it's never been a make or break factor for me. While I can see myself coming again solely for the pancakes, I doubt it'll be particularly often, or during their busier hours.

excerpts: I had the plow and ordered a extra side of chicken apple sausage, my scrambled eggs were runny and the lemon ricotta pancakes weren't as good as people said they are.
I tried my friend's crab scramble but that was just okay too.
Their bacon is nice and smoky though, I think that was the only thing I enjoyed.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Jenny Y.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
I was excited to try a new breakfast joint and when I came on a Friday around 1030am there was already a line. The wait was only about 20 minutes but I feel like the food is just typical. Nothing really stood out. I had the plow and ordered a extra side of chicken apple sausage, my scrambled eggs were runny and the lemon ricotta pancakes weren't as good as people said they are. I tried my friend's crab scramble but that was just okay too. Their bacon is nice and smoky though, I think that was the only thing I enjoyed. Besides their quick refills of coffee.

It's nice that they have seating outside, and also benches where you can wait outside but I suggest you go across the street in the sun to wait because they're situated in a shaded area.

Yay for glass cola bottles!

excerpts: I dragged my husband here, fresh off a flight, with the promise that I read about their gluten free, lemon ricotta pancakes.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Andrea M.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
I dragged my husband here, fresh off a flight, with the promise that I read about their gluten free, lemon ricotta pancakes. Alas, those do not exist, so I jumped on the almond flour pancake option, while my husband ordered the breakfast sandwich.

The breakfast sandwich, according to my husband, was amazing. Such perfectly runny eggs, lovely bread, and oh the potatoes! He couldn't stop raving about the best potatoes he had ever tasted.

Sadly, he had to look across the table at me. While I was in love with my iced chai, my pancakes were a sad surprise. I took it to mean a lot about the service at Plow when the plate of pancakes was put in front of me, burnt. I was starving, and the wait was long for food, so I dug in. I ended up peeling back the overly burnt portions and trying to salvage some breakfast. Unfortunately, the waitress wasn't by early enough for me to send the meal back, but again, if they put it in front of me that way, then obviously they think burnt pancakes are acceptable. The only saving grace of the plate was the syrup, which I literally drank from my spoon, in order to remove the burnt flavor from my mouth.

Should I have made more of an effort to seek out assistance and get new pancakes? Probably. But there has to be something said about a restaurant that lets obviously burnt food go out to a patron. 

For all the hype, maybe my husband's meal was worth it, but mine certainly wasn't.

excerpts: They are known for their lemon ricotta pancakes which I think they were just alright (BLD in LA is so much better).
There's a lot of brunch places around the city, so I will probably not go back here.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Andrew J.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: I think this place is pretty overrated.  We waited more than 1.5 hours on a Saturday morning.  Their food is really standard that you can pretty much find any other breakfast places.  There's nothing really special about their food.  They are known for their lemon ricotta pancakes which I think they were just alright (BLD in LA is so much better).  There's a lot of brunch places around the city, so I will probably not go back here.

excerpts: True to form, I loved the lemon ricotta pancakes and finished my entire bowl of chia seed pudding.
(Don't knock it until you try it!)
My boyfriend and I waited for about an hour on a Saturday afternoon - not bad, with sunny weather and other people to talk to.
Just make sure you keep track of where you are on the list and stay within earshot of the host.
I wish I was hungry enough to order one of the larger breakfast plates with eggs and potatoes.
Just another reason to go back!
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Auburn S.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: Charming, popular brunch spot in Potrero Hill. True to form, I loved the lemon ricotta pancakes and finished my entire bowl of chia seed pudding. (Don't knock it until you try it!) My boyfriend and I waited for about an hour on a Saturday afternoon - not bad, with sunny weather and other people to talk to. Just make sure you keep track of where you are on the list and stay within earshot of the host. I wish I was hungry enough to order one of the larger breakfast plates with eggs and potatoes. Just another reason to go back!

excerpts: The lemon ricotta pancakes were a delicious treat for my tastebuds.
It reminded me of a fluffy lemon bar, but only the custard part.
The homemade sausage patties were a bit dry.
The table next to us ordered the same thing but with bacon
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Michelle W.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
I came here on a Tuesday morning at 830am and there was a 30 minute wait. Yes a 30 minute wait on a Tuesday morning! My friend had warned me of the popularity of this place, but I was still surprised to see so many people waiting around. 

When we finally sat down, we quickly told our server our order and our meals came out soon after. We ordered The Plow, because why wouldn't you order the dish that's named after the restaurant? 

The lemon ricotta pancakes were a delicious treat for my tastebuds. It reminded me of a fluffy lemon bar, but only the custard part. The homemade sausage patties were a bit dry. The table next to us ordered the same thing but with bacon and I was drooling from second hand aromas. 

In conclusion, I'd go back if they accepted reservations or if friends were visiting but not on another weekday whim.

excerpts: The service was great, the food was great--the 3 of us split an order of lemon ricotta pancakes, and then we got the prosciutto sandwich, the fried egg sandwich, and the cold-smoked salmon toast.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Sharon L.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
It's my last weekend in the city! And all my co-workers raved about Plow, so I figured that it was as good a time as any to give it a chance. There was still a 1-hour wait at 1pm (seriously), but the hostess told us that we would be guaranteed seating if we came back at 1:50-ish, if we weren't seated before that. So we went to Farley's on the next block for banana bread and coffee, and came back around 1:30. We got seated around 1:45.

The service was great, the food was great--the 3 of us split an order of lemon ricotta pancakes, and then we got the prosciutto sandwich, the fried egg sandwich, and the cold-smoked salmon toast. All three of us also really loved the ambiance and the lighting in the restaurant.

I love smoked salmon. And this was some really good stuff. I would've loved some avocado to go with the toast rather than the weird cream cheese, but it was still pretty good. My friend's egg sandwich definitely needed a little more oomph, but she also didn't get the bacon or avocado add-ons--adding some bacon to it would've done the trick. The pancakes were fabulous. We went to MyMy's last weekend and got the lemon ricotta souffle pancakes, and while Plow does not have souffle pancakes, there was a stronger lemon flavor to their recipe, which I preferred over MyMy's.

If you have good company willing to wait with you, coming here is great. Street parking is super easy too if you're willing to walk a block or two--an added bonus!

excerpts: For main entrees, I shared the lemon ricotta pancakes (clear winner on the table!)
and the fried egg sandwich.
Do not go to this place without ordering the lemon ricotta pancakes!
They are thick, heavy, moist, and filling,
but oh so good!!
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Mansi A.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Our group of four arrived at Plow at 10am for Sunday brunch obviously expecting a waiting time based on other Yelp reviews. We were told it would be about 40-45 mins -- not so bad. After an hour wait, we were finally seated...outdoors on a slightly chilly day (not ideal, but hey, a table is a table).

We ordered the small order of french toast brioche to get started, since we were starving! Easily cut into four pieces, it was a fab start to the meal.

The huevos rancheros and monkey bread were sold out by the time we were seated. What!? On to plan B...

For main entrees, I shared the lemon ricotta pancakes (clear winner on the table!) and the fried egg sandwich. Do not go to this place without ordering the lemon ricotta pancakes! They are thick, heavy, moist, and filling, but oh so good!! The lemon flavor is very prominent and just a wonderful way to begin the day with some coffee.

The fried egg sandwich was a bit of a disappointment. While the Acme bread on which it was served was pretty delicious, the sandwich really only consisted of egg, cheese and frissee. Lacking in salt, it also ended up lacking in flavor. Definitely an item you can skip.

Overall, brunch at Plow was fairly good. However, for an hour long wait, there are many other great places with shorter wait times.

Note: Plow only takes max party size of 6. It's a pretty tiny spot!

excerpts: Lemon ricotta pancakes and house made sausage from Plow will make you abuse your body.
When it begs you to stop, your fork hand acts on its own and pleases the pallet with bite after bite of fluffy sweet or perfectly textured salty.
Smoked Bacon, 10.
The 90 minute wait is worth every second, but the food WILL ruin breakfast for you from any other chef for the rest of you life.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Aaron K.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
I rarely post and when I do it is because something is exceptionally good or exceptionally bad. The food at Plow is in a different realm from most restaurants. Like other bay area Panis and Larders, Plow takes the simple classics (of breakfast food) and perfects them. And also, like other bay area Panis and Larders, the cooks at Plow are on top of their game. They can poach an egg almost as good as Chef at Bouletts Larder. 
Lemon ricotta pancakes and house made sausage from Plow will make you abuse your body. When it begs you to stop, your fork hand acts on its own and pleases the pallet with bite after bite of fluffy sweet or perfectly textured salty.
Smoked Bacon, 10.
The 90 minute wait is worth every second, but the food WILL ruin breakfast for you from any other chef for the rest of you life.

excerpts: "So, I was like, ohmygod, the lemon ricotta pancakes!
" kind of reviews.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: tout le monde a.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Great tastes. Fine service. Questionable food handling techniques. 

In case you haven't already guessed, this is not another "So, I was like, ohmygod, the lemon ricotta pancakes!" kind of reviews. There are plenty of those already. 

On my last visit, instead of sitting at a table, I sat at the counter. I was able to observe the food preparation in great detail.

Unfortunately, I observed a lot of things which, once seen, can't be unseen.

Workers continuously alternated between touching surfaces of the kitchen and then raw food.  Some of the food was later cooked, which was a relief. However, some of the food was smoked fish, garnishes, or and salad greens, scooped by hand and placed on a plate.

I observed a kitchen worker blow his nose, and continue working without washing his hands. Another sneezed, and served food off the stove using his hand. Another lifted his shirt and scratched his bare skin. Then he touched food. 

I never saw gloves used the kitchen area. That in itself is not a problem. Gloves usually lend a false sense of security, because they are not changed each time they come into contact with food. Often, workers touch all of the same contaminated surfaces with gloves, and then go on to touch food, then go back to touching equipment. An employee would have to go through thousands of glove changes each shift, for gloves to be effective.

The only way to avoid cross-contamination is to wash hands first, do only one type of food preparation, followed by another good hand washing. However, in such a small place, the workers are constantly alternating between touching all of the kitchen surfaces, and touching food. 

I'm knocking off only two points, even though this is a potential life-threatening food safety issue. I'm being realistic, since I think almost all restaurants do the same thing. However, in most cases, the customer doesn't see it.

If you sit at the counter, take a look at the workers, and see if you don't notice the same thing. Even if you're sitting at a table, as you walk by, see how much of this you can observe. And if you ever get food poisoning after eating there, think about what I've said. 

I love this restaurant. I want them to do well, and I want to come back many times. I do hope that on some future visits, I notice some major changes.  If not, I'll be calling the health department.

excerpts: ULTIMATE PLOW $15 (which is lovely, as you get a little bit of everything, esp those crunchy potatoes and deeeeelectable lemon ricotta pancakes, sweet and savory OR savory with dessert!!)
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Angela W.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
PLOOWWW ON DOWN, LIKE TAHHHH DOWW!!! Like, uhhh now.

ULTIMATE PLOW $15 (which is lovely, as you get a little bit of everything, esp those crunchy potatoes and deeeeelectable lemon ricotta pancakes, sweet and savory OR savory with dessert!!):

- 2 eggs (served however you'd like)-I got mine sunny side up and they were perfectly cooked, ooey gooey in the middle
-so crispy crispity potatoes- did I mention these are CRISPY? It's like they triple fry em.
-a meat of your choice (chicken apple sausage, Nueske bacon, homemade pork sausage)-I got 2 sized chicken apple sausages, yum.
-2 lemony cricket ricotta pancakes- fresh, lemony, pillowy, light, lovely pancakes, you can definitely taste the lemon and the ricotta.

-1 star as this place is a little pretentious. Hosts were somewhat snobby and had their noses all up in the air like it was the freaking Catalina wine mixer. Gee whiz, it seemed like such a privilege just to be put on the wait list. 

HOT TIP!!:
GO @ 1:40ishPM on a Sunday afternoon. (just not on a day when I'M trying to go..) This way you can take it easy, have a lazy sunday, sleep in, get it "in", do ya thang, whatevs, and still make it to brunch. Most likely, and you will not have to wait a ridiculous amount of time. Luckily for us, we were able to get our name on the list, grabbed coffee at Farleys, and returned right back to have our name called in 5 mins!! *When they say, don't stray too far away, they mean it. A couple of dudes doing bromantic brunch together didn't get back in time and had their table given away but STILL waited another 30 mins!

Can't wait to get plowed again!!

excerpts: Get the super crispy breakfast potatoes & fluffy lemon ricotta pancakes.
My fiance got some sort of breakfast sandwich, which he seemed to enjoy as well.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Shreya O.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
The wait is usually ridiculous, so I was nervous to try this place. But we once came around 1pm on a Saturday and lucked out - we only had to wait 15 minutes. 

Get the super crispy breakfast potatoes & fluffy lemon ricotta pancakes. My fiance got some sort of breakfast sandwich, which he seemed to enjoy as well. The french toast was just okay, so I'd skip that. 

I'd definitely come back here, but just not on a Sunday.

excerpts: My favorite dish is "The Plow", it comes with lemon ricotta pancakes, eggs, potatoes and Chicken apple sausage.
One word, heaven.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Laura F.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: Plow is probably my favorite breakfast spot in San Francisco. Yes, it's small and yes, you will have to wait to be seated unless you're literally there when they open however, the wait is definitely worth it. Plus, they offer a cup of coffee while you wait which is nice since it tends to be cold in SF. My favorite dish is "The Plow", it comes with lemon ricotta pancakes, eggs, potatoes and Chicken apple sausage. One word, heaven.

excerpts: The three of us ordered the "Plow" with house made pork sausages, an extra order of pork sausages, and a full order of lemon ricotta pancakes.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Michelle K.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
FINALLY went to Plow on a Sunday for brunch. Arrived around 10am and was told the wait will be 2-2.5hrs. Yikes. 

My friends and I walked over to Front Coffee to kill time and came back to Plow after about an hour. We waited another half an hour and were seated. 

The three of us ordered the "Plow" with house made pork sausages, an extra order of pork sausages, and a full order of lemon ricotta pancakes. My favorite part of the meal  were the crispy potatoes which were perfectly seasoned. I was underwhelmed by the pancakes :-\ I liked the lemon flavor, but it tasted a bit bland so I had to drown it in syrup. The texture was too gooey. The soft scrambled eggs were unmemorable and needed a lot of salt. The homemade pork sausages were good -- they had a bit of heat, which I appreciated. The cold brewed coffee was yummy. 

I probably won't be back any time soon given the underwhelming food and the unreasonable wait time.

excerpts: good and lemon ricotta pancakes are the bomb.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Mckenna T.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: Amazing food!! But wait was super long.. and it is because of their limited space. I really wish this restaurant was bigger so we do not have to wait 2 hours to sit down.. a little upsetting. But when we waited they ask if you want coffee and when we sat we were given blankets and water. Food was soo good and lemon ricotta pancakes are the bomb.

excerpts: My husband got The Plow, which is a combo of lemon ricotta pancakes, bacon or sausage, eggs, and crispy potatoes.
This is a good dish to order if you are new to Plow and want to sample different items.
I like the lemon ricotta pancakes and crispy potatoes a lot.
I like the lemon ricotta pancakes and crispy potatoes a lot.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Ally W.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Plow is a great place for breakfast...as evidenced by the long line of people waiting outside even at ridiculous times like 8 AM on a Saturday morning.  What a bunch of crazies -- Saturdays are for sleeping in.

I got their French Toast - 3 thick and fluffy eggy bread slices with strawberry and lavender jam, mascarpone, and maple syrup. I have more of a savory tooth for brunch, but enjoyed this sweet dish a lot.

My husband got The Plow, which is a combo of lemon ricotta pancakes, bacon or sausage, eggs, and crispy potatoes. This is a good dish to order if you are new to Plow and want to sample different items.  However, his eggs were undercooked (to the point that the egg whites were slightly runny) and his chicken apple sausage was dry (it was seasoned well though).

I like the lemon ricotta pancakes and crispy potatoes a lot.  I may even want to make them at home, you know, at like 11 AM on a Saturday morning.

1 star off: I do not like dried sausage in my mouth. Get your mind out of the gutter. Read my review above.

excerpts: I'd rather drive all the way to Sonoma Mission in for the Lemon Ricotta Pancakes than to come here again.
So disappointed.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: amber c.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: Food is great here but this is the second time this has happened to my husband and I. We really tried to give it another chance. I give it 1 star for making my family and I feel profiled and treated a certain way because of the way we look. It may not have been the case but it sure felt like it. Either it's that, or people who live in the neighborhood get preferential treatment. We got there and were quoted 20 minutes. Everything seemed okay until people who started arriving started to get seated before us. A good 4 parties. We are patient people but my husband decided to check on the wait and he noticed that the sign in sheet had been completely rewritten and he was told, "your table should be coming up". Outside there were 2 empty tables that could have easily been placed together, but then they seated another 2 parties who, of course, came after us. When finally my husband said we were leaving because we were obviously being skipped the hostess Jess, offered no apology and said, "This is a restaurant and how it works, this is how our tables are set up." Insinuating that she was not able to put two tables together outside when I have seen it done the last time we ate there. Her tone was very snotty and rude. She ended saying, "I don't know what I could've done differently really" all while rolling her eyes.  I have lived in SF all my life and I can't believe what this city has turned to, my husband and I both may look young but be have respectable jobs. We have both worked in costumer service and by the way she answered it was obvious she was young and did not know the definition of it. We didn't get upset we just walked away. Never coming back. I'd rather drive all the way to Sonoma Mission in for the Lemon Ricotta Pancakes than to come here again. So disappointed.

excerpts: The lemon ricotta pancakes are amazing here!
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Archana Nadig K.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:

I recommend getting here early because the wait can be awful! That's my only complaint. Definitely worth it though!

lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Came on a Wednesday morning, arrived somewhere around 930am. No wait, although it was packed. Think the people out front waiting were waiting for outdoor seating, but since it was a heat wave in sf I was more than happy to sit inside. 
Ordered the plow with eggs over medium. Comes with 2 eggs (however you like), a pile of the best crispy potatoes ever, 2 strips of bacon (or you can order some sort of sausage) and 2 small lemon ricotta pancakes, which were to die for. Also ordered one of their homemade biscuits on the side, cause they look so scrumptious. Uhhh, it was divine. Came with some sweet whipped butter. 
Added a mimosa to all this. 
Jealous?

excerpts: the 3 other people in my group got the Plow which includes eggs, fried potatoes, choice of meats (everyone went for sausage) and lemon ricotta pancakes.
The pancakes are insanely good and could rival my favorite (Luluc in Brooklyn) and how can you go wrong with fried potatoes!
Highly recommend and can't wait to go back.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Jonathan H.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Probably 4.5 stars, but have to give them the 5 for atmosphere and food. Okay, so we are huge fans of Dotties, and pretty much go there every day when in SF, but Dotties is closed on Wednedays (and as it turned out this trip Thursday too) so my brother in law (who lives in SF) recommended Plow.  It was a typical cool foggy day downtown, but was super sunny at Plow and wait was less than 10 minutes.
Coffee is fantastic (although they seem to only fill halfway each time). I ordered the corn beef hash was nice and light and very healthy tasting and the 3 other people in my group got the Plow which includes eggs, fried potatoes, choice of meats (everyone went for sausage) and lemon ricotta pancakes.  The pancakes are insanely good and could rival my favorite (Luluc in Brooklyn) and how can you go wrong with fried potatoes!
Highly recommend and can't wait to go back.

excerpts: The bacon and potatoes were cooked perfectly and the lemon ricotta pancakes were a nice delicate compliment to the rest of the meal.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: sara r.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
A follow a photographer on Instagram and she frequently posted pictures from this place so I knew I had to try it the next time I was in town. Went with a few friends and we all ordered the Plow. Everything on this plate was delicious. The bacon and potatoes were cooked perfectly and the lemon ricotta pancakes were a nice delicate compliment to the rest of the meal. Definitely a healthy portion of food so come hungry. 

The atmosphere is nice but the place is on the smaller side, so don't come too hungry cause you'll probably need to wait a little bit before being seated. But it's worth it.

excerpts:

* bacon, well, how can you go wrong there? 
* homemade sausage patties, you were a little short on the flavor.
