lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Vicky L.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
another yummy place that I would never have gone to because it's so out of the way from everything, but my friend insisted. We put our name down, and drove off to go get ice cream, and came back just as they called out name. :) great timing! 

I shared the plow plate, with a side of bacon and fruit. 
* lemon ricotta pancakes, you make me swoon with pleasure. 
* bacon, well, how can you go wrong there? 
* homemade sausage patties, you were a little short on the flavor. 
* fruit bowl: you are the pick me up that I was looking for. blood oranges, tangerines, some other non-melon fruit... glad to see you weren't honeydew, cantaloupe and watermelon. 

I want to be your neighbor.

excerpts: The wife and I had 'The Plow' which they were happy to swap out the lemon ricotta pancakes.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Deniz U.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
This was, hands down, the best brunch I've ever had in San Francisco. 
We did have a bit of a wait and after coming to check back in at the time we were told, it did get my blood a little heated up that we were passed over several minutes before and ended up having to wait another 15 minutes while they rotated through some other parties that were on the list after us, but . . . . the brunch we had did more than I could ever hope to lift our moods. 
The wife and I had 'The Plow' which they were happy to swap out the lemon ricotta pancakes. My brother raved about those but the almond flour pancakes were AMAZING too. Luckily I forgot to ask them to hold the potatoes because the potatoes were nearly worth the trip on their own. Beautifully tender on the inside and the loveliest, crunchy outside I have ever experienced. The bacon was was absolute perfection too. 

I can't think of a single thing I would change. You can count on us waiting patiently outside at least twice a month. 

Bravo Plow!!!

excerpts: Can't believe how good the lemon ricotta pancakes are.
The rest of the food is fine, but pancakes are by far the best.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Oli J.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: Can't believe how good the lemon ricotta pancakes are. The rest of the food is fine, but pancakes are by far the best.

excerpts: eggs (poached was great), the meats, and of course the Lemon Ricotta Pancakes.
I'm not a big fan of pancakes but these were fantastic.
Great atmosphere and service as well.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Mert S.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: Overall a great experience. Almost full even on weekdays. Get 'the plow' to experience their best stuff: potatoes, eggs (poached was great), the meats, and of course the Lemon Ricotta Pancakes. I'm not a big fan of pancakes but these were fantastic. Great atmosphere and service as well.

excerpts: The lemon ricotta pancakes were amazing.
Sausage was a-ok.
Eggs were great.
Service was fast & attentive.
Couldn't quite convince myself if the whole package was worth that long of a wait for 2 people only.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Tina B.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: 45+ minute wait for 2 on a saturday morning 9am. We both got 'the plow'. The lemon ricotta pancakes were amazing. Sausage was a-ok. Eggs were great. Service was fast & attentive. Couldn't quite convince myself if the whole package was worth that long of a wait for 2 people only.

excerpts: i never eat pancakes but the lemon ricotta pancakes were great but with pork sausage and fried eggs?
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Bill W.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
I read the Yelp Reviews. I'm a breakfast aficionado. I was intrigued.

About Timing: I read about long lines so I arrived at 8am on Sunday and about a dozen people waiting so I sat right down when they opened. By 8:30 it was almost full but still no wait.

I love going out for breakfast but I can prepare a better breakfast at home than I find in most restaurants. This is my breakfast dilemma. So when I read the reviews, I hoped that the food and great space would make it all worth while.

The space is impressive, clean, well-run and organized.

i ordered "the Plow". Each part of it was good but as a combination, i wasn't impressed. Runny, fried eggs without bread? I loved the crispy potatoes but they were not ideal for sopping up eggs. The ricotta pancakes were great. The pork sausage was good but putting these items together on a plate didn't do it for me. i never eat pancakes but the lemon ricotta pancakes were great but with pork sausage and fried eggs? The price was $20 before the tip.

Over-all: Plow experience is more like a rushed lunch at a hot new restaurant than the perfect breakfast in which one puts ones thoughts together for the day. Apparently from the reviews, Plow is popular and people were strategizing what to get before it opened at 8am on a Sunday. 

Personally, I prefer a leisurely breakfast where i take my time; enjoy browsing the paper in sunny comfort, breaking into caffeine induced philosophical discussions now and then. 

I recommend trying Plow but for my taste, as a breakfast experience, it may be a victim of it's own success.

excerpts: I ordered the Plow,  which included two eggs any style, two lemon ricotta pancakes, crispy potato & house made pork or chicken apple sausage.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: En J.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
They don't take reservations so our wait time was almost an hour. By the time it was our turn to eat, they ran out of the Monkey bread. Bummer!!

I ordered the Plow,  which included two eggs any style, two lemon ricotta pancakes, crispy potato & house made pork or chicken apple sausage. The Lemon Ricotta pancake was simply the best, just cant be missed. 

The servers are friendly and accommodating. If you are a dog lover then this is a perfect spot to hang out with your canine while brunching.

excerpts: The Plow consisted of two eggs (over easy), house made sausage patties, crispy potatoes and two lemon ricotta pancakes.
The patty was good, and the pancake was delish!
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Leslie P.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Their crispy potatoes are addicting! So flavourful... savory, and naturally sweet. They are super crispy... I love them!

My sister and I shared the The Plow and the French toast with red wine poached pears. The French toast was okay. It was nothing special, and was actually lacking a little oomph. The Plow consisted of two eggs (over easy), house made sausage patties, crispy potatoes and two lemon ricotta pancakes. The patty was good, and the pancake was delish!

excerpts: Most reviews talk about the Lemon Ricotta pancakes (which I had) and the Breakfast Sandwich (which my boo ordered) and it's mainly because there isn't much else on the menu.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Brandon K.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
This place is two blocks from my house and I've been meaning to go for some time but the line is forever. Like, over an hour and I really don't believe any place is worth that, even if it's excellent, especially when there are so many other good choices in the city. Not their fault though: there isn't a lot of seating inside the tiny space and they use it the best they can.

If you can come back on an off-hour (I went at 12pm on a Wednesday and got the last two seats at the counter), it's very good.

Most reviews talk about the Lemon Ricotta pancakes (which I had) and the Breakfast Sandwich (which my boo ordered) and it's mainly because there isn't much else on the menu. Unless you like to order granola or porridge or yogurt for breakfast, which has never made sense to me as a restaurant patron, there's some combination of pancakes and eggs.

The good news is that they're both excellent! And those crispy potatoes are great.

I'm giving them the fifth star for two reasons:

1) They have Nueske's Bacon, which is probably my favorite stuff on the market.

2) They have a hot sauce brand I've never heard of and is made in the same zip code. I'm always so annoyed when I ask for hot sauce at a place and I get either Tapatio or Cholula, as both are unappealing to me. It's a bit of a surprise that more places don't make their own hot sauce as it's not too difficult and it's a nice touch. And the stuff at Plow? Not too watery and a great kick. Much better than the over the counter crap.

excerpts: I had the "plow" with lemon ricotta pancakes, house-made pork sausage, 2 eggs over easy (which frankly were a little underdone, but note they still get 5 stars) and the AMAZING crispy potatoes.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Amy W.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
WARNING BOLD STATEMENT AHEAD:

This is the BEST brunch in San Francisco!  

I'll admit it, when it comes to mornings and me, we just don't get along.  Luckily I had returned from Massachusetts the night before AND the time changed in my direction, so I was actually awake and ready to go somewhere at 8am on a Sunday!  (according to most yelpers this place usually has a wait for brunch, and I'm an inpatient gal when it comes to gettin' my grub on)

I had the "plow" with lemon ricotta pancakes, house-made pork sausage, 2 eggs over easy (which frankly were a little underdone, but note they still get 5 stars) and the AMAZING crispy potatoes.  My bf had the breakfast sandwich.  

They were a little chintzy with the pure maple syrup, but my neighbors left their table and I stole what they had left so I had enough.

I have never had breakfast potatoes so perfect, super crispy, with caramelized onions and rosemary - and LOTS of 'em.

YUM and YUM.

excerpts: Potatoes (crispy + yum), eggs, bacon, and lemon ricotta pancakes (just the right amount of lemon, no syrup needed).
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Vittorio L.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
This place had a line 12 people deep before it even opened on a saturday, and for a good reason. The ambiance was welcoming, with warm wood trim and tables juxtaposed with stainless steel and brushed metal accents. The windows let in the right amount of light, and made this somewhat narrow restaurant with maybe 12 tables and a counter seem bigger than it is. The open kitchen is a nice touch, too.

And the food was very good, as was the coffee. We had the cassoulet, which was something like ham hocks, duck confit, and some other meat broiled with beans in a savory broth - hearty and delicious. 'The Plow', my dish, was delicious in it's simplicity, and really just perfect. Potatoes (crispy + yum), eggs, bacon, and lemon ricotta pancakes (just the right amount of lemon, no syrup needed). 

What more can i say, except that I've found a place i will be coming back to for breakfast and brunch rather often *sigh*.

excerpts: For breakfast, we ordered the softly scrambled eggs and the plow - two eggs, meat of your choice (we got the homemade sausage), potatoes and lemon ricotta pancakes.
We were mostly MEH about the scrambled eggs
- they were good but nothing special.
The pancakes were fantastic and I wish they were like 12 inches bigger
so I could just make a lemon ricotta pancake hat to wear for forever.
But the real winner was those damn potatoes.
My husband and I actively debated on how we could replicate them.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: A K.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
My husband and I pop down to SF a few times a year.  He lived there for 6 years and it is his favorite city.  This was our first visit to Plow and we really enjoyed it.  We arrived at about 10:45 on Tuesday and were seated immediately.  

For breakfast, we ordered the softly scrambled eggs and the plow - two eggs, meat of your choice (we got the homemade sausage), potatoes and lemon ricotta pancakes.  We were mostly MEH about the scrambled eggs - they were good but nothing special.  The pancakes were fantastic and I wish they were like 12 inches bigger so I could just make a lemon ricotta pancake hat to wear for forever.  But the real winner was those damn potatoes.  My husband and I actively debated on how we could replicate them.  Don't think we will be able to.  

Oh, coffee and mimosas were good too. 

We will be back to Plow though I don't know if we would do a two hour wait.

excerpts: Crispy potatoes, eggs, lemon ricotta pancakes,  and house made sausage patties.
The crispy potatoes were the best home fries, cut potatoes I've had.
I'm definitely a fan.
The lemon ricotta pancakes were good, eggs were eggs, and the sausage was a tad dry.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Leona Z.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Eating breakfast with a 5-star restaurant experience is all the rage now days and the Plow is one of the hot-spots. My basic take-away - the food is good, much better than average, the service is reminiscence of high dining, although I think I prefer my breakfast in a more low-key friendly vibe. 

My dish was The Plow. Crispy potatoes, eggs, lemon ricotta pancakes,  and house made sausage patties. The crispy potatoes were the best home fries, cut potatoes I've had. I'm definitely a fan. The lemon ricotta pancakes were good, eggs were eggs, and the sausage was a tad dry. For $17, I wasn't impressed except by the potatoes.... and $17 to be wowed by potatoes is disappointing.

My final word: Definitely not worth the hour plus long waits on the weekend, but without a wait, I'd try it again.

excerpts: There has never been a time when a plow classic has thrown me off whether it'd be the lemon ricotta pancakes, egg sandwich, or "The Plow" (eggs, sausage or bacon, lemon ricotta pancakes, potatoes).
Each time I've had them they've tasted exactly the same, which is a very good thing.
The potatoes are always amazingly flaky and moist on the inside but crispy and herbaceous on the outside.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Lisa Q.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Plow is one of the hottest glowing epicenters for breakfast on this earth. You can see it from space, glowing and winking--- the smell of their famous potatoes cutting through the atmosphere into your space station and causing every astronaut to salivate and pine for home. 

I'm a longtime eater, first-time writer about the majesty that is this wonderful breakfast place. They have completely captivated the majority of San Francisco and definitely don't need my help, this is just a love letter to their high level of consistency, execution, and creativity.

There has never been a time when a plow classic has thrown me off whether it'd be the lemon ricotta pancakes, egg sandwich, or "The Plow" (eggs, sausage or bacon, lemon ricotta pancakes, potatoes). Each time I've had them they've tasted exactly the same, which is a very good thing. The potatoes are always amazingly flaky and moist on the inside but crispy and herbaceous on the outside. They remind me of Jonathan Waxman's famous potatoes at Barbuto, except I don't have to travel all the way to New York for them.

They also take recipes from great breakfast places all over this nation such as Joanne Chang's Flour in Boston and execute them exceptionally. Their really nailed Joanne's chocolate brioche with pastry cream recipe... I hope they do her sticky buns with goo next!

I also love it when they do their own seasonal riffs of breakfast, my favorite of all time was their "Chinese Breakfast" which had delicious red roasted pork on top of fluffy rice topped off with a fried egg. I will probably scream and jump up and down for joy when they bring it back--- it was one of the yummiest breakfasts I've ever had. *Siiigh* Those tender and aromatic pieces of pork mixed with the unctuousness of an oozing yolk on top of pristine pearly rice, oh god, it's a recipe for love potion.

My only advice is to get here as soon as they crack open their doors. Waiting an hour to eat food is pretty painful and is especially devastating when it's your first meal of the day.

excerpts: with crispy potato, 2 eggs your style, and the LEMON RICOTTA PANCAKES.
Those were amazing.
Crispy on the outside and fluffy on the inside.
I believe there was cheese in there
but i couldn't taste it.
The lemon addition in the pancake was amazing.
felt like i was eating a pastry!
I dont usually like pancakes cause they're a little on the heavy side
but these were so light.
I will be getting an order of Lemon Ricotta Pancakes next time
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Kristina L.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
was looking for a brunch place and stumbled upon this one because apparently its so good that people eat out here in the RAIN. its quite adorable and a little crazy so i had to give it a try. Came late on a Friday afternoon around 1? was seated right away. I ordered the Fried Egg Sandwich and my bf ordered The Plow. The Fried Egg Sandwich wasn't bad - didn't realize there would be no meat in this meal but i do love aioli sauce! wished there were more. The sandwich came with crispy potatoes and grilled onions - that was really good. super crispy on the outside and the potato texture on the inside. The Plow came with your choice of meat - i believe they make it themselves? with crispy potato, 2 eggs your style, and the LEMON RICOTTA PANCAKES. Those were amazing. Crispy on the outside and fluffy on the inside. I believe there was cheese in there but i couldn't taste it. The lemon addition in the pancake was amazing. felt like i was eating a pastry! I dont usually like pancakes cause they're a little on the heavy side but these were so light. I will be getting an order of Lemon Ricotta Pancakes next time :)

beware - this meal comes with food coma -____- at least it did for us!

excerpts: The Plow: eggs, crispy potatoes, homemade pork sausage, and lemon ricotta pancakes.
Everything was exceptional.
The fennel in the sausage was a bit overwhelming, and I prefer links to patties.
But other than that, 5 stars!
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Benjamin A.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: Def worth the hype! I woke up at 7:30am on a Sunday and made my way to Plow with high hopes. We put our name down for a table of 4 at 8:30am, and we were seated just under an hour late. It was reassuring to know that others woke up even earlier than I did. I got The Plow: eggs, crispy potatoes, homemade pork sausage, and lemon ricotta pancakes. Everything was exceptional.The fennel in the sausage was a bit overwhelming, and I prefer links to patties. But other than that, 5 stars!

excerpts: That said, the lemon ricotta pancakes are maybe the best pancakes I've ever had the honor of eating.
I'm not the world's biggest potato fan and the roasted home fry rosemary potatoes with the local hot sauce put this over the edge.
I am sure I will be dreaming about lemon ricotta pancakes until we return.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Nancy N.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: Ok so let me just begin by saying this place lived up to the hype. I love breakfast and I am picky about how I spend my calories. I am also from New England and I know real maple syrup. That said, the lemon ricotta pancakes are maybe the best pancakes I've ever had the honor of eating. I'm not the world's biggest potato fan and the roasted home fry rosemary potatoes with the local hot sauce put this over the edge.  I got the plow with scrambled eggs and the pork sausage. My husband got the eggs Benedict with ham,  mushrooms and spinach which also came with the potatoes,  and was also quite good. The January morning air was chilly  but it was a sunny day so we opted to sit outside as the wait was much shorter. While we were waiting we were given unlimited coffee. When we actually sat down we were given blankets for out laps which was very cozy. Our server was extremely attentive and knowledgeable and kept out coffee mugs and water glasses filled. Start to finish this was one of the best breakfast experiences we have ever had and we will definitely be back to try the other menu items. I am sure I will be dreaming about lemon ricotta pancakes until we return.

excerpts: She liked the lemon ricotta pancakes because it didn't taste like you're eating a bunch of flour.
The apple chicken sausage was pretty good too.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Ann Z.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Came here on a Friday around 1pm for a late brunch. Waited about 10-15 minutes before we were finally seated.

My friend and I both ordered a French toast to share. It was actually really good. The pears were so soft and sweet. The French toast was a perfect line between soggy and soft. 8.5/10 stars.

I ordered the yogurt and granola. It was probably one of the best I have ever had. It tasted so fresh and the granola was soooo good!!!

My friend ordered the plow. She liked the lemon ricotta pancakes because it didn't taste like you're eating a bunch of flour. The apple chicken sausage was pretty good too. The potatoes were okay.

We both had the fresh squeezed lemonade which was $4.50 without a refill. I was a literally turned off by that. I had to pay an extra $1 for a refill. The glass was not even that big! It was probably 8-12oz. I was like really!? Aside from that, the lemonade was actually very good and refreshing. 

Parking was fairly easy and it was free!

excerpts: Anyways, I ordered the plow, substituting the lemon ricotta pancakes for their gluten free counterpart.
Upon the arrival, first, of a french press filled with Ecuadorian coffee, then their decadent chia seed pudding.
Both of which were very delightful.
Next, our meals arrived.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Seth T.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
From the moment we arrived, we knew that an amazing experience was about to ensue. Arriving just prior to Plow opening, we parked our rental car on a San Francisco-esque  steeply-inclined side street and waited patiently for the doors to open.

Promptly at 7am we were greeted at the door by a beautiful waitress wearing a pearly-white smile. We were the first ones to be seated and had the place to ourselves. This was our final morning in San Francisco, so we were looking for an amazing meal to digest and reflect upon over the flight home. San Francisco food experiences had been quite kind to us during our stay, so the bar had been set high.

The decor, ambiance, music selection, and courteous staff were nothing short of amazing. I was also delighted to see the offering of gluten free pancakes. Progressive cities like SF make eating delicious, yet health conscious, meals so effortless. Anyways, I ordered the plow, substituting the lemon ricotta pancakes for their gluten free counterpart. Upon the arrival, first, of a french press filled with Ecuadorian coffee, then their decadent chia seed pudding. Both of which were very delightful. Next, our meals arrived. The food quality was far superior to what is attainable in our area of the East Coast. 

We ate our meal, took in the scenery, chatted with our waitress, and even bumped into a fellow Massachusetts resident who had given us the recommendation for Plow over dinner at a great Indian place just the night before.

Overall, I couldn't have been happier with our experience at Plow. It was the absolute perfect way to close our our trip. San Francisco was the most warm, inviting, and friendly city I have visited to date and Plow was the physical embodiment of the vibe which SF resonates.

excerpts: Lemon Ricotta pancakes are a must try
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Ryan K.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: One of my favorite places for breakfast. I stopped going on weekends, as the line is too long but any chance I have during the weekdays I'll try to head to Plow. Lemon Ricotta pancakes are a must try

excerpts: The plow - two eggs (whatever style), house made pork sausage, and 2 lemon ricotta pancakes.
This comes with a small container of real maple syrup.
This was AMAZING.
GET IT.
The pancakes are small, rich and
oh my god so fluffy.
The eggs were ordered sunny side up and they were prefect.
I just didn't want to get another the plow (like my partner).
I don't regret my choice
but I do think the plow was the much better idea.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Jessica P.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Let me preface this with stating that I had to wait a couple hours before I could sit down and eat.  So hunger might have made the food taste better than it should.  Food that we ordered

Crispy pig ears with a pickled egg - It comes with a chili vinaigrette but ask for the chili jam.  That chili jam is amazing and made everything taste better.  The pig ears were coated in batter and fried (ergo crispy) but the inside was melt in my mouth tender.  If you do get this, share it.  It is very rich. 

The plow - two eggs (whatever style), house made pork sausage, and 2 lemon ricotta pancakes.  This comes with a small container of real maple syrup.   This was AMAZING.  GET IT.  The pancakes are small, rich and oh my god so fluffy.  The eggs were ordered sunny side up and they were prefect.  The yolk was runny and the white is completely set. 

Soft egg scramble with goat cheese, lambsquarter and oyster mushrooms - This was decent but not my favorite.  I just didn't want to get another the plow (like my partner).  I don't regret my choice but I do think the plow was the much better idea.

Coffee - I don't know what they use but the this coffee was extremely fruity and not bitter at all.  They constantly refill the cup too.

All main came with crispy potato.  This was extremely good, especially with the chili jam. 

TLDR: If you are going to come here, bear in mind that you would need to wait at least  an hour (we got here around 11:30 on a Saturday)

Cost: You should expect to spend around $20+/person for food.

excerpts: The lemon ricotta pancakes are delish.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Grace H.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
One of my favorite brunch places in SF, and I've been to a lot!! I always get The Plow and the crab omelette. The lemon ricotta pancakes are delish.

Only thing that keeps me from coming all the time is the wait, besides one time I went super early, other times have always been hour+ waits (which is pretty much the case at every decent brunch place).

Sitting outside is nice on a sunny day but it tends to get really cold & windy at times so bring a jacket!!

excerpts: Maybe you'll have better luck on something other than the Lemon Ricotta Pancakes and Salmon Benedict
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Braxton D.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: Plow came as a highly recommended place from family. Waited ~40 minutes while having a coffee from a nearby shop. I do not see what the hype is about. The wait gets rather long for food I would not wait at all for. It is decent food, nothing wrong with it..but nothing spectacular and definitely not memorable. Maybe its a better lunch spot? Both my friend and I thought the breakfast was mediocre with only passable service. Maybe you'll have better luck on something other than the Lemon Ricotta Pancakes and Salmon Benedict

excerpts: Sure, the potatoes are amazing, the house made pork sausage is spot on, and the lemon ricotta pancakes (with house made ricotta) are a welcome delight.
But then you dig into the breakfast sandwich, the seasonal salads (chilled roasted squash on a salad?!

Hell yeah), the all too rarely available biscuit sandwich, the even more annoyingly rare (and monumentally delicate) fried chicken sandwich, the soft scramble, and the countless other brilliant strokes of refined genius that Max cranks out, and
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Matthew C.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
I'd like to tell you that Plow is awful, that you should go somewhere else, that there's nothing to see here... move along...  I'd like to tell you that so I won't have to wait as long for my go-to breakfast in SF, hands down. 

Sure, the potatoes are amazing, the house made pork sausage is spot on, and the lemon ricotta pancakes (with house made ricotta) are a welcome delight.  But then you dig into the breakfast sandwich, the seasonal salads (chilled roasted squash on a salad?!  Hell yeah), the all too rarely available biscuit sandwich, the even more annoyingly rare (and monumentally delicate) fried chicken sandwich, the soft scramble, and the countless other brilliant strokes of refined genius that Max cranks out, and you realize that you're in the presence of understated brilliance.  

Many times after finishing brunch at another spot in the city, I find myself quietly regretting having not gone to Plow.  It should be on everyone's short list in San Francisco.  Friends and family who have visited from out of town bring up Plow, unsolicited, on phone calls.  These are people who haven't been to San Francisco for a couple of years, and they don't mention the bridges, the wine, fancy dinner places, walks on twin peaks....Nope.  The thing that sticks with them is Plow.

Go, put your name in, grab a coffee from Farley's, walk around Potrero, go back in an hour and order too much food so you can try everything.

Or don't.  Nothing to see here.  Plane Jane breakfast place.  Move along...

excerpts: Finally the lemon ricotta pancakes added a slight   twist from your usual pancake and they were delicious.
Definitely try it if your in the beautiful Potrero Hill area.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Mike A.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: I've been hearing about Plow and decided to give it a try.  The place is small and comfy with plenty of staff.  A bit pricey but I don't mind paying for great food and great service.  I ordered "the  plow" the eggs and bacon were cooked perfectly. The potatoes were deep fried crispy with a hint of salt, rosemary, onions and it was flavorful. Finally the lemon ricotta pancakes added a slight   twist from your usual pancake and they were delicious.  Definitely try it if your in the beautiful Potrero Hill area.

lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Wow. What a brunch!

The +:
+ Ordered The Plow and the amount of food for $15 mowed me down. It was hefty and worth every bite. It was a sampler of everything like 2 eggs, 2 lemon ricotta pancakes (ok), crispy potatoes (WOW), and homemade pork sausage (yum)

The -:

Order The Plow if you want something hefty and show early to get your name on the list. Then build in time to take a short stroll before heading back to wait fo your name to be called.

excerpts: And the The Plow, which consisted of a little bit of everything popular...house made pork sausage, lemon ricotta pancakes and crispy potatoes.
I felt like the pork sausage tasted like some type of Vietnamese pork type food.
The lemon ricotta pancakes were also amazing.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Audrey N.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
I FINALLY got to try this place. I was afraid it would be a third time's a charm type mishap, but the brunch gods were in my favor. The wait was only 20 minutes my second time. =) Naturally, we waited on the cute benches attached to the side of the building. 

I wish I was living in the houses around the corner because I would be a regular! We had the French Toast... which was amazing. Literally I wanted MORE! And the The Plow, which consisted of a little bit of everything popular...house made pork sausage, lemon ricotta pancakes and crispy potatoes. I felt like the pork sausage tasted like some type of Vietnamese pork type food. The lemon ricotta pancakes were also amazing. I just wish I ordered poached eggs rather than over easy. 

I would definitely recommend this place. But don't let the hype ruin it...as many other reviewers, including myself will probably do.

excerpts: Ordered the Plow (crispy potatoes, eggs, lemon ricotta pancakes), pumpkin pancakes, and the breakfast sandwich.
I would definitely order all 3 again.
Delicious!
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: K. D.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Delicious brunch here - with only a 10 minute wait for a party of 6 on a weekday! 

Ordered the Plow (crispy potatoes, eggs, lemon ricotta pancakes), pumpkin pancakes, and the breakfast sandwich. I would definitely order all 3 again. Delicious!

excerpts: The sausage and eggs work great together, their potato is made perfectly crispy on the outside and warm and toasty on the inside, and their lemon ricotta pancakes are to die for.
I usually don't even like pancakes, but I ate it all.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Carrie L.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Love this place, but really hate the wait!

Starting with the positives - this place has AMAZING food.  Everything on their "plow" is amazing.  The sausage and eggs work great together, their potato is made perfectly crispy on the outside and warm and toasty on the inside, and their lemon ricotta pancakes are to die for.  I usually don't even like pancakes, but I ate it all.  I've only been here twice and have been dying to try their fried egg sandwich, but I'm such  a sucker for the plow.  

Oh, and the portions are very generous.

The downside of this place  is the wait...and that it doesn't accept reservations, but good things are worth waiting for.  I will definitely be back.

excerpts: : Lemon ricotta pancakes were zesty and very smooth from the homemade ricotta.
It was a new idea for me.
I liked it with syrup which added sweetness to the zest.
Potatoes added crunchiness to the plate- dipped each bite with ketchup/hot sauce, scooping up the oozing yolk from the eggs (Mmmm spicy and savory)- Eggs over easy was a genius idea, I might add!
Chicken apple sausage had a smooth, sweet, spicyness.
Overall the whole plate was full of dimension.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Maiden D.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Cute spot for breakfast, brunch, lunch. Anytime of the day actually but I'm saying this because of the windows that line an entire wall of the corner located store, allowing a great amount of daylight into the room. That's the first thing I noticed. Came in with my sister late morning and we were seated right away! MAJOR plus! (since, I hear the wait can be terrible). I then noticed that we were seated very closely to another group of people (so close, it was as if we were all seated in one cozy table). Despite that fact, this is what gave the restaurant a social, friendly, casual, and "fun intimate" feeling. We got our waters right away and our waitress was very prompt!! 

We looked through the menu, searching for something that stood out to us. Of course, we had to choose the infamous 'plow' and also decided on the Chicken Tinga to share. Eggs over easy for both- but you can have your eggs however you want them. Also, as a heads up, being the small business that it is, they don't serve groups greater than 6! 

The menu says no cell phones allowed? (not sure what that meant or why) That didn't stop me from checking in and taking pictures of my food - I HAD TO! ;)

-Chicken Tinga tasted mucho bien! A nice crunchy corn tortilla laid beneath chipotle tomato sauce and two eggs over easy, avocado, and creme fraiche. It was fresh and flavorsome. The textures and flavors mixed very well together and the combination of breakfast and mexican worked oh so well. 
 
-Plow: Lemon ricotta pancakes were zesty and very smooth from the homemade ricotta. It was a new idea for me. I liked it with syrup which added sweetness to the zest. Potatoes added crunchiness to the plate- dipped each bite with ketchup/hot sauce, scooping up the oozing yolk from the eggs (Mmmm spicy and savory)- Eggs over easy was a genius idea, I might add! Chicken apple sausage had a smooth, sweet, spicyness. Overall the whole plate was full of dimension. In my opinion, the pancakes were very appropriate, being that the potatoes were super crunchy, the eggs oozed yolk, and the sausage added a kick! 

Both plates had different ideas but I personally liked the Chicken Tinga for flavor. 

Don't go here if you don't like loud and compact areas. I suggest you go here if you want a casual and sociable meal. Cool.

excerpts: I got mine with two eggs sunny side up, Nueske bacon, and the standard crispy potatoes and lemon ricotta pancakes.
Nueske bacon is bacon in some of its awesomest form.
The crispy potatoes had a hint of rosemary for an added dimension of flavor.
The lemon ricotta pancakes featured a light lemon flavor and were a little dense yet still fluffy and really delicious (I really liked these pancakes).
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Erich D.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: When at Plow get the plow!  It's a seriously good breakfast/brunch entree that won't have you feeling overly stuffed or gross afterwards; perfect mix of savory and sweet items on your plate and just the right amount.  I got mine with two eggs sunny side up, Nueske bacon, and the standard crispy potatoes and lemon ricotta pancakes.  Nueske bacon is bacon in some of its awesomest form.  The crispy potatoes had a hint of rosemary for an added dimension of flavor.  The lemon ricotta pancakes featured a light lemon flavor and were a little dense yet still fluffy and really delicious (I really liked these pancakes).

excerpts: Don't get me wrong - the crispy potatoes were really good, as were the lemon ricotta pancakes (I got the Plow breakfast), but the sausage mixed with syrup mixed with egg mixed with potatoes?
Yeah.
I'm a fan.
Minus one star for inaccurate time keeping.
Cuz I'm a jerk like that.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Maria P.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Came here last Sunday for brunch. Arrived around 11:30, put our name down, was told it would be an hour. Thankfully there are shops around so we got busy for about 30 minutes. And because we were dying of hunger, we went back to check on the wait. Reported time? Another hour! So yeah, that was heart/gut wrenching. 

But when our time finally came, there was much rejoicing. The service was quick. And their homemade sausage blew my mind. Don't get me wrong - the crispy potatoes were really good, as were the lemon ricotta pancakes (I got the Plow breakfast), but the sausage mixed with syrup mixed with egg mixed with potatoes? Yeah. I'm a fan. Minus one star for inaccurate time keeping. Cuz I'm a jerk like that.

excerpts: Fluffy, gluten free lemon ricotta pancakes, potatoes, eggs, and bacon?
SOLD.
I had a hankering for some pancakes but have diet restrictions, which they gladly accommodated.
The staff was friendly and attentive.
Plow is located in Portrero Hill, a very quiet area that is perfect if you want to escape from the hustle and bustle of downtown.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Kaili K.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: Fluffy, gluten free lemon ricotta pancakes, potatoes, eggs, and bacon? SOLD. I had a hankering for some pancakes but have diet restrictions, which they gladly accommodated. The staff was friendly and attentive. Plow is located in Portrero Hill, a very quiet area that is perfect if you want to escape from the hustle and bustle of downtown.

excerpts: The crispy potatoes, chicken apple sausage, and the lemon ricotta pancakes were oh so yummy!
Definitely would recommend this as I am always torn when I go to brunch
- do I want sweet or savory?
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Christine W.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Came here on a Sunday around 10am and had to wait over an hour for a table for 5pm. Come here early or be prepared to wait. My friend said that there is a nice coffee shop up the block called farleys which is good to grab a cup of coffee and chat while we wait. We didn't get coffee this time but looks like most ppl do do this. 

We were seated outside which was fine but it does get chilly out there so bring a jacket. My friend mentioned they supply you blankets is you ask but none of us asked for one. We all just pounded cups of hot coffee to stay warm! 

The most popular item and best entree to get here if it is your first time is to get the plow. Has a little bit of everything! The crispy potatoes, chicken apple sausage, and the lemon ricotta pancakes were oh so yummy! Definitely would recommend this as I am always torn when I go to brunch - do I want sweet or savory? The plow gives you both and you will leave satisfied. 

Overall this is a great brunch spot with flavorful and tasty brunch options. Next time I want to try their Dungeness crab scramble sounds soo yum!

excerpts: Knowing either of us couldn't finish The Plow, we went for the lemon ricotta pancakes and a half portion of the french toast with a side of crispy potatoes.
They do everything so well that you really can't go wrong with any of their options!
Cheers!
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: David O.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Plow is seriously delicious. If you're a brunch person and you haven't been here, you're missing out. The lady and I had been hearing about this place for a while and we finally made it out. It was our lucky day because we were told that the wait would be about an hour and a half and we may possibly not get a table before closing. A lot of people gave up and it bumped down our wait time to about 20 minutes on a Saturday.

We sat at the bar where four men were working furiously behind the counter churning out pancakes, benedicts and the like in a very efficient system. Knowing either of us couldn't finish The Plow, we went for the lemon ricotta pancakes and a half portion of the french toast with a side of crispy potatoes. They do everything so well that you really can't go wrong with any of their options! Cheers!

excerpts: the lemon ricotta pancakes, didn't do a whole lot for me.
I thought they were a little on the dry side, and served with real maple ( I like the fake sugary junk).
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Elaine J.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
As an out-of-towner, I hopped on the band wagon and came to this place. It's a little far from the middle of the city, which was a bummer.

The food was pretty good though. The potatoes, I could absolutely eat all day. the lemon ricotta pancakes, didn't do a whole lot for me. I thought they were a little on the dry side, and served with real maple ( I like the fake sugary junk). Orange juice was super fresh and delicious.

It's a pretty cozy little place and sitting at the counter wasn't ideal, but did get the job done. The service was also a little slow.

I was eyeing the fried egg sandwich which I saw several people order, and will do the same, next time I have the chance.

excerpts: Famous for lemon ricotta pancakes, house made sausage and the crispiest potatoes known to man.
After waiting over an hour for a table I was skeptical, but Plow delivers.
These are some good breakfast eats.
Their potatoes are worth the wait!
Everything else is just a bonus.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Kellee K.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: We ventured to Potrero Hill neighborhood and sought out Plow. Famous for lemon ricotta pancakes, house made sausage and the crispiest potatoes known to man. After waiting over an hour for a table I was skeptical, but Plow delivers. These are some good breakfast eats. Their potatoes are worth the wait! Everything else is just a bonus.

excerpts: It also came with their signature lemon ricotta pancakes which was fluffy and unique.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Vi L.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
I'd give this place 4 stars, but I'm taking one out for the 2.5 hours wait for brunch. I came here after a hike and my last meal was at 7am, so that might have been a reason why I was STARVING by the time we got seated. It helped a lot that they kept reassuring us that we weren't forgotten and apologized for the wait so I give them 5 stars for customer service.

Brunch was good. OMG...the crispy potatoes were to die for. I'm so glad it came with 3 out of 4 of our meals. We ordered 2 plows (1 with house made pork sausages and 1 with the chicken apple sausages). I highly recommend the pork sausages over the chicken sausages. It also came with their signature lemon ricotta pancakes which was fluffy and unique. I highly recommend getting the plow if you want sample a couple of the things off their menu. We also got an order of french toast and the fried egg sandwiches. The french toast was okay. It was thick and crispy. We added avocados to our fried egg sandwich which made it pretty tasty. 

Overall, the food and service is great. I just don't think it's worth a 2 hour wait when there are so many other brunch places in the city. I'd come back here again, but only if the wait is no longer than an hour.

excerpts: Breakfast was excellent, house made sausage, lemon ricotta pancakes were included and bomb, coffee and cream were highest quality.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Timinator77 -.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
I thought Plow to be a fitting place to begin my Yelping;

Great location on corner with high ceilings, big windows, natural lighting, clean. Parking not bad for SF. Staff professional and pleasant. Has a contemporary feel w trancy music and farmhouse decor.

Breakfast was excellent, house made sausage, lemon ricotta pancakes were included and bomb, coffee and cream were highest quality.

Plow is unique for getting their products from multiple organic and small local farms.

excerpts: The lemon ricotta pancakes were delicious (the only yummy item on my plate) and would highly recommend trying them.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: R C.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
My husband and I waited in line for a little over an hour to be seated (which is the norm, especially on weekends).  After finally getting a table, we both ordered the plow entree with poached eggs and got our food fairly quickly.  Without tasting the food, right away we could see the inconsistency among the two plates.  My husbands plate looked perfect, eggs cooked wonderfully and the potatoes seasoned perfectly with salt and rosemary.  The eggs on my plate were slightly undercooked and leaking of yolk when I got it.  My potatoes were slightly overcooked with no taste of rosemary.  The lemon ricotta pancakes were delicious (the only yummy item on my plate) and would highly recommend trying them.

I was fairly disappointed in the lack of consistency this place has and am not willing to wait in line for over an hour when there are way better breakfast places in the city.

excerpts: LEMON RICOTTA PANCAKES ($10.50)
- house made ricotta, lemon zest, and pure maple syrup.
This came out with three pancakes covering the entire place, a sprinkle of powder sugar drizzled ontop, a dab of melted butter, and a side of the pure maple syrup.
I must say, this was absolutely DIVINE & HEAVENLY.
The pancakes were something i've never had before, definately can taste the lemon zest, and the ricotta just gave the batter that creamy-sweet taste.
It was extremely delcious!!!!
And the pure maple syrup, you dont need that much on the pancakes.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Jane A.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
STARTING SUMMER WITH A "SUMMER-Y" KIND OF BREAKFAST. 
(4.5 stars)

Crossing this off my "yelp booked marked" items. This quaint cafe makes me want to live in Potrero Hill. I'd be blessed to come eat here every morning before work. Such a cute inspiration, if I ever become a restaurant owner, I'd love to echo a place like this. 

- Food, healthy and exquisit (organic)
- Prices, little more out of the pocket (i spent $20 for myself)
- Service, on-point
- Ambiance, simple and cute neighborhood cafe

This is a restaurant that's packed all weekend long, especially for brunch. One to come with another or a few people. I've decided to drop in at 7:30AM on a Tuesday, alone (call me a loser, i guess I am. HA!). No worries, only one other person was there and the place was empty that early in the morning (good thing for me). Typically, I would'nt come to such a place alone but I been at the gym since 4:45AM, don't have to be at work until 9AM, bored and HUNGRY.

HEFFER-STYLE STATUS

**pictures to come**

LEMON RICOTTA PANCAKES ($10.50) - house made ricotta, lemon zest, and pure maple syrup. This came out with three pancakes covering the entire place, a sprinkle of powder sugar drizzled ontop, a dab of melted butter, and a side of the pure maple syrup. I must say, this was absolutely DIVINE & HEAVENLY. The pancakes were something i've never had before, definately can taste the lemon zest, and the ricotta just gave the batter that creamy-sweet taste. It was extremely delcious!!!! And the pure maple syrup, you dont need that much on the pancakes. Highly recommend trying.

CHICKEN APPLE SAUSAGE ($4) - kind of pricy for three sausage links. But it was definately needed to balance the sweet and creamy on the palate with some savory. Worth every penny after one bite. The sausages were perfectly cooked, browned on the outside and tender on the inside. 

CAMELLIA BLOSSOMED ICE TEA ($3) - it was served in a class with a lemon slice. Didn't add any sweetners and kepted it plain; taste real good with the lemon slice inside. Might not be for all palates but for those who like iced tea, this is for you.

COMPLIMENTARY H2O (Free) - love it when a restaurant brings out a chic glass bottle of water for the table. pour your own water!!!

The total of my bill was about $20 bucks. I left not feeling heavy nor gross. I left feeling refreshed and ready to start a long day in corporate america. That's a great feeling when you've ate well. 

Will I be back? Definately. I'll need to call people up to see if they'd like to wait in the long line with me on the weekend. If not, I can come back here alone and by myself at 7:30AM again. 

JABA APPROVED. Until the next review...

excerpts: I love their lemon ricotta pancakes.
Everything else I've had has been delicious as well.
Make sure you call ahead or make a reservation, there is always a long wait.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Bethany M.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: I love their lemon ricotta pancakes. Everything else I've had has been delicious as well. Make sure you call ahead or make a reservation, there is always a long wait.

excerpts: Well, I think Plow is doing just the opposite for their lemon ricotta pancakes.
The lemon ricotta pancakes were super delicious, but I wish something had been served alongside.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Amanda S.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
You know how most lazy restaurants and home cooks use pancake batter to make their waffles, even though if you think about it, great pancakes and waffles have nothing texturally in common? Well, I think Plow is doing just the opposite for their lemon ricotta pancakes. They're making a dense batter (anything with that much ricotta has to be dense), and then lightening it with whipped egg whites like you're supposed to do for waffles. Gives you a lighter texture, but still plenty of structure and a crispy exterior. Plus, waffles reheat poorly, and so did my leftover pancake. Now I could be totally off the mark, and no one but me could care about my little theory, but I like to know how things work. Especially yummy things.

The lemon ricotta pancakes were super delicious, but I wish something had been served alongside.

I also wish I had gotten some of those potatoes. I was full and getting ready to leave when the lady next to me's food came out, but the smell of the potatoes was intoxicating.

All in all, a very respectable brunch, I just recommend going on a weekday.

excerpts: I ordered the Plow which included lemon ricotta pancakes topped with powdered sugar, eggs your way, bacon, and home fries.
I have to say the home fries hit the spot with the grilled onions.
Since it was cold, I ordered hot water and tea.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Ciana P.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
I came here with a friend of mine after a morning work out so we were hongry! that's right HONGRY. It was only 10:30AM and this place had a massive wait list which means a) their food really is that good of b) the space is too small. I have to say it was a combination of a & b and it was definitely worth the wait. We ended up waiting about 45 min before we were seated outdoors. I wanted to sit inside but the wait was going to be longer and this particular day was cold and foggy. Luckily, there were blankets. The only complaint about the seating is that we were seated on a slope so I was afraid I was going to be a klutz and somehow knock myself over (which didn't happen btw).

I ordered the Plow which included lemon ricotta pancakes topped with powdered sugar, eggs your way, bacon, and home fries. I have to say the home fries hit the spot with the grilled onions. Since it was cold, I ordered hot water and tea. The bill came out to be about $25-30/person including drinks.

I would definitely come here again however, I might come even earlier! a solid 5 stars for service, food, and location. Be prepared to stalk other people for parking...it took about 20 min to a spot!

excerpts: Four of us tried lemon ricotta pancakes, homemade pork sausage, fried egg sandwich, soft-shell crab sandwich, and doughnuts.
Eating their pork sausage makes it worth it
that I'm not a vegetarian anymore.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Sonia M.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Finding a place like Plow makes me love this city still more... sorry New York.. (But for shopping, I'd still hop on a plane and hit SOHO.)  Everything was absolutely delicious, with lovely ambiance and kind service.  

The only downside was the wait.  For me waiting more than 20 minutes for anything is torturous.  Over an hour wait on a Saturday morning forced my starving girlfriend and me to go over to Farley's and split a scone to ease our bitchy attitude caused by our hunger.  Four of us tried lemon ricotta pancakes, homemade pork sausage, fried egg sandwich, soft-shell crab sandwich, and doughnuts.  Eating their pork sausage makes it worth it that I'm not a vegetarian anymore. The crispy potatoes were out of this world.  

Now, If you still have room for desert, hit Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous for little scoops of heaven.

excerpts: I almost always order the plow with lemon ricotta pancakes and their homemade sausage patties.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Larf P.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
My favorite brunch place. 

This is how I make the whole experience pleasurable:

I ride my scooter over, put my name on the list, ride back home, tell my boyfriend to get up because our names are on the list, then we go have a leisurely cup of coffee at Farleys before coming back to wait the last 10 minutes in front, or across the street in the sun. 

This is how it's done, all you waiter-haters! It's all about strategy.

I almost always order the plow with lemon ricotta pancakes and their homemade sausage patties. The crispy potatoes really are the most delicious things you could ever put into your mouth at breakfast.

Don't order the French toast here. They use French bread for some reason--it's way too thick with a stiff crust. 

Monkey bread, if they haven't run out yet, should be ordered immediately.

excerpts: Lemon ricotta pancakes.
No brainier.
Chicken apple sausage.
Yep.
Eggs perfectly done.
I was so chubby and happy leaving this place-
maybe I'm glad it's so far from me because I would clearly have to quit my job, eat here every day, and be fat and alone
but SO SO happy if it was in driving distance.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Siara C.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
I LOVE going out to breakfast, and this place has all the perfect elements for a most successful breakfast endeavor.  The location and building itself are so cute and cozy. it fits the food and you can see how perfectly thought out every detail is.  The napkins, salt and pepper shakers, restroom--everything was thoughtfully chosen.  It's small, and you will have to wait.  But let that waiting just be fuel for your fiery desire for awesome breakfast food.

The tea was delicious, and I got the Plow Breakfast so I could try a variety of items.  

Prepare to have all your preconceived notions of typical breakfast items blown away.  

Those.crispy.potatoes. 
 I want to cry thinking about how I have to live without them until my next visit to San Fran.  

Lemon ricotta pancakes. No brainier.  Chicken apple sausage.  Yep.  Eggs perfectly done.  I was so chubby and happy leaving this place- maybe I'm glad it's so far from me because I would clearly have to quit my job, eat here every day, and be fat and alone but SO SO happy if it was in driving distance.

excerpts: Ordered the fried egg sandwich, corn muffin and lemon ricotta pancakes.
The sandwich was very good - nice tastes with the cheese, the runny eggs and the sweet bun.
The frisee added nice texture.
The potatoes that came with the sandwich had too much rosemary for us.
Fantastic texture, but we couldn't get over the herb overload.
The pancake was very nice - soft and fluffy with a bit of texture on the outside and quite lemony.
The corn muffin was good, but not great for me - it "powders" too easily.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Manjesh N.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: Though this place is very good, I'm not sure it's worth standing in line. In any case, we wanted to try it once. Ordered the fried egg sandwich, corn muffin and lemon ricotta pancakes. The sandwich was very good - nice tastes with the cheese, the runny eggs and the sweet bun. The frisee added nice texture. The potatoes that came with the sandwich had too much rosemary for us. Fantastic texture, but we couldn't get over the herb overload. The pancake was very nice - soft and fluffy with a bit of texture on the outside and quite lemony. The corn muffin was good, but not great for me - it "powders" too easily.

excerpts: Oh, and lemon ricotta pancakes, like you could make at home, but who has ricotta laying around at home?
the maple syrup was good too (could have used a side of butter).
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Gary Y.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
We were in the Portrero, waiting for Hard Knox lunch, when we saw in the Examiner that Plow had breakfast and lunch altogether.  Great! so we tried it and was it fun.  The wait was a little long to get in, but there was plenty of parking on the street, a nice neighborhood to browse, and the friendliest breakfast staff!

Breakfast was delicious, we got a soup,  farro and kale (always wanted to know how farro would be in a soup, and it was perfect for a late breakfast).  then went on to the plow breakfast, two perfect sunny side up eggs, homemade fragrant sausage patty, and the best potatoes.  Oh, and lemon ricotta pancakes, like you could make at home, but who has ricotta laying around at home?  the maple syrup was good too (could have used a side of butter).  Our other was a fried egg sandwich, really smoky bacon, distinctive cheese melted in, soft bun, and more of the potatoes.  

Not cheap, but so friendly for a morning meal, everyone's proud of the offerings, tables close together, but everyone's excited about their meal.  We liked it and will come back with friends.

excerpts: The Plow-- two eggs, choice of Nueske bacon, house made pork sausage, or chicken apple sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes, crispy potatoes
two eggs fried, aioli, frisee, Vermont cheddar, Acme bun  10.75
add Nueske bacon
The lemon ricotta pancakes had a cake-like consistency and tons of flavor.
My only complaint about the pancakes was that they were way too small!
The potatoes?
Best freaking breakfast potatoes
I've ever had.
They were flavorful, crispy, and oh so good!
I also tasted my boyfriend's Fried Egg Sandwich was was also, very good.
The total came out to be about $30 something for breakfast.. a little pricy, but totally worth it!
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Joyce E.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Plow is absolutely delicious! I came here for my boyfriend's birthday brunch. The wait was about 15 minutes for two on a Thursday afternoon at around 1pm. The hostess/server was very nice and assured us that we would be seated soon. Since Plow is, as they describe "modest in size" definitely expect to get seated literally inches away from some random people. Anyways! Since we looked at the menu beforehand, we received our orders within 15 minutes. Pretty fast! I also want to mention that the wait went by quickly since my boyfriend and I were watching the cooks cook/prepare the food in the open kitchen. I ordered the Plow while my boyfriend settled on the Fried Egg sandwich.

Their water was served in jugs! My favorite. :)

(From their menu)

The Plow-- two eggs, choice of Nueske bacon, house made pork sausage, or chicken apple sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes, crispy potatoes  14.5

Fried egg sandwich -- two eggs fried, aioli, frisee, Vermont cheddar, Acme bun  10.75  add Nueske bacon  12.75

The Plow was SO good! The eggs were on the watery/yolky side which I didn't mind. The bacon tasted exactly like how my mom makes it -- It was sweet and not too crispy. The lemon ricotta pancakes had a cake-like consistency and tons of flavor. My only complaint about the pancakes was that they were way too small! The potatoes? Best freaking breakfast potatoes I've ever had. They were flavorful, crispy, and oh so good! I also tasted my boyfriend's Fried Egg Sandwich was was also, very good. The total came out to be about $30 something for breakfast.. a little pricy, but totally worth it!

excerpts: The eggs were cooked well, the potatoes perfect, lemon ricotta pancakes were good, but the sausage was boring.
I had a mimosa with my meal
and I did like how the flute curved out just a tad for that extra sip.
My husband got the spinach eggs benedict which he inhaled so it was probably good.
Our friend Chris got his usual scramble and then ate my 2nd pancake since he likes them so much
and I couldn't finish.
We were out of there in about a hour.
Imagine if we waited 2 hours for that 1 hour meal.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Rosalind S.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
4 stars only because we waited for about 5 mins, (thanks Chris!), although it was in the rain.  The wait was suppose to be about 2 hours which is ridiculous because it's not that good and I would never wait for food like that.  Don't get me wrong, I definitly enjoyed my meal, (but the company was better), but like I said, not wait 2 hours good.   

It was my first time so I got The Plow with sunny side up eggs and the pork sausage.  The eggs were cooked well, the potatoes perfect, lemon ricotta pancakes were good, but the sausage was boring.  I had a mimosa with my meal and I did like how the flute curved out just a tad for that extra sip.  My husband got the spinach eggs benedict which he inhaled so it was probably good.  Our friend Chris got his usual scramble and then ate my 2nd pancake since he likes them so much and I couldn't finish.  We were out of there in about a hour.  Imagine if we waited 2 hours for that 1 hour meal.

excerpts: My favorite dish is the lemon ricotta pancakes, but the menu has a ton of great options.
The only issue I've ever had is that the bacon can be a bit fatty for my tastes, but I understand that some people like it that way.
I just wish that Plow were open for dinner as well.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Drew C.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: This is one of my favorite brunch spots in SF. The wait can be maddening, but it's always worth it. My favorite dish is the lemon ricotta pancakes, but the menu has a ton of great options. The only issue I've ever had is that the bacon can be a bit fatty for my tastes, but I understand that some people like it that way. I just wish that Plow were open for dinner as well.

excerpts: I most always get the Plow, which consists of lemon ricotta pancakes, crispy, crispy rosemary potatoes, eggs, and some sort of protein.
I've had the soft scramble as well.
Last time I was there
there were oyster mushrooms, goat cheese, and stinging nettles all enveloped in soft, pillow-y, quivering eggs.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Rebecca N.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
I've been here a bunch of times and 
1. Somehow, I've never had to wait.
2. I've only ever sat at the bar. 
3. I love you


Plow is hands down, forever in my heart, deep within my soul, my favorite place to get breakfast. I eat breakfast here when I'm happy, I eat here when I want to celebrate, I eat here when I want to treat myself to something nice. I even eat here when I'm sad. (I do eat my feelings in the form of house made pork sausage.) Something tells me I'll be frequenting this place a little more nowadays. ;( :D

I've never had anything bad here. And not even just that, because well, that's a lukewarm statement. I've only had EXCELLENT things here. The coffee is delicious, and so is the food. I most always get the Plow, which consists of lemon ricotta pancakes, crispy, crispy rosemary potatoes, eggs, and some sort of protein. I've had the soft scramble as well. Last time I was there there were oyster mushrooms, goat cheese, and stinging nettles all enveloped in soft, pillow-y, quivering eggs. freaking yum. 

And seriously, I don't mean to assume, or step on anyone's toes, but... it doesn't seem like anyone hates their job here. I know, rude of me to say. But no, really. The service is always served with a genuine smile, and I always come back because they are really, really, really nice. 

I recently went on a Saturday and even though they open at 8, the restaurant was full by 8:05. So, keep that in mind if you don't like waits! Even though I never have had to, I would because this place is a gem.

excerpts: Anyway though I had the lemon ricotta pancakes with a side of potatoes
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Karl S.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
My breakfast was fantastic and I absolutely loved watching them cook in front of me at the counter, but I will say that the service could have been better. My waitress was very rude from the moment I sat down - I told her that I had a flight to catch and was in a hurry so I'd gladly take my check upfront and she seemed offended by this. I also had trouble getting my coffee refilled and when I flagged down a different waitress and asked for more coffee she never came back with any :-/

Anyway though I had the lemon ricotta pancakes with a side of potatoes and they were delicious!

FYI lots of reviewers mention a long line - just go early when they first open and you can avoid this. There were quite a few empty tables when I went at 7:15am.

excerpts: , I was super excited to taste the lemon ricotta pancakes as part of the plow.
So when they came, and I tried them, I was definitely let down.
they were....
just okay.
Definitely not as flavorful as I had been hoping.
Matter fact, that's how everything was.
I think the highlight if anything was the potatoes.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Jennifer O.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Okay, so it pains me a tad to give plow such a low rating when clearly the majority of what seems to be the world loves it. but let me remind you all that two stars means "meh, I've experienced better", and that's exactly what I left thinking after eating at plow. 

I went yesterday with three friends, and after waiting for close to two hours (thank the Lord for that little coffee shop with the board games. scrabble was clutch!) we finally got a table outside. My table ordered a number of things to share: the french toast, crab scramble, some pork dish (i forget the oh so elegant name), and of course the plow. 

Me being a fan of all pancakes (just had the best sweet potato pancakes the weekend before at brenda's), I was super excited to taste the lemon ricotta pancakes as part of the plow. So when they came, and I tried them, I was definitely let down. they were.... just okay. Definitely not as flavorful as I had been hoping. Matter fact, that's how everything was. I think the highlight if anything was the potatoes. Definitely had a good little crisp going on, and when dunked in ketchup, it was bomb! 

One thing though that I liked more as an afterthought was that I left not feeling weighed down by the food. Not sure if this was because I didn't eat much of it or if the food was just very healthy/airy/light, but i did appreciate not feeling like i need to take a two hour nap afterwards to digest the food.  

so all in all... I'm glad I went to plow, and can now check it off my sf bucket list. but will likely not return, and don't really recommend it actually. there's other restaurants in the city where the food merits the wait a lot more.

excerpts: The only thing I didn't care too much for was the lemon ricotta pancakes.
They were a bit dense.
It's probably the ricotta that makes it like that
but I like
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Karen L.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
There are lots of hills in this area so I don't recommend wearing high heels going to this restaurant. Also, it's also really cold in SF and you have to wait outside for a table so bring a warm jacket.

The food was pretty good. I ordered the "The Plow" which has a little bit of everything. The potatoes were really good. They seem to be deep fried first then tossed in a pan with some caramelized onions. The home-made pork sausage patties were really good as well. The only thing I didn't care too much for was the lemon ricotta pancakes. They were a bit dense. It's probably the ricotta that makes it like that but I like my pancakes light and fluffy. 

Overall, I would definitely come back to try the rest of the menu. The service was really nice, great environment, and good food. Just bring a jacket because you will most likely have to stand outside and wait for a table.

excerpts: I got the plow, which comes with their lemon ricotta pancakes, crispy Yukon gold potatoes, and your choice of bacon or sausages.
Their potatoes are AMAZING!!
It was so good we ordered seconds.
It was perfectly crispy on the outside and soft on the inside.
Seasoned to perfection.
I also tried the French toast but it was nothing out of the ordinary for me.
Mimosas are not bottomless but still delicious and $8 a glass.
The ambiance is casual, if seated at the countertop, you can watch your food being prepped.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Cindy H.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: Expect a wait on the weekends. Food is great, service is great. I got the plow, which comes with their lemon ricotta pancakes, crispy Yukon gold potatoes, and your choice of bacon or sausages. Their potatoes are AMAZING!! It was so good we ordered seconds. It was perfectly crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. Seasoned to perfection. I also tried the French toast but it was nothing out of the ordinary for me. Mimosas are not bottomless but still delicious and $8 a glass. The ambiance is casual, if seated at the countertop, you can watch your food being prepped.

excerpts: LEMON RICOTTA PANCAKES & Monte Cristo.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Heather R.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
LEMON RICOTTA PANCAKES & Monte Cristo.

Delicious. Can't wait to come here again to try some of their other items.

There's always a wait though.

excerpts:
We ordered:
-- lemon ricotta pancakes ($9) to share: slightly crisp edges & fluffier in the middle.
lemony but not at all tart.
the ricotta gave it a nice density & almost tangy flavor.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Fancypants X.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Their Saturday brunch was so good, I felt like I was literally *plowing* through my food.

At 11 am, there was roughly a 20 minute wait (some counter seating opened up but we held out for a table for two.) Plow is a compact space--more long than it is wide--that surprisingly doesn't feel crowded. 

We ordered:
-- lemon ricotta pancakes ($9) to share: slightly crisp edges & fluffier in the middle. lemony but not at all tart. the ricotta gave it a nice density & almost tangy flavor. it needed a drizzle of maple syrup for some sweetness. 
-- fried egg sandwich with crispy potatoes ($8.50): i added a side of chicken apple sausage ($4.) a 10 on the Richter scale, as far as breakfast sandwiches go. the potatoes were SO crispy & had a bit of onion running through it. 
-- cider brined pork chop for the bff ($14): the bff thought it was moist & flavorful. 

Everything about Plow is charming; from our waitress with a British accent to the simple design details & right down to the cozy neighborhood. Utterly charming. I like charming. Can't get enough of it, really.

excerpts: The lemon ricotta pancakes were good, but not food nirvana like most of the reviews seem to think.
Solid high tier.
The eggs were prepared fine, but who really messes up scrambled eggs, you know?
Mid-tier.
The sausage was a bit dry and the bacon a bit flimsy.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Mercutio k.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
There's this character in a fighting video game. She's generally counted to be on the side of the good guys. But land too many hits on her (when she has 5 bars), and she'll turn into the bitch from hell. My health bar waiting at Plow was at that magic pixel of life remaining, and there was one moment where that final punch landed on me, and it was on... full on Dark Phoenix sour puss bitch-face for me the rest of the meal.

Here's the tl;dr version of this review: Only eat here as a pair; not a 3-some, not a group of 4; Budda help you if you're a party of five or more. The food is better than average. The price is hipster high. And the wait is long and not worth it. The staff is friendly once you're seated.

Back to the fighting game analogy; I started off the morning at full life. Sure, we had to wake up at 7:30AM on a Sunday to drive across town to eat here; but I knew what I was getting into. This is SF, brunch waits are supposed to be brutal, but it'll all be okay in the end... I know that. I also understand that when a party of four shows up, we'll have to wait for a space to free up to get seated. But when MULTIPLE groups of pairs and THREE people parties were being seated ahead of my four-person party, my life bar took a hit. Why couldn't they just wait for 2 pairs seated near each other to leave and push those two tables together for us? I guess the business sense I gathered from this experience was: In the long run, it's okay to piss off a group of four customers, if you've already made 10 other customers happy. You still end up +6 overall.

When we were finally were given a table (an hour later after being initially told a 30 minute wait... you know, because we were the 3rd on the list arriving at 8:15AM), my lifebar took another big hit when I saw that a family group of four (parents plus 2 kids) who DEFINITELY came by after us were already seated and getting their order taken. How did this other four person party have priority over us?

Life's at a pixel now. The final blow? A pair who came later than us and who was seated before us finished their meal. Their table was cleared but was intentionally kept empty and not filled by the exponentially growing line behind us. When the second couple who sat adjacent to the now empty table left, the tables were cleared and the two tables pushed together to seat an incoming party of four. Why didn't this happen for us? 

"I can't control it!" And that was it. Even if they brought out food blessed by Alice Waters herself, it still wouldn't erase the bitterness and sour taste already in my mouth.

I will say that the actual service of the waitstaff after we were seated was exceptionally friendly and kind. The food? The best food item for me were their potatoes. Top tier. The lemon ricotta pancakes were good, but not food nirvana like most of the reviews seem to think. Solid high tier. The eggs were prepared fine, but who really messes up scrambled eggs, you know? Mid-tier. The sausage was a bit dry and the bacon a bit flimsy. Low tier.

I'm sure if things didn't start off on the wrong foot, I may have enjoyed my meal better. But for the price paid, it was just not worth the effort, even if the waitstaff was nice. Pass...

You are set for the day.
Parkings not bad.
Beautiful place, great neighborhood.
Love coming here
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: C. M.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Every time I've come here, I've waited at least 30-45 minutes and it's been worth it each and every time. Foods amazing here and waitstaff is always great. Fresh ingredients make the plates here just that good. I've ordered the plow which is your standard eggs, house potatoes bacon toast and it's soooo good!!!! Not boring at all. Lemon ricotta pancakes melt in your mouth, along with strong delicous coffee. You are set for the day. 
Parkings not bad. Beautiful place, great neighborhood. Love coming here

excerpts: But we'll still get the lemon ricotta pancakes in addition to anything else we get.
They.are.amazing!!!
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Karishma B.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
We had brunch at Plow with some friends today. The wait was a little over an hour but we expected that since it was the peak brunch hour. But let me tell you, it was worth the wait!

I got the fried egg sandwich (eggs were cooked perfectly) with crispy potatoes (had a hint of rosemary -- super delicious!). My husband and I split a lemon ricotta pancake, which was on point! And we tried a buttermilk biscuit that just melted in our mouths. My husband got the almond flour pancakes and he was a bit disappointed. He was under the impression that they would taste almondy but they didn't at all. They tasted good but don't get them if you want something that tastes almondy.

We would definitely go back and try other items on the menu. But we'll still get the lemon ricotta pancakes in addition to anything else we get. They.are.amazing!!!

Literally to die for.
Literally.

My server was not the friendliest, which is why I decided to give Plow 4 instead of 5 stars.
I suggest either going super early or going during the weekdays if possible to avoid the 1.5hr+ wait.
