excerpts: Lemon ricotta pancakes were absolutely divine.
Moist, light and similar to thick eggy crepes except with a hint of lemon flavor.
My hubs ordered that and I ordered the scramble.
We shared both plates and it was the perfect portion for two since we both wanted a little bit of pancakes but not necessarily an entire plate to ourselves.
And if you have pancakes at brunch, you must have eggs.
And you can bet we will be ordering the lemon ricotta pancakes again.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Esther A.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Who would have thought Potrero Hill would have one of the most popular brunch places in SF? Wait might be a bit lengthy but we got lucky and only waited about 15 minutes. 

The first thing I've noticed was how clean the restaurant was. Tables were immediately scrubbed down, forks and knives were sparkling and spotless and so were the cups. It made me anticipate my meal even more.

Lemon ricotta pancakes were absolutely divine. Moist, light and similar to thick eggy crepes except with a hint of lemon flavor. My hubs ordered that and I ordered the scramble. We shared both plates and it was the perfect portion for two since we both wanted a little bit of pancakes but not necessarily an entire plate to ourselves. And if you have pancakes at brunch, you must have eggs. I wanted to try their chocolate pudding but we were too stuffed to eat another bite when we finished our dishes.

I can't wait to come back here for a weekend brunch again. And you can bet we will be ordering the lemon ricotta pancakes again.

excerpts: If you want to try everything, the Plow is a must - you get unreal bacon, delicious fluffy eggs, the world's best potatoes, and not-to-miss lemon ricotta pancakes.
If you're lucky enough to steal a bite of someone else's pancakes, the goat cheese and tomato eggs were fantastic, soft scrambled
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Leslie K.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Let me set the scene here - it's Wednesday morning at 9:30am and there is a crowd outside and a 45 minute wait. Yes, a random Wednesday morning. At that point, we knew we had to be in for an incredible meal. And let me just say, we weren't disappointed. 

If you want to try everything, the Plow is a must - you get unreal bacon, delicious fluffy eggs, the world's best potatoes, and not-to-miss lemon ricotta pancakes. If you're lucky enough to steal a bite of someone else's pancakes, the goat cheese and tomato eggs were fantastic, soft scrambled so they melted in your mouth. 

Don't forget to ask for the jam to go with your toast, you won't regret it.

excerpts: The Lemon Ricotta pancakes - to die for!!
The service was stellar!
We will definitely return.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Maria M.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: I took my family here for Sunday brunch based on the reviews and all I can say is Plow exceeded our expectations. The Lemon Ricotta pancakes - to die for!! The service was stellar! We will definitely return.

excerpts: Lemon Ricotta Pancakes -
I'm not the biggest breakfast person
and I only like to eat pancakes about once a year, but I could have these every day.
Sausage, bacon, eggs, crispy potatoes, lemon ricotta pancakes... the works.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Brittany B.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Lemon Ricotta Pancakes - I'm not the biggest breakfast person and I only like to eat pancakes about once a year, but I could have these every day. They were lemon breakfast dessert clouds of yumminess.

Crispy Potatoes - The kind of homefries that are cooked in some sort of wonderful fat. There were pieces of all sizes, but my favorite were the really small crispies that were like shavings of salty fried butter. 

The Plow - One of the people I was eating with said it best, "They took all the best parts of breakfast and put it on a humungous plate." Sausage, bacon, eggs, crispy potatoes, lemon ricotta pancakes... the works.

excerpts: What I REALLY loved were the mini lemon ricotta pancakes.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Amanda G.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
After reading rave reviews, I really wanted to check this place out. 
I had read the wait on weekends was crazy, so we decided to go the day before X-mas Eve, since my guy had the day off. 

Unfortunately, there was still about a 30 minute wait. We were a group of 4, but i saw groups of 2 waiting awhile as well. 

The space is small, and feels a little cramped, but I liked being able to see the action in the kitchen, (and check out the food coming out.) 

My guy and I shared the much revered egg sandwich, and the plow. The sandwich was good, and the potatoes were as awesome as everyone says. What I REALLY loved were the mini lemon ricotta pancakes. So glad my guy and i ordered the way we did, we got to taste more things this way. 

I agree with other reviewers that the portions are smaller than a lot of breakfast places. But, all the products are sourced locally, and organic, (even the sausage is made in-house.) 
You're getting much higher quality food here than at your run-of-mill breakfast joint. 

If i lived in the neighborhood, i would be back, but not if the wait was over 30 minutes.I 'm just not that patient. 

On the day we were here, Charles Phan, and the owner of Gialina's & Ragazza, (she makes the best pizza around) were eating here too. I think that speaks volumes about the kind of food they're dishing out here.

excerpts: I got the plow and the lemon ricotta pancakes weren't phenomenal, they were sort of bready, burnt and a bit on the smaller side as a part of the combo.
And the pancakes came on the same plate as the rest of my crowded plate... which meant syrup leaking into my eggs and potatoes...
The eggs, apple sausage were mediocre - I could have replicated something similar @ home.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Christine B.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
I really really wanted to love this place with all my heart.... I had been dreaming of the day I could eat here - It was on my "SF Bucket List" Finally after sitting outside for 45-50 minutes on a Tuesday morning at 11 -- my rumbling tummy met with the plow... pancakes, potatoes, eggs sausage for about $15.

I got the plow and the lemon ricotta pancakes weren't phenomenal, they were sort of bready, burnt and a bit on the smaller side as a part of the combo. And the pancakes came on the same plate as the rest of my crowded plate... which meant syrup leaking into my eggs and potatoes...  The eggs, apple sausage were mediocre - I could have replicated something similar @ home. The highlight of the plate were the potatoes though -  super crispey on the outside like a fry, but soft on the inside like a baked potato. 

The service was good - the staff were upbeat and welcoming. Food wasn't brought out quickly and they seated 5 of us at a table and bench made for 4. Maybe eating with my elbow in my friends face made the food taste less good?

Overall - it's ok, but not worth 45 minutes though.

excerpts: I ordered "The Plow" which consists of 2 lemon ricotta pancakes, crispy potatoes, eggs your way, and your choice of bacon, chicken apple sausage, or the house sausage.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Marcus B.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Two words: crispy potatoes. 

I came here for brunch after a night of drinking well tequila at a bar whose name is slipping my mind. We got here on a Tuesday around 1030 and the place was packed. Luckily we didn't have to wait long for a table for 3. The staff is friendly and attentive. 

I ordered "The Plow" which consists of 2 lemon ricotta pancakes, crispy potatoes, eggs your way, and your choice of bacon, chicken apple sausage, or the house sausage.

I cleaned my plate! This place  is awesome and I wish there was something similar to it around where I live.

I will definitely be back if I'm ever in the area. 

Go get Plowed! (Sorry, couldn't resist.)

excerpts: Get their lemon ricotta pancakes or "The Plow."
If they have buttermilk biscuits, don't miss 'em!
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Thomas B.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
One word...wow.  :)  

Get their lemon ricotta pancakes or "The Plow."  If they have buttermilk biscuits, don't miss 'em!

excerpts: However, the lemon ricotta pancakes with the citrus-y syrup was deeelicious!
I actually dipped my bacon, and then my potatoes when the bacon ran out, into that maple syrup and cleaned up 2 mini pitchers of it.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Kate Y.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Right off the bat, I liked Plow. It looked like a crazy wait outside and the hostess told us it would be a 20 minute wait. They had this self-serve coffee section inside so we sipped some coffee and were seated within 10 minutes. Thank you for not lying to us and telling us it's a 20 minute wait when really it's 40 minutes like some other brunch places out there....

We got the fried egg sandwich and "the plow" which had everything. Fried egg sandwich was tasty, but didn't exactly meet my requirements to be called "heavenly". However, the lemon ricotta pancakes with the citrus-y syrup was deeelicious! I actually dipped my bacon, and then my potatoes when the bacon ran out, into that maple syrup and cleaned up 2 mini pitchers of it. Everything else was great but not spectacular. 

Just an fyi though, I totally thought that the coffee everyone got waiting for a table was free...like a "Thank you for waking up at 7:30am on a Sunday morning to brunch here only to have to wait outside in the cold anyways" type of free coffee, which I thought was so sweet of Plow. But then I saw a $4/cup charge on my bill. hmph...

excerpts: I had a hard time deciding between the lemon ricotta pancakes and the eggs benedict.
We sat at the counter and were able to watch the food being prepared, which after the long wait time, only made us hungrier.
Every plate that left the kitchen looked amazing.
We ended up with the eggs benedict with ham, and an egg sandwich.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Lisa N.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Every once in a while I get a craving for some hearty breakfast food, and Plow hits the spot!  The brunch menu isn't extensive, but everything on it sounds positively scrumptious...I had a hard time deciding between the lemon ricotta pancakes and the eggs benedict. We sat at the counter and were able to watch the food being prepared, which after the long wait time, only made us hungrier.  Every plate that left the kitchen looked amazing. We ended up with the eggs benedict with ham, and an egg sandwich. The farm fresh ingredients they use make everything taste better, right down to the eggs.  

The only downside of this place is that like every other popular breakfast/brunch place in the city, there is always a line. We came around 11:30 on a Saturday, and were told it would be a 45 minute to an hour wait. Also, the food took a while to get to the counter; it looked like they miss-timed some of the orders and were backed up. On the whole, I'm glad we decided to wait it out--the service was friendly and welcoming, and parking was relatively easy to find in this neighborhood.

lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Rebecca B.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
I had never been to this neighborhood west of Dogpatch and enjoyed discovering this area of San Francisco. Landing at Plow, I waited in the breeziness of this hilly area for a table which seemed to go fast, maybe half an hour, and sat in the staggered benches going up the contour of the hills implanted into the outside of the restaurant. A very nice touch in planning for patrons to be comfortable during the wait. Makes for a great touristy, artsy photo op. 

We were seated at the first table and the breeziness stayed with us throughout our meal.  Kinda chilly with everyone coming and going in and out of Plow.  There is a constant flow of hipster people hooked to their smartphones and wearing Tom's shoes.

Then it was time to eat the lemon ricotta pancakes-a must.
Hash- beans and vegetables but no corned beef
Smashed potatoes-very delicious
French toast- bread pudding like
Tomato bread soup-fresh flavors
Sausage paddies- had a kick
Coffee-full bodied

One of my favorite things about eating breakfast here is watching the subtle antics of the white lab in the garden/lighting store across the street. The doggy appears through the windowed door that seems to be custom made for this sweet looking dog. Charming!

Coffee is always good.
Prepare to wait if you go on peak brunch hours of 9:30-11:30.

MMMMM delicious!
The bacon was nice and thick, the egg was cooked perfectly and the bun they use is acme, so, can't go wrong there.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Delilah B.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
The Venue:  Very bright with natural lighting.  Simple and clean looking.  

The Price:  A little on the high end for breakfast.

The wait:  I've driven by quite a few times and it's always packed.  So we decided to go when they opened.  8am.  There are no reservations so you may have to wait.  The bad thing about coming first thing is you get the first wave wait.  It wasn't as bad as some places, but it beats waiting outside or standing.  :)

The neighborhood:  It's in Potrero Hill/ Dogpatch area so everywhere around there is pretty cute and quaint.

The food:  They have a great menu and everything sounds awesome.  
We had The Plow:  eggs, sausage, lemon ricotta pancakes and crispy potatoes.
 Pretty basic for an arm and a leg.  The lemon ricotta pancakes were pretty tasty.  The eggs and bacon were cooked perfectly but the crispy potatoes... weren't so crispy.
We also had the egg sandwich with bacon.  MMMMM delicious!  The bacon was nice and thick, the egg was cooked perfectly and the bun they use is acme, so, can't go wrong there.  The whole sandwich was melt in your mouth perfect.

I would definitely come again and will so that I can try out all of there other delicious menu items.

excerpts: Lemon Ricotta Pancakes.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Cavin T.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Sunday 21st April 2013

Goal: Lemon Ricotta Pancakes. 

Destination: Plow

Time and distance to destination: 15 minutes, 2.1 miles. 

Its time. 

Been hearing the reviews about this baby and decided on a late sunday afternoon to go get me some pancakes. Weather was sunny and i only had to wait for 20 minutes, give or take. Be sure to check the wait every now and then cause the server had almost cross my name because they forgot to check the page that had my name. 

Nevertheless, i absolutely loved the pancakes. It was soft, and the right amount of layers(some pancakes are so thick in SF) that i can never finish it. I was GLAD to finish mine in a serving. Also, the crab dungeness scramble is a must try! Other than that i think the menu is a pretty standard weekend brunch. Service was great, always got my water filled, and the server was polite and knows a lot about the menu. 

Decor wise, i love the wood tables, thats a plus, any place with wooden tables, i absolutely love it. Love the big windows...but i do think they should at least make a separate restroom for the men and women. Just for hygienic sake....

Destination complete. 
Im in pursuit of the perfect pancake in SF, 
till next time. Over and out.

excerpts: I had been craving their lemon ricotta pancakes, and dragged my husband out of bed early yesterday morning.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Marissa K.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
This is one of the saddest, most frustrating reviews I've ever had to write. I discovered Plow in its first months and I was so excited. It had been forever since a really awesome new breakfast place knocked my socks off in SF. Everything was amazing, the restaurant was quaint and busy and clean, the service was impeccable. I came here again and again, and recommended it to my friends enthusiastically. I never wanted to yelp it because, selfishly, I hoped that it wouldn't become *too* popular. Of course, it did become popular, and the lines on the weekends got longer. Even so, I got up at 7am many a Saturday or Sunday morning to make it by 8am and beat the line. It was worth it. 

I first noticed things slipping in March 2012. I came with 2 other people, waited for an hour+ (wasn't surprised, I knew we'd have to wait). Then we were seated at a 4-top. However, the host informed us that really, we were only allowed to have one half of the table, and they were going to put a chair on the long end and seat another party in the other two seats. Yes, a table for 2 people (a standard 2-top) with a chair pushed onto a longside (in the tiny aisle). We couldn't even fit 3 plates of food and our water glasses on the table. We asked if we could wait for a larger table and were told no. Apparently, they only seat 3 people at tables for 2. OK. Even though it was expensive, and we were squished and basically sharing our table with strangers, I came back again and again anyway because the food was delicious, and aside from the seating issues, the service was good. 

I had been craving their lemon ricotta pancakes, and dragged my husband out of bed early yesterday morning. I was so excited to get there and be first in line when the doors opened. 

We both ordered a coffee (they are $3.75 a piece, btw). Of course, it was 8am, and I drank my first cup in 5 minutes. Nobody came by to ask if I wanted a refill, so after trying to get someone's attention for 10 minutes, I got up and poured a refill myself. Remember, I was the first table in the restaurant. Nobody could possibly have been in the weeds yet. 

The food came, and my bacon was practically raw. The waitress had set our food down and began taking the order of the table next to us. I waited until they were done and then tried to get her attention politely. I was probably too quiet and she didn't hear me. I said excuse me a little louder. And a little louder. I wasn't trying to be rude, just wanted to get her attention before she walked away since she hadn't been attentive and I didn't want to eat cold food. She seemed incredibly annoyed, even though I was nothing but polite about it. I thanked her profusely. She still hadn't offered me a single refill, so when she brought the bacon back, I asked for one. This also seemed to irritate her. Can I say it again? It was 8am. There's no reason for anything to be off with your first table of the day!

Alone, that would be just bad service. But the food wasn't good. Like, not even diner-level good. My scrambled eggs were passable. The bacon came back fine. My lemon-ricotta pancakes were cold and rubbery. They tasted like they were day-old and had been sitting on the plate for an hour. My husband's eggs benedict (his usual favorite) was watery -- like the eggs hadn't been dried off before they were dropped on the spinach. And there was the tiniest serving of hollandaise sauce -- a smattering on top. These items used to be amazing. They were not just less-than amazing, they were subpar. If the waitress had been even the tiniest bit attentive, I might have pointed these things out to her. But at that point, I could feel her irritation, and I didn't want to complain to her about basically everything, particularly considering she was annoyed that I wanted a coffee refill.

I wouldn't return to eat that food. Combine that with the irritated service from the waitress whose long hair wasn't tied back, but hanging over her shoulder. And the fact that this cost us $50. Two coffees and two breakfasts. 

Minus 1 star each for the food, the service, the wait and the price that adds insult to injury. I'm sorry, Plow. It was good when it was good. Now, I'm just happy to never return.

excerpts: LOVED the fried potatoes and the lemon ricotta pancakes were yummy.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Nina L.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
It's rare that both of us are awake before 8 on a Saturday so when we found ourselves up and starving at 7:30, we hopped in the car and headed over to Plow.  Got there just in time for the doors to open so there was no wait.  Good thing too because the restaurant filled up very quickly.  It's a really cute space and they had tables and chairs set-up outside too.  

We started with the donut holes filled with an awesome lemon curd.  The lemon curd had a tart kick but was smooth and creamy inside some hot fried dough.  I had the french toast with vanilla-poached pears.  It was sweet and savory and satisfying.  Husband at The Plow and it did not disappoint.  LOVED the fried potatoes and the lemon ricotta pancakes were yummy.  

The quality of the food was excellent and they get fresh and local ingredients from vendors I recognize from the farmer's market nearby.

excerpts: The Lemon Ricotta pancakes are my favorite!
Love the atmosphere and friendly staff.
There is often a long wait, but the food is worth it!
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Lisa K.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: The Lemon Ricotta pancakes are my favorite! Love the atmosphere and friendly staff. There is often a long wait, but the food is worth it!

excerpts: As for three rest of "The Plow" (everyone should begin the day with a good plow), the lemon ricotta pancakes are delicious.
The eggs were good, but nothing special.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Hester B.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
I'm now ruined for all other potatoes. Are they deep fried? The texture is soft in the center and crispy in the outside with perfect seasoning. As for three rest of "The Plow" (everyone should begin the day with a good plow), the lemon ricotta pancakes are delicious. The eggs were good, but nothing special. Good coffee, also nothing special.

What I found confusing was how this place could be full with a waiting list at 10:30am on a weekday morning. I can't even imagine what the weekend must be like.

excerpts: The lemon ricotta pancakes were the best, and I, of course, saved it for last.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Zell C.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Every time I pass by, there's always a line. People are willing to wait more than an hour for a seat? Peaked my interest, but I don't have time for that. Seriously.

This time, we were lucky. Got parking, and got seated for two in less than 5 minutes. Had to get The Plow, which seemed to have a little bit of everything on the menu, and it was delicious! Had we waited more than 30 minutes for a table, my expectations would be higher. The crispy potatoes were a bit salty, but the ketchup saved it. The lemon ricotta pancakes were the best, and I, of course, saved it for last.

Right when we left, there were about 15 people waiting out the door for a seat.

excerpts: The lemon ricotta pancakes are amazing, and the fried egg sandwich is wonderful, but best of all was the bacon, and I don't eat bacon.
Everyone at our table raved about it so much that I gave it a try.
I'm so glad I did.
We also ordered the delicious biscuits to take home.
There was no way we were going to be able to eat them there.
The portions are very generous!
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Marie C.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: We knew going in that we would have a long wait for breakfast, so we came prepared to stroll over to a coffee shop to grab some caffein and view the neighborhood.  When we were seated our server was friendly and efficient, and our meal came quickly.....and everyone ate way too much.  The lemon ricotta pancakes are amazing, and the fried egg sandwich is wonderful, but best of all was the bacon, and I don't eat bacon.  Everyone at our table raved about it so much that I gave it a try.  I'm so glad I did.  We also ordered the delicious biscuits to take home.  There was no way we were going to be able to eat them there.  The portions are very generous!

excerpts: The lemon ricotta pancakes were very light and tasty and were probably the best thing I had.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Blake B.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Only three stars you ask?  Well 3 stars in my book means that a place was good but not extraordinary.  My wife and I went this past weekend and we had to wait for about an hour outside which wasn't ideal.  We thought the meal was going to be amazing though and like I said it was good.  

We sat at the counter and was able to see all of the goodness being made.  We started with the fried doughnut holes which were good but crispier than I thought they were going to be.  I had the plow and it was a lot of food but very good.  I got it with the housemade pork sausage which was delicious.  The lemon ricotta pancakes were very light and tasty and were probably the best thing I had.

The meal was good and place pretty cool but I think there are other breakfast places I'd rather wait an hour for.

excerpts:
The class made the following menu items: 
 Pecan streusel muffins
 Lemon ricotta pancakes (and for those who don't know, the ricotta is home made, not store bough...talk about fresh)
 Shirred eggs with tomato and gruyere
 Biscuits and gravy
Quiche
And of course the lemon ricotta pancakes and the plow potatoes that I have read so much about were better than I expected.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Kristen T.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
I enrolled in a Sunday morning Plow class offered by the San Francisco Cooking School and had the wonderful experience of cooking several of Plow's menu items with the owners, Maxine and Joel. I have never been to their restaurant but after reading all the wonderful reviews I thought, "what a great opportunity!" 
 First and for most, the owners of Plow are incredibly nice people.  It's was very obvious while speaking with them that they have a love and passion for what they do: making delicious food, using fresh ingredients, and quality over quantity. 

The class made the following menu items: 
 Pecan streusel muffins
 Lemon ricotta pancakes (and for those who don't know, the ricotta is home made, not store bough...talk about fresh)
 Shirred eggs with tomato and gruyere
 Biscuits and gravy
 Quiche
 Chinese breakfast (caramelized pork shoulder with eggs over rice)
 Plow potatoes 
 Smoked trout salad

 Breakfast is my favorite meal; I love it all and was so impressed with the meal we made! The pork shoulder in the Chinese breakfast was mouthwatering. The tomato sauce for the shirred eggs...so fresh, a taste you would expect from an Italian restaurant. The savory sausage gravy over perfected buttermilk biscuits...amazing! And of course the lemon ricotta pancakes and the plow potatoes that I have read so much about were better than I expected. I am very picky about home fries/hash browns, and often find most restaurants just miss the mark, but Plow's technique of cooking their potatoes ensures every bite is full of flavor. 

I can not say enough about my breakfast experience!! I will soon make a trip to the city with my husband so he can experience the goodness of Plow.

excerpts: My lemon ricotta pancakes were also fluffy and delicious, with just enough lemon.
Did not care for their chicken apple sausage though- only thing I didn't finish on my plate.
My husband also enjoyed his ham eggs benedict.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Sophia B.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: The wait was about 15 minutes for a table outside on Saturday at 9:30 am. I ordered the plow with chicken apple sausage. My favorite was, surprisingly, their potatoes. I devoured them. A tad too salty, but fried to absolute perfection. My lemon ricotta pancakes were also fluffy and delicious, with just enough lemon. Did not care for their chicken apple sausage though- only thing I didn't finish on my plate. My husband also enjoyed his ham eggs benedict.

excerpts: The lemon ricotta pancakes are delicious.
Also really liked the baked biscuit.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: David M.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: Really tasty and cute brunch spot. The wait can be painful (3 hours one time i went, 1 hour the other). If you live close by it works out well because you can just put your name down and come back later. The lemon ricotta pancakes are delicious. Also really liked the baked biscuit.

excerpts: Lemon ricotta pancakes are the balm a must try.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Janna W.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: I have been in this area for months on business & I go to plow almost every weekend. Food is great as well as service. Always packed & can be long wait times but WELL worth the wait. A little on the spendy side but better to pay for great food then not so great. Lemon ricotta pancakes are the balm a must try.

excerpts: I often find myself craving their lemon ricotta pancakes and when that happens, nothing else will do.
They really are that good.
And other dishes are reliably good in a way where you can't really go wrong.
BUT...my husband and eating partner-in-crime pretty much always orders eggs benedict at Plow and at any other breakfast/brunch establishment.
The past maybe 5-7 trips to Plow have resulted in unpredictably cooked eggs on this dish.
About 50% of the time, one or both of the eggs in his eggs benedict have been overcooked and either partially or completely lack a runny yolk...total bummer for an eggs benedict lover.
We began to sort of hold our breath as he'd cut into his eggs, not really knowing what to expect.
We placed our typical huge order: coffee, orange juice, pastry of the day and cold-smoked salmon toast to share, lemon ricotta pancakes, and eggs benedict.
(Told you - major fatties.)
About 5 minutes after placing our order, we decided we wanted a side of bacon.
So we asked our server if we could add this and were told it would be no problem.
I mean, it's bacon,
right?
That should be pretty easy to toss in.
So our food starts to come out
and we dig in.
First the pastry and salmon toast, then the pancakes and eggs benedict.
No bacon in sight.
We don't want to be jerks
so we don't say anything just thinking that it'll show up soon.
Well, fast forward to the end of our meal.
We are to the point where our plates are empty and the server is asking us if she can clear them.
We say Of Course!
and also toss in that the bacon never arrived and that we don't need it at this point.
Maxine overheard this and it immediately throws herself into our interaction by saying, "It's coming out right now" with what felt like a snippy tone.
I sort of felt like we were in trouble but still managed to sheepishly say, "But we're all done with our food.
I mean, our plates are being taken away," to which Maxine  curtly replied,
"So you don't want it then?
Maybe it's just me
but it's not fun going out to eat and
then feeling getting scolded by the owner and being made to feel like you've done something wrong.
Actually, we were sort of expecting an apology when she jumped into the conversation.
When she first started to speak, what I was expecting was more of a
"I'm so sorry!
It looks like you guys are done eating.
Do you still want the bacon even though it's late?
Totally fine if you don't.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Amy K.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
What a difference a couple years makes. I wrote a review of Plow a little over 3 years ago and after many more visits, I feel compelled to update my review. 

THE FOOD: Still good, sometimes great. I often find myself craving their lemon ricotta pancakes and when that happens, nothing else will do. They really are that good. And other dishes are reliably good in a way where you can't really go wrong. BUT...my husband and eating partner-in-crime pretty much always orders eggs benedict at Plow and at any other breakfast/brunch establishment. The past maybe 5-7 trips to Plow have resulted in unpredictably cooked eggs on this dish. About 50% of the time, one or both of the eggs in his eggs benedict have been overcooked and either partially or completely lack a runny yolk...total bummer for an eggs benedict lover. We began to sort of hold our breath as he'd cut into his eggs, not really knowing what to expect. Otherwise, the food has continued to be reliably good for the most part.

THE SERVICE: Sadly, it's the service that's prompted me to update my humble review. And let me say that I'm not taking to my computer after one negative experience like some crazy hothead. Being totally reasonable, I can appreciate Plow having an "off" day. It's only after this started to become the norm that I took notice. Here are a couple examples of recent experiences:

- Husband and I recently sat at the counter just on the other side of the glass from Maxine, the owner. We placed our typical huge order: coffee, orange juice, pastry of the day and cold-smoked salmon toast to share, lemon ricotta pancakes, and eggs benedict. (Told you - major fatties.) About 5 minutes after placing our order, we decided we wanted a side of bacon. So we asked our server if we could add this and were told it would be no problem. I mean, it's bacon, right? That should be pretty easy to toss in. So our food starts to come out and we dig in. First the pastry and salmon toast, then the pancakes and eggs benedict. No bacon in sight. We don't want to be jerks so we don't say anything just thinking that it'll show up soon. Well, fast forward to the end of our meal. We are to the point where our plates are empty and the server is asking us if she can clear them. We say Of Course! and also toss in that the bacon never arrived and that we don't need it at this point. Maxine overheard this and it immediately throws herself into our interaction by saying, "It's coming out right now" with what felt like a snippy tone. I sort of felt like we were in trouble but still managed to sheepishly say, "But we're all done with our food. I mean, our plates are being taken away," to which Maxine  curtly replied, "So you don't want it then?" Maybe it's just me but it's not fun going out to eat and then feeling getting scolded by the owner and being made to feel like you've done something wrong. Actually, we were sort of expecting an apology when she jumped into the conversation. When she first started to speak, what I was expecting was more of a "I'm so sorry! It looks like you guys are done eating. Do you still want the bacon even though it's late? Totally fine if you don't." 

- Last weekend we had some family in town and wanted to take them to Plow as we definitely enjoy the food. Knowing that a monster wait develops almost immediately, we got there at 7:30am to ensure we were the first people in line. As we stood there waiting, we all took turns studying the menu hanging on the front door planning what we were going to get. My husband, of course, was telling our family how he always gets the eggs benedict and that it's his favorite. So my mother decides she wants to try it too. The door opens at 8am and in we go. My mom orders first and requests the eggs benedict. The server quickly says, "I'm so sorry but the eggs benedict isn't available yet." And we're all crestfallen. Half of our party was planning to order eggs benedict and it's really the one breakfast thing my husband will eat. So my husband politely asks, "What does that mean - 'not ready'?" She says their hollandaise sauce isn't ready yet and that it should take about 30 minutes. So we ask for a few minutes to figure out our plan. We decide we've got plenty of time and decide to wait the 30 minutes with some extra smaller plates to start. When the server returns, we tell her we're going to wait for the eggs benedict but order a few smaller things in the meantime. She says, "I can't do that and have you hold the table that long." We go back and forth and then my husband asks why it takes so long to make hollandaise. He tells her it only takes a few minutes to do and that he doesn't understand. She says she doesn't know how it's made but she'll go ask and is clearly miffed with us. She returns quickly and says, "Okay, they'll do it. It's ready." But we definitely feel the brunt of her irritation and again feel like we're in the  Principal's office and have done something wrong. Major mood-killer and unnecessary.

excerpts: I had the lemon ricotta pancakes, which were nice and syrupy, but not sickeningly sweet.
My friends had the soft egg scramble (smelled great) and the 9-grain muffin (toasted perfectly) with homemade peanut butter and honey, which were also both delicious.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Vijay N.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
"Good, fresh food, but don't arrive on an empty stomach because you could wait for over one and a half hours for brunch."

Our party of three was seated for Sunday brunch at 12:05 after having given our names in at 10:30.  The line was consistently long the entire time we were in the neighborhood, so unless you come substantially earlier I don't think there's any avoiding the queue.  You can grab a coffee from them (a nice brew) while you're in line, but I would eat something before coming, anticipating that brunch could actually become lunch before you know it.

The food at Plow is very fresh and quite tasty.  I had the lemon ricotta pancakes, which were nice and syrupy, but not sickeningly sweet.  My friends had the soft egg scramble (smelled great) and the 9-grain muffin (toasted perfectly) with homemade peanut butter and honey, which were also both delicious.  The market fruit platter consists of a tiny portion of grapes and berries and a sliver of a mango for $6; the other items we ordered were on the pricey side but not unreasonable.

Overall, I think that eating at Plow could have been a  great experience, but, feeling faint and starving after the long wait, I devoured my food and didn't have a chance to enjoy the flavors or the ambiance.  If you have a scout who can get your name on the list early or want to wander around the pretty Potrero Hill neighborhood for a while on a lazy, sunny Sunday, Plow is a great place to eat.  But I wouldn't recommend taking it in on an empty stomach.

excerpts: The potatoes lived up to the hype and the lemon ricotta pancakes were a divine finish to the meal though the housemade pork sausage patties were probably my least favorite - they lacked salt or a kick in my opinion.
Plus coffee is bottomless so caffeinate away!
I'd love to try the breakfast sandwich next time or some other things
- everything looked so delicious.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Teresa T.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: I now understand the hype about Plow though the wait is ridiculous! We had a friend thankfully who lived nearby Plow so she put in our names two hours ahead of time for weekend brunch - we were a table of six. Otherwise I'm not sure if I would have waited that day - while Plow provides tea and coffee while you wait you are outside and it was drizzling that day so would have been miserable. The space is small and there is only one unisex bathroom behind a curtain. I ordered The Plow and couldn't help myself but to devour the entirety of it. The potatoes lived up to the hype and the lemon ricotta pancakes were a divine finish to the meal though the housemade pork sausage patties were probably my least favorite - they lacked salt or a kick in my opinion. Plus coffee is bottomless so caffeinate away! I'd love to try the breakfast sandwich next time or some other things - everything looked so delicious.

excerpts: The highlight of the meal was certainly the lemon ricotta pancakes, which I advise you save for last!
They were just the right size, moist, and flavorful.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Crystal J.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
If it weren't for the one hour and fifteen minute wait before being seated, I would rate this place five stars. I had their signature brunch item,  "the plow." I loved the crispy potatoes, and the chicken apple sausage was also tasty.  I ordered my eggs scrambled, and wasn't too satisfied - while they were certainly well-cooked,  they were rather bland and tasteless. 

The highlight of the meal was certainly the lemon ricotta pancakes, which I advise you save for last! They were just the right size, moist, and flavorful. The maple syrup is also fantastic. 

I'd probably return, but I'd make sure to get there right when it opens at 8 am to get a seat immediately.

excerpts: I had the "Plow" which has the works:  eggs, bacon, potatoes and the famed lemon ricotta pancakes.
Every component was awesome and cooked to perfection.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Chris K.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
The girls were in the area for some jewelry repair and needed to get lunch so we decided to make it an adventure.  The hostess was incredibly sweet and rather than the attitude you get at a lot of places with a big following she told us she'd seat us asap since we had little ones in tow.

I had the "Plow" which has the works:  eggs, bacon, potatoes and the famed lemon ricotta pancakes.  Every component was awesome and cooked to perfection.  The potatoes were seriously amazingly crisp and savory.  

Our server was really sweet and efficient.  This is definitely a kid-friendly place...they have a kid's menu and crayons that kept the girls occupied.  Parking is also easy and free.  

Can't wait to bring the males back to try it out :)

excerpts:
what my friends and I ordered: 

the plow (two eggs (any style), crispy potatoes, bacon or chicken-apple sausage, two (smaller than the full-plate option) lemon ricotta pancakes: amazing combination!
the lemon ricotta pancakes were good
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Patricia K.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Cute brunch place with delicious food!

what my friends and I ordered: 

the plow (two eggs (any style), crispy potatoes, bacon or chicken-apple sausage, two (smaller than the full-plate option) lemon ricotta pancakes: amazing combination! I get a little bit of everything which is perfect. the lemon ricotta pancakes were good but I had a bite of my friend's almond pancakes and those were AMAZING (just the perfect hint of almond flavor- not overbearing but lingers in your mouth long enough for you to crave more!)

I highly recommend going on a weekday. my friends and i arrived on a friday morning around 9:30am and waited ~20 minutes for seats in front of the restaurant (longer wait if you want to sit inside). 

you should definitely check this place out if you like brunch and you're willing to wait!

lemon ricotta pancakes.author: jonathan g.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: The wait is long, but food soooo worth it, get the plow a little bit of everything and soo good and the lemon ricotta pancakes were BomB!

lemon ricotta pancakes.review:

excerpts: The Plow comes with two eggs, crispy potatoes, lemon ricotta pancakes and a choice of meat.
The lemon ricotta pancakes are fluffy, although i usually don't opt for anything lemon-y, these were really good
and I did eat it all.
The eggs were perfectly cooked to my liking.
I really wish I can mimic their crispy potatoes because they are the BEST breakfast potatoes I ever eaten; it is extra crispy on the outside, but not at all over cooked on the inside.
The chicken apple sausage was yummy too.
Everything on the plate complimented well with one another.
The fried egg sandwich has frisee, cheese and two friend eggs between a soft warm bun.
I don't really like frisee
but it really worked well with the cheese and the saltiness of the egg.
The sandwich also comes with crispy potatoes.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Jeannie C.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Every time I visit SF, my sister brings me to a "must try" place. This past weekend she brought me here for breakfast. We got around the area around 8:30 am and parking was easy to find and best of all no wait to get seated. My sister did warn me on the weekend, however, the wait can be over an hour so I am glad we were there on a Friday. 

They have great options on their menu but I had my sister decide what to get. We decided on The Plow and the Fried egg sandwich. The Plow comes with two eggs, crispy potatoes, lemon ricotta pancakes and a choice of meat. We chose the plate with chicken apple sausage. 

Both plates were delicious. The freshness in the ingredients were there. The Plow is a great option if you want a hearty breakfast. The lemon ricotta pancakes are fluffy, although i usually don't opt for anything lemon-y, these were really good and I did eat it all. The eggs were perfectly cooked to my liking. I really wish I can mimic their crispy potatoes because they are the BEST breakfast potatoes I ever eaten; it is extra crispy on the outside, but not at all over cooked on the inside. The chicken apple sausage was yummy too. Everything on the plate complimented well with one another. The fried egg sandwich has frisee, cheese and two friend eggs between a soft warm bun. I don't really like frisee but it really worked well with the cheese and the saltiness of the egg. The sandwich also comes with crispy potatoes. 

Service was friendly and quick. It is very cozy in there...just the way I like it in this type of places especially in the Bay. Can't wait to return.

excerpts: The lemon ricotta pancakes are amazing.
I don't usually order pancakes, but these had a great texture and tasted amazing!
They're perhaps on the sweet side when you add the syrup, but sinfully good.
I also tried the chicken tinga and I loved the sauce tomato chipotle sauce.
This plate was light and refreshing, but packed a punch of flavor.
The only falter was the bacon.
I loved the taste but it arrived luke warm and SO greasy (see pic).
Even the plate it came on was splattered in grease.
I loved our server though - she was very friendly and kept the coffee coming!
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Vicente G.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
I felt a little guilty eating brunch at this cute, neighborhood restaurant. We sat outside among the passing joggers and even the table next to us had just finished a morning run. We had just rolled out of bed and wanted to gorge on a delicious brunch! 

And Plow delivered. The lemon ricotta pancakes are amazing. I don't usually order pancakes, but these had a great texture and tasted amazing! They're perhaps on the sweet side when you add the syrup, but sinfully good. I also tried the chicken tinga and I loved the sauce tomato chipotle sauce. This plate was light and refreshing, but packed a punch of flavor. The only falter was the bacon. I loved the taste but it arrived luke warm and SO greasy (see pic). Even the plate it came on was splattered in grease. I loved our server though - she was very friendly and kept the coffee coming!

excerpts: We split the crab scramble and the lemon ricotta pancakes with light and crispy house potatoes.
The crab was a bit grey-looking and lacked flavor, but I'm certain it's not reflective of the overall menu because everything else was fantastic.
And our server was sweet and prompt.
I would definitely go back to try other items on the menu.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Mariela D.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Lemon. Ricotta. Pancakes.

Light, fluffy and almost cake-like, Plow's ingenius twist on this familiar breakfast item makes the trip (and the wait) worth it. 

Tucked away into the Potrero hillside overlooking the city, Plow is just so freakin' charming. On any given weekend, you'll find a small crowd of people waiting for their name to be called, gathered near the dog-toting brunchers and young couples taking residence on their streetside tables. get there by 2pm, get your name on the list and be prepared for a bit of a wait.

My sister and I snagged a couple of seats at the bar. Mimosa for me, lemonade for her. We split the crab scramble and the lemon ricotta pancakes with light and crispy house potatoes. The crab was a bit grey-looking and lacked flavor, but I'm certain it's not reflective of the overall menu because everything else was fantastic. And our server was sweet and prompt. I would definitely go back to try other items on the menu.

excerpts: I had the most deliciously greasy fried egg sandwich, and my dining partner had the amazing lemon ricotta pancakes.
I also really enjoyed the breakfast potatoes.
Their not-so-secret ingredient in those seemed to be thyme.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Mike S.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
I walked up a series of really, really steep hills to get to Plow. But it was absolutely worth it. I had the most deliciously greasy fried egg sandwich, and my dining partner had the amazing lemon ricotta pancakes. I also really enjoyed the breakfast potatoes. Their not-so-secret ingredient in those seemed to be thyme. In my opinion, they were dangerously close to having too much thyme, but I love thyme so that didn't bother me.

The space is cute and unique. All around, one of my favorite brunch spots in San Francisco.

excerpts: To finish it off with a sweetness he lemon ricotta pancakes are also amazing (though I will say for all the hype they got, I've had just as good of lemon ricotta pancakes other places.)
For a brunch day with the girls-I would certainly wait, grab a coffee down the street at Farleys and hang out with the crowd in sunny potrero!!
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Sarah F.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
I'll start off saying, I am probably slightly biased because 1. I LOVE brunch and 2. I live in potrero hill. This place often has up to or over a 2 hour wait for weekend brunch, so for me I can out my name in, go home and get ready then come back to eat. The great thing is, they let you come back after your name was called and move to the top of the list (supporting locals basically-which is great!!).
On to the food-delicious. Though they don't always have them the sausage patties with the biscuits are a great starter. The crispy potatoes-wow (so perfectly cooked and seasoned-live up to the hype). The eggs Benedict is not by any means the best I've had-but it is delicious! To finish it off with a sweetness he lemon ricotta pancakes are also amazing (though I will say for all the hype they got, I've had just as good of lemon ricotta pancakes other places.)
For a brunch day with the girls-I would certainly wait, grab a coffee down the street at Farleys and hang out with the crowd in sunny potrero!!

excerpts: Those damn lemon ricotta pancakes are TO.
DIE.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Alex T.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Those damn lemon ricotta pancakes are TO. DIE. FOR.

Currently in my kitchen coming up with my own recipe for them...would love to eat them for lunch and dinner too!

Gotta order these if you come here!!!

excerpts: I ordered the lemon ricotta pancakes.
They are crave-worthy.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Katie D.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
OMG I love this place!! Get there right away when they open to get a table! 

We went in mid June when we visited the city. 

I ordered the lemon ricotta pancakes. They are crave-worthy. If I lived in the city again, we would be going here at least twice a month for them.

My husband ordered the breakfast sandwich. It was delicious and the potatoes were perfect. My daughter had the kids eggs, sausage, and potatoes and ate more than she normally does at any given meal time.

I'll be visiting again next time I'm in town!

excerpts:
In the interest of tasting as many items as possible - I got the Plow breakfast, with lemon ricotta pancakes, pork sausage, scrambled eggs, and their revered crispy potatoes. 

And the lemon ricotta pancakes were just a hint of sweet which I really appreciate.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Allison V.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Although I moved to the neighborhood about 9 months ago, I hadn't yet tried this place because the wait is JUST. SO. LONG.  

Today I thought I would pop in by myself for a late lunch at the counter, and ohmygod now I understand. 

In the interest of tasting as many items as possible - I got the Plow breakfast, with lemon ricotta pancakes, pork sausage, scrambled eggs, and their revered crispy potatoes. 

This might be the most perfect breakfast I have ever eaten. Thank you Plow for MAKING MY DAY!

The eggs were a totally even and perfect soft scramble.  The housemade pork sausage with fennel flavor was legit.  The potatoes were chunky and smashed to deliver extra crispy surface area with a soft center ... and the most intoxicating aroma of rosemary.  And the lemon ricotta pancakes were just a hint of sweet which I really appreciate. 

All of this deliciousness, delivered with smiling and thoughtful service.  

I can't wait to go back! (except, ahem, I will have to...)

excerpts: as are the crispy potatoes and lemon ricotta pancakes.
This place is the bomb.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Erica L.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: Put our name down for a table of four at 11:15 on a Saturday, went to the gym for an hour, came back and got seated at 12:30. Prepare for a wait, but it's WORTH it. I got the breakfast sandwich with bacon and it was amazingggg...as are the crispy potatoes and lemon ricotta pancakes. This place is the bomb.

excerpts: Hubs got the Plow ($15) plate which comes with 2 eggs, meat of your choice (i.e. bacon, apple chicken sausage, etc), 2 lemon ricotta pancakes, and crispy potatoes.
The lemon ricotta pancakes were delish too.
Thicker and more dense, the light lemon flavor was a nice surprise.
And with a dab or two of maple syrup, it was great.
Just wished the pancakes were bigger.
These were about the size of a woman's palm.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Cindy W.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Had to wait like 20 minutes on a random Friday lunch. Don't people work around here?

Anyway, we were seated outdoors, balancing on the sloping sidewalk, but it was nice out so we could watch the 22 MUNI roll on by.

Hubs got the Plow ($15) plate which comes with 2 eggs, meat of your choice (i.e. bacon, apple chicken sausage, etc), 2 lemon ricotta pancakes, and crispy potatoes.

I ordered the Fried Egg Sandwich ($11), 2 eggs over easy so that yolk is still runny, with a slice of cheese, frisee greens in a soft bun. Side of potatoes too. My sandwich was on the bland side, since I didn't add bacon (+$2). Even avocados would have been an add on. Too bad. I think they should just offer it on for more texture and taste. But I sprinkled some hot sauce and ketchup and that helped. 

The potatoes were really the stand out though. They must use a blend of small potatoes and sweet ones, with skin on and deep fried, then tossed in seasoning. Very savory and flavorful. First time I polished off my potatoes since I'm not a big potato starch fan.

The lemon ricotta pancakes were delish too. Thicker and more dense, the light lemon flavor was a nice surprise. And with a dab or two of maple syrup, it was great. Just wished the pancakes were bigger. These were about the size of a woman's palm. Could have easily had 1 more on the plate. 

Overall, cute place, with food done well.

excerpts: Lemon ricotta pancakes are impressive.
While you wait, they serve coffee!
WIN.
I sat at the bar and witnessed the kitchen working-
it was ran like a well oiled machine.
The food is cooked well and quite delicious.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Coco C.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
As everyone knows, the wait is long. Few places are worth it, but I gave it a try. 

Lemon ricotta pancakes are impressive. While you wait, they serve coffee! WIN. I sat at the bar and witnessed the kitchen working- it was ran like a well oiled machine. The food is cooked well and quite delicious.

excerpts: lemon ricotta pancakes and fried chunks of potatoes, seasoned with herb, salt/pepper.
If you have time to kill and wait 1-1.5hrs for a table, I'd vote to have the lemon ricotta pancakes, fried potatoes.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Ry T.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Hubby took us here for Mom's Day.  Arriving at 9AM, the wait was 1.5 hrs.  So, we idled our time away, waiting... just like all the other folks.
This time, Hubby tried The Plow,$15 and refllls of coffee, $3.50.  He especially liked te homemade sausage patties. lemon ricotta pancakes and fried chunks of potatoes, seasoned with herb, salt/pepper.
I ordered the Dungeness crab scramble, $17.  Didn't like the scramble so much even 'tho it had chunks of crab in it with sliced asparagus.  The 2 sm slices of Acme bread, fried potatoes were the best part of the breakfast.
My Arnold Palmer, $3.75 was so sour.  I had to add 2 spoons of sugar to it.  Wouldn't order either one again.
Jr. Yelper had a glass of OJ, $3.75 and corned beef hash, $15.  Shredded pieces of corned beef with potatoes, 2 slices of bread which were good.

If you have time to kill and wait 1-1.5hrs for a table, I'd vote to have the lemon ricotta pancakes, fried potatoes.  Will have to try to come back on a weekday to try the Chinese breakfast which isn't served on weekends.

excerpts: The biscuit was great, and the lemon ricotta pancakes.
Wow.
I got the pork sausage which was very tasty and had a lot of flavor.
And their potatoes are very crisp.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Jeff W.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: This food was amazing. The biscuit was great, and the lemon ricotta pancakes. Wow. I got the pork sausage which was very tasty and had a lot of flavor. And their potatoes are very crisp.

excerpts: We ordered The Plow which offers a variety of house favorites - eggs, sausage, lemon ricotta pancakes and crispy potatoes - and watched from the bar as our food was prepared.
The kitchen was clean, efficient, and smelled wonderful.
Food arrived quickly, everything was perfectly prepared, and the meal was out of this world.
The lemon ricotta pancakes were especially amazing.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Kim R.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
The best breakfast I have had in SF for a number of years!  
5 stars based on food and service 
2 stars based on wait time

Be prepared for a wait before seating!  We went on a weekday, and even then there was a 10 minute wait for seats at the bar.   If you go on a weekend, be prepared for a much longer wait!

We ordered The Plow which offers a variety of house favorites - eggs, sausage, lemon ricotta pancakes and crispy potatoes - and watched from the bar as our food was prepared.  The kitchen was clean, efficient, and smelled wonderful.  
Food arrived quickly, everything was perfectly prepared, and the meal was out of this world.  The lemon ricotta pancakes were especially amazing.

If you have the time, definitely a must visit!

excerpts: I ordered the plow (eggs, bacon, potatoes with 2 lemon ricotta pancakes) and everything was yummy, except for the pancakes which I had actually come here for.
With all the hype and raves, I was ready to devour it all and plead for the recipe.
However, they were too doughy for my taste.
It tasted gritty, like oats or some kind of mealy grain.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Lil D.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
It takes great effort for me to come here, as I don't live in San Francisco any more, and I'm 45min away in the burbs... I finally made it on a Wednesday at around 1pm, which I still had to wait. It's a very small place.

I ordered the plow (eggs, bacon, potatoes with 2 lemon ricotta pancakes) and everything was yummy, except for the pancakes which I had actually come here for. With all the hype and raves, I was ready to devour it all and plead for the recipe. However, they were too doughy for my taste. It tasted gritty, like oats or some kind of mealy grain. Needless to say, I left them half eaten. 

But the potatoes were the best! crispy all around and so flavorful. Don't know what/how they make them but you've got to try these. and I'm not even a potato fan.

Service was attentive. 

Parking is difficult around the crowded neighborhood. 

May return another day to try other breakfast items.

excerpts: We ordered "the plow" which came with eggs, sausages, fried potato (their version of home fries) and lemon ricotta pancakes.
The eggs and sausage were fine, the usual.
The fried potato was nice and crispy but a bit salty.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Joyce L.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Hooray for another San Franciscan brunch place! Really enjoyed the ambiance and the location of the restaurant. 

We ordered "the plow" which came with eggs, sausages, fried potato (their version of home fries) and lemon ricotta pancakes.  The eggs and sausage were fine, the usual.  The fried potato was nice and crispy but a bit salty.  The pancakes were definitely good, but i feel it can only be appreciated by lemon enthusiasts.

We also ordered the French toast.  A lot different from other brunch places due to the unique bread.  Bread was thick but had a lot of holes inside but that was good cause it kept the syrup inside.  It was garnished with apricots which are always good.

Overall a good brunch spot and a welcome addition to the SF area.

excerpts: We ordered the Eggs Benedict, the Lemon Ricotta Pancakes with crispy potatoes, eggs, bacon and sausage.
The crispy potatoes were addictive, and are best described and breakfast-french-fries.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Meredith S.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
This place is popular. My girlfriend and I arrived for brunch and there was about a 30 minute wait. Once seated, it was easy because we had 3 dogs with us and we were able to sit outside. 

Service was good, our server was upbeat and fun. It was pretty busy, so our water refills were a bit slow, but other than it was good. Our server told us about the homemade dog treats create by the chef and brought some out for the pups. 

The food was totally yummy. We ordered the Eggs Benedict, the Lemon Ricotta Pancakes with crispy potatoes, eggs, bacon and sausage. 

The hollandaise received my approval, but I wasn't that impressed with the ham. 

The crispy potatoes were addictive, and are best described and breakfast-french-fries. Perfect with the over-medium eggs. 

The pancakes were so delicious, again, I'm not a big fan on pancakes but they were light and really really good. 

The bacon was the BEST part of the meal, when we told our server she actually let us know that the owner is from Wisconsin and the Nueske bacon is smoked bacon from their home-state. 

The breakfast sausage was also really good and fennel-y. 

We will be back for more and more and more.

excerpts: Everyone in my crew ordered the "plow" so we can sample a bit of everything - 2 eggs, 2 lemon ricotta pancakes, sausages (or bacon), and potatoes.
It did not disappoint.
The eggs over easy were definitely on the "easy" side.
Next time I'll know to ask for eggs over medium instead.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Jennifer I.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
One hour wait later...happy tummies!

We sat outside since I brought my little Peanut along (this place is dog friendly).  Everyone in my crew ordered the "plow" so we can sample a bit of everything - 2 eggs, 2 lemon ricotta pancakes, sausages (or bacon), and potatoes.  It did not disappoint.  The eggs over easy were definitely on the "easy" side.  Next time I'll know to ask for eggs over medium instead.  We tried the lemon ricotta and almond flour pancakes and both were absolutely delish!  Potatoes were seasoned and done just right!

I will definitely be coming back!  (Another plus is the plentiful parking!)

excerpts: I'm giving this place 4 stars because the food was divine especially the lemon ricotta pancakes.
However, Angelica, our server was a complete sarcastic bitch.

We waited almost 3 hours because the place is pretty small and there were a lot of people so be prepared to write your name down and get coffee somewhere else (Farleys is right next door and is really cute) or go shopping.

excerpts: Urghmagawd the lemon ricotta pancakes and crispy potatoes were amazing.
The eggs were delicious, as was the apple chicken sausage.
The only complaints I had were that it had a large line and the coffee was kinda mediocre.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Sean W.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: Urghmagawd the lemon ricotta pancakes and crispy potatoes were amazing. The eggs were delicious, as was the apple chicken sausage. The only complaints I had were that it had a large line and the coffee was kinda mediocre.

excerpts: My lemon ricotta pancakes were perfectly done, the crispy potatoes were wonderous and the homemade sausage was flavorful.
The staff is friendly and the vibe is upbeat.
Cons - It's a small place
and you'll sit close to your neighbor
(we were ok with this).
And this spot is not a secret so expect a wait.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Justin W.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
We showed up close to Noon.  They told us it was a 90 min wait, but it only took abot an hour.  
Once we got a seat, the staff was super friendly and fast to our table.  I got "The Plow" and my wife got a fried egg sandwich.  After an awesome and filling brunch, and a mimosa a piece, we headed back home.   I'm writing this review upon waking up from my post-brunch nap.
Pro's - Food is fantastic.  My lemon ricotta pancakes were perfectly done, the crispy potatoes were wonderous and the homemade sausage was flavorful.  The staff is friendly and the vibe is upbeat.  
Cons - It's a small place and you'll sit close to your neighbor (we were ok with this).  And this spot is not a secret so expect a wait.

Biscuits & gravy
Lemon ricotta pancakes
Bacon

lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
I was surprised with their take on classic American. Yes, pleasantly.
