excerpts: We ordered quickly -- two coffees, two dungeness crab scrambles, one side order of lemon ricotta pancakes, please!
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Kelly N.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
I have been to Plow before with friends and, sure, the wait was long but we were prepared for it. I remembered loving their crispy potatoes and savoring our brunch. I was dying to take my potato-loving boyfriend to Plow to introduce him to the delights of their breakfast potatoes. 

Alas, every time we've tried to go for the last year and half, it has been an hour+ wait. Boyfriend is not one to wait around. We usually end up somewhere nearby and have explored many delicious restaurant alternatives as a result (a plus after all?). Well, we finally got our opportunity over a recent ridiculously rainy weekend. It was a downpour. My boyfriend woke me up at 7am on a Sunday and said, "Plow opens at 8! Let's go today. It's our best chance." Look at the things we do for love!

We went (though I dragged my feet getting out of bed) and arrived around 8:30. The wait was going to be between 1 to 1.5 hours. (!!!!!) WTF?!? We decided to wait. I banked on the fact that everyone who put their names down ahead of us likely didn't want to wait around in the rain. As luck would have it, we were seated after about 30 minutes. We ordered quickly -- two coffees, two dungeness crab scrambles, one side order of lemon ricotta pancakes, please! 

And then we waited for an hour. We watched all the people around us get their food and begin eating. Our server came over to explain there had been a snafu in the kitchen and our food was just being fired. No apologies. No offer of something to put in our stomachs in the meantime to offset the three cups of coffee we had been drinking during the wait. We watched the people who were seated after us finish and pay their bill before our meals arrived. And then when it did arrive, it was fine... fine as in mediocre, not fine as in "all is right in the world." Our scrambles were pretty salty and we got one tiny pancake to split... perhaps we could have asked for more info on what the "side" of pancakes consisted of.

When we got our tab, we still got no apologies, nothing comped off of our bill, and no fulfillment from our experience. After a year and half of trying to return to Plow, it was a bust in the end. We left with a sour taste in our mouths and confusion as to why so many people keep coming back and waiting that long. Chez Maman is a half block away and has a lovely brunch. You'll find us there.

excerpts: Generally I like to try what a place is known for on the first visit, which would thus be the Plow, but my friend decided to order one herself and offered to have me try some of her lemon ricotta pancakes.
I easily obliged and chose a brunch favorite of mine anywhere: eggs benedict with ham.
First of all, I loved my eggs benedict.
Not too much hollandaise sauce and the english muffins were quite big, and quite deliciously fluffy.
Also: I love eggs.
Good choice, me.
I also had a little bit of my friends' pancakes.
It was then in that moment of that first bite when I promised myself I'd be back to have a whole plate of it for myself.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Allen Mark A.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
I told myself that I would only review restaurants I've visited at least twice, but I think I liked it enough not to wait... aaaand San Francisco is far-ish :(

One of my friends took me here for a weekend brunch so we could catch up. We got there at about 12:40 (I got to the city 30 minutes late and my friend got lost on the way there. You live in SF and you've been there countless times before, HOW DO YOU GET LOST??) when it was packed, giving us a 45-60 minute wait. I didn't mind at all; I'm a really patient person and we ended up spending that time in a nearby bookstore anyway. We got back and opted to eat outside on a beautiful day in the city. It was kind of awkward eating on a slanted plane, but it wasn't terribly uncomfortable. And the pigeons walking around the tables got a little bothersome (but not in an annoying way, if that makes sense), but that's also a risk you take sitting outside. And the blankets they had available were a nice touch in case it got chilly. Okay, none of y'all want to hear about this, let's talk food!

Generally I like to try what a place is known for on the first visit, which would thus be the Plow, but my friend decided to order one herself and offered to have me try some of her lemon ricotta pancakes. I easily obliged and chose a brunch favorite of mine anywhere: eggs benedict with ham. First of all, I loved my eggs benedict. Not too much hollandaise sauce and the english muffins were quite big, and quite deliciously fluffy. Also: I love eggs. Good choice, me. I also had a little bit of my friends' pancakes. It was then in that moment of that first bite when I promised myself I'd be back to have a whole plate of it for myself. Oh, and I can't forget:

Them crispy potatoes, tho.

I'd come back just for them, TBH. Furthermore, our waitress was super nice (and super cute) and, oh, they have Tapatio. I already liked this place from first impression, but honestly they had me at Tapatio. The coffee was decent, though I'd love to try their cold brew some time. It wasn't quite warm enough that day for it. WELP I guess that's another reason to come back huh?

Anyway, to sum up, there really wasn't anything from my experience that would deserve to have a star docked off, so 5 it is! I'll be back, it's just a matter of when at this point. Thanks!

excerpts: Lemon Ricotta pancakes were half way cooked.
Meh.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Jess C.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: Breakfast sandwich was pretty good. Lemon Ricotta pancakes were half way cooked. Meh.

excerpts: Fresh eggs, 3 small chicken apple sausages, boatload of crispy potatoes, and 2 small lemon ricotta pancakes.
Pancakes and potatoes were the best.
I think the potatoes are flash fried or something -- amazingly crunchy, but not dripping with oil.
Best brunch potatoes
I've had -- hands down.
The lemon ricotta pancakes were the perfect size (not too big - i think bottomless flapjacks is the grossest idea ever).
Texture was great and flavor was delicate and not too sweet.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Kendra W.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
We came last week when it was sprinkling (more like misting).  No other groups wanted outside tables, so we bypassed the TWO HOUR wait and endured a little chilly drizzle over hot coffee and good food -- the smarter choice in my opinion!  Good brunch -- but really glad we didn't wait TWO HOURS.  Ambrosia from the gods would not be worth that much of my time...

I ordered the Plow ($15) -- good way to sample what they they do best.  Fresh eggs, 3 small chicken apple sausages, boatload of crispy potatoes, and 2 small lemon ricotta pancakes.  Pancakes and potatoes were the best.  I think the potatoes are flash fried or something -- amazingly crunchy, but not dripping with oil.  Best brunch potatoes I've had -- hands down.  The lemon ricotta pancakes were the perfect size (not too big - i think bottomless flapjacks is the grossest idea ever).  Texture was great and flavor was delicate and not too sweet. Yummers.

I think some claims that it's the "best brunch spot in the city" is a bit much -- but definitely a great place to try if you happen to drive by Potrero Hill and see that the line isn't too bad!

excerpts: Those lemon ricotta pancakes -- flavor explosion!
It was an incredible breakfast.
The price was very reasonable, if not inexpensive, for the quality.
Plow is a must have for every SF trip in the future now.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Rebecca S.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Everything about this breakfast was 5 Stars.  A friend's recommendation brought my boyfriend and I here on a Friday (brunchtime-ish). Were seated promptly next to another couple at a small table in the corner. I don't mind sitting next to strangers, but I did have to get up to let them out of their seats so I am sure they felt trapped.  
Ordered the fried egg sandwhich with bacon, which was a delicious brioche bun, farm fresh eggs and crispy bacon... side of the best freakin potatoes youve ever had.  Every restaurant should take tips on their potatoes, crispy, airy, cooked all the way through, without a hint of greasiness. Heaven!  Boyfriend got the Plow with sausage. Those lemon ricotta pancakes -- flavor explosion! It was an incredible breakfast. The price was very reasonable, if not inexpensive, for the quality. Plow is a must have for every SF trip in the future now.

excerpts: My mouth has been watering for their breakfast potatoes, house made sausage and lemon ricotta pancakes!!!!
And the décor is perfect, feel like your in someone's large country home!!!
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Quinn S.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
This place was close to my school, so lucky to find it!!
Love the location and that it has outside seating as well. The staff is always smiling and very nice, even with the craziness of a full restaurant. 
My mouth has been watering for their breakfast potatoes, house made sausage and lemon ricotta pancakes!!!!
And the décor is perfect, feel like your in someone's large country home!!!

excerpts: We also tried the lemon ricotta pancakes as it seems like that is a must, and I definitely liked them a lot (not sure if it's out of this world amazing, but they were definitely very good).
I'd get them again.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Alice W.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Just moved from NY, and Plow definitely makes me feel good that there are awesome brunch places in SF and that I won't need to hop on a plane any time soon whenever I need a good brunch. Went on a sunny Saturday afternoon (after 1:30PM) and waited for about 25 minutes. Perhaps that's the key for getting around the crazy peak time waits. 

We had the Fried Egg Sandwich with avocado and pork sausage... YUMMY. It fell apart though (definitely not easy to eat w/your hands), but I managed b/c it was just too yummy. Their crispy potatoes are a must, even if you are carb conscious... if you're gonna eat any kind of fried potatoes be it fries or home fries, eat these and skip all the others! So delicious.

We also tried the lemon ricotta pancakes as it seems like that is a must, and I definitely liked them a lot (not sure if it's out of this world amazing, but they were definitely very good). I'd get them again. YUM.

Come later, wait less, and eat happy.

excerpts: the lemon ricotta pancakes were the star of this meal.
Perfect combination of sweet and tart.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: irene u.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Quality ingredients, helpful staff, but the flavors and textures didn't suit my palate. The French toast was bland, the crispy potatoes had too much Rosemary, the infamous sandwich was hardly anything to remember outside of the acme bun, the sausages (pork and chicken apple.. Were just ok).... but one thing did make my list. the lemon ricotta pancakes were the star of this meal.  Perfect combination of sweet and tart. Just really small portions of it on the plow plate.  

Was it worth the hour wait... Meh.

excerpts: My favorite dish to get is The Plow because it has a little of everything: fluffy lemon ricotta pancakes, eggs, choice of tasty meat and those crispy potatoes that made the 7x7 list.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Chrissy M.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Assuming you're having a relaxing, weekend day and aren't in a hurry, this place is SO worth the wait!  I'm guessing it's not as busy during the week, but on the weekend, it's  not unusual to wait 45 minutes to an hour.

My boyfriend lives in Potrero and this is our favorite brunch place in the neighborhood.  Everything I've ever eaten here has been out of this world!  

They always have some yummy "starter" type items at the top of their brunch menu.  They change these up a lot, but every one I've tried has been awesome.

I don't have kids, but I saw on their website that they have a great kid's menu.  My favorite dish to get is The Plow because it has a little of everything: fluffy lemon ricotta pancakes, eggs, choice of tasty meat and those crispy potatoes that made the 7x7 list.

The restaurant is focused on using local ingredients.  They even list where the food comes from on their menu.

As I mentioned, they're always busy on the weekends.  Still, I've always had prompt friendly service.  They always offer plenty of coffee refills- love their coffee!

FYI they don't take reservations and don't serve parties over 6 people.

excerpts: It came with two pretty small lemon ricotta pancakes which were delightful.
They are served up with butter and maple syrup.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Bonnie B.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: This is a nice little breakfast Nook off the beaten path. Good coffee. I got the "plow breakfast" which consists of crispy potatoes and no you do not need to specify extra crispy because they are already very crispy. It came with two pretty small lemon ricotta pancakes which were delightful. They are served up with butter and maple syrup. You also get your choice of bacon or house made pork sausage which was fantastic and eggs. I found it to be quite a lot of food but it was also quite a lot of money but it was a very good breakfast all in all.

excerpts: The lemon ricotta pancakes are also something else.
Go here.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Luke A.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
The best breakfast potatoes on earth. The lemon ricotta pancakes are also something else. Go here. Order The Plow. You will be tempted by other things on the menu -- and the other things are good to be sure -- but The Plow is a life-altering dish.

Prepare to wait for ages if you come on the weekend. Come on a middle weekday instead, and then have a nap afterwards. You'll probably dream about potatoes.

excerpts: Possibly a side of lemon ricotta pancakes.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Mike M.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
A San Francisco Brunch must!

Get here early, because the space is small and the line is long. Most importantly, you don't want the best things on the menu running out.

If it's available, fried chicken and biscuits with gravy. If not, either the fried egg sandwich or the Plow. Possibly a side of lemon ricotta pancakes.

Just don't make the chump mistake of ordering coffee here. It is sub par. Just bring a cup of blue bottle, ritual, four barrel, sightglass, etc. and enjoy =)

excerpts: The Plow (two eggs, two pieces of bacon or sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes, and crispy potatoes) and The French Toast.
The food was just delicious.
We ate every bite.
Those potatoes are crispy on the outside, soft on the inside with great flavor.
Those lemon ricotta pancakes were so delectable.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: S G.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
So I've been really wanting to try this place.  It's a bit out of the way for me, but I love trying new things.

So, we waited about an hour to be seated on a Saturday...ok by me if the food is good.  Plus you can order some beverages while you wait.  Relax people, have some drinks outside with friends while you wait.  It's the weekend after all so enjoy. 

So my friend and I shared two dishes. The Plow (two eggs, two pieces of bacon or sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes, and crispy potatoes) and The French Toast.
The food was just delicious.  We ate every bite.  Those potatoes are crispy on the outside, soft on the inside with great flavor.  Those lemon ricotta pancakes were so delectable. French Toast was more on average but very good!  

I am definitely going to come back here again and try something else...but I may get those ricotta pancakes again..hehe.

excerpts: The lemon ricotta pancakes are light, creamy, lemony goodness!
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Raleigh S.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Hands down, one of the best breakfasts in San Francisco! 

Sat at the bar watching the happiest chefs work their magic. (I've never seen such enthusiasm in any restaurant, that these people have!!)

The lemon ricotta pancakes are light, creamy, lemony goodness! Wow!

Country potatoes.. Perfect!  Eggs... Exquisite!

excerpts: the lemon ricotta pancakes were a step better but still not that fluffy and not that lemony or ricotta-y
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: claudia y.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
plow is a hip brunch place in portrero hill.  it demands an hour wait.  friendly staff.  but mediocre food.  i cant seem to understand why people are willing to wait an hour for breakfast here.  i dont think we would come back again

first the tables were smelly.  they had accidentally left a wet rag on our chair but the table was still smelly and chair wet.  i think they need to wash those rags more.

we ordered the pulled pork sandwich, 2 soft scramble with chanterelle, nettles, and goat cheese, and also the plow which is eggs, meat, potatoes and a pancake.  i added an almond pancake to my meal because i was imagining it to be a fluffy french macaroon like thing.  

when my soft scramble came it was button mushrooms and not chanterelles.  we prompty notified our waitress who asked the kitchen which confirmed that yes they had run out of chanterelles.  at 10am.  and that they would take $1 off each soft scramble we ordered.  but if we hadnt asked?  as i left i was thinking of all the people who ordered the soft scramble with chanterelles for chanterelle price who were actually eating button mushrooms and not informed.  but they wouldnt care,  they are eating in a hip place and they are hip people.  the worst part is feeling like they were trying to trick us

next the homemade sausage patties.  i found to be bland and dry.  yuck.  the almond pacakes were gritty and mushy, like a soggy almond cookie.  so much worse that i had hoped.  i couldnt even finish.  the lemon ricotta pancakes were a step better but still not that fluffy and not that lemony or ricotta-y

the saving grace was the potatoes.  delicious.  can a restaurant survive by making good potatoes?  probably

everything else was crap

excerpts: I'm not the biggest b-fast sweat fan, but I have tried their lemon ricotta pancakes and they are delectable.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Daniel M.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
I love this place. It's probably my favorite brunch place. The atmosphere is awesome. Great bar overlooking the kitchen (so you can watch all of the food coming out), fairly high ceilings, tons of light, and a cozy row of tables. I've eaten there a number of times and I find it hard to have a favorite menu item. Their b-fast sando is high on the list. I like to add bacon and avocado. Their bun is the right amount of soft. I also love their potatoes. Perfectly crisp exterior and a nice herb flavor. Their homemade pork sausage and their blood sausage are also amazing. I'm not the biggest b-fast sweat fan, but I have tried their lemon ricotta pancakes and they are delectable. 

It can be a long wait so I try to go on the early side. I've never felt like I've waited too long for the food or the service I've received. It's also helpful that you can grab a cup of coffee when you go in to put your name on the list.

excerpts: The oft-mentioned lemon ricotta pancakes are different and quite good (though not my personal favorite).
The pork sausage was fabulous and worth ordering.
I fried potatoes
I'm sure
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Brad B.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Arrived around 9 am on a Sunday for breakfast and waited for about 45 minutes for a seat at the counter.  There are a few seats on the street while you wait, and the hostess offers coffee to sip while waiting.

The interior is clean, simple and tasteful, with two large farmland-inspired prints adorning the walls.  A counter space with about 8 seats overlooks the kitchen.  We sat here and really enjoyed watching the cooks throw together the menu items.

What sets this place apart from the typical brunch fare in SF is the menu.  The oft-mentioned lemon ricotta pancakes are different and quite good (though not my personal favorite).  The pork sausage was fabulous and worth ordering.  I fried potatoes I'm sure find their way immediately to your waistline, but they are scrumptious.

We will be back on a day when we are up early so as to beat the wait!

excerpts: Its nothing crazy special, but it is a decent place to go to if you're in the area and craving some lemon ricotta pancakes or homemade pork sausage.
As everyone else has said, the lemon ricotta pancakes are very tasty.
We got them by ordering the 'plow' which came with little medallion sized pancakes, eggs, potatoes, and choice of meat.
The pancakes weren't the best I've ever tasted, though (best I ever had were in auburn, ca).
The pork sausage that is more like a meat patty was a nice touch, but for some reason it was too meaty... and something was just a little off in the seasoning.
I also had the egg sandwhich with the bacon.
Bacon was nice and thick, but overall the sandwhich was meh.
Too messy even for an egg sandwhich, best part was the buns.
The house potatoes were too crispy for my liking, although they were tender inside.
I was curious about the pumpkin bread with icing...
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Tim B.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
This is an average hipster-filled brunch place in potrero hill. Its nothing crazy special, but it is a decent place to go to if you're in the area and craving some lemon ricotta pancakes or homemade pork sausage. 

As everyone else has said, the lemon ricotta pancakes are very tasty. We got them by ordering the 'plow' which came with little medallion sized pancakes, eggs, potatoes, and choice of meat. The pancakes weren't the best I've ever tasted, though (best I ever had were in auburn, ca). The pork sausage that is more like a meat patty was a nice touch, but for some reason it was too meaty... and something was just a little off in the seasoning. I also had the egg sandwhich with the bacon. Bacon was nice and thick, but overall the sandwhich was meh. Too messy even for an egg sandwhich, best part was the buns. The house potatoes were too crispy for my liking, although they were tender inside. 
I was curious about the pumpkin bread with icing... but didn't get to try. 

With the considerable wait in mind, I didn't really understand all the hype. They do serve mimosas/alcohol/coffee while you wait which can pass the time, along with all the people who bring their cute dogs! Service is efficient and polite, interesting to watch the kitchen staff work from the counter. 
Side note - i feel like the pig emblem that they use is used in several other restaurants? =p

excerpts: I ordered the lemon ricotta pancakes, they were dense but fluffy, lemony flavorful and soo good drizzled with syrup and powdered sugar.
I recommended you get here early because when we left there was like 15 people outside (9:30am)!!
Enjoy!
Oh and they also have "as you wait coffee" just ask!
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Carla F.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: So we get seated at the counter which was awesome because we were able to see the cooks create their "goodness"! It was fun to watch, maybe I'll learn something...  My son orders the Egg Sandwich w/added bacon and a side of potatoes! It looked amazing! As soon as he took the 1st bite and the yolk started dripping down his hand I grabbed his napkin and he pushes himself away!! He says, " Mom, that's the best ever, leave it!" lol...I'll lick it off! 5 mins later his plate was clean and his belly was full and mom was happy! I ordered the lemon ricotta pancakes, they were dense but fluffy, lemony flavorful and soo good drizzled with syrup and powdered sugar. I recommended you get here early because when we left there was like 15 people outside (9:30am)!! Enjoy! Oh and they also have "as you wait coffee" just ask!

excerpts: Friends enjoyed the lemon ricotta pancakes and the buttermilk biscuits and the eggs seemed to be quite fresh.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Sharon M.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
A group of us had brunch at Plow over the weekend for a birthday celebration (requested by the birthday girl.)  I viewed their website in advance and was aware that they did not take reservations and were a small venue that could only accommodate up to six in a group, so we kept our group to six.   We had heard good things about Plow and we were excited to give it a try. 

We arrived on a Sunday at 9:00 a.m. and we were told that it would be an hour wait.  The wait wasn't actually that long.  It felt like 20 minutes but it was probably 40 as we were busy chatting.  We sat outside.  

As we looked at the menu, someone pointed out a sentence in italics that said something to the effect of "no modifications to the menu."  I don't have the exact wording.  Well, to start, that's a bit of a buzz kill as who doesn't modify something even a little?  I decided to order all "sides" so that I could enjoy what I wanted and not have a plate with things that I don't care for included.  Very simply put, I ordered 2 eggs scrambled, crispy potatoes and a buttermilk biscuit.  How can you go wrong with that?   No where on the menu did it say that the crispy potatoes were "rosemary crispy potatoes" and it just so happens that rosemary does not agree with me and I stay far away from it.  It spilled over into my scrambled eggs, and I could not have been more disappointed. As a group we made our own modifications, and friends shared pancakes and meat that they would not ordinarily order.  Friends enjoyed the lemon ricotta pancakes and the buttermilk biscuits and the eggs seemed to be quite fresh.  

On a more important note, the waitress that we had was anything but cheerful. She didn't appear to be overly friendly to anyone outside.  From the moment we sat down, we felt her negative energy and lack of any form of customer service.  Overall, we had a great time together, the food was good, but the service was not anything to write home about.  On the ABOUT section of their website it says " Plow is a tribute to timeless recipes coupled with California cooking and warm hospitality."   Well, the hospitality portion was definitely missing from our experience which was really unfortunate. 

My rating of 3 stars is more about the service than the menu or food experience.

excerpts: so instead i ordered 'the plow', which consisted of eggs [poached], sausage and lemon ricotta pancakes.
i'm not a huge fan of lemon things
[exc.
lemonade, lemon bundt cake], and i knew these pancakes were risky.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Rosalee C.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
i've been wanting to try this place for some time but i am rarely in this neighborhood and i don't know why.

my boyfriend and i woke up early and decided to eat here since there's a chance of not waiting so long because it's so early. well, when we drove by the large crowd crowding the entrance almost made us change our minds but decided to stay. the 40min wait didn't seem so long.

we sat at the bar and just watched all the cooks in action. they got skills!

i wanted to try the almond flour pancakes but i was craving for eggs so instead i ordered 'the plow', which consisted of eggs [poached], sausage and lemon ricotta pancakes. i'm not a huge fan of lemon things [exc. lemonade, lemon bundt cake], and i knew these pancakes were risky. they're ok, but i don't love them like everyone else did. 

regardless, i am definitely coming back here to try the almond pancakes, and other things on their menu! it's small but they have large windows that bring all the sunlight in!

excerpts: The plow was basically my dream breakfast: eggs (scrambled and cooked to perfection), chicken apple sausage, wonderfully crispy brown potatoes, and light refreshing lemon ricotta pancakes.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Carrie C.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
My friend and I came here on a Wednesday afternoon to avoid the wait because we're not the most patient when we have to pathetically watch people eating food through a window while standing outside in the cold.  However, there was already a small crowd of people waiting outside the door, and we pledged that if the wait was more than 20 minutes, we would get it to go and eat in the car.

Luckily, we only had to wait about 10 minutes before getting a table, and it helps that the service is fast.  So many things on the menu sound amazing, but we ended up narrowing it down to a fried egg sandwich for my friend and the plow for me.

The plow was basically my dream breakfast: eggs (scrambled and cooked to perfection), chicken apple sausage, wonderfully crispy brown potatoes, and light refreshing lemon ricotta pancakes.  My friend loved her fried egg sandwich (+bacon) and raved that she could eat the potatoes for every single meal.

Overall, a wonderfully delicious brunch in a cute atmosphere.  I would highly recommend coming here (be prepared to wait), and I would love to come back to try all the other delicious menu items!

excerpts: Their lemon ricotta pancakes are the best.
I'm not even a big pancake fan
yet
I order them every time.
It comes with all of Plow's best dishes: lemon ricotta pancakes, crispy potatoes, eggs, and your choice of their yummy bacon or sausage.
Definitely a must order if it's your first time at Plow.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Erin B.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Love Plow's brunch and would give it 5 stars if it weren't for the wait. Their lemon ricotta pancakes are the best. I'm not even a big pancake fan yet I order them every time. Their crispy potatoes are delicious too; I've tried a few times to replicate them at home but can never seem to get them just right. If you go on a weekend be prepared for a pretty lengthy wait. This place is extremely tiny and very popular. But, they do offer coffee to make the wait a little more bearable and there is a great view of the city. They also have outdoor seating and are dog friendly. 
As for food, I have gotten the breakfast sandwich, which is very tasty, but after trying the plow plate, I am a convert. It comes with all of Plow's best dishes: lemon ricotta pancakes, crispy potatoes, eggs, and your choice of their yummy bacon or sausage. Definitely a must order if it's your first time at Plow.

excerpts: The lemon ricotta pancakes are well known, as is the "absolutely everything delicious on a plate" plate, the Plow.
My friend ordered the smoked salmon breakfast, and that looked pretty awesome too.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Tasha D.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: Delicious brunch. Friendly, charming space with good food, good coffee, and a line out the door (that part's less fun). The lemon ricotta pancakes are well known, as is the "absolutely everything delicious on a plate" plate, the Plow. My friend ordered the smoked salmon breakfast, and that looked pretty awesome too.

excerpts: One item: lemon ricotta pancakes.
To die for.
I'm usually not a big pancake person, but this makes me want to eat pancakes every day.
It is a small cute pancake but full of flavor.
The fried egg sandwich was delicious as well
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Stacy C.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
It seems like all I give are 5 star ratings but I find that i tend to only rate places that I love and can't stop talking about. And Plow is one of those places. I am sad I found out about this brunch place late in my 3 years in SF, but it is definitely my favorite brunch spot in the city after trying places like Stacks and Zazies. 

One item: lemon ricotta pancakes. To die for. I'm usually not a big pancake person, but this makes me want to eat pancakes every day. It is a small cute pancake but full of flavor. The fried egg sandwich was delicious as well (I got to mooch off some of my brother's order) and the potatoes were amazing, a tad on the salty side, but so crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. 

One negative, the wait is usually 30 to an hour. One time, I miraculously walked up with my party of four to an open table with no wait on a Tuesday at 1100am. The highlight of my day.

I love brunch and I love SF. This place is perfect! Just be ready to wait. :)

excerpts: The lemon ricotta pancakes are delicious, especially when paired with the crispy potatoes.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Ruby K.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: The wait is short if you get there early. The french toast and The Plow plate are good. The drinks are good too. The lemon ricotta pancakes are delicious, especially when paired with the crispy potatoes.

excerpts: Lemon ricotta pancakes were dense and flavorless.
I couldn't even finish one after waiting 1.5 hours to be seated!
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: S C.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: Lemon ricotta pancakes were dense and flavorless. I couldn't even finish one after waiting 1.5 hours to be seated! The French toast was pretty good though and the crispy potatoes were super crunchy and nicely salted.

excerpts: My friend ordered the Plow which is the works with 2 eggs, bacon,  2 lemon ricotta pancakes and crispy potatoes.
I ordered the soft egg crab and asparagus scramble with crispy potatoes, buttered toast and a side order of one almond pancake.
Everything was cooked to perfection and the potatoes are out of this world!
Best crispy potatoes with a sprinkling of salt and herbs.
Mmmm!
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Sharon D.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
This is my favorite breakfast place in the city!!  You've got to go to Plow!  I've been here twice and both brunches were fabulous!  Brought my friend from LA here and she absolutely loved it.  We had to wait about half hour on a Tuesday so we took a stroll around the sunny neighborhood.  

My friend ordered the Plow which is the works with 2 eggs, bacon,  2 lemon ricotta pancakes and crispy potatoes.  I ordered the soft egg crab and asparagus scramble with crispy potatoes, buttered toast and a side order of one almond pancake.  Everything was cooked to perfection and the potatoes are out of this world!  Best crispy potatoes with a sprinkling of salt and herbs.  Mmmm!  The almond pancake was nice and fluffy.

Love the decor and service was great.

excerpts: and I both ordered "The Plow" which consists of 2 eggs, bacon or sausage, lemon ricotta pancakes and potatoes.
I loved that it was a perfect balance of sweet and savory.
The eggs and sausage were good, but nothing too extraordinary.
The lemon ricotta pancakes had great flavor and were the perfect size.
The potatoes were the best potatoes I've had in the city.
I find myself craving more lemon ricotta pancakes and potatoes!
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Christina L.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
I had to take one star off because the wait is a little ridiculous. I put my name down at 10 am on a Sunday, left for 2 hrs to get my friends and wander about the city, and when I came back at noon, there were still no tables available inside. Since we were pressed for time, we ate outside. As expected in SF, it was cold, but the food was still great.

My boyfriend and I both ordered "The Plow" which consists of 2 eggs, bacon or sausage, lemon ricotta pancakes and potatoes. I loved that it was a perfect balance of sweet and savory. The eggs and sausage were good, but nothing too extraordinary. The lemon ricotta pancakes had great flavor and were the perfect size. The potatoes were the best potatoes I've had in the city. I don't know want to know how they are prepared or how much butter they are fried in because denial is bliss.

Our other 2 friends got the eggs benedict and fried egg sandwich. I think they enjoyed their meals, although my friend that got the eggs benedict asked for the sauce on the side, and her meal was smothered in sauce.

I'll definitely be back  - even though the wait is pretty bad the food makes up for it. Plus, it's difficult to find too many popular brunch places in the city with less than a 2 hour wait. I find myself craving more lemon ricotta pancakes and potatoes!

excerpts: lemon ricotta pancakes - first bite had a kick to it, but it's not fluffy.
i like fluffy pancakes.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Diana C.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
3.5 stars. this place is so cute!  the wait was very long...  love the decor.

ordered The Plow - with scrambled eggs and house made pork sausage patties. waitress came back half an hour later saying they were out of the pork sausage (it was 12:37pm on Sunday - yes, i did check the time) got the chicken apple sausage instead. should have gotten the bacon if i knew that the chicken apple sausages are those little bfast sausage (i like the ones with apple chunks in them instead). however, i really like the scrambled eggs (so runny!!) and CRISPY potatoes. tried that one weird whey orange drink (i wasn't paying a lot of attention when the waitress was describing it, but she mentioned that they made some cheese in-house and extracted protein, add orange juice and tonic... bleh - i didn't like it). lemon ricotta pancakes - first bite had a kick to it, but it's not fluffy. i like fluffy pancakes. same problem with the almond flour pancakes. 

i would totally go back for the eggs and potatoes. the muffin looked good, too. want to try that next time.

excerpts: Lemon ricotta pancakes.
I haven't tried a better pancake anywhere else.
They're so light and the flavour is just amazing (I eat them without syrup all the time because they taste so good).
My bf and I have been trying to make them ourselves
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Leanne M.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
This is my fave brunch spot in the history of brunch spots that I've been to. Quite extreme, I know, but you have to eat here to understand why I say this.

First of all, I always order the plow. Why? It lets you taste everything that is good and amazing at Plow. The pancakes... the best thing ever! Lemon ricotta pancakes. I haven't tried a better pancake anywhere else. They're so light and the flavour is just amazing (I eat them without syrup all the time because they taste so good). My bf and I have been trying to make them ourselves and we never get close to the quality and delicateness of Plow. 

Second, the potatoes! I love the crispy potatoes! They'd be the equivalent to homefries at any other brunch place, but these things are amazing! They're tossed in some salt, pepper and rosemary (and maybe other things that I just don't know about) and they add the perfect little crunch to the plow platter. 

The wait can be a little long since they don't have much space to seat people, but it's always worth the wait for me. I love this place! It keeps me coming back every time.

excerpts: I got the Plow, a combination of two small lemon ricotta pancakes, two eggs, bacon or sausage and potatoes.
Those potatoes.
oh man.
I don't know what they put in them (rosemary?
thyme?)
but they are crispy and delicious.
The only food item I would complain about - the bacon . . .
while tasty, I wish I had specified crispy, because they serve it kind of floppy and under cooked.
But other than that, everything was great.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Jenny R.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Plow.  A longstanding brunch obstacle, because I knew the endurance it would take.  And after being burned in the past by extraordinarily long waits for brunch and less than stellar food as my reward, I have to admit, I was a little hesitant to give Plow the chance.  

But I finally did, this past weekend.  And it was worth it.  Admittedly, the wait was lengthy.  Probably about an hour or so.  But that was to be expected.  And honestly, who cares about an hour wait, if it's good weather?  Wandering around Portrero Hill, stopping into some cute shops, getting tea at Farley's - it's not a bad way to spend an hour. 

And I would say the food is worth the wait, maybe not on a regular basis, but certainly once in a while.  I got the Plow, a combination of two small lemon ricotta pancakes, two eggs, bacon or sausage and potatoes.  Those potatoes.  . . oh man.  I don't know what they put in them (rosemary?  thyme?) but they are crispy and delicious.  The only food item I would complain about - the bacon . . . while tasty, I wish I had specified crispy, because they serve it kind of floppy and under cooked.  But other than that, everything was great.

excerpts: Lemon ricotta pancakes (yuuum), eggs, meat, potatoes.
Real maple syrup.
The bf grew up with the real stuff so this adds a star to his list.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Janny N.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: This place is awesome. I'm not a fan of the wait...especially when I'm starving for breakfast, but I tough it out like a champ because "the plow" is that good to me. That's my go to order. It has a little of everything. Lemon ricotta pancakes (yuuum), eggs, meat, potatoes. Real maple syrup. The bf grew up with the real stuff so this adds a star to his list.

excerpts: I enjoyed lemon ricotta pancakes and pork sausage.
Hubby had the fried egg sandwich.
Unfortunately, they had run out of monkey bread by the time we were brunching, so I can only conjure up the taste in my dreams.
The wait on a sunny Sunday was under an hour, which was worth it...even when we got distracted at the bookstore down the street and lost our table, forced then to wait another 10 or so minutes.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Kiesha R.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Delicious. I enjoyed lemon ricotta pancakes and pork sausage. Hubby had the fried egg sandwich. Unfortunately, they had run out of monkey bread by the time we were brunching, so I can only conjure up the taste in my dreams. The wait on a sunny Sunday was under an hour, which was worth it...even when we got distracted at the bookstore down the street and lost our table, forced then to wait another 10 or so minutes. But the hostess was very kind and accommodating, when she could have been hostile and persnickety.

Lovely atmosphere. Great food. Mmmmmm.

excerpts: And THANKFULLY the lemon ricotta pancakes were superb!!
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Sara D.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Honestly - what restaurant doesn't have mustard?!
That alone irks me from not wanting to return. 

My BF and I waited 45 minutes for brunch on a Sunday, and we're completely underwhelmed.

We both ordered "The Plow" and should have "plowed" right through it on to a different menu item.

We got the housemade sausage and it was pretty bad. SO dry and tough and overly spicy - blech. The potatoes were in such large chunks that I had to cut all of them down in order to fit them in my mouth - not a pleasant experience. The eggs were fine - can you really mess up eggs? And THANKFULLY the lemon ricotta pancakes were superb!! That seriously saved our meal and kept me full.

I do have to say that the space is adorable - inside and out and the service was really wonderful. I asked the waitress for a thousand things (including mustard!!) and she didn't even bat an eye in annoyance.

I want to like this place, I really do - and perhaps I will give it another try?

But there's a bagel joint down the road that I think we would have done a lot better off, and about $10 less.

excerpts:
- They have some pretty awesome lemon ricotta pancakes
- They do an excellent job with the crispy potatoes, which are the star of the show.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Kartik A.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
My cofounder and I have been going to Plow for lunch lately.

- They have good eggs, though at the end of the day, they aree eggs.
- They have some pretty awesome lemon ricotta pancakes
- They do an excellent job with the crispy potatoes, which are the star of the show.

They are cut small so you get to taste the outer crispy portions and aren't dealing with bland insides. Also, they are server well done - they are quite crisp.

Definitely pick something which comes with the potatoes when you are there.

- "The Plow" lets you sample the eggs, the potatoes and the pancakes in meal.
- If you are seated outside, they offer you blankets - an interesting novelty.
- I'm told they have a 2 hour wait on weekends, so weekdays might be a better option.
- I haven't tried the Chinese Breakfast - it tends to always be sold out by the time we get there.
- Its Portrero Hill, so parking isn't terrible.

excerpts: The french toast and lemon ricotta pancakes are excellent!
Ran into the owner outside one day and he sent us a free biscuit, which was maybe the best thing I've eaten all month.
Plus they make a lovely mimosa, which I appreciate as much, if not more, than the food.
The fried egg sandwich was only OK, little to great of a bread to substance ratio, IMHO.
Don't park out front on Wednesday, as it is street sweeping day and you will get ticket!
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Lindsay B.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: The french toast and lemon ricotta pancakes are excellent! Ran into the owner outside one day and he sent us a free biscuit, which was maybe the best thing I've eaten all month.  Plus they make a lovely mimosa, which I appreciate as much, if not more, than the food.  The fried egg sandwich was only OK, little to great of a bread to substance ratio, IMHO. Don't park out front on Wednesday, as it is street sweeping day and you will get ticket!

excerpts: Their lemon ricotta pancakes are the best.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Em D.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
I can keep going back here day after day and not get sick of it! I love their poached tuna sandwich (not always on the menu), but if not available then I get the chicken sandwich. Seriously ... SO DELICIOUS! Their lemon ricotta pancakes are the best.

The wait  on the weekends is LONG so try to go during the week (for lunch!) if in any way possible. And if you do go on the weekend and are unlucky and have to wait for an hour ... DO IT! It's worth it!

excerpts: Early bird gets delicious lemon ricotta pancakes.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Shum S.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: Happy every time. To avoid the crazy line, I go really early on a weekday. Early bird gets delicious lemon ricotta pancakes.

excerpts: The lemon ricotta pancakes left me wishing
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Laurent L.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
I've been here a couple times for weekend brunch. Overall, the food is outstanding. Plow serves a fancy twist on many classic breakfast and brunch favorites such as eggs, pancakes, sausage, french toast, etc. The ingredients taste fresh and all parts of the dish are carefully and thoughtfully seasoned.

Several items stood out for me. The "crispy potatoes" are similar to hash browns, but cut bigger. I don't usually care for hash browns, but the crispy potatoes at Plow are amazing; the perfect mix of crispy and savory. The french toast also stands out; they make it with really thick slices of fresh bread. The lemon ricotta pancakes left me wishing I had just ordered fifteen of them and nothing else!

I would have given five stars, but there is a price to pay for eating at Plow --- the wait. The two times I went were during lulls; I had "late brunch" at 2pm, and I had brunch during the holidays when most people were out of town. I waited 45min and 30min respectively, and I was lucky. The 45min wait would have been much longer, but two parties ahead of us changed their minds and left. I can only imagine what the wait must be like at "normal" hours. It's typical to see a crowd of people waiting outside Plow when you walk by on the weekend. A long wait is almost part of the experience! They don't take reservations so there is no way around it. Part of me wonders whether the food tastes so good simply because I'm starved by the time I get to eat it.

excerpts: I tried the lemon ricotta pancakes from the mister's plate, which made me wish I ordered them.
Overall, very tasty food and good, friendly service.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Thi D.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: Came here on a weekday at 1pm.  There was plenty of seating outdoors, but we opted for inside since it was a little chilly.  We had to wait about 20 minutes for a table.  I definitely dig the ambiance inside.  My friend and I ordered the soft scrambled eggs, the cherry tomatoes and goat cheese for me, and the oyster mushrooms and cheddar for her.  The mister ordered the plow.  My eggs were cooked perfectly and had a lot of flavor.  I can see why people rave about the crispy potatoes because they were very good.  I tried the lemon ricotta pancakes from the mister's plate, which made me wish I ordered them.  Overall, very tasty food and good, friendly service.

excerpts: Plow is not a greasy spoon, so it is not going to satisfy palates accustomed to heavier fare, but if you are hungry, the Plow dish (two eggs, choice of house made pork sausage, Nueske bacon, or chicken apple sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes + crispy potatoes) is a great choice for people who are not on any restricted diets.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Kristina P.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
It's true that the wait for breakfast at Plow is usually long, but the line-up there is packed because people want to eat well prepared and healthy food that is fresh, local, and organic. The demand is therefore high. If you're an early riser, I'd recommend arriving at Plow at opening time in order to avoid the wait. 

I eat rather "clean" by following a Paleo/SCD diet, which advocates avoiding starches and consuming high quality meats, vegs, and fruits. Plow serves delicious meals that easily fit in with this eating philosophy. The Two Eggs dish is a great option for people following this diet. Note that the staff can swap the potatoes with greens.

Service and atmosphere are both very good. 

Plow is not a greasy spoon, so it is not going to satisfy palates accustomed to heavier fare, but if you are hungry, the Plow dish (two eggs, choice of house made pork sausage, Nueske bacon, or chicken apple sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes + crispy potatoes) is a great choice for people who are not on any restricted diets.

excerpts: Lemon ricotta pancakes were delicious.
Less fluffy and more cakey which I liked and the lemon flavor was not overpowering.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: P W.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Got there on a Sunday morning around 10am and the wait wasn't too bad! About 35 mins for a party of 2 which is pretty reasonable for this place.

Ordered "The Plow" since I wanted to try a few different items (Not to mention, seems like everyone orders it so I figured it must be good).

Lemon ricotta pancakes were delicious. Less fluffy and more cakey which I liked and the lemon flavor was not overpowering. The crispy potatoes were good too. My sunnyside egg was okay although the yolk part ended up getting cooked in some parts so it wasnt as runny as it should be but otherwise, decent. The chicken sausages had a strange (but not in a bad way) taste although next time I think I'll try the bacon.

Probably not worth an hour+ wait but for 30 mins, I'd come back again

excerpts: I loved the lemon ricotta pancakes and the chicken apple sausage.
I asked for poached eggs, but I wish they put hollandaise sauce on it or even some spices would have been good.
Although I loved the food, I don't know if it was worth
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Reva B.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
I went for brunch on a Sunday around 11am. It was a two hour wait, which I already expected based on previous Yelp reviews. There were 8 of us and they can only take groups of 6 or 7 so they seated 6 of us outside and 2 of us inside.

Food wise - I ordered the plow, which was really good. The potatoes were crispy. I loved the lemon ricotta pancakes and the chicken apple sausage. I asked for poached eggs, but I wish they put hollandaise sauce on it or even some spices would have been good. Although I loved the food, I don't know if it was worth the 2 hour wait.

Either way, I think everyone should try this spot at least once! It's located in a really cool corner, surrounded by beautiful houses.

excerpts: The lemon ricotta pancakes were good, but not amazing.
If I ever come back, I'd probably order the chicken tinga.
I pretty much forced the dude to hand over his plate midway through our meal.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: C T.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Loved the ambience here. Super cute brunch spot, good for small groups and catching up with friends on the weekends.

I started with the Equator coffee (GREAT), and ordered the Plow for brunch.  I really enjoyed the home-made sausage, the over-easy eggs (not your average supermarket eggs) and crispy potatoes!!! The lemon ricotta pancakes were good, but not amazing.  If I ever come back, I'd probably order the chicken tinga.  I pretty much forced the dude to hand over his plate midway through our meal. YOINK.

Warning: be prepared to wait longer than the quoted time. We were told it would be a 35 minute wait, but ended up getting seated an hour and 15 minutes later.

excerpts: I was sad when I ran out of the lemon ricotta pancakes but fortunately everything else on the plate tasted good.
I polished everything off and spared the dishwasher from having to wash my plate.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: John B.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: Came here unknowing that this place is hyped like crazy. I was in the neighborhood when it opened first thing in the morning and I was trying to escape the cold rain. I was sad when I ran out of the lemon ricotta pancakes but fortunately everything else on the plate tasted good. I polished everything off and spared the dishwasher from having to wash my plate.

lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Andrea L.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Plow is one of those places I don't want to tell anyone else about. So, I'm not going to tell you about how their potatoes are perfect balance of crispy and fluffy, how the eggs are always cooked perfectly no matter the style, how their selection of teas is amazing, how the lemon ricotta pancakes will blow your mind etc. etc. 

Too many already know about Plow. The wait is always at least 45 minutes. Ah well, at least parking isn't generally a bitch and this patch of SF is generally pretty sunny too. 

People, avoid Plow!! Don't eat here!! Flee!! Flee!!! 

You definitely do not want to eat here because I do, a lot.

excerpts: Lemon ricotta pancakes is my favorite and it's one of the reasons I keep coming back.
I have convinced many patrons to try their lemon ricotta pancakes when I brunch here.
They are dense with pockets filled with ricotta (a light cheese, similar to mozzarella) and a subtle lemon flavor.
"The Plow" is a good way to sample all of their good things (it comes with lemon ricotta pancakes -smaller version).
The potatoes are tasty but their inconsistent size makes the large pieces stand out in buttery goodness and the tiny bits too burnt to eat.
Their homemade sausages are a bit dry.
I will return because think their lemon ricotta pancakes are delicious.
However, the prices, long wait, and hit-or-miss customer service pushes the over all rating down.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Ellie J.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Sitting atop Potrero Hill on the corner surrounded by trees and benches is Plow. It is a small, hip, and trendy brunch spot. Their menu changes weekly, so come back often. The boast fresh organic produce from local farms, which is the norm in San Francisco, but not the standard.

Their french toast is crunchy outside with a custard-like creaminess inside, delicately sweet and garnished with fresh berries and a brulee'd banana. Served with subtle sweet Vermont syrup (not too sweet, not too thick, just perfect syrup). 

Lemon ricotta pancakes is my favorite and it's one of the reasons I keep coming back. I have convinced many patrons to try their lemon ricotta pancakes when I brunch here. They are dense with pockets filled with ricotta (a light cheese, similar to mozzarella) and a subtle lemon flavor. I've tried to replicate their lemon-ricotta pancakes and while my pancakes can be similar in taste, they do not have the same thick, rich and hearty elements that Plow creates.

The eggs benedict are okay. The star of the dish is the hollandaise sauce which I feel is too zesty.  Most holllandaise sauce has a mild creamy flavor with subtle tang, however Plow's hollandaise sauce has a robust tang that overpowers the other mildly flavored components. I suspect a heavy hand in lemon juice. Poached eggs cooked to perfection. 

"The Plow" is a good way to sample all of their good things (it comes with lemon ricotta pancakes -smaller version). The potatoes are tasty but their inconsistent size makes the large pieces stand out in buttery goodness and the tiny bits too burnt to eat. Their homemade sausages are a bit dry. However, you can't go wrong with the chicken apple sausages (yum). 

The house made organic yogurt + granola with fresh fruit is not worth it. I think that it could have used more berries and less citrus fruits in my honest opinion. 

The fried egg sandwich is okay. The nueske bacon makes it a tad better. The acme bun was lovely. Everything else was standard. 

The dungenous crab scramble was tasty. It had hearty pieces of crab meat. Definitely a go to dish to try. But I think it's a bit pricey at $17. 

The almond pancake was disappointing. I didn't taste any flavor of almond. But I suppose that it is a fan for gluten-free eaters. 

The counter seating is quite small and can be uncomfortable, however that's where you get to see the magic of everything being cooked. I like sitting outside because it's quieter. Inside its warm and loud. 

Price wise, I think it's expensive. IMO, I think that brunch should be $10 and under. Many of the dishes here can be made at home for the fraction of the price. The prices here $10-$17 per meal. Not including extra such as drinks or side dishes. The coffee alone is a whopping $3.75.

Overall, I think that the food is prepared well and presented beautifully. I will return because think their lemon ricotta pancakes are delicious. However, the prices, long wait, and hit-or-miss customer service pushes the over all rating down.

oh so crispy!

lemon ricotta pancakes.author: S. D.

lemon ricotta pancakes.review:

As one reviewer said it looks like going right before they close is the way to do it. Or go back during the week as I did.

lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
YES, the lemon ricotta pancakes are as good as everyone says. You might be thinking, "Really? Lemon...and ricotta? How amazing can it be?" Let me tell you. Amazing. Nearly life-changing. I couldn't stop thinking about it for the rest of the day. I'M THAT SERIOUS. And I don't even like ricotta. 

They do not skimp on the bacon either! Get "the plow" if you can't decide between sweet and savory. (But to be honest, about an hour later I wished I had gotten the full serving of the Lemon Ricotta Pancakes. SO GOOD.)

Came in on a Thursday afternoon @1pm. Got seated at the bar within 5 minutes. Score! Space is tight, but the food is worth it!

Staff is wonderful and the atmosphere is very fun. Seems very kid-friendly as I saw multiple families there with their little ones.

excerpts: My friend and I tried the lemon ricotta pancakes and the dungeness crab scrambled eggs.
3 stars for the lemon ricotta pancakes.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Helen D.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Four stars for potential.

My friend and I tried the lemon ricotta pancakes and the dungeness crab scrambled eggs.

The scramble was quite tasty. Although the flavor of scallions dominated the dish, I'm a fan of scallions - so it was fine by me! The scramble didn't really have a crab flavor - but there were large chunks of delectable crab meat - eminently enjoyable! 

5 stars for the breakfast potatoes as well - perfect crunch outside, soft inside.

3 stars for the lemon ricotta pancakes. They were well-cooked and the lemon flavor was subtle but good, but somehow they didn't live up to expectations (perhaps because we ate them second and they were cold).

Slight negative: they only have drip coffee. Would have loved to have had my morning latte there...

Hope to return sometime soon!

excerpts: - Lemon ricotta pancakes - Light, fluffy, lemony, one of the best pancakes I've had
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Snuffles B.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
We violated the cardinal rule of Sunday Brunch, which is to be a lazy bum and roll out of bed incoherently to eat at an hour where the rest of the world could have done half a day's work already. Instead we got up at 7:30 so we could avoid the line. So technically, we didn't have brunch, we had breakfast and believe it or not, if you get there at 8:30, you might still have to wait b/c they stagger the first seating (outside and inside). 

The inside has an open but farmy feel, the outside is on the sidewalk on a steep hill - VERY challenging to avoid getting a sunburn and if you are facing up the hill, its a work out just to get your head close enough to the plate to eat your food. Plus the time we got our food, half the block was a waiting area for ravenously hungry Brunch-seekers, so I'd vote to sit inside. The servers are very nice and do a good job.

- Monkey bread - don't be deceived, this is NOT banana bread - its like a cinnamon roll and french toast hybrid - tasty
- Donut - a bit dry but still a good cake donut
- Egg Sandwich - Big, messy, technically challenging to eat, and yummy
- Bacon - Its bacon, you will like it unless there is something wrong with you
- Crispy potatoes - In fact crispy but a bit bland
- Pork Sausage - Pretty light and tasty
- Lemon ricotta pancakes - Light, fluffy, lemony, one of the best pancakes I've had
- Almond flour pancakes - Also light and fluffy, but tasted like a regular pancake, not a hint of almond to be found.

While this place is tasty, its not wait-for-an-hour-and-get-a-sunburn-tasty. And don't get me started about the bathroom line - OY.

Other stuff is good but the pancakes are what you go for.
Honorable mention-
their bread and butter is somehow amazing.
I don't find their egg breakfast items to be over the top but a main staple

excerpts: The lemon ricotta pancakes are quite delicious as well.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Helen Z.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Simple, yummy breakfast. 

It might sound silly, but their eggs are perfectly, lovingly scrambled. Just soft and creamy enough and oh-so-fluffy. It's my benchmark for how great a brunch place is, and this place is a winner. 

The lemon ricotta pancakes are quite delicious as well. The plow includes the pancakes, eggs, bacon, and crispy potatoes (what?!) Go to Plow and get the Plow, please.

Just one caveat: there's usually an hour-ish long wait, so be wary of that. It's the only thing that stops me from going all the time.

excerpts: So, we met our friends here for some lemon ricotta pancakes, dungeness crab scramble, and fried soft shell crab sandwich thing.
Originally the waitress said there was no more monkey bread left because we were just inquiring what it is.
Then she came out and told us, of course, we snatched it up!!

lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Stephanie Y.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Very cute neighborhood brunch spot. We waited for about 15 minutes before getting a table outside on a beautiful Sunday. The tables were so close together, that once one person sits, the other person behind you can't move. So, we met our friends here for some lemon ricotta pancakes, dungeness crab scramble, and fried soft shell crab sandwich thing. Originally the waitress said there was no more monkey bread left because we were just inquiring what it is. Then she came out and told us, of course, we snatched it up!! So a monkey bread is basically a cinnamon swirl bread inside out. Um...when it's nice and warm, it's quite amazing. 

So ... I had the scramble. It was pretty good, definitely a good amount of crab. I did order a side of bacon and it was over cooked. Wayyy too crispy.

excerpts: as it comes with 2 eggs any style, crispy potatoes, sausage or bacon, and those lemon ricotta pancakes.
The potatoes are hot goodness.
Even an hour later sitting in that compostable take-out box.
Ohmy.
The sausage is top-notch too, even though I don't usually order meat with my breakfast (chicken apple, if you're wondering the flavor!).
The pancakes, which I was really anticipating, were not as rich as I was hoping.

Also, (TMI alert)
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Tiffany C.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
3.5 stars. Plow does NOT make it easy to get to by public transportation. My fault. Catching a bus from North Beach on Giants game day is most likely the worst decision in recent SF traveling history. The bus jostled me all the way down and fortunately dropped me off only a block away, but never again - it took took me more than an hour.

Ahem, I got my order to-go (and yes, it was rather cold by the time I dug in) but from a quick glance the ambiance is super nice. Buuutt, I can see why it gets ridiculous on weekends. They really haven't much space inside for more than maybe 9 measly groups.. a couple tables outside. A bit like the old Outerlands format, but marginally larger.

I ordered the Plow since I don't expect I'd be making this trip again (why on earth are you near absolutely nothing, Plow?!) as it comes with 2 eggs any style, crispy potatoes, sausage or bacon, and those lemon ricotta pancakes. The potatoes are hot goodness. Even an hour later sitting in that compostable take-out box. Ohmy. The sausage is top-notch too, even though I don't usually order meat with my breakfast (chicken apple, if you're wondering the flavor!). The pancakes, which I was really anticipating, were not as rich as I was hoping. I guess I'm a fatty. I was hoping for a bit more creaminess/ricotta to burst out and shine, but it's very subtle. It isn't dry as some others have commented, but definitely not the best pancakes I've ever had either. They're too dense, perhaps griddle cakes would be a better term. Also, (TMI alert) I tasted lemon from when I ate it in the afternoon til I went to sleep which makes me think there must have been some kind of lemon extract or something in there cause it was way too strong.... just my opinion.

I wish I'd shared it with someone and perhaps taken in the restaurant a bit more casually, but I'd have to say the food I ate wasn't really worth coming all the way over. Glad I tried it, but not going again.

excerpts: Their lemon ricotta pancakes were killer and potatoes so tasty!
I can't put enough exclamation points in this review to fully articulate my experience.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Kevin M.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: Delicious! One of the best places I ate at while visiting San Francisco. We sat outside so the wait wasn't long, but even if you do have to wait, the food is worth it. Their lemon ricotta pancakes were killer and potatoes so tasty! I can't put enough exclamation points in this review to fully articulate my experience.

excerpts: The next course for me was a combination plate that sounded and tasted too good to be true:  a festival of flavors including extraordinary lemon ricotta pancakes, perfectly crispy home fried potatoes and housemade fennel sausage.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Derek W.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Picking a favorite brunch spot in San Francisco is a little like deciding which of your children you love the best.  There are many worthy contenders, hence the significance of my ordination of Plow as personal  favorite was a choice well considered.

I was primed to love this place when we drove up and saw expectant diners waiting patiently on every corner adjoining the restaurant, sipping delicious coffee on the house.  A second indication of the fine feast to come was the plump, perfectly contented pig which graces each menu and serves as the restaurant's icon.   I studied the menu carefully and greedily as we waited.

Ordering a 1/2 "appetizer" portion of the French Toast with caramelized apples, mascarpone, and maple syrup seemed like the right thing to do, and it was a good call indeed, every bite moist, rich and delightful.  

The next course for me was a combination plate that sounded and tasted too good to be true:  a festival of flavors including extraordinary lemon ricotta pancakes, perfectly crispy home fried potatoes and housemade fennel sausage.  Paired with eggs, this terrific trio took me on a non-stop flight to gastro-paradise.   

My girlfriend loved her soft scrambled eggs with merguez sausage and even conceded to the home fry perfection, quite an accomplishment given that ambivalence is generally the best a breakfast potato can hope for from her.  We both loved the fresh squeezed orange juice, too, an item I can safely say we hold to nearly-impossibly-high standards.
 
The open layout, simple decor and beautiful photography created a pleasant ambiance, and our server was a picture of attentiveness and calm amidst the bustling scene.

There will be many return visits.

excerpts: The plow is two eggs, choice of house made pork sausage, Nueske bacon, or chicken apple sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes + crispy potatoes.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Jayne A.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
If you are indecisive (like me) get the plow so you can get a taste of everything. The plow is two eggs, choice of house made pork sausage, Nueske bacon, or chicken apple sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes + crispy potatoes.

The pancakes sound weird but they are definitely worth trying. The home fries are unique since they have both crunchy and chunky pieces. There are small pieces that are basically French fries and others that are like home fries. It is an awesome mix since you usually only get home fries for breakfast. All in all a wonderful start to my Sunday. 

Although the wait was pretty long, the service was great so I am more than willing to come back for the plow anytime.

excerpts: Lemon ricotta pancakes were only ok.

lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Lemon ricotta pancakes were only ok. The texture was not as light and fluffy as I has hoped, but the flavor was just sweet enough and delicate. 

Their coffee cake was out of this world, though! Why I didn't see any notes on the cake is beyond me. We ordered this as an afterthought.  My cousin an I took one bite and all conversation stopped. All we could do is chew, smile, and make "mmm" sounds for like 5 minutes! 

Everything else we ordered was as good as expected, based on the other reviews.
