Overall, a sweet neighborhood gem.
Would probably come back if the wait weren't so long!
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Lisa H.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: De-lightful! First, I must say I've never had such pleasant service for brunch in SF. 5 stars for Katie, our server. Parking was easy, but the wait was killer, close to 2 hours, however it makes sense since the place is tiny and they don't rush you. We put our name down and made a Philz Coffee run with time to spare. Nonetheless! Loved how they had a sweet and savory option - The Plow - with 2 lemon ricotta pancakes, eggs, crispy potatoes and your choice of house made sausage patties, chicken apple sausage or bacon. Overall, a sweet neighborhood gem. Would probably come back if the wait weren't so long!

excerpts: I had the lemon ricotta pancakes and my boyfriend had the soft scrambled eggs with the most delicious breakfast potatoes ever!
The place was a bit cramped, we shared a table with another couple which was fine.
The pancakes were to die for and the service was great.
Love Plow.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Denisse R.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: Best breakfast/brunch place in the city. I met up with my boyfriend on a Saturday around just before noon. Be prepared to wait a good hour for a table in this tiny little spot. Once we tasted the food, it was no wonder there was a line. I had the lemon ricotta pancakes and my boyfriend had the soft scrambled eggs with the most delicious breakfast potatoes ever! The place was a bit cramped, we shared a table with another couple which was fine. The pancakes were to die for and the service was great. Love Plow.

excerpts: From all of the rave reviews, I was really expecting to be "wowed" by the lemon ricotta pancakes.
I found them to be yummy but nothing special.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Alison A.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
I ate here a couple weeks ago with my mom and sister. Parking was pretty easy to find, but it might take a couple trips around the block. The wait was around 45 minutes as promised.. A few groups got to be seated sooner, but sadly a bunch of groups came back who had been passed up on the list earlier.

Mom and sister both got the plow, and I had some of theirs. From all of the rave reviews, I was really expecting to be "wowed" by the lemon ricotta pancakes. I found them to be yummy but nothing special. They did have very good crispy potatoes though.

I had the french toast with kumquat compote. Sadly, I was very unimpressed by this dish. It was okay, but I make better french toast. I finished it though. It was not inedible. They did have some yummy bacon which i ordered as a side.

Customer service was friendly, which is always a plus. The girl working the front door and our waitress were both very nice. As far as eating here again, I wouldn't go out of my way for it, but if the occasion arose, I wouldn't protest.

excerpts: The Crispy Potatoes are amazing as are the Lemon Ricotta Pancakes and of the egg dises I've had, the scrambled eggs are delicious.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Alasdair S.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
French Toast doesn't get better than this.

French Toast is, most usually, the dish I order when going out to breakfast/brunch. Up until now it's been a matter of comparing dishes that are that are ok to terrible but it's not fair to even think of comparing Plow to anywhere else. The Crispy Potatoes are amazing as are the Lemon Ricotta Pancakes and of the egg dises I've had, the scrambled eggs are delicious.

The excellence of the food has to, of course, be attributed to great chefs but also to the quality of the ingredients all sourced from local farms.

The only gripe I can make is about their coffee which, as one would correctly assume, is excellent but the $3 per cup (free refills) price tag is a bit steep.

Based on various other reviews here, I've never considered going on the weekend but have never had to wait more than five minutes for a table on a mid-morning weekday and have never had an issue with parking. However, if you can only make it on the weekend I would say that the wait is worth it.

excerpts: The three of us knew Plow was known for their lemon ricotta pancakes and made sure we ordered those.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Lily R.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
So...Where do I start? My two girlfriends and I came on a Sunday afternoon, expecting the wait. We showed up around 11, and were told it would be an hour and a half wait. Yikes. Luckily, we had a lot to catch up on and the weather was absolutely perfect for spending walking around the area. An hour passed and we managed to swipe a spot on a planter nearby to sit upon. An hour and a half passed and there was still one more party of 3 to be seated before us. Just short of two hours passed and we were seated at the bar facing the open kitchen.

The three of us knew Plow was known for their lemon ricotta pancakes and made sure we ordered those. We also decided upon the hash, soft scrambled eggs, and french toast. As a side, we ordered the heirloom tomato salad. After ordering, we waited another likely 45 minutes to be served. They were busy and there were just two cooks preparing the food for all the patrons. 

It was far too much food for three rather small women, but we gladly forced ourselves to finish it all. Our brunch wasn't cheap (all that food plus drinks for each of us), but was WELL worth it, as was the wait. I will gladly return at the next opportunity that arises. Although, hopefully that will happen earlier in the morning so as to reduce that impressive wait.

excerpts: This care extends to the house-made sausage patties, lemon ricotta pancakes, biscuits and perfectly runny eggs.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: The K.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
A lot of care clearly goes into the dishes here.  Best evidence are the potatoes that come with the dishes: Even for very fine breakfast establishments, home fries or hash browns or whatever the accompanying spud side happens to be, is often an afterthought and underwhelming.  At Plow, the potatoes must be cooked twice.  They appear to be smashed before frying which likely means they were boiled or blanched first.  They are seasoned liberally (but not overly) with prominent rosemary.  They are ridiculously good!  This care extends to the house-made sausage patties, lemon ricotta pancakes, biscuits and perfectly runny eggs.  Ingredients are all locally-sourced and periodic wine-paired dinner events involving local vintners are a real plus.  

Plow serves as an anchor establishment in a classic San Francisco neighborhood, but, for better or worse (depending on whether you live close by, I guess), it has become one of the hottest breakfast tables in the City.  This reputation is well-deserved based on our experience.  The chef-owners' hearts are very clearly in the right place evidenced by the menu planning and preparation of the offerings.  It is very possible that the project that is Plow has taken on a life of its own, exceeding its initial space for sure and maybe even the scope that was intended.  That is certainly not the owners' fault and, yes, maybe the wait and crowds detract from the entire experience, but, in my opinion, the vision of a locally-sourced, locally-grounded restaurant that serves great food should be supported and congratulated.  Not everyone wants to own a restaurant, but, if we did, isn't this what we would hope for ourselves?

excerpts: Lemon Ricotta pancakes,
the size of a coffee cup saucer were INCREDIBLE!!!
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Kevin S.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: Well worth the wait!  Possibly the best breakfast I have eaten out!  Lemon Ricotta pancakes, the size of a coffee cup saucer were INCREDIBLE!!!

excerpts: We tried a veggie scramble with goat cheese, fava greens and mushrooms with a side of perfectly done potatoes and lemon ricotta pancakes.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Amber K.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
This urban-country localvore spot is a gem in Potrero. Plow boasts an open, airy kitchen and just handful of tables, mason jars full of herbs for decor and a small but delectable menu of farm fresh goods done well. 

We tried a veggie scramble with goat cheese, fava greens and mushrooms with a side of perfectly done potatoes and lemon ricotta pancakes. Perfect for a rainy day breakfast.

Fun fact: the sweet owners also own Ruby Wine around the corner, a great wine shop and an asset to our neighborhood.

I will be back! I can't wait to try lunch.

excerpts: Since then I have been wanting to check out Plow purely for the solid reviews and the lemon ricotta pancakes! :-)
In this case it was "The Plow" (two of their lemon ricotta pancakes, two eggs, Nueske bacon and crispy potatoes).
This is my usual breakfast choice anyways--like pancakes but gotta have breakfast meat and potatoes or hash browns!
Even though food took some time coming out, my table was happy with our orders.
The savory bread pudding was a hit as was the BLT, hamburger and egg sandwich.
The table also shared an order of the French toast which all seemed to enjoy and describe as a hybrid with bread pudding.
I was too full so resisted trying it.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Christopher W.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
First off, couldn't resist a "Go Aggies!"--I did not know that Plow was co-owned by a fellow Aggie, until my friend Mindy pointed it out.  Very cool to see Aggie alum out and doing what they are passionate about. :-)

I stumbled upon Plow using Yelp Nearby on my Android phone in Dec '10 when my buddies and I finished up the Anchor Steam brewery tour.  Unfortunately at that point people decided it was easier to go back to The Marina (joy.)  Since then I have been wanting to check out Plow purely for the solid reviews and the lemon ricotta pancakes! :-)

When we decided to grab breakfast in SF this weekend, I suggested it and even though it was off the beaten path, people thought we should check it out!  My buddy Richard made it on time (9:30am) when we said we would meet and put in our name for a table of 6.  A little over an hour later we sat down.  The kitchen was bustling and people seemed to be enjoying their food!

I usually order what I first put my eye on.  In this case it was "The Plow" (two of their lemon ricotta pancakes, two eggs, Nueske bacon and crispy potatoes).  This is my usual breakfast choice anyways--like pancakes but gotta have breakfast meat and potatoes or hash browns!  Even though food took some time coming out, my table was happy with our orders.  The savory bread pudding was a hit as was the BLT, hamburger and egg sandwich.  The table also shared an order of the French toast which all seemed to enjoy and describe as a hybrid with bread pudding.  I was too full so resisted trying it.  Next time.

One of the great perks (for all coffee drinkers) is that they allow you/and even offer you coffee while you are waiting!  Didn't see if they actually ended up charging for it.  Regardless it's a nice gesture.  

Great to see business so solid, and if there was a way to get the wait down, I will be highly likely to return!

excerpts: The lemon ricotta pancakes are good but not as exquisite as I anticipated, nor is the strawberry lemonade.
Overall it's very enjoyable nonetheless.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: J L.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: The food is definitely great but it doesn't warrant a 2+ hour wait (on the weekend)!  Come on a week day if you'd like to be seated in 30- minutes, or early in the morning at their opening time on the weekend (no way!).  The lemon ricotta pancakes are good but not as exquisite as I anticipated, nor is the strawberry lemonade.  Overall it's very enjoyable nonetheless.

excerpts: We had:  The lemon ricotta pancakes.
The pancakes were light and fluffy with bright citrus notes throughout.
The clear winner for us.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Kim A.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Was sent here by a friend who is a "brunch junkie".  He told me this is his favorite place at the moment.  I was not disappointed.

You've gotta go early to get a seat.  I hear there can be an hour plus wait on weekends.  Both times I've gone we were seated right away and there were folks waiting for seats (and our parking spaces) when we left.  

We had:  The lemon ricotta pancakes.  The pancakes were light and fluffy with bright citrus notes throughout.  The clear winner for us.  My friend had the Caramelized Banana French Toast, how can you go wrong with Bananas Foster topping on french toast and Marscapone cheese on the side?  

On my second trip we both had the two eggs special.  One with crispy bacon the other with house make pork sausage, perfectly seasoned with fennel, our favorite.  The breakfast potatoes are amazing!  Perfectly crunchy on the outside, light and fluffy on the inside.  Not one bite left on either plate...   

I'll be keeping Plow on my breakfast list too.  The space has a bright, clean, open feel, like going to a friends place for breakfast.  In fact, I'm going to meet friends there this morning.

excerpts: I am in love with those lemon ricotta pancakes.
If not for the long wait times, I would be here every weekend.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Akshaya M.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: 'The Plow' at the Plow is the best breakfast ever. I am in love with those lemon ricotta pancakes.  If not for the long wait times, I would be here every weekend.

excerpts: The lemon ricotta pancakes, however, are the one thing that stuck in my mind as being inordinately good.

lemon ricotta pancakes.review: This place was just A-OK. It's your basic breakfast diner-fare, but in a youthful, upbeat setting. The lemon ricotta pancakes, however, are the one thing that stuck in my mind as being inordinately good.

excerpts: On the other hand, the Lemon ricotta pancakes are to die for, they so moist.
Do not leave this place without trying the lemon ricotta pancakes.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Nithya S.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
I usually don't go to brunch places that don't take reservations only because I find it very very hard to wait in line and smell all the good food and not being able to eat it (you know what I mean ;)).  Well now if you decide to try this place you are most likely going to wait for anywhere between 30-40mins. Our party of 5 arrived and had to wait nearly an hour to get our table which was outside.  Would have preferred a table inside, but after an hour of waiting, I starving and was frankly very glad to get A table. 

By the time we settled down at our table and were ready to order, they were sold out of monkey bread and huevos rancheros! The 2 two things I was going to try here. Well instead I decided to order the Eggs Benedict and decided to share "the plow" with my friend (hey don't judge me I was starving!! :D).  The Hollandaise sauce was too lemony for my taste and didn't quite compliment the poached eggs and the veggies.  On the other hand, the Lemon ricotta pancakes are to die for, they so moist.  Do not leave this place without trying the lemon ricotta pancakes.  Oh almost forgot, the Crispy Potatoes are sooooo goood. 

Frankly I have had better food at places with less of a wait time than here.

excerpts: : I ordered The Plow ($15), and the lemon ricotta pancakes are just as good as everyone says.
And I am always happy to see real maple syrup instead of high-fructose corn syrup crap.
The eggs were also perfectly scrambled, and the homemade chicken apple sausage were smokey and sweet in a way that only homemade chicken apple sausage can be.
I was pretty disappointed with the potatoes, which seemed to be more small pieces of deep fried once-potato.
I like them crispy, but I still like to know they were once potatoes.
The coffee was also good, but $3.75?
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Amy B.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Was it delicious? Yep. Was it worth waiting an hour for a table for? Absolutely not. Of course, I don't think any food in the world is worth waiting for an hour for. When I want to eat, I want to eat!

Thankfully, I was catching up with a great old friend, which made the hour a bit bearable. But come on, who waits that long for brunch? I can think of many places where I can go for an equally good (or better) brunch where I don't have to wait that long, nor do I have to pay nearly $20 for. Don't get me wrong: I'm glad that I tried it and I thoroughly enjoyed the food, but I don't think I'll return to a place where a brunch dish and coffee costs almost $20 and I have to wait an hour. 

So, the good stuff: I ordered The Plow ($15), and the lemon ricotta pancakes are just as good as everyone says. And I am always happy to see real maple syrup instead of high-fructose corn syrup crap. The eggs were also perfectly scrambled, and the homemade chicken apple sausage were smokey and sweet in a way that only homemade chicken apple sausage can be. I was pretty disappointed with the potatoes, which seemed to be more small pieces of deep fried once-potato. I like them crispy, but I still like to know they were once potatoes. The coffee was also good, but $3.75? When did coffee become a side dish?

If you can get there on a day or at a time where you don't have to wait too long, it's definitely worth a splurge or somewhere to bring an out-of-town guest. But I likely won't be a regular.

lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Kalani C.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Came here with a friend for breakfast.  She likes her breakfast places, so I knew this would be good.  

Place was uncrowded when we arrived but packed when we left; good timing and good sign.  Plow is a rather narrow restaurant, but so very cute with its high ceilings and windows ushering bright natural light; its bustling open kitchen and warm wood accents to offset the stainless cold of the chairs.  

The waitress was nice, but in hindsight rather rushy towards the end.  She reminded me of a Heather Graham, say, from Boogie Nights.  I dunno.  Anyhow, we ordered the Lemon Ricotta Pancakes and the Carmalized Banana French Toast.  Without a doubt, the Lemon Ricotta Pancakes were outrageous!  Clearly the winner here.  The texture was nice and heavily influenced by the ricotta.  The lemon wasn't tart but more sweet and more noticeable with every passing bite.  My friend tried to catch a glimpse of its batter being made, however the chef cleverly tipped the bowl and all is still a secret.

Smoked trout salad was tossed with the most flavorful olive oil,lemon,garlic dressing in recent memory.
Fantastically delicious salad with salty smoked trout, avocado and frisee.

lemon ricotta pancakes.review: Plow offers high quality,delicious food.Lemon ricotta pancakes were more puddingish than cakey.Smoked trout salad was tossed with the most flavorful olive oil,lemon,garlic dressing in recent memory. Fantastically delicious salad with salty smoked trout, avocado and frisee. Crispy potatoes were very nice. Mushroom and point Reyes cheese sandwich on an acme roll was outstanding. Abita root beer was refreshing...Small place.We waited 20 minutes on a Wednesday at 1:00.

You HAVE to GET their LEMON RICOTTA Pancakes.

excerpts: If you like lemon/citrus, get the lemon ricotta pancakes - very unique and delicious flavors.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Teresa M.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: Another cozy little breakfast spot in SF. Great service and decor. The potatoes and eggs were good, but I would not get the sausage patties if I were to visit again. If you like lemon/citrus, get the lemon ricotta pancakes - very unique and delicious flavors.

excerpts: I had the plow, which consisted of bacon, eggs, crispy potatoes (my 2nd favorite item on the plate), and the mini lemon ricotta pancakes (the best part on the plate).
I don't know why, but the potatoes just stood out for me.
They were perfectly crispy and had a nice herb flavor.
I've wanted to try lemon ricotta pancakes for a while
and I'm glad I got to try it here.
They were fluffy and moist.
You get the subtle underlying flavors of lemon in there, like when eating a lemon cream filled cookie.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: robin w.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
I had no idea the hill it was located on was so steep. My friend almost flew out of her seat as she stepped out. If she weren't holding on to the steering wheel she would have hurdled into the car beside us. I love the place though. It almost seems like Mama's, but more contemporary and casual. We also didn't have to wait in line. Amazing.

The ceiling was just gigantic. It makes you feel like you're 2 feet tall. Beside us were the towering windows and everything in the restaurant made you feel welcome. Absolutely loved the service. Out waitress was so nice and came by to check it everything was well. 

Now for the food. I had the plow, which consisted of bacon, eggs, crispy potatoes (my 2nd favorite item on the plate), and the mini lemon ricotta pancakes (the best part on the plate). I don't know why, but the potatoes just stood out for me. They were perfectly crispy and had a nice herb flavor. I've wanted to try lemon ricotta pancakes for a while and I'm glad I got to try it here. They were fluffy and moist. You get the subtle underlying flavors of lemon in there, like when eating a lemon cream filled cookie. So good. 

I also got to try the french toast. Just delightful. The pure maple syrup really made it taste as good as it did, but I think the ingredient that really did it was the caramel. There was a bit of caramel on the bananas and it just made it stand out from all the other french toast that I've had before. 

I'd love to come here again. Maybe on a sunnier day, but there will probably be a long line. A bit pricey for a breakfast joint, but the ambiance is really amazing there and it's worth a try.

lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Tai N.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Love Plow. Love that it came to Potrero.  If you don't live nearby, still worth the drive.  And there's always parking here so no stress.

What to order:  lemon ricotta pancakes (get an order to share with the table), biscuits and gravy or huevos rancheros if it's on the menu, and no matter what make sure you get a side of potatoes (they're the best crispy potato you'll ever have).

I'm still not a fan, but maybe if you're a pancake person you'll love them.

the flavor is there and i could definitely taste the ricotta, but i'm glad i only ordered them through 'the plow' - you get 2 smaller versions of the normal-size panckaes - otherwise i wouldn't have been able to finish them.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Jennifer W.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Everyone raved about the lemon ricotta pancakes so even thought I'm not a fan of pancakes, I ordered 'the plow' specifically to try them. I'm still not a fan, but maybe if you're a pancake person you'll love them. the flavor is there and i could definitely taste the ricotta, but i'm glad i only ordered them through 'the plow' - you get 2 smaller versions of the normal-size panckaes - otherwise i wouldn't have been able to finish them.

I also tried the monkey bread and fried egg sandwich. Nothing blew me away as in "OMG/THIS IS TO DIE FOR" but everything is done extremely well. quality ingredients + care in preparation. I do want to come back and try the savory bread pudding, though. i sat at the counter and every few minutes the chef would slice a piece for someone's order and it looked soo amazing. didn't try it but if i hadn't asked, i would've thought it was more of a quiche. it looked so eggy and fluffy and it came with a side of huge mixed greens salad.

excerpts: plus there was some unique takes on things like lemon ricotta pancakes, breakfast sandwiches, biscuits and gravy (one of Alex's favorites).
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Jason P.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
The food here was very good...plus there was some unique takes on things like lemon ricotta pancakes, breakfast sandwiches, biscuits and gravy (one of Alex's favorites). I would suggest "The Plow" dish for the first time....BEST BREAKFAST POTATOES EVER!!! 

The service was friendly but a little absent...of course they were all wiped from a crazy morning rush like a tsunami (we got there at 1:30). Our server made a great gesture after she had forgotten about our drink order and 15 minute wait for water.  I think they are generally good staff and the bill was well worth the value. 

The wait is HORRENDOUS! We waited almost an hour...gosh, I will go back but not on the weekend or at least much much earlier.

excerpts: The lemon ricotta pancakes are amazing, the almond ones not as much.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Too M.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Prepare for the lines. 

Our service was probably the best in SF. It was the light blonde nice girl. She knew it before we even thought of it. We just had to open our mouth - and the completed the sentence for us.

Food was good. Especially the salmon benedict. The lemon ricotta pancakes are amazing, the almond ones not as much.

A very good place for breakfast/brunch.

No hard alcohol - so no bloody mary's or other cocktails. Only mimosa and wine (and beer) - and their orange juice is not squeezed on location - and therefore I avoided the mimosa.

excerpts: Must try their Lemon Ricotta Pancakes sweet soft and fluffy, If u have sweet tooth this for u. Great service as well.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Emanula M.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: Must try their Lemon Ricotta Pancakes sweet soft and fluffy, If u have sweet tooth this for u. Great service as well.

excerpts: Lemon ricotta pancakes are good, but very sweet.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Nora X.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
The potatoes. Dear god, the potatoes. I'll probably be repeating the phrase as i die of cardiac arrest here. To elaborate, the potatoes are deep fried and tossed with onions and herbs and are incredible. 

Other than that - yes, brunch is good, but it's pretty standard brunch fare done well. We had the plow and eggs benedict - plow is a great deal! You get a little of everything. Lemon ricotta pancakes are good, but very sweet. The monkey bread is also awesome and basically pieces of a cinnamon roll smushed together in a bundt pan. 

Beware - the wait is long for brunch. Walk across the street and sun yourself in front of the mechanized bikes!

excerpts: Pork sausage was good, and the lemon ricotta pancakes were good too, but it's that scramble...

lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
I'm still thinking about the crispy potatoes and the Dungeness crab scramble two days (a year) later. 

Pork sausage was good, and the lemon ricotta pancakes were good too, but it's that scramble...

what was I talking about before? totally the favorite brunch place. Totally the only brunch place I dream about or think about or compare all other brunch places to. 

Contemplating dinging it a star for ridiculous wait times. like almost 2 hours ridiculous.

excerpts: I was hoping the lemon ricotta pancakes would wow me.
But it was just alright.
There was something slightly off...
I don't know what it is to the taste.
I did like the chicken apple sausage though.
My cousin was indifferent to it.
The fried egg sandwich was my favorite.
It was like gout for breakfast.
The egg was fried perfectly and the bit of arugula (or some kind of mixed greens) helped balance out the sandwich.
I was expecting it to be super heavy
but it wasn't.
We also added bacon which made it pretty good.
We got a ton of potatoes.
In the beginning, the potatoes were really good.
But we all know that if you eat too much of something good, it becomes sorta not good.
That's what happened to us.
All in all, a good place to have brunch.
But there was a smell in the place that lingered.
I don't know if it was saffron or something.
But it stayed with me even when I left the place.
That smell also was associated with the potatoes.
And no, I know what potatoes smell like, but this smell was more herby or saffrony.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Jessica H.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Went here on a Tuesday morning with my cousin. Heard about this place from 7x7 and wanted to see if it was good.
I got the the plow and the fried egg sandwich. 
Now the plow was basically a sampler and had most of what was available on the menu. I was hoping the lemon ricotta pancakes would wow me. But it was just alright. There was something slightly off... I don't know what it is to the taste. I did like the chicken apple sausage though. My cousin was indifferent to it.
The fried egg sandwich was my favorite. It was like gout for breakfast. The egg was fried perfectly and the bit of arugula (or some kind of mixed greens) helped balance out the sandwich. I was expecting it to be super heavy but it wasn't. We also added bacon which made it pretty good.
We got a ton of potatoes. In the beginning, the potatoes were really good. But we all know that if you eat too much of something good, it becomes sorta not good. That's what happened to us.
All in all, a good place to have brunch. But there was a smell in the place that lingered. I don't know if it was saffron or something. But it stayed with me even when I left the place. That smell also was associated with the potatoes. And no, I know what potatoes smell like, but this smell was more herby or saffrony.

excerpts: Lemon ricotta pancakes and crispy potatoes made the two hour wait totally worth it.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: lisa l.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: Lemon ricotta pancakes and crispy potatoes made the two hour wait totally worth it.

excerpts: First time here so I decided to go with the "plow" sampler -- eggs (scrambled), chicken apple sausage, crispy potatoes and two lemon ricotta pancakes.
I'm getting full again even typing it out.
Definitely could have fed two people.
The crispy potatoes were very crispy, and I would have preferred a few more sautéed onions mixed in there to break up the starch overload.
Pancakes were good, moist and with the right degree of sweetness, but not spectacular.
Eggs were fluffy and yummy, probably the best part of the dish.
The nice thing was that we didn't have to wait for a table during lunchtime, and that they always serve brunch for lunch on the weekdays too.

lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
I LOVED my meal but the bf was not as excited as I was, maybe because he's not obsessed with eggs like I am.  I had the egg sandwich, duh, but next time will consider getting "the plow" bc the portions looked huge!  

minus a star because it's super tiny, they make u share tables, and the long wait (no reservations) on the weekend.

4 stars. great spot!

lemon ricotta pancakes.review: three words. lemon ricotta pancakes. 4 stars. great spot!

excerpts: We added a short stack of the lemon ricotta pancakes which were good.
I'm more of a savory breakfast eater
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Meredith K.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
This place is ahmazing!  My sister & bro-in-law keep talking about it since their friend's sister owns it.  Exceeded my expectations.   
We waited for about 20 mins for a table for 3 on a Friday around 11am.  Yes, it was crowded believe it or not.  It's super cute, quaint restaurant with lots of windows!

I had the omelette: lamb's quarters, mushrooms, goat cheese, crispy potatoes, toast.  TO DIE...you wouldn't believe how well the egg was cooked to perfection.  Wasn't dry nor was it under cooked.  Never had a more perfect omelette egg!  And the potatoes - never had anything like them.  Super tasty as they were tossed in sea salt flakes and the crispiness is like no other.

One friend had the breakfast sandwich which looked good, and the other had the plow which looked like a classic bfast to get especially if you're undecided.  We added a short stack of the lemon ricotta pancakes which were good.  I'm more of a savory breakfast eater so I was extremely content with my bfast.  

I highly recommend and would definitely come back - preferably on a weekday.

excerpts:
We ordered:
* lemon ricotta pancakes - 3 stars - Average taste.
* crispy pig ears - 1 star - Tasted like rubber.
* fried egg sandwich - 3 star - Average taste, but it was the best dish we had.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Richard S.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
This place is overrated at best.  We came here for Sunday brunch and I was sorely disappointed by the food.  

The food tasted like its chef... snobby.

To be fair, the wait staff was very friendly though.

The decor and ambiance make it look like a good restaurant but the food does not live up to expectations.  As the old saying goes, you can't judge a book by it's cover.

We sat down at our table at 1pm (one hour before closing time), so maybe they were running tired and were starting to run out of ingredients.  But man, the food was sub par.

We ordered:
* lemon ricotta pancakes - 3 stars - Average taste.
* crispy pig ears - 1 star - Tasted like rubber.
* fried egg sandwich - 3 star - Average taste, but it was the best dish we had.
* "the plow" (your typical American breakfast with eggs, choice of breakfast meat, pancakes and potatoes) - 2 stars - The bacon tasted good, but then again, it's hard to mess up bacon.  Everything else tasted like what you might get from a free continental breakfast at your good ol' Best Western.  Yelp-ers seem to rave about the crispy potatoes, but the "crispy" potatoes that came with my "the plow" dish were only ok.  The potato was not even cut into pieces all the way, so I got like one big chunk of the potato.  The other dishes at other tables seemed to have smaller potato pieces (almost like home fries), but mine was one huge chunk.

Maybe they're still working out the kinks because they're new.  Maybe their lunch items are better.

But honestly, the best thing I had was the Tapatio hot sauce.

excerpts: I LOVED the combo meal with eggs, housemade pork sausage, crispy home fries, and mini-lemon ricotta pancakes.
I love variety and this gave me everything I wanted.
The raisin brioche bun - warmed up - to start rocked.
For such a home-made place they should have fresh-squeezed my orange juice.
Made me cringe to see it come out of a purchased gallon jug.
Otherwise, impeccable.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Andrew K.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: i think we waited for like 2.5 hours, but it was a good excuse to explore Portrero Hill and I loved it. - go to Christopher's books and Farley's for coffee while you wait. I had high expectations given the reviews and the wait and everything was perfect. I LOVED the combo meal with eggs, housemade pork sausage, crispy home fries, and mini-lemon ricotta pancakes. I love variety and this gave me everything I wanted. The raisin brioche bun - warmed up - to start rocked. For such a home-made place they should have fresh-squeezed my orange juice. Made me cringe to see it come out of a purchased gallon jug. Otherwise, impeccable.

excerpts: The lemon ricotta pancakes are divine and I highly recommend The Plow, which gives you a taste of sweet and savory.
The fried egg sandwhich was nice but a little runny.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Madeline W.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: Plow has very yummy brunch.  I usually meet my sister there after her 24ers and we dine on delicious food while she deliriously tells us tales from the hospital.  Even though we usually get there early (before 9) there is always a line so be prepared to wait.  They do give out free coffee though which is a plus.  The lemon ricotta pancakes are divine and I highly recommend The Plow, which gives you a taste of sweet and savory.  The fried egg sandwhich was nice but a little runny.

excerpts: Lemon ricotta pancakes is a favorite staple here.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Rave Y.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Been going to plow for years (before the long waits) and is my favorite place in San Francisco for brunch.  I usually avoid the weekends because of the crowds but it has been busy during the weekdays also.  Parking is normally not bad in the area.  

The food has been consistently good over the years.  Like on everyone's review, The plow is my favorite but everything is good.  Had the fried egg sandwich on my last visit which was great!  The strawberry lemonade was good but I'll stick to coffee next time.  Lemon ricotta pancakes is a favorite staple here.  

I'm not normally a breakfast/brunch person but when I want a special or something different for breakfast/brunch, it's PLOW. 

They have outside seating on the sidewalk.  I prefer sitting indoors but from what I have seen, the outdoor seating is great with people with pets, restless kids and the extra seats keeps the wait time down for everyone.  I love the picture of the people sitting outside with their umbrellas out.  

Baked is a short walk away and is a favorite place for sweet treat after brunch.

excerpts: But I probably would have ordered it without the suggestion because I was set on trying their famous lemon ricotta pancakes, BEST pancakes ever and "The Plow" comes with 2 of the pancakes, sausage or bacon, potatoes, and 2 eggs.
I love it when restaurants give you an option of a sweet and savory dish.
I almost always go for it because they surprisingly don't come so often.
I tried the pumpkin pancakes the second time
and they were just OK to me.
Anyway, only downside about this place is the wait, but you can't escape that if you want to have a good brunch in SF.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Stephanie G.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: One of my favorite brunch spots in SF! I've been here twice-- once around 1pm for a late brunch, and waited around 30-40 minutes (for 2 people) and the second time, came around the same time, but waited over an hour for 3 people. We walked around a few blocks to get a cup of coffee while waiting and there were a few places to sit as well, so the wait wasn't too bad and it was definitely worth it. My boyfriend told me I should order "The Plow" and I would tell anyone else the same! But I probably would have ordered it without the suggestion because I was set on trying their famous lemon ricotta pancakes, BEST pancakes ever and "The Plow" comes with 2 of the pancakes, sausage or bacon, potatoes, and 2 eggs. I love it when restaurants give you an option of a sweet and savory dish. I almost always go for it because they surprisingly don't come so often. I tried the pumpkin pancakes the second time and they were just OK to me. Anyway, only downside about this place is the wait, but you can't escape that if you want to have a good brunch in SF.

- Poached eggs are done perfect.

excerpts: Reviewing my brunch experience here is pretty simple: great food (try the lemon ricotta pancakes!), great service, great location (there was plenty of street parking, yay!).
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Naomi A.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Reviewing my brunch experience here is pretty simple: great food (try the lemon ricotta pancakes!), great service, great location (there was plenty of street parking, yay!). 

A special shout-out to the pretty blond hostess who gracefully managed a long wait-list, and was extremely nice to us and everyone else it seemed.

Give it a try!

excerpts: I had the mini lemon ricotta pancakes and they were perfect!
I also ordered a side of crispy bacon and a side of their country potatoes.
I swear, these are the best potatoes I've had for brunch...EVER!
I asked how they were prepared and she answered my question with so much love.
I mean, I was sold after she told me.
And now, I'm going to share with you what the secret was!
They boil and roast the potatoes with salt, pepper, olive oil and thyme and caramelized onions then they deep fry them!
OMG they came out so crispy, crunchy and moist when you bite into them.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Mika D.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Finally, I stopped in today for a quick brunch. Table for 1 please! =) 
I really don't mind eating by myself. Alisa seated me and took my order. I had the mini lemon ricotta pancakes and they were perfect! I also ordered a side of crispy bacon and a side of their country potatoes. I swear, these are the best potatoes I've had for brunch...EVER! I asked how they were prepared and she answered my question with so much love. I mean, I was sold after she told me. And now, I'm going to share with you what the secret was! They boil and roast the potatoes with salt, pepper, olive oil and thyme and caramelized onions then they deep fry them! OMG they came out so crispy, crunchy and moist when you bite into them. *automatic drool*

I love this restaurant at first sight. I think this is one of my top 5 brunch spots in the City. I didn't have to wait for a table at 10:15 am today. There were a few customers who dined in. I did have their equator coffee and it was pretty good. 

Oh man, I can't wait to go back. Next time, I'm ordering the same exact thing but with extra butter for my pancakes. They're THAT good. Trust me.

lemon ricotta pancakes.review:

One of my fave brunches. Fine, fresh ingredients. Have not been disappointed with anything on the menu. My usual order is the goat cheese scramble and lemon ricotta pancakes. LRP's are cooked perfectly every time (just soft enough in the middle, and lightly browned around the edges). Hard to explain how good they are but they leave me speechless.
