Really cute place. 4.5 stars because the wait sucks!

excerpts: Eggs, the best crunch potatoes, lemon ricotta pancakes (currently), and sausage made in house.
You will however wait an hour and a half on weekends for a table.
Luckily I live around the corner...
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Kyle J.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: Great local brunch place. The plow breakfast is everything you want. Eggs, the best crunch potatoes, lemon ricotta pancakes (currently), and sausage made in house. You will however wait an hour and a half on weekends for a table. Luckily I live around the corner...

excerpts: Because it's a small cafe, the noise factor in the restaurant can get high and wait on the weekends can be discouraging as families & couples from the neighborhood make their pilgrimage to 18th Street to get smooth roasted coffee, yummy lemon ricotta pancakes, zesty chicken tinga and Nueske bacon.
We left pleasantly content, not full or overwhelmed.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Shari K.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
A perfect quaint cafe in Potrero Hill.  Let's be honest, San Francisco is a breakfast city.  For Plow to be open for breakfast & lunch is just right.  Because it's a small cafe, the noise factor in the restaurant can get high and wait on the weekends can be discouraging as families & couples from the neighborhood make their pilgrimage to 18th Street to get smooth roasted coffee, yummy lemon ricotta pancakes, zesty chicken tinga and Nueske bacon.  We left pleasantly content, not full or overwhelmed.  If you're set on making a weekend visit, you'll need to find that sweet-spot of a time if you don't want to walk through an agility course of strollers and high-chairs to have your meal.

If you want to avoid the lines, your best bet is to go on a weekday.  Plow is open from 7am on the weekdays so you can still get your douse of a wonderful breakfast without the wait and bustle.  The staff is friendly.  Having come from the service industry myself, I'm quick to sense & appreciate it when people "like" what they do.  That makes the whole experience (and meal) that more enjoyable!

excerpts: Lemon ricotta pancakes, sausages, and potatoes.
I've got to admit they were all pretty good and the plate was huge..
BUT it wasn't extremely ravingly good.
I think others might have raised my expectations to the point that when I finally tried the food, it didn't meet my expectations.
The food was good nonetheless.
Nothing memorable about the service or otherwise though.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Hannah K.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: Lemon ricotta pancakes, sausages, and potatoes. I've got to admit they were all pretty good and the plate was huge.. BUT it wasn't extremely ravingly good. I think others might have raised my expectations to the point that when I finally tried the food, it didn't meet my expectations. The food was good nonetheless. Nothing memorable about the service or otherwise though.

excerpts: I was expecting the lemon ricotta pancakes to blow me away.
They were just good.
The chicken tinga was also pretty good.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Fatty A.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: Solid brunch spot.  The wait here is cray.  Egg whites for $5.50 is cray.  The food is good but on the expensive side.  The homemade sausage patty was delicious.  I was expecting the lemon ricotta pancakes to blow me away.  They were just good.  The chicken tinga was also pretty good.  It looks heavy but was actually pretty light with soft scrambled eggs.  Thank you for not charging SF health tax.  I would go back.

excerpts: The lemon ricotta pancakes were moist and delicious.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Lindsay A.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Everything I was hoping for and more! 
OK, so the wait was a bit long (40 minutes) on a Sunday but boy was it worth it! We sat at the counter which was cozy and gave us a nice view of all the yummy foods coming out. I got the Plow with the chicken apple sausage which gave me a little taste of everything. EVERY SINGLE THING ON THE PLATE WAS AMAZING!
I don't know how some place can make even scrambled eggs more amazing than anywhere else, but Plow manages to make them that way. The lemon ricotta pancakes were moist and delicious. The crispy potatoes perfectly crisp and flavorful, didn't even need ketchup! And the sausage was equally to die for. What else can I say? amazing!

excerpts: The lemon ricotta pancakes were amazing.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Jessie F.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Yum.  Everything there was delicious.  The lemon ricotta pancakes were amazing.  Yum yum yum.

The wait is long but oh-so-worth it!

excerpts: The lemon ricotta pancakes were light and a nice alternative to the typical dense sandollars that are served in greasy spoon diners or other brunch places.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Anne D.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Great busy brunch place. The lemon ricotta pancakes were light and a nice alternative to the typical dense sandollars that are served in greasy spoon diners or other brunch places. Homefries were a little too heavy on the rosemary but had the perfect balance of crispiness and potato.

We were quoted a 2-hr wait but somehow lucked out and grabbed a table in 1 hr. They're busy but move tables reasonably fast. Get your name on the list, stroll around 18th (it won't take long) and by the time you're back you'll be seated for brunch.

excerpts: Their chicken apple sausage is delicious... as is the french toast, lemon ricotta pancakes, pumpkin pancakes, breakfast burrito, and the list goes on...
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Stephanie F.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Prepare to wait for admission!  The longest wait I've experienced here was an hour and a half, but it can be as short as 45 minutes... Meeh, not so fun.

Waiting aside, I have always loved the food.  They have a constant rotating menu of unique plates and various drinks (fresh juice, mimosas, beer, & of course, coffee) available.  Their chicken apple sausage is delicious... as is the french toast, lemon ricotta pancakes, pumpkin pancakes, breakfast burrito, and the list goes on...

Outdoor seating, yes.

Indoor seating, crowded.

If you can endure putting the time in initially, you won't be disappointed.

excerpts:
Standouts included:
+Lemon Ricotta Pancakes (house made ricotta, lemon zest, pure maple syrup) 
+Tinga (chicken in tomato chipotle sauce, two crispy corn tortillas, avocado, creme fraiche, cilantro)
+Crispy Potatoes

Mid-conversation, my friend let out a big 'MMMM!!!!

Looking forward to coming back to Plow ASAP to try their Fried Egg Sandwich, The Plow (two eggs, choice of Nueske bacon, house made pork sausage, or chicken apple sausage, two pancakes & crispy potatoes), and/or a Chocolate Eclair.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Tiffany M.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
I'm not one to vouch for restaurants that often, but in Plow's case, I guarantee that you'll like it... in fact, you'll LOVE it. I should also note that I almost never rate a place 5 stars based on a first time visit, but Plow was so freakin' good, that I feel confident in giving them 5 shiny stars.

Everything at Plow tasted just as good as it looked.

Standouts included:
+Lemon Ricotta Pancakes (house made ricotta, lemon zest, pure maple syrup) 
+Tinga (chicken in tomato chipotle sauce, two crispy corn tortillas, avocado, creme fraiche, cilantro)
+Crispy Potatoes

Mid-conversation, my friend let out a big 'MMMM!!!!" when he bit into his pancakes. I couldn't have agreed more! 

I like the fact that they work w/ local purveyors such as Frog Hollow Farms, Cowgirl Creamery, Monterey Fish Co, Acme Bread & Tcho Chocolate. When you see that they work w/ such local all-stars, you know you're in for a treat. I also really enjoyed Plow's Equator coffee while I waited for our table. And that wait was long! We came in at 11:30 am and had to wait an hour until we were seated. Normally I'd shoot for a much earlier brunch time to avoid the wait, but given that I was prepared for a leisurely Sunday brunch, the wait was pretty painless.

I love the ambiance of this place. It's small, but w/ their high ceilings and all the light that shines in from their big windows, they're able to make the space work; especially decorated in its rustic, modern, simplistic fashion. I love their signage, logo and menu- all well done. They also have stool seating where you can watch the chefs work their magic (like we did!)

The host was cool and our server efficient. Parking was ample (not surprising for Portrero Hill ) and diners seemed to be all SF locals. 

Looking forward to coming back to Plow ASAP to try their Fried Egg Sandwich, The Plow (two eggs, choice of Nueske bacon, house made pork sausage, or chicken apple sausage, two pancakes & crispy potatoes), and/or a Chocolate Eclair.

This place makes me thankful for SF's amazing food scene!

excerpts: My go-to order is conveniently named, "The Plow" which consists of 2 eggs, potatoes, 2 lemon ricotta pancakes, and your choice of breakfast meat.
The restaurant offers a slew of other items, but I can never convince myself to try anything else.
The meal never disappoints and the best part I must say are the potatoes.
Twice fried and tossed with some herbs, need I say more?
My bf loves the lemon ricotta pancakes and they are definitely the perfect size given the amount of food you get.
This time, we decided to order the Huckleberry Coffee Cake to share as well.
It was only okay for me.
The cake had a different texture than typically coffee cake (more spongy versus crumbly) and I was expecting something different.
We had to wait a good while to get our main dishes, so our waitress was nice enough to comp us on the coffee cake.
We didn't mind since we were enjoying the nice (but chilly) day, sipping our coffee.
It's a far drive for just brunch from San Jose, but definitely always worth the trek.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Michele L.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
This is by far our favorite brunch place if we go to San Francisco.  We've tried other restaurants in the city, but we always regret not coming back to Plow.  I want to give the restaurant 4.5 stars.  The restaurant is definitely small, so expect a 1 hour (or more) wait on the weekends (why I deducted a star).  

My go-to order is conveniently named, "The Plow" which consists of 2 eggs, potatoes, 2 lemon ricotta pancakes, and your choice of breakfast meat.  The restaurant offers a slew of other items, but I can never convince myself to try anything else.  The meal never disappoints and the best part I must say are the potatoes.  Twice fried and tossed with some herbs, need I say more?  My bf loves the lemon ricotta pancakes and they are definitely the perfect size given the amount of food you get.  This time, we decided to order the Huckleberry Coffee Cake to share as well.  It was only okay for me.  The cake had a different texture than typically coffee cake (more spongy versus crumbly) and I was expecting something different.  We had to wait a good while to get our main dishes, so our waitress was nice enough to comp us on the coffee cake.  We didn't mind since we were enjoying the nice (but chilly) day, sipping our coffee.  It's a far drive for just brunch from San Jose, but definitely always worth the trek.

excerpts: I love the lemon ricotta pancakes people have raved about!
I love the texture, flavor, and it's just amazing.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Racquel R.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Love, love, love this place!  Very easy access to get to off of the 280.  Cute quaint residential neighborhood.  Restaurant is at bottom of a hill. Got there at 8:30 am on a Sunday and there was already a line.  Parking was easy at that hour.  If you park on the hill, you park at 90 degrees to the curb. 
This was a birthday brunch with a girlfriend - based on review from other Yelpers and we expected a wait.  But it wasn't so bad. We were seated within a half an hour at the counter for the two of us.  No doubt about it, it's a small restaurant, but they've got their system down. The kitchen is busy and the owner and the wait staff have it down pat.  Service was quick and attentive.  We got our food quickly as well.
We both had the plow breakfast. I had it with scrambled eggs and the nueske bacon(applewood smoked bacon from Wisconsin -where the owner is from), and the best pancakes I've had in a long time. I love the lemon ricotta pancakes people have raved about!  I love the texture, flavor, and it's just amazing.  The nueske bacon was pretty good, too!  
I would definitely go back...maybe on a weekday when it may be a bit on the slower side of things.

excerpts: Lemon ricotta pancakes, almond milk pancakes and the dungeness crab scramble are some of my favorites.
During the week is less of a wait than the weekends, but honestly it's worth the wait.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Leslie S.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: Life changing brunch. I eat here pretty much once a week. Lemon ricotta pancakes, almond milk pancakes and the dungeness crab scramble are some of my favorites. During the week is less of a wait than the weekends, but honestly it's worth the wait.

excerpts: Definitely try their corn millet muffins and lemon ricotta pancakes (both VERY filling).
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Sharon T.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Go early...or go on a weekday (unless you don't mind the long wait).
That said, Plow is clean and cozy, with good friendly service. Total comfort food, all sourced from the local farms.

Definitely try their corn millet muffins and lemon ricotta pancakes (both VERY filling). If you want a heftier meal, the fried egg sandwich, and "The Plow" should meet your demands. I'll have to update this review once I have their lunch sandwiches, but so far, I'm quite satisfied.

excerpts: My sister and I split and the Plow order and it was an amazing sampler of delectable delights including: lemon ricotta pancakes,  home made pork sausages, crispy potatoes with rosemary and two eggs
any style that your heart desires.
When they say crispy potatoes, they really mean crispy.
We actually got specific recommendations to get their potatoes since they are so yummy there
and it was totally true.
Forget your usual limp, dry, mealy home fries, these are crunchy, crispy and delightful.
I LOVED the lemon ricotta pancakes, they were fluffy, tart and delicious!
I wished I got a whole order of these lovely treats.
We were deciding between the chicken apple sausage but was easily convinced to try the pork instead they were made in house and were delicious.
They were made sans casing and were tasty and succulent.
My friend got the omelet made with spinach and oyster mushrooms and that was amazing as well.
Bottom line: the food here is great and totally worth the wait ;)
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Vivian T.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: Long wait but probably a good sign.  They do provide coffee for the wait.  My sister and I split and the Plow order and it was an amazing sampler of delectable delights including: lemon ricotta pancakes,  home made pork sausages, crispy potatoes with rosemary and two eggs any style that your heart desires. When they say crispy potatoes, they really mean crispy.  We actually got specific recommendations to get their potatoes since they are so yummy there and it was totally true.  Forget your usual limp, dry, mealy home fries, these are crunchy, crispy and delightful.  I LOVED the lemon ricotta pancakes, they were fluffy, tart and delicious! I wished I got a whole order of these lovely treats.  We were deciding between the chicken apple sausage but was easily convinced to try the pork instead they were made in house and were delicious.  They were made sans casing and were tasty and succulent.  My friend got the omelet made with spinach and oyster mushrooms and that was amazing as well.  Bottom line: the food here is great and totally worth the wait ;)

excerpts: The lemon Ricotta pancakes that came w the sausage, eggs and potatoes were some of the best pancakes I've had.
I'll be back here for breakfast again soon!
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Paul K.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: What a nice breakfast!  Who knew a BLT could be so tasty.  The bread was crisp and light and the organic tomatoes & premium bacon certainly didn't hurt.   The lemon Ricotta pancakes that came w the sausage, eggs and potatoes were some of the best pancakes I've had.  I'll be back here for breakfast again soon!

excerpts: Lemon ricotta pancakes are so good but the best of everything is THE PLOW.
I am obsessed with their house made sausage and wished they would someday add biscuits and gravy to the menu because their buttermilk biscuit is amazing as well!!!!
The buttermilk biscuit is crunchy in the outside and soft and buttery on the inside!
I've had a handful of things on their menu and have not once been disappointed.
Only thing disappointing is having to wait for it!!
But I'm willing to wait!
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Kim S.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: This food is The JAM!! Soooo good!! Worth the wait! Lemon ricotta pancakes are so good but the best of everything is THE PLOW. I am obsessed with their house made sausage and wished they would someday add biscuits and gravy to the menu because their buttermilk biscuit is amazing as well!!!! The buttermilk biscuit is crunchy in the outside and soft and buttery on the inside! I've had a handful of things on their menu and have not once been disappointed. Only thing disappointing is having to wait for it!! But I'm willing to wait!

excerpts: The fact that we did leave half of the small order on the plate, and more than half of the lemon ricotta pancakes should've been a clue to anyone paying attention
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: d f.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
This is the worst breakfast/brunch I've had in ages -- I am still traumatized that I spent time and money going to check out this place.  Of note, I had no expectations and did not read any reviews prior.  In fact, I am now even more shocked that this restaurant has so many good reviews.  The only reason I don't give Zero stars is because I can't.

The french toast was tasteless.  The pears that came with it didn't enhance the taste at all.  I also asked for bananas and since they came later, I was such a state of disbelief that I didn't even try with the french toast -- I had 3 bites and I was disgusted -- no amount of syrup or anything else could save that so called "item".

The second dish (The Plow) was also a mix of mostly flavorless items (exception being the crispy potatoes that were flavorful and crispy).

My suggestion to anyone reading this: if you want a good brunch, basically any other  place in the City will do.  If you want very good brunch, go to Tangerine, Mission Cafe, Tartine, just to name a few.  If you want an excellent brunch, WITH THE BEST FRENCH TOAST IN TOWN, THE GOLD STANDARD OF FRENCH TOATS, go to Foreing Cinema.

I've lived in the City for over 20 years and I honestly do not recall having such a horrible brunch as far as the food is concerned.  The waitress was genuinely nice and polite, but never came back to ask if the food was good.  The fact that we did leave half of the small order on the plate, and more than half of the lemon ricotta pancakes should've been a clue to anyone paying attention

excerpts: Highly recommend the lemon ricotta pancakes.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Joe U.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Amazing food. This is the best breakfast in SF. Love the decor. Servers are terrific. The owner was incredible down to earth person who was an absolute pleasure to meet. 
Highly recommend the lemon ricotta pancakes.

excerpts: As are the rest of the components- house potatoes, lemon ricotta pancakes, and 2 eggs.
The plate is a great combination and is the perfect amount of food to leave you satisfied and account for a breakfast and a lunch.
I would not give Plow 5 stars because of the waitresses and the wait.
The wait has increasingly gotten longer and it seems to be getting swamped by techies who must work in the area.
Nonetheless, if you are willing to wait 1.5 hours on a Saturday morning, go to Plow.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Vanessa B.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: If you are going to Plow, you need to order the plow. The housemade pork sausage is TO DIE FOR. As are the rest of the components- house potatoes, lemon ricotta pancakes, and 2 eggs. The plate is a great combination and is the perfect amount of food to leave you satisfied and account for a breakfast and a lunch. I would not give Plow 5 stars because of the waitresses and the wait. The wait has increasingly gotten longer and it seems to be getting swamped by techies who must work in the area. Nonetheless, if you are willing to wait 1.5 hours on a Saturday morning, go to Plow.

excerpts: My friends got the Plow special (eggs, bacon, lemon ricotta pancakes, potatoes) and the biscuits and gravy.
We all gobbled all of our food - everyone agreed everything was delicious all around.
My only real complaint is that my salad was very over-dressed.
(Why do restaurants put so much dressing on salads??)
My friend who ordered the biscuits and gravy said the gravy was super (too) buttery and a bit too rich.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Kate W.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
I came here for brunch with friends today & it was great. We did have to wait outside for about 45 minutes for a table (and it was cold out!) but the hostess was super nice. 

I ordered the arugula salad with winter squash, pomegranate, hazelnuts and ricotta salata because I'm off gluten. My friends got the Plow special (eggs, bacon, lemon ricotta pancakes, potatoes) and the biscuits and gravy. We all gobbled all of our food - everyone agreed everything was delicious all around. My only real complaint is that my salad was very over-dressed. (Why do restaurants put so much dressing on salads??) My friend who ordered the biscuits and gravy said the gravy was super (too) buttery and a bit too rich. But hey, it's sausage gravy.

Also - we didn't order the fruit on the side but we should have when we saw our table neighbors'. They had gala apple and asian pear slices, fuyu persimmon slices, and half of a mango, cubed. It looked AWESOME. 1000% better than the gross melon-pineapple-grape combo with maybe a single strawberry on it that you usually see at a brunch place. 

I'd definitely come back here. The neighborhood around it is super cute as well & parking was really easy at 12:45 on a Saturday.

excerpts: The lemon ricotta pancakes were freaking delicious, small, but I would definitely recommend them!
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Elaine S.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Arrived around 10:30 on a Sunday, yeah, not the ideal time to arrive for Sunday brunch at a place that doesn't take reservations. The host said we would be in by 11, unfortunately we were not seated until 11:15, ouch. Luckily the food made it worth while!

I loved the decor, modern/country/homey all at the same time maybe it was, because we had been standing outside in the cold and it was raining...who knows. 

Our server was super friendly and told us about the daily specials.

We ordered the bakery basket to split between four of us, which came with a scone, a corn muffin, a biscuit, butter, jam & honey. I love scones, but enjoyed everything in the "basket", which turned out to be served on a plate.

The lemon ricotta pancakes were freaking delicious, small, but I would definitely recommend them!

The French toast looked awesome, but my brother finished it before I got a chance to try it; it must have been good.

The daily quiche special was fig, leek and egg custard, which was savory and sweet and totally delicious.

I ordered egg whites with toast, chicken apple sausage and potatoes. Everything was wonderful, like your traditional breakfast, but everything tasted fresh and natural.

Loved the food & atmosphere, not so much the wait, but I'm sure I'll be back!

excerpts: I've been here several times and my best bet is to go with the Plow breakfast - two eggs, sausage or bacon (I prefer the chicken apple sausage), two lemon ricotta pancakes (absolutely delicious and fluffy), and amazing potatoes.
It's worth the wait and definitely worth coming on a weekday when it's less crowded if you can!
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Lidia L.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: Consistently great quality of food and service.  I've been here several times and my best bet is to go with the Plow breakfast - two eggs, sausage or bacon (I prefer the chicken apple sausage), two lemon ricotta pancakes (absolutely delicious and fluffy), and amazing potatoes.  It's worth the wait and definitely worth coming on a weekday when it's less crowded if you can!

excerpts: We ordered The Plow [2 eggs, 2 small lemon ricotta pancakes, bacon (or sausage) and crispy potatoes], as well as an order of the French Toast (mascarpone and strawberries on top).
Both were delicious!
Staff was friendly and street parking was easy that early.
Will be back again soon!
With a pot of tea, I think our total (including tip) was about $45.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: L S.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: Arrived early (before 8am) on a Friday morning and were seated right away. We ordered The Plow [2 eggs, 2 small lemon ricotta pancakes, bacon (or sausage) and crispy potatoes], as well as an order of the French Toast (mascarpone and strawberries on top). Both were delicious! Staff was friendly and street parking was easy that early. Will be back again soon! With a pot of tea, I think our total (including tip) was about $45.

excerpts: The lemon ricotta pancakes, all of their fresh salads, the muffins, the mimosas.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Mariposa D.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Best brunch in San Francisco! The lemon ricotta pancakes, all of their fresh salads, the muffins, the mimosas. All awesome. 

The only weird part is that they only carry Youk's hot sauce. That stuff tastes like clogged drain. If the chef at plow could make a homemade hot sauce to go with their bomb crispy potatoes, I would be very very VERY grateful.

excerpts: I got "The Plow" which comes with crispy potatoes, two eggs, choice of bacon, pork sausage or chicken sausage and two lemon ricotta pancakes.
The crispy potatoes were also a hit
and I was just disappointed I couldn't manage to finish them all.
The lemon ricotta pancakes were pretty good as well.
Just enough sweetness and a good lemon flavor.
My only complaint is that they were a bit on the dry side and lacked fluffiness.
The freshly squeezed orange juice was also a plus.
The place is very small and it was completely packed when we visited.
Despite this, service was great.
I look forward to visiting the Plow on my next visit to SF.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Gema S.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: We were lucky to come across this place on a recent trip to SF because it was close to where we were staying, and it was quite a find! The first time we came here it was about 10:30 and there was an hour wait. We decided not to wait and came back the next day at opening because the pictures of the food looked so good on Yelp. I'm so glad we came back! The next day we had no wait and were seated quickly once the place opened. I got "The Plow" which comes with crispy potatoes, two eggs, choice of bacon, pork sausage or chicken sausage and two lemon ricotta pancakes. I got mine with the nueske bacon and I have to say it was the best bacon I've ever had. Slightly sweet and salty and they were very generous with the portions. The crispy potatoes were also a hit and I was just disappointed I couldn't manage to finish them all. The lemon ricotta pancakes were pretty good as well. Just enough sweetness and a good lemon flavor. My only complaint is that they were a bit on the dry side and lacked fluffiness. The freshly squeezed orange juice was also a plus. The place is very small and it was completely packed when we visited. Despite this, service was great. I look forward to visiting the Plow on my next visit to SF.

excerpts: First the food: everything we ordered was great: egg scramble with fresh tomatoes, greens, goat cheese; lemon ricotta pancakes; eggs benedict with crispy potatoes; steak and scrambled eggs; and a plate of fresh nectarines, figs, plums, and melons.
Our gluttonous bellies were full and satisfied when we left.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Sean K.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
First off, I wish there was a half-star option because I'd use here to boost UP to 3.5 stars, as Plow was closer to good than just A-OK.

First the food: everything we ordered was great: egg scramble with fresh tomatoes, greens, goat cheese; lemon ricotta pancakes; eggs benedict with crispy potatoes; steak and scrambled eggs; and a plate of fresh nectarines, figs, plums, and melons. Our gluttonous bellies were full and satisfied when we left. We sat at the counter and watched the dishes come off the line, which was essentially food porn in action.

All the staff we interacted with were friendly and welcoming, worth a special shout out when considering the intense brunch rush in the place.

Now for the bad: the wait. The stated 45 minute wait for two people became a bit over an hour, which is ok; the ebb and flow of restaurant traffic can't be predicted sometimes. By the time we sat down, we were understandably ravenous and wired from a couple cups of coffee in line. It took ten minutes for our server to get to us, and once we ordered, it was clear that everything was going to come out together 25-30 minutes later. We managed to get our fruit plate out early, but after waiting 90 minutes, we wish the food would have been paced better to get some of our sides out. We share some of the fault on this one for not conveying how hungry we were (and in turn how long we'd already been waiting), but wish the server would have picked up on this. Maybe we wear gaunt really well?

Worth going to--plan for the heinous wait and you'll be happier.

excerpts: I ordered The Plow which consists of two eggs, choice of house made pork sausage, Nueske bacon, or chicken apple sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes and crispy potatoes.
This was not cheap as the price of admission was $15.75, but it didn't fail to satisfy.
The potatoes were some of the best I've had in the city, super crispy and salty.
The eggs were scrambled to perfection and the pancakes may have been the highlight here.
And the bacon, was well bacon.
You can't really go wrong with bacon.
All in all, the entire experience was enjoyable and the waitress even prevented my from getting a parking ticket as halfway through the meal
she warned me there was street sweeping.
The neighborhood is a little out of the way if you are just visiting, but there is a great view of the skyline from across the street.
Definitely worth checking out if you've got some spare time.
Would highly suggest avoiding this place on the weekends.
#foodcomaking approved.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Food Coma K.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: In the past few weeks, Plow has frequently become the main topic of conversation when talking about brunch. Unless you get there around 7am on weekends, you are looking at waiting over two hours which is insane if you ask me. This morning I just so happened to be in the area and drove by to see many open spots inside so I decided to stop and see what all the fuss is about. I was seated immediately and was able to get in and out of the establishment in under a half an hour which was awesome. The food was great. Worth waiting two hours for? Probably not, but then again I'm not sure any food is worth waiting two hours for. I ordered The Plow which consists of two eggs, choice of house made pork sausage, Nueske bacon, or chicken apple sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes and crispy potatoes. This was not cheap as the price of admission was $15.75, but it didn't fail to satisfy. The potatoes were some of the best I've had in the city, super crispy and salty. The eggs were scrambled to perfection and the pancakes may have been the highlight here. And the bacon, was well bacon. You can't really go wrong with bacon. All in all, the entire experience was enjoyable and the waitress even prevented my from getting a parking ticket as halfway through the meal she warned me there was street sweeping. The neighborhood is a little out of the way if you are just visiting, but there is a great view of the skyline from across the street. Definitely worth checking out if you've got some spare time. Would highly suggest avoiding this place on the weekends. #foodcomaking approved.

excerpts: My wife had "the Plow" breakfast (lemon ricotta pancakes, sausage, crispy potatoes, scrambled eggs) and I ordered the "Scramble" (chanterelles, goat cheese, scallions with salad and acme toast).
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: J. SOMA S.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
This is a SOLID FOUR STAR establishment.  I had breakfast with my wife this morning and it was wonderful.

My wife had "the Plow" breakfast (lemon ricotta pancakes, sausage, crispy potatoes, scrambled eggs) and I ordered the "Scramble" (chanterelles, goat cheese, scallions with salad and acme toast).

The service was excellent -- and the coffee was hot and strong.

I will be back.  Well done, this is a good new addition to the SF restaurant scene.

excerpts: Definitely try the lemon ricotta pancakes and the house-made sausage.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Diana G.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: The food here is very good, especially for brunch. But be warned- the lines on the weekends are ridiculously long! If you get there before 9 it's a lot more tolerable. You can always pop over to Farley's and get some coffee while you wait. Definitely try the lemon ricotta pancakes and the house-made sausage.

excerpts: As a matter of fact, I have not had a better combination breakfast plate than the eponymous "plow" - wonderful lemon ricotta pancakes, earthy, house-made pork sausage patties, freshly fried and marvelously spiced potatoes (with some caramelized onions thrown in for good measure) and fresh farm eggs - now that's a breakfast plate.
My companion - who has some decidedly southern proclivities - was immensely pleased with the biscuits served with Gravy (capital G here!)
a text book version with pork.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Thor T.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Had breakfast today here and can only say that everything we ordered was perfect.  As a matter of fact, I have not had a better combination breakfast plate than the eponymous "plow" - wonderful lemon ricotta pancakes, earthy, house-made pork sausage patties, freshly fried and marvelously spiced potatoes (with some caramelized onions thrown in for good measure) and fresh farm eggs - now that's a breakfast plate.
My companion - who has some decidedly southern proclivities - was immensely pleased with the biscuits served with Gravy (capital G here!) a text book version with pork.  Rich!

Naturally, the place is hopping but the solicitous staff makes sure to seat everyone as promptly as possible and service is friendly and efficient.  We sat at the counter and had the opportunity to observe the incredibly hard-working crew of three young cooks, their movements as choreographed as Bolshoi dancers, as they cooked everything fresh and perfect.  Hats off to those wonderful cooks!

excerpts: Although I am definitely more savory than sweet when it comes to taste, I couldn't pass up the chance to try the famous lemon ricotta pancakes.
They were so airy and light and fortunately not too sweet at all.
Not sure what the batter secret is
but I can understand the hype.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: F. P.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
So after waking up unusually early on a Saturday morning, I came across the latest issue of SF Magazine, which happened to be the food issue.  I saw that Plow had received three stars and having long been on my "to-try" places, I decided no better time than the present (especially considering the wait would considerably be less at 8:30am than later in the day).

Turns out, there was no wait at all!  We got the last two counter seats offering excellent views of the dishes.  

Although I am definitely more savory than sweet when it comes to taste, I couldn't pass up the chance to try the famous lemon ricotta pancakes.  They were so airy and light and fortunately not too sweet at all.  Not sure what the batter secret is but I can understand the hype.  That being said, I couldn't help but crave some of the savory options that I passed up (especially the savory bread pudding, which looked amazing!)

Also had the fried egg sandwich served with frisee and optional order of bacon.  While simple in execution, it was quite delicious and served on a lightly toasted bun.  The accompanying crunchy potatoes tossed with herbs and spices were excellent.

I can see why this place gets packed (in fact, we apparently beat the rush as a wait began almost immediately after we were seated).  Crazy how people flock to this Potrero Hill outpost ... the power of good reviews, I guess.

The one BIG minus here is the smell of the water glasses.  It reeks of egg protein.  I know that some people can't smell it but for those that are sensitive to it, it's almost enough to make one lose his appetite.  The problem is that these glasses are placed in the dishwasher with all the plates that had contained egg yolk and it mixes.  It would be great if they could wash these separately or at least pre-wash those egg-tainted plates.

Service is very friendly and welcoming.   Note, not recommended for large groups because of limited seating (in fact, 6 is the max).

excerpts: My friend and I split the french toast and lemon ricotta pancakes.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Kimberly S.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
First time eating at Plow this morning. It was awesome! My friend and I split the french toast and lemon ricotta pancakes. Both were fantastic although if I had to do it all over again I'd get the pancakes and bread pudding dish (it's a breakfast version). 

We got there at 9:30am and had to wait less than 2 minutes for a table. The host with the dreadlocks was really friendly too.

The service was perfect. We had no complaints. We'll be back!

excerpts: I had the plow which was a great mix of sweet and savory, the lemon ricotta pancakes were like dessert!
My wife had the huevos rancheros and said they were amazing (that's impressive, because she has high standards for mexican food).
If you are ever in SF, you HAVE to check it out.
I promise you will be thanking me.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Josh C.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: My wife and I went here a couple months ago while in SF after our friends recommended it to us. One word to describe the breakfast........PHENOMENAL! The array of flavor profiles and the unique menu options set this place apart from many other breakfast spots. I had the plow which was a great mix of sweet and savory, the lemon ricotta pancakes were like dessert! My wife had the huevos rancheros and said they were amazing (that's impressive, because she has high standards for mexican food). If you are ever in SF, you HAVE to check it out. I promise you will be thanking me.

excerpts: Everything else is ok but not a standout (lemon ricotta pancakes, french toast, bacon, etc.)
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Cathy L.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
This is a really cute place with outdoor seating during the weekends.

I'll repeat what others have said - the crispy potatoes are yum!

Everything else is ok but not a standout (lemon ricotta pancakes, french toast, bacon, etc.)

If there wasn't always such a long wait I might come back as parking is easy but...I'd rather go to Zazie next time!

excerpts: The lemon ricotta pancakes are to die for.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Alan B.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Went on a Saturday morning at 8:30 because they open at 8.  The place is tiny, but not packed together and not noisy.  Two big plusses.

It is on a corner and very light filled and airy.  Sort of the hip Potrero crowd.

Sat at the counter and watched all the goings on in the open kitchen.  Ordered the plow.  I agree with everything Erica S said.  The lemon ricotta pancakes are to die for.  Portions just right.

Made my best brunch list.  A real find.  We will definitely go back.

excerpts: Lemon Ricotta Pancakes...
My mouth is watering just thinking about them: creamy, rich, moist, with just the right mount of lemon power in them.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Richard H.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
I found Plow by just typing "breakfast/brunch" into the yelp search and this was the first or second listing in the district I was in; figured I'd give it a try.

I most definitely pleased from the moment I walked in.  A small, unassuming, almost modeled after a highway breakfast joint, restaurant with one major visual difference; It's clean!!

The service is quick (I went on a tuesday in the late morning, from other reviews it seems weekends are busier), the restaurant is very quaint, and the servers are very sweet.

The menu, we were there for breakfast, was not overwhelming and each item on the menu was unique in its own way.  I decided to go with "The Plow", which is the restaurants specialty, I guess. The serving was large enough to fill my gut until late afternoon (I'm 6'0" 160 lbs) and came equipped with 2 eggs, my choice of a meat (unique to other breakfast restaurants), home fries, and the best pancakes I've ever had... Lemon Ricotta Pancakes...  My mouth is watering just thinking about them: creamy, rich, moist, with just the right mount of lemon power in them.  However, they are small if you get them with "The Plow", they may be bigger if you order just the cakes.

Overall, my only negative feedback was the price, I'm not disappointed AT ALL but I paid a lunch/dinner price for breakfast.  However, I'm from Florida so I might not be 100% attuned to the California lifestyle just yet.

Most definitely give it a try.... pancakes... /drool

excerpts: Comes with one of their lemon ricotta pancakes and house made pork sausage.
Also has potatoes, eggs your style and toast.
It's big, but if you're hungry, you will not be disappointed by any part of it.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Louis A.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
The wait can be crazy, but if you go at the right time (between 7-8 in the morning) or at off peak lunch hours, you can usually snag a spot, at least at the counter. 

All of the food is great. I will say that Plow has the best home fries / breakfast potatoes that I have ever had. Fried until crispy, tossed with spices and herbs. They are out of control and go great with everything else Plow brings to the table.

If you have never been, get "The Plow" for breakfast. Comes with one of their lemon ricotta pancakes and house made pork sausage. Also has potatoes, eggs your style and toast. It's big, but if you're hungry, you will not be disappointed by any part of it.

excerpts: I ordered the plow, which I customized to be composed of lemon ricotta pancakes, crispy potatoes, two fried eggs, and chicken apple sausage.
This was my first time trying lemon ricotta pancakes, which I was little apprehensive about at first, but it has probably become one of my top pancake flavor choices.
I also really enjoyed the potatoes which were seasoned perfectly and had a nice hint of rosemary.
I would have given this place five stars, but my party and I had to constantly keep requesting for more maple syrup and ketchup.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Shannon M.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: Probably the best brunch I've ever had in my life. I ordered the plow, which I customized to be composed of lemon ricotta pancakes, crispy potatoes, two fried eggs, and chicken apple sausage. This was my first time trying lemon ricotta pancakes, which I was little apprehensive about at first, but it has probably become one of my top pancake flavor choices. I also really enjoyed the potatoes which were seasoned perfectly and had a nice hint of rosemary. I would have given this place five stars, but my party and I had to constantly keep requesting for more maple syrup and ketchup.

excerpts: The lemon ricotta pancakes, while good, were not as fluffy as they appear, and I've definitely had better (although not in SF).
I'll be back to try the salmon benedict.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Ernest S.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
I have a thing for looking at trademarks and good business names, and Plow is a great name (my favorite being Crunch gym, despite not being a customer there).  If I had a restaurant, I probably would have named it Plow, so I was very excited to come and try this place.  

There was about a 45 minute wait when we got there around 12:15 pm on a Sunday, which was ok, because we just walked up and down the hills in the neighborhood and got an awesome work out for our bums.  The food was very good - for the most part.  The salmon cakes and side order of potatoes was spot on.  The lemon ricotta pancakes, while good, were not as fluffy as they appear, and I've definitely had better (although not in SF).  I'll be back to try the salmon benedict.

excerpts: Lemon ricotta pancakes that melt in your mouth.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: B. B.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Quality ingredients prepared and served with a sincere smile. 

Hands down the best bacon in town. Lemon ricotta pancakes that melt in your mouth. LOVE the potatoes !

Super friendly and attentive wait staff, and the owners go out of their way to make people feel welcome.

Word is out about their high quality eats, so it is best to go on a weekday if you don't have the patience for a long wait. OR, just walk over to Bloom's Bar for a quick mimosa while you wait !

excerpts:
I ordered the plow:

Lemon ricotta pancakes - the ricotta gave it an amusing texture

Potatoes - !!!
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Amy H.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
For someone who almost never gets excited about or craves breakfast/brunch food. I absolutely loved my meal here. The food made me happy :)

I ordered the plow:

Lemon ricotta pancakes - the ricotta gave it an amusing texture

Potatoes - !!! Best potatoes I've ever had. Hands down. Really crispy and well seasoned. Perfection.

Scrambled eggs - asked for them on the runny side - really fluffy and light - can eggs be ribbon like?

Sausage - they were good but I would want to try the bacon to see how they compare

My bf had the crab scramble which was also really good with fresh crab and well cooked eggs.

I would recommend coming early or you'll end up having to wait 1hr plus :| People were eating outside in the rain - well there was an awning at least.

excerpts: We ordered from the counter, and had the mixed Plow, with two small lemon ricotta pancakes, scrambled eggs, their unbelievably delicious bacon, and the home "fries".
All extremely well prepared and served.
The home fries are really special, as so often what you get in a restaurant are soggy, over greasy potatoes.
These are light and fluffy, exploding with flavor.
Wow is all I can say.
They have really raised the breakfast bar.
Wish I lived in San Francisco, but for sure it's going to be on my "must go" list for the next visit.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Gail B.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
What a memorable breakfast /brunch this was.  We ordered from the counter, and had the mixed Plow, with two small lemon ricotta pancakes, scrambled eggs, their unbelievably delicious bacon, and the home "fries".  All extremely well prepared and served.  The home fries are really special, as so often what you get in a restaurant are soggy, over greasy potatoes.  These are light and fluffy, exploding with flavor. 
Wow is all I can say.  They have really raised the breakfast bar.  Wish I lived in San Francisco, but for sure it's going to be on my "must go" list for the next visit.

excerpts: I ordered The Plow, which is 2 eggs, crispy potatoes, a breakfast meat (I chose bacon), and two lemon ricotta pancakes.
The food was EPIC.
The potatoes were absolutely crispy on the outside, soft on the inside and were made with rosemary and white onions

lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Brevin P.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
The Continuing Case of the Missing Papaya Diamond: By Detective Honeybutter

"An hour wait?!" I scoffed sarcastically, dramatically raising my eyebrows to make it clear to the nearby onlookers in the small eatery that I would have none of this tomfoolery.
"My good man, I missed being knighted by the Queen herself by only three ounces of blood. Had I been conscious I would have been Sir Honeybutter!"
They did not look impressed.
"I have looked into the eyes of the devil himself..." (and then softly to a nearby horrified lady) "... granted in a carnival's haunted house ride where I nearly defecated in my pantaloons..." (and then loudly again so everyone could hear) "...but I have seen things that would make you question your own faith in humanity! I mean, have you SEEN that documentary on the Bieber maiden?" At this point I was escorted out of the building as I yelled on about respect and was asked to wait outside with the others. Whatever happened to respecting a British detective?  
A bloody rut. That's what I was in. The Case of the Missing Papaya Diamond wasn't having a lot of traction. Not for a bloody lack of trying, mind you. Imagine a montage set to a funky bass groove where I kick down doors and chase down perps in dark alleys, screaming at them for answers. And by "chase down perps in dark alleys" I mean "eat a lot of waffles" and by "kick down doors" I mean "take naps". Not sure who I was screaming at outside of the montage, either. No, this was a critical rut. 
It was a Saturday morning stroll that brought me here to Plow. That, and the aroma of bacon. But this common occurrence of having to wait an hour to be seated still baffles me. The fact that most people are fine with this means that I'm either a savage barbarian with no patience or that I'm missing a key vantage point to this observation. So I just stood there in the morning sun, waiting. Thinking about the case. Thinking about little details. Things I might have missed. Overlooked. Suspects. Locations. 
And then it struck me. That eureka moment delegated to only the greatest breakthroughs in modern science and medicine.  
By Toutatis. Of course!
It was here that they called my name and I promptly forgot about my epiphany. Plowed! You may think than an hour goes by quickly when solving mysteries, but my hot tip here is that even though they say it's an hour wait, it probably won't be. Most people don't hang around long enough so you sort of move up the list to get seated. 
I had a dish called The Plow at a place called Plow. It was a decent mix of eggs, amazing bacon (I need to go back and investigate the bacon), magical lemon ricotta pancakes (because it's 2012 and science figured out how to give us this boon to culture) and SWEET MENTAL TIDDLYWINKS THE POTATOES! 
Oh golden crunchy potatoes, wherefor doth thou embrace my taste buds so?
I took my sweet time finishing this meal and will come back soon. It was when I finally waddled away that I remembered the epiphany. 
Game on, Baxter Borneo. Game on.

lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Erin I.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Okay, seriously Plow, if you can consistently do that thing you do inside of my mouth, that magic, that straight up no nonsense fuckery, the least you can do is figure out a way to manifest yourself a sixth star on Yelp to set yourself apart.

People think I'm straight crazy when I say my favorite restaurant in San Francisco is a breakfast joint, but seriously, did I stutter?  I'll say it again. Favorite.

And it's not entirely sentimental, though maybe a little! I went to Plow the morning I arrived in San Francisco with everything I own still in the back of my car, afraid I was going to get robbed, not yet knowing that the scariest thing to ever happen in Potrero Hill is Whole Foods being out of dried mango and stressed out of my gourd about how the hell I was going to make it in this city. I walked to Plow with my boyfriend in the pouring rain and found out there would be a wait (there's always a wait at Plow, let me get that out of the way, unless you're one of those partially-employed assholes that can manage to go early-morning on a weekday,, then you're in luck). My boyfriend and I huddled under an umbrella and the cute hostess brought us a giant mug of hot coffee to share outside on the corner. I took in the view (Plow is perched on Texas and 18th) and felt like it wouldn't be so bad after all, and that Plow was the jaunt for hooking me up with a sense of comfort. 

And that feeling has NEVER left me. Plow, you're still the jaunt. I have never been disappointed in anything I have eaten there. The breakfast potatoes shut down all previous attempts to be a breakfast potato: they're sauteed with herbs and caramelized onions. Ask for them extra crispy. I fantasize about them in a strictly not-weird kind of way. 

LIST OF NOTABLE MENU ITEMS (for people who don't want to read my bullshit, I don't blame you, just start here. You said get to the point, this is it:

*Spinach + Mushroom Eggs Benedict
*Little Gems Salad
*Olive Oil Poached Tuna Sandwich
*Lemon Ricotta Pancakes, as well as seasonal pumpkin ones
(all come with the breakfast potatoes if you ask, don't fret now)

Boyfriend likes the
*Plow (with applewood smoked sausage)
*Smoked Salmon Lox with Capers
*Olive Oil Poached Tuna Sandwich (we devour this together and hold a moment of silence when it's missing from the menu). 

That being said, their menu rotates depending on seasonal ingredients and chef preferences, so don't hesitate to go balls to the wall and try something new, you won't be disappointed, I swear on it. GO!!!

Simply fantastic.  We got an early start this morning and decided this would be the day we would finally try Plow!  We made it there by 8:30 am and there was already a wait (around 10-15 people hanging around outside the restaurant).  We were seated at the counter within about 20 minutes.  Typically, I wouldn't be overly excited to sit directly next to my boyfriend, staring into the kitchen - but today, our front row seats allowed us to see some amazing cooking!

I found our waitress to be extremely friendly and knowledgeable.  There were 3 men cooking in the exposed kitchen area; they had everything down to a fine art.  It was fascinating to watch them cook throughout the entire meal.

I ordered the fava bean puree and burrata dish.  It was essentially a deconstructed sandwich that came with a piece of grilled bread, burrata, fava bean spread and a side salad.  I also decided to order a side of two scrambled eggs to make the dish feel more breakfast-y.  Everything about this dish was spot-on and very fresh.  I even had the two women next to me at the counter ask me what I ordered because they thought my entree looked so delicious!  

I cannot lie...I also had a couple of bites off of my boyfriend's plate!  I loved the potatoes (which by the way are briefly deep fried and then tossed with sea salt, thyme and rosemary).  I also had a bite of his lemon ricotta pancakes, which were decadent!

I highly suggest Plow if you're looking for solid food in San Francisco.  Be prepared to wait, as the other Yelp reviews state....  Get up early, get great food and nap later!

I liked how they were mini pancakes and not the huge ones you'd get at like IHOP/Denny's.  The crispy potatoes were a little too salty for me, but my bf liked them.  I might have been able to eat the whole plate of food if it weren't for the monkey bread, but I did find many couples sharing the plow, if the other person ordered something small.  My bf got the fried egg sandwich that came with two eggs fried, cheddar, frisee, aioli, crispy potatoes  and Nueske bacon.  It looked good, and was an adequate sized sandwich.  I was tempted to order their organic yogurt with granola and mixed fruit, but felt I needed to order something more substancial since it was our first time here.  Plus, you can make that at home.

Overall, one of the better brunch places I've been to and will surely come back for more.

lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Katie W.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
sheer. 

perfection. 

I am tempted to simply leave my review at that, but being a long-winded know-it-all, I simply cannot. 

Sunny, quiet and quite practically perfect in every way was the day. We stepped in at about 9 and were promptly seated in the most quaint and lovely Farmhouse-esque setting. Beautiful wooden tables, great large windows for viewing clean little Potreo Hill. 

Enough about that fluff. The vitals. So gorgeous in it's simplicity, so delicious in literally every bite. The menu is small, but crafted in such a way that anyone could find something to fit their tastes to a tee. For me? The Plow. 

This includes your choice of breakfast meat, 2 eggs any way, potatoes and pancakes. Sounds like a standard from anywhere. But here, that's just not fair nor accurate. Those eggs, so fresh, that bacon - so full of actual ham flavor - but those potatoes. NO ONE does potatoes correctly when eating out. They need to be tender inside, extremely crispy outside and have the right amount of seasoning, no grease and if you're lucky, accompanied by great caramelized onions. I thought only my Mom could make this magic. She must have divulged her secret to the Chefs at Plow. Never were potatoes so right OUTSIDE of my Mother's kitchen. 
Let's not though, forget those pancakes. These are light, airy, moist. These are LEMON. Lemon ricotta pancakes that are so subtle and meek in their own little corner of your plate, you would never expect them to absolutely wow you, as they are certain to do. 

People are funny about their breakfasts, they all know what's the best and where to get said "best," but unless they are speaking of Plow, they are just wrong. 

However, maybe they are smarter than me and telling you other places to go so as not to form a line at Plow... 
shit.

excerpts: We both ordered the Plow, which is their little-bit-of-everything (2 eggs, meat of your choice, potatoes and 2 lemon ricotta pancakes).
I actually asked to switch the potatoes for a slice of French toast, which I think is somewhat unheard of given the confusion it caused the line cooks (who we were watching the entire time).
The service is top notch, as our waitress caught the cooks on a couple occasions to make sure the plates came out as ordered.
The pancakes were fresh but didn't really taste strongly of lemon and were underwhelming, which made me glad that I had solid-but-not-spectacular french toast to compensate.

The house-made pork sausage was decent but could've used a much heavier hand of sage to make it really like breakfast sausage (for those of you who don't like the flavor of breakfast sausage, then this is perfect for you).
I stole a piece of potato from my friend, which was essentially smashed (as opposed to cut) potatoes thrown into a deep fryer to attain great crispy texture throughout.
Overall the ambience is clean and comfortable, and I wasn't feeling overly greased from the meal (always a good thing).
I'll be back to order other things off the menu next time
(they look like they put a ton of Dungeness crab into their scrambled eggs), but I'm also still on the look-out for a better brunch place in SF.

We walked in and put our name on the list and took a nice stroll in the neighborhood. I never get a chance to visit this side of town. After a 35 minute wait, we were seated. We shared the butternut squash soup and the plow. The soup was flavorful, you can taste the spices. The plow came with 2 pancakes, choice of sausage, potato chunks and eggs. I'm just glad we shared the meal, that would be too much food for me.  The lemon ricotta pancakes were to die for. The best I've had, the pancakes were light and fluffy. The equator coffee was a good companion to the brunch, definitely strong. Would come back for more pancakes and crunchy potatoes.

Found a seat at the counter afte a 30 minute wait - cramped without a place to put your jacket, but it does have a front row view of the open kitchen and the bustling chefs.

My go-to breakfast item consists of something sweet and savory, so I immediately gravitated towards the plow.  The chicken apple sausages were juicy with a nice sweet counterbalance, but not particularly noteworthy.  The much lauded potatoes were indeed perfectly crispy without being too greasy. Light, tangy, and fluffy - definitely the best pancakes I've had in the bay, and two of them were not enough.

lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Rolling out of bed on a beautiful Sunday morning, I really wanted a hardy breakfast. I made the short trip up the hill and stopped at the restaurant with a pig on its sign. What I found was the BEST breakfast food that I've ever had.
     The "plow" breakfast was great. The home-made pork sausage was juicy, well-spiced, and well cooked. The mini lemon ricotta pancakes (I really do mean mini) had a nice crisp on the edges with a creamy center. The lemon flavor was bold without being overpowering. My eggs were cooked to my liking. But the star of this dish was the crispy potatoes. MAN these are GOOD. They grill moderate sized potatoes with onions, smash the potatoes, deep fry them, and toss them in salt and thyme. You get a hybrid concoction of homefries with the crisp of hashbrowns. VERY GOOD.
     The tuna sandwich is hands down the BEST I've ever had. The tuna is tossed in olive oil, lightly salted, mixed with capers,  and extremely fresh. The boquerones (white anchovies in olive oil and vinegar) added an extra dimension of flavor to the sandwich. Add a little hard boiled egg and put it on bread from Acme, and you have a Masterpiece.
     Unfortunately the portion sizes are bad. I can't really "plow" into a breakfast plate when there is not much food on it. I love eating and I'm willing to spend top dollar for top food. However, I feel that I should've been more satisfied after signing the check. It was really disappointing to watch the line cook throw a pile of crispy potatoes onto a plate only to have the head chef take some off and throw it back into the mixing bowl. The poor form ruined what was otherwise an AMAZING dining experience.

I'd give 4.5 stars if I could.
Overall, it's a sense-awakening breakfast and brunch spot!

lemon ricotta pancakes.review: This place is clean and simple, and I think it's what they don't add, that makes it so special.  The first thing you notice when you walk in is that it's busy.  Good food = a wait.  Next, you notice is that the smell makes you even hungry-as-ever, it's bright with natural light, warm with body heat, excited with servers and chefs moving about, and is loud with table conversations.  It hits just about all of the senses.  The pork sausages will hit the last sense with a lot of flavor and some spice.  The lemon ricotta pancakes could be addictive, and I'm glad that they don't give you a big stack for that reason.  The only reason for 4 stars and not 5 is that, my first visit, I had an omelette with tomatoes and goat cheese and really could not find the cheese, making the breakfast kind of bland.  I'd give 4.5 stars if I could.  Overall, it's a sense-awakening breakfast and brunch spot!

excerpts: So I decided on the plow, which was kinda like their combo breakfast with eggs, bacon or sausage, potatoes, and lemon ricotta pancakes!
Hubby took a bit longer to decide and finally went with the plow as well.

Finally the food came out and it was worth the wait!
My scrambled eggs were cooked perfectly, nice and delicate.
The bacon was good
but I wish it was a little bit crispier.
The potatoes were awesome.
They were so crispy on the outside but soft on the inside.
They were also perfectly seasoned and mixed with sauteed onions.
With a little bit of ketchup, we were all set.
The lemon ricotta pancakes were delicious, so soft, fluffy, and lemony, and came with a side of maple syrup.
I tried the homemade sausage and loved it.

lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Kat M.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
We've been wanting to come here for a long time, but I like to sleep in on my weekends and don't really like to wait over an hour for brunch.  Yesterday, we had a full day of activities planned and had to be out and about early anyway, so I thought why not make the most of a Saturday morning and make a trip to Plow for breakfast?

We got there a little before 9:30 and there was already a wait, but the host assured us it would only be a 15-20 minute wait.  In the meantime, he offered us coffee. Such a small and simple gesture, but always appreciated! Exactly 20 minutes later, we were seated at the counter where we could check out all the cooking action in the small, open kitchen.  It made it so hard to decide what to get because everything coming out looked so damn good. 

So I decided on the plow, which was kinda like their combo breakfast with eggs, bacon or sausage, potatoes, and lemon ricotta pancakes! Hubby took a bit longer to decide and finally went with the plow as well.  I got the bacon and hubby got the home made sausage patties. The food took about 15 minutes to come out because the kitchen was so busy.  There were 3 people in the kitchen and they were hustling nonstop. Finally the food came out and it was worth the wait! My scrambled eggs were cooked perfectly, nice and delicate.  The bacon was good but I wish it was a little bit crispier. The potatoes were awesome.  They were so crispy on the outside but soft on the inside.  They were also perfectly seasoned and mixed with sauteed onions.  With a little bit of ketchup, we were all set.  The lemon ricotta pancakes were delicious, so soft, fluffy, and lemony, and came with a side of maple syrup.  I tried the homemade sausage and loved it.  They were so flavorful with all the herbs and spices.  Next time, I am so getting the sausage patties! 

We had such a good meal here.  Not only was the food so delicious, but everyone there was so friendly and nice.  I loved their decor, so simple and bright with huge windows.  It just felt like a pleasant place to spend your weekend morning.  The great thing about sitting at the counter was that we got to see all the different stuff they had, so we had good ideas about what to order next time.  I was definitely intrigued by the fried pig ears! I know it sounds weird but they looked so good - light and crispy with what looked like a side of jalapeno vinaigrette.  Oh and I must have the chocolate eclair.  So many things to try next time.  I guess I'll need to plan another early morning to go to Plow again!

Being that I literally live around the corner from this place, I figured I needed to give it a shot. There is always a line on the weekends -- a long one. After thinking to put my name on the list before my brunch mate met me, I was told the wait was an hour. Ouch. They weren't kidding, either. 

They allow you to have some coffee from their brewed coffee station while you wait, which makes it slightly less unpleasant. Once we were finally set, we had a hard time picking what exactly to get for brunch. THe atmosphere is adorable, which makes chatting with friends all the more enjoyable. I ended up going with the Eggs Benedict, and we both shared a side of the lemon ricotta pancakes. Oh. My. Goodness. This food is good. The potatoes that come with it are also delicious. 

I can't wait to go back and try some of the other delicious items on the menu. I'm just a little intimidated by the wait time at this point.

lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Sherene C.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
I live in the Dogpatch and was very excited to have a new breakfast/brunch spot in the neighborhood. It looked modern but homey and like something definitely worth a try but...that line! On any given weekend morning there will be a crowd of people hanging out outside. I started resenting Plow for taunting me with its newness while shutting me out with it's dreadful long lines. "It's already over-hyped," I secretly thought to myself. Anyway, I finally bit the bullet and tried it out last weekend. The wait time was 45 minutes for a table for three. Ugh. They offer complementary coffee inside to soften the pain of waiting but it runs out quickly and people inside are too busy to keep it replenished. It is probably good business for Farley's, the coffee shop up the street.

Anyway, we finally got seated and I have to say the ambiance is simple but nice. It's going for a clean rustic vibe to go along with it's philosophy of using local, seasonal, farm-fresh ingredients. I works for me. We shared the lemon ricotta pancakes. SUPER DELICIOUS. I got the Plow breakfast plate (I think that was the name) which included eggs, potatoes, and two pancakes. Even though it's a pretty standard dish it just tasted better than I expected. The potatoes are crispy on the outside, soft on the inside and tossed with just the right amount of salt and some nice onions too. The freshness of the ingredients really makes a difference. I tried my friend's egg benedict with spinach and mushrooms and it was cooked to perfection. All our food was seemingly simple but wonderfully delicious and memorable. The nuances of the fresh ingredients really make all the difference in the flavors in the dishes. I felt totally satisfied but not overly stuffed nor heavy after my meal at Plow. I will definitely be back, although only on a day where I have the patience to wait in a ridiculous long line. I hope they expand soon!

excerpts: I ordered "the Plow" (lemon ricotta pancakes, crispy potatoes, and poached eggs).

lemon ricotta pancakes.author: D C.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: This place is absolutely delicious and the atmosphere is relaxed and cute. We were in line for Mama's for 30 min and moved about one foot before we decided to ditch Mama's and try somewhere else. So glad we did! This place had less than a 10 min wait (late breakfast). The waitress was nice, and the food arrived rather promptly. There were big glass jars of water at each table so we could refill as we liked. I ordered "the Plow" (lemon ricotta pancakes, crispy potatoes, and poached eggs). My bf ordered the "fried egg sandwich" which came with crispy potatoes. I'm not much of a pancake eater, but my goodness these were absolutely delicious and unique. The texture was great too--not too fluffy and not flat. The potatoes were the crispiest I've ever eaten, and my bf agrees. They are salted to perfection. I highly recommend this place. It's nestled away in a residential and hilly area. Totally worth the price (I believe our bill came out to be ~$40) including a coffee. Cute shop. Clean and packed.

excerpts: My friend and I both ordered the same thing, lemon ricotta pancakes and a side of bacon.
The lemon ricotta pancakes were fluffy and delicious.
The bacon was cut thin and cooked with just the right amount of crunch.
Plow is worth the trip to and the wait.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Adelina W.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: It's a small place, really cute and cozy. The wait wasn't too bad, but I went on a weekday. I can only imagine the line on weekends. My friend and I both ordered the same thing, lemon ricotta pancakes and a side of bacon. The lemon ricotta pancakes were fluffy and delicious. The bacon was cut thin and cooked with just the right amount of crunch. Plow is worth the trip to and the wait.

excerpts: I had "The Plow" which had probably the best lemon ricotta pancakes I've ever tasted.

lemon ricotta pancakes.review: All the press reviews are right-  Plow is a GREAT brunch spot. The ambience has a modern rustic feel- as well as the food.  It's all the staples of the best of brunch food... only kicked up a notch.  I had "The Plow" which had probably the best lemon ricotta pancakes I've ever tasted.  Everything was satisfying and was perfect to kick off a lazy Saturday afternoon.  NOTES: Theres a bit of a bustle inside, so it would be best for a more lively crowd to join you. The parking is easily found, but the wait can be a bit long.  Try to get there early to potentially avoid a rush.  I noticed people having sidewalk cocktails while waiting, which I'll be sure to remember the next time I wait.

excerpts: The menu is simple, and when the waitress told me they hadn't gotten in the peaches for the dish I ordered I wasn't sure if I was prepared for their lemon ricotta pancakes.
But they were outstanding!
I would completely recommend it, they're not different enough from regular pancakes that kids or picky adults wouldn't like them and the lemon taste is subtle.
Their hand-made sausage is also delicious.
Our waitress was attentive but not hovering and the regular coffee (the only way they serve it) was absolutely wonderful
, I couldn't get enough of it and our waitress was observant enough I never had an empty cup.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Nicole F.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: Plow has a wonderful set up for such a small restaurant, the tables are extraordinarily close together but its high ceilings and huge windows looking out over the city from its Potrero Hill location make it feel larger than it is. The menu is simple, and when the waitress told me they hadn't gotten in the peaches for the dish I ordered I wasn't sure if I was prepared for their lemon ricotta pancakes. But they were outstanding! I would completely recommend it, they're not different enough from regular pancakes that kids or picky adults wouldn't like them and the lemon taste is subtle. Their hand-made sausage is also delicious. Our waitress was attentive but not hovering and the regular coffee (the only way they serve it) was absolutely wonderful, I couldn't get enough of it and our waitress was observant enough I never had an empty cup.

excerpts: The lemon ricotta pancakes, the fried egg sandwich with bacon, anything with crispy potatoes, the olive oil poached tuna sandwich, and the cold smoked salmon.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Jerry R.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
If you go on a weekend & don't get there right as they open, you will have to wait--possibly an hour. But the food is spectacular and worth waiting for. It's fresh, it's cooked perfectly, and it's interesting without pretense. The mason jars of spices are as utilitarian as they are beautiful. I love watching the cooks pull one down occasionally to prep, though I'm still waiting to see someone use the juniper berries for something.

You have to try: The lemon ricotta pancakes, the fried egg sandwich with bacon, anything with crispy potatoes, the olive oil poached tuna sandwich, and the cold smoked salmon.

The coffee is strong and refilled frequently. The staff is friendly and usually quite attentive. It's hands down the best breakfast/brunch in Potrero Hill and it competes nicely with Chez Maman for best lunch.

excerpts:
and on the second day, i had a bite of my friend's lemon ricotta pancakes.

!
lemon ricotta pancakes aside, the food is average breakfast fare that's touched up enough to set it apart.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Ashley F.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
oh goodness.  never has a breakfast joint revitalized my affinity for morning meals (okay, slight exaggeration but who cares).  i've recently given up breakfast out of laziness, but it's amazing what lengths you'll go to for a place like this with good company.  :]  my friends and i came here on fridays for three straight weeks to try out all the dishes that we wanted.  while some things fell flat, i was mostly pleased whenever i left.

first off:  the coffee.  tasty and a nice pick-me-up for my sleepy mornings, especially if you wake up before six just to get some grub.  and can i just gush about their granulated brown sugar?  i think they use ramekins for it as presentation, and it's the cutest thing ever.  however, the last time i was there, they had white sugar cubes instead, and it made the coffee taste a little weird.  :|

second:  i mentioned it briefly, but everything from their containers to their choice of water pitchers (or bottles, in their case) to their napkins - guh, this place is smartly decorated.  first impressions are everything, and they present a good one!  moreover, it helps in my anticipation to try what they have to offer.  nice sense of décor = must be good.  :P  (also, their website makes the minimalist in me extremely happy!  simplicity goes a long way, people.)

the first day, i ordered the plow with chicken apple sausage.  everything was great and filling, but i wasn't sold on the sausage.  same thing happened the second time i was there when i ordered their two eggs and tried the pork instead.  i don't know, i'm just not a big fan of it in general, though it never hurts to try on the off-chance i'm blown away.  the third day i ordered some sides, but it was enough for me.  oh, and on the second day, i had a bite of my friend's lemon ricotta pancakes.

!  so delicious!  i normally stray away from anything cheese-like in my sweet foods, but i was pleasantly surprised by it!  i think i saw another review here that said the size of these pancakes were small ...?    buh.  i don't know, man.  the pancakes were pretty huge.  then again, everyone has their own idea about what a perfect portion is, so no big deal.

lemon ricotta pancakes aside, the food is average breakfast fare that's touched up enough to set it apart.  i just have a tendency to gloss over the tiny details because i'm easily fascinated by little things (pretty sugar in cute ceramic!).

service is a bit hit-or-miss, depending on who's working.  they're nice (i'm reluctant to say this because it's a very distant kind of niceness) enough and attentive, frequently checking up on your table if you need coffee refills and the like (i haven't been there while it was really busy, so i'm not sure if it's any different during a rush) so it's not so much as a complaint as it is an observation for improvement.

better off as a 3.5 establishment, but i'm okay with rounding up for the memorable rush of excitement i had with my friends.  :]

lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Joel G.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: awesome eggs benedict & lemon ricotta pancakes

Wish I lived there

lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Katherine C.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: Plow was on my list of places to try while in San Francisco for a while, and on a recent trip to the city I finally got to go! I arrived around 9 am on a Sunday and there was about an hour wait, which was well worth it! They offered coffee for waiting customers which helped on a chilly morning. I ordered the Plow which features some of the favorites - eggs, choice of meat, crispy potatoes (which were to die for) and lemon ricotta pancakes.
