excerpts: The Lemon Ricotta Pancakes were to die for, and the sausage patties had so many different flavors it was unbelievable.
The eggs were cooked just like I wanted them and the potatoes were perfectly crispy.
Overall it was a great place.
I will be back for sure.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Neil A.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
I had one of those Sundays where I didn't want to make breakfast.  I heard great things about this place through a family friend.  I got their at around 11:45 and the host, who was extremely helpful and nice told me it was a 45 min wait.  And boy was I glad that I waited.

I started out with a coffee cake and the english muffin with homemade peanut butter.  Both were fantastic, and had a lot of flavor.  I wanted to get the best of both worlds so I tried THE PLOW.  The Lemon Ricotta Pancakes were to die for, and the sausage patties had so many different flavors it was unbelievable.  The eggs were cooked just like I wanted them and the potatoes were perfectly crispy.  Overall it was a great place.  I will be back for sure.

excerpts: - loved the "Plow" with bacon, lemon ricotta pancakes, crispy potatoes and eggs.

lemon ricotta pancakes.author: L N.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: Met friends for breakfast at 8:30 on a Sunday morning and still waited for an hour.  Was glad I had a snack on the drive up there!  Appreciated that it's close to the freeway and I could find street parking.  Food is excellent  - loved the "Plow" with bacon, lemon ricotta pancakes, crispy potatoes and eggs.  For those with kids, know that they don't offer hot chocolate or straws.

excerpts: A couple of us were thinking about getting the lemon ricotta pancakes while we were waiting because they looked so good coming out of the kitchen, but they were gone by the time we sat down to order.
We got there during the last hour of brunch service, so get there earlier if you want to make sure you get some of the more popular menu items!
The advantage to getting there later like we did was that we only had to wait 5 to 10 minutes for a table.
As far as kid-friendly, I was pleasantly surprised-
there was a kids menu which came with a few crayons to color on.
They also had high chairs available.
We're definitely coming back to Plow.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Aimee L.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
This place was awesome all around. The service was friendly and more importantly, the food was flawless. We had the granola with yogurt and fresh seasonal fruit (ordered for my 2-year-old daughter), which was delicious and not too sweet since the yogurt was homemade and plain. My husband had the pork chop, eggs, and potatoes, which he said were delicious. My friend also loved her egg sandwich, which was on a brioche-type bread (can't remember exactly what the menu said). I had the vegetarian omelette which was made with mushrooms, leeks, and a little bit of cheese. It was just right- not greasy or runny and just the right amount of vegetables/cheese. The potatoes were awesome- just the right amount of seasoning and a little crunchy on the edges. I also had the decaf coffee which was really good too. A couple of us were thinking about getting the lemon ricotta pancakes while we were waiting because they looked so good coming out of the kitchen, but they were gone by the time we sat down to order. We got there during the last hour of brunch service, so get there earlier if you want to make sure you get some of the more popular menu items! The advantage to getting there later like we did was that we only had to wait 5 to 10 minutes for a table. As far as kid-friendly, I was pleasantly surprised- there was a kids menu which came with a few crayons to color on. They also had high chairs available. 
We're definitely coming back to Plow.

lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Marthe J.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: If I had a last meal on earth, it would be Plow's lemon ricotta pancakes and those potatoes.  Yes I know it's a tiny spot and you probably/always have to wait, but it is so worth it.  Across the board, the food is delicious.  I am still thinking about those potatoes.

excerpts: We also had the lusciously textured lemon ricotta pancakes, browned perfectly, and light, and creamy at the same time.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: OperationWayne r.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review:
Wow...what an amazing little spot on Potero Hill. Everything here is done right. First off, It starts with the space itself, which was constructed in amazing taste. It has beautiful wood floors, long, large windows, and high ceilings, making the somewhat small space seem larger. 

The food is also great. My wife and I tried a few things on the menu, from the perfectly-assembled fried egg sandwich (potatoes on the side are the best in the bay, hands down), to a surprisingly fresh and flavorful little gem salad, to some delectable sweet fritters that take you to the South, without weighing you down to much. We also had the lusciously textured lemon ricotta pancakes, browned perfectly, and light, and creamy at the same time. 

We were lucky enough to sit at the bar, so we could look into the kitchen and watch everything being made. It all looked fantastic. Very fresh, very simple, and with only the best ingredients. I can't wait to go back and explore their menu a bit. 

Oh yea, I was reading the one and two star reviews just a bit up from mine, and couldn't help feel sorry for these people. They must have woke up on the wrong side of the bed that day. The people the run this place seemed as pleasant as can be. They were accommodating and full of smiles. And since were were sitting at the counter, we got a glimpse into how they were with every patron. Five stars all the way.

excerpts: Not a fan of their menu or the food, except for their Lemon Ricotta Pancakes = heaven!

If you're going solo, enjoy the counter and triptych windows framing the oak tree; groups can enjoy comfortable tables with abundant indirect light.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Geo G.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: Plow is, by far, the best spot in San Francisco to enjoy breakfast. It's actually converted me into a breakfast fan after years of false promises or inconsistencies elsewhere. If you're going solo, enjoy the counter and triptych windows framing the oak tree; groups can enjoy comfortable tables with abundant indirect light. Thanks for rekindling opportunities to savor Equator Coffee while anticipating another outstanding meal (lunch too) before launching back into our City.

lemon ricotta pancakes.review: My new favorite brunch place. Best biscuits and gravy I've had in the Bay Area - flavorful rather than just salty gravy. Pleasant tasting lemon ricotta pancakes. I'd stay away from the cassoulet - it's the only bland offering.

The rest all culminates together - the friendly service, the intimate ambiance, the very nice owners-couple, the other excited patrons, the location, the venue - to make for a perfect way to start off your day.
If you live in, near or are planning a trip to SF, I can't recommend this place enough for brekkie, lunch or wkend brunch...

lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Lulu B.

Hubs found it on Yelp - paying it forward, yes I am - and when we saw/read their website, we knew it was THE brunch place for us. Worth the 20min wait (altho' I can see it being longer at times). I had the egg sandwich (all about that cheese) and a side of 1 lemon ricotta pancake - which also came with those yummy potatos. My hubs had The Plow - a little bit of everything. Their crispy potatoes are phenom. Their lemon ricotta pancakes are to die for. The rest all culminates together - the friendly service, the intimate ambiance, the very nice owners-couple, the other excited patrons, the location, the venue - to make for a perfect way to start off your day. But I say it again - it's DEF worth the wait. I will be back. Soon, I hope.

excerpts: We ordered egg sandwich (me), lamb sandwich (the man) and the lemon ricotta pancakes (to share).
Our waiter was nice if a bit tentative.
Everything but the egg sandwich came out, after we realized it wasn't coming, we told him about it and he said they're working on it now.
Then we saw him talking to the kitchen staff about it a few minutes later when it still didn't come out.
He hadn't followed through with the kitchen about it.
It eventually came and it was quite good, though quite messy, but
I've yet to eat an egg sandwich that wasn't messy.
He was quite apologetic though it would have been nice to have been comped for it or had our bill reduced in some way.
The lamb sandwich was fabulous, perfectly cooked lamb topped with salsa verde which gave it a wonderful bright herbally flavor with a nice garlic kick.
The lemon ricotta pancakes were lovely, so light with nicely done edges.
No, they aren't big but when they taste like this, who cares?
I usually have regret when I order pancakes because they're so dense but not this time.
Nits aside, we'll definitely go back, it's a great addition to the neighborhood.
They open for brunch at 8 am, to avoid a marathon
wait
I would strongly suggest going early or going later.
I may just have to try bribing the man with brunch to get him out of bed early.

You can taste the great ingredients and attention to detail in every bite.
Loved the baked goods and especially the homemade jam.
Highly recommend this place for a great breakfast.
Be warned that there could be a wait since there was considerable pent-up demand for just such a restaurant on the Hill.
I am looking forward to trying the lunch options sometime during the week when I can squeeze into a single place at the bar.
lemon ricotta pancakes.author: Abigail M.
lemon ricotta pancakes.review: Great new neighborhood place on Potrero Hill, brought to us by  a couple who are Potrero Hill residents. Great space, love the big windows; I wish it were larger, but you work with what you have. My 6 yr old loved the lemon ricotta pancakes and defended his plate from parental poaching. You can taste the great ingredients and attention to detail in every bite. Loved the baked goods and especially the homemade jam. Highly recommend this place for a great breakfast. Be warned that there could be a wait since there was considerable pent-up demand for just such a restaurant on the Hill. I am looking forward to trying the lunch options sometime during the week when I can squeeze into a single place at the bar.

excerpts: The menu consists of options like Soft Scrambled Eggs, Sausage & Eggs, Eggs Benedict, etc.
soft scrambled eggs.author: Chelsea W.
soft scrambled eggs.review:
Plow is a pretty good place to get standard brunch fare. If you come early, the wait is really worth it! 

I've always come at opening time around 8 AM and probably wouldn't wait more than 30 min for it, so I highly recommend coming early. 

The menu consists of options like Soft Scrambled Eggs, Sausage & Eggs, Eggs Benedict, etc. It seems like the more popular dishes are the Lemon Ricotta Pancakes and The Plow.

The Plow ($17.5) - Two eggs, two lemon ricotta pancakes + plow potatoes with choice of house made pork sausage, Nueske's bacon, or chicken apple sausage. I ended up getting the Annie's Almond Flour Pancakes since it was GF which tasted great! The chicken apple sausage was also pretty good too. I had a side of fruit which cost a little more, but also tried the potatoes and they were really delicious

Plow stands out because of it's simple, yet delicious and quality ingredients. It does run on the expensive side though.

excerpts: I got the soft scrambled eggs (no butter or cheese),
my boyfriend and his friend both got the chicken rancheros (I forget the exact name of the dish
soft scrambled eggs.author: Kat A.
soft scrambled eggs.review:
The wait was about 1.5 hr on Saturday late morning.  I don't think the food was worth the wait but the food was still good.  They don't take reservations so you have to stand around and wait for your name to get called.

I got the soft scrambled eggs (no butter or cheese), my boyfriend and his friend both got the chicken rancheros (I forget the exact name of the dish but it was something similar to this), and the last friend had the breakfast sandwich.

My eggs were ok...I know I lost a lot of the flavors from the butter and cheese so my eggs weren't very flavorful.  The plow potatoes were really good though.  The chicken rancheros were good but not amazing.  And the breakfast sandwich was also good.  Our friend said the sandwich would have been better if there was ham or bacon that automatically came with the sandwich...with just the egg as protein, it wasn't super filling.

Service was quick and friendly.  There are bathrooms towards the back of the restaurant.  There was outdoor seating.

excerpts: We ordered the Japanese Cheesecake, Custard French Toast, Soft Scrambled Eggs, Breakfast Sandwich with bacon, and Hong Kong Style Toast.
We destroyed each dish, with only a few bites to spare.
I absolutely love this place and can't wait to go back.
soft scrambled eggs.author: Tana B.
soft scrambled eggs.review: WORTH THE WAIT!!! THE BEST FRENCH TOAST YOU WILL EVER HAVE IN YOUR LIFE! When my boyfriend and I dine out we order A LOT of food because we love to eat, but also we like to give a restaurant a good try.  Yesterday we waited probably 30 minutes for a table for two(Monday around noon). We ordered the Japanese Cheesecake, Custard French Toast, Soft Scrambled Eggs, Breakfast Sandwich with bacon, and Hong Kong Style Toast. We destroyed each dish, with only a few bites to spare. I absolutely love this place and can't wait to go back.

excerpts: We ordered a buttermilk biscuit for the table (definitely recommend), and one of my friends and I split the soft scrambled eggs and the lemon ricotta pancakes.
This was more than enough food-
we were stuffed!!
The pancakes were perfectly cooked and fluffy.
The goat cheese in the soft scrambled eggs was also on point.
I was also a big fan of the potatoes, and I'm not even really into potatoes!
Would definitely recommend this place to all my friends!
soft scrambled eggs.author: Sonia S.
soft scrambled eggs.review: My roommates and I finally ventured to Potrero Hill this morning to try this famous brunch. My friend pt our name down early, and it was about an hour and half wait for four people. However, once we got our table the food came so quickly. We ordered a buttermilk biscuit for the table (definitely recommend), and one of my friends and I split the soft scrambled eggs and the lemon ricotta pancakes. This was more than enough food- we were stuffed!! The pancakes were perfectly cooked and fluffy. The goat cheese in the soft scrambled eggs was also on point. I was also a big fan of the potatoes, and I'm not even really into potatoes! Would definitely recommend this place to all my friends!

excerpts: I've pretty much tried everything on their menu but my favorites are soft scrambled eggs, the plow or French toast (toppings vary by season) and of course lemon ricotta pancake are delicious!
soft scrambled eggs.author: Iryna P.
soft scrambled eggs.review: This place is so charming and quaint, and the food is always on point. If you get there before 8am on weekday you can get seated within 20 minutes otherwise be prepared to wait at least an hours during their busy time. But it's still worth it. I've pretty much tried everything on their menu but my favorites are soft scrambled eggs, the plow or French toast (toppings vary by season) and of course lemon ricotta pancake are delicious!

excerpts: My favorites are the lemon ricotta pancakes and soft scrambled eggs!
Dog and kid friendly!
soft scrambled eggs.author: Liz C.
soft scrambled eggs.review: I've lived down the street for years, and must say that this is one of the best lunch/brunch places in town. The food is always high quality, and focuses on sustainably grown and local farmers. I try to go mostly during the week. It can be very very busy on weekends, so you must have the patience for a wait, but the food and atmosphere are worth it! My favorites are the lemon ricotta pancakes and soft scrambled eggs! Dog and kid friendly!

excerpts:
(we like to share)
- The plow
- Soft scrambled eggs 
- French toast 
- Salmon eggs benedict 
- Dungeness crab scramble 
- Breakfast sandwich 
-
My favorite was the lemon ricotta pancakes with the plow dish.

soft scrambled eggs.author: Jenna T.
soft scrambled eggs.review:
They can't take more than 6 people in a party which was just perfect for us. We had to wait for about 1.5 hour for our table. Partially our fault as we missed the first time our name was called. There were people waiting at 9am! The staff was very friendly and the place is pretty cozy. 
We had almost everything on the menu... (we like to share)
- The plow
- Soft scrambled eggs 
- French toast 
- Salmon eggs benedict 
- Dungeness crab scramble 
- Breakfast sandwich 
- Hong Kong toast 

Loved their house potatoes because they were crunchy instead of smooshy. Their hot sauce was good too. My favorite was the lemon ricotta pancakes with the plow dish. The crab scramble was also delicious. Nothing really disappointed me in the spread we got. The Hong Kong toast was also good but it just wasn't my cup of tea. 

I wouldn't mind coming again but it may be a shorter wait with a smaller party. Parking wasn't too bad either. They also don't have room for stroller parking if you're coming here with a baby/toddler and it's pretty difficult to have a high chair given the tight space.

excerpts: The food (soft scrambled eggs, lemon ricotta pancakes, regular scrambled eggs) was fresh and delicious.
I'm not a pancake junkie, but I don't remember ever having better pancakes than these.
They're lighter than they sound
soft scrambled eggs.author: Joe G.
soft scrambled eggs.review:
In one word? Wow.  This place is great. 

The food (soft scrambled eggs, lemon ricotta pancakes, regular scrambled eggs) was fresh and delicious.  I'm not a pancake junkie, but I don't remember ever having better pancakes than these. They're lighter than they sound and they're reasonably sized. 

Fast and friendly service.  Plenty of natural light inside. 

Yes, there will be a wait. Yes, it will be worth it.

excerpts: * Soft scrambled eggs (stinging nettles, shiitake mushrooms, goat cheese.

$15.75) - 4 stars
Great texture to the egg, love the combo of cheese and mushrooms.
soft scrambled eggs.author: Ziyan C.
soft scrambled eggs.review:
Always an excellent brunch here.

THE WAIT
They open at 8am on Sundays, and we got there at 8:11am.  There was already a line around the corner, but it was moving. We got on the list around 8:20am and had just barely missed the first wave of seating. They estimated a 30-minute wait, and we got a table inside around 8:50am!

SERVICE
Friendly and efficient.

THE COST
$66.61 before tips for 2 coffees, 1 starter, 2 sides, and 2 entrees. A very reasonable brunch for three.

MUST -HAVES
As always: Lemon Ricotta Pancake, anything with their potatoes.

* Chia seed pudding (almond milk, coconut, honey, almonds, bee pollen, apples, raw hemp seeds. $9.25) - 4.5 stars
My boyfriend's mom really enjoyed this. It was a nicely done, light breakfast. She wants to learn the recipe and make it herself!

* Breakfast sandwich + bacon & avocado ($17.50) - 4.5 stars
Always a great sandwich with quality ingredients. The potatoes, as always, easily the best in the city.

* Soft scrambled eggs (stinging nettles, shiitake mushrooms, goat cheese. $15.75) - 4 stars
Great texture to the egg, love the combo of cheese and mushrooms. Excellent potatoes.

SIDES
* One lemon ricotta pancake ($5.50) - 5 stars
Always amazing!

* One pumpkin pancake ($5.50) - 4 stars
Great seasonal item, though somehow not as moist as the lemon ricotta, and missing that interesting pop in flavor.

excerpts:
Very filling brunch place..
+ Ordered the perfect thing (for my taste) - soft scrambled eggs (shiitake mushrooms, stinging nettles, goat cheese, plow potatoes + toast) LOVED IT!
+ tried to famous lemon ricotta pancakes as well - really fluffy and different from regular pancakes
and I liked it but was definitely too full (even tho
I ordered it as a side)
soft scrambled eggs.author: Mahima D.
soft scrambled eggs.review:
Best eggs I've ever had! Very filling brunch place..
+ Ordered the perfect thing (for my taste) - soft scrambled eggs (shiitake mushrooms, stinging nettles, goat cheese, plow potatoes + toast) LOVED IT!
+ tried to famous lemon ricotta pancakes as well - really fluffy and different from regular pancakes and I liked it but was definitely too full (even tho I ordered it as a side)
+ my friend also enjoyed her condensed milk toast very much :)
+ the aesthetics of the place are gorgeous!!
+ really friendly waiters and waitresses (they check up on you and are helpful)
+ played nice background music too!!

- long wait time so expect that (even on a thurs morning)! You can put your name down and come back though,which is what I did (there's a coffee shop not too far from here just down the street that was really cozy called Farley's where you can order coffee and wait)

excerpts: Soft Scrambled Eggs?
This is how they do their eggs and boy
do they do it
soft scrambled eggs.author: Mae Louise L.
soft scrambled eggs.review:
HOLY SHIT!!! I came here visiting from Los Angeles & let me tell you, Plow was the highlight of our trip! All around BOMB brunch. Everything was amazing. I came at 9 AM on a Friday. (Black Friday to be exact) For a table for 4 we were quoted 1-1.5 hours and we were definitely turned off at first.. but then after failing to find a bar open that early to kill time while we waited, we came back at 9:30 to find out that all the other parties got discouraged by the quote time and left meaning we got sat after only a 30 minute wait! yay~! (So try to stick around despite being quoted a long time AND try to come early!) We got seated outside & it was a bit chilly but they offer blankets for every seat! Kudos.

I forget who our server was, but she was very down to earth and nice despite it being quite busy. NOW on to the important part: THE FOOD.

THE PLOW:
effffinggg AMAZING.

Lemon Ricotta Pancake? Small, but amazing. Fluffy and perfect flavor. Sad that I didn't try the other ones cuz they sounded just as appetizing.

House-made Sausage? Really good (recommended by server.) However, my friend got the apple something chicken sausage and THAT was astronomical. I'd say go for that one cuz that blew our minds.

Fried Potatoes? Best I've ever had, hands down. Perfect thin crisp on the outside. Seasoning just perfect, not overly salted with the perfect amount of rosemary coming through. Inside nice and soft, perfectly boiled. 

Soft Scrambled Eggs? This is how they do their eggs and boy do they do it gooooooood.

We also got the honey butter biscuit which was big and yummy. (though I have had better biscuits) BUT to be fair this was more scone-like and we did thoroughly enjoy them.

My only regret is not getting the other pancakes or the prosciutto and gruyere (because I had another reservation elsewhere for lunch right after.)

Plow, I will be dreaming of you until I get a chance to return.

Cheers to the team at Plow! You deserve more praise!!!

excerpts: I got the soft scrambled eggs and an almond pancake.
Eh.
soft scrambled eggs.author: Christineeeeeee K.
soft scrambled eggs.review:
Eh. I got the soft scrambled eggs and an almond pancake. 
Eh.

excerpts: The Plow still looked amazing but on the other hand, the soft scrambled eggs looked heavenly as well.
I mean...shitake mushrooms and goat cheese in my soft scrambled eggs?
I think yes.
Plus I've been told they are known for both these dishes.
It was going to be a game time decision.
As soon as the server came over, I completely scrambled (pun intended) and went with the soft scrambled eggs BUT added an order of the lemon ricotta pancakes on the side.
Could I BE any more excited?
The answer is no.
Plus I also ordered an iced chai.
I could not have been happier with my decision to get the soft scrambled eggs.
it was everything I could have hoped for and more.
soft scrambled eggs.author: Ilana B.
soft scrambled eggs.review:
Hmmm what to say about Plow....

Heard amazing things about this place and have been dying to try it! My friend and I finally ventured out to Petrero Hill (10 min car ride from my apt...) to try Plow and boy did it live up to the hype. We had been looking over the menu in the uber ride there and already knew what we wanted...The Plow. Of course. It had everything you could ever want...eggs, meat, pancakes, AND potatoes. YUM. I was ready to take on The Plow. 

We knew the line was going to be long and we'd probably be waiting for over an hour but it would be worth it. The second we walked in, we told the hostess we had two people and she said we can either put you on the list for inside or seat you outside right away. My friend and I both looked at each other and said outside at the same time. We could not believe it! Note: It was a little chilly outside but who cares...we were getting seated RIGHT AWAY! Anyone who lives in SF and eats brunch on a weekend knows how rare this is. So outside it was! They even provided each customer with their own blanket!! Incredible. Is there anything they don't think of?!

As soon as we sat down, I started looking over the menu. The Plow still looked amazing but on the other hand, the soft scrambled eggs looked heavenly as well. I mean...shitake mushrooms and goat cheese in my soft scrambled eggs? I think yes. Plus I've been told they are known for both these dishes. It was going to be a game time decision. As soon as the server came over, I completely scrambled (pun intended) and went with the soft scrambled eggs BUT added an order of the lemon ricotta pancakes on the side. Could I BE any more excited? The answer is no. Plus I also ordered an iced chai. It was so tasty. 

I could not have been happier with my decision to get the soft scrambled eggs. it was everything I could have hoped for and more. Much more. 

Plow, you have my heart.

excerpts: I got the plow with pork sausage, and soft scrambled eggs.
My plate turned out exactly what i thought it would.
soft scrambled eggs.author: Paulina N.
soft scrambled eggs.review:
Came here in a Monday afternoon, for a group of 5 our wait was about 30-35 minuets. Not too bad because a couple of parties before us didn't show up.
Our servicer was nice she got our orders in as soon as we were ready. 
We ordered 2 buttermilk biscuits to start off our lunch. The butter was sweet and seems like it was house made. 
I got the plow with pork sausage, and soft scrambled eggs. My plate turned out exactly what i thought it would. The lemon ricotta pancakes are supposed to be a huge hit here but I personally didn't favor them. The dense ricotta made it too heavy for me to finish both. But it seems to be exactly what a ricotta pancake should be. 
I would definitely come back next time for brunch again!

excerpts: I ordered the soft scrambled eggs but also got a side of lemon ricotta pancakes.
Both were out of this world!
We will definitely be coming back to Plow next time we are in town.
soft scrambled eggs.author: Kate O.
soft scrambled eggs.review: I can see why Plow is so popular! Excellent breakfast on our last day of vacation. Came on a Thursday morning around 9 and there was no wait for a table inside. Service was very attentive and friendly. I ordered the soft scrambled eggs but also got a side of lemon ricotta pancakes. Both were out of this world! We will definitely be coming back to Plow next time we are in town.

excerpts: I had the soft scrambled eggs with shiitake mushrooms, cherry tomatoes, and goat cheese.
It comes with a couple small pieces of toast and I substituted the potatoes with a side salad.
soft scrambled eggs.author: Sara M.
soft scrambled eggs.review:
I'm not sure I would wait 1-2 hours on a weekend to eat here. I waited about half an hour with a friend on a Tuesday at 10:15am. We were seated outside (I would have preferred inside for the ambiance) and the table was kind of lopsided because the outside tables are on a small hill and one of the legs wasn't level, so my friend's coffee spilled when the table jerked to one side and someone had to come with a wedge. 

My friend ordered the breakfast sandwich and liked it. I had the soft scrambled eggs with shiitake mushrooms, cherry tomatoes, and goat cheese. It comes with a couple small pieces of toast and I substituted the potatoes with a side salad. I enjoyed the side salad but the eggs were probably not the most exciting thing to order (I've seen the lemon ricotta pancakes are recommended by others). We each got coffee and the waiter kept it flowing! The price (about $15 each) seemed reasonable for the food and experience.

excerpts: Super crispy fried rosemary potatoes, homemade sausage, lemony pancakes perfectly fluffy and soft scrambled eggs done exactly how they should be which I find pretty rare.
soft scrambled eggs.author: Christine H.
soft scrambled eggs.review:
LOVE this place. The food is perfectly right. Super crispy fried rosemary potatoes, homemade sausage, lemony pancakes perfectly fluffy and soft scrambled eggs done exactly how they should be which I find pretty rare. Our server Yonya was great and always around for coffee refills. 

One gripe though made it lose a star- it was $4.75 to order a piece of toast. It came with 3 slices and homemade jam that we didn't need or want and that price is outrageous, especially considering the Hong Kong toast with condensed milk was just $4. It's a small thing but that really irritates me when a place price gouges on the side items. 

Waitress was awesome.

excerpts: I got the soft scrambled eggs with mushrooms and goat cheese and was expecting an amazing dish based on the wait time.
It was pretty good, but nothing extraordinary.
The eggs could've used more seasoning, or some more goat cheese.
At 1:30 they asked us to leave so they could give the table to someone else.
Overall good food, but a little overhyped.
soft scrambled eggs.author: Sara T.
soft scrambled eggs.review: Came here with a friend on a Saturday for brunch. We showed up at 10:45 and got seated at 12:30. I got the soft scrambled eggs with mushrooms and goat cheese and was expecting an amazing dish based on the wait time. It was pretty good, but nothing extraordinary. The eggs could've used more seasoning, or some more goat cheese. At 1:30 they asked us to leave so they could give the table to someone else. Overall good food, but a little overhyped.

excerpts: I had the soft scrambled eggs with oyster mushrooms, goat cheese plow fried potatoes, toast AND bacon.
soft scrambled eggs.author: Kate A.
soft scrambled eggs.review:
This is the cutest little breakfast cafe! They seem to always be busy and I'm not sure if they take reservations, so be prepared to wait about 15 minutes or so. The wait is worth it, I promise! 

I had the soft scrambled eggs with oyster mushrooms, goat cheese plow fried potatoes, toast AND bacon. This entire plate of deliciousness for less than $15 and washed down with an equally delicious coffee. 

My boyfriend and his sister each ordered "The Plow," which came with 2 eggs, 2 lemon ricotta pancakes, plow fried potatoes and sausage. You can choose between chicken apple sausage, pork sausage or bacon. I can't recall what sausage they chose, but I do remember it having a bit of a spicy kick to it. The lemon ricotta pancakes tasted a little much like a cookie to me..I will probably try their featured pancakes next time. When we went they were pumpkin pancakes, and had I the room, I would have ordered them as well.

My coffee cup was always as full as the tummy I left with. Great, friendly service. I will definitely be back to try more items!

excerpts: Soft scrambled eggs, lemon ricotta pancakes, great service...need I say more??
I was worried that Plow had been over hyped
but I'm happy to say that I wasn't disappointed!
Even on a Friday there was a line of people waiting to get in during lunch, but we put our name down and waited maybe 45 minutes before getting seated in the back.
The lemon ricotta pancakes were SO tender and moist, and the soft scrambled eggs were the perfect consistency to spread on my toast!
I also loved the open, airy decor in Plow.
I would definitely love to go again, but I recommend not going TOO hungry because the wait could be pretty long!
The lemon ricotta pancakes were SO tender and moist, and the soft scrambled eggs were the perfect consistency to spread on my toast!
I also loved the open, airy decor in Plow.
I would definitely love to go again, but I recommend not going TOO hungry because the wait could be pretty long!
soft scrambled eggs.author: Grace C.
soft scrambled eggs.review:
Soft scrambled eggs, lemon ricotta pancakes, great service...need I say more?? I was worried that Plow had been over hyped but I'm happy to say that I wasn't disappointed! Even on a Friday there was a line of people waiting to get in during lunch, but we put our name down and waited maybe 45 minutes before getting seated in the back. Our server was friendly and the food came out pretty quickly!

The lemon ricotta pancakes were SO tender and moist, and the soft scrambled eggs were the perfect consistency to spread on my toast! I also loved the open, airy decor in Plow. I would definitely love to go again, but I recommend not going TOO hungry because the wait could be pretty long!

excerpts: I ordered the fried egg sandwich w/ bacon and my friend got the soft scrambled eggs.
We didn't have to wait long for the food to arrive.
Mine looks great.
Hers looked like they gave her the potato dredges from the bottom of the bowl - lots of onions and burnt potato bits.
I was a little surprised they even served it - it was noticeably poorer quality than everyone else's plates around us.
soft scrambled eggs.author: Jean K.
soft scrambled eggs.review:
I was a little underwhelmed with brunch at Plow today. I was expecting that with the long lines at 10am that this place must be really good - especially since a lot of people travelled here from outside the neighborhood.

We left our names at the register and went to Farley's to chat away our 1-1.5hr wait. Why they don't take phone numbers to call beats me - too civilized that way? They do let you call to see where things are. So after 45 minutes we call and are told our table will be ready in half an hour. 15 minutes later we're back at the door and wait... wait.... wait... some more. We finally ask and they're like oh yeah, we called your name but we can put you at the top of the list now. I replied that we'd been waiting there for the past 20min at least and didn't hear anything. And we were watching them like a hawk because they weren't shouting people's names, just mumbling them as they walked around the sidewalk (it took most people several takes to understand that it was them being called).  Pro Tip: Try saying people's name louder than a whisper if you want us to actually hear you.

Service inside was good enough. I ordered the fried egg sandwich w/ bacon and my friend got the soft scrambled eggs. We didn't have to wait long for the food to arrive. Mine looks great. Hers looked like they gave her the potato dredges from the bottom of the bowl - lots of onions and burnt potato bits. I was a little surprised they even served it - it was noticeably poorer quality than everyone else's plates around us. Needless to say she wasn't going to take it lying down and asked them to exchange the potatoes

After that was sorted we were ready to dig in - almost. I picked up my eggs sandwich and the yolk just dribbled away onto my plate. Okay, I can just sop it up later. I take a bite of my sandwich and yolk squirts out all over my hand and shirt sleeve. Yikes! I guess I should have expected it in a softly cooked egg but I had mistaken the sandwich for something I could eat by hand - you know, like a sandwich. So I put it down, cleaned myself up, then proceeded to eat it with knife and fork deconstructed style. Didn't really work because it was hard to get bread, frisee, spread, egg, cheese, bacon all in one bite. I ended up eating it one at a time and the bacon whole because I couldn't cut it into pieces with the knife.

Okay, so these are all mishaps that shouldn't be held against the restaurant. However, in the end the food was just okay. Yes, it's better than your typical brunch place but I have high standards. The potatoes were crispy (deep fried instead of roasted) but bland. Definitely needed both salt and hot sauce to make interesting. Definitely looked better than they tasted. The sandwich wasn't that interesting - the extra for the bacon went to 2 skinny strips that I couldn't cut. Could barely taste the cheese. Was mostly a runny egg and nice bread meal.

Overall, not worth the wait. If you live in the neighborhood and can stop by when there's no wait at all I'd bump it up to 3.5-4 stars possibly. My friend enjoyed her scrambled eggs and newly exchanged potatoes with added salt and hot sauce.

excerpts: The soft scrambled eggs were slightly better though I wasn't much a fan of the potatoes they came with - super large potato chunks and not particularly crispy.
soft scrambled eggs.author: Gowri R.
soft scrambled eggs.review:
Hadn't been to Plow in a few years because the hours long wait is always a little daunting, but today I decided it was time to give it another try.

We waited ~1.5 hours and then were ultimately seated at the bar. A little disappointing to wait so long only to be crammed in at the bar, but it's fun to watch the chefs at work in the kitchen. There was catchy music playing and the folks in the kitchen were scrambling eggs and tossing pancakes to the tunes. They were clearly enjoying their work, which was kind of awesome to see.

I ordered the lemon ricotta pancakes and a biscuit. I had tried the pancakes the last time I was here a few years ago and remember not liking them. However, they're so hyped that I thought for sure it must just have been an off day or something. Unfortunately, I have to say - not sure exactly what it is, but they're just not my thing.

I also got a biscuit - that was pretty good. The soft scrambled eggs were slightly better though I wasn't much a fan of the potatoes they came with - super large potato chunks and not particularly crispy. 

Overall, I left feeling marginally unsatisfied. It might be another 3 years before I give plow another try.

excerpts: We ordered The Plow and Soft scrambled eggs, two cups of coffee and one orange juice.
Portions are big, you will not be hungry at the end.
But the food is just ok...
We payed $50 plus $10 tips for our breakfast.
For me it doesn't worth that money and lines.
soft scrambled eggs.author: Mariia N.
soft scrambled eggs.review: I wanted to visit the Plow very much, because of its popularity and long lines near cafe. I was expecting from this place something really delicious. So we came Wednesday morning and the line was just 20 minutes for us. Staff was very polite and nice - they smiled all the time and did a great job. Place is very clean and neat - that is so important. We ordered The Plow and Soft scrambled eggs, two cups of coffee and one orange juice. Portions are big, you will not be hungry at the end. But the food is just ok... We payed $50 plus $10 tips for our breakfast. For me it doesn't worth that money and lines.

excerpts: We ordered a buttermilk biscuit, soft scrambled eggs with potatoes and toast, and the lemon ricotta pancakes to share.
soft scrambled eggs.author: Casatrina L.
soft scrambled eggs.review:
I'd heard many great reviews of Plow before coming and it did live up to the hype, although I wouldn't wait an hour for it. Came here at 11 for brunch on Saturday - my friend had put our name down at 9.45 and was told that it would be an hour's wait. We were finally seated at 11. 

We ordered a buttermilk biscuit, soft scrambled eggs with potatoes and toast, and the lemon ricotta pancakes to share. Everyone seems to rave about The Plow but we decided that it would be too huge a portion to finish (which was a good call since we couldn't finish the potatoes from our order)

The food did take a while to arrive. The buttermilk biscuit came with honey butter. It was decent, though not worth the price ($4.25). The pancakes ($13.75 for 3) came looking nondescript, but they were custardy, not overly sweet, and absolutely delicious warm. Definitely lived up to its name of being Plow's must-order dish! The soft-scrambled eggs ($13) were pretty good, with generous fillings (goat's cheese, asparagus, spinach, mushrooms). That said, it wasn't a particularly memorable dish. I'm not a huge fan of potatoes to begin with, and so wasn't blown away by their famous potatoes.

Service is great, and the servers were attentive and really friendly, which is fantastic, especially having waited for an hour for your table. Our total bill added up to $40 (for the above 3 orders and a coffee) including tax, which is pretty affordable for such a popular place. Love the farm to table vibe of this place, and I'd be back if not for the long wait. Perhaps on a weekday :)

excerpts: : I ordered the soft scrambled eggs (with shiitake mushrooms, goat cheese, spinach, and a side of potatoes/toast) - approximately $15.75.
I was quite pleased with my selection!
The portions were good size but not overwhelming.
Kimberly got the breakfast sandwich and she really liked hers.
soft scrambled eggs.author: Salma R.
soft scrambled eggs.review:
Tried Plow today for the first time with fellow Yelper, Kimberly S. We got there around 12:50 pm and luckily didn't have to wait too long for a table. Something weird is that when they call names for people who aren't there they don't just cross it off the list - they keep calling it every time. So, we were advised we'd have to wait 30 minutes or 1.5 hours. Err...okay?

Atmosphere: Standard SF brunch ambience. You know what I'm talking 'bout.

Food: I ordered the soft scrambled eggs (with shiitake mushrooms, goat cheese, spinach, and a side of potatoes/toast) - approximately $15.75. I was quite pleased with my selection! The portions were good size but not overwhelming. Kimberly got the breakfast sandwich and she really liked hers. Huge fan of the potatoes. 

Service: Our waitress was quick and I attribute that to how much they need tables to get a move on :). Still friendly though.

Probably my second favorite brunch place in the city so far and that's saying something.

excerpts: We were disappointed they didn't have the Pazole but the mushroom and stinging nettles soft scrambled eggs were very good.
soft scrambled eggs.author: Mark M.
soft scrambled eggs.review:
This has been on my list for a while. I can see why it's always so busy and there's often a wait. 

Delicious food well done. Friendly welcoming staff. And beautiful. Cozy space. 

We were disappointed they didn't have the Pazole but the mushroom and stinging nettles soft scrambled eggs were very good. The crispy potatoes are top notch and the pork sausage so tasty-pork!

Friends had Annie's ricotta pancakes and loved them. Thanks Annie.

excerpts: Their soft scrambled eggs in any dish were one of our favorites, and in general it's hard to go wrong with this place!
soft scrambled eggs.author: Hope X.
soft scrambled eggs.review:
First off, the wait here is always at least 2 hours long for some reason. If you have other things to keep you busy anyways, I'd say it's worth it, but the long wait time is definitely something to take into consideration before you go. 

Plow is one of the most charming and pleasant brunch spots I've ever been to. Everyone who works there are very nice in a down-to-earth kind of way, and if you sit at the counter you can watch the cooks whipping up their magic out in the open. My boyfriend and I were the last ones allowed to be seated even though it was literally past closing time (bless our waitress' heart). By the time we started eating, there weren't many people in the restaurant anymore and we found ourselves having a nice, peaceful meal to the background sound of the employees brunching together at the tables next to us. Really relaxing. 

The food itself is really good. Their soft scrambled eggs in any dish were one of our favorites, and in general it's hard to go wrong with this place!

excerpts: I had the soft scrambled eggs which were very yummy.
We ordered the chia seed pudding for the table which I will definitely skip on my next visit.
soft scrambled eggs.author: Tracy S.
soft scrambled eggs.review: Both times I've been to plow I have really enjoyed my brunch. Reason for the 4 stars is because if you don't get in line by 7:50 am you will most likely have to wait two hours for brunch. I had the soft scrambled eggs which were very yummy. We ordered the chia seed pudding for the table which I will definitely skip on my next visit.

excerpts: Chefs can throw down on the omelette, soft scrambled eggs and pumpkin pancakes.
Everything has an artisan feel to it, with light touches of simple, yet divine flavors.
I would compare it to great Japanese cuisine, but in the breakfast realm.
Coffee is pretty good too, although not to be compared to the institution Sightglass....never...
soft scrambled eggs.author: Ella H.
soft scrambled eggs.review: Plow is the best brunch place in town! However, you need to have the patience as a mourning elephant pod. It can take up to 2.5-3hrs wait during their traffic hours. Even getting there at 8am in the morning entails a 1hr wait. Food is amaze ballz though. Simple, yet very thoughtful brunch menu. Fresh produce, cheese, eggs and bread ingredients. Chefs can throw down on the omelette, soft scrambled eggs and pumpkin pancakes. Everything has an artisan feel to it, with light touches of simple, yet divine flavors. I would compare it to great Japanese cuisine, but in the breakfast realm. Coffee is pretty good too, although not to be compared to the institution Sightglass....never...

excerpts: My husband had soft scrambled eggs, which blew his mind.
soft scrambled eggs.author: Heather H.
soft scrambled eggs.review:
Insanely good breakfast! Get there early because there is always a wait. We arrived around 9am on a Saturday morning and waited an hour. However, they made the wait a very pleasant experience. They served us fresh coffee that we took with us for a nice morning walk around the neighborhood. 
My husband had soft scrambled eggs, which blew his mind. I had an amazing farro salad with fresh, roasted veggies and a vinaigrette that was so yummy. I also induldged in the almond flour pancake, which was seriously the best pancake I remember ever having. We will definitely go back!

excerpts: My mom chose the soft scrambled eggs with oyster mushrooms, spinach and cheddar accommodated with potatoes and toast.
I never knew eggs can be that light, fluffy and divine!
I absolutely love eggs, but this made me fall in LOVE with them even more.

Oyster mushrooms have a really "meaty" quality to them, so I didn't miss that there was no carnivorous protein on the plate (besides the egg). 
.
soft scrambled eggs.author: Derrick H.
soft scrambled eggs.review:
You know a place is popular when my mom starts to talk about it. Being in close proximity to her work, I decided to take her on Saturday before she began her shift. Everyone knows you'd better be prepared to wait over an hour for a seat at any brunch spot in San Francisco; and Plow was no exception. To our surprise, our expected hour and a half turned into only 50 minutes! We were seated at the counter facing the open-aired kitchen. Plow is extremely homey. From the wooden decor to the spices stored in mason jars, I already knew I was going to like what I ordered. 

My mom and I both got coffee to start the meal. If I didn't drive, I definitely would have tried the Bloody Beer. But their coffee was great! My mom even said, "This is the best coffee I've had from any of the brunch spots you've taken me." It's hard to please my mom, especially when it comes to her coffee! 

But onto the food... between the both of us, we ordered two dishes.

My mom chose the soft scrambled eggs with oyster mushrooms, spinach and cheddar accommodated with potatoes and toast. I never knew eggs can be that light, fluffy and divine! I absolutely love eggs, but this made me fall in LOVE with them even more. Oyster mushrooms have a really "meaty" quality to them, so I didn't miss that there was no carnivorous protein on the plate (besides the egg). 
.
I decided to go with the Plow (2 ricotta lemon pancakes, eggs, house made sausages and potatoes). I had a small issue with my pancakes because they were a bit underdone in the center. The taste though... a punch of lemon-y goodness balanced with ricotta cheese! As for the house made sausage, the flavors again punched me in the face and left me in awe. It was unfortunately a bit on the drier side for my liking. 

But the key to this delicious meal lies in the potatoes... It doesn't make sense! Crispy goodness from the start to finish of meal. To be honest, I'm not a fan of the potato. Plow has to be seasoning their potatoes with something, because I ate every bite possible off my plate and then my mom's plate!

You definitely need to give Plow a try if you have any interest in brunch foods. I promise you won't be disappointed!

excerpts: Soft scrambled eggs -
Who knew that stinging nettles and goat cheese went together so well.

soft scrambled eggs.author: Nguyen L.
soft scrambled eggs.review:
I like the clean & simple neighborhood feeling of this restaurant. Waited an hour on Saturday but it wasn't that bad since the weather was nice and I had a Mimosa in my hand. 
I ordered the Plow with my eggs over medium and chicken apple sausage. My potatoes were a little too extra crispy. However, others that had the potatoes didn't suffer the same fate I did. I loved the lemon ricotta pancakes. The favor was light and not overpowering so I could easily see myself eating many of these.
Soft scrambled eggs - Who knew that stinging nettles and goat cheese went together so well. The eggs had that almost cooked looked like it was a little runny but when I ate it I tasted perfectly that way. 
Service- Hostess and servers were very nice.

They didn't have the monkey bread on the menu that day so I missed that opportunity.  If I was around Potrero Hill area I stop in again.

excerpts: We ordered the plow, a delicious biscuit and soft scrambled eggs.
Highly recommend all three.
Everything around us looked so delicious
but we were so full off the two plates we ordered that we didn't get to try more.
soft scrambled eggs.author: Sandra S.
soft scrambled eggs.review: Loved the brunch. We ordered the plow, a delicious biscuit and soft scrambled eggs. Highly recommend all three. Everything around us looked so delicious but we were so full off the two plates we ordered that we didn't get to try more.

excerpts: I had the Soft Scrambled Eggs.
soft scrambled eggs.author: Mel C.
soft scrambled eggs.review:
Solid spot for Sunday brunch, but not worth the 2 hour wait. Luckily you can put your name down and grab some coffee down the street... but still there are comparable brunch spots in SF.

I had the Soft Scrambled Eggs. The crispy potatoes (raved about on Yelp) were just ok. They are less greasy than your typical diner potatoes, but they lacked seasoning and salt. I had to put a lot of hot sauce and ketchup on them. They also come with a lot of fried skin, which may or may not be your thing. The eggs themselves were good but nothing to wait 2 hours for. They were soft as advertised. The feta flavor was subtle and didn't overpower the overall eggy flavor.

It's a small place with some outdoor seating. Ambiance is just average.

excerpts: The soft scrambled eggs are soft, the poached eggs are runny, and the fried egg sandwich has a slightly runny egg.
soft scrambled eggs.author: Rachelle T.
soft scrambled eggs.review:
Plow is top of my brunch list these days. 

Reasons why I will wait an HOUR for Plow: 
- Potatoes. Potatoes. Potatoes! There is a reason why it's on the 7x7 Big Eat list. Plow has my favorite breakfast potatoes yet. They are crispy, seasoned and sprinkled with onions! 
- Their eggs are cooked to perfection. The soft scrambled eggs are soft, the poached eggs are runny, and the fried egg sandwich has a slightly runny egg. 
- The bacon is thick and smoky, although I find the homemade sausage to be too lean (*gasp) and chewy. 

Unfortunately, it's closed on Mondays and sometimes the line outside will appear short but will actually be long. People tend to put their names down and wander around to pass the hour. It is a smaller place, so I recommend 4 or less in your party. Service can be a little spotty but the potatoes and hard working kitchen staff makes up for it. My favorite spot is at the counter!

excerpts: SOFT SCRAMBLED EGGS: asparagus, oyster mushrooms, goat cheese.
Flavor was a little lacking, would pass on this for the SOFT SCRAMBLED EGGS.
soft scrambled eggs.author: Sunny W.
soft scrambled eggs.review:
Been here twice, both times were to take friends visiting the area. It's good, with all the other amazing breakfast/brunch places in SF, I may skip this place next time.

What I've tried:
LEMON RICOTTA PANCAKES: First time I had this, I didn't enjoy it. Second time was much better.

FRIED EGG SANDWICH: My only grip with this dish is the bun used. I guess I'm picky about my carbs....

SOFT SCRAMBLED EGGS: asparagus, oyster mushrooms, goat cheese. One of my favorites from Plow --I would reorder next time I visit.

EGGS BENEDICT: I got the spinach/mushroom combo. The english muffin must be bought at a nearby bakery --thicker than your usual. Flavor was a little lacking, would pass on this for the SOFT SCRAMBLED EGGS.

Of course, the CRISPY POTATOES are as good as everyone says it is.

PARKING: If you come at the right time, you should be able to find street parking.

FIRST TIMER? Walk through the crowds near the entrance and put your name down with a staff. Expect to wait at least 45 min on weekends. There's bar and table seating inside, as well as a handful of tables outside.

excerpts: The soft scrambled eggs with goat cheese and oyster mushrooms, while boldly priced at $15, is the bronze medal dish.
Don't be ashamed to order yourself two dishes.
soft scrambled eggs.author: Lou S.
soft scrambled eggs.review:
On a warm weekend morning when you have at least 5 hours to spare, there's nothing like driving to Potrero Hill to get plowed.

Plow prepares the best breakfast in San Francisco, and absolutely everyone knows it. We began waiting in line for breakfast around 11 AM...and by the time we got a seat, it was almost time for dinner. Ways to make yourself feel better about the delay: they provide free coffee and the classic SF 90 degree hill above the restaurant has parking vacancies. Bring your mountain climbing gear to reascend to your vehicle.

Plow achieves equal prowess with the sugary and the salty: they offer both the best French toast in town and the best standard breakfast in "the plow." The soft scrambled eggs with goat cheese and oyster mushrooms, while boldly priced at $15, is the bronze medal dish. Don't be ashamed to order yourself two dishes. You earned it by walking up and down the hill 20 times before being seated.

Last time I went here, the next door building caught on fire--presumably an act of arson by a starving patron trying to cook their own sausages in the street. The fire truck roared onto the scene and parked parallel to the outside tables. The firefighters jumped out in formation, posing for a moment like TV show firefighters awaiting exaltation, then sadly grabbed their hoses and walked away when they realized nobody had stopped eating. That's the kind of food you're signing up to enjoy.

excerpts: Your soft scrambled eggs with oyster mushrooms, lambs quarter, and goat cheese is sheer heaven... being light and satisfyingly rich of flavor and texture.
soft scrambled eggs.author: Christine K.
soft scrambled eggs.review:
Dear Plow,

You are, dare I say, the epitome of why I go out and pay money for brunch... You provide an experience of flavors, quality, and sheer size that knocks everyone else out of the water.

Your staff is friendly and quick to take care of me as I walk in...

Your lemon ricotta pancakes are sheer brillance... with or without the love of Vermont maple syrup...

Your soft scrambled eggs with oyster mushrooms, lambs quarter, and goat cheese is sheer heaven... being light and satisfyingly rich of flavor and texture.

Your eggs benedict with ham is sheer perfection...

And the potatoes!  Fried crisp on the outside with the potato-y soft goodness on the inside.  I could've eaten these on the side of everything!

My only complaint is can you make all the other people go away, so I don't have to wait in line?  No?  Okay, I'll just come early for easier parking and the ability to walk right in and enjoy my coffee.

Much love and full of deliciousness,
Christine

excerpts: I ordered the soft scrambled eggs with goat cheese and nettles and acme toast.
There was...not going to lie...
a lot of butter, but it was worth it.
soft scrambled eggs.author: Madeline S.
soft scrambled eggs.review: Everything I had read about Plow was absolutely true and more. I am so glad we trekked out to Potrero Hill at 9:30 for this. It was an hour wait but there was plenty to walk around and see in the cute neighborhood and we got coffees at a nearby cafe. I ordered the soft scrambled eggs with goat cheese and nettles and acme toast. There was...not going to lie...a lot of butter, but it was worth it. The crispy potatoes are also delicious. My friend got the salmon tartine, which was good, but not as unique as mine. We shared one lemon ricotta pancake, a must-try!! It basically tasted like cake. The atmosphere is good, the service is excellent. It's just a long wait after 9:30 so I suggest going early.

excerpts: The soft scrambled eggs were unmemorable and needed a lot of salt.
The homemade pork sausages were good -- they had a bit of heat, which I appreciated.
soft scrambled eggs.author: Michelle K.
soft scrambled eggs.review:
FINALLY went to Plow on a Sunday for brunch. Arrived around 10am and was told the wait will be 2-2.5hrs. Yikes. 

My friends and I walked over to Front Coffee to kill time and came back to Plow after about an hour. We waited another half an hour and were seated. 

The three of us ordered the "Plow" with house made pork sausages, an extra order of pork sausages, and a full order of lemon ricotta pancakes. My favorite part of the meal  were the crispy potatoes which were perfectly seasoned. I was underwhelmed by the pancakes :-\ I liked the lemon flavor, but it tasted a bit bland so I had to drown it in syrup. The texture was too gooey. The soft scrambled eggs were unmemorable and needed a lot of salt. The homemade pork sausages were good -- they had a bit of heat, which I appreciated. The cold brewed coffee was yummy. 

I probably won't be back any time soon given the underwhelming food and the unreasonable wait time.

excerpts: I had the soft scrambled eggs and it was delicious.
Not 5 stars more for the brunchy scene on the weekend.
Yes, I know every place in SF has a wait, but sometimes you just want diner scenery, a good cup of coffee, and some decent food.
I was sitting outside on the sidewalk, freezing, eating my delicious food
and--I kinda just want a bit of an easier experience for my Saturday breakfast.
But yes--it was certainly tasty.
soft scrambled eggs.author: Mel G.
soft scrambled eggs.review: This place is good. Really good. I had the soft scrambled eggs and it was delicious. Not 5 stars more for the brunchy scene on the weekend. Yes, I know every place in SF has a wait, but sometimes you just want diner scenery, a good cup of coffee, and some decent food. I was sitting outside on the sidewalk, freezing, eating my delicious food and--I kinda just want a bit of an easier experience for my Saturday breakfast. But yes--it was certainly tasty.
