excerpts: I got signature "plow" breakfast plate with their house-made sausage patties, two eggs, the ridiculous rosemary and seat salt potatoes, and of course their famous lemon ricotta pancakes.
two eggs.author: Caddy M.
two eggs.review:
Let's get this out of the way: There will be a wait....now if you don't want to wait, get your ass out of bed earlier, dude! It's not that hard, especially for a place as fantastic as this.

The food really is something special here. When I went for the first time, I was alone so I sat the counter, which gave me an opportunity to watch their skillful cooks work their magic. It is a really intimate space, and everyone on staff is really adept at working together to make the operation run smoothly, especially considering the volume of patrons they serve each day.

I got signature "plow" breakfast plate with their house-made sausage patties, two eggs, the ridiculous rosemary and seat salt potatoes, and of course their famous lemon ricotta pancakes. Everything was superb, and as I sat there enjoying my meal, I saw several other dishes being prepared that also looked to die for, so I will be back.  

and if you're feeling the need to walk off the food coma that will most certainly fall into once you are done, they are located at the base of a nice long hill that provides a great view from the top.

excerpts: The Plow (two eggs, two lemon ricotta pancakes, crispy potatoes, and side of either bacon or sausages) was delicious.
How did the potatoes stay so crispy the whole time, I will never know.
They were well seasoned too.
I expected the pancakes to be the highlight piece on my plate, as I've had them before.
Sadly, these pancakes weren't as good as I remembered when I came here last.
Yes, the sweet lemon and honey taste was there, but the flavors just wasn't as packed this time around.
The grapefruit mimosa was alright.
Nothing too special and isn't worth $10.5 a glass.
two eggs.author: Kevin S.
two eggs.review:
The plow at the plow.

No matter how early you go, the wait is at least an hour. I came with a couple friends at 9:30am on a Saturday, and we weren't seated until 10:30am. Half the times I've waited before for brunch doesn't take that much time, but the brunch game in SF is always on point. Service here was efficient and welcoming, and street parking is everywhere.

TIP: Drop your friends off to get a spot on the waitlist while you find parking.

All 3 of us ordered the Plow, and I also ordered a grapefruit mimosa along with my meal.

The Plow (two eggs, two lemon ricotta pancakes, crispy potatoes, and side of either bacon or sausages) was delicious. How did the potatoes stay so crispy the whole time, I will never know. They were well seasoned too. I expected the pancakes to be the highlight piece on my plate, as I've had them before. Sadly, these pancakes weren't as good as I remembered when I came here last. Yes, the sweet lemon and honey taste was there, but the flavors just wasn't as packed this time around. The grapefruit mimosa was alright. Nothing too special and isn't worth $10.5 a glass. I'd rather go to Radish for their unlimited grapefruit mimosas ($15/person).

I'd come back just for the pancakes.

excerpts: Based on my buddy's recommendation, I ordered their self-titled brunch speciality: two eggs any style (I went poached), house made pork sausage patties, bacon or chicken apple sausage (I went with the sausage), potatoes and two lemon ricotta pancakes.
I'm usually one to avoid lemon flavored foods, but I have to say these two flapjacks were some of the lightest, fluffiest, tastiest I've had in as long as I can remember.
The eggs were perfectly cooked, the sausage savory and hot.
The other real highlight was the potatoes, which are twice fried.
two eggs.author: Alex L.
two eggs.review:
Holy breakfast of the Gods. This place lives up to the hype. You can't find too many traditional breakfasts/brunches anymore. Pop in here and order the aptly named "Plow" breakfast and watch your world change. 

I was a little doubtful of the rave reviews. After all, this is San Francisco and many a popular spot seems to have unusually good reviews based just on how trendy it is at the time. Fortunately, I came on a Wednesday when the wait was minimal and we sat almost immediately at the bar where we could watch the chefs work. Based on my buddy's recommendation, I ordered their self-titled brunch speciality: two eggs any style (I went poached), house made pork sausage patties, bacon or chicken apple sausage (I went with the sausage), potatoes and two lemon ricotta pancakes. I'm usually one to avoid lemon flavored foods, but I have to say these two flapjacks were some of the lightest, fluffiest, tastiest I've had in as long as I can remember. The eggs were perfectly cooked, the sausage savory and hot. The other real highlight was the potatoes, which are twice fried. Throw on a little hot sauce and you're in brunch heaven. 

Some waits are worth it, others are not. I'm here to say this is a brunch worth the wait, and worth coming back for.

excerpts: I had the breakfast sandwich, which came with two eggs fried soft, cheddar, aioli, and frisee with added bacon.
two eggs.author: Philana C.
two eggs.review:
I can't believe it's taken me so long just to finally try Plow! I've definitely been missing out and will be back soon! 

We put our name down around 12PM on a Saturday and got seated at the counter within an hour. Not too bad of a wait as I had heard others had to wait almost two hours especially for a weekend! I think we got lucky. :) 

We were seated at the counter, overlooking the kitchen. Best seats in the house since we were able to watch the cooking process. :) I had the breakfast sandwich, which came with two eggs fried soft, cheddar, aioli, and frisee with added bacon. It also came with the plow potatoes on the side. The breakfast sandwich was amazingly delicious! Very filling and not too heavy! Eggs were cooked perfectly and the bacon added a nice crisp to the sandwich. The potatoes were cooked to perfection. It had a rosemary kind of flavor. Crispy on the outside. Very delicious. I also got to try the lemon ricotta pancake. Oh man, that was soo good! Fluffy and light with a hint of lemon flavor. Loved how the lemon flavor wasn't too overwhelming. Definitely a must order! Everything that I tried was five stars and definitely want me coming back for more. :)

excerpts: The Plow the restaurant's go-to: two eggs, choice of meat, in this case chicken apple sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes, and plow potatoes.
Nice snappy sausage with full flavor, the potatoes again were crispy and soft at the same time, but the pancakes def stole the show.
two eggs.author: Jurem F.
two eggs.review:
If there is any restaurant that can serve as the example for all other restaurants to follow, it's Plow. Yes this place is a fabulous place to get breakfast/brunch, but what amazed me is the service. My wife and I didnt have many needs this afternoon, but our server Andrea got to us quickly and super efficiently, never skipping a beat with greeting us, taking our orders, running our food, and dropping the check. Thanks so much!

But the true unsung hero is the guy without a name on a receipt. You can tell this guy has been here for a long time because of how efficient he is, with clearing plates, setting up tables, seating guests from the waitlist, polishing silverware, and even with the breakdown of the outside patio seating. This dude completely blew me away with how every move he made was calculated and done very swiftly. I wish he worked for me!



ON TO THE FOOD. Mimosas, both grapefruit and OG, were served in wine glasses, which was greatly appreciated lol. I got the breakfast sandwich with bacon and my wife got the Plow with chicken apple sausage. 

The breakfast sandwich is your traditional egg sandwich with frisee, cheddar, and aioli. Done perfect and just what I was looking for. The yolks were runny, which is just bliss, the potatoes were crispy on the outside and soft on the inside, and the acme bun was soft and tasteful. 

The Plow the restaurant's go-to: two eggs, choice of meat, in this case chicken apple sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes, and plow potatoes. Nice snappy sausage with full flavor, the potatoes again were crispy and soft at the same time, but the pancakes def stole the show. You NEED THESE in your life!

BOOKMARKED. WILL RETURN FOR MOAR.

two eggs.author: Anthony N.
two eggs.review:
***This neighborhood breakfast spot utilizes high quality ingredients and a well-run kitchen to churn out delicious and satisfying breakfast and brunch dishes***

Plow is located in Dogpatch, an up-and-coming neighborhood that will probably introduce several more destination restaurants in the next few years.  Plow is a weekday and weekend breakfast and brunch eatery.  The restaurant is small and casual though the décor is nicely done featuring homey but still contemporary notes.  The counter is nice and provides an excellent view of the short order counter where the team of chefs here efficiently crank out breakfast dishes like a well-run greasy spoon.

The food at Plow is not greasy spoon staples though.  You will see more upscale ingredients here like prosciutto and frisee as well as some great looking bread from a prestigious San Francisco bakery.  I had The Plow, which is their signature breakfast plate.  It is a hearty plate featuring two eggs, crispy fried potatoes with onions, choice of meat (chicken apple sausage, pork sausage patties or bacon), and two lemon ricotta pancakes.

With the exception of the lemon ricotta pancakes, this breakfast veered more towards fairly classic interpretations.  I had the eggs sunny side up, and they were quite good.  I would have liked the egg yolk a little less done, but the flavor was great.  The crispy potatoes were quite delicious.  The caramelized onions provided a mild sweet flavor while the potatoes combined a satisfying crispy exterior with a hot and soft center.  I also had their bacon, which was Nueske's bacon, a popular Midwestern bacon from Wisconsin.  The bacon had a smoky flavor as well as an appetizing pork flavor from the crispy fat.

The bacon was not as thick as Niman Ranch bacon, but the flavor was definitely memorable.  I also ordered their pork sausage patties, and these were good though I probably did prefer the bacon.  The center of the sausage was moist while the outside was well seared and crispy.  They get a little more adventurous with the seasoning so you get more herb and fennel notes with their sausage than you would experience at most breakfast spots.

The kitchen gussied up the pancakes a little more than they did with the other breakfast items in The Plow.  The pancakes featured both lemon and ricotta.  The lemon was nice.  It provided a noticeable lemon flavor as well as a lot of freshness.  I felt though that the ricotta probably hurt the pancake more than it helped it.  The pancakes had a great color and the smell of the pancake was very inviting.  Unfortunately, the pancake could have been sweeter.  The center was also a tad on the dry side and did not have that light and fluffy cake-like texture you would expect in an excellent pancake.

Service was fairly quick given how busy this restaurant gets (even on weekdays).  Prices are higher than your standard breakfast spot, but the ingredients at Plow are definitely high quality and the portions are surprisingly generous.

I enjoyed The Plow at Plow though I felt the savory items were far superior to the disappointing lemon ricotta pancakes.  Part of me really loved the breakfast here, and, in some ways, Plow would rival my favorite breakfast restaurants--Matt's Big Breakfast in Phoenix or Huckleberry in Santa Monica, which features an excellent fried egg sandwich with bacon.  I would definitely go back and give Plow's other dishes a shot.  If you are a big breakfast fan, Plow is a must visit if you live in San Francisco or are just visiting.

I believe free street parking is available in the nearby residential area though parking spaces are probably hard to find around here.

two eggs.author: Joyce Z.
two eggs.review:
With my Yelp bookmarks on the rise due to Ben F.'s food pictures, I knew I wanted to knock a few off during the Memorial Day weekend.  After a quick stop at Neighbor Bakehouse beforehand, we headed over to Plow.  We arrived about 10 minutes before opening to already a long line so still had to wait an additional 40 min after opening to secure a table.  We were flexible with either inside or outside tables to cut the wait time so I was a bit confused when two parties of 2 after us in line got seated inside before us.  

We got one of the outside tables that they start opening up at 8:30 and although it was a bit chilly, they provide blankets to keep you warm or to use as a backrest if you happen to be leaning back on an incline.  Per Ben's recommendation, we knew we had to get the Plow and if I did not just buy 7 pastries from Neighbor, we would have both gotten the Plow.  Lemon ricotta pancakes, potatoes, pork sausage and two eggs anyway you like (we like poached), it is brunch heaven on a plate.  For our second order, we decided to go for a full order of lemon ricotta pancakes with blueberry compote and Vermont maple syrup.  If you order just pancakes, they are larger and thicker than the ones that comes with the Plow and comes with an order of 3.  At first bite, it tastes fluffy and light but as time goes by, you realize it is also decadent because of the ricotta with the hint of lemon lending a brightness to it.  

If I lived in the city and could get here even earlier without having to get up at 6AM, you would see me here more often so if this is Ben's way of getting us to move to SF, it may just be working!  Seriously though, although it is not foreign to me to wait in line for good food my limit would still be an hour.  However, if you don't mind waiting longer, I suggest swinging by Neighbor Bakehouse beforehand and get a pastry to stave off your hunger while you watch all the good food paraded past you while you wait.

****5 stars*****- We decided to share the Plow so we could try a bunch of the stuff they offered.

two eggs.author: Rachael S.
two eggs.review:
Absolute favorite brunch spot of all time - SF or anywhere.  Yes, there's a lot of hype...yes, there will be a wait...yes, there will probably be several tourists trying out the spot.  Typically, this will sway me away from any place, but after seeing all the pictures, reading all the reviews, and also hearing from several of my SF friends how delicious it was, I ponied up and decided to make my way there.  

My husband and I opted to try it out over the 4th of July weekend on a Friday mid-day, hoping to avoid the Saturday/Sunday brunch crowd.  We just prepared ourselves for a long wait - we ended up getting there around 12:30PM or so, and I think we waited for about an hour, which isn't bad.  My husband grabbed a beer as we waited, and I popped in to one of the boutique stores just up the block to browse/bum time.

When I was browsing at the store, I asked the store owner what she recommended at Plow.  She started off by highly recommending the "Plow" plate to get a sampling of all their stuff, said to ("whatever you do") get the baked good of the day if they aren't sold out, and then proceeded to pretty much list off every item they offered.  Pretty much, I knew right then and there that Plow would be a repeat brunch spot ;)

Everything we tried was excellent - every item blew my mind.  You can tell that every ingredient they use is high quality, in season, and fresh.  The eggs, for example - the yolks are bright orange, and whites so fluffy.  I learned that they buy their eggs from a local organic egg farmer in Napa - always delivered fresh.  

While we wanted to try everything on the menu, we tried:

The Plow (two lemon ricotta pancakes, two eggs any style, choice of pork sausage/chicken sausage/bacon, crispy potatoes) *****5 stars*****- We decided to share the Plow so we could try a bunch of the stuff they offered.  We selected the pork sausage per recommendation of the waitress and poached eggs.  I can't even pick which item was my favorite - everything was so perfectly done and went so well together. The perfect amount of savory and sweet.  The crispy potatoes were the best I've ever had - crisp on the outside and soft in the inside, and piping hot from the fryer.  The lemon ricotta pancakes were the BEST pancakes ever, ever, ever, ever.  I will be getting these (at least as a "side") every single time.  Holy crap, so good.

Banana Bread - *****4.5 stars***** One of the "baked goods of the day" - We thought it would be a bit much with everything else we were ordering, but since we received the recommendation to order "whatever baked good they are offering" we decided to go ahead.  We figured, "well we can bring any left overs home."  Uhhhh, let's just say, there were no leftovers.  SO delicious; came out warm, had a crispy crust of sugar coating the top, had chunks of gooey bananas throughout, and buttery flavor.  Mmmm...

Little Gem Salad - *****5 stars ****** To balance out some of the savory of our meal, I decided to order a little gem salad.  I was expecting nothing special, but even the salad surprised me!  The dressing was amazing; fresh and tasty.  All ingredients were fresh, seasonal, and balanced everything nicely.  I wish I could get this salad for lunch every day!

Bubbles/Beer - We also opted to make it a true brunch and ordered some adult beverages.  Decent selection of beers and wine.  If a cup of joe is more your cup of tea ;) - I heard that their coffee (even their decaf) is excellent.

Overall - this place is brunch/lunch perfection.  I am SO happy we're a quick walk to this place.  We will DEFINITELY be back many, many, more times.  Definitely, definitely, definitely a must-go....

It's true. The lemon ricotta pancakes are heavenly. Came here on a Monday morning around 8am and it was already packed! The servers were pretty quick about clearing tables and moving the line so we were seated pretty quickly. The sausage was seasoned perfectly and my over easy eggs were pleasingly runny. But the real star was the pancakes. How they make it so fluffy and light I will never know. They had a super strong lemon flavor. So, if you don't like lemon, don't order. But how could you not? 

I would definitely go back to try the other items on the menu. The plum ricotta pancake seemed interesting. If you're a first timer, you really can't go wrong with "the plow" because the dish includes everything that you would want to try as a first timer.

excerpts: For $16 you get a nice sampling of two lemon ricotta pancakes, two eggs, a mound of heavenly potatoes, and your choice of bacon, or pork or chicken apple sausage.
two eggs.author: Deanna Y.
two eggs.review:
Plow's crispy rosemary potatoes are pure potato perfection! I know it sounds silly that potatoes, of all things, are what keep me coming back, but after you try them, you'll understand that these are not ordinary spuds. These little bites of heaven must be double-fried because they have the most delightful crispy edges that go into all the nooks and crevices. They're perfectly salted and seasoned with fragrant rosemary. Hands down, the BEST brunch potatoes in the city!

Of course the potatoes aren't the only selling point for me. The popular lemon ricotta pancakes have a refreshingly light kick from the zest and are balanced out by the creamier texture of the ricotta cheese. They're definitely on the denser side, so if you're a fluffy pancake fan, these may not be for you.

They have a relatively small, but well-rounded menu that contains favorites such as the fried egg sandwich, smoked salmon eggs benedict, and corned beef hash. If it's your first time here, or for me the first 3 times, "The Plow" is the way to go! For $16 you get a nice sampling of two lemon ricotta pancakes, two eggs, a mound of heavenly potatoes, and your choice of bacon, or pork or chicken apple sausage.

They unexpectedly play throwback 90's R&B music all the time and I like the feel of their open kitchen and large glass windows that let in lots of natural light to help brighten your brunchy morning. The service is pretty average here. You're lucky if you get checked on once since they're busy running around all the time. They give you a pitcher of water though so refills are no problem. 

Expect an average wait of 1.5 hours, but if you're willing to wait until the early afternoon, you can arrive at 1:30 and only wait about a half hour since they stop taking names at 2pm. They can't accommodate parties of 6 or more due to their small size and they don't take reservations. Benches and a beautiful view of Mission Bay are available while you wait and parking isn't too bad. Plow continues to be one of my top brunch spots in the city. They are definitely worth a try!

two eggs.author: Aimee I.
two eggs.review:
If it's a Sunday, GO EARLY!!

My parents and I arrived 30 minutes before doors opened and there was already a line of 8 people! By 759AM, there were more than 2 dozen people in line!! That's crazy for a Sunday morning. As soon as the doors opened at 8AM, we were greeted and went straight to the counter. (We always enjoy sitting at the counter to watch the chefs. The chefs get into a rhythm which is a joy to watch. Each station is so different and they're masters of it!!)

As for the food, it was above average. To be honest, in the past the food was a bit better. Whenever we go, at least one of us with get The Plow which is amaaaaazing. (It comes with two eggs, two pancakes, your choice of house-made pork sausage, bacon, or chicken sausage, and Plow potatoes.) This time we got The Plow and it was just okay. The potatoes weren't really seasoned, the pancakes were gummy and the eggs were over-easy when I requested for sunny-side up. The best part of the meal was the house-made pork sausage. It had some spiciness to it, which was great. My mom ordered the Smoked Trout Salad and my dad ordered the Corned Beef Hash and Eggs. My mom's salad was lightly dressed with a vinaigrette, large chunks of smoked trout, avocado, and a poached egg on the side. It was tasty. My dad's corned beef hash was decent. We've had better at Sally's Dinner on the corner of 16th and De Haro. Both are homemade, but the one from Sally's has a better texture. The one from Plow was crunchy where it was hard and not as flavorful as the one from Sally's.
 
The service was great as always. They're personable and attentive to the customers. Every so often we catch a glance of them checking their phones and chatting, but it feels like a norm in the restaurant industry. Whenever we needed their attention, they gave us their undivided attention which is what matters anyway.

I am not a pancake person at all, but the lemon ricotta pancakes were definitely the highlight for me!
Crisp on the outside, but perfectly fluffy on the interior - the lemon flavor was absolutely delightful.
I don't remember the last time I enjoyed a pancake.
The potatoes were also excellent - super crispy and filled with rosemary flavor.
The pork sausages were juicy, but not super greasy -
two eggs.author: Samantha G.
two eggs.review:
I have been wanting to try this place for years and the food definitely lives up to the hype. I ended up getting their specialty, "The Plow" - two eggs, choice of bacon or handmade sausage (pork or apple chicken), potatoes and lemon ricotta pancakes. I opted for sunny side up eggs and the pork sausage. I am not a pancake person at all, but the lemon ricotta pancakes were definitely the highlight for me! Crisp on the outside, but perfectly fluffy on the interior - the lemon flavor was absolutely delightful. I don't remember the last time I enjoyed a pancake. The potatoes were also excellent - super crispy and filled with rosemary flavor. The pork sausages were juicy, but not super greasy - I thought the flavor was great. 

Plow takes the classic breakfast and adds their own twist to make it their own. I've never had a breakfast / brunch quite like this one, which is why Plow is always so busy. They know how to do breakfast right! 

I knocked off a star because of the wait time. I wish the hostess would have been more upfront with how long the wait was. I showed up at around 9:40am and was told my wait time would be 45 minutes to 1 hour, but ended up waiting 2 long hours. Since I was told 45 to an hour I didn't think the wait time was bad at all, since most brunch places in SF have similar wait times. Had I known up front that the wait was going to be 2 hours I probably would have gone someplace else. 

With that being said, I am glad I stuck it out and finally got to eat here - Plow is DEFINITELY worth the hype. This place is pure breakfast perfection and people come swarming here for a reason! Just know that it will take 2 hours. I definitely got a bit hangery towards the end of the wait, so I would definitely recommend a snack.

excerpts: Food: I ordered The Plow  (two eggs, choice of house made pork sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes + crispy potatoes).
Delicious.
The pancakes were amazing and I love that the breakfast potatoes are crispy!
The house made pork sausage was just okay
and I think I would opt for bacon if I were to order the same dish again.
My bf's fried egg sandwich was pretty legit.
two eggs.author: Leana L.
two eggs.review:
Oh my. Probably one of my favorite brunch places in town. We walked in on a random weekday morning a little before 9AM and were met with a wait time of about 30-45 minutes. Considering the last time we tried to eat here, the wait time was over an hour, we decided to grab some coffees at the front and sit it out on the little ledge protruding from the side of the building.

Ambiance: Your typical SF brunch spot. Bustling place with small tables and a lively crowd.

Service: Our waitress was excellent and everyone else was really nice, too! Even though it's a busy place, we didn't feel rushed at all.

Drinks: We grabbed coffees up front and they just added it to our bill after we actually ate. They refilled us at the table, of course, though.

Food: I ordered The Plow  (two eggs, choice of house made pork sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes + crispy potatoes). Delicious. The pancakes were amazing and I love that the breakfast potatoes are crispy! The house made pork sausage was just okay and I think I would opt for bacon if I were to order the same dish again. My bf's fried egg sandwich was pretty legit. So filling and so worth it.

Cost: Not too bad for an SF brunch spot!

Would I return? Yup!

A great spot for brunch. I can't wait to go back!!!!

Other than that I'm a fan!

excerpts: The Plow which comes with two eggs (over medium for me), potatoes (which are REALLY good, by the way), two lemon ricotta pancakes (which are amazing!) and a choice of their housemade sausages or bacon ($16.50).
My friend got the salmon benedict ($18)with potatoes, and we shared two pieces of their french toast with carmelized apples and mascarpone ($11.50)
Fluffy, I have to admit!
I would come back for their lemon ricotta pancakes for sure!
Their brunch is a little on the pricey side of things, but it's worth trying.
I pretty much stayed full for the rest of my day.
two eggs.author: Kathleen S.
two eggs.review:
Lately my best friend and I have been on a brunch craze and I've been wanting to try this place. We finally did!

I have known this place to be somewhere with a good hour or so wait especially on weekends. A popular thing people seem to do is put their name on the waitlist, and then wander off in the neighborhood for some coffee or pre-brunch snack. We waited about an hour and a half for a table inside. Due to high demand, it's possible you will be seated at a "community" table. Make friends with strangers, woohoo!

Now onto the food, it seems they change their menu based on what's available during the season and what is popular. I got The Plow which comes with two eggs (over medium for me), potatoes (which are REALLY good, by the way), two lemon ricotta pancakes (which are amazing!) and a choice of their housemade sausages or bacon ($16.50). My friend got the salmon benedict ($18)with potatoes, and we shared two pieces of their french toast with carmelized apples and mascarpone ($11.50) Fluffy, I have to admit! All in all, the food is delicious and filling. 

I would come back for their lemon ricotta pancakes for sure! Their brunch is a little on the pricey side of things, but it's worth trying. I pretty much stayed full for the rest of my day.

excerpts: You get two eggs, crispy potatoes, chicken sausage, & lemon ricotta pancakes.
The potatoes are so good!
Perfectly crisp and seasoned with salt and rosemary.
It went well with the runny egg yolks and chicken sausage.
But I was surprised at the lemon ricotta pancakes.
I'm usually not a lemon-flavored pastry type of person but the pancakes were so fluffy from the ricotta and refreshing and light from the lemon.
two eggs.author: Ralph N.
two eggs.review:
Plow has been on my "bookmarked" list for quite some time. I've been wanting to go here for so long but I always end up backing out due to the long line. But there's something so catchy about Plow that further ignited my curiosity. Number one...long lines. Number two...great reviews. And number three...the pictures on Yelp look amazing!

Finally I was able to pay a visit with a few friends from SoCal after picking them up from a 7am bus ride from LA. Since we were there around 7:30am, we were seated very quickly. It wasn't empty...but wasn't packed either.

Ambience: Very relaxed. It's like waking up and stepping into a friend's kitchen while being strikened with a whiff of bacon and eggs cooking in the background. It's not huge but just right. I love how the tables are wooden...it provides the perfect touch to my pics for Instagram and Yelp lol.

Food: So many choices to choose from! I wanna try the Corned Beef Hash, the Egg Sandwich, and the Crab Scramble on my next visit.  But for starters, I had to get "The Plow". What a huge serving! You get two eggs, crispy potatoes, chicken sausage, & lemon ricotta pancakes. The potatoes are so good! Perfectly crisp and seasoned with salt and rosemary. It went well with the runny egg yolks and chicken sausage. But I was surprised at the lemon ricotta pancakes. I'm usually not a lemon-flavored pastry type of person but the pancakes were so fluffy from the ricotta and refreshing and light from the lemon. I think they used just the lemon zest because they seemed perfumed with a lemon essence that I fell in love with.

Overall Plow is a great place for breakfast. It's a little small so it's intended for smaller groups. Parking isn't too bad either...primarily residential parking spots. Just be patient and you'll eventually find one. I'll admit it's not the cheapest breakfast spot but it's totally worth every penny. I can't wait for my next visit.

excerpts: Both my friend and I ordered the plow which consisted of a choice of meat, 2 lemon ricotta pancakes, two eggs, and crispy potatoes.
Let me just say, the wait is totally worth it.
My friend and I felt indifferent about the meat (she got the chicken apple sausage
and I got the homemade pork sausage).
I thought the sausage was kind of dry and was over it because everything else on the plate shined brighter.
The pancakes are sooo good.
They are cakey and moist, and just heavenly.
The potatoes, were some of the best potatoes I have ever had.
They were super crispy and seasoned well.
I recommend getting the crispy potatoes and lemon ricotta pancakes; they are just out of this world!
I recommend getting the crispy potatoes and lemon ricotta pancakes; they are just out of this world!
two eggs.author: Vivian Y.
two eggs.review:
I have been waiting to try Plow out because of it's ratings and reviews here on Yelp, and the fact that I have seen the name in numerous sources. Came to Plow on a saturday morning with my friend. We decided to brunch and catch up before she headed back to school. We waited a good 2 hours before we were finally seated, so either bring something to do, or get ready for some good conversations with your group. 

Ambiance/ Appearance:
Plow is located in Potrero Hill and it felt very hipster and homey. Plow is on the corner, which is a good thing because it needs all the waiting area space it can provide. There is a few tables of outdoor seating on the side of the restaurant. Inside, there aren't too many tables, so most likely you will have to share with others. There was a slight rustic feel inside, but it felt very lively because of the music and background conversations. 

Service:
The service is excellent. Servers and staff are super nice and made sure you felt comfortable.

Taste: 
Both my friend and I ordered the plow which consisted of a choice of meat, 2 lemon ricotta pancakes, two eggs, and crispy potatoes. Let me just say, the wait is totally worth it. My friend and I felt indifferent about the meat (she got the chicken apple sausage and I got the homemade pork sausage). I thought the sausage was kind of dry and was over it because everything else on the plate shined brighter. The pancakes are sooo good. They are cakey and moist, and just heavenly. The potatoes, were some of the best potatoes I have ever had. They were super crispy and seasoned well. It had some shallots or onions and other herbs. 

With tax and tip, I think it came out to $20. Overall the food was bomb dot com! I would totally return again (but probably not on a weekend or at later times in the day to avoid the wait). Even with the wait, it is totally worth trying out. I recommend getting the crispy potatoes and lemon ricotta pancakes; they are just out of this world!

excerpts: I had 'the plow' that came with two eggs, potatoes, lemon ricotta pancakes and bacon.
At first, they didn't look too different from other brunch place, but were x100 tastier!!
The eggs were soft but perfectly cooked, and potatoes were well-seasoned and very crispy.
I probably could have had 5 more pancakes.
two eggs.author: Julia C.
two eggs.review:
While I was visiting San Francisco late weekend, my friend took me here for brunch. Thanks to my friend who put her name on a wait list a couple of hours ahead, we were able to sit almost right after we showed up. 

I had 'the plow' that came with two eggs, potatoes, lemon ricotta pancakes and bacon. At first, they didn't look too different from other brunch place, but were x100 tastier!! The eggs were soft but perfectly cooked, and potatoes were well-seasoned and very crispy. I probably could have had 5 more pancakes. Lol. 

Our server was super friendly and attentive as well. Strongly recommended!

excerpts: It's two eggs, choice of house made pork sausage, nueske bacon, or chicken apple sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes, crispy potatoes
and it comes out
all photo shoot ready for your Instagram shot
I loved everything on my plate and it was one of the best brunches I've ever had but
definitely the lemon ricotta pancakes get a shout out.
I'll be back for sure!!
two eggs.author: Jingxi Z.
two eggs.review:
Ugh, the hype here is as real as it gets. Came for an early afternoon brunch on Sunday and because we came in so late, the wait was only around 15 minutes! Although I have heard nightmare tales about the wait here at peak hours so definitely try and come either really early or really late like us haha.

My friend and I both ordered The Plow, which I feel like everyone gets here haha, but for good reason! It's two eggs, choice of house made pork sausage, nueske bacon, or chicken apple sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes, crispy potatoes and it comes out all photo shoot ready for your Instagram shot :) I loved everything on my plate and it was one of the best brunches I've ever had but definitely the lemon ricotta pancakes get a shout out. I'll be back for sure!!

excerpts: I recommend "The Plow" -- two lemon ricotta pancakes, crispy potatoes, two eggs (any style), and a choice of bacon, house pork sausage, or chicken apple sausage.
This dish is huge, very satisfying, and has variety.
two eggs.author: Priscilla W.
two eggs.review:
Three words: lemon ricotta pancakes!

They're delicious. They're lemony without tasting like dishwash detergent and the ricotta isn't too heavy. They're dense and fluffy at the same time, with a mousse-like consistency. And they're good enough on their own that the side of pure maple syrup, served in the most adorable little dispenser, isn't necessary. I'm not a big fan of pancakes, yet I'd be willing to order a full serving of these amazing lemon ricotta pancakes next time!

I also love Plow's crispy potatoes. Every time I'm given a choice between side salad or side potatoes, I always opt for salad to be "healthier". Plow only offers potatoes. But I'm glad that's my only option or else I'd feel more guilty for not eating my veggies. The potatoes are so crispy! They're packed with flavor and I love the generous amount of dried rosemary used to season these carb-loaded tubers.

I recommend "The Plow" -- two lemon ricotta pancakes, crispy potatoes, two eggs (any style), and a choice of bacon, house pork sausage, or chicken apple sausage. This dish is huge, very satisfying, and has variety. You'll unbuckle your belt and roll down the hill after you've devoured everything and licked the plate clean.

The Eggs Benedict with smoked salmon is also tasty. The muffins are too thick and too large, proportionally, compared to the salmon and eggs. The salmon is salty and flavorful, and it pairs nicely with the beautifully poached, ooey-gooey runny eggs. 

Our host was extremely friendly and our waitress was nice, but service was poorly timed. It took a few minutes before we got our water and for her to take our orders. We arrived at 1PM on a Saturday and were seated outside within 30 minutes (inside would've taken at least another 10 minutes). Plow is on a hill with a slight incline, so it felt a little awkward eating on slanted tables outside. Therefore, I recommend dining inside. And I can't believe I'm saying this, but parking is VERY easy in this neighborhood. I will definitely be back!

excerpts: Two eggs

+:
We ate scrambled eggs that it was perfectly my favorite texture.
The muffin is crispy outside, chewy on the inside.
two eggs.author: Hiromi S.
two eggs.review:
This restaurant is located in Potrero Hill of San Francisco. 

I and my husband have tried several times to have for brunch on weekends.
There are always a long lines, so that we gave up every time.
We retried at 8:15 in the morning on Thursday.
Fortunately, we can sit down without any line!
  
The atmosphere in the restaurant makes me comfortable and cheer up.
The service is great who everyone is friendly and kind.

We ordered two dishes with two cup of coffee.

(Rating: +++ is perfect)
Lemon Ricotta Pancakes + + +: 
Pancakes were a little crispy outside, fluffy and airy on the inside. I felt a flavor of lemon.
This pancake I ate is the best in I have ever had in my life.

Two eggs +++:
We ate scrambled eggs that it was perfectly my favorite texture. The muffin is crispy outside, chewy on the inside. The crispy potatoes felt a flavor of rosemary.
 Chicken apple sausage of house made is unique taste and made me cheer up.  

How well organized everything!

excerpts: My favorites include "The Plow": two eggs, two lemon ricotta pancakes, their DELICIOUS potatoes, and choice of bacon, chicken apple sausage, or pork sausage.
two eggs.author: Tomas K.
two eggs.review:
One of my favorite breakfast places in SF, Plow serves delicious and reasonably priced traditional American breakfast in Portrero Hill. Bacon, eggs, pancakes, sausage, potatoes, and toast thrive here on a raw yet refined menu featuring all of the classics and then some. 

What makes the Plow different and "better" than other traditional breakfast joints is the high quality of their ingredients. The eggs, produce, dairy, breads, and meats served at Plow are sourced carefully and their superiority to the cheaper ingredients used by other restaurants is apparent both visually and in taste. 

The restaurant is small inside although they do offer additional outdoor seating. The interior decorum is clean and modern with stainless steel bar and stool seating at the kitchen counter as well as table and chair seating in the dining room.

My favorites include "The Plow": two eggs, two lemon ricotta pancakes, their DELICIOUS potatoes, and choice of bacon, chicken apple sausage, or pork sausage. I order "The Plow" when I am very hungry as this is a VERY filling breakfast. When I am a little less hungry I order the "open-faced proscuitto + gruyere sandwich" which is basically a piece of brioche toasted and topped with a garlic fried egg, gruyere cheese, prosciutto, frisee, parsley, and chili flakes. This also comes with a small side of their DELICIOUS (I'll say it again) potatoes. 

By the way, did I mention the breakfast potatoes here are DELICIOUS? You've got to try them.

excerpts: The Plow is a giant dish of potatoes, two eggs, meat, and lemon ricotta pancakes.

Potatoes- really dang good potatoes, well-seasoned and very tasty
House-made pork sausage- meh, kind of dry and bland
Eggs-
it's eggs
Lemon ricotta pancakes- meh
, I'm not sure why everyone loves lemon ricotta pancakes.
I've had them at some other places, and every time, they don't really do much for me.
two eggs.author: Alice T.
two eggs.review:
Sorry, Plow... I like you, but I'm just not blown away.

My friend and I agreed that we wouldn't wait more than 30 minutes to eat here. Luckily, she got there right as they opened so we were seated pretty quickly. I've walked past Plow around prime brunch times (10-2pm), and there's always tons of groups waiting outside.

The service was awesome and very attentive. The food was good and fresh. The restaurant is super cute and makes a perfect brunch spot. So why only 4 stars? I just didn't feel like any of the dishes were really unique or amazing. Don't get me wrong- everything was executed perfectly, and I definitely appreciate that what they do, they do really well. I was just expecting.... more?

As recommended by all the reviewers, I got the Plow. The Plow is a giant dish of potatoes, two eggs, meat, and lemon ricotta pancakes. 
Potatoes- really dang good potatoes, well-seasoned and very tasty
House-made pork sausage- meh, kind of dry and bland
Eggs- it's eggs
Lemon ricotta pancakes- meh, I'm not sure why everyone loves lemon ricotta pancakes. I've had them at some other places, and every time, they don't really do much for me. You can taste the lemon, but the ricotta always seems to dull the pancakes.

My friend had the benedict, which was very tasty, but I've never said no to a benedict. We also shared the chocolate chip walnut cake, which tasted as good as it looked. Overall, I'm glad I tried Plow. I'm just not sure I would want to go at 8am or wait two hours to eat there again.

excerpts:
I opted for "The Plow" which came with two eggs, your choice of meat (I went for the chicken apple sausage, yum!), some AMAZING POTATOES, and two really really yummy lemon ricotta pancakes!!!

I have zero regrets getting the plow because it was just that good!!!
two eggs.author: Kary Y.
two eggs.review:
Being raised the city has really raised my standards for good brunch places. But I really think if you're in the mood for some hearty brunch, Plow is the place to go.

My boyfriend and I arrived on a Friday afternoon at around 12PM. We waited around an hour and 10 minutes to get seated outside. The overall feel of plow is rustic and really clean. I love the wooden tables that had some amazing hot sauce!!!

I opted for "The Plow" which came with two eggs, your choice of meat (I went for the chicken apple sausage, yum!), some AMAZING POTATOES, and two really really yummy lemon ricotta pancakes!!!

I have zero regrets getting the plow because it was just that good!!!

On the other hand, my boyfriend didn't really enjoy the fried egg sandwich as much as he hoped he would. He said it lacked a bit of flavor even adding avocados in it, but the house potatoes were perfection!

excerpts: Food: I tried The Plow, which comes with two eggs, mini lemon ricotta pancakes, house made potatoes, and your choose of sausage, sausage patties, or bacon.
The eggs and the house made potatoes, which were in bite sized pieces, we're perfectly cooked!
The potatoes were nice and crispy.
Don't bother with their bacon here.
Unless you like the thin, cheap cuts of bacon that's burnt.
The lemon ricotta pancakes were the clear stars!
two eggs.author: Kay A.
two eggs.review:
3.5 stars. 
Pretty good breakfast place! 

Tips: 

-Menu changes daily, so what you want might not be there. Benedict and strawberry French toast wasn't available on the day I went. 

-Be prepared to wait. We had a 45 minute wait for just two people. 

-you might possibly have to share a table with another party. This place is pretty small, and they've tried to seat more people than they should. 

Food: I tried The Plow, which comes with two eggs, mini lemon ricotta pancakes, house made potatoes, and your choose of sausage, sausage patties, or bacon. 
The eggs and the house made potatoes, which were in bite sized pieces, we're perfectly cooked! The potatoes were nice and crispy.  Don't bother with their bacon here. Unless you like the thin, cheap cuts of bacon that's burnt. The lemon ricotta pancakes were the clear stars! Tasted out of this world!  


The reason I knocked this place down a star is because their waitresses were very pushy and seemed to be rushing us. Also didn't like the fact that the place was really crowded! Like elbow to elbow with the party next to us.

excerpts: I got the fried egg sandwich, constructed with two eggs, aioli, frisee, cheddar on an Acme bun.
two eggs.author: Bailey Z.
two eggs.review:
I am not easily impressed by overpriced brunch spots, but today I was an exception. It's funny that everyone emphasizes organic and locally-sourced ingredients these days. Eating organic isn't enough anymore, but you now must do society and your community a service by supporting local farms, etc. I hate it for the most part only because it usually means pricier bills for mediocre food. Plow keeps their menu simple, but they do it well.

I got the fried egg sandwich, constructed with two eggs, aioli, frisee, cheddar on an Acme bun. Pay the extra couple bucks for the Nueske bacon; you will not regret it. The sandwich was the perfect answer for breakfast. The bun was soft and airy, and the combination of melted cheese, fried eggs, and crispy bacon was heavenly. The crispy potatoes on the side were amazing. The best thing on the menu is the lemon ricotta pancakes. The texture was softer and crumblier than a normal pancake and the flavor was outstanding. It was probably one of the best pancakes I've ever had. 

Overall, I loved the breakfast here. The prices weren't cheap ($13 for the breakfast sandwich and $15 for the plow). I wouldn't normally pay this much for breakfast, but if it's done right, it's hard to pass up.

excerpts: The Plow is brunchy bliss comprised of two eggs, your choice of house made pork sausage, Nueske bacon, or chicken apple sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes and crispy potatoes.
I went for the house made pork sausage but was able to steal a chicken sausage link off my buddy's plate -
both were awesome!
Nine times out of ten I'll order anything but pancakes but seeing as these were part of the "package deal" I approached with not only an open mind, but also an open mouth.
I was told that the lemon ricotta pancakes "are a make or break item" leaving you loving or conflicted on the breakfast.
Truth be told, they were a big win in my book but the true star of the show were the crispy potatoes.
Kissed with a hint of rosemary and crisped to the point that they're crunchy, but not overcooked or burnt.
two eggs.author: Brad B.
two eggs.review:
I was given strict instructions when I went to Plow. They were short and simple, but were sure to provide me an experience that could not be flawed.

1. Don't look at the menu
2. Order "The Plow"

Easy enough right? Right! I did as I was told and had an exceptional breakfast, which admittedly was a little out of my wheelhouse, (not a huge breakfast fan), and resulted in the plate basically being licked clean. 

The Plow is brunchy bliss comprised of two eggs, your choice of house made pork sausage, Nueske bacon, or chicken apple sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes and crispy potatoes. I went for the house made pork sausage but was able to steal a chicken sausage link off my buddy's plate - both were awesome! Nine times out of ten I'll order anything but pancakes but seeing as these were part of the "package deal" I approached with not only an open mind, but also an open mouth. I was told that the lemon ricotta pancakes "are a make or break item" leaving you loving or conflicted on the breakfast. Truth be told, they were a big win in my book but the true star of the show were the crispy potatoes. Kissed with a hint of rosemary and crisped to the point that they're crunchy, but not overcooked or burnt. Be sure to ask for a bottle of hot sauce if you want to take them to another level and wash it all down with a cold glass of orange juice. 

Thanks Plow!

excerpts: The Plow - two lemon ricotta pancakes, two housemade sausages, two eggs and the crispy potatoes.
The pancakes were really amazing.
The lemon wasn't too strong and the flavor combined with the Vermont syrup was perfect together.
The sausages have a little kick to them.
I'm not a spicy eater
so these were just the right amount combined with the savory flavor or the pork.
The crispy potatoes were also just good, very good.
I'm not sure how they get them so fried and crispy like that.
Shirred Eggs - also a must get, two eggs in a tomato based concoction where the tomato doesn't overpower the dish and combines with the egg to produce a very smooth flavor.
two eggs.author: Ander C.
two eggs.review:
This place was really good. I came in on a weekday morning and there was still a line, albeit not very long, but it was surprised to see this place packed.

The Plow - two lemon ricotta pancakes, two housemade sausages, two eggs and the crispy potatoes. The pancakes were really amazing. The lemon wasn't too strong and the flavor combined with the Vermont syrup was perfect together. The sausages have a little kick to them. I'm not a spicy eater so these were just the right amount combined with the savory flavor or the pork. The crispy potatoes were also just good, very good. I'm not sure how they get them so fried and crispy like that. I was nibbling down to the very last little bit on those.

Shirred Eggs - also a must get, two eggs in a tomato based concoction where the tomato doesn't overpower the dish and combines with the egg to produce a very smooth flavor. It's limited due to the fact they serve it in a hot dish so get this if you can.

Overall it was really good place for brunch and I hope to definitely come back!

-the

lemon ricotta pancakes were delicious with a light tangy taste

two eggs.review:
-Arrived at 12:00PM on a Wed, seating in 5 minutes. It was a beautiful day so we sat outside
-Great service and friendly staff.
-Of course I got the PLOW: Two eggs, choice of house made pork sausage, nueske bacon, or chicken apple sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes, crispy potatoes

excerpts: I tried the plow 2 egg breakfast, complete with two eggs sunnyside up, the handmade pork sausage, the famous plow potatoes, and toast.
The winner of this meal, and perhaps the restaurant in general, were definitely the plow potatoes.
Fried to perfection.
The pork sausage was nicely seasoned, but a tad bit dry.
two eggs.author: Coleen K.
two eggs.review:
Came here for brunch with two girlfriends while visiting San Francisco for the weekend. We found this place via Yelp, and it was a big hit!

We went in on a Monday morning at about 9AM and we were able to snag three bar seats without a wait. The place is really small, ~10 tables, so definitely be prepared to wait. Our bar seats were great-- we had front row seats to look at the open kitchen and watch the chefs cook. Very cool to see them making the homemade pancakes, potatoes and eggs. 

I tried the plow 2 egg breakfast, complete with two eggs sunnyside up, the handmade pork sausage, the famous plow potatoes, and toast. The winner of this meal, and perhaps the restaurant in general, were definitely the plow potatoes. Fried to perfection. The pork sausage was nicely seasoned, but a tad bit dry. My girlfriends got the egg breakfast sandwich and the lemon ricotta pancakes. They loved both. I was able to try the lemon ricotta pancakes and these are a little slice of heaven. Sweet and savory all in one!

One thing I'll say is that breakfast seemed pricey. Dishes were about $14-$16, which seems steep. That being said, San Francisco is more expensive than Chicago!

excerpts: * two eggs cooked as you liked them
(I had mine scrambled: so fluffy!)
* your meat option (the chicken apple sausages are nicely sweet)
two eggs.author: Connie L.
two eggs.review:
Having read reviews on Yelp, I knew that the wait would be long, especially on a Sunday that was Father's Day! For our group of 5, we waited for around 1 hour and 30 minutes - luckily the SF marathon passed us just one block down the hill, so we were easily able to entertain ourselves that morning.

Plow has this great, welcoming, and airy ambience. It's small, so small you squeeze up against the waitstaff and other customers every time you get up out of your seat, but also so clean and cozy it feels like you're dining in a cloud of pleasantness and good intentions. It is a little loud, but comfortably so.
 
Per Yelp's recommendations, we ordered four Plows and one fried chicken sandwich: two with bacon, one with pork sausage, and one with chicken apple. Each was amply sized:
    * two delightfully sweet and light lemon ricotta pancakes
    * two eggs cooked as you liked them (I had mine scrambled: so fluffy!)
    * your meat option (the chicken apple sausages are nicely sweet)
    * crispy potatoes. Might I mention that if you come here for nothing else, you order    
    these potatoes. You wait an hour for these potatoes because they are WORTH IT. Just the right amount of batter, salt, and seasoning to make me forget about how much starch I'm consuming and wallow in happiness for the rest of the morning.

The fried egg sandwich, which my mother ordered, seemed kind of messy as the yolk managed to drip out all over her hand when she first picked it up.

Otherwise, I have no negative comments about Plow. The service is great, the food is outstanding, and it is worth the wait and the hour long drive we made to get there. C:

excerpts: I ordered two eggs and the chicken apple sausage and toast.
two eggs.author: Elizabeth S.
two eggs.review:
I echo the sentiments on the service being outstanding -- everyone was organized and very nice. We didn't feel rushed through, which is key after the inevitable wait, even on a weekday morning, which is when we went.

I think the wait is the thing most people mention in their reviews, whether good or lukewarm. Like others, I was more than willing to wait a half hour for an outstanding breakfast -- but this was far from outstanding.

First of all, the meals are a heart attack on a plate -- everything seems to be deep fried or cooked in vegetable oil (we sat at the bar, so we could see everything as it was cooked). My two friends got the Plow, which was two pancakes, eggs, breakfast meat, and toast. I ordered two eggs and the chicken apple sausage and toast.

The pancakes were, as others have written, delicious. The lemon flavoring makes them feel lighter than they are. The eggs were completely flavorless; my guess is that cooking with oil was behind this, rather than butter. I even had them add some cheese; what they added appeared on one side of the scramble but I didn't see cheese throughout.

The potatoes were delicious -- dude. Deep. Fried. How can they not be? Crispy and good. The toast was either a sour dough or almost Italian type bread which, when toasted, was hard to chew. The apple sausage was good, but not particularly memorable. For drinks, we ordered coffee and tea; they were happy with their coffee, my tea didn't stay very warm in the individual pot that was brought to the table.

In the end, if you do choose to go here, keep in mind that the portions are HUGE -- so perhaps share with someone at your table. I ate maybe a third of the eggs, 2 out of 4 of the sausage links, both small slices of toast, and maybe 1/2 the potatoes and left feeling very fool. And of course, bring a book or newspaper, something to keep you occupied -- because you'll be waiting a long, long time.

excerpts: Equipped with  two eggs fried, aioli, frisee, Vermont cheddar, Acme bun.
The Plow is a must order at Plow -- two eggs, choice of house made pork sausage, Nueske bacon, or chicken apple sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes, crispy potatoes.
We went with the two eggs, house made pork sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes, crispy potatoes.
Man-oh-man was this dish delish.
two eggs.author: Elaine N.
two eggs.review:
Came here with my fellow foodie Fanny W., we found parking across the street (that never happens...), walked in and were seated right away at the last table available, sweet! There's nothing like a bright and sunny morning in SF, I mean how often does that happen honestly? Good thing Plow takes full advantage of whenever the weather is beautiful with its huge storefront facing windows. 

We opted for the Fried Egg Sandwich and THE PLOW. I thought the Fried Egg Sandwich sounded a bit ordinary, but it was far from it! Equipped with  two eggs fried, aioli, frisee, Vermont cheddar, Acme bun. The aioli puts a nice twist on the egg sandwich, and to top it off with Acme bun made fresh in the city, I could not resist. 

The Plow is a must order at Plow -- two eggs, choice of house made pork sausage, Nueske bacon, or chicken apple sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes, crispy potatoes. We went with the two eggs, house made pork sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes, crispy potatoes. Man-oh-man was this dish delish. The pork sausage was nicely seasoned, not too salty (which is a huge plus to me), the lemon ricotta pancakes were AMAZING it made my mouth drop (and this is coming from a girl who doesn't like lemon zested anything...), and the seasoned house potatoes sounded average, but they definitely weren't. 

Overall we had a fantastic experience here at Plow. Parking was easy (no meter), we were seated right away (rare moment), and the service/ambiance screamed brunch, what more could you ask for. One thing bothered me though, there was a huge mix up with the check, we were charged an extra $20... Something was obviously wrong here. I've been reading about restaurants scamming their customers a lot lately down in Santa Ana, so I was extra careful to check the tab. I'm sure it was just a mistake, but for it to happen to both our table and the table adjacent to ours? Kind of strange, I think Plow needs to figure that one out... Nonetheless Fanny W. and I really enjoyed our experience here and hope to be back real soon!

excerpts: That way you can get it with two eggs any style and your choice of housemade sausage, Neuske bacon or chicken sausage.
Two eggs over easy sandwiched by soft, toasted Acme bread with frisee, aioli and cheese with the additional Neuske bacon (everything is better with bacon!).
The creamy egg yolk mixes with all the components and makes it finger lickin' good!
two eggs.author: Daisy T.
two eggs.review:
Crispy potatoes... *drool*.... mmmm, mmmm good!

Yes, there's a ridiculous wait for this place on the weekends (up to two hours), but it's totally worth it! Though I do suggest that you try to hit up this place during the week. The wait time goes down to 30 minutes. 

This cute little place is located right at the corner surrounded by FREE parking. Just hope that you can find a spot! The place is small. Maybe no more than 20 people can sit down at a time. But there are a handful of seats at the counter where you can watch the magic happen.

The menu is small but features locally sourced, high quality ingredients, making even the simplest dishes stand out in comparison to the basic breakfast joint. Choose from a warm mushroom salad to a dungeness crab scramble to chia seed pudding.

The lemon ricotta pancakes are a popular choice. Very fluffy and light with tons of lemon flavor. I love the texture, but the lemon was a bit to strong for my taste. I suggest getting The Plow combo if you want to enjoy these. That way you can get it with two eggs any style and your choice of housemade sausage, Neuske bacon or chicken sausage. Some salt to balance out the sweetness.

My fave is the fried egg sandwich! Two eggs over easy sandwiched by soft, toasted Acme bread with frisee, aioli and cheese with the additional Neuske bacon (everything is better with bacon!). The creamy egg yolk mixes with all the components and makes it finger lickin' good! It also comes with a side of their infamous crispy potatoes!

They're serious about their potatoes. Smashed red potatoes flavored with fresh rosemary and onions and fried to perfection! They managed to find a way for you to have your hashbrowns and country potatoes together as one! You can't find potatoes like this anywhere else!

By the way, if you like scrambled eggs, they know how to do it right. Super light and fluffy yet still creamy. I don't even like scrambled eggs, but I love them here!

Good thing I don't live next to here or else I'd have a muffin top full of crispy potatoes and bacon!

excerpts: My boyfriend and I ordered the plow breakfast combo which came with two eggs, two lemon ricotta pancakes, REALLY REALLY BOMB ASS crunchy potatoes, and two pork sausage patties.
The lemon ricotta pancakes were sooo flavorful and really moist.
We also ordered a French toast which came with marscapone cream and strawberries on top (also bomb).
Everything was absolutely delicious!!
Would definitely be back again to try their weekend brunch menu.
two eggs.author: Linz C.
two eggs.review: Got here around 12:45 on a Friday and it was a full house but we only waited about five minutes for a table of two. For drinks we ordered a root beer and a homemade strawberry lemonade. The lemonade was adorable and came with one of those old school paper straws with red stripes on it. It was a little on the sour side but was still refreshing. My boyfriend and I ordered the plow breakfast combo which came with two eggs, two lemon ricotta pancakes, REALLY REALLY BOMB ASS crunchy potatoes, and two pork sausage patties. The lemon ricotta pancakes were sooo flavorful and really moist. We also ordered a French toast which came with marscapone cream and strawberries on top (also bomb). Everything was absolutely delicious!!  Would definitely be back again to try their weekend brunch menu.

excerpts: The Plow is two eggs, two lemon ricotta pancakes, house potatoes and your choice of bacon, housemade pork sausage, or chicken apple sausage.
I chose to get the pork sausage.
I was so excited when our plates were finally in front of us.
His crab scramble was plentiful too and had a lot of fresh crab in it.
The creme fraiche was the perfect addition for the scramble.
He loved the house potatoes which was served with his meal too.
The toast it was served with was standard though.
As for my Plow: The eggs, which I chose over easy were perfectly cooked and the yolk just oozed all over once punctured.
The house potatoes were so crispy.
two eggs.author: Cat C.
two eggs.review:
I've had Plow bookmarked for quite sometime, but since I am an impatient person, he & I have stayed away due to the long waits.  Yesterday morning though, we both woke up early and decided to try our luck.  Parking was pretty easy as we got a space across the street. We arrived about 5 minutes or so after opening and got seated at the last table, which we shared with a couple that got in right before us.  Of course I was afraid that it wasn't going to live up to the hype, but it did!  7x7 released a few months ago the recipe for Plow's lemon ricotta pancakes and I took a stab at making them.  So, naturally I had to get The Plow ($16) & he instantly gravitated towards the Dungeness crab scramble ($17).  The waitress was coming around asking if we wanted coffee with her big pitcher.  Bf said yes and I declined since I'm so picky with coffee.  However, he (usually drinks black) and I (usually gets vanilla lattes and macchiatos) thought the coffee was quite good even with just a little bit of sugar, it was pretty mild.  The coffee was Equator.  

The Plow is two eggs, two lemon ricotta pancakes, house potatoes and your choice of bacon, housemade pork sausage, or chicken apple sausage.  I chose to get the pork sausage.  I was so excited when our plates were finally in front of us.  His crab scramble was plentiful too and had a lot of fresh crab in it.  The creme fraiche was the perfect addition for the scramble.  He loved the house potatoes which was served with his meal too.  The toast it was served with was standard though.  As for my Plow: The eggs, which I chose over easy were perfectly cooked and the yolk just oozed all over once punctured.  The house potatoes were so crispy.  The lemon ricotta pancakes were fluffy, moist, and lemony; they were to die for.  The only thing that killed the breakfast was the sausage.  We were surprised that they were made into patties, and it did have some nice seasoning but they were so dry.  We had to dip the pieces into the egg yolk or pour syrup on them.  Perhaps they didn't put any fat in it and that's why it was so dry?  The dry sausage was really the only thing that killed the breakfast and prevented us from deeming Plow a 5 star breakfast.  

Okay, I think even by SF standards the dishes are a little pricey for breakfast, but they're so worth it.  I'm gonna say a little gripe though, what I don't get is that, they offer free cups of coffee (refills too) for those stuck waiting for a table outside, but will ask around patrons dining if they'd like a cup...thought it may have been free, but was surprised to see the $3.50 charge on the receipt.  Bf was more optimistic than me though (even though he paid) and said, "Well at least they kept filling me up.  Not all places give free refills."  Plow is a solid 4.5 stars.  I can't wait to come back for more lemon ricotta pancakes and house potatoes!

excerpts: I ordered the Plow (two eggs, lemon ricotta pancakes, bacon or sausage, and crispy potatoes) and he ordered the Ham Benedict with potatoes.
We both thought the food was good
but it wasn't as AMAZING as we thought it would be.
The pancakes didn't have much flavor
and I've had better potatoes.
two eggs.author: Jamie T.
two eggs.review:
I've been wanting to try this place for the longest time. Decided to wake up early on a Saturday for breakfast at the Plow. My bf and I hoped that there wouldn't be as long of a wait in the morning as there would be during brunch, but we thought wrong.. Arrived there at around 9am and there was still a 45min- 1 hr wait.

I ordered the Plow (two eggs, lemon ricotta pancakes, bacon or sausage, and crispy potatoes) and he ordered the Ham Benedict with potatoes. We both thought the food was good but it wasn't as AMAZING as we thought it would be. The pancakes didn't have much flavor and I've had better potatoes.

excerpts: We decided to split the Fried Egg Sandwich (Two Eggs Fried, Cheddar, Aioli, Served w/Crispy Potatoes, $11 + Nueske Bacon, $2.50, http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/plow-san-francisco?select=GFi1WD9m-LXQzmYujzQpmA#YwR3TfuxiYN9OUvbMeiiBA) since I wasn't that hungry, and it was delicious.
However, it didn't compare to the crispy potatoes, which were AMAZING.
These were probably the best crispy potatoes that I've ever had.
They were super flavorful, and cooked really well-
this was a perfect addition to the 7x7 list.
The egg sandwich is highly recommend but the potatoes are a must order!
Hour Cold-Brewed Iced Coffee ($4, http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/plow-san-francisco?select=GFi1WD9m-LXQzmYujzQpmA#GFi1WD9m-LXQzmYujzQpmA): Also really good, and highly recommended.
two eggs.author: Amy D.
two eggs.review:
Crispy Potatoes- #92 on the 2013 7x7 100 Things to Eat Before You Die list.

I tried going to Plow once before, and the line was so crazy on a Saturday that they couldn't even accommodate to-go orders. I tried again on a Friday afternoon, and my friend and I got there around 11am and there was already a 20 minute wait! Luckily we were just a party of two and got seated after 10-15 minutes. We decided to split the Fried Egg Sandwich (Two Eggs Fried, Cheddar, Aioli, Served w/Crispy Potatoes, $11 + Nueske Bacon, $2.50, http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/plow-san-francisco?select=GFi1WD9m-LXQzmYujzQpmA#YwR3TfuxiYN9OUvbMeiiBA) since I wasn't that hungry, and it was delicious. However, it didn't compare to the crispy potatoes, which were AMAZING. These were probably the best crispy potatoes that I've ever had. They were super flavorful, and cooked really well- this was a perfect addition to the 7x7 list. The egg sandwich is highly recommend but the potatoes are a must order!
-12 Hour Cold-Brewed Iced Coffee ($4, http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/plow-san-francisco?select=GFi1WD9m-LXQzmYujzQpmA#GFi1WD9m-LXQzmYujzQpmA): Also really good, and highly recommended. The coffee was really smooth, and had good flavor.

Overall, the lines at Plow are justified, and is one of the best brunch spots I've been to ever. Although the restaurant and tables are small, and it can be difficult to find parking at times (it was easy on the weekday), I will definitely be back to try other items on their menu. I really like our waitress, who was really friendly and accommodating.

excerpts: This brunch item had a bit of everything:  two eggs (poached), some pork sausage, two small lemon ricotta pancakes, and the infamous PLOW POTATOES ($13).
The potatoes have ruined me for all future breakfast potatoes because the bar is now sky high.
They were really soft inside yet very crispy on the outside and sprinkled with great rosemary and salt seasoning.
The Fried Egg Sandwich came with two eggs over easy on a soft n' squishy Acme bun ($9).
two eggs.author: Amy C.
two eggs.review:
I plowed into the Plow at Plow.

This brunch item had a bit of everything:  two eggs (poached), some pork sausage, two small lemon ricotta pancakes, and the infamous PLOW POTATOES ($13).  The potatoes have ruined me for all future breakfast potatoes because the bar is now sky high.  They were really soft inside yet very crispy on the outside and sprinkled with great rosemary and salt seasoning.  And don't forget to try the locally made Youk's Hot Sauce!

The Fried Egg Sandwich came with two eggs over easy on a soft n' squishy Acme bun ($9).  The eggs were nice and runny and went great with the cheddar cheese, aioli, frisee, and Plow potatoes on the side.  

The bright space has a clean look with large windows and a cute sign that said, "No cell phone.  Please."  It's a small place though and busy for a weekday lunch.  I probably wouldn't brave the long wait on the weekend.

Unless "Plow Potatoes by the Bucket" becomes a menu item.  Then it's on like Donkey Kong!

More info here:  http://goo.gl/rnt4y

excerpts: I got the Plow breakfast (hey-- when in Rome, right?) which came with two eggs (over-easy for me), 4 things of chicken apple sausage, 2 lemon ricotta pancakes (yes!
and yes!), and a big hoppin' load of crispy potato chunks (it's a bit ginger-y, so be advised).
I loved The Plow (get
yer mind outta the gutter...lol).
I believe the gal pal loved her pancakes too.
I only wish my lemon ricotta pancakes had some blueberry compote (sp?)
like the ones in the regular lemon ricotta pancake entree.
two eggs.author: Melody W.
two eggs.review:
I came here with a gal pal on a Thursday lunch break (~12:15pm). Parking was easy (say what the what? It's never easy in SF). Since I was in great company, the wait wasn't long at all--probably 10-15 minutes max for first available seating. We got seated outside, which was fine. The weather was amazing, so we didn't mind. 

She ordered a side of scrambled eggs with the Almond Flour Pancakes. I got the Plow breakfast (hey-- when in Rome, right?) which came with two eggs (over-easy for me), 4 things of chicken apple sausage, 2 lemon ricotta pancakes (yes! and yes!), and a big hoppin' load of crispy potato chunks (it's a bit ginger-y, so be advised). Oh-- and a cup of Equator coffee to wash it all down. I loved The Plow (get yer mind outta the gutter...lol). I believe the gal pal loved her pancakes too. I only wish my lemon ricotta pancakes had some blueberry compote (sp?) like the ones in the regular lemon ricotta pancake entree. And, I think the crispy potatoes were a little over-powering with ginger taste. All in all, I loved the dish and the experience. 

This place is worth a visit in my book.

excerpts: I opted for "The Plow" which came with two lemon ricotta pancakes/maple syrup (so good), two eggs (got mine just pure egg whites which were perfectly prepared), bacon (it wasn't the best, I should've just got the chicken apple sausage), and potatoes (which were the highlight of my meal --
two eggs.author: Jorel C.
two eggs.review:
Plow is located in a convenient spot off of 280 in Potrero Hill.  There was easily found street parking nearby when I went so I think parking shouldn't be much of a problem.  

Keep in mind I did not dine in for my meal during this visit to Plow, just a simple takeout request since I was alone.  

I opted for "The Plow" which came with two lemon ricotta pancakes/maple syrup (so good), two eggs (got mine just pure egg whites which were perfectly prepared), bacon (it wasn't the best, I should've just got the chicken apple sausage), and potatoes (which were the highlight of my meal -- I wish I ordered more because they were made to absolute perfection, crispy and all with just the right touch of rosemary).  

If you're in the area this place is so worth trying out despite the wait I've heard it has.  They've got some top-quality eats and excellent/friendly service even though my experience was brief inside the restaurant since I was just claiming my takeout order.  Definitely plan on returning soon!

excerpts: two eggs, some really delicious Rosemary country potatoes, awesome sausage pattys, and to finish off, what I came for, Lemon Ricotta Pancakes!
If you visit for the pancakes alone
it's worth it.
They were fluffy , light and just lemony enough to not be overpowering and the ricotta, well let's just say I'm adding ricotta to my pancake mix from now on.
two eggs.author: Javier A.
two eggs.review: So we took a Cousin here during a 12 hr layover. We had seen the vids on YouTube about it and we were pleasantly surprised. Sunday morning about 9am the wait was about 45min. But worth it. I had "The Plow" plate which incl. two eggs, some really delicious Rosemary country potatoes, awesome sausage pattys, and to finish off, what I came for, Lemon Ricotta Pancakes!  If you visit for the pancakes alone it's worth it. They were fluffy , light and just lemony enough to not be overpowering and the ricotta, well let's just say I'm adding ricotta to my pancake mix from now on. Also delish was the corn millet muffin.

excerpts: I had "the plow", which included two eggs any style, two pancakes, crispy potato along with some fancy bacon - could also choose the house made pork or chicken apple sausage.
I added the house made pork to the order (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/A0AziPST4T6k-V3neWFRNA?select=Nvx5t7GSC0M9qR9nAUcjvQ).
two eggs.author: Peter L.
two eggs.review:
I had "the plow", which included two eggs any style, two pancakes, crispy potato along with some fancy bacon - could also choose the house made pork or chicken apple sausage. I added the house made pork to the order (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/A0AziPST4T6k-V3neWFRNA?select=Nvx5t7GSC0M9qR9nAUcjvQ). Add a refillable coffee and the total was $21.

The place is still new, only a few months old so it feels nice, looking like an old Victorian converted (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/A0AziPST4T6k-V3neWFRNA?select=rMjzBGdWw3oWzRP5ph3JFg). I feel like this is one of those nicer brunch place for foodies, so if you're into that scene then it is perfectly fine. And, while not extravagant, the menu  prices (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/A0AziPST4T6k-V3neWFRNA?select=RWYDmjlqUDtKN1aMzOeaMA) are higher than the average greasy spoon spot. But, the food was plentiful and worth it.

Go by 9AM on a weekday and you should find parking within the block - only a street over from Mariposa (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/A0AziPST4T6k-V3neWFRNA?select=KrJE6HcQ9q9AEOmc-wvpgw) - and no waitlist. The server Ashley (liked her NZealand accent!) was also helpful with the menu suggestions. I plan to include this place in my brunch rotation - returning other days and times and update the review.

Note: Bumped into one of the owners of Candybar. A sign for another UYE?

excerpts: The Plow: two eggs, choice of house made pork sausage, Nueske bacon, or chicken apple sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes with pure maple syrup, and some crispy potatoes.
The boy got his with the sugar pie pumpkin pancakes (instead of the lemon ricotta) and they were just as heavenly--if not better.
two eggs.author: Adena B.
two eggs.review:
"Hour and a half wait," says Randall.

"No worries, we'll wait it out," I told him. He smiled and handed me some coffee to pass the time. He also pointed down the street and shared a tip: "Rico makes some killer Bloody Marys. In case you're interested."

Of COURSE I'm interested, Randall. We wasted a good 45 minutes at Blooms Saloon, (http://www.yelp.com/biz/blooms-saloon-san-francisco#hrid:g60JAte3LvIB4-uJ8CCUXw) then headed back to wait out the remainder of the time. 

EATS
+The Plow: two eggs, choice of house made pork sausage, Nueske bacon, or chicken apple sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes with pure maple syrup, and some crispy potatoes. The boy got his with the sugar pie pumpkin pancakes (instead of the lemon ricotta) and they were just as heavenly--if not better. We both opted for the bacon--and it was just OK; kinda smokey.

DRANKS
+Mimosas: watered down and not that great; especially not after that spicy Bloody Mary.
+Coffee: San Raf's finest, Equator coffee. Excellent.

Service was good, Randall made it great. Will I be back? Probably not, but happy to have tested it out to see what the hype was all about.

excerpts: I had the two eggs, chicken apple sausage, and potatoes, and I could not have asked for anything more delicious or filling.
I am a big breakfast person, especially considering we were going to head over to Anchor for a tour, but I didn't come close to finishing my plate here!
The potatoes were fried so crispy, yet still tender on the inside, and they were seasoned so well!
The chicken Apple sausage seemed as fresh as when I make my own sausage from scratch back home!
The toast was a very thick cut slab of Acme bread that just could not be compared to anything else.
My friends had the ricotta pancakes which were light and tart, not too sweet.
And the salmon toast which was lighter fare, but still filling.
Overall, it was a wonderful start to a day of touring around SF, and I will make it a point to go here
anytime I am in town!
two eggs.author: R F.
two eggs.review:
