I was only in town for a few days, and luckily my friend lives in Potrero and knew about this amazing breakfast and brunch spot.
The decor was relaxed and inviting, the staff were warm and welcoming, and the food was amazing.
I had the two eggs, chicken apple sausage, and potatoes, and I could not have asked for anything more delicious or filling. I am a big breakfast person, especially considering we were going to head over to Anchor for a tour, but I didn't come close to finishing my plate here! The potatoes were fried so crispy, yet still tender on the inside, and they were seasoned so well! The chicken Apple sausage seemed as fresh as when I make my own sausage from scratch back home! The toast was a very thick cut slab of Acme bread that just could not be compared to anything else.
My friends had the ricotta pancakes which were light and tart, not too sweet. And the salmon toast which was lighter fare, but still filling.
Overall, it was a wonderful start to a day of touring around SF, and I will make it a point to go here anytime I am in town!

excerpts: I ordered the lemon ricotta pancakes and she order the plow which comes with two eggs, chicken apple sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes, and crispy potatoes.
We basically split everything, and I finished my own set of pancakes.
The pancakes were so light and fluffy, but you could taste the lemon and ricotta in every bite - exactly how it should be, right?
Everything in my cousin's dish was delicious - the crispy potatoes .... to die for.
two eggs.author: Kathleene E.
two eggs.review:
My cousin and I came to the Plow a few months ago, and I believe it was  Friday morning. We had to wait about an hour, but it wasn't a big deal because we walked down the street to this super cute coffee spot and the wait went by super quick. 

The restaurant is small and quaint, one of those small, cozy (as another yelper said) restaurant. It has a lot of bright open space, so if you're feeling a little vampirey and antisocial not wanting to share your space, I suggest you do not go here! Lol, onto the food.

I ordered the lemon ricotta pancakes and she order the plow which comes with two eggs, chicken apple sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes, and crispy potatoes. We basically split everything, and I finished my own set of pancakes. The pancakes were so light and fluffy, but you could taste the lemon and ricotta in every bite - exactly how it should be, right? Everything in my cousin's dish was delicious - the crispy potatoes .... to die for. The chicken apple sausage was yummy as well. 

Bottom line - it was a fun experience. Good food, good service topped with a beautiful sunny day in SF. But since I was having a leisurely day and not pressed on time, I was okay with waiting the hour to be seated. I wouldn't wait an hour if I had other things to do - i thought this was important to add :)

excerpts: My cousin and her husband had 'the Plow' which consists of two eggs, two pancakes, and they decided on the Nueske bacon.
My partner ordered the lemon ricotta pancakes and I decided on the corned beef hash with yukon gold potatoes, chillies, and two eggs.
two eggs.author: Simon K.
two eggs.review:
I was craving a very good breakfast, flying in the night before and dodging all the Black Friday madness of everyone shopping my cousin and her husband brought us here for a good start to our day. Lacking sleep already and a night of turkey I needed something to bring a good morning 'ring' to my day as I was tired, and mediocre was not going to do, thankfully I have a cousin who knows about food, and still remembering from years before on how she took me to places, I could put my faith in her to deliver.

She said that this place usually has line-ups going up the block (as this place is located on a hill), so to get here early, we arrived at 8 AM, the place was not empty, but it wasn't packed, probably being a holiday. It was a charming little place with real high ceilings, very bright white walls, defined by natural wood tables. It's a very happy, bright look, with the open kitchen concept that seems standard nowadays with new restaurants.

Once we sat down, we were presented the menu, and looking at that pageful of items to order, the problem was to decide on what to order. From pancakes, eggs, bacon, granola, sandwiches and salads, everything looked so good. My cousin and her husband had 'the Plow' which consists of two eggs, two pancakes, and they decided on the Nueske bacon. My partner ordered the lemon ricotta pancakes and I decided on the corned beef hash with yukon gold potatoes, chillies, and two eggs. As it wasn't that busy when we were here, the orders came quite quickly.

Speaking on my dish of hash browns, this was pefectly done, little bits of pefectly cooked potatoes mixed with strands of corned beef, and this was the stuff on the bottom of the plate. You could taste the freshness of the ingredients mixed with some chili to provide a kick, this was under the two sunny side eggs that were laid on top of the hash, welcoming me to breakfast like a set of eyes. Two small pieces of bread were laid on the top side of the eggs and I was ready to devour like a monster looking at this thing. My partner's pancakes were fluffy and had a good dense chew. I remember a smile everytime I took a bite, and I also remember my partners fork constantly coming over to my plate picking at little pieces of potato and meat.

Another thing that was damn good was the bacon here, whatever farmer they are getting this stuff from, it's like crack. I love the look that my partner had when she took a bite. One of those breakfast joints that if I was to be back in San Francisco I would check it out. From what I heard from my cousin, come early, or wait, but when was waiting for good food wrong.

excerpts: It includes two eggs, two lemon ricotta pancakes, potatoes, and choice of meat.
The pancakes were an absolute standout.
My husband is the meat eater between the two of us and said the house-made pork sausage patty was delightful.
two eggs.author: Roxanne S.
two eggs.review:
My husband and I waited quite some time to eat breakfast here on a Saturday morning. We arrived at 9 AM and were met with a one-hour wait, which we never tend to mind. We sat at the bar and it was fun to watch the cooks prepare the orders (also a good way to decide on different menu items because you can see them being prepared).

We got the Plow, which is their breakfast plate. It includes two eggs, two lemon ricotta pancakes, potatoes, and choice of meat. The pancakes were an absolute standout. My husband is the meat eater between the two of us and said the house-made pork sausage patty was delightful. We also shared a biscuit with honey butter and enjoyed it immensely!

Be aware that the menu items were pricey. We paid $4.50 for the biscuit, which felt high (especially compared to other restaurants where we typically get a biscuit on the side). Would highly recommend and would go back!

excerpts: Two eggs (good when dressed up with ketchup and hot sauce-
they're soft scrambled btw)
two eggs.author: Ritu K.
two eggs.review:
Plow you have broken me down. I'll admit it- I'm a fan. Partly thanks to my laziness and partly in large part to my love of brunch I kept returning to Plow hoping to find that magical brunch item that would make me love this place. And yes I've found it in the most unsuspecting item- Muesli. Yep I said muesli. I know that sounds boring and not fun (i.e. not fattening at all), but I love muesli and I especially love Plow's version. I order a almond flour pancake (yum) on the side so that I can pretend I'm enjoying a gluttonous breakfast, but the main attraction is the muesli.

I've tried 
The Plow (akin to a Denny's grand slam although perhaps a bit more refined). its kind of messy and I wish it was a little more refined for the price.
The Lemon Ricotta pancakes (I'm wrong- these are actually pretty disappointing- too much ricotta)
Two eggs (good when dressed up with ketchup and hot sauce- they're soft scrambled btw)
And the Plow version of bagel and lox (its toast with lox and pretty boring)..

So there you have it- I'm a fan but still avoid this place like a plague on the weekends. Definitely not worth an hour plus wait....

excerpts: It comes with two eggs, pork sausage, bacon or chicken apple sausage, two lemon pancakes and potatoes.
two eggs.author: Jessica R.
two eggs.review:
Love at first bite.

I love brunch and came here for my birthday brunch with the boyfriend.

If it's your first time, try The Plow! It comes with two eggs, pork sausage, bacon or chicken apple sausage, two lemon pancakes and potatoes. IT IS HEAVEN.

Our waitress was really kind. I love the atmosphere. The neighborhood is cute.

Will definitely be coming back to bring a friend who is visiting San Francisco for the first time in a couple weeks.

excerpts: The Plow with the two eggs, Nueske bacon, chicken apple sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes and potatoes was a total brunch that had everything you need and desire.
The bacon and sausage were good salty, sweet and meaty, while the pancakes definitely were the highlight.
two eggs.author: T L.
two eggs.review:
(See pics) Review #1192. Great all local purveyors ingredients brunch that brightens up any gloomy day or energizes a sunny day.

The day we visited, they were out of monkey bread so we opted for corn millet muffin which was good.

The Plow with the two eggs, Nueske bacon, chicken apple sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes and potatoes was a total brunch that had everything you need and desire. The bacon and sausage were good salty, sweet and meaty, while the pancakes definitely were the highlight. Eggs were prepared perfectly to my likeness.

As mentioned many times in my other reviews, I love locally roasted beans. Equator coffee was earthy and was happily light roasted.

My friend had the fried egg on Acme bun that was hearty and freshly tasted.

Mimosa was nice but more orange juice than sparkling wine.

Many had wondered about the San Francisco style long wait and yes even on a rainy weekend we we visited. However, the server was extremely helpful and actually told us not to go get coffee up the street because there would be a table coming up shortly and if those who were not there while called, they would lose the spot. Amazing enough, we only waited for 10 minutes. While the place was completely packed, service was super friendly and perky, we were never rushed to finish, though we were considerate to not hold up the tables.

Do wish they were closer to public transit stops.

excerpts: I ordered the Plow,  which included two eggs any style, two lemon ricotta pancakes, crispy potato & house made pork or chicken apple sausage.
two eggs.author: En J.
two eggs.review:
They don't take reservations so our wait time was almost an hour. By the time it was our turn to eat, they ran out of the Monkey bread. Bummer!!

I ordered the Plow,  which included two eggs any style, two lemon ricotta pancakes, crispy potato & house made pork or chicken apple sausage. The Lemon Ricotta pancake was simply the best, just cant be missed. 

The servers are friendly and accommodating. If you are a dog lover then this is a perfect spot to hang out with your canine while brunching.

excerpts: The Plow consisted of two eggs (over easy), house made sausage patties, crispy potatoes and two lemon ricotta pancakes.
The patty was good, and the pancake was delish!
two eggs.author: Leslie P.
two eggs.review:
Their crispy potatoes are addicting! So flavourful... savory, and naturally sweet. They are super crispy... I love them!

My sister and I shared the The Plow and the French toast with red wine poached pears. The French toast was okay. It was nothing special, and was actually lacking a little oomph. The Plow consisted of two eggs (over easy), house made sausage patties, crispy potatoes and two lemon ricotta pancakes. The patty was good, and the pancake was delish!

excerpts: Two eggs, 2 pancakes, potatoes, and sausage.
Everything was so average.
The potatoes were deep fried and basically like eating greasy fries.
The pancakes were forgettable.
Lemon Ricotta are a personal fav and they were probably the worst I have tasted.
two eggs.author: Laura O.
two eggs.review:
Is it just me or am I the only one feeling over the high prices and average quality/ service of restaurants in SF? My roommate said she heard Plow restaurant was the "it" brunch spot in SF right now. So, me and a few friends decided to have a Saturday fun day, starting with Plow. 

Such a disappointment. Sad, annoyed face. Hoping for that exchange value for time, $$$ and super mouth watering food, I was left thinking "I would pay $12 max ( I paid nearly $17) for that dish and wait 30 min max for the food/ service.

I got the "Plow" entree...Two eggs, 2 pancakes, potatoes, and sausage.  Everything was so average. The potatoes were deep fried and basically like eating greasy fries. The pancakes were forgettable. Lemon Ricotta are a personal fav and they were probably the worst I have tasted. I was so excited about the menu with so many unique options, but after trying my friends and my dishes, it was clear to me that I would never return to Plow.

I'm growing tired of the crazy prices and long waits for really average food and service. The place is cute, but not cute enough to overshadow a mediocre dining experience. 

Kudos to Plow for one thing... Humanely raised meat.

excerpts: For breakfast, we ordered the softly scrambled eggs and the plow - two eggs, meat of your choice (we got the homemade sausage), potatoes and lemon ricotta pancakes.
We were mostly MEH about the scrambled eggs
- they were good but nothing special.
The pancakes were fantastic and I wish they were like 12 inches bigger
so I could just make a lemon ricotta pancake hat to wear for forever.
But the real winner was those damn potatoes.
My husband and I actively debated on how we could replicate them.
two eggs.author: A K.
two eggs.review:
My husband and I pop down to SF a few times a year.  He lived there for 6 years and it is his favorite city.  This was our first visit to Plow and we really enjoyed it.  We arrived at about 10:45 on Tuesday and were seated immediately.  

For breakfast, we ordered the softly scrambled eggs and the plow - two eggs, meat of your choice (we got the homemade sausage), potatoes and lemon ricotta pancakes.  We were mostly MEH about the scrambled eggs - they were good but nothing special.  The pancakes were fantastic and I wish they were like 12 inches bigger so I could just make a lemon ricotta pancake hat to wear for forever.  But the real winner was those damn potatoes.  My husband and I actively debated on how we could replicate them.  Don't think we will be able to.  

Oh, coffee and mimosas were good too. 

We will be back to Plow though I don't know if we would do a two hour wait.

excerpts: I had the Two Eggs with Chicken Apple Sausage.
The eggs were scrambled exactly the way I like them--not dry, not runny, no browning portions, lightly salted.
The potatoes were light and crispy on the outside and soft on the inside.
These are the best potatoes I've had for breakfast in a long time.
I've never had chicken sausage before
so I have nothing to compare these to, but they were pretty good as well.
They were greasy (as are most sausages), but not excessively so.
Even the two pieces of toast--a part of the meal I don't usually bother with--were crunchy, warm, and lightly buttered.
two eggs.author: Carol Y.
two eggs.review:
Just one visit was all it took for this cute little restaurant to top my list of favorite breakfast/brunch spots.  Although the cozy atmosphere was pleasant and the service standard, it was all about the food for me at Plow.  

I had the Two Eggs with Chicken Apple Sausage.  The eggs were scrambled exactly the way I like them--not dry, not runny, no browning portions, lightly salted.  The potatoes were light and crispy on the outside and soft on the inside.  These are the best potatoes I've had for breakfast in a long time.  I've never had chicken sausage before so I have nothing to compare these to, but they were pretty good as well.  They were greasy (as are most sausages), but not excessively so.  Even the two pieces of toast--a part of the meal I don't usually bother with--were crunchy, warm, and lightly buttered.  The orange juice was sweet and refreshing (albeit small... even though I ordered a large glass).  

I enjoyed everything I tasted during my visit to Plow and I very much look forward to returning sometime soon.  I hear it gets extremely busy on the weekends, though, so it'll have to be another weekday morning.

excerpts: The plow - two eggs (whatever style), house made pork sausage, and 2 lemon ricotta pancakes.
This comes with a small container of real maple syrup.
This was AMAZING.
GET IT.
The pancakes are small, rich and
oh my god so fluffy.
The eggs were ordered sunny side up and they were prefect.
I just didn't want to get another the plow (like my partner).
I don't regret my choice
but I do think the plow was the much better idea.
two eggs.author: Jessica P.
two eggs.review:
Let me preface this with stating that I had to wait a couple hours before I could sit down and eat.  So hunger might have made the food taste better than it should.  Food that we ordered

Crispy pig ears with a pickled egg - It comes with a chili vinaigrette but ask for the chili jam.  That chili jam is amazing and made everything taste better.  The pig ears were coated in batter and fried (ergo crispy) but the inside was melt in my mouth tender.  If you do get this, share it.  It is very rich. 

The plow - two eggs (whatever style), house made pork sausage, and 2 lemon ricotta pancakes.  This comes with a small container of real maple syrup.   This was AMAZING.  GET IT.  The pancakes are small, rich and oh my god so fluffy.  The eggs were ordered sunny side up and they were prefect.  The yolk was runny and the white is completely set. 

Soft egg scramble with goat cheese, lambsquarter and oyster mushrooms - This was decent but not my favorite.  I just didn't want to get another the plow (like my partner).  I don't regret my choice but I do think the plow was the much better idea.

Coffee - I don't know what they use but the this coffee was extremely fruity and not bitter at all.  They constantly refill the cup too.

All main came with crispy potato.  This was extremely good, especially with the chili jam. 

TLDR: If you are going to come here, bear in mind that you would need to wait at least  an hour (we got here around 11:30 on a Saturday)

Cost: You should expect to spend around $20+/person for food.

excerpts: I had: the plow  two eggs, choice of Nueske bacon, house made pork sausage, or chicken apple sausage,
two eggs.author: Ming-Jou C.
two eggs.review:
If you want to sit next to a bitch for a really good brunch, Plow is the place for you. Well, it was for me on a nice, cool Sunday mid-morning. The lack of star perfection wasn't due to her, it was the 1-hour wait for a table, but hey, you learn to expect that at places in SF that don't take reservations. They don't take parties greater than 6. 

Situated on a corner in Potrero Hill, Plow is small inside with just as many seats outside. The reason for the bitch, is that they have 2-person tables lined up along the wall of the restaurant and well, I had to get in to the inner table for my seat. I asked her nicely if she could move her chair in, well, she moved her butt, not moving the chair and barely at that. So basically I just shoved past her. Good thing I was sitting next to her and didn't have to stare at her sour-puss face the entire meal like DK did sitting across from her. Anyway, she made for good conversation.

Onto the food...once we were seated, our waitress took a while to bring us our waters and by then we were ready to order. You really can't go wrong with a breakfast place that has a pig sign under the name of their restaurant. Mmmm.....oink.

I had: the plow  two eggs, choice of Nueske bacon, house made pork sausage, or chicken apple sausage, two pancakes + crispy potatoes  14

DK had: max's biscuits + gravy  two buttermilk biscuits, pork sausage gravy, crispy potatoes  11

It came out fairly quickly and it was GOOD. The bacon was plentiful and was cooked just right, the pancakes had this lemony hint to them and were on the smaller size, but that's because they're not your average pancakes. They were really good though, but kind of had a french toast consistency and about the size of English muffins. The potatoes had some sort of Saffron or something on them, because they were as yellow as my egg yolks, but boy, were they good. I normally leave potatoes untouched on my plate (except for the hash brown kind), but these were awesome and just the right amount of crispy.

DK's biscuits and gravy were really good and the gravy was coma-inducing. 

I really enjoyed my breakfast, sans bitch. There's a multitude of breakfast places in SF, and many are good one-morning stands, but this one I would go on a second date with.

excerpts: A nice crunchy corn tortilla laid beneath chipotle tomato sauce and two eggs over easy, avocado, and creme fraiche.
It was fresh and flavorsome.
The textures and flavors mixed very well together and the combination of breakfast and mexican worked
oh so well.
-Plow
two eggs.author: Maiden D.
two eggs.review:
Cute spot for breakfast, brunch, lunch. Anytime of the day actually but I'm saying this because of the windows that line an entire wall of the corner located store, allowing a great amount of daylight into the room. That's the first thing I noticed. Came in with my sister late morning and we were seated right away! MAJOR plus! (since, I hear the wait can be terrible). I then noticed that we were seated very closely to another group of people (so close, it was as if we were all seated in one cozy table). Despite that fact, this is what gave the restaurant a social, friendly, casual, and "fun intimate" feeling. We got our waters right away and our waitress was very prompt!! 

We looked through the menu, searching for something that stood out to us. Of course, we had to choose the infamous 'plow' and also decided on the Chicken Tinga to share. Eggs over easy for both- but you can have your eggs however you want them. Also, as a heads up, being the small business that it is, they don't serve groups greater than 6! 

The menu says no cell phones allowed? (not sure what that meant or why) That didn't stop me from checking in and taking pictures of my food - I HAD TO! ;)

-Chicken Tinga tasted mucho bien! A nice crunchy corn tortilla laid beneath chipotle tomato sauce and two eggs over easy, avocado, and creme fraiche. It was fresh and flavorsome. The textures and flavors mixed very well together and the combination of breakfast and mexican worked oh so well. 
 
-Plow: Lemon ricotta pancakes were zesty and very smooth from the homemade ricotta. It was a new idea for me. I liked it with syrup which added sweetness to the zest. Potatoes added crunchiness to the plate- dipped each bite with ketchup/hot sauce, scooping up the oozing yolk from the eggs (Mmmm spicy and savory)- Eggs over easy was a genius idea, I might add! Chicken apple sausage had a smooth, sweet, spicyness. Overall the whole plate was full of dimension. In my opinion, the pancakes were very appropriate, being that the potatoes were super crunchy, the eggs oozed yolk, and the sausage added a kick! 

Both plates had different ideas but I personally liked the Chicken Tinga for flavor. 

Don't go here if you don't like loud and compact areas. I suggest you go here if you want a casual and sociable meal. Cool.

excerpts: I got mine with two eggs sunny side up, Nueske bacon, and the standard crispy potatoes and lemon ricotta pancakes.
Nueske bacon is bacon in some of its awesomest form.
The crispy potatoes had a hint of rosemary for an added dimension of flavor.
The lemon ricotta pancakes featured a light lemon flavor and were a little dense yet still fluffy and really delicious (I really liked these pancakes).
two eggs.author: Erich D.
two eggs.review: When at Plow get the plow!  It's a seriously good breakfast/brunch entree that won't have you feeling overly stuffed or gross afterwards; perfect mix of savory and sweet items on your plate and just the right amount.  I got mine with two eggs sunny side up, Nueske bacon, and the standard crispy potatoes and lemon ricotta pancakes.  Nueske bacon is bacon in some of its awesomest form.  The crispy potatoes had a hint of rosemary for an added dimension of flavor.  The lemon ricotta pancakes featured a light lemon flavor and were a little dense yet still fluffy and really delicious (I really liked these pancakes).

excerpts: Two eggs, Grafton cheddar, frisee, aioli and crispy potatoes.
Add dashes of hot sauce and a dollop of ketchup.
two eggs.author: Jenny L.
two eggs.review:
02.12.11

Brunch at Plow was an amazing start to a remarkable Saturday.  I had a friend visit from LA, who is supposedly hard to impress with food.  Thank goodness Plow came through.

The wait was about 15-20 minutes.  We lost track because of the gorgeous clear blue skies and unseasonably warm weather.  Got seated at the counter, and my coffee came right away.

I ordered the fried egg sandwich (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/A0AziPST4T6k-V3neWFRNA?select=uZldEhL0UQTJFUmoQKN7Kg).  Two eggs, Grafton cheddar, frisee, aioli and crispy potatoes.  Add dashes of hot sauce and a dollop of ketchup.  I'm in love.

If I lived closer, this would definitely make it into the rotation more.  But, parking was a cinch, so that's a huge plus.

Total damage for two: around $30.

excerpts: The Plow-- two eggs, choice of Nueske bacon, house made pork sausage, or chicken apple sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes, crispy potatoes
two eggs fried, aioli, frisee, Vermont cheddar, Acme bun  10.75
add Nueske bacon
The lemon ricotta pancakes had a cake-like consistency and tons of flavor.
My only complaint about the pancakes was that they were way too small!
The potatoes?
Best freaking breakfast potatoes
I've ever had.
They were flavorful, crispy, and oh so good!
I also tasted my boyfriend's Fried Egg Sandwich was was also, very good.
The total came out to be about $30 something for breakfast.. a little pricy, but totally worth it!
two eggs.author: Joyce E.
two eggs.review:
Plow is absolutely delicious! I came here for my boyfriend's birthday brunch. The wait was about 15 minutes for two on a Thursday afternoon at around 1pm. The hostess/server was very nice and assured us that we would be seated soon. Since Plow is, as they describe "modest in size" definitely expect to get seated literally inches away from some random people. Anyways! Since we looked at the menu beforehand, we received our orders within 15 minutes. Pretty fast! I also want to mention that the wait went by quickly since my boyfriend and I were watching the cooks cook/prepare the food in the open kitchen. I ordered the Plow while my boyfriend settled on the Fried Egg sandwich.

Their water was served in jugs! My favorite. :)

(From their menu)

The Plow-- two eggs, choice of Nueske bacon, house made pork sausage, or chicken apple sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes, crispy potatoes  14.5

Fried egg sandwich -- two eggs fried, aioli, frisee, Vermont cheddar, Acme bun  10.75  add Nueske bacon  12.75

The Plow was SO good! The eggs were on the watery/yolky side which I didn't mind. The bacon tasted exactly like how my mom makes it -- It was sweet and not too crispy. The lemon ricotta pancakes had a cake-like consistency and tons of flavor. My only complaint about the pancakes was that they were way too small! The potatoes? Best freaking breakfast potatoes I've ever had. They were flavorful, crispy, and oh so good! I also tasted my boyfriend's Fried Egg Sandwich was was also, very good. The total came out to be about $30 something for breakfast.. a little pricy, but totally worth it!

excerpts:
what my friends and I ordered: 

the plow (two eggs (any style), crispy potatoes, bacon or chicken-apple sausage, two (smaller than the full-plate option) lemon ricotta pancakes: amazing combination!
the lemon ricotta pancakes were good
two eggs.author: Patricia K.
two eggs.review:
Cute brunch place with delicious food!

what my friends and I ordered: 

the plow (two eggs (any style), crispy potatoes, bacon or chicken-apple sausage, two (smaller than the full-plate option) lemon ricotta pancakes: amazing combination! I get a little bit of everything which is perfect. the lemon ricotta pancakes were good but I had a bite of my friend's almond pancakes and those were AMAZING (just the perfect hint of almond flavor- not overbearing but lingers in your mouth long enough for you to crave more!)

I highly recommend going on a weekday. my friends and i arrived on a friday morning around 9:30am and waited ~20 minutes for seats in front of the restaurant (longer wait if you want to sit inside). 

you should definitely check this place out if you like brunch and you're willing to wait!

excerpts: The Plow comes with two eggs, crispy potatoes, lemon ricotta pancakes and a choice of meat.
The lemon ricotta pancakes are fluffy, although i usually don't opt for anything lemon-y, these were really good
and I did eat it all.
The eggs were perfectly cooked to my liking.
I really wish I can mimic their crispy potatoes because they are the BEST breakfast potatoes I ever eaten; it is extra crispy on the outside, but not at all over cooked on the inside.
The chicken apple sausage was yummy too.
Everything on the plate complimented well with one another.
The fried egg sandwich has frisee, cheese and two friend eggs between a soft warm bun.
I don't really like frisee
but it really worked well with the cheese and the saltiness of the egg.
The sandwich also comes with crispy potatoes.
two eggs.author: Jeannie C.
two eggs.review:
Every time I visit SF, my sister brings me to a "must try" place. This past weekend she brought me here for breakfast. We got around the area around 8:30 am and parking was easy to find and best of all no wait to get seated. My sister did warn me on the weekend, however, the wait can be over an hour so I am glad we were there on a Friday. 

They have great options on their menu but I had my sister decide what to get. We decided on The Plow and the Fried egg sandwich. The Plow comes with two eggs, crispy potatoes, lemon ricotta pancakes and a choice of meat. We chose the plate with chicken apple sausage. 

Both plates were delicious. The freshness in the ingredients were there. The Plow is a great option if you want a hearty breakfast. The lemon ricotta pancakes are fluffy, although i usually don't opt for anything lemon-y, these were really good and I did eat it all. The eggs were perfectly cooked to my liking. I really wish I can mimic their crispy potatoes because they are the BEST breakfast potatoes I ever eaten; it is extra crispy on the outside, but not at all over cooked on the inside. The chicken apple sausage was yummy too. Everything on the plate complimented well with one another. The fried egg sandwich has frisee, cheese and two friend eggs between a soft warm bun. I don't really like frisee but it really worked well with the cheese and the saltiness of the egg. The sandwich also comes with crispy potatoes. 

Service was friendly and quick. It is very cozy in there...just the way I like it in this type of places especially in the Bay. Can't wait to return.

excerpts: The Plow (two eggs, two pieces of bacon or sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes, and crispy potatoes) and The French Toast.
The food was just delicious.
We ate every bite.
Those potatoes are crispy on the outside, soft on the inside with great flavor.
Those lemon ricotta pancakes were so delectable.
two eggs.author: S G.
two eggs.review:
So I've been really wanting to try this place.  It's a bit out of the way for me, but I love trying new things.

So, we waited about an hour to be seated on a Saturday...ok by me if the food is good.  Plus you can order some beverages while you wait.  Relax people, have some drinks outside with friends while you wait.  It's the weekend after all so enjoy. 

So my friend and I shared two dishes. The Plow (two eggs, two pieces of bacon or sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes, and crispy potatoes) and The French Toast.
The food was just delicious.  We ate every bite.  Those potatoes are crispy on the outside, soft on the inside with great flavor.  Those lemon ricotta pancakes were so delectable. French Toast was more on average but very good!  

I am definitely going to come back here again and try something else...but I may get those ricotta pancakes again..hehe.

excerpts: The potatoes were a side to their fried egg sandwich -- two eggs over easy, served on a soft Acme roll with melted Grafton cheddar, a light touch of aioli and some frisee.
I'd recommend tackling the sandwich with a knife and fork and let that yummy egg yolk break on the plate and co-mingle with those potatoes.
two eggs.author: Joel A.
two eggs.review:
Best breakfast potatoes ever! I love potatoes that have some crunch to them. More often than not, I get country style potatoes that are more on the soft side without any crispy bits -- not really to my liking. The potatoes at Plow were served deep fried and crunchy and then sauteed with onions and a little rosemary. Yum!

The potatoes were a side to their fried egg sandwich -- two eggs over easy, served on a soft Acme roll with melted Grafton cheddar, a light touch of aioli and some frisee. I'd recommend tackling the sandwich with a knife and fork and let that yummy egg yolk break on the plate and co-mingle with those potatoes. Deee-licious!

I like the location. It's a fairly small room (about 10 tables) and a counter right at the grill. Large uncovered windows face towards 18th Street and let in a lot of light. From my corner table, I could lazily stare out onto the street as I enjoyed my food and coffee. A very pleasant experience.

excerpts: , I got the fried egg sandwich (two eggs fried, cheddar, aioli, crispy potatoes) and you can add bacon and/or avocados for additional fee.
It is pretty delicious; the bread is soft yet slightly crispy on top and the runny egg yolk tastes delicious mixed in with your crispy potatoes.
two eggs.author: Lori F.
two eggs.review:
It's a cute small neighborhood spot for brunch; however, you should expect to wait for a table or arrive early. If I lived in that neighborhood, I would eat at Plow more often; otherwise, every once in a while is good enough. 

I've been to Plow twice for brunch and both times, I got the fried egg sandwich (two eggs fried, cheddar, aioli, crispy potatoes) and you can add bacon and/or avocados for additional fee. It is pretty delicious; the bread is soft yet slightly crispy on top and the runny egg yolk tastes delicious mixed in with your crispy potatoes. 

Maybe the next time I go, I'll be willing to try something different ... The French toast did look delicious and was sold out the first time around.

excerpts: I got the Plow, a combination of two small lemon ricotta pancakes, two eggs, bacon or sausage and potatoes.
Those potatoes.
oh man.
I don't know what they put in them (rosemary?
thyme?)
but they are crispy and delicious.
The only food item I would complain about - the bacon . . .
while tasty, I wish I had specified crispy, because they serve it kind of floppy and under cooked.
But other than that, everything was great.
two eggs.author: Jenny R.
two eggs.review:
Plow.  A longstanding brunch obstacle, because I knew the endurance it would take.  And after being burned in the past by extraordinarily long waits for brunch and less than stellar food as my reward, I have to admit, I was a little hesitant to give Plow the chance.  

But I finally did, this past weekend.  And it was worth it.  Admittedly, the wait was lengthy.  Probably about an hour or so.  But that was to be expected.  And honestly, who cares about an hour wait, if it's good weather?  Wandering around Portrero Hill, stopping into some cute shops, getting tea at Farley's - it's not a bad way to spend an hour. 

And I would say the food is worth the wait, maybe not on a regular basis, but certainly once in a while.  I got the Plow, a combination of two small lemon ricotta pancakes, two eggs, bacon or sausage and potatoes.  Those potatoes.  . . oh man.  I don't know what they put in them (rosemary?  thyme?) but they are crispy and delicious.  The only food item I would complain about - the bacon . . . while tasty, I wish I had specified crispy, because they serve it kind of floppy and under cooked.  But other than that, everything was great.

excerpts: The Two Eggs dish is a great option for people following this diet.

Plow is not a greasy spoon, so it is not going to satisfy palates accustomed to heavier fare, but if you are hungry, the Plow dish (two eggs, choice of house made pork sausage, Nueske bacon, or chicken apple sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes + crispy potatoes) is a great choice for people who are not on any restricted diets.
two eggs.author: Kristina P.
two eggs.review:
It's true that the wait for breakfast at Plow is usually long, but the line-up there is packed because people want to eat well prepared and healthy food that is fresh, local, and organic. The demand is therefore high. If you're an early riser, I'd recommend arriving at Plow at opening time in order to avoid the wait. 

I eat rather "clean" by following a Paleo/SCD diet, which advocates avoiding starches and consuming high quality meats, vegs, and fruits. Plow serves delicious meals that easily fit in with this eating philosophy. The Two Eggs dish is a great option for people following this diet. Note that the staff can swap the potatoes with greens.

Service and atmosphere are both very good. 

Plow is not a greasy spoon, so it is not going to satisfy palates accustomed to heavier fare, but if you are hungry, the Plow dish (two eggs, choice of house made pork sausage, Nueske bacon, or chicken apple sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes + crispy potatoes) is a great choice for people who are not on any restricted diets.

excerpts: The plow is two eggs, choice of house made pork sausage, Nueske bacon, or chicken apple sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes + crispy potatoes.
two eggs.author: Jayne A.
two eggs.review:
If you are indecisive (like me) get the plow so you can get a taste of everything. The plow is two eggs, choice of house made pork sausage, Nueske bacon, or chicken apple sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes + crispy potatoes.

The pancakes sound weird but they are definitely worth trying. The home fries are unique since they have both crunchy and chunky pieces. There are small pieces that are basically French fries and others that are like home fries. It is an awesome mix since you usually only get home fries for breakfast. All in all a wonderful start to my Sunday. 

Although the wait was pretty long, the service was great so I am more than willing to come back for the plow anytime.

excerpts: In this case it was "The Plow" (two of their lemon ricotta pancakes, two eggs, Nueske bacon and crispy potatoes).
This is my usual breakfast choice anyways--like pancakes but gotta have breakfast meat and potatoes or hash browns!
Even though food took some time coming out, my table was happy with our orders.
The savory bread pudding was a hit as was the BLT, hamburger and egg sandwich.
The table also shared an order of the French toast which all seemed to enjoy and describe as a hybrid with bread pudding.
I was too full so resisted trying it.
two eggs.author: Christopher W.
two eggs.review:
First off, couldn't resist a "Go Aggies!"--I did not know that Plow was co-owned by a fellow Aggie, until my friend Mindy pointed it out.  Very cool to see Aggie alum out and doing what they are passionate about. :-)

I stumbled upon Plow using Yelp Nearby on my Android phone in Dec '10 when my buddies and I finished up the Anchor Steam brewery tour.  Unfortunately at that point people decided it was easier to go back to The Marina (joy.)  Since then I have been wanting to check out Plow purely for the solid reviews and the lemon ricotta pancakes! :-)

When we decided to grab breakfast in SF this weekend, I suggested it and even though it was off the beaten path, people thought we should check it out!  My buddy Richard made it on time (9:30am) when we said we would meet and put in our name for a table of 6.  A little over an hour later we sat down.  The kitchen was bustling and people seemed to be enjoying their food!

I usually order what I first put my eye on.  In this case it was "The Plow" (two of their lemon ricotta pancakes, two eggs, Nueske bacon and crispy potatoes).  This is my usual breakfast choice anyways--like pancakes but gotta have breakfast meat and potatoes or hash browns!  Even though food took some time coming out, my table was happy with our orders.  The savory bread pudding was a hit as was the BLT, hamburger and egg sandwich.  The table also shared an order of the French toast which all seemed to enjoy and describe as a hybrid with bread pudding.  I was too full so resisted trying it.  Next time.

One of the great perks (for all coffee drinkers) is that they allow you/and even offer you coffee while you are waiting!  Didn't see if they actually ended up charging for it.  Regardless it's a nice gesture.  

Great to see business so solid, and if there was a way to get the wait down, I will be highly likely to return!

excerpts: On my second trip we both had the two eggs special.
One with crispy bacon the other with house make pork sausage, perfectly seasoned with fennel, our favorite.
The breakfast potatoes are amazing!
Perfectly crunchy on the outside, light and fluffy on the inside.
two eggs.author: Kim A.
two eggs.review:
Was sent here by a friend who is a "brunch junkie".  He told me this is his favorite place at the moment.  I was not disappointed.

You've gotta go early to get a seat.  I hear there can be an hour plus wait on weekends.  Both times I've gone we were seated right away and there were folks waiting for seats (and our parking spaces) when we left.  

We had:  The lemon ricotta pancakes.  The pancakes were light and fluffy with bright citrus notes throughout.  The clear winner for us.  My friend had the Caramelized Banana French Toast, how can you go wrong with Bananas Foster topping on french toast and Marscapone cheese on the side?  

On my second trip we both had the two eggs special.  One with crispy bacon the other with house make pork sausage, perfectly seasoned with fennel, our favorite.  The breakfast potatoes are amazing!  Perfectly crunchy on the outside, light and fluffy on the inside.  Not one bite left on either plate...   

I'll be keeping Plow on my breakfast list too.  The space has a bright, clean, open feel, like going to a friends place for breakfast.  In fact, I'm going to meet friends there this morning.

excerpts: with two eggs and a side of the House-Made Sausage.
I didn't finish the sausage because it was a little too spicy for me (even my friend, who is a HUGE fan of lighting her mouth on fire, said it was pretty spicy for a breakfast sausage).
two eggs.author: Kathy P.
two eggs.review:
It's nice to have another Brunch place on the HIll. Although it was quite crowded when we went ( a little after eight on a Saturday Morning) the space feels light and airy inside. I almost had the "the Plow" which features all the greatest hits on the menu, but opted to share the Monkey Bread (unbelievably good!) with two eggs and a side of the House-Made Sausage. I didn't finish the sausage because it was a little too spicy for me (even my friend, who is a HUGE fan of lighting her mouth on fire, said it was pretty spicy for a breakfast sausage). But I would come back again and have the French Toast.

The sweet spot for Breakfast seating seems to be about 9:00 am - if you go early as we did, you get a seat, but the kitchen gets slammed out of the gate, so you have a little wait on the food. Things shake out nicely after 9:00.

Wait staff is very friendly and efficient.

excerpts: I got the fried egg sandwich with the bacon and the wife got two eggs over medium with chicken apple sausage
and we both got the potatoes.
We sat at the bar so we got to see the three man team in action.
We enjoyed everything.
two eggs.author: Caesar R.
two eggs.review:
I enjoyed our little adventure over to this neighborhood.  The parking on a 90 degree angle to the curb is something this NYer found more fascinating than anything else on the 75 degree angle of the street.  But Plow has a great breakfast.  Very egg centric but all delicious and super friendly service helps as well.  

I got the fried egg sandwich with the bacon and the wife got two eggs over medium with chicken apple sausage and we both got the potatoes.  We sat at the bar so we got to see the three man team in action.  We enjoyed everything.  They did run out of the delicious looking rolls for the fried egg sandwich, so I got stuck with some busted regular toast that was eh.  

Otherwise, it's worth the wait at this pleasant bustling brunch spot.

excerpts: Looking forward to coming back to Plow ASAP to try their Fried Egg Sandwich, The Plow (two eggs, choice of Nueske bacon, house made pork sausage, or chicken apple sausage, two pancakes & crispy potatoes), and/or a Chocolate Eclair.
two eggs.author: Tiffany M.
two eggs.review:
I'm not one to vouch for restaurants that often, but in Plow's case, I guarantee that you'll like it... in fact, you'll LOVE it. I should also note that I almost never rate a place 5 stars based on a first time visit, but Plow was so freakin' good, that I feel confident in giving them 5 shiny stars.

Everything at Plow tasted just as good as it looked.

Standouts included:
+Lemon Ricotta Pancakes (house made ricotta, lemon zest, pure maple syrup) 
+Tinga (chicken in tomato chipotle sauce, two crispy corn tortillas, avocado, creme fraiche, cilantro)
+Crispy Potatoes

Mid-conversation, my friend let out a big 'MMMM!!!!" when he bit into his pancakes. I couldn't have agreed more! 

I like the fact that they work w/ local purveyors such as Frog Hollow Farms, Cowgirl Creamery, Monterey Fish Co, Acme Bread & Tcho Chocolate. When you see that they work w/ such local all-stars, you know you're in for a treat. I also really enjoyed Plow's Equator coffee while I waited for our table. And that wait was long! We came in at 11:30 am and had to wait an hour until we were seated. Normally I'd shoot for a much earlier brunch time to avoid the wait, but given that I was prepared for a leisurely Sunday brunch, the wait was pretty painless.

I love the ambiance of this place. It's small, but w/ their high ceilings and all the light that shines in from their big windows, they're able to make the space work; especially decorated in its rustic, modern, simplistic fashion. I love their signage, logo and menu- all well done. They also have stool seating where you can watch the chefs work their magic (like we did!)

The host was cool and our server efficient. Parking was ample (not surprising for Portrero Hill ) and diners seemed to be all SF locals. 

Looking forward to coming back to Plow ASAP to try their Fried Egg Sandwich, The Plow (two eggs, choice of Nueske bacon, house made pork sausage, or chicken apple sausage, two pancakes & crispy potatoes), and/or a Chocolate Eclair.

This place makes me thankful for SF's amazing food scene!

excerpts: My sister and I split and the Plow order and it was an amazing sampler of delectable delights including: lemon ricotta pancakes,  home made pork sausages, crispy potatoes with rosemary and two eggs
any style that your heart desires.
When they say crispy potatoes, they really mean crispy.
We actually got specific recommendations to get their potatoes since they are so yummy there
and it was totally true.
Forget your usual limp, dry, mealy home fries, these are crunchy, crispy and delightful.
I LOVED the lemon ricotta pancakes, they were fluffy, tart and delicious!
I wished I got a whole order of these lovely treats.
We were deciding between the chicken apple sausage but was easily convinced to try the pork instead they were made in house and were delicious.
They were made sans casing and were tasty and succulent.
My friend got the omelet made with spinach and oyster mushrooms and that was amazing as well.
Bottom line: the food here is great and totally worth the wait ;)
two eggs.author: Vivian T.
two eggs.review: Long wait but probably a good sign.  They do provide coffee for the wait.  My sister and I split and the Plow order and it was an amazing sampler of delectable delights including: lemon ricotta pancakes,  home made pork sausages, crispy potatoes with rosemary and two eggs any style that your heart desires. When they say crispy potatoes, they really mean crispy.  We actually got specific recommendations to get their potatoes since they are so yummy there and it was totally true.  Forget your usual limp, dry, mealy home fries, these are crunchy, crispy and delightful.  I LOVED the lemon ricotta pancakes, they were fluffy, tart and delicious! I wished I got a whole order of these lovely treats.  We were deciding between the chicken apple sausage but was easily convinced to try the pork instead they were made in house and were delicious.  They were made sans casing and were tasty and succulent.  My friend got the omelet made with spinach and oyster mushrooms and that was amazing as well.  Bottom line: the food here is great and totally worth the wait ;)

excerpts: Three of us had: the plow, mushroom salad and two eggs with the works.
Great stuff
Pancakes, sausage, fries - all part of either the plow or the two eggs were just awesome.
Pancakes, sausage, fries - all part of either the plow or the two eggs were just awesome.
two eggs.author: Bill L.
two eggs.review:
Went here on a Thursday around 10:15.  Already packed.  Does anyone work?  Hate to write a great review as it will just add to the lines!
Three of us had: the plow, mushroom salad and two eggs with the works.  Great stuff
Pancakes, sausage, fries - all part of either the plow or the two eggs were just awesome.  Mushroom salad is something else - fantastic.

We sat inside and watch all the things we didn't order and we will be back.
Service was great.  Busboy also kept an eye out at our water glass and kept them filled.

I hate myself for adding to the lines

excerpts: I've been here several times and my best bet is to go with the Plow breakfast - two eggs, sausage or bacon (I prefer the chicken apple sausage), two lemon ricotta pancakes (absolutely delicious and fluffy), and amazing potatoes.
It's worth the wait and definitely worth coming on a weekday when it's less crowded if you can!
two eggs.author: Lidia L.
two eggs.review: Consistently great quality of food and service.  I've been here several times and my best bet is to go with the Plow breakfast - two eggs, sausage or bacon (I prefer the chicken apple sausage), two lemon ricotta pancakes (absolutely delicious and fluffy), and amazing potatoes.  It's worth the wait and definitely worth coming on a weekday when it's less crowded if you can!

excerpts: I got "The Plow" which comes with crispy potatoes, two eggs, choice of bacon, pork sausage or chicken sausage and two lemon ricotta pancakes.
The crispy potatoes were also a hit
and I was just disappointed I couldn't manage to finish them all.
The lemon ricotta pancakes were pretty good as well.
Just enough sweetness and a good lemon flavor.
My only complaint is that they were a bit on the dry side and lacked fluffiness.
The freshly squeezed orange juice was also a plus.
The place is very small and it was completely packed when we visited.
Despite this, service was great.
I look forward to visiting the Plow on my next visit to SF.
two eggs.author: Gema S.
two eggs.review: We were lucky to come across this place on a recent trip to SF because it was close to where we were staying, and it was quite a find! The first time we came here it was about 10:30 and there was an hour wait. We decided not to wait and came back the next day at opening because the pictures of the food looked so good on Yelp. I'm so glad we came back! The next day we had no wait and were seated quickly once the place opened. I got "The Plow" which comes with crispy potatoes, two eggs, choice of bacon, pork sausage or chicken sausage and two lemon ricotta pancakes. I got mine with the nueske bacon and I have to say it was the best bacon I've ever had. Slightly sweet and salty and they were very generous with the portions. The crispy potatoes were also a hit and I was just disappointed I couldn't manage to finish them all. The lemon ricotta pancakes were pretty good as well. Just enough sweetness and a good lemon flavor. My only complaint is that they were a bit on the dry side and lacked fluffiness. The freshly squeezed orange juice was also a plus. The place is very small and it was completely packed when we visited. Despite this, service was great. I look forward to visiting the Plow on my next visit to SF.

excerpts: I ordered The Plow which consists of two eggs, choice of house made pork sausage, Nueske bacon, or chicken apple sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes and crispy potatoes.
This was not cheap as the price of admission was $15.75, but it didn't fail to satisfy.
The potatoes were some of the best I've had in the city, super crispy and salty.
The eggs were scrambled to perfection and the pancakes may have been the highlight here.
And the bacon, was well bacon.
You can't really go wrong with bacon.
All in all, the entire experience was enjoyable and the waitress even prevented my from getting a parking ticket as halfway through the meal
she warned me there was street sweeping.
The neighborhood is a little out of the way if you are just visiting, but there is a great view of the skyline from across the street.
Definitely worth checking out if you've got some spare time.
Would highly suggest avoiding this place on the weekends.
#foodcomaking approved.
two eggs.author: Food Coma K.
two eggs.review: In the past few weeks, Plow has frequently become the main topic of conversation when talking about brunch. Unless you get there around 7am on weekends, you are looking at waiting over two hours which is insane if you ask me. This morning I just so happened to be in the area and drove by to see many open spots inside so I decided to stop and see what all the fuss is about. I was seated immediately and was able to get in and out of the establishment in under a half an hour which was awesome. The food was great. Worth waiting two hours for? Probably not, but then again I'm not sure any food is worth waiting two hours for. I ordered The Plow which consists of two eggs, choice of house made pork sausage, Nueske bacon, or chicken apple sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes and crispy potatoes. This was not cheap as the price of admission was $15.75, but it didn't fail to satisfy. The potatoes were some of the best I've had in the city, super crispy and salty. The eggs were scrambled to perfection and the pancakes may have been the highlight here. And the bacon, was well bacon. You can't really go wrong with bacon. All in all, the entire experience was enjoyable and the waitress even prevented my from getting a parking ticket as halfway through the meal she warned me there was street sweeping. The neighborhood is a little out of the way if you are just visiting, but there is a great view of the skyline from across the street. Definitely worth checking out if you've got some spare time. Would highly suggest avoiding this place on the weekends. #foodcomaking approved.

excerpts: We usually order The Plow, which is a short stack of lemon-ricotta pancakes, choice of bacon or sausage, and two eggs.
Now let's talk about the potatoes for a second here.
These are the crowning glory of the place.
They literally make the experience unforgettable.
I'm not a chef, but I do cook some and it seems to me the yukon gold potatoes are fried once, smashed by hand, seasoned with salt, pepper and herbs, and then fried again to a crispy, golden brown.
I am not doing them justice thru my description.
Go ahead, wait an hour on the sidewalk and tell me these don't make you do cartwheels.
They're that crazy good.
The coffee is strong, dark, the juices freshly squeezed, the breads are artisan.
Service is so friendly, so congenial, that if they spilled my potatoes on the floor, I would still give them a warm hug.
two eggs.author: Angelo S.
two eggs.review:
If not for the long waits, I would give the place 6 stars for best brunch in The City.  We have waited 1+ hours to snag a table here, but it was truly worth it.  Now this husband and wife team used to work at the beloved 42 Degrees, way back when.  Fast forward 15 years, they have taken over a lovely, light-filled space on Potrero Hill.  Nothing fancy, but clean, modern, yet comfortable.  You can't help but smile even after you waited outside for an hour.  It's a cheery spot.  And that's before you take your first bite of food!

We usually order The Plow, which is a short stack of lemon-ricotta pancakes, choice of bacon or sausage, and two eggs.  Now let's talk about the potatoes for a second here.  These are the crowning glory of the place.  They literally make the experience unforgettable.  I'm not a chef, but I do cook some and it seems to me the yukon gold potatoes are fried once, smashed by hand, seasoned with salt, pepper and herbs, and then fried again to a crispy, golden brown.  I am not doing them justice thru my description.  Go ahead, wait an hour on the sidewalk and tell me these don't make you do cartwheels.  They're that crazy good.
The coffee is strong, dark, the juices freshly squeezed, the breads are artisan.  Service is so friendly, so congenial, that if they spilled my potatoes on the floor, I would still give them a warm hug.  Assuming of course, I get a fresh plate of these beauties.

I have yet to venture out and try their fried chicken sandwich, although just sighting it, it looks like it has a strong chance to be a contender against the fried chicken sandwich at Bakesale Bettys or Marlowe's.  

Another unfortunate another minus (along with the wait) is the lack of a full bar.  Sigh.  Can't have it all I suppose.  This comes pretty damn close, I guaran-damn-tee ya.

excerpts: Anyway, back to the food: I had the egg sandwich -- two eggs, arugula and cheddar on an Acme bun.
Delicious.
The bun was grilled to perfection, and the eggs were prepared perfectly.
The potatoes that accompanied the sandwich were also incredibly good; very crispy on the outside, and soft in the middle, with mildly caramelized onions.
two eggs.author: Jamie T.
two eggs.review:
I came here with a small group to remember a friend who used to frequent this establishment. Although he's no longer with us, I'm thankful he indirectly lured me to plow, as it was an excellent choice and I can see why he used to love coming here.

We arrived a little after 11 on a Sunday for brunch, which led to an hour-and-a-half wait -- and turned out to be completely worthwhile. When I entered the crowded doorway of this intimate space, I was promptly greeted by the incredibly gracious and cool host/front-of-house manager. Great start. A friendly, genuine smile can go a long way.

They had some coffee sitting out, to which we helped ourselves, under the impression that it was complimentary for waiting customers. Unfortunately, we misunderstood and were charged $2.75 a piece for batch drip coffee we had to serve to ourselves, and I did not get offered a mug or replenishment of my cup once seated. The coffee was excellent, and ultimately I didn't really mind paying for it, but I just wish it had been more clearly marked as something that would be added to the bill. But that was really the only downside to the experience, and in the end, the overall quality of service and food made up for it. Oh, and bonus points for the dual-flush, water-saving toilet in the restroom.

Anyway, back to the food: I had the egg sandwich -- two eggs, arugula and cheddar on an Acme bun. Delicious. The bun was grilled to perfection, and the eggs were prepared perfectly. The potatoes that accompanied the sandwich were also incredibly good; very crispy on the outside, and soft in the middle, with mildly caramelized onions. Yum.

It's rare that I make the trek out to Potrero Hill, but because of plow, I may need to come out more regularly.

excerpts: It came with two eggs and two pieces of toast.
two eggs.author: Jboogie L.
two eggs.review:
Saturday brunch wait around 11am - 30 minutes.  We walked around the neighborhood (Christopher's bookstore, FARLEYS, baked, and some other gift shops around the area)

You have to consistently check in with the host because I noticed that he did not come out of the restaurant to call out tables being available. With that being said, it is a bit irritating because there are plenty of opening and closing the door (there is a wind draft) too. 

We were lucky because we were offered either to sit by the open kitchen or in the back. We opted to sit by the open kitchen. 

I LOVE WATCHING CHEFS IN ACTION. 

DECOR - Modern, simple with metal high chairs and marbled counter tops. It reminds me of being in NYC because of the big sprawling windows as well.  

FOOD - I ordered the Duck Hash with leeks $14. I thought the duck didn't have much flavor. It was chopped up duck and it was prepped ahead of time already. The leek was there but I didn't taste much of the flavor. 
It came with two eggs and two pieces of toast.  The eggs were well made.

The PLOW was a standard pancake (it tasted good with a lemony flavor? i dont remember, a bit fluffy) homemade sausage patties (not too salty which is good), eggs, toast and scrumptious potatoes. 

KITCHEN STAFF - Two Mexican line cooks and probably another two in the back area cleaning the dishes.  

Everything is open so you can see the preparation.   

PARKING - easy street parking in Poterero.

SERVICE - pleasant staff 

I would come back on a less busier day.  THREE STARS FOR FOOD I HAD, FOUR STARS FOR DECOR and SERVICE

excerpts: I had "the plow" there for $13 -  "two eggs, choice of Nueske bacon, house made pork sausage, or chicken apple sausage, 2 pancakes, and crispy potatoes."
I saw the Chinese sausage there on the menu, and they allowed me to substitute that for my sausage choice.
The food came relatively quick, presented nicely on a white plate.
two eggs.author: Leo C.
two eggs.review:
Plow offers a clean and relaxed atmosphere to enjoy a fresh and delicious breakfast/brunch.  I came here jet lagged after getting off a trans-pacific flight, looking for a satisfying meal that features fresh ingredients.  Plow did the job for sure.  

I had "the plow" there for $13 -  "two eggs, choice of Nueske bacon, house made pork sausage, or chicken apple sausage, 2 pancakes, and crispy potatoes."  I saw the Chinese sausage there on the menu, and they allowed me to substitute that for my sausage choice.  The food came relatively quick, presented nicely on a white plate.  The server was very attentive and nice while conscious of not being bothersome.  

Overall, Plow is a place that I'd come back to as well as recommend to my friends.  It's not a great value since the price is somewhat premium for what you're getting.  But it's also very fresh and clean, so the price is fair.  Come check it out!

excerpts: Menu said two eggs, choice of bacon or sausage, crispy potatoes, and two pancakes.
I'm thinking upscale grand slam breakfast at Denny's.
Pancakes were about 2 inch diameter.
Tasty, but not very filling.
Two eggs would be more correctly labeled two small eggs.
Had to grab a sandwich shortly afterward to carry me through to dinner.
two eggs.author: Bryan L.
two eggs.review: Food was good, but portion size of "the plow" was misleading.  Menu said two eggs, choice of bacon or sausage, crispy potatoes, and two pancakes.  I'm thinking upscale grand slam breakfast at Denny's.  Pancakes were about 2 inch diameter.  Tasty, but not very filling.  Two eggs would be more correctly labeled two small eggs.  Had to grab a sandwich shortly afterward to carry me through to dinner.

excerpts: My bf got the fried egg sandwich that came with two eggs fried, cheddar, frisee, aioli, crispy potatoes  and Nueske bacon.
It looked good, and was an adequate sized sandwich.
I was tempted to order their organic yogurt with granola and mixed fruit, but felt I needed to order something more substancial since it was our first time here.
two eggs.author: Joycelyn L.
two eggs.review:
Tasty, well-portioned meals, get here before 9am if coming for brunch so you don't have to wait in line.

Came here Sunday morning before 9am and were lucky to get some bar seats in front of all the cooks.  It was neat to see how they cooked everything.  We started off with the monkey bread and it tasted just like cinnamon buns, just not as sweet and without the sugary frosting spread all on it.  I got "the plow", which came with scrambled eggs, their homemade pork sausage, lemon ricotta pancakes and crispy potatoes.  The homemade pork sausage was slightly spicy with really good flavor, while the pancakes were super soft and tasty.  I liked how they were mini pancakes and not the huge ones you'd get at like IHOP/Denny's.  The crispy potatoes were a little too salty for me, but my bf liked them.  I might have been able to eat the whole plate of food if it weren't for the monkey bread, but I did find many couples sharing the plow, if the other person ordered something small.  My bf got the fried egg sandwich that came with two eggs fried, cheddar, frisee, aioli, crispy potatoes  and Nueske bacon.  It looked good, and was an adequate sized sandwich.  I was tempted to order their organic yogurt with granola and mixed fruit, but felt I needed to order something more substancial since it was our first time here.  Plus, you can make that at home.

Overall, one of the better brunch places I've been to and will surely come back for more.

excerpts: if i still ate meat, i would definitely recommend the plow plate:  two eggs, choice of meat, and a side of crispy potatoes and pancake.
I definitely stood out of my table of 4 plow plates and one vegetarian dish.
two eggs.author: Justina F.
two eggs.review:
Came here for brunch on thursday morning and it was still crowded! me plus 4 more didnt have to wait long for a table although they dont seat larger parties of 6 due to the size.  The kitchen is open with a bar like seating in front. i ordered the herloom tomato salad, fruit cup and the side order of crispy potatoes....to the demand of my friend who adamantly raved about their potatoes.  I have to say it was the best crispy potatoes ive ever had and i dont even like potatoes.  They didnt have the overly dipped in oil kinda taste nor was it so starchy you couldnt eat the rest of your meal.  yum. the fruits were not standard fruit cup (thank god), rather i had pears, figs, grapes.  double yum. anddd lastly the heirloom tomatoes which ive been dying to order at a restaurant since their now in season, was sliced, drizzled in olive oil with avocados on top.  Didnt seem like much but it was pretty filling and i was completely satisfied with my mini meals for brunch.  The ambiance was bright and relaxing for a chilly morning.  

if i still ate meat, i would definitely recommend the plow plate:  two eggs, choice of meat, and a side of crispy potatoes and pancake.  I definitely stood out of my table of 4 plow plates and one vegetarian dish. =)

excerpts:
the main dish to order here is the plow:
two eggs any style (i usually get poached), two small lemon ricotta pancakes, chicken apple or pork sausage (probably not necessary), and perfect breakfast potatoes -- just the right amount of salt and rosemary.
the potatoes are crispy because of partially deep frying.

the pancakes have great flavor, fluffy, almost taste like muffins.
also tried the duck and sweet potato hash with crispy lotus root and poached eggs.

lots of diced duck bits with the fat and diced sweet potato, but definitely was longing for more crispy potato
locally sourced ingredients, nothing too creative, just stuff done well.
two eggs.author: Rob C.
two eggs.review:
very solid breakfast, brunch lines can be up to an hour.
the main dish to order here is the plow:
two eggs any style (i usually get poached), two small lemon ricotta pancakes, chicken apple or pork sausage (probably not necessary), and perfect breakfast potatoes -- just the right amount of salt and rosemary.
the potatoes are crispy because of partially deep frying.
the pancakes have great flavor, fluffy, almost taste like muffins.
also tried the duck and sweet potato hash with crispy lotus root and poached eggs.  lots of diced duck bits with the fat and diced sweet potato, but definitely was longing for more crispy potato
locally sourced ingredients, nothing too creative, just stuff done well.

excerpts: I have had the Plow, the two eggs and the french toast...
ALL very good and freshly cooked.
As I type this review I cannot help but drool as I think about the dishes I ate from them LoL!
two eggs.author: Grace V.
two eggs.review: This place is but a treat to me! I have been here a few times already and everytime I have gone I am always satisfied and full. The staff is friendly and provides excellent service. If your looking for a very tasty, delicious and scrumptious breakfast this is the place to dine. I have had the Plow, the two eggs and the french toast...ALL very good and freshly cooked. As I type this review I cannot help but drool as I think about the dishes I ate from them LoL! =)

excerpts:
fried egg sandwich - two eggs, cheddar, frisee, aioli, crispy potatoes 
house made organic yogurt + granola + market fruit + Potrero Hill honey

seated at the counter facing the workers
watching them mix, chop, flame, plate the magic.
two eggs.author: Anna K.
two eggs.review:
fried egg sandwich - two eggs, cheddar, frisee, aioli, crispy potatoes 
house made organic yogurt + granola + market fruit + Potrero Hill honey

seated at the counter facing the workers
watching them mix, chop, flame, plate the magic.
it's no secret that plow only uses fresh, wholesome ingredients
in every single dish they offer.
sip on coffee or a mimosa during your wait
as they take no reservations in advance.

excerpts: My girlfriend had the Scramble and I had the Two Eggs, both of which were generous portions and were excellent.
two eggs.author: Dr B.
two eggs.review: We read about this place on Yelp and decided to try it since it was a short walk from my sister's condo where we were staying.  We were skeptical when we arrived around 11am and saw a big line of people outside but put our names on the list anyway.  We were only a party of 2 and after 5 minutes we were seated!  My girlfriend had the Scramble and I had the Two Eggs, both of which were generous portions and were excellent.  Our coffee cups were never empty with Equator coffee, the service was phenomenal!  We are definitely going back!

excerpts: Comes with two eggs, freshly made pork sausage, two ricotta cheese pancakes and potatoes.
The pork sausage was very nice and the eggs was done to perfection, enough liquid egg yolk to dip your pancake in!
YUM!
Another friend got smoked
trout salad
and that was very nice, too.
The beetroot gave the salad a little kick and avocado mashed into frisée was nicely done, the trout tastes great.
Ended up paying $60 and it was worth every penny.
Very filling and satisfying first experience there.
I WILL DEFINITELY be back for more!
Their baked egg looks amazing and I shall put that on my list to try next time.
two eggs.author: Nitta P. B.
two eggs.review: I went there for the first time today for brunch, and god, what an amazing food!!!!! LOVE, LOVE, LOVE everything about this place. The service was great, ambience was awesome, and above all, the FOOD!! We were seated on the counter, I got a pot of jasmine tea and it comes in this cutesy little pot, enough for 1 1/2 cup. Then ordered the dungeness crab scramble which turned out to be a little bland on the egg, but the chunks of crab meat was perfect and the egg was not overcooked, so it balanced out. Homefries that comes with the egg was AMAZING. Crunchy, well-seasoned, I mean, it was just perfect. A friend got their big breakfast plate "The Plow" which also turned out to be amazing. Comes with two eggs, freshly made pork sausage, two ricotta cheese pancakes and potatoes. The pork sausage was very nice and the eggs was done to perfection, enough liquid egg yolk to dip your pancake in! YUM! Another friend got smoked trout salad and that was very nice, too. The beetroot gave the salad a little kick and avocado mashed into frisée was nicely done, the trout tastes great. Ended up paying $60 and it was worth every penny. Very filling and satisfying first experience there. I WILL DEFINITELY be back for more! Their baked egg looks amazing and I shall put that on my list to try next time.

two eggs.author: Ashley F.
two eggs.review:
oh goodness.  never has a breakfast joint revitalized my affinity for morning meals (okay, slight exaggeration but who cares).  i've recently given up breakfast out of laziness, but it's amazing what lengths you'll go to for a place like this with good company.  :]  my friends and i came here on fridays for three straight weeks to try out all the dishes that we wanted.  while some things fell flat, i was mostly pleased whenever i left.

first off:  the coffee.  tasty and a nice pick-me-up for my sleepy mornings, especially if you wake up before six just to get some grub.  and can i just gush about their granulated brown sugar?  i think they use ramekins for it as presentation, and it's the cutest thing ever.  however, the last time i was there, they had white sugar cubes instead, and it made the coffee taste a little weird.  :|

second:  i mentioned it briefly, but everything from their containers to their choice of water pitchers (or bottles, in their case) to their napkins - guh, this place is smartly decorated.  first impressions are everything, and they present a good one!  moreover, it helps in my anticipation to try what they have to offer.  nice sense of décor = must be good.  :P  (also, their website makes the minimalist in me extremely happy!  simplicity goes a long way, people.)

the first day, i ordered the plow with chicken apple sausage.  everything was great and filling, but i wasn't sold on the sausage.  same thing happened the second time i was there when i ordered their two eggs and tried the pork instead.  i don't know, i'm just not a big fan of it in general, though it never hurts to try on the off-chance i'm blown away.  the third day i ordered some sides, but it was enough for me.  oh, and on the second day, i had a bite of my friend's lemon ricotta pancakes.

!  so delicious!  i normally stray away from anything cheese-like in my sweet foods, but i was pleasantly surprised by it!  i think i saw another review here that said the size of these pancakes were small ...?    buh.  i don't know, man.  the pancakes were pretty huge.  then again, everyone has their own idea about what a perfect portion is, so no big deal.

lemon ricotta pancakes aside, the food is average breakfast fare that's touched up enough to set it apart.  i just have a tendency to gloss over the tiny details because i'm easily fascinated by little things (pretty sugar in cute ceramic!).

service is a bit hit-or-miss, depending on who's working.  they're nice (i'm reluctant to say this because it's a very distant kind of niceness) enough and attentive, frequently checking up on your table if you need coffee refills and the like (i haven't been there while it was really busy, so i'm not sure if it's any different during a rush) so it's not so much as a complaint as it is an observation for improvement.

better off as a 3.5 establishment, but i'm okay with rounding up for the memorable rush of excitement i had with my friends.  :]

dungeness crab scramble.author: Alice Z.
dungeness crab scramble.review:
5/5 Talking about competitive brunch..we arrived at 8:15 on a Saturday morning and still had to wait about 45 minutes before getting seated. How are so many people up this early to wait in line? Anyway, if you walk up the top of the hill next to Plow the view at 8:15 on a clear SF day is actually pretty amazing. If you're waiting I would highly recommend undertaking the climb! The brunch was some of the best brunch I've had, and I thoroughly every part of my experience!

[Brunch]
I sat at the counter and had a full view of the kitchen. These chefs are machines! I also watched one chef use at least three eggs to perfect his poached egg that I thought was a great sign of the quality of Plow. They also played some awesome music, including the Narcos theme song when I was there. I had the Dungeness Crab Scramble, a biscuit, and my friend had the Steak+Eggs. The two main brunches came wit bread and fried potatoes. Holy, those potatoes were to die for. I watched the chef toss them with salt and herbs and then had the pleasure of eating a half a plate of them. The steak+eggs definitely stole the show. Highly recommend this if you're in for a big breakfast!

[Drinks]
I had the mimosas. I didn't think they were that special as I've had better mimosas, but they went well with my food. It's not brunch without a mimosa. 

[Service]
The servers do a great job to clear tables efficiently and move the long wait. I also heard one server patiently explain the whole menu to some very indecisive diners. They're all also super friendly!

Overall, if you can wake up to line up at 7:45 on a Saturday morning, or just have lots of time on your hands, head over to the dogpatch to enjoy a nice view of SF and an amazing brunch!
