dungeness crab scramble.review:
Plow is a pretty good breakfast/brunch breakfast place. It wasn't mind blowing but I would come here again.

We came here on a Friday during lunch time and waited about 45 minutes for a 2 person table. The place is pretty small, so it's pretty understandable. They do have little benches for you to sit on outside as you wait.

For food, we ordered the breakfast sandwich with bacon and the open face gruyere and prosciutto toast. Both of these dishes came with golden roasted potatoes that were crisp on the outside and soft on the inside, though it was a tad bit dry. The breakfast sandwich and open face toast tasted pretty similar so you can't go wrong either.

Some of the things listed on their website are not available in the actual menu. I didn't see Dungeness crab scramble or Chinese Breakfast, which I was hoping to try.

excerpts: I was debating between the Plow, the Dungeness crab scramble, and the open-faced prosciutto + Gruyere toast.
But since I was intrigued by the lemon ricotta pancakes, I opted for the Plow.
dungeness crab scramble.author: Lisa N.
dungeness crab scramble.review:
What a cute little place for breakfast/brunch. There are hooks along the wall for your coats/bags.

I was forewarned about how long the wait can be, so I planned to come here on a Monday morning during my visit. We showed up not long after they opened and were seated right away. 

I was debating between the Plow, the Dungeness crab scramble, and the open-faced prosciutto + Gruyere toast. But since I was intrigued by the lemon ricotta pancakes, I opted for the Plow.

The dish comes with two eggs with choice of house made pork sausage patties, Nueske's bacon, or chicken apple sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes + plow potatoes. I asked for scrambled eggs (which is a rarity for me) and bacon. Every element of the dish was really good, the potatoes were very crispy on the outside, and the pancakes had a nice balance of flavors.

Service seemed a bit slow, but I'll just give them the benefit of the doubt that it was busy. It certainly seemed busy, but I noticed the servers standing around and inattentive numerous times throughout our meal.

Overall, I would recommend this place for the food. Service wasn't terrible, but it wasn't fantastic either. Granted, it was early on a Monday morning. If I find my way back to this spot during a future visit, I'll definitely try one of the other dishes that intrigued me.

dungeness crab scramble.review:
A stellar brunch destination and easily within my Top 3 of all-time, but that wait is as ridiculous as many others have said.

My dungeness crab scramble was superb - loads of fresh crab meat and very balanced on the palate.  The accompanying potatoes were damn tasty as well in their exceptional crispiness.  My brotato opted for the plow and one bite of the lemon ricotta pancake was enough have me sold.  I loved the delicate, fluffy texture complemented by the mild, balanced flavors of citrus and ricotta.  Everything was in harmony and I could easily see myself devouring a full plate of these the next time I'm around.

Definitely try to come around opening time if possible and just be prepared to build your appetite up a fair bit if that doesn't pan out.

dungeness crab scramble.author: Louisa L.
dungeness crab scramble.review:
I finally made it to Plow!

My girl friend had been telling me that I have to try the lemon ricotta pancake at Plow - as a person who's not a fan of pancake, it has to be really good pancake to "wow" me - and Plow did it!

It was a rainy Friday and I got there a little past noon. Because of the rain there was a uniform line waiting outside the door. At first I thought we just line up to get in, but then I figured out you have to tell them your name so you will be on the wait list. Luckily it didn't take me long enough to find out, or else I won't be eating there!

I waited for almost an hour for 3 people. I have to say it's a bit crazy especially it's on a week day. Menu was simple - a variety of brunch items. The three of us decided to get the Plow with homemade sausage (recommended by our waitress), dungeness crab scramble and prosciutto gruyere egg toast. We have also ordered a side of the hk style toast (as a person from hk I felt obligated to order that lol~).

Food came out pretty fast. I got to try everything (except the meat) and everything was so good! Pancake was so good that we ended up ordering an extra side of it. I like how the hk style toast was burnt, which brought out the flavor of the toast and matched perfectly with the condensed milk. And the potatoes! I usually left out the potatoes on brunch dishes but I got to say Plow made some really good potatoes. 

It's hard to say if I ever gonna go back since there are still a lot of brunch places to try out in the city. But if you haven't been to Plow yet, make sure to put them on your to go list!

dungeness crab scramble.author: Tiffany P.
dungeness crab scramble.review:
My favorite underrated brunch place in SF! I feel like there isn't enough hype around Plow, but there is still always a wait. The wait on weekends can be about an hour; I came on my own on a weekday this time and had to wait ~20 minutes.

I had the dungeness crab scramble a while ago and remember loving it. I was really looking forward to getting more of it this recent time but it wasn't on the menu anymore, so I tried a couple new things instead.

1) Buttermilk biscuit with honey butter (5/5) - AMAZING. The biscuit is large, golden brown on the edges, and fluffy inside. The honey butter is essentially butter mixed lightly with honey, but the balance of the creamy saltiness of butter with the sweet was so good.

2) The plow - Combination plate that allowed me to try a lot of different components. Crispy potatoes (5/5) - YES, so crispy on the outside, really well seasoned, but still buttery on the inside. Two overeasy eggs (4/5) - no complaints on the eggs themselves, wish they could have salted it a bit more though. House-made pork sausage (5/5) - really flavorful, it tasted like they mixed in little pieces of onions and herbs into it. Lemon ricotta pancakes (4/5) - actually not quite what I expected, for all that I hear about these pancakes, I was a little disappointed. The pancakes tasted really good, with just a hint of lemon that wasn't overpowering. However, because of the ricotta, the texture of the pancakes is a lot more dense, and I prefer my pancakes fluffier and airy.

A bit out of the way over in Potrero, but the trek is worth it!

My favorite dish was the dungeness crab scramble - not skimpy on the crab meat and you end up getting some in every bite. 

Another signature dish is the "plow" which is like a "best-of" dish that includes two lemon ricotta pancakes, eggs, homemade sausage, and amazing smashed potatoes.

dungeness crab scramble.review:
Crispy potatoes... *drool*.... mmmm, mmmm good!

Yes, there's a ridiculous wait for this place on the weekends (up to two hours), but it's totally worth it! Though I do suggest that you try to hit up this place during the week. The wait time goes down to 30 minutes. 

This cute little place is located right at the corner surrounded by FREE parking. Just hope that you can find a spot! The place is small. Maybe no more than 20 people can sit down at a time. But there are a handful of seats at the counter where you can watch the magic happen.

The menu is small but features locally sourced, high quality ingredients, making even the simplest dishes stand out in comparison to the basic breakfast joint. Choose from a warm mushroom salad to a dungeness crab scramble to chia seed pudding.

The lemon ricotta pancakes are a popular choice. Very fluffy and light with tons of lemon flavor. I love the texture, but the lemon was a bit to strong for my taste. I suggest getting The Plow combo if you want to enjoy these. That way you can get it with two eggs any style and your choice of housemade sausage, Neuske bacon or chicken sausage. Some salt to balance out the sweetness.

My fave is the fried egg sandwich! Two eggs over easy sandwiched by soft, toasted Acme bread with frisee, aioli and cheese with the additional Neuske bacon (everything is better with bacon!). The creamy egg yolk mixes with all the components and makes it finger lickin' good! It also comes with a side of their infamous crispy potatoes!

They're serious about their potatoes. Smashed red potatoes flavored with fresh rosemary and onions and fried to perfection! They managed to find a way for you to have your hashbrowns and country potatoes together as one! You can't find potatoes like this anywhere else!

By the way, if you like scrambled eggs, they know how to do it right. Super light and fluffy yet still creamy. I don't even like scrambled eggs, but I love them here!

Good thing I don't live next to here or else I'd have a muffin top full of crispy potatoes and bacon!

dungeness crab scramble.review:
I've had Plow bookmarked for quite sometime, but since I am an impatient person, he & I have stayed away due to the long waits.  Yesterday morning though, we both woke up early and decided to try our luck.  Parking was pretty easy as we got a space across the street. We arrived about 5 minutes or so after opening and got seated at the last table, which we shared with a couple that got in right before us.  Of course I was afraid that it wasn't going to live up to the hype, but it did!  7x7 released a few months ago the recipe for Plow's lemon ricotta pancakes and I took a stab at making them.  So, naturally I had to get The Plow ($16) & he instantly gravitated towards the Dungeness crab scramble ($17).  The waitress was coming around asking if we wanted coffee with her big pitcher.  Bf said yes and I declined since I'm so picky with coffee.  However, he (usually drinks black) and I (usually gets vanilla lattes and macchiatos) thought the coffee was quite good even with just a little bit of sugar, it was pretty mild.  The coffee was Equator.  

The Plow is two eggs, two lemon ricotta pancakes, house potatoes and your choice of bacon, housemade pork sausage, or chicken apple sausage.  I chose to get the pork sausage.  I was so excited when our plates were finally in front of us.  His crab scramble was plentiful too and had a lot of fresh crab in it.  The creme fraiche was the perfect addition for the scramble.  He loved the house potatoes which was served with his meal too.  The toast it was served with was standard though.  As for my Plow: The eggs, which I chose over easy were perfectly cooked and the yolk just oozed all over once punctured.  The house potatoes were so crispy.  The lemon ricotta pancakes were fluffy, moist, and lemony; they were to die for.  The only thing that killed the breakfast was the sausage.  We were surprised that they were made into patties, and it did have some nice seasoning but they were so dry.  We had to dip the pieces into the egg yolk or pour syrup on them.  Perhaps they didn't put any fat in it and that's why it was so dry?  The dry sausage was really the only thing that killed the breakfast and prevented us from deeming Plow a 5 star breakfast.  

Okay, I think even by SF standards the dishes are a little pricey for breakfast, but they're so worth it.  I'm gonna say a little gripe though, what I don't get is that, they offer free cups of coffee (refills too) for those stuck waiting for a table outside, but will ask around patrons dining if they'd like a cup...thought it may have been free, but was surprised to see the $3.50 charge on the receipt.  Bf was more optimistic than me though (even though he paid) and said, "Well at least they kept filling me up.  Not all places give free refills."  Plow is a solid 4.5 stars.  I can't wait to come back for more lemon ricotta pancakes and house potatoes!

excerpts: "I'll have the Dungeness Crab Scramble please.
dungeness crab scramble.author: Cherylynn N.
dungeness crab scramble.review:
* ~ * ~ * April 22, 2012 * ~ * ~ * 

Our first beer goggle-free date:

Mr. NSS: "Did you want to go to brunch?"
Me: "Sure, let's try Plow; I've been wanting to go there for a while now."

*Arrives at Plow*

Wait staff: "It's going to be a two hour wait."
Mr. NSS: "Two $@$^&*# hours?!?!...uhh, no thanks."

Mr. NSS: "I would never wait THAT long for food; it's just 'food', let's go somewhere else."
Me *thinking*: "Thanks for speaking for the both of us, you jerk!"

Fast forward nearly a year of dating a food snob. 

* ~ * ~ * April 5, 2013 * ~ * ~ *

Me: "Since we both took a day off, let's try going to Plow again?"
Mr. NSS: "Uhhh, the place with a two hour wait?"

Me: "Or, we can go to Red Door Cafe instead where the owner may molest your bootay while we wait in line?"
Mr. NSS: "Actually, Plow sounds PERFECT!"

*Arrives at Plow at 10:30 am*

Me: "I'll get the Fried Egg Sandwich w/ Bacon and one Lemon Ricotta Pancake please."
Mr. NSS: "I'll have the Dungeness Crab Scramble please."

*Our order arrives after 10 minutes*

Mr. NSS *talking with mouth full*: "Dayaum, I never knew crab and eggs could taste THIS good."

*2 minutes passes and Mr. NSS annihilates his crab scramble*

Mr. NSS *eyeing my sandwich*: "Aren't you going to ask if I want a bite?"
Me *reluctantly hands over sandwich*

Mr. NSS *Kills the rest of the sandwich*
Me: "WTF! That was MY sandwich!!!!"

Mr. NSS: "Sorry, you always give me half of your food."
Me: "UGH! You're sleeping with Ms. Lubriderm tonight!"

*Walking back to the car*

Mr. NSS: "So the next time we come to Plow, let's put our name down then come back two hours later ok?"
Me: "Uhhh, WTF has Plow done to my bf?!?!"

YEUP, it's THAT good folks!

OTHER NOTES:
*Expect a 30+ minute wait on weekdays and up to a 2+ hour wait on weekends. NO reservations. 
*Rockstar staff. The waitresses are very friendly and the very efficient kitchen staff churns out 6-7 plates at a time. Very impressive. 
*Get the Fried Egg Sandwich w/ Bacon ($13.50): http://bit.ly/16ICt9c! Simple but top-notch ingredients that's perfectly prepared = AMAZING: http://bit.ly/Y8xCIJ! The potatoes are f*cking delicious so make sure your order comes with this as a side!
*The Ricotta Lemon Pancake ($5) is also a must order! It's like a Lemon Meringue Pie but in a pancake: http://bit.ly/Y8xFEu. SO good!
*Why is the Chinese Breakfast always sold out or never available? It wasn't available on Friday. =(
*Outdoor seating, indoor seating, and counter seating. Sit at the counter and watch where all the magic happens!
*Loved the low-key casual ambiance with TLC, Destiny's Child and Toni Braxton bumping in the background.
*Fairly easy residential street parking.

dungeness crab scramble.review:
I looooooove brunch. If I had it my way I would eat breakfast foods all day. Heard about this place from friends so I'm glad I got to stop by as I was visiting from out of town. We got there around noon on a Sunday and of course, the corner was bustling with people waiting for a table. I can't believe we waited almost two hours to get seated, but I'm proud of us for making it through alive. The moment when your name does get called makes you feel like you've just won the lottery, it's great. We got a table outside which was fine because as other reviewers have said, they provide blankets. The outdoor seating can get a bit awkward with hungry folks staring at you and your food, the likelihood increasing exponentially the closer you are to the main door (which we were right beside). The indoor area is a bit small, but love the decor and atmosphere.  

Maybe it was the hunger (or hanger), but I thought the coffee was really good. My friend had the plow while I had the dungeness crab scramble. The food here did not disappoint. The scramble was really good but it seemed to be a bit watery/mushy? Tried friend's pancakes and they were also good, not too flour-y. Definitely pretty heavy on the lemon, whether you are or aren't into that. Seemed like a lot of folks dining around us were substituting in almond flour pancakes. I also couldn't stop eyeing all the egg sandwiches that were being carried out of the kitchen! Overall had an enjoyable brunch experience at Plow. Would've been slightly better had we not spent a good portion of our day waiting and eating.

excerpts: + Dungeness Crab Scramble: so happy this was on the menu on this visit
:) I never imagined mixing crab with eggs, but it worked so well!
I loved it.
Also came with the potatoes, which I was really happy about because they were well-seasoned, and muy yummy
dungeness crab scramble.author: Ashley N.
dungeness crab scramble.review:
After having Plow on my list of brunch places to try in SF, I was luckily able to convince my boyfriend to get up at an ungodly hour on a Saturday to venture over here with me. Why ungodly? Coming from Berkeley, we knew we had to get up, at the latest, by 06AM in order to make the commute via BART to Plow. You bet I would have been disappointed if this brunch wasn't any good. 

Sadly .. we still didn't make it by 08, hahaha (although to be fair, I was taking a little longer than I needed to get ready). We arrived around 8:45AM probably, and were told it would be a 45-60 min wait for two. There's not much to do around this neighborhood while you wait, sadly. You could walk a few blocks more to meet a freeway overpass (a little scary). There were a few shops around the area, but they were closed since it it was pretty early still. I think you get free coffee inside as you wait (I didn't get it myself .. because I didn't see it until we were already seated..).

We got our seats after about an hour, right at the counter. Pretty cool to watch the chefs pump out Plows like clockwork. It made waiting for our food not as bad! 

BF and I ordered:

+ The Plow (of course): the bacon was good, the potatoes were good, and the eggs (we got them poached) were also good, but the real winner (to me) was the lemon ricotta pancakes!!! 
+ Dungeness Crab Scramble: so happy this was on the menu on this visit :) I never imagined mixing crab with eggs, but it worked so well! I loved it. Also came with the potatoes, which I was really happy about because they were well-seasoned, and muy yummy :) 


Service was fast and efficient as it could be. 
Parking on the street, didn't look like it would be too hard to find, at least on a Sat morning. 
Restaurant is tiny, so yes, if you don't want to wait.. getting here early is important.

excerpts: I came here with a friend on a Saturday and we shared french toast, eggs benedict, and the dungeness crab scramble.

Wow.

dungeness crab scramble.review:
There are so many wonderful things about this place.
First and foremost, the weekend brunch is quite delectable. Everything tastes amazing and you can see it being cooked right in front of you if you sit in the booth. I came here with a friend on a Saturday and we shared french toast, eggs benedict, and the dungeness crab scramble. Everything is tasty, delicious, and every other adjective you can think of for good food. Those crispy potatoes are quite something. So amazing. 
The french toast is served with ricotta cheese and (somehow) totally perfect strawberries. The eggs benedict has some amazing hollandaise sauce too--really lemony. The dungeness crab scramble. Wow. No additional words needed. Simply delicious.

There is a bit of a wait though, but I think it was totally worth it. It's in a cute neighborhood so you can take a bit of a stroll before you eat. Also a stroll after you overeat like I did. Plenty of parking nearby too! That's always a plus. 

The works are also super friendly and nice. Will definitely be coming back here to try other items on the menu. That fried egg sandwich looked amazing.

excerpts: DUNGENESS CRAB SCRAMBLE:
3 stars:
The eggs were again soggy, but the scramble preserved the crab flavor.
dungeness crab scramble.author: Emily C.
dungeness crab scramble.review:
3.5 stars.

THE WAIT: About 40 minutes around 12:30p on a Saturday. 

THE FOOD: 
|| THE PLOW: 4 stars: Lemon Ricotta pancakes were sweet, full of lemony flavor & fluffy. The crispy potatoes were PERFECT, as they were crispy on the outside, yet retained the potato texture and flavor on the inside (I hate when a crispy potato becomes unrecognizable in flavor other than a fried mess)! The pork sausage was good. The scrambled eggs was unfortunately disappointing because it was soggy. 

|| DUNGENESS CRAB SCRAMBLE: 3 stars: The eggs were again soggy, but the scramble preserved the crab flavor. Good dish if you really like crab without much flavoring added to it. 

PARKING: Lots of parking, since it is Potrero Hill, your car will likely be parked at a 45 degree angle. 

ATMOSPHERE: Small restaurant with cute, clean decor (pottery barn-esque). Seating is limited inside and our table of 2 was awkwardly super close to the table next to us (so censor your conversations :P). 

SERVICE: Friendly and with a smile.

excerpts: I've also had their dungeness crab scramble, which was also amazing.
dungeness crab scramble.author: Annie L.
dungeness crab scramble.review:
Plow is simply amazing. I'm never one to wait any amount of time for a restaurant, but I will wait for Plow...even if it was an hour + wait. -_- It's worth it. If it's your first time here, definitely get "The Plow". You can't go wrong with this. The lemon ricotta pancakes are to die for!  I've also had their dungeness crab scramble, which was also amazing.

Service is great. Even though this place is always packed, the employees here are super efficient. While you wait outside, you can always order your drinks/coffees first. Also, sit at the bar area so you can watch all the action.

excerpts:
After perusing a fairly succinct menu, we ended up ordering the Plow, Dungeness crab scramble [ http://flic.kr/p/c2HfrY ], and an order of French toast to go.

And while the French toast was just okay, the lemon ricotta pancakes that came with the Plow were easily the best part of the meal - light on both the lemon and ricotta, they reminded me somewhat of fluffy lemon cream cookies.
dungeness crab scramble.author: Johnny W.
dungeness crab scramble.review:
A bit of clarification first - Plow is indeed not wheelchair accessible, as there are a few steps up into the restaurant. However! They have outdoor seating on nice days, and that IS accessible, albeit requiring that one deal with the slight incline of the hill on which Plow sits.

Showing up around 9am last Saturday, my friend and I were eventually seated after a ~45 minute wait. Part of this was due to having to wait for an outdoor seat though - had that not been necessary, our wait would have been about 15 minutes shorter. After perusing a fairly succinct menu, we ended up ordering the Plow, Dungeness crab scramble [ http://flic.kr/p/c2HfrY ], and an order of French toast to go.

The crab scramble wasn't bad, and most enjoyable when the scramble was eaten along with the accompanying toast. I was slightly turned off by how fishy the dish was though - while it WAS seafood, the taste was far stronger than one would expect of fresh seafood. The crispy potatoes that came as a side of that dish were pretty good though, albeit a bit too salty for my tastes. And while the French toast was just okay, the lemon ricotta pancakes that came with the Plow were easily the best part of the meal - light on both the lemon and ricotta, they reminded me somewhat of fluffy lemon cream cookies.

After all is said and done, with tax and tip, expect the meal to come out to about $20 a person for a single entree. Service is friendly, and while I suppose the local ingredient sourcing is a nice touch, it's never been a make or break factor for me. While I can see myself coming again solely for the pancakes, I doubt it'll be particularly often, or during their busier hours.

excerpts: Tried a bit of the dungeness crab scramble from my other friend's plate, also very good, but a bit too briny-tasting for me.
dungeness crab scramble.author: Evelyn C.
dungeness crab scramble.review:
Delicious. Came here with a couple of friends and their baby; the staff was really accommodating and wrote down our party as 3.5 people. (Note: They don't take parties larger than 6 people due to limited space inside the restaurant.) 

I ordered the soft scramble with hen of the woods mushrooms. It was perfectly seasoned and cooked just right, and served with crispy potatoes and buttered bread. Tried a bit of the lemon ricotta pancake from my friend's plate, and omg, it was amazing. I plan to go back just for those pancakes. Tried a bit of the dungeness crab scramble from my other friend's plate, also very good, but a bit too briny-tasting for me. 

Service was fine. Only downside was the wait. We got there around 10 AM and wound up waiting an hour for a table. But I will say it was worth the wait.

excerpts: Next time I want to try their Dungeness crab scramble sounds soo yum!
dungeness crab scramble.author: Christine W.
dungeness crab scramble.review:
Came here on a Sunday around 10am and had to wait over an hour for a table for 5pm. Come here early or be prepared to wait. My friend said that there is a nice coffee shop up the block called farleys which is good to grab a cup of coffee and chat while we wait. We didn't get coffee this time but looks like most ppl do do this. 

We were seated outside which was fine but it does get chilly out there so bring a jacket. My friend mentioned they supply you blankets is you ask but none of us asked for one. We all just pounded cups of hot coffee to stay warm! 

The most popular item and best entree to get here if it is your first time is to get the plow. Has a little bit of everything! The crispy potatoes, chicken apple sausage, and the lemon ricotta pancakes were oh so yummy! Definitely would recommend this as I am always torn when I go to brunch - do I want sweet or savory? The plow gives you both and you will leave satisfied. 

Overall this is a great brunch spot with flavorful and tasty brunch options. Next time I want to try their Dungeness crab scramble sounds soo yum!

excerpts: I ordered the Dungeness crab scramble, $17.
Didn't like the scramble so much even 'tho
it had chunks of crab in it with sliced asparagus.
The 2 sm slices of Acme bread, fried potatoes were the best part of the breakfast.
My Arnold Palmer, $3.75 was so sour.
I had to add 2 spoons of sugar to it.
Wouldn't order either one again.
Jr. Yelper had a glass of OJ, $3.75 and corned beef hash, $15.
dungeness crab scramble.author: Ry T.
dungeness crab scramble.review:
Hubby took us here for Mom's Day.  Arriving at 9AM, the wait was 1.5 hrs.  So, we idled our time away, waiting... just like all the other folks.
This time, Hubby tried The Plow,$15 and refllls of coffee, $3.50.  He especially liked te homemade sausage patties. lemon ricotta pancakes and fried chunks of potatoes, seasoned with herb, salt/pepper.
I ordered the Dungeness crab scramble, $17.  Didn't like the scramble so much even 'tho it had chunks of crab in it with sliced asparagus.  The 2 sm slices of Acme bread, fried potatoes were the best part of the breakfast.
My Arnold Palmer, $3.75 was so sour.  I had to add 2 spoons of sugar to it.  Wouldn't order either one again.
Jr. Yelper had a glass of OJ, $3.75 and corned beef hash, $15.  Shredded pieces of corned beef with potatoes, 2 slices of bread which were good.

If you have time to kill and wait 1-1.5hrs for a table, I'd vote to have the lemon ricotta pancakes, fried potatoes.  Will have to try to come back on a weekday to try the Chinese breakfast which isn't served on weekends.

excerpts: My only gripe was that my dungeness crab scramble was dominated by the crazy amount of scallions that was in it.
The crab was largely lost in the dish and I found myself picking off some of the scallions just to get a bit of balance.
dungeness crab scramble.author: Victor H.
dungeness crab scramble.review:
This place served up a solid Sunday brunch. I like the decor and thought the ingredients really stood out here. They served one of the best blood sausages that I've had in awhile and the breakfast potatoes were cooked to perfection... crispy and well seasoned. 

My only gripe was that my dungeness crab scramble was dominated by the crazy amount of scallions that was in it. The crab was largely lost in the dish and I found myself picking off some of the scallions just to get a bit of balance.

excerpts: So, we met our friends here for some lemon ricotta pancakes, dungeness crab scramble, and fried soft shell crab sandwich thing.
Originally the waitress said there was no more monkey bread left because we were just inquiring what it is.
Then she came out and told us, of course, we snatched it up!!
So a monkey bread is basically a cinnamon swirl bread inside out.
dungeness crab scramble.author: Stephanie Y.
dungeness crab scramble.review:
Very cute neighborhood brunch spot. We waited for about 15 minutes before getting a table outside on a beautiful Sunday. The tables were so close together, that once one person sits, the other person behind you can't move. So, we met our friends here for some lemon ricotta pancakes, dungeness crab scramble, and fried soft shell crab sandwich thing. Originally the waitress said there was no more monkey bread left because we were just inquiring what it is. Then she came out and told us, of course, we snatched it up!! So a monkey bread is basically a cinnamon swirl bread inside out. Um...when it's nice and warm, it's quite amazing. 

So ... I had the scramble. It was pretty good, definitely a good amount of crab. I did order a side of bacon and it was over cooked. Wayyy too crispy.

excerpts: I'm still thinking about the crispy potatoes and the Dungeness crab scramble two days (a year) later.
dungeness crab scramble.author: Jessica P.
dungeness crab scramble.review:
I'm still thinking about the crispy potatoes and the Dungeness crab scramble two days (a year) later. 

Pork sausage was good, and the lemon ricotta pancakes were good too, but it's that scramble...

what was I talking about before? totally the favorite brunch place. Totally the only brunch place I dream about or think about or compare all other brunch places to. 

Contemplating dinging it a star for ridiculous wait times. like almost 2 hours ridiculous.

excerpts: Lemon ricotta pancakes, almond milk pancakes and the dungeness crab scramble are some of my favorites.
During the week is less of a wait than the weekends, but honestly it's worth the wait.
dungeness crab scramble.author: Leslie S.
dungeness crab scramble.review: Life changing brunch. I eat here pretty much once a week. Lemon ricotta pancakes, almond milk pancakes and the dungeness crab scramble are some of my favorites. During the week is less of a wait than the weekends, but honestly it's worth the wait.

excerpts: Their dungeness crab scramble (with fresh crab meat!) was delicious, as well as the side of crispy potatoes.
dungeness crab scramble.author: Jennifer L.
dungeness crab scramble.review:
Plow continues to be one of my favorite brunch spots in the city.  My friend and I only waited 20-25 minutes for an inside table (chalking it up to people being out of town for the holidays ;p), but we were bracing ourselves for at least a 45 min wait.  The staff was really friendly and timely with their service... as soon as we sat down our cups were filled with coffee!  Their dungeness crab scramble (with fresh crab meat!) was delicious, as well as the side of crispy potatoes.  

Even as we wrapped up our meals and continued to chat, my friend and I never felt rushed to vacate the table.  I really appreciated this because for a place like Plow where there's always a long line, you would think patrons were quickly shuttled in and out in order to accommodate all the hungry customers.  That wasn't the case; We were able to enjoy our catch up session without feeling pressure to hurry, and the staff continued to fill our coffee cups even though it was clear we were done eating.  

For their great service and outstanding, fresh food, I always include Plow on my recommended list of brunch spots in the city, even if the wait can be more than 20-25 minutes!

excerpts: My mom had the Dungeness crab scramble when it was in season and it was good too.
The only negative is the wait.
The line can be long on the weekend.
Just ask for a coffee while waiting.
dungeness crab scramble.author: Lenny C.
dungeness crab scramble.review: I almost always order the Plow with the pork sausage.  My mom had the Dungeness crab scramble when it was in season and it was good too. The only negative is the wait.  The line can be long on the weekend.  Just ask for a coffee while waiting.

excerpts: Love, love, love the Dungeness Crab scramble.
Toast was too hard.
dungeness crab scramble.author: Brenda B.
dungeness crab scramble.review:
The food is delicious but the service is average. 

I've been twice and both times we had to ask several times for creamer or jam or anything else that did not come on the plate were were served.   No coffee refills offered either.  

If you can get past the service, the food is delicious.  My husband loves the plow breakfast.  The homefries are among the best I've tasted.  Love, love, love the Dungeness Crab scramble.  Toast was too hard.  If you get the plow breakfast, trade the home fries for a fruit dish and you won't be sorry.  Homemade sausage is pretty amazing too.

Go early on a weekday and you won't have to wait :)

excerpts: but I'll probably try the dungeness crab scramble along with 5 orders of lemon ricotta pancakes......
dungeness crab scramble.author: Mimi N.
dungeness crab scramble.review: Oh my gawd this place is uh-mazingggg.  I had the fried egg sandwich with bacon, the boyfriend had the plow.  Both were a win.  The eggs had the perfect amount of leaky yolk and the bun..omg...i mean... how fluffy can a bun get?? I wouldn't mind ordering the same items on my next visit but I'll probably try the dungeness crab scramble along with 5 orders of lemon ricotta pancakes......

excerpts: I got the dungeness crab scramble which was delish, and as others have said, the potatoes are awesome.
dungeness crab scramble.author: Lauren M.
dungeness crab scramble.review:
This place had been on my list for a while but my husband isn't a fan of waiting an hour to eat somewhere so we always avoided it. One sunday we were up early enough that I convinced him to go with me. We got there right at 9am and the timing seemed to be good, got busier after that. There were tables outside that were open but it was pretty cold, so we waited for inside. The wait was about 20 minutes or so, didn't seem too bad. 

I got the dungeness crab scramble which was delish, and as others have said, the potatoes are awesome. My husband got the Plow, which is great because you get to try a bit of everything, including the famous lemon ricotta pancakes. My husband isn't a huge lemon fan, but this was just a slight lemon flavor so he (and I) really liked them. The fresh OJ is great too.

Service once inside was quick and I felt the food was worth it. Not sure we'd make it a regular thing considering the wait, but it is a great spot.

excerpts: Then ordered the dungeness crab scramble which turned out to be a little bland on the egg, but the chunks of crab meat was perfect and the egg was not overcooked, so it balanced out.
Homefries that comes with the egg was AMAZING.
Crunchy, well-seasoned, I mean, it was just perfect.
dungeness crab scramble.author: Nitta P. B.
dungeness crab scramble.review: I went there for the first time today for brunch, and god, what an amazing food!!!!! LOVE, LOVE, LOVE everything about this place. The service was great, ambience was awesome, and above all, the FOOD!! We were seated on the counter, I got a pot of jasmine tea and it comes in this cutesy little pot, enough for 1 1/2 cup. Then ordered the dungeness crab scramble which turned out to be a little bland on the egg, but the chunks of crab meat was perfect and the egg was not overcooked, so it balanced out. Homefries that comes with the egg was AMAZING. Crunchy, well-seasoned, I mean, it was just perfect. A friend got their big breakfast plate "The Plow" which also turned out to be amazing. Comes with two eggs, freshly made pork sausage, two ricotta cheese pancakes and potatoes. The pork sausage was very nice and the eggs was done to perfection, enough liquid egg yolk to dip your pancake in! YUM! Another friend got smoked trout salad and that was very nice, too. The beetroot gave the salad a little kick and avocado mashed into frisée was nicely done, the trout tastes great. Ended up paying $60 and it was worth every penny. Very filling and satisfying first experience there. I WILL DEFINITELY be back for more! Their baked egg looks amazing and I shall put that on my list to try next time.

excerpts: We split the dungeness crab scramble and the plow
so we got to try a little of everything.
While the freshly fried potatoes were shatteringly crisp and the sausage was well seasoned the star of the show was definitely the ricotta pancakes.
I saved some of the pancakes for last
but I really should have eaten it all when it first came out.
Sitting on the plate, the pancakes lost some of the lightest and airiness from coming directly off the griddle.
The brunch was really simple, well done and satisfying.
Best yet I completely cleaned my plate but did not feel heavy or fall into a food coma.
All in all it was a great way to start off a Sunday.
As we were finishing up our meal a single diner was seated right next to us
and I don't remember him waiting in line
so this might be an even better call if you are dining alone.
dungeness crab scramble.author: Hieu L.
dungeness crab scramble.review: The average wait time was between 45 minutes to an hour for a party of two which is not bad for showing up after 12pm.  The wait was definitely worth it. We split the dungeness crab scramble and the plow so we got to try a little of everything. While the freshly fried potatoes were shatteringly crisp and the sausage was well seasoned the star of the show was definitely the ricotta pancakes. I saved some of the pancakes for last but I really should have eaten it all when it first came out. Sitting on the plate, the pancakes lost some of the lightest and airiness from coming directly off the griddle. The brunch was really simple, well done and satisfying. Best yet I completely cleaned my plate but did not feel heavy or fall into a food coma. All in all it was a great way to start off a Sunday. As we were finishing up our meal a single diner was seated right next to us and I don't remember him waiting in line so this might be an even better call if you are dining alone.

excerpts: I ordered " the plow " it came with two small lemon ricotta pancakes.
I have to pause and mention that there is a tight team of 3 guys working and one is making ricotta fresh right there on the line.
Talk about high-end pancakes!
One guy is working on the potatoes, one is working on the meats, it is a friendly, swift and delicious team of chefs.

The plow also comes with crispy Neueske bacon, two eggs (I chose over medium) cooked absolutely perfectly, a hash of deep-fried country potatoes which were still soft and buttery inside but nice and crispy on the outside, caramelized onion and bacon tossed together, it was really a step above the norm.
the plow.author: Kelly T.
the plow.review:
I was looking for a quick bite to eat between appointments in the city and in San Rafael and was lucky to find Plow. Breakfast or brunch was on my mind and I saw the positive Yelp reviews at Plow and thought I would check it out and oh my goodness I am happy that I did! 

I ordered " the plow " it came with two small lemon ricotta pancakes. I have to pause and mention that there is a tight team of 3 guys working and one is making ricotta fresh right there on the line. Talk about high-end pancakes! One guy is working on the potatoes, one is working on the meats, it is a friendly, swift and delicious team of chefs. The menu is expansive and they have such unique breakfasts, large portions and such high quality. 

The plow also comes with crispy Neueske bacon, two eggs (I chose over medium) cooked absolutely perfectly, a hash of deep-fried country potatoes which were still soft and buttery inside but nice and crispy on the outside, caramelized onion and bacon tossed together, it was really a step above the norm. 

Everyone works as a friendly well-oiled machine, they all have their pace down and it works wonderfully for all of us. The service is lovely, they don't bother you but they check in with you which is nice, not overt or pushy which many places as packed as this can tend to be. I can't wait to go back.

excerpts: THE PLOW - so much food!
I hope you have a big stomach or you'll be taking left overs.
The pancakes are on the small side, but still packs some great flavors.
The sausages are smaller too, but you honestly don't need more food.
Eggs great.
Potatoes were amazing.
the plow.author: Kevin N.
the plow.review:
Food is on point, but is it worth the wait? 

This place definitely lives up to the hype. The downside being the wait. It's definitely easier to get in with a group of 2. Groups of 4 will be waiting a little longer. You put your name on a list and you have to be there when they call it out. No phone calls, which sucks. We walked around the area and grabbed coffee next door. The coffee shop has games so it wasn't too hard to kill time. 

THE PLOW - so much food! I hope you have a big stomach or you'll be taking left overs. The pancakes are on the small side, but still packs some great flavors. The sausages are smaller too, but you honestly don't need more food. Eggs great. Potatoes were amazing. Crispy and perfect. 

Everyone should try this place at least once! Then you can decide if it's worth it enough to wait in line again.

excerpts: I can definitely see why lines are out the door (even on a weekday) for The Plow!
I have been to The Plow twice, and I definitely had a better experience the second time.
I ordered the plow breakfast, which came with 2 eggs, 2 ricotta pancakes, potatoes, and breakfast meats--pretty much everything you'll ever want or need in the morning.
For breakfast meats, I would highly recommend their homemade pork sausage; I chose the chicken apple sausage the first time, and it definitely wasn't as good.
the plow.author: Sandra S.
the plow.review:
Such a simple and homey brunch place on Potrero Hill! I can definitely see why lines are out the door (even on a weekday) for The Plow! Parking is readily available right outside the restaurant, and it's free for up to two hours. 

I have been to The Plow twice, and I definitely had a better experience the second time. I ordered the plow breakfast, which came with 2 eggs, 2 ricotta pancakes, potatoes, and breakfast meats--pretty much everything you'll ever want or need in the morning. For breakfast meats, I would highly recommend their homemade pork sausage; I chose the chicken apple sausage the first time, and it definitely wasn't as good. The ricotta pancakes were fluffy and the potatoes were super crispy. 

Be aware that this place has crazy lines, and they don't take reservations! We went on a weekday at around 10:30am for 2 people and there was already a 20 minute wait.

excerpts: Since I couldn't choose between salty or sweet, I ordered the plow which gives you the best of both worlds (lemon ricotta pancakes, choice of meat, choice of eggs, and potatoes).
You get your choice of eggs and meat
so I went with scrambled eggs and pork sausage.
The scrambled eggs and ricotta pancake were both very light and fluffy, the pork sausages were decent, and the potatoes were straight up delicious.
the plow.author: Julian Y.
the plow.review:
My friend and I knew that the wait would take awhile judging from the crowd of people chilling near the entrance. We arrived at 1:15pm, and got seated at 2pm. Luckily, there was a coffee shop a few stores down which was very convenient for us to get a coffee while we wait.

We had outdoor seating which wasn't bad at all since it was sunny. Since I couldn't choose between salty or sweet, I ordered the plow which gives you the best of both worlds (lemon ricotta pancakes, choice of meat, choice of eggs, and potatoes). You get your choice of eggs and meat so I went with scrambled eggs and pork sausage. The scrambled eggs and ricotta pancake were both very light and fluffy, the pork sausages were decent, and the potatoes were straight up delicious. A combo of food put into one delicious dish.

The servers are really attentive and your glass of water will never be empty. The friendly servers were a big plus on a Sunday afternoon to finish off my weekend.

I can't wait to explore the other items on the menu next time!

excerpts: Shared a combination plate called "The Plow" and an order of their seasonal french toast (peaches), and it was definitely a good amount of food.
I really like their potatoes!
I don't know what they do to it, but it was sooo delicious!
I don't usually choose potatoes as the highlight of a dish but for this sampler plate, the potatoes definitely were my favorite part.
Would definitely come back to try the rest of the menu or to just order the Plow again.
Definitely thinking about the potatoes again...
the plow.author: Sara T.
the plow.review:
Long wait but delicious! Shared a combination plate called "The Plow" and an order of their seasonal french toast (peaches), and it was definitely a good amount of food. I really like their potatoes! I don't know what they do to it, but it was sooo delicious! I don't usually choose potatoes as the highlight of a dish but for this sampler plate, the potatoes definitely were my favorite part. The lemon ricotta pancakes were also delicious. 

We sat at the outdoor seats, which was fine on a nice day but I would definitely bundle up or dress in layers since SF weather is sometimes unpredictable. It wasn't difficult to flag a server down. Everyone was very friendly!

Would definitely come back to try the rest of the menu or to just order the Plow again. Definitely thinking about the potatoes again...

excerpts: Ordered the Plow which comes with two eggs, two lemon ricotta pancakes, plow potatoes, and
I got the chicken apple sauage which I really liked and the plow potatoes are SOOOO good.
The lemon ricotta pancakes were also SOOOOOO good.
the plow.author: Carol L.
the plow.review:
Oh, Plow... how I waited and waited and waited and wanted so badly to love you. My friends and I came around 10:30am on a Saturday as a party of 5 and waited WAY OVER 2 hours. We were quoted 1.5 hours - 2 hours and called pretty frequently to check in on our table. 

This is the part that irks me the most about my experience.. at one point maybe 1.5 hours in, they told us to come back in 15 minutes. We came back in around 10 minutes and they told us "oh sorry, we just gave your table away". Sorry, but WHAT???? You would think that a place this popular can figure out their reservations and their waiting system but NOPE. So if you come here, you better just wait right outside the restaurant....... They call your name once or twice and if you're not there they just skip right over you even if they tell you to come back at a certain time. Truly unlike anything else I've ever experienced before, but maybe I'm spoiled after being in Chicago and NY for a while now as they have their lines and reservation systems all figured out..

Service was good from one person, but rude from another. Honestly, at this point I was pretty hangry though. So maybe the service wasn't THAT bad, it just came across as horribly rude when we asked for more water and were ignored. Also the host just wasn't pleasant to my party at all. 

Ordered the Plow which comes with two eggs, two lemon ricotta pancakes, plow potatoes, and your choice of house made pork sausage, Nueske's bacon, or chicken apple sausage. I got the chicken apple sauage which I really liked and the plow potatoes are SOOOO good. The lemon ricotta pancakes were also SOOOOOO good. (But was it because I was starving after waiting close to 2.5 hours for a table and the food?) 

I would come back, but I would never wait more than 30 minutes for the food. 3 stars because this restaurant needs to work on their service and their queue, but the food is pretty good.

TL;DR: Wait outside the restaurant otherwise your table will be given away and you'll wait outside forever and be even more starving than you already were.

Also their place is tiny, so if you want to get seated as quickly as possible then come by yourself or with one other person. They have like one or two tables that can accommodate parties over 4 people.

excerpts: The Plow was just as yummy as I remembered.
Their pastry apple bread was solid and a nice prelude to our breakfast.
Unfortunately I always get the same thing when I come here
so I can't speak for much of the rest of the menu.
the plow.author: Kathleen S.
the plow.review:
This place is one of my favorite brunch places in the city! However, it must be on the list of every one else too as the wait here is ridic and I can't do it any longer. I can't wait over 1 hour for those lemon ricotta pancakes and home made pork sausages no matter how delicious they are and how harmoniously they go together.

How do you eat at Plow and not agonizingly have to wait for grub on a weekend? Start waiting in line before they open. I unexpectedly had to work a graveyard shift and would miraculously be in the city semi-awake at 7am on a Saturday so to Plow we went. They don't open until 8am on the weekends (Yelp hours were wrong) so we walked over to Farley's a half block away to get some caffeine and lined up around 7:40 am and managed to get in on the first seating. If you come at 8am, I think that might be too late.

The Plow was just as yummy as I remembered. Their pastry apple bread was solid and a nice prelude to our breakfast. Unfortunately I always get the same thing when I come here so I can't speak for much of the rest of the menu.

excerpts: The Plow" is the obvious go-to brunch meal.
In concloosh- if you can avoid a long wait time, come here and order The Plow!
the plow.author: Catherine T.
the plow.review:
"The Plow" is the obvious go-to brunch meal. A hearty plate filled with two lemon ricotta pancakes, crispy potatoes, choice of protein (I chose pork sausage patties), and eggs! Everything was delicious and service was quick and attentive. 

We waited for two hours and I honestly wouldn't wait again. Looking at the menu it doesn't look like anything else was enticing either. Also sitting at the counter there was this pungent smell that was bothersome.

Luckily we had a pre-snack before eating here so if I was really hangry this rating would've been lower lol.

In concloosh- if you can avoid a long wait time, come here and order The Plow!

excerpts: Get the Plow platter if you're not vegetarian, you can also just get it as a side.
the plow.author: Ayumi W.
the plow.review:
I had the best pancakes I've ever had here: the lemon ricotta pancake is one of a kind and perfect. Get the Plow platter if you're not vegetarian, you can also just get it as a side. I'm still dreaming about how good these pancakes were- not too sweet at all, just like the other reviews noted. 

I had the breakfast sandwich with avocado and potatoes. The potatoes are also delicious!! No wonder this place usually has an incredibly long line. We were really lucky with seating and were seated right away. Definitely don't go with a big group! 

Would love to come here again.

excerpts: We both got The Plow ($17.50)- which basically comes with a little bit of everything!
The potatoes were SO SO good and perfectly seasoned and crispy.
the plow.author: April L.
the plow.review:
I went here for brunch with my friend on a Saturday morning at around 10:30 am. We had heard a lot of hype about this place so we decided to check it out. We were quoted a 1 hour and 30 minute wait time, but we ended up waiting about an hour. I would not come here super hungry (maybe grab a coffee while waiting). 

We both got The Plow ($17.50)- which basically comes with a little bit of everything! The potatoes were SO SO good and perfectly seasoned and crispy. The lemon ricotta pancakes....they were incredibly fluffy and just the right amount of sweet to balance out the savory aspects of the dish. The eggs and apple sausage were also good. I do wish they added a couple more sausages to finish off the dish. 

We also got the Buttermilk Biscuit ($5) while we were waiting for our main dishes, which was a bit dry but the the honey butter helped. 

Overall, I would come here again, but maybe on a weekday when it's not as busy.

excerpts: *The Plow
** ($17.50), recommended to me by my breakfast bud as a sampling of Plow's hit items.
the plow.author: Joyce C.
the plow.review:
IT'S SO WORTH IT.  Do not doubt, believe and be blessed!  Got here at 8:30am on a Sunday and there was already an hour wait.  We went to a neighboring cafe for some coffee while we waited, but the large mug of black coffee on an empty stomach set me up with raging anxiety and nausea by the time we got back (woohoo! Adventure...)

Even with all the shenanigans besetting my poor bod, this meal is by far the best brunch I've had in a looong time.  I ordered **The Plow ** ($17.50), recommended to me by my breakfast bud as a sampling of Plow's hit items.  Eggs, choice of meat (I had chicken apple sausage), crispy potatoes, and lemon ricotta pancakes.  Sounds standard, but oh my god - they are out of this world.

I identify as a huge tater lover, and I was still intrigued by this hype over their potatoes.  Best way to describe it: you know the crispy skin on peking duck?  These potatoes had that kind of delicate crisp to them!  HNGH.  Nom nom.

Their lemon ricotta pancakes are smol, light, and fluffy -- finally, a pancake that doesn't weigh you down!  The sausages were v flavorful and juicy, but not at all greasy - *praise*.  Best of all the parts were so well proportioned to each other!  AMAZING.

Keep in mind I felt all these lovey dovey things towards the food while having an anxiety-crippled appetite, so the food really is THAT good. @Plow, TAKE MY MONEY.  I'll be back.  And you should try waiting for and eventually eating at this place too :3

excerpts: This review is for the dish, THE PLOW.
If you don't order the plow but another dish you can order the potatoes on the side.
The plow was perfect for me, someone who couldn't decide if they wanted eggs, meat, pancakes or potatoes for brunch-
Service is friendly and it's sort  of cool to be able to sit at the counter and watch all the cooks bust out 10 orders of THE PLOW all at once!
the plow.author: Karen H.
the plow.review:
This review is for the dish, THE PLOW. Wow easily hands down in the top 3 brunch dishes I've had in the city.

The potatoes are the best. If you don't order the plow but another dish you can order the potatoes on the side.

You can choose your egg option (scrambled, poached, etc etc), meat options include bacon, house made pork sausage, chicken apple sausage.

I went with scrambled eggs and pork sausage. I did not regret it one bit.... it was delicious. Standard are the potatoes and ricotta pancakes... which are sooo fluffy, soft and good.

The plow was perfect for me, someone who couldn't decide if they wanted eggs, meat, pancakes or potatoes for brunch- I could have them all!!

Parking isn't a problem but THE LINE. It's normally a 2 hour wait so come and put your name down and come back...

Outdoor seating is limited for those with dogs, which can have you waiting longer for an outside table than inside table since most folks prefer either and they do first come first serve.

Service is friendly and it's sort  of cool to be able to sit at the counter and watch all the cooks bust out 10 orders of THE PLOW all at once!

excerpts: We got the plow and the bfast sandwich.
I like the bfast sandwich more.
I will say the lemon pancakes were a standout.
the plow.author: Tina L.
the plow.review:
TIP: There will be a long wait FYI. I recommend going early, putting your name is and walking around to the coffee shops and book store. There is only about 3 blocks of shops, but it is really cute. You can get mimosas while you wait though!

Vibes (5/5): located in an adorable part of town, Plow has outdoor and indoor seating and a great vibe. Biggest reason for coming. 

Food (4.5/5): the food was great, but nothing special. We got the plow and the bfast sandwich. I like the bfast sandwich more. I will say the lemon pancakes were a standout. Very tasty. 

Service (4/5): it was good, nothing standout. 

Would I do back? Yesssssss. I just love the area and this place. 

Ranking for my notes, not for the stars. 
5- Amazing, top of the line- standout 
4- Very good
3- Not good
2- Horrible
1- Very bad

excerpts: As a first timer, I knew I had to get their namesake dish: The Plow ($17.50).
The Plow platter comes with two mini pancakes, but I might need to order a whole side of these to myself next time!
the plow.author: Dianna H.
the plow.review:
Another solid spot for brunch in SF, as long as you're willing to wait. Food is 5 stars but I'm taking away one star for the perpetually long wait.

I've tried to come once before, but when we were told the wait would be around 1.5 hours, my friend and I bounced and ate at a place nearby with a much shorter wait. One year later, I decide to challenge the wait at Plow again.

My friend came around 10:15 on a Saturday to put her name down and was told to check back in 2 hours or so. When the three of us came back around noon, they had already called our name but bumped us to the top of the list. We were seated shortly after that.

I can see why they have such a long wait; it's a small space with seating for maybe 30 people? Definitely don't recommend coming here with a big group.

As a first timer, I knew I had to get their namesake dish: The Plow ($17.50). It comes with two eggs, two lemon ricotta pancakes, Plow potatoes, and your choice of pork sausage, bacon, or chicken apple sausage. I don't know why more brunch places don't offer this, but it's the person brunch platter for people who prefer mostly savory dishes with a small bit of sweet on the side.

I've heard such good things about their lemon ricotta pancakes, so I knew I *had* to try them out. Almost everything was perfect about this platter: the eggs were perfectly scrambled, the potatoes were roasted just right, and OMG THE PANCAKES. They were so light with a nice lemon flavor that wasn't overpowering. The pancakes themselves aren't too sweet so you can control the sweetness with the syrup. The Plow platter comes with two mini pancakes, but I might need to order a whole side of these to myself next time! My only complaint was that the pork sausage wasn't that great.

It was so nice to come here with my girlfriends and catch up on life. So glad I finally got to check this place out, and I will be back!

excerpts: We ordered the Plow, which comes with chicken sausage/homemade sausage patty, eggs, breakfast potatoes
the plow.author: Aileen C.
the plow.review:
After hearing about this place for years as a not-to-miss SF brunch experience, my curiosity of their "amazing" potatoes overcame my weariness of SF lines. There were over 20 tables ahead of me when I put my name down but luckily not everyone is as willing to wait and we were seated after about 45 minutes of waiting. We ordered the Plow, which comes with chicken sausage/homemade sausage patty, eggs, breakfast potatoes and....lemon ricotta pancakes. I will try the homemade sausage patty next time since the chicken apple sausage was fairly ordinary. I will come back to this place just for the lemon ricotta pancakes and breakfast potatoes. Though the pancakes are small, they're just lovely - fragrant and fluffy with a little bit of crispy edge. The breakfast potatoes are amazing - the seasoning is spicy and earthy and they're crunchy on the outside and tender on the inside.

I really enjoyed the smoked salmon eggs benedict - the eggs were perfectly poached and the hollandaise sauce was creamy but not overly heavy. I also appreciated that they toasted the english muffin so the muffin didn't dissolve to mush as we broke open the egg yolk. I was tempted to lick the plate. One interesting thing was that I tasted the vinegar flavour from the cooked egg, which my boyfriend didn't notice so I'm curious if that was a one-off experience.

excerpts: I ordered the plow, which comes with eggs, lemon ricotta pancakes, rosemary potatoes, and your choice of chicken apple sausage or pork sausage patties (but you already knew that) for $17.
I was pleasantly surprised with the lemon ricotta pancakes and the potatoes!
I fell in love with both of those.
The lemon ricotta pancakes were so creamy with a hint of lemon, and the potatoes were super crunchy and had the perfect amount of seasoning.
I never finish my potatoes bc
they are so filling, but I almost finished these!
The thing I was most disappointed in was the meat...
I ordered the pork sausage patties after seeing many yelp photos and I was sad to bite into a dry, flavorless sausage patty!
Maybe next time i'll try the chicken apple sausage.
I also thought the price point was a little high, but hey, we're in San Francisco so anything goes!
the plow.author: Tara A.
the plow.review:
Finalllly tried Plow and it is a solid 3.5 stars from me! I came for a Monday brunch at 12 pm and there was a 45 minute wait for a party of 3. Parties of 2 definitely get seated faster than parties of 3-4.

I ordered the plow, which comes with eggs, lemon ricotta pancakes, rosemary potatoes, and your choice of chicken apple sausage or pork sausage patties (but you already knew that) for $17. I was pleasantly surprised with the lemon ricotta pancakes and the potatoes! I fell in love with both of those. The lemon ricotta pancakes were so creamy with a hint of lemon, and the potatoes were super crunchy and had the perfect amount of seasoning. I never finish my potatoes bc they are so filling, but I almost finished these! The thing I was most disappointed in was the meat... I ordered the pork sausage patties after seeing many yelp photos and I was sad to bite into a dry, flavorless sausage patty! :( Maybe next time i'll try the chicken apple sausage. I also thought the price point was a little high, but hey, we're in San Francisco so anything goes!

excerpts: If you don't know what I'm talking about, it's called "the plow".
the plow.author: Benjamin F.
the plow.review:
I legit think I could write a million 5 star reviews about Plow and it's quality of food. No joke. 

Yesterday was no exception to my other 5 star reviews as it continues to be my favorite plate of brunch food in all the land. If you don't know what I'm talking about, it's called "the plow". Just order it, no further explanation needed. 

The sleeper item on the menu has to be the biscuit. It's flaky, full of butter and just heavenly. 

Be prepared to wait but, wait you will. Otherwise you're a damn fool.

excerpts: I got the plow
so I can have my mix of savory and sweet.
The savory items were fine.
Nothing special... pretty much things you can find anywhere.
the plow.author: Sophia L.
the plow.review:
I sat at the bar for brunch and like that you can watch them cook.

Of course the wait was long. I believe I waited just under an hour since it was a little less crowded during Christmas weekend.

I got the plow so I can have my mix of savory and sweet. The savory items were fine. Nothing special... pretty much things you can find anywhere. About the lemon ricotta pancakes, I love lemon ricotta desserts/pancakes in general. I found these kind of a letdown. The hype isn't real in my opinion, but I seem to be the outlier.

excerpts: I had "The Plow" with a biscuit with honey butter to start.
The biscuit was delicious, it was warm and soft on the inside, and had a crisp crunchiness on the outside.
I had the Plow with over-easy eggs, and pork sausage.
The pork sausage was well made and quite delicious, and a little overflow syrup from the pancakes adds a nice touch.
the plow.author: Tyler T.
the plow.review:
The wait here can be quite long, especially if you come close to noon. It was nearly 2 hours for my table on a Sunday at ~11:30AM. That being said, the food is quite good, but I don't think it's worth the wait.

I had "The Plow" with a biscuit with honey butter to start. The biscuit was delicious, it was warm and soft on the inside, and had a crisp crunchiness on the outside. The honey butter tasted amazing went with the biscuit so well.

I had the Plow with over-easy eggs, and pork sausage. The pork sausage was well made and quite delicious, and a little overflow syrup from the pancakes adds a nice touch. The potatoes were probably my favorite, being nice and crispy and flavorful, and the hot sauce is quite good here as well!

The ricotta pancakes were decent, I think they are better at Kitchen Story which has a smoother and richer taste to them; it's a bit lighter here though I did enjoy the lemon flavor. The eggs were solidly made.

Overall a great brunch place if there was no line, but that line makes it too difficult to be worth it.

excerpts: I ordered the plow, which is two eggs, potatoes, meat and two of their lemon ricotta pancakes.
Boy
oh boy, those pancakes stole the entire show.
They melted in your mouth with twangs of lemon and notes of sweet, melt-in-your-mouth savory flavors which I can only assume is the ricotta.
the plow.author: Emily R.
the plow.review:
Absolutely delicious. This was my first time here and because it is a Thursday and I went at 8am, it wasn't busy at all. I was told by a friend that there is usually a line out the door, and I'm not surprised. 

The general atmosphere fits perfectly with the farm to table vibe, it feels relaxed and familiar. The servers were super friendly and nice. It reminded me of going to a hip friends house for breakfast. I sat at the breakfast bar and was able to see the kitchen staff preparing food, which also gave the sense of cleanliness because I could see any missteps made. 

The food was delicious, it all tasted homemade and fresh. The eggs were creamy and moist. The potatoes had a crisp to them that made me keep going back for me. The pork sausage was slightly spicy, which I am not a fan of, but I was able to try my friend's chicken sausage which had a maple syrup aftertaste to them which was just delicious. I ordered the plow, which is two eggs, potatoes, meat and two of their lemon ricotta pancakes. Boy oh boy, those pancakes stole the entire show. They melted in your mouth with twangs of lemon and notes of sweet, melt-in-your-mouth savory flavors which I can only assume is the ricotta. Combined with the syrup served on the side and a small pat of butter on top, it was heavenly. 

I would absolutely check this place out again and suggest you do the same.

excerpts: I went with the plow because it has their name on it
and I couldn't decide what to go so as mine as we'll try a bit of everything.
Yes the potatoes are dope,
the crispness and the seasoning are lovely, but it loses its flair after a few of them.
It could use a nice a nice homemade sauce: I asked and they have a garlic aioli which is a solid option.
The house made sausage is super juicy and tender, but not the most exciting flavors.
The pancakes are super fluffy and if lemon ricotta is your thing, then you'll love them.
They were a bit overpowering for me, but thankfully the maple syrup helped balance it out a bit.
The plow is all the standard breakfast fare just somewhat better than most other spots.
the plow.author: Jason S.
the plow.review:
(3.5 stars) I wasn't exactly blown away by Plow. Sure it's enjoyable and really beautiful to dine in with high ceilings and lots of natural light, but especially given the wait, the hype, and the price, it left me wanting a bit more. 

I went with the plow because it has their name on it and I couldn't decide what to go so as mine as we'll try a bit of everything. Yes the potatoes are dope, the crispness and the seasoning are lovely, but it loses its flair after a few of them. It could use a nice a nice homemade sauce: I asked and they have a garlic aioli which is a solid option. The house made sausage is super juicy and tender, but not the most exciting flavors. The pancakes are super fluffy and if lemon ricotta is your thing, then you'll love them. They were a bit overpowering for me, but thankfully the maple syrup helped balance it out a bit. The plow is all the standard breakfast fare just somewhat better than most other spots.

excerpts: I ordered the Plow which consists of two lemon ricotta pancakes, potatoes, two eggs, and your choice or bacon/sausage.
It's essentially a sampler.
It was admittedly pretty good.
I especially enjoyed the flavorful, buttery pancakes and the runny eggs.
The potatoes were very well seasoned and the sausage was also delicious.
the plow.author: Alicia L.
the plow.review:
Plow's notoriously long wait coupled with their slow af service makes me not want to come here again.

I ordered the Plow which consists of two lemon ricotta pancakes, potatoes, two eggs, and your choice or bacon/sausage. It's essentially a sampler.
It was admittedly pretty good. I especially enjoyed the flavorful, buttery pancakes and the runny eggs. The potatoes were very well seasoned and the sausage was also delicious. They do their basics pretty well, but I kept biting into something hard with the potatoes.

My friend ordered the Vietnamese pork chop and it was absolutely terrible. I don't know if the chef just messed up but it was so overly salty we could not eat it. I'm pretty sure it was a mishap though because there's no way they'd still be in business delivering this kind of food.

The service isn't good either as there is very limited seating, so you have to wait a looooong time. Additionally, it takes forever to get your food. Set aside a really long dining time slot if you wanna eat here.

Price is 2/5
Food is 3/5
Wait is 2/5
Service is 2/5

excerpts: If you've never been here, be sure to get the Plow.
I usually don't like breakfast foods all that much, but the Plow sure does it for me!
With lemon pancakes, sausage (or bacon), eggs done your way, and potatoes, the Plow has everything you could possibly want!
the plow.author: Kaitlynn L.
the plow.review:
My all-time favorite brunch place! I take friends from out of town here all the time (if they're here in SF during the week). 

Downside - there's usually a long wait. On the weekends, expect to wait up to 2 hours! On the weekdays, the wait is about 30 minutes. Do I think it's worth it? YES 

If you've never been here, be sure to get the Plow. I usually don't like breakfast foods all that much, but the Plow sure does it for me! With lemon pancakes, sausage (or bacon), eggs done your way, and potatoes, the Plow has everything you could possibly want!

If you want to eat something a bit lower calorie, the chia seed pudding is also good, but not very filling. Get that if you're not hungry and something on the side in addition to that if you are.

There's indoor seating and outdoor seating. If you choose outdoor seating, they also offer warm blankets for you to use. The staff here (in my experience) are very kind and friendly. I will definitely be back!

excerpts: The Plow potatoes are delicious, but I wish there was a bit more prosciutto.
the plow.author: Melissa H.
the plow.review:
Finally got to try Plow! I came in around 8:40 on a weekday and was seated immediately, which was lucky. The interior is so small, I can definitely see why the wait is insane on weekends. 

I was really excited for the famous lemon ricotta pancakes, but surprisingly it was my least favorite thing that I tried; the lemon flavor was good and they were pretty fluffy/soft but still not good enough to justify 3 pancakes for $16 in my opinion. 

By far the standout of the meal was the BUTTERMILK BISCUIT! I love baked goods of all types and I've had more than my fair share of biscuits but this is definitely leagues above any other biscuit I've ever eaten in my life. It's SO flakey and buttery and delicious and pairs AMAZINGLY with the honey butter for an ultra decadent experience. The outer crust is so perfect and the inside is so soft and warm; next time I come to Plow I'm literally just ordering like 5 of these biscuits and calling it a day.

I also tried the prosciutto & gruyere toast which was a solid savory option! The Plow potatoes are delicious, but I wish there was a bit more prosciutto. 

Overall, really solid brunch. Definitely get one (or ten) of the buttermilk biscuits.

excerpts: My go-to dish is The Plow, which seems to come with all their top hits.
I forgot what the other dishes are like since I just get the plow for now, but someday I will venture past this dish!
Also, please start using yelp waitlist!!!
Waiting around dogwatch is so painfully especially at 8am when nothing is open!
the plow.author: Michele L.
the plow.review:
Solid 4.5 stars for brunch. 

This place is great for brunch, though the waits can be horrendous. The few times we actually got through the wait we ended up wandering around dogwatch for a couple hours, getting coffee at a nearby coffee shop, browsing the nearby market, walking to the nearby park, and debating whether we should maybe eat somewhere else with a shorter wait (like Aina). We have never regretted holding out though!

My go-to dish is The Plow, which seems to come with all their top hits. The potatoes are some of the best breakfast potatoes I've had - well seasoned - and the sausage, the lemon ricotta pancakes, and the eggs were all amazing!

I forgot what the other dishes are like since I just get the plow for now, but someday I will venture past this dish! Also, please start using yelp waitlist!!! Waiting around dogwatch is so painfully especially at 8am when nothing is open!

excerpts: It seems like the more popular dishes are the Lemon Ricotta Pancakes and The Plow.
The Plow ($17.5) - Two eggs, two lemon ricotta pancakes + plow potatoes with choice of house made pork sausage, Nueske's bacon, or chicken apple sausage.
The Plow ($17.5) - Two eggs, two lemon ricotta pancakes + plow potatoes with choice of house made pork sausage, Nueske's bacon, or chicken apple sausage.
the plow.author: Chelsea W.
the plow.review:
Plow is a pretty good place to get standard brunch fare. If you come early, the wait is really worth it! 

I've always come at opening time around 8 AM and probably wouldn't wait more than 30 min for it, so I highly recommend coming early. 

The menu consists of options like Soft Scrambled Eggs, Sausage & Eggs, Eggs Benedict, etc. It seems like the more popular dishes are the Lemon Ricotta Pancakes and The Plow.

The Plow ($17.5) - Two eggs, two lemon ricotta pancakes + plow potatoes with choice of house made pork sausage, Nueske's bacon, or chicken apple sausage. I ended up getting the Annie's Almond Flour Pancakes since it was GF which tasted great! The chicken apple sausage was also pretty good too. I had a side of fruit which cost a little more, but also tried the potatoes and they were really delicious

Plow stands out because of it's simple, yet delicious and quality ingredients. It does run on the expensive side though.

excerpts: The food was incredible- everyone at my table ordered "The Plow" - lemon ricotta pancakes, potatoes (highlight of the meal!!), eggs, and choice of meat.
the plow.author: Hannah O.
the plow.review:
Came here on a Sunday morning with 4 friends- had roughly an hour wait but there are cute shops nearby to peruse while waiting. The food was incredible- everyone at my table ordered "The Plow" - lemon ricotta pancakes, potatoes (highlight of the meal!!), eggs, and choice of meat. I subbed my pancakes for the seasonal pumpkin spice pancakes.

Beautiful atmosphere, incredible food, and lovely service. Will definitely be back here anytime I'm back in SF!

excerpts: I ordered the fried egg sandwich and the plow with chicken apple sausage.
Potatoes were nicely crispy on the outside, egg was perfectly fried, bacon was cooked just right, orange juice was small but refreshing, and pancakes were fluffy!
I was satisfied with my meal, and it made the two hour wait worth it!
I also feel that over the years, their recipes have improved and portions are not as big as they used to be, which is what I prefer.
the plow.author: Andrea T.
the plow.review: I ordered the fried egg sandwich and the plow with chicken apple sausage. Potatoes were nicely crispy on the outside, egg was perfectly fried, bacon was cooked just right, orange juice was small but refreshing, and pancakes were fluffy! I was satisfied with my meal, and it made the two hour wait worth it! I also feel that over the years, their recipes have improved and portions are not as big as they used to be, which is what I prefer.

excerpts: I would highly recommend the Plow ($17) where you are able to experience this savory delight w/ bacon (also fried super well), your choice of eggs and sweeten your taste buds with the lemon ricotta pancakes.
These pancakes live up to its hype and is worth getting.
If you're looking for something sweet stick to the lemon ricotta pancakes.
the plow.author: Christina G.
the plow.review:
Pro tip: if you come here for brunch on a weekend be prepared to wait 1-2 hrs. Bring a coat because it's SF weather and you'll freeze waiting outside (the sun shines on the opposite side of the street) and so you can opt to eat outside and expedite your wait time. 

If you love breakfast potatoes this quite possibly may be the best in town. The potatoes here are roasted and I'm guessing flash fried to create an extra crispy texture. 

I would highly recommend the Plow ($17) where you are able to experience this savory delight w/ bacon (also fried super well), your choice of eggs and sweeten your taste buds with the lemon ricotta pancakes. These pancakes live up to its hype and is worth getting. They have a strong lemon taste and are extra fluffy. 

We also got the French roast and I WOULD NOT recommend this dish. The French toast wasn't sweet, it was soggy in all the bad ways and the stuffing inside of it was bland. Even when we tried to drench the French toast in maple syrup it did not taste good. If you're looking for something sweet stick to the lemon ricotta pancakes.

excerpts: Get the PLOW BREAKFAST PLATE!
Like... don't even think twice about it.

the plow.author: Shayla B.
the plow.review:
So... are YOU ready to plow into some total and utter goodness?! Get them forks and and knives ready people! On your mark... geeeeeet set... aaaand PLOOOW!

Ugh. You know, I don't often put on the stank face. But THIS meal that I had at Plow... yeah, that made me do it. Food was so damn good that I had to put on my stanky face. Like ooooh mah GAAAAWD! Why oh WHYYY was this food just so flippin' GOOD?! Mm, mm, mm! I couldn't tell ya... Naw, naw, naaaaw... now wait. I CAN tell you, and I will. 

First things first; YOU my dear... you need to wait. Yep. Just do it. Keep yourself occupied with the Yelp to make the time go by faster. I'll tell you a little secret though... if you come solo, you won't have to wait as long. I know people don't really like to dine by themselves, but if time is a major issue, then this is a major option. If you don't wanna do that, you'll be looking at wait times of up to 2 hours long! But don't fret... that's what your waiting buddy is for, right? It's worth it. It IS... WORTH... the WAIT!
