The Lemon Ricotta pancakes were ok
the plow.author: Belinda C.
the plow.review:
Talk about the early bird gets the worm.  Well, let's apply that phrase to Plow.  We got here around 10 am and we had to wait an hour for a table.  They print a new menu everyday, so it's great to see how they change things up.  So after waiting for an hour my friend and I studied the menu inside out and already knew what we were going to order when they seated us.   So here's what we ordered

The plow:  the plow has two eggs (any style you want), two lemon ricotta pancakes, potatoes or sausages (don't get the pork sausage).   This was a pretty decent size order. However, i wasn't completely impressed by this dish because i was disappointed in the pork sausage. it was a little too chewy for me. The Lemon Ricotta pancakes were ok, it did have a lot of lemon flavor, but it wasn't as fluffy as i hoped for.   

Prosciutto and gruyere toast-  this dish came with potatoes.  My friend loved the potatoes, but i felt it was too dry.   We actually found a hair in this dish, but we just took it off and let it go, we waited an hour for food, we didn't want to wait anymore for it to be sent back to the kitchen.  This dish turned out pretty good.  I loved prosciutto, so anything with prosciutto is perfect. 

Overall,the service was great, next time i'll get here early so that we didn't have to wait until noon for food.  I did hear that if you have a group of 6 they can't seat you, so you have to break up your group.

excerpts: The plow platter, so delicious.
the plow.author: Joey N.
the plow.review: The plow platter, so delicious. The lemon ricotta pancakes are the go to. Homemade sausage is just okay, i'd just get stacks of that pancake! - @joeyngoy

excerpts: I had the Plow breakfast.
Everything cooked/prepared perfectly.
Good eggs and bacon.
The pancakes were really good.
the plow.author: Ryan B.
the plow.review:
Had a great weekday brunch here this week. 

I had the Plow breakfast. Everything cooked/prepared perfectly. Good eggs and bacon. The pancakes were really good. The potatoes are out of this world good. 

Very responsive service, inviting space.

excerpts: I always order the Plow, which comes with two eggs, choice of proteins, potatoes, and the lemon ricotta pancakes.
I think this is just the perfect amount of food and on the borderline of feeling bloated for me.
Seriously everything they make though is amazing, especially the pancakes.
I absolutely love lemon-y things
so it's so bomb.
I know the pancake and potato recipe is online so
the plow.author: Janet H.
the plow.review:
Oh, Plow... my favorite brunch spot in SF.

Even though it's my favorite, solid brunch spot, I rarely eat here because of long lines and I value my precious sleep time on weekends. No matter what, it's always at least an hour wait, unless you get here at opening (I assume).

I always order the Plow, which comes with two eggs, choice of proteins, potatoes, and the lemon ricotta pancakes. I think this is just the perfect amount of food and on the borderline of feeling bloated for me. Seriously everything they make though is amazing, especially the pancakes. I absolutely love lemon-y things so it's so bomb. I know the pancake and potato recipe is online so one day I shall make it!

Also, you know when Plow is delicious when people wait in the rain, with no overhang. That's commitment.

excerpts: but The Plow with potatoes, lemon ricotta pancakes, homemade sausage, and two sunny side eggs were exactly the way I wanted to start off my Sunday.
My friend's eggs benedict with spinach and mushrooms was also super delicious.
I will definitely come again!
Especially since that 18th st strip is hustlin and bustlin with up and coming restaurants.
the plow.author: Annie L.
the plow.review:
Not sure what else I can do to add to the stellar reviews, but damnnnnn Plow potatoes are out of this world. These made the 7x7 list a couple years ago, and while I was determined to finish that list, I never made it to Plow due to the inconvenience of its location. But now, I've discovered 22nd st Caltrain, which is only 15 minutes walking distance away. I came around 12PM and got seated around 1:30PM. 

The wait is ridiculous.... they dont accept parties larger than 6, primarily because of their small space, but also because that party of 6 would wait FOREVER. I suggest coming in small groups of 1 or 2, 3 or 4 are max but you'd probably be waiting awhile. 

Though, the food here was delicious. There is a Philz quite close by, but of course you could make it easy on yourself and just order some coffee from Plow while waiting. It was worth it to me, not sure if I was starving but The Plow with potatoes, lemon ricotta pancakes, homemade sausage, and two sunny side eggs were exactly the way I wanted to start off my Sunday. My friend's eggs benedict with spinach and mushrooms was also super delicious. I will definitely come again! Especially since that 18th st strip is hustlin and bustlin with up and coming restaurants.

excerpts:
THE PLOW 5/5
Their signature plate with 2 eggs, meat (choice of pork sausage patties, bacon, or chicken apple sausage), potatoes, and 2 small but amazing lemon ricotta pancakes!
the plow.author: Poy W.
the plow.review:
A delicious place for brunch in SF! It's American with a hint of Chinese influence. You can see it in their menu with specialities like Chinese breakfast and Hong Kong Style brick toast.

I came here on a Wednesday at 10:15 am and the place was already packed for brunch. It's very small - no wonder the wait is over an hour on weekends. Luckily, my group of 4 only waited maybe 15-20 minutes for a table outside. Although it's chilly outside at this time of year, they offer blankets to keep you warm (but no heaters). The waiters are friendly and despite being outside, they came out often to see if we needed anything and to fill our waters. 

THE PLOW 5/5
Their signature plate with 2 eggs, meat (choice of pork sausage patties, bacon, or chicken apple sausage), potatoes, and 2 small but amazing lemon ricotta pancakes! It's a great choice if you're looking for a taste of their famous pancakes but want a heartier breakfast. 

OPEN-FACED PROSCITTO + GRUYERE TOAST 3.5/5
I love anything with proscuitto so this was a must try, but it didn't quite live up to expectations. It's more on the healthy side, with a perfectly runny egg atop lot of frisee, parsley, one slice of proscuitto, and cheese. In my opinion, it could have used more meat to balance out the greens. I would probably pass on this next time. 

HONG KONG STYLE TOAST 1/5
It's $4 for brioche bread covered with condensed milk which just feels like a trap for non-Asian people LOLOL. Just find a dessert place with brick toast next time. 

Overall, the ambiance and food was good. I would come here again!

excerpts: The plow is a great choice if it's your first time here.
You get to try a little of everything
and I had some leftovers to bring home.

I ordered the plow with:
- Over medium eggs: Crispy whites with slightly runny yolks!
I've started ordering my eggs over medium ever since I've had them at Plow.
- House made pork parties: I was disappointed that the pork patties were dry.
Eat them with your egg yolks and some hot sauce to make up for the dryness.
- Plow potatoes:
So crispy and well seasoned.
Everything you'd hope for in breakfast potatoes.
the plow.author: Charlene E.
the plow.review:
Plow wasn't anything mind blowing, but pretty tasty nonetheless!

The plow is a great choice if it's your first time here. You get to try a little of everything and I had some leftovers to bring home. I ordered the plow with:
- Over medium eggs: Crispy whites with slightly runny yolks! I've started ordering my eggs over medium ever since I've had them at Plow. 
- House made pork parties: I was disappointed that the pork patties were dry. Eat them with your egg yolks and some hot sauce to make up for the dryness. 
- Plow potatoes: So crispy and well seasoned. Everything you'd hope for in breakfast potatoes. 
- Lemon ricotta pancakes: The right amount of lemon/tartness. Would consider sharing a full order of these if I ever returned. 

Service here is great, everyone is friendly (despite how busy they are) without being overbearing. Plow was definitely satisfying, but not sure that it's worth waiting hours to try. I came here on a weekday around 11am and waited about half an hour for a table. Worth returning to, but there are other brunch spots I want to try before coming back!y

excerpts: The plow comes with eggs (your preference on cooking style), sausage patties, house potatoes and two mini lemon ricotta pancakes.
Sadly they sold out of biscuits when we sat down.
The lemon ricotta pancakes are delish!
Soft fluffy puffs of pancake goodness with a tart zing of lemon.
The ricotta cuts the sweetness from the pancakes and syrup giving it a nice balanced flavor profile.
I really liked them, they were the perfect size.
My bf really liked the flavor of the sausage patties.
The eggs were sunny side up and cooked perfectly.
Runny yoke but crispy edges
just the way I like mine cooked.
I really enjoyed the house potatoes.
Some days you just feel like hardy chunks of potatoes versus crispy hash browns.
The potatoes were seasoned well great flavor didn't need any additional seasoning.
Nice and fork tender with a little crispy potato skin outside.
I devoured my potatoes.
Let's not forget my breakfast sandwich!
Two fried eggs, aioli, frisée, no cheddar for me, sandwich between two toasted Acme buns.
Delicious!
With a good side of house potatoes.
When you bite into it, the egg bursts and you get the nice runny yolk all over your sandwich.
Added a little hot sauce and it was perfection.
Loved the refreshing crisp of the frisée.
The bread was fresh and soft.
the plow.author: Karen H.
the plow.review:
Come early! I'll repeat come early! The wait is crazy long here. At least an hour to 1.5 hours. We came on a Saturday afternoon for brunch before we left SF. Didn't end up getting seated until around 2. As long as you get your name on the list before closing at 2pm they will feed you! 

They have indoor and outdoor seating we chose whatever came first. They do offer blankets for those seated outside. Luckily we got a seat inside very close quarters. They also some bar seating. Service was great, they cleaned tables quickly to keep the lines moving. Waitress was really sweet and was quick with our order. We were starving by the time we sat down. My BF went with the "plow" basically a little of everything. I went with their breakfast sandwich which comes with a side of house potatoes. The plow comes with eggs (your preference on cooking style), sausage patties, house potatoes and two mini lemon ricotta pancakes. Sadly they sold out of biscuits when we sat down. The lemon ricotta pancakes are delish! Soft fluffy puffs of pancake goodness with a tart zing of lemon. The ricotta cuts the sweetness from the pancakes and syrup giving it a nice balanced flavor profile. I really liked them, they were the perfect size. My bf really liked the flavor of the sausage patties. The eggs were sunny side up and cooked perfectly. Runny yoke but crispy edges just the way I like mine cooked. I really enjoyed the house potatoes. Some days you just feel like hardy chunks of potatoes versus crispy hash browns. The potatoes were seasoned well great flavor didn't need any additional seasoning. Nice and fork tender with a little crispy potato skin outside. I devoured my potatoes. Let's not forget my breakfast sandwich! Two fried eggs, aioli, frisée, no cheddar for me, sandwich between two toasted Acme buns. Delicious! With a good side of house potatoes. When you bite into it, the egg bursts and you get the nice runny yolk all over your sandwich. Added a little hot sauce and it was perfection. Loved the refreshing crisp of the frisée. The bread was fresh and soft. The aioli added great flavor and moisture to the bread. 

Overall a great food experience. I'll be honest not worth the hour wait to get in. Really great service worth trying if you haven't been. But do come early or plan on putting your name on the list then coming back.

excerpts: My friend and I split the plow, and added an extra lemon ricotta pancake on the side.
The plow comes with 2 eggs, 2 lemon ricotta pancakes, plow potatoes, and the choice of pork sausage patties, bacon, or chicken apple sausage.
We ended up sticking with the Nueske's bacon.
The eggs and bacon were good, but what really made the meal was the lemon ricotta pancakes and the plow potatoes.
The plow potatoes were made to perfection..the perfect amount of crispiness and seasoned well.
Honestly the best potatoes I've had in SF.
the plow.author: Jackie C.
the plow.review:
A friend and I do weekly breakfast catch-up sessions, and decided to check out Plow one week. We went on a weekday, so there was no wait and were able to get seated immediately. It's located in Dogpatch, and the interior has so much light with their large windows (which I absolutely love!). My friend and I split the plow, and added an extra lemon ricotta pancake on the side. The plow comes with 2 eggs, 2 lemon ricotta pancakes, plow potatoes, and the choice of pork sausage patties, bacon, or chicken apple sausage. We ended up sticking with the Nueske's bacon. The eggs and bacon were good, but what really made the meal was the lemon ricotta pancakes and the plow potatoes. The lemon ricotta pancakes were so light and fluffy, and had the right amount of lemon ricotta taste. It also wasn't too sweet, which I really liked. The plow potatoes were made to perfection..the perfect amount of crispiness and seasoned well. Honestly the best potatoes I've had in SF. The amount was perfect for my friend and me, and we were both happily stuffed.

Plow is on the pricier side for breakfast/brunch, but also pretty typical pricing for SF. The service was great. They were quick to fill us up on our coffee and ask if we needed anything. I would definitely come back here as long as there isn't too long of a wait :)

excerpts: For food we got the Plow and the chicken tinga.
the plow.author: Wendan L.
the plow.review:
Plow is another one of those trendy SF brunch spots with impossible lines. I've tried to come here several times before but always gave up because the lines are just too long. The last time I was finally determined enough to eat there that I was willing to wait. Put our name down, walked around the neighborhood, got some beverages at a little shop nearby, and came back to be seated. The space is really bright and airy and pretty, but it was so hot on the day we went (which is rare for SF) and we sat inside where it was really stuffy and we were sweating the whole time. We could have waited longer for an outside table but I didn't really feel like it so we just suffered through the heat.  

We got 2 mimosas to cool down, one orange and one grapefruit (I love grapefruit so I was really glad they had it!). For food we got the Plow and the chicken tinga. Everything tasted delicious, including the lemon ricotta pancakes that was so highly rated. However I wasn't blown away by anything, and I'm not sure if it was worth the long wait. 

The service was just ok. The hostess was super nice, but our server was kind of disgruntled and not very friendly. Overall I'm glad I had the chance to eat here but I don't know if I would be come again given the wait time.

excerpts: Ordered "The Plow" and really enjoyed it.
the plow.author: Joseph L.
the plow.review:
Woke up at 7am on Memorial Day weekend to try this place out. Ordered "The Plow" and really enjoyed it. Everything is on point and the servers are very friendly.

And as you know, the down side of this place is it gets crowded. So def try to come at weird hours to avoid the line.

excerpts: I've pretty much tried everything on their menu but my favorites are soft scrambled eggs, the plow or French toast (toppings vary by season) and of course lemon ricotta pancake are delicious!
the plow.author: Iryna P.
the plow.review: This place is so charming and quaint, and the food is always on point. If you get there before 8am on weekday you can get seated within 20 minutes otherwise be prepared to wait at least an hours during their busy time. But it's still worth it. I've pretty much tried everything on their menu but my favorites are soft scrambled eggs, the plow or French toast (toppings vary by season) and of course lemon ricotta pancake are delicious!

excerpts:
Highlights: 
Buttermilk biscuit with honey butter - delicious, though mine was a touch overcooked
The Plow - good mix of stuff, including perfectly prepared eggs, delicious chicken apple sausage, and great little lemon ricotta pancakes.
the plow.author: Dave R.
the plow.review:
This place is rock solid....you figure a restaurant with 2+ hour waits for brunch is solid, and this doesn't disappoint.  
Highlights: 
Buttermilk biscuit with honey butter - delicious, though mine was a touch overcooked
The Plow - good mix of stuff, including perfectly prepared eggs, delicious chicken apple sausage, and great little lemon ricotta pancakes. 

Coffee was good but not great.

excerpts: The Plow (their namesake dish) makes sure you get hooked up with their famous lemon ricotta pancakes AND some potatoes and sausage/bacon!
The Plow is hefty on its own, so I like to split it with something smaller (like the breakfast sandwich).
Are you the kind of person who is skeptical about ordering non-meat foods?
the plow.author: Amy J.
the plow.review:
My Plow review is long overdue, tried this spot over a year ago and it's still at the top of my SF brunch spots list (I am willing to come back here for brunch every damn time). 

Plow is like the boy next door: no flashy gimmicks, only wholesome happiness. Everything on the menu is pretty classic brunch fare. My biggest struggle when brunching is having to choose between sweet and savory, so if that's something you go through too, fear not! The Plow (their namesake dish) makes sure you get hooked up with their famous lemon ricotta pancakes AND some potatoes and sausage/bacon! The Plow is hefty on its own, so I like to split it with something smaller (like the breakfast sandwich). Are you the kind of person who is skeptical about ordering non-meat foods? Fear not, the aioli in the breakfast sandwich transforms the egg in such a way that you will forget you even need meat! 

The biggest downside is the wait- this is a pretty popular spot so if you come at any normal brunch time it'll be something close to an hour. I've come about thirty minutes from closing and there was still a fifteen minute wait. But if you haven't been here before and are a fan of simple fare, you won't be disappointed.

excerpts: Get "the plow" with the Apple sausage and you will not be disappointed.
the plow.author: Elena H.
the plow.review: First place I went when I got to SF. Get "the plow" with the Apple sausage and you will not be disappointed. The lemon ricotta pancakes on the side are very light fluffy and full of flavor. Delicious place !

excerpts: I ordered the plow: two eggs, two lemon ricotta pancakes, potatoes, and chicken apple sausage.
The food came out quick and it was the perfect portion.
The potatoes were well seasoned, eggs were slurped and gone in seconds, and the pancakes were so fluffy.
Def try the pancakes because the hint of lemon got me hooked.
I typically don't like maple syrup because of how sweet and thick it is but the syrup it came with was really good.
The sausage tasted just okay tho.
the plow.author: Ying Z.
the plow.review:
LOVED this place!

I ordered the plow: two eggs, two lemon ricotta pancakes, potatoes, and chicken apple sausage. The food came out quick and it was the perfect portion. The potatoes were well seasoned, eggs were slurped and gone in seconds, and the pancakes were so fluffy. Def try the pancakes because the hint of lemon got me hooked. I typically don't like maple syrup because of how sweet and thick it is but the syrup it came with was really good. The sausage tasted just okay tho. It wasn't anything special. 

The wait was no joke. They gave us a 1.5 wait time at noon and we were seated close to 2pm. But the staff was nice so I can't imagine them turning people away. 

TIP: come early to avoid the long wait

excerpts: The Plow Plate satisfied all my brunch cravings!
the plow.author: Lucia L.
the plow.review:
The Plow Plate satisfied all my brunch cravings! Fluffy lemon ricotta pancakes + crispy garlicky potatoes + eggs your way + choice of meat is THE ultimate brunch plate in my book. You can bet I did not leave a single crumb on my plate lol. 

I got my eggs poached and chose the homemade pork sausage as my protein option. My eggs were a bit overdone but the sausage was bomb with the addition of fennel in it. A little dry so I'd probably try something else next time. But oh my those mini lemon ricotta pancakes were lifee. There will definitely be a wait for a table but it is worth!!!

excerpts: The plow is my favorite; 2 eggs, choice of meat, lemon ricotta pancakes, and potatoes.
the plow.author: Tuuyen N.
the plow.review: Favorite brunch spot. It's a small restaurant with limited seating, so come prepared to wait. The plow is my favorite; 2 eggs, choice of meat, lemon ricotta pancakes, and potatoes.

excerpts: He was a good sport about sharing The Plow with me.
the plow.author: Yi Z.
the plow.review:
I was so excited for my Tuesday morning breakfast at Plow that I could barely sleep the night before. See, I've had this place bookmarked on Yelp for longer than I can remember and every so often, in some obscure conversation, someone would mention how wonderful the brunch is at Plow. I'd listen with hunger and envy. I'd get motivated to try to find someone who would be willing to get up at the crack of dawn with me. And I'd be disappointed when my friends laughed at my suggestion of eating that early.

Fast forward to today, March 7, 2017. He was willing to meet me at Plow at opening time. He might be a keeper for that reason alone. When I got there, we sluggishly greeted each other; both of us were still in a sleepy daze.

We were one of the first to get seated and we browsed the many tasty options on the menu. He was a good sport about sharing The Plow with me. With two eggs, two lemon ricotta pancakes, plow potatoes, and bacon, it was a good amount for a weekday breakfast. We also ordered the jiggly coconut mochi cake.

It was all excellent. Our eggs over easy were cooked perfectly with beautiful runny yolks. The pancakes had a fluffy texture with a bit of refreshing lemon flavor. The bacon and potatoes were crispy and flavorful. The mochi cake was sticky and filling in a great way.

I'll have to come back another day to try some other items on the menu. Next Tuesday at 7am, anyone?

excerpts: The Plow was not bad.
The pancakes were unique, fluffy, sweet and delicious.
The scrambled eggs were cooked just right and not overcooked.
The salad seemed not to be too fresh, but the potatoes are said to be quite good.
The bacon is average.
the plow.author: Kimberly H.
the plow.review: The wait is usually long, and there is seating both inside and outside. There is a bus stop immediately in front of the restaurant, which may affect whether eating outside is desired. The Plow was not bad. The pancakes were unique, fluffy, sweet and delicious. The scrambled eggs were cooked just right and not overcooked. The salad seemed not to be too fresh, but the potatoes are said to be quite good. The bacon is average.

excerpts: Yes, the lemon ricotta pancakes are exactly as good as everyone says they are, and yes, the plow is the perfect meal to try everything people on Yelp rave about.
I also got a side of the biscuit w/ honey butter.
The two pancakes they serve with the plow barely amount to the size of one normal pancake.
I just waited in line for 2 hours.
I'm H U N G
the plow.author: Patricia K.
the plow.review:
I came here last weekend for the pancakes and was not disappointed. Yes, the lemon ricotta pancakes are exactly as good as everyone says they are, and yes, the plow is the perfect meal to try everything people on Yelp rave about. I also got a side of the biscuit w/ honey butter. #worthit

Will I be coming back here in the near future though? Probably not, unless I find some magical time when the wait isn't two hours longs. Minus 1/2 a star for the ridiculous amount of time I had to invest for this experience and another 1/2 for the tiny pancakes. Yes, they are delicious, and that is exactly why I want more! The two pancakes they serve with the plow barely amount to the size of one normal pancake. I just waited in line for 2 hours. I'm H U N G R Y. 

All that said, there are arguably better places in the city for pancakes that have shorter wait times. I'll be there most weekends instead.

excerpts: The menu gives you a good selection of food and drinks depending on what you're craving and from Yelp reviews we saw that things most noted were probably their lemon ricotta pancakes and their house potatoes so my boyfriend opted for the Plow which gave him both the pancakes, potatoes, and eggs
and I got their breakfast sandwich with potatoes.
And I never really had lemon ricotta pancakes before and theirs definitely taste strongly of lemon flavor, but I wasn't blown away by them.
Overall, both dishes were finished and we were pretty satisfy with everything, but I don't know if I would come here again for brunch.
There are a bunch of brunch places around San Francisco and I want to explore them.
the plow.author: Venus L.
the plow.review:
The wait is ridiculous here. If you want to eat in less than an hour then I suggest coming here right when they open because otherwise you are going to be waiting for quite a while. My boyfriend and I got here around 1016am and the estimated wait time was 1.5-2 hours. After the initial hour pass, the worker said it was going to be another half an hour possibly for a table... it ended up being another full hour and thank god my boyfriend knows me so well because the hangry side of me was about to come out and reek havoc among SF. 

I don't want to say parking here is super easy because if you come on a weekday then it is time limited and some spots are metered, however, I guess my boyfriend was blessed this past Sunday because we were able to find parking across the street right away. 

The menu gives you a good selection of food and drinks depending on what you're craving and from Yelp reviews we saw that things most noted were probably their lemon ricotta pancakes and their house potatoes so my boyfriend opted for the Plow which gave him both the pancakes, potatoes, and eggs and I got their breakfast sandwich with potatoes. The food did come pretty quick which was nice because I was starving by the time we sat down. 

So... breakfast sandwich was pretty bomb. I'm not usually a fan of runny eggs, still not, but it was under the bun and I ate it and it exploded and it was very yummy with the rest of the sandwich so I cannot complain. The potatoes were cooked very crispy, but they don't really have a sauce for it outside of ketchup and hot sauce so I didn't find much flavor with it. And I never really had lemon ricotta pancakes before and theirs definitely taste strongly of lemon flavor, but I wasn't blown away by them. Overall, both dishes were finished and we were pretty satisfy with everything, but I don't know if I would come here again for brunch. There are a bunch of brunch places around San Francisco and I want to explore them.

excerpts: After having waited for so long, and unsure when I would have the patience to do so once again, I decided to order their "all-inclusive" offering - 'The Plow.'
I had mainly heard their potatoes and pancakes were to die for, and 'The Plow' offered both.
It was a good brunch (turned late lunch after the wait), but definitely not worth $17 and the 2 hours my stomach was calling out for food.
the plow.author: Vivian N.
the plow.review:
Tl;dr: Not worth the 2-hour wait. 

After years of wanting to sample the highly lauded Plow, I finally took the leap this past weekend and waited the 2 hours for brunch. 

We put our name down at 11:30 and aimlessly wandered the hills of Potrero Hill until, at long last, our name was called around 1:30. It was a chilly day and we were seated outside, but they provided lap blankets which was a nice touch. 

After having waited for so long, and unsure when I would have the patience to do so once again, I decided to order their "all-inclusive" offering - 'The Plow.' I had mainly heard their potatoes and pancakes were to die for, and 'The Plow' offered both. It was a good brunch (turned late lunch after the wait), but definitely not worth $17 and the 2 hours my stomach was calling out for food. While the potatoes were cooked to a perfect crisp and the lemon ricotta pancakes were delectably light and fluffy, the eggs were just standard and the house-made sausage patties were too bland and dry for my liking. 

In conclusion, the brunch was good, but not mind blowingly amazing as I had expected. 

Tip: Don't arrive hungry.

excerpts: I had the biscuit and The Plow.
The potatoes are the star of the show, don't miss them!
The biscuit with the honey butter is so fresh and not dry.
the plow.author: Ahmed H.
the plow.review: Such an amazing breakfast!  I had the biscuit and The Plow.  The potatoes are the star of the show, don't miss them!  The biscuit with the honey butter is so fresh and not dry.

excerpts: I ordered The Plow and the only disappointment was the chicken apple sausage.
the plow.author: Manuela R.
the plow.review: The line here for Saturday brunch is incredibly long, but the service was fantastic and the food was great. I ordered The Plow and the only disappointment was the chicken apple sausage. The potatoes, eggs, and lemon ricotta pancakes were fantastic. Would definitely come again and try something else, and also come at an earlier time to leave my name on the list.

excerpts: The plow is a fantastic brunch spot (in a city full of them) so it's definitely worth eating at, as long as you're prepared to wait or to wake up really early.
I ordered the plow, which I was afraid would be too much food, but which ended up being the perfect amount.
the plow.author: Alok N.
the plow.review:
We arrived to plow at around 9am on a Saturday and were greeted with a line and notification that we would be seated at around 10:15am. After some discussion we decided to wait it out and we were not disappointed by our choice one bit. The plow is a fantastic brunch spot (in a city full of them) so it's definitely worth eating at, as long as you're prepared to wait or to wake up really early. 

I ordered the plow, which I was afraid would be too much food, but which ended up being the perfect amount. The lemon ricotta pancakes were fluffy, not too lemony, and perfectly delicious. I ordered poached eggs which were well cooked - runny with firm yet tender white. The sausage I ordered was probably the least impressive part of the meal yet was still pretty solid. 

My friend tried the eggs Benedict which had excellent hollandaise sauce (which in my opinion makes or breaks the dish). 

I saved the potatoes for last as they were the defining part of the brunch in my opinion. We all agreed potatoes were cooked extremely well as they boasted a crispy exterior and a soft interior that complemented the other parts of the breakfast.

excerpts: Although almost all items we've ordered have been great, my favorite is consistently The Plow (underwhelming, I know), and the lemon pancakes.
the plow.author: Jeremy C.
the plow.review:
Plow is a place that you first mock, then decide to visit, hate the wait, and finally realize why the wait is worth your time.

I'm a sucker for a good brunch, and having been spoiled by living close to great digs like Universal Cafe and Mission Beach, but Plow is on another level. My girlfriend and I visit every so often on a sunny weekend, diligently wait the hour or two that it takes to be seated. Thanks to a great staff who are kind to take time to answer your questions, this experience isn't too bad.

Although almost all items we've ordered have been great, my favorite is consistently The Plow (underwhelming, I know), and the lemon pancakes. You've most likely never tried potatoes or eggs cooked so perfectly, plainly in front of you.

Honestly, just pay a visit and wait the hour. It's worth it!

excerpts: My friend ordered The Plow which was your typical breakfast/ brunch (2 eggs, choice of meat,pancakes and potatoes).
I ordered the Prosciutto on toast( egg fried up on toasted brioche ).
We were both satisfied with our orders, I especially liked the prosciutto on toast because it was similar to eggs Benedict with a twist!
I would definitely consider coming back again if I am in the neighborhood.
the plow.author: Rochelle E.
the plow.review:
Well worth the wait! The food was superb, the restaurant was classy, and the service was great! My friend and I put our names down and explored different shops nearby for about an hour. The hostess recommended we grab a drink at a little dive bar across the street to kill time. Great suggestion because time flew by! 

When we went back we were seated right away. The restaurant is small so expect to sit relatively close to your neighbor. I was surprised that the prices were good and not horribly overpriced considering the popularity of this place and the amount of food you received was a lot.

There were plenty of options to choose from some being your basic breakfast/ brunch deal and others quite different. My friend ordered The Plow which was your typical breakfast/ brunch (2 eggs, choice of meat,pancakes and potatoes). I ordered the Prosciutto on toast( egg fried up on toasted brioche ). We were both satisfied with our orders, I especially liked the prosciutto on toast because it was similar to eggs Benedict with a twist! I would definitely consider coming back again if I am in the neighborhood.

excerpts: The Plow:
This is what most people get and is definitely the best for your buck.
The Plow potatoes definitely lived up to the hype--crispy on the outside yet soft on the inside.
They also give you smaller pieces that are all crunch
the plow.author: Angelina H.
the plow.review:
I've heard sooo much about this place so I decided to finally come check out the hype. My thoughts are that the food and service are both equally exceptional, BUT I wouldn't wait more than 30 min for it. Thankfully I arrived on a Sunday at ~7:45am and I was able to be seated right at 8am. The line grew substantially after I arrived so I would recommend coming around the same time I did. Parking on a weekend morning was easy and free as well.

Now for the food:
French toast: So yummy! Not overly sweet and just the right thickness. Mine came with strawberries and thick whipped cream on top. There was also plenty of maple syrup on the side. Definitely recommend getting this and also asking for extra whipped cream!

The Plow: This is what most people get and is definitely the best for your buck. The lemon ricotta pancakes were SO scrumptious. The lemon was just the right amount. Combine that with the ricotta and you have an amazing balance of sweet and savory. I got the housemade pork sausage, which was good, but I think I would opt for the bacon next time. The Plow potatoes definitely lived up to the hype--crispy on the outside yet soft on the inside. They also give you smaller pieces that are all crunch and that was my favorite part.

I shared these two dishes with my sister and it was the perfect amount--not too full and we left satisfied. I will say that I saw folks around us order the biscuit and holy cow it looked amazing.

This place is worth coming to if you're not bothered waiting OR if you come early like I did!

excerpts: I ordered the Plow Breakfast plate.
The biggest winner for the Plow Breakfast plate is the Lemon Ricotta pancakes!
The pancakes tasted flawless and magnificent which I did feel the flavors of lemon and ricotta combined into a one great taste!
Adding with a maple syrup is a breeze of fresh air.
the plow.author: William L.
the plow.review:
What can I say? This is the most incredible place that I've ever experienced!

Yesterday on 1/11/2017, while I arrived in San Francisco, I decided to dine in at this well known local breakfast and brunch restaurant at the Potrero Hill neighborhood. "Plow" is the name by serving the customers from young to old to tasted their contemporary brunch dishes on every season and year! The atmosphere is very natural and elegant as I welcomed there. The concept is much more modern and contemporary like Bacon & Butter in Sacramento and Great Maple in San Diego (both in California) has and it feels like vising to the old country's kitchen in the plain lands.

The employees from servers and cookers are doing an excellent job for making the customers like me an outstanding service! Very friendly and approachable. No cons necessary.

Now onto the food! I ordered the Plow Breakfast plate. It contains with your choice of house made breakfast pork sausage, Nuesake's bacon, or chicken apple sausage (I picked) along with 2 eggs (I picked scrambled), 2 mini Lemon Ricotta Pancakes and baked potatoes. As I ate it, that plate taste irresistibly delicious! The chicken apple sausage taste remarkable and flavorful and it cooked perfectly for perfection. The scrambled eggs cook very well and fluffy to eat which I did feel the softness of the eggs naturally. The potatoes cooked not bad and perfectly seasoned for both salt and black pepper. The biggest winner for the Plow Breakfast plate is the Lemon Ricotta pancakes! The pancakes tasted flawless and magnificent which I did feel the flavors of lemon and ricotta combined into a one great taste! Adding with a maple syrup is a breeze of fresh air. What a great breakfast meal indeed!

Parking at Plow can be challenging to park. You can park at the nearest surface street parking if it's available, but you'll better be act quickly to find the best spot to park. You can also ride a bike, walk or public transportation easier without the hassles.

In the end, Plow is the most majestic and sensational local breakfast/brunch duo restaurant that I've ever enjoyed the most! Perfect for friends and family gatherings of all ages! A must visit for your SF trip needs! A well received visit! My rating: 4 1/2 stars.

excerpts: We ordered the plow with homemade sausages, the goat cheese and shiitake mushroom scramble and the prosciutto and gruyere cheese toast.
The homemade sausage had a lot of fennel seeds so the taste was very distinct and strong.
I thought it was ok, but worth trying at least since it's made in house.
The ricotta pancakes were good and so were the potatoes!
Was not too big of a fan of the goat cheese and shiitake mushroom combo.
The prosciutto toast was really good though!
I probably wouldn't wait again for two hours but if it weren't that long of a wait
and if I lived closer I'd come again.
the plow.author: Vicki L.
the plow.review:
Damn, came here at 9:30am thinking we were early, but still ended up waiting 2 hours for brunch. And was it worth the wait?

My verdict, probably not. Food was good but to wait 2 hours was a little excessive. We ordered the plow with homemade sausages, the goat cheese and shiitake mushroom scramble and the prosciutto and gruyere cheese toast. The homemade sausage had a lot of fennel seeds so the taste was very distinct and strong. I thought it was ok, but worth trying at least since it's made in house. The ricotta pancakes were good and so were the potatoes! Was not too big of a fan of the goat cheese and shiitake mushroom combo. The prosciutto toast was really good though! I probably wouldn't wait again for two hours but if it weren't that long of a wait and if I lived closer I'd come again.

excerpts: Food: I got the plow and my boyfriend got the breakfast sandwich.
the plow.author: Hayley D.
the plow.review:
Came here on a Sunday morning around 9 AM. When we got here they told us it would be an hour and a half wait. Crazy. 

Food: I got the plow and my boyfriend got the breakfast sandwich. The lemon ricotta pancakes were probably the best pancakes I've ever had. Perfect amount of lemon flavor and a really good fluffy texture. The potatoes were also amazing, very good flavor and texture. 

Service: We ended up getting seated after about 45 minutes, quicker than expected. We sat at the bar seat which was cool because we got to see the food being made. Our waitress was great except we asked her to split the meal between two cards and she ended up charging one of them twice. Not sure how that would happen. 

Ambiance: The inside was a lot smaller that I thought it would be, guess that explains the long wait times. Very clean inside and we saw that they got a 100 score on their food/cleanliness which is always good to see. Big windows that bring in a lot of light. There was also outside seating. 

Overall it was a great meal. Probably not the best breakfast I've ever had but also nothing to complain about (besides the wait). Definitely worth checking this place out.

excerpts: We got the Plow meal and a biscuit.
The highlight was the lemon ricotta pancake which was delicious.
The biscuit was also above average and the honey butter made it stand out.
The rest was pretty standard and nothing out of the ordinary.
I'm not sure the 2 hour wait was worth it though.
Because of the wait and the hype, it didn't quite meet my expectations.
But if I take that out of the equation, then I was very satisfied.
the plow.author: Simon S.
the plow.review: Was a solid, satisfying brunch. We got the Plow meal and a biscuit.  The highlight was the lemon ricotta pancake which was delicious. The biscuit was also above average and the honey butter made it stand out. The rest was pretty standard and nothing out of the ordinary.  I'm not sure the 2 hour wait was worth it though. Because of the wait and the hype, it didn't quite meet my expectations. But if I take that out of the equation, then I was very satisfied.

excerpts: My personal favorite is the Plow, which is breakfast sampler of all things good in the breakfast world: lemon ricotta pancakes, potatoes, home made pork sausage (other meat options, but the sausage is my #1).
the plow.author: Frances P.
the plow.review:
Plow is my go-to for a low stress, early morning breakfast spot. They offer simple brunch classics that are done perfectly. My personal favorite is the Plow, which is breakfast sampler of all things good in the breakfast world: lemon ricotta pancakes, potatoes, home made pork sausage (other meat options, but the sausage is my #1). My fiancé ordered a new one, the dungeness crab scrambled eggs, which was DOPE.

The inside interior is rustic romantic (you know that weathered wood, farmhouse feel). Service is great. I always feel like I am eating at home with my mom cooking me a great meal. It also has that neighborhood feel. One time I ate, a cop parked and just said hello and gave badge stickers to all the kids. There is ample street parking everywhere, so not an issue if you want to drive over.

I hear the line can get really long, but I am the crazy person that gets there around 7:30 am and is the first person in line. Around 7:45 people start lining up in masses. One thing to note if you want to be cray like me and be the first people seated, one time the biscuits weren't ready for us that early. Not really sure when they are typically done. But the biscuits there, also DOPE.

excerpts: The plow did everything it needed as a main dish.
The reason this isn't a 5 star is b/c of the long wait which is due to the small size of the place.
the plow.author: Michael C.
the plow.review: Ate the honey butter biscuit which was good, but I don't think I'd get it again for $5. The chia pudding tasted refreshing with some honey sweetness. I shared sausage patties (had a unique slightly sour taste) and bacon (had a smokey taste). Both were atypical flavor to typical brunch food. The plow did everything it needed as a main dish. The reason this isn't a 5 star is b/c of the long wait which is due to the small size of the place.

excerpts: I tried the plow and the food was decent minus the pancakes being small and over cooked.
Overall the staff and ambiance ruined it for me
and I won't be back.
the plow.author: Rae W.
the plow.review: I've been looking forward to trying this place and I'm utterly disappointed. The service sucked, the ppl that worked there came off as rude and clueless. I tried the plow and the food was decent minus the pancakes being small and over cooked. Overall the staff and ambiance ruined it for me and I won't be back.

excerpts: The Plow is the fantastic.
The egg was cooked nicely, the almond pancakes were delicious and my favorite were the potatoes.
My mouth is getting watery as I think about them.
Also I did try the toast that has condensed milk, anyway that was just fantastic.
I forgot to get a photo of the buttermilk biscuit but that biscuit was phenomenal.
Thank you plow for great food and great service!
Definitely will be coming back!
the plow.author: Nickiee S.
the plow.review: Plow was there first stop I went to when I got to SF. It was the best breakfast I had my whole trip. The Plow is the fantastic. The egg was cooked nicely, the almond pancakes were delicious and my favorite were the potatoes. My mouth is getting watery as I think about them. Also I did try the toast that has condensed milk, anyway that was just fantastic. I forgot to get a photo of the buttermilk biscuit but that biscuit was phenomenal. Thank you plow for great food and great service! Definitely will be coming back!

excerpts: I've tried the egg sandwich, the plow, and butcher's steak and eggs!
My favorite is "the plow," and I always recommend every friend to get it!
The sausage (homemade sausage) is so flavorful, the eggs are a perfect consistency, and the potatoes are always cooked to perfection.
the plow.author: Shirley S.
the plow.review:
My favorite brunch place of all time! Worth the wait!

I've been here about 5 (or more) times and it's so good every single time!

I've tried the egg sandwich, the plow, and butcher's steak and eggs!

My favorite is "the plow," and I always recommend every friend to get it! The sausage (homemade sausage) is so flavorful, the eggs are a perfect consistency, and the potatoes are always cooked to perfection. Last, but not least, it also comes with lemon ricotta pancakes which are just as delicious and flavorful as everything else! It is a little pricey (20$) but it's so worth it! 

I don't really recommend the egg sandwich. Don't get me wrong, it is delicious, but not as delicious as the other 2 dishes. Plus, this dish doesn't come with potatoes and brunch is never complete without some delicious potatoes. 

During the weekend, there will be a long wait but I really think this is one of the few restaurants that are worth the wait! I usually recommend that you either go really early, or show up around 1:30pm (they close at 2) for a shorter wait time. If you walk up the hill, there is a beautiful view of San Francisco, but don't wander too far or you will lose your seat. They only call out your name about three times before they give up your seat to the next party!

excerpts: I was debating between the Plow, the Dungeness crab scramble, and the open-faced prosciutto + Gruyere toast.
But since I was intrigued by the lemon ricotta pancakes, I opted for the Plow.
the plow.author: Lisa N.
the plow.review:
What a cute little place for breakfast/brunch. There are hooks along the wall for your coats/bags.

I was forewarned about how long the wait can be, so I planned to come here on a Monday morning during my visit. We showed up not long after they opened and were seated right away. 

I was debating between the Plow, the Dungeness crab scramble, and the open-faced prosciutto + Gruyere toast. But since I was intrigued by the lemon ricotta pancakes, I opted for the Plow.

The dish comes with two eggs with choice of house made pork sausage patties, Nueske's bacon, or chicken apple sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes + plow potatoes. I asked for scrambled eggs (which is a rarity for me) and bacon. Every element of the dish was really good, the potatoes were very crispy on the outside, and the pancakes had a nice balance of flavors.

Service seemed a bit slow, but I'll just give them the benefit of the doubt that it was busy. It certainly seemed busy, but I noticed the servers standing around and inattentive numerous times throughout our meal.

Overall, I would recommend this place for the food. Service wasn't terrible, but it wasn't fantastic either. Granted, it was early on a Monday morning. If I find my way back to this spot during a future visit, I'll definitely try one of the other dishes that intrigued me.

excerpts: We shared The Plow (with sausages and poached egg), a mochi cake, and a crab scramble.
The Plow was definitely the item to get!
the plow.author: Diana W.
the plow.review:
I endured a 2+ mile walk from the Tenderloin w/ my friend to try Plow out! We were super cold by the time we got to Plow and then were told that the wait would be almost 2 hours if we wanted to sit inside ... So we waited about 40 minutes for outdoor seating instead at around 9AM. The cold was barely bearable!

Soon after we were seated, we were provided with thin blankets and hot water that had the aftertaste of coffee. We shared The Plow (with sausages and poached egg), a mochi cake, and a crab scramble. All food was finished between two ladies!!

The Plow was definitely the item to get! The raved-about lemon ricotta pancakes were indeed delightfully fluffy, though I was unpleasantly surprised to find that they were about the size of the palm of my hand. The potatoes were deliciously crispy and had the texture of curly fries despite looking like regular breakfast potatoes. Sausages were normal and egg was perfectly cooked with a runny middle!! 

Mochi cake was also a good choice - moist and bouncy and not too sweet! But the crab scramble was kind of watery even though I was satisfied w/ the amount of crab provided. 

Prices were definitely more like brunch prices than breakfast prices ($$$$). I would come back on a nice day in autumn, maybe .. I already saw one bee in late December, so I probably would not want to sit outside in spring/summer lol.

excerpts: I have sampled the Plow, the Prosciutto and Gruyere toast and the Breakfast Sandwich.
My least favorite was DEFINITELY the Plow.
Super overrated and nothing on the plate was really noteworthy.
The pancakes are pretty basic
the plow.author: Carrie W.
the plow.review:
Plow makes a solid brunch but by no means is it worth the hype it receives. I have visited twice in the past year and tried a sampling of their items. Everything is good but nothing (and I truly mean nothing) is worth waiting more than 30 minutes. Plow is pretty small but the staff does cram quite a few tables in the narrow space which also has bar seating and outdoor tables. I would definitely not recommend coming if you have a large group, or really any group larger than 3. The space is very simple and perfect for a brunch joint. There is a ton of natural light which is perfect for snapping some pictures of your food which is what EVERYONE in this restaurant is doing all of the time.

I have sampled the Plow, the Prosciutto and Gruyere toast and the Breakfast Sandwich. My least favorite was DEFINITELY the Plow. Super overrated and nothing on the plate was really noteworthy. The pancakes are pretty basic and I think compared to a lot of the other notable places in the city offering lemon ricotta pancakes, the weakest. The Prosciutto and Gruyere toast is a pretty solid option and the Breakfast Sandwich is good, if not basic. The prices are pretty high for what you get but considering how popular this place is, I suppose it is reasonable. The service is fine but be prepared to wait a bit for your food since the kitchen is pretty small.

All in all, I do like Plow and maybe this review is negative. I just think there are other places in the city preparing more innovative food that are less mobbed and have better pricing. Plus, Portrero Hill is kinda depressing at 8AM which you will surely find out if you try to arrive at any point later than 30 minutes before opening.

excerpts: THE PLOW - $17
the plow.author: Tu-Anh N.
the plow.review:
On an early Sunday morning, we came here around 8:30am.  We were told that for a party of 2, it would be a little over an hour wait. And they were right! We got seated outside at 9:45am.  They have blankets if your cold!  What did we do to wait? Walk around! Plow is located in a quaint area with other small shops and cafes to walk by.  Get that walk in so you can fill that belly!

Here's what we had:

Five Mountains organic tea - $4.75
Rolled Jasmine Green
It's tea. Warm. It was cold out so it was fitting. :)

BUTTERMILK BISCUIT - $4.50
This hunk of biscuit was served with a side of honey butter, that was sweet and yummy.  The biscuit itself is shareable and fluffy. I really enjoyed it!

BROWN BUTTER COCONUT MOCHI CAKE - $4.25
This dessert was delicious! Order quick before they run out!  would never expect a mochi cake here!  There's a layer in There that tasted quite custardy.  I recommend getting this even if your full; have it to go!  

FRENCH TOAST - $13  
Brown sugar caramelized apples, blood, mascarpone, pure Vermont maple syrup.
Depending on the season, the fruit may change.  This French toast was amazing.  It was so creamy and you definitely taste quality in every bite. Get it!

THE PLOW - $17 
Two eggs, house made pork sausage patties, lemon ricotta pancakes and plow potatoes.
Not sure what to get? Get this one! It has everything!  The pork sausage patties was although not quite what I expected, was good.  It tasted healthier than your normal diner pork sausage patty--looks like there are veggies in the mix and it's not as salty.  I liked it!  The potatoes was probable the main reason why I got this.  It's all so crispy and yummy!  I can have a bowl of this in its own.  As for the lemon ricotta pancakes to fulfill that sweet side, it was great.  I liked the small portion and the flavors were subtle and wonderful.    

I enjoyed everything here. I can see why it's so popular and I was not annoyed with the wait.  Our server was friendly.  It started to right as we were leaving so freat timing! Don't worry they have a thing they roll out to cover you from getting wet. :)

excerpts: GET THE PLOW.
the plow.author: Cecille W.
the plow.review:
Gonna make this short and sweet since there's already so many 5 stars reviews: It's worth the wait!!! 

GET THE PLOW. They make the best lemon ricotta pancakes, juiciest pork sausage, and the crispiest potatoes. The portions are on point, not too much but just enough to fill you up. I think I found my new favorite brunch place! Can't wait to come back to try the other items on the menu and a grapefruit mimosa.

excerpts: We both ordered the plow!
I got mine with bacon and it was delicious!
the plow.author: Ariana T.
the plow.review:
Plow has been on my "to try" list for awhile now and I finally got around to checking it out. My friend and I came in on a Sunday morning around 9:30. We ended up waiting about 40 minutes, which went by pretty fast. 

We both ordered the plow! I got mine with bacon and it was delicious! I loved the lemon ricotta pancakes. I was expecting them to be super sweet, but they were JUST right! Overall, I would recommend this place. It is a little more than I would like to spend on brunch, but it was definitely worth it.

excerpts: I loved not having to choose between a sweet and savory breakfast with "The Plow" dish.
The potatoes were so delicious, nicely fried and the skins were a nice touch.
the plow.author: Cassandra F.
the plow.review: This was an amazing spot for brunch! I loved not having to choose between a sweet and savory breakfast with "The Plow" dish. The potatoes were so delicious, nicely fried and the skins were a nice touch. The lemon ricotta pancakes were fluffy and very aromatic. The only issue I have with this place is the wait time. I recommend showing up at 8am or even a little earlier than when it opens because it's a non stop crowd of people outside. I waited 1 hr and 45 mins for a two person spot and arrived at 9:40 am.

excerpts: I got the Plow and my fiancé got the custard French toast.
Both were REALLY good.
I am not sure if they are my favorite potatoes in the world, but for sure they were the best I had during the trip to SF.
They were crispy, well seasoned, and super hot!
The pancakes were nicely balanced (not too sweet, not too lemony) and the eggs were cooked nicely.
I would say what you get at Plow is simple food that is made perfectly, which is exactly what I look for when I go to brunch!
the plow.author: Karen G.
the plow.review: YUM YUM YUM! I found Plow on Yelp and really any places that boasts about having the best breakfast potatoes in the city, I knew I had to check out. Because its a super tiny place (maybe there are like 15 small tables in the entire place), we decided to go on Tuesday morning rather than during the weekend. We were seated right away at the bar (no open tables even on a Tuesday!) and the service was overall good. The food itself was also really good! I got the Plow and my fiancé got the custard French toast. Both were REALLY good. I am not sure if they are my favorite potatoes in the world, but for sure they were the best I had during the trip to SF. They were crispy, well seasoned, and super hot! The pancakes were nicely balanced (not too sweet, not too lemony) and the eggs were cooked nicely. I would say what you get at Plow is simple food that is made perfectly, which is exactly what I look for when I go to brunch!

excerpts: The best option in my opinion is getting "the Plow" which satisfies a lot of different tastes.
the plow.author: Elliott W.
the plow.review:
Pro tip: If you can, go early during a week day. You'll likely get seated without waiting + there will be plenty of time to eat before you need to be at work.

I trekked over from the Mission (dang, those hills will get ya!) early Thursday morning with the boy and got there right at 7 when they open. We were seated right away and then had the difficult time of figuring out what to order.

I'm pretty sure EVERYTHING would be amazing on the menu, and I'm really bummed that I couldn't justify ordering one of everything. The best option in my opinion is getting "the Plow" which satisfies a lot of different tastes. It comes with two eggs, their famous potatoes, choice of brekky meat and two lemon ricotta pancakes.

Guys, their potatoes. I don't know how to do them justice. They are the most crispy delicious things on the planet, and perfectly salted/seasoned as well. I wish I had a mountain of these.

The lemon ricotta pancakes were also amazing- light and fluffy and melt in your mouth delicious.

I really don't think there's a bad option on the menu; it's more of timing your visit right so that you don't get hangry while you wait!

excerpts: I ended up ordering the Plow, which comes with two lemon ricotta pancakes, chicken apple sausage (you can also opt to choose bacon or regular sausage), their potatoes, and eggs.
Their lemon ricotta pancakes were pretty tasty, but that's about it.
For the price you're paying for your food (I payed $25 for coffee and The Plow), I would say to check out another one of San Francisco's great brunch places.
the plow.author: Elizabeth M.
the plow.review:
Eh.

For the price I paid for this, I was underwhelmed. I tried coming here before with a friend when we stayed over the weekend in San Francisco, but the wait time was over three hours and we weren't down for that. 

I came this past Monday around 8:00 am so I was able to get a seat right away as it was only me. For my drink I ordered coffee, which was a mistake. The coffee here is so darn bitter! It could not even be saved with cream and sugar :( Please do yourself a favor and either get coffee beforehand from somewhere else, or skip coffee from Plow altogether. 

I ended up ordering the Plow, which comes with two lemon ricotta pancakes, chicken apple sausage (you can also opt to choose bacon or regular sausage), their potatoes, and eggs. Their lemon ricotta pancakes were pretty tasty, but that's about it. There was nothing particularly remarkable about this dish, I could have easily made something like this at home.

Bottom line- only come here if there is no wait, and do NOT order the coffee! For the price you're paying for your food (I payed $25 for coffee and The Plow), I would say to check out another one of San Francisco's great brunch places.

excerpts: I got the "soft scramble eggs" which comes with potatoes and toast and my boyfriend got the "the plow".
Everything was great and the service was amazing.
Totally got me off my toes, would revisit if I take another trip to San Francisco!
the plow.author: Tethivorada G.
the plow.review:
My boyfriend searched, "best breakfast spot in San Francisco" and this was one of the few that popped up. It was our first time and it definitely blew our minds away. We were greeted with the "old vintage" look of the restaurant, it was super cute and chic! They offer a breakfast bar and shared tables and inside/outside seating. We caught them on a good day, so the wait time didn't exceed 20 minutes. We were pretty starving by the time we got our table though. 
First things first, get the orange juice!! Omg it's so fresh and not pasteurized! They offer two size, I got the small but if I knew it tasted this bomb I'd get the large. 
The breakfast platters are huge and it'll fill you up! I got the "soft scramble eggs" which comes with potatoes and toast and my boyfriend got the "the plow". Everything was great and the service was amazing. Totally got me off my toes, would revisit if I take another trip to San Francisco!

excerpts: The biscuits are amazing, the Plow Breakfast is so large we can split that... we each get a mimosa and also

if we feel "Dangerous" we will order a French toast :P 
Such amazing breakfast food with quality taste!
the plow.author: Justin S.
the plow.review:
My fiancé and I live only 3 blocks away from here, and this is our FAVORITE spot to get breakfast in the city of San Francisco! 
We will wait 2 hours for this breakfast... its just that good. 
The biscuits are amazing, the Plow Breakfast is so large we can split that... we each get a mimosa and also if we feel "Dangerous" we will order a French toast :P 
Such amazing breakfast food with quality taste!

excerpts: My boyfriend got The Plow.
the plow.author: Kim O.
the plow.review: After 6 years in SF I finally made it to Plow! It was a cold, rainy day so I ordered the Shirred Eggs in a creamy tomato sauce with crispy garlic toast. It was perfect. My boyfriend got The Plow. The lemon ricotta pancakes melt in your mouth. Service is impeccable too.

excerpts:
(we like to share)
- The plow
- Soft scrambled eggs 
- French toast 
- Salmon eggs benedict 
- Dungeness crab scramble 
- Breakfast sandwich 
-
My favorite was the lemon ricotta pancakes with the plow dish.
The crab scramble was also delicious.
Nothing really disappointed me in the spread we got.
The Hong Kong toast was also good
the plow.author: Jenna T.
the plow.review:
They can't take more than 6 people in a party which was just perfect for us. We had to wait for about 1.5 hour for our table. Partially our fault as we missed the first time our name was called. There were people waiting at 9am! The staff was very friendly and the place is pretty cozy. 
We had almost everything on the menu... (we like to share)
- The plow
- Soft scrambled eggs 
- French toast 
- Salmon eggs benedict 
- Dungeness crab scramble 
- Breakfast sandwich 
- Hong Kong toast 

Loved their house potatoes because they were crunchy instead of smooshy. Their hot sauce was good too. My favorite was the lemon ricotta pancakes with the plow dish. The crab scramble was also delicious. Nothing really disappointed me in the spread we got. The Hong Kong toast was also good but it just wasn't my cup of tea. 

I wouldn't mind coming again but it may be a shorter wait with a smaller party. Parking wasn't too bad either. They also don't have room for stroller parking if you're coming here with a baby/toddler and it's pretty difficult to have a high chair given the tight space.

excerpts: I ordered the Plow with chicken apple sausage.
The eggs are fluffy and potatoes are super crispy with strong rosemary flavors.
I couldn't taste the lavender salt in the potatoes but it's interesting to know that it's there.
Chicken apple sausages were on the saltier side and slightly burnt, but really well-made.
the plow.author: Julia Y.
the plow.review:
First things first, a word to those with TREE NUT ALLERGIES: There are pecans (or some other tree nut) in the apple cinnamon coffee cake. I had a small reaction to it and we also picked out a nut in the crust. Unfortunately the waitress said the chef said there weren't nuts in the cake, which is false. This is a serious blunder, especially if there are unsuspecting customers with more serious nut allergies than me. 

Favorite thing here: Lemon Ricotta Pancakes!! I am such a fan :) Apparently it's one of their specialties. I love the thin layer of ricotta within the lemon-ricotta batter. It's finished with a dusting of powdered sugar, and a dash of maple syrup really brings it home!

I ordered the Plow with chicken apple sausage. The eggs are fluffy and potatoes are super crispy with strong rosemary flavors. I couldn't taste the lavender salt in the potatoes but it's interesting to know that it's there. Chicken apple sausages were on the saltier side and slightly burnt, but really well-made. It's a ton of food, so a solid order for even the hangriest of people. 

Apple Cinnamon cake: small nut reaction aside, it was delicious. You can really taste the moist, buttery cinnamon and the crust is full and thick. 

Was it worth the 2.5 hour wait for a party of 4? Probably not. I could see myself waiting at most an hour for those heavenly lemon ricotta pancakes.

excerpts: I decided to get The Plow with sunny side up eggs and pork sausage with a butter biscuit.
The drip coffee is also amazing and strong!!
Highly recommend it and will be back soon!
the plow.author: Mel R.
the plow.review:
This was an amazing experience and so good! Downside is that there is always a line and a wait, my friend and I waited almost 2 hours to get a seat but it was worth it. 

I decided to get The Plow with sunny side up eggs and pork sausage with a butter biscuit. The drip coffee is also amazing and strong!! Highly recommend it and will be back soon!

excerpts: Wife got the Plow two eggs and lemon pancakes
and She finished her plate and not normal for her as for the kids
one got the breakfast sandwich and the other got the almond pancakes.
the plow.author: M K.
the plow.review:
Simple menu and full with flavors and chef magic.
I got the chicken sandwich and it worth the wait. Guess what even the kids their nagging changes to plate licking and wow dad thx. Wife got the Plow two eggs and lemon pancakes and She finished her plate and not normal for her as for the kids one got the breakfast sandwich and the other got the almond pancakes.

excerpts: From their lemon ricotta pancakes to their signature "the plow" brunch dish, plow has gotten brunch and break food down to a tee.
the plow.author: Diane T.
the plow.review:
Plow oh Plow 

Even on a rainy Saturday afternoon at close to 1, there was still a 1-2 hour wait for a party of two. 

There's an abundance of reviews for this place. To keep it short, plow is known for their brunch. Yea, they do brunch well. 

From their lemon ricotta pancakes to their signature "the plow" brunch dish, plow has gotten brunch and break food down to a tee. 

A small establishment, anticipate an at least 1 hour wait on the weekends. Put you name down and keep within close proximity to the host as they normally do roll call ever so often. I would suggest that you come in a small party, otherwise I can't imagine how long you would have to wait. 

I can't deny that the food was good. But, frankly, I wasn't blow away.  Yes, their Crispy rosemary potatoes are super delicious, but the rest of my plow dish ( eggs pork sausage and I subbed almond pancakes as I'm GF) was mediocre. It was cooked well, but I actually felt like it was missing some flavors.  For 2+ hour wait...I don't know if I would do it again. 

The BF has the lemon pancakes and felt it was a bit undercooked. Maybe it's just our taste buds? He did like his salmon Benny though. 

Portion wise, it's decent and within the same limits as with most SF brunch establishments.  Pricing wise, most dishes are approx 15-18. Which is a little most hefty for brunch. 

Would I come back? Yes--absolutely. But not with that wait time. I would have to disclose that since I'm Gf I'm limited to certain items.  I saw a lot of other patrons ordering their baked goods and they looked delicious. So perhaps for you my friend, plow will be a 5 star worthy place even with the heinous wait.

excerpts: The food was above and beyond delicious (especially the plow potatoes!)
and the staff was very nice.
We sat outside on the little patio where it was a bit chilly so one of the waiters offered me a cozy blanket to use during my meal!
It made my experience even more enjoyable.
I would recommend this place to everyone, it is worth the drive!
the plow.author: Katie M.
the plow.review: This little breakfast place was PHENOMENAL and totally worth all the forms of transportation we had to take to get there! The food was above and beyond delicious (especially the plow potatoes!) and the staff was very nice. We sat outside on the little patio where it was a bit chilly so one of the waiters offered me a cozy blanket to use during my meal! It made my experience even more enjoyable. I would recommend this place to everyone, it is worth the drive!

excerpts: Ordered the Plow breakfast plate and it was delicious!
Their fresh baked biscuit is also a must try too!
Although the wait to get a table was long, the food and the friendly staff made it worth the wait:)
the plow.author: Meredith P.
the plow.review: Was visiting sf for the weekend and came across this great brunch spot! Ordered the Plow breakfast plate and it was delicious! Their fresh baked biscuit is also a must try too! Although the wait to get a table was long, the food and the friendly staff made it worth the wait:)

excerpts: I ordered the plow because I wanted to try their lemon ricotta pancakes and have potatoes and eggs.
It was pretty much an obvious choice.
The boyfriend ordered french toast with a side of potatoes.
Let's just begin with how awesome their potatoes are!
They do such a great job with them-
I personally love it when the potatoes are super crispy.
the plow.author: Dara S.
the plow.review:
Got to check this spot out on a random Thursday morning and the wait was only 15 minutes! I ordered the plow because I wanted to try their lemon ricotta pancakes and have potatoes and eggs. It was pretty much an obvious choice. The boyfriend ordered french toast with a side of potatoes. Let's just begin with how awesome their potatoes are! They do such a great job with them- I personally love it when the potatoes are super crispy. The pancakes and french toast were good too, but my favorite part of the meal were the potatoes for sure!

And I love how they offer blankets if you sit outside! How thoughtful!

excerpts: We both ordered "the plow" which came with 2 lemon ricotta pancakes, potatos, two eggs, and your choice of sausage patties, bacon, or chicken apple sausage!
the plow.author: Alyssa C.
the plow.review:
Finally got to try this place out... ive had this place bookmarked for a couple years!! Went here for brunch with my bff yesterday we both really enjoyed it here! We both ordered "the plow" which came with 2 lemon ricotta pancakes, potatos, two eggs, and your choice of sausage patties, bacon, or chicken apple sausage! We also got a glass of mimosas which were super refreshing! 

Overall I had a great experience here, it has such a cute ambiance, service was great and the servers were fast. One of the workers even refilled our glasses with more champagne towards the end and offered to take our picture! Definitely coming back!

excerpts:
I order the plow and french toast
All is ok but the french toast 
I think they soak bread too long
Every plate is big portion think before you order
the plow.author: Gibkm O.
the plow.review:
Everyday longgggg line!
I order the plow and french toast
All is ok but the french toast 
I think they soak bread too long
Every plate is big portion think before you order

excerpts: She had the plow for her main and loved the pancakes.
the plow.author: Drew H.
the plow.review:
Good, but not worth $66 (for 2) and an hour and a half wait. My wife loved the fresh fruit (but it was $7.50). She had the plow for her main and loved the pancakes. I had the soft scramble which was good but was light on the goat cheese.

Food came out quickly (in a good way) and the server was friendly and attentive.

excerpts: My brotato opted for the plow and one bite of the lemon ricotta pancake was enough have me sold.
I loved the delicate, fluffy texture complemented by the mild, balanced flavors of citrus and ricotta.
the plow.author: Eric F.
the plow.review:
A stellar brunch destination and easily within my Top 3 of all-time, but that wait is as ridiculous as many others have said.

My dungeness crab scramble was superb - loads of fresh crab meat and very balanced on the palate.  The accompanying potatoes were damn tasty as well in their exceptional crispiness.  My brotato opted for the plow and one bite of the lemon ricotta pancake was enough have me sold.  I loved the delicate, fluffy texture complemented by the mild, balanced flavors of citrus and ricotta.  Everything was in harmony and I could easily see myself devouring a full plate of these the next time I'm around.

Definitely try to come around opening time if possible and just be prepared to build your appetite up a fair bit if that doesn't pan out.

excerpts: The Plow which was decent.
Really enjoyed the homemade pork sausage- delicious.
The ricotta lemon pancakes are actually quite small and dense.
I  also tried a bit of the crab scramble which was tasty with the creme fraiche on top.
the plow.author: Vivian D.
the plow.review: Came on a Sun very close to closing and still had to wait maybe 45 min. Pretty standard brunch cuisine, but a cozy nice place to spend your weekend brunch. I got The Plow which was decent. Really enjoyed the homemade pork sausage- delicious. The ricotta lemon pancakes are actually quite small and dense. I  also tried a bit of the crab scramble which was tasty with the creme fraiche on top. Equator coffee was good. Overall- a good standard brunch, very very very long lines so if you are in no hurry at all enjoy a leisurely wait here.

excerpts: My son and I ordered "The Plow" and it was good...but nothing majorly spectacular.
The bacon we ordered on the side seemed okay.
Kind of pricey at $4 for the few small strips.
The pork sausage was just okay as well.
I mean everything tasted good - just not THAT good.
If that makes sense.
the plow.author: Jill P.
the plow.review: Got here at 7:40am and there were like 7 people ahead of us.  Was really excited to get here since I've seen all the reviews and pictures and everything looked really amazing.  We were seated quickly after they opened up the doors.  The place is really cute inside but kind of small.  It was nice to see that they brought out tables and chairs to further accommodate the patrons.  Although a bit chilly, in my opinion...My son and I ordered "The Plow" and it was good...but nothing majorly spectacular.  The bacon we ordered on the side seemed okay.  Kind of pricey at $4 for the few small strips.  The pork sausage was just okay as well.  I mean everything tasted good - just not THAT good.  If that makes sense.  What I enjoyed the most was the coffee (LOL) and the lemon ricotta pancakes.  I liked those.  Maybe may come back but will not wait in that line again.  Service was also excellent - friendly waitstaff.

excerpts: The plow breakfast is ok, especially the lemon pancakes tasty, however the fried potatoes are not to die for, and I was actually hungry despite the hefty price tag.
It is ok, but after one or two days I won't remember it
the plow.author: Emmanuel B.
the plow.review: The place is really nice and the service friendly. However , and after having tried many places in SF ( sweet maple, Mymi etc) the brunch fell a bit short. The plow breakfast is ok, especially the lemon pancakes tasty, however the fried potatoes are not to die for, and I was actually hungry despite the hefty price tag. It is ok, but after one or two days I won't remember it

excerpts: However my favorite thing to order is The Plow, their namesake dish.
the plow.author: Peter P.
the plow.review:
In the cutthroat brunch scene that is San Francisco, Plow shines as one of the best. If its not obvious from the wait/long lines on the weekends or the confusing fact they typically have a small wait during the week this place is popular for good reason. The restaurant itself is small, inside there is a small counter and the seating with tables can get tight so don't be surprised if you touch your neighbors shoulder. They also have outside seating which can be a good option depending on the day. Don't let the size of the place fool you because the food they make will make you forget about the seating arrangement. 
My go-to items are the breakfast sandwich (I recommend you treat yoself and get bacon and or avocado on it cause it dials up the awesomeness), buttermilk biscuits (make sure to get plenty of the rich sweet honey butter), and lemon ricotta pancakes. FYI the biscuits do run out so don't be sad if you get there late and they are out. However my favorite thing to order is The Plow, their namesake dish. You get 2 lemon ricotta pancakes, 2 eggs, potatoes, and choice of protein. The lemon ricotta pancakes are served with maple syrup and are fluffy delicious. They have just the right balance of lemon and ricotta so the pancake isn't soggy. While I'm partial to bacon as my protein side, their other options the pork sausage patties and chicken apple sausage are also quite good. If you're extra hungry or just appreciate a variety of breakfast proteins, order an extra side with your order and you'll be a happy camper.

excerpts: I ordered The Plow, since it had a little bit of everything.
the plow.author: Lisa C.
the plow.review: A great brunch place with amazing food! My two friends and I decided to come here early (right when it opens) since we read from the Yelp reviews that the wait would be an hour to an hour and a half. We came on a Sunday and we drove by at 7:55ish (it opens at 8am on weekends) and there was already a long line, so I can't imagine how early the people came and waited in line! We dropped off one of my friends so he could stand in line while we were looking for parking. Parking wasn't too bad, considering it was around 8am, and there's street parking nearby (90 degree street parking on hills). We proceeded to wait in line, and the line was quick, only for us to discover that the hostess was just taking down how many people were in your party and whether if you preferred sitting outside, inside, or no preference.
