I mean they were good but as a lover of lemon ricotta pancakes these were not the best I've had. They could use much more lemon flavor and could spruce up the blueberry compote as well. Maybe give you a bit more since there were about 12 blueberries in total and add a little more to it maybe some liqueur flavor or a wow factor. Perhaps I should have gone for the plow breakfast (pancakes, sausage, eggs, potatoes) for the price. $16 for just pancakes is a little steep.  My brother got the gruyere toast and really enjoyed his meal. I tried one of the potatoes and they are spot on. The dining area is beautiful, they play current music, and the service is on point. There was not one thing on the menu I wasn't interested in trying I just think I may have ordered wrong.

excerpts: We ordered the plow and the two eggs breakfast and I was very happy with it!
Service was decent and the wait wasn't too long on a Wednesday morning (watch out for street cleaning!)
The only thing that was a little strange was sharing a table with another group...
Other than that I'm a fan!
the plow.author: Jenny E.
the plow.review: I'm not much of a breakfast/brunch girl but I definitely enjoyed it here! We ordered the plow and the two eggs breakfast and I was very happy with it! Service was decent and the wait wasn't too long on a Wednesday morning (watch out for street cleaning!) The only thing that was a little strange was sharing a table with another group... Other than that I'm a fan!

excerpts: The food was outstanding; I had the Plow, which I highly recommend.
the plow.author: Kelsey A.
the plow.review:
Although the wait was long, it was worth it. The staff was friendly and able to accommodate us quickly and efficiently. I absolutely loved watching the chefs prepare our meals while seated at the counter. In fact, they we were so mesmerized by their artistry that they noticed and gave us a free bowl of fresh and crispy potatoes. The food was outstanding; I had the Plow, which I highly recommend. 

Also, great music. A lot of old-school rap/hip-hop.

excerpts: I ordered the plow that came with lemon ricotta pancakes, sausage patty, over medium eggs, and the plow potatoes.
We got to see how everything was made and were anxiously waiting for our food to come.
Let me first start off by saying, everything tasted so fresh and delicious, that I am currently drooling while typing this review.
Everything was perfect!
The potatoes and pancake were my favorite.
The potatoes were nice and crispy and had a really nice flavor to them.
the plow.author: Lisa H.
the plow.review:
This place is the best place to get brunch while in the city. I always wanted to try this place but I always see a long line and sometimes the wait can be 1-2 hr wait. So finally one day, my bf and I have decided to wait it out and see what they hype was all about. When we got there on a Wednesday around 11am, we only waited about 20 mins before getting seated. I sat at the counter with my boyfriend and we had the best view in the restaurant. I ordered the plow that came with lemon ricotta pancakes, sausage patty, over medium eggs, and the plow potatoes. We got to see how everything was made and were anxiously waiting for our food to come. Let me first start off by saying, everything tasted so fresh and delicious, that I am currently drooling while typing this review. Everything was perfect! The potatoes and pancake were my favorite. The potatoes were nice and crispy and had a really nice flavor to them. The pancakes were very soft and flulffy!

It is a lot of food for one person but I couldn't put my fork down! This is a really great place for breakfast and lunch. Definitely come here early to avoid a long wait. Service is pretty good here too, the waitress is attentive and refilled our waters when empty. Will come back again and try their other items.

excerpts:
The Plow
+ Fried egg sandwich with bacon and avocado

IT
The Plow potatoes were ORGASMIC.
(I usually hate using this word, but I don't know how else to describe those taters.)
the plow.author: Jennifer K.
the plow.review:
I remember adding Plow to my Yelp bookmarks about a year ago, and laughing at this photo: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/plow-san-francisco?select=AQQHQEMRFHofOnyRFOBWCA&utm_campaign=www_photo_share_popup&utm_medium=copy_link&utm_source=(direct)

"Silly San Franciscans," I thought. I mean, brunch is great and all, but I wouldn't think twice before opting out of a rain-soaked meal.

Then my boyfriend and I went to Plow this past weekend. Waited 2 hours in line. (Actually, drank coffee and read magazines at Farley's down the street to help pass the time.) Was finally seated! And ordered the following:

+ Buttermilk biscuit with honey butter
+ The Plow
+ Fried egg sandwich with bacon and avocado

IT WAS ALL DELICIOUS. Usually, I find brunch spots specialize in making one item their "thing," but everything we ordered was incredible. The buttermilk biscuit was crunchy on the outside, and the honey butter that came with it? I'd bathe in it, if I could. The Plow potatoes were ORGASMIC. (I usually hate using this word, but I don't know how else to describe those taters.) The house made pork sausage patties were as flavorful as a mudder fudger. The fried egg sandwich was a no brainer. And don't even get me started on the lemon ricotta pancakes.

And, the staff was great! The host didn't even get annoyed that we switched back and forth between indoor seating and "first available" three times.

So, yeah. I'll be back... with an umbrella and raincoat, if necessary.

excerpts: Like many others, I have had the plow.
The portion size is pretty generous.
The plow potatoes are also nice and crispy and well seasoned.
the plow.author: Marc H.
the plow.review:
This might be my favorite breakfast/brunch place in SF. I've been here a couple times, and it does not disappoint. Although many of the reviews comment on how long the wait typically is, if you go during the week, the wait is not nearly as long (I've never had to wait over 15 min which sounds crazy compared to what most reviews mention). However, it is still very crowded even during the week day, so expect to wait a little bit and make sure your entire party is present. 

Parking is essentially just street parking around the area. As expected, it can be a bit tricky in SF some times, but there usually seems to be spots relatively close by.

They have indoor and outdoor seating, with a nice comfortable feel to the interior. Seating is a bit cramped inside, but doesn't feel uncomfortable. Although there is only one bathroom, it is nice that it is clean and tidy.

The service was very friendly from the moment we walked in to our actual table service. 

Like many others, I have had the plow. The portion size is pretty generous. The lemon ricotta pancakes are as good as everyone mentions in their reviews. The plow potatoes are also nice and crispy and well seasoned. I also had the chicken apple sausage, which was another plus to this dish. 

We also had the french toast, which was surprisingly thick yet cooked nicely all the way through. The strawberries were fresh and, when topped with the syrup, was a perfect sweet start to the day.

I've also had the breakfast sandwich which was also delicious. Adding the bacon to it made it even better (obviously!). 

All in all, great breakfast/brunch place in SF. Be prepared to wait (especially if you go on the weekend), and it is a little pricey, but the food, service and ambiance will not disappoint!

excerpts: Once seated I ordered coffee and The Plow for an entree; it was delicious.
the plow.author: Michael C.
the plow.review: I visited this place on a Saturday morning around 10:30am. Wow, the wait was long...1.5 hours long. The weather was nice that day so standing around wasn't an issue. Once seated I ordered coffee and The Plow for an entree; it was delicious. Homemade sausage patties, scrambled eggs, lemon ricotta pancakes and crispy smashed potatoes with rosemary. It was worth the wait.

excerpts: The Plow which comes with two eggs (over medium for me), potatoes (which are REALLY good, by the way), two lemon ricotta pancakes (which are amazing!) and a choice of their housemade sausages or bacon ($16.50).
My friend got the salmon benedict ($18)with potatoes, and we shared two pieces of their french toast with carmelized apples and mascarpone ($11.50)
Fluffy, I have to admit!
I would come back for their lemon ricotta pancakes for sure!
Their brunch is a little on the pricey side of things, but it's worth trying.
I pretty much stayed full for the rest of my day.
the plow.author: Kathleen S.
the plow.review:
Lately my best friend and I have been on a brunch craze and I've been wanting to try this place. We finally did!

I have known this place to be somewhere with a good hour or so wait especially on weekends. A popular thing people seem to do is put their name on the waitlist, and then wander off in the neighborhood for some coffee or pre-brunch snack. We waited about an hour and a half for a table inside. Due to high demand, it's possible you will be seated at a "community" table. Make friends with strangers, woohoo!

Now onto the food, it seems they change their menu based on what's available during the season and what is popular. I got The Plow which comes with two eggs (over medium for me), potatoes (which are REALLY good, by the way), two lemon ricotta pancakes (which are amazing!) and a choice of their housemade sausages or bacon ($16.50). My friend got the salmon benedict ($18)with potatoes, and we shared two pieces of their french toast with carmelized apples and mascarpone ($11.50) Fluffy, I have to admit! All in all, the food is delicious and filling. 

I would come back for their lemon ricotta pancakes for sure! Their brunch is a little on the pricey side of things, but it's worth trying. I pretty much stayed full for the rest of my day.

excerpts: But for starters, I had to get "The Plow".
What a huge serving!
the plow.author: Ralph N.
the plow.review:
Plow has been on my "bookmarked" list for quite some time. I've been wanting to go here for so long but I always end up backing out due to the long line. But there's something so catchy about Plow that further ignited my curiosity. Number one...long lines. Number two...great reviews. And number three...the pictures on Yelp look amazing!

Finally I was able to pay a visit with a few friends from SoCal after picking them up from a 7am bus ride from LA. Since we were there around 7:30am, we were seated very quickly. It wasn't empty...but wasn't packed either.

Ambience: Very relaxed. It's like waking up and stepping into a friend's kitchen while being strikened with a whiff of bacon and eggs cooking in the background. It's not huge but just right. I love how the tables are wooden...it provides the perfect touch to my pics for Instagram and Yelp lol.

Food: So many choices to choose from! I wanna try the Corned Beef Hash, the Egg Sandwich, and the Crab Scramble on my next visit.  But for starters, I had to get "The Plow". What a huge serving! You get two eggs, crispy potatoes, chicken sausage, & lemon ricotta pancakes. The potatoes are so good! Perfectly crisp and seasoned with salt and rosemary. It went well with the runny egg yolks and chicken sausage. But I was surprised at the lemon ricotta pancakes. I'm usually not a lemon-flavored pastry type of person but the pancakes were so fluffy from the ricotta and refreshing and light from the lemon. I think they used just the lemon zest because they seemed perfumed with a lemon essence that I fell in love with.

Overall Plow is a great place for breakfast. It's a little small so it's intended for smaller groups. Parking isn't too bad either...primarily residential parking spots. Just be patient and you'll eventually find one. I'll admit it's not the cheapest breakfast spot but it's totally worth every penny. I can't wait for my next visit.

excerpts: My boyfriend and his sister each ordered "The Plow," which came with 2 eggs, 2 lemon ricotta pancakes, plow fried potatoes and sausage.
You can choose between chicken apple sausage, pork sausage or bacon.
I can't recall what sausage they chose, but I do remember it having a bit of a spicy kick to it.
The lemon ricotta pancakes tasted a little much like a cookie to me..
I will probably try their featured pancakes next time.
the plow.author: Kate A.
the plow.review:
This is the cutest little breakfast cafe! They seem to always be busy and I'm not sure if they take reservations, so be prepared to wait about 15 minutes or so. The wait is worth it, I promise! 

I had the soft scrambled eggs with oyster mushrooms, goat cheese plow fried potatoes, toast AND bacon. This entire plate of deliciousness for less than $15 and washed down with an equally delicious coffee. 

My boyfriend and his sister each ordered "The Plow," which came with 2 eggs, 2 lemon ricotta pancakes, plow fried potatoes and sausage. You can choose between chicken apple sausage, pork sausage or bacon. I can't recall what sausage they chose, but I do remember it having a bit of a spicy kick to it. The lemon ricotta pancakes tasted a little much like a cookie to me..I will probably try their featured pancakes next time. When we went they were pumpkin pancakes, and had I the room, I would have ordered them as well.

My coffee cup was always as full as the tummy I left with. Great, friendly service. I will definitely be back to try more items!

excerpts: We all ordered the The Plow and got our food in about 15 minutes.
Right away we noticed that the portions seemed way smaller than in the pictures from previous yelp reviews which was annoying cause the entree was $17.
the plow.author: Cynthia L.
the plow.review: I was extremely excited for this place and I couldn't stop looking at the pictures on yelp. My friends and I came here on a Tuesday and we waited close to an hour for a table of 3. The hostess was also rude and the vibe we got from her was kind of snobby. Once we got seated we were served fairly quickly. We all ordered the The Plow and got our food in about 15 minutes. Right away we noticed that the portions seemed way smaller than in the pictures from previous yelp reviews which was annoying cause the entree was $17. The lemon ricotta pancakes were not fluffy or good. The eggs were unseasoned. To be honest, the best part of the dish were the potatoes which were not even that good. I felt like I wasted my money and time.

excerpts: The potatoes are amazing tried their house made sausage with poached eggs aka the plow for $17$$.
I'm on the fence about giving them 4stars.
I will go back again and dine in.
I feel like take out is never as good as dining  in.
I'm also like 17$ for two small pancakes sausage patties potatoes and eggs feels over priced.
However the place stays packed.
The French toast looks amazing will come back and try that next
the plow.author: Andre F.
the plow.review: Service was average and the food was okay. I ordered take out because there was a long line. I had to see what all the fuss was about their pancakes. The potatoes are amazing tried their house made sausage with poached eggs aka the plow for $17$$. I'm on the fence about giving them 4stars. I will go back again and dine in. I feel like take out is never as good as dining  in. I'm also like 17$ for two small pancakes sausage patties potatoes and eggs feels over priced. However the place stays packed. The French toast looks amazing will come back and try that next

excerpts: We both ordered the Plow and loved it!
The potatoes could of used a bit more seasoning but were still great.
the plow.author: Evelia T.
the plow.review:
Breakfast is my favorite meal of the day so while visiting the bay area, my bf and I HAD  to find a good breakfast spot. This place opens up at 8am on Sunday and we got there a couple minutes past 8 and there was a huge line already. That was a good sign of a great breakfast to come. We waited like an hour but it didn't bother us because you can people watch and sip complimentary coffee while you wait. 

Finally I hear my name being called and personally I think we got the best seats in the place, counter seats. We were in awe at how fast the cooks made everything. We both ordered the Plow and loved it! The potatoes could of used a bit more seasoning but were still great. I had fresh grapefruit juice and it was a nice addition to my morning. Overall we really enjoyed Plow.

excerpts: For 3, we ordered the plow (they substitute avocado instead of meat if you're vegetarian), summer melon salad, almond flour pancakes, and the cornbread muffin.
My favorites were the plow and the summer melon salad.
The plow was the perfect dish for breakfast: 2 eggs, plow potatoes, and 2 mini lemon ricotta pancakes.
If I were to go back again and get a dish solely for me, I would get this.
The eggs were cooked perfects, the potatoes were just the right amount of crispy and had great seasoning, and the pancakes were soft, fluffy and just melted in your mouth.
If you can't tell already, order this dish!
There's definitely a reason it's named after the restaurant itself.
The summer melon salad was beyond fresh and tasty.
It had many crunchy melon pieces alongside lettuce, onions, cheese, and corn.
The almond flour pancakes were just ok
- they tasted more like regular pancakes to me and there wasn't really anything special about them.
Same goes for the muffin, we honestly just ordered this because they told us they were running out of them and there was only a limited quantity
so we had some high hopes.
the plow.author: Malika R.
the plow.review:
It's no joke that you usually have to wait 1.5-2 hours to get a spot at this small but delicious brunch spot in potrero. It's just something that most San Franciscans do on a weekend morning, wait in line for one of the famous brunch places in the area. I've done it before and I'll do it again - although the wait seems far too long, Plow is mouth-watering good! 

Right on the 2-hour mark, our name was called and we were so excited to finally sit down and eat! For 3, we ordered the plow (they substitute avocado instead of meat if you're vegetarian), summer melon salad, almond flour pancakes, and the cornbread muffin. It was a LOT of food! 

My favorites were the plow and the summer melon salad. The plow was the perfect dish for breakfast: 2 eggs, plow potatoes, and 2 mini lemon ricotta pancakes. If I were to go back again and get a dish solely for me, I would get this. The eggs were cooked perfects, the potatoes were just the right amount of crispy and had great seasoning, and the pancakes were soft, fluffy and just melted in your mouth. If you can't tell already, order this dish! There's definitely a reason it's named after the restaurant itself. The summer melon salad was beyond fresh and tasty. It had many crunchy melon pieces alongside lettuce, onions, cheese, and corn. I loved the combination of all these ingredients, but this is probably a supplement to your meal, I don't think this would fill you up.

The almond flour pancakes were just ok - they tasted more like regular pancakes to me and there wasn't really anything special about them. Same goes for the muffin, we honestly just ordered this because they told us they were running out of them and there was only a limited quantity so we had some high hopes. I didn't really like the texture of the muffin and the taste was just ok as well. 

Service is great even though they're busy for at least 7 hours straight (7am-2pm). If you're willing to wait, go here! It's some good quality, hearty, delicious brunch food. I wish there was a shorter wait so I could keep going back again and again.

excerpts: On the menu, the Plow is a great choice since it comes with a variety of items.
I ordered my eggs over-easy
and it was cooked PERFECTLY!
the plow.author: Lynn T.
the plow.review: I finally got plowed! My boyfriend and I were working from home one day so we decided to check out Plow. We arrived before 8am and lucky for us there was NO wait! Once inside, I instantly fell in love with the ambiance and cozy decor. On the menu, the Plow is a great choice since it comes with a variety of items. I ordered my eggs over-easy and it was cooked PERFECTLY! The lemon ricotta pancakes were delicious and had the perfect texture.The potatoes were super fried and seasoned well, really tasty. Overall, great food and friendly service. Is it worth the 1+ hour wait? I'm not sure... but it is the best brunch place we have been to so far in the city if that helps. Tip: Go on early on a weekday to avoid the crowds!

excerpts: The coffee, the plow, the service was absolutely superb!
This will be a regular stop for us when in San Fran.
the plow.author: Rebekah S.
the plow.review: The coffee, the plow, the service was absolutely superb! This will be a regular stop for us when in San Fran.

excerpts: The lemon ricotta pancakes are the winner winner for me...as part of "the plow", you also get eggs, I chose chicken apple sausage, and potatoes.
Delish.
I could've just done the pancakes alone.
We also ordered the shirred eggs.
the plow.author: Jen W.
the plow.review:
My favorite breakfast spot in SF...always busy and for good reason.  Expect to wait...but be patient.  The food speaks for itself.

The lemon ricotta pancakes are the winner winner for me...as part of "the plow", you also get eggs, I chose chicken apple sausage, and potatoes.  Delish.  I could've just done the pancakes alone.  We also ordered the shirred eggs.  Something about tomatoes and eggs that get me everytime.  

The place is small, quaint, and very clean.  Service is friendly and efficient.  Love, love, love this place!

excerpts: Order The Plow for breakfast and have their blueberry muffin if available.
the plow.author: Yousif A.
the plow.review:
One of the best breakfast/brunch places I've had. The only downside is the wait can be very long, try to come on a weekday around 10am seems to be the least crowded.

Order The Plow for breakfast and have their blueberry muffin if available.

excerpts: I got "The Plow" as recommended for first timers since it has everything.
I love the lemon pancakes and the bacon.
Will definitely come back.
Btw we arrived at 9am and waited for 40mins.
the plow.author: mel m.
the plow.review: I live in the neighborhood but this is my first time to eat here. The long line always discouraged me to come here. Today I woke up early and decided to try and witness what the buzz is all about. I got "The Plow" as recommended for first timers since it has everything. I love the lemon pancakes and the bacon. Will definitely come back. Btw we arrived at 9am and waited for 40mins.

excerpts: The other two ordered the Plow and the Dungeness Crab Omelette.
The food took a while to come, around 15-20 minutes.
Nevertheless the presentations were nice.
the Plow was good but not spectacular.
the plow.author: Jessica E.
the plow.review:
Brunch is a meal I often dream about. That's when I knew I had to check out this popular brunch place. I came in during a weekday, to avoid the weekend rush, and only waited 10 minutes for indoor seating. The place is pretty small and our tavle of three had to squeeze into a table set normally for two. After glancing over the menu, I ordered the Fried Egg Sandwich because eggs are egg-celent in my book. The other two ordered the Plow and the Dungeness Crab Omelette. The food took a while to come, around 15-20 minutes. Nevertheless the presentations were nice. We ended up sharing a majority of our dishes.

I ended up really liking my dish. The egg was warm and runny and the bread had a soft, crunchy texture. However, the best component of my dish were the house potatoes.  Mmmm... mouth watering and crispy, a reminiscent of french fries. These potatoes were out of this world!

In regards to the other dishes, I didn't really like the omelette  and the Plow was good but not spectacular. I really enjoyed the lemon ricotta pancakes. Overall the food impressed but was a little on the pricy side.  Good thing everything came in big portions! Will hopefully be back soon

excerpts: I ordered The Plow and the eggs and potatoes were my favorite parts of the dish.
Best eggs and potatoes I've ever eaten!
the plow.author: Karen L.
the plow.review:
Brunch in San Francisco is the best and Potrero Hill has the best parking in all of San Francisco. I found an unmetered street parking spot within a few minutes of spotting the restaurant. 

The wait for breakfast early in the morning on the weekend was one hour but it was worth it. I ordered The Plow and the eggs and potatoes were my favorite parts of the dish. Best eggs and potatoes I've ever eaten! The lemon ricotta pancakes were good but I think I was a little too full to enjoy them as much as I should have. I probably wouldn't order the sausage again. Highly recommend coming here if you have two hours to kill for breakfast!

excerpts: I ordered the Plow breakfast.
the plow.author: Alysa N.
the plow.review:
This is probably one of the best breakfast/brunch places in SF. I got here around 740 on a Saturday and was seated immediately when they opened. Keep in mind, I was maybe 10th in line and there was a huge line behind me before 8AM. 

The coffee was just okay. Nothing too special. I ordered the Plow breakfast. It consists of eggs, a meat, potatoes, and lemon ricotta pancakes. Te best part of the dish was the lemon ricotta pancakes!! So moist (I hate that word but had to use it) and delicious! I selected the house made sausage...definitely a winner! Try this even if you don't like sausage! The potatoes were perfectly seasoned and crispy. I could have an entire plate of this. It was a very large plate overall but totally worth the money! 

I'll be back to try more items.

excerpts: Both my friend and I ordered the plow which consisted of a choice of meat, 2 lemon ricotta pancakes, two eggs, and crispy potatoes.
Let me just say, the wait is totally worth it.
My friend and I felt indifferent about the meat (she got the chicken apple sausage
and I got the homemade pork sausage).
I thought the sausage was kind of dry and was over it because everything else on the plate shined brighter.
The pancakes are sooo good.
They are cakey and moist, and just heavenly.
The potatoes, were some of the best potatoes I have ever had.
They were super crispy and seasoned well.
I recommend getting the crispy potatoes and lemon ricotta pancakes; they are just out of this world!
I recommend getting the crispy potatoes and lemon ricotta pancakes; they are just out of this world!
the plow.author: Vivian Y.
the plow.review:
I have been waiting to try Plow out because of it's ratings and reviews here on Yelp, and the fact that I have seen the name in numerous sources. Came to Plow on a saturday morning with my friend. We decided to brunch and catch up before she headed back to school. We waited a good 2 hours before we were finally seated, so either bring something to do, or get ready for some good conversations with your group. 

Ambiance/ Appearance:
Plow is located in Potrero Hill and it felt very hipster and homey. Plow is on the corner, which is a good thing because it needs all the waiting area space it can provide. There is a few tables of outdoor seating on the side of the restaurant. Inside, there aren't too many tables, so most likely you will have to share with others. There was a slight rustic feel inside, but it felt very lively because of the music and background conversations. 

Service:
The service is excellent. Servers and staff are super nice and made sure you felt comfortable.

Taste: 
Both my friend and I ordered the plow which consisted of a choice of meat, 2 lemon ricotta pancakes, two eggs, and crispy potatoes. Let me just say, the wait is totally worth it. My friend and I felt indifferent about the meat (she got the chicken apple sausage and I got the homemade pork sausage). I thought the sausage was kind of dry and was over it because everything else on the plate shined brighter. The pancakes are sooo good. They are cakey and moist, and just heavenly. The potatoes, were some of the best potatoes I have ever had. They were super crispy and seasoned well. It had some shallots or onions and other herbs. 

With tax and tip, I think it came out to $20. Overall the food was bomb dot com! I would totally return again (but probably not on a weekend or at later times in the day to avoid the wait). Even with the wait, it is totally worth trying out. I recommend getting the crispy potatoes and lemon ricotta pancakes; they are just out of this world!

excerpts: Let's start off by saying the Plow potatoes were by far my favorite part of my meal.

Food:
-Ordered the Plow breakfast which comes with lemon ricotta pancakes, your choice of protein, potatoes, and eggs.
the plow.author: Chhaya N.
the plow.review:
Let's start off by saying the Plow potatoes were by far my favorite part of my meal. 

Food:
-Ordered the Plow breakfast which comes with lemon ricotta pancakes, your choice of protein, potatoes, and eggs. I also ordered a rolled Jasmine tea.

The portion size is huge, so I couldn't finish everything but that works if you'd like some leftovers.

Atmosphere:
-The place is well decorated meaning colors are soothing and match the wood theme throughout the place. 

The music is a little odd. Blend of house and jazz. 

Parking:
-There are side streets to park but no parking lot that belongs to the restaurant. 

Wait times:
-The place is small so be prepared to wait. Especially on the weekends. They have small benches to sit on outside while you wait so you won't have to stand. 

Cleanliness:
-The place as a whole is very clean, including the restroom. However there is only a single stall for both men and women. 

Overall a great brunch place.

excerpts: It was good, but expensive: $22 for 'the plow' and a cup of coffee, plus tip.
the plow.author: Andrew M.
the plow.review:
It was good, but expensive: $22 for 'the plow' and a cup of coffee, plus tip. 

Service was great, the food was good, and the waiting to be seated certainly sucks, but that's not their fault.

I'd give 3.5 stars.

excerpts: We got the Plow so we could try a little of everything.
Variety is the spice of life and all that shizz.
the plow.author: Aerin Y.
the plow.review:
DEFINITELY got lucky. Among ~10 breakfast spots in the city, this was our pick. And we left satisfied. 

Came on a weekday @1PM and there was only a 15min wait. Easy...we went for a walk and checked out the shops in the vicinity. Table was ready in no time. (~10 tables, half indoors/half outdoors)

We got the Plow so we could try a little of everything. Variety is the spice of life and all that shizz. Came with 2 eggs, 2 lemon ricotta pancakes, potatoes, and choice of meat. Not bad for $16!

So the food...Let's start with the NEGATIVES. 1. Compared to the banana pancakes at Bill's Cafe in SJ (A+), the pancakes are on the smaller side. And as we all know, #biggerisbetter...always. BUT if you're #qualityoverquantity, flavor is just right...enough lemony goodness without being overpowering.

2. Baked goods were all out by the time we got there. +They must be damn delicious! -Get there early (definitely before noon)

The POSITIVES. The eggs were perfect..let's be real, it's hard to get eggs wrong. Potatoes were nice and crispy. Now the meat. For all you meatatarians, if you're not a bacon lover, please do yourself a favor and go with the pork sausage. I love me some bacon but after tasting my sister's pork sausage, I spent the whole meal secretly wishing I could steal her plate. Don't make the same mistake.

Overall, a memorable breakfast. I'll be back!

excerpts: I got the Plow, which is a fair amount of food, but my plate was wiped clean at the end and
I even picked at my Mom's bacon, which was crunchy, fatty and great.
I highly recommend the Plow.
Overall: One of the better breakfasts/brunches I have had.
Come hungry and leave happy, full and a little heavier.
I can't imagine the wait on the weekends, so try coming off peak hours because you cannot make reservations.
the plow.author: George S.
the plow.review:
Service: Hard to say since I sat at the "bar" with my Mom and watched the cooking.
Atmosphere: I went on a weekday morning and it was still packed. You will have to wait and it will be crowded, but it doesn't seem like it gets too loud and a great option is to sit at the "bar".
Drink: I got whole milk since I wanted to indulge a tad and my mother got a homemade juice that was refreshing.  I would stick to caffeinated drinks and save all of your stomach for the food.
Food: Delicious. Come with an empty stomach and be sure to try the lemon pancakes. I got the Plow, which is a fair amount of food, but my plate was wiped clean at the end and I even picked at my Mom's bacon, which was crunchy, fatty and great. I highly recommend the Plow. 
Overall: One of the better breakfasts/brunches I have had. Come hungry and leave happy, full and a little heavier. I can't imagine the wait on the weekends, so try coming off peak hours because you cannot make reservations.

excerpts: I ordered the plow which comes with their spiced potatoes, eggs, lemon griddle cakes, and your choice of sausage or bacon.
Its pretty simple but executed very well.
My lady ordered the breakfast sandwich with Bacon and it also comes with eggs, potatoes too.
It was also very good though not a very different of a dish at all
the plow.author: Huy V.
the plow.review:
This place serves some legit breakfast eats. I ordered the plow which comes with their spiced potatoes, eggs, lemon griddle cakes, and your choice of sausage or bacon. Its pretty simple but executed very well. My lady ordered the breakfast sandwich with Bacon and it also comes with eggs, potatoes too. It was also very good though not a very different of a dish at all so if you wanted to try something new, I think you would need to order something else. 

Its a small place and gets extremely crowded so plan accordingly. Even during a weekday you might wait close to an hour for a table. There are a number of coffee shops nearby though. Parking was pretty easy on the cross street but can imagine it might get difficult during a busy weekend. Overall, I really enjoyed this place and would go back if I had the time.

excerpts: I had the plow which included potatoes (a bit overfried and standard tasting), eggs (scrambled done perfectly) chicken sausage and lemon ricotta pancakes.
The lemon ricotta pancakes are the most delicious thing I have ever tasted.
the plow.author: Sarah S.
the plow.review:
Simple. Carefully made. Local.

First time to Plow with colleagues. We started with a round of grapefruit mimosas. They were fantastic and don't skimp on the champagne.

We shared a biscuit with homage butter and it was to die for. I could make a meal of those biscuits.

I had the plow which included potatoes (a bit overfried and standard tasting), eggs (scrambled done perfectly) chicken sausage and lemon ricotta pancakes.

The pork sausage is way better than the chicken.

The lemon ricotta pancakes are the most delicious thing I have ever tasted. Next time I'll get those with a side of sausage.

Service was good. Menu was delightfully small. Wait on a Friday morning was pretty long. Get in early.

excerpts: My wife and I got the Plow & Egg Benedict, both were amazing :)
the plow.author: Alex K.
the plow.review:
Really really good breakfast spot! My wife and I got the Plow & Egg Benedict, both were amazing :)

Make sure you have plenty of time dropping by, both times we passed by there was a long line waiting outside. We waited around 30min, but it was totally worth the wait

excerpts: I had the Plow breakfast, which was incredibly filling, varied, and I ate every morsel of it, plus a side of potatoes.
The table also ordered the lemon ricotta, the eggs Benny, and another item which I 'm forgetting.
Even with the crowd and the slightly frenetic pace, the food is delivered with care, cooked just right, and served fairly quickly.
Not sure how they do it, but it's impressive.
Wouldn't wait two hours for the food, but 30-45 minutes was worth it.
the plow.author: Mike C.
the plow.review:
Welp, we took the ongoing advice and got there early on a Sunday AM. Totally worth it. I knew we were onto something great when they had a person dedicated to the "list". That tells me a lot. This place cares about your experience from the minute you walk in. Plus she was super nice...and cute.
The food, well, was simply delicious. Maybe not up to the ultimate hype, but definitely very good. I had the Plow breakfast, which was incredibly filling, varied, and I ate every morsel of it, plus a side of potatoes. The table also ordered the lemon ricotta, the eggs Benny, and another item which I 'm forgetting. Even with the crowd and the slightly frenetic pace, the food is delivered with care, cooked just right, and served fairly quickly. Not sure how they do it, but it's impressive.
Wouldn't wait two hours for the food, but 30-45 minutes was worth it.

excerpts: Get The Plow breakfast plate and get the amaaaazing coffee!
the plow.author: Wanda G.
the plow.review: Yes!!! Worth the wait no matter how long the line is! Great food, great vibe, great service. Get The Plow breakfast plate and get the amaaaazing coffee!

excerpts: I had 'the plow' that came with two eggs, potatoes, lemon ricotta pancakes and bacon.
At first, they didn't look too different from other brunch place, but were x100 tastier!!
The eggs were soft but perfectly cooked, and potatoes were well-seasoned and very crispy.
I probably could have had 5 more pancakes.
the plow.author: Julia C.
the plow.review:
While I was visiting San Francisco late weekend, my friend took me here for brunch. Thanks to my friend who put her name on a wait list a couple of hours ahead, we were able to sit almost right after we showed up. 

I had 'the plow' that came with two eggs, potatoes, lemon ricotta pancakes and bacon. At first, they didn't look too different from other brunch place, but were x100 tastier!! The eggs were soft but perfectly cooked, and potatoes were well-seasoned and very crispy. I probably could have had 5 more pancakes. Lol. 

Our server was super friendly and attentive as well. Strongly recommended!

excerpts: We've tried the Plow with the lemon ricotta pancakes, the Hong Kong style toast, the egg sandwich with avocado, and the french toast.
Everything we've ordered thus far has been delicious.
the plow.author: Anne Y.
the plow.review:
Oh Plow, I'm starting to fall in love with you. I was forewarned by the Yelp reviews about how long the wait is, so each time I've been here, I made sure to try and get there shortly after they've opened to beat the hour long wait.

I'm writing my review based on my latest visit. I have a 10-month old baby who gets pretty fussy if he isn't kept entertained, so I'm always apprehensive about taking him with me when dining out. This past visit, my hubby, son, and I were seated at the bar. I love that their high chair attaches to the table. Our server was so friendly and engaged with the baby, which to me was a plus. Not to mention the hostess, who noticed that we were beginning to struggle with the baby. She brought over a little toy to keep him entertained so that was really sweet of her.

Now to the important part... the food. BOMB! We've tried the Plow with the lemon ricotta pancakes, the Hong Kong style toast, the egg sandwich with avocado, and the french toast. Everything we've ordered thus far has been delicious. The quality of the ingredients is great, even down to the cup of coffee.

I'll continue to frequent this place. Highly recommended for anyone who likes breakfast. Just as a head's up, come early to avoid the long wait.

excerpts: I split the plow plate with my mom and they were happy to provide and extra plate to do so, which I really appreciate.
The plow plate is well rounded and delicious.
I enjoyed splitting it too.
the plow.author: Julia M.
the plow.review:
Delicious!!!

Great food. Great staff. Great atmosphere. Great spot. 

I highly recommend this breakfast joint. This is a great neighborhood place. 

The staff was very friendly, kind and attentive. I split the plow plate with my mom and they were happy to provide and extra plate to do so, which I really appreciate. 

We went on this Wednesday morning a little before 8am and only had to wait about 15 mins. I would recommend getting your name in a few minutes before 8 since some people who were meeting each other for breakfast got there right at 8. 

The drip coffee from Plow was rich and flavorful. And the servers are great about keeping it full. 

The plow plate is well rounded and delicious. I enjoyed splitting it too. The lemon ricotta pancakes were rich but light. I would love to try them with be berry compote that comes with them when ordered alone. The potatoes were the real star of the dish they had rosemary on them but it wasn't overpowering and they were crispy but not greasy. The bacon was excellent! 

Definitely would come back!

excerpts: I ordered "The Plow" which was with 2 eggs, 4 chicken apple sausage, potatoes, and 2 lemon ricotta pancakes.
The pancakes were delicious- pretty strong on the lemon flavor.
the plow.author: Taylor M.
the plow.review:
One of my new favorite brunch spots in the city. I went here on a Thursday around 11 with no reservation and waited for about 10 minutes. We were seated outside. It was a bit chilly but they offer blankets which is a nice perk. 

I ordered "The Plow" which was with 2 eggs, 4 chicken apple sausage, potatoes, and 2 lemon ricotta pancakes. The pancakes were delicious- pretty strong on the lemon flavor. I also had a side of bacon, and shared the French toast for dessert.  

I enjoy the true "farm to table" vibe, which makes it worth the slightly higher price point. But for 3 entrees and one side, one mimosa and 1 orange juice, we paid $100 including the tip. 

I will definitely be back the next time I am looking for an excuse to treat my self, which will be sooner than later I am sure.

excerpts: My friend and I both ordered The Plow, which I feel like everyone gets here haha, but for good reason!
the plow.author: Jingxi Z.
the plow.review:
Ugh, the hype here is as real as it gets. Came for an early afternoon brunch on Sunday and because we came in so late, the wait was only around 15 minutes! Although I have heard nightmare tales about the wait here at peak hours so definitely try and come either really early or really late like us haha.

My friend and I both ordered The Plow, which I feel like everyone gets here haha, but for good reason! It's two eggs, choice of house made pork sausage, nueske bacon, or chicken apple sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes, crispy potatoes and it comes out all photo shoot ready for your Instagram shot :) I loved everything on my plate and it was one of the best brunches I've ever had but definitely the lemon ricotta pancakes get a shout out. I'll be back for sure!!

excerpts: My boyfriend ordered "The Plow" and also enjoyed every bite!
the plow.author: Marissa R.
the plow.review:
Tip: Come early! The line gets very long!

Service: We did wait about an hour or so and were one of the last to be seated (it stops taking patrons at 2 pm).  The waitress did seem a bit pushy but she took our orders and everything came out as asked.

Food: Incredible!!! I never thought a simple order of pancakes could be so delicious! I ordered the almond flour pancakes.  Huge pancakes that filled me up and satisfied my hunger.  My boyfriend ordered "The Plow" and also enjoyed every bite!

excerpts: I'd recommend getting the The Plow if you ever don't know what to get, especially since it's their signature dish.
Plus the grapefruit mimosa as I constantly saw people ordering them.
Overall awesome service, awesome food, awesome place!
the plow.author: Quaid M.
the plow.review: Definitely a place to go for breakfast/brunch. If you don't mind the wait it is well worth it for the food. The ambiance is pretty cool and laid back. The service was amazing to top it off. I'd recommend getting the The Plow if you ever don't know what to get, especially since it's their signature dish. Plus the grapefruit mimosa as I constantly saw people ordering them. Overall awesome service, awesome food, awesome place!

excerpts: I recommend "The Plow" -- two lemon ricotta pancakes, crispy potatoes, two eggs (any style), and a choice of bacon, house pork sausage, or chicken apple sausage.
This dish is huge, very satisfying, and has variety.
the plow.author: Priscilla W.
the plow.review:
Three words: lemon ricotta pancakes!

They're delicious. They're lemony without tasting like dishwash detergent and the ricotta isn't too heavy. They're dense and fluffy at the same time, with a mousse-like consistency. And they're good enough on their own that the side of pure maple syrup, served in the most adorable little dispenser, isn't necessary. I'm not a big fan of pancakes, yet I'd be willing to order a full serving of these amazing lemon ricotta pancakes next time!

I also love Plow's crispy potatoes. Every time I'm given a choice between side salad or side potatoes, I always opt for salad to be "healthier". Plow only offers potatoes. But I'm glad that's my only option or else I'd feel more guilty for not eating my veggies. The potatoes are so crispy! They're packed with flavor and I love the generous amount of dried rosemary used to season these carb-loaded tubers.

I recommend "The Plow" -- two lemon ricotta pancakes, crispy potatoes, two eggs (any style), and a choice of bacon, house pork sausage, or chicken apple sausage. This dish is huge, very satisfying, and has variety. You'll unbuckle your belt and roll down the hill after you've devoured everything and licked the plate clean.

The Eggs Benedict with smoked salmon is also tasty. The muffins are too thick and too large, proportionally, compared to the salmon and eggs. The salmon is salty and flavorful, and it pairs nicely with the beautifully poached, ooey-gooey runny eggs. 

Our host was extremely friendly and our waitress was nice, but service was poorly timed. It took a few minutes before we got our water and for her to take our orders. We arrived at 1PM on a Saturday and were seated outside within 30 minutes (inside would've taken at least another 10 minutes). Plow is on a hill with a slight incline, so it felt a little awkward eating on slanted tables outside. Therefore, I recommend dining inside. And I can't believe I'm saying this, but parking is VERY easy in this neighborhood. I will definitely be back!

excerpts: I ordered the plow.
Yes, the house made sausage is pretty tasty.
Other than that I can't rave about the lemon pancakes.
They weren't as amazing as many reviewers said they are.
the plow.author: M E.
the plow.review:
This place is good. I wouldn't say I would ever wait an hour long to dine here again though. 

First off, the hostess... she was slightly snooty. She was not rude, just not very welcoming. Can't put my finger on it. It's like she didn't know how to smile.

Our server on the other hand was very sweet. I ordered the plow. Yes, the house made sausage is pretty tasty. Other than that I can't rave about the lemon pancakes. They weren't as amazing as many reviewers said they are. I think I prefer plain ol buttermilk to be honest. 

It's easy to find. Parking was not too bad on a Friday morning. It's clean but with a tight seating arrangement. 

My other peeve is they only serve drip coffee... no espresso drinks.

excerpts: Had the plow special heard about this place and been wanting to try it for a long time the wait was about 30 minutes on a Friday afternoon
everything was good service was
good food was OK not somewhere and rush back to you
but maybe if I was in the area I'd stop in again just a normal breakfast spot
the plow.author: Johnny C.
the plow.review: Came in. Had the plow special heard about this place and been wanting to try it for a long time the wait was about 30 minutes on a Friday afternoon everything was good service was good food was OK not somewhere and rush back to you but maybe if I was in the area I'd stop in again just a normal breakfast spot

excerpts: These two dishes are the Plow and the Omelette.
The Plow, really really good, but
the Omelette was just ok.
We were both not hungry anymore because we had to wait an hour
and we ended up walking over to Farley's for a coffee and a Carrot Zucchinni Bread.
Even still...we both thought the food was excellent and highly recommend!
the plow.author: Soo K.
the plow.review: This spot satisfies my love for creative and delicious food with inspired spaces.  These two dishes are the Plow and the Omelette.  The Plow, really really good, but the Omelette was just ok.  We were both not hungry anymore because we had to wait an hour and we ended up walking over to Farley's for a coffee and a Carrot Zucchinni Bread.  Even still...we both thought the food was excellent and highly recommend!

excerpts: My husband got "the plow" with the special lemon ricotta pancakes.
You can really tell the ingredients are fresh!
the plow.author: Amanda H.
the plow.review:
It's been less then 12 hours and I'm already wanting to go back! The breakfast here is on point! Love the fresh ingredients! 
Got here on a Saturday morning at 8:45. Yes, the wait was long..like an hour, but it was so worth it! I got the French toast with strawberries. It was hands down the best French toast I've ever had. The syrup is the bomb! My husband got "the plow" with the special lemon ricotta pancakes. You can really tell the ingredients are fresh!

excerpts: The Plow is a cute little place with indoor and outdoor seating.
The first time I tried to go to the plow, I was told it would be a 1 hour wait on a Sunday morning.
However, after waiting 1 hour.. I went to check up on the wait list and was told it would be 1 more hour.
At that point we were just too hungry
so we decided to leave and try somewhere else.
we got "the plow".. and let me just say.. those crispy potatoes doe.
i know everyone's raving about those..
they're almost like those typical potato hash pieces brunch places serve.. but fried to a crisp perfection.
as a huge fan of fries, im in love with these!
the plow.author: Sandy Y.
the plow.review:
The Plow is a cute little place with indoor and outdoor seating. The first time I tried to go to the plow, I was told it would be a 1 hour wait on a Sunday morning. However, after waiting 1 hour.. I went to check up on the wait list and was told it would be 1 more hour. At that point we were just too hungry so we decided to leave and try somewhere else. A few weeks later, we decided to go back and give it a try, and waited 1 hour to get in. 

we got "the plow".. and let me just say.. those crispy potatoes doe. i know everyone's raving about those..  they're almost like those typical potato hash pieces brunch places serve.. but fried to a crisp perfection. as a huge fan of fries, im in love with these! the rest of the plate was good with two poached eggs, lemon ricotta pancakes (very unique!), and house- made pork sausage, 

we also got a plate of french toast! the french toast here was unlike any other french toast that i've had before. the outside was what you'd expect- toasted bread. but the inside of the toast was what surprised me. it was super moist and soft.. and it basically melted in your mouth. it was a really interesting juxtaposition of textures. 

overall, food was really good.. but the wait time is a bit too much for me

excerpts: We ordered the Plow breakfast (with lemon ricotta pancakes, eggs, potatoes and chicken apple sausage), and the seasonal pumpkin pancakes.
The lemon ricotta pancakes were beautifully golden brown.
They had a definite hint of lemon, but I thought they were a little bland.
Not enough sugar in the batter perhaps.
The potatoes were extra crispy on the outside, tender on the inside, and perfectly seasoned (no ketchup required).
the plow.author: Keys W.
the plow.review:
Visited during Saturday brunch hour. Waited over an hour, and probably would not have gotten a table if hadn't spoken up, as they seated people who came after us before us. 

However, the food was perfectly cooked, the atmosphere and service are friendly, and the coffee while you wait was a caffeinated perk. 

We ordered the Plow breakfast (with lemon ricotta pancakes, eggs, potatoes and chicken apple sausage), and the seasonal pumpkin pancakes. The lemon ricotta pancakes were beautifully golden brown. They had a definite hint of lemon, but I thought they were a little bland. Not enough sugar in the batter perhaps. The potatoes were extra crispy on the outside, tender on the inside, and perfectly seasoned (no ketchup required). I highly recommend the potatoes. 

I also recommend the delicious pumpkin pancakes. They were like pumpkin pie in pancake form, topped with delicately flavored pears. 
 
If you can visit during an off time, do. They make a great breakfast, however I don't think it's worth the wait.

excerpts: We all ordered the Plow, which came with plenty of food but not overly so that I felt uncomfortably stuffed.
the plow.author: Mina K.
the plow.review:
I've wanted to try Plow for a while, but was apprehensive about the infamously long 1.5 hour+ wait on weekends. But when a friend visiting from out of town requested Plow, I eagerly hopped on board. 

I went at 11:30 am on a Saturday to place our party of 4 on the list. The hostess said it would be a 1.5 hour wait. We came back in 1.5 hours, and they had already called our party, but gave us the next available table. 

We all ordered the Plow, which came with plenty of food but not overly so that I felt uncomfortably stuffed. The lemon ricotta pancakes that came with the dish- out of this world. I never knew pancakes could taste so lemony and fluffy! 

The potatoes were also delicious. I usually do not eat all my potatoes, because let's be real, they usually suck. But not Plow's! They have perfected their potatoes to crispy bites of enchantments. 

The service was also impeccable. Our waitress was friendly, as was the general manager (I think his name might have been Randall?) of the establishment. SO friendly. I really enjoyed interacting with the manager. 

Overall, a lovely brunch with excellent food. However, I don't think that it is worth the 1.5-2 hour wait. I recommend writing your name down and coming back later on the weekend, or going in on a weekday if somehow possible (I know, most of us have this inconvenient thing called work...). A friend of mine went in on a Thursday morning/early afternoon and he was seated with no wait!

excerpts: The plow breakfast may have very well been the best breakfast I've ever eaten.
And I really, really like breakfast.
the plow.author: Shayna B.
the plow.review:
The plow breakfast may have very well been the best breakfast I've ever eaten. And I really, really like breakfast. Lemon ricotta pancakes, eggs cooked perfectly, homemade sausage (it shows), and excellent deep fried potatoes with rosemary.

They serve Youk's hot sauce here, which I was unaware of until now, but is apparently my favorite hot sauce. Especially for eggs.

Prepare to wait to be seated. A while. It's small. They'll allow you to put your name in, take a walk and/or grab a coffee nearby and come back though.

And once you sit down, service and the kitchen are super fast.

Seriously, you MUST go here if you're in the Potrero Hill area and don't get put off by the wait. It's WELL worth it!!

excerpts: We had The plow breakfast.
The potatoes were perfectly crunchy and super flavorful.
The house sausages not greasy and delicious.
The pancakes were not huge like other places, which for us was a big plus, instead they are small enough that you can actually finish the rest of the food and not feel stuffed.
the plow.author: Rosa G.
the plow.review:
AMAZING!! This place did not disappoint.  We had The plow breakfast.  The potatoes were perfectly crunchy and super flavorful.  The house sausages not greasy and delicious.  The pancakes were not huge like other places, which for us was a big plus, instead they are small enough that you can actually finish the rest of the food and not feel stuffed.  Prices are on the high end, but for a breakfast like this, don't mind AT ALL! 

This place lives up to the hype!

excerpts: Generous portion of eggs make The Plow a delicious and filling choice.
the plow.author: Ashley R.
the plow.review: Long wait but definitely worth it! The roasted potatoes were the best thing I ate, but the lemon ricotta pancakes were a close second. Generous portion of eggs make The Plow a delicious and filling choice.

excerpts: We got the Plow and corned hash.
These were both just okay; when you order a combination dish with pancakes plus other stuff, you expect and usually receive regular sized pancakes.
Here, they give you baby ones.
If we had known that, we would have just gotten the lemon ricotta pancake dish.
I also wasn't really impressed with the sausage, so I'd advise the bacon instead as a side.
The corned hash with toast and eggs your way was nothing spectacular.
the plow.author: Stella A.
the plow.review:
Slow service. It was actually pretty busy on a Wednesday morning, so we had a 15 min wait before we were seated, but then there was another 30 min wait for our food. And we ordered right when we sat down. For brunch food, I don't think it should have taken this long.

We got the Plow and corned hash. These were both just okay; when you order a combination dish with pancakes plus other stuff, you expect and usually receive regular sized pancakes. Here, they give you baby ones. If we had known that, we would have just gotten the lemon ricotta pancake dish. I also wasn't really impressed with the sausage, so I'd advise the bacon instead as a side. The corned hash with toast and eggs your way was nothing spectacular. Both dishes required a lot of hot sauce and pepper for my taste.

As not all brunch places in SF are open on a weekday morning, we were happy to stop by Plow. The ambiance is nice, with lots of natural lighting and an open kitchen (there's bar seating too). But still, that wait time and the just okay food.

excerpts: Okay the plow potatoes- am I missing something???
They're okay-
I personally don't think they have much flavor.
Open faced sandwich-
my BF is a fan of.
Get it if you are a fan of prosciutto!
Chia seed pudding is a great healthy option but I wish it was a little bigger.
The fried egg sandwich- meh.
You're in SF!
Why you get this.
Just no.
the plow.author: Michelle M.
the plow.review:
Oh, plow. How I've struggled to get to you before the rush times so I don't have to wait an hour+ 

I've eaten here three times now. I've tried a lot of the things on the menu because I have gone with a group two times out of the three. 

I have gotten the lemon ricotta pancakes some way or another every single time. The first time- it was SO good, super lemony and it had the perfect amount of sweetness. The second time- had a weird taste at the end that I can't put my finger on. The third time- barely any lemon flavor. I have to say it was nice and moist all three times though. Maybe the batch differs by whoever that makes it? But the taste has not been consistent. 
They cook the eggs well- some places are too oily or buttery. The sausage patty tastes homemade but came out burnt last time. 
Okay the plow potatoes- am I missing something??? They're okay- I personally don't think they have much flavor. 
Open faced sandwich- my BF is a fan of. Get it if you are a fan of prosciutto! 
Chia seed pudding is a great healthy option but I wish it was a little bigger.
The fried egg sandwich- meh. You're in SF! Why you get this. Just no. 
The French toast with balsamic strawberries- the bread itself is super thick so it wasn't cooked all the way through last time. 

Grapefruit mimosa is good and it's a good amount but it's a lil pricey. The strawberry lemonade is waaaay too sour. 

The waitresses are nice and attentive- I have no complaints. 

Do yourself a favor and get here before 9 AT LEAST. Parking is actually pretty easy- plenty of spots.

To be honest, it is overhyped but it's definitely worth a try. I think I've had my share of plow for now.

excerpts: You really can't go wrong with the Plow.
It gives you a little bit of everything that this amazing places has to offer
the plow.author: Kate S.
the plow.review: Best breakfast I have had in a long time! Really simple breakfast staples like eggs and pancakes, but the done in a very elegant and delicious way. You really can't go wrong with the Plow. It gives you a little bit of everything that this amazing places has to offer

excerpts: I had the Plow with chicken Apple sausage, sunny side up eggs, breakfast potatoes, and lemon ricotta pancakes.
The food was pleasant and well flavored and fresh...
the plow.author: Lori S.
the plow.review:
Bottom line: tasty food, but not worth the hype. 

Twice, the boyfriend and I have headed to Plow for brunch, and twice we balked at the multi-hour waits and went somewhere else. This time we put our names on the list, held back a wince when we were told a 2 hour wait, and went to a coffee shop to pass the time. We came back two hours later and were seated promptly. 

The staff was nice and the food was good. I had the Plow with chicken Apple sausage, sunny side up eggs, breakfast potatoes, and lemon ricotta pancakes. The food was pleasant and well flavored and fresh... But nothing to write home about. 

Basically, it was a solid breakfast option but certainly not worth the insane wait time.

excerpts: I order the Plow ( eggs + pancakes + potatoes) each time just to make sure I get a little bit of everything.
the plow.author: Kayla M.
the plow.review:
I love Plow so much. 

This tiny restaurant is PACKED at any given time of the day. I always like to show up when the doors first open to avoid the 1+ hour wait time. But boy are you in for a treat once you're finally seated. 

I've tried pretty much everything on their menu at this point and NOTHING disappoints. The best thing though hands down are their lemon ricotta pancakes. Each bite is like a little taste of heaven. I order the Plow ( eggs + pancakes + potatoes) each time just to make sure I get a little bit of everything. Their crispy potatoes are also delicious. Customer service is always on point. Feel free to ask for a mimosa or a cup of coffee while you wait. They'll gladly oblige. 

Can't wait to go back once I'm in town!

excerpts: I wanted to visit the Plow very much, because of its popularity and long lines near cafe.
I was expecting from this place something really delicious.
So we came Wednesday morning and the line was just 20 minutes for us.
Staff was very polite and nice - they smiled all the time and did a great job.
Place is very clean and neat - that is so important.
We ordered The Plow and Soft scrambled eggs, two cups of coffee and one orange juice.
Portions are big, you will not be hungry at the end.
But the food is just ok...
We payed $50 plus $10 tips for our breakfast.
For me it doesn't worth that money and lines.
the plow.author: Mariia N.
the plow.review: I wanted to visit the Plow very much, because of its popularity and long lines near cafe. I was expecting from this place something really delicious. So we came Wednesday morning and the line was just 20 minutes for us. Staff was very polite and nice - they smiled all the time and did a great job. Place is very clean and neat - that is so important. We ordered The Plow and Soft scrambled eggs, two cups of coffee and one orange juice. Portions are big, you will not be hungry at the end. But the food is just ok... We payed $50 plus $10 tips for our breakfast. For me it doesn't worth that money and lines.

excerpts: I ordered the plow which consisted of lemon ricotta pancakes, house potatoes, chicken sausage (or bacon) and eggs with their iced chai tea!
I wasn't a fan of the lemon ricotta pancakes, I thought they were a little too dense.
I'm not really a pancake person, so when I do have them I expect a lot.
I'm also not a chai tea person, but the chai tea was really good!
I ordered it with almond milk instead of regular milk.
It had a very strong spicy taste to it.
My friend ordered the chia pudding, a side of the Hong Kong style toast, with their strawberry lemonade.
All I remember is seeing her food then seeing nothing but an empty plate & bowl!
the plow.author: Vangielynne P.
the plow.review:
I came here with a friend for my birthday brunch. It was a random Wednesday around noon time. I was expecting there to be a long wait but nope! It was probably a 15-20 minute wait which isn't bad at all! 

After putting our name down, we were able to get a copy of the menu and decide what we were going to eat. Even though, we both already had something in mind from all the pictures on Yelp! 

Once we got called, we asked to sit inside rather than out because it was still a little chilly in SF. We sat at the bar & were amazed since we were able to watch the chefs cook! Everything they were making looked delicious!! I ordered the plow which consisted of lemon ricotta pancakes, house potatoes, chicken sausage (or bacon) and eggs with their iced chai tea! I wasn't a fan of the lemon ricotta pancakes, I thought they were a little too dense. I'm not really a pancake person, so when I do have them I expect a lot. I'm also not a chai tea person, but the chai tea was really good! I ordered it with almond milk instead of regular milk. It had a very strong spicy taste to it. My friend ordered the chia pudding, a side of the Hong Kong style toast, with their strawberry lemonade.* All I remember is seeing her food then seeing nothing but an empty plate & bowl! So I'm pretty sure it was really good!! 

The service was very good! The setting of the restaurant was very warm and cozy. There's an option to sit outside, inside, or along the bar area. The price for each dish is reasonable. When looking at the menu some of the dishes had an * next to them. Looks like some dishes they only serve until they run out, so heads up! 

Definitely coming again to try the fried egg sandwich!!

excerpts: I sat at the bar, ordered the plow with beacon and found out that they don't have beacon.
Uhm..., so you don't have the most consumed product in your menu at 9am?
Well, then I went ahead with the chicken sausage per their recommendations and it took exactly 45 minutes for me to get my food.
the plow.author: Gokhan T.
the plow.review:
Okay, I understand all that hype about the lemon ricotta pancake but seriously, waiting hours just for that? I certainly have more important things to do in life.

I went in on a Friday morning before I go to work assuming that things will move fast and boy, was I wrong. I sat at the bar, ordered the plow with beacon and found out that they don't have beacon. Uhm..., so you don't have the most consumed product in your menu at 9am? Well, then I went ahead with the chicken sausage per their recommendations and it took exactly 45 minutes for me to get my food. If on a normal Friday morning things are moving that slowly, I can't imagine how it'd be like on a weekend. 

So to sum up, lemon ricotta pancakes were awesome. Scrambled eggs were fluffy and pretty good. Sausage and plow potatoes failed. Wait is frustrating. Prices are right.

excerpts: The Plow which consisted of the legendary lemon ricotta pancakes, home fries, sunny side eggs and chicken apples sausages.
It was a great introduction to this restaurant because you aren't just getting the lemon ricotta panakces, which everyone comes here for.
A friend got the same except with bacon.
The moment we got our food all the waiting was well worth it.
Everything was perfect.
Next time I will definitely try to get different things because everything looked amazing.
Particularly the french toast and the banana bread.
The chicken Tinga also looked great.
the plow.author: Thielson D.
the plow.review:
Lemon. ricotta. pancakes. Just about every other review will talk about these so needless to say they are awesome! Came here for the first time (of many to follow) this last weekend. I don't think they take reservations so we rolled up and were quoted about 1.5 hours to be seated on a Sunday. We ended up waiting for about 2hr:15 minutes to actually be seated, so expect that or go as early as you can. 

I got The Plow which consisted of the legendary lemon ricotta pancakes, home fries, sunny side eggs and chicken apples sausages. It was a great introduction to this restaurant because you aren't just getting the lemon ricotta panakces, which everyone comes here for. A friend got the same except with bacon. The moment we got our food all the waiting was well worth it. Everything was perfect. Next time I will definitely try to get different things because everything looked amazing. Particularly the french toast and the banana bread. The chicken Tinga also looked great. We ended up being seated at the counter and got to watch all the workers do their thing and jam to the music that was playing (literally everyone was dancing). 

The one thing is that there isn't much to do in the surrounding area while you are waiting. So you have to rough it out and stand in front of the restaurant until that fateful moment when your name is called. Then again, maybe there is and I just don't know the area. Find a way to keep yourself entertained while you wait.

excerpts: We ordered the Plow Plate and the French Toast both were fantastic.
I would definitely come back here again.
I was telling my daughter she has to try this place she would love it.
the plow.author: C C.
the plow.review:
So I finally came here Memorial Day! I thought it wouldn't be busy but when I got here around 8:30am there was already a line outside.

My experience here was wonderful! The food was so good and tasty.  We ordered the Plow Plate and the French Toast both were fantastic.  I would definitely come back here again.  I was telling my daughter she has to try this place she would love it.  Next time I will try the pancakes.

The staff was very nice and friendly always attentive.  The service was just great!  Can't wait to go back.

excerpts: We all ordered the plow as suggested by our friend, and it did not disappoint.
the plow.author: Cynthia T.
the plow.review: Came on a weekday for lunch with some friends, and when we arrived there was no wait, but we couldn't get seated until our other party arrived. Such a cute little place on the corner! The hostess checked on us to see if our other party had arrived as we waited, which was nice and appreciated. We sat outside on the sidewalk, and our waitress was charming, witty and attentive. We all ordered the plow as suggested by our friend, and it did not disappoint. The lemon ricotta pancakes were my fave! I can see how this place would have a line out the door on the weekends for brunch.

excerpts: Get the Plow, a little bit of everything.
And you MUST MUST MUST get a buttermilk biscuit with honey butter.
Everything is great!
the plow.author: Tatum C.
the plow.review: AMAZING! Get the Plow, a little bit of everything. And you MUST MUST MUST get a buttermilk biscuit with honey butter. Everything is great!

excerpts: - The Plow:
Probably the most popular dish on the menu, my friend went with the Plow.
She started it and I finished it!
(Hey, I said I was starving.)
the plow.author: Courtney K.
the plow.review:
Bottom Line:  The food is delicious, the interior is cute and the service is friendly, but I don't think I'd typically wait more than 30 minutes to eat here.

My friend lives two block from Plow so as foodies and elite Yelpers, we had to give it a try.  If you are thinking about venturing to Potrero Hill yourself, here is some information that I hope will help you decide if Plow is worth the trip and the wait:

- The Wait.  My take away from reading many Yelp reviews is that the wait runs one to two hours.  I really can't imagine waiting that long and luckily I didn't have to.  I arrived a few minutes before 8am on a Saturday and only waited about ten minutes for a party of two.  Since the restaurant doesn't open until 8am on Saturday, and we were able to get in on the first seating, we only had to wait long enough for the hostess to get to us.  It helped immensely that there were only two of us.  

- Size Does Matter.  Plow is small and if your party is big, Plow won't be a good fit for you.  My recollection is that there are a handful of four-top tables but not many bigger options.  In fact, there website says they can only accommodate parties of six or less.  If you have a small party and want to sit at the counter, you can probably get seated faster.  And if you are a party of one, don't let the wait deter you, because you can probably snag a seat at the counter rather quickly.  

- Food.  The food here is really good but not so good that I'd wait hours for it.  I do like how fresh their ingredients are and the uniqueness of some of their items.  You can definitely taste the quality of the ingredients they use and I fully appreciate their efforts to source their ingredients locally.  Also, they make many items, like their ricotta and pork sausage in house.   Because I was starving, we (and by "we," I mean "I") ordered lots of food.  

   - Breakfast Dessert!: We were seated at the counter overlooking the freshly baked breakfast desserts so of course I had to order the chocolate chip walnut coffee cake to start.  That probably isn't the right name for it, but just know those breakfast desserts are good!

   - Eggs Benny:  Plow's rendition of the classic Eggs Benedict was wonderful.  I did it with the Fra' Mani ham (Fra' Mani is a fancy pork company out of Berkley that sells its products wholesale and to Costco).

   - The Plow:  Probably the most popular dish on the menu, my friend went with the Plow.  She started it and I finished it!  (Hey, I said I was starving.)  Even though I am not much of a breakfast potato person, I thought Plow's crispy potatoes were delicious and I ate way more of those potatoes than I would anyone else's breakfast potatoes!  I also really enjoyed the sausage.  I am sure it helped that I had been in town for a vegetarian wedding all weekend and was craving meat like a cave man.  The homemade pork sausage had great texture and flavor.  For me, the lemon ricotta pancakes weren't worth the hype.  They were good, and I like the unique combination, but they didn't wow me.  Nevertheless, I think Plow makes their own ricotta which is very cool and admirable.      

- Service.  Service was friendly an attentive.  Despite a line out the door, the staff remains calm and keeps on plowing through the service.  I also like that they kept my coffee full and didn't rush us out of there.  

- The ambiance is very cute and the décor is well done - hardwood floors, marble counter top, big windows and an open kitchen.  

- Extras.  Plow is a very cute, cohesive, well-thought-out place.  They also have a great, classy web site.  I can tell the owners put a lot of love and pride into this business and for that I applaud them!

excerpts: We had time to look at our menus and I decided on the Plow with pork sausage and poached eggs.
My friend ordered the Plow as well with bacon with sunny side up eggs and the last member ordered a ham egg benedict.
My plate came and I was surprised with the large portion.
I first began with the patty pork sausage and I felt that it tasted decent.
It was quite solid and wasn't too juicy.
The poached eggs were flavorless and overcooked.
There were way too many potatoes for one person to have for breakfast
and I noticed that most of my pieces were pretty dry and burnt to the brownest of the brown.
The lemon pancakes were a tad sour in my book.
I ended up cutting up half of everything and passing it onto the other members of my table.
I then drenched my food with the hot sauce that was provided and drowned it with pepper.
I also ordered their black coffee that I thought tasted watered down and burnt at the same time.
I was bummed.
I had a sample of the ham benedict and I thought it was amazing.
The egg had a slight hint of lemon that I enjoyed with this combination.
But the english muffin itself wasn't crunchy at all which I thought was a bummer.
the plow.author: Linda K.
the plow.review:
Waited for food on a beautiful Saturday morning. Marvelous.

As we put our name down, the incredibly welcoming host mentioned that the wait would take about 1.5 hours. We were fine with that. We decided to take a walk around the neighborhood and enjoyed the bookstore down the block and some cafe's around the corner. We took a stroll back to check our status and we were cheery to be seated.

We had time to look at our menus and I decided on the Plow with pork sausage and poached eggs. My friend ordered the Plow as well with bacon with sunny side up eggs and the last member ordered a ham egg benedict. 
My plate came and I was surprised with the large portion. I first began with the patty pork sausage and I felt that it tasted decent. It was quite solid and wasn't too juicy.  The poached eggs were flavorless and overcooked. There were way too many potatoes for one person to have for breakfast and I noticed that most of my pieces were pretty dry and burnt to the brownest of the brown. The lemon pancakes were a tad sour in my book. I ended up cutting up half of everything and passing it onto the other members of my table. I then drenched my food with the hot sauce that was provided and drowned it with pepper. I also ordered their black coffee that I thought tasted watered down and burnt at the same time. I was bummed.
I had a sample of the ham benedict and I thought it was amazing. The egg had a slight hint of lemon that I enjoyed with this combination. But the english muffin itself wasn't crunchy at all which I thought was a bummer. The friends said the bacon was a Class A bacon which I regret to not have been able to try. 

Don't get me wrong, I really enjoyed my experience at Plow. I enjoyed the busy and bright atmosphere. The waitress was very kind and attentive. The hosts were really friendly and sarcastic. Maybe it was an off day for my pallet? Maybe it was an off day for the cooks? But for my first experience at Plow, I would say it was a memorable one.

excerpts: I had the Plow breakfast: 2 eggs, 2 lemon ricotta pancakes, 2 plow homemade sausage patties and the best breakfast potatoes
I've had the pleasure of tasting.
The lemon ricotta pancakes!
I can't wait to have them again.
Plow has something I'm not sure I can describe.
It's a feeling, a good feeling emanating throughout the small dining room and counter space.
The staff appears to genuinely enjoy their job and their kindness comes through in how they move, how they talk amongst themselves and how they interact with the patrons.
And to the one staff member, owner, chef, manager (I'm not sure) who was smiling the entire time I was dining, thank you, you made my day.
Thanks, Plow!
the plow.author: Don A.
the plow.review:
Went today, a Tuesday, and there luckily was no line. Service was very pleasant and the food delicious. I had the Plow breakfast: 2 eggs, 2 lemon ricotta pancakes, 2 plow homemade sausage patties and the best breakfast potatoes I've had the pleasure of tasting. The lemon ricotta pancakes! I can't wait to have them again. 
Plow has something I'm not sure I can describe. It's a feeling, a good feeling emanating throughout the small dining room and counter space. The staff appears to genuinely enjoy their job and their kindness comes through in how they move, how they talk amongst themselves and how they interact with the patrons.
