And to the one staff member, owner, chef, manager (I'm not sure) who was smiling the entire time I was dining, thank you, you made my day.
Thanks, Plow!

excerpts: What makes the Plow different and "better" than other traditional breakfast joints is the high quality of their ingredients.
My favorites include "The Plow": two eggs, two lemon ricotta pancakes, their DELICIOUS potatoes, and choice of bacon, chicken apple sausage, or pork sausage.
I order "The Plow" when I am very hungry as this is a VERY filling breakfast.
When I am a little less hungry
I order the "open-faced proscuitto + gruyere sandwich" which is basically a piece of brioche toasted and topped with a garlic fried egg, gruyere cheese, prosciutto, frisee, parsley, and chili flakes.
the plow.author: Tomas K.
the plow.review:
One of my favorite breakfast places in SF, Plow serves delicious and reasonably priced traditional American breakfast in Portrero Hill. Bacon, eggs, pancakes, sausage, potatoes, and toast thrive here on a raw yet refined menu featuring all of the classics and then some. 

What makes the Plow different and "better" than other traditional breakfast joints is the high quality of their ingredients. The eggs, produce, dairy, breads, and meats served at Plow are sourced carefully and their superiority to the cheaper ingredients used by other restaurants is apparent both visually and in taste. 

The restaurant is small inside although they do offer additional outdoor seating. The interior decorum is clean and modern with stainless steel bar and stool seating at the kitchen counter as well as table and chair seating in the dining room.

My favorites include "The Plow": two eggs, two lemon ricotta pancakes, their DELICIOUS potatoes, and choice of bacon, chicken apple sausage, or pork sausage. I order "The Plow" when I am very hungry as this is a VERY filling breakfast. When I am a little less hungry I order the "open-faced proscuitto + gruyere sandwich" which is basically a piece of brioche toasted and topped with a garlic fried egg, gruyere cheese, prosciutto, frisee, parsley, and chili flakes. This also comes with a small side of their DELICIOUS (I'll say it again) potatoes. 

By the way, did I mention the breakfast potatoes here are DELICIOUS? You've got to try them.

excerpts: I ordered the Plow with bacon and a side or pork sausage as well as split a biscuit with honey butter.
Yea it was pretty good, the pancakes had body but then slowly fell apart- delicious.
The potatoes were seasoned, hot and crisp.
The pork sausage patty was had a nice flavor too.
In addition, the biscuit with honey butter was addicting, but hey it's butter.
the plow.author: Raymond L.
the plow.review:
I'm down... even with a parking ticket due to street cleaning ( it's the city, I know).

Got here around 830am and waited about 30min to get seated. I ordered the Plow with bacon and a side or pork sausage as well as split a biscuit with honey butter.
Yea it was pretty good, the pancakes had body but then slowly fell apart- delicious. The potatoes were seasoned, hot and crisp. The pork sausage patty was had a nice flavor too. In addition, the biscuit with honey butter was addicting, but hey it's butter. And last, their drip coffee was a great compliment to the entire dish.

We were seated on the counter which we liked; we got to see the cooking process which is quite fun to observe. I'll be back and won't hesitate to try a few new things

excerpts: My breakfast was delicious (ordered The Plow meal - eggs, bacon and lemon ricotta pancakes - YUM) and the coffee strong!
the plow.author: Sarah F.
the plow.review:
Favorite breakfast spot that I've found so far in San Francisco. Perfect hipster vibe with the wood tables and white linen napkins. 
My breakfast was delicious (ordered The Plow meal - eggs, bacon and lemon ricotta pancakes - YUM) and the coffee strong!  Service was very friendly and timely. 

I will go back and you should, too. :)

excerpts: Everyone seems to rave about The Plow but we decided that it would be too huge a portion to finish (which was a good call since we couldn't finish the potatoes from our order)
the plow.author: Casatrina L.
the plow.review:
I'd heard many great reviews of Plow before coming and it did live up to the hype, although I wouldn't wait an hour for it. Came here at 11 for brunch on Saturday - my friend had put our name down at 9.45 and was told that it would be an hour's wait. We were finally seated at 11. 

We ordered a buttermilk biscuit, soft scrambled eggs with potatoes and toast, and the lemon ricotta pancakes to share. Everyone seems to rave about The Plow but we decided that it would be too huge a portion to finish (which was a good call since we couldn't finish the potatoes from our order)

The food did take a while to arrive. The buttermilk biscuit came with honey butter. It was decent, though not worth the price ($4.25). The pancakes ($13.75 for 3) came looking nondescript, but they were custardy, not overly sweet, and absolutely delicious warm. Definitely lived up to its name of being Plow's must-order dish! The soft-scrambled eggs ($13) were pretty good, with generous fillings (goat's cheese, asparagus, spinach, mushrooms). That said, it wasn't a particularly memorable dish. I'm not a huge fan of potatoes to begin with, and so wasn't blown away by their famous potatoes.

Service is great, and the servers were attentive and really friendly, which is fantastic, especially having waited for an hour for your table. Our total bill added up to $40 (for the above 3 orders and a coffee) including tax, which is pretty affordable for such a popular place. Love the farm to table vibe of this place, and I'd be back if not for the long wait. Perhaps on a weekday :)

excerpts: (I ordered the Plow and while the other components of the meal were also delightful the pancakes are the component that are going to make me come back for more!)
the plow.author: Emma M.
the plow.review: We waited almost 2 hours to get a table at Plow, but those lemon ricotta pancakes made it soooo worth it. They had a great lemon flavor and it kind of melts in your mouth. Honestly, I'm sad that I'm not still eating it. Absolutely make that part of your meal. (I ordered the Plow and while the other components of the meal were also delightful the pancakes are the component that are going to make me come back for more!)

excerpts: We ordered the plow to share and a side of fresh seasonal fruit.
The plow is a nice dish to try if you want to sample a little of everything-
the plow.author: Melissa P.
the plow.review: Food was good but still not convinced it was worth the 1.5hr wait. We put our name in and walked across the street to get a cup of coffee and keep warm while we waited. We ordered the plow to share and a side of fresh seasonal fruit. The plow is a nice dish to try if you want to sample a little of everything- I enjoyed the lemon ricotta pancakes, but beyond those the rest of the plate (eggs, potatoes, chicken sausage) was not particularly noteworthy. Fresh fruit was great- mix of peaches, plums, pluots, and fig. Would be worth trying on a weekday when it's (presumably) less crowded.

excerpts: And for me, the thing to order is The Plow: an assortment of their offerings, including house made pork sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes and plow potatoes.
And all of it is fantastic.
the plow.author: David Z.
the plow.review:
This is my favorite San Francisco breakfast! I've been here twice, once for a long line for a table of four on the weekend, and once in the morning on the way to drop a friend to the airport before driving back to Los Angeles. While I will gladly admit that it's great to be seated at Plow immediately (and a 7AM breakfast will allow for that), this is a place I'll wait in line for any day!

And for me, the thing to order is The Plow: an assortment of their offerings, including house made pork sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes and plow potatoes. And all of it is fantastic. Rarely do I not try new menu offerings on a return trip to a restaurant, but I can't imagine doing better than this plentiful platter.

I'll be back to San Francisco soon. Rest assured, I'll be returning to Plow.

excerpts: The plow is a great dish for first timers.
the plow.author: Sridevi K.
the plow.review:
The plow is a great dish for first timers. It has the famous lemon ricotta pancakes (excellent soft and super tasty), pork sausage (freshly made, not frozen or prepackaged), home fries(freshly cut and tossed, tasty). Blood sausage is good if you like that stuff. 
Big downside is the long wait, be prepared for an hour wait most weekend brunch time.

excerpts: Friends got the Plow dish with their lemon ricotta pancakes + apple sausages, and my gf got the french toast.
All around everything was deliciously carb-tastic and amazingly fatty goodness.
the plow.author: Lorrie M.
the plow.review:
I am usually not one for places that are hyped up. They are often ... well ... hyped up? Too many people show up, too much line waiting occurs, and everyone leaves annoyed and low on patience. 

Except Plow. Oh Plow.

I have to say, I don't know what kind of expectations I had. And despite having waited 1.5 hour for a brunch date of 4, in the freezing cold and THEN had to sit outside for the duration of our brunch, I am impressed that I am giving Plow 4 stars.

So then it must be a real testament to their food! I have to say, their food is delicious, simple, and yet so very worth while. I got the salmon benedict with a side of their seasonal pumpkin pancake. Friends got the Plow dish with their lemon ricotta pancakes + apple sausages, and my gf got the french toast. All around everything was deliciously carb-tastic and amazingly fatty goodness. Seriously, every bite was brunch heaven. 

I know this sounds ridiculous, but have someone come here early, put in your name, go sit in Farley's and grab a latte while you wait. It's worth your time!

excerpts: As recommended by all the reviewers, I got the Plow.
The Plow is a giant dish of potatoes, two eggs, meat, and lemon ricotta pancakes.

Potatoes- really dang good potatoes, well-seasoned and very tasty
House-made pork sausage- meh, kind of dry and bland
Eggs-
it's eggs
Lemon ricotta pancakes- meh
the plow.author: Alice T.
the plow.review:
Sorry, Plow... I like you, but I'm just not blown away.

My friend and I agreed that we wouldn't wait more than 30 minutes to eat here. Luckily, she got there right as they opened so we were seated pretty quickly. I've walked past Plow around prime brunch times (10-2pm), and there's always tons of groups waiting outside.

The service was awesome and very attentive. The food was good and fresh. The restaurant is super cute and makes a perfect brunch spot. So why only 4 stars? I just didn't feel like any of the dishes were really unique or amazing. Don't get me wrong- everything was executed perfectly, and I definitely appreciate that what they do, they do really well. I was just expecting.... more?

As recommended by all the reviewers, I got the Plow. The Plow is a giant dish of potatoes, two eggs, meat, and lemon ricotta pancakes. 
Potatoes- really dang good potatoes, well-seasoned and very tasty
House-made pork sausage- meh, kind of dry and bland
Eggs- it's eggs
Lemon ricotta pancakes- meh, I'm not sure why everyone loves lemon ricotta pancakes. I've had them at some other places, and every time, they don't really do much for me. You can taste the lemon, but the ricotta always seems to dull the pancakes.

My friend had the benedict, which was very tasty, but I've never said no to a benedict. We also shared the chocolate chip walnut cake, which tasted as good as it looked. Overall, I'm glad I tried Plow. I'm just not sure I would want to go at 8am or wait two hours to eat there again.

excerpts: I got the Plow, because hey, this place is called Plow.
Boyfriend got the 2 piece French toast vs. the 3 piece because we saw that there was HK toast.
So...yes.
All the toasts!
They also serve Five Mountains tea, which isn't bad.
The Plow was delicious.
I asked for my eggs to be hard-scrambled, but it was still on the soft-side -
I guess that's what they're known for.
I had to explain my messed up allergy
but they were really understanding and fixed that for me in a jiff.
The bacon was delicious and super crisp.
the plow.author: Robbin A.
the plow.review:
The only reason why I went to Plow is because our friend lives right up the hill. Being the pal he is, he walked down, put our names in, and told us to come back in about two hours. That is friendship right there.

We were seated outside. It was nice of them to have blankets out there, though I personally would never touch them, because I have a problem with germs and stuff. The wait staff is super nice and friendly!

I wanted to come here to try the hash that my coworker told me about. Sadly, they did not have this hash. Fortunately, everything else on the menu sounded amazing. I basically wanted to order everything and eat it all.

The boyfriend and I were strategic about what we ordered. There was a matcha mochi cake, which I obviously had to try because MATCHA MOCHI sounds so fantastic. I got the Plow, because hey, this place is called Plow. Boyfriend got the 2 piece French toast vs. the 3 piece because we saw that there was HK toast. So...yes. All the toasts! They also serve Five Mountains tea, which isn't bad. On the bright side, they serve it in heavy iron tea pots.

The food itself was so very tasty. The French toast with strawberry and lemon curd on it basically made me cry. That's how good it was. I think I like it more than Curbsides, which is blasphemous in itself, but oh my goodness, I haven't had French toast that good in a long while. The Plow was delicious. I asked for my eggs to be hard-scrambled, but it was still on the soft-side - I guess that's what they're known for. I had to explain my messed up allergy but they were really understanding and fixed that for me in a jiff. The bacon was delicious and super crisp. The lemon ricotta pancakes probably would have been delicious if I didn't eat the fabulous French toast first - they were just a shadow of the French toast after the fact. Oh, and eat the potatoes as soon as they come out. That is when they are tastiest.

I'd definitely come back, but I don't know if I'd wait for 2 hours for it.

Also, don't park at the bottom of the hill. That's where all the car thieves are, according to my friend.

excerpts: You can see that most people order "the plow" -- it includes pancakes and eggs.
We opted for the breakfast sandwich (amazing) and the soft scramble (so good).
The wait wasn't too bad -- about 30 min at 9am on a weekday.
the plow.author: Jen G.
the plow.review: Really great breakfast place! You can see that most people order "the plow" -- it includes pancakes and eggs. We opted for the breakfast sandwich (amazing) and the soft scramble (so good). The wait wasn't too bad -- about 30 min at 9am on a weekday.

excerpts: I ended up getting 'The Plow' and really enjoyed it, a good mix of classic breakfast foods.
TIP:
If you don't order The Plow, make sure you get a side of their potatoes - it is seriously the best.
the plow.author: Kim N.
the plow.review:
Put your name on the list and order a few mimosas to sip on while you wait. Typically the list is extremely long making the estimate wait time stretch to over an hour, but if you're lucky + observant, you'll realize about half of that list won't be coming back. 

A table for 2's expected 1 hour and 45 minute wait became just about 50 mins, which wasn't too bad after a stroll and a drink! 

I typically appreciate restaurants where the menu is more refined to a few great items. Plow is just that, but then it also becomes tough because everything just sounds amazing. I ended up getting 'The Plow' and really enjoyed it, a good mix of classic breakfast foods. TIP: If you don't order The Plow, make sure you get a side of their potatoes - it is seriously the best.

excerpts:
I opted for "The Plow" which came with two eggs, your choice of meat (I went for the chicken apple sausage, yum!), some AMAZING POTATOES, and two really really yummy lemon ricotta pancakes!!!

I have zero regrets getting the plow because it was just that good!!!
the plow.author: Kary Y.
the plow.review:
Being raised the city has really raised my standards for good brunch places. But I really think if you're in the mood for some hearty brunch, Plow is the place to go.

My boyfriend and I arrived on a Friday afternoon at around 12PM. We waited around an hour and 10 minutes to get seated outside. The overall feel of plow is rustic and really clean. I love the wooden tables that had some amazing hot sauce!!!

I opted for "The Plow" which came with two eggs, your choice of meat (I went for the chicken apple sausage, yum!), some AMAZING POTATOES, and two really really yummy lemon ricotta pancakes!!!

I have zero regrets getting the plow because it was just that good!!!

On the other hand, my boyfriend didn't really enjoy the fried egg sandwich as much as he hoped he would. He said it lacked a bit of flavor even adding avocados in it, but the house potatoes were perfection!

excerpts: We had the Plow, 2 Eggs Breakfast, and the Apricot Ricotta cake.
And coffee, or course.
Arrived a little after 8:15am.
Waited only a few minutes.
Service is fast.
Worth the wait even if it would have been the predicted 25 minutes.
Tables also available on the sidewalk.
The host provided lap blankets!
Polite courteous service.
Street parking.
the plow.author: Lorene P.
the plow.review: This was a recommended breakfast place from a SF friend. Delicious!  We had the Plow, 2 Eggs Breakfast, and the Apricot Ricotta cake.  And coffee, or course. Arrived a little after 8:15am. Waited only a few minutes. Service is fast. Worth the wait even if it would have been the predicted 25 minutes. Tables also available on the sidewalk. The host provided lap blankets!  Polite courteous service. Street parking.

excerpts: All three of us got the signature dish, The Plow.
the plow.author: Toni J.
the plow.review:
Went for breakfast with 2 friends. The wait wasn't too bad.. approx 45 minutes. 

All three of us got the signature dish, The Plow. It came with 2 eggs, super delish potatoes, some meat (bacon, or 2 types of sausage if I recall correctly), and 2 lemon ricotta pancakes. The pancakes and potatoes were superb!! The service was good. Only complaint is that there's only one restroom and it's unisex so there's usually a wait.

Would definitely go again and would recommend to anyone within a 50 mile radius of SF!

excerpts: (I got The Plow btw)

that's definitely not half the plate.

the plow.author: Harriet W.
the plow.review:
2 STARS because I found a really long piece of hair in my food. Delicious am I right? At least if I found a bug, I'd have extra protein. 

On the bright side, the first 2 or 3 bites before I found the hair snugged in my potatoes were pleasant. excerpts: I got the plow,  which is the pancakes,  chicken Sausage,  and potatoes.
I would say the pricing doesn't necessarily match what you're getting.
the plow.author: Arman J.
the plow.review: Pretty good breakfast food.  Simple and straight.  I got the plow,  which is the pancakes,  chicken Sausage,  and potatoes.  I would say the pricing doesn't necessarily match what you're getting.

excerpts: My husband ordered The Plow and I ordered the avocado toast with a side of sausage.
My husband devoured his breakfast, and said everything was delicious.
the plow.author: Esmeralda Q.
the plow.review: Came here today on a Wednesday and there was no wait. It was still pretty busy and got even more packed 20 mins after ver arrived, closer to 11 am. We sat outside, it was a cool breezy day but they have blankets that you can use to keep warm which I think is a really nice touch. My husband ordered The Plow and I ordered the avocado toast with a side of sausage. My husband devoured his breakfast, and said everything was delicious. The lemon ricotta pancakes are yummy, sweet and fluffy. The avocado toast was lemony, tangy and the bread crispy and flavorful. They have homemade salsa which wasn't spicy but added a burst of flavor. The coffee was good it's Equator coffee. Definitely recommend this place, only downside is that I wish that the avocado toast included 2, other than that great service, great food and nice area. Found parking easily which is a big plus anywhere near the SF area.

excerpts: My brother and I both ordered the plow.
I ordered mine with scrambled eggs and chicken apple sausage, and he ordered his with sunny side up eggs and pork sausage patties.
In addition to eggs and your choice of meat, the plow also comes with two mini lemon ricotta pancakes and a generous helping of potatoes.
The eggs and the sausage were good but nothing out of the ordinary.
the plow.author: Michelle L.
the plow.review:
Plow is a great weekday brunch spot, with a clean and cozy atmosphere, and awesome food! As a brunch-loving out-of-towner with only one day in San Francisco, I chose to make Plow my first stop for the day after getting off the Caltrain at 22nd Street. My brother and I arrived at the restaurant around 10:45am on a Thursday morning, and had to wait about 10 minutes for a table. We ended up with a table outside - perfect for enjoying the beautiful weather.

My brother and I both ordered the plow. I ordered mine with scrambled eggs and chicken apple sausage, and he ordered his with sunny side up eggs and pork sausage patties. In addition to eggs and your choice of meat, the plow also comes with two mini lemon ricotta pancakes and a generous helping of potatoes. The eggs and the sausage were good but nothing out of the ordinary. The lemon ricotta pancakes, on the other hand, were ah-MAY-zing. They tasted like lemon meringue, and weren't too doughy or flaky, which is something I often don't like about pancakes. The potatoes were also delicious - salted, with lots of crispy potato skin.

The service was great, and our server came outside to our table often to check on us and the other people sitting outside. If I lived in SF, I'm sure Plow would be one of my regular brunch places!

excerpts: but I ordered the Plow with bacon, cleaned my plate and 3 mimosas later, est.
I'd come back anytime.
the plow.author: Hazel H.
the plow.review: Worth the wait. No bottomless mimosas but I ordered the Plow with bacon, cleaned my plate and 3 mimosas later, est. $50. I'd come back anytime.

excerpts: I got them in combination with "the plow" which also comes with SUPER DUPER crispy potatoes, eggs (I'd go sunny side or over easy) and your choice between bacon, pork sausage, and apple chicken sausage.
I opted for the chicken sausage and it was delightful!
the plow.author: Kero D.
the plow.review:
I was INCREDIBLY lucky. Came here with my coworker/lova and we only had to endure a measly 15 minute wait. At 12:45 pm to boot! So if you want to test your luck, come here on a weekday afternoon (happened to be a Friday for us) and maybe the pancake gods will take mercy on your pitiful mortal souls!

Everyone is right about the lemon ricotta pancakes. They are amaze balls and quite special. For all you anti-lemon people out there, trust me when I say these fluffy babies will change your mind! If anyone here has ever had three twin's lemon cookie ice cream, it reminds me of that. The lemon flavor isn't citrusy or sour...it's more floral and subtle if anything.

I got them in combination with "the plow" which also comes with SUPER DUPER crispy potatoes, eggs (I'd go sunny side or over easy) and your choice between bacon, pork sausage, and apple chicken sausage. I opted for the chicken sausage and it was delightful! The smoky apple aftertaste was tasty. 

Plow is charming, homey and a little bit rustic. The rave reviews are well deserves, and if fate is kind enough to bring me back one day, I would love to try out the pumpkin pancakes as well! :)

excerpts: My dad gave me some lemon ricotta pancakes from his dish, the Plow, and I thought that it was SO good, just like the custard French toast, and my mom gave me her
I think it was called Skirred Eggs, and that was bomb!
I thought that it was the best brunch place I have ever had!
the plow.author: Pil C.
the plow.review: I thought having Plow for the first time was one of the best breakfasts I've ever had in my life! The wait was about 30-45 mins., but I didn't really mind it. I ordered the custard French toast and I thought it was killer! My dad gave me some lemon ricotta pancakes from his dish, the Plow, and I thought that it was SO good, just like the custard French toast, and my mom gave me her I think it was called Skirred Eggs, and that was bomb! I thought that it was the best brunch place I have ever had!

excerpts: we love ordering the plow so delicious !
the plow.author: Gabi M.
the plow.review: Great experience! Awesome food and great cooks sat kitchen front at the bar and it was awesome ! Cooks are incredibly fast and everything was impressively clean ! Our waitress was pleasant and even though we waited an our to be seated it was worth the wait.  we love ordering the plow so delicious !

excerpts: Since pictures don't do justice, two orders of The Plow were on their way to our table.

The portion and size of the order were perfect, consisting of mouth-watering homemade pork sausage, mini house-made ricotta cheese lemon pancakes, and the most damn delicate deliciously made potatoes that were crispier with every bite.
Oh, and let's not forget my perfect over easy eggs that spilled yolk everywhere after I sliced and diced them over the pork sausages.
There's so much more to try, but we'll be back next time.
the plow.author: Tim P.
the plow.review:
After my gf suggested this place, we decided to pay a visit this morning. You would think that there would be less people during a weekday, but I was surely wrong. I've been to many brunch spots in SF (my reviews don't show it, I KNOW) and after my meal today, I can honestly say that Plow is my favorite. I don't remember the last time I arrived at a restaurant with a menu so appetizing that I didn't know what I wanted to eat even after waiting nearly an hour and a half. Eventually, I decided to order the most enticing entree I saw photos of on here. Since pictures don't do justice, two orders of The Plow were on their way to our table. The portion and size of the order were perfect, consisting of mouth-watering homemade pork sausage, mini house-made ricotta cheese lemon pancakes, and the most damn delicate deliciously made potatoes that were crispier with every bite. Oh, and let's not forget my perfect over easy eggs that spilled yolk everywhere after I sliced and diced them over the pork sausages. There's so much more to try, but we'll be back next time. Nonetheless, I highly recommend anyone pay a visit! 

P.S. No need to worry If you get seated outside on a chilly morning, they provide blankets to comfort you during your meal!

excerpts: We both ordered the plow.
the plow.author: Breniel L.
the plow.review:
Today a Christmas miracle happened; my friend and I got in the door and had a table within 5 minutes! 5 MINUTES! That never happens in San Francisco, especially at a place as good as Plow. The party of two that was before us on the list did not show up, so they sat us first (which was fantastic). I know that it was a weekday morning and Christmas eve, but still, that's pretty amazing.

The first thing I noticed about this place was that the tables were pretty close together. We could hear the conversation of the table next to us and if we stretched our arms out, we would have definitely hit them. I did not mind this all too much, since the people sitting next to us were super friendly. 

Now, the food/drink. I got the coffee while my friend got the 12-hour cold brewed iced coffee. He says that if you really need to wake up, the iced coffee is the way to go. We both ordered the plow. He got the chicken and apple sausage while I got the house made pork sausage. We also ordered a side of bacon. Everything was great! The potatoes were nice and crispy and the scrambled eggs I had were not dry. The lemon ricotta pancakes were AMAZING. It was like biting into a fluffy lemon cookie. The serving size was great for what we ordered because we got to try a little bit of everything.

I will definitely be coming back. The service was great. I will definitely appreciate the Christmas miracle of having brunch within 5 minutes of putting my name on the list since this will probably never happen again.

excerpts: If it is your first time here, I would order the plow (5/5).
It is just their breakfast platter with a little bit of everything.
The plow is basically the most amazing breakfast platter you will ever eat.
It comes with a heaping pile of potatoes (5/5).
The potatoes aren't your average hash brown or the soggy potatoes that come with a diner breakfast.
These potatoes are super crispy and brown on the outside, soft on the inside, and seasoned to perfection.
You can hear the crunch as you bite down.
You also have the option of bacon (4/5) or sausage (5/5).
You really can't go wrong with either option.
Their chicken apple sausage is the perfect amount of sweetness and savory.
The bacon is fatty and rich.
My only qualm is that the bacon is a little limp If you're really feeling hungry, get both!
Why not!
the plow.author: Diana C.
the plow.review:
This is my all time favorite brunch place. Hands down. I try to make a trip up for brunch every couple months or so. The lines here get super long especially on weekends, but trust me, it's worth the long agonizing wait. If it is your first time here, I would order the plow (5/5). It is just their breakfast platter with a little bit of everything. On my numerous trips back to this place, I also tried the fried egg sandwich (4/5) and their crab scramble (3/5). 

The plow is basically the most amazing breakfast platter you will ever eat. It comes with a heaping pile of potatoes (5/5). The potatoes aren't your average hash brown or the soggy potatoes that come with a diner breakfast. These potatoes are super crispy and brown on the outside, soft on the inside, and seasoned to perfection. You can hear the crunch as you bite down. You also have the option of bacon (4/5) or sausage (5/5). You really can't go wrong with either option. Their chicken apple sausage is the perfect amount of sweetness and savory. The bacon is fatty and rich. My only qualm is that the bacon is a little limp If you're really feeling hungry, get both! Why not! Also, with the plate comes the standard 2 eggs any way you like, I personally prefer them poached soft so you can dip the crispy potatoes and meat in the runny yolk. Finally, to top it all off, are 2 lemon ricotta pancakes (6/5). These pancakes are not your average fluffy pancake. They are slightly denser, but packed full of flavor. I'll be honest, I'm not a pancake person normally. Waffles win it all for me, but when it comes to these lemon ricotta pancakes, I would eat a hundred if I could. 

As for the egg sandwich, they fry the egg to perfection. Yolk is perfectly runny, acting as a great sauce for the sandwich. The only reason this got a 4/5 in my book was due to the fact it really needed the addition of some meat. If you do get this sandwich, spend the extra couple bucks to add in some of that delicious bacon they have. Trust me, it'll take the sandwich to the next level. 

The crab scramble had way too many green onions for my liking (I personally hate them and will pick them out given the chance, but this had way too many to do so). It covered up the taste of the crab a bit. There were large hunks of crab throughout the omelet which is great, but there were quite a few pieces of shells too, which made it a bit annoying to eat.

Amazing food, great service - nothing more you could ask for.

Cons: 
- long wait on weekends and in the mornings 
- restaurant is small, so if you sit on the patio, it does get very cold

Pros: 
- brunch food here is A+ - everything is cooked to perfection
- service is fast and friendly

excerpts: We came here for breakfast and although it was hard to order anything but "the plow" (basic breakfast with their signature ricotta & lemon pancakes), we also opted for the little gem salad to counter balance the bacon.
First, their potatoes are fantastic.
I don't understand why so many breakfast places can't seem to get the potatoes right when it's such an important staple?!
But The Plow does them A+.
They were my favorite part.
The ricotta & lemon pancakes were fluffy and melted in my mouth, topped with a little Vermont maple syrup.
The eggs which I took scrambled, were perfectly cooked.
The pork sausage was ok
, I'll opt for the bacon next time.
The salad lost me a bit.
I know, I know...
Who orders salad at a breakfast spot...
Still.
It's a salad.
And salads are in.
the plow.author: Isabelle R.
the plow.review:
We came here for breakfast and although it was hard to order anything but "the plow" (basic breakfast with their signature ricotta & lemon pancakes), we also opted for the little gem salad to counter balance the bacon. First, their potatoes are fantastic. I don't understand why so many breakfast places can't seem to get the potatoes right when it's such an important staple?! But The Plow does them A+. They were my favorite part. The ricotta & lemon pancakes were fluffy and melted in my mouth, topped with a little Vermont maple syrup. The eggs which I took scrambled, were perfectly cooked. The pork sausage was ok, I'll opt for the bacon next time. The salad lost me a bit. I know, I know... Who orders salad at a breakfast spot... Still. It's a salad. And salads are in. It was bland, with boiled beets and raw carrots atop lettuce.

Otherwise, service was fantastic, coffee was tasty and plentiful, OJ was freshly squeezed, decor was cute, atmosphere was comfortable and they offer a front patio for those wanting to brunch in the sunshine.

excerpts: I've had their fried egg sandwich, avocado toast, lemon ricotta pancakes, french toast, and the plow.
Everything so far has been great!
Parking in the area is a bit of a challenge especially if you come on a busy time.
Prepare to walk.
the plow.author: Ardielyn F.
the plow.review: A great breakfast / brunch spot when you are in the area. The place is small so be prepared for a wait or come when they open. They have some tables outside as well.  Their crispy, crunchy, oh so yummy potatoes is a MUST order. If your getting something that doesn't come with it, order it as a side. Trust me! You can thank me later. They get most or all their ingredients from local farmers. Coffee is always good when it comes from Equator. I've had their fried egg sandwich, avocado toast, lemon ricotta pancakes, french toast, and the plow. Everything so far has been great! Parking in the area is a bit of a challenge especially if you come on a busy time. Prepare to walk.

excerpts: Food: I tried The Plow, which comes with two eggs, mini lemon ricotta pancakes, house made potatoes, and your choose of sausage, sausage patties, or bacon.
The eggs and the house made potatoes, which were in bite sized pieces, we're perfectly cooked!
The potatoes were nice and crispy.
Don't bother with their bacon here.
Unless you like the thin, cheap cuts of bacon that's burnt.
The lemon ricotta pancakes were the clear stars!
the plow.author: Kay A.
the plow.review:
3.5 stars. 
Pretty good breakfast place! 

Tips: 

-Menu changes daily, so what you want might not be there. Benedict and strawberry French toast wasn't available on the day I went. 

-Be prepared to wait. We had a 45 minute wait for just two people. 

-you might possibly have to share a table with another party. This place is pretty small, and they've tried to seat more people than they should. 

Food: I tried The Plow, which comes with two eggs, mini lemon ricotta pancakes, house made potatoes, and your choose of sausage, sausage patties, or bacon. 
The eggs and the house made potatoes, which were in bite sized pieces, we're perfectly cooked! The potatoes were nice and crispy.  Don't bother with their bacon here. Unless you like the thin, cheap cuts of bacon that's burnt. The lemon ricotta pancakes were the clear stars! Tasted out of this world!  


The reason I knocked this place down a star is because their waitresses were very pushy and seemed to be rushing us. Also didn't like the fact that the place was really crowded! Like elbow to elbow with the party next to us.

excerpts: We went ahead and ordered the plow.
It was super amazing!
The food is delicious, completely worth the 45 min to an hour wait.
With the plow, I ordered with the patty as my boyfriend ordered it with bacon.
I like how the pancakes has a lemon twist to it.
Overall, place and food is amazing.
the plow.author: Raena R.
the plow.review: One thing about this place is that, the seating is super crowded. Be prepared to be sitting literally and inch close away from the table next to you. When i arrived, just to put my name down it was approximately an hour wait. My boyfriend and I decided to just go ahead and wait since we were already there. As time went on, it went down from an hour wait to 45 minutes. Once seated, my boyfriend and I knew already what to get, due to past Yelp reviews from other people. We went ahead and ordered the plow. It was super amazing! The food is delicious, completely worth the 45 min to an hour wait. With the plow, I ordered with the patty as my boyfriend ordered it with bacon. I like how the pancakes has a lemon twist to it. Overall, place and food is amazing.

excerpts: I ended up ordering the Plow because it came with everything I wanted: lemon-ricotta pancakes, Plow potatoes, and the house-made pork sausage patties.
Holy smokes.
They sure did take some normal brunch items and did them up well.
The lemon-ricotta pancakes, just perfectly executed.
Delicious balance between the lemon and ricotta with just the right fluff, moisture, and size.
If it's your first time, be sure to get the Plow.
You will be "plown" away.
the plow.author: Brent C.
the plow.review:
I must say, Plow did not disappoint.

I came here on a Saturday morning 5 minutes after they opened at 8am and I still had to wait 30 minutes for a table. That alone was impressive. To have people line up at opening to have breakfast at a restaurant, it must be good.

I ended up ordering the Plow because it came with everything I wanted: lemon-ricotta pancakes, Plow potatoes, and the house-made pork sausage patties. Holy smokes. They sure did take some normal brunch items and did them up well. The lemon-ricotta pancakes, just perfectly executed. Delicious balance between the lemon and ricotta with just the right fluff, moisture, and size. The crispy potatoes, again just perfectly executed. The house-made pork sausage patties, now that is how every breakfast sausage should taste. I usually don't care for breakfast sausage but this was my absolute favorite part of the dish. Honestly, I took the last patty home because I was not ready to part with it and I just munched on it the rest of the day Okay, reading that out loud makes me seem a little crazy. Oh well, NO SHAME.

If it's your first time, be sure to get the Plow. You will be "plown" away.

excerpts: : I got "the plow" with lemon ricotta (good), plow potatoes (amazing) eggs and bacon (normal)
But my gf noticed how quickly I plowed through the plow (see what I did there?)
and luckily she's a small eater
so I got about 1/4 of her sandwich which left me satisfied.
And the Hong Kong toast, $4 for one slice of bread with condensed milk on top?
For that much you could go get a full loaf and do it yourself at home.
But overall, great brunch place, fresh ingredients and above average for a "light" breakfast (by my portion standards)
the plow.author: Virgil C.
the plow.review:
Got here around 9:40 on a Thursday. Wait was about 30 min but according to these other reviews that's relatively fast for this place. The space is small and cozy.

Service: on the slower side but understandable considering how busy this place is 

Food: I got "the plow" with lemon ricotta (good), plow potatoes (amazing) eggs and bacon (normal) $17

My gf had the $14 breakfast sandwich (great amount of cheese on fresh bread) and we had a side order of Hong Kong toast $4 (meh, alright) 

Reason why a 4 and not a 5 was portion size, can't really knock the prices cause that's normal these days. But my gf noticed how quickly I plowed through the plow (see what I did there?) and luckily she's a small eater so I got about 1/4 of her sandwich which left me satisfied. And the Hong Kong toast, $4 for one slice of bread with condensed milk on top? For that much you could go get a full loaf and do it yourself at home. But overall, great brunch place, fresh ingredients and above average for a "light" breakfast (by my portion standards)

excerpts: The prices weren't cheap ($13 for the breakfast sandwich and $15 for the plow).
I wouldn't normally pay this much for breakfast, but if it's done right, it's hard to pass up.
the plow.author: Bailey Z.
the plow.review:
I am not easily impressed by overpriced brunch spots, but today I was an exception. It's funny that everyone emphasizes organic and locally-sourced ingredients these days. Eating organic isn't enough anymore, but you now must do society and your community a service by supporting local farms, etc. I hate it for the most part only because it usually means pricier bills for mediocre food. Plow keeps their menu simple, but they do it well.

I got the fried egg sandwich, constructed with two eggs, aioli, frisee, cheddar on an Acme bun. Pay the extra couple bucks for the Nueske bacon; you will not regret it. The sandwich was the perfect answer for breakfast. The bun was soft and airy, and the combination of melted cheese, fried eggs, and crispy bacon was heavenly. The crispy potatoes on the side were amazing. The best thing on the menu is the lemon ricotta pancakes. The texture was softer and crumblier than a normal pancake and the flavor was outstanding. It was probably one of the best pancakes I've ever had. 

Overall, I loved the breakfast here. The prices weren't cheap ($13 for the breakfast sandwich and $15 for the plow). I wouldn't normally pay this much for breakfast, but if it's done right, it's hard to pass up.

excerpts:
We ordered "the plow", OJ, coffee, tea and a fruit plate.
- $4 for a tiny glass of OJ that's not fresh squeezed - don't bother ordering
- $5 tea in tea bag that's so old there's very little flavor
- $4 for coffee that was burned -

at least they give you free refills
- $7.5 for fruit plate served with pieces of brown fruit
- bacon was not high quality.
It was burned yet somehow still fatty.
the plow.author: Greg T.
the plow.review:
TL;DR Wait over an hour in the cold for average diner food that is $30+ per person.  Save your time and money.

Maybe it's the ever-present 1+ hour wait that raised my expectations, but I have no idea why there is always a line at this place.  People must just like the scene.  Given that there is always a wait (even on a weekday), they should come up with a better scheduling system.

The good:
4/5 stars for service.  The staff were mostly friendly and attentive.  The atmosphere inside is cozy.

The bad:
1/5 stars for the long wait.  You have to put your name on the list and you wait on some tiny benches outside in the cold.  (They recently added a single heat lamp outside for people to gather around).  I wouldn't mind waiting if the food was really good, but...

1/5 stars for the food (at the price)
I know this is SF and everything is expensive, but I'd rather pay an additional 20-30% if it meant having better ingredients.  We ordered "the plow", OJ, coffee, tea and a fruit plate.
- $4 for a tiny glass of OJ that's not fresh squeezed - don't bother ordering
- $5 tea in tea bag that's so old there's very little flavor
- $4 for coffee that was burned - at least they give you free refills
- $7.5 for fruit plate served with pieces of brown fruit
- bacon was not high quality.  It was burned yet somehow still fatty.
- chicken sausage was average and burned
- lemon ricotta pancakes were ok, but not above average
- the potatoes are better than at an average diner but nothing special
- the eggs were ok

Overall, 2 stars.  

To be fair, I guess the bar is pretty low when it comes to breakfast and brunch in SF.  I can't think of many spots that I would consider good for the price.  (Olea used to be good, but their ingredients took a step down).  Overall, Plow will leave you feeling like you ate at a greasy diner, but somehow overpaid by 2x.

Example good brunch spots: La Note in Berkeley, Square One in L.A.

excerpts: I don't say that often... order the plow and you won't be disappointed.
All their pancakes are delicious.
the plow.author: Marie-Therese J.
the plow.review: Plow is worth the hype and the wait! I don't say that often... order the plow and you won't be disappointed. All their pancakes are delicious.

excerpts: I got the plow for my breakfast which came with bacon, potatoes, pancakes and eggs.
I also ordered chicken apple sausage on the side because I was starving.
When my food came out, I was a little disappointed because they burnt the sausages and pancakes which isn't something that I enjoy.
Maybe I should've warned them to watch out.
Anyway, other than that food was pretty good.
Service is pretty good.
My friend and I were sitting outside the restaurant and it was extremely cold.
They handed me blankets to cover myself which was super considerate of them.
the plow.author: Kilim C.
the plow.review: I got the plow for my breakfast which came with bacon, potatoes, pancakes and eggs. I also ordered chicken apple sausage on the side because I was starving. When my food came out, I was a little disappointed because they burnt the sausages and pancakes which isn't something that I enjoy. Maybe I should've warned them to watch out. Anyway, other than that food was pretty good. Service is pretty good. My friend and I were sitting outside the restaurant and it was extremely cold. They handed me blankets to cover myself which was super considerate of them.

excerpts: Now on to the food...we ordered the plow with the lemon ricotta pancakes and another with caramelized apple french toast.
TOTALLY worth however long we waited or were going to wait!!
The food tasted fresh!
the plow.author: Mariana C.
the plow.review:
After a couple of days in San Francisco and the regular union square spots, we somehow encountered this location. I read online that the wait time was a long time...as we pulled up, I realized this wasn't a joke. Truth was, I NEEDED to try the lemon ricotta pancakes everyone was talking about! 

Let me just say that the wait was COMPLETELY worth it. We were advised the wait would be around 45-1hr for a table for 2. Thing was that people are impatient and about 3 couples ahead of us choose to leave rather than wait, so our actual wait time was only 25 minutes!!! I think we got lucky, a local way saying it is always crazy, so if you plan on coming out, expect the delay. 

Now on to the food...we ordered the plow with the lemon ricotta pancakes and another with caramelized apple french toast. TOTALLY worth however long we waited or were going to wait!! The food tasted fresh! From the sausage patties to the bacon, you can definitely taste the natural.

Every single person that makes the staff up is super nice! Which also made the experience a wonderful one! This place is awesome! Next time I'm in town I'm coming back! That is for sure!

excerpts:
Order "The Plow"

Easy enough right?
The Plow is brunchy bliss comprised of two eggs, your choice of house made pork sausage, Nueske bacon, or chicken apple sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes and crispy potatoes.
the plow.author: Brad B.
the plow.review:
I was given strict instructions when I went to Plow. They were short and simple, but were sure to provide me an experience that could not be flawed.

1. Don't look at the menu
2. Order "The Plow"

Easy enough right? Right! I did as I was told and had an exceptional breakfast, which admittedly was a little out of my wheelhouse, (not a huge breakfast fan), and resulted in the plate basically being licked clean. 

The Plow is brunchy bliss comprised of two eggs, your choice of house made pork sausage, Nueske bacon, or chicken apple sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes and crispy potatoes. I went for the house made pork sausage but was able to steal a chicken sausage link off my buddy's plate - both were awesome! Nine times out of ten I'll order anything but pancakes but seeing as these were part of the "package deal" I approached with not only an open mind, but also an open mouth. I was told that the lemon ricotta pancakes "are a make or break item" leaving you loving or conflicted on the breakfast. Truth be told, they were a big win in my book but the true star of the show were the crispy potatoes. Kissed with a hint of rosemary and crisped to the point that they're crunchy, but not overcooked or burnt. Be sure to ask for a bottle of hot sauce if you want to take them to another level and wash it all down with a cold glass of orange juice. 

Thanks Plow!

excerpts: Came here for breakfast and ordered the plow.
My plate looks good by looking at it
but when I started to dig in....it was just average to me.
the plow.author: Cee M.
the plow.review:
Came here for breakfast and ordered the plow. My plate looks good by looking at it but when I started to dig in....it was just average to me. Lemon ricotta pancakes were ok, the crispy potatoes are not so crispy, Sunnyside up was a tiny bit raw and with the apple sausages was good.

For a weekday around 930ish am was busy and i waited about 20 mins to be seated. Yes, this place is too hipster for me and the prices on the menu are pricey. Got fooled by the yelp reviewers and I do not plan on coming back here.

excerpts: The Plow - two lemon ricotta pancakes, two housemade sausages, two eggs and the crispy potatoes.
The pancakes were really amazing.
The lemon wasn't too strong and the flavor combined with the Vermont syrup was perfect together.
The sausages have a little kick to them.
I'm not a spicy eater
so these were just the right amount combined with the savory flavor or the pork.
The crispy potatoes were also just good, very good.
I'm not sure how they get them so fried and crispy like that.
Shirred Eggs - also a must get, two eggs in a tomato based concoction where the tomato doesn't overpower the dish and combines with the egg to produce a very smooth flavor.
the plow.author: Ander C.
the plow.review:
This place was really good. I came in on a weekday morning and there was still a line, albeit not very long, but it was surprised to see this place packed.

The Plow - two lemon ricotta pancakes, two housemade sausages, two eggs and the crispy potatoes. The pancakes were really amazing. The lemon wasn't too strong and the flavor combined with the Vermont syrup was perfect together. The sausages have a little kick to them. I'm not a spicy eater so these were just the right amount combined with the savory flavor or the pork. The crispy potatoes were also just good, very good. I'm not sure how they get them so fried and crispy like that. I was nibbling down to the very last little bit on those.

Shirred Eggs - also a must get, two eggs in a tomato based concoction where the tomato doesn't overpower the dish and combines with the egg to produce a very smooth flavor. It's limited due to the fact they serve it in a hot dish so get this if you can.

Overall it was really good place for brunch and I hope to definitely come back!

excerpts: I ordered The Plow and my boyfriend ordered the Benedict and both were really good.
the plow.author: Chloe S.
the plow.review: It's a very cute place, but very small for amount of people who come here. I waited almost two hours but it was totally worth it. The waiters are really nice. I ordered The Plow and my boyfriend ordered the Benedict and both were really good. ALSO MUST TRY LEMON RICOTTA PANCAKES!!

excerpts: I had the Plow with bacon, eggs, lemon ricotta pancakes and plow potatoes
and it was amazing.
There are so many great options on the menu
I wish I could have tried it all.
the plow.author: Kelsey L.
the plow.review: Expect to wait a while to be seated for brunch on Saturday or Sunday but I promise it was worth the wait. I had the Plow with bacon, eggs, lemon ricotta pancakes and plow potatoes and it was amazing. There are so many great options on the menu I wish I could have tried it all.

excerpts: I got the PLOW:
the plow.author: Lisa N.
the plow.review:
-Arrived at 12:00PM on a Wed, seating in 5 minutes. It was a beautiful day so we sat outside
-Great service and friendly staff.
-Of course I got the PLOW: Two eggs, choice of house made pork sausage, nueske bacon, or chicken apple sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes, crispy potatoes
-Their crispy potatoes are honestly the best I've ever had. Better than french fries i've had too!
-the lemon ricotta pancakes were delicious with a light tangy taste
-I would pass on the house made pork sausage. It was very bland
-$16 for my plate which I thought was reasonable with HUGE portion I was served

In conclusion, would def come back and recommend to friends

excerpts: I had the plow which comes with eggs, a side of meat (sausage,bacon), potatoes and lemon ricotta pancakes.
Good amount of food offered since it was like $16.00.
But of what was offered the potatoes were the most memorable.
2nd to that was the pancakes which I had as my dessert, light and sweet.
Good solid brunch spot, but can get a bit tight during busy hours, as seating can get pretty "friendly" to your neighbor.
the plow.author: Julie B.
the plow.review:
5 stars for their potatoes
How do they make these wonderful potatoes?! 
So crispy and crunchy yet soft and tender on the inside. They are brunchtastic magic!

I had the plow which comes with eggs, a side of meat (sausage,bacon), potatoes and lemon ricotta pancakes.
Good amount of food offered since it was like $16.00. But of what was offered the potatoes were the most memorable. 2nd to that was the pancakes which I had as my dessert, light and sweet. 
Good solid brunch spot, but can get a bit tight during busy hours, as seating can get pretty "friendly" to your neighbor.

excerpts: I ordered the plow w/scrambled eggs, add cheese.
So good and enough for two people easily.
Maybe it's not your most creative breakfast food, but it sure was satisfying.
the plow.author: Veronica T.
the plow.review:
I've wanted to come here for a long time. I love lemon ricotta pancakes and heard this place is one of the best spots for that.

We came around 1030am and waited for nearly an hour. It's quite small inside so you wait outside. We quickly figured out you can go inside and get a cup of coffee while waiting. AWESOME.

After our wait we finally got seated at the counter. It was so fun to watch all the chefs in the kitchen. They're amazingly fast and talented at preparing delicious looking and smelling food.

Food was amazing. I ordered the plow w/scrambled eggs, add cheese. So good and enough for two people easily. Maybe it's not your most creative breakfast food, but it sure was satisfying.

excerpts: $40 for 2 orders of "the plow" and 1 coffee (not strong).
the plow.author: Chia-Fen Y.
the plow.review:
Underwhelming, especially for the 1.25 hour wait. It's so ridiculous.

$40 for 2 orders of "the plow" and 1 coffee (not strong).

Service was professional but unattentive and mediocre like the food.

The pancakes come out pretty black on both sides and then almost undercooked in the middle. If you absolutely must come here (as in all other brunches are closed and eating toast isn't an option), then I suggest you go with the lemon pancake instead of the almond pancake. It's the only thing that had any luster.

There are hooks under the counter if you end up being seated there.

Better off somewhere else.

Just because there's a line does not mean the food is good. Hipsters are lemmings.

excerpts: I tried the plow 2 egg breakfast, complete with two eggs sunnyside up, the handmade pork sausage, the famous plow potatoes, and toast.
The winner of this meal, and perhaps the restaurant in general, were definitely the plow potatoes.
Fried to perfection.
The pork sausage was nicely seasoned, but a tad bit dry.
the plow.author: Coleen K.
the plow.review:
Came here for brunch with two girlfriends while visiting San Francisco for the weekend. We found this place via Yelp, and it was a big hit!

We went in on a Monday morning at about 9AM and we were able to snag three bar seats without a wait. The place is really small, ~10 tables, so definitely be prepared to wait. Our bar seats were great-- we had front row seats to look at the open kitchen and watch the chefs cook. Very cool to see them making the homemade pancakes, potatoes and eggs. 

I tried the plow 2 egg breakfast, complete with two eggs sunnyside up, the handmade pork sausage, the famous plow potatoes, and toast. The winner of this meal, and perhaps the restaurant in general, were definitely the plow potatoes. Fried to perfection. The pork sausage was nicely seasoned, but a tad bit dry. My girlfriends got the egg breakfast sandwich and the lemon ricotta pancakes. They loved both. I was able to try the lemon ricotta pancakes and these are a little slice of heaven. Sweet and savory all in one!

One thing I'll say is that breakfast seemed pricey. Dishes were about $14-$16, which seems steep. That being said, San Francisco is more expensive than Chicago!

excerpts: Get "The Plow
" it lets you taste a  little it of everything.
Made our trip to SF insanely better
the plow.author: Lorena H.
the plow.review: The food was fire, really worth the wait!! Get "The Plow" it lets you taste a  little it of everything. Made our trip to SF insanely better

excerpts: I would recommend "The Plow" with the sausage!
the plow.author: Sasha P.
the plow.review:
Best breakfast/brunch food ever. 
I told my friend about this place and I said "lemon ricotta pancakes" and he just looked at me funny. We went there and after he tasted them, he was pleasantly surprised. It tastes like a dessert but not an overwhelming sugary dessert. These pancakes hands down the best I've ever had - so light and fluffy.

Same goes for the sausages - they have fennel in them and are the absolute best sausages I've ever had. 

I would recommend "The Plow" with the sausage!

excerpts: I ordered the plow...
the plow.author: Jennifer F.
the plow.review:
One of my favorite brunch spots. Wish they had this in San Diego! 

I ordered the plow... Can I just say the crispy potatoes did not disappoint and the lemon ricotta pancakes were Aaaaaamazzzing!! I've definitely never tasted something like that before. Also, the biscuit with honey butter melts in your mouth; I'm drooling as I type this.

I definitely recommend this spot if you're into the savory kind of breakfast and if you have time (long wait, but worth it!) When I visit SF again, I will def be coming here!

excerpts: Ordered The Plow and it was enough food to share with my friend...with leftovers.
the plow.author: Jenny L.
the plow.review:
Came here 10 minutes before they opened on a Saturday and the line wasn't too bad at all.  Ordered The Plow and it was enough food to share with my friend...with leftovers.  Portions are huge and delicious.  

The Lemon Ricotta pancakes melt in your mouth and taste like dessert.  

Got the chicken apple sausage and it didn't disappoint.  Will need to be back to check out the rest of the menu!

excerpts: The GF ordered "the plow" and I got the eggs benedict.
The benedict was average tasting.
Either the hollandaise sauce or the muffin tasted somewhat sour.
Maybe the bread is sourdough.
Regardless, it had a very strange aspect associated with it.
The best part of the meal was the potatoes, hands down.
It is true what they say about this place having the crispiest potatoes.
I tried the pancakes too, and my taste buds did not go for it.
It is very different tasting than a traditional pancake.
the plow.author: Victor L.
the plow.review:
The GF and I came here around 12:00.  The hostess informed us it would be an hour and a half to an hour and forty five minute wait.  We decided to walk around the neighborhood, and ended up at Whole Foods.  After half an hour there, we walked back, and waited for the remainder of the time.  We were seated in practically the worst spot in the entire restaurant- right next to the bathroom.  If this was not bad enough, the bathroom only has a single stall, creating a never ending line.  These people waiting in line were practically hovering over our table.  

The GF ordered "the plow" and I got the eggs benedict.  The benedict was average tasting.  Either the hollandaise sauce or the muffin tasted somewhat sour.  Maybe the bread is sourdough.  Regardless, it had a very strange aspect associated with it.  The best part of the meal was the potatoes, hands down.  It is true what they say about this place having the crispiest potatoes. I tried the pancakes too, and my taste buds did not go for it.  It is very different tasting than a traditional pancake.  I will pass on that next time.  

Overall, I loved the potatoes.  The eggs benedict was just alright, and the pancakes were a no go in my book.  

I cannot justify waiting almost two hours to eat breakfast.  :(

excerpts: Ordered the Plow, French Toast and the Fried Egg Sandwich as well and pretty much everything tasted great ( plus the wait makes you super hungry as well :P )
the plow.author: Preethish S.
the plow.review: Be prepared to wait for your food for a really long time but the food's really really good. I guess its the curse of Yelp that once someone recommends an item everyone orders it - but the Lemon Ricotta Pancakes are worth every review written out here (must try!!). Ordered the Plow, French Toast and the Fried Egg Sandwich as well and pretty much everything tasted great ( plus the wait makes you super hungry as well :P )

excerpts: As all the Yelpers recommend, get the Plow.
the plow.author: Angela K.
the plow.review:
Plow sits in the up and coming Dogpatch and I'm really loving this area. That being said, I was really excited to try this place. The only catch - it's basically a 2 hour wait.

The food is good, definitely. As all the Yelpers recommend, get the Plow. I agree - it gives you all the breakfast basics: eggs, sausage or bacon, pancakes and crispy potatoes. Everyone comes here for the lemon ricotta pancakes. Being that I'm the stranger person that does not like lemony baked goods, I went with the almond flour pancakes. I was a big fan of the almond flour pancakes and the crispy potatoes. Everything else was made well and overall, it was a fulfilling breakfast.

But it is NOT worth a 2 hour wait. If you're an early riser, then definitely come when they open. Otherwise, plan to put your name down, walk around grab a snack, take your time and come back 2 hours later.

excerpts: My two friends got the Plow, which was two pancakes, eggs, breakfast meat, and toast.
the plow.author: Elizabeth S.
the plow.review:
I echo the sentiments on the service being outstanding -- everyone was organized and very nice. We didn't feel rushed through, which is key after the inevitable wait, even on a weekday morning, which is when we went.

I think the wait is the thing most people mention in their reviews, whether good or lukewarm. Like others, I was more than willing to wait a half hour for an outstanding breakfast -- but this was far from outstanding.

First of all, the meals are a heart attack on a plate -- everything seems to be deep fried or cooked in vegetable oil (we sat at the bar, so we could see everything as it was cooked). My two friends got the Plow, which was two pancakes, eggs, breakfast meat, and toast. I ordered two eggs and the chicken apple sausage and toast.

The pancakes were, as others have written, delicious. The lemon flavoring makes them feel lighter than they are. The eggs were completely flavorless; my guess is that cooking with oil was behind this, rather than butter. I even had them add some cheese; what they added appeared on one side of the scramble but I didn't see cheese throughout.

The potatoes were delicious -- dude. Deep. Fried. How can they not be? Crispy and good. The toast was either a sour dough or almost Italian type bread which, when toasted, was hard to chew. The apple sausage was good, but not particularly memorable. For drinks, we ordered coffee and tea; they were happy with their coffee, my tea didn't stay very warm in the individual pot that was brought to the table.

In the end, if you do choose to go here, keep in mind that the portions are HUGE -- so perhaps share with someone at your table. I ate maybe a third of the eggs, 2 out of 4 of the sausage links, both small slices of toast, and maybe 1/2 the potatoes and left feeling very fool. And of course, bring a book or newspaper, something to keep you occupied -- because you'll be waiting a long, long time.

excerpts: I tried the Plow, anything named after the restaurant has to be their signature dish and SOOO GOOD.
The Plow or Lemon Ricotta Pancakes
the plow.author: Reena B.
the plow.review:
This place is spot on for the food/service/atmosphere.

To start off, I had a minor celebrity spotting while I waited for a table.  I found it even more entertaining when they seated me AHEAD of the minor celebrity because I came in first...well done for service and treating everyone equal.  

I tried the Plow, anything named after the restaurant has to be their signature dish and SOOO GOOD.  It's a little bit of everything and guaranteed to hit the spot.

The homemade sausage patties were out of this world, rosemary potatoes some of the best I ever had..but the marvel of the dish was the lemon ricotta pancakes.  I dont know how to describe how well this hit every piece of my pallate.  Little zest, not overly sweetened, creamy yet firm.  Wow wow wow!

Service was also impeccable.  Friendly and made you feel like a guest in someones home. My coffee cup was NEVER empty and you could tell that they all kind of loved being part of the team.

Food Recommendation: The Plow or Lemon Ricotta Pancakes

excerpts: We opted for the Fried Egg Sandwich and THE PLOW.
I thought the Fried Egg Sandwich sounded a bit ordinary, but it was far from it!
The Plow is a must order at Plow -- two eggs, choice of house made pork sausage, Nueske bacon, or chicken apple sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes, crispy potatoes.
the plow.author: Elaine N.
the plow.review:
Came here with my fellow foodie Fanny W., we found parking across the street (that never happens...), walked in and were seated right away at the last table available, sweet! There's nothing like a bright and sunny morning in SF, I mean how often does that happen honestly? Good thing Plow takes full advantage of whenever the weather is beautiful with its huge storefront facing windows. 

We opted for the Fried Egg Sandwich and THE PLOW. I thought the Fried Egg Sandwich sounded a bit ordinary, but it was far from it! Equipped with  two eggs fried, aioli, frisee, Vermont cheddar, Acme bun. The aioli puts a nice twist on the egg sandwich, and to top it off with Acme bun made fresh in the city, I could not resist. 

The Plow is a must order at Plow -- two eggs, choice of house made pork sausage, Nueske bacon, or chicken apple sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes, crispy potatoes. We went with the two eggs, house made pork sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes, crispy potatoes. Man-oh-man was this dish delish. The pork sausage was nicely seasoned, not too salty (which is a huge plus to me), the lemon ricotta pancakes were AMAZING it made my mouth drop (and this is coming from a girl who doesn't like lemon zested anything...), and the seasoned house potatoes sounded average, but they definitely weren't. 

Overall we had a fantastic experience here at Plow. Parking was easy (no meter), we were seated right away (rare moment), and the service/ambiance screamed brunch, what more could you ask for. One thing bothered me though, there was a huge mix up with the check, we were charged an extra $20... Something was obviously wrong here. I've been reading about restaurants scamming their customers a lot lately down in Santa Ana, so I was extra careful to check the tab. I'm sure it was just a mistake, but for it to happen to both our table and the table adjacent to ours? Kind of strange, I think Plow needs to figure that one out... Nonetheless Fanny W. and I really enjoyed our experience here and hope to be back real soon!

excerpts: My friends both ordered "the plow" which came with A LOT of food!
I had a bite of the famous lemon pancakes which had a great texture.
Very tasty, but a little sweet for me.
The coffee here is strong and made well, which everyone can appreciate.
I can't wait to go back to try more of the menu!
the plow.author: Lauren G.
the plow.review:
First off, the potatoes here are amazing. Each piece is crunchy and I'm not even a big potato person. It took me about 4 hours to decide what I wanted, and the server ended up choosing the breakfast sandwich for me - great choice! I ordered it with chicken sausage. The sandwich was perfect, it had two fried eggs, frisée, homemade chicken sausage and melty cheese. The bread was a brioche bun and the sandwich was so delicious! 

My friends both ordered "the plow" which came with A LOT of food! I had a bite of the famous lemon pancakes which had a great texture. Very tasty, but a little sweet for me. The coffee here is strong and made well, which everyone can appreciate. I can't wait to go back to try more of the menu!

excerpts: I ordered the plow and was able to alter my order without complaint.
Service was great, surmising quick wait.

excerpts: I suggest getting The Plow combo if you want to enjoy these.
the plow.author: Daisy T.
the plow.review:
Crispy potatoes... *drool*.... mmmm, mmmm good!

Yes, there's a ridiculous wait for this place on the weekends (up to two hours), but it's totally worth it! Though I do suggest that you try to hit up this place during the week. The wait time goes down to 30 minutes. 

This cute little place is located right at the corner surrounded by FREE parking. Just hope that you can find a spot! The place is small. Maybe no more than 20 people can sit down at a time. But there are a handful of seats at the counter where you can watch the magic happen.

The menu is small but features locally sourced, high quality ingredients, making even the simplest dishes stand out in comparison to the basic breakfast joint. Choose from a warm mushroom salad to a dungeness crab scramble to chia seed pudding.

The lemon ricotta pancakes are a popular choice. Very fluffy and light with tons of lemon flavor. I love the texture, but the lemon was a bit to strong for my taste. I suggest getting The Plow combo if you want to enjoy these. That way you can get it with two eggs any style and your choice of housemade sausage, Neuske bacon or chicken sausage. Some salt to balance out the sweetness.

My fave is the fried egg sandwich! Two eggs over easy sandwiched by soft, toasted Acme bread with frisee, aioli and cheese with the additional Neuske bacon (everything is better with bacon!). The creamy egg yolk mixes with all the components and makes it finger lickin' good! It also comes with a side of their infamous crispy potatoes!

They're serious about their potatoes. Smashed red potatoes flavored with fresh rosemary and onions and fried to perfection! They managed to find a way for you to have your hashbrowns and country potatoes together as one! You can't find potatoes like this anywhere else!

By the way, if you like scrambled eggs, they know how to do it right. Super light and fluffy yet still creamy. I don't even like scrambled eggs, but I love them here!

Good thing I don't live next to here or else I'd have a muffin top full of crispy potatoes and bacon!

excerpts: I got 'The Plow' which features the best of sweet and salty breakfast options.
the plow.author: Danielle C.
the plow.review:
Best brunch I've had in a long time. While the menu appears to have simple, classic brunch items, Plow really perfected all of the items on my plate. I got 'The Plow' which features the best of sweet and salty breakfast options. The lemon ricotta pancakes were perfectly fluffy and were complimented well with the little pitcher of maple syrup. The home fries, oh the home fries. These were very well seasoned, crispy and golden on the outside, soft on the inside. A separate waitress made sure we had little dishes of ketchup to go with our potatoes. Lastly, the scrambled eggs. These were also very yummy and I definitely got way more than the two the menu said I'd get. WIN. I got the chicken apple sausage and recommend it.

You won't regret going here!

excerpts: I got to try some of "the plow", which had their house made sausage, lemon ricotta pancakes, and crispy potatoes.
I really liked the lemon ricotta pancakes, too!
They had a little citrus flavor that went well with a little bit of syrup.
They don't have an extensive menu, but it is like that for a reason.
They do what they do well and that is all you need to know!
the plow.author: Aaron Y.
the plow.review:
We got lucky and were seated quickly considering they have limited seating. I got the fried egg sandwich with bacon. It came with their fried potatoes, which were fried to perfection. Very crispy outside, and soft on the inside and well seasoned. The sandwich was a delight. It had cheese and a expertly fried egg. The bacon acted as the sprinkles on a good cupcake! Really good! We shared some of the Almond flour pancakes, which were surprisingly light and fluffy. 

I got to try some of "the plow", which had their house made sausage, lemon ricotta pancakes, and crispy potatoes.  I really liked the lemon ricotta pancakes, too! They had a little citrus flavor that went well with a little bit of syrup. They don't have an extensive menu, but it is like that for a reason. They do what they do well and that is all you need to know!

excerpts: As everyone else has said, The Plow is delicious.
Also try the biscuit as an appetizer!
It's insanely good.
I like the ambiance of this neighborhood as well.
the plow.author: Melody Y.
the plow.review:
Outstanding... the only place that I would happily walk to, in the rain, without an umbrella or rain boots, and then wait 2.5 hours to get a seat. 

As everyone else has said, The Plow is delicious. Also try the biscuit as an appetizer! It's insanely good. I like the ambiance of this neighborhood as well. Grab a coffee at Farley's and/or browse the aisles at Christopher's Books while you wait. 

Just a note: they don't close at 2PM - they just stop taking names then.

excerpts: The menu changes, and I've enjoyed many items over the years, but this last weekend I tried the Benedict with Smoked Salmon and my boyfriend had The Plow.
The Plow contains house made sausage that is so delicious!
It has a ton of flavor and melts in your mouth.
The house potatoes are a crispy baked potato wedge that with their hot sauce and ketchup are yummy with every bite.
the plow.author: Mik B.
the plow.review:
This brunch spot holds a special place in my heart :)  It's in my childhood neighborhood... it's cute, quiet, and a pretty little "suburb of the city."  Plow is never overcrowded, or too loud for comfort like other brunch locations; it's small, intimate, and cozy.  You'll always have at least an hour wait, but that is a to be expected price to pay for a enjoyable brunch experience.  Worth it.

The menu changes, and I've enjoyed many items over the years, but this last weekend I tried the Benedict with Smoked Salmon and my boyfriend had The Plow. The Plow contains house made sausage that is so delicious!  It has a ton of flavor and melts in your mouth.  The house potatoes are a crispy baked potato wedge that with their hot sauce and ketchup are yummy with every bite.  The Benedict doesn't over do it with the hollandaise sauce and their smoked salmon is incredible, really bringing up the level of the classic Eggs Benedict.  

I typically bring friends and family that travel from other parts of the state and/or other parts of the country to this little neighborhood spot.  With constant menu changes I'm always in for a treat with my traveling guests making this a wonderful regular location even for a lifelong local.  

Mimosas are always a nice touch to brunch, however, not bottomless, so don't indulge too much! 

xox

excerpts: 3 of us ordered the plow I had mine with poached eggs and chicken apple sausage.

the plow.review:

Usually I never wait more than 1/2 hour, but with friends visiting from out of state and knowing that by the time you get to another worthwhile spot it's going to be the same wait we decided to stay and wait the 1 1/2 hours. There are some good coffee spots around or you can order coffee or mimosas here and have them while you wait so it's not too big of a deal. 3 of us ordered the plow I had mine with poached eggs and chicken apple sausage. I thought they gave me pork sausage it was that good, and those lemon ricotta pancakes amazing. Another good thing was parking plenty on the same street and other close streets, each is only 2 hours so you might have to move your car while u wait but hey close and free parking in San Francisco is worth it.
I would definitely recommend and go back

the plow.review: Got here around 12:45 on a Friday and it was a full house but we only waited about five minutes for a table of two. For drinks we ordered a root beer and a homemade strawberry lemonade. The lemonade was adorable and came with one of those old school paper straws with red stripes on it. It was a little on the sour side but was still refreshing. My boyfriend and I ordered the plow breakfast combo which came with two eggs, two lemon ricotta pancakes, REALLY REALLY BOMB ASS crunchy potatoes, and two pork sausage patties. The lemon ricotta pancakes were sooo flavorful and really moist. We also ordered a French toast which came with marscapone cream and strawberries on top (also bomb).
