excerpts: I selected The Plow ($16) with sunny side-up eggs, housemade pork sausage, two Lemon Ricotta Pancakes, and crispy potatoes.
The sausage was nice, but dry.
Not my favorite sausage.
Though the crispy potatoes were lovely and the Lemon Ricotta Pancakes were perfect!
Though the crispy potatoes were lovely and the Lemon Ricotta Pancakes were perfect!
the plow.author: Amelinda L.
the plow.review:
We walked here from the 16th St BART Station. Not a good idea. I didn't think to check the distance (1.6 miles); it seemed so close on the map. It's not that a 32-minute walk wasn't good for me (I totally earned my breakfast, not), it's the unsavory characters that you encounter. So, don't do what I did. However, the meal was worth the trouble!

We arrived around 9:30 on a Tuesday and it was much busier than I expected. Fortunately not busy enough that we had to wait because thankfully, there were two seats available at the bar. Some helpful notes: they will not seat you unless your entire party is present. Even if it is just one other person. No exceptions. Also, there's only 6-7 seats at the bar and roughly seven tables (very small space). There are a couple tables for outside dining as well.

Owner/Chef Maxine Siu was directly in front of us busily preparing dishes in their small partially-open kitchen. She was careful not to make eye contact with any patrons. Totally understandable, but it would have been so much fun to talk food. 

Ruben started with a cup of Equator Coffee ($3.50) and we shared a Cinnamon Brioche ($4). It was a delicious rendition of a cinnamon roll and the center was perfectly gooey and flavorful. I selected The Plow ($16) with sunny side-up eggs, housemade pork sausage, two Lemon Ricotta Pancakes, and crispy potatoes. The sausage was nice, but dry. Not my favorite sausage. Though the crispy potatoes were lovely and the Lemon Ricotta Pancakes were perfect! Ruben had the Fried Egg Sandwich with Nueske Bacon ($13.50), two soft fried eggs, aioli, cheddar, and frisée on an Acme bun. This was also tasty with the addition of the "Food's Best Friend Lucky Dog" hot fire-roasted pepper sauce.

Our server was really friendly and everyone was very pleasant. We didn't loiter much since there were several people waiting, but it's a nice setting to hang out and catch up with friends. The decor is fun with many pigs around! Oh, the important question - would I wait for 1+ hour(s) for a table? No, but that is why you plan ahead!

excerpts:
THE PLOW ($16)
[+/-
the plow.author: Sandy T.
the plow.review:
Plow was pretty good, but was it an hour wait long good? Ehhh, let's just say I'm not in a hurry to come back. And an hour is on the SHORTER end of the wait time frame!

Decided to make a trip here for brunch on "Spring Forward" DST day, hoping people were thrown off by the hour that disappeared from the day. Was intending to get there by 9:45am but lagged myself until 10:30a (oops, darn DST lol). I was almost dropped off to get our names on the list but I rushed out my house blind (without contacts on) so we had to go find parking first (again, oops lol). Good thing parking was easy to find! We got a spot right around the corner and then the hour wait commenced...

We were seated at the bar, which I love because of the open kitchen, and this is how I learned that:
[+] pork sausages are uncooked, hand-formed and cooked only when ordered
[+/-] chicken-apple sausages are cooked a bit and "reheated"/"recooked"
[-] bacon is cooked beforehand, sits in an open metal pan, and simply "reheated" on the flat top griddle (albeit it is most efficient this way, considering how busy it is here)
[+] everything else is cooked only when ordered
[+] the cooks have a very organized system so, props to those guys!

THE PLOW ($16)
[+/-] Lemon ricotta pancakes (2 small) were very good in some bites (depending on where the ricotta is), but it was a bit dry overall and had a very faint lemon flavor. I usually don't use syrup with my pancakes but for this, I had to dip a bit to add some sweetness to it.
[+] Potatoes were on point. I love the crispy, herby tastes and it was not overly salty either.
[+] Chicken-apple sausages (4 links) were very enjoyable and did not taste overcooked from the "recooking"
[+/-] Eggs are made to your liking

CORNED BEEF HASH ($15)
[-] Yes, it comes with potatoes but it is NOT their signature crispy, herby goodness! You've been warned.
[+] Corned beef was corned beef. Good and thinly-sliced.
[+/-] Comes with 2 slices of lightly-toasted rustic loaf
[+/-] Eggs are made to your liking

SERVICE
[-] Took a while to get our waters after we were seated
[-] Waitress/server totally forgot I asked for a box, even after giving us our check
[+/-] Was never asked how we were doing, but maybe because we were at the bar?

We finished our meal around 12:30pm and there was STILL a long wait. I don't know how people wait so long for this place! It's good but I'm not blown away. If I'm going to wake up early and wait at least an hour for food, I expect nothing less than awesome. Until next time, Plow. And maybe on a weekday morning for a shorter wait time.

the plow.review: This is one of the cutest brunch places I've been to. The inside is just so French, like effortlessly cool. And the food is simple but elegant in a rustic way. The potatoes were amazing and just right.
There was a great balance between the starch and crisp layer.
We topped the order off with a biscuit and to be honest that would have been it for me with some coffee or tea.
The honey butter is a great addition and melted makes it even better.
The biscuit doesn't look like a biscuit
the plow.author: Jodie G.
the plow.review:
This place has become an absolute favorite after just one day. I was initially feeling miserable as I saw my fiends sitting outside, the wind had been picking up and the sun was nowhere close to touching my skin. One of the waitress offered us blankets and it was very much needed. I see this a  sign of paying attention to the needs of customers and their satisfaction. I don't think I would have been able to enjoy my meal if that blanket wasn't a part of the equation. 

The waitress was very patient as my friend and I caught up after almost three years apart. I ordered "The Plow" and it had all the makings of a good breakfast. The potatoes were amazing and just right. There was a great balance between the starch and crisp layer. We topped the order off with a biscuit and to be honest that would have been it for me with some coffee or tea. The honey butter is a great addition and melted makes it even better. The biscuit doesn't look like a biscuit but once you bite into it all those thoughts escape you. 

I look forward to going back, I hear that you have to go early. Wish me luck!

excerpts: So, naturally I had to get The Plow ($16)
The Plow is two eggs, two lemon ricotta pancakes, house potatoes and your choice of bacon, housemade pork sausage, or chicken apple sausage.
I chose to get the pork sausage.
I was so excited when our plates were finally in front of us.
His crab scramble was plentiful too and had a lot of fresh crab in it.
The creme fraiche was the perfect addition for the scramble.
He loved the house potatoes which was served with his meal too.
The toast it was served with was standard though.
As for my Plow: The eggs, which I chose over easy were perfectly cooked and the yolk just oozed all over once punctured.
The house potatoes were so crispy.
the plow.author: Cat C.
the plow.review:
I've had Plow bookmarked for quite sometime, but since I am an impatient person, he & I have stayed away due to the long waits.  Yesterday morning though, we both woke up early and decided to try our luck.  Parking was pretty easy as we got a space across the street. We arrived about 5 minutes or so after opening and got seated at the last table, which we shared with a couple that got in right before us.  Of course I was afraid that it wasn't going to live up to the hype, but it did!  7x7 released a few months ago the recipe for Plow's lemon ricotta pancakes and I took a stab at making them.  So, naturally I had to get The Plow ($16) & he instantly gravitated towards the Dungeness crab scramble ($17).  The waitress was coming around asking if we wanted coffee with her big pitcher.  Bf said yes and I declined since I'm so picky with coffee.  However, he (usually drinks black) and I (usually gets vanilla lattes and macchiatos) thought the coffee was quite good even with just a little bit of sugar, it was pretty mild.  The coffee was Equator.  

The Plow is two eggs, two lemon ricotta pancakes, house potatoes and your choice of bacon, housemade pork sausage, or chicken apple sausage.  I chose to get the pork sausage.  I was so excited when our plates were finally in front of us.  His crab scramble was plentiful too and had a lot of fresh crab in it.  The creme fraiche was the perfect addition for the scramble.  He loved the house potatoes which was served with his meal too.  The toast it was served with was standard though.  As for my Plow: The eggs, which I chose over easy were perfectly cooked and the yolk just oozed all over once punctured.  The house potatoes were so crispy.  The lemon ricotta pancakes were fluffy, moist, and lemony; they were to die for.  The only thing that killed the breakfast was the sausage.  We were surprised that they were made into patties, and it did have some nice seasoning but they were so dry.  We had to dip the pieces into the egg yolk or pour syrup on them.  Perhaps they didn't put any fat in it and that's why it was so dry?  The dry sausage was really the only thing that killed the breakfast and prevented us from deeming Plow a 5 star breakfast.  

Okay, I think even by SF standards the dishes are a little pricey for breakfast, but they're so worth it.  I'm gonna say a little gripe though, what I don't get is that, they offer free cups of coffee (refills too) for those stuck waiting for a table outside, but will ask around patrons dining if they'd like a cup...thought it may have been free, but was surprised to see the $3.50 charge on the receipt.  Bf was more optimistic than me though (even though he paid) and said, "Well at least they kept filling me up.  Not all places give free refills."  Plow is a solid 4.5 stars.  I can't wait to come back for more lemon ricotta pancakes and house potatoes!

My bf and I hoped that there wouldn't be as long of a wait in the morning as there would be during brunch, but we thought wrong..

excerpts: Had the plow with sausage and lemon ricotta pancakes.
The Lemon Ricotta Pancakes were a surprise.
Not as good as they were hyped up by my friends
the plow.author: Adam Y.
the plow.review:
Amazingly popular place. Even on a Tuesday morning,t his place was packed. Had the plow with sausage and lemon ricotta pancakes. Literally everything was delicious. 

The sausage which I heard is made in house was hearty and salted perfectly.

The potatoes were made just how I like them: with a lot of crunch yet soft on the inside. Like a french fry but round. They really do a great job with the potatoes here.

The Lemon Ricotta Pancakes were a surprise. Not as good as they were hyped up by my friends but they were still rich, creamy and lemony.

Service was slow but they recognized it and gave us a lemon scone.

excerpts: the plow with their potatoes is one of the best things i ever ate.
i love potatoes in any form but this is one of my favorite iterations.
also their handmade sausage patties are yummy as well.
it's worth the wait if you come at peak brunch time
but if you get there when it opens, the wait isn't as bad.
the plow.author: S L.
the plow.review: whenever i go to sf to visit my sister, this is one of the places i must eat for brunch. the plow with their potatoes is one of the best things i ever ate. i love potatoes in any form but this is one of my favorite iterations. also their handmade sausage patties are yummy as well. it's worth the wait if you come at peak brunch time but if you get there when it opens, the wait isn't as bad.

excerpts: Although there were several dishes on their menu that I wanted to try (particularly "The Plow"), I ordered the Duck Hash with Poached Eggs so that I could compare it to the one I had at MBC.
Now unfortunately, I forgot to take a picture of my dish, but trust me when I say it looked so good when it was brought out.
And like the one I had at MBC, this one tasted just as good as it looked.
The hash had a lot of duck flavor, but not to the point where it was overpowering everything else on the plate.
It was especially impressive given that there wasn't a ton of duck meat (there was still enough to keep me happy though).
And what can I say about poached eggs?
Aren't they always good, especially when they're runny?
the plow.author: Mike L.
the plow.review:
Not too long ago, I wrote about how Mission Beach Cafe is one of my favorite brunch spots in the city.  While that hasn't really changed since then, they're going to have to make some room at the top of my brunch list for Plow.  MBC is still great and all, but it's kinda like when a kid gets a little brother or sister - still loved, just that there's someone else now to share the spotlight with.

After my friend's brother raved about the food at Plow, my friend and I decided to come by on a Saturday morning to check them out.  He had warned us that there there was usually a long wait on weekends, so we were fully prepared with the possibility of not getting seated for a while.  However, when we put our names down, we were pleasantly surprised that was only going to take about 20 minutes to get a table.  Sweet!

Although there were several dishes on their menu that I wanted to try (particularly "The Plow"), I ordered the Duck Hash with Poached Eggs so that I could compare it to the one I had at MBC.  Now unfortunately, I forgot to take a picture of my dish, but trust me when I say it looked so good when it was brought out.  And like the one I had at MBC, this one tasted just as good as it looked.  The hash had a lot of duck flavor, but not to the point where it was overpowering everything else on the plate.  It was especially impressive given that there wasn't a ton of duck meat (there was still enough to keep me happy though).  And what can I say about poached eggs?  Aren't they always good, especially when they're runny?  Yum.

While I'm reluctant to say that the food at Plow is better than MBC (or vice versa, for that matter), they definitely win out in one important category - parking.  It was such a breeze getting a space.  Even though the drive here was a little longer, being able to drive up and park within a block without circling made it well worth it.  For that reason, I'd be slightly more inclined to come back to Plow than MBC, but I'm still going to show equal love to two of my favorites.

excerpts: Ordered the plow which was really good!
However I found a hair in my food which I wasn't too concerned about but the staff kindly insisted the food was on the house!
Really great staff, these things happen!
the plow.author: Rj L.
the plow.review: Got here around noon and the wait wasn't too bad, maybe a 20-25 min wait for brunch. Ordered the plow which was really good! However I found a hair in my food which I wasn't too concerned about but the staff kindly insisted the food was on the house! Really great staff, these things happen!

excerpts: The Plow", need I say more?
I had the plow with scrambled eggs, chicken apple sausages, lemon ricotta pancakes and their house potatoes.
It was delicious for such a "standard traditional breakfast".
I did pass on the house made pork sausages because a lot of reviewers said that they were dried.
The potatoes were seasoned with rosemary and had a nice crisp.
the plow.author: Laura T.
the plow.review:
"The Plow", need I say more? 

I have tried to dine here for brunch 3 times in the past and have always given up because the wait is 2 hours+. One Tuesday morning, I finally scored a table outside with no wait. As many Yelpers advised, it is better to dine here on a week day versus a weekend. Right away I already knew what I wanted. 

I had the plow with scrambled eggs, chicken apple sausages, lemon ricotta pancakes and their house potatoes. It was delicious for such a "standard traditional breakfast". I did pass on the house made pork sausages because a lot of reviewers said that they were dried. The potatoes were seasoned with rosemary and had a nice crisp. I really liked the lemon pancakes because they weren't too sour or doughy. 

I would come back but hopefully there won't be such a long wait.

excerpts: Afterall, my dish, the Plow, didn't sound like anything special: potatoes, sausage, eggs, and a pancake.
the plow.author: Neha S.
the plow.review:
I just had THE BEST BRUNCH OF MY LIFE at Plow.

Despite the yelp reviews, I wasn't expecting anything extraordinary. Afterall, my dish, the Plow, didn't sound like anything special: potatoes, sausage, eggs, and a pancake. Boy was I wrong!

While all the elements were simple and recognizable, each one was perfectly executed. The potatoes were the best I've ever had. The eggs were unbelievably fluffy. Even the sausage, which I don't usually care for, was delicious. And the lemon ricotta pancake brought it all home with a nice sweetness to round out the rest of the savory meal.

The wait wasn't too bad for two people, either: 30 minutes. Bring a book and park yourself under the many shady trees to while away the time before your name is called.

The only disadvantage of this place is that it's a bit out of the way...a 38 minute walk from my place, and 30 with public transport (who else hates SF public transport?!), but it's completely worth it.

excerpts: I ordered the plow with Almond flour pancakes, bacon, poached eggs with mixed greens.
Delicious soft pancakes, bacon and creamy eggs!
Healthy and Hearty brunch!
the plow.author: Vanessa R.
the plow.review: My first time I went here with my dad and sister. I ordered the plow with Almond flour pancakes, bacon, poached eggs with mixed greens. Delicious soft pancakes, bacon and creamy eggs! Healthy and Hearty brunch!

excerpts: I ordered The Plow with almond flour pancakes instead of the lemon, because I don't like anything with lemon.
I ate everything but the pancakes because they tasted just like almond flour, it was horrible!!
Not sweet, or buttery, just flour...
almond flour.
My boyfriend, who eats EVERYTHING couldn't even contain his facial expression when he tried it.
It was just bad, and to think that I stalked this place from a Postmates AD and flew down there just for the disappointment.
the plow.author: Kae W.
the plow.review: Oooh Plow, I wanted to love you, but meh. I arrived at 930 & was told that my wait would be about an hr and 15mins, which was fine; I've read the yelp reviews. So, I grabbed starbucks and went to office depot, just to return right on time. I ordered The Plow with almond flour pancakes instead of the lemon, because I don't like anything with lemon. I ate everything but the pancakes because they tasted just like almond flour, it was horrible!! Not sweet, or buttery, just flour...almond flour. My boyfriend, who eats EVERYTHING couldn't even contain his facial expression when he tried it. It was just bad, and to think that I stalked this place from a Postmates AD and flew down there just for the disappointment.

excerpts: The PLOW was great if you want to taste a bit of everything - got to try their lemon ricotta pancakes and crunchy potatoes from my husbands plate!
Got a bite of  the fried egg sandwich from my niece.
the plow.author: June R.
the plow.review: We had to wait close to two hours for brunch only because we were party of 4. Space is limited and if you are party of two or single party then seats more available. We didn't mind the wait since there are plenty of cafes and shops to fill your time while waiting.  It was well worth the wait. The PLOW was great if you want to taste a bit of everything - got to try their lemon ricotta pancakes and crunchy potatoes from my husbands plate! Got a bite of  the fried egg sandwich from my niece. A taste of the salmon Benedict from her friends plate and then enjoyed my scrumptious Farro Salad. Atmosphere is great along with the staff. 4 stars only because of the limited space.

excerpts: They do have a sign sticking out that says "The Plow" though.
For my dish, I ordered The Plow ($16) [http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/plow-san-francisco?select=idHQVocGRxfnUjULoUkgDA#NYJXSTwF-Ugv0vFpKULyvQ] and a side of Nueske Bacon ($5.50)
[http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/plow-san-francisco?select=
idHQVocGRxfnUjULoUkgDA#fzy-q83TFoTe12n157Wu4Q].
The Plow was delicious!
the plow.author: Mandy G.
the plow.review:
Arriving on a sunny, windy weekday afternoon, we entered Plow at around 1pm. The restaurant had quite a number of people, so we were kicked to curb, to wait in the wind. By kicking us to the curb, I mean they told us to step outside to wait till we're seated because they don't want it cramping up by the entrance. I like this idea because it makes the dining experience more enjoyable. They told us to wait about 5 mins, but we were seated within 3 mins. 

Located on the corner of Mississippi St and Texas St, this place can easily be missed..only because it's located in a residential area. They do have a sign sticking out that says "The Plow" though. Parking wasn't bad for my friend and I because we found one quick, right across the street. 

Seated in the back, service was still prompt and good because they would come check on us quite often. The food came out fairly quick in about 10 minutes. For my drink, I ordered the housemade strawberry lemonade ($3.75) [http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/plow-san-francisco?select=idHQVocGRxfnUjULoUkgDA#N3EwXeV_dXhdgR037ddEUw]. The drink looks adorable and instagram-worthy with its cute striped straw and lemon on the side, but don't let that fool you! I like the looks of it, but the straw is made of paper which can make it soggy. That's the only thing that irks me because the longer it sits in the lemonade, the faster it becomes soggy and the harder it becomes to drink. 

For my dish, I ordered The Plow ($16) [http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/plow-san-francisco?select=idHQVocGRxfnUjULoUkgDA#NYJXSTwF-Ugv0vFpKULyvQ] and a side of Nueske Bacon ($5.50) [http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/plow-san-francisco?select=idHQVocGRxfnUjULoUkgDA#fzy-q83TFoTe12n157Wu4Q]. The Plow was delicious! It consisted of  (2) small Lemon Ricotta Pancakes, Crispy Potatoes, Eggs, and House made pork sausage patties. I ordered this becuase it basically consisted of everything from the highlights on the Yelp page! I highly recommend ordering this for your first time because you get a taste of everything. Going from the lemon ricotta pancakes to crispy potatoes, to eggs and the house made pork sausage patties, everything just tasted so different from each other and unique! It changes your taste buds! 

The side of nueske bacon was a recommended dish in the highlights and as a fan of bacon, I just haaad to order it! I don't think it was all that special, but it was decently good. It was also pretty oily. 

If you can't finish your meal and plan to take the leftovers home, skip the crispy potatoes...it won't taste crispy anymore, haha. 

Overall, I enjoyed my experience and would definitely come back again..on a weekday! ;)

excerpts: What I noticed is everyone got the plow.
the plow.author: Emily K.
the plow.review:
Great breakfast spot! I recommend getting there early, the wait can be up an hour or two!

The lemon ricotta pancakes were delicious! What I noticed is everyone got the plow. It had potatoes, eggs, lemon ricotta pancakes and a meat selection. My fiancé got that and he liked it.

Enjoy!

excerpts: I usually opt for THE PLOW when I come here.
the plow.author: Veronica L.
the plow.review:
Plow is the epitome of what it means to be a brunch spot. I wish I could stop coming here but their food really gets me every time. 

I usually opt for THE PLOW when I come here. The LEMON RICOTTA PANCAKES are the perfect blend of zest and depth for a pancake, this is definitely a must try! The NUESKE'S BACON and HOUSE MADE PORK SAUSAGE are both delicious, but I wouldn't recommend the Chicken-Apple. The potatoes are always fresh and crispy and eggs how you like 'em. The FRENCH TOAST w/ bananas is a great way to end brunch on a sweet note. Coffee, grapefruit juice, and the ginger beer are all great pairs with their dishes.

Things to keep in mind: The wait is going to be long. I was lucky to come by here when the wait was 15-20 minutes, but I know the wait can be up to 1.5-2 hours depending on the day and time you come by. You won't miss this place because of the large crowd standing at the corner of the block waiting to eat at this place.

Service is always great and friendly. Food doesn't take long despite the popularity and seating is both indoor and outdoor.

excerpts: The plow breakfast ordered was such a letdown, upon immediate glance of small plate.
the plow.author: Jana C.
the plow.review:
Generous 2.3 for brunch very recently. Bookmarked for 3 years----crestfallen experience on a warm afternoon.

I was stuck on the Bridge; plenty of empty tables available outside. My friend was forced to stand and wait until I arrived in order to sit down somewhere. Joking me?? I understand upholding that when there are not a minimum of 6 2-tops open! Off-putting

The plow breakfast ordered was such a letdown, upon immediate glance of small plate. Crispy potatoes tasted stale to both of us, and instead of properly cut small chunks, we got little bits and bobbles of leftover pan. Couldn't even spear them with the tines of a fork. Resigned, we just wasted an already small plate of food for $16.

Lemon ricotta pancakes (2 silver dollar-sized) did not have that refined, think crispy buttery edge with super fluffy, melt-in-mouth feel. Lemon was very nice on the tongue, but it certainly was the only positive attribute to them.

Nueske bacon fine.

After within the month, going to many brunch places, I find the food way overrated. Way.

excerpts: We ordered the proscuitto toast and the plow (one with bacon and one with chicken sausage).
My order was the plow with bacon and it very tasty!
The pancakes were light and fluffy, the potatoes were crispy on the outside and seasoned well.
If I were to rate this restaurant on food alone, I would have definitely given this place a 5/5!
It was actually the service that was less that subpar.
the plow.author: Rochelle M.
the plow.review:
I went here with a party of 3. The wait wasn't too bad since we arrived around 1pm. My friends raved about this place so I was pretty excited to finally try it. We ordered the proscuitto toast and the plow (one with bacon and one with chicken sausage). My order was the plow with bacon and it very tasty! The pancakes were light and fluffy, the potatoes were crispy on the outside and seasoned well. If I were to rate this restaurant on food alone, I would have definitely given this place a 5/5! It was actually the service that was less that subpar. ):

I don't know if I went on a bad day but the service my party and I received was one of the worst and I wish I had spoken to the manager or someone about it. 
1) The server accidentally gave us the wrong food (two plows both with chicken sausage, no mention of a third plate coming either); it was supposed to be for the party of two in the adjacent table. No big deal, mix-ups happen. We gave them their food and they flagged down the server to let them know they had made a mistake. The server looked at us angrily like we had made the mistake and then rushed to the back. 
2) The server came back to let us know that we had ordered the same thing. I asked to confirm if mine had bacon, because that's what I had ordered. She rudely replied "your food is coming soon" and left without confirming what I had ordered. She could have just said yes and left it at that??? I didn't ask how long my food was taking, nor did I care about how long it would take... 
3) During the meal, our server did not check on us (or anyone for that matter) to see if we needed water or anything, not even once throughout the meal. 
4) When our server came by the tables I asked her "excuse me, may I please have the check?" She ignored me and continued to scan the tables in the area without approaching any of them. I thought that she didn't hear me so I repeated myself several more times until I got her attention. She gave me a dirty look and went to get our bill.
5) When my friend got her card back with the receipt, the server threw the pen next to her instead of handing it to her along with her card. 

You could've just said you didn't want to be tipped instead of treating us poorly? But you do you... We tipped her out of courtesy but it felt wrong because the service was nonexistent /: 

The guy giving us condiments was totally coo tho. 

Anyways, I would go back cause the food was bomb but definitely not anytime soon because of this experience lol maybe next time will be better??? Who knows......

excerpts: We had the french toast and the Plow...which was good, but again not amazing.
the plow.author: Lily W.
the plow.review:
I came here expecting really great foods...and was a bit disappointed.  I mean, not enough to tell people NOT to come, but enough to not put it higher on my recommendations for good brunch in SF.

I came here with my sister on a Friday morning. Knowing there was going to be a line, we budgeted a 30 minute wait. We seemed to have come in right before they opened the outside dining, which was cool because that shortened the wait significantly. Then again, they still staggered us (which, I assume is to not over burden the kitchen). And plus...the outside seating is on an incline. Made for some awkward sitting. 

We had the french toast and the Plow...which was good, but again not amazing. Plow included the lemon ricotta pancakes people rave about. The pancakes people rave about is just ok. Seriously. If I didn't know it was ricotta in there, I'd think it was under cooked.  I still have my doubts on the full-cooked-ness of these pancakes. Outside was crispy, inside was goopy. 

The rest of the food was pretty solid. I like that they don't shy away from making the scrambled eggs JUST done. Like seriously, a second less and it'd be runny. But I kind of like my eggs like that. 

The pancakes dinged it a bit for me...and also the service. Oh, the people were relatively nice and all. But my coffee (which I legitimately LIVE for) I had to flag down folks many times for refills (I nearly told them to leave the carafe. And had pre-warned them of my caffeine needs). We were ready to order right when we sat down, and they acknowledged this and still waited quite some time to come back.  

I'm usually one that's willing to wait for good food, but I don't think I'd crave Plow enough to wait in a line longer than 30 minutes. =/

excerpts: I highly recommend "The Plow" with homemade pork sausage.
the plow.author: Claudia N.
the plow.review:
Thought there would be a long line, but we were seated almost immediately, though we did come on a Friday (near closing time). 

This is hands down one of the best brunch places I've encountered in San Francisco. Located in a beautiful neighborhood with quaint little cafes and shops across the street, Plow fulfills the definition of what a true brunch experience in the city should be, fresh and local. 

I highly recommend "The Plow" with homemade pork sausage. You get a bit of everything, including two of their famous, melt in tongue, lemon ricotta pancakes. 

Don't forget to drizzle your sausage with some of their Lucky Dog hot sauce. 

So amazing!

excerpts: Most of us had the fried egg sandwich, one had the plow and one had a crab omelette.
The fried egg sandwich was amazing.
The bacon in it was really tasty and high quality.
Most dishes come with the best potatoes one could wish for.
We also shared a lemon ricotta pancake for the table.
Service was friendly and attentive.
the plow.author: Luciana B.
the plow.review:
SOLID! We arrived on a Friday morning around 9:30 am and had a 15 minute wait. We sat outside, and they had blankets since it was a little chilly.
Most of us had the fried egg sandwich, one had the plow and one had a crab omelette.
The fried egg sandwich was amazing. The bacon in it was really tasty and high quality. Most dishes come with the best potatoes one could wish for. 
We also shared a lemon ricotta pancake for the table. 
Service was friendly and attentive.

excerpts: If you're super hungry or just like diversity, get "the plow".
the plow.author: Xinxin W.
the plow.review:
The wait is wayyyy too long here but if you come before 9am, it's not so bad. 

The egg sandwich is delicious but I wish it had a different bun! The bread is a let down. If you're super hungry or just like diversity, get "the plow". It's a bit of everything -- 2 eggs, 2 pieces of bacon or sausage, 2 lemon ricotta pancakes, and the smashed potatoes. While the pancakes are so soft and fluffy with just the right amount of lemon flavor, the real winner is the potatoes. Imagine potatoes that are smashed and deep fried so that it's extra crispy!

excerpts: Order the PLOW.
the plow.author: L F.
the plow.review:
Yum! Order the PLOW. Comes with your choice of meat, eggs, potatoes, and their famous lemon ricotta pancakes! 

The only downside for this place is the wait! There's always a wait, no matter what time of day. I've waited an hour at most, but today we got seated within 10 minutes. 

Regardless of the wait time, were always down for some plow.

excerpts: Since I read such amazing reviews about the lemon ricotta pancakes and house made pork sausage and wanted to try both, I ordered the plow (2 eggs, house made pork sausage, 2 lemon ricotta pancakes, and crispy potatoes).
Plow also offers side orders of both items.
I really enjoyed everything, especially the pancakes and potatoes.
the plow.author: Cici A.
the plow.review:
Since I read such amazing reviews about the lemon ricotta pancakes and house made pork sausage and wanted to try both, I ordered the plow (2 eggs, house made pork sausage, 2 lemon ricotta pancakes, and crispy potatoes).   Plow also offers side orders of both items.  I really enjoyed everything, especially the pancakes and potatoes.  Unless you dislike lemon (the pancakes really are pretty lemony), I highly recommend you at least order the side dish for your table to share.  

Meanwhile, one of my friends ordered the french toast, which was good, but in my opinion not as good as the pancakes.  Another of my friends ordered the chia seed pudding which though I did not personally try, had a gelatinous texture (due to the chia seeds) that she did not enjoy.

excerpts: I ordered the plow and the stars of that dish were the ricotta pancakes and the pork sausage.
Both were especially yummy and the kind of stuff I'd drool over.
The meh parts of the dish were the potatoes and the eggs (scrambled).
The potatoes were essentially deep fried and were just too heavy for my taste.
the plow.author: Jeffrey J.
the plow.review:
I think this place's food caters to a certain type of patron, and I was not of that sort (i.e. someone who likes heavy/greasy food). 

I ordered the plow and the stars of that dish were the ricotta pancakes and the pork sausage. Both were especially yummy and the kind of stuff I'd drool over. The meh parts of the dish were the potatoes and the eggs (scrambled). The potatoes were essentially deep fried and were just too heavy for my taste. The eggs were basically thrown onto a skillet with nothing else (very bland). 

Ultimately, given that half the dish was great & half forgettable and that it was a 1.5 hour wait knocks this place down to a three.

excerpts: I went with the pork chop and 2 eggs (others have told me that I shoulda tried "The Plow", but hey, we can't bat 1.000).
I was not disappointed.
The pork chop was seasoned and flavored quite nicely with some sort of soy sauce glaze?
Their potatoes are golden and crispy (just how daddy likes em).
I also got to try their pumpkin pancakes and it was fire flame emoji.
I'd be lying if I said it wasn't one of my favorite brunch spots in SF.
I'll be back, Plow.
the plow.author: Bradley C.
the plow.review: Popped my Plow cherry and it was everything I wanted it to be and more! I went with the pork chop and 2 eggs (others have told me that I shoulda tried "The Plow", but hey, we can't bat 1.000). I was not disappointed. The pork chop was seasoned and flavored quite nicely with some sort of soy sauce glaze? Their potatoes are golden and crispy (just how daddy likes em). I also got to try their pumpkin pancakes and it was fire flame emoji. I'd be lying if I said it wasn't one of my favorite brunch spots in SF. I'll be back, Plow.

excerpts: We ordered The Plow, Fried egg sandwich, Cold-smoked salmon toast, and two egged breakfast.
the plow.author: Crystal Y.
the plow.review:
Came here on a weekend around 11AM and left because the wait was too long.  Finally got to try this place on a monday morning with a part of four.  We waited about 30 min, which isn't bad compared to the waits on the weekends.  

It wasn't too hard to find parking other than how some streets had street cleaning.  The service was good with polite staff.  The music was nice and suits the environment.  We ordered The Plow, Fried egg sandwich, Cold-smoked salmon toast, and two egged breakfast.  It was A LOT for four people.  

Overall, I'm impressed with the Cold-smoked salmon toast and Fried egg sandwich.  The potatoes were AMAZING.  Totally worth the meal and would come back on a weekday.

excerpts: Eat The Plow at Plow!
the plow.author: Ruth C.
the plow.review:
Plow plow plow!  Eat The Plow at Plow!

Showed up at 11:30 with Ingrid C on a Sunday for brunch... we were told the wait would be AN HOUR.  WOW.  So popular!  But since all my Yelpy friends said it was worth the wait, I was very excited that the wait was really only about 35 minutes.

Sitting at the marble? counter is an excellent experience.  The 3 guys pumping out the brunch menu for 40+ occupants really know what they're doing.  It's fascinating watch them make the eggs, fry the potatoes, cook the lemon ricotta pancakes, and dole out all the other goodies in very organized and efficient fashion.

Tasty mimosa, tasty coffee.  I have to say, the lemon ricotta pancakes really were not my favorite.  I did appreciate that they were crispy-edged pancakes and the lemony flavor was spot on.. but I didn't quite like the ricotta texture in my otherwise fluffy pancakes.  I didn't feel like the cheese added anything... but then again, I'm lactose intolerant and don't really enjoy cheese anymore...

LOVE the potatoes.  Super fried and delicious!  Seasoned perfectly.  The bacon was tasty but not memorable.  I tried Ingrid C's pork sausage and that was flavory herby goodness.

Definitely worth the wait.  There are plenty of cute shops to browse around including a bookstore about a block away.

My favorite brunch is still St. Mike's in Palo Alto, but this is pretty damn tasty if you're up in the city.

Extra bonus love to all the piggy figurines and piggy symbol as the restaurant mascot.

excerpts: The food: Get the Plow ($16) if you've never been before.
the plow.author: Emily S.
the plow.review:
I'm going to say it - and I may get some flack for it, but this is by far and away, in my opinion, the best brunch in San Francisco. Yep, I said it!

The wait: It's always long, even on a weekday which leaves me wondering - what do all these people do for a living if they can wait in line for brunch at 10am on a Tuesday?! But then I realize I'm right there with them :)

The food: Get the Plow ($16) if you've never been before. Their lemon ricotta pancakes are amazing and no matter which protein you pick it will be delicious. Recently they've started having an eggs Benedict ($17), which makes me the happiest person around! But the soft eggs scramble ($15) is always amazing!

The service: always efficient and friendly, but not too friendly where you feel like you've gained another table mate. 

The restaurant: it's decorated in such a way that I feel calm and relaxed despite the crowded small space full of hungry diners.

excerpts: Ordered The Plow and liked Lemon ricotta pancakes:).
the plow.author: Asato T.
the plow.review:
Went there for b-fast on Wednesday morning like 7:30. I know this place is been very popular with locals and packed on weekends, so thought today was a perfect timing to swing by.  There's 3-4 tables were taken already at this point!
Ordered The Plow and liked Lemon ricotta pancakes:). I didn't like crispy potatoes that much because they were too crunch and crispy and had barely portion to eat.

Will come back for the full portion of pancakes again!

excerpts: The plow platter and French toast were everything we hoped for and more!
It sounds corny
but it's just true.
You want to eat here.
the plow.author: Courtney L.
the plow.review:
I would actually give this place a 4 1/2 stars but unfortunately that isn't an option.  The half star ding is just for the wait time which actually isn't that big of an issue.  You can put your name down and leave and if they already called your name by the time you come back, they'll just bump you to the top of the list.  

More importantly, the grub.  For all its reviews and all the stars given, I went in with high expectations.  This can be dangerous and lead to disappointment (like when I waited in line for 2 1/2 hours to eat at mamas and the food was jut meh), but Plow came through.  It met, if not exceeded my expectations.  The plow platter and French toast were everything we hoped for and more!  It sounds corny but it's just true.  You want to eat here.

excerpts: The plow does a really good breakfast sandwich.
The Plow has an open kitchen
so I was standing approximately 10 feet from the conversation the waitress was having with the chef.
Based on the facial expressions and body language of the chef she seemed troubled and reluctant to permit my request.
I was put off by what I was witnessing
but I gave them the benefit of the doubt because I could not hear what was being said
the plow.author: Peter B.
the plow.review:
This may seem trivial to some but to me it is not.

I do not enjoy giving a negative review. In fact I have never given a negative review to anyone. I am a business owner in a highly competitive environment with a big emphasis on customer service. I know the challenges involved in dealing with the general public. It can be very demanding. 

The plow does a really good breakfast sandwich. It is pricey but I enjoy it.

Because of my busy schedule I always order to go. This morning I ordered my sandwich en route.  When I arrived at the restaurant I noticed it was not as busy as usual so I politely asked the waitress if I could eat my to-go order at the restaurant and requested a seat outside. The waitress was gracious and asked me to wait while she asked the chef if that was ok?

The Plow has an open kitchen so I was standing approximately 10 feet from the conversation the waitress was having with the chef. Based on the facial expressions and body language of the chef she seemed troubled and reluctant to permit my request. I was put off by what I was witnessing but I gave them the benefit of the doubt because I could not hear what was being said and I could easily have been reading the situation wrong. 

All seemed fine but as the waitress escorted me to a seat at the counter she said something to me that I did not hear. She placed my plate on the counter top and I asked her to repeat what she had said. 
She said "just want to let you know that we cannot do this again. This is the only time". I was very surprised and felt like I had just been reprimanded. I asked for an explanation and I was told that the to-go box cost extra!!!  "Are you kidding me!?"

I was not happy. If I had not witnessed the chefs reaction to my request I may not have been so annoyed. The waitress pleaded with me to sit down and explained that the box had been thrown away. I told her to get another box and to charge me for both. 

Why didn't the waitress inform me that it was not a problem to seat me but there would be an extra charge for the paper box? Don't take me to a seat ignoring my request for outside seating and warn me as if I had done something wrong.  

My thoughts are the manager or chef needs to pay attention to the fact that she is being observed and she should show a little appreciation for her customers. Maybe she is over worked or maybe she just doesn't care? Maybe she might act differently if she was trying to start a business rather than running what outwardly looks like a successful one.

When I go to a place to eat I want to be treated with a modicum of respect. I want to feel welcomed. I do not want to be treated as an annoyance. I am a regular customer here but I don't think anyone noticed.

excerpts: Had "the plow" which was eggs, meat (I had bacon
, my friend had sausage
the plow.author: Sean M.
the plow.review:
Came during a weekday so there was no wait (I'm assuming this isn't always normal during the week and it was more luck than anything). 

Had "the plow" which was eggs, meat (I had bacon, my friend had sausage so we tried them both), crispy potatoes and ricotta pancakes. 

Food was amazing, particularly the pork sausage, the pancakes and the potatoes. Sausage was house made, super moist and had amazing flavor. The Ricotta pancakes were the perfect crispness on the outside and perfectly light inside. Some of the best pancakes I've ever had, although there was a little bit too much lemon flavor. The potatoes are damn good. My guess is they're deep fried breakfast potatoes so a little different than what you would normally get. 

Totally recommend it, but not sure I'd want to wait 2 hours for it.

excerpts: We really enjoyed the Salmon Eggs Benedict and The Plow (lemon ricotta pancakes, eggs made to order, choice of pork sausage, chicken sausage or bacon, and potatoes).
Seating is cozy but the staff was pretty friendly.
the plow.author: Rose A.
the plow.review:
Every time my husband and I try a new restaurant, we always ask each other if we would be willing to come back .  In regards to Plow, that would be a yes.

We really enjoyed the Salmon Eggs Benedict and The Plow (lemon ricotta pancakes, eggs made to order, choice of pork sausage, chicken sausage or bacon, and potatoes).  Seating is cozy but the staff was pretty friendly.

excerpts: Boyfriend had "The Plow
" w/their home-made pork sausage.
The crispy potato was good, but nothing super special in my opinion.
the plow.author: Sam B.
the plow.review:
Had breakfast here today. Was there right when they opened, so didn't have to wait (didn't get to experience that long wait that everyone keeps talking about). 

Boyfriend had "The Plow" w/their home-made pork sausage. The crispy potato was good, but nothing super special in my opinion. The lemon ricotta pancakes were really good and tasty, however, my favorite of the dish was the pork sausage. Very well made and tasted almost "burger-like" - but in a good way! (maybe the patty shape had something to do with it)

I had the Gruyere with prosciutto and chili fried egg sandwich. It was big, but not too overwhelming. The bread was pretty thick, so I had to eat it with a fork and knife. It also came with leafy greens. It was very delicious and tasty, however, you can't really go wrong with fancy cheese + proscuitto + fried egg can you?

Overall, I thought that the food was good, place/vibe was excellent, however, it didn't really live up to the hype. I'd go back here again if I'm lucky enough to not have to wait in line again for sure, but it hasn't convinced me that it's worth the 45 minute wait.

excerpts: I got the Plow meal to try get a little bit of everything they had to offer.
Biscuit is great, and eggs were delightful.
the plow.author: Nathan C.
the plow.review:
I got the Plow meal to try get a little bit of everything they had to offer. Biscuit is great, and eggs were delightful. Home fries had a just the right amount of seasoning.

Coming on a weekday morning and sitting at the bar meant no wait for me, though everyone doesn't necessarily have that flexibility. A wait will be rewarded by a solid meal.

excerpts: The Plow breakfast is a great choice but you certainly can't go wrong with 1 of their biscuits and a side of bacon.
the plow.author: Marla M.
the plow.review: Service & food OUTSTANDING. Get there early but worth the wait. The Plow breakfast is a great choice but you certainly can't go wrong with 1 of their biscuits and a side of bacon.

excerpts: "The Plow" review:
the plow.author: Anna L.
the plow.review:
This place "plowed" me away! Haha, get it? 

We waited 45 minutes to get seated. It wasn't bad since me and my friend went a little crazy taking pictures on the hill right around the corner. I have weird knacks for hippy like brunch places. I loved the interior design and everything that was there. Definitely a small restaurant, but it was spacious and not cramped (at least where I was sitting). I kinda wish they had more than one restroom though because homegirl over hurr had to go and I couldn't wait! 

Food wise. U H M A Z I N G!! 

"The Plow" review: 
Omgosh, crispy side potatoes, sausages, eggs, and lemon ricotta pancakes were on point. I think I fell in love with their french toasts. It's hard to find good french toasts, and I think this is the place! We tried ordering their cornbread but they were out :( So sad, oh wells, next time!

excerpts: The Plow Plate was great.
the Ricotta pancakes are out-of-this-world (the best thing that I had on sweet toothed brunch items anywhere).
the plow.author: Rebecca C.
the plow.review:
Great spot for brunch but only if you don't have to wait too long. otherwise, head to foreign cinema at 11am and you could get a seat without too much hassle.

Tall ceilings surrounding a sunny ambience. laid back. not too loud. great food. hard working bus boys leaping to the next table to get it cleaned. all of the things that one wants at a fantastic brunch place.

The Plow Plate was great. the Ricotta pancakes are out-of-this-world (the best thing that I had on sweet toothed brunch items anywhere). I like that they make their apple chicken sausage in-house.

The eggs benedict was a bit too creamy for my taste but probably just right for the benedict lover.

excerpts: I got the plow, potatoes were burned, super stingy with condiments, only got .5 oz of syrup for the gross lemon riccota pancakes....
im olny giving 2 stars for the fresh high quality food #hipsterfood
the plow.author: Marc A.
the plow.review: Went here with a party of 2 to a half full dining room got sat in a tiny dark corner away from the windows all the way in the back... got pretty fast service and when we ask to be moved to the table in back of us the waitress told us "no thats where the kitchen guys are about to sit" ARE YOU F***ING KIDDING ME? I got the plow, potatoes were burned, super stingy with condiments, only got .5 oz of syrup for the gross lemon riccota pancakes.... im olny giving 2 stars for the fresh high quality food #hipsterfood

excerpts: I ordered the Plow and it was wonderful.
Everything on my plate was fantastic.
the plow.author: Abena O.
the plow.review:
This place turned me into the person that waits 2 hours in line for brunch and I'm okay with that. I was always a huge fan of brunch, but I didn't know that it could be that damn good! 

I ordered the Plow and it was wonderful. Everything on my plate was fantastic. However, the crispy potatoes were the standout item. 

Do yourself a favor and bear the line at least once so you can try their amazing brunch.

excerpts: We both ordered coffee and The Plow.
My friend got it with the pork sausage
and I got it with the chicken sausage, which are like meat patties and not the hot dog shaped ones.
The chicken sausages were extremely dry and a little hard to swallow.
the plow.author: Cheryl Q.
the plow.review:
To avoid the extremely long wait time, my friend and I got here 10 minutes before opening, on a Saturday. About 6 people were waiting before us and by the time the front doors opened, there were just enough people lined up to fill the first seating.

We both ordered coffee and The Plow. My friend got it with the pork sausage and I got it with the chicken sausage, which are like meat patties and not the hot dog shaped ones. The chicken sausages were extremely dry and a little hard to swallow. The lemon ricotta pancakes were not fluffy whatsoever, which is how you imagine ricotta pancakes, but were somewhat hard. The flavor was good tho. My scrambled eggs were good and my friend enjoyed the poached eggs. The highlight were the potatoes. So crispy, perfectly seasoned, and full of rosemary flavor. My friend doesn't like rosemary too much so she wasn't fond of them, but I lovedddd em.

Our coffees were never refilled and had to ask twice before it was. Since we woke up early, I NEEDED that second cup! 

I wouldn't wait the crazy 2 hours.

excerpts: I got the plow breakfast and loved the potatoes, super crispy.
the plow.author: Megan C.
the plow.review: Loved this place for a more traditional breakfast option. It's in a great location and I'll definitely be back. I got the plow breakfast and loved the potatoes, super crispy. The sausage and lemon ricotta pancakes were delicious too.

excerpts: The Plow - I got this with over-easy eggs & pork sausage.
Great news:
Eggs perfect.
Rosemary potatoes very tasty.
Bad news
: the pork sausage was well-spiced but dry; I recommend avoiding.
If I am going to eat pig, a lovely animal, it should be worth it
the plow.author: Sarah J.
the plow.review:
Had breakfast-for-lunch this Tuesday about 11 AM, just me. Can you call this meal brunch if it's not the weekend? Hmm... 

About 8 people waiting outside with me. I sat about 10 minutes sitting on an outside planter to get counter seat after putting my name on waiting list. Once in, I appreciated the pretty table setting with pressed striped thick cotton napkin folded between silverware, well-used coffee mug adding honest patina to marble counter. Heavy glass embossed salt & pepper shakers plus "raw" sugar in single-pour dispenser. It's the little things.

Ordered: 

Banana Cardamom Bread - DELICIOUS. Having it grill-fried only makes it more so. For sure get this if available. Really. Monkeys would be in eeeping nirvana eating this.

The Plow - I got this with over-easy eggs & pork sausage. Great news: Eggs perfect. Rosemary potatoes very tasty. Bad news: the pork sausage was well-spiced but dry; I recommend avoiding. If I am going to eat pig, a lovely animal, it should be worth it ;-) The lemon ricotta pancakes were not for me, though most Yelpers love them; they tasted like soggy Pledge polish to me.

Grapefruit Mimosa - Served in a pretty champagne flute but a bit $ at $10.50. I'd skip this next time.

Coffee - Tasty, smooth, subtle coconut flavor. Yum! 

Service - Excellent! Friendly & quick from Angela. Thanks!

The kitchen was working hard to get the dishes out, and I appreciated their labor, but pork sausage needs more fat or something -- and I will leave the famed lemon ricotta pancakes to the other people who adore them. Cute place, great service, but next time, I would stick with the classics: eggs, potatoes, bacon, coffee.

excerpts: I ordered the plow breakfast with pork sausage patty and a side of Hong Kong toast.
I cleaned my plate.
The wait was around an hour and a half, but there were a lot of friendly people waiting as well and we had good conversation and the time flew by.
The wait did not deter me and my husband from driving all the way from Modesto just to eat there again with our kids.
The wait was again about and hour
but it flew by once again.
I can't encourage you enough to go and try this place for the best breakfast of your life.
Be sure to order the Hong Kong toast as well.
the plow.author: Anesa H.
the plow.review: I tried this place after seeing a independent show with two brothers eating their way through the city. It was on my place to try. I was not let down. The food was out of this world. The coffee was really good too. I ordered the plow breakfast with pork sausage patty and a side of Hong Kong toast. I cleaned my plate. The wait was around an hour and a half, but there were a lot of friendly people waiting as well and we had good conversation and the time flew by. The wait did not deter me and my husband from driving all the way from Modesto just to eat there again with our kids. The wait was again about and hour but it flew by once again. I can't encourage you enough to go and try this place for the best breakfast of your life. Be sure to order the Hong Kong toast as well.

excerpts: The last time I was in attendance to have brunch here, I ordered The Plow which consists of 2 eggs prepared anyway
I'll have The Plow please.
Hold the dust.
the plow.author: Mike D.
the plow.review:
Set high in this quaint little neighborhood in Potrero Hill that has a great view of the downtown SF is this wonderful breakfast/brunch joint. 

I've been here twice and both times were equally amazing in food quality and service. I would rate this place higher if I had the option to. 

The last time I was in attendance to have brunch here, I ordered The Plow which consists of 2 eggs prepared anyway you'd like, choice of pork sausage/bacon/chicken sausage, crispy potatoes, and of course their popular lemon ricotta pancakes which are fluffy, moist, and scaled to perfection on taste. 

Needless to say, this is one of my all time favorites in the city. 

WORD OF ADVICE: COME EARLY!! The wait is usually pretty hardcore, but don't worry... you can order a mimosa to ease the pain while you wait outside. I'd recommend the grapefruit option over orange. Also, as much as I love sitting outdoors, I'd choose to sit inside on this one. The bus stop is right next to where you're seated... "I'll have The Plow please. Hold the dust."

excerpts: Boyfriend got the Plow.
the plow.author: Hayne P.
the plow.review:
Got here at 8:30 am and didn't get seated until 9:30. SF brunch game is too strong. 

Boyfriend got the Plow. Omgggggggg lemon ricotta pancakes are fluffy, moist, light, and perfectly lemony. I could inhale this forever. Perfect potatoes are perfect. Delicately crispy on the outside, soft and creamy on the inside. 

I got the eggs benedict with mushroom and spinach. Egg was poached perfectly, the sauce was creamy and rich with a little bit of tang to keep things interesting, and the English muffin  was to die for. I'm craving this for reals. 

I'm coming back for you. Soon.

excerpts: I plowed into the Plow at Plow.
the plow.author: Amy C.
the plow.review:
I plowed into the Plow at Plow.

This brunch item had a bit of everything:  two eggs (poached), some pork sausage, two small lemon ricotta pancakes, and the infamous PLOW POTATOES ($13).  The potatoes have ruined me for all future breakfast potatoes because the bar is now sky high.  They were really soft inside yet very crispy on the outside and sprinkled with great rosemary and salt seasoning.  And don't forget to try the locally made Youk's Hot Sauce!

The Fried Egg Sandwich came with two eggs over easy on a soft n' squishy Acme bun ($9).  The eggs were nice and runny and went great with the cheddar cheese, aioli, frisee, and Plow potatoes on the side.  

The bright space has a clean look with large windows and a cute sign that said, "No cell phone.  Please."  It's a small place though and busy for a weekday lunch.  I probably wouldn't brave the long wait on the weekend.

Unless "Plow Potatoes by the Bucket" becomes a menu item.  Then it's on like Donkey Kong!

More info here:  http://goo.gl/rnt4y

excerpts: If you get The Plow, which is basically their breakfast sampler, skip the sausage patty (very dry), and go for their bacon (nice and crispy).
The lemon ricotta pancakes are delicious, but the star of The Plow has got to be the crispy potatoes with rosemary.
the plow.author: Helen Z.
the plow.review:
This is easily one of the top brunch places to go to in SF. If you get The Plow, which is basically their breakfast sampler, skip the sausage patty (very dry), and go for their bacon (nice and crispy). The lemon ricotta pancakes are delicious, but the star of The Plow has got to be the crispy potatoes with rosemary. Yum. 

They have some staples on the menu like the fried egg sandwich, which is very good, but they also have great seasonal dishes. I tried the salmon tartine last time and it tasted delicious.

Pro Tip: Come on the weekdays to avoid the ridiculous lines.

excerpts: My friend had the plow while I had the dungeness crab scramble.
The food here did not disappoint.
The scramble was really good
but it seemed to be a bit watery/mushy?
Tried friend's pancakes and they were also good, not too flour-y.
Definitely pretty heavy on the lemon, whether you are or aren't into that.
the plow.author: Cathy C.
the plow.review:
I looooooove brunch. If I had it my way I would eat breakfast foods all day. Heard about this place from friends so I'm glad I got to stop by as I was visiting from out of town. We got there around noon on a Sunday and of course, the corner was bustling with people waiting for a table. I can't believe we waited almost two hours to get seated, but I'm proud of us for making it through alive. The moment when your name does get called makes you feel like you've just won the lottery, it's great. We got a table outside which was fine because as other reviewers have said, they provide blankets. The outdoor seating can get a bit awkward with hungry folks staring at you and your food, the likelihood increasing exponentially the closer you are to the main door (which we were right beside). The indoor area is a bit small, but love the decor and atmosphere.  

Maybe it was the hunger (or hanger), but I thought the coffee was really good. My friend had the plow while I had the dungeness crab scramble. The food here did not disappoint. The scramble was really good but it seemed to be a bit watery/mushy? Tried friend's pancakes and they were also good, not too flour-y. Definitely pretty heavy on the lemon, whether you are or aren't into that. Seemed like a lot of folks dining around us were substituting in almond flour pancakes. I also couldn't stop eyeing all the egg sandwiches that were being carried out of the kitchen! Overall had an enjoyable brunch experience at Plow. Would've been slightly better had we not spent a good portion of our day waiting and eating.

excerpts: I decided to get the Plow as it has a little bit of everything - eggs your way, choice of pork/chicken sausage or bacon, two lemon ricotta pancakes, and crispy potatoes.
Come hungry!
The crispy potatoes are seriously the best - absolutely MUST HAVE.
The lemon ricotta pancakes were really good too.
I had my eggs poached and the chicken sausage, both of which were good.
Although, the potatoes really stole the show!
The fresh orange juice was delicious.
We were seated outside and it was cute to watch people walk up and down the hill as we enjoyed our huge brunch.
It's dog friendly which is nice.
A bit more expensive than other places, good food, and friendly service except for the long wait.
Will go back for the crispy potatoes!
the plow.author: Jaya P.
the plow.review:
Best brunch I had in SF! Being from DC, I was kind of disappointed with the SF brunch scene but Plow definitely changed that. Yes, the wait is long and kind of annoying depending on when you go, but it's worth it, and definitely better than some other touristy brunch places (looking at you Mama's). Plow is in Portrero Hill, a mostly residential neighborhood and there are some cute stores, restaurants, bookshops around the block that you can check out while you wait. 
I decided to get the Plow as it has a little bit of everything - eggs your way, choice of pork/chicken sausage or bacon, two lemon ricotta pancakes, and crispy potatoes. Come hungry! The crispy potatoes are seriously the best - absolutely MUST HAVE. The lemon ricotta pancakes were really good too. I had my eggs poached and the chicken sausage, both of which were good. Although, the potatoes really stole the show! The fresh orange juice was delicious. We were seated outside and it was cute to watch people walk up and down the hill as we enjoyed our huge brunch. It's dog friendly which is nice. A bit more expensive than other places, good food, and friendly service except for the long wait. Will go back for the crispy potatoes!

excerpts: I got the Plow breakfast (hey-- when in Rome, right?) which came with two eggs (over-easy for me), 4 things of chicken apple sausage, 2 lemon ricotta pancakes (yes!
and yes!), and a big hoppin' load of crispy potato chunks (it's a bit ginger-y, so be advised).
I loved The Plow (get
yer mind outta the gutter...lol).
I believe the gal pal loved her pancakes too.
I only wish my lemon ricotta pancakes had some blueberry compote (sp?)
like the ones in the regular lemon ricotta pancake entree.
the plow.author: Melody W.
the plow.review:
I came here with a gal pal on a Thursday lunch break (~12:15pm). Parking was easy (say what the what? It's never easy in SF). Since I was in great company, the wait wasn't long at all--probably 10-15 minutes max for first available seating. We got seated outside, which was fine. The weather was amazing, so we didn't mind. 

She ordered a side of scrambled eggs with the Almond Flour Pancakes. I got the Plow breakfast (hey-- when in Rome, right?) which came with two eggs (over-easy for me), 4 things of chicken apple sausage, 2 lemon ricotta pancakes (yes! and yes!), and a big hoppin' load of crispy potato chunks (it's a bit ginger-y, so be advised). Oh-- and a cup of Equator coffee to wash it all down. I loved The Plow (get yer mind outta the gutter...lol). I believe the gal pal loved her pancakes too. I only wish my lemon ricotta pancakes had some blueberry compote (sp?) like the ones in the regular lemon ricotta pancake entree. And, I think the crispy potatoes were a little over-powering with ginger taste. All in all, I loved the dish and the experience. 

This place is worth a visit in my book.

excerpts: It's the signature dish, the Plow.
the plow.author: Herman E.
the plow.review:
This place serves crack.

I swear.  Pure craaaaaaaack!

This is a plate of crack:
http://www.yelp.ca/biz_photos/plow-san-francisco?select=AQQHQEMRFHofOnyRFOBWCA#ToiZprRvyLu9we-MuuTI8g
It's the signature dish, the Plow.  A plate of crispy potatoes(crack), Nueske bacon (crack), lemon ricotta pancakes (crack) and eggs (cracked =P)  My GAWD this was delicious.  The Nueske bacon was simply the best bacon I've had.  The lemon ricotta pancakes were heavenly.

Cold smoked salmon, fromage blanc, pickled red onions, capers, grilled Acme rye:
http://www.yelp.ca/biz_photos/plow-san-francisco#OZ955kbTXWpM8skTrkEXEw

This was good.  Ingredients were fresh.  My only complaint would be that the smoked salmon was not smoked enough.  I come from the land of smoked salmon, and this needed more smoking.

Also ordered a side of house made sausage patties.  Again good, but, yours truly makes a better version.  There were chili flakes and fennel in the spicing mixture.   So attn,  Management of Plow, you wanna pack 'em in even more?  PM me and maybe I'll share my sausage spicing recipe with you.  Pfffffffffft......

One real stand out.  Coffee.

I should have asked where they got their coffee, b/c this is a first!  And I really do mean first.  I do not like sour coffee.  I drink it black.  The coffee they served here was amazing.  It was fruity and citrusy with nice acidity WITHOUT being sour.  I have not encountered coffee like this before.
-----
Update:  Just found out the coffee is from Equator out of San Rafael!
-----
Plow, I'll visit you again.  2 hour flight, rental car, 30 minute wait, and all.  I'll come again.

excerpts: What I'm having today and on most visits here is The Plow.
the plow.author: Cameron T.
the plow.review:
My favorite breakfast in the peninsula, well actually, in the whole Bay Area. Very simple and delicious menu. I've tried the eggs Benedict with smoked salmon. Wow! What I'm having today and on most visits here is The Plow. You can never go wrong with their basic breakfast sampler of crispy seasoned potatoes, eggs any style (I get them as whites scrambled with cheddar) with your choice of apple chicken sausage, nueske bacon or (...can't remember the other choice) along with 2 very perfect lemon ricotta pancakes with real maple syrup. Yum! 

It's always busy here but well worth the wait (usually 45min-1hr in the weekends)

excerpts: Food: get the PLOW SPECIAL.
The ricotta pancakes were great.
And it's a great mix of everything Plow has to offer.
I would definitely go back again.
the plow.author: Sharon G.
the plow.review:
My girls and I needed a place to brunch at and we decided to check out Plow after reading all the other Yelp reviews. We went on a Saturday morning. Parking was fine, given it was located in a fairly residential area. 

Go EARLY and get your name on the list. We had to wait for an hour before getting seated. It was a gorgeous day and we sat outside. 

FYI - there's coffee available while you wait, BUT they will charge you. It's NOT FREE. We were mistaken and thought they were complimentary until we saw the charge on the bill. 

Food: get the PLOW SPECIAL. The ricotta pancakes were great. And it's a great mix of everything Plow has to offer. I would definitely go back again. :)

excerpts: Everything tastes good on The Plow dish.
the plow.author: Sandy W.
the plow.review:
They have a pretty good system in place for seating parties. You put your name down and they tell you when to come back to check on your status. It's good that they do this so you don't have to wait outside the restaurant for them to call your name. Who knows how long that will take. 

When we got seated outside, the waiter asked if we would like blankets in case it was too chilly. Beverages and food was ordered promptly after we got seated. I'm glad we didn't have to wait long for our orders to be taken. The food was great. Everything tastes good on The Plow dish.

excerpts: I opted for "The Plow" which came with two lemon ricotta pancakes/maple syrup (so good), two eggs (got mine just pure egg whites which were perfectly prepared), bacon (it wasn't the best, I should've just got the chicken apple sausage), and potatoes (which were the highlight of my meal --
the plow.author: Jorel C.
the plow.review:
Plow is located in a convenient spot off of 280 in Potrero Hill.  There was easily found street parking nearby when I went so I think parking shouldn't be much of a problem.  

Keep in mind I did not dine in for my meal during this visit to Plow, just a simple takeout request since I was alone.  

I opted for "The Plow" which came with two lemon ricotta pancakes/maple syrup (so good), two eggs (got mine just pure egg whites which were perfectly prepared), bacon (it wasn't the best, I should've just got the chicken apple sausage), and potatoes (which were the highlight of my meal -- I wish I ordered more because they were made to absolute perfection, crispy and all with just the right touch of rosemary).  

If you're in the area this place is so worth trying out despite the wait I've heard it has.  They've got some top-quality eats and excellent/friendly service even though my experience was brief inside the restaurant since I was just claiming my takeout order.  Definitely plan on returning soon!

excerpts: I decided to go with the Plow (2 ricotta lemon pancakes, eggs, house made sausages and potatoes).
I had a small issue with my pancakes because they were a bit underdone in the center.
The taste though... a punch of lemon-y goodness balanced with ricotta cheese!
As for the house made sausage, the flavors again punched me in the face and left me in awe.
the plow.author: Derrick H.
the plow.review:
You know a place is popular when my mom starts to talk about it. Being in close proximity to her work, I decided to take her on Saturday before she began her shift. Everyone knows you'd better be prepared to wait over an hour for a seat at any brunch spot in San Francisco; and Plow was no exception. To our surprise, our expected hour and a half turned into only 50 minutes! We were seated at the counter facing the open-aired kitchen. Plow is extremely homey. From the wooden decor to the spices stored in mason jars, I already knew I was going to like what I ordered. 

My mom and I both got coffee to start the meal. If I didn't drive, I definitely would have tried the Bloody Beer. But their coffee was great! My mom even said, "This is the best coffee I've had from any of the brunch spots you've taken me." It's hard to please my mom, especially when it comes to her coffee! 

But onto the food... between the both of us, we ordered two dishes.

My mom chose the soft scrambled eggs with oyster mushrooms, spinach and cheddar accommodated with potatoes and toast. I never knew eggs can be that light, fluffy and divine! I absolutely love eggs, but this made me fall in LOVE with them even more. Oyster mushrooms have a really "meaty" quality to them, so I didn't miss that there was no carnivorous protein on the plate (besides the egg). 
.
I decided to go with the Plow (2 ricotta lemon pancakes, eggs, house made sausages and potatoes). I had a small issue with my pancakes because they were a bit underdone in the center. The taste though... a punch of lemon-y goodness balanced with ricotta cheese! As for the house made sausage, the flavors again punched me in the face and left me in awe. It was unfortunately a bit on the drier side for my liking. 

But the key to this delicious meal lies in the potatoes... It doesn't make sense! Crispy goodness from the start to finish of meal. To be honest, I'm not a fan of the potato. Plow has to be seasoning their potatoes with something, because I ate every bite possible off my plate and then my mom's plate!

You definitely need to give Plow a try if you have any interest in brunch foods. I promise you won't be disappointed!

excerpts: I ordered the Plow with my eggs over medium and chicken apple sausage.
My potatoes were a little too extra crispy.
However, others that had the potatoes didn't suffer the same fate I did.
the plow.author: Nguyen L.
the plow.review:
I like the clean & simple neighborhood feeling of this restaurant. Waited an hour on Saturday but it wasn't that bad since the weather was nice and I had a Mimosa in my hand. 
I ordered the Plow with my eggs over medium and chicken apple sausage. My potatoes were a little too extra crispy. However, others that had the potatoes didn't suffer the same fate I did. I loved the lemon ricotta pancakes. The favor was light and not overpowering so I could easily see myself eating many of these.
Soft scrambled eggs - Who knew that stinging nettles and goat cheese went together so well. The eggs had that almost cooked looked like it was a little runny but when I ate it I tasted perfectly that way. 
Service- Hostess and servers were very nice.

They didn't have the monkey bread on the menu that day so I missed that opportunity.  If I was around Potrero Hill area I stop in again.

excerpts: Get the plow breakfast!
You get the best of all worlds.
the plow.author: Kaitlyn M.
the plow.review:
After we got married, we ended up in the heart of San Francisco being the tourists we are. Thankfully we stumbled upon this charming little quarter. It is worth every single second of the wait...odds are there will be a wait! I'll save you some time ordering though -- Get the plow breakfast! You get the best of all worlds. Lemon ricotta pancakes, potatoes, bacon, eggs, you name it. The almond flour pancakes are also incredible, my hubs ended up stealing mine because he doesn't like lemon pancakes. They make everything fresh and you can see them cutting potatoes or squeezing orange juice when you walk in the door!

See the link below for my top 10 favorite Breakfast Spots//Coast to Coast --

http://www.kaitgmiller.com/healthy-eating/10bestbreakfastspots
kaitgmiller.com

excerpts: I had "The Plow" plate which incl.
the plow.author: Javier A.
the plow.review: So we took a Cousin here during a 12 hr layover. We had seen the vids on YouTube about it and we were pleasantly surprised. Sunday morning about 9am the wait was about 45min. But worth it. I had "The Plow" plate which incl. two eggs, some really delicious Rosemary country potatoes, awesome sausage pattys, and to finish off, what I came for, Lemon Ricotta Pancakes!  If you visit for the pancakes alone it's worth it. They were fluffy , light and just lemony enough to not be overpowering and the ricotta, well let's just say I'm adding ricotta to my pancake mix from now on. Also delish was the corn millet muffin.

excerpts: The plow is such a good place to have brunch.
The food is great.
I ordered the plow.
the plow.author: Roger P.
the plow.review:
The plow is such a good place to have brunch. The food is great. I ordered the plow. It has 2 fried eggs, 2 lemon ricotta pancakes, 2 house made pork sausage and crispy country potatoes. First, the lemon ricotta pancakes were sooo good! They were light and fluffy. It has a unique taste that you just just have to taste for your yourself to truly appreciate it. Second, The crispy potato is amazing! Country potato is normally roasted and are soft with a texture to more of bake potato. But the crispy potato at plow is so different. Has tons of flavor! Third, The house made sausages were really good too. Full of herbs and spices. Making your own sausage in house, gives you a clue at the quality of the food you will be eating. 
If fresh food with great flavors is what your looking for, then plow is the place to go! Will definitely be returning to try other things on the menu!

excerpts: Had "the plow" and the pancakes and pork sausage were the highlights of
the dish hands down.
The staff is extremely friendly and takes good care of you.
Would visit regularly if we lived in the area.
the plow.author: Trevor C.
the plow.review: Lovey little spot that stays busy all morning but is worth the wait. Had "the plow" and the pancakes and pork sausage were the highlights of the dish hands down. The staff is extremely friendly and takes good care of you. Would visit regularly if we lived in the area.

excerpts: I had "the plow", which included two eggs any style, two pancakes, crispy potato along with some fancy bacon - could also choose the house made pork or chicken apple sausage.
I added the house made pork to the order (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/A0AziPST4T6k-V3neWFRNA?select=Nvx5t7GSC0M9qR9nAUcjvQ).
the plow.author: Peter L.
the plow.review:
I had "the plow", which included two eggs any style, two pancakes, crispy potato along with some fancy bacon - could also choose the house made pork or chicken apple sausage. I added the house made pork to the order (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/A0AziPST4T6k-V3neWFRNA?select=Nvx5t7GSC0M9qR9nAUcjvQ). Add a refillable coffee and the total was $21.

The place is still new, only a few months old so it feels nice, looking like an old Victorian converted (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/A0AziPST4T6k-V3neWFRNA?select=rMjzBGdWw3oWzRP5ph3JFg). I feel like this is one of those nicer brunch place for foodies, so if you're into that scene then it is perfectly fine.
