And, while not extravagant, the menu  prices (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/A0AziPST4T6k-V3neWFRNA?select=RWYDmjlqUDtKN1aMzOeaMA) are higher than the average greasy spoon spot. But, the food was plentiful and worth it.

Go by 9AM on a weekday and you should find parking within the block - only a street over from Mariposa (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/A0AziPST4T6k-V3neWFRNA?select=KrJE6HcQ9q9AEOmc-wvpgw) - and no waitlist. The server Ashley (liked her NZealand accent!) was also helpful with the menu suggestions. I plan to include this place in my brunch rotation - returning other days and times and update the review.

Note: Bumped into one of the owners of Candybar. A sign for another UYE?

excerpts: Me and my other friends all got the Plow and I loved their crispy potatoes!!
I was very satisfied after this meal (:
the plow.author: Tina C.
the plow.review: Came here on a Friday morning at 10:30 and surprisingly there was a wait! We waited an hour for party of three. Me and my other friends all got the Plow and I loved their crispy potatoes!! I was very satisfied after this meal (:

excerpts: The Plow - 2 eggs, crispy potatoes, 2 Lemon ricotta pancake - sweeter than the pumpkin, lighter and fluffier, and pork sausage.
Amazing.
the plow.author: Tiffany N.
the plow.review:
Yum! Definitely worth the 40min wait. I was disappointed that they ran out some things I want try like the Monte Cristo and Eggs Benedict. 

Pumpkin pancake - So Good! Perfectly cinnamon-y, fluffy and flavorful

The Plow - 2 eggs, crispy potatoes, 2 Lemon ricotta pancake - sweeter than the pumpkin, lighter and fluffier, and pork sausage. Amazing. And a great way to try a few different things

Pork lion sandwich. Hard to put down. That red sauce in it brought all the flavor. The bread was nice and not dry. 

Got their ice tea - whatever. Tasted like tea, that wasn't worth the $4! Haha

excerpts: I had the plow with sausage, extra bacon, egg whites and a French toast
and I loved every bit of is!
Their toast is a must have as well!
This place made my last day here one to remember!
the plow.author: Ismael L.
the plow.review: Dood this place is amazing! Stayed in San Fran this weekend on vacation and tried a lot of good places to eat but this place here just blows every other place out of the water! The music they place is great, the food is amazing, and the employees are friendly and helpful. Definitely will be making this a must have every time I'm out here in San Fran! I 110% recommend this place! I had the plow with sausage, extra bacon, egg whites and a French toast and I loved every bit of is! Their toast is a must have as well! This place made my last day here one to remember!

excerpts: I got the Plow, which includes 2 eggs, your choice of meat (I got bacon, obviously), crispy potatoes, and 2 small lemon-ricotta pancakes.
It was the perfect amount of food for someone who has been waiting for a table for 1 hour!
It was also delicious.
The crispy potatoes were mixed with onions and both were extra crispy.
These are probably the best breakfast potatoes I've ever had!
the plow.author: Sungeeta A.
the plow.review:
Wow is this place popular!  I came here around 8:50 on a Sunday morning, thinking there was no way there would be a huge wait. Was I wrong! I guess San Franciscans really like their brunch!

I have to say brunch was worth the wait. I got the Plow, which includes 2 eggs, your choice of meat (I got bacon, obviously), crispy potatoes, and 2 small lemon-ricotta pancakes. It was the perfect amount of food for someone who has been waiting for a table for 1 hour! It was also delicious. The crispy potatoes were mixed with onions and both were extra crispy. These are probably the best breakfast potatoes I've ever had! The lemon ricotta pancakes were of course delicious as well. The only negative was they were a little on the luke warm side. 

Next time I come here (and there will be a next time) I'm going to get here right when they open at 8, or come on a weekday.

excerpts: We ordered the plow, a delicious biscuit and soft scrambled eggs.
Highly recommend all three.
Everything around us looked so delicious
but we were so full off the two plates we ordered that we didn't get to try more.
the plow.author: Sandra S.
the plow.review: Loved the brunch. We ordered the plow, a delicious biscuit and soft scrambled eggs. Highly recommend all three. Everything around us looked so delicious but we were so full off the two plates we ordered that we didn't get to try more.

excerpts: I got the plow and I loved the potatoes!
the plow.author: Erika-Kelly C.
the plow.review: Long over due for this review.. Plow on the weekends is a 1-2 hour wait. Surprisingly, the parking is not bad. The interior of this place is " cozy ". And for the food, it's just a little different but not bad. I got the plow and I loved the potatoes! The lemon ricotta pancakes were good as well, but I got easily tired of it. I will probably try to come back again on a weekday.

excerpts: I got the plow with house-made sausage.
The potatoes were amazingly crispy but not in the oily tasting way.
House-made sausage blows the chicken apple sausage out of the park!
the plow.author: Jennifer W.
the plow.review:
Came on a Saturday morning at 11:15am and was told it'd be a hour wait. So took a walk to nearby neighborhood for maybe 25 mins or so .. Come back to check in, it'll be another hour. Umm say what?!?! I know it's crazy here but .. That's a crazy long wait! Luckily, we decide to stick it out and wait. By 11:50, they were starting to call out parties of 2! Turns out that everyone either left or went for a walk and we got so lucky to be seated before 12! 

It was my second time here but the first wasn't memorable. This time .. It kind of really blew my mind! I got the plow with house-made sausage. The potatoes were amazingly crispy but not in the oily tasting way. House-made sausage blows the chicken apple sausage out of the park! And lemon ricotta pancakes actually had more of a lemony taste to it vs the first time I had it. 

Overall, it was a pretty awesome brunch. But if I had a choice, I'd avoid this place during the weekend! I think we just got lucky with the seating. It's probably easier during the weekdays!

excerpts:
I ordered:

+ The Plow (of course):
the plow.author: Ashley N.
the plow.review:
After having Plow on my list of brunch places to try in SF, I was luckily able to convince my boyfriend to get up at an ungodly hour on a Saturday to venture over here with me. Why ungodly? Coming from Berkeley, we knew we had to get up, at the latest, by 06AM in order to make the commute via BART to Plow. You bet I would have been disappointed if this brunch wasn't any good. 

Sadly .. we still didn't make it by 08, hahaha (although to be fair, I was taking a little longer than I needed to get ready). We arrived around 8:45AM probably, and were told it would be a 45-60 min wait for two. There's not much to do around this neighborhood while you wait, sadly. You could walk a few blocks more to meet a freeway overpass (a little scary). There were a few shops around the area, but they were closed since it it was pretty early still. I think you get free coffee inside as you wait (I didn't get it myself .. because I didn't see it until we were already seated..).

We got our seats after about an hour, right at the counter. Pretty cool to watch the chefs pump out Plows like clockwork. It made waiting for our food not as bad! 

BF and I ordered:

+ The Plow (of course): the bacon was good, the potatoes were good, and the eggs (we got them poached) were also good, but the real winner (to me) was the lemon ricotta pancakes!!! 
+ Dungeness Crab Scramble: so happy this was on the menu on this visit :) I never imagined mixing crab with eggs, but it worked so well! I loved it. Also came with the potatoes, which I was really happy about because they were well-seasoned, and muy yummy :) 


Service was fast and efficient as it could be. 
Parking on the street, didn't look like it would be too hard to find, at least on a Sat morning. 
Restaurant is tiny, so yes, if you don't want to wait.. getting here early is important.

excerpts: I've had the plow (drooooolll) and the fried egg sandwich (also drool).
I don't know which one I like better
the plow.author: Emily D.
the plow.review:
I discovered this through my friend a week before I moved away. 

Sad, because this is probably one of my favorite breakfast places on the planet. 

I've had the plow (drooooolll) and the fried egg sandwich (also drool). I don't know which one I like better and I don't know if I'll ever be able to figure it out, and I am perfectly OK with that. 

Come early, or wait a long time.

excerpts: The Plow: two eggs, choice of house made pork sausage, Nueske bacon, or chicken apple sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes with pure maple syrup, and some crispy potatoes.
The boy got his with the sugar pie pumpkin pancakes (instead of the lemon ricotta) and they were just as heavenly--if not better.
the plow.author: Adena B.
the plow.review:
"Hour and a half wait," says Randall.

"No worries, we'll wait it out," I told him. He smiled and handed me some coffee to pass the time. He also pointed down the street and shared a tip: "Rico makes some killer Bloody Marys. In case you're interested."

Of COURSE I'm interested, Randall. We wasted a good 45 minutes at Blooms Saloon, (http://www.yelp.com/biz/blooms-saloon-san-francisco#hrid:g60JAte3LvIB4-uJ8CCUXw) then headed back to wait out the remainder of the time. 

EATS
+The Plow: two eggs, choice of house made pork sausage, Nueske bacon, or chicken apple sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes with pure maple syrup, and some crispy potatoes. The boy got his with the sugar pie pumpkin pancakes (instead of the lemon ricotta) and they were just as heavenly--if not better. We both opted for the bacon--and it was just OK; kinda smokey.

DRANKS
+Mimosas: watered down and not that great; especially not after that spicy Bloody Mary.
+Coffee: San Raf's finest, Equator coffee. Excellent.

Service was good, Randall made it great. Will I be back? Probably not, but happy to have tested it out to see what the hype was all about.

excerpts: ordered the plow: 2 lemon ricotta pancakes, 2 eggs any style, crispy potatoes, and choice of home made pork sausage patties, bacon, or chicken sausage.
I got sunny side up and bacon.
the plate was a lot of for me
and I couldn't finish.
LB got the fried egg sandwich with added avocado, side order of pancakes and the pork sausage.
the plow.author: Jules L.
the plow.review:
came on a Tuesday around 11am, there were about 5 parties ahead of us. ask them to put your name on the list. some people tried to just sit themselves onto open tables. it is not open seatings. they have little benches for you to sit on as you wait. they will ask if you prefer outdoor or inside seatings or whichever is first available. around after 12, the crowd dies down and not much of a wait. they are open till 2pm though and closed on Mondays. took around 20 mins to be seated. 

ordered the plow: 2 lemon ricotta pancakes, 2 eggs any style, crispy potatoes, and choice of home made pork sausage patties, bacon, or chicken sausage. I got sunny side up and bacon. the plate was a lot of for me and I couldn't finish. LB got the fried egg sandwich with added avocado, side order of pancakes and the pork sausage. he can eat and was not able to finish too. 

food was pretty good. not mind blowing. some of the potatoes are extra crispy like potato chips, egg yolks was small, bacon had a smokey taste, pancakes was alright. I made the mistake of eating that last and it has gotten cold. I do taste the hint of lemon. 

service was good. LB's coffee got refilled 3 times. they asked if you want water also, but we declined. When food arrives, waiter will ask if you need anything else like ketchup or hot sauce. they did not check up on us afterward. the food took a bit to come out, around 25 mins. so don't go hungry. 

a little pricey breakfast, but you're paying for the quality of the ingredients. their juices are not freshly squeezed though, came from bottled jugs. I got the grapefruit juice. Comes in small or large. 

plenty of parking around the neighbor. not metered. nice view as you wait. right off the 280 freeway.

excerpts: We ordered the Fried Egg Sandwiches with avocado and The Plow.
the plow.author: Stacy L.
the plow.review:
I finally got to try Plow last weekend with my bf. We got there around 10:30am and the wait lists were quite long already. We waited for an hour before we got seated. I'm an inpatient person, since I was willing to waited for an hour for my brunch. IT GOT TO BE GOOD FOOD. Also,It was cold in the morning, so it was very nice of Plow offered complimentary coffee   for people who were waiting to be seated.  

We ordered the Fried Egg Sandwiches with avocado and The Plow. We really enjoyed our food, specially, the crispy potatoes They were the best crispy potatoes that I had tried so far. The egg sandwiches was good but it can get  really messy as well. Tip: cut the sandwiches in half before chowing it down. 

It's delicious. Definitely, will go back and try the other dishes on the menu. Maybe try to go there earlier too just to avoid the long wait.

excerpts: You really can't go wrong with the Plow breakfast: the potatoes are insane - cooked to perfection and delicious, the chicken sausage is flavorful and the ricotta pancakes are a little eggy, but fluffy and light nonetheless.
The lemon zest flavor really sets them apart.
the plow.author: Lauren C.
the plow.review:
WOW. If you're up for a 1.5-2 hour wait for breakfast on the weekend, by all means - come to Plow. You really can't go wrong with the Plow breakfast: the potatoes are insane - cooked to perfection and delicious, the chicken sausage is flavorful and the ricotta pancakes are a little eggy, but fluffy and light nonetheless. The lemon zest flavor really sets them apart. The size of the meal was unexpectedly large - not one of us cleared our plates.

The only thing they're missing to make this breakfast perfection is a bloody mary!

excerpts: I have had most things on the menu and you really can't go wrong, but I think the best thing to get is "the plow" because it comes with a little bit of their best foods!
I also always get a biscuit on the side because they are to die for!
The service is great and the staff is friendly.
Overall, great spot!
the plow.author: Lauren P.
the plow.review: This is THE BEST brunch spot in town! The only downside is you are going to have to wait between 30 min to two hours for a table and they don't take reservations. I have had most things on the menu and you really can't go wrong, but I think the best thing to get is "the plow" because it comes with a little bit of their best foods! I also always get a biscuit on the side because they are to die for! The service is great and the staff is friendly. Overall, great spot!

excerpts: I had The Plow.
the plow.author: Leanne S.
the plow.review:
This is one place that seriously lives up to all the hype. Hello...Lemon Ricotta Pancakes! I not even a huge pancake fan but these things killed Mama's and Dotties pancakes. Yes, that's right...they're better than both Mama's and Dotties. (Dear Dottie, I love you too, so don't worry I'll be back)

The eats - I had The Plow. It's a great plate that gives you two silver dollar sized lemon ricotta pancakes, eggs, crispy potatos (wow) and your choice of meat. 

Service - Great, everyone is really friendly and seemed to be happy. The wait wasn't even too bad for a Saturday morning. I think we only had to wait 30 minutes which is pretty fast considering how busy this place gets.

Atmosphere - I love the open kitchen concept and enjoy watching the chefs prepare food. The decor itself is warm, modern and bright.

excerpts:
As for the food, we both ordered "The Plow" which consists of their:

-silver dollar lemon ricotta pancakes -
the plow.author: Shannon L.
the plow.review:
SO SO SOO AMAZING! This is my new favorite brunch place. My friend and I came on a Thursday around 12 noon so there was only a five minute wait, but that's probably nothing compared to how long it is on the weekends. I can't even imagine how crazy it is then. As for the food, we both ordered "The Plow" which consists of their:

-silver dollar lemon ricotta pancakes - I'm not normally a fan of pancakes, but these blew my mind! Probably my favorite out of everything on my plate. Eat them slowly and just taste all the flavors in these light and fluffy pancakes! Still thinking about them...so good!
-crispy potatoes - all I can say is crispy and oh-so-delicious, just the way I like it. 
-nueske bacon - can't go wrong with bacon. 
 
I'll definitely be coming back to try the almond flour pancakes and french toast!

excerpts: When I come here I ALWAYS get the Plow and the lemon ricotta pancakes are such a treat.
A great place to bring out of town guests.
I would give it 5  stars if the wait wasn't that LONG.
It can be frustrating
but once you are seated and you get your delish food all is forgotten.
the plow.author: Schisandra S.
the plow.review:
I love this place!
The food is great and the space is awesome! 
When I come here I ALWAYS get the Plow and the lemon ricotta pancakes are such a treat. 
A great place to bring out of town guests.
I would give it 5  stars if the wait wasn't that LONG. It can be frustrating but once you are seated and you get your delish food all is forgotten.

excerpts:
Waited 45 minutes and ordered "The Plow." 

The Plow ($16) : 2 eggs, choice of pork sausage, bacon, OR chicken apple sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes, and crispy potatoes.
the plow.author: B. R.
the plow.review:
Waited 45 minutes and ordered "The Plow." 

The Plow ($16) : 2 eggs, choice of pork sausage, bacon, OR chicken apple sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes, and crispy potatoes.

Got seated outside on a cold morning. You can ask them for blankets since there's no patio heaters outside.

No tobasco sauce here. Only serve Youk's hot sauce -- wasn't that spicy for me.

Everything was good, but wasn't a big fan of the lemon ricotta pancakes as I thought I would've been. Customer service was attentive and friendly.

excerpts: Of course I had to get the Plow breakfast and boyfriend got the breakfast sandwich.
DELICIOUS ugh
I'm craving it just remembering.
Although all the food was outstanding
I think we both were surprised by the potatoes.
How do they do that?
They were like baked and fried at the same time - very good!
The pancakes of course stood out too
they were very tasty.
Just try it!
the plow.author: Bianca A.
the plow.review: We are VERY lucky at finding some of the best breakfast places everywhere we go and Plow is definitely on that list.  After reading all (ok some of) the reviews we went prepared for the big wait.  Luckily for us we got in at just the right time with only a 10 minute wait before being seated and beginning our tantalizing breakfast journey.  Of course I had to get the Plow breakfast and boyfriend got the breakfast sandwich.  DELICIOUS ugh I'm craving it just remembering.  Although all the food was outstanding I think we both were surprised by the potatoes.  How do they do that?  They were like baked and fried at the same time - very good!  The pancakes of course stood out too they were very tasty.  Just try it!

excerpts: Fortunately, being the awesome servers they are, the Plow peeps sat us right away at an awesome table outside!
We both ordered "The Plow," based on excited reviewers who claimed this was the first-timer's MUST ORDER.
/NEED TO) try the potatoes, the Plow was definitely a good way of getting the best of both worlds.
the plow.author: Rachel L.
the plow.review:
Based on their infamous long wait-times, I was really hoping Plow would suck and I wouldn't have to continue to plot ways to survive the line. Unfortunately, Plow fully and completely won me over. Two hour wait for some of their crispy breakfast potatoes? Sign me up.

After rushing over and putting my name in at 9am on a Saturday morning, I proceeded to pick a friend up at the airport and by the time we made it back, our name had already been called. First thought was: NOOOOOOOOO. Fortunately, being the awesome servers they are, the Plow peeps sat us right away at an awesome table outside! At this point, I was already sold.

We both ordered "The Plow," based on excited reviewers who claimed this was the first-timer's MUST ORDER. The eggs were definitely just your average eggs, but boy the lemon ricotta pancakes and crispy breakfast potatoes were something SPECIAL. If you're dying to try the pancakes, but also want to (/NEED TO) try the potatoes, the Plow was definitely a good way of getting the best of both worlds.

Definitely go early and put your name in with an hour - two hour interim plan and definitely try the potatoes.

excerpts: We got the plow and the tuscan kale salad.
Both were delicious.
the plow.author: Margaret L.
the plow.review:
Do I need to say more?

If you come here, just get the lemon ricotta pancakes!

We got the plow and the tuscan kale salad. Both were delicious. The lemon ricotta pancakes have a strong lemon flavor, which I like. It very distinct and the pancakes are fluffy and soft.

I came here on a weekday and the wait was not long. 

So it looks like a lot of food but I actually feel like it's not a lot of food compared to other brunch places (ie Zazies). The food is good though! This places reminds me of restaurants/chefs who perfect their dishes and only give you a little of it to try to satisfy your palette (like what you see on iron chef)! The portions are decent though, but you won't leave here super stuffed and full, just satisfied!!

excerpts: THE PLOW: 4 stars: Lemon Ricotta pancakes were sweet, full of lemony flavor & fluffy.
the plow.author: Emily C.
the plow.review:
3.5 stars.

THE WAIT: About 40 minutes around 12:30p on a Saturday. 

THE FOOD: 
|| THE PLOW: 4 stars: Lemon Ricotta pancakes were sweet, full of lemony flavor & fluffy. The crispy potatoes were PERFECT, as they were crispy on the outside, yet retained the potato texture and flavor on the inside (I hate when a crispy potato becomes unrecognizable in flavor other than a fried mess)! The pork sausage was good. The scrambled eggs was unfortunately disappointing because it was soggy. 

|| DUNGENESS CRAB SCRAMBLE: 3 stars: The eggs were again soggy, but the scramble preserved the crab flavor. Good dish if you really like crab without much flavoring added to it. 

PARKING: Lots of parking, since it is Potrero Hill, your car will likely be parked at a 45 degree angle. 

ATMOSPHERE: Small restaurant with cute, clean decor (pottery barn-esque). Seating is limited inside and our table of 2 was awkwardly super close to the table next to us (so censor your conversations :P). 

SERVICE: Friendly and with a smile.

excerpts: Get the Plow
so you get a full hearty eggs, sausage and potatoes to go with it.
Favorite part: the potatoes included the crispy bits at the bottom of the pan that I love to scrape off and eat myself, but much better done here.
Wish coffee selection was a bit better.
A cappuccino would've been a nice compliment but a-ok drip coffee suits, too.
Long lines...good spot, but
I probably wouldn't wait longer than 30-40 min for it.
the plow.author: Viv T.
the plow.review: 3.8/5 stars. Solid breakfast/brunch spot. The prosciutto and Gruyere toast is divine. The lemon ricotta pancakes are melt in your mouth good as everyone recommends. Get the Plow so you get a full hearty eggs, sausage and potatoes to go with it. Favorite part: the potatoes included the crispy bits at the bottom of the pan that I love to scrape off and eat myself, but much better done here. Wish coffee selection was a bit better. A cappuccino would've been a nice compliment but a-ok drip coffee suits, too. Long lines...good spot, but I probably wouldn't wait longer than 30-40 min for it.

excerpts: I had The Plow, and while I was not especially impressed by the pork sausage patties or eggs, I was absolutely blown away by the rest of the plate.
We waited for quite awhile on a cold Saturday morning (seriously, that wait!), but once we got inside, the restaurant was beautifully bright and adorable.
Perfect place for brunch if you're willing to wait!
the plow.author: Kelly R.
the plow.review: The lemon ricotta pancakes and potatoes are just incredible. I had The Plow, and while I was not especially impressed by the pork sausage patties or eggs, I was absolutely blown away by the rest of the plate. We waited for quite awhile on a cold Saturday morning (seriously, that wait!), but once we got inside, the restaurant was beautifully bright and adorable. Perfect place for brunch if you're willing to wait!

excerpts: My cousin and I came to the Plow a few months ago, and I believe it was  Friday morning.
I ordered the lemon ricotta pancakes and she order the plow which comes with two eggs, chicken apple sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes, and crispy potatoes.
We basically split everything, and I finished my own set of pancakes.
The pancakes were so light and fluffy, but you could taste the lemon and ricotta in every bite - exactly how it should be, right?
the plow.author: Kathleene E.
the plow.review:
My cousin and I came to the Plow a few months ago, and I believe it was  Friday morning. We had to wait about an hour, but it wasn't a big deal because we walked down the street to this super cute coffee spot and the wait went by super quick. 

The restaurant is small and quaint, one of those small, cozy (as another yelper said) restaurant. It has a lot of bright open space, so if you're feeling a little vampirey and antisocial not wanting to share your space, I suggest you do not go here! Lol, onto the food.

I ordered the lemon ricotta pancakes and she order the plow which comes with two eggs, chicken apple sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes, and crispy potatoes. We basically split everything, and I finished my own set of pancakes. The pancakes were so light and fluffy, but you could taste the lemon and ricotta in every bite - exactly how it should be, right? Everything in my cousin's dish was delicious - the crispy potatoes .... to die for. The chicken apple sausage was yummy as well. 

Bottom line - it was a fun experience. Good food, good service topped with a beautiful sunny day in SF. But since I was having a leisurely day and not pressed on time, I was okay with waiting the hour to be seated. I wouldn't wait an hour if I had other things to do - i thought this was important to add :)

excerpts: Do yourself a favor and get the plow.
I was skeptical about the chicken sausage but it was perfect.
I would eat here daily if I lived anywhere remotely close.
Just go.
the plow.author: Tim L.
the plow.review: I don't know what else to say other than incredible. Everything was absolutely delicious. Do yourself a favor and get the plow. I was skeptical about the chicken sausage but it was perfect. I would eat here daily if I lived anywhere remotely close. Just go.

excerpts: I highly recommend getting "the plow" your first time there.
You get a good assortment of different items on the menu (sausage, pancakes, exquisite potatoes, eggs).
the plow.author: Gina G.
the plow.review:
I absolutely LOVED this place. I highly recommend getting "the plow" your first time there. You get a good assortment of different items on the menu (sausage, pancakes, exquisite potatoes, eggs).  The LEMON RICOTTA pancakes were just divine. I'm still dreaming about them...

My bf had the egg sandwich with bacon added. He claims it was the best egg sandwich he's ever had. 

The wait was a bit long (about 45 min at around 9am on a sunday) however, you can get a cup of coffee to sip on while you wait. I liked that, especially since it was a bit chilly when i went. And the host was just a doll, very nice lady :)

Also extra stars for the awesome busboy that brought my pup a bowl of water! 

I can't wait to go back!!!

excerpts: I opted for The Plow ($16) which came with 2 lemon ricotta pancakes, 4 modest sized chicken/apple sausages, 2 eggs done your preference, and breakfast potatoes.
The pancakes were so heavenly...like biting into a meyer lemon cupcakes.
It was more dense than I imagined, but still very delicious.
The potatoes are done to a crisp and has some sauteed onions mixed into it.
the plow.author: Elaine Y.
the plow.review:
Came here at 9am and was still hit with a 45min wait. Pretty modest at Plow. But once inside, the atmosphere was modern, yet cozy. We were seated at a table meant for two, so it was a little cramped, but we made it work. FYI though, Plow does not seat for parties more than 6 people.

I opted for The Plow ($16) which came with 2 lemon ricotta pancakes, 4 modest sized chicken/apple sausages, 2 eggs done your preference, and breakfast potatoes. The pancakes were so heavenly...like biting into a meyer lemon cupcakes. It was more dense than I imagined, but still very delicious. The potatoes are done to a crisp and has some sauteed onions mixed into it. It was really good, but some of the pieces were very large and too potato-y for my liking.

All in all, the meal was very delicious and filling. Seriously, it's been over 4 hours and I still feel stuffed...

excerpts: My cousin and her husband had 'the Plow' which consists of two eggs, two pancakes, and they decided on the Nueske bacon.
My partner ordered the lemon ricotta pancakes and I decided on the corned beef hash with yukon gold potatoes, chillies, and two eggs.
the plow.author: Simon K.
the plow.review:
I was craving a very good breakfast, flying in the night before and dodging all the Black Friday madness of everyone shopping my cousin and her husband brought us here for a good start to our day. Lacking sleep already and a night of turkey I needed something to bring a good morning 'ring' to my day as I was tired, and mediocre was not going to do, thankfully I have a cousin who knows about food, and still remembering from years before on how she took me to places, I could put my faith in her to deliver.

She said that this place usually has line-ups going up the block (as this place is located on a hill), so to get here early, we arrived at 8 AM, the place was not empty, but it wasn't packed, probably being a holiday. It was a charming little place with real high ceilings, very bright white walls, defined by natural wood tables. It's a very happy, bright look, with the open kitchen concept that seems standard nowadays with new restaurants.

Once we sat down, we were presented the menu, and looking at that pageful of items to order, the problem was to decide on what to order. From pancakes, eggs, bacon, granola, sandwiches and salads, everything looked so good. My cousin and her husband had 'the Plow' which consists of two eggs, two pancakes, and they decided on the Nueske bacon. My partner ordered the lemon ricotta pancakes and I decided on the corned beef hash with yukon gold potatoes, chillies, and two eggs. As it wasn't that busy when we were here, the orders came quite quickly.

Speaking on my dish of hash browns, this was pefectly done, little bits of pefectly cooked potatoes mixed with strands of corned beef, and this was the stuff on the bottom of the plate. You could taste the freshness of the ingredients mixed with some chili to provide a kick, this was under the two sunny side eggs that were laid on top of the hash, welcoming me to breakfast like a set of eyes. Two small pieces of bread were laid on the top side of the eggs and I was ready to devour like a monster looking at this thing. My partner's pancakes were fluffy and had a good dense chew. I remember a smile everytime I took a bite, and I also remember my partners fork constantly coming over to my plate picking at little pieces of potato and meat.

Another thing that was damn good was the bacon here, whatever farmer they are getting this stuff from, it's like crack. I love the look that my partner had when she took a bite. One of those breakfast joints that if I was to be back in San Francisco I would check it out. From what I heard from my cousin, come early, or wait, but when was waiting for good food wrong.

excerpts: On two occasions, I  have personally order The Plow.
We generally get there early- between 8am to 8:30am, so that we do not have to wait in line.
After 9am, you expect to wait in line about 10 mins to 30 mins depending on the size of your party.
What we've always enjoyed about Plow is its consistency with how simple and how good their food is.
The service is pretty good and fairly quick.
Surprisingly enough, we've never had any challenges with finding parking within 2 blocks.
the plow.author: Al G.
the plow.review: My wife have eaten at Plow 8 times in the last 3 years- all breakfasts/brunch on weekends. We are somewhat automatic in what order: lemon ricotta pancakes, almond flour pancakes, and several times the French toast. On two occasions, I  have personally order The Plow. We generally get there early- between 8am to 8:30am, so that we do not have to wait in line. After 9am, you expect to wait in line about 10 mins to 30 mins depending on the size of your party. What we've always enjoyed about Plow is its consistency with how simple and how good their food is. The service is pretty good and fairly quick. Surprisingly enough, we've never had any challenges with finding parking within 2 blocks.

excerpts: We got the Plow, which is their breakfast plate.
the plow.author: Roxanne S.
the plow.review:
My husband and I waited quite some time to eat breakfast here on a Saturday morning. We arrived at 9 AM and were met with a one-hour wait, which we never tend to mind. We sat at the bar and it was fun to watch the cooks prepare the orders (also a good way to decide on different menu items because you can see them being prepared).

We got the Plow, which is their breakfast plate. It includes two eggs, two lemon ricotta pancakes, potatoes, and choice of meat. The pancakes were an absolute standout. My husband is the meat eater between the two of us and said the house-made pork sausage patty was delightful. We also shared a biscuit with honey butter and enjoyed it immensely!

Be aware that the menu items were pricey. We paid $4.50 for the biscuit, which felt high (especially compared to other restaurants where we typically get a biscuit on the side). Would highly recommend and would go back!

excerpts:
The plow - great value, my fav was their sausage patties and the lemon ricotta pancake ( too big for one person, share it)
5.
Their pacific pepeminit tea goes great with the frech toast!
the plow.author: Wasabi L.
the plow.review:
I came here on a Saturday morning before the giants game.  Arrived around 9 and the wait was less than 20 minutes for two.   

Service was friendly and attentive. 
Restaurant itself was clean and cozy. 
Food:

1. pastries - good
2. French Toast - good 
3. Bacons - good
4. The plow - great value, my fav was their sausage patties and the lemon ricotta pancake ( too big for one person, share it)
5. Their pacific pepeminit tea goes great with the frech toast!

excerpts: Plow achieves equal prowess with the sugary and the salty: they offer both the best French toast in town and the best standard breakfast in "the plow.
the plow.author: Lou S.
the plow.review:
On a warm weekend morning when you have at least 5 hours to spare, there's nothing like driving to Potrero Hill to get plowed.

Plow prepares the best breakfast in San Francisco, and absolutely everyone knows it. We began waiting in line for breakfast around 11 AM...and by the time we got a seat, it was almost time for dinner. Ways to make yourself feel better about the delay: they provide free coffee and the classic SF 90 degree hill above the restaurant has parking vacancies. Bring your mountain climbing gear to reascend to your vehicle.

Plow achieves equal prowess with the sugary and the salty: they offer both the best French toast in town and the best standard breakfast in "the plow." The soft scrambled eggs with goat cheese and oyster mushrooms, while boldly priced at $15, is the bronze medal dish. Don't be ashamed to order yourself two dishes. You earned it by walking up and down the hill 20 times before being seated.

Last time I went here, the next door building caught on fire--presumably an act of arson by a starving patron trying to cook their own sausages in the street. The fire truck roared onto the scene and parked parallel to the outside tables. The firefighters jumped out in formation, posing for a moment like TV show firefighters awaiting exaltation, then sadly grabbed their hoses and walked away when they realized nobody had stopped eating. That's the kind of food you're signing up to enjoy.

excerpts: Ordered the plow * came with mini pancakes and they were so yummy!
This place is also insta worthy for those people looking for a cute Instagram restaurant!
the plow.author: Julie T.
the plow.review: First time coming here and I will for sure be back. I'm always a sucker for potatoes/hash browns and they honestly have the best potatoes by far! Went on a Tuesday at 12pm and there was no wait which was nice. Ordered the plow * came with mini pancakes and they were so yummy! This place is also insta worthy for those people looking for a cute Instagram restaurant!

excerpts: I had "the plow".
the plow.author: Cyn L.
the plow.review: Our service was great, and the food was good. I had "the plow". The lemon ricotta pancakes were amazing! I've never had anything like them. They barely need any maple syrup. The bacon was nice and crispy. The potatoes were well seasoned with rosemary and had a nice crispy texture as well. The wait can be long but it's worth it.

excerpts: Simple order recommendations: the plow and the lemon ricotta pancakes.
the plow.author: Meghana D.
the plow.review:
A recent visit has me downgrading this storied brunch spot from a 5 to a 2. 

Why? Service, service, service.  Yes it was Sunday, and yes it was brunch. I'm well aware of the standard busy-ness and crowds. I know how it works .

It's never an excuse to be abjectly rude to your customers or actively dissuade them from enjoying yoru cuisine. Many many instances occured during our wait and meal that shocked me vs. my last experience (the differential perhaps being the increase in popularity recently).

Now, all of this is sometimes still worth it if the food is epic (a la soup nazi). Unfortunately, it's no longer the case. Upon our seating, we waited 40 minutes for our [very simple] orders. not only that, the food arrived very cold. 

At one point in time, Plow was worth every second of the wait and / or mild disrespect. I'm sorry to say that's no longer the case. Hop on over to Radish, Foreign Cinema, or really, anywhere else instead. 

--
No questions on this rating. Absolutely one of the best brunch places I have ever been to and a must-visit for aspiring foodies 

Get ready to wait-- 1.5 hours @ peak time. The hipster coffee shop around the corner provides ample opportunity for people watching and general credibility-building in the area ;) (let's just say our designer handbags and celebrity-gossip infused conversations got us some looks at first, but my friends and I are quick learners and briskly changed the subject matter) 

I digress. 

Simple order recommendations: the plow and the lemon ricotta pancakes. Divine. 

Happy eating. I'm jealous from afar.

excerpts: I got "the plow" dish, which comes with eggs, chicken apple sausage (there are other meat options), PERFECT POTATOES, and lemon ricotta pancakes.
My friends got the breakfast sandwich and also raved about it.
The place is very cute.
Even though the prices are kind of steep, the food is so tasty!!
the plow.author: Michelle K.
the plow.review: Absolutely delicious and well worth the 2 hour wait, despite it being a weekday morning. I got "the plow" dish, which comes with eggs, chicken apple sausage (there are other meat options), PERFECT POTATOES, and lemon ricotta pancakes. My friends got the breakfast sandwich and also raved about it. The place is very cute. Even though the prices are kind of steep, the food is so tasty!!

excerpts: I ordered the Plow, which came with 2 eggs, choice of Nueske bacon, house made pork sausage, or chicken apple sausage, 2 of their famous lemon ricotta pancakes, and crispy potatoes.
I chose the pork sausage.
The portions were just right.
My 2 eggs were nicely formed in a circle that they must have used a circle mold.
The pork sausage were basically patties, but they were really tasty.
You can taste the fennel with a little spice.
The best part was the lemon ricotta pancakes.
They were EXCELLENT!!
It just melted in my mouth; very moist.
With just a little bit of syrup, it's like dessert.
I had seen Yelp reviews about them and they were right!
You HAVE to try these!
Potatoes were nice and crispy.
the plow.author: Erica S.
the plow.review:
My friend picked this place for a recent brunch.  It was a 45 minute wait, but it was DEFINITELY worth it!  They don't accept reservations so you either have to wait or eat elsewhere.  Seems they're only open for brunch/lunch, no dinner.  

The interior is nice and clean.  Service is pretty friendly although I was slightly bothered when our female server decided to take my guy friend and my husband's order before mine.  What happened to ladies first?!

Started off with coffee and their fried doughnut holes.  One order came with 3.  They were good, but nothing too special.  Let them cool before you munch on them.  

I ordered the Plow, which came with 2 eggs, choice of Nueske bacon, house made pork sausage, or chicken apple sausage, 2 of their famous lemon ricotta pancakes, and crispy potatoes.  I chose the pork sausage.  The portions were just right.  My 2 eggs were nicely formed in a circle that they must have used a circle mold.  The pork sausage were basically patties, but they were really tasty.  You can taste the fennel with a little spice.  The best part was the lemon ricotta pancakes.  They were EXCELLENT!!  It just melted in my mouth; very moist.  With just a little bit of syrup, it's like dessert.  I had seen Yelp reviews about them and they were right!  You HAVE to try these!  Potatoes were nice and crispy.  Everything was so good, I finished my whole plate!

My husband had the Short Rib Hash and that was tasty as well.  Have to come back again!!!  Thanks, Richard for taking us here!

excerpts: If it's your first time here, definitely get "The Plow".
You can't go wrong with this.
the plow.author: Annie L.
the plow.review:
Plow is simply amazing. I'm never one to wait any amount of time for a restaurant, but I will wait for Plow...even if it was an hour + wait. -_- It's worth it. If it's your first time here, definitely get "The Plow". You can't go wrong with this. The lemon ricotta pancakes are to die for!  I've also had their dungeness crab scramble, which was also amazing.

Service is great. Even though this place is always packed, the employees here are super efficient. While you wait outside, you can always order your drinks/coffees first. Also, sit at the bar area so you can watch all the action.

excerpts: The Plow is to die for.
the plow.author: Em F.
the plow.review:
The key is to either come 2 hours before you're hungry or between 8am-9am. Anytime after that and be prepared to make long conversation with your friend/voices in your head. 

I've somehow had brunch here 5 times even though I make it a point to try new places in the city and lines make me crotchety because it. is. just. that. good. That's about 10 hours of my life spent waiting in lines, and yet I have no regrets. The Plow is to die for. Every element comprising it from the lemon ricotta pancakes to the crispy potatoes to the bacon to the eggs are made to perfection. It's like sushi in a way - simple-looking but each component has been carefully prepared and a lot of care has been placed into each element, creating one amazing meal. 

Ditch your acquaintances because this place is rather small, and it will elongate your wait time.

excerpts: I had the fried egg sandwich and opted to add sausage instead of bacon (even though they only list that you can add on bacon) and my friend got The Plow (which is pretty much your basic breakfast combo plate).
We were both very, VERY happy with our choices.
I tried some of the lemon ricotta pancakes that came on The Plow, and they were deeelish.
the plow.author: Miss H.
the plow.review:
I haven't been to a good brunch place in a while AND I haven't written a Yelp review in a while... but Plow was so good that they broke both streaks!

They close at 2, and we got there at 2:05... and there was still a line... luckily, the host & hostess felt bad that we had trekked so far to go there and there were "only" 4 tables ahead of us, so they put us down anyway. We ate "brunch" at 2:30 - better late than never :)

I had the fried egg sandwich and opted to add sausage instead of bacon (even though they only list that you can add on bacon) and my friend got The Plow (which is pretty much your basic breakfast combo plate). We were both very, VERY happy with our choices. The fried egg was perfectly cooked with a still runny yolk and the crispy potatoes were SO GOOD. Usually, I think of potatoes as an extra filler and try to not get too full off of them so I can finish the main part of my dish, but they were super crispy and tasty so I couldn't help myself! I tried some of the lemon ricotta pancakes that came on The Plow, and they were deeelish. I normally don't like ricotta, but it added a nice texture to the pancakes and the lemon flavor was just right.

Next time I'm in the city for brunch, this is where you'll find me!

excerpts: We ordered the breakfast sandwich and the plow.
My god, amazing doesn't even describe it.
The fresh squeezed orange juice was superb and the lemon ricotta Pandora are to die for.
Definitely would go back.
the plow.author: JonMichael E.
the plow.review: We waited only 30 minutes but we're quoted 45 at 11:30am.  We ordered the breakfast sandwich and the plow.  My god, amazing doesn't even describe it.  The fresh squeezed orange juice was superb and the lemon ricotta Pandora are to die for.  Definitely would go back.

excerpts: I had the plow, which included lemon ricotta pancakes, eggs, potatoes, and bacon.
the plow.author: Katherine C.
the plow.review:
The rating isn't for the food. The food was great. I had the plow, which included lemon ricotta pancakes, eggs, potatoes, and bacon. My boyfriend had the eggs benedict, which he also enjoyed. 

When we first showed we were expecting to wait awhile. We arrived about 11am on a Saturday, and of course, there was a mob outside the restaurant. When we asked how the long the wait was, the girl said an hour and a half. We were about to leave when someone else came up to her and said it was more like 45 minutes. Well, we believed him, and we should have left because an hour and a half later they called our names. We got a table outside in the shade which was at an angle because of the hill. This made it very awkward for me to set down my mimosa glass. 

Food was yummy, but I won't be waiting an hour + again. I will always remember being hangry. Maybe if I'm ever free on a weekday?

excerpts: Had the plow.
the plow.author: Amy O.
the plow.review:
Had the plow. Pretty dang good.

Chinese breakfast was out when we wetter seated at 11:30. Midweek...Waited about 15-20 min at 11:10 check in. 

Small. Great service. Excellent coffee.

excerpts: My favorites are the lemon ricotta pancakes and the crispy potatoes (included if you order "The Plow" or you can just order the pancakes by themselves).
Seriously, they are incredible.
the plow.author: Ashley K.
the plow.review:
A must.

One of my go-to spots for breakfast in the city. There will be a wait (typically longer than an hour on weekends). The wait will be worth it. Casual ambiance perfect for brunch on weekends. My favorites are the lemon ricotta pancakes and the crispy potatoes (included if you order "The Plow" or you can just order the pancakes by themselves). Seriously, they are incredible. Service is always friendly and prompt.

I'll be back. Early!

excerpts: and I ordered the Plow.
the plow.author: Joann A.
the plow.review:
Husband and I hit up this place after reading the Conde Nast article on Plow, entitled "San Francisco's Best Brunch. It's Worth the Two Hour Wait." I think the title is a bit generous, I mean its a very good brunch and maybe worth a 15 to 30 minute wait, but 2 hours? Folks, this is not manna falling from the sky. 

We arrived exactly at 8:00 am on a Saturday, because any later you will be stuck in a line for at least 45 minutes. Service was great, providing fresh coffee and water as soon as we sat down. My husband got the steak and eggs and I ordered the Plow. Both were equally delicious, with the crispy potatoes being a highlight of the meal. The lemon ricotta pancakes were fluffy and not too sweet and balanced well with my hickory smoked bacon and eggs. All in all, our meal here was good, not the BEST, but I would definitely come here again, at 8:00am. 

Plow is like the Ariana Grande of SF brunches. People says she sounds like Mariah Carey, but when you hear her, she's good, but she ain't no Mariah Carey.

excerpts: The Plow (akin to a Denny's grand slam although perhaps a bit more refined).
its kind of messy
and I wish it was a little more refined for the price.
And the Plow version of bagel and lox (its toast with lox and pretty boring)..
the plow.author: Ritu K.
the plow.review:
Plow you have broken me down. I'll admit it- I'm a fan. Partly thanks to my laziness and partly in large part to my love of brunch I kept returning to Plow hoping to find that magical brunch item that would make me love this place. And yes I've found it in the most unsuspecting item- Muesli. Yep I said muesli. I know that sounds boring and not fun (i.e. not fattening at all), but I love muesli and I especially love Plow's version. I order a almond flour pancake (yum) on the side so that I can pretend I'm enjoying a gluttonous breakfast, but the main attraction is the muesli.

I've tried 
The Plow (akin to a Denny's grand slam although perhaps a bit more refined). its kind of messy and I wish it was a little more refined for the price.
The Lemon Ricotta pancakes (I'm wrong- these are actually pretty disappointing- too much ricotta)
Two eggs (good when dressed up with ketchup and hot sauce- they're soft scrambled btw)
And the Plow version of bagel and lox (its toast with lox and pretty boring)..

So there you have it- I'm a fan but still avoid this place like a plague on the weekends. Definitely not worth an hour plus wait....

excerpts: We each got the Plow breakfast and couldn't have been happier, or more full.
I'm not sure that any of us finished our plates.
the plow.author: Wendy K.
the plow.review:
Every single thing here was absolutely delicious.. down to the potatoes. We each got the Plow breakfast and couldn't have been happier, or more full. I'm not sure that any of us finished our plates. I had the house mimosa and was ecstatic with my choice!

The only reason I'm giving this 4/5 is because of the wait. Even on a Sunday during a holiday weekend (when the city is empty), there was a 1.5 hour wait. This is truly a neighborhood brunch spot, but in my opinion, those are all over the city. You just need to find one that hasn't been written about time and time again. 

There's a coffee shop right UP the street with Ritual coffee, a good place to hang out while you're waiting.

excerpts: I always get The Plow, which comes with eggs, your choice of meat, lemon ricotta pancakes, and crispy potatoes.
Though I'm not particularly a lemon or ricotta person, the lemon ricotta pancakes were SO GOOD!
I could eat them all day.
The pancakes are fluffy on the inside and delicately scented with lemon, mixed with the taste of ricotta.
I've also never had potatoes quite the same as I had at Plow, they were perfectly seasoned and just crispy enough.
I've tried the house sausage and the chicken-apple sausage here.
the plow.author: Joy C.
the plow.review:
This is my favorite brunch place in the city so far. The place is very cozy and small, resulting in a long wait, but it is worth it. The place has large windows and reminds me of a farmhouse, which definitely matches the food they serve there.

I always get The Plow, which comes with eggs, your choice of meat, lemon ricotta pancakes, and crispy potatoes. Though I'm not particularly a lemon or ricotta person, the lemon ricotta pancakes were SO GOOD! I could eat them all day. The pancakes are fluffy on the inside and delicately scented with lemon, mixed with the taste of ricotta. I've also never had potatoes quite the same as I had at Plow, they were perfectly seasoned and just crispy enough. I've tried the house sausage and the chicken-apple sausage here. Both were good, but definitely overshadowed by the pancakes and the potatoes.

Service here has always been friendly, but the staff are definitely busy. The food is simple yet heavenly. My only complaint is the wait, but it is definitely worth it.

excerpts: If it's your first time, try The Plow!
the plow.author: Jessica R.
the plow.review:
Love at first bite.

I love brunch and came here for my birthday brunch with the boyfriend.

If it's your first time, try The Plow! It comes with two eggs, pork sausage, bacon or chicken apple sausage, two lemon pancakes and potatoes. IT IS HEAVEN.

Our waitress was really kind. I love the atmosphere. The neighborhood is cute.

Will definitely be coming back to bring a friend who is visiting San Francisco for the first time in a couple weeks.

excerpts: The Plow with the two eggs, Nueske bacon, chicken apple sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes and potatoes was a total brunch that had everything you need and desire.
The bacon and sausage were good salty, sweet and meaty, while the pancakes definitely were the highlight.
the plow.author: T L.
the plow.review:
(See pics) Review #1192. Great all local purveyors ingredients brunch that brightens up any gloomy day or energizes a sunny day.

The day we visited, they were out of monkey bread so we opted for corn millet muffin which was good.

The Plow with the two eggs, Nueske bacon, chicken apple sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes and potatoes was a total brunch that had everything you need and desire. The bacon and sausage were good salty, sweet and meaty, while the pancakes definitely were the highlight. Eggs were prepared perfectly to my likeness.

As mentioned many times in my other reviews, I love locally roasted beans. Equator coffee was earthy and was happily light roasted.

My friend had the fried egg on Acme bun that was hearty and freshly tasted.

Mimosa was nice but more orange juice than sparkling wine.

Many had wondered about the San Francisco style long wait and yes even on a rainy weekend we we visited. However, the server was extremely helpful and actually told us not to go get coffee up the street because there would be a table coming up shortly and if those who were not there while called, they would lose the spot. Amazing enough, we only waited for 10 minutes. While the place was completely packed, service was super friendly and perky, we were never rushed to finish, though we were considerate to not hold up the tables.

Do wish they were closer to public transit stops.

excerpts:
the pancakes were fluffy and the plow breakfast i had was a huge portion 
grapefruit mimosas are the way to go!
the plow.author: Marie r.
the plow.review:
ok i suppose it is worth the wait - but i dont know about 2 hours.
luckily we only waited 30 minutes 
very cute homey vibe and food was really good too
service was friendly - a total neighborhood feel...
the pancakes were fluffy and the plow breakfast i had was a huge portion 
grapefruit mimosas are the way to go!

excerpts:
The Plow with homemade sausage 
Dungeness crab scramble 
French toast with caramelized bananas
Fruit plate 
& mimosas.
It was only my friend
and I
but I felt like being a fatty.
All the plates were awesome!!!
The scramble and French toast are definite
must try's
I look forward to going back to try the other menu items but not looking forward to the wait
the plow.author: Blake R.
the plow.review:
There aren't many places that the wait is over a hour long and you finish everything and feel it was worth the wait. I've driven by plow many times and have never seen it without people waiting. 
I finally went to get it a try and see what everyone is willing to wait for. 
We waiting a little over and hour, there aren't many places to sit so we sat across the street and watch the crowd maintain its size. 
When we finally got a table the server was really quick and helpful. 
Everything on the menu sounds good but we settled on 
The Plow with homemade sausage 
Dungeness crab scramble 
French toast with caramelized bananas
Fruit plate 
& mimosas. 
It was only my friend and I but I felt like being a fatty. 
All the plates were awesome!!! The scramble and French toast are definite must try's  
I look forward to going back to try the other menu items but not looking forward to the wait

excerpts: I ordered "The Plow" which was a little bit of everything!
I am a fan of sweet and salty so "The plow" was a great combination of everything.
My bf ordered the fried egg sandwich.
This place was packed with flavor and if you love runny eggs like my bf, this is a great dish!
Love this place.
the plow.author: Shirley N.
the plow.review: My first brunch spot in SF and I am very happy i chose Plow! A little pricey but it's a given when you're dining in SF. I made sure my bf and i made the first wave of people for their 8am breakfast but unfortunately we arrived at 8:10am and they already had a 45 min wait. What the heck! lol That clearly meant this place is amazingly delicious and i couldn't wait to try it! :D We sipped on their complimentary coffee while sitting on some cute benches on the side of the building. I was ready to eat and placed my order as soon as i sat down =P I ordered "The Plow" which was a little bit of everything! I am in love with their lemon ricotta pancakes and potatoes! I am a fan of sweet and salty so "The plow" was a great combination of everything. My bf ordered the fried egg sandwich. This place was packed with flavor and if you love runny eggs like my bf, this is a great dish! Love this place.

excerpts: I ordered the plow, of the meat choices I'd recommend the chicken apple sausage then the pork patties - the bacon is just bacon.
the plow.author: Ryan L.
the plow.review: A small modern rustic restaurant that serves a solid American breakfast. The food is fantastic and the mimosas were spot on. Yeah, dropping $20+ for brunch shouldn't be a surprise, make it $30 if you want a few mimosas in you. Came with a party of five and waited like 40 minutes which wasn't too bad. I ordered the plow, of the meat choices I'd recommend the chicken apple sausage then the pork patties - the bacon is just bacon. And yes, if you haven't already heard, the lemon ricotta pancakes are the bomb.

excerpts:
After perusing a fairly succinct menu, we ended up ordering the Plow, Dungeness crab scramble [ http://flic.kr/p/c2HfrY ], and an order of French toast to go.

And while the French toast was just okay, the lemon ricotta pancakes that came with the Plow were easily the best part of the meal - light on both the lemon and ricotta, they reminded me somewhat of fluffy lemon cream cookies.
the plow.author: Johnny W.
the plow.review:
A bit of clarification first - Plow is indeed not wheelchair accessible, as there are a few steps up into the restaurant. However! They have outdoor seating on nice days, and that IS accessible, albeit requiring that one deal with the slight incline of the hill on which Plow sits.

Showing up around 9am last Saturday, my friend and I were eventually seated after a ~45 minute wait. Part of this was due to having to wait for an outdoor seat though - had that not been necessary, our wait would have been about 15 minutes shorter. After perusing a fairly succinct menu, we ended up ordering the Plow, Dungeness crab scramble [ http://flic.kr/p/c2HfrY ], and an order of French toast to go.

The crab scramble wasn't bad, and most enjoyable when the scramble was eaten along with the accompanying toast. I was slightly turned off by how fishy the dish was though - while it WAS seafood, the taste was far stronger than one would expect of fresh seafood. The crispy potatoes that came as a side of that dish were pretty good though, albeit a bit too salty for my tastes. And while the French toast was just okay, the lemon ricotta pancakes that came with the Plow were easily the best part of the meal - light on both the lemon and ricotta, they reminded me somewhat of fluffy lemon cream cookies.

After all is said and done, with tax and tip, expect the meal to come out to about $20 a person for a single entree. Service is friendly, and while I suppose the local ingredient sourcing is a nice touch, it's never been a make or break factor for me. While I can see myself coming again solely for the pancakes, I doubt it'll be particularly often, or during their busier hours.

excerpts: I had the plow and ordered a extra side of chicken apple sausage, my scrambled eggs were runny and the lemon ricotta pancakes weren't as good as people said they are.
I tried my friend's crab scramble but that was just okay too.
Their bacon is nice and smoky though, I think that was the only thing I enjoyed.
the plow.author: Jenny Y.
the plow.review:
I was excited to try a new breakfast joint and when I came on a Friday around 1030am there was already a line. The wait was only about 20 minutes but I feel like the food is just typical. Nothing really stood out. I had the plow and ordered a extra side of chicken apple sausage, my scrambled eggs were runny and the lemon ricotta pancakes weren't as good as people said they are. I tried my friend's crab scramble but that was just okay too. Their bacon is nice and smoky though, I think that was the only thing I enjoyed. Besides their quick refills of coffee.

It's nice that they have seating outside, and also benches where you can wait outside but I suggest you go across the street in the sun to wait because they're situated in a shaded area.

Yay for glass cola bottles!

excerpts: I would recommend their signature dish "the plow.
the plow.author: Steven G.
the plow.review: I've never had such a delicious breakfast in my life! So amazingly good! There's minimal seating but it's worth the wait. The pancakes and potatoes were spot on. I would recommend their signature dish "the plow."

excerpts: Had the plow and absolutely loved it.
the plow.author: Gloria C.
the plow.review:
Had the plow and absolutely loved it.

The restaurant is so clean and charming. Sat at the bar with my ladies to share a wonderful Saturday brunch and left completely stuffed and satisfied.

The pork sausage is amazing, as well as the egg sandwich. We saw the cooks preparing a variety of dishes and I must say that the salmon benedict, scrambled eggs and random ingredients layed out in the kitchen all looked really fresh. I'm definitely coming back here. Next time, I will put my name down on the list, and then sit at Farley's for a nice cup of coffee to kill time.

Don't hesitate, it's worth the wait.

excerpts: We ordered The Plow, because why wouldn't you order the dish that's named after the restaurant?
the plow.author: Michelle W.
the plow.review:
I came here on a Tuesday morning at 830am and there was a 30 minute wait. Yes a 30 minute wait on a Tuesday morning! My friend had warned me of the popularity of this place, but I was still surprised to see so many people waiting around. 

When we finally sat down, we quickly told our server our order and our meals came out soon after. We ordered The Plow, because why wouldn't you order the dish that's named after the restaurant? 

The lemon ricotta pancakes were a delicious treat for my tastebuds. It reminded me of a fluffy lemon bar, but only the custard part. The homemade sausage patties were a bit dry. The table next to us ordered the same thing but with bacon and I was drooling from second hand aromas. 

In conclusion, I'd go back if they accepted reservations or if friends were visiting but not on another weekday whim.

excerpts: I typically have just ordered the "the plow".
the plow.author: Felix C.
the plow.review:
If you don't like the long wait that everyone speaks of, all I can suggest is to live close by.  My fiancée and I moved to SF from Atlanta, and picked Potrero Hill as our first neighborhood.

Little did we know that we were only 1 block away from Plow.  When we want brunch from Plow on the weekends we put our names down and head home for a bit to do whatever.

I typically have just ordered the "the plow".  It has a little bit of everything and the crispy potatoes are SOooOOoo good.

excerpts: We sat at the bar and got the plow-crispy potatoes, eggs, bacon, and lemon pancakes.
Super yummy.
The pancakes were fluffy, the potatoes are fried and seasoned well.
They gave me 4 pieces of bacon and it has a smoky flavor to it.
Most places give you only 2 pieces.
the plow.author: Karen H.
the plow.review:
Plow opens at 8am and I got there at 8:15am. It was one hour wait and it was worth the wait. 

We sat at the bar and got the plow-crispy potatoes, eggs, bacon, and lemon pancakes. Super yummy. The pancakes were fluffy, the potatoes are fried and seasoned well. They gave me 4 pieces of bacon and it has a smoky flavor to it. Most places give you only 2 pieces. The eggs were a decent amount too.

Staff is friendly and I will be back! This place makes my heart warm and fuzzy. :)

excerpts: And the plow is nothing impressive, even the look.
Maybe I am expecting too much
but I guess it's a bit overrated after all.
the plow.author: Jennifer S.
the plow.review:
I'd say if you walk by and they have seat you can give it a try, but if during a Saturday morning for a 2hr wait... Go wait for Rotunda at least you got union square and Neiman Marcus to kill time, and with a bit higher price you got way better quality of service and food.
The scrambled crab with egg was really bland... And the plow is nothing impressive, even the look. Maybe I am expecting too much but I guess it's a bit overrated after all.

excerpts: My favorite dish is "The Plow", it comes with lemon ricotta pancakes, eggs, potatoes and Chicken apple sausage.
One word, heaven.
the plow.author: Laura F.
the plow.review: Plow is probably my favorite breakfast spot in San Francisco. Yes, it's small and yes, you will have to wait to be seated unless you're literally there when they open however, the wait is definitely worth it. Plus, they offer a cup of coffee while you wait which is nice since it tends to be cold in SF. My favorite dish is "The Plow", it comes with lemon ricotta pancakes, eggs, potatoes and Chicken apple sausage. One word, heaven.

excerpts: I ended up getting the Plow, the ultimate combo plate for noncommittal people like me, with eggs my way, house sausage patties, crispy potato home fry, and lemon ricotta pancake.
The crispy potato had nice golden brown crust and was hearty.
The lemon ricotta pancake was probably the best I have had, so fluffy and light, with just the right level of sweetness.
the plow.author: Alice A.
the plow.review:
My friend suggested an early-ish brunch Saturday morning at 8am.  It's quite frankly too early for me but I oblige.  I arrive at 8am and he is already in line and we barely get the second-to-last table.  

I loved the space here--high ceiling, big windows, and lots of light.  I felt torn looking at the menu, because everything I love for brunch is listed, including lemon ricotta pancake and pumpkin pancake, among others.  I ended up getting the Plow, the ultimate combo plate for noncommittal people like me, with eggs my way, house sausage patties, crispy potato home fry, and lemon ricotta pancake.  The crispy potato had nice golden brown crust and was hearty.  The lemon ricotta pancake was probably the best I have had, so fluffy and light, with just the right level of sweetness.  The coffee was good, too, and the service was friendly and relaxed.

By the time we left, there was a crowd of people waiting outside and apparently the wait can be long.  But they serve coffee to people in line, which is super nice!

excerpts: My husband got The Plow, which is a combo of lemon ricotta pancakes, bacon or sausage, eggs, and crispy potatoes.
This is a good dish to order if you are new to Plow and want to sample different items.
I like the lemon ricotta pancakes and crispy potatoes a lot.
I like the lemon ricotta pancakes and crispy potatoes a lot.
the plow.author: Ally W.
the plow.review:
Plow is a great place for breakfast...as evidenced by the long line of people waiting outside even at ridiculous times like 8 AM on a Saturday morning.  What a bunch of crazies -- Saturdays are for sleeping in.

I got their French Toast - 3 thick and fluffy eggy bread slices with strawberry and lavender jam, mascarpone, and maple syrup. I have more of a savory tooth for brunch, but enjoyed this sweet dish a lot.

My husband got The Plow, which is a combo of lemon ricotta pancakes, bacon or sausage, eggs, and crispy potatoes. This is a good dish to order if you are new to Plow and want to sample different items.  However, his eggs were undercooked (to the point that the egg whites were slightly runny) and his chicken apple sausage was dry (it was seasoned well though).

I like the lemon ricotta pancakes and crispy potatoes a lot.  I may even want to make them at home, you know, at like 11 AM on a Saturday morning.

1 star off: I do not like dried sausage in my mouth. Get your mind out of the gutter. Read my review above.

excerpts: Recommend "The Plow" for a perfect Sunday Brunch.
the plow.author: Samantha M.
the plow.review:
Plow - how do I love thee?  Let me count the ways...

1.  You are seriously the potato Maestro.  Hands down the best potatoes I've ever had. 
2.  Lemon ricotta pancakes.  
3.  Killer mimosas. 
4.  Phenomenal coffee.  
5.  OH MY biscuits.  
6.  Clean open kitchen with singing and dancing cooks.  
7.  Baked goodies are always amazing and they switch it up often to keep it exciting!
8.  Generous portions. 
9.  Recommend "The Plow" for a perfect Sunday Brunch. 
10.  Let's start again.  

Cons:

1.  Loooooong wait. 
2.  Some of the waitstaff/greeters can be a bit dry.  You can be cool AND friendly at the same time ya know!

I love the food so much that it makes me forgive the cons.  Highly recommend for a great breakfast.

excerpts: The Plow is fantastic - 2 eggs any style, house potatoes, choice of 3 meats (homemade pork sausage, chicken apple sausage or bacon) and 2 pancakes.
They say Lemon Ricotta and the bottom of the menu says no substitutions
but we were able to get Pumpkin pancakes, which were quite delicious!
Plow is a really cute space and a great brunch destination in SF, would totally come back.
the plow.author: Lydia W.
the plow.review: Baffled by the crowd outside Plow on a Friday morning, but the wait was probably around 15-20 minutes, not bad at all on a sunny day! The Plow is fantastic - 2 eggs any style, house potatoes, choice of 3 meats (homemade pork sausage, chicken apple sausage or bacon) and 2 pancakes. They say Lemon Ricotta and the bottom of the menu says no substitutions but we were able to get Pumpkin pancakes, which were quite delicious! Plow is a really cute space and a great brunch destination in SF, would totally come back.

excerpts: The Plow dish includes 2 eggs cooked whatever style you prefer, choice of bacon/pork sausage/chicken apple sausage, home potatoes and two small lemon ricotta pancakes.
Yummies!!
I will definitely be back =)
the plow.author: Kaila Y.
the plow.review: I finally got to try Plow!  All the hype about the lemon ricotta pancakes is true, they're absolutely delicious :) The staff told us the wait would be around 1 to 1.5 hours when we arrived at 11am :\ Luckily the actual wait was about 30 minutes after other people waiting went to Chez Maman instead. The Plow dish includes 2 eggs cooked whatever style you prefer, choice of bacon/pork sausage/chicken apple sausage, home potatoes and two small lemon ricotta pancakes. Yummies!!! I will definitely be back =)

excerpts: Ordered the plow with eggs over medium.
the plow.author: Sarah U.
the plow.review:
Came on a Wednesday morning, arrived somewhere around 930am. No wait, although it was packed. Think the people out front waiting were waiting for outdoor seating, but since it was a heat wave in sf I was more than happy to sit inside. 
Ordered the plow with eggs over medium. Comes with 2 eggs (however you like), a pile of the best crispy potatoes ever, 2 strips of bacon (or you can order some sort of sausage) and 2 small lemon ricotta pancakes, which were to die for. Honestly this breakfast is the type of breakfast that ruins future breakfasts to come. 
Also ordered one of their homemade biscuits on the side, cause they look so scrumptious. Uhhh, it was divine. Came with some sweet whipped butter. 
Added a mimosa to all this. 
Jealous?

excerpts: the 3 other people in my group got the Plow which includes eggs, fried potatoes, choice of meats (everyone went for sausage) and lemon ricotta pancakes.
The pancakes are insanely good and could rival my favorite (Luluc in Brooklyn) and how can you go wrong with fried potatoes!
Highly recommend and can't wait to go back.
the plow.author: Jonathan H.
the plow.review:
Probably 4.5 stars, but have to give them the 5 for atmosphere and food. Okay, so we are huge fans of Dotties, and pretty much go there every day when in SF, but Dotties is closed on Wednedays (and as it turned out this trip Thursday too) so my brother in law (who lives in SF) recommended Plow.  It was a typical cool foggy day downtown, but was super sunny at Plow and wait was less than 10 minutes.
Coffee is fantastic (although they seem to only fill halfway each time). I ordered the corn beef hash was nice and light and very healthy tasting and the 3 other people in my group got the Plow which includes eggs, fried potatoes, choice of meats (everyone went for sausage) and lemon ricotta pancakes.  The pancakes are insanely good and could rival my favorite (Luluc in Brooklyn) and how can you go wrong with fried potatoes!
Highly recommend and can't wait to go back.

excerpts: I ordered the plow (breakfast sampler) and although my potatoes were nicely crunchy on the outside and soft in the middle, everything else was just normally decent.
Potatoes, eggs, small pancakes, sausage.
the plow.author: Hilary F.
the plow.review:
Okay I know my review is going to be a drop in the bucket. But forrealz, this place ain't all that. I ordered the plow (breakfast sampler) and although my potatoes were nicely crunchy on the outside and soft in the middle, everything else was just normally decent. Potatoes, eggs, small pancakes, sausage. Nothing to rave over. 

But THEN, for the rest of the day, I got to re-experience my meal in the form of stomach pains and queasiness. I called my brunch friend and asked her how she was feeling and she said her stomach was hurting too! The only thing our meals had in common were the eggs. 

I'm sorry, if you're a brunch place and you can't make eggs without making customers sick, you've got a problem.

excerpts: I got "The Plow".
LEMON RICCOTTA PANCAKES= BOMB.
the plow.author: Jefferson Y.
the plow.review:
GODDAMN THIS PLACE IS EXPENSIVE.

Its expected though, and they serve Equator coffee which is my favorite brand. So def a plus! They have outside seating which is also a plus. Oh and they have some sitting area outside for you to sit at while you wait too. Service was very good.

I got "The Plow". LEMON RICCOTTA PANCAKES= BOMB. Perfectly cooked over easy egg and crispy potatoes. I got the chicken apple sausages which were meh, were they packaged or something? Because there are "homemade pork sausages", that I wish I tried instead but will next time. Overall, sweet spot I would definitely come again.

excerpts: Went with a few friends and we all ordered the Plow.
Everything on this plate was delicious.
the plow.author: sara r.
the plow.review:
A follow a photographer on Instagram and she frequently posted pictures from this place so I knew I had to try it the next time I was in town. Went with a few friends and we all ordered the Plow. Everything on this plate was delicious. The bacon and potatoes were cooked perfectly and the lemon ricotta pancakes were a nice delicate compliment to the rest of the meal. Definitely a healthy portion of food so come hungry. 

The atmosphere is nice but the place is on the smaller side, so don't come too hungry cause you'll probably need to wait a little bit before being seated. But it's worth it.

excerpts: I got the plow sampler.
The potatoes with Rosemary was sooo good.
The egg was good and although I didn't like the ricotta lemon pancake
(I wished I did) but that a "me" problem and not their fault.
My boyfriend had their crab scramble and it was delicious as well.
They put plenty of crab in there.
Also ordered a side of fruit for our son and even the fruits were super fresh organic and our son are it all.
Def a new tradition every Saturday for us.
the plow.author: Ava L.
the plow.review:
Yummy!!!!!!!!

This became one of my favorite brunch places in the city! I can't wait to go back! 

The wait was pretty accurate. We waited over 30 minutes which is what the manager or host told us when we put down our name. The service was fast and efficient as well. And the food was just sooo good! I got the plow sampler. The potatoes with Rosemary was sooo good. The egg was good and although I didn't like the ricotta lemon pancake (I wished I did) but that a "me" problem and not their fault. My boyfriend had their crab scramble and it was delicious as well. They put plenty of crab in there. Also ordered a side of fruit for our son and even the fruits were super fresh organic and our son are it all. Def a new tradition every Saturday for us.

excerpts: I shared the plow plate, with a side of bacon and fruit.
the plow.author: Vicky L.
the plow.review:
another yummy place that I would never have gone to because it's so out of the way from everything, but my friend insisted. We put our name down, and drove off to go get ice cream, and came back just as they called out name. :) great timing! 

I shared the plow plate, with a side of bacon and fruit. 
* lemon ricotta pancakes, you make me swoon with pleasure. 
* bacon, well, how can you go wrong there? 
* homemade sausage patties, you were a little short on the flavor. 
* fruit bowl: you are the pick me up that I was looking for. blood oranges, tangerines, some other non-melon fruit... glad to see you weren't honeydew, cantaloupe and watermelon. 

I want to be your neighbor.

excerpts: The wife and I had 'The Plow' which they were happy to swap out the lemon ricotta pancakes.
the plow.author: Deniz U.
the plow.review:
This was, hands down, the best brunch I've ever had in San Francisco. 
We did have a bit of a wait and after coming to check back in at the time we were told, it did get my blood a little heated up that we were passed over several minutes before and ended up having to wait another 15 minutes while they rotated through some other parties that were on the list after us, but . . . . the brunch we had did more than I could ever hope to lift our moods.
