The wife and I had 'The Plow' which they were happy to swap out the lemon ricotta pancakes. My brother raved about those but the almond flour pancakes were AMAZING too. Luckily I forgot to ask them to hold the potatoes because the potatoes were nearly worth the trip on their own. Beautifully tender on the inside and the loveliest, crunchy outside I have ever experienced. The bacon was was absolute perfection too. 

I can't think of a single thing I would change. You can count on us waiting patiently outside at least twice a month. 

Bravo Plow!!!

excerpts: Get 'the plow' to experience their best stuff: potatoes,
the plow.author: Mert S.
the plow.review: Overall a great experience. Almost full even on weekdays. Get 'the plow' to experience their best stuff: potatoes, eggs (poached was great), the meats, and of course the Lemon Ricotta Pancakes. I'm not a big fan of pancakes but these were fantastic. Great atmosphere and service as well.

excerpts: We both got 'the plow'.
the plow.author: Tina B.
the plow.review: 45+ minute wait for 2 on a saturday morning 9am. We both got 'the plow'. The lemon ricotta pancakes were amazing. Sausage was a-ok. Eggs were great. Service was fast & attentive. Couldn't quite convince myself if the whole package was worth that long of a wait for 2 people only.

excerpts: i ordered "the Plow".
Each part of it was good but as a combination, i wasn't impressed.
Runny, fried eggs without bread?
the plow.author: Bill W.
the plow.review:
I read the Yelp Reviews. I'm a breakfast aficionado. I was intrigued.

About Timing: I read about long lines so I arrived at 8am on Sunday and about a dozen people waiting so I sat right down when they opened. By 8:30 it was almost full but still no wait.

I love going out for breakfast but I can prepare a better breakfast at home than I find in most restaurants. This is my breakfast dilemma. So when I read the reviews, I hoped that the food and great space would make it all worth while.

The space is impressive, clean, well-run and organized.

i ordered "the Plow". Each part of it was good but as a combination, i wasn't impressed. Runny, fried eggs without bread? I loved the crispy potatoes but they were not ideal for sopping up eggs. The ricotta pancakes were great. The pork sausage was good but putting these items together on a plate didn't do it for me. i never eat pancakes but the lemon ricotta pancakes were great but with pork sausage and fried eggs? The price was $20 before the tip.

Over-all: Plow experience is more like a rushed lunch at a hot new restaurant than the perfect breakfast in which one puts ones thoughts together for the day. Apparently from the reviews, Plow is popular and people were strategizing what to get before it opened at 8am on a Sunday. 

Personally, I prefer a leisurely breakfast where i take my time; enjoy browsing the paper in sunny comfort, breaking into caffeine induced philosophical discussions now and then. 

I recommend trying Plow but for my taste, as a breakfast experience, it may be a victim of it's own success.

excerpts: I ordered the Plow,  which included two eggs any style, two lemon ricotta pancakes, crispy potato & house made pork or chicken apple sausage.
the plow.author: En J.
the plow.review:
They don't take reservations so our wait time was almost an hour. By the time it was our turn to eat, they ran out of the Monkey bread. Bummer!!

I ordered the Plow,  which included two eggs any style, two lemon ricotta pancakes, crispy potato & house made pork or chicken apple sausage. The Lemon Ricotta pancake was simply the best, just cant be missed. 

The servers are friendly and accommodating. If you are a dog lover then this is a perfect spot to hang out with your canine while brunching.

excerpts: But I was pretty disappointed when I went today and they charged me $4 to replace the meat side of The Plow with fruit.
Even for SF prices, that's a little absurd...
the plow.author: Megan H.
the plow.review: The service is good and the food is delicious! But I was pretty disappointed when I went today and they charged me $4 to replace the meat side of The Plow with fruit. Even for SF prices, that's a little absurd...

excerpts: I also got the plow.
Good portion.
the plow.author: Nam V.
the plow.review: The frebch toast with marcaspon was great.. so was the strawberry lemonade. My favoeite thing was their biscuit.  I culd have eatten 5 of them. I also got the plow. Good portion.

excerpts: My sister and I shared the The Plow and the French toast with red wine poached pears.
The French toast was okay.
It was nothing special, and was actually lacking a little oomph.
The Plow consisted of two eggs (over easy), house made sausage patties, crispy potatoes and two lemon ricotta pancakes.
The patty was good, and the pancake was delish!
the plow.author: Leslie P.
the plow.review:
Their crispy potatoes are addicting! So flavourful... savory, and naturally sweet. They are super crispy... I love them!

My sister and I shared the The Plow and the French toast with red wine poached pears. The French toast was okay. It was nothing special, and was actually lacking a little oomph. The Plow consisted of two eggs (over easy), house made sausage patties, crispy potatoes and two lemon ricotta pancakes. The patty was good, and the pancake was delish!

excerpts: I had 'The Plow" because i wanted to try the well-reviewed lemon ricotta pan cakes
but I also wanted a salty breakfast ( The plow comes with 2 small pan cakes along with home made sausages and your choice of eggs).
The lemon ricotta pan cakes didn't do it for me,
the plow.author: Lianne M.
the plow.review:
Neat little breakfast/brunch restaurant serving VERY delicious breakfasts. Tastier than the famous Mama's in my opinion. Every item on the plate has its own unique flavor and texture, yet it works all so well together.

I'm a foodie who not only loves eating, but also loves cooking. I can usually make the typical cafe style breakfast/brunch at home, so I usually don't find breakfast menu surprising or eye catching, to me they're all pretty much the same. But at Plow, even their potatoes stand out of the breakfast restaurant crowd! Its crunchiness is amazingly  addictive that makes your teeth wanting to take one bite after another ( yet it's stil; fluffy on the inside). 

I had 'The Plow" because i wanted to try the well-reviewed lemon ricotta pan cakes but I also wanted a salty breakfast ( The plow comes with 2 small pan cakes along with home made sausages and your choice of eggs). The lemon ricotta pan cakes didn't do it for me, BUT, the pork sausages I had was so flavored and made with high quality minced meat that left me amazed at how delicious it was at every bite. 

Again, I usually find breakfast at restaurants really average, but Plow's breakfast went beyond my expectation, it is truly worth the wait.

Very busy if you are visiting in weekend. No table reservations, first come first served, put your name on the wait list and walk around the neighborhood. They only seat you if all parties have arrived.

excerpts: The Plow', my dish, was delicious in it's simplicity, and really just perfect.
the plow.author: Vittorio L.
the plow.review:
This place had a line 12 people deep before it even opened on a saturday, and for a good reason. The ambiance was welcoming, with warm wood trim and tables juxtaposed with stainless steel and brushed metal accents. The windows let in the right amount of light, and made this somewhat narrow restaurant with maybe 12 tables and a counter seem bigger than it is. The open kitchen is a nice touch, too.

And the food was very good, as was the coffee. We had the cassoulet, which was something like ham hocks, duck confit, and some other meat broiled with beans in a savory broth - hearty and delicious. 'The Plow', my dish, was delicious in it's simplicity, and really just perfect. Potatoes (crispy + yum), eggs, bacon, and lemon ricotta pancakes (just the right amount of lemon, no syrup needed). 

What more can i say, except that I've found a place i will be coming back to for breakfast and brunch rather often *sigh*.

excerpts: For breakfast, we ordered the softly scrambled eggs and the plow - two eggs, meat of your choice (we got the homemade sausage), potatoes and lemon ricotta pancakes.
We were mostly MEH about the scrambled eggs
- they were good but nothing special.
The pancakes were fantastic and I wish they were like 12 inches bigger
so I could just make a lemon ricotta pancake hat to wear for forever.
But the real winner was those damn potatoes.
My husband and I actively debated on how we could replicate them.
the plow.author: A K.
the plow.review:
My husband and I pop down to SF a few times a year.  He lived there for 6 years and it is his favorite city.  This was our first visit to Plow and we really enjoyed it.  We arrived at about 10:45 on Tuesday and were seated immediately.  

For breakfast, we ordered the softly scrambled eggs and the plow - two eggs, meat of your choice (we got the homemade sausage), potatoes and lemon ricotta pancakes.  We were mostly MEH about the scrambled eggs - they were good but nothing special.  The pancakes were fantastic and I wish they were like 12 inches bigger so I could just make a lemon ricotta pancake hat to wear for forever.  But the real winner was those damn potatoes.  My husband and I actively debated on how we could replicate them.  Don't think we will be able to.  

Oh, coffee and mimosas were good too. 

We will be back to Plow though I don't know if we would do a two hour wait.

excerpts: 3 words.... GET THE PLOW!!!
So amazing..
Hands down best breakfast ever.
The "plow" dish is so filling and so amazing
I was so happy.
I wish the place had more seating because it is so popular which makes the wait time very long.
Parking is super easy..
There are so many spots available on the street by the restaurant.
Hostess is very good with the estimation of time as it is fun to walk around for a little while waiting.
Will always be my favorite breakfast place!!!
the plow.author: Kayla F.
the plow.review: 3 words.... GET THE PLOW!!! So amazing.. Hands down best breakfast ever. The "plow" dish is so filling and so amazing I was so happy. I wish the place had more seating because it is so popular which makes the wait time very long. Parking is super easy.. There are so many spots available on the street by the restaurant. Hostess is very good with the estimation of time as it is fun to walk around for a little while waiting. Will always be my favorite breakfast place!!!

excerpts: Eating breakfast with a 5-star restaurant experience is all the rage now days and the Plow is one of the hot-spots.
My dish was The Plow.
the plow.author: Leona Z.
the plow.review:
Eating breakfast with a 5-star restaurant experience is all the rage now days and the Plow is one of the hot-spots. My basic take-away - the food is good, much better than average, the service is reminiscence of high dining, although I think I prefer my breakfast in a more low-key friendly vibe. 

My dish was The Plow. Crispy potatoes, eggs, lemon ricotta pancakes,  and house made sausage patties. The crispy potatoes were the best home fries, cut potatoes I've had. I'm definitely a fan. The lemon ricotta pancakes were good, eggs were eggs, and the sausage was a tad dry. For $17, I wasn't impressed except by the potatoes.... and $17 to be wowed by potatoes is disappointing.

My final word: Definitely not worth the hour plus long waits on the weekend, but without a wait, I'd try it again.

excerpts: There has never been a time when a plow classic has thrown me off whether it'd be the lemon ricotta pancakes, egg sandwich, or "The Plow" (eggs, sausage or bacon, lemon ricotta pancakes, potatoes).
Each time I've had them they've tasted exactly the same, which is a very good thing.
The potatoes are always amazingly flaky and moist on the inside but crispy and herbaceous on the outside.
the plow.author: Lisa Q.
the plow.review:
Plow is one of the hottest glowing epicenters for breakfast on this earth. You can see it from space, glowing and winking--- the smell of their famous potatoes cutting through the atmosphere into your space station and causing every astronaut to salivate and pine for home. 

I'm a longtime eater, first-time writer about the majesty that is this wonderful breakfast place. They have completely captivated the majority of San Francisco and definitely don't need my help, this is just a love letter to their high level of consistency, execution, and creativity.

There has never been a time when a plow classic has thrown me off whether it'd be the lemon ricotta pancakes, egg sandwich, or "The Plow" (eggs, sausage or bacon, lemon ricotta pancakes, potatoes). Each time I've had them they've tasted exactly the same, which is a very good thing. The potatoes are always amazingly flaky and moist on the inside but crispy and herbaceous on the outside. They remind me of Jonathan Waxman's famous potatoes at Barbuto, except I don't have to travel all the way to New York for them.

They also take recipes from great breakfast places all over this nation such as Joanne Chang's Flour in Boston and execute them exceptionally. Their really nailed Joanne's chocolate brioche with pastry cream recipe... I hope they do her sticky buns with goo next!

I also love it when they do their own seasonal riffs of breakfast, my favorite of all time was their "Chinese Breakfast" which had delicious red roasted pork on top of fluffy rice topped off with a fried egg. I will probably scream and jump up and down for joy when they bring it back--- it was one of the yummiest breakfasts I've ever had. *Siiigh* Those tender and aromatic pieces of pork mixed with the unctuousness of an oozing yolk on top of pristine pearly rice, oh god, it's a recipe for love potion.

My only advice is to get here as soon as they crack open their doors. Waiting an hour to eat food is pretty painful and is especially devastating when it's your first meal of the day.

excerpts: I ordered the Fried Egg Sandwich and my bf ordered The Plow.
The Fried Egg Sandwich wasn't bad - didn't realize there would be no meat in this meal
but i do love aioli sauce!
wished there were more.
The Plow came with your choice of meat - i believe they make it themselves?
the plow.author: Kristina L.
the plow.review:
was looking for a brunch place and stumbled upon this one because apparently its so good that people eat out here in the RAIN. its quite adorable and a little crazy so i had to give it a try. Came late on a Friday afternoon around 1? was seated right away. I ordered the Fried Egg Sandwich and my bf ordered The Plow. The Fried Egg Sandwich wasn't bad - didn't realize there would be no meat in this meal but i do love aioli sauce! wished there were more. The sandwich came with crispy potatoes and grilled onions - that was really good. super crispy on the outside and the potato texture on the inside. The Plow came with your choice of meat - i believe they make it themselves? with crispy potato, 2 eggs your style, and the LEMON RICOTTA PANCAKES. Those were amazing. Crispy on the outside and fluffy on the inside. I believe there was cheese in there but i couldn't taste it. The lemon addition in the pancake was amazing. felt like i was eating a pastry! I dont usually like pancakes cause they're a little on the heavy side but these were so light. I will be getting an order of Lemon Ricotta Pancakes next time :)

beware - this meal comes with food coma -____- at least it did for us!

excerpts: The Plow: eggs, crispy potatoes, homemade pork sausage, and lemon ricotta pancakes.
Everything was exceptional.
The fennel in the sausage was a bit overwhelming, and I prefer links to patties.
But other than that, 5 stars!
the plow.author: Benjamin A.
the plow.review: Def worth the hype! I woke up at 7:30am on a Sunday and made my way to Plow with high hopes. We put our name down for a table of 4 at 8:30am, and we were seated just under an hour late. It was reassuring to know that others woke up even earlier than I did. I got The Plow: eggs, crispy potatoes, homemade pork sausage, and lemon ricotta pancakes. Everything was exceptional.The fennel in the sausage was a bit overwhelming, and I prefer links to patties. But other than that, 5 stars!

excerpts: The group ordered a medley of dishes, the lemon ricotta pancackes, the french toast, the fried egg sandwich and the Plow.
I won't bore the reader with the details
(800 other reviews describe them quite accurately), but they were all delicious.
I especially liked the sweet stuff (the french toast and pancakes) versus the fried egg.
The potatoes with the fried egg was pretty awesome
the plow.author: Rahul H.
the plow.review:
We went in on a Sunday for Brunch as a party of 7. They don't typically seat a table of 7 but after a bit of discussion they were ok with seating us outside. We put our names down and then had to wait for a little over 2-1/2 hours to get a table. At this point, it is fairly standard for all good Brunch places in San Francisco and being a large party definitely made it worse. But oh well, at least there is a nice bookstore a block away to kill some time. I also recommend stopping at Farley's and getting a croissant and coffee. 

The group ordered a medley of dishes, the lemon ricotta pancackes, the french toast, the fried egg sandwich and the Plow. I won't bore the reader with the details (800 other reviews describe them quite accurately), but they were all delicious. I especially liked the sweet stuff (the french toast and pancakes) versus the fried egg. The potatoes with the fried egg was pretty awesome but I think the egg sandwich at Mission beach cafe is just a tad bit better. 

Overall, I think it is a very good brunch place. But I am just not convinced waiting 2-1/2 - 3 hrs for brunch here is worth it. But I am loath to make other recommendations since the good ones all have a long wait. At least parking over here is not a beast.

On a side note, this place opens at 8AM so if you are up early and are interested in getting an awesome SF brunch, this is the place to go.

excerpts: I got the plow with scrambled eggs and the pork sausage.
My husband got the eggs Benedict with ham,  mushrooms and spinach which also came with the potatoes,  and was also quite good.
The January morning air was chilly  but it was a sunny day
so we opted to sit outside as the wait was much shorter.
While we were waiting we were given unlimited coffee.
When we actually sat down we were given blankets for out laps which was very cozy.
Our server was extremely attentive and knowledgeable and kept out coffee mugs and water glasses filled.
Start to finish this was one of the best breakfast experiences we have ever had and we will definitely be back to try the other menu items.
the plow.author: Nancy N.
the plow.review: Ok so let me just begin by saying this place lived up to the hype. I love breakfast and I am picky about how I spend my calories. I am also from New England and I know real maple syrup. That said, the lemon ricotta pancakes are maybe the best pancakes I've ever had the honor of eating. I'm not the world's biggest potato fan and the roasted home fry rosemary potatoes with the local hot sauce put this over the edge.  I got the plow with scrambled eggs and the pork sausage. My husband got the eggs Benedict with ham,  mushrooms and spinach which also came with the potatoes,  and was also quite good. The January morning air was chilly  but it was a sunny day so we opted to sit outside as the wait was much shorter. While we were waiting we were given unlimited coffee. When we actually sat down we were given blankets for out laps which was very cozy. Our server was extremely attentive and knowledgeable and kept out coffee mugs and water glasses filled. Start to finish this was one of the best breakfast experiences we have ever had and we will definitely be back to try the other menu items. I am sure I will be dreaming about lemon ricotta pancakes until we return.

excerpts: My friend ordered the plow.
the plow.author: Ann Z.
the plow.review:
Came here on a Friday around 1pm for a late brunch. Waited about 10-15 minutes before we were finally seated.

My friend and I both ordered a French toast to share. It was actually really good. The pears were so soft and sweet. The French toast was a perfect line between soggy and soft. 8.5/10 stars.

I ordered the yogurt and granola. It was probably one of the best I have ever had. It tasted so fresh and the granola was soooo good!!!

My friend ordered the plow. She liked the lemon ricotta pancakes because it didn't taste like you're eating a bunch of flour. The apple chicken sausage was pretty good too. The potatoes were okay.

We both had the fresh squeezed lemonade which was $4.50 without a refill. I was a literally turned off by that. I had to pay an extra $1 for a refill. The glass was not even that big! It was probably 8-12oz. I was like really!? Aside from that, the lemonade was actually very good and refreshing. 

Parking was fairly easy and it was free!

excerpts: Anyways, I ordered the plow, substituting the lemon ricotta pancakes for their gluten free counterpart.
Upon the arrival, first, of a french press filled with Ecuadorian coffee, then their decadent chia seed pudding.
Both of which were very delightful.
Next, our meals arrived.
the plow.author: Seth T.
the plow.review:
From the moment we arrived, we knew that an amazing experience was about to ensue. Arriving just prior to Plow opening, we parked our rental car on a San Francisco-esque  steeply-inclined side street and waited patiently for the doors to open.

Promptly at 7am we were greeted at the door by a beautiful waitress wearing a pearly-white smile. We were the first ones to be seated and had the place to ourselves. This was our final morning in San Francisco, so we were looking for an amazing meal to digest and reflect upon over the flight home. San Francisco food experiences had been quite kind to us during our stay, so the bar had been set high.

The decor, ambiance, music selection, and courteous staff were nothing short of amazing. I was also delighted to see the offering of gluten free pancakes. Progressive cities like SF make eating delicious, yet health conscious, meals so effortless. Anyways, I ordered the plow, substituting the lemon ricotta pancakes for their gluten free counterpart. Upon the arrival, first, of a french press filled with Ecuadorian coffee, then their decadent chia seed pudding. Both of which were very delightful. Next, our meals arrived. The food quality was far superior to what is attainable in our area of the East Coast. 

We ate our meal, took in the scenery, chatted with our waitress, and even bumped into a fellow Massachusetts resident who had given us the recommendation for Plow over dinner at a great Indian place just the night before.

Overall, I couldn't have been happier with our experience at Plow. It was the absolute perfect way to close our our trip. San Francisco was the most warm, inviting, and friendly city I have visited to date and Plow was the physical embodiment of the vibe which SF resonates.

excerpts: Beverages were tasty (although I thought the mimosa overpriced for the size), and I got the Plow in order to try a bit of everything.
the plow.author: Ingrid C.
the plow.review:
Mr. Plow, that's my name, my name again is Mr. Plow. 

Oops. Wrong Plow. 

This Plow serves tasty food. 

I came here with Ruth C. one morning before going to the Bazaar Bizzare Craft Show downtown. After I dropped her off to find parking (an easy-by-SF-standards 10 minutes), she informed me there was an hour wait. 

Now, for good brunch, an hour is nothing. Many debates have been had in NYC brunch places (yes, I know this is SF, but you wait a similar amount of time for good brunch here!), and there have been stories of showing up 3 hours before closing (think Clinton Street Baking Company) and being told that you won't be able to get seated that day. 

The only negative experience was the wait, though. The estimated wait time and the actual are nothing alike. If you're not there when they call your name, you get skipped. And yes, that means that if your name magically gets called 15 minutes after you put it down (and you wandered off because they told you to wait an hour), you get skipped. Really, really annoying. So bring your Kindle and coat (if it's cold), and stay put.

We got seated at the counter (with rosemary plants!) with a full view of the stoves. Really fun to watch! Out of the three guys working, one looks useless. I think this is also typical. The stove master is boss, though. Watching him work though palates of eggs was super fun. 

Beverages were tasty (although I thought the mimosa overpriced for the size), and I got the Plow in order to try a bit of everything. Here's the rundown:

- Potatoes are crispy outside, soft inside, well-seasoned, and very tasty. 
- Pork sausage was the best meat option (homemade patties are delicious!)
- Ricotta pancakes were bland and had a weird ricotta cheese texture (ha!) 

I'd come back.

excerpts: The plow - two eggs (whatever style), house made pork sausage, and 2 lemon ricotta pancakes.
This comes with a small container of real maple syrup.
This was AMAZING.
GET IT.
The pancakes are small, rich and
oh my god so fluffy.
The eggs were ordered sunny side up and they were prefect.
I just didn't want to get another the plow (like my partner).
I don't regret my choice
but I do think the plow was the much better idea.
the plow.author: Jessica P.
the plow.review:
Let me preface this with stating that I had to wait a couple hours before I could sit down and eat.  So hunger might have made the food taste better than it should.  Food that we ordered

Crispy pig ears with a pickled egg - It comes with a chili vinaigrette but ask for the chili jam.  That chili jam is amazing and made everything taste better.  The pig ears were coated in batter and fried (ergo crispy) but the inside was melt in my mouth tender.  If you do get this, share it.  It is very rich. 

The plow - two eggs (whatever style), house made pork sausage, and 2 lemon ricotta pancakes.  This comes with a small container of real maple syrup.   This was AMAZING.  GET IT.  The pancakes are small, rich and oh my god so fluffy.  The eggs were ordered sunny side up and they were prefect.  The yolk was runny and the white is completely set. 

Soft egg scramble with goat cheese, lambsquarter and oyster mushrooms - This was decent but not my favorite.  I just didn't want to get another the plow (like my partner).  I don't regret my choice but I do think the plow was the much better idea.

Coffee - I don't know what they use but the this coffee was extremely fruity and not bitter at all.  They constantly refill the cup too.

All main came with crispy potato.  This was extremely good, especially with the chili jam. 

TLDR: If you are going to come here, bear in mind that you would need to wait at least  an hour (we got here around 11:30 on a Saturday)

Cost: You should expect to spend around $20+/person for food.

excerpts: I always get The Plow and the crab omelette.
the plow.author: Grace H.
the plow.review:
One of my favorite brunch places in SF, and I've been to a lot!! I always get The Plow and the crab omelette. The lemon ricotta pancakes are delish.

Only thing that keeps me from coming all the time is the wait, besides one time I went super early, other times have always been hour+ waits (which is pretty much the case at every decent brunch place).

Sitting outside is nice on a sunny day but it tends to get really cold & windy at times so bring a jacket!!

excerpts: I ordered their signature the plow and my friend the egg Benedict.
Also, I love the way they work because I took the counter and watched they prepare for our food.
It's Super organized and clean.
It's totally worth
the 45min wait.
Afterall a great breakfast lights up your day.
the plow.author: Robin W.
the plow.review: Great breakfast with great potatoes and even awesome milk! I ordered their signature the plow and my friend the egg Benedict. Also, I love the way they work because I took the counter and watched they prepare for our food. It's Super organized and clean. It's totally worth the 45min wait. Afterall a great breakfast lights up your day.

excerpts: + Ordered The Plow and the amount of food for $15 mowed me down.
It was hefty and worth every bite.
Order The Plow if you want something hefty and show early to get your name on the list.
Then build in time to take a short stroll before heading back to wait fo your name to be called.
the plow.author: Yiven C.
the plow.review:
Wow. What a brunch!

The +:
+ Ordered The Plow and the amount of food for $15 mowed me down. It was hefty and worth every bite. It was a sampler of everything like 2 eggs, 2 lemon ricotta pancakes (ok), crispy potatoes (WOW), and homemade pork sausage (yum)
+ Almond pancakes (gluten-free) were fantastic with the maple syrup. Fluffy and not a heavy sponge of carbs! We preferred these pancakes over the much-hyped lemon ricotta
 + Coffee was great. Strong and tasty
+ Staff was very pleasant and helpful. 
+ Wait is torture but at least there were wooden benches built by the wall and there are shops less than a block away to kill some time
+ Our pooches are able to join us for brunch! Outdoor seating of course.


The -:
- The Wait. For table of 2 on a Sunday at 1:30pm was at least 30 minutes. Sheesh
- Patio seating is on a Potrero Hill. So if you don't mind sitting in the shade on a tilt then you'll be fine.

Order The Plow if you want something hefty and show early to get your name on the list. Then build in time to take a short stroll before heading back to wait fo your name to be called.

excerpts: And the The Plow, which consisted of a little bit of everything popular...house made pork sausage, lemon ricotta pancakes and crispy potatoes.
I felt like the pork sausage tasted like some type of Vietnamese pork type food.
The lemon ricotta pancakes were also amazing.
the plow.author: Audrey N.
the plow.review:
I FINALLY got to try this place. I was afraid it would be a third time's a charm type mishap, but the brunch gods were in my favor. The wait was only 20 minutes my second time. =) Naturally, we waited on the cute benches attached to the side of the building. 

I wish I was living in the houses around the corner because I would be a regular! We had the French Toast... which was amazing. Literally I wanted MORE! And the The Plow, which consisted of a little bit of everything popular...house made pork sausage, lemon ricotta pancakes and crispy potatoes. I felt like the pork sausage tasted like some type of Vietnamese pork type food. The lemon ricotta pancakes were also amazing. I just wish I ordered poached eggs rather than over easy. 

I would definitely recommend this place. But don't let the hype ruin it...as many other reviewers, including myself will probably do.

excerpts: I went with the Plow which had their lemon pancakes, pork sausage, potatoes and eggs.
Without hesitation I can say that this meal was in my top 3 best breakfast meals ever.
I live in Austin TX and have traveled all my life for pleasure and business.
I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this place to anyone.
Great Job!
I will be back very soon!
the plow.author: Steve V.
the plow.review: I stumbled across this place when I was in town on business. I was there early so I didn't have to worry about a wait. The waiter was very helpful offering suggestions on what to order. I went with the Plow which had their lemon pancakes, pork sausage, potatoes and eggs. Without hesitation I can say that this meal was in my top 3 best breakfast meals ever. I live in Austin TX and have traveled all my life for pleasure and business. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this place to anyone. Great Job! I will be back very soon!

excerpts: Ordered the Plow (crispy potatoes, eggs, lemon ricotta pancakes), pumpkin pancakes, and the breakfast sandwich.
I would definitely order all 3 again.
Delicious!
the plow.author: K. D.
the plow.review:
Delicious brunch here - with only a 10 minute wait for a party of 6 on a weekday! 

Ordered the Plow (crispy potatoes, eggs, lemon ricotta pancakes), pumpkin pancakes, and the breakfast sandwich. I would definitely order all 3 again. Delicious!

excerpts: We got the plow and egg benedict.
The food is rich and heavy, the homemade sausage is OMG delicious.
the plow.author: Chau V.
the plow.review:
Plow has been on my bookmark for months and I finally convince the boyfriend to come here for breakfast. We left early from San Jose and arrived at Plow around 9:30am last Sunday. Street parking was abundant  We were happy to find parking within 500 ft from the restaurant but mortified once we found out that the wait could be an hour and 45 minutes. We patiently waited while it seemed to me that a lot of people gave up. 

 
Plow's dining room is bright and loaded with natural sunlight during the day. The restaurant features high ceiling, polished wood floors, and a busy open kitchen. They also have outside seating and provide blankets for those who are sleeveless and wear shorts on a cold windy spring day like last Sunday. That was very thoughtful of them.

Don't even bother counting how many calories you think you are consuming, because it is probably a lot. They serve traditional breakfast items. We got the plow and egg benedict. The food is rich and heavy, the homemade sausage is OMG delicious. Their signature potatoes are truly amazing, packed with flavors and roasted perfectly with crispy skin.

Great ambience, fantastic food, I would have given 4 stars, but customer service was unbelievably slow.

Was it worth the wait? ... A little bit.

excerpts: On our table, we have the french toast with roasted peaches, soft eggs, and the plow.
I LOVE their french toast, they cut you 3 thick slices of "french" bread?
Definitely not the skimpy slice of bread from a loaf.
Lightly dusted with sugar powder, even the maple syrup was light!
Each bite of the toast melts in my mouth, it's not oily and I finished my meal before the two hungry guys so that means something right there.
the plow.author: Elaine Y.
the plow.review:
I LOVE YOU!

I would just leave it like that, but I guess you readers will want more than that. So first of, go in groups of either 2 or 4. Not 3, 5, 6, 7, 8,......If you go in groups of 2s, the wait will be cut short a lot less! For some reason, they seat pairs sooner. And if you were going to get a table for 3, come on, you have that ONE extra seat, might as well invite one more friend to enjoy delicious food (one more order for you to take a bite from!)

Parking was easy, many street parking and there's no time restriction on Saturdays and Sundays. Service was friendly, but can't say it was fully fast and efficient because the wait to order and receive our food after we were seated were longer than waiting for a table (table: 30 minutes, food: 35+ minutes). One of my friend "I'm so hungry" out loud and was overheard by the waitress. She came over to ensure us that our food was coming out next so perhaps a little whining doesn't hurt anyone?

When the food got out, all the waiting was worth it. SO WORTH IT! On our table, we have the french toast with roasted peaches, soft eggs, and the plow. I LOVE their french toast, they cut you 3 thick slices of "french" bread? Definitely not the skimpy slice of bread from a loaf. Lightly dusted with sugar powder, even the maple syrup was light! Each bite of the toast melts in my mouth, it's not oily and I finished my meal before the two hungry guys so that means something right there. I also had their homemade lemonade, it was decent, not too sweet, but the glass was pretty small.

The other guys seems to enjoy their food and one of them complimented on their potatoes. I had a up-coming culinary chef in my group and even he said he'll return to this place. The brunch did come up to about $15-$20 per person. I'm not saying you come here everyday, but maybe once every two weeks to shock your taste buds with good food.

I can't wait to return to try the rest of the menu =)

excerpts: We ordered the Benedict eggs and The Plow.
The hollandaise sauce and poached eggs were cooked to perfection.
I like spicy hot sauces but just wouldn't add anything extra to the crispy, salty, delicious potatoes.
The best I have tried in my life.
The breakfast ended on a high sweet note of ricotta lemon pancake.
This was a meal to remember!!
the plow.author: Elizabeth L.
the plow.review: The wait was worthy. We ordered the Benedict eggs and The Plow. The hollandaise sauce and poached eggs were cooked to perfection. I like spicy hot sauces but just wouldn't add anything extra to the crispy, salty, delicious potatoes. The best I have tried in my life. The breakfast ended on a high sweet note of ricotta lemon pancake. This was a meal to remember!!

excerpts: I had: the plow  two eggs, choice of Nueske bacon, house made pork sausage, or chicken apple sausage,
the plow.author: Ming-Jou C.
the plow.review:
If you want to sit next to a bitch for a really good brunch, Plow is the place for you. Well, it was for me on a nice, cool Sunday mid-morning. The lack of star perfection wasn't due to her, it was the 1-hour wait for a table, but hey, you learn to expect that at places in SF that don't take reservations. They don't take parties greater than 6. 

Situated on a corner in Potrero Hill, Plow is small inside with just as many seats outside. The reason for the bitch, is that they have 2-person tables lined up along the wall of the restaurant and well, I had to get in to the inner table for my seat. I asked her nicely if she could move her chair in, well, she moved her butt, not moving the chair and barely at that. So basically I just shoved past her. Good thing I was sitting next to her and didn't have to stare at her sour-puss face the entire meal like DK did sitting across from her. Anyway, she made for good conversation.

Onto the food...once we were seated, our waitress took a while to bring us our waters and by then we were ready to order. You really can't go wrong with a breakfast place that has a pig sign under the name of their restaurant. Mmmm.....oink.

I had: the plow  two eggs, choice of Nueske bacon, house made pork sausage, or chicken apple sausage, two pancakes + crispy potatoes  14

DK had: max's biscuits + gravy  two buttermilk biscuits, pork sausage gravy, crispy potatoes  11

It came out fairly quickly and it was GOOD. The bacon was plentiful and was cooked just right, the pancakes had this lemony hint to them and were on the smaller size, but that's because they're not your average pancakes. They were really good though, but kind of had a french toast consistency and about the size of English muffins. The potatoes had some sort of Saffron or something on them, because they were as yellow as my egg yolks, but boy, were they good. I normally leave potatoes untouched on my plate (except for the hash brown kind), but these were awesome and just the right amount of crispy.

DK's biscuits and gravy were really good and the gravy was coma-inducing. 

I really enjoyed my breakfast, sans bitch. There's a multitude of breakfast places in SF, and many are good one-morning stands, but this one I would go on a second date with.

excerpts: I've only been here twice and have been dying to try their fried egg sandwich, but I'm such  a sucker for the plow.
the plow.author: Carrie L.
the plow.review:
Love this place, but really hate the wait!

Starting with the positives - this place has AMAZING food.  Everything on their "plow" is amazing.  The sausage and eggs work great together, their potato is made perfectly crispy on the outside and warm and toasty on the inside, and their lemon ricotta pancakes are to die for.  I usually don't even like pancakes, but I ate it all.  I've only been here twice and have been dying to try their fried egg sandwich, but I'm such  a sucker for the plow.  

Oh, and the portions are very generous.

The downside of this place  is the wait...and that it doesn't accept reservations, but good things are worth waiting for.  I will definitely be back.

excerpts: When at Plow get the plow!
It's a seriously good breakfast/brunch entree that won't have you feeling overly stuffed or gross afterwards; perfect mix of savory and sweet items on your plate and just the right amount.
the plow.author: Erich D.
the plow.review: When at Plow get the plow!  It's a seriously good breakfast/brunch entree that won't have you feeling overly stuffed or gross afterwards; perfect mix of savory and sweet items on your plate and just the right amount.  I got mine with two eggs sunny side up, Nueske bacon, and the standard crispy potatoes and lemon ricotta pancakes.  Nueske bacon is bacon in some of its awesomest form.  The crispy potatoes had a hint of rosemary for an added dimension of flavor.  The lemon ricotta pancakes featured a light lemon flavor and were a little dense yet still fluffy and really delicious (I really liked these pancakes).

excerpts: Don't get me wrong - the crispy potatoes were really good, as were the lemon ricotta pancakes (I got the Plow breakfast), but the sausage mixed with syrup mixed with egg mixed with potatoes?
Yeah.
I'm a fan.
Minus one star for inaccurate time keeping.
Cuz I'm a jerk like that.
the plow.author: Maria P.
the plow.review:
Came here last Sunday for brunch. Arrived around 11:30, put our name down, was told it would be an hour. Thankfully there are shops around so we got busy for about 30 minutes. And because we were dying of hunger, we went back to check on the wait. Reported time? Another hour! So yeah, that was heart/gut wrenching. 

But when our time finally came, there was much rejoicing. The service was quick. And their homemade sausage blew my mind. Don't get me wrong - the crispy potatoes were really good, as were the lemon ricotta pancakes (I got the Plow breakfast), but the sausage mixed with syrup mixed with egg mixed with potatoes? Yeah. I'm a fan. Minus one star for inaccurate time keeping. Cuz I'm a jerk like that.

excerpts: I ordered the plow because it seemed the most "worth it
" (haha).
Everything tasted so-so until I took a bite out of the pancakes.
DELICIOUS OMGASDFKAWER.
Will definitely be back for the pancake!
I'm drooling as I'm typing up this review!
the plow.author: Johnny G.
the plow.review:
I woke up early one day to run some errands with my girlfriend and as we finished up, we got hungry. She was craving some breakfast food so we yelped something close by and this popped up. As I walked in, it looked cramped but the building was nice and bright due to the fact that its lit up by the sunlight. Has a good vibe and atmosphere because everybody was socializing while enjoying their food. I ordered the plow because it seemed the most "worth it" (haha). Everything tasted so-so until I took a bite out of the pancakes. DELICIOUS OMGASDFKAWER. Will definitely be back for the pancake! I'm drooling as I'm typing up this review! If you haven't tried their pancakes, WHAT ARE YOU WAITING FOR?!

Service was excellent. The waitress was nice and recommended what to get. Extremely friendly.

***Parking***: Street parking only. Should be fairly easy to find in the morning/early afternoon.

Cash/Credit are accepted here.

excerpts: He usually gets the plow and is always satisfied with that, so I think for him it was matter of ordering.
I've tried their monkey bread, which was just okay and tasted more like a cinnamon roll.
the plow.author: Victoria J.
the plow.review:
Yes, the wait here is ridiculous, there's no pleasant place to sit and you can't sit inside because it's a small place. That's just how it is. If you come with this mindset, you'll be okay waiting, if not, then you'll probably be miserable. Although, a few times when I've come and I know the wait will be more than 30 minutes, I'll just leave and go to Farley's to hang out there for a while and come back with a hot cup of coffee in hand. 

The potatoes here are always amazing. I love how they fry them, I love how they come with beautiful sprigs of rosemary, and sometimes when I come here I get a side order with my meal because the amount of potatoes that come with the dish just aren't enough! I usually get something with eggs here (eg. soft scrambled eggs) and I've always loved what I order. The last time I visited plow my boyfriend ordered the crab scramble and he said he didn't like it at all though. He described it as too watery and the taste was lackluster. He usually gets the plow and is always satisfied with that, so I think for him it was matter of ordering. I've tried their monkey bread, which was just okay and tasted more like a cinnamon roll. I've also tried their pop tart, which was pretty good, but I feel like I could home make pop tarts just as good and not for $5 a piece. 

I like plow a lot and is my go to breakfast place, but just there is a ridiculous wait, but the food is very solidly good. The waitstaff is alright, nothing to really say about them. Some people find them rude, but they're usually attentive and that's all I care about.

excerpts: I ordered The Plow, which came with two small lemon ricotta pancake, apple smoked sausages, sunny-side up eggs, and seasoned fried potatoes.
The pancakes are absolutely divine, with a burst of lemon and ricotta flavors with each bite, and the rest of the plate was done so well to complement.
You actually get the choice in between the sausage patty or the apple smoked sausage, and I am glad I chose the apple smoked sausages.
Highly recommend!
On the other hand, the bf ordered the egg sandwich and he devoured that thing in a mattered of seconds.
the plow.author: Luby H.
the plow.review:
So delicious!!! I LOVE brunch, but Plow takes it to a whole new level! Or maybe it was simply because it was a near 2-hour wait and at that point, anything tasted like heaven. 

Came here on a Sunday around 12:00pm, and was not seated until a little before 2pm. Yes, it's THAT good. I feel like I was never so happy to finally see food, but have the food taste even better than I had ever expected. I ordered The Plow, which came with two small lemon ricotta pancake, apple smoked sausages, sunny-side up eggs, and seasoned fried potatoes. The pancakes are absolutely divine, with a burst of lemon and ricotta flavors with each bite, and the rest of the plate was done so well to complement. You actually get the choice in between the sausage patty or the apple smoked sausage, and I am glad I chose the apple smoked sausages. Highly recommend! On the other hand, the bf ordered the egg sandwich and he devoured that thing in a mattered of seconds. I also though he was going to lick his plates! 

The bottom line is, although the wait was unattractive, the meal was definitely worth it. The good thing is, while you are waiting, you can assist yourself to some free coffee. 

Note: This is the same coffee you get when you order coffee during the meal, so you might as well drink up and get caffeine high for free while killing time!

excerpts: if it is your first time is to get the plow.
Has a little bit of everything!
The plow gives you both and you will leave satisfied.
the plow.author: Christine W.
the plow.review:
Came here on a Sunday around 10am and had to wait over an hour for a table for 5pm. Come here early or be prepared to wait. My friend said that there is a nice coffee shop up the block called farleys which is good to grab a cup of coffee and chat while we wait. We didn't get coffee this time but looks like most ppl do do this. 

We were seated outside which was fine but it does get chilly out there so bring a jacket. My friend mentioned they supply you blankets is you ask but none of us asked for one. We all just pounded cups of hot coffee to stay warm! 

The most popular item and best entree to get here if it is your first time is to get the plow. Has a little bit of everything! The crispy potatoes, chicken apple sausage, and the lemon ricotta pancakes were oh so yummy! Definitely would recommend this as I am always torn when I go to brunch - do I want sweet or savory? The plow gives you both and you will leave satisfied. 

Overall this is a great brunch spot with flavorful and tasty brunch options. Next time I want to try their Dungeness crab scramble sounds soo yum!

excerpts: Knowing either of us couldn't finish The Plow, we went for the lemon ricotta pancakes and a half portion of the french toast with a side of crispy potatoes.
They do everything so well that you really can't go wrong with any of their options!
Cheers!
the plow.author: David O.
the plow.review:
Plow is seriously delicious. If you're a brunch person and you haven't been here, you're missing out. The lady and I had been hearing about this place for a while and we finally made it out. It was our lucky day because we were told that the wait would be about an hour and a half and we may possibly not get a table before closing. A lot of people gave up and it bumped down our wait time to about 20 minutes on a Saturday.

We sat at the bar where four men were working furiously behind the counter churning out pancakes, benedicts and the like in a very efficient system. Knowing either of us couldn't finish The Plow, we went for the lemon ricotta pancakes and a half portion of the french toast with a side of crispy potatoes. They do everything so well that you really can't go wrong with any of their options! Cheers!

excerpts: I highly recommend getting the plow if you want sample a couple of the things off their menu.
We also got an order of french toast and the fried egg sandwiches.
The french toast was okay.
It was thick and crispy.
the plow.author: Vi L.
the plow.review:
I'd give this place 4 stars, but I'm taking one out for the 2.5 hours wait for brunch. I came here after a hike and my last meal was at 7am, so that might have been a reason why I was STARVING by the time we got seated. It helped a lot that they kept reassuring us that we weren't forgotten and apologized for the wait so I give them 5 stars for customer service.

Brunch was good. OMG...the crispy potatoes were to die for. I'm so glad it came with 3 out of 4 of our meals. We ordered 2 plows (1 with house made pork sausages and 1 with the chicken apple sausages). I highly recommend the pork sausages over the chicken sausages. It also came with their signature lemon ricotta pancakes which was fluffy and unique. I highly recommend getting the plow if you want sample a couple of the things off their menu. We also got an order of french toast and the fried egg sandwiches. The french toast was okay. It was thick and crispy. We added avocados to our fried egg sandwich which made it pretty tasty. 

Overall, the food and service is great. I just don't think it's worth a 2 hour wait when there are so many other brunch places in the city. I'd come back here again, but only if the wait is no longer than an hour.

excerpts: After finally getting a table, we both ordered the plow entree with poached eggs and got our food fairly quickly.
Without tasting the food, right away we could see the inconsistency among the two plates.
My husbands plate looked perfect, eggs cooked wonderfully and the potatoes seasoned perfectly with salt and rosemary.
The eggs on my plate were slightly undercooked and leaking of yolk when I got it.
My potatoes were slightly overcooked with no taste of rosemary.
the plow.author: R C.
the plow.review:
My husband and I waited in line for a little over an hour to be seated (which is the norm, especially on weekends).  After finally getting a table, we both ordered the plow entree with poached eggs and got our food fairly quickly.  Without tasting the food, right away we could see the inconsistency among the two plates.  My husbands plate looked perfect, eggs cooked wonderfully and the potatoes seasoned perfectly with salt and rosemary.  The eggs on my plate were slightly undercooked and leaking of yolk when I got it.  My potatoes were slightly overcooked with no taste of rosemary.  The lemon ricotta pancakes were delicious (the only yummy item on my plate) and would highly recommend trying them.

I was fairly disappointed in the lack of consistency this place has and am not willing to wait in line for over an hour when there are way better breakfast places in the city.

excerpts: We ordered the The Plow (heh heh), a couple fried egg sandwiches, the ricotta pancakes, and donut holes.
The sandwiches were awesome, and the ricotta pancakes were surprisingly good, as I was weary about "ricotta" pancakes.
The donut holes where just ok, but the definite highlight of the breakfast...
THE POTATOES.
I could have easily ate a couple bowls of them, if they were to serve it as cereal.
Without a doubt, some of the best potatoes I've EVER had.
the plow.author: Gino E.
the plow.review:
Girlfriend: "What are we doing for breakfast?"
Me: "Plow."
Girlfriend: "Ummmmmm... what?"
Me: "You heard me."

The name of this place is PLOW. If you don't see the humor in this, then I'm waaaaay too inappropriate for your liking.

ANYWAY, like any of the local weekend breakfast hotspots, we waited a little over an hour for the 4.5 of us to be seated on a Sunday morning. After we were finally seated, we were attended immediately and our orders taken, since we had already looked at the menu for the past hour. 

We ordered the The Plow (heh heh), a couple fried egg sandwiches, the ricotta pancakes, and donut holes. The sandwiches were awesome, and the ricotta pancakes were surprisingly good, as I was weary about "ricotta" pancakes. The donut holes where just ok, but the definite highlight of the breakfast... THE POTATOES. I could have easily ate a couple bowls of them, if they were to serve it as cereal. Without a doubt, some of the best potatoes I've EVER had. THAT good...

PLOW is something to definitely put on your to-do list when in the city. Heh heh heh... PLOW.

excerpts: We ordered the plow, different eggs and meat.
Of course I got bacon, I think.
the plow.author: Claire J.
the plow.review:
Location is great for folks who are driving here. Lots of parking, no metered parking required. 
It's a small place and since there was 3 of us, we had to wait about 10 mins. We  were then asked if it would be ok seated on a communal table and we said why not.  Something that is getting popular nowadays which I think can be pretty cool. W e were seated with 2 guys on 5-seater table. I thought it would feel awkward but it felt like a community plus they were minding their own business. Just a lil chat with them he re and there. 
Ambiance- open, bright, like eating outside. Reminded me of eating outside in Addendum in Yountville. I'd stay here if I could, lol.  

Coffee good, but no refill?
Millet corn muffin yum
We ordered the plow, different eggs and meat. Of course I got bacon, I think.  Potatoes are yum.

Local farms all the way. Love it!
Need to ask next time what flour is used with pancake.  Or I might have to try their other pancake.  

I wanna go back.

excerpts: I had "the plow" with almond pancakes because I have celiacs (have to eat GF) and I can't stop dreaming about that meal!
Waited for about an hour, but it was well worth it!
the plow.author: Ali H.
the plow.review: Delicious!  I had "the plow" with almond pancakes because I have celiacs (have to eat GF) and I can't stop dreaming about that meal!  Waited for about an hour, but it was well worth it!

excerpts: I ordered the Plow which included lemon ricotta pancakes topped with powdered sugar, eggs your way, bacon, and home fries.
I have to say the home fries hit the spot with the grilled onions.
Since it was cold, I ordered hot water and tea.
the plow.author: Ciana P.
the plow.review:
I came here with a friend of mine after a morning work out so we were hongry! that's right HONGRY. It was only 10:30AM and this place had a massive wait list which means a) their food really is that good of b) the space is too small. I have to say it was a combination of a & b and it was definitely worth the wait. We ended up waiting about 45 min before we were seated outdoors. I wanted to sit inside but the wait was going to be longer and this particular day was cold and foggy. Luckily, there were blankets. The only complaint about the seating is that we were seated on a slope so I was afraid I was going to be a klutz and somehow knock myself over (which didn't happen btw).

I ordered the Plow which included lemon ricotta pancakes topped with powdered sugar, eggs your way, bacon, and home fries. I have to say the home fries hit the spot with the grilled onions. Since it was cold, I ordered hot water and tea. The bill came out to be about $25-30/person including drinks.

I would definitely come here again however, I might come even earlier! a solid 5 stars for service, food, and location. Be prepared to stalk other people for parking...it took about 20 min to a spot!

excerpts: The other two had the Plow.
The granola was not as crunchy as I like (more chewy), it had shredded coconut, seeds, nuts (no dried fruit, for those who prefer that).
I tried the lemon pancakes and they were tasty!
Would return as it was an enjoyable experience.
the plow.author: Ashleigh D.
the plow.review: As a group of 3, there was a short wait for breakfast on a Wednesday morning - it wasn't a bad thing as we had time to check out the neighbourhood shops. I ordered the granola, which came with yogurt & chopped up chunks of fruit. The other two had the Plow. The granola was not as crunchy as I like (more chewy), it had shredded coconut, seeds, nuts (no dried fruit, for those who prefer that). I tried the lemon pancakes and they were tasty! Would return as it was an enjoyable experience.

excerpts: I almost always order the plow with lemon ricotta pancakes and their homemade sausage patties.
the plow.author: Larf P.
the plow.review:
My favorite brunch place. 

This is how I make the whole experience pleasurable:

I ride my scooter over, put my name on the list, ride back home, tell my boyfriend to get up because our names are on the list, then we go have a leisurely cup of coffee at Farleys before coming back to wait the last 10 minutes in front, or across the street in the sun. 

This is how it's done, all you waiter-haters! It's all about strategy.

I almost always order the plow with lemon ricotta pancakes and their homemade sausage patties. The crispy potatoes really are the most delicious things you could ever put into your mouth at breakfast.

Don't order the French toast here. They use French bread for some reason--it's way too thick with a stiff crust. 

Monkey bread, if they haven't run out yet, should be ordered immediately.

excerpts: The tea was delicious, and I got the Plow Breakfast
the plow.author: Siara C.
the plow.review:
I LOVE going out to breakfast, and this place has all the perfect elements for a most successful breakfast endeavor.  The location and building itself are so cute and cozy. it fits the food and you can see how perfectly thought out every detail is.  The napkins, salt and pepper shakers, restroom--everything was thoughtfully chosen.  It's small, and you will have to wait.  But let that waiting just be fuel for your fiery desire for awesome breakfast food.

The tea was delicious, and I got the Plow Breakfast so I could try a variety of items.  

Prepare to have all your preconceived notions of typical breakfast items blown away.  

Those.crispy.potatoes. 
 I want to cry thinking about how I have to live without them until my next visit to San Fran.  

Lemon ricotta pancakes. No brainier.  Chicken apple sausage.  Yep.  Eggs perfectly done.  I was so chubby and happy leaving this place- maybe I'm glad it's so far from me because I would clearly have to quit my job, eat here every day, and be fat and alone but SO SO happy if it was in driving distance.

excerpts: then went on to the plow breakfast,
two perfect sunny side up eggs, homemade fragrant sausage patty, and the best potatoes.
the plow.author: Gary Y.
the plow.review:
We were in the Portrero, waiting for Hard Knox lunch, when we saw in the Examiner that Plow had breakfast and lunch altogether.  Great! so we tried it and was it fun.  The wait was a little long to get in, but there was plenty of parking on the street, a nice neighborhood to browse, and the friendliest breakfast staff!

Breakfast was delicious, we got a soup,  farro and kale (always wanted to know how farro would be in a soup, and it was perfect for a late breakfast).  then went on to the plow breakfast, two perfect sunny side up eggs, homemade fragrant sausage patty, and the best potatoes.  Oh, and lemon ricotta pancakes, like you could make at home, but who has ricotta laying around at home?  the maple syrup was good too (could have used a side of butter).  Our other was a fried egg sandwich, really smoky bacon, distinctive cheese melted in, soft bun, and more of the potatoes.  

Not cheap, but so friendly for a morning meal, everyone's proud of the offerings, tables close together, but everyone's excited about their meal.  We liked it and will come back with friends.

excerpts: Tried the little gem salad w/nectarines and "the plow"..
the plow.author: Melody T.
the plow.review:
Ok, after trip #2 I need to up it another star.

Tried the little gem salad w/nectarines and "the plow".. wow those lemon ricotta mini pancakes and potatoes are amazing!!!!! 

We were lucky enough to get seated at a table immediately (it being a Thurs afternoon), just wish it was like this all the time...

As usual, staff was uuber friendly. Great coffee too.

excerpts: I ordered the Plow while my boyfriend settled on the Fried Egg sandwich.
The Plow was SO good!
The eggs were on the watery/yolky side which I didn't mind.
The bacon tasted exactly like how my mom makes it
-- It was sweet and not too crispy.
the plow.author: Joyce E.
the plow.review:
Plow is absolutely delicious! I came here for my boyfriend's birthday brunch. The wait was about 15 minutes for two on a Thursday afternoon at around 1pm. The hostess/server was very nice and assured us that we would be seated soon. Since Plow is, as they describe "modest in size" definitely expect to get seated literally inches away from some random people. Anyways! Since we looked at the menu beforehand, we received our orders within 15 minutes. Pretty fast! I also want to mention that the wait went by quickly since my boyfriend and I were watching the cooks cook/prepare the food in the open kitchen. I ordered the Plow while my boyfriend settled on the Fried Egg sandwich.

Their water was served in jugs! My favorite. :)

(From their menu)

The Plow-- two eggs, choice of Nueske bacon, house made pork sausage, or chicken apple sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes, crispy potatoes  14.5

Fried egg sandwich -- two eggs fried, aioli, frisee, Vermont cheddar, Acme bun  10.75  add Nueske bacon  12.75

The Plow was SO good! The eggs were on the watery/yolky side which I didn't mind. The bacon tasted exactly like how my mom makes it -- It was sweet and not too crispy. The lemon ricotta pancakes had a cake-like consistency and tons of flavor. My only complaint about the pancakes was that they were way too small! The potatoes? Best freaking breakfast potatoes I've ever had. They were flavorful, crispy, and oh so good! I also tasted my boyfriend's Fried Egg Sandwich was was also, very good. The total came out to be about $30 something for breakfast.. a little pricy, but totally worth it!

excerpts: so I got The Plow with sunny side up eggs and the pork sausage.
the plow.author: Rosalind S.
the plow.review:
4 stars only because we waited for about 5 mins, (thanks Chris!), although it was in the rain.  The wait was suppose to be about 2 hours which is ridiculous because it's not that good and I would never wait for food like that.  Don't get me wrong, I definitly enjoyed my meal, (but the company was better), but like I said, not wait 2 hours good.   

It was my first time so I got The Plow with sunny side up eggs and the pork sausage.  The eggs were cooked well, the potatoes perfect, lemon ricotta pancakes were good, but the sausage was boring.  I had a mimosa with my meal and I did like how the flute curved out just a tad for that extra sip.  My husband got the spinach eggs benedict which he inhaled so it was probably good.  Our friend Chris got his usual scramble and then ate my 2nd pancake since he likes them so much and I couldn't finish.  We were out of there in about a hour.  Imagine if we waited 2 hours for that 1 hour meal.

excerpts: My friend ordered the plow which was similar to mine but also had their pancakes included in it and those pancakes were soooo good..with just a hint of lemon in them!!
Do give their pancakes a try if you go there..
And everything they make there comes fresh from various farmers markets :-)
the plow.author: Rikki S.
the plow.review:
Yummm.. We came here for one of my friends birthday brunch and it is very good brunch place.. We all started off with coffee and juices and ordered our food.  I had their classic egg breakfast with chicken apple sausage which came with some of their potatoes and bread on the side.. My friend ordered the plow which was similar to mine but also had their pancakes included in it and those pancakes were soooo good..with just a hint of lemon in them!! 
Do give their pancakes a try if you go there.. And everything they make there comes fresh from various farmers markets :-)

excerpts: I most always get the Plow, which consists of lemon ricotta pancakes, crispy, crispy rosemary potatoes, eggs, and some sort of protein.
I've had the soft scramble as well.
Last time I was there
there were oyster mushrooms, goat cheese, and stinging nettles all enveloped in soft, pillow-y, quivering eggs.
the plow.author: Rebecca N.
the plow.review:
I've been here a bunch of times and 
1. Somehow, I've never had to wait.
2. I've only ever sat at the bar. 
3. I love you


Plow is hands down, forever in my heart, deep within my soul, my favorite place to get breakfast. I eat breakfast here when I'm happy, I eat here when I want to celebrate, I eat here when I want to treat myself to something nice. I even eat here when I'm sad. (I do eat my feelings in the form of house made pork sausage.) Something tells me I'll be frequenting this place a little more nowadays. ;( :D

I've never had anything bad here. And not even just that, because well, that's a lukewarm statement. I've only had EXCELLENT things here. The coffee is delicious, and so is the food. I most always get the Plow, which consists of lemon ricotta pancakes, crispy, crispy rosemary potatoes, eggs, and some sort of protein. I've had the soft scramble as well. Last time I was there there were oyster mushrooms, goat cheese, and stinging nettles all enveloped in soft, pillow-y, quivering eggs. freaking yum. 

And seriously, I don't mean to assume, or step on anyone's toes, but... it doesn't seem like anyone hates their job here. I know, rude of me to say. But no, really. The service is always served with a genuine smile, and I always come back because they are really, really, really nice. 

I recently went on a Saturday and even though they open at 8, the restaurant was full by 8:05. So, keep that in mind if you don't like waits! Even though I never have had to, I would because this place is a gem.

excerpts: My table ordered a number of things to share: the french toast, crab scramble, some pork dish (i forget the oh so elegant name), and of course the plow.
, I was super excited to taste the lemon ricotta pancakes as part of the plow.
So when they came, and I tried them, I was definitely let down.
they were....
just okay.
Definitely not as flavorful as I had been hoping.
Matter fact, that's how everything was.
I think the highlight if anything was the potatoes.
the plow.author: Jennifer O.
the plow.review:
Okay, so it pains me a tad to give plow such a low rating when clearly the majority of what seems to be the world loves it. but let me remind you all that two stars means "meh, I've experienced better", and that's exactly what I left thinking after eating at plow. 

I went yesterday with three friends, and after waiting for close to two hours (thank the Lord for that little coffee shop with the board games. scrabble was clutch!) we finally got a table outside. My table ordered a number of things to share: the french toast, crab scramble, some pork dish (i forget the oh so elegant name), and of course the plow. 

Me being a fan of all pancakes (just had the best sweet potato pancakes the weekend before at brenda's), I was super excited to taste the lemon ricotta pancakes as part of the plow. So when they came, and I tried them, I was definitely let down. they were.... just okay. Definitely not as flavorful as I had been hoping. Matter fact, that's how everything was. I think the highlight if anything was the potatoes. Definitely had a good little crisp going on, and when dunked in ketchup, it was bomb! 

One thing though that I liked more as an afterthought was that I left not feeling weighed down by the food. Not sure if this was because I didn't eat much of it or if the food was just very healthy/airy/light, but i did appreciate not feeling like i need to take a two hour nap afterwards to digest the food.  

so all in all... I'm glad I went to plow, and can now check it off my sf bucket list. but will likely not return, and don't really recommend it actually. there's other restaurants in the city where the food merits the wait a lot more.

excerpts: I ordered the "The Plow" which has a little bit of everything.
The potatoes were really good.
They seem to be deep fried first then tossed in a pan with some caramelized onions.
The home-made pork sausage patties were really good as well.
the plow.author: Karen L.
the plow.review:
There are lots of hills in this area so I don't recommend wearing high heels going to this restaurant. Also, it's also really cold in SF and you have to wait outside for a table so bring a warm jacket.

The food was pretty good. I ordered the "The Plow" which has a little bit of everything. The potatoes were really good. They seem to be deep fried first then tossed in a pan with some caramelized onions. The home-made pork sausage patties were really good as well. The only thing I didn't care too much for was the lemon ricotta pancakes. They were a bit dense. It's probably the ricotta that makes it like that but I like my pancakes light and fluffy. 

Overall, I would definitely come back to try the rest of the menu. The service was really nice, great environment, and good food. Just bring a jacket because you will most likely have to stand outside and wait for a table.

excerpts: I got the plow, which comes with their lemon ricotta pancakes, crispy Yukon gold potatoes, and your choice of bacon or sausages.
Their potatoes are AMAZING!!
It was so good we ordered seconds.
It was perfectly crispy on the outside and soft on the inside.
Seasoned to perfection.
I also tried the French toast but it was nothing out of the ordinary for me.
Mimosas are not bottomless but still delicious and $8 a glass.
The ambiance is casual, if seated at the countertop, you can watch your food being prepped.
the plow.author: Cindy H.
the plow.review: Expect a wait on the weekends. Food is great, service is great. I got the plow, which comes with their lemon ricotta pancakes, crispy Yukon gold potatoes, and your choice of bacon or sausages. Their potatoes are AMAZING!! It was so good we ordered seconds. It was perfectly crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. Seasoned to perfection. I also tried the French toast but it was nothing out of the ordinary for me. Mimosas are not bottomless but still delicious and $8 a glass. The ambiance is casual, if seated at the countertop, you can watch your food being prepped.

excerpts: Gluten-free almond pancakes are good option for dietary restrictions, however would like to see non-meat side options with the main dishes like the Plow.
Mimosas, wine and beer on the menu, but no Bloody Mary and the sides above keeps Plow from reaching 5 star status.
the plow.author: Brian G.
the plow.review: I've sampled half the menu and everything has been  very fresh and delicious - PURE MAPLE SYRUP, nothing fake here!  Weekends can always expect a 45-60 minute wait (no reservations).  Gluten-free almond pancakes are good option for dietary restrictions, however would like to see non-meat side options with the main dishes like the Plow.  Mimosas, wine and beer on the menu, but no Bloody Mary and the sides above keeps Plow from reaching 5 star status.

excerpts: Hubby had The Plow and when I ordered the eggs benedict, I was told, "Oh, we're sold out.
We JUST sold the last one.
Literally a minute ago.
Really?!?
Way to add insult to injury.
We waited an hour in the cold wind, you took your sweet time with our food order and now you tell me that I just missed the last plate of eggs benedict by ONE minute?!?
Had she been more timely and efficient and showed up a minute earlier, I wouldn't have missed it.
the plow.author: Tone C.
the plow.review:
Plow has been on my list of "must try restaurants" for awhile.  Today when hubby and I were near the area, we decided to stop in.  Little did I know it was going to be a royal waste of time!  We showed up at 1:00 on a Saturday and were told the wait would be 30-45 minutes for 2 of us.  So frustrating to see people streaming out and several four tops (arriving after us) getting seated before us.  Problem is:  the very small restaurant is made up of mostly of four tops - so parties of 4 get priority seating.  At 50 minutes, I seriously considered cutting bait but we had come so far so we persevered, pushing past the pangs of hunger and our near-frozen fingers and toes. Had we been given an accurate estimate of the hour wait time, we would've gone elsewhere.  Like, Chez Maman - close by and has never disappointed.  

An hour later, we were finally seated at the counter.  Our server showed up almost immediately to take our drink order but took awhile to come back for our food order.  After I made eye contact with her twice (once she mouthed "I'll be right there"), she finally came back.  Hubby had The Plow and when I ordered the eggs benedict, I was told, "Oh, we're sold out.  We JUST sold the last one.  Literally a minute ago."  Really?!?  Way to add insult to injury.  We waited an hour in the cold wind, you took your sweet time with our food order and now you tell me that I just missed the last plate of eggs benedict by ONE minute?!?  Had she been more timely and efficient and showed up a minute earlier, I wouldn't have missed it.  Argh!

Unfortunately, the food wasn't good enough to rid the bad taste in my mouth I got from the wait and the couldn't-care-less attitude of the staff.  Though the food is better than average, it is in NO WAY worth the hour wait (or 2 hours for some other Yelpers who seem to have much more fortitude than I).  

I won't be going back unless they start taking reservations and upping the batch of hollandaise they make.  It's a head-scratcher for sure - they had plenty of eggs, ham/spinach/smoked salmon and english muffins (I had a side order, in fact) but they couldn't serve me eggs benedict?!?  I can only guess that they ran out of hollandaise.  How hard is it to make extra hollandaise?  Apparently this outage is a frequent occurrence - so why hasn't Plow addressed this?  Dear Plow:  Make extra hollandaise.  It doesn't cost much and you'll more than make up the cost of any potentially wasted hollandaise in the extra plates you sell.

Don't get sucked into the hype.  I wouldn't recommend going to Plow but if you absolutely must, then 1) go on a weekday, 2) go with a party of four and 3) make sure you place your order of eggs benedict ASAP (before you do anything else!).

excerpts: I've ordered the plow which is your standard eggs, house potatoes bacon toast
and it's soooo good!!!!
Not boring at all.
the plow.author: C. M.
the plow.review:
Every time I've come here, I've waited at least 30-45 minutes and it's been worth it each and every time. Foods amazing here and waitstaff is always great. Fresh ingredients make the plates here just that good. I've ordered the plow which is your standard eggs, house potatoes bacon toast and it's soooo good!!!! Not boring at all. Lemon ricotta pancakes melt in your mouth, along with strong delicous coffee. You are set for the day. 
Parkings not bad. Beautiful place, great neighborhood. Love coming here

excerpts: If you want to try everything, the Plow is a must - you get unreal bacon, delicious fluffy eggs, the world's best potatoes, and not-to-miss lemon ricotta pancakes.
If you're lucky enough to steal a bite of someone else's pancakes, the goat cheese and tomato eggs were fantastic, soft scrambled
the plow.author: Leslie K.
the plow.review:
Let me set the scene here - it's Wednesday morning at 9:30am and there is a crowd outside and a 45 minute wait. Yes, a random Wednesday morning. At that point, we knew we had to be in for an incredible meal. And let me just say, we weren't disappointed. 

If you want to try everything, the Plow is a must - you get unreal bacon, delicious fluffy eggs, the world's best potatoes, and not-to-miss lemon ricotta pancakes. If you're lucky enough to steal a bite of someone else's pancakes, the goat cheese and tomato eggs were fantastic, soft scrambled so they melted in your mouth. 

Don't forget to ask for the jam to go with your toast, you won't regret it.

excerpts: The Plow - One of the people I was eating with said it best, "They took all the best parts of breakfast and put it on a humungous plate.
the plow.author: Brittany B.
the plow.review:
Lemon Ricotta Pancakes - I'm not the biggest breakfast person and I only like to eat pancakes about once a year, but I could have these every day. They were lemon breakfast dessert clouds of yumminess.

Crispy Potatoes - The kind of homefries that are cooked in some sort of wonderful fat. There were pieces of all sizes, but my favorite were the really small crispies that were like shavings of salty fried butter. 

The Plow - One of the people I was eating with said it best, "They took all the best parts of breakfast and put it on a humungous plate." Sausage, bacon, eggs, crispy potatoes, lemon ricotta pancakes... the works.

excerpts: My guy and I shared the much revered egg sandwich, and the plow.
The sandwich was good, and the potatoes were as awesome as everyone says.
the plow.author: Amanda G.
the plow.review:
After reading rave reviews, I really wanted to check this place out. 
I had read the wait on weekends was crazy, so we decided to go the day before X-mas Eve, since my guy had the day off. 

Unfortunately, there was still about a 30 minute wait. We were a group of 4, but i saw groups of 2 waiting awhile as well. 

The space is small, and feels a little cramped, but I liked being able to see the action in the kitchen, (and check out the food coming out.) 

My guy and I shared the much revered egg sandwich, and the plow. The sandwich was good, and the potatoes were as awesome as everyone says. What I REALLY loved were the mini lemon ricotta pancakes. So glad my guy and i ordered the way we did, we got to taste more things this way. 

I agree with other reviewers that the portions are smaller than a lot of breakfast places. But, all the products are sourced locally, and organic, (even the sausage is made in-house.) 
You're getting much higher quality food here than at your run-of-mill breakfast joint. 

If i lived in the neighborhood, i would be back, but not if the wait was over 30 minutes.I 'm just not that patient.
