On the day we were here, Charles Phan, and the owner of Gialina's & Ragazza, (she makes the best pizza around) were eating here too. I think that speaks volumes about the kind of food they're dishing out here.

excerpts: I had been dreaming of the day I could eat here - It was on my "SF Bucket List" Finally after sitting outside for 45-50 minutes on a Tuesday morning at 11 -- my rumbling tummy met with the plow... pancakes, potatoes, eggs sausage for about $15.
I got the plow and the lemon ricotta pancakes weren't phenomenal, they were sort of bready, burnt and a bit on the smaller side as a part of the combo.
And the pancakes came on the same plate as the rest of my crowded plate... which meant syrup leaking into my eggs and potatoes...
The eggs, apple sausage were mediocre - I could have replicated something similar @ home.
the plow.author: Christine B.
the plow.review:
I really really wanted to love this place with all my heart.... I had been dreaming of the day I could eat here - It was on my "SF Bucket List" Finally after sitting outside for 45-50 minutes on a Tuesday morning at 11 -- my rumbling tummy met with the plow... pancakes, potatoes, eggs sausage for about $15.

I got the plow and the lemon ricotta pancakes weren't phenomenal, they were sort of bready, burnt and a bit on the smaller side as a part of the combo. And the pancakes came on the same plate as the rest of my crowded plate... which meant syrup leaking into my eggs and potatoes...  The eggs, apple sausage were mediocre - I could have replicated something similar @ home. The highlight of the plate were the potatoes though -  super crispey on the outside like a fry, but soft on the inside like a baked potato. 

The service was good - the staff were upbeat and welcoming. Food wasn't brought out quickly and they seated 5 of us at a table and bench made for 4. Maybe eating with my elbow in my friends face made the food taste less good?

Overall - it's ok, but not worth 45 minutes though.

excerpts: I ordered "The Plow" which consists of 2 lemon ricotta pancakes, crispy potatoes, eggs your way, and your choice of bacon, chicken apple sausage, or the house sausage.
the plow.author: Marcus B.
the plow.review:
Two words: crispy potatoes. 

I came here for brunch after a night of drinking well tequila at a bar whose name is slipping my mind. We got here on a Tuesday around 1030 and the place was packed. Luckily we didn't have to wait long for a table for 3. The staff is friendly and attentive. 

I ordered "The Plow" which consists of 2 lemon ricotta pancakes, crispy potatoes, eggs your way, and your choice of bacon, chicken apple sausage, or the house sausage.

I cleaned my plate! This place  is awesome and I wish there was something similar to it around where I live.

I will definitely be back if I'm ever in the area. 

Go get Plowed! (Sorry, couldn't resist.)

excerpts: It would not hurt to live down the street and show up at the door when they open, but I will definitely hold future pancake places to the Plow standard.
the plow.author: Liaty Z.
the plow.review:
Be prepared to wait..and wait..and wait some more.  On a Sunday, the list fills up to three or four pages, and it feels like winning the lottery when you get a table.  Still, the food was worth the wait and full of delicious brunching goodness. 

-Crispy potatoes with a chewy center
-Double thick pancakes that make you feel like you died and went to pancake heaven (I had the GF ones--but they were delicious)
-Smoky, albeit greasy bacon.
-And savory pockets of deliciousness called breakfast sausage

Would I go here for brunch again?  It would not hurt to live down the street and show up at the door when they open, but I will definitely hold future pancake places to the Plow standard.

excerpts: Get their lemon ricotta pancakes or "The Plow."
If they have buttermilk biscuits, don't miss 'em!
the plow.author: Thomas B.
the plow.review:
One word...wow.  :)  

Get their lemon ricotta pancakes or "The Plow."  If they have buttermilk biscuits, don't miss 'em!

excerpts: We got the fried egg sandwich and "the plow" which had everything.
Fried egg sandwich was tasty, but didn't exactly meet my requirements to be called "heavenly".
the plow.author: Kate Y.
the plow.review:
Right off the bat, I liked Plow. It looked like a crazy wait outside and the hostess told us it would be a 20 minute wait. They had this self-serve coffee section inside so we sipped some coffee and were seated within 10 minutes. Thank you for not lying to us and telling us it's a 20 minute wait when really it's 40 minutes like some other brunch places out there....

We got the fried egg sandwich and "the plow" which had everything. Fried egg sandwich was tasty, but didn't exactly meet my requirements to be called "heavenly". However, the lemon ricotta pancakes with the citrus-y syrup was deeelicious! I actually dipped my bacon, and then my potatoes when the bacon ran out, into that maple syrup and cleaned up 2 mini pitchers of it. Everything else was great but not spectacular. 

Just an fyi though, I totally thought that the coffee everyone got waiting for a table was free...like a "Thank you for waking up at 7:30am on a Sunday morning to brunch here only to have to wait outside in the cold anyways" type of free coffee, which I thought was so sweet of Plow. But then I saw a $4/cup charge on my bill. hmph...

excerpts: Our group of six five had the Plow their signature dish..
And it was awesome !
The potatoes perfect the lemon pancakes
WOW !
Something everyone should try!!
Your missing out if you do not try it.
the plow.author: Richard D.
the plow.review:
Why this place does not have 5 stars is amazing to me. 
Yes you have a long wait BUT every second is worth it. 
The food is great. Our group of six five had the Plow their signature dish.. And it was awesome ! The potatoes perfect the lemon pancakes WOW ! 
Something everyone should try!! 
Your missing out if you do not try it.

excerpts: The plow is always my favorite thing to order with mimosas of course (;
the plow.author: Danica C.
the plow.review: Every time I come to San Francisco I can't leave without a breakfast at plow! This spot is so yummy and it's always at the top of my list. Place is small and very popular so I suggest early arrival, and the wait is well worth it! The plow is always my favorite thing to order with mimosas of course (;

excerpts: I ordered the plow, a side of the market fruit & a grapefruit mimosa.
Everything was amazing & the service was very friendly.
My husband & I did have to wait about an hour or more to get a table, but it was well worth it!
Go & wait for a table!
You won't regret it!
the plow.author: Molly M.
the plow.review: Hands down the best brunch I have ever had! I ordered the plow, a side of the market fruit & a grapefruit mimosa. Everything was amazing & the service was very friendly. My husband & I did have to wait about an hour or more to get a table, but it was well worth it! Go & wait for a table! You won't regret it!

excerpts: We had The Plow:  eggs, sausage, lemon ricotta pancakes and crispy potatoes.
Pretty basic for an arm and a leg.
The lemon ricotta pancakes were pretty tasty.
The eggs and bacon were cooked perfectly but
the crispy potatoes... weren't so crispy.
We also had the egg sandwich with bacon.
MMMMM delicious!
The bacon was nice and thick, the egg was cooked perfectly and the bun they use is acme, so, can't go wrong there.
the plow.author: Delilah B.
the plow.review:
The Venue:  Very bright with natural lighting.  Simple and clean looking.  

The Price:  A little on the high end for breakfast.

The wait:  I've driven by quite a few times and it's always packed.  So we decided to go when they opened.  8am.  There are no reservations so you may have to wait.  The bad thing about coming first thing is you get the first wave wait.  It wasn't as bad as some places, but it beats waiting outside or standing.  :)

The neighborhood:  It's in Potrero Hill/ Dogpatch area so everywhere around there is pretty cute and quaint.

The food:  They have a great menu and everything sounds awesome.  
We had The Plow:  eggs, sausage, lemon ricotta pancakes and crispy potatoes.
 Pretty basic for an arm and a leg.  The lemon ricotta pancakes were pretty tasty.  The eggs and bacon were cooked perfectly but the crispy potatoes... weren't so crispy.
We also had the egg sandwich with bacon.  MMMMM delicious!  The bacon was nice and thick, the egg was cooked perfectly and the bun they use is acme, so, can't go wrong there.  The whole sandwich was melt in your mouth perfect.

I would definitely come again and will so that I can try out all of there other delicious menu items.

excerpts: I only ever get the aptly named "The Plow" dish.
the plow.author: Seth D.
the plow.review: Simply the best. I only ever get the aptly named "The Plow" dish. Best Lemon Ricotta pancakes around

excerpts: I ordered the plow and the best part of it where the lemon ricotta pancakes; I only wish they were bigger.
I waited literally two hours, myself another person, so we were only a small party of two
.I
don't think I'd go back because of this.
Maybe I didn't order the right thing but the food was (only) pretty, good and the service was good, but the wait kind of killed it for me.
the plow.author: R J.
the plow.review:
I was here a couple weeks ago on a Sunday,
around 11 AM, for the first time. I ordered the plow and the best part of it where the lemon ricotta pancakes; I only wish they were bigger. I waited literally two hours, myself another person, so we were only a small party of two .I don't think I'd go back because of this. Maybe I didn't order the right thing but the food was (only) pretty, good and the service was good, but the wait kind of killed it for me.

excerpts: Husband at The Plow
and it did not disappoint.
the plow.author: Nina L.
the plow.review:
It's rare that both of us are awake before 8 on a Saturday so when we found ourselves up and starving at 7:30, we hopped in the car and headed over to Plow.  Got there just in time for the doors to open so there was no wait.  Good thing too because the restaurant filled up very quickly.  It's a really cute space and they had tables and chairs set-up outside too.  

We started with the donut holes filled with an awesome lemon curd.  The lemon curd had a tart kick but was smooth and creamy inside some hot fried dough.  I had the french toast with vanilla-poached pears.  It was sweet and savory and satisfying.  Husband at The Plow and it did not disappoint.  LOVED the fried potatoes and the lemon ricotta pancakes were yummy.  

The quality of the food was excellent and they get fresh and local ingredients from vendors I recognize from the farmer's market nearby.

excerpts: You Most get the plow!!!
FYI...
the home fries are out of this world.
One caveat, food preparation is unique to say the least.
the plow.author: Miguel C.
the plow.review: Amazing atmosphere, really friendly staff. You Most get the plow!!!  FYI...the home fries are out of this world.  One caveat, food preparation is unique to say the least.

excerpts: As for three rest of "The Plow" (everyone should begin the day with a good plow), the lemon ricotta pancakes are delicious.
The eggs were good, but nothing special.
the plow.author: Hester B.
the plow.review:
I'm now ruined for all other potatoes. Are they deep fried? The texture is soft in the center and crispy in the outside with perfect seasoning. As for three rest of "The Plow" (everyone should begin the day with a good plow), the lemon ricotta pancakes are delicious. The eggs were good, but nothing special. Good coffee, also nothing special.

What I found confusing was how this place could be full with a waiting list at 10:30am on a weekday morning. I can't even imagine what the weekend must be like.

excerpts: My husband and I enjoyed our meals, we both opted for the plow, he had the sausage which was also good and we ordered a side of bacon.
The mimosas were good as well.
the plow.author: Sheira C.
the plow.review: Only reason I'm giving this place four stars is because of the wait time, otherwise it would have been a 5. Also, the outside seating was a bit harsh for the day's weather, but they did provide us with two blankets (we had to wait a bit for them to free up). However, it was pretty fun eating on a hill.The homemade sausage patties are to die for! There was also a corn muffin that was pretty awesome. My husband and I enjoyed our meals, we both opted for the plow, he had the sausage which was also good and we ordered a side of bacon. The mimosas were good as well.

excerpts: (THE PLOW $17) trust me
order it you will finish and love it.) also ordered French Toast(2 THICK SLICES $12) also NEUSKES bacon (side).
ALL in ALL a perfect breakfast for 3 total was $55.00.
Plus we included a visit to ANCHOR STEAM BREWERY-just around the corner at DE HARO/MARIPOSA to buy some cold ones for the UBER ride home-
hey we walked here c'mon)
the plow.author: Tim R.
the plow.review: This place in a WORD PROBABLY THE BEST BREAKFAST in SOMA and MAYBE SAN FRANCISCO.  JOEL is a BREAKFAST and FRESH FOOD KING.  We had heard the LEMON RICOTTA PANCAKES were AWESOME and people ARE RIGHT THEY ARE!!!! PERFECT!!!!  However our waitress Was PERFECT in the suggestions.  The day started off with a LONG WALK from NOB HILL (California/JONES) hey we knew we were going to eat a lot!!!  After our sojourn through SOMA, we found this casual and comforting spot known as PLOW.  The place is not large but the host and hostess(SOMA residents) make it work.  There are a few outside tables as well.  NOW for the STAR the food.  We started with a perfectly balanced MIMOSA ($11) to pass the 30 minute wait time pleasantly enough.  After we were seated we ordered based on the waitress selections (THE PLOW $17) trust me order it you will finish and love it.) also ordered French Toast(2 THICK SLICES $12) also NEUSKES bacon (side).  ALL in ALL a perfect breakfast for 3 total was $55.00.  Plus we included a visit to ANCHOR STEAM BREWERY-just around the corner at DE HARO/MARIPOSA to buy some cold ones for the UBER ride home- hey we walked here c'mon)

excerpts: Had to get The Plow, which seemed to have a little bit of everything on the menu, and it was delicious!
Had we waited more than 30 minutes for a table, my expectations would be higher.
the plow.author: Zell C.
the plow.review:
Every time I pass by, there's always a line. People are willing to wait more than an hour for a seat? Peaked my interest, but I don't have time for that. Seriously.

This time, we were lucky. Got parking, and got seated for two in less than 5 minutes. Had to get The Plow, which seemed to have a little bit of everything on the menu, and it was delicious! Had we waited more than 30 minutes for a table, my expectations would be higher. The crispy potatoes were a bit salty, but the ketchup saved it. The lemon ricotta pancakes were the best, and I, of course, saved it for last.

Right when we left, there were about 15 people waiting out the door for a seat.

excerpts: I had the plow and it was a lot of food but very good.
I got it with the housemade pork sausage which was delicious.
the plow.author: Blake B.
the plow.review:
Only three stars you ask?  Well 3 stars in my book means that a place was good but not extraordinary.  My wife and I went this past weekend and we had to wait for about an hour outside which wasn't ideal.  We thought the meal was going to be amazing though and like I said it was good.  

We sat at the counter and was able to see all of the goodness being made.  We started with the fried doughnut holes which were good but crispier than I thought they were going to be.  I had the plow and it was a lot of food but very good.  I got it with the housemade pork sausage which was delicious.  The lemon ricotta pancakes were very light and tasty and were probably the best thing I had.

The meal was good and place pretty cool but I think there are other breakfast places I'd rather wait an hour for.

excerpts: We had the plow and the fired egg sandwich with a side of sausage.
The food was really good, but be prepared for a wait.
We got there at 8:30 and there was already a 45 minute wait.
the plow.author: Ragen C.
the plow.review: We had the plow and the fired egg sandwich with a side of sausage. The food was really good, but be prepared for a wait. We got there at 8:30 and there was already a 45 minute wait.

excerpts: And of course the lemon ricotta pancakes and the plow potatoes that I have read so much about were better than I expected.
the plow.author: Kristen T.
the plow.review:
I enrolled in a Sunday morning Plow class offered by the San Francisco Cooking School and had the wonderful experience of cooking several of Plow's menu items with the owners, Maxine and Joel. I have never been to their restaurant but after reading all the wonderful reviews I thought, "what a great opportunity!" 
 First and for most, the owners of Plow are incredibly nice people.  It's was very obvious while speaking with them that they have a love and passion for what they do: making delicious food, using fresh ingredients, and quality over quantity. 

The class made the following menu items: 
 Pecan streusel muffins
 Lemon ricotta pancakes (and for those who don't know, the ricotta is home made, not store bough...talk about fresh)
 Shirred eggs with tomato and gruyere
 Biscuits and gravy
 Quiche
 Chinese breakfast (caramelized pork shoulder with eggs over rice)
 Plow potatoes 
 Smoked trout salad

 Breakfast is my favorite meal; I love it all and was so impressed with the meal we made! The pork shoulder in the Chinese breakfast was mouthwatering. The tomato sauce for the shirred eggs...so fresh, a taste you would expect from an Italian restaurant. The savory sausage gravy over perfected buttermilk biscuits...amazing! And of course the lemon ricotta pancakes and the plow potatoes that I have read so much about were better than I expected. I am very picky about home fries/hash browns, and often find most restaurants just miss the mark, but Plow's technique of cooking their potatoes ensures every bite is full of flavor. 

I can not say enough about my breakfast experience!! I will soon make a trip to the city with my husband so he can experience the goodness of Plow.

excerpts: I ordered the plow with chicken apple sausage.
My favorite was, surprisingly, their potatoes.
I devoured them.
A tad too salty, but fried to absolute perfection.
the plow.author: Sophia B.
the plow.review: The wait was about 15 minutes for a table outside on Saturday at 9:30 am. I ordered the plow with chicken apple sausage. My favorite was, surprisingly, their potatoes. I devoured them. A tad too salty, but fried to absolute perfection. My lemon ricotta pancakes were also fluffy and delicious, with just enough lemon. Did not care for their chicken apple sausage though- only thing I didn't finish on my plate. My husband also enjoyed his ham eggs benedict.

excerpts: I had "The Plow" which was exactly like a midwest breakfast but with the healthy, organic touch that I'm familiar with in Boulder.
the plow.author: Justin H.
the plow.review:
This is the best brunch spot I've been to in the city.

I have lived in Boulder, CO and grew up in the Midwest. It has the best of both worlds. I had "The Plow" which was exactly like a midwest breakfast but with the healthy, organic touch that I'm familiar with in Boulder.

My reviews are base on food.

Expect long waits 30min -1hr. They also didn't have a liquor menu incase you like drinks with your brunch. Definitely the first place brunch spot I'd take my friends when they are in town.

excerpts: We were seated outside, and I ordered The Plow, which included: 2 pancakes, 3 pieces of bacon, 2 eggs, and some potatoes.
In addition, I ordered some chicken sausages on the side.
The pancakes had this orange taste to it, which was interesting and pretty good compared to any pancake I've ever had, the bacon and eggs were standard, but the potatoes were cooked to perfection
and I enjoyed every pieces even the crumbs of the potato skins.
The chicken sausages were pretty good, probably wouldn't get it next time thought, it's just typical sausages.
Honestly, for $15 for the The Plow alone, the portion was pretty small
the plow.author: Bryant D.
the plow.review:
Pretty good place to have brunch.  The inside of this place looks pretty nice, but just a bit small, which will result in a long wait.  We had to wait a little over an hour to be seat, but that's probably because we had a party of 7.  We were fine with it because it was a nice place to hang out, with a view of SF down the street.  We were seated outside, and I ordered The Plow, which included: 2 pancakes, 3 pieces of bacon, 2 eggs, and some potatoes.  In addition, I ordered some chicken sausages on the side.  The pancakes had this orange taste to it, which was interesting and pretty good compared to any pancake I've ever had, the bacon and eggs were standard, but the potatoes were cooked to perfection and I enjoyed every pieces even the crumbs of the potato skins.  The chicken sausages were pretty good, probably wouldn't get it next time thought, it's just typical sausages.  Honestly, for $15 for the The Plow alone, the portion was pretty small so I probably won't eat here again next time.

The long wait for a high priced small portion meal was disappointing.

excerpts: The plow was good
but I like the egg Benedict with salmon/spinach shroom more.
Their coffee is way better than the drip coffee half a block away.
the plow.author: Anna W.
the plow.review:
Brunch was awesome.  Thought we came early (10am) but trust me, there's a bunch of others waiting before you.  Even though they said 1.5-2hours wait for the 5 of us, I think we only waited 45mins.  You have a choice of seating inside or outside...or both.  We just wanted to eat so when outdoor settings became available, we took it.  

If you sit outdoor, bring a blanket or a nice warm jacket, it's super cold. 
The plow was good but I like the egg Benedict with salmon/spinach shroom more.  
Their coffee is way better than the drip coffee half a block away.

excerpts: I ordered The Plow and couldn't help myself but to devour the entirety of it.
the plow.author: Teresa T.
the plow.review: I now understand the hype about Plow though the wait is ridiculous! We had a friend thankfully who lived nearby Plow so she put in our names two hours ahead of time for weekend brunch - we were a table of six. Otherwise I'm not sure if I would have waited that day - while Plow provides tea and coffee while you wait you are outside and it was drizzling that day so would have been miserable. The space is small and there is only one unisex bathroom behind a curtain. I ordered The Plow and couldn't help myself but to devour the entirety of it. The potatoes lived up to the hype and the lemon ricotta pancakes were a divine finish to the meal though the housemade pork sausage patties were probably my least favorite - they lacked salt or a kick in my opinion. Plus coffee is bottomless so caffeinate away! I'd love to try the breakfast sandwich next time or some other things - everything looked so delicious.

excerpts: I had their signature brunch item,  "the plow.
the plow.author: Crystal J.
the plow.review:
If it weren't for the one hour and fifteen minute wait before being seated, I would rate this place five stars. I had their signature brunch item,  "the plow." I loved the crispy potatoes, and the chicken apple sausage was also tasty.  I ordered my eggs scrambled, and wasn't too satisfied - while they were certainly well-cooked,  they were rather bland and tasteless. 

The highlight of the meal was certainly the lemon ricotta pancakes, which I advise you save for last! They were just the right size, moist, and flavorful. The maple syrup is also fantastic. 

I'd probably return, but I'd make sure to get there right when it opens at 8 am to get a seat immediately.

excerpts:
what my friends and I ordered: 

the plow (two eggs (any style), crispy potatoes, bacon or chicken-apple sausage, two (smaller than the full-plate option) lemon ricotta pancakes: amazing combination!
the lemon ricotta pancakes were good
the plow.author: Patricia K.
the plow.review:
Cute brunch place with delicious food!

what my friends and I ordered: 

the plow (two eggs (any style), crispy potatoes, bacon or chicken-apple sausage, two (smaller than the full-plate option) lemon ricotta pancakes: amazing combination! I get a little bit of everything which is perfect. the lemon ricotta pancakes were good but I had a bite of my friend's almond pancakes and those were AMAZING (just the perfect hint of almond flavor- not overbearing but lingers in your mouth long enough for you to crave more!)

I highly recommend going on a weekday. my friends and i arrived on a friday morning around 9:30am and waited ~20 minutes for seats in front of the restaurant (longer wait if you want to sit inside). 

you should definitely check this place out if you like brunch and you're willing to wait!

excerpts: The wait is long, but food soooo worth it, get the plow a little bit of everything and soo good and the lemon ricotta pancakes were BomB!
the plow.author: jonathan g.
the plow.review: The wait is long, but food soooo worth it, get the plow a little bit of everything and soo good and the lemon ricotta pancakes were BomB!

excerpts:
i'll take it over normal scrambled eggs any day 
- the plow - eggs, bacon, lemon ricotta pancakes, potatoes - everything on this dish was amazing!
pancakes i normally don't like
but these ones were amazing.
i even wished they were bigger.
and the potatoes - so crispy and yum!
- smoked salmon toast
- it was good cause i love smoked salmon but wasn't anything special, if you have to chose
the first two are better.
i just wish they had bloody mary's on the menu.
but i guess i'll settle for a mimosa
not sure if i would come often
since the wait is soo long
but if the occasion calls for it, i would.
the food IS good!
the plow.author: Jen S.
the plow.review:
wow got here before 9am and the wait is an hour and a half? are you kidding me? luckily my friend lived close by and so we ran some errands and came back just in time for our name to be called. we ordered: 
- soft scrambled eggs - this dish sounds so normal but is so good. i'll take it over normal scrambled eggs any day 
- the plow - eggs, bacon, lemon ricotta pancakes, potatoes - everything on this dish was amazing! pancakes i normally don't like but these ones were amazing. i even wished they were bigger. and the potatoes - so crispy and yum!
- smoked salmon toast - it was good cause i love smoked salmon but wasn't anything special, if you have to chose the first two are better. 
i just wish they had bloody mary's on the menu. but i guess i'll settle for a mimosa ;) not sure if i would come often since the wait is soo long but if the occasion calls for it, i would. the food IS good!

excerpts: We decided on The Plow and the Fried egg sandwich.
The Plow comes with two eggs, crispy potatoes, lemon ricotta pancakes and a choice of meat.
The Plow is a great option if you want a hearty breakfast.
the plow.author: Jeannie C.
the plow.review:
Every time I visit SF, my sister brings me to a "must try" place. This past weekend she brought me here for breakfast. We got around the area around 8:30 am and parking was easy to find and best of all no wait to get seated. My sister did warn me on the weekend, however, the wait can be over an hour so I am glad we were there on a Friday. 

They have great options on their menu but I had my sister decide what to get. We decided on The Plow and the Fried egg sandwich. The Plow comes with two eggs, crispy potatoes, lemon ricotta pancakes and a choice of meat. We chose the plate with chicken apple sausage. 

Both plates were delicious. The freshness in the ingredients were there. The Plow is a great option if you want a hearty breakfast. The lemon ricotta pancakes are fluffy, although i usually don't opt for anything lemon-y, these were really good and I did eat it all. The eggs were perfectly cooked to my liking. I really wish I can mimic their crispy potatoes because they are the BEST breakfast potatoes I ever eaten; it is extra crispy on the outside, but not at all over cooked on the inside. The chicken apple sausage was yummy too. Everything on the plate complimented well with one another. The fried egg sandwich has frisee, cheese and two friend eggs between a soft warm bun. I don't really like frisee but it really worked well with the cheese and the saltiness of the egg. The sandwich also comes with crispy potatoes. 

Service was friendly and quick. It is very cozy in there...just the way I like it in this type of places especially in the Bay. Can't wait to return.

excerpts:
In the interest of tasting as many items as possible - I got the Plow breakfast, with lemon ricotta pancakes, pork sausage, scrambled eggs, and their revered crispy potatoes. 

And the lemon ricotta pancakes were just a hint of sweet which I really appreciate.
the plow.author: Allison V.
the plow.review:
Although I moved to the neighborhood about 9 months ago, I hadn't yet tried this place because the wait is JUST. SO. LONG.  

Today I thought I would pop in by myself for a late lunch at the counter, and ohmygod now I understand. 

In the interest of tasting as many items as possible - I got the Plow breakfast, with lemon ricotta pancakes, pork sausage, scrambled eggs, and their revered crispy potatoes. 

This might be the most perfect breakfast I have ever eaten. Thank you Plow for MAKING MY DAY!

The eggs were a totally even and perfect soft scramble.  The housemade pork sausage with fennel flavor was legit.  The potatoes were chunky and smashed to deliver extra crispy surface area with a soft center ... and the most intoxicating aroma of rosemary.  And the lemon ricotta pancakes were just a hint of sweet which I really appreciate. 

All of this deliciousness, delivered with smiling and thoughtful service.  

I can't wait to go back! (except, ahem, I will have to...)

excerpts: I usually get the Plow with ricotta pancakes and house made sausage, or the breakfast sandwich.
All of the food looks amazing and is simply delicious.
Warning the wait is 1-1.5 hours, so just put you name on the list and walk around the cute neighborhood.
the plow.author: Jordana C.
the plow.review: Top three favorite brunch spots in SF! I usually get the Plow with ricotta pancakes and house made sausage, or the breakfast sandwich. All of the food looks amazing and is simply delicious. Warning the wait is 1-1.5 hours, so just put you name on the list and walk around the cute neighborhood.

excerpts: Hubs got the Plow ($15) plate which comes with 2 eggs, meat of your choice (i.e. bacon, apple chicken sausage, etc), 2 lemon ricotta pancakes, and crispy potatoes.
The lemon ricotta pancakes were delish too.
Thicker and more dense, the light lemon flavor was a nice surprise.
And with a dab or two of maple syrup, it was great.
Just wished the pancakes were bigger.
These were about the size of a woman's palm.
the plow.author: Cindy W.
the plow.review:
Had to wait like 20 minutes on a random Friday lunch. Don't people work around here?

Anyway, we were seated outdoors, balancing on the sloping sidewalk, but it was nice out so we could watch the 22 MUNI roll on by.

Hubs got the Plow ($15) plate which comes with 2 eggs, meat of your choice (i.e. bacon, apple chicken sausage, etc), 2 lemon ricotta pancakes, and crispy potatoes.

I ordered the Fried Egg Sandwich ($11), 2 eggs over easy so that yolk is still runny, with a slice of cheese, frisee greens in a soft bun. Side of potatoes too. My sandwich was on the bland side, since I didn't add bacon (+$2). Even avocados would have been an add on. Too bad. I think they should just offer it on for more texture and taste. But I sprinkled some hot sauce and ketchup and that helped. 

The potatoes were really the stand out though. They must use a blend of small potatoes and sweet ones, with skin on and deep fried, then tossed in seasoning. Very savory and flavorful. First time I polished off my potatoes since I'm not a big potato starch fan.

The lemon ricotta pancakes were delish too. Thicker and more dense, the light lemon flavor was a nice surprise. And with a dab or two of maple syrup, it was great. Just wished the pancakes were bigger. These were about the size of a woman's palm. Could have easily had 1 more on the plate. 

Overall, cute place, with food done well.

excerpts: I got "The Plow" with house made pork sausages and poached eggs.
Boyfriend got corned beef hash (the best he has ever had).
Amazing breakfast potatoes, crispy and ton of fresh herbs.
For the quantity and QUALITY of ingredients, it is totally well priced.
the plow.author: Adele A.
the plow.review:
THE best breakfast of my life. I got "The Plow" with house made pork sausages and poached eggs. Boyfriend got corned beef hash (the best he has ever had). Amazing breakfast potatoes, crispy and ton of fresh herbs. For the quantity and QUALITY of ingredients, it is totally well priced. The wait staff were wonderful and recommended we get a Bloody Mary down the street that def put hair on our chest. 

This is the kind of spot that I will take out of town guests and/or recommend to others.

excerpts: The Plow" is always great, be sure to get the bacon and order a side of the sausage.
Almond pancakes are amazing.
Some of the best pancakes I have ever had - Gluten free people will rejoice.
Don't be frightened by the long wait, well worth it.
Go to Farley's and grab some coffee and enjoy the unique and amazing view of San Francisco.
the plow.author: Mark H.
the plow.review: I have been coming here for years. Food is always delicious and never disappoints. "The Plow" is always great, be sure to get the bacon and order a side of the sausage. Almond pancakes are amazing. Some of the best pancakes I have ever had - Gluten free people will rejoice. Don't be frightened by the long wait, well worth it. Go to Farley's and grab some coffee and enjoy the unique and amazing view of San Francisco.

excerpts: We ordered The Plow which offers a variety of house favorites - eggs, sausage, lemon ricotta pancakes and crispy potatoes - and watched from the bar as our food was prepared.
The kitchen was clean, efficient, and smelled wonderful.
Food arrived quickly, everything was perfectly prepared, and the meal was out of this world.
The lemon ricotta pancakes were especially amazing.
the plow.author: Kim R.
the plow.review:
The best breakfast I have had in SF for a number of years!  
5 stars based on food and service 
2 stars based on wait time

Be prepared for a wait before seating!  We went on a weekday, and even then there was a 10 minute wait for seats at the bar.   If you go on a weekend, be prepared for a much longer wait!

We ordered The Plow which offers a variety of house favorites - eggs, sausage, lemon ricotta pancakes and crispy potatoes - and watched from the bar as our food was prepared.  The kitchen was clean, efficient, and smelled wonderful.  
Food arrived quickly, everything was perfectly prepared, and the meal was out of this world.  The lemon ricotta pancakes were especially amazing.

If you have the time, definitely a must visit!

excerpts: I ordered the plow (eggs, bacon, potatoes with 2 lemon ricotta pancakes) and everything was yummy, except for the pancakes which I had actually come here for.
With all the hype and raves, I was ready to devour it all and plead for the recipe.
However, they were too doughy for my taste.
It tasted gritty, like oats or some kind of mealy grain.
the plow.author: Lil D.
the plow.review:
It takes great effort for me to come here, as I don't live in San Francisco any more, and I'm 45min away in the burbs... I finally made it on a Wednesday at around 1pm, which I still had to wait. It's a very small place.

I ordered the plow (eggs, bacon, potatoes with 2 lemon ricotta pancakes) and everything was yummy, except for the pancakes which I had actually come here for. With all the hype and raves, I was ready to devour it all and plead for the recipe. However, they were too doughy for my taste. It tasted gritty, like oats or some kind of mealy grain. Needless to say, I left them half eaten. 

But the potatoes were the best! crispy all around and so flavorful. Don't know what/how they make them but you've got to try these. and I'm not even a potato fan.

Service was attentive. 

Parking is difficult around the crowded neighborhood. 

May return another day to try other breakfast items.

excerpts: We ordered "the plow" which came with eggs, sausages, fried potato (their version of home fries) and lemon ricotta pancakes.
The eggs and sausage were fine, the usual.
The fried potato was nice and crispy but a bit salty.
the plow.author: Joyce L.
the plow.review:
Hooray for another San Franciscan brunch place! Really enjoyed the ambiance and the location of the restaurant. 

We ordered "the plow" which came with eggs, sausages, fried potato (their version of home fries) and lemon ricotta pancakes.  The eggs and sausage were fine, the usual.  The fried potato was nice and crispy but a bit salty.  The pancakes were definitely good, but i feel it can only be appreciated by lemon enthusiasts.

We also ordered the French toast.  A lot different from other brunch places due to the unique bread.  Bread was thick but had a lot of holes inside but that was good cause it kept the syrup inside.  It was garnished with apricots which are always good.

Overall a good brunch spot and a welcome addition to the SF area.

excerpts: I got "The Plow" and my wife got a fried egg sandwich.
After an awesome and filling brunch, and a mimosa a piece, we headed back home.
I'm writing this review upon waking up from my post-brunch nap.
Pro's - Food is fantastic.
the plow.author: Justin W.
the plow.review:
We showed up close to Noon.  They told us it was a 90 min wait, but it only took abot an hour.  
Once we got a seat, the staff was super friendly and fast to our table.  I got "The Plow" and my wife got a fried egg sandwich.  After an awesome and filling brunch, and a mimosa a piece, we headed back home.   I'm writing this review upon waking up from my post-brunch nap.
Pro's - Food is fantastic.  My lemon ricotta pancakes were perfectly done, the crispy potatoes were wonderous and the homemade sausage was flavorful.  The staff is friendly and the vibe is upbeat.  
Cons - It's a small place and you'll sit close to your neighbor (we were ok with this).  And this spot is not a secret so expect a wait.

excerpts: We both already knew we wanted the Plow (little bit of everything!) and got the buttered bread and homemade preserves as a starter.
The bread was definitely tasty but the jam was honestly nothing mind blowing (it was mixed berry).
Also it was a super small portion so each of us got only 2 tiny baguette pieces.
the plow.author: Naseem K.
the plow.review:
So I think Plow is definitely a solid 4 but nothing more than that. Which was a bit of a let down for me because I had heard SO much about this place -- even some of my foodie friends calling it their favorite brunch in the city. I was hesitant on going there on a weekend because I knew the wait would be crazy but my friend who was visiting me had a car and down to drive us and was adamant on trying a new place which was perfect for me since Plow had been on my bucket list for so long. 

We got there and were greeted with a FAT line out the door. The host told us the wait for 2 was easily an hour. Expecting that, we put our names down and headed around the neighborhood to scope it out while we waited (and Potrero Hill is very cute I might add). We came back exactly an hour later and were seated inside. The spot is super cute but it's also very small which totally explains why the wait is always so long. We both already knew we wanted the Plow (little bit of everything!) and got the buttered bread and homemade preserves as a starter. The bread was definitely tasty but the jam was honestly nothing mind blowing (it was mixed berry). Also it was a super small portion so each of us got only 2 tiny baguette pieces. I guess it's meant to be only for one. 

Anyways, another good thing was that the food came out relatively fast. Here's my breakdown on each of the parts of the dish:
- Eggs: MIND blowing for SURE. You could tell in an instant that these eggs were farm fresh and organic. I loved them.
- Chicken apple sausage: Very average IMO. The nice thing was that they got our dishes mixed up and actually brought both of us bacon but when we told them they brought us five sausages each -- which was more than enough!
- Bacon: Super average. Sweet Maple's is 100X better.
- Country potatoes: Definitely good but I thought they were a little too fried. They could have been just regular potatoes and still been just as good without being overly crispy. But I still enjoyed!
- Pancakes: Good too but I was super sad to realize they didn't blow my mind. Now just a disclaimer -- if you like anything lemony then you will LOVE this -- because the texture is bomb, the portion is perfect, and the consistency is great (not too dry, not too soppy). But sadly I'm just really not a lemon person (never been into any lemony desserts either), but I LOVE my pancakes. So I enjoyed these but I wasn't blown away. My friend on the other hand loved them. I also should have known I probably wouldn't be obsessed, but my friends had told you could barely taste the lemon (which is not true). 

All in all, excellent dining experience, ambiance, and service. You could tell the food was fresh too -- but I just wasn't blown away which is what I expected from a place with Plow's reputation. Not to say that's bad, I think a solid 4 is awesome, but I'm always in search of a 5 for brunching because I'm such a tough critic with it. (Olea still has my heart at #1). But I definitely loved my meal at Plow and do not regret going for 1 second!

excerpts: You MUST get The Plow.
the plow.author: P. L.
the plow.review:
You MUST get The Plow. You'll thank me later.

It comes with lemon ricotta cheese pancakes, eggs, sausage and potatoes. It's AMAZING.

excerpts: Generally I like to try what a place is known for on the first visit, which would thus be the Plow, but my friend decided to order one herself and offered to have me try some of her lemon ricotta pancakes.
I easily obliged and chose a brunch favorite of mine anywhere: eggs benedict with ham.
First of all, I loved my eggs benedict.
Not too much hollandaise sauce and the english muffins were quite big, and quite deliciously fluffy.
Also: I love eggs.
Good choice, me.
I also had a little bit of my friends' pancakes.
It was then in that moment of that first bite when I promised myself I'd be back to have a whole plate of it for myself.
the plow.author: Allen Mark A.
the plow.review:
I told myself that I would only review restaurants I've visited at least twice, but I think I liked it enough not to wait... aaaand San Francisco is far-ish :(

One of my friends took me here for a weekend brunch so we could catch up. We got there at about 12:40 (I got to the city 30 minutes late and my friend got lost on the way there. You live in SF and you've been there countless times before, HOW DO YOU GET LOST??) when it was packed, giving us a 45-60 minute wait. I didn't mind at all; I'm a really patient person and we ended up spending that time in a nearby bookstore anyway. We got back and opted to eat outside on a beautiful day in the city. It was kind of awkward eating on a slanted plane, but it wasn't terribly uncomfortable. And the pigeons walking around the tables got a little bothersome (but not in an annoying way, if that makes sense), but that's also a risk you take sitting outside. And the blankets they had available were a nice touch in case it got chilly. Okay, none of y'all want to hear about this, let's talk food!

Generally I like to try what a place is known for on the first visit, which would thus be the Plow, but my friend decided to order one herself and offered to have me try some of her lemon ricotta pancakes. I easily obliged and chose a brunch favorite of mine anywhere: eggs benedict with ham. First of all, I loved my eggs benedict. Not too much hollandaise sauce and the english muffins were quite big, and quite deliciously fluffy. Also: I love eggs. Good choice, me. I also had a little bit of my friends' pancakes. It was then in that moment of that first bite when I promised myself I'd be back to have a whole plate of it for myself. Oh, and I can't forget:

Them crispy potatoes, tho.

I'd come back just for them, TBH. Furthermore, our waitress was super nice (and super cute) and, oh, they have Tapatio. I already liked this place from first impression, but honestly they had me at Tapatio. The coffee was decent, though I'd love to try their cold brew some time. It wasn't quite warm enough that day for it. WELP I guess that's another reason to come back huh?

Anyway, to sum up, there really wasn't anything from my experience that would deserve to have a star docked off, so 5 it is! I'll be back, it's just a matter of when at this point. Thanks!

excerpts: I ordered the Plow ($15) -- good way to sample what they they do best.
the plow.author: Kendra W.
the plow.review:
We came last week when it was sprinkling (more like misting).  No other groups wanted outside tables, so we bypassed the TWO HOUR wait and endured a little chilly drizzle over hot coffee and good food -- the smarter choice in my opinion!  Good brunch -- but really glad we didn't wait TWO HOURS.  Ambrosia from the gods would not be worth that much of my time...

I ordered the Plow ($15) -- good way to sample what they they do best.  Fresh eggs, 3 small chicken apple sausages, boatload of crispy potatoes, and 2 small lemon ricotta pancakes.  Pancakes and potatoes were the best.  I think the potatoes are flash fried or something -- amazingly crunchy, but not dripping with oil.  Best brunch potatoes I've had -- hands down.  The lemon ricotta pancakes were the perfect size (not too big - i think bottomless flapjacks is the grossest idea ever).  Texture was great and flavor was delicate and not too sweet. Yummers.

I think some claims that it's the "best brunch spot in the city" is a bit much -- but definitely a great place to try if you happen to drive by Potrero Hill and see that the line isn't too bad!

excerpts: Boyfriend got the Plow with sausage.
the plow.author: Rebecca S.
the plow.review:
Everything about this breakfast was 5 Stars.  A friend's recommendation brought my boyfriend and I here on a Friday (brunchtime-ish). Were seated promptly next to another couple at a small table in the corner. I don't mind sitting next to strangers, but I did have to get up to let them out of their seats so I am sure they felt trapped.  
Ordered the fried egg sandwhich with bacon, which was a delicious brioche bun, farm fresh eggs and crispy bacon... side of the best freakin potatoes youve ever had.  Every restaurant should take tips on their potatoes, crispy, airy, cooked all the way through, without a hint of greasiness. Heaven!  Boyfriend got the Plow with sausage. Those lemon ricotta pancakes -- flavor explosion! It was an incredible breakfast. The price was very reasonable, if not inexpensive, for the quality. Plow is a must have for every SF trip in the future now.

excerpts: Just really small portions of it on the plow plate.
the plow.author: irene u.
the plow.review:
Quality ingredients, helpful staff, but the flavors and textures didn't suit my palate. The French toast was bland, the crispy potatoes had too much Rosemary, the infamous sandwich was hardly anything to remember outside of the acme bun, the sausages (pork and chicken apple.. Were just ok).... but one thing did make my list. the lemon ricotta pancakes were the star of this meal.  Perfect combination of sweet and tart. Just really small portions of it on the plow plate.  

Was it worth the hour wait... Meh.

excerpts: My favorite dish to get is The Plow because it has a little of everything: fluffy lemon ricotta pancakes, eggs, choice of tasty meat and those crispy potatoes that made the 7x7 list.
the plow.author: Chrissy M.
the plow.review:
Assuming you're having a relaxing, weekend day and aren't in a hurry, this place is SO worth the wait!  I'm guessing it's not as busy during the week, but on the weekend, it's  not unusual to wait 45 minutes to an hour.

My boyfriend lives in Potrero and this is our favorite brunch place in the neighborhood.  Everything I've ever eaten here has been out of this world!  

They always have some yummy "starter" type items at the top of their brunch menu.  They change these up a lot, but every one I've tried has been awesome.

I don't have kids, but I saw on their website that they have a great kid's menu.  My favorite dish to get is The Plow because it has a little of everything: fluffy lemon ricotta pancakes, eggs, choice of tasty meat and those crispy potatoes that made the 7x7 list.

The restaurant is focused on using local ingredients.  They even list where the food comes from on their menu.

As I mentioned, they're always busy on the weekends.  Still, I've always had prompt friendly service.  They always offer plenty of coffee refills- love their coffee!

FYI they don't take reservations and don't serve parties over 6 people.

excerpts: Order The Plow.
You will be tempted by other things on the menu -- and the other things are good to be sure -- but The Plow is a life-altering dish.
the plow.author: Luke A.
the plow.review:
The best breakfast potatoes on earth. The lemon ricotta pancakes are also something else. Go here. Order The Plow. You will be tempted by other things on the menu -- and the other things are good to be sure -- but The Plow is a life-altering dish.

Prepare to wait for ages if you come on the weekend. Come on a middle weekday instead, and then have a nap afterwards. You'll probably dream about potatoes.

excerpts: I had The Plow and give you a taste of everything.
My friend says it is the best potatoes he ever had.
the plow.author: Mae M.
the plow.review: this little spot is great. food is delicious and service is nice. the place is very small, so expect a wait when you go. I had The Plow and give you a taste of everything. My friend says it is the best potatoes he ever had.

excerpts: If it's your first time, go with The Plow, which is eggs, potatoes, ricotta pancakes, and meat of your choice.
Everything is prepared perfectly, and in exactly the right portions.
the plow.author: Liz S.
the plow.review:
If you are looking for the quintessential San Francisco brunch experience, Plow may be it.

Views from Portrero Hill make you feel like you are on a movie set.

The line out the door tells you that it's a popular choice (but worth the wait, I promise).

The short-ish menu has something for just about everyone, very simply prepared to showcase the freshness and quality of the ingredients.

The interior is sunny, modern-casual, with an open kitchen, tables and counter seating, and a shelf of cookbooks and things in Ball jars to make you feel right at home.

The staff is very smiley and super nice.

You can't go wrong with whatever choice you make.  If it's your first time, go with The Plow, which is eggs, potatoes, ricotta pancakes, and meat of your choice.  Everything is prepared perfectly, and in exactly the right portions.  A little shake of Youk's hot sauce on the potatoes is a great added touch if you want a little spice.

I recently had the smoked salmon dish, and it was delicious, with tons of salmon.  

A wonderful little gem in the city, and never a disappointment.

excerpts: If not, either the fried egg sandwich or the Plow.
the plow.author: Mike M.
the plow.review:
A San Francisco Brunch must!

Get here early, because the space is small and the line is long. Most importantly, you don't want the best things on the menu running out.

If it's available, fried chicken and biscuits with gravy. If not, either the fried egg sandwich or the Plow. Possibly a side of lemon ricotta pancakes.

Just don't make the chump mistake of ordering coffee here. It is sub par. Just bring a cup of blue bottle, ritual, four barrel, sightglass, etc. and enjoy =)

excerpts: The Plow Breakfast is amazing !
Minus 1 star for the horrible wait time on the weekends..
the plow.author: Sonny S.
the plow.review: The Plow Breakfast is amazing ! Minus 1 star for the horrible wait time on the weekends..

excerpts: The Plow (two eggs, two pieces of bacon or sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes, and crispy potatoes) and The French Toast.
The food was just delicious.
We ate every bite.
Those potatoes are crispy on the outside, soft on the inside with great flavor.
Those lemon ricotta pancakes were so delectable.
the plow.author: S G.
the plow.review:
So I've been really wanting to try this place.  It's a bit out of the way for me, but I love trying new things.

So, we waited about an hour to be seated on a Saturday...ok by me if the food is good.  Plus you can order some beverages while you wait.  Relax people, have some drinks outside with friends while you wait.  It's the weekend after all so enjoy. 

So my friend and I shared two dishes. The Plow (two eggs, two pieces of bacon or sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes, and crispy potatoes) and The French Toast.
The food was just delicious.  We ate every bite.  Those potatoes are crispy on the outside, soft on the inside with great flavor.  Those lemon ricotta pancakes were so delectable. French Toast was more on average but very good!  

I am definitely going to come back here again and try something else...but I may get those ricotta pancakes again..hehe.

excerpts: I got the dish called the plow which comes with 2 lemon pancakes, their house sausages, 2 eggs, and their potatoe fry things that I swear we're made by god himself.
Literally so good I can't even.
the plow.author: Madi N.
the plow.review: So I am a HUGE brunch lover. Very few things make me happier. And holy moly this place is my new favorite. I have been looking for the best brunch ever and I found it! I got the dish called the plow which comes with 2 lemon pancakes, their house sausages, 2 eggs, and their potatoe fry things that I swear we're made by god himself. Literally so good I can't even.

excerpts: I ordered "The Plow" and had my eggs cooked over easy.
the plow.author: Jason C.
the plow.review:
I had high expectations coming to Plow, and Plow delivered. The food is good - nothing special in my opinion. I ordered "The Plow" and had my eggs cooked over easy. The eggs were fine, the crispy potatoes were tasty, the bacon (which the server recommended) was no good, and the pancakes were decent.

I mean, at $15 for the entree, I expected it to be out of this world. I can name a dozen breakfast joints in the area with a tastier, heartier breakfast for less money.

Overall, the food is good, but I wouldn't wait more than 20 minutes to eat there.

excerpts: I had the Plow and my sister had the crab scramble.
the plow.author: Sally S.
the plow.review: Great brunch place! I had the Plow and my sister had the crab scramble. The crispy potatoes were my favorite and was not a let down. Next time I want to try the Egg Sandwich which my sister says is delicious! Try coming here on a weekday, it's not as crowded and wait is only about 20 min during peak times.

excerpts: we ordered the pulled pork sandwich, 2 soft scramble with chanterelle, nettles, and goat cheese, and also the plow which is eggs, meat, potatoes and a pancake.
the plow.author: claudia y.
the plow.review:
plow is a hip brunch place in portrero hill.  it demands an hour wait.  friendly staff.  but mediocre food.  i cant seem to understand why people are willing to wait an hour for breakfast here.  i dont think we would come back again

first the tables were smelly.  they had accidentally left a wet rag on our chair but the table was still smelly and chair wet.  i think they need to wash those rags more.

we ordered the pulled pork sandwich, 2 soft scramble with chanterelle, nettles, and goat cheese, and also the plow which is eggs, meat, potatoes and a pancake.  i added an almond pancake to my meal because i was imagining it to be a fluffy french macaroon like thing.  

when my soft scramble came it was button mushrooms and not chanterelles.  we prompty notified our waitress who asked the kitchen which confirmed that yes they had run out of chanterelles.  at 10am.  and that they would take $1 off each soft scramble we ordered.  but if we hadnt asked?  as i left i was thinking of all the people who ordered the soft scramble with chanterelles for chanterelle price who were actually eating button mushrooms and not informed.  but they wouldnt care,  they are eating in a hip place and they are hip people.  the worst part is feeling like they were trying to trick us

next the homemade sausage patties.  i found to be bland and dry.  yuck.  the almond pacakes were gritty and mushy, like a soggy almond cookie.  so much worse that i had hoped.  i couldnt even finish.  the lemon ricotta pancakes were a step better but still not that fluffy and not that lemony or ricotta-y

the saving grace was the potatoes.  delicious.  can a restaurant survive by making good potatoes?  probably

everything else was crap

excerpts: I'm still not a big fan of brunch, but I really enjoyed brunch at the Plow on Sunday morning.
I struggled to pick one out of its various choices, so I ended up choosing the plow!
the plow.author: Nathan N.
the plow.review: I'm still not a big fan of brunch, but I really enjoyed brunch at the Plow on Sunday morning. I struggled to pick one out of its various choices, so I ended up choosing the plow!

excerpts: It was around a 2.5 hour wait and we ordered the plow and benedict.
The plate felt like it was 1/2-3/4 full of potatoes.
the plow.author: Sandy T.
the plow.review: There are definitely better brunch places in SF. It was around a 2.5 hour wait and we ordered the plow and benedict. The plate felt like it was 1/2-3/4 full of potatoes. Now, if they were delicious crispy potatoes, then awesome! But no, they were big chunks of soggy waste-of-calories potatoes. Meh. Their lemon ricotta pancake was also very dry. So there is no reason why I would return.

excerpts: so instead i ordered 'the plow', which consisted of eggs [poached], sausage and lemon ricotta pancakes.
i'm not a huge fan of lemon things
[exc.
lemonade, lemon bundt cake], and i knew these pancakes were risky.
the plow.author: Rosalee C.
the plow.review:
i've been wanting to try this place for some time but i am rarely in this neighborhood and i don't know why.

my boyfriend and i woke up early and decided to eat here since there's a chance of not waiting so long because it's so early. well, when we drove by the large crowd crowding the entrance almost made us change our minds but decided to stay. the 40min wait didn't seem so long.

we sat at the bar and just watched all the cooks in action. they got skills!

i wanted to try the almond flour pancakes but i was craving for eggs so instead i ordered 'the plow', which consisted of eggs [poached], sausage and lemon ricotta pancakes. i'm not a huge fan of lemon things [exc. lemonade, lemon bundt cake], and i knew these pancakes were risky. they're ok, but i don't love them like everyone else did. 

regardless, i am definitely coming back here to try the almond pancakes, and other things on their menu! it's small but they have large windows that bring all the sunlight in!

excerpts: So many things on the menu sound amazing, but we ended up narrowing it down to a fried egg sandwich for my friend and the plow for me.
The plow was basically my dream breakfast: eggs (scrambled and cooked to perfection), chicken apple sausage, wonderfully crispy brown potatoes, and light refreshing lemon ricotta pancakes.
the plow.author: Carrie C.
the plow.review:
My friend and I came here on a Wednesday afternoon to avoid the wait because we're not the most patient when we have to pathetically watch people eating food through a window while standing outside in the cold.  However, there was already a small crowd of people waiting outside the door, and we pledged that if the wait was more than 20 minutes, we would get it to go and eat in the car.

Luckily, we only had to wait about 10 minutes before getting a table, and it helps that the service is fast.  So many things on the menu sound amazing, but we ended up narrowing it down to a fried egg sandwich for my friend and the plow for me.

The plow was basically my dream breakfast: eggs (scrambled and cooked to perfection), chicken apple sausage, wonderfully crispy brown potatoes, and light refreshing lemon ricotta pancakes.  My friend loved her fried egg sandwich (+bacon) and raved that she could eat the potatoes for every single meal.

Overall, a wonderfully delicious brunch in a cute atmosphere.  I would highly recommend coming here (be prepared to wait), and I would love to come back to try all the other delicious menu items!

excerpts: I was super hungry and ate 2/3s of it, but ended picking at my friend's meals (they all got the Plow) to fill up.
the plow.author: Emily H.
the plow.review:
So, I haven't gone to Plow in awhile because it's exploded in popularity over the past year. I live a couple houses up and ride my bike past the restaurant every day. There is always some kind of line outside the restaurant, even on weekdays! Good for them! However, that means I just haven't been in awhile because waiting in the line sucks.

Anyways, I went yesterday (Sunday) for brunch. Was quite disappointed in both the food and service we received at Plow. 

1) I ordered a duck and sweet potato hash. Sounds amazing, right? Well, the duck was fatty and flavorless. Quite gamey but not in a good way. I kept on having to add ketchup and hot sauce because it just tasted like someone had taken cubed duck breast and boiled it. There was no caramelization, no nice tasty brown spots on the meat. There were also fatty chunks on the meat that weren't rendered properly, like poorly cooked pork belly.  All of it was a dull brown-gray. The sweet potatoes fared no better. They were overcooked and disintegrated fairly quickly. I was super hungry and ate 2/3s of it, but ended picking at my friend's meals (they all got the Plow) to fill up.

2) The service! It's gotten so snobby! The blonde girl who served us (we were sitting outside) really needs to consider the fact that she's at a BREAKFAST joint, not a Michelin starred restaurant. Two incidents. First, my friend asked if they had brown sugar. He just likes the extra richness. She says, "We don't have brown sugar, we have RAW sugar" in a tone that basically said "how dare you ask for brown sugar when we have this organic local better-than-you sugar here already". Second incident, another friend asked for goat cheese instead of cheddar on her fried egg sandwich. She makes a face and says "well, I'll get that for you on the side because it probably won't taste good." Girl, have you even had goat cheese on eggs and frisee? It tastes FINE. Delicious, even! I understand if we were at a fine dining establishment, and the dish has specific ingredients that were meant to go together, but for fucks sake, we just want to switch out the cheese. 

Bottom line, probably not coming here very often anymore, especially since the wait is a huge turn off. It's expensive too, I spent $20+ on just my dish (no coffee, no extras). I'm sad because this used to be a great, friendly, local brunch restaurant, and I feel like it's just turning into the next Mission Beach Cafe with the snob factor. But with crappier food.

excerpts: As for food, I have gotten the breakfast sandwich, which is very tasty, but after trying the plow plate, I am a convert.
the plow.author: Erin B.
the plow.review:
Love Plow's brunch and would give it 5 stars if it weren't for the wait. Their lemon ricotta pancakes are the best. I'm not even a big pancake fan yet I order them every time. Their crispy potatoes are delicious too; I've tried a few times to replicate them at home but can never seem to get them just right. If you go on a weekend be prepared for a pretty lengthy wait. This place is extremely tiny and very popular. But, they do offer coffee to make the wait a little more bearable and there is a great view of the city. They also have outdoor seating and are dog friendly. 
As for food, I have gotten the breakfast sandwich, which is very tasty, but after trying the plow plate, I am a convert. It comes with all of Plow's best dishes: lemon ricotta pancakes, crispy potatoes, eggs, and your choice of their yummy bacon or sausage. Definitely a must order if it's your first time at Plow.

excerpts: Order "The Plow", and you can't go wrong.
the plow.author: DJ P.
the plow.review:
Yes- the line is a bit long... but more than worth the wait.  I think the brunch served at Plow is one of the best!  And the POTATOES are deliciouso. 

Order "The Plow", and you can't go wrong.  Actually anything on the menu, you can't go wrong.

Will be back a million more times.

excerpts: The lemon ricotta pancakes are well known, as is the "absolutely everything delicious on a plate" plate, the Plow.
My friend ordered the smoked salmon breakfast, and that looked pretty awesome too.
the plow.author: Tasha D.
the plow.review: Delicious brunch. Friendly, charming space with good food, good coffee, and a line out the door (that part's less fun). The lemon ricotta pancakes are well known, as is the "absolutely everything delicious on a plate" plate, the Plow. My friend ordered the smoked salmon breakfast, and that looked pretty awesome too.

excerpts: We had the Plow and fried egg sandwich.
The food was great but after a two hour wait only to sit at the bar, nothing is that good.
We couldn't think of a single place we loved that much to wait that long and we tried hard to think of one.
Anyway, good but the wait is too much.
the plow.author: Roberta J.
the plow.review: Three stars just based on the ridiculous wait. The wait is stupid, I don't care how good it is. And it was good. It was delicious. We had the Plow and fried egg sandwich. The food was great but after a two hour wait only to sit at the bar, nothing is that good. We couldn't think of a single place we loved that much to wait that long and we tried hard to think of one. Anyway, good but the wait is too much.

excerpts: The french toast and The Plow plate are good.
The drinks are good too.
the plow.author: Ruby K.
the plow.review: The wait is short if you get there early. The french toast and The Plow plate are good. The drinks are good too. The lemon ricotta pancakes are delicious, especially when paired with the crispy potatoes.

excerpts: My friend ordered the Plow which is the works with 2 eggs, bacon,  2 lemon ricotta pancakes and crispy potatoes.
I ordered the soft egg crab and asparagus scramble with crispy potatoes, buttered toast and a side order of one almond pancake.
Everything was cooked to perfection and the potatoes are out of this world!
Best crispy potatoes with a sprinkling of salt and herbs.
Mmmm!
the plow.author: Sharon D.
the plow.review:
This is my favorite breakfast place in the city!!  You've got to go to Plow!  I've been here twice and both brunches were fabulous!  Brought my friend from LA here and she absolutely loved it.  We had to wait about half hour on a Tuesday so we took a stroll around the sunny neighborhood.  

My friend ordered the Plow which is the works with 2 eggs, bacon,  2 lemon ricotta pancakes and crispy potatoes.  I ordered the soft egg crab and asparagus scramble with crispy potatoes, buttered toast and a side order of one almond pancake.  Everything was cooked to perfection and the potatoes are out of this world!  Best crispy potatoes with a sprinkling of salt and herbs.  Mmmm!  The almond pancake was nice and fluffy.

Love the decor and service was great.

excerpts: and I both ordered "The Plow" which consists of 2 eggs, bacon or sausage, lemon ricotta pancakes and potatoes.
I loved that it was a perfect balance of sweet and savory.
The eggs and sausage were good, but nothing too extraordinary.
The lemon ricotta pancakes had great flavor and were the perfect size.
The potatoes were the best potatoes I've had in the city.
I find myself craving more lemon ricotta pancakes and potatoes!
the plow.author: Christina L.
the plow.review:
I had to take one star off because the wait is a little ridiculous. I put my name down at 10 am on a Sunday, left for 2 hrs to get my friends and wander about the city, and when I came back at noon, there were still no tables available inside. Since we were pressed for time, we ate outside. As expected in SF, it was cold, but the food was still great.

My boyfriend and I both ordered "The Plow" which consists of 2 eggs, bacon or sausage, lemon ricotta pancakes and potatoes. I loved that it was a perfect balance of sweet and savory. The eggs and sausage were good, but nothing too extraordinary. The lemon ricotta pancakes had great flavor and were the perfect size. The potatoes were the best potatoes I've had in the city. I don't know want to know how they are prepared or how much butter they are fried in because denial is bliss.

Our other 2 friends got the eggs benedict and fried egg sandwich. I think they enjoyed their meals, although my friend that got the eggs benedict asked for the sauce on the side, and her meal was smothered in sauce.

I'll definitely be back  - even though the wait is pretty bad the food makes up for it. Plus, it's difficult to find too many popular brunch places in the city with less than a 2 hour wait. I find myself craving more lemon ricotta pancakes and potatoes!

excerpts:
The plow (2 eggs, meat, potatoes, and two pancakes)
Side of fruit
the plow.author: Raina B.
the plow.review:
3.5 stars

Mmmm... was time to try another brunch place last weekend.

The order:
Soft scramble with nettles, mushroom and chives
The plow (2 eggs, meat, potatoes, and two pancakes)
Side of fruit

The reaction:
EXCELLENT PANCAKES! We substituted the almond pancakes for the lemon ricotta and absolutely loved them. The soft scramble really had a wonderful flavor except they came out a little watery which wasn't the most appealing presentation. The side of fruit had a fun presentation with a mango turned inside out but there was so little fruit on a plate that cost $6! 

Final notes:
1. Will likely go again if there is no wait
2. While it's fun to sit at the bar and watch them move through the kitchen quickly, don't, because then you'll start thinking about how much oil goes into everything.
3. GO FOR THE PANCAKES.

excerpts: ordered The Plow - with scrambled eggs and house made pork sausage patties.
waitress came back half an hour later saying they were out of the pork sausage
(it was 12:37pm on Sunday - yes, i did check the time)
got the chicken apple sausage instead.
should have gotten the bacon if i knew that the chicken apple sausages are those little bfast sausage (i like the ones with apple chunks in them instead).
the plow.author: Diana C.
the plow.review:
3.5 stars. this place is so cute!  the wait was very long...  love the decor.

ordered The Plow - with scrambled eggs and house made pork sausage patties. waitress came back half an hour later saying they were out of the pork sausage (it was 12:37pm on Sunday - yes, i did check the time) got the chicken apple sausage instead. should have gotten the bacon if i knew that the chicken apple sausages are those little bfast sausage (i like the ones with apple chunks in them instead). however, i really like the scrambled eggs (so runny!!) and CRISPY potatoes. tried that one weird whey orange drink (i wasn't paying a lot of attention when the waitress was describing it, but she mentioned that they made some cheese in-house and extracted protein, add orange juice and tonic... bleh - i didn't like it). lemon ricotta pancakes - first bite had a kick to it, but it's not fluffy. i like fluffy pancakes. same problem with the almond flour pancakes. 

i would totally go back for the eggs and potatoes. the muffin looked good, too. want to try that next time.

excerpts: First of all, I always order the plow.
Why?
It lets you taste everything that is good and amazing at Plow.
The pancakes... the best thing ever!
They're tossed in some salt, pepper and rosemary (and maybe other things that I just don't know about) and they add the perfect little crunch to the plow platter.
the plow.author: Leanne M.
the plow.review:
This is my fave brunch spot in the history of brunch spots that I've been to. Quite extreme, I know, but you have to eat here to understand why I say this.

First of all, I always order the plow. Why? It lets you taste everything that is good and amazing at Plow. The pancakes... the best thing ever! Lemon ricotta pancakes. I haven't tried a better pancake anywhere else. They're so light and the flavour is just amazing (I eat them without syrup all the time because they taste so good). My bf and I have been trying to make them ourselves and we never get close to the quality and delicateness of Plow. 

Second, the potatoes! I love the crispy potatoes! They'd be the equivalent to homefries at any other brunch place, but these things are amazing! They're tossed in some salt, pepper and rosemary (and maybe other things that I just don't know about) and they add the perfect little crunch to the plow platter. 

The wait can be a little long since they don't have much space to seat people, but it's always worth the wait for me. I love this place! It keeps me coming back every time.

excerpts: I got the Plow, a combination of two small lemon ricotta pancakes, two eggs, bacon or sausage and potatoes.
Those potatoes.
oh man.
I don't know what they put in them (rosemary?
thyme?)
but they are crispy and delicious.
The only food item I would complain about - the bacon . . .
while tasty, I wish I had specified crispy, because they serve it kind of floppy and under cooked.
But other than that, everything was great.
the plow.author: Jenny R.
the plow.review:
Plow.  A longstanding brunch obstacle, because I knew the endurance it would take.  And after being burned in the past by extraordinarily long waits for brunch and less than stellar food as my reward, I have to admit, I was a little hesitant to give Plow the chance.  

But I finally did, this past weekend.  And it was worth it.  Admittedly, the wait was lengthy.  Probably about an hour or so.  But that was to be expected.  And honestly, who cares about an hour wait, if it's good weather?  Wandering around Portrero Hill, stopping into some cute shops, getting tea at Farley's - it's not a bad way to spend an hour. 

And I would say the food is worth the wait, maybe not on a regular basis, but certainly once in a while.  I got the Plow, a combination of two small lemon ricotta pancakes, two eggs, bacon or sausage and potatoes.  Those potatoes.  . . oh man.  I don't know what they put in them (rosemary?  thyme?) but they are crispy and delicious.  The only food item I would complain about - the bacon . . . while tasty, I wish I had specified crispy, because they serve it kind of floppy and under cooked.  But other than that, everything was great.

excerpts: I'm not a fan of the wait...especially when I'm starving for breakfast, but I tough it out like a champ because "the plow" is that good to me.
That's my go to order.
It has a little of everything.
the plow.author: Janny N.
the plow.review: This place is awesome. I'm not a fan of the wait...especially when I'm starving for breakfast, but I tough it out like a champ because "the plow" is that good to me. That's my go to order. It has a little of everything. Lemon ricotta pancakes (yuuum), eggs, meat, potatoes. Real maple syrup. The bf grew up with the real stuff so this adds a star to his list.

excerpts: We both ordered "The Plow" and should have "plowed" right through it on to a different menu item.
the plow.author: Sara D.
the plow.review:
Honestly - what restaurant doesn't have mustard?!
That alone irks me from not wanting to return. 

My BF and I waited 45 minutes for brunch on a Sunday, and we're completely underwhelmed.

We both ordered "The Plow" and should have "plowed" right through it on to a different menu item.

We got the housemade sausage and it was pretty bad. SO dry and tough and overly spicy - blech. The potatoes were in such large chunks that I had to cut all of them down in order to fit them in my mouth - not a pleasant experience. The eggs were fine - can you really mess up eggs? And THANKFULLY the lemon ricotta pancakes were superb!! That seriously saved our meal and kept me full.

I do have to say that the space is adorable - inside and out and the service was really wonderful. I asked the waitress for a thousand things (including mustard!!) and she didn't even bat an eye in annoyance.

I want to like this place, I really do - and perhaps I will give it another try?

But there's a bagel joint down the road that I think we would have done a lot better off, and about $10 less.

excerpts:
Definitely pick something which comes with the potatoes when you are there.

- "The Plow" lets you sample the eggs, the potatoes and the pancakes in meal.
the plow.author: Kartik A.
the plow.review:
My cofounder and I have been going to Plow for lunch lately.

- They have good eggs, though at the end of the day, they aree eggs.
- They have some pretty awesome lemon ricotta pancakes
- They do an excellent job with the crispy potatoes, which are the star of the show.

They are cut small so you get to taste the outer crispy portions and aren't dealing with bland insides. Also, they are server well done - they are quite crisp.

Definitely pick something which comes with the potatoes when you are there.

- "The Plow" lets you sample the eggs, the potatoes and the pancakes in meal.
- If you are seated outside, they offer you blankets - an interesting novelty.
- I'm told they have a 2 hour wait on weekends, so weekdays might be a better option.
- I haven't tried the Chinese Breakfast - it tends to always be sold out by the time we get there.
- Its Portrero Hill, so parking isn't terrible.

excerpts: Had the plow and my pertner had the breakfast sammy that was delicious also!
GREAT coffee and was even poured into a FOR HERE cup as we waited outside for a few minutes for our indoor table as I was put off by dining outside on the slope and the lack of sun that morning
(I can be such a Princess sometimes!).
The hostess and our wait staff all were friendly and efficient and I think THE PLOW I had with the house made sausage was one of the best breakfasts I've had in this food centric CITY!

Can't wait to go back!
CHEERS!
the plow.author: Sean M.
the plow.review:
Had a great breakfast last Sunday morning and got there early before the real crowd started lining up!  Had the plow and my pertner had the breakfast sammy that was delicious also!  GREAT coffee and was even poured into a FOR HERE cup as we waited outside for a few minutes for our indoor table as I was put off by dining outside on the slope and the lack of sun that morning (I can be such a Princess sometimes!). The hostess and our wait staff all were friendly and efficient and I think THE PLOW I had with the house made sausage was one of the best breakfasts I've had in this food centric CITY!
Can't wait to go back!
CHEERS!

excerpts: so I can't comment on meat dishes, but friends whom I have gone to Plow with all rave about the dishes they've gotten (everything from The Plow to the Nicoise salad).
the plow.author: Rishi N.
the plow.review:
