Plow is probably my favorite brunch spot in SF.  The location itself is pretty small and very homely / cozy, with huge windows that allow sunlight to pour in (especially valuable for those who don't enjoy as much sunlight due to living elsewhere in SF...).  If only I could park myself here on weekdays and read a book / eat breakfast every day... (and if only I had unlimited monetary resources...)

The food itself is delightful.  During my last visit, I ordered the almond flour pancakes, which are perfectly fluffy on the inside, with the right amount of almond flavor so as to deliver a rich taste without being overwhelming.  I've also ordered the french toast with strawberry compote, mascarpone, and syrup, which was tremendous.  I'm a vegetarian so I can't comment on meat dishes, but friends whom I have gone to Plow with all rave about the dishes they've gotten (everything from The Plow to the Nicoise salad).  Plow is also one of the few places that serve Equator coffee in SF (especially now that La Boulange is being acquired by Starbucks) - while expensive at $3.75 / cup (unlimited refills), it complements a meal perfectly.  Service is great given how hectic things seem to be every time I visit (which has always been on weekends), as the staff is very friendly.

The main negative aspect, as other folks have noted here, is the wait - it can be absolutely brutal at 1-2 hours on weekends.  That wait will get you a single table for 2 if you're lucky, or perhaps a seat at a table of 4 (typically shared with other people if your party is fewer than 4 people) or at the bar.  If you show up after 10:30am on a weekend, be prepared to wait a while ... with limited breakfast / brunch options nearby if you decide that you can't stand the wait.  Plow is also quite pricey for brunch (even by SF standards) - in my opinion, it's worth it, but coupled with the long wait it's something to keep in mind.

All in all, Plow is definitely worth visiting - and if you can make it work, visit on a weekday to avoid the brutal lines (note that they're closed on Mondays).

excerpts: The mister ordered the plow.
My eggs were cooked perfectly and had a lot of flavor.
the plow.author: Thi D.
the plow.review: Came here on a weekday at 1pm.  There was plenty of seating outdoors, but we opted for inside since it was a little chilly.  We had to wait about 20 minutes for a table.  I definitely dig the ambiance inside.  My friend and I ordered the soft scrambled eggs, the cherry tomatoes and goat cheese for me, and the oyster mushrooms and cheddar for her.  The mister ordered the plow.  My eggs were cooked perfectly and had a lot of flavor.  I can see why people rave about the crispy potatoes because they were very good.  I tried the lemon ricotta pancakes from the mister's plate, which made me wish I ordered them.  Overall, very tasty food and good, friendly service.

excerpts: Plow is not a greasy spoon, so it is not going to satisfy palates accustomed to heavier fare, but if you are hungry, the Plow dish (two eggs, choice of house made pork sausage, Nueske bacon, or chicken apple sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes + crispy potatoes) is a great choice for people who are not on any restricted diets.
the plow.author: Kristina P.
the plow.review:
It's true that the wait for breakfast at Plow is usually long, but the line-up there is packed because people want to eat well prepared and healthy food that is fresh, local, and organic. The demand is therefore high. If you're an early riser, I'd recommend arriving at Plow at opening time in order to avoid the wait. 

I eat rather "clean" by following a Paleo/SCD diet, which advocates avoiding starches and consuming high quality meats, vegs, and fruits. Plow serves delicious meals that easily fit in with this eating philosophy. The Two Eggs dish is a great option for people following this diet. Note that the staff can swap the potatoes with greens.

Service and atmosphere are both very good. 

Plow is not a greasy spoon, so it is not going to satisfy palates accustomed to heavier fare, but if you are hungry, the Plow dish (two eggs, choice of house made pork sausage, Nueske bacon, or chicken apple sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes + crispy potatoes) is a great choice for people who are not on any restricted diets.

excerpts: Ordered "The Plow" since I wanted to try a few different items (Not to mention, seems like everyone orders it
the plow.author: P W.
the plow.review:
Got there on a Sunday morning around 10am and the wait wasn't too bad! About 35 mins for a party of 2 which is pretty reasonable for this place.

Ordered "The Plow" since I wanted to try a few different items (Not to mention, seems like everyone orders it so I figured it must be good).

Lemon ricotta pancakes were delicious. Less fluffy and more cakey which I liked and the lemon flavor was not overpowering. The crispy potatoes were good too. My sunnyside egg was okay although the yolk part ended up getting cooked in some parts so it wasnt as runny as it should be but otherwise, decent. The chicken sausages had a strange (but not in a bad way) taste although next time I think I'll try the bacon.

Probably not worth an hour+ wait but for 30 mins, I'd come back again

excerpts: Food wise - I ordered the plow, which was really good.
The potatoes were crispy.
the plow.author: Reva B.
the plow.review:
I went for brunch on a Sunday around 11am. It was a two hour wait, which I already expected based on previous Yelp reviews. There were 8 of us and they can only take groups of 6 or 7 so they seated 6 of us outside and 2 of us inside.

Food wise - I ordered the plow, which was really good. The potatoes were crispy. I loved the lemon ricotta pancakes and the chicken apple sausage. I asked for poached eggs, but I wish they put hollandaise sauce on it or even some spices would have been good. Although I loved the food, I don't know if it was worth the 2 hour wait.

Either way, I think everyone should try this spot at least once! It's located in a really cool corner, surrounded by beautiful houses.

excerpts: I started with the Equator coffee (GREAT), and ordered the Plow for brunch.
the plow.author: C T.
the plow.review:
Loved the ambience here. Super cute brunch spot, good for small groups and catching up with friends on the weekends.

I started with the Equator coffee (GREAT), and ordered the Plow for brunch.  I really enjoyed the home-made sausage, the over-easy eggs (not your average supermarket eggs) and crispy potatoes!!! The lemon ricotta pancakes were good, but not amazing.  If I ever come back, I'd probably order the chicken tinga.  I pretty much forced the dude to hand over his plate midway through our meal. YOINK.

Warning: be prepared to wait longer than the quoted time. We were told it would be a 35 minute wait, but ended up getting seated an hour and 15 minutes later.

excerpts: After I got some special juice in me, I ordered 'The Plow.'
I figured, "When in Rome," right?
the plow.author: Matthew K.
the plow.review:
My boyfriend and I ventured into the city from Sacramento for a day of fun. We started the day at Plow, which was a great choice! The service was friendly and efficient.

The table was set with coffee mugs, which is an automatic plus for me. After I got some special juice in me, I ordered 'The Plow.' I figured, "When in Rome," right? The meal was delicious and quite savory, but the most memorable part was the miniature, lemon-flavored pancakes. 

I would certainly return. Only tip I can offer is to be prepared to wait for a table for up to an hour, but I assure you it's worth it.

excerpts: "The Plow" is a good way to sample all of their good things (it comes with lemon ricotta pancakes -smaller version).
The potatoes are tasty but their inconsistent size makes the large pieces stand out in buttery goodness and the tiny bits too burnt to eat.
Their homemade sausages are a bit dry.
the plow.author: Ellie J.
the plow.review:
Sitting atop Potrero Hill on the corner surrounded by trees and benches is Plow. It is a small, hip, and trendy brunch spot. Their menu changes weekly, so come back often. The boast fresh organic produce from local farms, which is the norm in San Francisco, but not the standard.

Their french toast is crunchy outside with a custard-like creaminess inside, delicately sweet and garnished with fresh berries and a brulee'd banana. Served with subtle sweet Vermont syrup (not too sweet, not too thick, just perfect syrup). 

Lemon ricotta pancakes is my favorite and it's one of the reasons I keep coming back. I have convinced many patrons to try their lemon ricotta pancakes when I brunch here. They are dense with pockets filled with ricotta (a light cheese, similar to mozzarella) and a subtle lemon flavor. I've tried to replicate their lemon-ricotta pancakes and while my pancakes can be similar in taste, they do not have the same thick, rich and hearty elements that Plow creates.

The eggs benedict are okay. The star of the dish is the hollandaise sauce which I feel is too zesty.  Most holllandaise sauce has a mild creamy flavor with subtle tang, however Plow's hollandaise sauce has a robust tang that overpowers the other mildly flavored components. I suspect a heavy hand in lemon juice. Poached eggs cooked to perfection. 

"The Plow" is a good way to sample all of their good things (it comes with lemon ricotta pancakes -smaller version). The potatoes are tasty but their inconsistent size makes the large pieces stand out in buttery goodness and the tiny bits too burnt to eat. Their homemade sausages are a bit dry. However, you can't go wrong with the chicken apple sausages (yum). 

The house made organic yogurt + granola with fresh fruit is not worth it. I think that it could have used more berries and less citrus fruits in my honest opinion. 

The fried egg sandwich is okay. The nueske bacon makes it a tad better. The acme bun was lovely. Everything else was standard. 

The dungenous crab scramble was tasty. It had hearty pieces of crab meat. Definitely a go to dish to try. But I think it's a bit pricey at $17. 

The almond pancake was disappointing. I didn't taste any flavor of almond. But I suppose that it is a fan for gluten-free eaters. 

The counter seating is quite small and can be uncomfortable, however that's where you get to see the magic of everything being cooked. I like sitting outside because it's quieter. Inside its warm and loud. 

Price wise, I think it's expensive. IMO, I think that brunch should be $10 and under. Many of the dishes here can be made at home for the fraction of the price. The prices here $10-$17 per meal. Not including extra such as drinks or side dishes. The coffee alone is a whopping $3.75.

Overall, I think that the food is prepared well and presented beautifully. I will return because think their lemon ricotta pancakes are delicious. However, the prices, long wait, and hit-or-miss customer service pushes the over all rating down.

excerpts: Get "the plow" if you can't decide between sweet and savory.
the plow.author: Moraia W.
the plow.review:
YES, the lemon ricotta pancakes are as good as everyone says. You might be thinking, "Really? Lemon...and ricotta? How amazing can it be?" Let me tell you. Amazing. Nearly life-changing. I couldn't stop thinking about it for the rest of the day. I'M THAT SERIOUS. And I don't even like ricotta. 

They do not skimp on the bacon either! Get "the plow" if you can't decide between sweet and savory. (But to be honest, about an hour later I wished I had gotten the full serving of the Lemon Ricotta Pancakes. SO GOOD.)

Came in on a Thursday afternoon @1pm. Got seated at the bar within 5 minutes. Score! Space is tight, but the food is worth it!

Staff is wonderful and the atmosphere is very fun. Seems very kid-friendly as I saw multiple families there with their little ones.

excerpts: The plow includes the pancakes, eggs, bacon, and crispy potatoes (what?!)
Go to Plow and get the Plow, please.
the plow.author: Helen Z.
the plow.review:
Simple, yummy breakfast. 

It might sound silly, but their eggs are perfectly, lovingly scrambled. Just soft and creamy enough and oh-so-fluffy. It's my benchmark for how great a brunch place is, and this place is a winner. 

The lemon ricotta pancakes are quite delicious as well. The plow includes the pancakes, eggs, bacon, and crispy potatoes (what?!) Go to Plow and get the Plow, please.

Just one caveat: there's usually an hour-ish long wait, so be wary of that. It's the only thing that stops me from going all the time.

excerpts: Not even the Plow potatoes could make-up for the 2-hours of my life that I will never get back!
Hmph.
the plow.author: Denise L.
the plow.review:
2-hour wait for an egg sandwich. 

Note to self: Only come to Plow in pairs. 

Dining is not just about the food but about the experience that comes along with it, and as each party of 2 came strolling in after my party of 3 and got seated first I got progressively more hungry and irritable. 

Not even the Plow potatoes could make-up for the 2-hours of my life that I will never get back! Hmph.

excerpts: Our waiter, the water slug, oozed herself into being for our ordering of The Plow and never fully materialized again.
And to her
I have one statement: "A slow to come, quick to go mantra only works in certain circumstances.
It is particularly not helpful in a food serving establishment.
the plow.author: Savier M.
the plow.review:
The chill of being a nightmonger planted the audacity for attempting brunch at Plow. My nights consist of shifting through drunk hipsters, ugly, tipsy women, and walking through the bitter frost of the bay. These taxing experiences drifted me, my bro, L, and M to Potrero Hill for a taste of morning goodness.

In return for our wayfaring we received a 1 hour wait and a Cirque Soleil feast for our eyes. Men in sparkling jackets danced over taxi riding fatties blocking the view of two grannies that chilled like villains whilst we basked in the spontaneous San Francisco sun. If only I had had a Mimosa to sip on.

The Mimosa never came to be. Like fish we breathed 4 to 5 wine bottles of water and blew bubbles of laughter and irony about the establishment. Our waiter, the water slug, oozed herself into being for our ordering of The Plow and never fully materialized again. And to her I have one statement: "A slow to come, quick to go mantra only works in certain circumstances. It is particularly not helpful in a food serving establishment."

Our "slow to come" food was graced by one item I will never forget..... The Lemon Ricotta Pancake. This edible specimen was bred between a slice of pound cake and a lemon drop. It's deliciousness, moistiness, and solid, cake-like composure are in a league of their own. I raise a Mimosa to The Lemon Ricotta Pancake. Hip hip nom Nom NOM.

Come to Plow to get plowed by the experience and make sweet love with pancakes but go somewhere cheaper to eat with less remorse.

excerpts: I ordered the Plow since I don't expect I'd be making this trip again (why on earth are you near absolutely nothing, Plow?!)
the plow.author: Tiffany C.
the plow.review:
3.5 stars. Plow does NOT make it easy to get to by public transportation. My fault. Catching a bus from North Beach on Giants game day is most likely the worst decision in recent SF traveling history. The bus jostled me all the way down and fortunately dropped me off only a block away, but never again - it took took me more than an hour.

Ahem, I got my order to-go (and yes, it was rather cold by the time I dug in) but from a quick glance the ambiance is super nice. Buuutt, I can see why it gets ridiculous on weekends. They really haven't much space inside for more than maybe 9 measly groups.. a couple tables outside. A bit like the old Outerlands format, but marginally larger.

I ordered the Plow since I don't expect I'd be making this trip again (why on earth are you near absolutely nothing, Plow?!) as it comes with 2 eggs any style, crispy potatoes, sausage or bacon, and those lemon ricotta pancakes. The potatoes are hot goodness. Even an hour later sitting in that compostable take-out box. Ohmy. The sausage is top-notch too, even though I don't usually order meat with my breakfast (chicken apple, if you're wondering the flavor!). The pancakes, which I was really anticipating, were not as rich as I was hoping. I guess I'm a fatty. I was hoping for a bit more creaminess/ricotta to burst out and shine, but it's very subtle. It isn't dry as some others have commented, but definitely not the best pancakes I've ever had either. They're too dense, perhaps griddle cakes would be a better term. Also, (TMI alert) I tasted lemon from when I ate it in the afternoon til I went to sleep which makes me think there must have been some kind of lemon extract or something in there cause it was way too strong.... just my opinion.

I wish I'd shared it with someone and perhaps taken in the restaurant a bit more casually, but I'd have to say the food I ate wasn't really worth coming all the way over. Glad I tried it, but not going again.

excerpts: The Plow which consisted of 2 eggs, 2 pieces of meat and pancakes (yes the Ricotta one) and those tasty potatoes.
The pancakes aren't as hyped up as people make it, I thought the French Toast was substantially better.
the plow.author: Justin L.
the plow.review:
Went here last Friday for lunch. Its a great place for brunch on any day. 

Had The Plow which consisted of 2 eggs, 2 pieces of meat and pancakes (yes the Ricotta one) and those tasty potatoes. The pancakes aren't as hyped up as people make it, I thought the French Toast was substantially better. Overall, pretty good, left full. 

Otherwise, I prefer this place over a lot of other options mainly due to the quaint neighborhood, easy parking, and those tasty potatoes... Will be back soon

excerpts: I ordered the PLOW, which is bacon and eggs.
Like I said, I'm old fashioned.
Only thing I wanted was my eggs over medium.
Guess what?
I got runny yolks...way closer to over easy.
Rest of the plate was fine.
the plow.author: Sergei A.
the plow.review:
Maybe I'm old fashioned. I don't do trendy foodie-type places but we had friends coming in from out of town and they wanted to eat here. I should have known better.

Got there at 10:30 and put our name on the list. I heard them tell the people in front of us that the wait was an hour. Then when I asked, they told me 45 minutes. So we started to wait. One positive is that they serve free coffee while you are waiting. I ended up have 4 cups while waiting the HOUR and a HALF to be seated. Now, I don't care how great the food is.....an hour and a half for eggs and bacon is absurd.

Ok. We waited that long so the service better be extraordinary and the food exceptional. Nope. Waitress was nice but didn't listen to us nor did she go out of her way to be helpful. She asked if I wanted more coffee. I said no and ordered a beer. She brought the beer and refilled the coffee?!?!? We had a child with us. She spilled some OJ on the table and waitress literally watched us clean it up with one of the napkins from the table and didn't offer to replace the napkin. I got up and literally got one myself. We asked for her recommendation on the best 2 items on the menu and she pretty much started at the top and read every item. I'm not sure she has ever eaten anything there.

Now the food. I thought it would be great, seeing as everyone in the restaurant was taking pictures of their meals before eating them. It's BREAKFAST....how great could it be? I ordered the PLOW, which is bacon and eggs. Like I said, I'm old fashioned. Only thing I wanted was my eggs over medium. Guess what? I got runny yolks...way closer to over easy. Rest of the plate was fine. I would not have waited 10 minutes for it and won't do so again.

So overall we waited too long, got mediocre service, food was not prepared to order but was otherwise acceptable. Next time, I'm making "brunch" at home.

excerpts: If you are indecisive (like me) get the plow so you can get a taste of everything.
The plow is two eggs, choice of house made pork sausage, Nueske bacon, or chicken apple sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes + crispy potatoes.
so I am more than willing to come back for the plow anytime.
the plow.author: Jayne A.
the plow.review:
If you are indecisive (like me) get the plow so you can get a taste of everything. The plow is two eggs, choice of house made pork sausage, Nueske bacon, or chicken apple sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes + crispy potatoes.

The pancakes sound weird but they are definitely worth trying. The home fries are unique since they have both crunchy and chunky pieces. There are small pieces that are basically French fries and others that are like home fries. It is an awesome mix since you usually only get home fries for breakfast. All in all a wonderful start to my Sunday. 

Although the wait was pretty long, the service was great so I am more than willing to come back for the plow anytime.

excerpts: I had the plow and my wife had the almond pancakes, and both of our dishes were incredibly tasty, blah,
the plow.author: Matthew L.
the plow.review:
Get. The. Crispy. Potatoes.

Look, everything here is outrageously delicious, fresh, and not at all overpriced, but BY GOD, you'd better include some crispy potatoes with whatever else you get. I had the plow and my wife had the almond pancakes, and both of our dishes were incredibly tasty, blah, blah -

But the potatoes? Oh man, the potatoes. I have dreams about those things. Dreams that turn into nightmares when I realize I don't actually have them. They're super-crispy, flavorful, and incredimazing. My wife broke her no-potatoes rule to eat them, and by 'them', I mean half my portion. I couldn't blame her, either - they're that good.

Also, service is nice, especially considering that it's always crowded, and yes, prepare yourself for about an hour wait on the weekends, depending. It's worth it. It's really, really worth it.

excerpts: Loved how they had a sweet and savory option - The Plow - with 2 lemon ricotta pancakes, eggs, crispy potatoes and your choice of house made sausage patties, chicken apple sausage or bacon.
Overall, a sweet neighborhood gem.
Would probably come back if the wait weren't so long!
the plow.author: Lisa H.
the plow.review: De-lightful! First, I must say I've never had such pleasant service for brunch in SF. 5 stars for Katie, our server. Parking was easy, but the wait was killer, close to 2 hours, however it makes sense since the place is tiny and they don't rush you. We put our name down and made a Philz Coffee run with time to spare. Nonetheless! Loved how they had a sweet and savory option - The Plow - with 2 lemon ricotta pancakes, eggs, crispy potatoes and your choice of house made sausage patties, chicken apple sausage or bacon. Overall, a sweet neighborhood gem. Would probably come back if the wait weren't so long!

excerpts: Mom and sister both got the plow, and I had some of theirs.
the plow.author: Alison A.
the plow.review:
I ate here a couple weeks ago with my mom and sister. Parking was pretty easy to find, but it might take a couple trips around the block. The wait was around 45 minutes as promised.. A few groups got to be seated sooner, but sadly a bunch of groups came back who had been passed up on the list earlier.

Mom and sister both got the plow, and I had some of theirs. From all of the rave reviews, I was really expecting to be "wowed" by the lemon ricotta pancakes. I found them to be yummy but nothing special. They did have very good crispy potatoes though.

I had the french toast with kumquat compote. Sadly, I was very unimpressed by this dish. It was okay, but I make better french toast. I finished it though. It was not inedible. They did have some yummy bacon which i ordered as a side.

Customer service was friendly, which is always a plus. The girl working the front door and our waitress were both very nice. As far as eating here again, I wouldn't go out of my way for it, but if the occasion arose, I wouldn't protest.

excerpts: Got The Plow and the ricotta pancakes was tangy and the texture was like bread pudding- so good!
My fave has to be the potatoes- crunchy and soft at the same time, and perfectly seasoned!
Get the plow- a bit of everything!
the plow.author: Rae C.
the plow.review: Got The Plow and the ricotta pancakes was tangy and the texture was like bread pudding- so good! My fave has to be the potatoes- crunchy and soft at the same time, and perfectly seasoned! Get the plow- a bit of everything!

excerpts: In this case it was "The Plow" (two of their lemon ricotta pancakes, two eggs, Nueske bacon and crispy potatoes).
This is my usual breakfast choice anyways--like pancakes but gotta have breakfast meat and potatoes or hash browns!
Even though food took some time coming out, my table was happy with our orders.
The savory bread pudding was a hit as was the BLT, hamburger and egg sandwich.
The table also shared an order of the French toast which all seemed to enjoy and describe as a hybrid with bread pudding.
I was too full so resisted trying it.
the plow.author: Christopher W.
the plow.review:
First off, couldn't resist a "Go Aggies!"--I did not know that Plow was co-owned by a fellow Aggie, until my friend Mindy pointed it out.  Very cool to see Aggie alum out and doing what they are passionate about. :-)

I stumbled upon Plow using Yelp Nearby on my Android phone in Dec '10 when my buddies and I finished up the Anchor Steam brewery tour.  Unfortunately at that point people decided it was easier to go back to The Marina (joy.)  Since then I have been wanting to check out Plow purely for the solid reviews and the lemon ricotta pancakes! :-)

When we decided to grab breakfast in SF this weekend, I suggested it and even though it was off the beaten path, people thought we should check it out!  My buddy Richard made it on time (9:30am) when we said we would meet and put in our name for a table of 6.  A little over an hour later we sat down.  The kitchen was bustling and people seemed to be enjoying their food!

I usually order what I first put my eye on.  In this case it was "The Plow" (two of their lemon ricotta pancakes, two eggs, Nueske bacon and crispy potatoes).  This is my usual breakfast choice anyways--like pancakes but gotta have breakfast meat and potatoes or hash browns!  Even though food took some time coming out, my table was happy with our orders.  The savory bread pudding was a hit as was the BLT, hamburger and egg sandwich.  The table also shared an order of the French toast which all seemed to enjoy and describe as a hybrid with bread pudding.  I was too full so resisted trying it.  Next time.

One of the great perks (for all coffee drinkers) is that they allow you/and even offer you coffee while you are waiting!  Didn't see if they actually ended up charging for it.  Regardless it's a nice gesture.  

Great to see business so solid, and if there was a way to get the wait down, I will be highly likely to return!

excerpts: I had the plow and every item was perfection
the plow.author: Tamara V.
the plow.review: Delicious , perfection, foodie- must-go!!! So happy my friend introduced me to this amazing place ! I had the plow and every item was perfection

excerpts: In 75 minutes I think we only saw like three different dishes go out - the Plow version of the Grand Slam, the sando and a friend chicken sandwich.
the plow.author: Matt S.
the plow.review:
November is Month of BRUNCH.  Plow got us off to an amazing start.  I heard this was some of the best brunch in SF and I agree wholeheartedly.  

Following the Yelp reviews, we ordered up a fried egg sando w bacon, one lemon ricotta pancake and the smoked salmon and bially.  All were absolutely wonderful.

The house potatoes were the best I've ever had.  Perfectly seasoned and with onions, fried crisptacularly - wow.  On the sando, the bread was so soft and fluffy and perfectly airy that it made the whole dish for me.  The egg was cooked exactly right and it gooed all over me when I bit in.

The salmon was awesome, the cream cheese puffy and wonderful, and the onions were pickly and sour and great.

We sat at the counter and were treated to a view of what everyone else was getting, and, while the menu has a range of items on it, In 75 minutes I think we only saw like three different dishes go out - the Plow version of the Grand Slam, the sando and a friend chicken sandwich.  

The bially was a little big and bready for me, and it was oven cooked rather than toasted.  I'm sure there's a reason for this, but I prefer my toasted bread/bagel thingies crispy-toasted on the outside and chewy on the inside, and this was just like mostly warm dense bread.  

That was the only very slight miss for me in an otherwise pitch-perfect brunch to kick off the world's first Month of BRUNCH.  Go Plow!!

excerpts: I get the plow because I like to try a little of everything.
the plow.author: Jessica H.
the plow.review:
Ok, this is the best breakfast place in the city right now.  I've been here twice and the first time was on a Sunday and we had to wait 1hour and 45 minutes!  It's that good.  The next time was today, Thursday, and we waited about 5min. 

The food is amazing.  You will lick your plate and nothing will leave you disappointed.  I get the plow because I like to try a little of everything.  The breakfast sandwich and the pork chops are also very good.  

Bacon is to die for, best potatoes in SF right now, chicken sausage very yummy, they do perfect poached eggs mmmmmmmmm, and the ricotta lemon pancakes are a must try!  They have perfectly brewed ice tea too!

I haver down all the best brunch spots in SF and this is the best right now.  Worth the 15 bucks a plate.

A little bonus, if you have seen the episode of Portlandia were they go to the crazy hip brunch spot, this place is like that on the weekend.  The hostess literally came out to tell all the patrons waiting that, "Everyone is doing really good, you're all doing really good, thanks for waiting".  I loved it, and I love PLOW.

excerpts: We both got the plow breakfast and it was absolutely delicious!
I'd recommend this place to anyone visiting or living in the Bay Area for sure!
the plow.author: Courtney S.
the plow.review: This place is worth the wait. My sister and I came here last Saturday, waited for 45 minutes in the cold, and then were sat. Let me just tell you that the wait was definitely worth it. We both got the plow breakfast and it was absolutely delicious! I'd recommend this place to anyone visiting or living in the Bay Area for sure!

excerpts: The Plow' at the Plow is the best breakfast ever.
the plow.author: Akshaya M.
the plow.review: 'The Plow' at the Plow is the best breakfast ever. I am in love with those lemon ricotta pancakes.  If not for the long wait times, I would be here every weekend.

excerpts: I got "The Plow" and it was amazing.
the plow.author: Taylor S.
the plow.review: A must stop if you're in San Fran! I got "The Plow" and it was amazing. Solid portion of food for even a hungry guy like myself and the lemon ricotta pancakes were some of the best I've ever had. Be prepared to wait a bit to get a table, but it's worth it and while you wait, grab a drip coffee and some banana bread a half a block down at Farley's!

excerpts: Well instead I decided to order the Eggs Benedict and decided to share "the plow" with my friend
(hey don't judge me I was starving!!
The Hollandaise sauce was too lemony for my taste and didn't quite compliment the poached eggs and the veggies.
the plow.author: Nithya S.
the plow.review:
I usually don't go to brunch places that don't take reservations only because I find it very very hard to wait in line and smell all the good food and not being able to eat it (you know what I mean ;)).  Well now if you decide to try this place you are most likely going to wait for anywhere between 30-40mins. Our party of 5 arrived and had to wait nearly an hour to get our table which was outside.  Would have preferred a table inside, but after an hour of waiting, I starving and was frankly very glad to get A table. 

By the time we settled down at our table and were ready to order, they were sold out of monkey bread and huevos rancheros! The 2 two things I was going to try here. Well instead I decided to order the Eggs Benedict and decided to share "the plow" with my friend (hey don't judge me I was starving!! :D).  The Hollandaise sauce was too lemony for my taste and didn't quite compliment the poached eggs and the veggies.  On the other hand, the Lemon ricotta pancakes are to die for, they so moist.  Do not leave this place without trying the lemon ricotta pancakes.  Oh almost forgot, the Crispy Potatoes are sooooo goood. 

Frankly I have had better food at places with less of a wait time than here.

excerpts: : I ordered The Plow ($15), and the lemon ricotta pancakes are just as good as everyone says.
And I am always happy to see real maple syrup instead of high-fructose corn syrup crap.
The eggs were also perfectly scrambled, and the homemade chicken apple sausage were smokey and sweet in a way that only homemade chicken apple sausage can be.
I was pretty disappointed with the potatoes, which seemed to be more small pieces of deep fried once-potato.
I like them crispy, but I still like to know they were once potatoes.
The coffee was also good, but $3.75?
the plow.author: Amy B.
the plow.review:
Was it delicious? Yep. Was it worth waiting an hour for a table for? Absolutely not. Of course, I don't think any food in the world is worth waiting for an hour for. When I want to eat, I want to eat!

Thankfully, I was catching up with a great old friend, which made the hour a bit bearable. But come on, who waits that long for brunch? I can think of many places where I can go for an equally good (or better) brunch where I don't have to wait that long, nor do I have to pay nearly $20 for. Don't get me wrong: I'm glad that I tried it and I thoroughly enjoyed the food, but I don't think I'll return to a place where a brunch dish and coffee costs almost $20 and I have to wait an hour. 

So, the good stuff: I ordered The Plow ($15), and the lemon ricotta pancakes are just as good as everyone says. And I am always happy to see real maple syrup instead of high-fructose corn syrup crap. The eggs were also perfectly scrambled, and the homemade chicken apple sausage were smokey and sweet in a way that only homemade chicken apple sausage can be. I was pretty disappointed with the potatoes, which seemed to be more small pieces of deep fried once-potato. I like them crispy, but I still like to know they were once potatoes. The coffee was also good, but $3.75? When did coffee become a side dish?

If you can get there on a day or at a time where you don't have to wait too long, it's definitely worth a splurge or somewhere to bring an out-of-town guest. But I likely won't be a regular.

excerpts: I had the plow, which consisted of bacon, eggs, crispy potatoes (my 2nd favorite item on the plate), and the mini lemon ricotta pancakes (the best part on the plate).
I don't know why, but the potatoes just stood out for me.
They were perfectly crispy and had a nice herb flavor.
I've wanted to try lemon ricotta pancakes for a while
and I'm glad I got to try it here.
They were fluffy and moist.
You get the subtle underlying flavors of lemon in there, like when eating a lemon cream filled cookie.
the plow.author: robin w.
the plow.review:
I had no idea the hill it was located on was so steep. My friend almost flew out of her seat as she stepped out. If she weren't holding on to the steering wheel she would have hurdled into the car beside us. I love the place though. It almost seems like Mama's, but more contemporary and casual. We also didn't have to wait in line. Amazing.

The ceiling was just gigantic. It makes you feel like you're 2 feet tall. Beside us were the towering windows and everything in the restaurant made you feel welcome. Absolutely loved the service. Out waitress was so nice and came by to check it everything was well. 

Now for the food. I had the plow, which consisted of bacon, eggs, crispy potatoes (my 2nd favorite item on the plate), and the mini lemon ricotta pancakes (the best part on the plate). I don't know why, but the potatoes just stood out for me. They were perfectly crispy and had a nice herb flavor. I've wanted to try lemon ricotta pancakes for a while and I'm glad I got to try it here. They were fluffy and moist. You get the subtle underlying flavors of lemon in there, like when eating a lemon cream filled cookie. So good. 

I also got to try the french toast. Just delightful. The pure maple syrup really made it taste as good as it did, but I think the ingredient that really did it was the caramel. There was a bit of caramel on the bananas and it just made it stand out from all the other french toast that I've had before. 

I'd love to come here again. Maybe on a sunnier day, but there will probably be a long line. A bit pricey for a breakfast joint, but the ambiance is really amazing there and it's worth a try.

excerpts: Everyone raved about the lemon ricotta pancakes so even thought I'm not a fan of pancakes, I ordered 'the plow' specifically to try them.
I'm still not a fan, but maybe if you're a pancake person you'll love them.

the flavor is there and i could definitely taste the ricotta, but i'm glad i only ordered them through 'the plow' - you get 2 smaller versions of the normal-size panckaes - otherwise i wouldn't have been able to finish them.
the plow.author: Jennifer W.
the plow.review:
Everyone raved about the lemon ricotta pancakes so even thought I'm not a fan of pancakes, I ordered 'the plow' specifically to try them. I'm still not a fan, but maybe if you're a pancake person you'll love them. the flavor is there and i could definitely taste the ricotta, but i'm glad i only ordered them through 'the plow' - you get 2 smaller versions of the normal-size panckaes - otherwise i wouldn't have been able to finish them.

I also tried the monkey bread and fried egg sandwich. Nothing blew me away as in "OMG/THIS IS TO DIE FOR" but everything is done extremely well. quality ingredients + care in preparation. I do want to come back and try the savory bread pudding, though. i sat at the counter and every few minutes the chef would slice a piece for someone's order and it looked soo amazing. didn't try it but if i hadn't asked, i would've thought it was more of a quiche. it looked so eggy and fluffy and it came with a side of huge mixed greens salad.

excerpts: I would suggest "The Plow" dish for the first time....BEST BREAKFAST POTATOES EVER!!!
the plow.author: Jason P.
the plow.review:
The food here was very good...plus there was some unique takes on things like lemon ricotta pancakes, breakfast sandwiches, biscuits and gravy (one of Alex's favorites). I would suggest "The Plow" dish for the first time....BEST BREAKFAST POTATOES EVER!!! 

The service was friendly but a little absent...of course they were all wiped from a crazy morning rush like a tsunami (we got there at 1:30). Our server made a great gesture after she had forgotten about our drink order and 15 minute wait for water.  I think they are generally good staff and the bill was well worth the value. 

The wait is HORRENDOUS! We waited almost an hour...gosh, I will go back but not on the weekend or at least much much earlier.

excerpts: We had the plow and eggs benedict - plow is a great deal!
You get a little of everything.
the plow.author: Nora X.
the plow.review:
The potatoes. Dear god, the potatoes. I'll probably be repeating the phrase as i die of cardiac arrest here. To elaborate, the potatoes are deep fried and tossed with onions and herbs and are incredible. 

Other than that - yes, brunch is good, but it's pretty standard brunch fare done well. We had the plow and eggs benedict - plow is a great deal! You get a little of everything. Lemon ricotta pancakes are good, but very sweet. The monkey bread is also awesome and basically pieces of a cinnamon roll smushed together in a bundt pan. 

Beware - the wait is long for brunch. Walk across the street and sun yourself in front of the mechanized bikes!

excerpts: We frequent this place for their lemon ricotta pancakes and the sausage option for "The Plow" is delicious.
Didn't mind waiting 30 minutes to eat here.
the plow.author: Ro B.
the plow.review: We frequent this place for their lemon ricotta pancakes and the sausage option for "The Plow" is delicious. Didn't mind waiting 30 minutes to eat here.

excerpts: Had The Plow (which includes their famous pancakes) as well as the Fried Egg Sandwich.
The pancakes are as at least as good as people say, and the egg sandwich is delicious, and even the potatoes (which I normally don't eat much of) are good.
Would gladly come back here, even if I have to sacrifice a couple hours of sleep.
the plow.author: Josh Q.
the plow.review:
Very solid brunch spot.  The trick is to get here among the first group to be seated, likely around 7:30-7:45 on a Saturday morning - otherwise, you will be waiting for a long time.  That obviously means an early wake-up, but it's well worth it.

Had The Plow (which includes their famous pancakes) as well as the Fried Egg Sandwich.  The pancakes are as at least as good as people say, and the egg sandwich is delicious, and even the potatoes (which I normally don't eat much of) are good.  Would gladly come back here, even if I have to sacrifice a couple hours of sleep.

excerpts: I got the the plow and the fried egg sandwich.
Now the plow was basically a sampler and had most of what was available on the menu.
the plow.author: Jessica H.
the plow.review:
Went here on a Tuesday morning with my cousin. Heard about this place from 7x7 and wanted to see if it was good.
I got the the plow and the fried egg sandwich. 
Now the plow was basically a sampler and had most of what was available on the menu. I was hoping the lemon ricotta pancakes would wow me. But it was just alright. There was something slightly off... I don't know what it is to the taste. I did like the chicken apple sausage though. My cousin was indifferent to it.
The fried egg sandwich was my favorite. It was like gout for breakfast. The egg was fried perfectly and the bit of arugula (or some kind of mixed greens) helped balance out the sandwich. I was expecting it to be super heavy but it wasn't. We also added bacon which made it pretty good.
We got a ton of potatoes. In the beginning, the potatoes were really good. But we all know that if you eat too much of something good, it becomes sorta not good. That's what happened to us.
All in all, a good place to have brunch. But there was a smell in the place that lingered. I don't know if it was saffron or something. But it stayed with me even when I left the place. That smell also was associated with the potatoes. And no, I know what potatoes smell like, but this smell was more herby or saffrony.

excerpts: (As for a review, the Plow is amazing, and the crab scramble is excellent.
Also, I love generously buttered toast.)
the plow.author: .caroline. ..
the plow.review:
Best.  Potatoes.  I.  Have.  Ever.  Put.  In.  My.  Mouth.

So there are many, many wonderful things about playing hookey, but maybe the best thing is being able to go to a restaurant that would otherwise have an insane weekend line without having to wait in an insane line.

Thank you, Plow.  I think I'll order anything you'll serve that comes with those potatoes, please. 

(As for a review, the Plow is amazing, and the crab scramble is excellent.  Also, I love generously buttered toast.)

excerpts:
I had the egg sandwich, duh, but next time will consider getting "the plow" bc the portions looked huge!  

minus a star because it's super tiny, they make u share tables, and the long wait (no reservations) on the weekend.
the plow.author: Tiffany D.
the plow.review:
I LOVED my meal but the bf was not as excited as I was, maybe because he's not obsessed with eggs like I am.  I had the egg sandwich, duh, but next time will consider getting "the plow" bc the portions looked huge!  

minus a star because it's super tiny, they make u share tables, and the long wait (no reservations) on the weekend.  

Had the pear french toast which was delish, but gotta go back to try the lemon ricotta pancakes.

excerpts: Get the plow, the pancakes were awesome.
the potato in that dish was super tasty.
French toast was really fluffy.
the plow.author: Deb L.
the plow.review:
Long wait, but worth it. 

Tips: get your coffee inside while you wait.

Get the plow, the pancakes were awesome.  the potato in that dish was super tasty.  French toast was really fluffy.

excerpts: My mom loved The Plow dish, she was able to enjoy everything at once!
Kudos Maxine!
the plow.author: Jen C.
the plow.review: Wow, one of the best fried chicken sandwiches I have ever had!  My mom loved The Plow dish, she was able to enjoy everything at once!  Kudos Maxine!

excerpts: My friend who is gluten free enjoyed the Plow breakfast w/ a gluten free pancake and loved it:)
So awesome!
the plow.author: Heather F.
the plow.review: This is now my favorite breakfast/brunch spot. I would wait all morning and yes, you must be willing bc it's a wait? But it is worth it! Every insane bite. Potatoes are like crack, the lemon pancakes are insane! I have a new fav and this is it! It is clear that these folks know food and do it right. My friend who is gluten free enjoyed the Plow breakfast w/ a gluten free pancake and loved it:) So awesome!

excerpts: One friend had the breakfast sandwich which looked good, and the other had the plow which looked like a classic bfast to get especially if you're undecided.
the plow.author: Meredith K.
the plow.review:
This place is ahmazing!  My sister & bro-in-law keep talking about it since their friend's sister owns it.  Exceeded my expectations.   
We waited for about 20 mins for a table for 3 on a Friday around 11am.  Yes, it was crowded believe it or not.  It's super cute, quaint restaurant with lots of windows!

I had the omelette: lamb's quarters, mushrooms, goat cheese, crispy potatoes, toast.  TO DIE...you wouldn't believe how well the egg was cooked to perfection.  Wasn't dry nor was it under cooked.  Never had a more perfect omelette egg!  And the potatoes - never had anything like them.  Super tasty as they were tossed in sea salt flakes and the crispiness is like no other.

One friend had the breakfast sandwich which looked good, and the other had the plow which looked like a classic bfast to get especially if you're undecided.  We added a short stack of the lemon ricotta pancakes which were good.  I'm more of a savory breakfast eater so I was extremely content with my bfast.  

I highly recommend and would definitely come back - preferably on a weekday.

excerpts: I almost had the "the Plow" which features all the greatest hits on the menu, but opted to share the Monkey Bread (unbelievably good!)
the plow.author: Kathy P.
the plow.review:
It's nice to have another Brunch place on the HIll. Although it was quite crowded when we went ( a little after eight on a Saturday Morning) the space feels light and airy inside. I almost had the "the Plow" which features all the greatest hits on the menu, but opted to share the Monkey Bread (unbelievably good!) with two eggs and a side of the House-Made Sausage. I didn't finish the sausage because it was a little too spicy for me (even my friend, who is a HUGE fan of lighting her mouth on fire, said it was pretty spicy for a breakfast sausage). But I would come back again and have the French Toast.

The sweet spot for Breakfast seating seems to be about 9:00 am - if you go early as we did, you get a seat, but the kitchen gets slammed out of the gate, so you have a little wait on the food. Things shake out nicely after 9:00.

Wait staff is very friendly and efficient.

excerpts: I ordered the PLOW breakfast plate with 2 eggs, 2 house sausage patties, 2 ricotta pancakes and home fries.
I had barely tasted anything before I spotted a hair embedded in the home fries.
Gross.
Though they offered to replace the plate, I had lost my appetite and didn't feel like eating anything anymore.
Needless to say, this dining experience was memorable for all the wrong reasons.
the plow.author: Genevieve D.
the plow.review: I was so excited to finally dine at Plow. My friends and I didn't even mind waiting 45 minutes for the outside table next to bus stop. I ordered the PLOW breakfast plate with 2 eggs, 2 house sausage patties, 2 ricotta pancakes and home fries. I had barely tasted anything before I spotted a hair embedded in the home fries. Gross. Though they offered to replace the plate, I had lost my appetite and didn't feel like eating anything anymore. Needless to say, this dining experience was memorable for all the wrong reasons.

excerpts: I got the plow breakfast.
The bad started when 3 waters were placed on the table automatically when we had bottled waters in front of us.
Water should only be served upon request right now which really made me mad..
Then, I asked for my potatoes without onion so I could share them with my mom, who has a severe onion allergy.
Luckily I spotted them in the potatoes before she ate them...
I would've let our waitress know if she hadn't disappeared.
We didn't see her until she left the check on our table.
I might come back for the ricotta pancakes, to go.
Might.
the plow.author: kristen k.
the plow.review: I was extremely excited to try plow, specifically because my mom has quite a few food allergies and is gluten free. She got the almond flour pancakes which she loved... I got the plow breakfast. The bad started when 3 waters were placed on the table automatically when we had bottled waters in front of us. Water should only be served upon request right now which really made me mad.. Then, I asked for my potatoes without onion so I could share them with my mom, who has a severe onion allergy. Luckily I spotted them in the potatoes before she ate them... I would've let our waitress know if she hadn't disappeared. We didn't see her until she left the check on our table. I might come back for the ricotta pancakes, to go. Might.

excerpts: I had the plow and coffee.
No doubt that it was very good....
but it is hard for me to justify $25 for breakfast.
Knock that down to $15
and I'd be a regular.
the plow.author: Kristin P.
the plow.review: I had the plow and coffee.   No doubt that it was very good....but it is hard for me to justify $25 for breakfast.   Knock that down to $15 and I'd be a regular.

excerpts: * "the plow" (your typical American breakfast with eggs, choice of breakfast meat, pancakes and potatoes) - 2 stars -
The bacon tasted good, but then again, it's hard to mess up bacon.
Everything else tasted like what you might get from a free continental breakfast at your good ol' Best Western.
Yelp-ers seem to rave about the crispy potatoes, but the "crispy" potatoes that came with my "the plow" dish were only ok.
The potato was not even cut into pieces all the way, so I got like one big chunk of the potato.
the plow.author: Richard S.
the plow.review:
This place is overrated at best.  We came here for Sunday brunch and I was sorely disappointed by the food.  

The food tasted like its chef... snobby.

To be fair, the wait staff was very friendly though.

The decor and ambiance make it look like a good restaurant but the food does not live up to expectations.  As the old saying goes, you can't judge a book by it's cover.

We sat down at our table at 1pm (one hour before closing time), so maybe they were running tired and were starting to run out of ingredients.  But man, the food was sub par.

We ordered:
* lemon ricotta pancakes - 3 stars - Average taste.
* crispy pig ears - 1 star - Tasted like rubber.
* fried egg sandwich - 3 star - Average taste, but it was the best dish we had.
* "the plow" (your typical American breakfast with eggs, choice of breakfast meat, pancakes and potatoes) - 2 stars - The bacon tasted good, but then again, it's hard to mess up bacon.  Everything else tasted like what you might get from a free continental breakfast at your good ol' Best Western.  Yelp-ers seem to rave about the crispy potatoes, but the "crispy" potatoes that came with my "the plow" dish were only ok.  The potato was not even cut into pieces all the way, so I got like one big chunk of the potato.  The other dishes at other tables seemed to have smaller potato pieces (almost like home fries), but mine was one huge chunk.

Maybe they're still working out the kinks because they're new.  Maybe their lunch items are better.

But honestly, the best thing I had was the Tapatio hot sauce.

excerpts: The lemon ricotta pancakes are divine and I highly recommend The Plow, which gives you a taste of sweet and savory.
The fried egg sandwhich was nice but a little runny.
the plow.author: Madeline W.
the plow.review: Plow has very yummy brunch.  I usually meet my sister there after her 24ers and we dine on delicious food while she deliriously tells us tales from the hospital.  Even though we usually get there early (before 9) there is always a line so be prepared to wait.  They do give out free coffee though which is a plus.  The lemon ricotta pancakes are divine and I highly recommend The Plow, which gives you a taste of sweet and savory.  The fried egg sandwhich was nice but a little runny.

excerpts: get the plow breakfast-- it showcases all os there
work@
the plow.author: Michael S.
the plow.review: Great spot for breakfast. This place pays attention to every detail. Mimosa's were outstanding-- get the plow breakfast-- it showcases all os there work@

excerpts: Like on everyone's review, The plow is my favorite but everything is good.
Had the fried egg sandwich on my last visit which was great!
The strawberry lemonade was good
but I'll stick to coffee next time.
the plow.author: Rave Y.
the plow.review:
Been going to plow for years (before the long waits) and is my favorite place in San Francisco for brunch.  I usually avoid the weekends because of the crowds but it has been busy during the weekdays also.  Parking is normally not bad in the area.  

The food has been consistently good over the years.  Like on everyone's review, The plow is my favorite but everything is good.  Had the fried egg sandwich on my last visit which was great!  The strawberry lemonade was good but I'll stick to coffee next time.  Lemon ricotta pancakes is a favorite staple here.  

I'm not normally a breakfast/brunch person but when I want a special or something different for breakfast/brunch, it's PLOW. 

They have outside seating on the sidewalk.  I prefer sitting indoors but from what I have seen, the outdoor seating is great with people with pets, restless kids and the extra seats keeps the wait time down for everyone.  I love the picture of the people sitting outside with their umbrellas out.  

Baked is a short walk away and is a favorite place for sweet treat after brunch.

excerpts: My boyfriend told me I should order "The Plow"
and I would tell anyone else the same!

But I probably would have ordered it without the suggestion because I was set on trying their famous lemon ricotta pancakes, BEST pancakes ever and "The Plow" comes with 2 of the pancakes, sausage or bacon, potatoes, and 2 eggs.
I love it when restaurants give you an option of a sweet and savory dish.
I almost always go for it because they surprisingly don't come so often.
I tried the pumpkin pancakes the second time
and they were just OK to me.
Anyway, only downside about this place is the wait, but you can't escape that if you want to have a good brunch in SF.
the plow.author: Stephanie G.
the plow.review: One of my favorite brunch spots in SF! I've been here twice-- once around 1pm for a late brunch, and waited around 30-40 minutes (for 2 people) and the second time, came around the same time, but waited over an hour for 3 people. We walked around a few blocks to get a cup of coffee while waiting and there were a few places to sit as well, so the wait wasn't too bad and it was definitely worth it. My boyfriend told me I should order "The Plow" and I would tell anyone else the same! But I probably would have ordered it without the suggestion because I was set on trying their famous lemon ricotta pancakes, BEST pancakes ever and "The Plow" comes with 2 of the pancakes, sausage or bacon, potatoes, and 2 eggs. I love it when restaurants give you an option of a sweet and savory dish. I almost always go for it because they surprisingly don't come so often. I tried the pumpkin pancakes the second time and they were just OK to me. Anyway, only downside about this place is the wait, but you can't escape that if you want to have a good brunch in SF.

excerpts: The plow breakfast is everything you want.
the plow.author: Kyle J.
the plow.review: Great local brunch place. The plow breakfast is everything you want. Eggs, the best crunch potatoes, lemon ricotta pancakes (currently), and sausage made in house. You will however wait an hour and a half on weekends for a table. Luckily I live around the corner...

excerpts: I went for " the plow" and the pancakes blew my mind.
the plow.author: Joseph M.
the plow.review:
Finally another b-fast place in Potrero. I went for " the plow" and the pancakes blew my mind. Dont miss a good spot for a great meal.

Housemade sausage = top notch 
Pancakes = something like creme brulee 
Potatoes = crunchy and delicious
Hot suace = careful
Eggs = if you get this wrong.....

Maybe not super kid friendly but a great breakfast addition to the hill.

excerpts: We had "the plow" and the fried egg sandwich for breakfast and it both was delicious!
We came here around 9.30am so there was a wait list already.
After 20min we had a table.
The service is very nice.
The food looked good on every table.
The savory breadpudding looked so good on our neighbors table:) I'll have it the next time.
The eggs benedict also looked soooo perfect!
It's a bit noisy in here
but it's definitely a nice spot to have breakfast in SF!
the plow.author: Katja J.
the plow.review: What a great way to start your day. They have great food! We had "the plow" and the fried egg sandwich for breakfast and it both was delicious! We came here around 9.30am so there was a wait list already. After 20min we had a table. The service is very nice. The food looked good on every table. The savory breadpudding looked so good on our neighbors table:) I'll have it the next time. The eggs benedict also looked soooo perfect! It's a bit noisy in here but it's definitely a nice spot to have breakfast in SF!

excerpts: I got the Plow with the chicken apple sausage which gave me a little taste of everything.
EVERY SINGLE THING ON THE PLATE WAS AMAZING!
I don't know how some place can make even scrambled eggs more amazing than anywhere else, but Plow manages to make them that way.
the plow.author: Lindsay A.
the plow.review:
Everything I was hoping for and more! 
OK, so the wait was a bit long (40 minutes) on a Sunday but boy was it worth it! We sat at the counter which was cozy and gave us a nice view of all the yummy foods coming out. I got the Plow with the chicken apple sausage which gave me a little taste of everything. EVERY SINGLE THING ON THE PLATE WAS AMAZING!
I don't know how some place can make even scrambled eggs more amazing than anywhere else, but Plow manages to make them that way. The lemon ricotta pancakes were moist and delicious. The crispy potatoes perfectly crisp and flavorful, didn't even need ketchup! And the sausage was equally to die for. What else can I say? amazing!

excerpts: I was undecided between the crab omelette and the plow, and decided to go with the latter.
the homemade sausage was good but a little dry.
The almond pancakes were tasty.
Overall, It didn't really blow me away.
Maybe I set my expectations a little high?
The service was great though and they keep the place very clean.
the plow.author: Chris L.
the plow.review: After reading the reviews, I drove to the city at 7am to try this place. I found parking right away, and the restaurant was mostly empty. I was undecided between the crab omelette and the plow, and decided to go with the latter. the homemade sausage was good but a little dry. The almond pancakes were tasty. Overall, It didn't really blow me away. Maybe I set my expectations a little high? The service was great though and they keep the place very clean.

excerpts: Some of my favorites have been: The plow, the potato skin dish with an egg on top and the fried chicken sandwich.
They also have great sides (seasonal) and awesome dishes to share.
You may have to wait a way, it gets busy but it's totally worth the wait.
Quality food, great ingredients!
the plow.author: Kara S.
the plow.review:
I love this place. Friendly service (although a little ditsy at times, they never bring you a spoon with your sugar, cream and coffee-people stirring away with the butt end of their forks everywhere).
The food is great. I have been at least 10 times and every single time it's great and consistent. Some of my favorites have been: The plow, the potato skin dish with an egg on top and the fried chicken sandwich. They also have great sides (seasonal) and awesome dishes to share.
You may have to wait a way, it gets busy but it's totally worth the wait.
Quality food, great ingredients!

excerpts: Looking forward to coming back to Plow ASAP to try their Fried Egg Sandwich, The Plow (two eggs, choice of Nueske bacon, house made pork sausage, or chicken apple sausage, two pancakes & crispy potatoes), and/or a Chocolate Eclair.
the plow.author: Tiffany M.
the plow.review:
I'm not one to vouch for restaurants that often, but in Plow's case, I guarantee that you'll like it... in fact, you'll LOVE it. I should also note that I almost never rate a place 5 stars based on a first time visit, but Plow was so freakin' good, that I feel confident in giving them 5 shiny stars.

Everything at Plow tasted just as good as it looked.

Standouts included:
+Lemon Ricotta Pancakes (house made ricotta, lemon zest, pure maple syrup) 
+Tinga (chicken in tomato chipotle sauce, two crispy corn tortillas, avocado, creme fraiche, cilantro)
+Crispy Potatoes

Mid-conversation, my friend let out a big 'MMMM!!!!" when he bit into his pancakes. I couldn't have agreed more! 

I like the fact that they work w/ local purveyors such as Frog Hollow Farms, Cowgirl Creamery, Monterey Fish Co, Acme Bread & Tcho Chocolate. When you see that they work w/ such local all-stars, you know you're in for a treat. I also really enjoyed Plow's Equator coffee while I waited for our table. And that wait was long! We came in at 11:30 am and had to wait an hour until we were seated. Normally I'd shoot for a much earlier brunch time to avoid the wait, but given that I was prepared for a leisurely Sunday brunch, the wait was pretty painless.

I love the ambiance of this place. It's small, but w/ their high ceilings and all the light that shines in from their big windows, they're able to make the space work; especially decorated in its rustic, modern, simplistic fashion. I love their signage, logo and menu- all well done. They also have stool seating where you can watch the chefs work their magic (like we did!)

The host was cool and our server efficient. Parking was ample (not surprising for Portrero Hill ) and diners seemed to be all SF locals. 

Looking forward to coming back to Plow ASAP to try their Fried Egg Sandwich, The Plow (two eggs, choice of Nueske bacon, house made pork sausage, or chicken apple sausage, two pancakes & crispy potatoes), and/or a Chocolate Eclair.

This place makes me thankful for SF's amazing food scene!

excerpts: My go-to order is conveniently named, "The Plow" which consists of 2 eggs, potatoes, 2 lemon ricotta pancakes, and your choice of breakfast meat.
The restaurant offers a slew of other items, but I can never convince myself to try anything else.
The meal never disappoints and the best part I must say are the potatoes.
Twice fried and tossed with some herbs, need I say more?
My bf loves the lemon ricotta pancakes and they are definitely the perfect size given the amount of food you get.
This time, we decided to order the Huckleberry Coffee Cake to share as well.
It was only okay for me.
The cake had a different texture than typically coffee cake (more spongy versus crumbly) and I was expecting something different.
We had to wait a good while to get our main dishes, so our waitress was nice enough to comp us on the coffee cake.
We didn't mind since we were enjoying the nice (but chilly) day, sipping our coffee.
It's a far drive for just brunch from San Jose, but definitely always worth the trek.
the plow.author: Michele L.
the plow.review:
This is by far our favorite brunch place if we go to San Francisco.  We've tried other restaurants in the city, but we always regret not coming back to Plow.  I want to give the restaurant 4.5 stars.  The restaurant is definitely small, so expect a 1 hour (or more) wait on the weekends (why I deducted a star).  

My go-to order is conveniently named, "The Plow" which consists of 2 eggs, potatoes, 2 lemon ricotta pancakes, and your choice of breakfast meat.  The restaurant offers a slew of other items, but I can never convince myself to try anything else.  The meal never disappoints and the best part I must say are the potatoes.  Twice fried and tossed with some herbs, need I say more?  My bf loves the lemon ricotta pancakes and they are definitely the perfect size given the amount of food you get.  This time, we decided to order the Huckleberry Coffee Cake to share as well.  It was only okay for me.  The cake had a different texture than typically coffee cake (more spongy versus crumbly) and I was expecting something different.  We had to wait a good while to get our main dishes, so our waitress was nice enough to comp us on the coffee cake.  We didn't mind since we were enjoying the nice (but chilly) day, sipping our coffee.  It's a far drive for just brunch from San Jose, but definitely always worth the trek.

excerpts: We both had the plow breakfast.
I had it with scrambled eggs and the nueske bacon(applewood smoked bacon from Wisconsin
-where the owner is from), and the best pancakes I've had in a long time.
the plow.author: Racquel R.
the plow.review:
Love, love, love this place!  Very easy access to get to off of the 280.  Cute quaint residential neighborhood.  Restaurant is at bottom of a hill. Got there at 8:30 am on a Sunday and there was already a line.  Parking was easy at that hour.  If you park on the hill, you park at 90 degrees to the curb. 
This was a birthday brunch with a girlfriend - based on review from other Yelpers and we expected a wait.  But it wasn't so bad. We were seated within a half an hour at the counter for the two of us.  No doubt about it, it's a small restaurant, but they've got their system down. The kitchen is busy and the owner and the wait staff have it down pat.  Service was quick and attentive.  We got our food quickly as well.
We both had the plow breakfast. I had it with scrambled eggs and the nueske bacon(applewood smoked bacon from Wisconsin -where the owner is from), and the best pancakes I've had in a long time. I love the lemon ricotta pancakes people have raved about!  I love the texture, flavor, and it's just amazing.  The nueske bacon was pretty good, too!  
I would definitely go back...maybe on a weekday when it may be a bit on the slower side of things.

excerpts: You get a good selection of all their best if you order "The Plow".
the plow.author: Ryan C.
the plow.review:
There is something magical about their potatoes :)

Hands down favorite brunch place in the city. The freshness of their ingredients tells you this is a place with integrity and they will serve you real food. The line is long, so get there early! But totally worth every single minute of wait. The food is excellent and you can hardly go wrong with anything you order. Prices are reasonable. You get a good selection of all their best if you order "The Plow". 

Lets get down to the numbers:
Service: Good, but be patient with the line :)
Food: Excellent!
Interior: Perfect for brunch
Price: Reasonable and totally worth it!

excerpts: If you want a heftier meal, the fried egg sandwich, and "The Plow" should meet your demands.
I'll have to update this review once I have their lunch sandwiches, but so far, I'm quite satisfied.
the plow.author: Sharon T.
the plow.review:
Go early...or go on a weekday (unless you don't mind the long wait).
That said, Plow is clean and cozy, with good friendly service. Total comfort food, all sourced from the local farms.

Definitely try their corn millet muffins and lemon ricotta pancakes (both VERY filling). If you want a heftier meal, the fried egg sandwich, and "The Plow" should meet your demands. I'll have to update this review once I have their lunch sandwiches, but so far, I'm quite satisfied.

excerpts: My sister and I split and the Plow order and it was an amazing sampler of delectable delights including: lemon ricotta pancakes,  home made pork sausages, crispy potatoes with rosemary and two eggs
any style that your heart desires.
When they say crispy potatoes, they really mean crispy.
We actually got specific recommendations to get their potatoes since they are so yummy there
and it was totally true.
Forget your usual limp, dry, mealy home fries, these are crunchy, crispy and delightful.
I LOVED the lemon ricotta pancakes, they were fluffy, tart and delicious!
I wished I got a whole order of these lovely treats.
We were deciding between the chicken apple sausage but was easily convinced to try the pork instead they were made in house and were delicious.
They were made sans casing and were tasty and succulent.
My friend got the omelet made with spinach and oyster mushrooms and that was amazing as well.
Bottom line: the food here is great and totally worth the wait ;)
the plow.author: Vivian T.
the plow.review: Long wait but probably a good sign.  They do provide coffee for the wait.  My sister and I split and the Plow order and it was an amazing sampler of delectable delights including: lemon ricotta pancakes,  home made pork sausages, crispy potatoes with rosemary and two eggs any style that your heart desires. When they say crispy potatoes, they really mean crispy.  We actually got specific recommendations to get their potatoes since they are so yummy there and it was totally true.  Forget your usual limp, dry, mealy home fries, these are crunchy, crispy and delightful.  I LOVED the lemon ricotta pancakes, they were fluffy, tart and delicious! I wished I got a whole order of these lovely treats.  We were deciding between the chicken apple sausage but was easily convinced to try the pork instead they were made in house and were delicious.  They were made sans casing and were tasty and succulent.  My friend got the omelet made with spinach and oyster mushrooms and that was amazing as well.  Bottom line: the food here is great and totally worth the wait ;)

excerpts: Three of us had: the plow, mushroom salad and two eggs with the works.
Great stuff
Pancakes, sausage, fries - all part of either the plow or the two eggs were just awesome.
Pancakes, sausage, fries - all part of either the plow or the two eggs were just awesome.
the plow.author: Bill L.
the plow.review:
Went here on a Thursday around 10:15.  Already packed.  Does anyone work?  Hate to write a great review as it will just add to the lines!
Three of us had: the plow, mushroom salad and two eggs with the works.  Great stuff
Pancakes, sausage, fries - all part of either the plow or the two eggs were just awesome.  Mushroom salad is something else - fantastic.

We sat inside and watch all the things we didn't order and we will be back.
Service was great.  Busboy also kept an eye out at our water glass and kept them filled.

I hate myself for adding to the lines

excerpts: Lemon ricotta pancakes are so good but the best of everything is THE PLOW.
I am obsessed with their house made sausage and wished they would someday add biscuits and gravy to the menu because their buttermilk biscuit is amazing as well!!!!
The buttermilk biscuit is crunchy in the outside and soft and buttery on the inside!
I've had a handful of things on their menu and have not once been disappointed.
Only thing disappointing is having to wait for it!!
But I'm willing to wait!
the plow.author: Kim S.
the plow.review: This food is The JAM!! Soooo good!! Worth the wait! Lemon ricotta pancakes are so good but the best of everything is THE PLOW. I am obsessed with their house made sausage and wished they would someday add biscuits and gravy to the menu because their buttermilk biscuit is amazing as well!!!! The buttermilk biscuit is crunchy in the outside and soft and buttery on the inside! I've had a handful of things on their menu and have not once been disappointed. Only thing disappointing is having to wait for it!! But I'm willing to wait!

excerpts: The second dish (The Plow) was also a mix of mostly flavorless items (exception being the crispy potatoes that were flavorful and crispy).
the plow.author: d f.
the plow.review:
This is the worst breakfast/brunch I've had in ages -- I am still traumatized that I spent time and money going to check out this place.  Of note, I had no expectations and did not read any reviews prior.  In fact, I am now even more shocked that this restaurant has so many good reviews.  The only reason I don't give Zero stars is because I can't.

The french toast was tasteless.  The pears that came with it didn't enhance the taste at all.  I also asked for bananas and since they came later, I was such a state of disbelief that I didn't even try with the french toast -- I had 3 bites and I was disgusted -- no amount of syrup or anything else could save that so called "item".

The second dish (The Plow) was also a mix of mostly flavorless items (exception being the crispy potatoes that were flavorful and crispy).

My suggestion to anyone reading this: if you want a good brunch, basically any other  place in the City will do.  If you want very good brunch, go to Tangerine, Mission Cafe, Tartine, just to name a few.  If you want an excellent brunch, WITH THE BEST FRENCH TOAST IN TOWN, THE GOLD STANDARD OF FRENCH TOATS, go to Foreing Cinema.

I've lived in the City for over 20 years and I honestly do not recall having such a horrible brunch as far as the food is concerned.  The waitress was genuinely nice and polite, but never came back to ask if the food was good.  The fact that we did leave half of the small order on the plate, and more than half of the lemon ricotta pancakes should've been a clue to anyone paying attention

excerpts: After reading the reviews, we decided to try The Plow, pumpkin pancakes, a biscuit and eggs, and a side salad.
The salad never came (though we were charged for it, and had to point out that we'd never received it).
The pancakes were fine, nothing special.
The biscuit didn't come until really late in the meal (which is odd, as you could see them already existing by the register...) and was similarly fine, but not impressive.
The muffin we'd gotten the last time around had been spectacular--it was a millet corn coconut muffin--but perhaps Plow is not as impressive on weekdays?
I'm not sure what the buzz is about.
the plow.author: Californian I.
the plow.review: We came here on a Thursday morning, and were shocked to be able to get a table without a wait. It was our first time (apart from a failed weekend attempt where the wait was so long we decided to buy a muffin--which was excellent--and return another day). After reading the reviews, we decided to try The Plow, pumpkin pancakes, a biscuit and eggs, and a side salad. The salad never came (though we were charged for it, and had to point out that we'd never received it). The pancakes were fine, nothing special. The biscuit didn't come until really late in the meal (which is odd, as you could see them already existing by the register...) and was similarly fine, but not impressive. The muffin we'd gotten the last time around had been spectacular--it was a millet corn coconut muffin--but perhaps Plow is not as impressive on weekdays? I'm not sure what the buzz is about.

excerpts: The Plow and tons of pancakes...
lemon ricotta or almond.
the plow.author: HipsterChick S.
the plow.review: Plan ahead...get here well before you die of hunger because the wait is long...with good reason. My favorite brunch in SF hands down. Order The Plow and tons of pancakes...lemon ricotta or almond. The crispy potatoes are other worldly!

excerpts: I ordered The Plow.
Why?
Because if it's your first time at a restaurant, you can't go wrong with the dish carrying the restaurants name.
Yes, it's very good.
The place is a bit small, with outdoor and bar seating as well as tables.
It gets real crowded on weekends and so probably not a good option for large groups.
We visited during prime time for Sunday brunch and had to wait about 45 minutes.
Well worth it.
the plow.author: Nathan E.
the plow.review: I ordered The Plow. Why?  Because if it's your first time at a restaurant, you can't go wrong with the dish carrying the restaurants name. Yes, it's very good. The place is a bit small, with outdoor and bar seating as well as tables. It gets real crowded on weekends and so probably not a good option for large groups. We visited during prime time for Sunday brunch and had to wait about 45 minutes. Well worth it.

excerpts: I had the Plow which has eggs, crispy home fries (really good and actually crispy), pancakes and pork sausage.
Everything was cooked to perfection except the pancakes.
They were slightly burned on the outside so the burnt flavor overpowered them.
the plow.author: Andrew B.
the plow.review:
First thing everyone should know... There's going to be a wait time. Don't expect to get there and be seated right away. It's that popular! Also make sure that your whole party is there. They won't sit you until then. 
None of these are negative traits, it's a part of business and a place so popular it's completely understandable. 

Now the food! I had the Plow which has eggs, crispy home fries (really good and actually crispy), pancakes and pork sausage. Everything was cooked to perfection except the pancakes. They were slightly burned on the outside so the burnt flavor overpowered them. Sad but still nice on the inside. 

We sat outside and it was a little cold so our food got colder faster but it was still nice to be outside. Ask for a blanket if you're too cold. They are limited and used by others so don't expect freshly clean linens. 

Will visit again, hopefully sooner than later. Not many brunch spots I can recommend, but this one I can. Visit and get some good food.

excerpts: If you are going to Plow, you need to order the plow.
The housemade pork sausage is TO DIE FOR.
the plow.author: Vanessa B.
the plow.review: If you are going to Plow, you need to order the plow. The housemade pork sausage is TO DIE FOR. As are the rest of the components- house potatoes, lemon ricotta pancakes, and 2 eggs. The plate is a great combination and is the perfect amount of food to leave you satisfied and account for a breakfast and a lunch. I would not give Plow 5 stars because of the waitresses and the wait. The wait has increasingly gotten longer and it seems to be getting swamped by techies who must work in the area. Nonetheless, if you are willing to wait 1.5 hours on a Saturday morning, go to Plow.

excerpts: My friends got the Plow special (eggs, bacon, lemon ricotta pancakes, potatoes) and the biscuits and gravy.
