crispy potatoes.author: Anthony N.
crispy potatoes.review:
***This neighborhood breakfast spot utilizes high quality ingredients and a well-run kitchen to churn out delicious and satisfying breakfast and brunch dishes***

Plow is located in Dogpatch, an up-and-coming neighborhood that will probably introduce several more destination restaurants in the next few years.  Plow is a weekday and weekend breakfast and brunch eatery.  The restaurant is small and casual though the décor is nicely done featuring homey but still contemporary notes.  The counter is nice and provides an excellent view of the short order counter where the team of chefs here efficiently crank out breakfast dishes like a well-run greasy spoon.

The food at Plow is not greasy spoon staples though.  You will see more upscale ingredients here like prosciutto and frisee as well as some great looking bread from a prestigious San Francisco bakery.  I had The Plow, which is their signature breakfast plate.  It is a hearty plate featuring two eggs, crispy fried potatoes with onions, choice of meat (chicken apple sausage, pork sausage patties or bacon), and two lemon ricotta pancakes.

With the exception of the lemon ricotta pancakes, this breakfast veered more towards fairly classic interpretations.  I had the eggs sunny side up, and they were quite good.  I would have liked the egg yolk a little less done, but the flavor was great.  The crispy potatoes were quite delicious.  The caramelized onions provided a mild sweet flavor while the potatoes combined a satisfying crispy exterior with a hot and soft center.  I also had their bacon, which was Nueske's bacon, a popular Midwestern bacon from Wisconsin.  The bacon had a smoky flavor as well as an appetizing pork flavor from the crispy fat.

The bacon was not as thick as Niman Ranch bacon, but the flavor was definitely memorable.  I also ordered their pork sausage patties, and these were good though I probably did prefer the bacon.  The center of the sausage was moist while the outside was well seared and crispy.  They get a little more adventurous with the seasoning so you get more herb and fennel notes with their sausage than you would experience at most breakfast spots.

The kitchen gussied up the pancakes a little more than they did with the other breakfast items in The Plow.  The pancakes featured both lemon and ricotta.  The lemon was nice.  It provided a noticeable lemon flavor as well as a lot of freshness.  I felt though that the ricotta probably hurt the pancake more than it helped it.  The pancakes had a great color and the smell of the pancake was very inviting.  Unfortunately, the pancake could have been sweeter.  The center was also a tad on the dry side and did not have that light and fluffy cake-like texture you would expect in an excellent pancake.

Service was fairly quick given how busy this restaurant gets (even on weekdays).  Prices are higher than your standard breakfast spot, but the ingredients at Plow are definitely high quality and the portions are surprisingly generous.

I enjoyed The Plow at Plow though I felt the savory items were far superior to the disappointing lemon ricotta pancakes.  Part of me really loved the breakfast here, and, in some ways, Plow would rival my favorite breakfast restaurants--Matt's Big Breakfast in Phoenix or Huckleberry in Santa Monica, which features an excellent fried egg sandwich with bacon.  I would definitely go back and give Plow's other dishes a shot.  If you are a big breakfast fan, Plow is a must visit if you live in San Francisco or are just visiting.

I believe free street parking is available in the nearby residential area though parking spaces are probably hard to find around here.

excerpts: I thoroughly enjoyed the fluffly sweetness of the pancakes but the CRISPY POTATOES were the star of the show; I now have a much higher standard for my brunch potatoes.
The eggs were cooked perfectly (over medium is not really a thing so basically over easy).
However the pork sausage was a huge letdown as it was very dry and had whole cumin seeds in it.
It was remediable with dashes of Youk's hot sauce, but it was really just tough and dry.
I had a bite of my friend's fried egg sandwich with avocado
and it was stellar (though this is something rather difficult to not succeed in).
crispy potatoes.author: Angela L.
crispy potatoes.review:
With over a thousand reviews, you've probably gleaned that there is a ridiculous wait for a delicious breakfast. 

I finally got to come here on a Saturday with a party of three and was quoted a 1.5 hour wait. While pretending to be a flowerpots sitting on the sills outside, we decided to imbibe some self serve coffee (very strong - solid flavors). 

Upon being seated a little over an hour later, I noticed how once again new San Francisco the place is with a minimalist look, lots of natural lighting and light woodsy interior. It was also very cramped inside, but we did not want to wait extra for al fresco dining. 

Of course I ordered the Plow which came with the lemon ricotta pancakes, potatoes and opted for the pork sausage and my eggs over medium. I also had a camellia iced tea on the side. I thoroughly enjoyed the fluffly sweetness of the pancakes but the CRISPY POTATOES were the star of the show; I now have a much higher standard for my brunch potatoes. The eggs were cooked perfectly (over medium is not really a thing so basically over easy). However the pork sausage was a huge letdown as it was very dry and had whole cumin seeds in it. It was remediable with dashes of Youk's hot sauce, but it was really just tough and dry. I had a bite of my friend's fried egg sandwich with avocado and it was stellar (though this is something rather difficult to not succeed in). The camellia iced tea was blase but refreshing.

Service was wonderful and our waters and teas were refilled regularly. I was a little miffed because the self serve coffee was ~$4 and there was no real sign or warning from the hostess who merely said "help yourself." I guess it is San Francisco and people no longer bat an eye at a $4 cup of coffee. The area is definitely different now than it was when I drove through to lifeguard at UCSF in my high school days. 

On the whole, a solid brunch place, but a little pricey ($30 after tax and tip for myself). I would come back if the wait abates.

Ordered:

My dish was YUMMERS!  I love the lemon ricotta pancakes, my first time btw.  They were soft, fluffy, slightly tangy, a hint of sweetness so that I don't even need that sweet maple syrup they gave me.  I opted for their housemade sausages instead of the other bacon option...WRONG CHOICE.  Their sausage was made from a lean cut or something??  Boy was it dry. Will I visit this place again? Heck no, nothing spectacular.

I have to add there was a girl in front of us waiting by herself.  When they finally opened she asked one of the guys if they do take-out.  Response "No"  O well can I sit down, order, and take it to-go. Response "No"  Wow that SUCKS.  She was there BEFORE us and she left empty handed.  Douche.

excerpts: The Plow (two lemon ricotta pancakes, two eggs any style, choice of pork sausage/chicken sausage/bacon, crispy potatoes)
****5 stars*****- We decided to share the Plow so we could try a bunch of the stuff they offered.
We selected the pork sausage per recommendation of the waitress and poached eggs.
I can't even pick which item was my favorite - everything was so perfectly done and went so well together.
The perfect amount of savory and sweet.

The lemon ricotta pancakes were the BEST pancakes ever, ever, ever, ever.
I will be getting these (at least as a "side") every single time.
crispy potatoes.author: Rachael S.
crispy potatoes.review:
Absolute favorite brunch spot of all time - SF or anywhere.  Yes, there's a lot of hype...yes, there will be a wait...yes, there will probably be several tourists trying out the spot.  Typically, this will sway me away from any place, but after seeing all the pictures, reading all the reviews, and also hearing from several of my SF friends how delicious it was, I ponied up and decided to make my way there.  

My husband and I opted to try it out over the 4th of July weekend on a Friday mid-day, hoping to avoid the Saturday/Sunday brunch crowd.  We just prepared ourselves for a long wait - we ended up getting there around 12:30PM or so, and I think we waited for about an hour, which isn't bad.  My husband grabbed a beer as we waited, and I popped in to one of the boutique stores just up the block to browse/bum time.

When I was browsing at the store, I asked the store owner what she recommended at Plow.  She started off by highly recommending the "Plow" plate to get a sampling of all their stuff, said to ("whatever you do") get the baked good of the day if they aren't sold out, and then proceeded to pretty much list off every item they offered.  Pretty much, I knew right then and there that Plow would be a repeat brunch spot ;)

Everything we tried was excellent - every item blew my mind.  You can tell that every ingredient they use is high quality, in season, and fresh.  The eggs, for example - the yolks are bright orange, and whites so fluffy.  I learned that they buy their eggs from a local organic egg farmer in Napa - always delivered fresh.  

While we wanted to try everything on the menu, we tried:

The Plow (two lemon ricotta pancakes, two eggs any style, choice of pork sausage/chicken sausage/bacon, crispy potatoes) *****5 stars*****- We decided to share the Plow so we could try a bunch of the stuff they offered.  We selected the pork sausage per recommendation of the waitress and poached eggs.  I can't even pick which item was my favorite - everything was so perfectly done and went so well together. The perfect amount of savory and sweet.  The crispy potatoes were the best I've ever had - crisp on the outside and soft in the inside, and piping hot from the fryer.  The lemon ricotta pancakes were the BEST pancakes ever, ever, ever, ever.  I will be getting these (at least as a "side") every single time.  Holy crap, so good.

Banana Bread - *****4.5 stars***** One of the "baked goods of the day" - We thought it would be a bit much with everything else we were ordering, but since we received the recommendation to order "whatever baked good they are offering" we decided to go ahead.  We figured, "well we can bring any left overs home."  Uhhhh, let's just say, there were no leftovers.  SO delicious; came out warm, had a crispy crust of sugar coating the top, had chunks of gooey bananas throughout, and buttery flavor.  Mmmm...

Little Gem Salad - *****5 stars ****** To balance out some of the savory of our meal, I decided to order a little gem salad.  I was expecting nothing special, but even the salad surprised me!  The dressing was amazing; fresh and tasty.  All ingredients were fresh, seasonal, and balanced everything nicely.  I wish I could get this salad for lunch every day!

Bubbles/Beer - We also opted to make it a true brunch and ordered some adult beverages.  Decent selection of beers and wine.  If a cup of joe is more your cup of tea ;) - I heard that their coffee (even their decaf) is excellent.

Overall - this place is brunch/lunch perfection.  I am SO happy we're a quick walk to this place.  We will DEFINITELY be back many, many, more times.  Definitely, definitely, definitely a must-go....

crispy potatoes.review:
Way overhyped. Like all other popular brunch places in this foodie city of mine, the wait is ridiculously long. The food? Nothing to write home about. It was good but not stand-outside-in-the-cold-for-2-hours kind of good. 

I ordered the most popular dish here, the plow, which comes with 2 eggs your way, 2 mini lemon ricotta pancakes, crispy Rosemary potatoes, and a choice of either apple chicken sausages, bacon, or pork sausages. 

Sadly the best item on my plate was the crispy potatoes. The apple sausages didn't taste too different from any store-bought kind that you can heat up on your own at home. The lemon ricotta pancakes were dry and didn't taste completely cooked through.

Service was efficient after we sat down, but the hostess definitely messed up with seating people in the order that they came in. People were not happy about that.

Delicious.
The pancakes were amazing and I love that the breakfast potatoes are crispy!
The house made pork sausage was just okay
and I think I would opt for bacon if I were to order the same dish again.

crispy potatoes.author: Leana L.
crispy potatoes.review:
Oh my. Probably one of my favorite brunch places in town. We walked in on a random weekday morning a little before 9AM and were met with a wait time of about 30-45 minutes. Considering the last time we tried to eat here, the wait time was over an hour, we decided to grab some coffees at the front and sit it out on the little ledge protruding from the side of the building.

Ambiance: Your typical SF brunch spot. Bustling place with small tables and a lively crowd.

Service: Our waitress was excellent and everyone else was really nice, too! Even though it's a busy place, we didn't feel rushed at all.

Drinks: We grabbed coffees up front and they just added it to our bill after we actually ate. They refilled us at the table, of course, though.

Food: I ordered The Plow  (two eggs, choice of house made pork sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes + crispy potatoes). Delicious. The pancakes were amazing and I love that the breakfast potatoes are crispy! The house made pork sausage was just okay and I think I would opt for bacon if I were to order the same dish again. My bf's fried egg sandwich was pretty legit. So filling and so worth it.

Cost: Not too bad for an SF brunch spot!

Would I return? Yup!

I actually opt for one of the egg benedicts--the salmon or the mushroom and spinach are both amazing.
I also really like the breakfast sandwich, which is pretty much just a burger.
You can add either bacon or avocado on it, which is a great touch to that fried egg.
Everything here is definitely a size large, so no need to fight over those crispy potatoes.
Also, if you get a chance to sit at the "bar", it's pretty awesome spectacle watching them cook.

crispy potatoes.review:
The Plow is a tiny little brunch place where a wait on a weekend is practically unbearable. I've been there as early as 8am and as late as 12pm. Either way, be prepared for a wait. The only reason why I keep coming back is because parking is plentiful and I spend most of the wait time at Farleys, the coffee shop down the street with tons of magazines to keep you busy. Oh, and the food too. 

You can't go wrong with the plow that everyone has mentioned. It gives you a little taste of everything, the crispy potatoes, lemon ricotta pancakes, your choice of eggs and some meat. I actually opt for one of the egg benedicts--the salmon or the mushroom and spinach are both amazing. I also really like the breakfast sandwich, which is pretty much just a burger. You can add either bacon or avocado on it, which is a great touch to that fried egg. Everything here is definitely a size large, so no need to fight over those crispy potatoes. Also, if you get a chance to sit at the "bar", it's pretty awesome spectacle watching them cook.

crispy potatoes.review:

I ordered the plow, tasted good but not as great as I thought it would be.
Love the scrambled eggs and crispy potatoes but not a big fan of their ricotta pancake, too dry for me.
Not sure if I will be back, but maybe I will try the breakfast sandwich next time.

Our server was a kind and polite young Asian lady who was quick and had great humor.
crispy potatoes.author: Jodi H.
crispy potatoes.review:
I'm going to keep this review short and quick, which is the complete opposite of the waiting time/procedure to get into Plow (ooh, BURN)

Came here during prime brunch time on Sunday with the lil sis, and we easily found street parking in the hills of Potrero Hills. We wrote out name down around 11AM and knew that we would have to wait for 1+ hours, so walked all the way to Boba Guys in Mission to kill time. The whole thing took about one hour, and by the time we were back at Plow, we were 2nd in line for our spot!! (I HIGHLY recommend doing something like this while you wait--trust me, you won't miss anything). Once we got to Boba Guys, we also called Plow to ask about our spot and they politely told us that we still had about 40 minutes left. SCORE.

Food-wise, plow is delicioso. The Mexican dudes working the kitchen are right by the bar, so the bar seaters can watch them make the fried egg sandwich to the french toast...it's a beautiful thing to see. I devoured the fried egg sandwich and my sis had the french toast. Their crispy potatoes are TO DIE FOR, just as everybody else has commented. Their portion sizes run along the perfect size to a little bit too much--I only noticed a few takeaway boxes being used. Our server was a kind and polite young Asian lady who was quick and had great humor. Shoutout to everyone at Plow who kept their smiles on and politeness intact throughout their rid

I wouldn't come back any time soon because of the long wait time, but if someone was DYING to come back, I'd do the same thing I did the first time--write my name down, walk anywhere within a 1-1.5 hour distance, and come back just in time.

excerpts: In fact, they we were so mesmerized by their artistry that they noticed and gave us a free bowl of fresh and crispy potatoes.

Also, great music. A lot of old-school rap/hip-hop.

The lemon ricotta pancakes... mouthwatering.
moist, rich, slight hint of cheesy texture, slight sweetness from the lemon.
crispy potatoes.author: Lyn M.
crispy potatoes.review:
Came to plow after a recommendation from a family member. I'm not a huge brunch/breakfast person, but I'd change my mind for Plow.

Getting there at about 8:30am on a Saturday, we waited a good 20 minutes to be seated. It's definitely busy, with crowded seating indoors and just a few tables outdoors. We didn't mind the wait - the weather was spectacular and the view was pleasant. There was no issue finding parking, and we had fun parking at a 90 degree angle to the street.

Servers are casual and attentive. There was overall a relaxed atmosphere. The coffee was wonderful. I had their Plow, scrambled eggs with chicken apple sausage, lemon ricotta pancakes, and crispy potatoes. I personally wasn't a huge fan of the sausage, but my husband loved it. The scrambled eggs were cooked appropriately, but nothing really to write home about. Their big 5-star review items are the crispy potatoes and the lemon ricotta pancakes. The potatoes are perfectly crisped and salted, very hearty. The lemon ricotta pancakes... mouthwatering. moist, rich, slight hint of cheesy texture, slight sweetness from the lemon. This place gets 5 stars for that alone!

To top it off, the restaurant derives its products from local markets and farms, which i LOVE. There's nothing like supporting your local farmers. Their menu changes daily, so be aware that they may not have the same thing two days in a row.

excerpts: Their potatoes, those CRISPY POTATOES.
Nice crispy on the outside and fluffy potato goodness on the inside.
They come out real hot too.
I LOVE POTATOES and
crispy potatoes.author: Stephanie L.
crispy potatoes.review:
I really enjoyed Plow for brunch. Now that wait can be quite disappointing, especially since there's not much you can do around there to kill time. I brought my dog out that day and since the wait was 45 mins and we told them inside or out, whichever was first available was fine with us. Since we had time to kill, we took the pup to a dog park near by in dog patch area. But I hear there's a coffee shop not too far. We came back just in time and our table was ready as they quoted around 45 mins. 

I got their fresh squeezed orange juice. yummmmm, very refreshing. I ordered their fried egg sandwich, really good. The egg was perfectly cooked and runny. It was kinda messy, but delicious. The bf got the crab scramble which he really enjoyed. We shared the lemon ricotta pancakes, it was over hyped for me wasn't bad, but wasn't as good as I had expected.

Now the highlight, why it's really worth the wait. Their potatoes, those CRISPY POTATOES. Nice crispy on the outside and fluffy potato goodness on the inside. They come out real hot too. I LOVE POTATOES and to me, they're definitely worth the wait.

Service was decent. Didn't have anything to really complain about. Food came out a bit slow.

excerpts: You get two eggs, crispy potatoes, chicken sausage, & lemon ricotta pancakes.
The potatoes are so good!
Perfectly crisp and seasoned with salt and rosemary.
It went well with the runny egg yolks and chicken sausage.
But I was surprised at the lemon ricotta pancakes.
I'm usually not a lemon-flavored pastry type of person but the pancakes were so fluffy from the ricotta and refreshing and light from the lemon.
crispy potatoes.author: Ralph N.
crispy potatoes.review:
Plow has been on my "bookmarked" list for quite some time. I've been wanting to go here for so long but I always end up backing out due to the long line. But there's something so catchy about Plow that further ignited my curiosity. Number one...long lines. Number two...great reviews. And number three...the pictures on Yelp look amazing!

Finally I was able to pay a visit with a few friends from SoCal after picking them up from a 7am bus ride from LA. Since we were there around 7:30am, we were seated very quickly. It wasn't empty...but wasn't packed either.

Ambience: Very relaxed. It's like waking up and stepping into a friend's kitchen while being strikened with a whiff of bacon and eggs cooking in the background. It's not huge but just right. I love how the tables are wooden...it provides the perfect touch to my pics for Instagram and Yelp lol.

Food: So many choices to choose from! I wanna try the Corned Beef Hash, the Egg Sandwich, and the Crab Scramble on my next visit.  But for starters, I had to get "The Plow". What a huge serving! You get two eggs, crispy potatoes, chicken sausage, & lemon ricotta pancakes. The potatoes are so good! Perfectly crisp and seasoned with salt and rosemary. It went well with the runny egg yolks and chicken sausage. But I was surprised at the lemon ricotta pancakes. I'm usually not a lemon-flavored pastry type of person but the pancakes were so fluffy from the ricotta and refreshing and light from the lemon. I think they used just the lemon zest because they seemed perfumed with a lemon essence that I fell in love with.

Overall Plow is a great place for breakfast. It's a little small so it's intended for smaller groups. Parking isn't too bad either...primarily residential parking spots. Just be patient and you'll eventually find one. I'll admit it's not the cheapest breakfast spot but it's totally worth every penny. I can't wait for my next visit.

excerpts: They included crispy potatoes on the side that were to die for.
I also recommend getting their seasonal chia pudding, which is creamy and delicious and served with local fruit on top.
crispy potatoes.author: Emily G.
crispy potatoes.review: If you are a brunch lover, this is the place to go. Incredible food, that's definitely worth the wait. I usually judge brunch places by their Eggs Benedict and Plow's version was one of the best I've had. They included crispy potatoes on the side that were to die for. I also recommend getting their seasonal chia pudding, which is creamy and delicious and served with local fruit on top.

Let me just say, the wait is totally worth it.
My friend and I felt indifferent about the meat (she got the chicken apple sausage
and I got the homemade pork sausage).

The pancakes are sooo good.
They are cakey and moist, and just heavenly.
The potatoes, were some of the best potatoes I have ever had.
They were super crispy and seasoned well.
I recommend getting the crispy potatoes and lemon ricotta pancakes; they are just out of this world!

crispy potatoes.author: Vivian Y.
crispy potatoes.review:
I have been waiting to try Plow out because of it's ratings and reviews here on Yelp, and the fact that I have seen the name in numerous sources. Came to Plow on a saturday morning with my friend. We decided to brunch and catch up before she headed back to school. We waited a good 2 hours before we were finally seated, so either bring something to do, or get ready for some good conversations with your group. 

Ambiance/ Appearance:
Plow is located in Potrero Hill and it felt very hipster and homey. Plow is on the corner, which is a good thing because it needs all the waiting area space it can provide. There is a few tables of outdoor seating on the side of the restaurant. Inside, there aren't too many tables, so most likely you will have to share with others. There was a slight rustic feel inside, but it felt very lively because of the music and background conversations. 

Service:
The service is excellent. Servers and staff are super nice and made sure you felt comfortable.

Taste: 
Both my friend and I ordered the plow which consisted of a choice of meat, 2 lemon ricotta pancakes, two eggs, and crispy potatoes. Let me just say, the wait is totally worth it. My friend and I felt indifferent about the meat (she got the chicken apple sausage and I got the homemade pork sausage). I thought the sausage was kind of dry and was over it because everything else on the plate shined brighter. The pancakes are sooo good. They are cakey and moist, and just heavenly. The potatoes, were some of the best potatoes I have ever had. They were super crispy and seasoned well. It had some shallots or onions and other herbs. 

With tax and tip, I think it came out to $20. Overall the food was bomb dot com! I would totally return again (but probably not on a weekend or at later times in the day to avoid the wait). Even with the wait, it is totally worth trying out. I recommend getting the crispy potatoes and lemon ricotta pancakes; they are just out of this world!

excerpts: It's two eggs, choice of house made pork sausage, nueske bacon, or chicken apple sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes, crispy potatoes
and it comes out
all photo shoot ready for your Instagram shot
I loved everything on my plate and it was one of the best brunches I've ever had but
definitely the lemon ricotta pancakes get a shout out.
I'll be back for sure!!
crispy potatoes.author: Jingxi Z.
crispy potatoes.review:
Ugh, the hype here is as real as it gets. Came for an early afternoon brunch on Sunday and because we came in so late, the wait was only around 15 minutes! Although I have heard nightmare tales about the wait here at peak hours so definitely try and come either really early or really late like us haha.

My friend and I both ordered The Plow, which I feel like everyone gets here haha, but for good reason! It's two eggs, choice of house made pork sausage, nueske bacon, or chicken apple sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes, crispy potatoes and it comes out all photo shoot ready for your Instagram shot :) I loved everything on my plate and it was one of the best brunches I've ever had but definitely the lemon ricotta pancakes get a shout out. I'll be back for sure!!

excerpts: I also love Plow's crispy potatoes.
Every time I'm given a choice between side salad or side potatoes, I always opt for salad to be "healthier".
Plow only offers potatoes.
But I'm glad that's my only option or else
I'd feel more guilty for not eating my veggies.
The potatoes are so crispy!
I recommend "The Plow" -- two lemon ricotta pancakes, crispy potatoes, two eggs (any style), and a choice of bacon, house pork sausage, or chicken apple sausage.
This dish is huge, very satisfying, and has variety.
crispy potatoes.author: Priscilla W.
crispy potatoes.review:
Three words: lemon ricotta pancakes!

They're delicious. They're lemony without tasting like dishwash detergent and the ricotta isn't too heavy. They're dense and fluffy at the same time, with a mousse-like consistency. And they're good enough on their own that the side of pure maple syrup, served in the most adorable little dispenser, isn't necessary. I'm not a big fan of pancakes, yet I'd be willing to order a full serving of these amazing lemon ricotta pancakes next time!

I also love Plow's crispy potatoes. Every time I'm given a choice between side salad or side potatoes, I always opt for salad to be "healthier". Plow only offers potatoes. But I'm glad that's my only option or else I'd feel more guilty for not eating my veggies. The potatoes are so crispy! They're packed with flavor and I love the generous amount of dried rosemary used to season these carb-loaded tubers.

I recommend "The Plow" -- two lemon ricotta pancakes, crispy potatoes, two eggs (any style), and a choice of bacon, house pork sausage, or chicken apple sausage. This dish is huge, very satisfying, and has variety. You'll unbuckle your belt and roll down the hill after you've devoured everything and licked the plate clean.

The Eggs Benedict with smoked salmon is also tasty. The muffins are too thick and too large, proportionally, compared to the salmon and eggs. The salmon is salty and flavorful, and it pairs nicely with the beautifully poached, ooey-gooey runny eggs. 

Our host was extremely friendly and our waitress was nice, but service was poorly timed. It took a few minutes before we got our water and for her to take our orders. We arrived at 1PM on a Saturday and were seated outside within 30 minutes (inside would've taken at least another 10 minutes). Plow is on a hill with a slight incline, so it felt a little awkward eating on slanted tables outside. Therefore, I recommend dining inside. And I can't believe I'm saying this, but parking is VERY easy in this neighborhood. I will definitely be back!

excerpts: The crispy potatoes are a must eat!
crispy potatoes.author: Josh L.
crispy potatoes.review:
5 stars for the Lemon Ricotta Pancakes! 

To celebrate my girlfriend's birthday we came here on a Friday for brunch. I was surprised at the amount of people here being that it was a weekday - we waited for about twenty five minutes for a table inside. Well worth the wait!

Lemon Ricotta Pancakes: Oh so soft and perfect... mouthwatering delicious! My new favorite.
Housemade Pork Sausage Patties: had that homemade fresh, feel.
Soft Scramble: Delightful combination of eggs and goat cheese. The crispy potatoes are a must eat!

The hostess and our waitress were both friendly and attentive. The ambiance has a casual, refreshing feel with light wood accents, but the space is very small and cozy. Be prepared to share your table if there are open seats next to you. There are tables outside and some small benches to sit on while you're waiting. If you don't want a long wait, I suggest coming on a weekday. Parking in this area is a breeze.

crispy potatoes.review:
The Plow is a cute little place with indoor and outdoor seating. The first time I tried to go to the plow, I was told it would be a 1 hour wait on a Sunday morning. However, after waiting 1 hour.. I went to check up on the wait list and was told it would be 1 more hour. At that point we were just too hungry so we decided to leave and try somewhere else. A few weeks later, we decided to go back and give it a try, and waited 1 hour to get in. 

we got "the plow".. and let me just say.. those crispy potatoes doe. i know everyone's raving about those..  they're almost like those typical potato hash pieces brunch places serve.. but fried to a crisp perfection. as a huge fan of fries, im in love with these! the rest of the plate was good with two poached eggs, lemon ricotta pancakes (very unique!), and house- made pork sausage, 

we also got a plate of french toast! the french toast here was unlike any other french toast that i've had before. the outside was what you'd expect- toasted bread. but the inside of the toast was what surprised me. it was super moist and soft.. and it basically melted in your mouth. it was a really interesting juxtaposition of textures. 

overall, food was really good.. but the wait time is a bit too much for me

Customer service is always on point.
Feel free to ask for a mimosa or a cup of coffee while you wait.
crispy potatoes.author: Kayla M.
crispy potatoes.review:
I love Plow so much. 

This tiny restaurant is PACKED at any given time of the day. I always like to show up when the doors first open to avoid the 1+ hour wait time. But boy are you in for a treat once you're finally seated. 

I've tried pretty much everything on their menu at this point and NOTHING disappoints. The best thing though hands down are their lemon ricotta pancakes. Each bite is like a little taste of heaven. I order the Plow ( eggs + pancakes + potatoes) each time just to make sure I get a little bit of everything. Their crispy potatoes are also delicious. Customer service is always on point. Feel free to ask for a mimosa or a cup of coffee while you wait. They'll gladly oblige. 

Can't wait to go back once I'm in town!

excerpts: Even though I am not much of a breakfast potato person, I thought Plow's crispy potatoes were delicious
and I ate way more of those potatoes
than I would anyone else's breakfast potatoes!
I also really enjoyed the sausage.
I am sure it helped that I had been in town for a vegetarian wedding all weekend and was craving meat like a cave man.

crispy potatoes.author: Courtney K.
crispy potatoes.review:
Bottom Line:  The food is delicious, the interior is cute and the service is friendly, but I don't think I'd typically wait more than 30 minutes to eat here.

My friend lives two block from Plow so as foodies and elite Yelpers, we had to give it a try.  If you are thinking about venturing to Potrero Hill yourself, here is some information that I hope will help you decide if Plow is worth the trip and the wait:

- The Wait.  My take away from reading many Yelp reviews is that the wait runs one to two hours.  I really can't imagine waiting that long and luckily I didn't have to.  I arrived a few minutes before 8am on a Saturday and only waited about ten minutes for a party of two.  Since the restaurant doesn't open until 8am on Saturday, and we were able to get in on the first seating, we only had to wait long enough for the hostess to get to us.  It helped immensely that there were only two of us.  

- Size Does Matter.  Plow is small and if your party is big, Plow won't be a good fit for you.  My recollection is that there are a handful of four-top tables but not many bigger options.  In fact, there website says they can only accommodate parties of six or less.  If you have a small party and want to sit at the counter, you can probably get seated faster.  And if you are a party of one, don't let the wait deter you, because you can probably snag a seat at the counter rather quickly.  

- Food.  The food here is really good but not so good that I'd wait hours for it.  I do like how fresh their ingredients are and the uniqueness of some of their items.  You can definitely taste the quality of the ingredients they use and I fully appreciate their efforts to source their ingredients locally.  Also, they make many items, like their ricotta and pork sausage in house.   Because I was starving, we (and by "we," I mean "I") ordered lots of food.  

   - Breakfast Dessert!: We were seated at the counter overlooking the freshly baked breakfast desserts so of course I had to order the chocolate chip walnut coffee cake to start.  That probably isn't the right name for it, but just know those breakfast desserts are good!

   - Eggs Benny:  Plow's rendition of the classic Eggs Benedict was wonderful.  I did it with the Fra' Mani ham (Fra' Mani is a fancy pork company out of Berkley that sells its products wholesale and to Costco).

   - The Plow:  Probably the most popular dish on the menu, my friend went with the Plow.  She started it and I finished it!  (Hey, I said I was starving.)  Even though I am not much of a breakfast potato person, I thought Plow's crispy potatoes were delicious and I ate way more of those potatoes than I would anyone else's breakfast potatoes!  I also really enjoyed the sausage.  I am sure it helped that I had been in town for a vegetarian wedding all weekend and was craving meat like a cave man.  The homemade pork sausage had great texture and flavor.  For me, the lemon ricotta pancakes weren't worth the hype.  They were good, and I like the unique combination, but they didn't wow me.  Nevertheless, I think Plow makes their own ricotta which is very cool and admirable.      

- Service.  Service was friendly an attentive.  Despite a line out the door, the staff remains calm and keeps on plowing through the service.  I also like that they kept my coffee full and didn't rush us out of there.  

- The ambiance is very cute and the décor is well done - hardwood floors, marble counter top, big windows and an open kitchen.  

- Extras.  Plow is a very cute, cohesive, well-thought-out place.  They also have a great, classy web site.  I can tell the owners put a lot of love and pride into this business and for that I applaud them!

excerpts: The crispy potatoes felt a flavor of rosemary.
crispy potatoes.author: Hiromi S.
crispy potatoes.review:
This restaurant is located in Potrero Hill of San Francisco. 

I and my husband have tried several times to have for brunch on weekends.
There are always a long lines, so that we gave up every time.
We retried at 8:15 in the morning on Thursday.
Fortunately, we can sit down without any line!
  
The atmosphere in the restaurant makes me comfortable and cheer up.
The service is great who everyone is friendly and kind.

We ordered two dishes with two cup of coffee.

(Rating: +++ is perfect)
Lemon Ricotta Pancakes + + +: 
Pancakes were a little crispy outside, fluffy and airy on the inside. I felt a flavor of lemon.
This pancake I ate is the best in I have ever had in my life.

Two eggs +++:
We ate scrambled eggs that it was perfectly my favorite texture. The muffin is crispy outside, chewy on the inside. The crispy potatoes felt a flavor of rosemary.
 Chicken apple sausage of house made is unique taste and made me cheer up.  

How well organized everything!

excerpts: Their CRISPY POTATOES?
Uh-mazing!
crispy potatoes.author: Jennifer M.
crispy potatoes.review:
Despite the crowd, this place is amazing!!!! We came here on a Sunday morning roughly 25 minutes after their doors opened (8am), and restaurant's first seating was full! (Man, everything good in SF requires a line!) The conservative wait time for us was 45 minutes for a table, which at the time had me concerned since my boyfriend and I had to meet up with a tour at 10am in Union Square. Immediately after the hostess told us about the wait I had asked about outdoor seating. She said that they would be seating people outside shortly, which concluded to me that our 45 minutes would be the extent of our wait if they had about 8 tables out on the sidewalk open.

My boyfriend and I had to strategize. If were were going to be seated before 9am, our order had to be ready buy the time they directed us to a table. So we went through the whole menu.  It was short and sweet which indicated to me that all of these dishes had to be good.  But the Lemon Ricotta Pancakes screamed at me, so I went with that and a side of bacon. My boyfriend, the Egg Sandwich with potatoes.

We were finally seated at 8:55, with our orders submitted by 8:57 (Hell yea I was watching the time!) Refills on our coffee and two waters followed at 9:02 and 9:05 respectively.  Our server also mentioned that seating outside generally starts after indoor tables' food tickets' have passed through the kitchen, which in my opinion was reassuring to hear.

Our orders -  finally delivered by 9:15 with the bill ready in hand without even having to ask!!! 

Their CRISPY POTATOES? Uh-mazing! Their LEMON RICOTTA PANCAKES? Best pancakes of my life. BACON? Extra crispy/crunchy just like I like them. The hot sauce? Local, made by Youk's 

What I did notice about Plow that put them at 5 star was that they gave out blankets to the customers who sat outside!! Wasn't too sure if that was upon request or just done out of hospitality, but knowing that they were available just topped my cup off.

excerpts: I got them in combination with "the plow" which also comes with SUPER DUPER crispy potatoes, eggs (I'd go sunny side or over easy) and your choice between bacon, pork sausage, and apple chicken sausage.
I opted for the chicken sausage and it was delightful!
crispy potatoes.author: Kero D.
crispy potatoes.review:
I was INCREDIBLY lucky. Came here with my coworker/lova and we only had to endure a measly 15 minute wait. At 12:45 pm to boot! So if you want to test your luck, come here on a weekday afternoon (happened to be a Friday for us) and maybe the pancake gods will take mercy on your pitiful mortal souls!

Everyone is right about the lemon ricotta pancakes. They are amaze balls and quite special. For all you anti-lemon people out there, trust me when I say these fluffy babies will change your mind! If anyone here has ever had three twin's lemon cookie ice cream, it reminds me of that. The lemon flavor isn't citrusy or sour...it's more floral and subtle if anything.

I got them in combination with "the plow" which also comes with SUPER DUPER crispy potatoes, eggs (I'd go sunny side or over easy) and your choice between bacon, pork sausage, and apple chicken sausage. I opted for the chicken sausage and it was delightful! The smoky apple aftertaste was tasty. 

Plow is charming, homey and a little bit rustic. The rave reviews are well deserves, and if fate is kind enough to bring me back one day, I would love to try out the pumpkin pancakes as well! :)

excerpts: Also, with the plate comes the standard 2 eggs any way you like, I personally prefer them poached soft so you can dip the crispy potatoes and meat in the runny yolk.
crispy potatoes.author: Diana C.
crispy potatoes.review:
This is my all time favorite brunch place. Hands down. I try to make a trip up for brunch every couple months or so. The lines here get super long especially on weekends, but trust me, it's worth the long agonizing wait. If it is your first time here, I would order the plow (5/5). It is just their breakfast platter with a little bit of everything. On my numerous trips back to this place, I also tried the fried egg sandwich (4/5) and their crab scramble (3/5). 

The plow is basically the most amazing breakfast platter you will ever eat. It comes with a heaping pile of potatoes (5/5). The potatoes aren't your average hash brown or the soggy potatoes that come with a diner breakfast. These potatoes are super crispy and brown on the outside, soft on the inside, and seasoned to perfection. You can hear the crunch as you bite down. You also have the option of bacon (4/5) or sausage (5/5). You really can't go wrong with either option. Their chicken apple sausage is the perfect amount of sweetness and savory. The bacon is fatty and rich. My only qualm is that the bacon is a little limp If you're really feeling hungry, get both! Why not! Also, with the plate comes the standard 2 eggs any way you like, I personally prefer them poached soft so you can dip the crispy potatoes and meat in the runny yolk. Finally, to top it all off, are 2 lemon ricotta pancakes (6/5). These pancakes are not your average fluffy pancake. They are slightly denser, but packed full of flavor. I'll be honest, I'm not a pancake person normally. Waffles win it all for me, but when it comes to these lemon ricotta pancakes, I would eat a hundred if I could. 

As for the egg sandwich, they fry the egg to perfection. Yolk is perfectly runny, acting as a great sauce for the sandwich. The only reason this got a 4/5 in my book was due to the fact it really needed the addition of some meat. If you do get this sandwich, spend the extra couple bucks to add in some of that delicious bacon they have. Trust me, it'll take the sandwich to the next level. 

The crab scramble had way too many green onions for my liking (I personally hate them and will pick them out given the chance, but this had way too many to do so). It covered up the taste of the crab a bit. There were large hunks of crab throughout the omelet which is great, but there were quite a few pieces of shells too, which made it a bit annoying to eat.

Amazing food, great service - nothing more you could ask for.

Cons: 
- long wait on weekends and in the mornings 
- restaurant is small, so if you sit on the patio, it does get very cold

Pros: 
- brunch food here is A+ - everything is cooked to perfection
- service is fast and friendly

crispy potatoes.review:

Visit date: January 27, 2013
First time? Yes.

A one hour wait with good company isn't so bad, especially on a sunny day. And then we were rewarded with monkey bread! The monkey bread is a definite must eat (note: limited supply!). It's like a cinnamon bun, but on crack. Warm, just enough gooey, and a touch of sweet. For our main dish, my friend and I split the fried egg sandwich (two fried eggs, cheddar, aioli), crispy potatoes, and a side of Nueske bacon (salty, salty bacon). Ok, so I could have made this at home without the one hour wait, but it wouldn't have come with an awesome egg show. Try to get seated at the bar and you'll see what I mean. The egg guy was on fire -- no timer, just instinct. Soft poached, scrambled, sunny side -- you name it, and he was on it! He was too cool. Also fun, the host/ess will take your coat and hang it up for you; made me feel like I was visiting someone's home.

excerpts: The crispy potatoes must be the best potatoes I've had for brunch.
crispy potatoes.author: Tes Y.
crispy potatoes.review:
3 stars for my main dish. The lemon ricotta pancakes had a nice, light lemon flavor, but the texture was rather eggy. Halfway into my first pancake, I felt that it was a little too heavy for my taste. I guess I prefer it the old fashion way where it's fluffy, airy and light.

The crispy potatoes must be the best potatoes I've had for brunch.

The green tea is brewed with tea leaves and comes in a teapot- good!

It was about a 20 minute wait on a Wednesday morning.

It was a bright, clean, boisterous place; I had a good time catching up with an old friend.

excerpts: The "plow" breakfast - This allowed me to try everything everyone had told me about: the crispy potatoes (good, but not mind-blowing) and the lemon ricotta pancakes (great!).
crispy potatoes.author: David B.
crispy potatoes.review:
Showed up just before 9 am on a Saturday morning and was shocked to hear that the wait would be an hour. I figured Sunday, yeah. Or 10 or 11 am, yeah. But 9? But we were in for the food and waited patiently. 

It was probably about 45-50 minutes before we got seated, and there was some sort of snafu where they seated some other person with the same name ahead of us. It's good I went to check our place on the list because my name (with last initial!) was crossed off. 

On to the food:
Buttermilk biscuit - we shared this, and it was great by itself and even better with the accompanying honey butter.
The "plow" breakfast - This allowed me to try everything everyone had told me about: the crispy potatoes (good, but not mind-blowing) and the lemon ricotta pancakes (great!). Meanwhile, the housemade pork sausage patty was flavorful and the eggs were, well, eggs.

While I'm not sure I'd go back and wait an hour to do this again, the food was definitely very good overall and I loved the atmosphere of the place. Friendly service, nice ambiance...a good place.

crispy potatoes.review:
I must say, Plow did not disappoint.

I came here on a Saturday morning 5 minutes after they opened at 8am and I still had to wait 30 minutes for a table. That alone was impressive. To have people line up at opening to have breakfast at a restaurant, it must be good.

I ended up ordering the Plow because it came with everything I wanted: lemon-ricotta pancakes, Plow potatoes, and the house-made pork sausage patties. Holy smokes. They sure did take some normal brunch items and did them up well. The lemon-ricotta pancakes, just perfectly executed. Delicious balance between the lemon and ricotta with just the right fluff, moisture, and size. The crispy potatoes, again just perfectly executed. The house-made pork sausage patties, now that is how every breakfast sausage should taste. I usually don't care for breakfast sausage but this was my absolute favorite part of the dish. Honestly, I took the last patty home because I was not ready to part with it and I just munched on it the rest of the day Okay, reading that out loud makes me seem a little crazy. Oh well, NO SHAME.

If it's your first time, be sure to get the Plow. You will be "plown" away.

excerpts: The crispy potatoes on the side were amazing.
crispy potatoes.author: Bailey Z.
crispy potatoes.review:
I am not easily impressed by overpriced brunch spots, but today I was an exception. It's funny that everyone emphasizes organic and locally-sourced ingredients these days. Eating organic isn't enough anymore, but you now must do society and your community a service by supporting local farms, etc. I hate it for the most part only because it usually means pricier bills for mediocre food. Plow keeps their menu simple, but they do it well.

I got the fried egg sandwich, constructed with two eggs, aioli, frisee, cheddar on an Acme bun. Pay the extra couple bucks for the Nueske bacon; you will not regret it. The sandwich was the perfect answer for breakfast. The bun was soft and airy, and the combination of melted cheese, fried eggs, and crispy bacon was heavenly. The crispy potatoes on the side were amazing. The best thing on the menu is the lemon ricotta pancakes. The texture was softer and crumblier than a normal pancake and the flavor was outstanding. It was probably one of the best pancakes I've ever had. 

Overall, I loved the breakfast here. The prices weren't cheap ($13 for the breakfast sandwich and $15 for the plow). I wouldn't normally pay this much for breakfast, but if it's done right, it's hard to pass up.

excerpts: The Plow is brunchy bliss comprised of two eggs, your choice of house made pork sausage, Nueske bacon, or chicken apple sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes and crispy potatoes.
I went for the house made pork sausage but was able to steal a chicken sausage link off my buddy's plate -
both were awesome!
Nine times out of ten I'll order anything but pancakes but seeing as these were part of the "package deal" I approached with not only an open mind, but also an open mouth.
I was told that the lemon ricotta pancakes "are a make or break item" leaving you loving or conflicted on the breakfast.
Truth be told, they were a big win in my book but the true star of the show were the crispy potatoes.
Kissed with a hint of rosemary and crisped to the point that they're crunchy, but not overcooked or burnt.
crispy potatoes.author: Brad B.
crispy potatoes.review:
I was given strict instructions when I went to Plow. They were short and simple, but were sure to provide me an experience that could not be flawed.

1. Don't look at the menu
2. Order "The Plow"

Easy enough right? Right! I did as I was told and had an exceptional breakfast, which admittedly was a little out of my wheelhouse, (not a huge breakfast fan), and resulted in the plate basically being licked clean. 

The Plow is brunchy bliss comprised of two eggs, your choice of house made pork sausage, Nueske bacon, or chicken apple sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes and crispy potatoes. I went for the house made pork sausage but was able to steal a chicken sausage link off my buddy's plate - both were awesome! Nine times out of ten I'll order anything but pancakes but seeing as these were part of the "package deal" I approached with not only an open mind, but also an open mouth. I was told that the lemon ricotta pancakes "are a make or break item" leaving you loving or conflicted on the breakfast. Truth be told, they were a big win in my book but the true star of the show were the crispy potatoes. Kissed with a hint of rosemary and crisped to the point that they're crunchy, but not overcooked or burnt. Be sure to ask for a bottle of hot sauce if you want to take them to another level and wash it all down with a cold glass of orange juice. 

Thanks Plow!

crispy potatoes.author: Connie L.
crispy potatoes.review:
Having read reviews on Yelp, I knew that the wait would be long, especially on a Sunday that was Father's Day! For our group of 5, we waited for around 1 hour and 30 minutes - luckily the SF marathon passed us just one block down the hill, so we were easily able to entertain ourselves that morning.

Plow has this great, welcoming, and airy ambience. It's small, so small you squeeze up against the waitstaff and other customers every time you get up out of your seat, but also so clean and cozy it feels like you're dining in a cloud of pleasantness and good intentions. It is a little loud, but comfortably so.
 
Per Yelp's recommendations, we ordered four Plows and one fried chicken sandwich: two with bacon, one with pork sausage, and one with chicken apple. Each was amply sized:
    * two delightfully sweet and light lemon ricotta pancakes
    * two eggs cooked as you liked them (I had mine scrambled: so fluffy!)
    * your meat option (the chicken apple sausages are nicely sweet)
    * crispy potatoes. Might I mention that if you come here for nothing else, you order    
    these potatoes. You wait an hour for these potatoes because they are WORTH IT. Just the right amount of batter, salt, and seasoning to make me forget about how much starch I'm consuming and wallow in happiness for the rest of the morning.

The fried egg sandwich, which my mother ordered, seemed kind of messy as the yolk managed to drip out all over her hand when she first picked it up.

Otherwise, I have no negative comments about Plow. The service is great, the food is outstanding, and it is worth the wait and the hour long drive we made to get there. C:

crispy potatoes.author: Nette T.
crispy potatoes.review:
I came here for brunch on a weekday and I have to say, one of the best I've ever had. Plow is located in Potrero Hill and the decor inside was neutral colors and quaint. Since it's a small restaurant, it can get a little cramped.

I'm not normally a pancake fan but people raved about the lemon-ricotta pancakes so I had to try them. 

I was not disappointed. Nice, lemon flavor with bits of ricotta cheese. 

Brunch companion had the regular eggs and potatoes dish with homemade sausage patties. Usually potatoes in dishes like these are semi-crispy, even when requesting extra crispy. But not the potatoes at Plow - these were fried up perfectly crispy and had that crunch that I love. Homemade sausage patties were flavorful and a slight kick to them.

They had an open kitchen and the guys in the kitchen were like machines - cranking out quality food even as the restaurant was bustling. Everything was delicious but the crispy potatoes kicked it up to 5 stars.

Plow sits in the up and coming Dogpatch and I'm really loving this area. That being said, I was really excited to try this place. The only catch - it's basically a 2 hour wait.

The food is good, definitely. As all the Yelpers recommend, get the Plow. I agree - it gives you all the breakfast basics: eggs, sausage or bacon, pancakes and crispy potatoes. Everyone comes here for the lemon ricotta pancakes. Being that I'm the stranger person that does not like lemony baked goods, I went with the almond flour pancakes. I was a big fan of the almond flour pancakes and the crispy potatoes. Everything else was made well and overall, it was a fulfilling breakfast.

But it is NOT worth a 2 hour wait. If you're an early riser, then definitely come when they open. Otherwise, plan to put your name down, walk around grab a snack, take your time and come back 2 hours later.

crispy potatoes.review:
Came here with my fellow foodie Fanny W., we found parking across the street (that never happens...), walked in and were seated right away at the last table available, sweet! There's nothing like a bright and sunny morning in SF, I mean how often does that happen honestly? Good thing Plow takes full advantage of whenever the weather is beautiful with its huge storefront facing windows. 

We opted for the Fried Egg Sandwich and THE PLOW. I thought the Fried Egg Sandwich sounded a bit ordinary, but it was far from it! Equipped with  two eggs fried, aioli, frisee, Vermont cheddar, Acme bun. The aioli puts a nice twist on the egg sandwich, and to top it off with Acme bun made fresh in the city, I could not resist. 

The Plow is a must order at Plow -- two eggs, choice of house made pork sausage, Nueske bacon, or chicken apple sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes, crispy potatoes. We went with the two eggs, house made pork sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes, crispy potatoes. Man-oh-man was this dish delish. The pork sausage was nicely seasoned, not too salty (which is a huge plus to me), the lemon ricotta pancakes were AMAZING it made my mouth drop (and this is coming from a girl who doesn't like lemon zested anything...), and the seasoned house potatoes sounded average, but they definitely weren't. 

Overall we had a fantastic experience here at Plow. Parking was easy (no meter), we were seated right away (rare moment), and the service/ambiance screamed brunch, what more could you ask for. One thing bothered me though, there was a huge mix up with the check, we were charged an extra $20... Something was obviously wrong here. I've been reading about restaurants scamming their customers a lot lately down in Santa Ana, so I was extra careful to check the tab. I'm sure it was just a mistake, but for it to happen to both our table and the table adjacent to ours? Kind of strange, I think Plow needs to figure that one out... Nonetheless Fanny W. and I really enjoyed our experience here and hope to be back real soon!

crispy potatoes.author: Daisy T.
crispy potatoes.review:
Crispy potatoes... *drool*.... mmmm, mmmm good!

Yes, there's a ridiculous wait for this place on the weekends (up to two hours), but it's totally worth it! Though I do suggest that you try to hit up this place during the week. The wait time goes down to 30 minutes. 

This cute little place is located right at the corner surrounded by FREE parking. Just hope that you can find a spot! The place is small. Maybe no more than 20 people can sit down at a time. But there are a handful of seats at the counter where you can watch the magic happen.

The menu is small but features locally sourced, high quality ingredients, making even the simplest dishes stand out in comparison to the basic breakfast joint. Choose from a warm mushroom salad to a dungeness crab scramble to chia seed pudding.

The lemon ricotta pancakes are a popular choice. Very fluffy and light with tons of lemon flavor. I love the texture, but the lemon was a bit to strong for my taste. I suggest getting The Plow combo if you want to enjoy these. That way you can get it with two eggs any style and your choice of housemade sausage, Neuske bacon or chicken sausage. Some salt to balance out the sweetness.

My fave is the fried egg sandwich! Two eggs over easy sandwiched by soft, toasted Acme bread with frisee, aioli and cheese with the additional Neuske bacon (everything is better with bacon!). The creamy egg yolk mixes with all the components and makes it finger lickin' good! It also comes with a side of their infamous crispy potatoes!

They're serious about their potatoes. Smashed red potatoes flavored with fresh rosemary and onions and fried to perfection! They managed to find a way for you to have your hashbrowns and country potatoes together as one! You can't find potatoes like this anywhere else!

By the way, if you like scrambled eggs, they know how to do it right. Super light and fluffy yet still creamy. I don't even like scrambled eggs, but I love them here!

Good thing I don't live next to here or else I'd have a muffin top full of crispy potatoes and bacon!

crispy potatoes.author: Amelinda L.
crispy potatoes.review:
We walked here from the 16th St BART Station. Not a good idea. I didn't think to check the distance (1.6 miles); it seemed so close on the map. It's not that a 32-minute walk wasn't good for me (I totally earned my breakfast, not), it's the unsavory characters that you encounter. So, don't do what I did. However, the meal was worth the trouble!

We arrived around 9:30 on a Tuesday and it was much busier than I expected. Fortunately not busy enough that we had to wait because thankfully, there were two seats available at the bar. Some helpful notes: they will not seat you unless your entire party is present. Even if it is just one other person. No exceptions. Also, there's only 6-7 seats at the bar and roughly seven tables (very small space). There are a couple tables for outside dining as well.

Owner/Chef Maxine Siu was directly in front of us busily preparing dishes in their small partially-open kitchen. She was careful not to make eye contact with any patrons. Totally understandable, but it would have been so much fun to talk food. 

Ruben started with a cup of Equator Coffee ($3.50) and we shared a Cinnamon Brioche ($4). It was a delicious rendition of a cinnamon roll and the center was perfectly gooey and flavorful. I selected The Plow ($16) with sunny side-up eggs, housemade pork sausage, two Lemon Ricotta Pancakes, and crispy potatoes. The sausage was nice, but dry. Not my favorite sausage. Though the crispy potatoes were lovely and the Lemon Ricotta Pancakes were perfect! Ruben had the Fried Egg Sandwich with Nueske Bacon ($13.50), two soft fried eggs, aioli, cheddar, and frisée on an Acme bun. This was also tasty with the addition of the "Food's Best Friend Lucky Dog" hot fire-roasted pepper sauce.

Our server was really friendly and everyone was very pleasant. We didn't loiter much since there were several people waiting, but it's a nice setting to hang out and catch up with friends. The decor is fun with many pigs around! Oh, the important question - would I wait for 1+ hour(s) for a table? No, but that is why you plan ahead!

-Lemon Ricotta Pancakes- So so so so good! The texture was perfect. Fluffy on the inside, slightly crisp (for a lack of better words) on the outside, and not too sweet!
-Soft scrambled eggs- amazing flavor! It has heirloom tomatos, goat cheese, and the eggs were so fluffy and soft.  The toast on the side was a nice touch and the crispy potatoes are perfect and a must have at Plow. 
-Lemonade-nothing special.  It was on the more tart side.

Overall I would definitely recommend this place to anyone visit SF.  Just avoid going in large groups on the weekend because the waiting time will take forever!  Other than that, I can't wait to go back!

Arriving on a sunny, windy weekday afternoon, we entered Plow at around 1pm. The restaurant had quite a number of people, so we were kicked to curb, to wait in the wind. By kicking us to the curb, I mean they told us to step outside to wait till we're seated because they don't want it cramping up by the entrance. I like this idea because it makes the dining experience more enjoyable. They told us to wait about 5 mins, but we were seated within 3 mins. 

Located on the corner of Mississippi St and Texas St, this place can easily be missed..only because it's located in a residential area. They do have a sign sticking out that says "The Plow" though. Parking wasn't bad for my friend and I because we found one quick, right across the street. 

Seated in the back, service was still prompt and good because they would come check on us quite often. The food came out fairly quick in about 10 minutes. For my drink, I ordered the housemade strawberry lemonade ($3.75) [http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/plow-san-francisco?select=idHQVocGRxfnUjULoUkgDA#N3EwXeV_dXhdgR037ddEUw]. The drink looks adorable and instagram-worthy with its cute striped straw and lemon on the side, but don't let that fool you! I like the looks of it, but the straw is made of paper which can make it soggy. That's the only thing that irks me because the longer it sits in the lemonade, the faster it becomes soggy and the harder it becomes to drink. 

For my dish, I ordered The Plow ($16) [http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/plow-san-francisco?select=idHQVocGRxfnUjULoUkgDA#NYJXSTwF-Ugv0vFpKULyvQ] and a side of Nueske Bacon ($5.50) [http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/plow-san-francisco?select=idHQVocGRxfnUjULoUkgDA#fzy-q83TFoTe12n157Wu4Q]. The Plow was delicious! It consisted of  (2) small Lemon Ricotta Pancakes, Crispy Potatoes, Eggs, and House made pork sausage patties. I ordered this becuase it basically consisted of everything from the highlights on the Yelp page! I highly recommend ordering this for your first time because you get a taste of everything. Going from the lemon ricotta pancakes to crispy potatoes, to eggs and the house made pork sausage patties, everything just tasted so different from each other and unique! It changes your taste buds! 

The side of nueske bacon was a recommended dish in the highlights and as a fan of bacon, I just haaad to order it! I don't think it was all that special, but it was decently good. It was also pretty oily. 

If you can't finish your meal and plan to take the leftovers home, skip the crispy potatoes...it won't taste crispy anymore, haha. 

Overall, I enjoyed my experience and would definitely come back again..on a weekday! ;)

excerpts: Crispy potatoes tasted stale to both of us, and instead of properly cut small chunks, we got little bits and bobbles of leftover pan.
Couldn't even spear them with the tines of a fork.
crispy potatoes.author: Jana C.
crispy potatoes.review:
Generous 2.3 for brunch very recently. Bookmarked for 3 years----crestfallen experience on a warm afternoon.

I was stuck on the Bridge; plenty of empty tables available outside. My friend was forced to stand and wait until I arrived in order to sit down somewhere. Joking me?? I understand upholding that when there are not a minimum of 6 2-tops open! Off-putting

The plow breakfast ordered was such a letdown, upon immediate glance of small plate. Crispy potatoes tasted stale to both of us, and instead of properly cut small chunks, we got little bits and bobbles of leftover pan. Couldn't even spear them with the tines of a fork. Resigned, we just wasted an already small plate of food for $16.

Lemon ricotta pancakes (2 silver dollar-sized) did not have that refined, think crispy buttery edge with super fluffy, melt-in-mouth feel. Lemon was very nice on the tongue, but it certainly was the only positive attribute to them.

Nueske bacon fine.

After within the month, going to many brunch places, I find the food way overrated. Way.

excerpts: Since I read such amazing reviews about the lemon ricotta pancakes and house made pork sausage and wanted to try both, I ordered the plow (2 eggs, house made pork sausage, 2 lemon ricotta pancakes, and crispy potatoes).
Plow also offers side orders of both items.
I really enjoyed everything, especially the pancakes and potatoes.
crispy potatoes.author: Cici A.
crispy potatoes.review:
Since I read such amazing reviews about the lemon ricotta pancakes and house made pork sausage and wanted to try both, I ordered the plow (2 eggs, house made pork sausage, 2 lemon ricotta pancakes, and crispy potatoes).   Plow also offers side orders of both items.  I really enjoyed everything, especially the pancakes and potatoes.  Unless you dislike lemon (the pancakes really are pretty lemony), I highly recommend you at least order the side dish for your table to share.  

Meanwhile, one of my friends ordered the french toast, which was good, but in my opinion not as good as the pancakes.  Another of my friends ordered the chia seed pudding which though I did not personally try, had a gelatinous texture (due to the chia seeds) that she did not enjoy.

excerpts: The ricotta pancakes may get the headlines, but the crispy potatoes are the real winner.
crispy potatoes.author: Herb K.
crispy potatoes.review: For under $20, this brunch place is solid, if you're willing to wait for an hour or so.  The ricotta pancakes may get the headlines, but the crispy potatoes are the real winner.

excerpts: I didn't like crispy potatoes that much because they were too crunch and crispy and had barely portion to eat.
crispy potatoes.author: Asato T.
crispy potatoes.review:
Went there for b-fast on Wednesday morning like 7:30. I know this place is been very popular with locals and packed on weekends, so thought today was a perfect timing to swing by.  There's 3-4 tables were taken already at this point!
Ordered The Plow and liked Lemon ricotta pancakes:). I didn't like crispy potatoes that much because they were too crunch and crispy and had barely portion to eat.

Will come back for the full portion of pancakes again!

excerpts: so we tried them both), crispy potatoes and ricotta pancakes.
crispy potatoes.author: Sean M.
crispy potatoes.review:
Came during a weekday so there was no wait (I'm assuming this isn't always normal during the week and it was more luck than anything). 

Had "the plow" which was eggs, meat (I had bacon, my friend had sausage so we tried them both), crispy potatoes and ricotta pancakes. 

Food was amazing, particularly the pork sausage, the pancakes and the potatoes. Sausage was house made, super moist and had amazing flavor. The Ricotta pancakes were the perfect crispness on the outside and perfectly light inside. Some of the best pancakes I've ever had, although there was a little bit too much lemon flavor. The potatoes are damn good. My guess is they're deep fried breakfast potatoes so a little different than what you would normally get. 

Totally recommend it, but not sure I'd want to wait 2 hours for it.

excerpts: We decided to split the Fried Egg Sandwich (Two Eggs Fried, Cheddar, Aioli, Served w/Crispy Potatoes, $11 + Nueske Bacon, $2.50, http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/plow-san-francisco?select=GFi1WD9m-LXQzmYujzQpmA#YwR3TfuxiYN9OUvbMeiiBA) since I wasn't that hungry, and it was delicious.
However, it didn't compare to the crispy potatoes, which were AMAZING.
These were probably the best crispy potatoes that I've ever had.
They were super flavorful, and cooked really well-
this was a perfect addition to the 7x7 list.
The egg sandwich is highly recommend but the potatoes are a must order!
Hour Cold-Brewed Iced Coffee ($4, http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/plow-san-francisco?select=GFi1WD9m-LXQzmYujzQpmA#GFi1WD9m-LXQzmYujzQpmA): Also really good, and highly recommended.
crispy potatoes.author: Amy D.
crispy potatoes.review:
Crispy Potatoes- #92 on the 2013 7x7 100 Things to Eat Before You Die list.

I tried going to Plow once before, and the line was so crazy on a Saturday that they couldn't even accommodate to-go orders. I tried again on a Friday afternoon, and my friend and I got there around 11am and there was already a 20 minute wait! Luckily we were just a party of two and got seated after 10-15 minutes. We decided to split the Fried Egg Sandwich (Two Eggs Fried, Cheddar, Aioli, Served w/Crispy Potatoes, $11 + Nueske Bacon, $2.50, http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/plow-san-francisco?select=GFi1WD9m-LXQzmYujzQpmA#YwR3TfuxiYN9OUvbMeiiBA) since I wasn't that hungry, and it was delicious. However, it didn't compare to the crispy potatoes, which were AMAZING. These were probably the best crispy potatoes that I've ever had. They were super flavorful, and cooked really well- this was a perfect addition to the 7x7 list. The egg sandwich is highly recommend but the potatoes are a must order!
-12 Hour Cold-Brewed Iced Coffee ($4, http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/plow-san-francisco?select=GFi1WD9m-LXQzmYujzQpmA#GFi1WD9m-LXQzmYujzQpmA): Also really good, and highly recommended. The coffee was really smooth, and had good flavor.

Overall, the lines at Plow are justified, and is one of the best brunch spots I've been to ever. Although the restaurant and tables are small, and it can be difficult to find parking at times (it was easy on the weekday), I will definitely be back to try other items on their menu. I really like our waitress, who was really friendly and accommodating.

excerpts: However, the crispy potatoes were the standout item.
crispy potatoes.author: Abena O.
crispy potatoes.review:
This place turned me into the person that waits 2 hours in line for brunch and I'm okay with that. I was always a huge fan of brunch, but I didn't know that it could be that damn good! 

I ordered the Plow and it was wonderful. Everything on my plate was fantastic. However, the crispy potatoes were the standout item. 

Do yourself a favor and bear the line at least once so you can try their amazing brunch.

excerpts: Their gluten free pancakes or crispy potatoes or waffles or scrambled eggs - whatever it is, there is nothing like it elsewhere.
They have distinguished themselves in a very big way when it comes to food, so everything else is secondary.
For me, there has never been a chance to ever notice the service (although luckily it has been good for me whenever I have been here).
There has never been a chance to ever notice the long line which can be pretty long
crispy potatoes.author: Sun B.
crispy potatoes.review:
If you have never been to Plow then you must know that Plow has more of a cult fan following now than anything else. Their gluten free pancakes or crispy potatoes or waffles or scrambled eggs - whatever it is, there is nothing like it elsewhere. They have distinguished themselves in a very big way when it comes to food, so everything else is secondary. For me, there has never been a chance to ever notice the service (although luckily it has been good for me whenever I have been here). There has never been a chance to ever notice the long line which can be pretty long (Read: might have to wait for an hour or more sometimes).

I have been among that fan following where I would wake up at 6.30 am on a weekend, quickly drive to this place and wait in the queue; then feel highly accomplished for being one of the first few ones who quickly got a table for my hard work (waiting in the queue lol!). People who live in SF and who love good food know how amazing it is to be able to eat at this restaurant - it is THAT good! 

I have not found many restaurants who take the trouble to make gluten free stuff, much less gluten-free pancakes. Whatever I found at other restaurants scream this at the top of their lungs: "Here it is! We took some corn/rice/quinoa/or whatever you call it 'gluten free' flour, dumped some milk, sugar, butter, oil and eggs in it. To give it some flavor as a favor to you, we will add a tiny bitsy drop of some fake vanilla essence like we are lazying around in the park on a bright sunny day; then throw this mess of a vanilla smelling concoction on a pan and v.o.i.l.a. there you go! See, we told you we have it in the menu!" 

Plow is one of the very few restaurants who takes gluten free seriously and so well! Their gluten free pancakes with almond flour tastes like one jolly best stuff in the world! Keep it up Plow! Never stop making those pancakes ever ever!

excerpts: you'd like, choice of pork sausage/bacon/chicken sausage, crispy potatoes, and of course their popular lemon ricotta pancakes which are fluffy, moist, and scaled to perfection on taste.
crispy potatoes.author: Mike D.
crispy potatoes.review:
Set high in this quaint little neighborhood in Potrero Hill that has a great view of the downtown SF is this wonderful breakfast/brunch joint. 

I've been here twice and both times were equally amazing in food quality and service. I would rate this place higher if I had the option to. 

The last time I was in attendance to have brunch here, I ordered The Plow which consists of 2 eggs prepared anyway you'd like, choice of pork sausage/bacon/chicken sausage, crispy potatoes, and of course their popular lemon ricotta pancakes which are fluffy, moist, and scaled to perfection on taste. 

Needless to say, this is one of my all time favorites in the city. 

WORD OF ADVICE: COME EARLY!! The wait is usually pretty hardcore, but don't worry... you can order a mimosa to ease the pain while you wait outside. I'd recommend the grapefruit option over orange. Also, as much as I love sitting outdoors, I'd choose to sit inside on this one. The bus stop is right next to where you're seated... "I'll have The Plow please. Hold the dust."

excerpts: I wanna find out what they do with their amazing crispy potatoes.
And their turkey sausage.
Clarissa can't wait to talk to her French friends about this.
crispy potatoes.author: Ulrich L.
crispy potatoes.review:
Today I decided to take my daughter Clarissa to breakfast. Petit dejeuner, as they say in France. 

(That's where my daughter Clarissa lives most of the year for work. She is a model, lawyer and UN ambassador.)

So we arrived at Plow only to be greeted by a gigantic line of people waiting for food. Reminded especially me of the lines I would see at supermarkets in East European communist countries at times when they would sell special items like bananas or apples. Even Clarissa giggled. 

Still we were seated promptly and were able to enjoy an absolute delicious breakfast. Even by the standards of my well travelled model daughter. 

Here's the only downside. We were seated right at the entrance and there is a lot of traffic coming through these doors. My daughter has to be a size zero for work reasons and therefore gets chills easily. People just have no etiquette and leave the door open, even when kindly asked to consider the effects on the people seated. 

The restaurant staff tried to compensate - with sometimes too little effect. 

So, that is the only minus in this experience. The food is stellar. I wanna find out what they do with their amazing crispy potatoes. And their turkey sausage. Clarissa can't wait to talk to her French friends about this. After having a cigarette of course. 

Delicious, Clarissa is off to New York now, to give a speech in front of the UN. I hope she won't have gotten a cold from those ignorant people waiting in line. 

Not chic,
U. L. and C. H. M. L.

excerpts: Until we meet again, crispy potatoes...
crispy potatoes.author: Mariel A.
crispy potatoes.review:
Came here on a weekday with my brunch buddy, the best kind of buddy there is. Found parking pretty quickly. Parking on these steep hills always freak me out, though.

Only had to wait about 20 mins. Not bad!
The space and decor that they had was nice..reminded me of NOPA's interior. The nice light wood tables..big windows that let in natural light. Made for a pleasant dining experience. We had to sit directly next to another table though, because of space, but I didn't mind too much.

Had the fried egg sandwich with bacon. Pretty good, but honestly the highlight of the meal was the potatoes. Holy crispiness. Haha, so herby and delicious! If you're a texture freak like me, then I think you'd appreciate these as much as I did. I liked how crisp they were, like super fried but it didn't feel greasy which was nice. :]

My buddy had "the plow"--2 eggs, bacon, and lemon ricotta pancakes. Pretty good. the ricotta pancakes...were good. don't get me wrong, but I did have better--at Zazie's in Cole Valley. Sorry! I'd still come back if I were in the area! :D 

Service was good. Left happy. Prices weren't too bad for what you got. Until we meet again, crispy potatoes...

excerpts: The lemon ricotta pancakes are delicious, but the star of The Plow has got to be the crispy potatoes with rosemary.
crispy potatoes.author: Helen Z.
crispy potatoes.review:
