This is easily one of the top brunch places to go to in SF. If you get The Plow, which is basically their breakfast sampler, skip the sausage patty (very dry), and go for their bacon (nice and crispy). The lemon ricotta pancakes are delicious, but the star of The Plow has got to be the crispy potatoes with rosemary. Yum. 

They have some staples on the menu like the fried egg sandwich, which is very good, but they also have great seasonal dishes. I tried the salmon tartine last time and it tasted delicious.

Pro Tip: Come on the weekdays to avoid the ridiculous lines.

excerpts: I decided to get the Plow as it has a little bit of everything - eggs your way, choice of pork/chicken sausage or bacon, two lemon ricotta pancakes, and crispy potatoes.
Come hungry!
The crispy potatoes are seriously the best - absolutely MUST HAVE.
The lemon ricotta pancakes were really good too.
I had my eggs poached and the chicken sausage, both of which were good.
Although, the potatoes really stole the show!
The fresh orange juice was delicious.
We were seated outside and it was cute to watch people walk up and down the hill as we enjoyed our huge brunch.
It's dog friendly which is nice.
A bit more expensive than other places, good food, and friendly service except for the long wait.
Will go back for the crispy potatoes!
crispy potatoes.author: Jaya P.
crispy potatoes.review:
Best brunch I had in SF! Being from DC, I was kind of disappointed with the SF brunch scene but Plow definitely changed that. Yes, the wait is long and kind of annoying depending on when you go, but it's worth it, and definitely better than some other touristy brunch places (looking at you Mama's). Plow is in Portrero Hill, a mostly residential neighborhood and there are some cute stores, restaurants, bookshops around the block that you can check out while you wait. 
I decided to get the Plow as it has a little bit of everything - eggs your way, choice of pork/chicken sausage or bacon, two lemon ricotta pancakes, and crispy potatoes. Come hungry! The crispy potatoes are seriously the best - absolutely MUST HAVE. The lemon ricotta pancakes were really good too. I had my eggs poached and the chicken sausage, both of which were good. Although, the potatoes really stole the show! The fresh orange juice was delicious. We were seated outside and it was cute to watch people walk up and down the hill as we enjoyed our huge brunch. It's dog friendly which is nice. A bit more expensive than other places, good food, and friendly service except for the long wait. Will go back for the crispy potatoes!

excerpts: And, I think the crispy potatoes were a little over-powering with ginger taste.
crispy potatoes.author: Melody W.
crispy potatoes.review:
I came here with a gal pal on a Thursday lunch break (~12:15pm). Parking was easy (say what the what? It's never easy in SF). Since I was in great company, the wait wasn't long at all--probably 10-15 minutes max for first available seating. We got seated outside, which was fine. The weather was amazing, so we didn't mind. 

She ordered a side of scrambled eggs with the Almond Flour Pancakes. I got the Plow breakfast (hey-- when in Rome, right?) which came with two eggs (over-easy for me), 4 things of chicken apple sausage, 2 lemon ricotta pancakes (yes! and yes!), and a big hoppin' load of crispy potato chunks (it's a bit ginger-y, so be advised). Oh-- and a cup of Equator coffee to wash it all down. I loved The Plow (get yer mind outta the gutter...lol). I believe the gal pal loved her pancakes too. I only wish my lemon ricotta pancakes had some blueberry compote (sp?) like the ones in the regular lemon ricotta pancake entree. And, I think the crispy potatoes were a little over-powering with ginger taste. All in all, I loved the dish and the experience. 

This place is worth a visit in my book.

excerpts: I think the best part about it were the crispy potatoes.
They were really good and probably super unhealthy!
crispy potatoes.author: Tommy L.
crispy potatoes.review:
LEMON RICOTTA PANCAKES

Came here on a wet weekend for brunch with my cousin. It was already packed when we got there and it was only 10am. Make sure to put your name down. They tell you how long it might take. Told us it would take 45 mins so we decided to make a short trip to Trader Joe's for flowers. 

By the time we came back, we didn't have to wait long to be seated. The seating area inside is super tiny, most likely you'll have to share tables with someone. We sat next to these two old gay men who were probably a couple. Didn't bother me at all. 

I ordered the lemon ricotta pancakes while my cousin had the sandwich. Both were good. I think the best part about it were the crispy potatoes. They were really good and probably super unhealthy! They are super fried. 

Parking isnt too bad. You'd have to park residential. I parked on a hill. I know some of you tourist aren't used to parking 90 degrees on a hill in SF but luckily I grew up here and I'm used to it :)

excerpts: Me and my other friends all got the Plow and I loved their crispy potatoes!!
I was very satisfied after this meal (:
crispy potatoes.author: Tina C.
crispy potatoes.review: Came here on a Friday morning at 10:30 and surprisingly there was a wait! We waited an hour for party of three. Me and my other friends all got the Plow and I loved their crispy potatoes!! I was very satisfied after this meal (:

excerpts: The Plow - 2 eggs, crispy potatoes, 2 Lemon ricotta pancake - sweeter than the pumpkin, lighter and fluffier, and pork sausage.
Amazing.
crispy potatoes.author: Tiffany N.
crispy potatoes.review:
Yum! Definitely worth the 40min wait. I was disappointed that they ran out some things I want try like the Monte Cristo and Eggs Benedict. 

Pumpkin pancake - So Good! Perfectly cinnamon-y, fluffy and flavorful

The Plow - 2 eggs, crispy potatoes, 2 Lemon ricotta pancake - sweeter than the pumpkin, lighter and fluffier, and pork sausage. Amazing. And a great way to try a few different things

Pork lion sandwich. Hard to put down. That red sauce in it brought all the flavor. The bread was nice and not dry. 

Got their ice tea - whatever. Tasted like tea, that wasn't worth the $4! Haha

excerpts: I got the Plow, which includes 2 eggs, your choice of meat (I got bacon, obviously), crispy potatoes, and 2 small lemon-ricotta pancakes.
It was the perfect amount of food for someone who has been waiting for a table for 1 hour!
It was also delicious.
The crispy potatoes were mixed with onions and both were extra crispy.
These are probably the best breakfast potatoes I've ever had!
crispy potatoes.author: Sungeeta A.
crispy potatoes.review:
Wow is this place popular!  I came here around 8:50 on a Sunday morning, thinking there was no way there would be a huge wait. Was I wrong! I guess San Franciscans really like their brunch!

I have to say brunch was worth the wait. I got the Plow, which includes 2 eggs, your choice of meat (I got bacon, obviously), crispy potatoes, and 2 small lemon-ricotta pancakes. It was the perfect amount of food for someone who has been waiting for a table for 1 hour! It was also delicious. The crispy potatoes were mixed with onions and both were extra crispy. These are probably the best breakfast potatoes I've ever had! The lemon ricotta pancakes were of course delicious as well. The only negative was they were a little on the luke warm side. 

Next time I come here (and there will be a next time) I'm going to get here right when they open at 8, or come on a weekday.

excerpts: It was a very generous portion with a side of perfectly crispy potatoes.
crispy potatoes.author: Grace S.
crispy potatoes.review:
My two friends and I arrived for Sunday brunch at 9:35 and didn't get seated until close to 11.  Yes, the wait was long.  (The place is tiny; definitely not a place for large groups).  However, Plow's location in a charming neighborhood of coffee shops and boutiques gave us out-of-towners a nice way to pass the time as we waited for a table. We grabbed coffee at a nearby coffee shop and said "hi" to the occasional dog that sat outside the various cafes, patiently waiting for their owners.

And the wait was so worth it. 

Our food came quickly once we ordered. I had the eggs Benedict with smoked salmon. It was a very generous portion with a side of perfectly crispy potatoes. My friends and I also shared an order of the lemon ricotta pancakes. I'm generally not a fan of flavored pancakes, but these were the best pancakes I've had in recent memory -- perfect thickness, wonderfully soft in the inside, slightly crisp on the outside, with a subtle lemon zing. For meat lovers, I'd recommend the pork chops. The meat is tender and perfectly greasy; it was a favorite at the table.

excerpts: The crispy potatoes (raved about on Yelp) were just ok.
They are less greasy than your typical diner potatoes, but they lacked seasoning and salt.
I had to put a lot of hot sauce and ketchup on them.
They also come with a lot of fried skin, which may or may not be your thing.
The eggs themselves were good but nothing to wait 2 hours for.
They were soft as advertised.
crispy potatoes.author: Mel C.
crispy potatoes.review:
Solid spot for Sunday brunch, but not worth the 2 hour wait. Luckily you can put your name down and grab some coffee down the street... but still there are comparable brunch spots in SF.

I had the Soft Scrambled Eggs. The crispy potatoes (raved about on Yelp) were just ok. They are less greasy than your typical diner potatoes, but they lacked seasoning and salt. I had to put a lot of hot sauce and ketchup on them. They also come with a lot of fried skin, which may or may not be your thing. The eggs themselves were good but nothing to wait 2 hours for. They were soft as advertised. The feta flavor was subtle and didn't overpower the overall eggy flavor.

It's a small place with some outdoor seating. Ambiance is just average.

excerpts: The Plow: two eggs, choice of house made pork sausage, Nueske bacon, or chicken apple sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes with pure maple syrup, and some crispy potatoes.
The boy got his with the sugar pie pumpkin pancakes (instead of the lemon ricotta) and they were just as heavenly--if not better.
crispy potatoes.author: Adena B.
crispy potatoes.review:
"Hour and a half wait," says Randall.

"No worries, we'll wait it out," I told him. He smiled and handed me some coffee to pass the time. He also pointed down the street and shared a tip: "Rico makes some killer Bloody Marys. In case you're interested."

Of COURSE I'm interested, Randall. We wasted a good 45 minutes at Blooms Saloon, (http://www.yelp.com/biz/blooms-saloon-san-francisco#hrid:g60JAte3LvIB4-uJ8CCUXw) then headed back to wait out the remainder of the time. 

EATS
+The Plow: two eggs, choice of house made pork sausage, Nueske bacon, or chicken apple sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes with pure maple syrup, and some crispy potatoes. The boy got his with the sugar pie pumpkin pancakes (instead of the lemon ricotta) and they were just as heavenly--if not better. We both opted for the bacon--and it was just OK; kinda smokey.

DRANKS
+Mimosas: watered down and not that great; especially not after that spicy Bloody Mary.
+Coffee: San Raf's finest, Equator coffee. Excellent.

Service was good, Randall made it great. Will I be back? Probably not, but happy to have tested it out to see what the hype was all about.

excerpts: ordered the plow: 2 lemon ricotta pancakes, 2 eggs any style, crispy potatoes, and choice of home made pork sausage patties, bacon, or chicken sausage.
I got sunny side up and bacon.
the plate was a lot of for me
and I couldn't finish.
LB got the fried egg sandwich with added avocado, side order of pancakes and the pork sausage.
crispy potatoes.author: Jules L.
crispy potatoes.review:
came on a Tuesday around 11am, there were about 5 parties ahead of us. ask them to put your name on the list. some people tried to just sit themselves onto open tables. it is not open seatings. they have little benches for you to sit on as you wait. they will ask if you prefer outdoor or inside seatings or whichever is first available. around after 12, the crowd dies down and not much of a wait. they are open till 2pm though and closed on Mondays. took around 20 mins to be seated. 

ordered the plow: 2 lemon ricotta pancakes, 2 eggs any style, crispy potatoes, and choice of home made pork sausage patties, bacon, or chicken sausage. I got sunny side up and bacon. the plate was a lot of for me and I couldn't finish. LB got the fried egg sandwich with added avocado, side order of pancakes and the pork sausage. he can eat and was not able to finish too. 

food was pretty good. not mind blowing. some of the potatoes are extra crispy like potato chips, egg yolks was small, bacon had a smokey taste, pancakes was alright. I made the mistake of eating that last and it has gotten cold. I do taste the hint of lemon. 

service was good. LB's coffee got refilled 3 times. they asked if you want water also, but we declined. When food arrives, waiter will ask if you need anything else like ketchup or hot sauce. they did not check up on us afterward. the food took a bit to come out, around 25 mins. so don't go hungry. 

a little pricey breakfast, but you're paying for the quality of the ingredients. their juices are not freshly squeezed though, came from bottled jugs. I got the grapefruit juice. Comes in small or large. 

plenty of parking around the neighbor. not metered. nice view as you wait. right off the 280 freeway.

excerpts: We really enjoyed our food, specially, the crispy potatoes
They were the best crispy potatoes that I had tried so far.
The egg sandwiches was good but it can get  really messy as well.
crispy potatoes.author: Stacy L.
crispy potatoes.review:
I finally got to try Plow last weekend with my bf. We got there around 10:30am and the wait lists were quite long already. We waited for an hour before we got seated. I'm an inpatient person, since I was willing to waited for an hour for my brunch. IT GOT TO BE GOOD FOOD. Also,It was cold in the morning, so it was very nice of Plow offered complimentary coffee   for people who were waiting to be seated.  

We ordered the Fried Egg Sandwiches with avocado and The Plow. We really enjoyed our food, specially, the crispy potatoes They were the best crispy potatoes that I had tried so far. The egg sandwiches was good but it can get  really messy as well. Tip: cut the sandwiches in half before chowing it down. 

It's delicious. Definitely, will go back and try the other dishes on the menu. Maybe try to go there earlier too just to avoid the long wait.

excerpts: Those crispy potatoes are quite something.
So amazing.
The french toast is served with ricotta cheese and (somehow) totally perfect strawberries.
The eggs benedict has some amazing hollandaise sauce too--really lemony.
crispy potatoes.author: Sarah K.
crispy potatoes.review:
There are so many wonderful things about this place.
First and foremost, the weekend brunch is quite delectable. Everything tastes amazing and you can see it being cooked right in front of you if you sit in the booth. I came here with a friend on a Saturday and we shared french toast, eggs benedict, and the dungeness crab scramble. Everything is tasty, delicious, and every other adjective you can think of for good food. Those crispy potatoes are quite something. So amazing. 
The french toast is served with ricotta cheese and (somehow) totally perfect strawberries. The eggs benedict has some amazing hollandaise sauce too--really lemony. The dungeness crab scramble. Wow. No additional words needed. Simply delicious.

There is a bit of a wait though, but I think it was totally worth it. It's in a cute neighborhood so you can take a bit of a stroll before you eat. Also a stroll after you overeat like I did. Plenty of parking nearby too! That's always a plus. 

The works are also super friendly and nice. Will definitely be coming back here to try other items on the menu. That fried egg sandwich looked amazing.

excerpts: The Plow ($16) : 2 eggs, choice of pork sausage, bacon, OR chicken apple sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes, and crispy potatoes.
Everything was good, but wasn't a big fan of the lemon ricotta pancakes as I thought I would've been.
Customer service was attentive and friendly.
crispy potatoes.author: B. R.
crispy potatoes.review:
Waited 45 minutes and ordered "The Plow." 

The Plow ($16) : 2 eggs, choice of pork sausage, bacon, OR chicken apple sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes, and crispy potatoes.

Got seated outside on a cold morning. You can ask them for blankets since there's no patio heaters outside.

No tobasco sauce here. Only serve Youk's hot sauce -- wasn't that spicy for me.

Everything was good, but wasn't a big fan of the lemon ricotta pancakes as I thought I would've been. Customer service was attentive and friendly.

excerpts: Perfectly poached eggs, crispy potatoes, and the right amount of sauce.
Highly recommend!
crispy potatoes.author: Laura M.
crispy potatoes.review:
Perfect breakfast spot. Love the atmosphere and the menu is great - variety but not an overwhelming number of options. We were a group of four; arrived 8:30 on a Saturday and were seated by 9:15. Coffee with refills while we waited! 

After some rave reviews from the woman at the table next to us (a few too many mimosas by her own admission), we all ordered a version of Eggs Benedict. Perfectly poached eggs, crispy potatoes, and the right amount of sauce. Highly recommend!

excerpts: Of course, the CRISPY POTATOES are as good as everyone says it is.
crispy potatoes.author: Sunny W.
crispy potatoes.review:
Been here twice, both times were to take friends visiting the area. It's good, with all the other amazing breakfast/brunch places in SF, I may skip this place next time.

What I've tried:
LEMON RICOTTA PANCAKES: First time I had this, I didn't enjoy it. Second time was much better.

FRIED EGG SANDWICH: My only grip with this dish is the bun used. I guess I'm picky about my carbs....

SOFT SCRAMBLED EGGS: asparagus, oyster mushrooms, goat cheese. One of my favorites from Plow --I would reorder next time I visit.

EGGS BENEDICT: I got the spinach/mushroom combo. The english muffin must be bought at a nearby bakery --thicker than your usual. Flavor was a little lacking, would pass on this for the SOFT SCRAMBLED EGGS.

Of course, the CRISPY POTATOES are as good as everyone says it is.

PARKING: If you come at the right time, you should be able to find street parking.

FIRST TIMER? Walk through the crowds near the entrance and put your name down with a staff. Expect to wait at least 45 min on weekends. There's bar and table seating inside, as well as a handful of tables outside.

excerpts: The lemon ricotta pancakes were amazing and the crispy potatoes are a-maz-ing.
crispy potatoes.author: Sarah G.
crispy potatoes.review:
Great spot for breakfast in SF! We stopped here on a brief visit to the city, and it was well worth the wait 

The lemon ricotta pancakes were amazing and the crispy potatoes are a-maz-ing. 

It was 20 minutes on a Thursday, so I'm thinking the weekend is a nightmare. I'd recommend getting there early.

excerpts: The crispy potatoes were PERFECT, as they were crispy on the outside, yet retained the potato texture and flavor on the inside (I hate when a crispy potato becomes unrecognizable in flavor other than a fried mess)!
The pork sausage was good.
crispy potatoes.author: Emily C.
crispy potatoes.review:
3.5 stars.

THE WAIT: About 40 minutes around 12:30p on a Saturday. 

THE FOOD: 
|| THE PLOW: 4 stars: Lemon Ricotta pancakes were sweet, full of lemony flavor & fluffy. The crispy potatoes were PERFECT, as they were crispy on the outside, yet retained the potato texture and flavor on the inside (I hate when a crispy potato becomes unrecognizable in flavor other than a fried mess)! The pork sausage was good. The scrambled eggs was unfortunately disappointing because it was soggy. 

|| DUNGENESS CRAB SCRAMBLE: 3 stars: The eggs were again soggy, but the scramble preserved the crab flavor. Good dish if you really like crab without much flavoring added to it. 

PARKING: Lots of parking, since it is Potrero Hill, your car will likely be parked at a 45 degree angle. 

ATMOSPHERE: Small restaurant with cute, clean decor (pottery barn-esque). Seating is limited inside and our table of 2 was awkwardly super close to the table next to us (so censor your conversations :P). 

SERVICE: Friendly and with a smile.

excerpts: I ordered the lemon ricotta pancakes and she order the plow which comes with two eggs, chicken apple sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes, and crispy potatoes.
We basically split everything, and I finished my own set of pancakes.
The pancakes were so light and fluffy, but you could taste the lemon and ricotta in every bite - exactly how it should be, right?
Everything in my cousin's dish was delicious - the crispy potatoes .... to die for.
crispy potatoes.author: Kathleene E.
crispy potatoes.review:
My cousin and I came to the Plow a few months ago, and I believe it was  Friday morning. We had to wait about an hour, but it wasn't a big deal because we walked down the street to this super cute coffee spot and the wait went by super quick. 

The restaurant is small and quaint, one of those small, cozy (as another yelper said) restaurant. It has a lot of bright open space, so if you're feeling a little vampirey and antisocial not wanting to share your space, I suggest you do not go here! Lol, onto the food.

I ordered the lemon ricotta pancakes and she order the plow which comes with two eggs, chicken apple sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes, and crispy potatoes. We basically split everything, and I finished my own set of pancakes. The pancakes were so light and fluffy, but you could taste the lemon and ricotta in every bite - exactly how it should be, right? Everything in my cousin's dish was delicious - the crispy potatoes .... to die for. The chicken apple sausage was yummy as well. 

Bottom line - it was a fun experience. Good food, good service topped with a beautiful sunny day in SF. But since I was having a leisurely day and not pressed on time, I was okay with waiting the hour to be seated. I wouldn't wait an hour if I had other things to do - i thought this was important to add :)

excerpts: The breakfast sandwich and crispy potatoes are unlike anything else.
The wait time quoted on weekend mornings are typically at least 45 mins.
I don't mind when I go in prepared to wait though.
Both indoor and outdoor seating available.
I've never had an issue with street parking here.
crispy potatoes.author: Alias A.
crispy potatoes.review: My favorite restaurant in the city. And that's saying a lot! The breakfast sandwich and crispy potatoes are unlike anything else. The wait time quoted on weekend mornings are typically at least 45 mins. I don't mind when I go in prepared to wait though. Both indoor and outdoor seating available. I've never had an issue with street parking here.

excerpts: My favorite was the french toast and crispy potatoes.
Be prepared to wait in line.
crispy potatoes.author: Katherine R.
crispy potatoes.review: This place was great! Even their orange juice was so delicious! Definitely coming back. My favorite was the french toast and crispy potatoes. Be prepared to wait in line.

excerpts: The crispy potatoes are prepared perfectly and the lemon ricotta pancake is a MUST!
Share it with your table mates - it's the perfect combination of lemon, ricotta, and pancake!
It's how empty carbs and calories are meant to taste!
crispy potatoes.author: Joshua S.
crispy potatoes.review:
Get here early, and still be prepared to wait. It's a small restaurant but they turn the tables quickly. 
The food is amazing! I had the eggs Benedict with salmon and it was great. The crispy potatoes are prepared perfectly and the lemon ricotta pancake is a MUST! Share it with your table mates - it's the perfect combination of lemon, ricotta, and pancake! It's how empty carbs and calories are meant to taste!

excerpts: Those CRISPY POTATOES, though!!!
They were the star of our meal.
I would recommend them to anyone with functioning taste buds, because seriously, who wouldn't appreciate the perfect crisp that complements that nice, soft yet dense interior?
Coming to Plow and not ordering those crispy potatoes is like going to Ike's and not ordering a sandwich.
You just can't.
Respect your body by giving it the best possible version of potatoes one could possibly eat for breakfast (permutations of dinner potatoes are a different story).
crispy potatoes.author: Tuwie N.
crispy potatoes.review:
Those CRISPY POTATOES, though!!! They were the star of our meal. I would recommend them to anyone with functioning taste buds, because seriously, who wouldn't appreciate the perfect crisp that complements that nice, soft yet dense interior? Coming to Plow and not ordering those crispy potatoes is like going to Ike's and not ordering a sandwich. You just can't. Respect your body by giving it the best possible version of potatoes one could possibly eat for breakfast (permutations of dinner potatoes are a different story). I liked sitting at the bar and seeing all the work that goes into making the food.  

regarding the wait: don't be intimidated. Who are you kidding? It's the 21st century, and we all have things to do while waiting. Catch up with friends, do your grocery shopping, instagram, call your grandma, read a book, give out-of-towners a tour of the Mission, just do whatever you'd normally do and be rewarded with a beautiful breakfast by the end of it! I put my name down at 11:30am on a Saturday and was told the wait was going to be 2 hours for our party of 2. Not a problem, it was a beautiful day in SF so my brother and I killed time by taking pictures (instagrammers love those benches outside!) and making a coffee run. We got back at around 1 hour and 55 minutes after I was told "2 hours", but it seems we should have gotten back earlier, because our name was called multiple times already. They were so nice and called our name next as soon as we told them we were there. Other places are not this nice and will put your name at the bottom of the list and make you wait all over again. Thanks, Plow!

excerpts: The lemon ricotta pancakes are still stuck in my mind six months later as are the, "... the best crispy potatoes I've ever had.
crispy potatoes.author: Justin S.
crispy potatoes.review:
How could I have forgotten this review? 

Go here now!

The lemon ricotta pancakes are still stuck in my mind six months later as are the, "... the best crispy potatoes I've ever had." They are amazing.

Also coffee in line while you wait, is an excellent idea.

excerpts: I ordered the Plow, which came with 2 eggs, choice of Nueske bacon, house made pork sausage, or chicken apple sausage, 2 of their famous lemon ricotta pancakes, and crispy potatoes.
I chose the pork sausage.
The portions were just right.
My 2 eggs were nicely formed in a circle that they must have used a circle mold.
The pork sausage were basically patties, but they were really tasty.
You can taste the fennel with a little spice.
The best part was the lemon ricotta pancakes.
They were EXCELLENT!!
It just melted in my mouth; very moist.
With just a little bit of syrup, it's like dessert.
I had seen Yelp reviews about them and they were right!
You HAVE to try these!
Potatoes were nice and crispy.
crispy potatoes.author: Erica S.
crispy potatoes.review:
My friend picked this place for a recent brunch.  It was a 45 minute wait, but it was DEFINITELY worth it!  They don't accept reservations so you either have to wait or eat elsewhere.  Seems they're only open for brunch/lunch, no dinner.  

The interior is nice and clean.  Service is pretty friendly although I was slightly bothered when our female server decided to take my guy friend and my husband's order before mine.  What happened to ladies first?!

Started off with coffee and their fried doughnut holes.  One order came with 3.  They were good, but nothing too special.  Let them cool before you munch on them.  

I ordered the Plow, which came with 2 eggs, choice of Nueske bacon, house made pork sausage, or chicken apple sausage, 2 of their famous lemon ricotta pancakes, and crispy potatoes.  I chose the pork sausage.  The portions were just right.  My 2 eggs were nicely formed in a circle that they must have used a circle mold.  The pork sausage were basically patties, but they were really tasty.  You can taste the fennel with a little spice.  The best part was the lemon ricotta pancakes.  They were EXCELLENT!!  It just melted in my mouth; very moist.  With just a little bit of syrup, it's like dessert.  I had seen Yelp reviews about them and they were right!  You HAVE to try these!  Potatoes were nice and crispy.  Everything was so good, I finished my whole plate!

My husband had the Short Rib Hash and that was tasty as well.  Have to come back again!!!  Thanks, Richard for taking us here!

excerpts: The crispy potatoes are also delicious.
My friend got the salmon tartine, which was good, but not as unique as mine.
crispy potatoes.author: Madeline S.
crispy potatoes.review: Everything I had read about Plow was absolutely true and more. I am so glad we trekked out to Potrero Hill at 9:30 for this. It was an hour wait but there was plenty to walk around and see in the cute neighborhood and we got coffees at a nearby cafe. I ordered the soft scrambled eggs with goat cheese and nettles and acme toast. There was...not going to lie...a lot of butter, but it was worth it. The crispy potatoes are also delicious. My friend got the salmon tartine, which was good, but not as unique as mine. We shared one lemon ricotta pancake, a must-try!! It basically tasted like cake. The atmosphere is good, the service is excellent. It's just a long wait after 9:30 so I suggest going early.

excerpts: Every element comprising it from the lemon ricotta pancakes to the crispy potatoes to the bacon to the eggs are made to perfection.
crispy potatoes.author: Em F.
crispy potatoes.review:
The key is to either come 2 hours before you're hungry or between 8am-9am. Anytime after that and be prepared to make long conversation with your friend/voices in your head. 

I've somehow had brunch here 5 times even though I make it a point to try new places in the city and lines make me crotchety because it. is. just. that. good. That's about 10 hours of my life spent waiting in lines, and yet I have no regrets. The Plow is to die for. Every element comprising it from the lemon ricotta pancakes to the crispy potatoes to the bacon to the eggs are made to perfection. It's like sushi in a way - simple-looking but each component has been carefully prepared and a lot of care has been placed into each element, creating one amazing meal. 

Ditch your acquaintances because this place is rather small, and it will elongate your wait time.

excerpts: The fried egg was perfectly cooked with a still runny yolk and the crispy potatoes were SO GOOD.
Usually, I think of potatoes as an extra filler and try to not get too full off of them
so I can finish the main part of my dish, but they were super crispy and tasty
so I couldn't help myself!
crispy potatoes.author: Miss H.
crispy potatoes.review:
I haven't been to a good brunch place in a while AND I haven't written a Yelp review in a while... but Plow was so good that they broke both streaks!

They close at 2, and we got there at 2:05... and there was still a line... luckily, the host & hostess felt bad that we had trekked so far to go there and there were "only" 4 tables ahead of us, so they put us down anyway. We ate "brunch" at 2:30 - better late than never :)

I had the fried egg sandwich and opted to add sausage instead of bacon (even though they only list that you can add on bacon) and my friend got The Plow (which is pretty much your basic breakfast combo plate). We were both very, VERY happy with our choices. The fried egg was perfectly cooked with a still runny yolk and the crispy potatoes were SO GOOD. Usually, I think of potatoes as an extra filler and try to not get too full off of them so I can finish the main part of my dish, but they were super crispy and tasty so I couldn't help myself! I tried some of the lemon ricotta pancakes that came on The Plow, and they were deeelish. I normally don't like ricotta, but it added a nice texture to the pancakes and the lemon flavor was just right.

Next time I'm in the city for brunch, this is where you'll find me!

excerpts: wait for the fried egg sandwich with super crispy potatoes.
The ricotta pancake is also amazing.
Complimentary coffee while you wait!
crispy potatoes.author: Jeff P.
crispy potatoes.review: Awesome food! Definitely worth the hour wait for the fried egg sandwich with super crispy potatoes. The ricotta pancake is also amazing. Complimentary coffee while you wait!

excerpts: My favorites are the lemon ricotta pancakes and the crispy potatoes (included if you order "The Plow" or you can just order the pancakes by themselves).
Seriously, they are incredible.
crispy potatoes.author: Ashley K.
crispy potatoes.review:
A must.

One of my go-to spots for breakfast in the city. There will be a wait (typically longer than an hour on weekends). The wait will be worth it. Casual ambiance perfect for brunch on weekends. My favorites are the lemon ricotta pancakes and the crispy potatoes (included if you order "The Plow" or you can just order the pancakes by themselves). Seriously, they are incredible. Service is always friendly and prompt.

I'll be back. Early!

excerpts: Both were equally delicious, with the crispy potatoes being a highlight of the meal.
crispy potatoes.author: Joann A.
crispy potatoes.review:
Husband and I hit up this place after reading the Conde Nast article on Plow, entitled "San Francisco's Best Brunch. It's Worth the Two Hour Wait." I think the title is a bit generous, I mean its a very good brunch and maybe worth a 15 to 30 minute wait, but 2 hours? Folks, this is not manna falling from the sky. 

We arrived exactly at 8:00 am on a Saturday, because any later you will be stuck in a line for at least 45 minutes. Service was great, providing fresh coffee and water as soon as we sat down. My husband got the steak and eggs and I ordered the Plow. Both were equally delicious, with the crispy potatoes being a highlight of the meal. The lemon ricotta pancakes were fluffy and not too sweet and balanced well with my hickory smoked bacon and eggs. All in all, our meal here was good, not the BEST, but I would definitely come here again, at 8:00am. 

Plow is like the Ariana Grande of SF brunches. People says she sounds like Mariah Carey, but when you hear her, she's good, but she ain't no Mariah Carey.

excerpts: I always get The Plow, which comes with eggs, your choice of meat, lemon ricotta pancakes, and crispy potatoes.
Though I'm not particularly a lemon or ricotta person, the lemon ricotta pancakes were SO GOOD!
I could eat them all day.
The pancakes are fluffy on the inside and delicately scented with lemon, mixed with the taste of ricotta.
I've also never had potatoes quite the same as I had at Plow, they were perfectly seasoned and just crispy enough.
I've tried the house sausage and the chicken-apple sausage here.
crispy potatoes.author: Joy C.
crispy potatoes.review:
This is my favorite brunch place in the city so far. The place is very cozy and small, resulting in a long wait, but it is worth it. The place has large windows and reminds me of a farmhouse, which definitely matches the food they serve there.

I always get The Plow, which comes with eggs, your choice of meat, lemon ricotta pancakes, and crispy potatoes. Though I'm not particularly a lemon or ricotta person, the lemon ricotta pancakes were SO GOOD! I could eat them all day. The pancakes are fluffy on the inside and delicately scented with lemon, mixed with the taste of ricotta. I've also never had potatoes quite the same as I had at Plow, they were perfectly seasoned and just crispy enough. I've tried the house sausage and the chicken-apple sausage here. Both were good, but definitely overshadowed by the pancakes and the potatoes.

Service here has always been friendly, but the staff are definitely busy. The food is simple yet heavenly. My only complaint is the wait, but it is definitely worth it.

excerpts:
I was craving something with tomato sauce and runny yolks, so this was perfect
- Crispy potatoes: amazingly crisp (possibly deep fried?) and very well seasoned, plus there's a hint of thyme, which makes them really stand out among all the home fries I've ever had

Food was really good, and it's nice that they can serve you alcohol while you wait,
crispy potatoes.author: Marilyn T.
crispy potatoes.review:
The line is always ridiculous, but at least they'll serve you alcohol while you wait.  We were initially quoted an hour, then it became 90 min when we checked back in, and I think ultimately it took about 2 hours to get a table even though we arrived around 10am.  We were able to put our name down and come back, but they won't call your phone, so you have to come back and check in. We actually missed being called, but they kept us at the top of the list. 

The champagne pours they gave us in paper cups while we waited were VERY generous, so that definitely helped the wait significantly.

We started with a sausage biscuit, which was a buttery flaky biscuit with melted cheese and a sausage patty. The sausage had really good flavor, and this really hit the spot because we were all starving.

- Fried egg sandwich: fried eggs with runny yolk, cheddar, Nueske bacon (in honor of National Bacon Day!), with a little bit of frisee so you feel less guilty about the other contents of the sandwich.  The bun was light, and it was a well balanced sandwich.
- Chicken tinga: fried corn tortillas topped with shredded chicken and two fried eggs, topped with a chipotle tomato sauce and avocado. I was craving something with tomato sauce and runny yolks, so this was perfect
- Crispy potatoes: amazingly crisp (possibly deep fried?) and very well seasoned, plus there's a hint of thyme, which makes them really stand out among all the home fries I've ever had

Food was really good, and it's nice that they can serve you alcohol while you wait, but I don't think I would wait 2 hours again.

excerpts: This time, your with the Dungeness crab scramble - asparagus, greens, scallions, cremini mushrooms, crispy potatoes and toast (which I subbed for fruit instead).
To say I was satisfied with my meal is an understatement.
Each bite was better than the next.
My only complaint is that there wasn't more to eat (but that's just being greedy, I know).
When you arrive, put your name on the list and then get ready to wait.
The place is small and the food is delicious which adds up to a long line, but one that's worth it.
Trust me.
Somehow I have become a regular here
and I live thousands of miles away.
Go figure!
lol!
crispy potatoes.author: Elsa M.
crispy potatoes.review:
Plow: You've done it again.  This time, your with the Dungeness crab scramble - asparagus, greens, scallions, cremini mushrooms, crispy potatoes and toast (which I subbed for fruit instead).  To say I was satisfied with my meal is an understatement.  Each bite was better than the next.  My only complaint is that there wasn't more to eat (but that's just being greedy, I know).
When you arrive, put your name on the list and then get ready to wait. The place is small and the food is delicious which adds up to a long line, but one that's worth it. Trust me.  Somehow I have become a regular here and I live thousands of miles away.  Go figure! lol!

excerpts: The crispy potatoes are SO crispy and have crunchy carmalized onions mixed in with them...
sooo good!
I'm not even a huge fan of potatoes
and I eat some.
crispy potatoes.author: Alexandra C.
crispy potatoes.review:
My favorite breakfast in san francisco!
Fried egg sandwich YUM add avocado YUM

My boyfriend is in love with the lemon ricotta pancakes, they taste like cake. I think they smell better than they taste but i'm not a huge fan of dough.

The wait here can be SO ridiculous, I try to come on weekdays around 10 when less people are usually in line. Even though Plow on the weekend is like a total dream come true. 

The crispy potatoes are SO crispy and have crunchy carmalized onions mixed in with them...sooo good! I'm not even a huge fan of potatoes and I eat some.

excerpts: The crispy potatoes that came as a side of that dish were pretty good though, albeit a bit too salty for my tastes.
crispy potatoes.author: Johnny W.
crispy potatoes.review:
A bit of clarification first - Plow is indeed not wheelchair accessible, as there are a few steps up into the restaurant. However! They have outdoor seating on nice days, and that IS accessible, albeit requiring that one deal with the slight incline of the hill on which Plow sits.

Showing up around 9am last Saturday, my friend and I were eventually seated after a ~45 minute wait. Part of this was due to having to wait for an outdoor seat though - had that not been necessary, our wait would have been about 15 minutes shorter. After perusing a fairly succinct menu, we ended up ordering the Plow, Dungeness crab scramble [ http://flic.kr/p/c2HfrY ], and an order of French toast to go.

The crab scramble wasn't bad, and most enjoyable when the scramble was eaten along with the accompanying toast. I was slightly turned off by how fishy the dish was though - while it WAS seafood, the taste was far stronger than one would expect of fresh seafood. The crispy potatoes that came as a side of that dish were pretty good though, albeit a bit too salty for my tastes. And while the French toast was just okay, the lemon ricotta pancakes that came with the Plow were easily the best part of the meal - light on both the lemon and ricotta, they reminded me somewhat of fluffy lemon cream cookies.

After all is said and done, with tax and tip, expect the meal to come out to about $20 a person for a single entree. Service is friendly, and while I suppose the local ingredient sourcing is a nice touch, it's never been a make or break factor for me. While I can see myself coming again solely for the pancakes, I doubt it'll be particularly often, or during their busier hours.

excerpts: It has a little bit of everything and the crispy potatoes are SOooOOoo good.
crispy potatoes.author: Felix C.
crispy potatoes.review:
If you don't like the long wait that everyone speaks of, all I can suggest is to live close by.  My fiancée and I moved to SF from Atlanta, and picked Potrero Hill as our first neighborhood.

Little did we know that we were only 1 block away from Plow.  When we want brunch from Plow on the weekends we put our names down and head home for a bit to do whatever.

I typically have just ordered the "the plow".  It has a little bit of everything and the crispy potatoes are SOooOOoo good.

excerpts: And possibly what's even more perplexing to me is that my favorite thing at Plow was the side crispy potatoes that come with every order.
Chunky, twice-fried nuggets of potatoes that are impossibly crispy on the outside and creamy inside.
crispy potatoes.author: Monelle A.
crispy potatoes.review:
Four times. 

The number of times I ATTEMPTED to go here before I finally scored a table for brunch. Brunching at Plow is straight out of an episode from Portlandia. It's crazy and worth it, I dare say! 

I finally scored a table here by arriving right when it opened on a Saturday morning and willingly sitting outside with my dogs. At this point, I was willing to do anything just to try this place. Luckily, the food lived up to the hype. 

What strikes me about this place is how SIMPLE the food is. Some people might say that the food is too simple, and unimpressive. But I'm a believer that most often, simple food is harder to make than complicated food because you have to really do justice to the ingredients to make the dishes shine.

And that's what they do best at Plow, simple food, but prepared with extraordinary care and attention to detail. We tried: 

-Cinnamon Brioche: deceivingly simple, but outrageously good. Reminded me of a Kouign Amann from B Patisserie
-The Plow: the house made pork sausage was really really good
-Fried Egg Sandwich w/ Bacon: hits all the notes - savory egg yolk, doughy bread, salty bacon, creamy aioli 
-Lemon Ricotta Pancake: good, but I've had better (Aquarius Cafe in Emeryville. R.I.P.)

And those were my favorites, in that order. 

And possibly what's even more perplexing to me is that my favorite thing at Plow was the side crispy potatoes that come with every order. Chunky, twice-fried nuggets of potatoes that are impossibly crispy on the outside and creamy inside. The crispy side potatoes are worth a detour by themselves!  

If you can stomach the wait or manage to get there early, Plow is worth the trip!

excerpts: We sat at the bar and got the plow-crispy potatoes, eggs, bacon, and lemon pancakes.
Super yummy.
The pancakes were fluffy, the potatoes are fried and seasoned well.
They gave me 4 pieces of bacon and it has a smoky flavor to it.
Most places give you only 2 pieces.
crispy potatoes.author: Karen H.
crispy potatoes.review:
Plow opens at 8am and I got there at 8:15am. It was one hour wait and it was worth the wait. 

We sat at the bar and got the plow-crispy potatoes, eggs, bacon, and lemon pancakes. Super yummy. The pancakes were fluffy, the potatoes are fried and seasoned well. They gave me 4 pieces of bacon and it has a smoky flavor to it. Most places give you only 2 pieces. The eggs were a decent amount too.

Staff is friendly and I will be back! This place makes my heart warm and fuzzy. :)

excerpts: My favorite part of the meal  were the crispy potatoes which were perfectly seasoned.
I was underwhelmed by the pancakes :
I liked the lemon flavor, but it tasted a bit bland
so I had to drown it in syrup.
The texture was too gooey.
crispy potatoes.author: Michelle K.
crispy potatoes.review:
FINALLY went to Plow on a Sunday for brunch. Arrived around 10am and was told the wait will be 2-2.5hrs. Yikes. 

My friends and I walked over to Front Coffee to kill time and came back to Plow after about an hour. We waited another half an hour and were seated. 

The three of us ordered the "Plow" with house made pork sausages, an extra order of pork sausages, and a full order of lemon ricotta pancakes. My favorite part of the meal  were the crispy potatoes which were perfectly seasoned. I was underwhelmed by the pancakes :-\ I liked the lemon flavor, but it tasted a bit bland so I had to drown it in syrup. The texture was too gooey. The soft scrambled eggs were unmemorable and needed a lot of salt. The homemade pork sausages were good -- they had a bit of heat, which I appreciated. The cold brewed coffee was yummy. 

I probably won't be back any time soon given the underwhelming food and the unreasonable wait time.

excerpts: My husband got The Plow, which is a combo of lemon ricotta pancakes, bacon or sausage, eggs, and crispy potatoes.
This is a good dish to order if you are new to Plow and want to sample different items.
I like the lemon ricotta pancakes and crispy potatoes a lot.
I like the lemon ricotta pancakes and crispy potatoes a lot.
crispy potatoes.author: Ally W.
crispy potatoes.review:
Plow is a great place for breakfast...as evidenced by the long line of people waiting outside even at ridiculous times like 8 AM on a Saturday morning.  What a bunch of crazies -- Saturdays are for sleeping in.

I got their French Toast - 3 thick and fluffy eggy bread slices with strawberry and lavender jam, mascarpone, and maple syrup. I have more of a savory tooth for brunch, but enjoyed this sweet dish a lot.

My husband got The Plow, which is a combo of lemon ricotta pancakes, bacon or sausage, eggs, and crispy potatoes. This is a good dish to order if you are new to Plow and want to sample different items.  However, his eggs were undercooked (to the point that the egg whites were slightly runny) and his chicken apple sausage was dry (it was seasoned well though).

I like the lemon ricotta pancakes and crispy potatoes a lot.  I may even want to make them at home, you know, at like 11 AM on a Saturday morning.

1 star off: I do not like dried sausage in my mouth. Get your mind out of the gutter. Read my review above.

excerpts: Comes with 2 eggs (however you like), a pile of the best crispy potatoes ever, 2 strips of bacon (or you can order some sort of sausage) and 2 small lemon ricotta pancakes, which were to die for.
Honestly this breakfast is the type of breakfast that ruins future breakfasts to come.
Also ordered one of their homemade biscuits on the side, cause they look so scrumptious.
Uhhh, it was divine.
Came with some sweet whipped butter.

Added a mimosa to all this. 
Jealous?
crispy potatoes.author: Sarah U.
crispy potatoes.review:
Came on a Wednesday morning, arrived somewhere around 930am. No wait, although it was packed. Think the people out front waiting were waiting for outdoor seating, but since it was a heat wave in sf I was more than happy to sit inside. 
Ordered the plow with eggs over medium. Comes with 2 eggs (however you like), a pile of the best crispy potatoes ever, 2 strips of bacon (or you can order some sort of sausage) and 2 small lemon ricotta pancakes, which were to die for. Honestly this breakfast is the type of breakfast that ruins future breakfasts to come. 
Also ordered one of their homemade biscuits on the side, cause they look so scrumptious. Uhhh, it was divine. Came with some sweet whipped butter. 
Added a mimosa to all this. 
Jealous?

excerpts: Perfectly cooked over easy egg and crispy potatoes.
I got the chicken apple sausages which were meh, were they packaged or something?
Because there are "homemade pork sausages", that I wish I tried instead but will next time.
Overall, sweet spot I would definitely come again.
crispy potatoes.author: Jefferson Y.
crispy potatoes.review:
GODDAMN THIS PLACE IS EXPENSIVE.

Its expected though, and they serve Equator coffee which is my favorite brand. So def a plus! They have outside seating which is also a plus. Oh and they have some sitting area outside for you to sit at while you wait too. Service was very good.

I got "The Plow". LEMON RICCOTTA PANCAKES= BOMB. Perfectly cooked over easy egg and crispy potatoes. I got the chicken apple sausages which were meh, were they packaged or something? Because there are "homemade pork sausages", that I wish I tried instead but will next time. Overall, sweet spot I would definitely come again.

excerpts: I would recommend the crispy potatoes with whatever you get.
Great little breakfast stop.
crispy potatoes.author: Christos C.
crispy potatoes.review:
Great place for brunch. The line is insane on weekends but still a cool vibe hanging out on line even! If you can, go during the week. I personally don't like waiting on lines. Especially when I am hungry. 

Everything here is really good. I would recommend the crispy potatoes with whatever you get. Great little breakfast stop.

excerpts: For breakfast: 1 lemon ricotta pancake, 1 almond pancake, side of crispy potatoes.
The friggin best rosemary crispy potatoes i have ever had for breakfast.
I gave some co-workers a sample, and they all quickly agreed.
crispy potatoes.author: Abigail W.
crispy potatoes.review:
For breakfast: 1 lemon ricotta pancake, 1 almond pancake, side of crispy potatoes.

The friggin best rosemary crispy potatoes i have ever had for breakfast. I gave some co-workers a sample, and they all quickly agreed. Great crunch, full flavor packed.

Pancakes, absolutely loved. There was some powder sugar dusted on top, no syrup (i had it to go, and didn't notice til i got to work) but they were scrumptious. I might have liked the ricotta one just slightly above the almond, but both were some of the best pancakes I've ever had. 

Only downfall, the price. I think i paid around $15 for everything..which wasn't a whole lot, but i will certainly be back

excerpts: I loved the crispy potatoes but they were not ideal for sopping up eggs.
The ricotta pancakes were great.
The pork sausage was good but putting these items together on a plate didn't do it for me.
crispy potatoes.author: Bill W.
crispy potatoes.review:
I read the Yelp Reviews. I'm a breakfast aficionado. I was intrigued.

About Timing: I read about long lines so I arrived at 8am on Sunday and about a dozen people waiting so I sat right down when they opened. By 8:30 it was almost full but still no wait.

I love going out for breakfast but I can prepare a better breakfast at home than I find in most restaurants. This is my breakfast dilemma. So when I read the reviews, I hoped that the food and great space would make it all worth while.

The space is impressive, clean, well-run and organized.

i ordered "the Plow". Each part of it was good but as a combination, i wasn't impressed. Runny, fried eggs without bread? I loved the crispy potatoes but they were not ideal for sopping up eggs. The ricotta pancakes were great. The pork sausage was good but putting these items together on a plate didn't do it for me. i never eat pancakes but the lemon ricotta pancakes were great but with pork sausage and fried eggs? The price was $20 before the tip.

Over-all: Plow experience is more like a rushed lunch at a hot new restaurant than the perfect breakfast in which one puts ones thoughts together for the day. Apparently from the reviews, Plow is popular and people were strategizing what to get before it opened at 8am on a Sunday. 

Personally, I prefer a leisurely breakfast where i take my time; enjoy browsing the paper in sunny comfort, breaking into caffeine induced philosophical discussions now and then. 

I recommend trying Plow but for my taste, as a breakfast experience, it may be a victim of it's own success.

excerpts: The side of crispy potatoes with onions was the best thing on the plate.
crispy potatoes.author: Erika C.
crispy potatoes.review:
Three of us came here at 1pm on Sunday and it took an hour to get seated. It was another 30 minutes for food. We ate in 20 minutes,  got the bill and left in 25. The most relaxing part of this brunch was waiting at Farley's, a nearby coffee shop. 

After 40 minutes at the coffee shop, the table still wasn't ready. They gave us free apple fritters while we waited. I think this is their beignet but they called it "apple fritter" when they gave it to us. Freebies are a generous move and it was much appreciated.  

They told us a table would be another 20 minutes but the counter was available.  We waited 20 minutes anyway for our food.

I was grumpy from hunger and impatience by the time my eggs benedict came.  My poached eggs had several pieces eggshells in them.  I bit down and felt a disgusting crunch.  Aww hell naw hell naw.  Further insult - the hollandaise was no longer emulsified.  The sauce had curdled.  Gross.  Lastly, it was not good in flavor... they added too much lemon.  Thumbs down for this dish; the other components were just so so.  The side of crispy potatoes with onions was the best thing on the plate.

My lemon ricotta pancake never came so they just canceled it and I GTFO'd.

The wait is definitely not worth it.  Not even if it was good.  Which it wasn't.

- - - - -

Comments unrelated to food:

Sitting at the counter gave us a full view of the cooking.  One line cook who was in charge of eggs had a permanent close-to-tears look on his face.  My friend asked if I thought they liked cooking, since he was literally pumping out eggs (fried! poached! scrambled!) dish after dish.  This guy was a one-man sweatshop for eggs.  He and the other line cook (who was in charge of meats and pancakes) very much earned their salary.  

There was a woman in the kitchen who was in charge of potatoes and plating, and she would snack on every other dish she was preparing.  She was super chill and seemed to be just standing around every five minutes while the other two line cooks toiled away.  She also only wore an apron instead of a chef's jacket.  This led me to believe she was BOSS.

I think it was just my hunger talking but I started to resent every dish she plated that wasn't my food.  She kept snacking everything she plated/prepared.  Where was my damn snack?  (Ok, definitely hunger talking since they gave me my damn snack in the form of a free apple fritter.)

excerpts: Their crispy potatoes are addicting!
So flavourful... savory, and naturally sweet.
They are super crispy...
The Plow consisted of two eggs (over easy), house made sausage patties, crispy potatoes and two lemon ricotta pancakes.
The patty was good, and the pancake was delish!
crispy potatoes.author: Leslie P.
crispy potatoes.review:
Their crispy potatoes are addicting! So flavourful... savory, and naturally sweet. They are super crispy... I love them!

My sister and I shared the The Plow and the French toast with red wine poached pears. The French toast was okay. It was nothing special, and was actually lacking a little oomph. The Plow consisted of two eggs (over easy), house made sausage patties, crispy potatoes and two lemon ricotta pancakes. The patty was good, and the pancake was delish!

excerpts: And those crispy potatoes are great.
crispy potatoes.author: Brandon K.
crispy potatoes.review:
This place is two blocks from my house and I've been meaning to go for some time but the line is forever. Like, over an hour and I really don't believe any place is worth that, even if it's excellent, especially when there are so many other good choices in the city. Not their fault though: there isn't a lot of seating inside the tiny space and they use it the best they can.

If you can come back on an off-hour (I went at 12pm on a Wednesday and got the last two seats at the counter), it's very good.

Most reviews talk about the Lemon Ricotta pancakes (which I had) and the Breakfast Sandwich (which my boo ordered) and it's mainly because there isn't much else on the menu. Unless you like to order granola or porridge or yogurt for breakfast, which has never made sense to me as a restaurant patron, there's some combination of pancakes and eggs.

The good news is that they're both excellent! And those crispy potatoes are great.

I'm giving them the fifth star for two reasons:

1) They have Nueske's Bacon, which is probably my favorite stuff on the market.

2) They have a hot sauce brand I've never heard of and is made in the same zip code. I'm always so annoyed when I ask for hot sauce at a place and I get either Tapatio or Cholula, as both are unappealing to me. It's a bit of a surprise that more places don't make their own hot sauce as it's not too difficult and it's a nice touch. And the stuff at Plow? Not too watery and a great kick. Much better than the over the counter crap.

excerpts: I had the "plow" with lemon ricotta pancakes, house-made pork sausage, 2 eggs over easy (which frankly were a little underdone, but note they still get 5 stars) and the AMAZING crispy potatoes.
crispy potatoes.author: Amy W.
crispy potatoes.review:
WARNING BOLD STATEMENT AHEAD:

This is the BEST brunch in San Francisco!  

I'll admit it, when it comes to mornings and me, we just don't get along.  Luckily I had returned from Massachusetts the night before AND the time changed in my direction, so I was actually awake and ready to go somewhere at 8am on a Sunday!  (according to most yelpers this place usually has a wait for brunch, and I'm an inpatient gal when it comes to gettin' my grub on)

I had the "plow" with lemon ricotta pancakes, house-made pork sausage, 2 eggs over easy (which frankly were a little underdone, but note they still get 5 stars) and the AMAZING crispy potatoes.  My bf had the breakfast sandwich.  

They were a little chintzy with the pure maple syrup, but my neighbors left their table and I stole what they had left so I had enough.

I have never had breakfast potatoes so perfect, super crispy, with caramelized onions and rosemary - and LOTS of 'em.

YUM and YUM.

excerpts: Crispy potatoes, eggs, lemon ricotta pancakes,  and house made sausage patties.
The crispy potatoes were the best home fries, cut potatoes I've had.
I'm definitely a fan.
The lemon ricotta pancakes were good, eggs were eggs, and the sausage was a tad dry.
crispy potatoes.author: Leona Z.
crispy potatoes.review:
Eating breakfast with a 5-star restaurant experience is all the rage now days and the Plow is one of the hot-spots. My basic take-away - the food is good, much better than average, the service is reminiscence of high dining, although I think I prefer my breakfast in a more low-key friendly vibe. 

My dish was The Plow. Crispy potatoes, eggs, lemon ricotta pancakes,  and house made sausage patties. The crispy potatoes were the best home fries, cut potatoes I've had. I'm definitely a fan. The lemon ricotta pancakes were good, eggs were eggs, and the sausage was a tad dry. For $17, I wasn't impressed except by the potatoes.... and $17 to be wowed by potatoes is disappointing.

My final word: Definitely not worth the hour plus long waits on the weekend, but without a wait, I'd try it again.

excerpts: The sandwich came with crispy potatoes and grilled onions - that was really good.
super crispy on the outside and the potato texture on the inside.
crispy potatoes.author: Kristina L.
crispy potatoes.review:
was looking for a brunch place and stumbled upon this one because apparently its so good that people eat out here in the RAIN. its quite adorable and a little crazy so i had to give it a try. Came late on a Friday afternoon around 1? was seated right away. I ordered the Fried Egg Sandwich and my bf ordered The Plow. The Fried Egg Sandwich wasn't bad - didn't realize there would be no meat in this meal but i do love aioli sauce! wished there were more. The sandwich came with crispy potatoes and grilled onions - that was really good. super crispy on the outside and the potato texture on the inside. The Plow came with your choice of meat - i believe they make it themselves? with crispy potato, 2 eggs your style, and the LEMON RICOTTA PANCAKES. Those were amazing. Crispy on the outside and fluffy on the inside. I believe there was cheese in there but i couldn't taste it. The lemon addition in the pancake was amazing. felt like i was eating a pastry! I dont usually like pancakes cause they're a little on the heavy side but these were so light. I will be getting an order of Lemon Ricotta Pancakes next time :)

beware - this meal comes with food coma -____- at least it did for us!

excerpts: The Plow: eggs, crispy potatoes, homemade pork sausage, and lemon ricotta pancakes.
Everything was exceptional.
The fennel in the sausage was a bit overwhelming, and I prefer links to patties.
But other than that, 5 stars!
crispy potatoes.author: Benjamin A.
crispy potatoes.review: Def worth the hype! I woke up at 7:30am on a Sunday and made my way to Plow with high hopes. We put our name down for a table of 4 at 8:30am, and we were seated just under an hour late. It was reassuring to know that others woke up even earlier than I did. I got The Plow: eggs, crispy potatoes, homemade pork sausage, and lemon ricotta pancakes. Everything was exceptional.The fennel in the sausage was a bit overwhelming, and I prefer links to patties. But other than that, 5 stars!

excerpts:
Came with crispy potatoes and eggs prepared your way - we chose scrambled.

Eggs poached perfectly with a deliciously flavorful hollandaise sauce and crispy potatoes with caramelized onions (same potatoes that accompanied the Pork Chops).
crispy potatoes.author: Cathy K.
crispy potatoes.review:
If I could design my dream neighborhood, Plow would be in it. I dig its modern, clean lines, natural wood furnishings, high ceiling, big windows, sunlight, and its local, organic, sustainable offerings Their amiable staff are like a well oiled machine - efficient and reliable. I was impressed by how quickly they turned the tables to greet its waiting patrons. 

We had:

- Corn Millet Muffin with sweet butter * - my sharp-eyed friend noticed that the asterisked items are 'until it's gone' ~  the law of supply & demand bumped them up as a priority to consider. The muffin had a nice texture, flavor and a dash of warmth. On the other hand, its butter sidekick was cold & hard, making it awkward to spread on the delicate muffin ~ if I had a lighter, I could've softened it a bit.

- Coffee Cake * - Although it didn't stand out, it was a good, sweet compliment to our meal. 

- Pork Chops (a bit too briny for my palate, but cooked to a nice doneness). Came with crispy potatoes and eggs prepared your way - we chose scrambled.

- Eggs Benedict with Spinach and Mushrooms - My favorite. Eggs poached perfectly with a deliciously flavorful hollandaise sauce and crispy potatoes with caramelized onions (same potatoes that accompanied the Pork Chops).

Our meal was delightful ~ I couldn't stop eating. I was tempted to call the local wheelbarrow company to cart me out.

excerpts: So while it was a delish egg and some tasty crispy potatoes (for which they are known), not sure I would repeat the madness here when you can make make reservations elsewhere.
crispy potatoes.author: Jenny M.
crispy potatoes.review:
Damnnnn... people in SF seriously love their brunch.  I mean sure NY-ers like their brunch too, but this town brings it to a whole new level.  Arrived at Plow at 11am and there was a 2 hour wait!  NOT A JOKE.  Ok, so since its not in the hustle and bustle part of the city and anywhere else worth it would have a similar wait, my friend and I decided to get a coffee, check out the neighb, and wait it out.

Yes, its good, but its brunch.  So while it was a delish egg and some tasty crispy potatoes (for which they are known), not sure I would repeat the madness here when you can make make reservations elsewhere.

excerpts: It was perfectly seasoned and cooked just right, and served with crispy potatoes and buttered bread.
Tried a bit of the lemon ricotta pancake from my friend's plate, and omg, it was amazing.
I plan to go back just for those pancakes.
crispy potatoes.author: Evelyn C.
crispy potatoes.review:
Delicious. Came here with a couple of friends and their baby; the staff was really accommodating and wrote down our party as 3.5 people. (Note: They don't take parties larger than 6 people due to limited space inside the restaurant.) 

I ordered the soft scramble with hen of the woods mushrooms. It was perfectly seasoned and cooked just right, and served with crispy potatoes and buttered bread. Tried a bit of the lemon ricotta pancake from my friend's plate, and omg, it was amazing. I plan to go back just for those pancakes. Tried a bit of the dungeness crab scramble from my other friend's plate, also very good, but a bit too briny-tasting for me. 

Service was fine. Only downside was the wait. We got there around 10 AM and wound up waiting an hour for a table. But I will say it was worth the wait.

excerpts: The best thing about the menu though were the crispy potatoes!
They were definitely cooked to a crisp!
My mouth is watering just a little thinking about them haha.
I ordered the fresh crab scramble - delish!
Not too heavy and mind if I reiterate how yummers the crispy potatoes were?
I think I might've licked my plate clean ...
crispy potatoes.author: Christina C.
crispy potatoes.review:
Expect at least an 1.5 hour wait! But never fear, there's a cute coffee shop just up the street where you can get coffee (or in my case an almond chai tea latte :-)). They have plenty of seating inside and a nice outdoor veranda. But enough about this coffee shop, on to Plow!

It didn't feel like we had to wait that long (but partly because we grabbed caffeine after we put our names down and before we sat down) - it was maybe a half hour wait? But the waitress/hostess was kind enough to say that we could enjoy sidewalk mimosas if we wanted to - so a definite plus!

The best thing about the menu though were the crispy potatoes! They were definitely cooked to a crisp! My mouth is watering just a little thinking about them haha. I ordered the fresh crab scramble - delish! Not too heavy and mind if I reiterate how yummers the crispy potatoes were? I think I might've licked my plate clean ...

excerpts: It comes with a side of crispy potatoes which are AWESOME.
crispy potatoes.author: Diana Y.
crispy potatoes.review:
All brunch places have the same thing in common: It's always a 1-1.5 hour wait and they all essentially taste the same. This was no different. Buuuuuuuuuuuut, if you're gonna do brunch in SF, this is still a good choice over some of the others. Really nice setup they got going on, the staff is super friendly, and the food is pretty satisfying (even after a 1 hr wait). 

Their lemon ricotta pancake? It lived up to the hype. Super fluffy and tasty and I don't even like pancakes but I'd order this. 
Soft scramble is pretty good & hearty but it's pretty standard with what you get at brunch places. It comes with a side of crispy potatoes which are AWESOME. That's not something you get at every brunch place. 

Solid brunch spot. If you have good company to wait with, then it's worth checking out. Plus it's got a sweet view of downtown SF you can enjoy while you're waiting outside with the crowds of people

excerpts:
It was a sampler of everything like 2 eggs, 2 lemon ricotta pancakes (ok), crispy potatoes (WOW), and homemade pork sausage (yum)
+ Almond pancakes (gluten-free) were fantastic with the maple syrup.
Fluffy and not a heavy sponge of carbs!

We preferred these pancakes over the much-hyped lemon ricotta
 + Coffee was great.

Strong and tasty
+
Staff was very pleasant and helpful.
Wait is torture
but at least there were wooden benches built by the wall
and there are shops less than a block away to kill some time
+ Our pooches are able to join us for brunch!
crispy potatoes.author: Yiven C.
crispy potatoes.review:
Wow. What a brunch!

The +:
+ Ordered The Plow and the amount of food for $15 mowed me down. It was hefty and worth every bite. It was a sampler of everything like 2 eggs, 2 lemon ricotta pancakes (ok), crispy potatoes (WOW), and homemade pork sausage (yum)
+ Almond pancakes (gluten-free) were fantastic with the maple syrup. Fluffy and not a heavy sponge of carbs! We preferred these pancakes over the much-hyped lemon ricotta
 + Coffee was great. Strong and tasty
+ Staff was very pleasant and helpful. 
+ Wait is torture but at least there were wooden benches built by the wall and there are shops less than a block away to kill some time
+ Our pooches are able to join us for brunch! Outdoor seating of course.


The -:
- The Wait. For table of 2 on a Sunday at 1:30pm was at least 30 minutes. Sheesh
- Patio seating is on a Potrero Hill. So if you don't mind sitting in the shade on a tilt then you'll be fine.

Order The Plow if you want something hefty and show early to get your name on the list. Then build in time to take a short stroll before heading back to wait fo your name to be called.

excerpts: And the The Plow, which consisted of a little bit of everything popular...house made pork sausage, lemon ricotta pancakes and crispy potatoes.
I felt like the pork sausage tasted like some type of Vietnamese pork type food.
The lemon ricotta pancakes were also amazing.
crispy potatoes.author: Audrey N.
crispy potatoes.review:
I FINALLY got to try this place. I was afraid it would be a third time's a charm type mishap, but the brunch gods were in my favor. The wait was only 20 minutes my second time. =) Naturally, we waited on the cute benches attached to the side of the building. 

I wish I was living in the houses around the corner because I would be a regular! We had the French Toast... which was amazing. Literally I wanted MORE! And the The Plow, which consisted of a little bit of everything popular...house made pork sausage, lemon ricotta pancakes and crispy potatoes. I felt like the pork sausage tasted like some type of Vietnamese pork type food. The lemon ricotta pancakes were also amazing. I just wish I ordered poached eggs rather than over easy. 

I would definitely recommend this place. But don't let the hype ruin it...as many other reviewers, including myself will probably do.

excerpts: Ordered the Plow (crispy potatoes, eggs, lemon ricotta pancakes), pumpkin pancakes, and the breakfast sandwich.
I would definitely order all 3 again.
Delicious!
crispy potatoes.author: K. D.
crispy potatoes.review:
Delicious brunch here - with only a 10 minute wait for a party of 6 on a weekday! 

Ordered the Plow (crispy potatoes, eggs, lemon ricotta pancakes), pumpkin pancakes, and the breakfast sandwich. I would definitely order all 3 again. Delicious!

excerpts: two pancakes + crispy potatoes

14

DK had: max's biscuits + gravy  two buttermilk biscuits, pork sausage gravy, crispy potatoes
crispy potatoes.author: Ming-Jou C.
crispy potatoes.review:
If you want to sit next to a bitch for a really good brunch, Plow is the place for you. Well, it was for me on a nice, cool Sunday mid-morning. The lack of star perfection wasn't due to her, it was the 1-hour wait for a table, but hey, you learn to expect that at places in SF that don't take reservations. They don't take parties greater than 6. 

Situated on a corner in Potrero Hill, Plow is small inside with just as many seats outside. The reason for the bitch, is that they have 2-person tables lined up along the wall of the restaurant and well, I had to get in to the inner table for my seat. I asked her nicely if she could move her chair in, well, she moved her butt, not moving the chair and barely at that. So basically I just shoved past her. Good thing I was sitting next to her and didn't have to stare at her sour-puss face the entire meal like DK did sitting across from her. Anyway, she made for good conversation.

Onto the food...once we were seated, our waitress took a while to bring us our waters and by then we were ready to order. You really can't go wrong with a breakfast place that has a pig sign under the name of their restaurant. Mmmm.....oink.

I had: the plow  two eggs, choice of Nueske bacon, house made pork sausage, or chicken apple sausage, two pancakes + crispy potatoes  14

DK had: max's biscuits + gravy  two buttermilk biscuits, pork sausage gravy, crispy potatoes  11

It came out fairly quickly and it was GOOD. The bacon was plentiful and was cooked just right, the pancakes had this lemony hint to them and were on the smaller size, but that's because they're not your average pancakes. They were really good though, but kind of had a french toast consistency and about the size of English muffins. The potatoes had some sort of Saffron or something on them, because they were as yellow as my egg yolks, but boy, were they good. I normally leave potatoes untouched on my plate (except for the hash brown kind), but these were awesome and just the right amount of crispy.

DK's biscuits and gravy were really good and the gravy was coma-inducing. 

I really enjoyed my breakfast, sans bitch. There's a multitude of breakfast places in SF, and many are good one-morning stands, but this one I would go on a second date with.

excerpts: I got mine with two eggs sunny side up, Nueske bacon, and the standard crispy potatoes and lemon ricotta pancakes.
Nueske bacon is bacon in some of its awesomest form.
The crispy potatoes had a hint of rosemary for an added dimension of flavor.
The lemon ricotta pancakes featured a light lemon flavor and were a little dense yet still fluffy and really delicious (I really liked these pancakes).
crispy potatoes.author: Erich D.
crispy potatoes.review: When at Plow get the plow!  It's a seriously good breakfast/brunch entree that won't have you feeling overly stuffed or gross afterwards; perfect mix of savory and sweet items on your plate and just the right amount.  I got mine with two eggs sunny side up, Nueske bacon, and the standard crispy potatoes and lemon ricotta pancakes.  Nueske bacon is bacon in some of its awesomest form.  The crispy potatoes had a hint of rosemary for an added dimension of flavor.  The lemon ricotta pancakes featured a light lemon flavor and were a little dense yet still fluffy and really delicious (I really liked these pancakes).

excerpts: Don't get me wrong - the crispy potatoes were really good, as were the lemon ricotta pancakes (I got the Plow breakfast), but the sausage mixed with syrup mixed with egg mixed with potatoes?
Yeah.
I'm a fan.
Minus one star for inaccurate time keeping.
Cuz I'm a jerk like that.
crispy potatoes.author: Maria P.
crispy potatoes.review:
Came here last Sunday for brunch. Arrived around 11:30, put our name down, was told it would be an hour. Thankfully there are shops around so we got busy for about 30 minutes. And because we were dying of hunger, we went back to check on the wait. Reported time? Another hour! So yeah, that was heart/gut wrenching. 

But when our time finally came, there was much rejoicing. The service was quick. And their homemade sausage blew my mind. Don't get me wrong - the crispy potatoes were really good, as were the lemon ricotta pancakes (I got the Plow breakfast), but the sausage mixed with syrup mixed with egg mixed with potatoes? Yeah. I'm a fan. Minus one star for inaccurate time keeping. Cuz I'm a jerk like that.

excerpts: Regardless, food there was mediocre, the crispy potatoes were good though.

fried egg sandwich, was nothing out of the ordinary (very average)
and the lemon rocotta pancakes wasn't THAT great.
I got sick of it after 3 bites.
crispy potatoes.author: Angela W.
crispy potatoes.review:
Wait for two wasn't too bad.
It was really cold outside to wait so the server asked if we wanted some coffee when we put our names down. We thought it was free and were talking about how nice they were for offering something hot for people waiting out in the cold. I barely like drinking coffee but i got it because it was hot and thought it was free but it later showed up on our bill (I literally took 2 sips and was charged without knowing. o well).

Regardless, food there was mediocre, the crispy potatoes were good though.
fried egg sandwich, was nothing out of the ordinary (very average)
and the lemon rocotta pancakes wasn't THAT great. I got sick of it after 3 bites.

excerpts: The crispy potatoes, chicken apple sausage, and the lemon ricotta pancakes were oh so yummy!
Definitely would recommend this as I am always torn when I go to brunch
- do I want sweet or savory?
crispy potatoes.author: Christine W.
crispy potatoes.review:
Came here on a Sunday around 10am and had to wait over an hour for a table for 5pm. Come here early or be prepared to wait. My friend said that there is a nice coffee shop up the block called farleys which is good to grab a cup of coffee and chat while we wait. We didn't get coffee this time but looks like most ppl do do this. 

We were seated outside which was fine but it does get chilly out there so bring a jacket. My friend mentioned they supply you blankets is you ask but none of us asked for one. We all just pounded cups of hot coffee to stay warm! 

The most popular item and best entree to get here if it is your first time is to get the plow. Has a little bit of everything! The crispy potatoes, chicken apple sausage, and the lemon ricotta pancakes were oh so yummy! Definitely would recommend this as I am always torn when I go to brunch - do I want sweet or savory? The plow gives you both and you will leave satisfied. 

Overall this is a great brunch spot with flavorful and tasty brunch options. Next time I want to try their Dungeness crab scramble sounds soo yum!
