excerpts: Knowing either of us couldn't finish The Plow, we went for the lemon ricotta pancakes and a half portion of the french toast with a side of crispy potatoes.
They do everything so well that you really can't go wrong with any of their options!
Cheers!
crispy potatoes.author: David O.
crispy potatoes.review:
Plow is seriously delicious. If you're a brunch person and you haven't been here, you're missing out. The lady and I had been hearing about this place for a while and we finally made it out. It was our lucky day because we were told that the wait would be about an hour and a half and we may possibly not get a table before closing. A lot of people gave up and it bumped down our wait time to about 20 minutes on a Saturday.

We sat at the bar where four men were working furiously behind the counter churning out pancakes, benedicts and the like in a very efficient system. Knowing either of us couldn't finish The Plow, we went for the lemon ricotta pancakes and a half portion of the french toast with a side of crispy potatoes. They do everything so well that you really can't go wrong with any of their options! Cheers!

excerpts: The "soft scrambled eggs - asparagus, stinging nettles, oyster mushrooms, goat cheese, crispy potatoes + toast", sounds fancy but is pretty average fare.
The potatoes were tasty,
the scrambled eggs also ok.
crispy potatoes.author: Mar L.
crispy potatoes.review:
Pretty underwhelmed, particularly based on the glowing reviews I've read. 

Wait was quoted on a Friday for an hour, which was pretty much right on.

Were seated next to other people. I don't mind, but I think servers should always ask the party if that's ok first.

The entrance door was open and sitting next to the door was frigid cold. I asked if the door could be closed, but after 5 minutes the staff were too lazy to close it again.

The general decor is ok. Nice, basic, but pleasant.

The service is basic, a bit short staffed. I saw the waitress roll her eyes while walking away from a request of another table, which I don't particularly like to see.

I had the gluten free almond pancakes $13. Honestly again, BASIC. Slightly burnt on one side. Taste is below average, grainy, very little taste. It's literally just three small pancakes on a barren plate with a *speck* of butter. Kinda sad. It could use some fruit, or bananas, walnuts, berries, anything to make it more presentable. I've had pretty gnarly gluten free pancakes before (friggin Swingers in LA, for example), and for $13 this leaves a bit to be desired. 

The "soft scrambled eggs - asparagus, stinging nettles, oyster mushrooms, goat cheese, crispy potatoes + toast", sounds fancy but is pretty average fare. The potatoes were tasty, the scrambled eggs also ok. I would eat it again, but not particularly worth $15.

Just upon leaving, I was asked to leave the table because other people were waiting, and the waitress mumbled something about promising people a table for too long. I was offered a "glass of water" for my gesture.

Decent place, BUT:

NOT worth the wait.
NOT worth the price.

excerpts: the crispy potatoes were to die for.
I'm so glad it came with 3 out of 4 of our meals.
We ordered 2 plows (1 with house made pork sausages and 1 with the chicken apple sausages).
I highly recommend the pork sausages over the chicken sausages.
crispy potatoes.author: Vi L.
crispy potatoes.review:
I'd give this place 4 stars, but I'm taking one out for the 2.5 hours wait for brunch. I came here after a hike and my last meal was at 7am, so that might have been a reason why I was STARVING by the time we got seated. It helped a lot that they kept reassuring us that we weren't forgotten and apologized for the wait so I give them 5 stars for customer service.

Brunch was good. OMG...the crispy potatoes were to die for. I'm so glad it came with 3 out of 4 of our meals. We ordered 2 plows (1 with house made pork sausages and 1 with the chicken apple sausages). I highly recommend the pork sausages over the chicken sausages. It also came with their signature lemon ricotta pancakes which was fluffy and unique. I highly recommend getting the plow if you want sample a couple of the things off their menu. We also got an order of french toast and the fried egg sandwiches. The french toast was okay. It was thick and crispy. We added avocados to our fried egg sandwich which made it pretty tasty. 

Overall, the food and service is great. I just don't think it's worth a 2 hour wait when there are so many other brunch places in the city. I'd come back here again, but only if the wait is no longer than an hour.

excerpts: The crispy potatoes were out of this world.
crispy potatoes.author: Sonia M.
crispy potatoes.review:
Finding a place like Plow makes me love this city still more... sorry New York.. (But for shopping, I'd still hop on a plane and hit SOHO.)  Everything was absolutely delicious, with lovely ambiance and kind service.  

The only downside was the wait.  For me waiting more than 20 minutes for anything is torturous.  Over an hour wait on a Saturday morning forced my starving girlfriend and me to go over to Farley's and split a scone to ease our bitchy attitude caused by our hunger.  Four of us tried lemon ricotta pancakes, homemade pork sausage, fried egg sandwich, soft-shell crab sandwich, and doughnuts.  Eating their pork sausage makes it worth it that I'm not a vegetarian anymore. The crispy potatoes were out of this world.  

Now, If you still have room for desert, hit Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous for little scoops of heaven.

excerpts: Two eggs, Grafton cheddar, frisee, aioli and crispy potatoes.
Add dashes of hot sauce and a dollop of ketchup.
crispy potatoes.author: Jenny L.
crispy potatoes.review:
02.12.11

Brunch at Plow was an amazing start to a remarkable Saturday.  I had a friend visit from LA, who is supposedly hard to impress with food.  Thank goodness Plow came through.

The wait was about 15-20 minutes.  We lost track because of the gorgeous clear blue skies and unseasonably warm weather.  Got seated at the counter, and my coffee came right away.

I ordered the fried egg sandwich (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/A0AziPST4T6k-V3neWFRNA?select=uZldEhL0UQTJFUmoQKN7Kg).  Two eggs, Grafton cheddar, frisee, aioli and crispy potatoes.  Add dashes of hot sauce and a dollop of ketchup.  I'm in love.

If I lived closer, this would definitely make it into the rotation more.  But, parking was a cinch, so that's a huge plus.

Total damage for two: around $30.

excerpts: The crispy potatoes really are the most delicious things you could ever put into your mouth at breakfast.
crispy potatoes.author: Larf P.
crispy potatoes.review:
My favorite brunch place. 

This is how I make the whole experience pleasurable:

I ride my scooter over, put my name on the list, ride back home, tell my boyfriend to get up because our names are on the list, then we go have a leisurely cup of coffee at Farleys before coming back to wait the last 10 minutes in front, or across the street in the sun. 

This is how it's done, all you waiter-haters! It's all about strategy.

I almost always order the plow with lemon ricotta pancakes and their homemade sausage patties. The crispy potatoes really are the most delicious things you could ever put into your mouth at breakfast.

Don't order the French toast here. They use French bread for some reason--it's way too thick with a stiff crust. 

Monkey bread, if they haven't run out yet, should be ordered immediately.

excerpts: The Plow-- two eggs, choice of Nueske bacon, house made pork sausage, or chicken apple sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes, crispy potatoes
two eggs fried, aioli, frisee, Vermont cheddar, Acme bun  10.75
add Nueske bacon
The lemon ricotta pancakes had a cake-like consistency and tons of flavor.
My only complaint about the pancakes was that they were way too small!
The potatoes?
Best freaking breakfast potatoes
I've ever had.
They were flavorful, crispy, and oh so good!
I also tasted my boyfriend's Fried Egg Sandwich was was also, very good.
The total came out to be about $30 something for breakfast.. a little pricy, but totally worth it!
crispy potatoes.author: Joyce E.
crispy potatoes.review:
Plow is absolutely delicious! I came here for my boyfriend's birthday brunch. The wait was about 15 minutes for two on a Thursday afternoon at around 1pm. The hostess/server was very nice and assured us that we would be seated soon. Since Plow is, as they describe "modest in size" definitely expect to get seated literally inches away from some random people. Anyways! Since we looked at the menu beforehand, we received our orders within 15 minutes. Pretty fast! I also want to mention that the wait went by quickly since my boyfriend and I were watching the cooks cook/prepare the food in the open kitchen. I ordered the Plow while my boyfriend settled on the Fried Egg sandwich.

Their water was served in jugs! My favorite. :)

(From their menu)

The Plow-- two eggs, choice of Nueske bacon, house made pork sausage, or chicken apple sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes, crispy potatoes  14.5

Fried egg sandwich -- two eggs fried, aioli, frisee, Vermont cheddar, Acme bun  10.75  add Nueske bacon  12.75

The Plow was SO good! The eggs were on the watery/yolky side which I didn't mind. The bacon tasted exactly like how my mom makes it -- It was sweet and not too crispy. The lemon ricotta pancakes had a cake-like consistency and tons of flavor. My only complaint about the pancakes was that they were way too small! The potatoes? Best freaking breakfast potatoes I've ever had. They were flavorful, crispy, and oh so good! I also tasted my boyfriend's Fried Egg Sandwich was was also, very good. The total came out to be about $30 something for breakfast.. a little pricy, but totally worth it!

excerpts:
it needed a drizzle of maple syrup for some sweetness. 
-- fried egg sandwich with crispy potatoes ($8.50): i added a side of chicken apple sausage ($4.)
a 10 on the Richter scale, as far as breakfast sandwiches go.
crispy potatoes.author: Fancypants X.
crispy potatoes.review:
Their Saturday brunch was so good, I felt like I was literally *plowing* through my food.

At 11 am, there was roughly a 20 minute wait (some counter seating opened up but we held out for a table for two.) Plow is a compact space--more long than it is wide--that surprisingly doesn't feel crowded. 

We ordered:
-- lemon ricotta pancakes ($9) to share: slightly crisp edges & fluffier in the middle. lemony but not at all tart. the ricotta gave it a nice density & almost tangy flavor. it needed a drizzle of maple syrup for some sweetness. 
-- fried egg sandwich with crispy potatoes ($8.50): i added a side of chicken apple sausage ($4.) a 10 on the Richter scale, as far as breakfast sandwiches go. the potatoes were SO crispy & had a bit of onion running through it. 
-- cider brined pork chop for the bff ($14): the bff thought it was moist & flavorful. 

Everything about Plow is charming; from our waitress with a British accent to the simple design details & right down to the cozy neighborhood. Utterly charming. I like charming. Can't get enough of it, really.

excerpts: I got the fried egg sandwich (eggs were cooked perfectly) with crispy potatoes (had a hint of rosemary -- super delicious!).
My husband and I split a lemon ricotta pancake, which was on point!
And we tried a buttermilk biscuit that just melted in our mouths.
crispy potatoes.author: Karishma B.
crispy potatoes.review:
We had brunch at Plow with some friends today. The wait was a little over an hour but we expected that since it was the peak brunch hour. But let me tell you, it was worth the wait!

I got the fried egg sandwich (eggs were cooked perfectly) with crispy potatoes (had a hint of rosemary -- super delicious!). My husband and I split a lemon ricotta pancake, which was on point! And we tried a buttermilk biscuit that just melted in our mouths. My husband got the almond flour pancakes and he was a bit disappointed. He was under the impression that they would taste almondy but they didn't at all. They tasted good but don't get them if you want something that tastes almondy.

We would definitely go back and try other items on the menu. But we'll still get the lemon ricotta pancakes in addition to anything else we get. They.are.amazing!!!

excerpts: Crispy Potatoes - The kind of homefries that are cooked in some sort of wonderful fat.
Sausage, bacon, eggs, crispy potatoes, lemon ricotta pancakes... the works.
crispy potatoes.author: Brittany B.
crispy potatoes.review:
Lemon Ricotta Pancakes - I'm not the biggest breakfast person and I only like to eat pancakes about once a year, but I could have these every day. They were lemon breakfast dessert clouds of yumminess.

Crispy Potatoes - The kind of homefries that are cooked in some sort of wonderful fat. There were pieces of all sizes, but my favorite were the really small crispies that were like shavings of salty fried butter. 

The Plow - One of the people I was eating with said it best, "They took all the best parts of breakfast and put it on a humungous plate." Sausage, bacon, eggs, crispy potatoes, lemon ricotta pancakes... the works.

excerpts:
Two words: crispy potatoes. 

I ordered "The Plow" which consists of 2 lemon ricotta pancakes, crispy potatoes, eggs your way, and your choice of bacon, chicken apple sausage, or the house sausage.
crispy potatoes.author: Marcus B.
crispy potatoes.review:
Two words: crispy potatoes. 

I came here for brunch after a night of drinking well tequila at a bar whose name is slipping my mind. We got here on a Tuesday around 1030 and the place was packed. Luckily we didn't have to wait long for a table for 3. The staff is friendly and attentive. 

I ordered "The Plow" which consists of 2 lemon ricotta pancakes, crispy potatoes, eggs your way, and your choice of bacon, chicken apple sausage, or the house sausage.

I cleaned my plate! This place  is awesome and I wish there was something similar to it around where I live.

I will definitely be back if I'm ever in the area. 

Go get Plowed! (Sorry, couldn't resist.)

excerpts: We had The Plow:  eggs, sausage, lemon ricotta pancakes and crispy potatoes.
Pretty basic for an arm and a leg.
The lemon ricotta pancakes were pretty tasty.
The eggs and bacon were cooked perfectly but
the crispy potatoes... weren't so crispy.
We also had the egg sandwich with bacon.
MMMMM delicious!
The bacon was nice and thick, the egg was cooked perfectly and the bun they use is acme, so, can't go wrong there.
crispy potatoes.author: Delilah B.
crispy potatoes.review:
The Venue:  Very bright with natural lighting.  Simple and clean looking.  

The Price:  A little on the high end for breakfast.

The wait:  I've driven by quite a few times and it's always packed.  So we decided to go when they opened.  8am.  There are no reservations so you may have to wait.  The bad thing about coming first thing is you get the first wave wait.  It wasn't as bad as some places, but it beats waiting outside or standing.  :)

The neighborhood:  It's in Potrero Hill/ Dogpatch area so everywhere around there is pretty cute and quaint.

The food:  They have a great menu and everything sounds awesome.  
We had The Plow:  eggs, sausage, lemon ricotta pancakes and crispy potatoes.
 Pretty basic for an arm and a leg.  The lemon ricotta pancakes were pretty tasty.  The eggs and bacon were cooked perfectly but the crispy potatoes... weren't so crispy.
We also had the egg sandwich with bacon.  MMMMM delicious!  The bacon was nice and thick, the egg was cooked perfectly and the bun they use is acme, so, can't go wrong there.  The whole sandwich was melt in your mouth perfect.

I would definitely come again and will so that I can try out all of there other delicious menu items.

excerpts: No doubt my favorite item here, despite the crispy potatoes (which are also amazing) being on the 7x7 big eats list.
Also got the fried egg sandwich.
I'm completely biased here since I've pretty much never had a fried egg sandwich in SF that wasn't amazing.
Thinking about this is making me hungry!
crispy potatoes.author: Tiffany C.
crispy potatoes.review: drool*  The lemon ricotta pancake is amazing.  Who would think that ricotta would go so well in a pancake.  No doubt my favorite item here, despite the crispy potatoes (which are also amazing) being on the 7x7 big eats list.  Also got the fried egg sandwich.  I'm completely biased here since I've pretty much never had a fried egg sandwich in SF that wasn't amazing.  Thinking about this is making me hungry!

excerpts: The crispy potatoes were excellent, too.
Ketchup would have been blasphemous.
My friends enjoyed their meals, also.
crispy potatoes.author: Karen Z.
crispy potatoes.review:
Happy, happy, happy tummy!

Most people can wait for a table without wanting to wail in misery. Not me. I LOATHE a wait. Honestly, I just. Don't. Do. It.  But I had plans immediately afterwards with my friends who'd underestimated the wait. By an HOUR. So I was trapped. UGH!!! Luckily a friend got there 30 minutes before me, but still...a 90 minute wait for a meal is stupid. I'm glad the restaurant is doing well. I just question the sanity of people willing to wait. Wait to spend money. Why would people do that?? Get a scone from Farley's and go home, ya'll!

Anyway, my misery over the wait isn't Plow's fault. In fact, once we were seated, they seemed to move things forward at a good pace. 

I had the fried egg sandwich with bacon, as did one other in our party. A third person had the ricotta pancakes. The fourth had the soft scramble. I also ordered a side salad, which was just lettuce. The salad, if you can call just lettuce a salad, was fine. The greens were fresh and the dressing was good. The sandwich was delicious, and the pillow-soft brioche bun really made it fabulous. The crispy potatoes were excellent, too. Ketchup would have been blasphemous. My friends enjoyed their meals, also. The creme fraiche pumpkin muffin was just okay. 

All in all, I'd go back for SURE if I ever catch this place without a wait.

excerpts: The crispy potatoes were a bit salty, but the ketchup saved it.
crispy potatoes.author: Zell C.
crispy potatoes.review:
Every time I pass by, there's always a line. People are willing to wait more than an hour for a seat? Peaked my interest, but I don't have time for that. Seriously.

This time, we were lucky. Got parking, and got seated for two in less than 5 minutes. Had to get The Plow, which seemed to have a little bit of everything on the menu, and it was delicious! Had we waited more than 30 minutes for a table, my expectations would be higher. The crispy potatoes were a bit salty, but the ketchup saved it. The lemon ricotta pancakes were the best, and I, of course, saved it for last.

Right when we left, there were about 15 people waiting out the door for a seat.

excerpts: The crispy potatoes are incredible.
You're doing yourself an injustice if you don't get them:
crispy, salty rosemary goodness.
crispy potatoes.author: Ashly O.
crispy potatoes.review: Very worth the potential 90 minute wait. The crispy potatoes are incredible. You're doing yourself an injustice if you don't get them: crispy, salty rosemary goodness. I also love the almond flour pancakes. I recommend going an hour earlier than you'd like to eat to put your name on the list and walk around the neighborhood to check out it's gorgeous views. The counter seats are your best opportunities to see the real stars of Plow at work!

excerpts: I loved the crispy potatoes, and the chicken apple sausage was also tasty.
crispy potatoes.author: Crystal J.
crispy potatoes.review:
If it weren't for the one hour and fifteen minute wait before being seated, I would rate this place five stars. I had their signature brunch item,  "the plow." I loved the crispy potatoes, and the chicken apple sausage was also tasty.  I ordered my eggs scrambled, and wasn't too satisfied - while they were certainly well-cooked,  they were rather bland and tasteless. 

The highlight of the meal was certainly the lemon ricotta pancakes, which I advise you save for last! They were just the right size, moist, and flavorful. The maple syrup is also fantastic. 

I'd probably return, but I'd make sure to get there right when it opens at 8 am to get a seat immediately.

excerpts:
what my friends and I ordered: 

the plow (two eggs (any style), crispy potatoes, bacon or chicken-apple sausage, two (smaller than the full-plate option) lemon ricotta pancakes: amazing combination!
the lemon ricotta pancakes were good
crispy potatoes.author: Patricia K.
crispy potatoes.review:
Cute brunch place with delicious food!

what my friends and I ordered: 

the plow (two eggs (any style), crispy potatoes, bacon or chicken-apple sausage, two (smaller than the full-plate option) lemon ricotta pancakes: amazing combination! I get a little bit of everything which is perfect. the lemon ricotta pancakes were good but I had a bite of my friend's almond pancakes and those were AMAZING (just the perfect hint of almond flavor- not overbearing but lingers in your mouth long enough for you to crave more!)

I highly recommend going on a weekday. my friends and i arrived on a friday morning around 9:30am and waited ~20 minutes for seats in front of the restaurant (longer wait if you want to sit inside). 

you should definitely check this place out if you like brunch and you're willing to wait!

excerpts: The crispy potatoes were evil.
crispy potatoes.author: avalon e.
crispy potatoes.review:
We noticed this place with a long line at 11-ish on a rainy Saturday a few weeks ago when we went to Chez Papa Bistro and we were wondering what the big deal is.  The menu describes pretty commonplace American fare (didnt pay attention to the credits to the local farms and suppliers).

So on this sunny-yet-freezing morning we decided to join the crowd and put our names on the waiting list.  1 hour wait....hmmm... if it werent so
nice out there and we had all the time to spare I would have suggested we go elsewhere.

An hour later we returned and found that there were just a few parties ahead of us.  Got seated @ the counter where we can get a glimpse of the action and we were greeted by our super-model-like-drop-dead-gorgeous and super-friendly waitress Ashley.  Ashley gave us the right touch of attention and YES she wrote down exactly the way we liked our dishes done (Joel and Maxine give her a raise please!).

What?  No cappuccino machine?  Never mind,  drip coffee with milk will do.  The food definitely did not disappoint.
We had a scramble with chicken apple sausage, a citrus beet salad with feta cheese, and a biscuit.  Eggs were fluffy and NOT salty (as with most places).  The crispy potatoes were evil.

Price is very fair for the location, decor, and most importantly the quality of food.  Yes, the freshness of each ingredient does come through.

Clientele is full of yuppies and hipsters.  Yes even VCs have to wait in line ( yes! I saw you!  hope you are reading this).

We'll be back!

excerpts: The Plow comes with two eggs, crispy potatoes, lemon ricotta pancakes and a choice of meat.
The lemon ricotta pancakes are fluffy, although i usually don't opt for anything lemon-y, these were really good
and I did eat it all.
The eggs were perfectly cooked to my liking.
I really wish I can mimic their crispy potatoes because they are the BEST breakfast potatoes I ever eaten; it is extra crispy on the outside, but not at all over cooked on the inside.
The chicken apple sausage was yummy too.
Everything on the plate complimented well with one another.
The fried egg sandwich has frisee, cheese and two friend eggs between a soft warm bun.
I don't really like frisee
but it really worked well with the cheese and the saltiness of the egg.
The sandwich also comes with crispy potatoes.
crispy potatoes.author: Jeannie C.
crispy potatoes.review:
Every time I visit SF, my sister brings me to a "must try" place. This past weekend she brought me here for breakfast. We got around the area around 8:30 am and parking was easy to find and best of all no wait to get seated. My sister did warn me on the weekend, however, the wait can be over an hour so I am glad we were there on a Friday. 

They have great options on their menu but I had my sister decide what to get. We decided on The Plow and the Fried egg sandwich. The Plow comes with two eggs, crispy potatoes, lemon ricotta pancakes and a choice of meat. We chose the plate with chicken apple sausage. 

Both plates were delicious. The freshness in the ingredients were there. The Plow is a great option if you want a hearty breakfast. The lemon ricotta pancakes are fluffy, although i usually don't opt for anything lemon-y, these were really good and I did eat it all. The eggs were perfectly cooked to my liking. I really wish I can mimic their crispy potatoes because they are the BEST breakfast potatoes I ever eaten; it is extra crispy on the outside, but not at all over cooked on the inside. The chicken apple sausage was yummy too. Everything on the plate complimented well with one another. The fried egg sandwich has frisee, cheese and two friend eggs between a soft warm bun. I don't really like frisee but it really worked well with the cheese and the saltiness of the egg. The sandwich also comes with crispy potatoes. 

Service was friendly and quick. It is very cozy in there...just the way I like it in this type of places especially in the Bay. Can't wait to return.

excerpts: The crispy potatoes-wow
(so perfectly cooked and seasoned-live up to the hype).
The eggs Benedict is not by any means the best I've had-but it is delicious!
crispy potatoes.author: Sarah F.
crispy potatoes.review:
I'll start off saying, I am probably slightly biased because 1. I LOVE brunch and 2. I live in potrero hill. This place often has up to or over a 2 hour wait for weekend brunch, so for me I can out my name in, go home and get ready then come back to eat. The great thing is, they let you come back after your name was called and move to the top of the list (supporting locals basically-which is great!!).
On to the food-delicious. Though they don't always have them the sausage patties with the biscuits are a great starter. The crispy potatoes-wow (so perfectly cooked and seasoned-live up to the hype). The eggs Benedict is not by any means the best I've had-but it is delicious! To finish it off with a sweetness he lemon ricotta pancakes are also amazing (though I will say for all the hype they got, I've had just as good of lemon ricotta pancakes other places.)
For a brunch day with the girls-I would certainly wait, grab a coffee down the street at Farleys and hang out with the crowd in sunny potrero!!

excerpts:
In the interest of tasting as many items as possible - I got the Plow breakfast, with lemon ricotta pancakes, pork sausage, scrambled eggs, and their revered crispy potatoes. 

And the lemon ricotta pancakes were just a hint of sweet which I really appreciate.
crispy potatoes.author: Allison V.
crispy potatoes.review:
Although I moved to the neighborhood about 9 months ago, I hadn't yet tried this place because the wait is JUST. SO. LONG.  

Today I thought I would pop in by myself for a late lunch at the counter, and ohmygod now I understand. 

In the interest of tasting as many items as possible - I got the Plow breakfast, with lemon ricotta pancakes, pork sausage, scrambled eggs, and their revered crispy potatoes. 

This might be the most perfect breakfast I have ever eaten. Thank you Plow for MAKING MY DAY!

The eggs were a totally even and perfect soft scramble.  The housemade pork sausage with fennel flavor was legit.  The potatoes were chunky and smashed to deliver extra crispy surface area with a soft center ... and the most intoxicating aroma of rosemary.  And the lemon ricotta pancakes were just a hint of sweet which I really appreciate. 

All of this deliciousness, delivered with smiling and thoughtful service.  

I can't wait to go back! (except, ahem, I will have to...)

excerpts: as are the crispy potatoes and lemon ricotta pancakes.
This place is the bomb.
crispy potatoes.author: Erica L.
crispy potatoes.review: Put our name down for a table of four at 11:15 on a Saturday, went to the gym for an hour, came back and got seated at 12:30. Prepare for a wait, but it's WORTH it. I got the breakfast sandwich with bacon and it was amazingggg...as are the crispy potatoes and lemon ricotta pancakes. This place is the bomb.

excerpts: Hubs got the Plow ($15) plate which comes with 2 eggs, meat of your choice (i.e. bacon, apple chicken sausage, etc), 2 lemon ricotta pancakes, and crispy potatoes.
The lemon ricotta pancakes were delish too.
Thicker and more dense, the light lemon flavor was a nice surprise.
And with a dab or two of maple syrup, it was great.
Just wished the pancakes were bigger.
These were about the size of a woman's palm.
crispy potatoes.author: Cindy W.
crispy potatoes.review:
Had to wait like 20 minutes on a random Friday lunch. Don't people work around here?

Anyway, we were seated outdoors, balancing on the sloping sidewalk, but it was nice out so we could watch the 22 MUNI roll on by.

Hubs got the Plow ($15) plate which comes with 2 eggs, meat of your choice (i.e. bacon, apple chicken sausage, etc), 2 lemon ricotta pancakes, and crispy potatoes.

I ordered the Fried Egg Sandwich ($11), 2 eggs over easy so that yolk is still runny, with a slice of cheese, frisee greens in a soft bun. Side of potatoes too. My sandwich was on the bland side, since I didn't add bacon (+$2). Even avocados would have been an add on. Too bad. I think they should just offer it on for more texture and taste. But I sprinkled some hot sauce and ketchup and that helped. 

The potatoes were really the stand out though. They must use a blend of small potatoes and sweet ones, with skin on and deep fried, then tossed in seasoning. Very savory and flavorful. First time I polished off my potatoes since I'm not a big potato starch fan.

The lemon ricotta pancakes were delish too. Thicker and more dense, the light lemon flavor was a nice surprise. And with a dab or two of maple syrup, it was great. Just wished the pancakes were bigger. These were about the size of a woman's palm. Could have easily had 1 more on the plate. 

Overall, cute place, with food done well.

excerpts: We ordered The Plow which offers a variety of house favorites - eggs, sausage, lemon ricotta pancakes and crispy potatoes - and watched from the bar as our food was prepared.
The kitchen was clean, efficient, and smelled wonderful.
Food arrived quickly, everything was perfectly prepared, and the meal was out of this world.
The lemon ricotta pancakes were especially amazing.
crispy potatoes.author: Kim R.
crispy potatoes.review:
The best breakfast I have had in SF for a number of years!  
5 stars based on food and service 
2 stars based on wait time

Be prepared for a wait before seating!  We went on a weekday, and even then there was a 10 minute wait for seats at the bar.   If you go on a weekend, be prepared for a much longer wait!

We ordered The Plow which offers a variety of house favorites - eggs, sausage, lemon ricotta pancakes and crispy potatoes - and watched from the bar as our food was prepared.  The kitchen was clean, efficient, and smelled wonderful.  
Food arrived quickly, everything was perfectly prepared, and the meal was out of this world.  The lemon ricotta pancakes were especially amazing.

If you have the time, definitely a must visit!

excerpts: We ordered the Eggs Benedict, the Lemon Ricotta Pancakes with crispy potatoes, eggs, bacon and sausage.
The crispy potatoes were addictive, and are best described and breakfast-french-fries.
crispy potatoes.author: Meredith S.
crispy potatoes.review:
This place is popular. My girlfriend and I arrived for brunch and there was about a 30 minute wait. Once seated, it was easy because we had 3 dogs with us and we were able to sit outside. 

Service was good, our server was upbeat and fun. It was pretty busy, so our water refills were a bit slow, but other than it was good. Our server told us about the homemade dog treats create by the chef and brought some out for the pups. 

The food was totally yummy. We ordered the Eggs Benedict, the Lemon Ricotta Pancakes with crispy potatoes, eggs, bacon and sausage. 

The hollandaise received my approval, but I wasn't that impressed with the ham. 

The crispy potatoes were addictive, and are best described and breakfast-french-fries. Perfect with the over-medium eggs. 

The pancakes were so delicious, again, I'm not a big fan on pancakes but they were light and really really good. 

The bacon was the BEST part of the meal, when we told our server she actually let us know that the owner is from Wisconsin and the Nueske bacon is smoked bacon from their home-state. 

The breakfast sausage was also really good and fennel-y. 

We will be back for more and more and more.

excerpts: Urghmagawd the lemon ricotta pancakes and crispy potatoes were amazing.
The eggs were delicious, as was the apple chicken sausage.
The only complaints I had were that it had a large line and the coffee was kinda mediocre.
crispy potatoes.author: Sean W.
crispy potatoes.review: Urghmagawd the lemon ricotta pancakes and crispy potatoes were amazing. The eggs were delicious, as was the apple chicken sausage. The only complaints I had were that it had a large line and the coffee was kinda mediocre.

excerpts: My lemon ricotta pancakes were perfectly done, the crispy potatoes were wonderous and the homemade sausage was flavorful.
The staff is friendly and the vibe is upbeat.
Cons - It's a small place
and you'll sit close to your neighbor

And this spot is not a secret so expect a wait.
crispy potatoes.author: Justin W.
crispy potatoes.review:
We showed up close to Noon.  They told us it was a 90 min wait, but it only took abot an hour.  
Once we got a seat, the staff was super friendly and fast to our table.  I got "The Plow" and my wife got a fried egg sandwich.  After an awesome and filling brunch, and a mimosa a piece, we headed back home.   I'm writing this review upon waking up from my post-brunch nap.
Pro's - Food is fantastic.  My lemon ricotta pancakes were perfectly done, the crispy potatoes were wonderous and the homemade sausage was flavorful.  The staff is friendly and the vibe is upbeat.  
Cons - It's a small place and you'll sit close to your neighbor (we were ok with this).  And this spot is not a secret so expect a wait.

excerpts: I remembered loving their crispy potatoes and savoring our brunch.
crispy potatoes.author: Kelly N.
crispy potatoes.review:
I have been to Plow before with friends and, sure, the wait was long but we were prepared for it. I remembered loving their crispy potatoes and savoring our brunch. I was dying to take my potato-loving boyfriend to Plow to introduce him to the delights of their breakfast potatoes. 

Alas, every time we've tried to go for the last year and half, it has been an hour+ wait. Boyfriend is not one to wait around. We usually end up somewhere nearby and have explored many delicious restaurant alternatives as a result (a plus after all?). Well, we finally got our opportunity over a recent ridiculously rainy weekend. It was a downpour. My boyfriend woke me up at 7am on a Sunday and said, "Plow opens at 8! Let's go today. It's our best chance." Look at the things we do for love!

We went (though I dragged my feet getting out of bed) and arrived around 8:30. The wait was going to be between 1 to 1.5 hours. (!!!!!) WTF?!? We decided to wait. I banked on the fact that everyone who put their names down ahead of us likely didn't want to wait around in the rain. As luck would have it, we were seated after about 30 minutes. We ordered quickly -- two coffees, two dungeness crab scrambles, one side order of lemon ricotta pancakes, please! 

And then we waited for an hour. We watched all the people around us get their food and begin eating. Our server came over to explain there had been a snafu in the kitchen and our food was just being fired. No apologies. No offer of something to put in our stomachs in the meantime to offset the three cups of coffee we had been drinking during the wait. We watched the people who were seated after us finish and pay their bill before our meals arrived. And then when it did arrive, it was fine... fine as in mediocre, not fine as in "all is right in the world." Our scrambles were pretty salty and we got one tiny pancake to split... perhaps we could have asked for more info on what the "side" of pancakes consisted of.

When we got our tab, we still got no apologies, nothing comped off of our bill, and no fulfillment from our experience. After a year and half of trying to return to Plow, it was a bust in the end. We left with a sour taste in our mouths and confusion as to why so many people keep coming back and waiting that long. Chez Maman is a half block away and has a lovely brunch. You'll find us there.

excerpts: Them crispy potatoes, tho.
crispy potatoes.author: Allen Mark A.
crispy potatoes.review:
I told myself that I would only review restaurants I've visited at least twice, but I think I liked it enough not to wait... aaaand San Francisco is far-ish :(

One of my friends took me here for a weekend brunch so we could catch up. We got there at about 12:40 (I got to the city 30 minutes late and my friend got lost on the way there. You live in SF and you've been there countless times before, HOW DO YOU GET LOST??) when it was packed, giving us a 45-60 minute wait. I didn't mind at all; I'm a really patient person and we ended up spending that time in a nearby bookstore anyway. We got back and opted to eat outside on a beautiful day in the city. It was kind of awkward eating on a slanted plane, but it wasn't terribly uncomfortable. And the pigeons walking around the tables got a little bothersome (but not in an annoying way, if that makes sense), but that's also a risk you take sitting outside. And the blankets they had available were a nice touch in case it got chilly. Okay, none of y'all want to hear about this, let's talk food!

Generally I like to try what a place is known for on the first visit, which would thus be the Plow, but my friend decided to order one herself and offered to have me try some of her lemon ricotta pancakes. I easily obliged and chose a brunch favorite of mine anywhere: eggs benedict with ham. First of all, I loved my eggs benedict. Not too much hollandaise sauce and the english muffins were quite big, and quite deliciously fluffy. Also: I love eggs. Good choice, me. I also had a little bit of my friends' pancakes. It was then in that moment of that first bite when I promised myself I'd be back to have a whole plate of it for myself. Oh, and I can't forget:

Them crispy potatoes, tho.

I'd come back just for them, TBH. Furthermore, our waitress was super nice (and super cute) and, oh, they have Tapatio. I already liked this place from first impression, but honestly they had me at Tapatio. The coffee was decent, though I'd love to try their cold brew some time. It wasn't quite warm enough that day for it. WELP I guess that's another reason to come back huh?

Anyway, to sum up, there really wasn't anything from my experience that would deserve to have a star docked off, so 5 it is! I'll be back, it's just a matter of when at this point. Thanks!

excerpts: Fresh eggs, 3 small chicken apple sausages, boatload of crispy potatoes, and 2 small lemon ricotta pancakes.
Pancakes and potatoes were the best.
I think the potatoes are flash fried or something -- amazingly crunchy, but not dripping with oil.
Best brunch potatoes
I've had -- hands down.
The lemon ricotta pancakes were the perfect size (not too big - i think bottomless flapjacks is the grossest idea ever).
Texture was great and flavor was delicate and not too sweet.
crispy potatoes.author: Kendra W.
crispy potatoes.review:
We came last week when it was sprinkling (more like misting).  No other groups wanted outside tables, so we bypassed the TWO HOUR wait and endured a little chilly drizzle over hot coffee and good food -- the smarter choice in my opinion!  Good brunch -- but really glad we didn't wait TWO HOURS.  Ambrosia from the gods would not be worth that much of my time...

I ordered the Plow ($15) -- good way to sample what they they do best.  Fresh eggs, 3 small chicken apple sausages, boatload of crispy potatoes, and 2 small lemon ricotta pancakes.  Pancakes and potatoes were the best.  I think the potatoes are flash fried or something -- amazingly crunchy, but not dripping with oil.  Best brunch potatoes I've had -- hands down.  The lemon ricotta pancakes were the perfect size (not too big - i think bottomless flapjacks is the grossest idea ever).  Texture was great and flavor was delicate and not too sweet. Yummers.

I think some claims that it's the "best brunch spot in the city" is a bit much -- but definitely a great place to try if you happen to drive by Potrero Hill and see that the line isn't too bad!

excerpts: Their crispy potatoes are a must, even if you are carb conscious... if you're gonna eat any kind of fried potatoes be it fries or home fries, eat these and skip all the others!
crispy potatoes.author: Alice W.
crispy potatoes.review:
Just moved from NY, and Plow definitely makes me feel good that there are awesome brunch places in SF and that I won't need to hop on a plane any time soon whenever I need a good brunch. Went on a sunny Saturday afternoon (after 1:30PM) and waited for about 25 minutes. Perhaps that's the key for getting around the crazy peak time waits. 

We had the Fried Egg Sandwich with avocado and pork sausage... YUMMY. It fell apart though (definitely not easy to eat w/your hands), but I managed b/c it was just too yummy. Their crispy potatoes are a must, even if you are carb conscious... if you're gonna eat any kind of fried potatoes be it fries or home fries, eat these and skip all the others! So delicious.

We also tried the lemon ricotta pancakes as it seems like that is a must, and I definitely liked them a lot (not sure if it's out of this world amazing, but they were definitely very good). I'd get them again. YUM.

Come later, wait less, and eat happy.

excerpts: The French toast was bland, the crispy potatoes had too much Rosemary, the infamous sandwich was hardly anything to remember outside of the acme bun,
the sausages (pork and chicken apple.. Were just ok).... but one thing did make my list.
crispy potatoes.author: irene u.
crispy potatoes.review:
Quality ingredients, helpful staff, but the flavors and textures didn't suit my palate. The French toast was bland, the crispy potatoes had too much Rosemary, the infamous sandwich was hardly anything to remember outside of the acme bun, the sausages (pork and chicken apple.. Were just ok).... but one thing did make my list. the lemon ricotta pancakes were the star of this meal.  Perfect combination of sweet and tart. Just really small portions of it on the plow plate.  

Was it worth the hour wait... Meh.

excerpts: My favorite dish to get is The Plow because it has a little of everything: fluffy lemon ricotta pancakes, eggs, choice of tasty meat and those crispy potatoes that made the 7x7 list.
crispy potatoes.author: Chrissy M.
crispy potatoes.review:
Assuming you're having a relaxing, weekend day and aren't in a hurry, this place is SO worth the wait!  I'm guessing it's not as busy during the week, but on the weekend, it's  not unusual to wait 45 minutes to an hour.

My boyfriend lives in Potrero and this is our favorite brunch place in the neighborhood.  Everything I've ever eaten here has been out of this world!  

They always have some yummy "starter" type items at the top of their brunch menu.  They change these up a lot, but every one I've tried has been awesome.

I don't have kids, but I saw on their website that they have a great kid's menu.  My favorite dish to get is The Plow because it has a little of everything: fluffy lemon ricotta pancakes, eggs, choice of tasty meat and those crispy potatoes that made the 7x7 list.

The restaurant is focused on using local ingredients.  They even list where the food comes from on their menu.

As I mentioned, they're always busy on the weekends.  Still, I've always had prompt friendly service.  They always offer plenty of coffee refills- love their coffee!

FYI they don't take reservations and don't serve parties over 6 people.

excerpts: I got the "plow breakfast" which consists of crispy potatoes
and no you do not need to specify extra crispy because they are already very crispy.
crispy potatoes.author: Bonnie B.
crispy potatoes.review: This is a nice little breakfast Nook off the beaten path. Good coffee. I got the "plow breakfast" which consists of crispy potatoes and no you do not need to specify extra crispy because they are already very crispy. It came with two pretty small lemon ricotta pancakes which were delightful. They are served up with butter and maple syrup. You also get your choice of bacon or house made pork sausage which was fantastic and eggs. I found it to be quite a lot of food but it was also quite a lot of money but it was a very good breakfast all in all.

excerpts: The Plow (two eggs, two pieces of bacon or sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes, and crispy potatoes) and The French Toast.

We ate every bite.

crispy potatoes.review:
So I've been really wanting to try this place.  It's a bit out of the way for me, but I love trying new things.

So, we waited about an hour to be seated on a Saturday...ok by me if the food is good.  Plus you can order some beverages while you wait.  Relax people, have some drinks outside with friends while you wait.  It's the weekend after all so enjoy. 

So my friend and I shared two dishes. The Plow (two eggs, two pieces of bacon or sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes, and crispy potatoes) and The French Toast.
The food was just delicious.  We ate every bite.  Those potatoes are crispy on the outside, soft on the inside with great flavor.  Those lemon ricotta pancakes were so delectable. French Toast was more on average but very good!  

I am definitely going to come back here again and try something else...but I may get those ricotta pancakes again..hehe.

excerpts: The eggs were fine, the crispy potatoes were tasty, the bacon (which the server recommended) was no good, and the pancakes were decent.
crispy potatoes.author: Jason C.
crispy potatoes.review:
I had high expectations coming to Plow, and Plow delivered. The food is good - nothing special in my opinion. I ordered "The Plow" and had my eggs cooked over easy. The eggs were fine, the crispy potatoes were tasty, the bacon (which the server recommended) was no good, and the pancakes were decent.

I mean, at $15 for the entree, I expected it to be out of this world. I can name a dozen breakfast joints in the area with a tastier, heartier breakfast for less money.

Overall, the food is good, but I wouldn't wait more than 20 minutes to eat there.

excerpts: The crispy potatoes were my favorite and was not a let down.
Next time I want to try the Egg Sandwich which my sister says is delicious!
Try coming here on a weekday, it's not as crowded and wait is only about 20 min during peak times.
crispy potatoes.author: Sally S.
crispy potatoes.review: Great brunch place! I had the Plow and my sister had the crab scramble. The crispy potatoes were my favorite and was not a let down. Next time I want to try the Egg Sandwich which my sister says is delicious! Try coming here on a weekday, it's not as crowded and wait is only about 20 min during peak times.

But no, they were big chunks of soggy waste-of-calories potatoes.
Meh.

crispy potatoes.author: Sandy T.
crispy potatoes.review: There are definitely better brunch places in SF. It was around a 2.5 hour wait and we ordered the plow and benedict. The plate felt like it was 1/2-3/4 full of potatoes. Now, if they were delicious crispy potatoes, then awesome! But no, they were big chunks of soggy waste-of-calories potatoes. Meh. Their lemon ricotta pancake was also very dry. So there is no reason why I would return.

excerpts: Very simply put, I ordered 2 eggs scrambled, crispy potatoes and a buttermilk biscuit.
How can you go wrong with that?
No where on the menu did it say that the crispy potatoes were "rosemary crispy potatoes" and it just so happens that rosemary does not agree with me
and I stay far away from it.
It spilled over into my scrambled eggs, and I could not have been more disappointed.
As a group we made our own modifications, and friends shared pancakes and meat that they would not ordinarily order.
crispy potatoes.author: Sharon M.
crispy potatoes.review:
A group of us had brunch at Plow over the weekend for a birthday celebration (requested by the birthday girl.)  I viewed their website in advance and was aware that they did not take reservations and were a small venue that could only accommodate up to six in a group, so we kept our group to six.   We had heard good things about Plow and we were excited to give it a try. 

We arrived on a Sunday at 9:00 a.m. and we were told that it would be an hour wait.  The wait wasn't actually that long.  It felt like 20 minutes but it was probably 40 as we were busy chatting.  We sat outside.  

As we looked at the menu, someone pointed out a sentence in italics that said something to the effect of "no modifications to the menu."  I don't have the exact wording.  Well, to start, that's a bit of a buzz kill as who doesn't modify something even a little?  I decided to order all "sides" so that I could enjoy what I wanted and not have a plate with things that I don't care for included.  Very simply put, I ordered 2 eggs scrambled, crispy potatoes and a buttermilk biscuit.  How can you go wrong with that?   No where on the menu did it say that the crispy potatoes were "rosemary crispy potatoes" and it just so happens that rosemary does not agree with me and I stay far away from it.  It spilled over into my scrambled eggs, and I could not have been more disappointed. As a group we made our own modifications, and friends shared pancakes and meat that they would not ordinarily order.  Friends enjoyed the lemon ricotta pancakes and the buttermilk biscuits and the eggs seemed to be quite fresh.  

On a more important note, the waitress that we had was anything but cheerful. She didn't appear to be overly friendly to anyone outside.  From the moment we sat down, we felt her negative energy and lack of any form of customer service.  Overall, we had a great time together, the food was good, but the service was not anything to write home about.  On the ABOUT section of their website it says " Plow is a tribute to timeless recipes coupled with California cooking and warm hospitality."   Well, the hospitality portion was definitely missing from our experience which was really unfortunate. 

My rating of 3 stars is more about the service than the menu or food experience.

excerpts: Their crispy potatoes are delicious too; I've tried a few times to replicate them at home but can never seem to get them just right.
If you go on a weekend be prepared for a pretty lengthy wait.
This place is extremely tiny and very popular.
But, they do offer coffee to make the wait a little more bearable and there is a great view of the city.
They also have outdoor seating and are dog friendly.
It comes with all of Plow's best dishes: lemon ricotta pancakes, crispy potatoes, eggs, and your choice of their yummy bacon or sausage.
Definitely a must order if it's your first time at Plow.
crispy potatoes.author: Erin B.
crispy potatoes.review:
Love Plow's brunch and would give it 5 stars if it weren't for the wait. Their lemon ricotta pancakes are the best. I'm not even a big pancake fan yet I order them every time. Their crispy potatoes are delicious too; I've tried a few times to replicate them at home but can never seem to get them just right. If you go on a weekend be prepared for a pretty lengthy wait. This place is extremely tiny and very popular. But, they do offer coffee to make the wait a little more bearable and there is a great view of the city. They also have outdoor seating and are dog friendly. 
As for food, I have gotten the breakfast sandwich, which is very tasty, but after trying the plow plate, I am a convert. It comes with all of Plow's best dishes: lemon ricotta pancakes, crispy potatoes, eggs, and your choice of their yummy bacon or sausage. Definitely a must order if it's your first time at Plow.

excerpts: The much lauded crispy potatoes and some levain toast (well buttered with butter you could actually taste) were also there.
I don't even like eggs
crispy potatoes.author: Candice L.
crispy potatoes.review:
For a year and a half, I have been hearing my Potrero friends rave about Plow. Actually, I've been hearing raves about Plow from friends, the blogs, and pretty much anybody who had been and weathered the wait for their tasty breakfasts. Truth be told, I am not enamored with Mission Beach Cafe or Boogaloos and didn't think that breakfast at Plow would wow me.

The breakfast wowed me. 

We started with a corn and millet muffin, freshly baked and still warm from the oven. The muffin was crumbly and a bit hard to eat but the crust on the muffin top was crunchy and the millet added crispy bits to the slightly sweet corn muffin. Seriously though, all muffins should be eaten fresh and warm from the oven. 

Next up were a la carte orders of an almond pancake (gluten-free!) and a pumpkin pancake. The pumpkin pancake was fine, similar to what I make at home, but the almond pancake was really interesting. I didn't believe it was actually gluten-free at first b/c the texture was so spot on and it wasn't heavily almond flavored. I dislike marzipan, so I was quite pleased at the neutral flavor profile of the pancake. We asked the server and she informed us that it was made with almond, oat, and coconut flour. An excellent option for the g-f people out there.

The soft scrambled eggs were the turning point for me, where I switched from liking Plow to loving Plow. Of course we've all read about the proper way to slowly scramble eggs, slow and over low heat a la Julia Child or Jacques Pepin, and I thought I had it right before. I was wrong. These eggs were so, so silky. Not runny, but perfectly silky, highlighted by fava greens, chanterelles, and goat cheese. The much lauded crispy potatoes and some levain toast (well buttered with butter you could actually taste) were also there. I don't even like eggs and I kept going back to them, passing over the crispy fried potatoes!

We also tried the Chinese Breakfast whose name manages to simultaneously bring to mind my family and Humphry Slocombe's Secret Breakfast. Anyway, of course you can't go wrong with gingery braised pork shoulder over rice, but the soft scrambled eggs are really where it's at.

All the ingredients used were obviously quality; seasoning levels and ingredient ratios were also well balanced. Loved the clean yet rustic vibe of the naturally sunny dining room. Also loved our server who understood that we were there to sample some different dishes vs eating at a traditional pace. She brought things out at a comfortable rate and was there to answer questions as needed. I can't imagine this perfect vision of what breakfast at Plow is ruined by the hoards on weekends so I guess I'll just save it for an occasional 7am weekday treat.

excerpts: The lemon ricotta pancakes are delicious, especially when paired with the crispy potatoes.
crispy potatoes.author: Ruby K.
crispy potatoes.review: The wait is short if you get there early. The french toast and The Plow plate are good. The drinks are good too. The lemon ricotta pancakes are delicious, especially when paired with the crispy potatoes.

excerpts: The French toast was pretty good though and the crispy potatoes were super crunchy and nicely salted.
crispy potatoes.author: S C.
crispy potatoes.review: Lemon ricotta pancakes were dense and flavorless. I couldn't even finish one after waiting 1.5 hours to be seated! The French toast was pretty good though and the crispy potatoes were super crunchy and nicely salted.

excerpts: My friend ordered the Plow which is the works with 2 eggs, bacon,  2 lemon ricotta pancakes and crispy potatoes.
I ordered the soft egg crab and asparagus scramble with crispy potatoes, buttered toast and a side order of one almond pancake.
Everything was cooked to perfection and the potatoes are out of this world!
Best crispy potatoes with a sprinkling of salt and herbs.
Mmmm!
crispy potatoes.author: Sharon D.
crispy potatoes.review:
This is my favorite breakfast place in the city!!  You've got to go to Plow!  I've been here twice and both brunches were fabulous!  Brought my friend from LA here and she absolutely loved it.  We had to wait about half hour on a Tuesday so we took a stroll around the sunny neighborhood.  

My friend ordered the Plow which is the works with 2 eggs, bacon,  2 lemon ricotta pancakes and crispy potatoes.  I ordered the soft egg crab and asparagus scramble with crispy potatoes, buttered toast and a side order of one almond pancake.  Everything was cooked to perfection and the potatoes are out of this world!  Best crispy potatoes with a sprinkling of salt and herbs.  Mmmm!  The almond pancake was nice and fluffy.

Love the decor and service was great.

excerpts: , I got the fried egg sandwich (two eggs fried, cheddar, aioli, crispy potatoes) and you can add bacon and/or avocados for additional fee.
It is pretty delicious; the bread is soft yet slightly crispy on top and the runny egg yolk tastes delicious mixed in with your crispy potatoes.
crispy potatoes.author: Lori F.
crispy potatoes.review:
It's a cute small neighborhood spot for brunch; however, you should expect to wait for a table or arrive early. If I lived in that neighborhood, I would eat at Plow more often; otherwise, every once in a while is good enough. 

I've been to Plow twice for brunch and both times, I got the fried egg sandwich (two eggs fried, cheddar, aioli, crispy potatoes) and you can add bacon and/or avocados for additional fee. It is pretty delicious; the bread is soft yet slightly crispy on top and the runny egg yolk tastes delicious mixed in with your crispy potatoes. 

Maybe the next time I go, I'll be willing to try something different ... The French toast did look delicious and was sold out the first time around.

excerpts: however, i really like the scrambled eggs (so runny!!) and CRISPY potatoes.

tried that one weird whey orange drink (i wasn't paying a lot of attention when the waitress was describing it, but she mentioned that they made some cheese in-house and extracted protein, add orange juice and tonic...
bleh - i didn't like it).
crispy potatoes.author: Diana C.
crispy potatoes.review:
3.5 stars. this place is so cute!  the wait was very long...  love the decor.

ordered The Plow - with scrambled eggs and house made pork sausage patties. waitress came back half an hour later saying they were out of the pork sausage (it was 12:37pm on Sunday - yes, i did check the time) got the chicken apple sausage instead. should have gotten the bacon if i knew that the chicken apple sausages are those little bfast sausage (i like the ones with apple chunks in them instead). however, i really like the scrambled eggs (so runny!!) and CRISPY potatoes. tried that one weird whey orange drink (i wasn't paying a lot of attention when the waitress was describing it, but she mentioned that they made some cheese in-house and extracted protein, add orange juice and tonic... bleh - i didn't like it). lemon ricotta pancakes - first bite had a kick to it, but it's not fluffy. i like fluffy pancakes. same problem with the almond flour pancakes. 

i would totally go back for the eggs and potatoes. the muffin looked good, too. want to try that next time.

excerpts: I love the crispy potatoes!
They'd be the equivalent to homefries at any other brunch place, but these things are amazing!
crispy potatoes.author: Leanne M.
crispy potatoes.review:
This is my fave brunch spot in the history of brunch spots that I've been to. Quite extreme, I know, but you have to eat here to understand why I say this.

First of all, I always order the plow. Why? It lets you taste everything that is good and amazing at Plow. The pancakes... the best thing ever! Lemon ricotta pancakes. I haven't tried a better pancake anywhere else. They're so light and the flavour is just amazing (I eat them without syrup all the time because they taste so good). My bf and I have been trying to make them ourselves and we never get close to the quality and delicateness of Plow. 

Second, the potatoes! I love the crispy potatoes! They'd be the equivalent to homefries at any other brunch place, but these things are amazing! They're tossed in some salt, pepper and rosemary (and maybe other things that I just don't know about) and they add the perfect little crunch to the plow platter. 

The wait can be a little long since they don't have much space to seat people, but it's always worth the wait for me. I love this place! It keeps me coming back every time.

excerpts:
- They have some pretty awesome lemon ricotta pancakes
- They do an excellent job with the crispy potatoes, which are the star of the show.
crispy potatoes.author: Kartik A.
crispy potatoes.review:
My cofounder and I have been going to Plow for lunch lately.

- They have good eggs, though at the end of the day, they aree eggs.
- They have some pretty awesome lemon ricotta pancakes
- They do an excellent job with the crispy potatoes, which are the star of the show.

They are cut small so you get to taste the outer crispy portions and aren't dealing with bland insides. Also, they are server well done - they are quite crisp.

Definitely pick something which comes with the potatoes when you are there.

- "The Plow" lets you sample the eggs, the potatoes and the pancakes in meal.
- If you are seated outside, they offer you blankets - an interesting novelty.
- I'm told they have a 2 hour wait on weekends, so weekdays might be a better option.
- I haven't tried the Chinese Breakfast - it tends to always be sold out by the time we get there.
- Its Portrero Hill, so parking isn't terrible.

excerpts: The "crispy potatoes" are similar to hash browns, but cut bigger.
I don't usually care for hash browns, but the crispy potatoes at Plow are amazing; the perfect mix of crispy and savory.
The french toast also stands out; they make it with really thick slices of fresh bread.
crispy potatoes.author: Laurent L.
crispy potatoes.review:
I've been here a couple times for weekend brunch. Overall, the food is outstanding. Plow serves a fancy twist on many classic breakfast and brunch favorites such as eggs, pancakes, sausage, french toast, etc. The ingredients taste fresh and all parts of the dish are carefully and thoughtfully seasoned.

Several items stood out for me. The "crispy potatoes" are similar to hash browns, but cut bigger. I don't usually care for hash browns, but the crispy potatoes at Plow are amazing; the perfect mix of crispy and savory. The french toast also stands out; they make it with really thick slices of fresh bread. The lemon ricotta pancakes left me wishing I had just ordered fifteen of them and nothing else!

I would have given five stars, but there is a price to pay for eating at Plow --- the wait. The two times I went were during lulls; I had "late brunch" at 2pm, and I had brunch during the holidays when most people were out of town. I waited 45min and 30min respectively, and I was lucky. The 45min wait would have been much longer, but two parties ahead of us changed their minds and left. I can only imagine what the wait must be like at "normal" hours. It's typical to see a crowd of people waiting outside Plow when you walk by on the weekend. A long wait is almost part of the experience! They don't take reservations so there is no way around it. Part of me wonders whether the food tastes so good simply because I'm starved by the time I get to eat it.

excerpts: I can see why people rave about the crispy potatoes because they were very good.
crispy potatoes.author: Thi D.
crispy potatoes.review: Came here on a weekday at 1pm.  There was plenty of seating outdoors, but we opted for inside since it was a little chilly.  We had to wait about 20 minutes for a table.  I definitely dig the ambiance inside.  My friend and I ordered the soft scrambled eggs, the cherry tomatoes and goat cheese for me, and the oyster mushrooms and cheddar for her.  The mister ordered the plow.  My eggs were cooked perfectly and had a lot of flavor.  I can see why people rave about the crispy potatoes because they were very good.  I tried the lemon ricotta pancakes from the mister's plate, which made me wish I ordered them.  Overall, very tasty food and good, friendly service.

excerpts: I was a bit less impressed with the crispy potatoes, which also get raves - I found them to be good, but they didn't really elevate fried potatoes to a whole new level of deliciousness for me.
For me, it's not worth all the hassle and expense, but I'd definitely go back for another weekday brunch where someone else was paying in a heartbeat.
crispy potatoes.author: Lisa K.
crispy potatoes.review: I was happy that the 6 of us could be seated at 9 am on a weekday - it was tricky enough at that time, so I'd never want to come on a weekend. I liked the single pancake options, which allowed us to try the lemon ricotta and the almond flour pancake. I never would have ordered them even though everyone always raves about them, so that was a great way to try without committing, and I did love them both. I was a bit less impressed with the crispy potatoes, which also get raves - I found them to be good, but they didn't really elevate fried potatoes to a whole new level of deliciousness for me. For me, it's not worth all the hassle and expense, but I'd definitely go back for another weekday brunch where someone else was paying in a heartbeat.

excerpts: Plow is not a greasy spoon, so it is not going to satisfy palates accustomed to heavier fare, but if you are hungry, the Plow dish (two eggs, choice of house made pork sausage, Nueske bacon, or chicken apple sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes + crispy potatoes) is a great choice for people who are not on any restricted diets.
crispy potatoes.author: Kristina P.
crispy potatoes.review:
It's true that the wait for breakfast at Plow is usually long, but the line-up there is packed because people want to eat well prepared and healthy food that is fresh, local, and organic. The demand is therefore high. If you're an early riser, I'd recommend arriving at Plow at opening time in order to avoid the wait. 

I eat rather "clean" by following a Paleo/SCD diet, which advocates avoiding starches and consuming high quality meats, vegs, and fruits. Plow serves delicious meals that easily fit in with this eating philosophy. The Two Eggs dish is a great option for people following this diet. Note that the staff can swap the potatoes with greens.

Service and atmosphere are both very good. 

Plow is not a greasy spoon, so it is not going to satisfy palates accustomed to heavier fare, but if you are hungry, the Plow dish (two eggs, choice of house made pork sausage, Nueske bacon, or chicken apple sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes + crispy potatoes) is a great choice for people who are not on any restricted diets.

excerpts: The crispy potatoes were good too.
My sunnyside egg was okay although the yolk part ended up getting cooked in some parts
so it wasnt as runny as it should be
but otherwise, decent.
crispy potatoes.author: P W.
crispy potatoes.review:
Got there on a Sunday morning around 10am and the wait wasn't too bad! About 35 mins for a party of 2 which is pretty reasonable for this place.

Ordered "The Plow" since I wanted to try a few different items (Not to mention, seems like everyone orders it so I figured it must be good).

Lemon ricotta pancakes were delicious. Less fluffy and more cakey which I liked and the lemon flavor was not overpowering. The crispy potatoes were good too. My sunnyside egg was okay although the yolk part ended up getting cooked in some parts so it wasnt as runny as it should be but otherwise, decent. The chicken sausages had a strange (but not in a bad way) taste although next time I think I'll try the bacon.

Probably not worth an hour+ wait but for 30 mins, I'd come back again

excerpts: I really enjoyed the home-made sausage, the over-easy eggs (not your average supermarket eggs) and crispy potatoes!!!
crispy potatoes.author: C T.
crispy potatoes.review:
Loved the ambience here. Super cute brunch spot, good for small groups and catching up with friends on the weekends.

I started with the Equator coffee (GREAT), and ordered the Plow for brunch.  I really enjoyed the home-made sausage, the over-easy eggs (not your average supermarket eggs) and crispy potatoes!!! The lemon ricotta pancakes were good, but not amazing.  If I ever come back, I'd probably order the chicken tinga.  I pretty much forced the dude to hand over his plate midway through our meal. YOINK.

Warning: be prepared to wait longer than the quoted time. We were told it would be a 35 minute wait, but ended up getting seated an hour and 15 minutes later.

excerpts: I had the salmon eggs benedict with crispy potatoes (that were actually crispy) and a mimosa
and it was all delicious!
I appreciate a spot that can execute well known breakfast options and still preserve a little originality.
crispy potatoes.author: MissM R.
crispy potatoes.review: The 80 minute wait was worth it! I had the salmon eggs benedict with crispy potatoes (that were actually crispy) and a mimosa and it was all delicious! I appreciate a spot that can execute well known breakfast options and still preserve a little originality.

excerpts: Chicken apple sausage, crispy potatoes and most of all ALMOND FLOUR PANCAKES were all amazing
crispy potatoes.author: Nate M.
crispy potatoes.review: Chicken apple sausage, crispy potatoes and most of all ALMOND FLOUR PANCAKES were all amazing

excerpts:
- Monkey bread - don't be deceived, this is NOT banana bread - its like a cinnamon roll and french toast hybrid - tasty
- Donut - a bit dry but still a good cake donut
- Egg Sandwich - Big, messy, technically challenging to eat, and yummy
- Bacon - Its bacon, you will like it unless there is something wrong with you
- Crispy potatoes -

In fact crispy but a bit bland
- Pork Sausage - Pretty light and tasty
crispy potatoes.author: Snuffles B.
crispy potatoes.review:
We violated the cardinal rule of Sunday Brunch, which is to be a lazy bum and roll out of bed incoherently to eat at an hour where the rest of the world could have done half a day's work already. Instead we got up at 7:30 so we could avoid the line. So technically, we didn't have brunch, we had breakfast and believe it or not, if you get there at 8:30, you might still have to wait b/c they stagger the first seating (outside and inside). 

The inside has an open but farmy feel, the outside is on the sidewalk on a steep hill - VERY challenging to avoid getting a sunburn and if you are facing up the hill, its a work out just to get your head close enough to the plate to eat your food. Plus the time we got our food, half the block was a waiting area for ravenously hungry Brunch-seekers, so I'd vote to sit inside. The servers are very nice and do a good job.

- Monkey bread - don't be deceived, this is NOT banana bread - its like a cinnamon roll and french toast hybrid - tasty
- Donut - a bit dry but still a good cake donut
- Egg Sandwich - Big, messy, technically challenging to eat, and yummy
- Bacon - Its bacon, you will like it unless there is something wrong with you
- Crispy potatoes - In fact crispy but a bit bland
- Pork Sausage - Pretty light and tasty
- Lemon ricotta pancakes - Light, fluffy, lemony, one of the best pancakes I've had
- Almond flour pancakes - Also light and fluffy, but tasted like a regular pancake, not a hint of almond to be found.

While this place is tasty, its not wait-for-an-hour-and-get-a-sunburn-tasty. And don't get me started about the bathroom line - OY.

excerpts: The plow includes the pancakes, eggs, bacon, and crispy potatoes (what?!)
Go to Plow and get the Plow, please.
crispy potatoes.author: Helen Z.
crispy potatoes.review:
Simple, yummy breakfast. 

It might sound silly, but their eggs are perfectly, lovingly scrambled. Just soft and creamy enough and oh-so-fluffy. It's my benchmark for how great a brunch place is, and this place is a winner. 

The lemon ricotta pancakes are quite delicious as well. The plow includes the pancakes, eggs, bacon, and crispy potatoes (what?!) Go to Plow and get the Plow, please.

Just one caveat: there's usually an hour-ish long wait, so be wary of that. It's the only thing that stops me from going all the time.

excerpts: as it comes with 2 eggs any style, crispy potatoes, sausage or bacon, and those lemon ricotta pancakes.
The potatoes are hot goodness.
Even an hour later sitting in that compostable take-out box.
Ohmy.
The sausage is top-notch too, even though I don't usually order meat with my breakfast (chicken apple, if you're wondering the flavor!).
The pancakes, which I was really anticipating, were not as rich as I was hoping.
I guess I'm a fatty.
I was hoping for a bit more creaminess/ricotta to burst out and shine, but it's very subtle.
It isn't dry as some others have commented, but definitely not the best pancakes I've ever had either.
They're too dense, perhaps griddle cakes would be a better term.
Also, (TMI alert)
crispy potatoes.author: Tiffany C.
crispy potatoes.review:
3.5 stars. Plow does NOT make it easy to get to by public transportation. My fault. Catching a bus from North Beach on Giants game day is most likely the worst decision in recent SF traveling history. The bus jostled me all the way down and fortunately dropped me off only a block away, but never again - it took took me more than an hour.

Ahem, I got my order to-go (and yes, it was rather cold by the time I dug in) but from a quick glance the ambiance is super nice. Buuutt, I can see why it gets ridiculous on weekends. They really haven't much space inside for more than maybe 9 measly groups.. a couple tables outside. A bit like the old Outerlands format, but marginally larger.

I ordered the Plow since I don't expect I'd be making this trip again (why on earth are you near absolutely nothing, Plow?!) as it comes with 2 eggs any style, crispy potatoes, sausage or bacon, and those lemon ricotta pancakes. The potatoes are hot goodness. Even an hour later sitting in that compostable take-out box. Ohmy. The sausage is top-notch too, even though I don't usually order meat with my breakfast (chicken apple, if you're wondering the flavor!). The pancakes, which I was really anticipating, were not as rich as I was hoping. I guess I'm a fatty. I was hoping for a bit more creaminess/ricotta to burst out and shine, but it's very subtle. It isn't dry as some others have commented, but definitely not the best pancakes I've ever had either. They're too dense, perhaps griddle cakes would be a better term. Also, (TMI alert) I tasted lemon from when I ate it in the afternoon til I went to sleep which makes me think there must have been some kind of lemon extract or something in there cause it was way too strong.... just my opinion.

I wish I'd shared it with someone and perhaps taken in the restaurant a bit more casually, but I'd have to say the food I ate wasn't really worth coming all the way over. Glad I tried it, but not going again.

excerpts: The crispy potatoes are the best I have ever had in the "roasted" category, bar none.
Honestly just outrageously delicious potatoes.
crispy potatoes.author: Solomon W.
crispy potatoes.review:
Potato, potahto, however you say the name of this tuberifous vegetable, you must eat them at Plow if you are in San Francisco. Yes, the wait on any given day is pretty crazy--odd that it is in such a residential area--but I assure you that it is worth your time.

The restaurant is small and quaint, so they are really consistent at cranking out good grub to a few people at a time. I believe that they take care in each dish, and it comes out in the offerings, primarily the potatoes.

The lemon ricotta pancake was fluffy and creamy; it boasted just a touch of sweetness balanced with a hint of lemon, to boot. The duckfat cornmeal pancake possessed this tartness from possibly buttermilk? It was just rich and fluffy, with a touch of crispness. The coffee crumbcake was just OK, unfortunately. Lots o' blueberry, but sort of a mealy texture and light flavor.

Onto the actual food. The crispy potatoes are the best I have ever had in the "roasted" category, bar none. Honestly just outrageously delicious potatoes. The soft scrambled eggs were good, but nothing fancy. But... the potatoes. Yes, they are mighty fine and just so... dang.... GOOD.

Plow falls into that category "sleek" eatery with one word with only a few letters like "Cow" or "Meat" or "Brunch." Does it match up to all of the like? 100%, yes.

excerpts: Yes, the crispy potatoes were good.
So was the egg scramble.
My sister's egg sandwich looked good too.
But we all agreed that although the food was good, it wasn't worth the cost ($15 for scrambled eggs and potatoes)
now was it worth the 1.5 hours it took me to get to the place, or
the hour-and-15-min wait worth it.

They kept seating parties of 4 before us even though we'd signed in before them, and the "hostess" kept asking us if we wanted to sit outside--but it was showering already and, really, outside when it's showering?
Sorry, you could have seated us before some of those 4-somes, gotten them to sit outside.
Now, maybe you have to be one of those people who really doesn't know how to cook very well
so is impressed with the food served here.
But since all 3 of us cook rather well, and I could have tossed together scrambled eggs with oyster 'srooms myself....
Yea, potatoes were good and something I don't normally eat but servings are too big (
my sister and I could have shared one serving)--and
I hate wasting food.
The chefs are ace though, looked like every single order they sent out was perfect.
I just don't think it's worth the time and money and is "trendy."
Since you do have to wait so long, they ought to at least offer you something while you're waiting--free coffee or something.
And anyone eating there ought to keep in mind that there are a lot of other people outside waiting--
SO YOU DON'T
SIT

THERE GABBING FOR HOURS after you finish eating, take yourselves elsewhere if you want to continue the conversation and free up a table; this isn't the place to hog a table considering their limited business hours.
And, incidentally, there are a couple eateries along 18th St. that looked perfectly good to me, plus Goat Hill pizza is within about 3 blocks--all good alternatives to this place.

excerpts: The plow is two eggs, choice of house made pork sausage, Nueske bacon, or chicken apple sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes + crispy potatoes.
crispy potatoes.author: Jayne A.
crispy potatoes.review:
If you are indecisive (like me) get the plow so you can get a taste of everything. The plow is two eggs, choice of house made pork sausage, Nueske bacon, or chicken apple sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes + crispy potatoes.

The pancakes sound weird but they are definitely worth trying. The home fries are unique since they have both crunchy and chunky pieces.
