There are small pieces that are basically French fries and others that are like home fries. It is an awesome mix since you usually only get home fries for breakfast. All in all a wonderful start to my Sunday. 

Although the wait was pretty long, the service was great so I am more than willing to come back for the plow anytime.

excerpts: Look, everything here is outrageously delicious, fresh, and not at all overpriced, but BY GOD, you'd better include some crispy potatoes with whatever else you get.
crispy potatoes.author: Matthew L.
crispy potatoes.review:
Get. The. Crispy. Potatoes.

Look, everything here is outrageously delicious, fresh, and not at all overpriced, but BY GOD, you'd better include some crispy potatoes with whatever else you get. I had the plow and my wife had the almond pancakes, and both of our dishes were incredibly tasty, blah, blah -

But the potatoes? Oh man, the potatoes. I have dreams about those things. Dreams that turn into nightmares when I realize I don't actually have them. They're super-crispy, flavorful, and incredimazing. My wife broke her no-potatoes rule to eat them, and by 'them', I mean half my portion. I couldn't blame her, either - they're that good.

Also, service is nice, especially considering that it's always crowded, and yes, prepare yourself for about an hour wait on the weekends, depending. It's worth it. It's really, really worth it.

excerpts: Had to try the highly recommended lemon ricotta pancakes and crispy potatoes, hoping to be impressed with zesty fluffiness and savory heartiness---Disappointed.
Perhaps there were high expectations, but definitely had better.
3 stars may be a bit generous.
crispy potatoes.author: Cindy L.
crispy potatoes.review: Food was ok. Had to try the highly recommended lemon ricotta pancakes and crispy potatoes, hoping to be impressed with zesty fluffiness and savory heartiness---Disappointed. Perhaps there were high expectations, but definitely had better. 3 stars may be a bit generous.

excerpts: Crispy potatoes so good

that when I dropped one on the floor I thought "5 second rule!"
4 year old said, "when I finish my French toast can I order another one?
" even though he had a full adult sized portion.
Go early and get a spot.
This place fills up fast and has a line around the corner!
crispy potatoes.author: krystin k.
crispy potatoes.review:
Crispy potatoes so good that when I dropped one on the floor I thought "5 second rule!"
4 year old said, "when I finish my French toast can I order another one?" even though he had a full adult sized portion.
Go early and get a spot. This place fills up fast and has a line around the corner!

excerpts: The crispy potatoes are different and good!
The do a lot of different things here which I really appreciate.
The only issue I have is the pancakes are always under-cooked.
They are still wet in the middle.
I'll have to request my pancakes "well" in the future.
Nice little spot with very nice people, good food and great service.
crispy potatoes.author: Ron U.
crispy potatoes.review:
I've only had breakfast here. Love their homemade sausage.The crispy potatoes are different and good! The do a lot of different things here which I really appreciate. The only issue I have is the pancakes are always under-cooked. They are still wet in the middle. I'll have to request my pancakes "well" in the future.
Nice little spot with very nice people, good food and great service.

excerpts: Loved how they had a sweet and savory option - The Plow - with 2 lemon ricotta pancakes, eggs, crispy potatoes and your choice of house made sausage patties, chicken apple sausage or bacon.
Overall, a sweet neighborhood gem.
Would probably come back if the wait weren't so long!
crispy potatoes.author: Lisa H.
crispy potatoes.review: De-lightful! First, I must say I've never had such pleasant service for brunch in SF. 5 stars for Katie, our server. Parking was easy, but the wait was killer, close to 2 hours, however it makes sense since the place is tiny and they don't rush you. We put our name down and made a Philz Coffee run with time to spare. Nonetheless! Loved how they had a sweet and savory option - The Plow - with 2 lemon ricotta pancakes, eggs, crispy potatoes and your choice of house made sausage patties, chicken apple sausage or bacon. Overall, a sweet neighborhood gem. Would probably come back if the wait weren't so long!

excerpts: They did have very good crispy potatoes though.
crispy potatoes.author: Alison A.
crispy potatoes.review:
I ate here a couple weeks ago with my mom and sister. Parking was pretty easy to find, but it might take a couple trips around the block. The wait was around 45 minutes as promised.. A few groups got to be seated sooner, but sadly a bunch of groups came back who had been passed up on the list earlier.

Mom and sister both got the plow, and I had some of theirs. From all of the rave reviews, I was really expecting to be "wowed" by the lemon ricotta pancakes. I found them to be yummy but nothing special. They did have very good crispy potatoes though.

I had the french toast with kumquat compote. Sadly, I was very unimpressed by this dish. It was okay, but I make better french toast. I finished it though. It was not inedible. They did have some yummy bacon which i ordered as a side.

Customer service was friendly, which is always a plus. The girl working the front door and our waitress were both very nice. As far as eating here again, I wouldn't go out of my way for it, but if the occasion arose, I wouldn't protest.

excerpts: The Crispy Potatoes are amazing as are the Lemon Ricotta Pancakes and of the egg dises I've had, the scrambled eggs are delicious.
crispy potatoes.author: Alasdair S.
crispy potatoes.review:
French Toast doesn't get better than this.

French Toast is, most usually, the dish I order when going out to breakfast/brunch. Up until now it's been a matter of comparing dishes that are that are ok to terrible but it's not fair to even think of comparing Plow to anywhere else. The Crispy Potatoes are amazing as are the Lemon Ricotta Pancakes and of the egg dises I've had, the scrambled eggs are delicious.

The excellence of the food has to, of course, be attributed to great chefs but also to the quality of the ingredients all sourced from local farms.

The only gripe I can make is about their coffee which, as one would correctly assume, is excellent but the $3 per cup (free refills) price tag is a bit steep.

Based on various other reviews here, I've never considered going on the weekend but have never had to wait more than five minutes for a table on a mid-morning weekday and have never had an issue with parking. However, if you can only make it on the weekend I would say that the wait is worth it.

excerpts: In this case it was "The Plow" (two of their lemon ricotta pancakes, two eggs, Nueske bacon and crispy potatoes).
This is my usual breakfast choice anyways--like pancakes but gotta have breakfast meat and potatoes or hash browns!
Even though food took some time coming out, my table was happy with our orders.
The savory bread pudding was a hit as was the BLT, hamburger and egg sandwich.
The table also shared an order of the French toast which all seemed to enjoy and describe as a hybrid with bread pudding.
I was too full so resisted trying it.
crispy potatoes.author: Christopher W.
crispy potatoes.review:
First off, couldn't resist a "Go Aggies!"--I did not know that Plow was co-owned by a fellow Aggie, until my friend Mindy pointed it out.  Very cool to see Aggie alum out and doing what they are passionate about. :-)

I stumbled upon Plow using Yelp Nearby on my Android phone in Dec '10 when my buddies and I finished up the Anchor Steam brewery tour.  Unfortunately at that point people decided it was easier to go back to The Marina (joy.)  Since then I have been wanting to check out Plow purely for the solid reviews and the lemon ricotta pancakes! :-)

When we decided to grab breakfast in SF this weekend, I suggested it and even though it was off the beaten path, people thought we should check it out!  My buddy Richard made it on time (9:30am) when we said we would meet and put in our name for a table of 6.  A little over an hour later we sat down.  The kitchen was bustling and people seemed to be enjoying their food!

I usually order what I first put my eye on.  In this case it was "The Plow" (two of their lemon ricotta pancakes, two eggs, Nueske bacon and crispy potatoes).  This is my usual breakfast choice anyways--like pancakes but gotta have breakfast meat and potatoes or hash browns!  Even though food took some time coming out, my table was happy with our orders.  The savory bread pudding was a hit as was the BLT, hamburger and egg sandwich.  The table also shared an order of the French toast which all seemed to enjoy and describe as a hybrid with bread pudding.  I was too full so resisted trying it.  Next time.

One of the great perks (for all coffee drinkers) is that they allow you/and even offer you coffee while you are waiting!  Didn't see if they actually ended up charging for it.  Regardless it's a nice gesture.  

Great to see business so solid, and if there was a way to get the wait down, I will be highly likely to return!

excerpts: Oh almost forgot, the Crispy Potatoes are sooooo goood.
crispy potatoes.author: Nithya S.
crispy potatoes.review:
I usually don't go to brunch places that don't take reservations only because I find it very very hard to wait in line and smell all the good food and not being able to eat it (you know what I mean ;)).  Well now if you decide to try this place you are most likely going to wait for anywhere between 30-40mins. Our party of 5 arrived and had to wait nearly an hour to get our table which was outside.  Would have preferred a table inside, but after an hour of waiting, I starving and was frankly very glad to get A table. 

By the time we settled down at our table and were ready to order, they were sold out of monkey bread and huevos rancheros! The 2 two things I was going to try here. Well instead I decided to order the Eggs Benedict and decided to share "the plow" with my friend (hey don't judge me I was starving!! :D).  The Hollandaise sauce was too lemony for my taste and didn't quite compliment the poached eggs and the veggies.  On the other hand, the Lemon ricotta pancakes are to die for, they so moist.  Do not leave this place without trying the lemon ricotta pancakes.  Oh almost forgot, the Crispy Potatoes are sooooo goood. 

Frankly I have had better food at places with less of a wait time than here.

excerpts: Crispy potatoes were very nice.
Mushroom and point Reyes cheese sandwich on an acme roll was outstanding.
crispy potatoes.author: Bleep S.
crispy potatoes.review: Plow offers high quality,delicious food.Lemon ricotta pancakes were more puddingish than cakey.Smoked trout salad was tossed with the most flavorful olive oil,lemon,garlic dressing in recent memory. Fantastically delicious salad with salty smoked trout, avocado and frisee. Crispy potatoes were very nice. Mushroom and point Reyes cheese sandwich on an acme roll was outstanding. Abita root beer was refreshing...Small place.We waited 20 minutes on a Wednesday at 1:00.

excerpts: I had the plow, which consisted of bacon, eggs, crispy potatoes (my 2nd favorite item on the plate), and the mini lemon ricotta pancakes (the best part on the plate).
I don't know why, but the potatoes just stood out for me.
They were perfectly crispy and had a nice herb flavor.
I've wanted to try lemon ricotta pancakes for a while
and I'm glad I got to try it here.
They were fluffy and moist.
You get the subtle underlying flavors of lemon in there, like when eating a lemon cream filled cookie.
crispy potatoes.author: robin w.
crispy potatoes.review:
I had no idea the hill it was located on was so steep. My friend almost flew out of her seat as she stepped out. If she weren't holding on to the steering wheel she would have hurdled into the car beside us. I love the place though. It almost seems like Mama's, but more contemporary and casual. We also didn't have to wait in line. Amazing.

The ceiling was just gigantic. It makes you feel like you're 2 feet tall. Beside us were the towering windows and everything in the restaurant made you feel welcome. Absolutely loved the service. Out waitress was so nice and came by to check it everything was well. 

Now for the food. I had the plow, which consisted of bacon, eggs, crispy potatoes (my 2nd favorite item on the plate), and the mini lemon ricotta pancakes (the best part on the plate). I don't know why, but the potatoes just stood out for me. They were perfectly crispy and had a nice herb flavor. I've wanted to try lemon ricotta pancakes for a while and I'm glad I got to try it here. They were fluffy and moist. You get the subtle underlying flavors of lemon in there, like when eating a lemon cream filled cookie. So good. 

I also got to try the french toast. Just delightful. The pure maple syrup really made it taste as good as it did, but I think the ingredient that really did it was the caramel. There was a bit of caramel on the bananas and it just made it stand out from all the other french toast that I've had before. 

I'd love to come here again. Maybe on a sunnier day, but there will probably be a long line. A bit pricey for a breakfast joint, but the ambiance is really amazing there and it's worth a try.

excerpts:
Bacon is a must
Crispy potatoes lived up to it's name
Lemon Ricotta Pancake is where I want to die and go to heaven
crispy potatoes.author: John M.
crispy potatoes.review:
Worth every minute of the 90 minute wait.

I believe the sign of a good breakfast joint is one that does a great job w/ the potatoes. I should be able to devour them--catsup and salt free--and want to go back for more. Good potatoes are really hard to do well if you simply don't put time into them, and I've found that time and time again any brunch joint that delivers great fried spuds will kill it with every other dish

And Plow did just that

Egg sandwich was legendary. Bacon is a must
Crispy potatoes lived up to it's name
Lemon Ricotta Pancake is where I want to die and go to heaven

excerpts: I'm still thinking about the crispy potatoes and the Dungeness crab scramble two days (a year) later.
crispy potatoes.author: Jessica P.
crispy potatoes.review:
I'm still thinking about the crispy potatoes and the Dungeness crab scramble two days (a year) later. 

Pork sausage was good, and the lemon ricotta pancakes were good too, but it's that scramble...

what was I talking about before? totally the favorite brunch place. Totally the only brunch place I dream about or think about or compare all other brunch places to. 

Contemplating dinging it a star for ridiculous wait times. like almost 2 hours ridiculous.

excerpts: Lemon ricotta pancakes and crispy potatoes made the two hour wait totally worth it.
crispy potatoes.author: lisa l.
crispy potatoes.review: Lemon ricotta pancakes and crispy potatoes made the two hour wait totally worth it.

excerpts: First time here so I decided to go with the "plow" sampler -- eggs (scrambled), chicken apple sausage, crispy potatoes and two lemon ricotta pancakes.
I'm getting full again even typing it out.
Definitely could have fed two people.
The crispy potatoes were very crispy, and I would have preferred a few more sautéed onions mixed in there to break up the starch overload.
Pancakes were good, moist and with the right degree of sweetness, but not spectacular.
Eggs were fluffy and yummy, probably the best part of the dish.
The nice thing was that we didn't have to wait for a table during lunchtime, and that they always serve brunch for lunch on the weekdays too.
crispy potatoes.author: Joyce H.
crispy potatoes.review: First time here so I decided to go with the "plow" sampler -- eggs (scrambled), chicken apple sausage, crispy potatoes and two lemon ricotta pancakes. I'm getting full again even typing it out. Definitely could have fed two people. The crispy potatoes were very crispy, and I would have preferred a few more sautéed onions mixed in there to break up the starch overload. Pancakes were good, moist and with the right degree of sweetness, but not spectacular. Eggs were fluffy and yummy, probably the best part of the dish. The nice thing was that we didn't have to wait for a table during lunchtime, and that they always serve brunch for lunch on the weekdays too.

excerpts: The crispy potatoes are very good as are the almond flour pancakes.
The bacon was not crispy, but a bit blackened like it had been cooked over an oven with a lot of burnt grease.
The bacon ruined the experience for me.
I will have to avoid ordering that next time.
I think the seats at the counter are the best seats in the house, since there's a direct view of the action in the kitchen.
crispy potatoes.author: Jenny K.
crispy potatoes.review: The crispy potatoes are very good as are the almond flour pancakes.  The bacon was not crispy, but a bit blackened like it had been cooked over an oven with a lot of burnt grease.  The bacon ruined the experience for me.  I will have to avoid ordering that next time.  I think the seats at the counter are the best seats in the house, since there's a direct view of the action in the kitchen.

excerpts: I had the omelette: lamb's quarters, mushrooms, goat cheese, crispy potatoes, toast.
TO DIE...you wouldn't believe how well the egg was cooked to perfection.
Wasn't dry nor was it under cooked.
Never had a more perfect omelette egg!
And the potatoes - never had anything like them.
crispy potatoes.author: Meredith K.
crispy potatoes.review:
This place is ahmazing!  My sister & bro-in-law keep talking about it since their friend's sister owns it.  Exceeded my expectations.   
We waited for about 20 mins for a table for 3 on a Friday around 11am.  Yes, it was crowded believe it or not.  It's super cute, quaint restaurant with lots of windows!

I had the omelette: lamb's quarters, mushrooms, goat cheese, crispy potatoes, toast.  TO DIE...you wouldn't believe how well the egg was cooked to perfection.  Wasn't dry nor was it under cooked.  Never had a more perfect omelette egg!  And the potatoes - never had anything like them.  Super tasty as they were tossed in sea salt flakes and the crispiness is like no other.

One friend had the breakfast sandwich which looked good, and the other had the plow which looked like a classic bfast to get especially if you're undecided.  We added a short stack of the lemon ricotta pancakes which were good.  I'm more of a savory breakfast eater so I was extremely content with my bfast.  

I highly recommend and would definitely come back - preferably on a weekday.

excerpts: I recommend the granola, salmon, and crispy potatoes.
crispy potatoes.author: Archie R.
crispy potatoes.review:
I plowed my girlfriend this weekend.

I was pretty excited to plow, but I made sure to not finish too fast. 

I took my time and savored every moment.

And she, for once, loved it.

She loved it so much, she even paid!!

I recommend the granola, salmon, and crispy potatoes.

Safe.

excerpts: They're known for their crispy potatoes and they definitely were crispy.
There's a gluten-free option for pancakes, which I got.
crispy potatoes.author: Green Y.
crispy potatoes.review:
Came for Sunday brunch. We were told it would be a 10-minute wait. We were seated after 20 minutes. The food was excellent. They're known for their crispy potatoes and they definitely were crispy. There's a gluten-free option for pancakes, which I got. Service was a bit slow, but the waitstaff was very nice - it was just crowded.

The reason I left off the last star is because they have the world's most uncomfortable chairs.

excerpts: Yelp-ers seem to rave about the crispy potatoes, but the "crispy" potatoes that came with my "the plow" dish were only ok.
The potato was not even cut into pieces all the way, so I got like one big chunk of the potato.
crispy potatoes.author: Richard S.
crispy potatoes.review:
This place is overrated at best.  We came here for Sunday brunch and I was sorely disappointed by the food.  

The food tasted like its chef... snobby.

To be fair, the wait staff was very friendly though.

The decor and ambiance make it look like a good restaurant but the food does not live up to expectations.  As the old saying goes, you can't judge a book by it's cover.

We sat down at our table at 1pm (one hour before closing time), so maybe they were running tired and were starting to run out of ingredients.  But man, the food was sub par.

We ordered:
* lemon ricotta pancakes - 3 stars - Average taste.
* crispy pig ears - 1 star - Tasted like rubber.
* fried egg sandwich - 3 star - Average taste, but it was the best dish we had.
* "the plow" (your typical American breakfast with eggs, choice of breakfast meat, pancakes and potatoes) - 2 stars - The bacon tasted good, but then again, it's hard to mess up bacon.  Everything else tasted like what you might get from a free continental breakfast at your good ol' Best Western.  Yelp-ers seem to rave about the crispy potatoes, but the "crispy" potatoes that came with my "the plow" dish were only ok.  The potato was not even cut into pieces all the way, so I got like one big chunk of the potato.  The other dishes at other tables seemed to have smaller potato pieces (almost like home fries), but mine was one huge chunk.

Maybe they're still working out the kinks because they're new.  Maybe their lunch items are better.

But honestly, the best thing I had was the Tapatio hot sauce.

excerpts: The portions were the perfect size, and everything was wonderful, from the different kinds of eggs to the crispy potatoes to the pancakes to the biscuits and gravy.
Oh, and not to mention the creme brulee our waitress talked us into for dessert.
crispy potatoes.author: Stephanie W.
crispy potatoes.review:
When they tell you that the wait is going to be an hour and twenty minutes, they're not joking. Really. If you're not keen on waiting, I'd recommend arriving right when they open at 8am, not at 11am like normal Sunday brunchers. 

After an hour and a half chilling on the sidewalk, needless to say we were starving. In fact, I was so hungry I could barely hold a conversation. Luckily, our waitress was super sweet and took our order right away. We decided to start with the bakery basket, which came out promptly and steaming hot and fresh. There's nothing like pastries baked that morning to start a day off right, and these were no exception. The basket featured a corn millet muffin, a currant scone and a buttermilk biscuit, all of which were exceptional with oh-so-good perfect crunchiness on the top. (We might, of course, have been slightly biased by how hungry we were.)

Despite the wait to be seated, once we ordered our food it actually came out pretty quickly. The portions were the perfect size, and everything was wonderful, from the different kinds of eggs to the crispy potatoes to the pancakes to the biscuits and gravy. Oh, and not to mention the creme brulee our waitress talked us into for dessert. Even though we were stuffed, my friends and I were still nearly licking the ramekin. 

Other lovely things:
- Even though the place is tiny, there are high ceilings and big windows so it feels airier and larger than it is
- Service was delightful. There were also enough people working to keep everything moving quickly (except table turnover...)
- The kitchen is entirely open, so you can see everything as it's happening. 
- The menu is full of a million things I'd love to try, and all the ingredients are sourced fresh from local farms.

Unfortunately, because of the hour and a half wait, I don't think we'll be heading back here any time soon. I just can't wait that long for my breakfast, at least not without getting something to eat first.

excerpts: The crispy potatoes perfectly crisp and flavorful, didn't even need ketchup!
And the sausage was equally to die for.
What else can I say?
amazing!
crispy potatoes.author: Lindsay A.
crispy potatoes.review:
Everything I was hoping for and more! 
OK, so the wait was a bit long (40 minutes) on a Sunday but boy was it worth it! We sat at the counter which was cozy and gave us a nice view of all the yummy foods coming out. I got the Plow with the chicken apple sausage which gave me a little taste of everything. EVERY SINGLE THING ON THE PLATE WAS AMAZING!
I don't know how some place can make even scrambled eggs more amazing than anywhere else, but Plow manages to make them that way. The lemon ricotta pancakes were moist and delicious. The crispy potatoes perfectly crisp and flavorful, didn't even need ketchup! And the sausage was equally to die for. What else can I say? amazing!

excerpts:
Standouts included:
+Lemon Ricotta Pancakes (house made ricotta, lemon zest, pure maple syrup) 
+Tinga (chicken in tomato chipotle sauce, two crispy corn tortillas, avocado, creme fraiche, cilantro)
+Crispy Potatoes

Mid-conversation, my friend let out a big 'MMMM!!!!

Looking forward to coming back to Plow ASAP to try their Fried Egg Sandwich, The Plow (two eggs, choice of Nueske bacon, house made pork sausage, or chicken apple sausage, two pancakes & crispy potatoes), and/or a Chocolate Eclair.
crispy potatoes.author: Tiffany M.
crispy potatoes.review:
I'm not one to vouch for restaurants that often, but in Plow's case, I guarantee that you'll like it... in fact, you'll LOVE it. I should also note that I almost never rate a place 5 stars based on a first time visit, but Plow was so freakin' good, that I feel confident in giving them 5 shiny stars.

Everything at Plow tasted just as good as it looked.

Standouts included:
+Lemon Ricotta Pancakes (house made ricotta, lemon zest, pure maple syrup) 
+Tinga (chicken in tomato chipotle sauce, two crispy corn tortillas, avocado, creme fraiche, cilantro)
+Crispy Potatoes

Mid-conversation, my friend let out a big 'MMMM!!!!" when he bit into his pancakes. I couldn't have agreed more! 

I like the fact that they work w/ local purveyors such as Frog Hollow Farms, Cowgirl Creamery, Monterey Fish Co, Acme Bread & Tcho Chocolate. When you see that they work w/ such local all-stars, you know you're in for a treat. I also really enjoyed Plow's Equator coffee while I waited for our table. And that wait was long! We came in at 11:30 am and had to wait an hour until we were seated. Normally I'd shoot for a much earlier brunch time to avoid the wait, but given that I was prepared for a leisurely Sunday brunch, the wait was pretty painless.

I love the ambiance of this place. It's small, but w/ their high ceilings and all the light that shines in from their big windows, they're able to make the space work; especially decorated in its rustic, modern, simplistic fashion. I love their signage, logo and menu- all well done. They also have stool seating where you can watch the chefs work their magic (like we did!)

The host was cool and our server efficient. Parking was ample (not surprising for Portrero Hill ) and diners seemed to be all SF locals. 

Looking forward to coming back to Plow ASAP to try their Fried Egg Sandwich, The Plow (two eggs, choice of Nueske bacon, house made pork sausage, or chicken apple sausage, two pancakes & crispy potatoes), and/or a Chocolate Eclair.

This place makes me thankful for SF's amazing food scene!

excerpts: My sister and I split and the Plow order and it was an amazing sampler of delectable delights including: lemon ricotta pancakes,  home made pork sausages, crispy potatoes with rosemary and two eggs
any style that your heart desires.
When they say crispy potatoes, they really mean crispy.
We actually got specific recommendations to get their potatoes since they are so yummy there
and it was totally true.
Forget your usual limp, dry, mealy home fries, these are crunchy, crispy and delightful.
I LOVED the lemon ricotta pancakes, they were fluffy, tart and delicious!
I wished I got a whole order of these lovely treats.
We were deciding between the chicken apple sausage but was easily convinced to try the pork instead they were made in house and were delicious.
They were made sans casing and were tasty and succulent.
My friend got the omelet made with spinach and oyster mushrooms and that was amazing as well.
Bottom line: the food here is great and totally worth the wait ;)
crispy potatoes.author: Vivian T.
crispy potatoes.review: Long wait but probably a good sign.  They do provide coffee for the wait.  My sister and I split and the Plow order and it was an amazing sampler of delectable delights including: lemon ricotta pancakes,  home made pork sausages, crispy potatoes with rosemary and two eggs any style that your heart desires. When they say crispy potatoes, they really mean crispy.  We actually got specific recommendations to get their potatoes since they are so yummy there and it was totally true.  Forget your usual limp, dry, mealy home fries, these are crunchy, crispy and delightful.  I LOVED the lemon ricotta pancakes, they were fluffy, tart and delicious! I wished I got a whole order of these lovely treats.  We were deciding between the chicken apple sausage but was easily convinced to try the pork instead they were made in house and were delicious.  They were made sans casing and were tasty and succulent.  My friend got the omelet made with spinach and oyster mushrooms and that was amazing as well.  Bottom line: the food here is great and totally worth the wait ;)

excerpts: The second dish (The Plow) was also a mix of mostly flavorless items (exception being the crispy potatoes that were flavorful and crispy).
crispy potatoes.author: d f.
crispy potatoes.review:
This is the worst breakfast/brunch I've had in ages -- I am still traumatized that I spent time and money going to check out this place.  Of note, I had no expectations and did not read any reviews prior.  In fact, I am now even more shocked that this restaurant has so many good reviews.  The only reason I don't give Zero stars is because I can't.

The french toast was tasteless.  The pears that came with it didn't enhance the taste at all.  I also asked for bananas and since they came later, I was such a state of disbelief that I didn't even try with the french toast -- I had 3 bites and I was disgusted -- no amount of syrup or anything else could save that so called "item".

The second dish (The Plow) was also a mix of mostly flavorless items (exception being the crispy potatoes that were flavorful and crispy).

My suggestion to anyone reading this: if you want a good brunch, basically any other  place in the City will do.  If you want very good brunch, go to Tangerine, Mission Cafe, Tartine, just to name a few.  If you want an excellent brunch, WITH THE BEST FRENCH TOAST IN TOWN, THE GOLD STANDARD OF FRENCH TOATS, go to Foreing Cinema.

I've lived in the City for over 20 years and I honestly do not recall having such a horrible brunch as far as the food is concerned.  The waitress was genuinely nice and polite, but never came back to ask if the food was good.  The fact that we did leave half of the small order on the plate, and more than half of the lemon ricotta pancakes should've been a clue to anyone paying attention

excerpts: The crispy potatoes are other worldly!
crispy potatoes.author: HipsterChick S.
crispy potatoes.review: Plan ahead...get here well before you die of hunger because the wait is long...with good reason. My favorite brunch in SF hands down. Order The Plow and tons of pancakes...lemon ricotta or almond. The crispy potatoes are other worldly!

excerpts: Their dungeness crab scramble (with fresh crab meat!) was delicious, as well as the side of crispy potatoes.
crispy potatoes.author: Jennifer L.
crispy potatoes.review:
Plow continues to be one of my favorite brunch spots in the city.  My friend and I only waited 20-25 minutes for an inside table (chalking it up to people being out of town for the holidays ;p), but we were bracing ourselves for at least a 45 min wait.  The staff was really friendly and timely with their service... as soon as we sat down our cups were filled with coffee!  Their dungeness crab scramble (with fresh crab meat!) was delicious, as well as the side of crispy potatoes.  

Even as we wrapped up our meals and continued to chat, my friend and I never felt rushed to vacate the table.  I really appreciated this because for a place like Plow where there's always a long line, you would think patrons were quickly shuttled in and out in order to accommodate all the hungry customers.  That wasn't the case; We were able to enjoy our catch up session without feeling pressure to hurry, and the staff continued to fill our coffee cups even though it was clear we were done eating.  

For their great service and outstanding, fresh food, I always include Plow on my recommended list of brunch spots in the city, even if the wait can be more than 20-25 minutes!

excerpts: We ordered The Plow [2 eggs, 2 small lemon ricotta pancakes, bacon (or sausage) and crispy potatoes], as well as an order of the French Toast (mascarpone and strawberries on top).
Both were delicious!
Staff was friendly and street parking was easy that early.
Will be back again soon!
With a pot of tea, I think our total (including tip) was about $45.
crispy potatoes.author: L S.
crispy potatoes.review: Arrived early (before 8am) on a Friday morning and were seated right away. We ordered The Plow [2 eggs, 2 small lemon ricotta pancakes, bacon (or sausage) and crispy potatoes], as well as an order of the French Toast (mascarpone and strawberries on top). Both were delicious! Staff was friendly and street parking was easy that early. Will be back again soon! With a pot of tea, I think our total (including tip) was about $45.

excerpts: If the chef at plow could make a homemade hot sauce to go with their bomb crispy potatoes, I would be very very VERY grateful.
crispy potatoes.author: Mariposa D.
crispy potatoes.review:
Best brunch in San Francisco! The lemon ricotta pancakes, all of their fresh salads, the muffins, the mimosas. All awesome. 

The only weird part is that they only carry Youk's hot sauce. That stuff tastes like clogged drain. If the chef at plow could make a homemade hot sauce to go with their bomb crispy potatoes, I would be very very VERY grateful.

excerpts: I got "The Plow" which comes with crispy potatoes, two eggs, choice of bacon, pork sausage or chicken sausage and two lemon ricotta pancakes.
The crispy potatoes were also a hit
and I was just disappointed I couldn't manage to finish them all.
The lemon ricotta pancakes were pretty good as well.
Just enough sweetness and a good lemon flavor.
My only complaint is that they were a bit on the dry side and lacked fluffiness.
The freshly squeezed orange juice was also a plus.
The place is very small and it was completely packed when we visited.
Despite this, service was great.
I look forward to visiting the Plow on my next visit to SF.
crispy potatoes.author: Gema S.
crispy potatoes.review: We were lucky to come across this place on a recent trip to SF because it was close to where we were staying, and it was quite a find! The first time we came here it was about 10:30 and there was an hour wait. We decided not to wait and came back the next day at opening because the pictures of the food looked so good on Yelp. I'm so glad we came back! The next day we had no wait and were seated quickly once the place opened. I got "The Plow" which comes with crispy potatoes, two eggs, choice of bacon, pork sausage or chicken sausage and two lemon ricotta pancakes. I got mine with the nueske bacon and I have to say it was the best bacon I've ever had. Slightly sweet and salty and they were very generous with the portions. The crispy potatoes were also a hit and I was just disappointed I couldn't manage to finish them all. The lemon ricotta pancakes were pretty good as well. Just enough sweetness and a good lemon flavor. My only complaint is that they were a bit on the dry side and lacked fluffiness. The freshly squeezed orange juice was also a plus. The place is very small and it was completely packed when we visited. Despite this, service was great. I look forward to visiting the Plow on my next visit to SF.

excerpts: First the food: everything we ordered was great: egg scramble with fresh tomatoes, greens, goat cheese; lemon ricotta pancakes; eggs benedict with crispy potatoes; steak and scrambled eggs; and a plate of fresh nectarines, figs, plums, and melons.
Our gluttonous bellies were full and satisfied when we left.
crispy potatoes.author: Sean K.
crispy potatoes.review:
First off, I wish there was a half-star option because I'd use here to boost UP to 3.5 stars, as Plow was closer to good than just A-OK.

First the food: everything we ordered was great: egg scramble with fresh tomatoes, greens, goat cheese; lemon ricotta pancakes; eggs benedict with crispy potatoes; steak and scrambled eggs; and a plate of fresh nectarines, figs, plums, and melons. Our gluttonous bellies were full and satisfied when we left. We sat at the counter and watched the dishes come off the line, which was essentially food porn in action.

All the staff we interacted with were friendly and welcoming, worth a special shout out when considering the intense brunch rush in the place.

Now for the bad: the wait. The stated 45 minute wait for two people became a bit over an hour, which is ok; the ebb and flow of restaurant traffic can't be predicted sometimes. By the time we sat down, we were understandably ravenous and wired from a couple cups of coffee in line. It took ten minutes for our server to get to us, and once we ordered, it was clear that everything was going to come out together 25-30 minutes later. We managed to get our fruit plate out early, but after waiting 90 minutes, we wish the food would have been paced better to get some of our sides out. We share some of the fault on this one for not conveying how hungry we were (and in turn how long we'd already been waiting), but wish the server would have picked up on this. Maybe we wear gaunt really well?

Worth going to--plan for the heinous wait and you'll be happier.

excerpts: I ordered The Plow which consists of two eggs, choice of house made pork sausage, Nueske bacon, or chicken apple sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes and crispy potatoes.
This was not cheap as the price of admission was $15.75, but it didn't fail to satisfy.
The potatoes were some of the best I've had in the city, super crispy and salty.
The eggs were scrambled to perfection and the pancakes may have been the highlight here.
And the bacon, was well bacon.
You can't really go wrong with bacon.
All in all, the entire experience was enjoyable and the waitress even prevented my from getting a parking ticket as halfway through the meal
she warned me there was street sweeping.
The neighborhood is a little out of the way if you are just visiting, but there is a great view of the skyline from across the street.
Definitely worth checking out if you've got some spare time.
Would highly suggest avoiding this place on the weekends.
#foodcomaking approved.
crispy potatoes.author: Food Coma K.
crispy potatoes.review: In the past few weeks, Plow has frequently become the main topic of conversation when talking about brunch. Unless you get there around 7am on weekends, you are looking at waiting over two hours which is insane if you ask me. This morning I just so happened to be in the area and drove by to see many open spots inside so I decided to stop and see what all the fuss is about. I was seated immediately and was able to get in and out of the establishment in under a half an hour which was awesome. The food was great. Worth waiting two hours for? Probably not, but then again I'm not sure any food is worth waiting two hours for. I ordered The Plow which consists of two eggs, choice of house made pork sausage, Nueske bacon, or chicken apple sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes and crispy potatoes. This was not cheap as the price of admission was $15.75, but it didn't fail to satisfy. The potatoes were some of the best I've had in the city, super crispy and salty. The eggs were scrambled to perfection and the pancakes may have been the highlight here. And the bacon, was well bacon. You can't really go wrong with bacon. All in all, the entire experience was enjoyable and the waitress even prevented my from getting a parking ticket as halfway through the meal she warned me there was street sweeping. The neighborhood is a little out of the way if you are just visiting, but there is a great view of the skyline from across the street. Definitely worth checking out if you've got some spare time. Would highly suggest avoiding this place on the weekends. #foodcomaking approved.

excerpts: My wife had "the Plow" breakfast (lemon ricotta pancakes, sausage, crispy potatoes, scrambled eggs) and I ordered the "Scramble" (chanterelles, goat cheese, scallions with salad and acme toast).
crispy potatoes.author: J. SOMA S.
crispy potatoes.review:
This is a SOLID FOUR STAR establishment.  I had breakfast with my wife this morning and it was wonderful.

My wife had "the Plow" breakfast (lemon ricotta pancakes, sausage, crispy potatoes, scrambled eggs) and I ordered the "Scramble" (chanterelles, goat cheese, scallions with salad and acme toast).

The service was excellent -- and the coffee was hot and strong.

I will be back.  Well done, this is a good new addition to the SF restaurant scene.

excerpts: If anything, go for the crispy potatoes & bakery basket.
As a savory bruncher myself - I highly recommend the cider brined pork chop - it was moist and well... delicously SAVORY.
The ambiance, equally charming, consist of modern-farmhouse-style reclaimed wood tables/countertops & industrial style chairs and barstools.
crispy potatoes.author: Tina T.
crispy potatoes.review:
The staff is charming/hospitable & engaged in conversation with what seemed like every single patron - dining or waiting.  

Everything here is absolutely delicious!  If anything, go for the crispy potatoes & bakery basket.  As a savory bruncher myself - I highly recommend the cider brined pork chop - it was moist and well... delicously SAVORY. 
 
The ambiance, equally charming, consist of modern-farmhouse-style reclaimed wood tables/countertops & industrial style chairs and barstools.  Eco-friendyly note - even their salt and pepper shakers are made of recycled glass.

A definite top contender in the SF brunch scene!

excerpts: The crispy potatoes were amazing!
I had the soft scrambled egg with asparagus and mushroom
and I loved it!
The almond pancakes were good but didn't taste like almond
and I would've preferred fresh fruit vs compote on it.
The wait was a little too long.
Overall it was a great experience.
crispy potatoes.author: Elahe H.
crispy potatoes.review: The food was excellent. The crispy potatoes were amazing! I had the soft scrambled egg with asparagus and mushroom and I loved it!  The almond pancakes were good but didn't taste like almond and I would've preferred fresh fruit vs compote on it. The wait was a little too long. Overall it was a great experience.

excerpts: Great crispy potatoes!
Fried egg sandwich was amazing!
crispy potatoes.author: Kristoff F.
crispy potatoes.review: Great crispy potatoes! Fried egg sandwich was amazing!

excerpts: The first time I had the open face egg sandwich with pork sausage and crispy potatoes.
crispy potatoes.author: Christie X.
crispy potatoes.review:
Really great place for brunch.  Another reason why I want to live in Potrero Hill.

The restaurant has a really nice vibe inside.  The words that come to mind right now are warm, fresh, clean, comfort, and modern. Right when you walk in, you see the open kitchen with seating at the counter (they even have purse hooks underneath - love it).  Both times that I've been here for brunch on Saturdays I had less than a five minute wait (hooray).  So far everyone that I've met has been very nice and attentive (please don't lose that as you gain more notoriety).  

The first time I had the open face egg sandwich with pork sausage and crispy potatoes.  Both delicious and an adequate serving size.  

Yesterday I ordered the egg scramble and I thought it was "ok."  The eggs were good, but I was a little disappointed by the portion size of the scramble and I think this time I only got like, six small pieces of potatoes (but I got two pieces of toast, though.) Hmmm.  Very strong coffee, too.  

I'll still come back.  Next time I'll just have to order the open face egg sandwich.

excerpts: I'll repeat what others have said - the crispy potatoes are yum!
crispy potatoes.author: Cathy L.
crispy potatoes.review:
This is a really cute place with outdoor seating during the weekends.

I'll repeat what others have said - the crispy potatoes are yum!

Everything else is ok but not a standout (lemon ricotta pancakes, french toast, bacon, etc.)

If there wasn't always such a long wait I might come back as parking is easy but...I'd rather go to Zazie next time!

excerpts: We came here with a group and almost every single one of us ordered the "plow" because it is a sampling of all of the good stuff - ricotta pancakes, crispy potatoes, chicken sausage (which was great) and eggs.
Yum!
crispy potatoes.author: Vanessa L.
crispy potatoes.review: The brunch here is very good!  We came here with a group and almost every single one of us ordered the "plow" because it is a sampling of all of the good stuff - ricotta pancakes, crispy potatoes, chicken sausage (which was great) and eggs.  Yum!

excerpts: I ordered the plow, which I customized to be composed of lemon ricotta pancakes, crispy potatoes, two fried eggs, and chicken apple sausage.
This was my first time trying lemon ricotta pancakes, which I was little apprehensive about at first, but it has probably become one of my top pancake flavor choices.
I also really enjoyed the potatoes which were seasoned perfectly and had a nice hint of rosemary.
I would have given this place five stars, but my party and I had to constantly keep requesting for more maple syrup and ketchup.
crispy potatoes.author: Shannon M.
crispy potatoes.review: Probably the best brunch I've ever had in my life. I ordered the plow, which I customized to be composed of lemon ricotta pancakes, crispy potatoes, two fried eggs, and chicken apple sausage. This was my first time trying lemon ricotta pancakes, which I was little apprehensive about at first, but it has probably become one of my top pancake flavor choices. I also really enjoyed the potatoes which were seasoned perfectly and had a nice hint of rosemary. I would have given this place five stars, but my party and I had to constantly keep requesting for more maple syrup and ketchup.

excerpts: I ordered The Plow, which is 2 eggs, crispy potatoes, a breakfast meat (I chose bacon), and two lemon ricotta pancakes.
The food was EPIC.
The potatoes were absolutely crispy on the outside, soft on the inside and were made with rosemary and white onions
(I'm sure there were more seasonings, but I don't have the most discerning tongue).
The lemon ricotta pancakes were perfect little clouds of perfection.
They were cooked to perfection with a fantastic lemon taste.
crispy potatoes.author: Meranda M.
crispy potatoes.review:
Had breakfast at Plow yesterday after reading the reviews on Yelp.  We showed up and the wait was an hour.  This place is teeny tiny, but I will give them credit, they had people moving in and out of there at a decent pace.  We did wait the full hour (maybe a little more), but the wait was worth it.  

I ordered The Plow, which is 2 eggs, crispy potatoes, a breakfast meat (I chose bacon), and two lemon ricotta pancakes.  The food was EPIC.  The potatoes were absolutely crispy on the outside, soft on the inside and were made with rosemary and white onions (I'm sure there were more seasonings, but I don't have the most discerning tongue).  The lemon ricotta pancakes were perfect little clouds of perfection.  They were cooked to perfection with a fantastic lemon taste.  It is my personal mission to learn how to make these.  

My friend had their salmon eggs benedict, which she basically described as the best she has ever had in her life, and that everything was cooked to perfection.  The staff was great, and they even provided free coffee for their customers waiting outside in the rain.  

Worth the wait.

excerpts: Housemade pork sausage, lemon ricotta pancakes and addictive double-fried crispy potatoes.
crispy potatoes.author: around town e.
crispy potatoes.review:
Housemade pork sausage, lemon ricotta pancakes and addictive double-fried crispy potatoes.

Tuscan kale caesar, topped with parmesan, avocado, and crunchy walnuts.

excerpts: I had "the plow" there for $13 -  "two eggs, choice of Nueske bacon, house made pork sausage, or chicken apple sausage, 2 pancakes, and crispy potatoes."
I saw the Chinese sausage there on the menu, and they allowed me to substitute that for my sausage choice.
The food came relatively quick, presented nicely on a white plate.
crispy potatoes.author: Leo C.
crispy potatoes.review:
Plow offers a clean and relaxed atmosphere to enjoy a fresh and delicious breakfast/brunch.  I came here jet lagged after getting off a trans-pacific flight, looking for a satisfying meal that features fresh ingredients.  Plow did the job for sure.  

I had "the plow" there for $13 -  "two eggs, choice of Nueske bacon, house made pork sausage, or chicken apple sausage, 2 pancakes, and crispy potatoes."  I saw the Chinese sausage there on the menu, and they allowed me to substitute that for my sausage choice.  The food came relatively quick, presented nicely on a white plate.  The server was very attentive and nice while conscious of not being bothersome.  

Overall, Plow is a place that I'd come back to as well as recommend to my friends.  It's not a great value since the price is somewhat premium for what you're getting.  But it's also very fresh and clean, so the price is fair.  Come check it out!

excerpts: The way they do their crispy potatoes reminds me a little bit of Lola in Seattle; smashed and fried so they're crispy on the outside with a fluffy center.
In a word, "spectacular!
I always ask for a little of their aioli to go along with it.
crispy potatoes.author: Ava J.
crispy potatoes.review: I. LOVE. PLOW. I seriously cannot say enough gushing things about this place without making people think I'm being facetious. The way they do their crispy potatoes reminds me a little bit of Lola in Seattle; smashed and fried so they're crispy on the outside with a fluffy center. In a word, "spectacular!" I always ask for a little of their aioli to go along with it. The Plow is their "greatest hits" plate and in the past I know they had blood sausage on the menu, which was wonderfully done! The setting is also beautiful and intimate, and the service is always spot on. Every time I've been there, I've seen the husband and wife who own Plow behind the counter, talking to customers, which I think really shows how much they enjoy being involved in the business. I'll never stop loving this place and I can't wait to go back!

excerpts: The crispy potatoes were alright, some were slightly burnt
so I had to cover it with ketchup to cover up the burnt taste.
Eggs were... well eggs.
Nothing too special about that.
I didn't get the lemon ricotta pancake, but my friend did and I tried it...
was pretty good too.
Usually not a pancake person
but I wouldn't mind a stack of those!
Other than that, meal was decent.
Clean restaurant, clean restroom, and good service.
crispy potatoes.author: Johnson S.
crispy potatoes.review: I came here for lunch with some of my friends around 1:30. I came after the rush so I didn't have to wait. Was seated right away. I ordered the grilled cider-brined pork chop + eggs. Lucked out since they gave me my order and said it was the last pork chop! Simple looking but don't let that deceive you, but worth trying! The crispy potatoes were alright, some were slightly burnt so I had to cover it with ketchup to cover up the burnt taste.  Eggs were... well eggs. Nothing too special about that. I didn't get the lemon ricotta pancake, but my friend did and I tried it... was pretty good too. Usually not a pancake person but I wouldn't mind a stack of those! Other than that, meal was decent. Clean restaurant, clean restroom, and good service.

excerpts: Menu said two eggs, choice of bacon or sausage, crispy potatoes, and two pancakes.
I'm thinking upscale grand slam breakfast at Denny's.
Pancakes were about 2 inch diameter.
Tasty, but not very filling.
Two eggs would be more correctly labeled two small eggs.
Had to grab a sandwich shortly afterward to carry me through to dinner.
crispy potatoes.author: Bryan L.
crispy potatoes.review: Food was good, but portion size of "the plow" was misleading.  Menu said two eggs, choice of bacon or sausage, crispy potatoes, and two pancakes.  I'm thinking upscale grand slam breakfast at Denny's.  Pancakes were about 2 inch diameter.  Tasty, but not very filling.  Two eggs would be more correctly labeled two small eggs.  Had to grab a sandwich shortly afterward to carry me through to dinner.

excerpts: Home made sausages, fluffy pancakes, crispy potatoes and lamb sandwiches are all familiar, but each has their own little unique twist, and is well executed.
crispy potatoes.author: Christine P.
crispy potatoes.review:
After seeing the long lines and sleepy huddled masses on the corner of Texas and 18th St, I was a little confused.  What COULD make a crowd like that on an overcast morning in Potrero Hill?  

Deliciousness can, that's what.

The vibe of the place is great, without being overdone or precious.  The coffee is great, which is a baseline requirement in San Francisco.  It takes a little time for your food to get to you, but once it does, you're happy that you hung out and chatted with the people sitting next to you for a while.

Home made sausages, fluffy pancakes, crispy potatoes and lamb sandwiches are all familiar, but each has their own little unique twist, and is well executed.

excerpts: I got "the plow", which came with scrambled eggs, their homemade pork sausage, lemon ricotta pancakes and crispy potatoes.
The homemade pork sausage was slightly spicy with really good flavor, while the pancakes were super soft and tasty.
I liked how they were mini pancakes and not the huge ones you'd get at like
IHOP/Denny's.
The crispy potatoes were a little too salty for me, but my bf liked them.
I might have been able to eat the whole plate of food if it weren't for the monkey bread, but I did find many couples sharing the plow, if the other person ordered something small.
My bf got the fried egg sandwich that came with two eggs fried, cheddar, frisee, aioli, crispy potatoes  and Nueske bacon.
It looked good, and was an adequate sized sandwich.
I was tempted to order their organic yogurt with granola and mixed fruit, but felt I needed to order something more substancial since it was our first time here.
crispy potatoes.author: Joycelyn L.
crispy potatoes.review:
Tasty, well-portioned meals, get here before 9am if coming for brunch so you don't have to wait in line.

Came here Sunday morning before 9am and were lucky to get some bar seats in front of all the cooks.  It was neat to see how they cooked everything.  We started off with the monkey bread and it tasted just like cinnamon buns, just not as sweet and without the sugary frosting spread all on it.  I got "the plow", which came with scrambled eggs, their homemade pork sausage, lemon ricotta pancakes and crispy potatoes.  The homemade pork sausage was slightly spicy with really good flavor, while the pancakes were super soft and tasty.  I liked how they were mini pancakes and not the huge ones you'd get at like IHOP/Denny's.  The crispy potatoes were a little too salty for me, but my bf liked them.  I might have been able to eat the whole plate of food if it weren't for the monkey bread, but I did find many couples sharing the plow, if the other person ordered something small.  My bf got the fried egg sandwich that came with two eggs fried, cheddar, frisee, aioli, crispy potatoes  and Nueske bacon.  It looked good, and was an adequate sized sandwich.  I was tempted to order their organic yogurt with granola and mixed fruit, but felt I needed to order something more substancial since it was our first time here.  Plus, you can make that at home.

Overall, one of the better brunch places I've been to and will surely come back for more.

excerpts: I got the lemon ricotta pancakes, sausage, eggs and crispy potatoes.
Oh, I could really use that meal in front of me right now.
I've been craving it ever since
and it's been three days.
It also fills you up.
I ate at 1pm and didn't want to eat anything else the rest of the day.
Stop by this bruch place, you won't be disappointed.
crispy potatoes.author: Brad S.
crispy potatoes.review: Yes even after waiting over an hour for a group of three to be seating, this place still deserves 5 stars.  I also had the expectation that we would be waiting a while to get in so my expectations were properly set.   What I didn't believe was how good the food was going to be.  I thought it was EXCELLENT.  I got the lemon ricotta pancakes, sausage, eggs and crispy potatoes.  Oh, I could really use that meal in front of me right now.  I've been craving it ever since and it's been three days.  It also fills you up.  I ate at 1pm and didn't want to eat anything else the rest of the day.   Stop by this bruch place, you won't be disappointed.

excerpts: i ordered the herloom tomato salad, fruit cup and the side order of crispy potatoes....to the demand of my friend who adamantly raved about their potatoes.
I have to say it was the best crispy potatoes ive ever had
and i dont even like potatoes.
They didnt have the overly dipped in oil kinda taste nor was it so starchy you couldnt eat the rest of your meal.
yum.
the fruits were not standard fruit cup (thank god), rather i had pears, figs, grapes.
double yum.
anddd lastly the heirloom tomatoes which ive been dying to order at a restaurant since their now in season, was sliced, drizzled in olive oil with avocados on top.
Didnt seem like much
but it was pretty filling
and i was completely satisfied with my mini meals for brunch.
if i still ate meat, i would definitely recommend the plow plate:  two eggs, choice of meat, and a side of crispy potatoes and pancake.
I definitely stood out of my table of 4 plow plates and one vegetarian dish.
crispy potatoes.author: Justina F.
crispy potatoes.review:
Came here for brunch on thursday morning and it was still crowded! me plus 4 more didnt have to wait long for a table although they dont seat larger parties of 6 due to the size.  The kitchen is open with a bar like seating in front. i ordered the herloom tomato salad, fruit cup and the side order of crispy potatoes....to the demand of my friend who adamantly raved about their potatoes.  I have to say it was the best crispy potatoes ive ever had and i dont even like potatoes.  They didnt have the overly dipped in oil kinda taste nor was it so starchy you couldnt eat the rest of your meal.  yum. the fruits were not standard fruit cup (thank god), rather i had pears, figs, grapes.  double yum. anddd lastly the heirloom tomatoes which ive been dying to order at a restaurant since their now in season, was sliced, drizzled in olive oil with avocados on top.  Didnt seem like much but it was pretty filling and i was completely satisfied with my mini meals for brunch.  The ambiance was bright and relaxing for a chilly morning.  

if i still ate meat, i would definitely recommend the plow plate:  two eggs, choice of meat, and a side of crispy potatoes and pancake.  I definitely stood out of my table of 4 plow plates and one vegetarian dish. =)

excerpts: The crispy potatoes that came with most dishes were great too.
Still dreaming about the blood sausage... and all the cute little piggy artifacts throughout the restaurant!
crispy potatoes.author: Julie C.
crispy potatoes.review:
Very cute place. Took a day off from work so I came on a weekday morning. 

Everything looked great on the menu and it was a hard decision but we settled on the following:

1) Lemon Ricotta Pancakes: So good. Soft and fluffy with little bits of ricotta throughout. 

2) Soft scrambled eggs w/goat cheese: Solid dish. Tastes exactly like you'd imagine but better. Simple and comforting.

3) Blood sausage: The best dish we had that morning. Everyone loved it.

The crispy potatoes that came with most dishes were great too. Still dreaming about the blood sausage... and all the cute little piggy artifacts throughout the restaurant!

excerpts: The crispy potatoes were phenomenal.
The almond pancakes were great too, preferred them to the lemon ricotta.
5 stars!
crispy potatoes.author: michael q.
crispy potatoes.review: Awesome brunch. The crispy potatoes were phenomenal. The almond pancakes were great too, preferred them to the lemon ricotta. 5 stars!

excerpts: I had "The Plow" which was 2 eggs served any way you'd like, 2 strips of delicious cooked to perfection bacon (actually I had 3 by some happy accident), 2 lemon ricotta pancakes, and crispy potatoes.
It is a tie between the pancakes and potatoes as far as my favorite.
Each bite of potato was amazingly crispy (with no oil at all) on the outside but so soft and delicious once you bite into it.
The lemon ricotta pancakes were mind blowing.
I don't even really favor pancakes, I normally opt for french toast or waffles
but these were far superior.
The light taste of lemon mixed with sweet was amazing.
Maybe they use magic.
UGHH!
SO GOOD!
crispy potatoes.author: Kristie R.
crispy potatoes.review: Oh.  My.  Gosh.  The food at this place was amazing!  Let me start by getting the only negatives out of the way.  It was very busy but we got seated quickly at 9:30am  right next to another table.  When I say right next to another table, I mean our tables were tops 1-2 inches apart.  Our waitress was not the greatest or nicest (just give me my extra syrup w/out the judgement!)  Maybe it's because she knows they are so busy that she doesn't have to be.  I'd ding a star for it but the food was just too good!  Now, onto the food!  I had "The Plow" which was 2 eggs served any way you'd like, 2 strips of delicious cooked to perfection bacon (actually I had 3 by some happy accident), 2 lemon ricotta pancakes, and crispy potatoes.  It is a tie between the pancakes and potatoes as far as my favorite.  Each bite of potato was amazingly crispy (with no oil at all) on the outside but so soft and delicious once you bite into it.  The lemon ricotta pancakes were mind blowing.  I don't even really favor pancakes, I normally opt for french toast or waffles but these were far superior.  The light taste of lemon mixed with sweet was amazing.  Maybe they use magic.  UGHH! SO GOOD!

excerpts: the other upside is that the crispy potatoes are pretty awesome.
crispy potatoes.author: dan a.
crispy potatoes.review:
i really want to give plow a 3.5 stars.  but, the food just wasn't as amazing as everyone thinks.  especially for the 30 min wait we had.

i had the duck hash, and i have to say it wasn't bad.  far from mindblowing though.  served with two small pieces of bread (certainly not enough to sop up the hash) and a (supposed) poached egg.  my egg came out pretty over done though.

the upside is the staff.  the girl that greeted us was really nice, and our waitress even noticed that my egg was overdone and offered to take it back.  i humbly declined but more than appreciated the offer (no substitute for great service!)  the other upside is that the crispy potatoes are pretty awesome.

i hope i can come back again sometime and be wowed by a different dish.

excerpts: Love their french toast and the earth defying crispy potatoes.
These two things will keep me coming back for more.
crispy potatoes.author: Karen H.
crispy potatoes.review: Didn't sleep just to be awake and avoid lines for this lil gem. What a treat it was. Love their french toast and the earth defying crispy potatoes. These two things will keep me coming back for more.

excerpts: fried egg sammie...and crispy potatoes.
YUM...more than YUM.
good service...great food.
crispy potatoes.author: Sonia C.
crispy potatoes.review:
the only reason it doesn't get 5 stars...the wait..and the wait...and we came on a day where it was cold out...and i had lost my voice...and the hostess asked me 3 times if we were willing to take a table outside.  uh...i guess the notation that we only wanted inside was lost?!  also, people who are NOT there when their name is called really shouldn't be able to get the next table.  seriously?!
however, it's about the food...and it really is good.  fried egg sammie...and crispy potatoes.  YUM...more than YUM.  good service...great food.

excerpts: The eggs were cooked to perfection, and the crispy potatoes lived up to their name.
Overall, a great brunch place to add to my list of go-to's.
I will mos def be back!
crispy potatoes.author: Jen T.
crispy potatoes.review:
plow has quickly been rising in the ranks as a staple brunch place in SF, so I can't believe it's taken me this long to remember to review it.
This place is GOOD. It's in a somewhat random location for me (meaning, when we walked around after our meal, there were only other restaurants to look at.. e.g. Chez Papa Bistrot down the block), but the upside of this is that the parking is SO much better than the rest of the city. 
Our friend came an hour early before our meeting time for the wait on a Saturday morning, so that tells you how poppin' this place is. The place overall is quaint and airy, with a handful of tables and a counter facing the open kitchen, with very modern decor.
The Equator coffee was strong to my liking, and you can even sip on it while you're waiting in line outside.
We tried the cinnamon sugar donuts (not on the menu currently), which reminded me of freshly fried beignets. SO GOOD. I'm bummed I won't get to try these again anytime soon.
I had the eggs benedict with mushroom/spinach and ham (the two add-ons), which was delicious. The eggs were cooked to perfection, and the crispy potatoes lived up to their name.
Overall, a great brunch place to add to my list of go-to's. I will mos def be back!

excerpts: - they were heavenly and the crispy potatoes to die for..
BUT the noise level is atrocious.
The staff slams and bangs glasses and plates.
The pass through to the dishwasher was placed directly facing the dining room and sends out even more noise.
It is ear splitting.
Cannot take it.
Bring ear plugs.
crispy potatoes.author: T F.
crispy potatoes.review: Couldn't wait to get to this place - had heard such great things about it. Must say, have never had better scrambled eggs. I'm not kidding - they were heavenly and the crispy potatoes to die for.. BUT the noise level is atrocious. The staff slams and bangs glasses and plates. The pass through to the dishwasher was placed directly facing the dining room and sends out even more noise. It is ear splitting. Cannot take it. Bring ear plugs.

excerpts: Everything from the crispy potatoes, lemon ricotta pancakes and Benedict was AMAZING!
The service and the atmosphere made it even better.
Can't wait to go back.
crispy potatoes.author: Au N.
crispy potatoes.review: One of the best brunches I have ever had. Everything from the crispy potatoes, lemon ricotta pancakes and Benedict was AMAZING! The service and the atmosphere made it even better. Can't wait to go back.

excerpts:
fried egg sandwich - two eggs, cheddar, frisee, aioli, crispy potatoes 
house made organic yogurt + granola + market fruit + Potrero Hill honey

seated at the counter facing the workers
watching them mix, chop, flame, plate the magic.
crispy potatoes.author: Anna K.
crispy potatoes.review:
fried egg sandwich - two eggs, cheddar, frisee, aioli, crispy potatoes 
house made organic yogurt + granola + market fruit + Potrero Hill honey

seated at the counter facing the workers
watching them mix, chop, flame, plate the magic.
it's no secret that plow only uses fresh, wholesome ingredients
in every single dish they offer.
sip on coffee or a mimosa during your wait
as they take no reservations in advance.

excerpts: But the star of this dish was the crispy potatoes.
MAN these are GOOD.
They grill moderate sized potatoes with onions, smash the potatoes, deep fry them, and toss them in salt and thyme.
You get a hybrid concoction of homefries with the crisp of hashbrowns.
VERY GOOD.
The tuna sandwich is hands down the BEST I've ever had.
The tuna is tossed in olive oil, lightly salted, mixed with capers,  and extremely fresh.
The boquerones (white anchovies in olive oil and vinegar) added an extra dimension of flavor to the sandwich.
Add a little hard boiled egg and put it on bread from Acme, and you have a Masterpiece.
Unfortunately the portion sizes are bad.
I can't really "plow" into a breakfast plate when there is not much food on it.
I love eating
and I'm willing to spend top dollar for top food.
However, I feel that I should've been more satisfied after signing the check.
It was really disappointing to watch the line cook throw a pile of crispy potatoes onto a plate only to have the head chef take some off and throw it back into the mixing bowl.
The poor form ruined what was otherwise an AMAZING dining experience.
crispy potatoes.author: Siao W.
crispy potatoes.review:
Rolling out of bed on a beautiful Sunday morning, I really wanted a hardy breakfast. I made the short trip up the hill and stopped at the restaurant with a pig on its sign. What I found was the BEST breakfast food that I've ever had.
     The "plow" breakfast was great. The home-made pork sausage was juicy, well-spiced, and well cooked. The mini lemon ricotta pancakes (I really do mean mini) had a nice crisp on the edges with a creamy center. The lemon flavor was bold without being overpowering. My eggs were cooked to my liking. But the star of this dish was the crispy potatoes. MAN these are GOOD. They grill moderate sized potatoes with onions, smash the potatoes, deep fry them, and toss them in salt and thyme. You get a hybrid concoction of homefries with the crisp of hashbrowns. VERY GOOD.
     The tuna sandwich is hands down the BEST I've ever had. The tuna is tossed in olive oil, lightly salted, mixed with capers,  and extremely fresh. The boquerones (white anchovies in olive oil and vinegar) added an extra dimension of flavor to the sandwich. Add a little hard boiled egg and put it on bread from Acme, and you have a Masterpiece.
     Unfortunately the portion sizes are bad. I can't really "plow" into a breakfast plate when there is not much food on it. I love eating and I'm willing to spend top dollar for top food. However, I feel that I should've been more satisfied after signing the check. It was really disappointing to watch the line cook throw a pile of crispy potatoes onto a plate only to have the head chef take some off and throw it back into the mixing bowl. The poor form ruined what was otherwise an AMAZING dining experience.

excerpts: THAT HAS THE CRISPY POTATOES!
crispy potatoes.author: neil c.
crispy potatoes.review:
best brunch for the $ since i have lived here (4 years). 

pros: get coffee while you wait for the table, friendly staff, well appointed environs, fresh and visually pleasing dishes, moderate prices, GET ANYTHING THAT HAS THE CRISPY POTATOES!, definitely get the homemade patty sausage.

cons: usual SF brunch wait, cramped if you get sat at the bar.

make yourself happy this weekend. make it your new favourite!!!

to the owners: great job bringing a classy, tasty, friendly establishment to my neighborhood.

excerpts: Lemon ricotta pancakes with those crispy potatoes and mimosa...
can't be beat!
crispy potatoes.author: David G.
crispy potatoes.review: Plow is great for brunch. Lemon ricotta pancakes with those crispy potatoes and mimosa...can't be beat!

excerpts: What gives their dishes a final "wow" are the crispy potatoes.
Never have I had a potato fried and seasoned quite like theirs.
They were excellent.
The fried egg sandwich, while good - should only be eaten with a knife and fork.
crispy potatoes.author: Bryan F.
crispy potatoes.review: While visiting San Francisco, we tried to find places that were not the "tourist traps" of the city for dining.  Plow's great reviews on Yelp lead us to venture to this small, yet excellent restaurant just 10 minutes by taxi from our hotel.  When we got there, we were promptly greeted by the hostess, and got our name on the list.   The wait was about 20 minutes on a Sunday morning around 10.  The service was fantastic, and the food was even better.   What gives their dishes a final "wow" are the crispy potatoes.  Never have I had a potato fried and seasoned quite like theirs.  They were excellent.  The fried egg sandwich, while good - should only be eaten with a knife and fork.  And the Plow - is just awesome.   To top it off, when we were done, we asked the waitress where we should walk to try and hail a cab, as the restaurant is in a more residential area, and we were worried that taxis wouldn't be readily available.  She instantly offered to call one for us!   As we were waiting in front while she was on the phone, she noticed one down the street and we were able to hail that one.  It was impressive that she was going out of her way to help us, as she did more than we were expecting!  This is a definite must, and if we lived in the area, would definitely come back many more times!

excerpts: I ordered "the Plow" (lemon ricotta pancakes, crispy potatoes, and poached eggs).
My bf ordered the "fried egg sandwich" which came with crispy potatoes.
I'm not much of a pancake eater, but my goodness these were absolutely delicious and unique.
The texture was great too--not too fluffy and not flat.
The potatoes were the crispiest I've ever eaten, and my bf agrees.
They are salted to perfection.
I highly recommend this place.
It's nestled away in a residential and hilly area.
Totally worth the price (I believe our bill came out to be ~$40) including a coffee.
Cute shop.
Clean and packed.
crispy potatoes.author: D C.
crispy potatoes.review: This place is absolutely delicious and the atmosphere is relaxed and cute. We were in line for Mama's for 30 min and moved about one foot before we decided to ditch Mama's and try somewhere else. So glad we did! This place had less than a 10 min wait (late breakfast). The waitress was nice, and the food arrived rather promptly. There were big glass jars of water at each table so we could refill as we liked. I ordered "the Plow" (lemon ricotta pancakes, crispy potatoes, and poached eggs). My bf ordered the "fried egg sandwich" which came with crispy potatoes. I'm not much of a pancake eater, but my goodness these were absolutely delicious and unique. The texture was great too--not too fluffy and not flat. The potatoes were the crispiest I've ever eaten, and my bf agrees. They are salted to perfection. I highly recommend this place. It's nestled away in a residential and hilly area. Totally worth the price (I believe our bill came out to be ~$40) including a coffee. Cute shop. Clean and packed.

excerpts: The lemon ricotta pancakes, the fried egg sandwich with bacon, anything with crispy potatoes, the olive oil poached tuna sandwich, and the cold smoked salmon.
crispy potatoes.author: Jerry R.
crispy potatoes.review:
If you go on a weekend & don't get there right as they open, you will have to wait--possibly an hour. But the food is spectacular and worth waiting for. It's fresh, it's cooked perfectly, and it's interesting without pretense. The mason jars of spices are as utilitarian as they are beautiful. I love watching the cooks pull one down occasionally to prep, though I'm still waiting to see someone use the juniper berries for something.

You have to try: The lemon ricotta pancakes, the fried egg sandwich with bacon, anything with crispy potatoes, the olive oil poached tuna sandwich, and the cold smoked salmon.

The coffee is strong and refilled frequently. The staff is friendly and usually quite attentive. It's hands down the best breakfast/brunch in Potrero Hill and it competes nicely with Chez Maman for best lunch.

excerpts: I ordered the Plow which features some of the favorites - eggs, choice of meat, crispy potatoes (which were to die for) and lemon ricotta pancakes.
Very pleased with the service, food and ambiance
Wish I lived there
so I could go more often!
crispy potatoes.author: Katherine C.
crispy potatoes.review: Plow was on my list of places to try while in San Francisco for a while, and on a recent trip to the city I finally got to go! I arrived around 9 am on a Sunday and there was about an hour wait, which was well worth it! They offered coffee for waiting customers which helped on a chilly morning. I ordered the Plow which features some of the favorites - eggs, choice of meat, crispy potatoes (which were to die for) and lemon ricotta pancakes. Very pleased with the service, food and ambiance Wish I lived there so I could go more often!

excerpts: - loved the "Plow" with bacon, lemon ricotta pancakes, crispy potatoes and eggs.
For those with kids, know that they don't offer hot chocolate or straws.
crispy potatoes.author: L N.
crispy potatoes.review: Met friends for breakfast at 8:30 on a Sunday morning and still waited for an hour.  Was glad I had a snack on the drive up there!  Appreciated that it's close to the freeway and I could find street parking.  Food is excellent  - loved the "Plow" with bacon, lemon ricotta pancakes, crispy potatoes and eggs.  For those with kids, know that they don't offer hot chocolate or straws.

excerpts: you must must must get the monkey bread if you go, and the crispy potatoes are like the most incredible hash-brown/home-fries hybrid flavor explosion.
i left this place so happy and sated and can't wait to come back for another lovely brunch here.
crispy potatoes.author: p.c. m.
crispy potatoes.review: phenomenal brunch. the food and the ambiance rival each other in fabulousness. what was so surprising about this place was that the service was absolutely delightful -- the host, our waitress, and the guys cooking the food across the counter from us were all in a wonderful and welcoming mood which is all-too-rare at some of these hot restaurants in the city. you must must must get the monkey bread if you go, and the crispy potatoes are like the most incredible hash-brown/home-fries hybrid flavor explosion. i left this place so happy and sated and can't wait to come back for another lovely brunch here.

excerpts: The 'Plow' was a great sampling of everything (eggs, crispy potatoes, sausage, pancakes).
The pancakes were a little too sweet and cake-like for my taste, but they were fluffy and light.
Would probably go back to try some of their other dishes.
crispy potatoes.author: c H.
crispy potatoes.review: Went for brunch on a Friday late morning (11am) and the place was packed. Waited ~30minutes for a table for 4. But once seated, wait staff was pleasant and service was prompt. The 'Plow' was a great sampling of everything (eggs, crispy potatoes, sausage, pancakes). The pancakes were a little too sweet and cake-like for my taste, but they were fluffy and light. Would probably go back to try some of their other dishes.

excerpts: The crispy potatoes are a must try if it doesn't already come with your dish.
My first taste of the pancake made me wished I had ordered the whole stack.
The sandwich looked really well put together.
