I like the fact that they used frisee lettuce it holds up very well especially when the yolk is broken and all its gooey goodness gets all over them.
Everything was very well seasoned
and I'm giving it 4 stars for overall quality of ingredients and taste.
With that said there is definitely room for improvement in the kitchen and in the service.
My omelette hardly had any mushrooms and I ended up eating 3/4 of it before I actually had any shiitake and sad to say the oyster mushrooms were no where to be found.
The staff was really friendly but need more attention to water and coffee refills.
crispy potatoes.author: Pamela M.
crispy potatoes.review: We ordered the Market Omelette with the side of Lemon Ricotta Pancake and Fried Egg Sandwich with bacon.  The crispy potatoes are a must try if it doesn't already come with your dish. My first taste of the pancake made me wished I had ordered the whole stack.  The sandwich looked really well put together.  I like the fact that they used frisee lettuce it holds up very well especially when the yolk is broken and all its gooey goodness gets all over them.  Everything was very well seasoned and I'm giving it 4 stars for overall quality of ingredients and taste.  With that said there is definitely room for improvement in the kitchen and in the service.  My omelette hardly had any mushrooms and I ended up eating 3/4 of it before I actually had any shiitake and sad to say the oyster mushrooms were no where to be found.  The staff was really friendly but need more attention to water and coffee refills.

excerpts: Their crispy potatoes are phenom.
crispy potatoes.author: Lulu B.
crispy potatoes.review: Ok, so this is my 2nd Yelp review ever and the fact that I'm taking the time to review this AWESOME place, what does that say? Hands down, the BEST brunch ever in SF. My hubs & I grew up in the Bay Area & often go to SF for culinary adventures. We had a spontaneous New Years 2day adventure in SF and this was THE highlight. (Hey, we like food.) Hubs found it on Yelp - paying it forward, yes I am - and when we saw/read their website, we knew it was THE brunch place for us. Worth the 20min wait (altho' I can see it being longer at times). I had the egg sandwich (all about that cheese) and a side of 1 lemon ricotta pancake - which also came with those yummy potatos. My hubs had The Plow - a little bit of everything. Their crispy potatoes are phenom. Their lemon ricotta pancakes are to die for. The rest all culminates together - the friendly service, the intimate ambiance, the very nice owners-couple, the other excited patrons, the location, the venue - to make for a perfect way to start off your day. If you live in, near or are planning a trip to SF, I can't recommend this place enough for brekkie, lunch or wkend brunch...Just be patient - grab a coffee down the block - as you may have to wait a few minutes. But I say it again - it's DEF worth the wait. I will be back. Soon, I hope.

excerpts:
* One lemon ricotta pancake ($5.50) - 5 stars
Always amazing!
one lemon ricotta pancake.author: Ziyan C.
one lemon ricotta pancake.review:
Always an excellent brunch here.

THE WAIT
They open at 8am on Sundays, and we got there at 8:11am.  There was already a line around the corner, but it was moving. We got on the list around 8:20am and had just barely missed the first wave of seating. They estimated a 30-minute wait, and we got a table inside around 8:50am!

SERVICE
Friendly and efficient.

THE COST
$66.61 before tips for 2 coffees, 1 starter, 2 sides, and 2 entrees. A very reasonable brunch for three.

MUST -HAVES
As always: Lemon Ricotta Pancake, anything with their potatoes.

* Chia seed pudding (almond milk, coconut, honey, almonds, bee pollen, apples, raw hemp seeds. $9.25) - 4.5 stars
My boyfriend's mom really enjoyed this. It was a nicely done, light breakfast. She wants to learn the recipe and make it herself!

* Breakfast sandwich + bacon & avocado ($17.50) - 4.5 stars
Always a great sandwich with quality ingredients. The potatoes, as always, easily the best in the city.

* Soft scrambled eggs (stinging nettles, shiitake mushrooms, goat cheese. $15.75) - 4 stars
Great texture to the egg, love the combo of cheese and mushrooms. Excellent potatoes.

SIDES
* One lemon ricotta pancake ($5.50) - 5 stars
Always amazing!

* One pumpkin pancake ($5.50) - 4 stars
Great seasonal item, though somehow not as moist as the lemon ricotta, and missing that interesting pop in flavor.

excerpts: : "I'll get the Fried Egg Sandwich w/ Bacon and one Lemon Ricotta Pancake please.
Mr. NSS:
one lemon ricotta pancake.author: Cherylynn N.
one lemon ricotta pancake.review:
* ~ * ~ * April 22, 2012 * ~ * ~ * 

Our first beer goggle-free date:

Mr. NSS: "Did you want to go to brunch?"
Me: "Sure, let's try Plow; I've been wanting to go there for a while now."

*Arrives at Plow*

Wait staff: "It's going to be a two hour wait."
Mr. NSS: "Two $@$^&*# hours?!?!...uhh, no thanks."

Mr. NSS: "I would never wait THAT long for food; it's just 'food', let's go somewhere else."
Me *thinking*: "Thanks for speaking for the both of us, you jerk!"

Fast forward nearly a year of dating a food snob. 

* ~ * ~ * April 5, 2013 * ~ * ~ *

Me: "Since we both took a day off, let's try going to Plow again?"
Mr. NSS: "Uhhh, the place with a two hour wait?"

Me: "Or, we can go to Red Door Cafe instead where the owner may molest your bootay while we wait in line?"
Mr. NSS: "Actually, Plow sounds PERFECT!"

*Arrives at Plow at 10:30 am*

Me: "I'll get the Fried Egg Sandwich w/ Bacon and one Lemon Ricotta Pancake please."
Mr. NSS: "I'll have the Dungeness Crab Scramble please."

*Our order arrives after 10 minutes*

Mr. NSS *talking with mouth full*: "Dayaum, I never knew crab and eggs could taste THIS good."

*2 minutes passes and Mr. NSS annihilates his crab scramble*

Mr. NSS *eyeing my sandwich*: "Aren't you going to ask if I want a bite?"
Me *reluctantly hands over sandwich*

Mr. NSS *Kills the rest of the sandwich*
Me: "WTF! That was MY sandwich!!!!"

Mr. NSS: "Sorry, you always give me half of your food."
Me: "UGH! You're sleeping with Ms. Lubriderm tonight!"

*Walking back to the car*

Mr. NSS: "So the next time we come to Plow, let's put our name down then come back two hours later ok?"
Me: "Uhhh, WTF has Plow done to my bf?!?!"

YEUP, it's THAT good folks!

OTHER NOTES:
*Expect a 30+ minute wait on weekdays and up to a 2+ hour wait on weekends. NO reservations. 
*Rockstar staff. The waitresses are very friendly and the very efficient kitchen staff churns out 6-7 plates at a time. Very impressive. 
*Get the Fried Egg Sandwich w/ Bacon ($13.50): http://bit.ly/16ICt9c! Simple but top-notch ingredients that's perfectly prepared = AMAZING: http://bit.ly/Y8xCIJ! The potatoes are f*cking delicious so make sure your order comes with this as a side!
*The Ricotta Lemon Pancake ($5) is also a must order! It's like a Lemon Meringue Pie but in a pancake: http://bit.ly/Y8xFEu. SO good!
*Why is the Chinese Breakfast always sold out or never available? It wasn't available on Friday. =(
*Outdoor seating, indoor seating, and counter seating. Sit at the counter and watch where all the magic happens!
*Loved the low-key casual ambiance with TLC, Destiny's Child and Toni Braxton bumping in the background.
*Fairly easy residential street parking.

excerpts: We shared one lemon ricotta pancake, a must-try!!
It basically tasted like cake.
The atmosphere is good, the service is excellent.
It's just a long wait after 9:30
so I suggest going early.
one lemon ricotta pancake.author: Madeline S.
one lemon ricotta pancake.review: Everything I had read about Plow was absolutely true and more. I am so glad we trekked out to Potrero Hill at 9:30 for this. It was an hour wait but there was plenty to walk around and see in the cute neighborhood and we got coffees at a nearby cafe. I ordered the soft scrambled eggs with goat cheese and nettles and acme toast. There was...not going to lie...a lot of butter, but it was worth it. The crispy potatoes are also delicious. My friend got the salmon tartine, which was good, but not as unique as mine. We shared one lemon ricotta pancake, a must-try!! It basically tasted like cake. The atmosphere is good, the service is excellent. It's just a long wait after 9:30 so I suggest going early.

excerpts: Following the Yelp reviews, we ordered up a fried egg sando w bacon, one lemon ricotta pancake and the smoked salmon and bially.
one lemon ricotta pancake.author: Matt S.
one lemon ricotta pancake.review:
November is Month of BRUNCH.  Plow got us off to an amazing start.  I heard this was some of the best brunch in SF and I agree wholeheartedly.  

Following the Yelp reviews, we ordered up a fried egg sando w bacon, one lemon ricotta pancake and the smoked salmon and bially.  All were absolutely wonderful.

The house potatoes were the best I've ever had.  Perfectly seasoned and with onions, fried crisptacularly - wow.  On the sando, the bread was so soft and fluffy and perfectly airy that it made the whole dish for me.  The egg was cooked exactly right and it gooed all over me when I bit in.

The salmon was awesome, the cream cheese puffy and wonderful, and the onions were pickly and sour and great.

We sat at the counter and were treated to a view of what everyone else was getting, and, while the menu has a range of items on it, In 75 minutes I think we only saw like three different dishes go out - the Plow version of the Grand Slam, the sando and a friend chicken sandwich.  

The bially was a little big and bready for me, and it was oven cooked rather than toasted.  I'm sure there's a reason for this, but I prefer my toasted bread/bagel thingies crispy-toasted on the outside and chewy on the inside, and this was just like mostly warm dense bread.  

That was the only very slight miss for me in an otherwise pitch-perfect brunch to kick off the world's first Month of BRUNCH.  Go Plow!!

excerpts: I ordered the soft egg crab and asparagus scramble with crispy potatoes, buttered toast and a side order of one almond pancake.
Everything was cooked to perfection and the potatoes are out of this world!
one almond pancake.author: Sharon D.
one almond pancake.review:
This is my favorite breakfast place in the city!!  You've got to go to Plow!  I've been here twice and both brunches were fabulous!  Brought my friend from LA here and she absolutely loved it.  We had to wait about half hour on a Tuesday so we took a stroll around the sunny neighborhood.  

My friend ordered the Plow which is the works with 2 eggs, bacon,  2 lemon ricotta pancakes and crispy potatoes.  I ordered the soft egg crab and asparagus scramble with crispy potatoes, buttered toast and a side order of one almond pancake.  Everything was cooked to perfection and the potatoes are out of this world!  Best crispy potatoes with a sprinkling of salt and herbs.  Mmmm!  The almond pancake was nice and fluffy.

Love the decor and service was great.

excerpts: your choice of house made pork sausage, Nueske's bacon, or chicken apple sausage.
house made pork sausage.author: Carol L.
house made pork sausage.review:
Oh, Plow... how I waited and waited and waited and wanted so badly to love you. My friends and I came around 10:30am on a Saturday as a party of 5 and waited WAY OVER 2 hours. We were quoted 1.5 hours - 2 hours and called pretty frequently to check in on our table. 

This is the part that irks me the most about my experience.. at one point maybe 1.5 hours in, they told us to come back in 15 minutes. We came back in around 10 minutes and they told us "oh sorry, we just gave your table away". Sorry, but WHAT???? You would think that a place this popular can figure out their reservations and their waiting system but NOPE. So if you come here, you better just wait right outside the restaurant....... They call your name once or twice and if you're not there they just skip right over you even if they tell you to come back at a certain time. Truly unlike anything else I've ever experienced before, but maybe I'm spoiled after being in Chicago and NY for a while now as they have their lines and reservation systems all figured out..

Service was good from one person, but rude from another. Honestly, at this point I was pretty hangry though. So maybe the service wasn't THAT bad, it just came across as horribly rude when we asked for more water and were ignored. Also the host just wasn't pleasant to my party at all. 

Ordered the Plow which comes with two eggs, two lemon ricotta pancakes, plow potatoes, and your choice of house made pork sausage, Nueske's bacon, or chicken apple sausage. I got the chicken apple sauage which I really liked and the plow potatoes are SOOOO good. The lemon ricotta pancakes were also SOOOOOO good. (But was it because I was starving after waiting close to 2.5 hours for a table and the food?) 

I would come back, but I would never wait more than 30 minutes for the food. 3 stars because this restaurant needs to work on their service and their queue, but the food is pretty good.

TL;DR: Wait outside the restaurant otherwise your table will be given away and you'll wait outside forever and be even more starving than you already were.

Also their place is tiny, so if you want to get seated as quickly as possible then come by yourself or with one other person. They have like one or two tables that can accommodate parties over 4 people.

excerpts: I order the "Plow Breakfast " which came with the lemon ricotta pancakes , organic fresh eggs cooked to order , Plow potatoes and choice of bacon , house made pork sausage patties or apple sausage.
I opted for the house made pork sausage patties and they were great .
house made pork sausage.author: Elizabeth B.
house made pork sausage.review:
You must make Plow a staple brunch spot while visiting SF . After researching reviews we decided on going to Plow for breakfast as I read great reviews and also heard they had the "best potatoes " in the city . The reviews were all spot on .
I dined here on a Tuesday around 9:30am in Oct and while the place was small and packed we managed to sit down right away outside but there was also counter seating where you can watch the Chefs perform their magic . 

I order the "Plow Breakfast " which came with the lemon ricotta pancakes , organic fresh eggs cooked to order , Plow potatoes and choice of bacon , house made pork sausage patties or apple sausage. I opted for the house made pork sausage patties and they were great . If I would of changed anything about them o would of made them a little more seasoned . 

The pancakes were light but flavorful and a nice lemon touch but not over the top. They were a nice size .The maple syrup was authentic and complemented the pancakes nicely . They also had pumpkin pancakes as a choice as well . 
We enjoyed one of the home made biscuits with butter ($5) . You can tell they are made with love and from scratch . 

The highlight of the entire breakfast were the potatoes though . They were perfectly seasoned , crispy and crunchy on the outside and light on the inside . I never quite had breakfast potatoes like this but I can see why people line up for this country style breakfast spot. Hey there early though because around 10 or so when we were leaving there was a line starting to form .

The staff here was very friendly , patient and accommodating . I even saw one of the waitresses bring a table a ricotta pancake on the house just because they had ordered pumpkin pancakes . Food was fresh , hot and fairly quick to arrive . The meal was quite filling and I left a very satisfied customer .

excerpts: You can choose your egg option (scrambled, poached, etc etc), meat options include bacon, house made pork sausage, chicken apple sausage.
house made pork sausage.author: Karen H.
house made pork sausage.review:
This review is for the dish, THE PLOW. Wow easily hands down in the top 3 brunch dishes I've had in the city.

The potatoes are the best. If you don't order the plow but another dish you can order the potatoes on the side.

You can choose your egg option (scrambled, poached, etc etc), meat options include bacon, house made pork sausage, chicken apple sausage.

I went with scrambled eggs and pork sausage. I did not regret it one bit.... it was delicious. Standard are the potatoes and ricotta pancakes... which are sooo fluffy, soft and good.

The plow was perfect for me, someone who couldn't decide if they wanted eggs, meat, pancakes or potatoes for brunch- I could have them all!!

Parking isn't a problem but THE LINE. It's normally a 2 hour wait so come and put your name down and come back...

Outdoor seating is limited for those with dogs, which can have you waiting longer for an outside table than inside table since most folks prefer either and they do first come first serve.

Service is friendly and it's sort  of cool to be able to sit at the counter and watch all the cooks bust out 10 orders of THE PLOW all at once!

excerpts: The Plow ($17.5) - Two eggs, two lemon ricotta pancakes + plow potatoes with choice of house made pork sausage, Nueske's bacon, or chicken apple sausage.
house made pork sausage.author: Chelsea W.
house made pork sausage.review:
Plow is a pretty good place to get standard brunch fare. If you come early, the wait is really worth it! 

I've always come at opening time around 8 AM and probably wouldn't wait more than 30 min for it, so I highly recommend coming early. 

The menu consists of options like Soft Scrambled Eggs, Sausage & Eggs, Eggs Benedict, etc. It seems like the more popular dishes are the Lemon Ricotta Pancakes and The Plow.

The Plow ($17.5) - Two eggs, two lemon ricotta pancakes + plow potatoes with choice of house made pork sausage, Nueske's bacon, or chicken apple sausage. I ended up getting the Annie's Almond Flour Pancakes since it was GF which tasted great! The chicken apple sausage was also pretty good too. I had a side of fruit which cost a little more, but also tried the potatoes and they were really delicious

Plow stands out because of it's simple, yet delicious and quality ingredients. It does run on the expensive side though.

excerpts:
It was clear what their signature dish is that all tourists and locals like to order alike ...

the plow - two eggs sunny side up, two lemon ricotta pancakes, plow potatoes with house made pork sausage.
And now the lemon ricotta pancakes: WERE THE ABSOLUTE BEST!
Perfectly fluffy and soft with that great blend of lemon flavors woven within.
Not too strong nor tangy, but perfectly sweeet!
Here for some more lemon ricotta pancakes and maybe try their almond pancakes next!
house made pork sausage.author: Cuc N.
house made pork sausage.review:
On the second attempt, the boyfriend and I finally got to try this brunch restaurant called Plow. Why? Not only because it was a suggestion from a local San Franciscan, but my boyfriend finds fun and giddiness in the name itself. Weird. It's all about cows!!

Even on a Friday morning, this place has a wait for the inside, which is warm and cozy and the Christmas spirit is definitely in the air. With an airplane to catch back home, we opted to sit outside with no wait. This wasn't so bad because I do enjoy sitting on a cup of hot tea while enjoying the crisp cold air through my nose and on my face. What better Christmas spirit?

What we didn't know would be waiting for us was a very kind hostess who not only seated us at our table, but also had her hands filled with two warm and cozy blankets for each of us. I looked around. Every single seated customer had one around their shoulders or on their lap. What nice and thoughtful customer service to provide such amenities for the outside! Now I was really glad to sit outside. Just that small thing added to my cold and crisp winter morning.

I enjoyed the warm blanket. It was perfect!!!

So let's get to food??? We didn't order much because it was just us two and we both don't want to feel overstuffed. But what to order when you can only order one? This was easy to decide! It was clear what their signature dish is that all tourists and locals like to order alike ...

the plow - two eggs sunny side up, two lemon ricotta pancakes, plow potatoes with house made pork sausage.

Now everything on this plate was scrumptious. The eggs were perfectly yolky and freshly made. The patties were hand made from scratch and you can taste all the fresh flavors and hard work into molding these. The potatoes were crispy, crunchy and hot. And now the lemon ricotta pancakes: WERE THE ABSOLUTE BEST! Perfectly fluffy and soft with that great blend of lemon flavors woven within. Not too strong nor tangy, but perfectly sweeet! Now this is what they were known for!

I would definitely come back here. Here for some more lemon ricotta pancakes and maybe try their almond pancakes next!

excerpts: I had The Plow with their house made pork sausage patties, along with two lemon ricotta pancakes and their famous Plow potatoes.
Out of the three items that were on the plate, I probably enjoyed the pancakes the most, with the potatoes coming in a close second.
The sausage patties were good, but maybe just a tad too salty for me.
My husband had the French Toast and we essentially ate in total silence.
house made pork sausage.author: Lisa I.
house made pork sausage.review:
After living in SF for 7 years, I finally made it to Plow. Don't ask me why it took so long. But I finally did it.

My husband and I braved the experience by queueing up before 7:30AM to ensure that we were in the first wave of seating once they opened. I suppose a true San Franciscan would have braved the epic line later on in the day, but I've got more important things to do than sit around and wait. I had The Plow with their house made pork sausage patties, along with two lemon ricotta pancakes and their famous Plow potatoes. Out of the three items that were on the plate, I probably enjoyed the pancakes the most, with the potatoes coming in a close second. The sausage patties were good, but maybe just a tad too salty for me. My husband had the French Toast and we essentially ate in total silence. Neither of us wanted to share any of our dishes, which usually means it's truly delicious and worth keeping close to the vest.

Do I think waiting for Plow is worth it? No. But if you're an early riser and need something to do early in the morning, this is a great place to check off your SF Must-Eat list.

excerpts: It included two eggs with your choice of house made pork sausage patties, Nueske's bacon, or chicken apple sausage, and two (mini) lemon ricotta pancakes with a side of yet again those delicious plow potatoes ($17.50).
house made pork sausage.author: Brittany D.
house made pork sausage.review:
This is definitely one of the more upscale brunch joints with average meals $15+, but to be fair, the food is excellent! They deserve to be paid top dollar for the eclectic menu. 

FOOD. My goodness, what I would give for another open-faced prosciutto and gruyere toast this morning?! This magical combo with chili, garlic egg fried up, frisee (a type of endive) and parsley atop a toasted Acme brioche ($15) was heavenly. With a side of plow potatoes, this meal leans on the carb-heavy side of the breakfast food spectrum, but I cannot complain because it was simply amazing. *I do have to warn you, however, that the egg is super runny, so consume with extreme caution* They also serve Equator drip coffee! Although not a seasoned coffee drinker myself, I do appreciate this particular brand of coffee ever since my first tasting at its home base location in Marin County. My two other classmates each ordered the plow signature dish, a tasting platter, if you will, and a good first-timer dish according to the waitress. It included two eggs with your choice of house made pork sausage patties, Nueske's bacon, or chicken apple sausage, and two (mini) lemon ricotta pancakes with a side of yet again those delicious plow potatoes ($17.50). One of them also ordered fresh grapefruit juice and a warm buttermilk biscuit with honey butter (omg). 

SERVICE. 5 stars. The waitress even knew how to use an instax mini 9. She deserved bonus points for this. Tuesday morning around 10am is also the best time to come if you can. We were seated almost instantly upon arrival-- it took longer for my instax camera to produce an image on the Polaroid film. She was also very accommodating and gave great recommendations. We got pretty good seats by the window, but do be aware that since space is tight, the tables feel communal even though they're separate from each other. So if you're okay with sitting right next to the table next to you, then it should be fine. Get friendly.

I will reiterate: excellent food, excellent service. Can't wait to be back to try the other items on the menu!

excerpts: It comes with your choice of bacon or house made pork sausage, two eggs, two lemon ricotta pancakes, and potatoes.
Every element in this dish is done perfectly.
I haven't tried the bacon because their house made pork sausage is so well flavored (they put a lot of herbs inside to balance out the pork).
The lemon ricotta pancakes are softer than normal pancakes because of the ricotta and they have a nice lemon-y taste throughout.
And the POTATOES.
They are always so on point with their potatoes.
I don't know how they make the outside so crispy and the inside so soft.
These are probably the best potatoes I've ever had.
house made pork sausage.author: Christine L.
house made pork sausage.review:
I've visited Plow at least 3 times now. You really cannot get any better than ordering "The Plow". It comes with your choice of bacon or house made pork sausage, two eggs, two lemon ricotta pancakes, and potatoes. Every element in this dish is done perfectly. I haven't tried the bacon because their house made pork sausage is so well flavored (they put a lot of herbs inside to balance out the pork). The lemon ricotta pancakes are softer than normal pancakes because of the ricotta and they have a nice lemon-y taste throughout. And the POTATOES. They are always so on point with their potatoes. I don't know how they make the outside so crispy and the inside so soft. These are probably the best potatoes I've ever had. Their seasoning is good too.

We've tried the breakfast sandwich and the eggs benedict. They're good too but will forever be in the shadow of "The Plow".

Come early and get in with the first batch of people so you minimize your wait time. Don't fear eating outside even with the cold fog. They provide blankets.

excerpts: Opt for the salty-sweet juicy house made pork sausage patties.
house made pork sausage.author: Mitzi G.
house made pork sausage.review:
Get ready to wait, and wait, and wait... for some of the best brunch plates you've ever had in SF. By the time you're seated, you're ready to PLOW! 

Order the Plow- a sampler of all of their best dishes: The Lemon Ricotta Pancakes have been described as "sunshine in a pancake", accompanied by breakfast potatoes that are crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. Opt for the salty-sweet juicy house made pork sausage patties. Just YUM! 

Mimosas of course!

excerpts: House made pork sausage patties tastes like Italian sausage by the brand New York Style Sausage Company that you can buy at Safeway.
house made pork sausage.author: Ingrid E.
house made pork sausage.review:
As a native, I've tried a variety of brunch spots ranging from the most Instagram Famous all the way down to the cheapest hole in the wall spots in San Francisco.  What I've learned is to not let all places with 1-2 hour waits prove themselves worthy based on how esthetically  pleasing their decor looks or how well their food photographs. With that being said, Plow is easily one of the few places in SF that is NOT worth the 1-2 hour wait, money or camera space. If you're going to wait anywhere for a table during brunch, do yourself a favor and play the waiting game at better restaurants like Kitchen Story, Sweet Maple or Mission Beach Cafe. Luckily service was nice and attentive which is always the more important everlasting impression anyways. 

The Breakfast Sandwich with Bacon- the best part about this sandwich was the cheddar cheese, aioli and frisée. The eggs are supposed to be served soft, but mine in particular came out hard. Bacon was soggy. 

The Plow- basically Plow's version of a Denny's Grand Slam. I hate lemon but love ricotta. I gave the lemon ricotta pancakes a try but if you're anything like me then definitely skip out on these. I overheard another customer sub out these pancakes for the almond flour pancakes instead. House made pork sausage patties tastes like Italian sausage by the brand New York Style Sausage Company that you can buy at Safeway. 

Buttermilk Biscuit with honey butter- best thing we ordered! It was a hybrid of a cornbread and biscuit.

excerpts: The dish comes with two eggs with choice of house made pork sausage patties, Nueske's bacon, or chicken apple sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes + plow potatoes.
I asked for scrambled eggs (which is a rarity for me) and bacon.
house made pork sausage.author: Lisa N.
house made pork sausage.review:
What a cute little place for breakfast/brunch. There are hooks along the wall for your coats/bags.

I was forewarned about how long the wait can be, so I planned to come here on a Monday morning during my visit. We showed up not long after they opened and were seated right away. 

I was debating between the Plow, the Dungeness crab scramble, and the open-faced prosciutto + Gruyere toast. But since I was intrigued by the lemon ricotta pancakes, I opted for the Plow.

The dish comes with two eggs with choice of house made pork sausage patties, Nueske's bacon, or chicken apple sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes + plow potatoes. I asked for scrambled eggs (which is a rarity for me) and bacon. Every element of the dish was really good, the potatoes were very crispy on the outside, and the pancakes had a nice balance of flavors.

Service seemed a bit slow, but I'll just give them the benefit of the doubt that it was busy. It certainly seemed busy, but I noticed the servers standing around and inattentive numerous times throughout our meal.

Overall, I would recommend this place for the food. Service wasn't terrible, but it wasn't fantastic either. Granted, it was early on a Monday morning. If I find my way back to this spot during a future visit, I'll definitely try one of the other dishes that intrigued me.

excerpts: Two eggs, house made pork sausage patties, lemon ricotta pancakes and plow potatoes.
Not sure what to get?
Get this one!
It has everything!
The pork sausage patties was although not quite what I expected, was good.
It tasted healthier than your normal diner pork sausage patty--looks like there are veggies in the mix
and it's not as salty.
I liked it!
The potatoes was probable the main reason why I got this.
It's all so crispy and yummy!
I can have a bowl of this in its own.
As for the lemon ricotta pancakes to fulfill that sweet side, it was great.
house made pork sausage.author: Tu-Anh N.
house made pork sausage.review:
On an early Sunday morning, we came here around 8:30am.  We were told that for a party of 2, it would be a little over an hour wait. And they were right! We got seated outside at 9:45am.  They have blankets if your cold!  What did we do to wait? Walk around! Plow is located in a quaint area with other small shops and cafes to walk by.  Get that walk in so you can fill that belly!

Here's what we had:

Five Mountains organic tea - $4.75
Rolled Jasmine Green
It's tea. Warm. It was cold out so it was fitting. :)

BUTTERMILK BISCUIT - $4.50
This hunk of biscuit was served with a side of honey butter, that was sweet and yummy.  The biscuit itself is shareable and fluffy. I really enjoyed it!

BROWN BUTTER COCONUT MOCHI CAKE - $4.25
This dessert was delicious! Order quick before they run out!  would never expect a mochi cake here!  There's a layer in There that tasted quite custardy.  I recommend getting this even if your full; have it to go!  

FRENCH TOAST - $13  
Brown sugar caramelized apples, blood, mascarpone, pure Vermont maple syrup.
Depending on the season, the fruit may change.  This French toast was amazing.  It was so creamy and you definitely taste quality in every bite. Get it!

THE PLOW - $17 
Two eggs, house made pork sausage patties, lemon ricotta pancakes and plow potatoes.
Not sure what to get? Get this one! It has everything!  The pork sausage patties was although not quite what I expected, was good.  It tasted healthier than your normal diner pork sausage patty--looks like there are veggies in the mix and it's not as salty.  I liked it!  The potatoes was probable the main reason why I got this.  It's all so crispy and yummy!  I can have a bowl of this in its own.  As for the lemon ricotta pancakes to fulfill that sweet side, it was great.  I liked the small portion and the flavors were subtle and wonderful.    

I enjoyed everything here. I can see why it's so popular and I was not annoyed with the wait.  Our server was friendly.  It started to right as we were leaving so freat timing! Don't worry they have a thing they roll out to cover you from getting wet. :)

excerpts:
Here is what we ordered: 

the plow  - two eggs, choice of house made pork sausage patties, Nueske's bacon, or chicken apple sausage, lemon ricotta pancakes + plow potatoes
The lemon ricotta pancakes here were the highlight here, small and fluffy and just the perfect ratio of lemon flavor mixed it.
The plow potatoes were quite good too, crunchy and complements the rest of the breakfast plate.

Beef Hash Skillet - two eggs, beef hash 
Pretty standard here, had better ones 

Overall the food was as expected it to be
house made pork sausage.author: Charlton C.
house made pork sausage.review:
Don't think I've ever waited this long for brunch before which was shy of just 2 hours! Was it worth the wait? Find out in my review below. 

This restaurant is located in corner of an intersection. There is a steep hill right next to it, we parked on top of that hill which turned out to be quite the walk.  
Here is what we ordered: 

the plow  - two eggs, choice of house made pork sausage patties, Nueske's bacon, or chicken apple sausage, lemon ricotta pancakes + plow potatoes

The lemon ricotta pancakes here were the highlight here, small and fluffy and just the perfect ratio of lemon flavor mixed it. The plow potatoes were quite good too, crunchy and complements the rest of the breakfast plate. Be sure to mix it with the egg yolk for maximum yumminess! 

Beef Hash Skillet - two eggs, beef hash 
Pretty standard here, had better ones 

Overall the food was as expected it to be, I think the reason why the wait times were so long is because the restaurant is so small and cannot accommodate more than let's say 20-30 people at a time. 

The good thing about this place is that parking is easy to find since it is in a neighborhood. All in all, it is a good spot for brunch to cross of the list and onto the next one when I come back to visit!

excerpts: She got the house made pork sausage patties.
I thought it was super yummy.
I got to try everything she had.
I really like their triple fried plow potatoes.
Must have!!
I got their special *
Cornbeef hash on poached eggs.
I really like it.
Wasn't too heavy.
house made pork sausage.author: Sandy B.
house made pork sausage.review:
Finally got my seat at plow this passed Saturday. Been waiting to come here for awhile. The week before I got to plow at 11:30am and it was a 2.5 hour wait for a party of 3. We couldn't wait because we were hungry. Came back this Saturday at 10:30am and it was 1.5 - 2 hour wait for a party of 2. WOW!!! I know, the wait is crazy long. Instead of just waiting outside, my friend and I decided to get coffee 2 blocks away to kill time. Also you can order coffee, drinks and baked goods from Plow as you wait for your table. 

It was slightly over 1.5 hour wait and got a seat at the counter. We ordered **Equator coffee $3.75. Unlimited refills. We started with their **Hong Kong style toast  buttered brioche + sweetened condensed milk. I was super excited because its been forever since I had condensed milk. The brioche we had was super dry. Was a bit disappointed with that. We had one piece and let the milk soak in to soften up the brioche. My friend had their famous **"The Plow". Comes with everything, two eggs, choice of protein, 2 lemon ricotta pancakes + plow potatoes. She got the house made pork sausage patties. I thought it was super yummy. I got to try everything she had. I really like their triple fried plow potatoes. Must have!! I got their special **Cornbeef hash on poached eggs. I really like it. Wasn't too heavy. This dish is smaller in portion size but I thought it was perfect for me. 

Not my favorite in the city but it has became my TOP 5 BRUNCH in SF. Service was good, staff was friendly, especially the chefs.

excerpts: Also, if you like sausage patties, the house made pork sausage is a must try.
house made pork sausage.author: Jennie J.
house made pork sausage.review: Came here sunday morning around 9:30 and waited less than an hour for two people. My friend and I both ordered the Plow & it was amazing! I am a huge fan of lemon flavor so the lemon ricotta pancakes were delicious. Also, if you like sausage patties, the house made pork sausage is a must try. The Plow is the perfect amount of food to satisfy your brunch craving & I would definitely come back again.

excerpts: Based on my buddy's recommendation, I ordered their self-titled brunch speciality: two eggs any style (I went poached), house made pork sausage patties, bacon or chicken apple sausage (I went with the sausage), potatoes and two lemon ricotta pancakes.
I'm usually one to avoid lemon flavored foods, but I have to say these two flapjacks were some of the lightest, fluffiest, tastiest I've had in as long as I can remember.
The eggs were perfectly cooked, the sausage savory and hot.
The other real highlight was the potatoes, which are twice fried.
house made pork sausage.author: Alex L.
house made pork sausage.review:
Holy breakfast of the Gods. This place lives up to the hype. You can't find too many traditional breakfasts/brunches anymore. Pop in here and order the aptly named "Plow" breakfast and watch your world change. 

I was a little doubtful of the rave reviews. After all, this is San Francisco and many a popular spot seems to have unusually good reviews based just on how trendy it is at the time. Fortunately, I came on a Wednesday when the wait was minimal and we sat almost immediately at the bar where we could watch the chefs work. Based on my buddy's recommendation, I ordered their self-titled brunch speciality: two eggs any style (I went poached), house made pork sausage patties, bacon or chicken apple sausage (I went with the sausage), potatoes and two lemon ricotta pancakes. I'm usually one to avoid lemon flavored foods, but I have to say these two flapjacks were some of the lightest, fluffiest, tastiest I've had in as long as I can remember. The eggs were perfectly cooked, the sausage savory and hot. The other real highlight was the potatoes, which are twice fried. Throw on a little hot sauce and you're in brunch heaven. 

Some waits are worth it, others are not. I'm here to say this is a brunch worth the wait, and worth coming back for.

excerpts: I ordered the French toast with strawberries, mascarpone, and pure maple syrup while the mister ordered the Plow breakfast with two eggs, house made pork sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes, and crispy potatoes.
No complaints!
All the components on the Plow were nicely cooked and the two fluffy lemon ricotta pancakes truly had a pleasant lemon essence.
All the components on the Plow were nicely cooked and the two fluffy lemon ricotta pancakes truly had a pleasant lemon essence.
house made pork sausage.author: Merica S.
house made pork sausage.review:
Good food, but not feeling the approximately 1 hour and 45 minutes wait on the weekends. 

I'm not going to lie---the food just wasn't worth the unbearably long wait. Didn't blow my mind. 

I ordered the French toast with strawberries, mascarpone, and pure maple syrup while the mister ordered the Plow breakfast with two eggs, house made pork sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes, and crispy potatoes.  No complaints! All the components on the Plow were nicely cooked and the two fluffy lemon ricotta pancakes truly had a pleasant lemon essence. I thought my French toast appeared relatively burnt, though it didn't taste like it. 

+ Can only accommodate parties of 6 or fewer due to the small size of the venue 
+ No reservations
+ Indoor and outdoor seating

excerpts:
=/

I ordered the ever so popular 'The Plow', which comes with two eggs, choice of protein (chicken apple sausage, house made pork sausage patties, or bacon), two mini lemon ricotta pancakes, and their plow potatoes.
I was able to try my bf's house made pork sausage patties, and while they do have a robust smokey flavor, I found it dry and tough
.. something I wouldn't like to have more than a few bites of.

At first I said to myself, "I'm paying ~$17 for this..?

house made pork sausage.author: Kris C.
house made pork sausage.review:
I'm actually a little sad to be the minority that is not really in favor of this place as I just thought the food was 'okay' and nothing special.  As a previous yelper said, I honestly think the reason why it gets such high reviews is the location. =/

I ordered the ever so popular 'The Plow', which comes with two eggs, choice of protein (chicken apple sausage, house made pork sausage patties, or bacon), two mini lemon ricotta pancakes, and their plow potatoes. Everything was good, but nothing great. 

The chicken apple sausage was a standard sausage in my opinion. I was able to try my bf's house made pork sausage patties, and while they do have a robust smokey flavor, I found it dry and tough.. something I wouldn't like to have more than a few bites of. The potatoes were a little disappointing; if you can see with my picture, our potatoes were more on the dark brown, amber/orange side with a lot of burnt potato skins. At first I said to myself, "I'm paying ~$17 for this..?" (I will admit, the actual potatoes (that weren't burnt) were tasty though!) It's not when we finally left and saw that other people's potatoes were golden yellow and plumped with starchy goodness. So that's what the potatoes were suppose to be like! The lemon ricotta pancakes were probably the best of the dish, although nothing that I would be dying to come back for. 

My bf and I had the lovely outdoor seating on a beautiful SF day. It's a little comical thinking back that we were all seated on such a steep street/hill with an incline hahaha. That's SF for ya! (Must...fight...gravity..!!) I loved the decor though! Portions were huge, so at least that was something to make up for the more heftier price. Service was just okay for us, nothing above and beyond. Again, everything in general was good... but not great. For now, I wouldn't be back!

excerpts: The second time I had a simple two egg breakfast with house made pork sausage and a buttermilk biscuit.
This was an equally good choice, but I would choose the pork over both the chicken sausage and bacon, for the simple reason that the pork is house made, the bacon and chicken sausage are not.
Some of the coffee cakes and biscuits are only available until they are all gone, so it's a good idea to grab it while you can.
house made pork sausage.author: Michael M.
house made pork sausage.review:
The place to see, be seen, be seen eating.

I've been having a bit of fun trying to find new places to go in my new found freedom, to no fault of my own.  I've taken the cue from a few other people and tried to get here early.  I arrived before 8:30 am during the week to a nearly empty restaurant, and by the time I was finished less than an hour later all the seats were taken. So get here early.  Time went quickly, as I sat at the counter, dining solo, and enjoyed watching the chefs do their thing.

First time I had The Plow breakfast.  This comes with 2 eggs your way, choice of protein, Plow potatoes,  and 2 lemon ricotta pancakes.  I like my eggs over hard, so that way I know I will get fresh cracked eggs.  I did not notice if the eggs for scrambled eggs or omelets come from a ladle.  I chose chicken apple sausage.  Everything was very good.  The lemon ricotta pancakes do not need any of the accompanying maple syrup and are light, and the lemon brings it together.  The potatoes are first boiled, lightly smashed, then deep fried and tossed with a few herbs and fewer onions that do not overpower.  Quite possibly the best breakfast potatoes I've had.  They pale in comparison to the undercooked potatoes from Crepevine, but that's another review.

The second time I had a simple two egg breakfast with house made pork sausage and a buttermilk biscuit.  This was an equally good choice, but I would choose the pork over both the chicken sausage and bacon, for the simple reason that the pork is house made, the bacon and chicken sausage are not.   Some of the coffee cakes and biscuits are only available until they are all gone, so it's a good idea to grab it while you can.  Same for the Chinese Breakfast,  which I want to try next ... pork shoulder with chili garlic ginger sauce, 2 fried eggs and rice.  It sounds so perfect. 

Service is friendly and efficient.  Sitting at the counter I saw the servers correct the plates several times when the order was incorrect.  

Coffee is provided by Equator, if I recall.  This place is worth getting up early for ... of course I'm up early every day whether I want to or not.  The only negative was the provided hot sauce ... it was not as spicy as I normally like on my eggs.

excerpts: I ordered "The Plow" which consisted of two eggs any style, plow potatoes, your choice of house made pork sausage, bacon, or chicken sausage, and two lemon ricotta pancakes.
If you're a first timer, you really can't go wrong with "the plow" because the dish includes everything that you would want to try as a first timer.
house made pork sausage.author: Jennalyn L.
house made pork sausage.review:
It's true. The lemon ricotta pancakes are heavenly. Came here on a Monday morning around 8am and it was already packed! The servers were pretty quick about clearing tables and moving the line so we were seated pretty quickly. It didn't take long for me to decide what I wanted since I went there with the lemon ricotta pancakes already in mind. I ordered "The Plow" which consisted of two eggs any style, plow potatoes, your choice of house made pork sausage, bacon, or chicken sausage, and two lemon ricotta pancakes. 

So I never usually finish my potatoes at any brunch place but omg these were amazing. It was roasted perfectly with rosemary and super crispy. The sausage was seasoned perfectly and my over easy eggs were pleasingly runny. But the real star was the pancakes. How they make it so fluffy and light I will never know. They had a super strong lemon flavor. So, if you don't like lemon, don't order. But how could you not? 

I would definitely go back to try the other items on the menu. The plum ricotta pancake seemed interesting. If you're a first timer, you really can't go wrong with "the plow" because the dish includes everything that you would want to try as a first timer.

excerpts: Their house made pork sausage is scrumptious as well.
Thank you Plow for being the only restaurant where I can eat pancakes
I will gladly visit you every vacation I have to SF.
house made pork sausage.author: Melissa R.
house made pork sausage.review: Oh The Plow, let me count the many ways I love you.  There is yet to be a restaurant that has pure almond flour pancakes without a bunch of other junk in the batter.  I do believe these flapjacks flopped down from heaven just for me. The wait is long, so snuggle up next to a tree and watch SF hustle and bustle in the meantime because it's worth it.  Their house made pork sausage is scrumptious as well.  Thank you Plow for being the only restaurant where I can eat pancakes  I will gladly visit you every vacation I have to SF.

excerpts: chili + garlic egg fried up, frisee + parsley, toasted Acme brioche   14.75 and she ate the the plow  two eggs with choice of house made pork sausage patties, Nueske's bacon, or chicken apple sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes + plow potatoes.
Both delicious.
This is a must when in the city.
house made pork sausage.author: Keith C.
house made pork sausage.review:
Plow was WOW!!
We arrived early and we're lucky enough to get right inn. Place is small so heard there is almost always a wait. I would go back again and be more than happy to wait for their food. My wife and I split a order of the Hong Kong style toast  buttered brioche + sweetened condensed milk and it was amazing.....I wanted to lick the plate. I had the open-faced proscuitto + gruyere toast  chili + garlic egg fried up, frisee + parsley, toasted Acme brioche   14.75 and she ate the the plow  two eggs with choice of house made pork sausage patties, Nueske's bacon, or chicken apple sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes + plow potatoes. Both delicious. This is a must when in the city.

excerpts: Food: I ordered The Plow  (two eggs, choice of house made pork sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes + crispy potatoes).
Delicious.
The pancakes were amazing and I love that the breakfast potatoes are crispy!
The house made pork sausage was just okay
and I think I would opt for bacon if I were to order the same dish again.
My bf's fried egg sandwich was pretty legit.
house made pork sausage.author: Leana L.
house made pork sausage.review:
Oh my. Probably one of my favorite brunch places in town. We walked in on a random weekday morning a little before 9AM and were met with a wait time of about 30-45 minutes. Considering the last time we tried to eat here, the wait time was over an hour, we decided to grab some coffees at the front and sit it out on the little ledge protruding from the side of the building.

Ambiance: Your typical SF brunch spot. Bustling place with small tables and a lively crowd.

Service: Our waitress was excellent and everyone else was really nice, too! Even though it's a busy place, we didn't feel rushed at all.

Drinks: We grabbed coffees up front and they just added it to our bill after we actually ate. They refilled us at the table, of course, though.

Food: I ordered The Plow  (two eggs, choice of house made pork sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes + crispy potatoes). Delicious. The pancakes were amazing and I love that the breakfast potatoes are crispy! The house made pork sausage was just okay and I think I would opt for bacon if I were to order the same dish again. My bf's fried egg sandwich was pretty legit. So filling and so worth it.

Cost: Not too bad for an SF brunch spot!

Would I return? Yup!

excerpts: The house made pork sausage patties were as flavorful as a mudder fudger.
The fried egg sandwich was a no brainer.
house made pork sausage.author: Jennifer K.
house made pork sausage.review:
I remember adding Plow to my Yelp bookmarks about a year ago, and laughing at this photo: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/plow-san-francisco?select=AQQHQEMRFHofOnyRFOBWCA&utm_campaign=www_photo_share_popup&utm_medium=copy_link&utm_source=(direct)

"Silly San Franciscans," I thought. I mean, brunch is great and all, but I wouldn't think twice before opting out of a rain-soaked meal.

Then my boyfriend and I went to Plow this past weekend. Waited 2 hours in line. (Actually, drank coffee and read magazines at Farley's down the street to help pass the time.) Was finally seated! And ordered the following:

+ Buttermilk biscuit with honey butter
+ The Plow
+ Fried egg sandwich with bacon and avocado

IT WAS ALL DELICIOUS. Usually, I find brunch spots specialize in making one item their "thing," but everything we ordered was incredible. The buttermilk biscuit was crunchy on the outside, and the honey butter that came with it? I'd bathe in it, if I could. The Plow potatoes were ORGASMIC. (I usually hate using this word, but I don't know how else to describe those taters.) The house made pork sausage patties were as flavorful as a mudder fudger. The fried egg sandwich was a no brainer. And don't even get me started on the lemon ricotta pancakes.

And, the staff was great! The host didn't even get annoyed that we switched back and forth between indoor seating and "first available" three times.

So, yeah. I'll be back... with an umbrella and raincoat, if necessary.

excerpts: It's two eggs, choice of house made pork sausage, nueske bacon, or chicken apple sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes, crispy potatoes
and it comes out
all photo shoot ready for your Instagram shot
I loved everything on my plate and it was one of the best brunches I've ever had but
definitely the lemon ricotta pancakes get a shout out.
I'll be back for sure!!
house made pork sausage.author: Jingxi Z.
house made pork sausage.review:
Ugh, the hype here is as real as it gets. Came for an early afternoon brunch on Sunday and because we came in so late, the wait was only around 15 minutes! Although I have heard nightmare tales about the wait here at peak hours so definitely try and come either really early or really late like us haha.

My friend and I both ordered The Plow, which I feel like everyone gets here haha, but for good reason! I'll be back for sure!!

house made pork sausage.author: David Z.
house made pork sausage.review:
This is my favorite San Francisco breakfast! I've been here twice, once for a long line for a table of four on the weekend, and once in the morning on the way to drop a friend to the airport before driving back to Los Angeles. While I will gladly admit that it's great to be seated at Plow immediately (and a 7AM breakfast will allow for that), this is a place I'll wait in line for any day!

And for me, the thing to order is The Plow: an assortment of their offerings, including house made pork sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes and plow potatoes. And all of it is fantastic. Rarely do I not try new menu offerings on a return trip to a restaurant, but I can't imagine doing better than this plentiful platter.

I'll be back to San Francisco soon. Rest assured, I'll be returning to Plow.

We also ordered a side of bacon.
Everything was great!
The potatoes were nice and crispy and the scrambled eggs I had were not dry.
house made pork sausage.author: Breniel L.
house made pork sausage.review:
Today a Christmas miracle happened; my friend and I got in the door and had a table within 5 minutes! 5 MINUTES! That never happens in San Francisco, especially at a place as good as Plow. The party of two that was before us on the list did not show up, so they sat us first (which was fantastic). I know that it was a weekday morning and Christmas eve, but still, that's pretty amazing.

The first thing I noticed about this place was that the tables were pretty close together. We could hear the conversation of the table next to us and if we stretched our arms out, we would have definitely hit them. I did not mind this all too much, since the people sitting next to us were super friendly. 

Now, the food/drink. I got the coffee while my friend got the 12-hour cold brewed iced coffee. He says that if you really need to wake up, the iced coffee is the way to go. We both ordered the plow. He got the chicken and apple sausage while I got the house made pork sausage. We also ordered a side of bacon. Everything was great! The potatoes were nice and crispy and the scrambled eggs I had were not dry. The lemon ricotta pancakes were AMAZING. It was like biting into a fluffy lemon cookie. The serving size was great for what we ordered because we got to try a little bit of everything.

I will definitely be coming back. The service was great. I will definitely appreciate the Christmas miracle of having brunch within 5 minutes of putting my name on the list since this will probably never happen again.

excerpts: The Plow is brunchy bliss comprised of two eggs, your choice of house made pork sausage, Nueske bacon, or chicken apple sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes and crispy potatoes.
I went for the house made pork sausage but was able to steal a chicken sausage link off my buddy's plate -
both were awesome!
Nine times out of ten I'll order anything but pancakes but seeing as these were part of the "package deal" I approached with not only an open mind, but also an open mouth.
I was told that the lemon ricotta pancakes "are a make or break item" leaving you loving or conflicted on the breakfast.
Truth be told, they were a big win in my book but the true star of the show were the crispy potatoes.
Kissed with a hint of rosemary and crisped to the point that they're crunchy, but not overcooked or burnt.

I was given strict instructions when I went to Plow. They were short and simple, but were sure to provide me an experience that could not be flawed.

1. Don't look at the menu
2. Order "The Plow"

Easy enough right? Right! I did as I was told and had an exceptional breakfast, which admittedly was a little out of my wheelhouse, (not a huge breakfast fan), and resulted in the plate basically being licked clean. 

The Plow is brunchy bliss comprised of two eggs, your choice of house made pork sausage, Nueske bacon, or chicken apple sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes and crispy potatoes. I went for the house made pork sausage but was able to steal a chicken sausage link off my buddy's plate - both were awesome! Nine times out of ten I'll order anything but pancakes but seeing as these were part of the "package deal" I approached with not only an open mind, but also an open mouth. I was told that the lemon ricotta pancakes "are a make or break item" leaving you loving or conflicted on the breakfast. Truth be told, they were a big win in my book but the true star of the show were the crispy potatoes. Kissed with a hint of rosemary and crisped to the point that they're crunchy, but not overcooked or burnt. Be sure to ask for a bottle of hot sauce if you want to take them to another level and wash it all down with a cold glass of orange juice. 

Thanks Plow!

house made pork sausage.review:
Came here with my fellow foodie Fanny W., we found parking across the street (that never happens...), walked in and were seated right away at the last table available, sweet! There's nothing like a bright and sunny morning in SF, I mean how often does that happen honestly? Good thing Plow takes full advantage of whenever the weather is beautiful with its huge storefront facing windows. 

We opted for the Fried Egg Sandwich and THE PLOW. I thought the Fried Egg Sandwich sounded a bit ordinary, but it was far from it! Equipped with  two eggs fried, aioli, frisee, Vermont cheddar, Acme bun. The aioli puts a nice twist on the egg sandwich, and to top it off with Acme bun made fresh in the city, I could not resist. 

The Plow is a must order at Plow -- two eggs, choice of house made pork sausage, Nueske bacon, or chicken apple sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes, crispy potatoes. We went with the two eggs, house made pork sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes, crispy potatoes. Man-oh-man was this dish delish. The pork sausage was nicely seasoned, not too salty (which is a huge plus to me), the lemon ricotta pancakes were AMAZING it made my mouth drop (and this is coming from a girl who doesn't like lemon zested anything...), and the seasoned house potatoes sounded average, but they definitely weren't. 

Overall we had a fantastic experience here at Plow. Parking was easy (no meter), we were seated right away (rare moment), and the service/ambiance screamed brunch, what more could you ask for. One thing bothered me though, there was a huge mix up with the check, we were charged an extra $20... Something was obviously wrong here. I've been reading about restaurants scamming their customers a lot lately down in Santa Ana, so I was extra careful to check the tab. I'm sure it was just a mistake, but for it to happen to both our table and the table adjacent to ours? Kind of strange, I think Plow needs to figure that one out... Nonetheless Fanny W. and I really enjoyed our experience here and hope to be back real soon!

house made pork sausage.author: Mandy G.
house made pork sausage.review:
Arriving on a sunny, windy weekday afternoon, we entered Plow at around 1pm. The restaurant had quite a number of people, so we were kicked to curb, to wait in the wind. By kicking us to the curb, I mean they told us to step outside to wait till we're seated because they don't want it cramping up by the entrance. I like this idea because it makes the dining experience more enjoyable. They told us to wait about 5 mins, but we were seated within 3 mins. 

Located on the corner of Mississippi St and Texas St, this place can easily be missed..only because it's located in a residential area. They do have a sign sticking out that says "The Plow" though. Parking wasn't bad for my friend and I because we found one quick, right across the street. 

Seated in the back, service was still prompt and good because they would come check on us quite often. The food came out fairly quick in about 10 minutes. For my drink, I ordered the housemade strawberry lemonade ($3.75) [http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/plow-san-francisco?select=idHQVocGRxfnUjULoUkgDA#N3EwXeV_dXhdgR037ddEUw]. The drink looks adorable and instagram-worthy with its cute striped straw and lemon on the side, but don't let that fool you! I like the looks of it, but the straw is made of paper which can make it soggy. That's the only thing that irks me because the longer it sits in the lemonade, the faster it becomes soggy and the harder it becomes to drink. 

For my dish, I ordered The Plow ($16) [http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/plow-san-francisco?select=idHQVocGRxfnUjULoUkgDA#NYJXSTwF-Ugv0vFpKULyvQ] and a side of Nueske Bacon ($5.50) [http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/plow-san-francisco?select=idHQVocGRxfnUjULoUkgDA#fzy-q83TFoTe12n157Wu4Q]. The Plow was delicious! It consisted of  (2) small Lemon Ricotta Pancakes, Crispy Potatoes, Eggs, and House made pork sausage patties. I ordered this becuase it basically consisted of everything from the highlights on the Yelp page! I highly recommend ordering this for your first time because you get a taste of everything. Going from the lemon ricotta pancakes to crispy potatoes, to eggs and the house made pork sausage patties, everything just tasted so different from each other and unique! It changes your taste buds! 

The side of nueske bacon was a recommended dish in the highlights and as a fan of bacon, I just haaad to order it! I don't think it was all that special, but it was decently good. It was also pretty oily. 

If you can't finish your meal and plan to take the leftovers home, skip the crispy potatoes...it won't taste crispy anymore, haha. 

Overall, I enjoyed my experience and would definitely come back again..on a weekday! ;)

house made pork sausage.review:
Plow is the epitome of what it means to be a brunch spot. I wish I could stop coming here but their food really gets me every time. 

I usually opt for THE PLOW when I come here. The LEMON RICOTTA PANCAKES are the perfect blend of zest and depth for a pancake, this is definitely a must try! The NUESKE'S BACON and HOUSE MADE PORK SAUSAGE are both delicious, but I wouldn't recommend the Chicken-Apple. The potatoes are always fresh and crispy and eggs how you like 'em. The FRENCH TOAST w/ bananas is a great way to end brunch on a sweet note. Coffee, grapefruit juice, and the ginger beer are all great pairs with their dishes.

Things to keep in mind: The wait is going to be long. I was lucky to come by here when the wait was 15-20 minutes, but I know the wait can be up to 1.5-2 hours depending on the day and time you come by. You won't miss this place because of the large crowd standing at the corner of the block waiting to eat at this place.

Service is always great and friendly. Food doesn't take long despite the popularity and seating is both indoor and outdoor.

"Hour and a half wait," says Randall.

"No worries, we'll wait it out," I told him. He smiled and handed me some coffee to pass the time. He also pointed down the street and shared a tip: "Rico makes some killer Bloody Marys. In case you're interested."

Of COURSE I'm interested, Randall. We wasted a good 45 minutes at Blooms Saloon, (http://www.yelp.com/biz/blooms-saloon-san-francisco#hrid:g60JAte3LvIB4-uJ8CCUXw) then headed back to wait out the remainder of the time. 

EATS
+The Plow: two eggs, choice of house made pork sausage, Nueske bacon, or chicken apple sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes with pure maple syrup, and some crispy potatoes. The boy got his with the sugar pie pumpkin pancakes (instead of the lemon ricotta) and they were just as heavenly--if not better. We both opted for the bacon--and it was just OK; kinda smokey.

DRANKS
+Mimosas: watered down and not that great; especially not after that spicy Bloody Mary.
+Coffee: San Raf's finest, Equator coffee. Excellent.

Service was good, Randall made it great. Will I be back? Probably not, but happy to have tested it out to see what the hype was all about.

My friend picked this place for a recent brunch.  It was a 45 minute wait, but it was DEFINITELY worth it!  They don't accept reservations so you either have to wait or eat elsewhere.  Seems they're only open for brunch/lunch, no dinner.  

The interior is nice and clean.  Service is pretty friendly although I was slightly bothered when our female server decided to take my guy friend and my husband's order before mine.  What happened to ladies first?!

Started off with coffee and their fried doughnut holes.  One order came with 3.  They were good, but nothing too special.  Let them cool before you munch on them.  

I ordered the Plow, which came with 2 eggs, choice of Nueske bacon, house made pork sausage, or chicken apple sausage, 2 of their famous lemon ricotta pancakes, and crispy potatoes.  I chose the pork sausage.  The portions were just right.  My 2 eggs were nicely formed in a circle that they must have used a circle mold.  The pork sausage were basically patties, but they were really tasty.  You can taste the fennel with a little spice.  The best part was the lemon ricotta pancakes.  They were EXCELLENT!!  It just melted in my mouth; very moist.  With just a little bit of syrup, it's like dessert.  I had seen Yelp reviews about them and they were right!  You HAVE to try these!  Potatoes were nice and crispy.  Everything was so good, I finished my whole plate!

My husband had the Short Rib Hash and that was tasty as well.  Have to come back again!!!  Thanks, Richard for taking us here!

house made pork sausage.review:
Four times. 

The number of times I ATTEMPTED to go here before I finally scored a table for brunch. Brunching at Plow is straight out of an episode from Portlandia. It's crazy and worth it, I dare say! 

I finally scored a table here by arriving right when it opened on a Saturday morning and willingly sitting outside with my dogs. At this point, I was willing to do anything just to try this place. Luckily, the food lived up to the hype. 

What strikes me about this place is how SIMPLE the food is. Some people might say that the food is too simple, and unimpressive. But I'm a believer that most often, simple food is harder to make than complicated food because you have to really do justice to the ingredients to make the dishes shine.

And that's what they do best at Plow, simple food, but prepared with extraordinary care and attention to detail. We tried: 

-Cinnamon Brioche: deceivingly simple, but outrageously good. Reminded me of a Kouign Amann from B Patisserie
-The Plow: the house made pork sausage was really really good
-Fried Egg Sandwich w/ Bacon: hits all the notes - savory egg yolk, doughy bread, salty bacon, creamy aioli 
-Lemon Ricotta Pancake: good, but I've had better (Aquarius Cafe in Emeryville. R.I.P.)

And those were my favorites, in that order. 

And possibly what's even more perplexing to me is that my favorite thing at Plow was the side crispy potatoes that come with every order. Chunky, twice-fried nuggets of potatoes that are impossibly crispy on the outside and creamy inside. The crispy side potatoes are worth a detour by themselves!  

If you can stomach the wait or manage to get there early, Plow is worth the trip!

Crispy pig ears with a pickled egg - It comes with a chili vinaigrette but ask for the chili jam.  That chili jam is amazing and made everything taste better.  The pig ears were coated in batter and fried (ergo crispy) but the inside was melt in my mouth tender.  If you do get this, share it.  It is very rich. 

The plow - two eggs (whatever style), house made pork sausage, and 2 lemon ricotta pancakes.  This comes with a small container of real maple syrup.   This was AMAZING.  GET IT.  The pancakes are small, rich and oh my god so fluffy.  The eggs were ordered sunny side up and they were prefect.  The yolk was runny and the white is completely set. 

Soft egg scramble with goat cheese, lambsquarter and oyster mushrooms - This was decent but not my favorite.  I just didn't want to get another the plow (like my partner).  I don't regret my choice but I do think the plow was the much better idea.

Coffee - I don't know what they use but the this coffee was extremely fruity and not bitter at all.  They constantly refill the cup too.

All main came with crispy potato.  This was extremely good, especially with the chili jam. 

TLDR: If you are going to come here, bear in mind that you would need to wait at least  an hour (we got here around 11:30 on a Saturday)

Cost: You should expect to spend around $20+/person for food.

house made pork sausage.author: Matthew C.
house made pork sausage.review:
I'd like to tell you that Plow is awful, that you should go somewhere else, that there's nothing to see here... move along...  I'd like to tell you that so I won't have to wait as long for my go-to breakfast in SF, hands down. 

Sure, the potatoes are amazing, the house made pork sausage is spot on, and the lemon ricotta pancakes (with house made ricotta) are a welcome delight.  But then you dig into the breakfast sandwich, the seasonal salads (chilled roasted squash on a salad?!  Hell yeah), the all too rarely available biscuit sandwich, the even more annoyingly rare (and monumentally delicate) fried chicken sandwich, the soft scramble, and the countless other brilliant strokes of refined genius that Max cranks out, and you realize that you're in the presence of understated brilliance.  

Many times after finishing brunch at another spot in the city, I find myself quietly regretting having not gone to Plow.  It should be on everyone's short list in San Francisco.  Friends and family who have visited from out of town bring up Plow, unsolicited, on phone calls.  These are people who haven't been to San Francisco for a couple of years, and they don't mention the bridges, the wine, fancy dinner places, walks on twin peaks....Nope.  The thing that sticks with them is Plow.

Go, put your name in, grab a coffee from Farley's, walk around Potrero, go back in an hour and order too much food so you can try everything.

Or don't.  Nothing to see here.  Plane Jane breakfast place.  Move along...
