If you want to sit next to a bitch for a really good brunch, Plow is the place for you. Well, it was for me on a nice, cool Sunday mid-morning. The lack of star perfection wasn't due to her, it was the 1-hour wait for a table, but hey, you learn to expect that at places in SF that don't take reservations. They don't take parties greater than 6. 

Situated on a corner in Potrero Hill, Plow is small inside with just as many seats outside. The reason for the bitch, is that they have 2-person tables lined up along the wall of the restaurant and well, I had to get in to the inner table for my seat. I asked her nicely if she could move her chair in, well, she moved her butt, not moving the chair and barely at that. So basically I just shoved past her. Good thing I was sitting next to her and didn't have to stare at her sour-puss face the entire meal like DK did sitting across from her. Anyway, she made for good conversation.

Onto the food...once we were seated, our waitress took a while to bring us our waters and by then we were ready to order. You really can't go wrong with a breakfast place that has a pig sign under the name of their restaurant. Mmmm.....oink.

I had: the plow  two eggs, choice of Nueske bacon, house made pork sausage, or chicken apple sausage, two pancakes + crispy potatoes  14

DK had: max's biscuits + gravy  two buttermilk biscuits, pork sausage gravy, crispy potatoes  11

It came out fairly quickly and it was GOOD. The bacon was plentiful and was cooked just right, the pancakes had this lemony hint to them and were on the smaller size, but that's because they're not your average pancakes. They were really good though, but kind of had a french toast consistency and about the size of English muffins. The potatoes had some sort of Saffron or something on them, because they were as yellow as my egg yolks, but boy, were they good. I normally leave potatoes untouched on my plate (except for the hash brown kind), but these were awesome and just the right amount of crispy.

DK's biscuits and gravy were really good and the gravy was coma-inducing. 

I really enjoyed my breakfast, sans bitch. There's a multitude of breakfast places in SF, and many are good one-morning stands, but this one I would go on a second date with.

excerpts: The Plow-- two eggs, choice of Nueske bacon, house made pork sausage, or chicken apple sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes, crispy potatoes
two eggs fried, aioli, frisee, Vermont cheddar, Acme bun  10.75
add Nueske bacon
The lemon ricotta pancakes had a cake-like consistency and tons of flavor.
My only complaint about the pancakes was that they were way too small!
The potatoes?
Best freaking breakfast potatoes
I've ever had.
They were flavorful, crispy, and oh so good!
I also tasted my boyfriend's Fried Egg Sandwich was was also, very good.
The total came out to be about $30 something for breakfast.. a little pricy, but totally worth it!
house made pork sausage.author: Joyce E.
house made pork sausage.review:
Plow is absolutely delicious! I came here for my boyfriend's birthday brunch. The wait was about 15 minutes for two on a Thursday afternoon at around 1pm. The hostess/server was very nice and assured us that we would be seated soon. Since Plow is, as they describe "modest in size" definitely expect to get seated literally inches away from some random people. Anyways! Since we looked at the menu beforehand, we received our orders within 15 minutes. Pretty fast! I also want to mention that the wait went by quickly since my boyfriend and I were watching the cooks cook/prepare the food in the open kitchen. I ordered the Plow while my boyfriend settled on the Fried Egg sandwich.

Their water was served in jugs! My favorite. :)

(From their menu)

The Plow-- two eggs, choice of Nueske bacon, house made pork sausage, or chicken apple sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes, crispy potatoes  14.5

Fried egg sandwich -- two eggs fried, aioli, frisee, Vermont cheddar, Acme bun  10.75  add Nueske bacon  12.75

The Plow was SO good! The eggs were on the watery/yolky side which I didn't mind. The bacon tasted exactly like how my mom makes it -- It was sweet and not too crispy. The lemon ricotta pancakes had a cake-like consistency and tons of flavor. My only complaint about the pancakes was that they were way too small! The potatoes? Best freaking breakfast potatoes I've ever had. They were flavorful, crispy, and oh so good! I also tasted my boyfriend's Fried Egg Sandwich was was also, very good. The total came out to be about $30 something for breakfast.. a little pricy, but totally worth it!

excerpts: (I do eat my feelings in the form of house made pork sausage.)
Something tells me I'll be frequenting this place a little more nowadays.
house made pork sausage.author: Rebecca N.
house made pork sausage.review:
I've been here a bunch of times and 
1. Somehow, I've never had to wait.
2. I've only ever sat at the bar. 
3. I love you


Plow is hands down, forever in my heart, deep within my soul, my favorite place to get breakfast. I eat breakfast here when I'm happy, I eat here when I want to celebrate, I eat here when I want to treat myself to something nice. I even eat here when I'm sad. (I do eat my feelings in the form of house made pork sausage.) Something tells me I'll be frequenting this place a little more nowadays. ;( :D

I've never had anything bad here. And not even just that, because well, that's a lukewarm statement. I've only had EXCELLENT things here. The coffee is delicious, and so is the food. I most always get the Plow, which consists of lemon ricotta pancakes, crispy, crispy rosemary potatoes, eggs, and some sort of protein. I've had the soft scramble as well. Last time I was there there were oyster mushrooms, goat cheese, and stinging nettles all enveloped in soft, pillow-y, quivering eggs. freaking yum. 

And seriously, I don't mean to assume, or step on anyone's toes, but... it doesn't seem like anyone hates their job here. I know, rude of me to say. But no, really. The service is always served with a genuine smile, and I always come back because they are really, really, really nice. 

I recently went on a Saturday and even though they open at 8, the restaurant was full by 8:05. So, keep that in mind if you don't like waits! Even though I never have had to, I would because this place is a gem.

excerpts: You also get your choice of bacon or house made pork sausage which was fantastic and eggs.
I found it to be quite a lot of food
but it was also quite a lot of money
but it was a very good breakfast all in all.
house made pork sausage.author: Bonnie B.
house made pork sausage.review: This is a nice little breakfast Nook off the beaten path. Good coffee. I got the "plow breakfast" which consists of crispy potatoes and no you do not need to specify extra crispy because they are already very crispy. It came with two pretty small lemon ricotta pancakes which were delightful. They are served up with butter and maple syrup. You also get your choice of bacon or house made pork sausage which was fantastic and eggs. I found it to be quite a lot of food but it was also quite a lot of money but it was a very good breakfast all in all.

excerpts: ordered The Plow - with scrambled eggs and house made pork sausage patties.
waitress came back half an hour later saying they were out of the pork sausage
(it was 12:37pm on Sunday - yes, i did check the time)
got the chicken apple sausage instead.
should have gotten the bacon if i knew that the chicken apple sausages are those little bfast sausage (i like the ones with apple chunks in them instead).
house made pork sausage.author: Diana C.
house made pork sausage.review:
3.5 stars. this place is so cute!  the wait was very long...  love the decor.

ordered The Plow - with scrambled eggs and house made pork sausage patties. waitress came back half an hour later saying they were out of the pork sausage (it was 12:37pm on Sunday - yes, i did check the time) got the chicken apple sausage instead. should have gotten the bacon if i knew that the chicken apple sausages are those little bfast sausage (i like the ones with apple chunks in them instead). however, i really like the scrambled eggs (so runny!!) and CRISPY potatoes. tried that one weird whey orange drink (i wasn't paying a lot of attention when the waitress was describing it, but she mentioned that they made some cheese in-house and extracted protein, add orange juice and tonic... bleh - i didn't like it). lemon ricotta pancakes - first bite had a kick to it, but it's not fluffy. i like fluffy pancakes. same problem with the almond flour pancakes. 

i would totally go back for the eggs and potatoes. the muffin looked good, too. want to try that next time.

excerpts: I thought the house made pork sausage was a little dry, I wish I'd ordered the bacon or chicken apple sausage instead.
My poached eggs were cooked to perfection.
The potatoes were good
but I wish they weren't deep fried.
house made pork sausage.author: Tala D.
house made pork sausage.review:
Went here for the first time for Saturday breakfast. Had the "Plow" with lemon-ricotta pancakes & pork sausage.

The stand-out of the dish was certainly the pancakes... WOW. They were fantastic! I thought the house made pork sausage was a little dry, I wish I'd ordered the bacon or chicken apple sausage instead. My poached eggs were cooked to perfection. The potatoes were good but I wish they weren't deep fried. Coffee was excellent, and they had organic sugar on the table which was a big plus.

The wait here at 830AM was 45 minutes. This place is very popular.

excerpts: Plow is not a greasy spoon, so it is not going to satisfy palates accustomed to heavier fare, but if you are hungry, the Plow dish (two eggs, choice of house made pork sausage, Nueske bacon, or chicken apple sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes + crispy potatoes) is a great choice for people who are not on any restricted diets.
house made pork sausage.author: Kristina P.
house made pork sausage.review:
It's true that the wait for breakfast at Plow is usually long, but the line-up there is packed because people want to eat well prepared and healthy food that is fresh, local, and organic. The demand is therefore high. If you're an early riser, I'd recommend arriving at Plow at opening time in order to avoid the wait. 

I eat rather "clean" by following a Paleo/SCD diet, which advocates avoiding starches and consuming high quality meats, vegs, and fruits. Plow serves delicious meals that easily fit in with this eating philosophy. The Two Eggs dish is a great option for people following this diet. Note that the staff can swap the potatoes with greens.

Service and atmosphere are both very good. 

Plow is not a greasy spoon, so it is not going to satisfy palates accustomed to heavier fare, but if you are hungry, the Plow dish (two eggs, choice of house made pork sausage, Nueske bacon, or chicken apple sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes + crispy potatoes) is a great choice for people who are not on any restricted diets.

excerpts: The plow is two eggs, choice of house made pork sausage, Nueske bacon, or chicken apple sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes + crispy potatoes.
house made pork sausage.author: Jayne A.
house made pork sausage.review:
If you are indecisive (like me) get the plow so you can get a taste of everything. The plow is two eggs, choice of house made pork sausage, Nueske bacon, or chicken apple sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes + crispy potatoes.

The pancakes sound weird but they are definitely worth trying. The home fries are unique since they have both crunchy and chunky pieces. There are small pieces that are basically French fries and others that are like home fries. It is an awesome mix since you usually only get home fries for breakfast. All in all a wonderful start to my Sunday. 

Although the wait was pretty long, the service was great so I am more than willing to come back for the plow anytime.

excerpts: Looking forward to coming back to Plow ASAP to try their Fried Egg Sandwich, The Plow (two eggs, choice of Nueske bacon, house made pork sausage, or chicken apple sausage, two pancakes & crispy potatoes), and/or a Chocolate Eclair.
house made pork sausage.author: Tiffany M.
house made pork sausage.review:
I'm not one to vouch for restaurants that often, but in Plow's case, I guarantee that you'll like it... in fact, you'll LOVE it. I should also note that I almost never rate a place 5 stars based on a first time visit, but Plow was so freakin' good, that I feel confident in giving them 5 shiny stars.

Everything at Plow tasted just as good as it looked.

Standouts included:
+Lemon Ricotta Pancakes (house made ricotta, lemon zest, pure maple syrup) 
+Tinga (chicken in tomato chipotle sauce, two crispy corn tortillas, avocado, creme fraiche, cilantro)
+Crispy Potatoes

Mid-conversation, my friend let out a big 'MMMM!!!!" when he bit into his pancakes. I couldn't have agreed more! 

I like the fact that they work w/ local purveyors such as Frog Hollow Farms, Cowgirl Creamery, Monterey Fish Co, Acme Bread & Tcho Chocolate. When you see that they work w/ such local all-stars, you know you're in for a treat. I also really enjoyed Plow's Equator coffee while I waited for our table. And that wait was long! We came in at 11:30 am and had to wait an hour until we were seated. Normally I'd shoot for a much earlier brunch time to avoid the wait, but given that I was prepared for a leisurely Sunday brunch, the wait was pretty painless.

I love the ambiance of this place. It's small, but w/ their high ceilings and all the light that shines in from their big windows, they're able to make the space work; especially decorated in its rustic, modern, simplistic fashion. I love their signage, logo and menu- all well done. They also have stool seating where you can watch the chefs work their magic (like we did!)

The host was cool and our server efficient. Parking was ample (not surprising for Portrero Hill ) and diners seemed to be all SF locals. 

Looking forward to coming back to Plow ASAP to try their Fried Egg Sandwich, The Plow (two eggs, choice of Nueske bacon, house made pork sausage, or chicken apple sausage, two pancakes & crispy potatoes), and/or a Chocolate Eclair.

This place makes me thankful for SF's amazing food scene!

excerpts: I ordered The Plow which consists of two eggs, choice of house made pork sausage, Nueske bacon, or chicken apple sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes and crispy potatoes.
This was not cheap as the price of admission was $15.75, but it didn't fail to satisfy.
The potatoes were some of the best I've had in the city, super crispy and salty.
The eggs were scrambled to perfection and the pancakes may have been the highlight here.
And the bacon, was well bacon.
You can't really go wrong with bacon.
All in all, the entire experience was enjoyable and the waitress even prevented my from getting a parking ticket as halfway through the meal
she warned me there was street sweeping.
The neighborhood is a little out of the way if you are just visiting, but there is a great view of the skyline from across the street.
Definitely worth checking out if you've got some spare time.
Would highly suggest avoiding this place on the weekends.
#foodcomaking approved.
house made pork sausage.author: Food Coma K.
house made pork sausage.review: In the past few weeks, Plow has frequently become the main topic of conversation when talking about brunch. Unless you get there around 7am on weekends, you are looking at waiting over two hours which is insane if you ask me. This morning I just so happened to be in the area and drove by to see many open spots inside so I decided to stop and see what all the fuss is about. I was seated immediately and was able to get in and out of the establishment in under a half an hour which was awesome. The food was great. Worth waiting two hours for? Probably not, but then again I'm not sure any food is worth waiting two hours for. I ordered The Plow which consists of two eggs, choice of house made pork sausage, Nueske bacon, or chicken apple sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes and crispy potatoes. This was not cheap as the price of admission was $15.75, but it didn't fail to satisfy. The potatoes were some of the best I've had in the city, super crispy and salty. The eggs were scrambled to perfection and the pancakes may have been the highlight here. And the bacon, was well bacon. You can't really go wrong with bacon. All in all, the entire experience was enjoyable and the waitress even prevented my from getting a parking ticket as halfway through the meal she warned me there was street sweeping. The neighborhood is a little out of the way if you are just visiting, but there is a great view of the skyline from across the street. Definitely worth checking out if you've got some spare time. excerpts: Comes with one of their lemon ricotta pancakes and house made pork sausage.
Also has potatoes, eggs your style and toast.
It's big, but if you're hungry, you will not be disappointed by any part of it.
house made pork sausage.author: Louis A.
house made pork sausage.review:
The wait can be crazy, but if you go at the right time (between 7-8 in the morning) or at off peak lunch hours, you can usually snag a spot, at least at the counter. 

All of the food is great. I will say that Plow has the best home fries / breakfast potatoes that I have ever had. Fried until crispy, tossed with spices and herbs. They are out of control and go great with everything else Plow brings to the table.

If you have never been, get "The Plow" for breakfast. Comes with one of their lemon ricotta pancakes and house made pork sausage. Also has potatoes, eggs your style and toast. It's big, but if you're hungry, you will not be disappointed by any part of it.

excerpts: he also got the chicken apple sausage with his order since they ran of the house made pork sausage.
boo.
house made pork sausage.author: Genie S.
house made pork sausage.review:
Came here on a weekday.  It was already packed.  We waited about 20 minutes (not bad) and were seated at the counter.  I love their open kitchen and watching the cooks at work.

I got an egg sandwich with bacon and Vince w. got the plow.  I'm sure it's their ingredients and the farms they get their produce from because that was one yummy egg sandwich.  I'm probably so used to eating eggs from hormone injected chickens that I'm used to it!

The plow order came with some yummy pancakes.  They are dollar pancakes though, but cooked to lemony perfection.  I'm not a pancake fan, but i liked. he also got the chicken apple sausage with his order since they ran of the house made pork sausage. boo.  The chicken apple was fine, nothing out of the ordinary.

The potatoes were yum, with just a pinch of salt. 

The service was spotty as I had to get my own ketchup, but then she asked us if we needed water like 5 times. *shrugs*

Go for the eggs!

excerpts: I had "the plow" there for $13 -  "two eggs, choice of Nueske bacon, house made pork sausage, or chicken apple sausage, 2 pancakes, and crispy potatoes."
I saw the Chinese sausage there on the menu, and they allowed me to substitute that for my sausage choice.
The food came relatively quick, presented nicely on a white plate.
house made pork sausage.author: Leo C.
house made pork sausage.review:
Plow offers a clean and relaxed atmosphere to enjoy a fresh and delicious breakfast/brunch.  I came here jet lagged after getting off a trans-pacific flight, looking for a satisfying meal that features fresh ingredients.  Plow did the job for sure.  

I had "the plow" there for $13 -  "two eggs, choice of Nueske bacon, house made pork sausage, or chicken apple sausage, 2 pancakes, and crispy potatoes."  I saw the Chinese sausage there on the menu, and they allowed me to substitute that for my sausage choice.  The food came relatively quick, presented nicely on a white plate.  The server was very attentive and nice while conscious of not being bothersome.  

Overall, Plow is a place that I'd come back to as well as recommend to my friends.  It's not a great value since the price is somewhat premium for what you're getting.  But it's also very fresh and clean, so the price is fair.  Come check it out!

excerpts: The house made pork sausage yummers.
Still working my way down the menu.
I met someone at the counter who said he eats there at least 3 times a week.
I totally see why.
I'm so tempted to head over there right now.
house made pork sausage.author: Pamela A.
house made pork sausage.review: LOVE everything about this place. Atmosphere is fresh and clean. The people are super nice. And the food... The potatoes are outrageously good, crispy, rosemary goodness. The pancakes, sweet, fluffy. The house made pork sausage yummers. Still working my way down the menu. I met someone at the counter who said he eats there at least 3 times a week. I totally see why. I'm so tempted to head over there right now.

excerpts: The side of nueske bacon $5.75 is very meh.
You might as well order regular bacon.
The biscuit $4.50 was good, but not anything mind blowing.
nueske bacon.author: Thien H.
nueske bacon.review:
Plow is my LEAST favorite breakfast in the city so far. 

The place is small, so expect a long wait. 

We expected a long wait, but we did not expect the hostess (the brunette with darker hair in a bun) to FORGET to seat our party.

With these SF small types of restaurants, I try to check with the hostess periodically on the status of a table - but not too often in case we annoy them or make their stressful job any harder. We kept an eye on another party of four that was on the list before us. They were told repeatedly that their table was almost ready and to get prepared to be seated. Kind of in a warning/scolding tone. But it was a good 45 minutes after they were told they would get seated soon (1 hr and 35 minutes total) before they actually got seated. 

For us, it took at least 2 hrs to get seated. We checked a couple times by either asking her or peering over her shoulder when she'd come outside with the list. The second to last time we asked, she was annoyed that we asked and brushed us off not bothering to check our name on the list. Then when we saw a group of four and a two top (who arrived after us) get seated we started to worry. We asked her for an update for the last time and she had a look of confusion and panic in her eyes. We told her the name (it was on the previous page - she had started a new page in the notepad) and we all realized she totally FORGOT about us.

She kinda freaked out, half apologized, and magically a table opened up soon. As a former hostess/restaurant worker and observing her for a couple hours, I don't think she really knows what she's doing. The "forgetting a party" happens on rare occasions, but I'm not sure why she couldn't push two tables for two together for a party of four. I saw multiple tables of two (who arrived much later than others) seated before parties of four on several occasions. Not sure why parties of four are treated as a second class at Plow.

Food: OJ is not fresh. The side of nueske bacon $5.75 is very meh. You might as well order regular bacon. The biscuit $4.50 was good, but not anything mind blowing. The Plow breakfast platter is okay, the pancakes were a bit dry. I liked the sausage. The potatoes were okay and could have been crispier. The two egg brekke $15.75 is basic. 

The white napkins are very linty and will leave a mess on your dark pants.

Tl;dr Disappointed the hostess forgot to seat our table of four. The food was just alright and not worth the wait.

excerpts: I got it with the nueske bacon.
Yeah it was good
but again I wouldn't shell out that much for a fried egg sandwich
nueske bacon.author: Tiffanie T.
nueske bacon.review:
I wish I could give it a 3.5. My experience was good here but it's was not shell shocking die worthy.  Aka--a tad too much hype! I'm pretty sure the only reason there's so much buzz is it's in Potrero hill...

If you come here, make sure to get the lemon ricotta pancakes (yum they were good). 

There was much buzz about the fried egg sandwich... I got it with the nueske bacon. Yeah it was good but again I wouldn't shell out that much for a fried egg sandwich and it wasn't that memorable

I think what I still dream of are those freaking fried potato fries things - make sure to get an order of those. I am actually serious about that.

excerpts: It's two eggs, choice of house made pork sausage, nueske bacon, or chicken apple sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes, crispy potatoes
and it comes out
all photo shoot ready for your Instagram shot
I loved everything on my plate and it was one of the best brunches I've ever had but
definitely the lemon ricotta pancakes get a shout out.
I'll be back for sure!!
nueske bacon.author: Jingxi Z.
nueske bacon.review:
Ugh, the hype here is as real as it gets. Came for an early afternoon brunch on Sunday and because we came in so late, the wait was only around 15 minutes! Although I have heard nightmare tales about the wait here at peak hours so definitely try and come either really early or really late like us haha.

My friend and I both ordered The Plow, which I feel like everyone gets here haha, but for good reason! It's two eggs, choice of house made pork sausage, nueske bacon, or chicken apple sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes, crispy potatoes and it comes out all photo shoot ready for your Instagram shot :) I loved everything on my plate and it was one of the best brunches I've ever had but definitely the lemon ricotta pancakes get a shout out. I'll be back for sure!!

excerpts: No, the Nueske bacon isn't all that special (if your meal comes with it, cool.
If not?
Don't bother ordering it as a side)
nueske bacon.author: Susy C.
nueske bacon.review:
Yea this place lives up to hype. 
Yea the lemon ricotta pancakes are good. 
Yea the wait really is about two hours.
Yea the potatoes are crispy and delicious. 
Yea this place is tiny. 

No, I don't think the lemon ricotta pancakes are worth waiting that long for. 
No, I don't like waiting. 
No, the Nueske bacon isn't all that special (if your meal comes with it, cool. If not? Don't bother ordering it as a side) 
No, they don't give you enough ketchup. 

Eat your food, pay, AND THEN GET UP AND LEAVE YOU DAMN HIPSTERS!!! Other people have to fecking eat too!!!

excerpts: For our main dish, my friend and I split the fried egg sandwich (two fried eggs, cheddar, aioli), crispy potatoes, and a side of Nueske bacon (salty, salty bacon).
Ok, so I could have made this at home without the one hour wait, but it wouldn't have come with an awesome egg show.
Try to get seated at the bar and you'll see what I mean.
The egg guy was on fire --
no timer, just instinct.
Soft poached, scrambled, sunny side -- you name it, and he was on it!
He was too cool.
Also fun, the host/ess will take your coat and hang it up for you; made me feel like I was visiting someone's home.
nueske bacon.author: Erin G.
nueske bacon.review:
What I ate: Monkey bread, fried egg sandwich
Visit date: January 27, 2013
First time? Yes.

A one hour wait with good company isn't so bad, especially on a sunny day. And then we were rewarded with monkey bread! The monkey bread is a definite must eat (note: limited supply!). It's like a cinnamon bun, but on crack. Warm, just enough gooey, and a touch of sweet. For our main dish, my friend and I split the fried egg sandwich (two fried eggs, cheddar, aioli), crispy potatoes, and a side of Nueske bacon (salty, salty bacon). Ok, so I could have made this at home without the one hour wait, but it wouldn't have come with an awesome egg show. Try to get seated at the bar and you'll see what I mean. The egg guy was on fire -- no timer, just instinct. Soft poached, scrambled, sunny side -- you name it, and he was on it! He was too cool. Also fun, the host/ess will take your coat and hang it up for you; made me feel like I was visiting someone's home.

excerpts: Pay the extra couple bucks for the Nueske bacon; you will not regret it.
The sandwich was the perfect answer for breakfast.
The bun was soft and airy, and the combination of melted cheese, fried eggs, and crispy bacon was heavenly.
nueske bacon.author: Bailey Z.
nueske bacon.review:
I am not easily impressed by overpriced brunch spots, but today I was an exception. It's funny that everyone emphasizes organic and locally-sourced ingredients these days. Eating organic isn't enough anymore, but you now must do society and your community a service by supporting local farms, etc. I hate it for the most part only because it usually means pricier bills for mediocre food. Plow keeps their menu simple, but they do it well.

I got the fried egg sandwich, constructed with two eggs, aioli, frisee, cheddar on an Acme bun. Pay the extra couple bucks for the Nueske bacon; you will not regret it. The sandwich was the perfect answer for breakfast. The bun was soft and airy, and the combination of melted cheese, fried eggs, and crispy bacon was heavenly. The crispy potatoes on the side were amazing. The best thing on the menu is the lemon ricotta pancakes. The texture was softer and crumblier than a normal pancake and the flavor was outstanding. It was probably one of the best pancakes I've ever had. 

Overall, I loved the breakfast here. The prices weren't cheap ($13 for the breakfast sandwich and $15 for the plow). I wouldn't normally pay this much for breakfast, but if it's done right, it's hard to pass up.

excerpts: The Plow is brunchy bliss comprised of two eggs, your choice of house made pork sausage, Nueske bacon, or chicken apple sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes and crispy potatoes.
I went for the house made pork sausage but was able to steal a chicken sausage link off my buddy's plate -
both were awesome!
Nine times out of ten I'll order anything but pancakes but seeing as these were part of the "package deal" I approached with not only an open mind, but also an open mouth.
I was told that the lemon ricotta pancakes "are a make or break item" leaving you loving or conflicted on the breakfast.
Truth be told, they were a big win in my book but the true star of the show were the crispy potatoes.
Kissed with a hint of rosemary and crisped to the point that they're crunchy, but not overcooked or burnt.
nueske bacon.author: Brad B.
nueske bacon.review:
I was given strict instructions when I went to Plow. They were short and simple, but were sure to provide me an experience that could not be flawed.

1. Don't look at the menu
2. Order "The Plow"

Easy enough right? Right! I did as I was told and had an exceptional breakfast, which admittedly was a little out of my wheelhouse, (not a huge breakfast fan), and resulted in the plate basically being licked clean. 

The Plow is brunchy bliss comprised of two eggs, your choice of house made pork sausage, Nueske bacon, or chicken apple sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes and crispy potatoes. I went for the house made pork sausage but was able to steal a chicken sausage link off my buddy's plate - both were awesome! Nine times out of ten I'll order anything but pancakes but seeing as these were part of the "package deal" I approached with not only an open mind, but also an open mouth. I was told that the lemon ricotta pancakes "are a make or break item" leaving you loving or conflicted on the breakfast. Truth be told, they were a big win in my book but the true star of the show were the crispy potatoes. Kissed with a hint of rosemary and crisped to the point that they're crunchy, but not overcooked or burnt. Be sure to ask for a bottle of hot sauce if you want to take them to another level and wash it all down with a cold glass of orange juice. 

Thanks Plow!

-$16 for my plate which I thought was reasonable with HUGE portion I was served

In conclusion, would def come back and recommend to friends

We went with the two eggs, house made pork sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes, crispy potatoes.
Man-oh-man was this dish delish.

Man-oh-man was this dish delish.
The pork sausage was nicely seasoned, not too salty (which is a huge plus to me), the lemon ricotta pancakes were AMAZING
nueske bacon.author: Elaine N.
nueske bacon.review:
Came here with my fellow foodie Fanny W., we found parking across the street (that never happens...), walked in and were seated right away at the last table available, sweet! There's nothing like a bright and sunny morning in SF, I mean how often does that happen honestly? Good thing Plow takes full advantage of whenever the weather is beautiful with its huge storefront facing windows. 

We opted for the Fried Egg Sandwich and THE PLOW. I thought the Fried Egg Sandwich sounded a bit ordinary, but it was far from it! Equipped with  two eggs fried, aioli, frisee, Vermont cheddar, Acme bun. The aioli puts a nice twist on the egg sandwich, and to top it off with Acme bun made fresh in the city, I could not resist. 

The Plow is a must order at Plow -- two eggs, choice of house made pork sausage, Nueske bacon, or chicken apple sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes, crispy potatoes. We went with the two eggs, house made pork sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes, crispy potatoes. Man-oh-man was this dish delish. The pork sausage was nicely seasoned, not too salty (which is a huge plus to me), the lemon ricotta pancakes were AMAZING it made my mouth drop (and this is coming from a girl who doesn't like lemon zested anything...), and the seasoned house potatoes sounded average, but they definitely weren't. 

Overall we had a fantastic experience here at Plow. Parking was easy (no meter), we were seated right away (rare moment), and the service/ambiance screamed brunch, what more could you ask for. One thing bothered me though, there was a huge mix up with the check, we were charged an extra $20... Something was obviously wrong here. I've been reading about restaurants scamming their customers a lot lately down in Santa Ana, so I was extra careful to check the tab. I'm sure it was just a mistake, but for it to happen to both our table and the table adjacent to ours? Kind of strange, I think Plow needs to figure that one out... Nonetheless Fanny W. and I really enjoyed our experience here and hope to be back real soon!

excerpts: Ruben had the Fried Egg Sandwich with Nueske Bacon ($13.50), two soft fried eggs, aioli, cheddar, and frisée on an Acme bun.
nueske bacon.author: Amelinda L.
nueske bacon.review:
We walked here from the 16th St BART Station. Not a good idea. I didn't think to check the distance (1.6 miles); it seemed so close on the map. It's not that a 32-minute walk wasn't good for me (I totally earned my breakfast, not), it's the unsavory characters that you encounter. So, don't do what I did. However, the meal was worth the trouble!

We arrived around 9:30 on a Tuesday and it was much busier than I expected. Fortunately not busy enough that we had to wait because thankfully, there were two seats available at the bar. Some helpful notes: they will not seat you unless your entire party is present. Even if it is just one other person. No exceptions. Also, there's only 6-7 seats at the bar and roughly seven tables (very small space). There are a couple tables for outside dining as well.

Owner/Chef Maxine Siu was directly in front of us busily preparing dishes in their small partially-open kitchen. She was careful not to make eye contact with any patrons. Totally understandable, but it would have been so much fun to talk food. 

Ruben started with a cup of Equator Coffee ($3.50) and we shared a Cinnamon Brioche ($4). It was a delicious rendition of a cinnamon roll and the center was perfectly gooey and flavorful. I selected The Plow ($16) with sunny side-up eggs, housemade pork sausage, two Lemon Ricotta Pancakes, and crispy potatoes. The sausage was nice, but dry. Not my favorite sausage. Though the crispy potatoes were lovely and the Lemon Ricotta Pancakes were perfect! Ruben had the Fried Egg Sandwich with Nueske Bacon ($13.50), two soft fried eggs, aioli, cheddar, and frisée on an Acme bun. This was also tasty with the addition of the "Food's Best Friend Lucky Dog" hot fire-roasted pepper sauce.

Our server was really friendly and everyone was very pleasant. We didn't loiter much since there were several people waiting, but it's a nice setting to hang out and catch up with friends. The decor is fun with many pigs around! Oh, the important question - would I wait for 1+ hour(s) for a table? No, but that is why you plan ahead!

excerpts: I always get the plow at plow (haa) since my love for lemon ricotta pancakes is just as strong as my love for nueske bacon.
The fluffiness of the pancakes are just not recreate-able.
If they were, I'd be making them every morning.
nueske bacon.author: Nina S.
nueske bacon.review: This is one of the cutest brunch places I've been to. The inside is just so French, like effortlessly cool. And the food is simple but elegant in a rustic way. I always get the plow at plow (haa) since my love for lemon ricotta pancakes is just as strong as my love for nueske bacon. The fluffiness of the pancakes are just not recreate-able. If they were, I'd be making them every morning.

excerpts: For my dish, I ordered The Plow ($16) [http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/plow-san-francisco?select=idHQVocGRxfnUjULoUkgDA#NYJXSTwF-Ugv0vFpKULyvQ] and a side of Nueske Bacon ($5.50)
[http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/plow-san-francisco?select=
idHQVocGRxfnUjULoUkgDA#fzy-q83TFoTe12n157Wu4Q].
The side of nueske bacon was a recommended dish in the highlights and as a fan of bacon, I just haaad to order it!
I don't think it was all that special, but it was decently good.
nueske bacon.author: Mandy G.
nueske bacon.review:
Arriving on a sunny, windy weekday afternoon, we entered Plow at around 1pm. The restaurant had quite a number of people, so we were kicked to curb, to wait in the wind. By kicking us to the curb, I mean they told us to step outside to wait till we're seated because they don't want it cramping up by the entrance. I like this idea because it makes the dining experience more enjoyable. They told us to wait about 5 mins, but we were seated within 3 mins. 

Located on the corner of Mississippi St and Texas St, this place can easily be missed..only because it's located in a residential area. They do have a sign sticking out that says "The Plow" though. Parking wasn't bad for my friend and I because we found one quick, right across the street. 

Seated in the back, service was still prompt and good because they would come check on us quite often. The food came out fairly quick in about 10 minutes. For my drink, I ordered the housemade strawberry lemonade ($3.75) [http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/plow-san-francisco?select=idHQVocGRxfnUjULoUkgDA#N3EwXeV_dXhdgR037ddEUw]. The drink looks adorable and instagram-worthy with its cute striped straw and lemon on the side, but don't let that fool you! I like the looks of it, but the straw is made of paper which can make it soggy. That's the only thing that irks me because the longer it sits in the lemonade, the faster it becomes soggy and the harder it becomes to drink. 

For my dish, I ordered The Plow ($16) [http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/plow-san-francisco?select=idHQVocGRxfnUjULoUkgDA#NYJXSTwF-Ugv0vFpKULyvQ] and a side of Nueske Bacon ($5.50) [http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/plow-san-francisco?select=idHQVocGRxfnUjULoUkgDA#fzy-q83TFoTe12n157Wu4Q]. The Plow was delicious! It consisted of  (2) small Lemon Ricotta Pancakes, Crispy Potatoes, Eggs, and House made pork sausage patties. I ordered this becuase it basically consisted of everything from the highlights on the Yelp page! I highly recommend ordering this for your first time because you get a taste of everything. Going from the lemon ricotta pancakes to crispy potatoes, to eggs and the house made pork sausage patties, everything just tasted so different from each other and unique! It changes your taste buds! 

The side of nueske bacon was a recommended dish in the highlights and as a fan of bacon, I just haaad to order it! I don't think it was all that special, but it was decently good. It was also pretty oily. 

If you can't finish your meal and plan to take the leftovers home, skip the crispy potatoes...it won't taste crispy anymore, haha. 

Overall, I enjoyed my experience and would definitely come back again..on a weekday! ;)

excerpts: Nueske bacon fine.
nueske bacon.author: Jana C.
nueske bacon.review:
Generous 2.3 for brunch very recently. Bookmarked for 3 years----crestfallen experience on a warm afternoon.

I was stuck on the Bridge; plenty of empty tables available outside. My friend was forced to stand and wait until I arrived in order to sit down somewhere. Joking me?? I understand upholding that when there are not a minimum of 6 2-tops open! Off-putting

The plow breakfast ordered was such a letdown, upon immediate glance of small plate. Crispy potatoes tasted stale to both of us, and instead of properly cut small chunks, we got little bits and bobbles of leftover pan. Couldn't even spear them with the tines of a fork. Resigned, we just wasted an already small plate of food for $16.

Lemon ricotta pancakes (2 silver dollar-sized) did not have that refined, think crispy buttery edge with super fluffy, melt-in-mouth feel. Lemon was very nice on the tongue, but it certainly was the only positive attribute to them.

Nueske bacon fine.

After within the month, going to many brunch places, I find the food way overrated. Way.

excerpts: We decided to split the Fried Egg Sandwich (Two Eggs Fried, Cheddar, Aioli, Served w/Crispy Potatoes, $11 + Nueske Bacon, $2.50, http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/plow-san-francisco?select=GFi1WD9m-LXQzmYujzQpmA#YwR3TfuxiYN9OUvbMeiiBA) since I wasn't that hungry, and it was delicious.
However, it didn't compare to the crispy potatoes, which were AMAZING.
These were probably the best crispy potatoes that I've ever had.
They were super flavorful, and cooked really well-
this was a perfect addition to the 7x7 list.
The egg sandwich is highly recommend but the potatoes are a must order!
Hour Cold-Brewed Iced Coffee ($4, http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/plow-san-francisco?select=GFi1WD9m-LXQzmYujzQpmA#GFi1WD9m-LXQzmYujzQpmA): Also really good, and highly recommended.
nueske bacon.author: Amy D.
nueske bacon.review:
Crispy Potatoes- #92 on the 2013 7x7 100 Things to Eat Before You Die list.

I tried going to Plow once before, and the line was so crazy on a Saturday that they couldn't even accommodate to-go orders. I tried again on a Friday afternoon, and my friend and I got there around 11am and there was already a 20 minute wait! Luckily we were just a party of two and got seated after 10-15 minutes. We decided to split the Fried Egg Sandwich (Two Eggs Fried, Cheddar, Aioli, Served w/Crispy Potatoes, $11 + Nueske Bacon, $2.50, http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/plow-san-francisco?select=GFi1WD9m-LXQzmYujzQpmA#YwR3TfuxiYN9OUvbMeiiBA) since I wasn't that hungry, and it was delicious. However, it didn't compare to the crispy potatoes, which were AMAZING. These were probably the best crispy potatoes that I've ever had. They were super flavorful, and cooked really well- this was a perfect addition to the 7x7 list. The egg sandwich is highly recommend but the potatoes are a must order!
-12 Hour Cold-Brewed Iced Coffee ($4, http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/plow-san-francisco?select=GFi1WD9m-LXQzmYujzQpmA#GFi1WD9m-LXQzmYujzQpmA): Also really good, and highly recommended. The coffee was really smooth, and had good flavor.

Overall, the lines at Plow are justified, and is one of the best brunch spots I've been to ever. Although the restaurant and tables are small, and it can be difficult to find parking at times (it was easy on the weekday), I will definitely be back to try other items on their menu. I really like our waitress, who was really friendly and accommodating.

excerpts: A plate of crispy potatoes(crack), Nueske bacon (crack), lemon ricotta pancakes (crack) and eggs (cracked =P)
My GAWD this was delicious.
The Nueske bacon was simply the best bacon I've had.
The lemon ricotta pancakes were heavenly.
nueske bacon.author: Herman E.
nueske bacon.review:
This place serves crack.

I swear.  Pure craaaaaaaack!

This is a plate of crack:
http://www.yelp.ca/biz_photos/plow-san-francisco?select=AQQHQEMRFHofOnyRFOBWCA#ToiZprRvyLu9we-MuuTI8g
It's the signature dish, the Plow.  A plate of crispy potatoes(crack), Nueske bacon (crack), lemon ricotta pancakes (crack) and eggs (cracked =P)  My GAWD this was delicious.  The Nueske bacon was simply the best bacon I've had.  The lemon ricotta pancakes were heavenly.

Cold smoked salmon, fromage blanc, pickled red onions, capers, grilled Acme rye:
http://www.yelp.ca/biz_photos/plow-san-francisco#OZ955kbTXWpM8skTrkEXEw

This was good.  Ingredients were fresh.  My only complaint would be that the smoked salmon was not smoked enough.  I come from the land of smoked salmon, and this needed more smoking.

Also ordered a side of house made sausage patties.  Again good, but, yours truly makes a better version.  There were chili flakes and fennel in the spicing mixture.   So attn,  Management of Plow, you wanna pack 'em in even more?  PM me and maybe I'll share my sausage spicing recipe with you.  Pfffffffffft......

One real stand out.  Coffee.

I should have asked where they got their coffee, b/c this is a first!  And I really do mean first.  I do not like sour coffee.  I drink it black.  The coffee they served here was amazing.  It was fruity and citrusy with nice acidity WITHOUT being sour.  I have not encountered coffee like this before.
-----
Update:  Just found out the coffee is from Equator out of San Rafael!
-----
Plow, I'll visit you again.  2 hour flight, rental car, 30 minute wait, and all.  I'll come again.

excerpts: You can never go wrong with their basic breakfast sampler of crispy seasoned potatoes, eggs any style (I get them as whites scrambled with cheddar) with your choice of apple chicken sausage, nueske bacon or (...can't remember the other choice) along with 2 very perfect lemon ricotta pancakes with real maple syrup.
nueske bacon.author: Cameron T.
nueske bacon.review:
My favorite breakfast in the peninsula, well actually, in the whole Bay Area. Very simple and delicious menu. I've tried the eggs Benedict with smoked salmon. Wow! What I'm having today and on most visits here is The Plow. You can never go wrong with their basic breakfast sampler of crispy seasoned potatoes, eggs any style (I get them as whites scrambled with cheddar) with your choice of apple chicken sausage, nueske bacon or (...can't remember the other choice) along with 2 very perfect lemon ricotta pancakes with real maple syrup. Yum! 

It's always busy here but well worth the wait (usually 45min-1hr in the weekends)

excerpts: The Plow: two eggs, choice of house made pork sausage, Nueske bacon, or chicken apple sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes with pure maple syrup, and some crispy potatoes.
The boy got his with the sugar pie pumpkin pancakes (instead of the lemon ricotta) and they were just as heavenly--if not better.
nueske bacon.author: Adena B.
nueske bacon.review:
"Hour and a half wait," says Randall.

"No worries, we'll wait it out," I told him. He smiled and handed me some coffee to pass the time. He also pointed down the street and shared a tip: "Rico makes some killer Bloody Marys. In case you're interested."

Of COURSE I'm interested, Randall. We wasted a good 45 minutes at Blooms Saloon, (http://www.yelp.com/biz/blooms-saloon-san-francisco#hrid:g60JAte3LvIB4-uJ8CCUXw) then headed back to wait out the remainder of the time. 

EATS
+The Plow: two eggs, choice of house made pork sausage, Nueske bacon, or chicken apple sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes with pure maple syrup, and some crispy potatoes. The boy got his with the sugar pie pumpkin pancakes (instead of the lemon ricotta) and they were just as heavenly--if not better. We both opted for the bacon--and it was just OK; kinda smokey.

DRANKS
+Mimosas: watered down and not that great; especially not after that spicy Bloody Mary.
+Coffee: San Raf's finest, Equator coffee. Excellent.

Service was good, Randall made it great. Will I be back? Probably not, but happy to have tested it out to see what the hype was all about.

excerpts: My cousin and her husband had 'the Plow' which consists of two eggs, two pancakes, and they decided on the Nueske bacon.
My partner ordered the lemon ricotta pancakes and I decided on the corned beef hash with yukon gold potatoes, chillies, and two eggs.
nueske bacon.author: Simon K.
nueske bacon.review:
I was craving a very good breakfast, flying in the night before and dodging all the Black Friday madness of everyone shopping my cousin and her husband brought us here for a good start to our day. Lacking sleep already and a night of turkey I needed something to bring a good morning 'ring' to my day as I was tired, and mediocre was not going to do, thankfully I have a cousin who knows about food, and still remembering from years before on how she took me to places, I could put my faith in her to deliver.

She said that this place usually has line-ups going up the block (as this place is located on a hill), so to get here early, we arrived at 8 AM, the place was not empty, but it wasn't packed, probably being a holiday. It was a charming little place with real high ceilings, very bright white walls, defined by natural wood tables. It's a very happy, bright look, with the open kitchen concept that seems standard nowadays with new restaurants.

Once we sat down, we were presented the menu, and looking at that pageful of items to order, the problem was to decide on what to order. From pancakes, eggs, bacon, granola, sandwiches and salads, everything looked so good. My cousin and her husband had 'the Plow' which consists of two eggs, two pancakes, and they decided on the Nueske bacon. My partner ordered the lemon ricotta pancakes and I decided on the corned beef hash with yukon gold potatoes, chillies, and two eggs. As it wasn't that busy when we were here, the orders came quite quickly.

Speaking on my dish of hash browns, this was pefectly done, little bits of pefectly cooked potatoes mixed with strands of corned beef, and this was the stuff on the bottom of the plate. You could taste the freshness of the ingredients mixed with some chili to provide a kick, this was under the two sunny side eggs that were laid on top of the hash, welcoming me to breakfast like a set of eyes. Two small pieces of bread were laid on the top side of the eggs and I was ready to devour like a monster looking at this thing. My partner's pancakes were fluffy and had a good dense chew. I remember a smile everytime I took a bite, and I also remember my partners fork constantly coming over to my plate picking at little pieces of potato and meat.

Another thing that was damn good was the bacon here, whatever farmer they are getting this stuff from, it's like crack. I love the look that my partner had when she took a bite. One of those breakfast joints that if I was to be back in San Francisco I would check it out. From what I heard from my cousin, come early, or wait, but when was waiting for good food wrong.

excerpts: I ordered the Plow, which came with 2 eggs, choice of Nueske bacon, house made pork sausage, or chicken apple sausage, 2 of their famous lemon ricotta pancakes, and crispy potatoes.
I chose the pork sausage.
The portions were just right.
My 2 eggs were nicely formed in a circle that they must have used a circle mold.
The pork sausage were basically patties, but they were really tasty.
You can taste the fennel with a little spice.
The best part was the lemon ricotta pancakes.
They were EXCELLENT!!
It just melted in my mouth; very moist.
With just a little bit of syrup, it's like dessert.
I had seen Yelp reviews about them and they were right!
You HAVE to try these!
Potatoes were nice and crispy.
nueske bacon.author: Erica S.
nueske bacon.review:
My friend picked this place for a recent brunch.  It was a 45 minute wait, but it was DEFINITELY worth it!  They don't accept reservations so you either have to wait or eat elsewhere.  Seems they're only open for brunch/lunch, no dinner.  

The interior is nice and clean.  Service is pretty friendly although I was slightly bothered when our female server decided to take my guy friend and my husband's order before mine.  What happened to ladies first?!

Started off with coffee and their fried doughnut holes.  One order came with 3.  They were good, but nothing too special.  Let them cool before you munch on them.  

I ordered the Plow, which came with 2 eggs, choice of Nueske bacon, house made pork sausage, or chicken apple sausage, 2 of their famous lemon ricotta pancakes, and crispy potatoes.  I chose the pork sausage.  The portions were just right.  My 2 eggs were nicely formed in a circle that they must have used a circle mold.  The pork sausage were basically patties, but they were really tasty.  You can taste the fennel with a little spice.  The best part was the lemon ricotta pancakes.  They were EXCELLENT!!  It just melted in my mouth; very moist.  With just a little bit of syrup, it's like dessert.  I had seen Yelp reviews about them and they were right!  You HAVE to try these!  Potatoes were nice and crispy.  Everything was so good, I finished my whole plate!

My husband had the Short Rib Hash and that was tasty as well.  Have to come back again!!!  Thanks, Richard for taking us here!

excerpts: - Fried egg sandwich: fried eggs with runny yolk, cheddar, Nueske bacon (in honor of National Bacon Day!), with a little bit of frisee
so you feel less guilty about the other contents of the sandwich.
The bun was light, and it was a well balanced sandwich.
- Chicken tinga: fried corn tortillas topped with shredded chicken and two fried eggs, topped with a chipotle tomato sauce and avocado.
nueske bacon.author: Marilyn T.
nueske bacon.review:
The line is always ridiculous, but at least they'll serve you alcohol while you wait.  We were initially quoted an hour, then it became 90 min when we checked back in, and I think ultimately it took about 2 hours to get a table even though we arrived around 10am.  We were able to put our name down and come back, but they won't call your phone, so you have to come back and check in. We actually missed being called, but they kept us at the top of the list. 

The champagne pours they gave us in paper cups while we waited were VERY generous, so that definitely helped the wait significantly.

We started with a sausage biscuit, which was a buttery flaky biscuit with melted cheese and a sausage patty. The sausage had really good flavor, and this really hit the spot because we were all starving.

- Fried egg sandwich: fried eggs with runny yolk, cheddar, Nueske bacon (in honor of National Bacon Day!), with a little bit of frisee so you feel less guilty about the other contents of the sandwich.  The bun was light, and it was a well balanced sandwich.
- Chicken tinga: fried corn tortillas topped with shredded chicken and two fried eggs, topped with a chipotle tomato sauce and avocado. I was craving something with tomato sauce and runny yolks, so this was perfect
- Crispy potatoes: amazingly crisp (possibly deep fried?) and very well seasoned, plus there's a hint of thyme, which makes them really stand out among all the home fries I've ever had

Food was really good, and it's nice that they can serve you alcohol while you wait, but I don't think I would wait 2 hours again.

excerpts: The Plow with the two eggs, Nueske bacon, chicken apple sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes and potatoes was a total brunch that had everything you need and desire.
The bacon and sausage were good salty, sweet and meaty, while the pancakes definitely were the highlight.
nueske bacon.author: T L.
nueske bacon.review:
(See pics) Review #1192. Great all local purveyors ingredients brunch that brightens up any gloomy day or energizes a sunny day.

The day we visited, they were out of monkey bread so we opted for corn millet muffin which was good.

The Plow with the two eggs, Nueske bacon, chicken apple sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes and potatoes was a total brunch that had everything you need and desire. The bacon and sausage were good salty, sweet and meaty, while the pancakes definitely were the highlight. Eggs were prepared perfectly to my likeness.

As mentioned many times in my other reviews, I love locally roasted beans. Equator coffee was earthy and was happily light roasted.

My friend had the fried egg on Acme bun that was hearty and freshly tasted.

Mimosa was nice but more orange juice than sparkling wine.

Many had wondered about the San Francisco style long wait and yes even on a rainy weekend we we visited. However, the server was extremely helpful and actually told us not to go get coffee up the street because there would be a table coming up shortly and if those who were not there while called, they would lose the spot. Amazing enough, we only waited for 10 minutes. While the place was completely packed, service was super friendly and perky, we were never rushed to finish, though we were considerate to not hold up the tables.

Do wish they were closer to public transit stops.

excerpts: -a meat of your choice (chicken apple sausage, Nueske bacon, homemade pork sausage)-I got 2 sized chicken apple sausages, yum.
-2 lemony cricket ricotta pancakes- fresh, lemony, pillowy, light, lovely pancakes
nueske bacon.author: Angela W.
nueske bacon.review:
PLOOWWW ON DOWN, LIKE TAHHHH DOWW!!! Like, uhhh now.

ULTIMATE PLOW $15 (which is lovely, as you get a little bit of everything, esp those crunchy potatoes and deeeeelectable lemon ricotta pancakes, sweet and savory OR savory with dessert!!):

- 2 eggs (served however you'd like)-I got mine sunny side up and they were perfectly cooked, ooey gooey in the middle
-so crispy crispity potatoes- did I mention these are CRISPY? It's like they triple fry em.
-a meat of your choice (chicken apple sausage, Nueske bacon, homemade pork sausage)-I got 2 sized chicken apple sausages, yum.
-2 lemony cricket ricotta pancakes- fresh, lemony, pillowy, light, lovely pancakes, you can definitely taste the lemon and the ricotta.

-1 star as this place is a little pretentious. Hosts were somewhat snobby and had their noses all up in the air like it was the freaking Catalina wine mixer. Gee whiz, it seemed like such a privilege just to be put on the wait list. 

HOT TIP!!:
GO @ 1:40ishPM on a Sunday afternoon. (just not on a day when I'M trying to go..) This way you can take it easy, have a lazy sunday, sleep in, get it "in", do ya thang, whatevs, and still make it to brunch. Most likely, and you will not have to wait a ridiculous amount of time. Luckily for us, we were able to get our name on the list, grabbed coffee at Farleys, and returned right back to have our name called in 5 mins!! *When they say, don't stray too far away, they mean it. A couple of dudes doing bromantic brunch together didn't get back in time and had their table given away but STILL waited another 30 mins!

Can't wait to get plowed again!!

excerpts: I had: the plow  two eggs, choice of Nueske bacon, house made pork sausage, or chicken apple sausage,
nueske bacon.author: Ming-Jou C.
nueske bacon.review:
If you want to sit next to a bitch for a really good brunch, Plow is the place for you. Well, it was for me on a nice, cool Sunday mid-morning. The lack of star perfection wasn't due to her, it was the 1-hour wait for a table, but hey, you learn to expect that at places in SF that don't take reservations. They don't take parties greater than 6. 

Situated on a corner in Potrero Hill, Plow is small inside with just as many seats outside. The reason for the bitch, is that they have 2-person tables lined up along the wall of the restaurant and well, I had to get in to the inner table for my seat. I asked her nicely if she could move her chair in, well, she moved her butt, not moving the chair and barely at that. So basically I just shoved past her. Good thing I was sitting next to her and didn't have to stare at her sour-puss face the entire meal like DK did sitting across from her. Anyway, she made for good conversation.

Onto the food...once we were seated, our waitress took a while to bring us our waters and by then we were ready to order. You really can't go wrong with a breakfast place that has a pig sign under the name of their restaurant. Mmmm.....oink.

I had: the plow  two eggs, choice of Nueske bacon, house made pork sausage, or chicken apple sausage, two pancakes + crispy potatoes  14

DK had: max's biscuits + gravy  two buttermilk biscuits, pork sausage gravy, crispy potatoes  11

It came out fairly quickly and it was GOOD. The bacon was plentiful and was cooked just right, the pancakes had this lemony hint to them and were on the smaller size, but that's because they're not your average pancakes. They were really good though, but kind of had a french toast consistency and about the size of English muffins. The potatoes had some sort of Saffron or something on them, because they were as yellow as my egg yolks, but boy, were they good. I normally leave potatoes untouched on my plate (except for the hash brown kind), but these were awesome and just the right amount of crispy.

DK's biscuits and gravy were really good and the gravy was coma-inducing. 

I really enjoyed my breakfast, sans bitch. There's a multitude of breakfast places in SF, and many are good one-morning stands, but this one I would go on a second date with.

excerpts: I got mine with two eggs sunny side up, Nueske bacon, and the standard crispy potatoes and lemon ricotta pancakes.
Nueske bacon is bacon in some of its awesomest form.
The crispy potatoes had a hint of rosemary for an added dimension of flavor.
The lemon ricotta pancakes featured a light lemon flavor and were a little dense yet still fluffy and really delicious (I really liked these pancakes).
nueske bacon.author: Erich D.
nueske bacon.review: When at Plow get the plow!  It's a seriously good breakfast/brunch entree that won't have you feeling overly stuffed or gross afterwards; perfect mix of savory and sweet items on your plate and just the right amount.  I got mine with two eggs sunny side up, Nueske bacon, and the standard crispy potatoes and lemon ricotta pancakes.  Nueske bacon is bacon in some of its awesomest form.  The crispy potatoes had a hint of rosemary for an added dimension of flavor.  The lemon ricotta pancakes featured a light lemon flavor and were a little dense yet still fluffy and really delicious (I really liked these pancakes).

excerpts: The Plow-- two eggs, choice of Nueske bacon, house made pork sausage, or chicken apple sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes, crispy potatoes
two eggs fried, aioli, frisee, Vermont cheddar, Acme bun  10.75
add Nueske bacon
The lemon ricotta pancakes had a cake-like consistency and tons of flavor.
My only complaint about the pancakes was that they were way too small!
The potatoes?
Best freaking breakfast potatoes
I've ever had.
They were flavorful, crispy, and oh so good!
I also tasted my boyfriend's Fried Egg Sandwich was was also, very good.
The total came out to be about $30 something for breakfast.. a little pricy, but totally worth it!
nueske bacon.author: Joyce E.
nueske bacon.review:
Plow is absolutely delicious! I came here for my boyfriend's birthday brunch. The wait was about 15 minutes for two on a Thursday afternoon at around 1pm. The hostess/server was very nice and assured us that we would be seated soon. Since Plow is, as they describe "modest in size" definitely expect to get seated literally inches away from some random people. Anyways! Since we looked at the menu beforehand, we received our orders within 15 minutes. Pretty fast! I also want to mention that the wait went by quickly since my boyfriend and I were watching the cooks cook/prepare the food in the open kitchen. I ordered the Plow while my boyfriend settled on the Fried Egg sandwich.

Their water was served in jugs! My favorite. :)

(From their menu)

The Plow-- two eggs, choice of Nueske bacon, house made pork sausage, or chicken apple sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes, crispy potatoes  14.5

Fried egg sandwich -- two eggs fried, aioli, frisee, Vermont cheddar, Acme bun  10.75  add Nueske bacon  12.75

The Plow was SO good! The eggs were on the watery/yolky side which I didn't mind. The bacon tasted exactly like how my mom makes it -- It was sweet and not too crispy. The lemon ricotta pancakes had a cake-like consistency and tons of flavor. My only complaint about the pancakes was that they were way too small! The potatoes? Best freaking breakfast potatoes I've ever had. They were flavorful, crispy, and oh so good! I also tasted my boyfriend's Fried Egg Sandwich was was also, very good. The total came out to be about $30 something for breakfast.. a little pricy, but totally worth it!

excerpts: The bacon was the BEST part of the meal, when we told our server she actually let us know that the owner is from Wisconsin and the Nueske bacon is smoked bacon from their home-state.
nueske bacon.author: Meredith S.
nueske bacon.review:
This place is popular. My girlfriend and I arrived for brunch and there was about a 30 minute wait. Once seated, it was easy because we had 3 dogs with us and we were able to sit outside. 

Service was good, our server was upbeat and fun. It was pretty busy, so our water refills were a bit slow, but other than it was good. Our server told us about the homemade dog treats create by the chef and brought some out for the pups. 

The food was totally yummy. We ordered the Eggs Benedict, the Lemon Ricotta Pancakes with crispy potatoes, eggs, bacon and sausage. 

The hollandaise received my approval, but I wasn't that impressed with the ham. 

The crispy potatoes were addictive, and are best described and breakfast-french-fries. Perfect with the over-medium eggs. 

The pancakes were so delicious, again, I'm not a big fan on pancakes but they were light and really really good. 

The bacon was the BEST part of the meal, when we told our server she actually let us know that the owner is from Wisconsin and the Nueske bacon is smoked bacon from their home-state. 

The breakfast sausage was also really good and fennel-y. 

We will be back for more and more and more.

excerpts: Plow is not a greasy spoon, so it is not going to satisfy palates accustomed to heavier fare, but if you are hungry, the Plow dish (two eggs, choice of house made pork sausage, Nueske bacon, or chicken apple sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes + crispy potatoes) is a great choice for people who are not on any restricted diets.
nueske bacon.author: Kristina P.
nueske bacon.review:
It's true that the wait for breakfast at Plow is usually long, but the line-up there is packed because people want to eat well prepared and healthy food that is fresh, local, and organic. The demand is therefore high. If you're an early riser, I'd recommend arriving at Plow at opening time in order to avoid the wait. 

I eat rather "clean" by following a Paleo/SCD diet, which advocates avoiding starches and consuming high quality meats, vegs, and fruits. Plow serves delicious meals that easily fit in with this eating philosophy. The Two Eggs dish is a great option for people following this diet. Note that the staff can swap the potatoes with greens.

Service and atmosphere are both very good. 

Plow is not a greasy spoon, so it is not going to satisfy palates accustomed to heavier fare, but if you are hungry, the Plow dish (two eggs, choice of house made pork sausage, Nueske bacon, or chicken apple sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes + crispy potatoes) is a great choice for people who are not on any restricted diets.

excerpts: The nueske bacon makes it a tad better.
The acme bun was lovely.
nueske bacon.author: Ellie J.
nueske bacon.review:
Sitting atop Potrero Hill on the corner surrounded by trees and benches is Plow. It is a small, hip, and trendy brunch spot. Their menu changes weekly, so come back often. The boast fresh organic produce from local farms, which is the norm in San Francisco, but not the standard.

Their french toast is crunchy outside with a custard-like creaminess inside, delicately sweet and garnished with fresh berries and a brulee'd banana. Served with subtle sweet Vermont syrup (not too sweet, not too thick, just perfect syrup). 

Lemon ricotta pancakes is my favorite and it's one of the reasons I keep coming back. I have convinced many patrons to try their lemon ricotta pancakes when I brunch here. They are dense with pockets filled with ricotta (a light cheese, similar to mozzarella) and a subtle lemon flavor. I've tried to replicate their lemon-ricotta pancakes and while my pancakes can be similar in taste, they do not have the same thick, rich and hearty elements that Plow creates.

The eggs benedict are okay. The star of the dish is the hollandaise sauce which I feel is too zesty.  Most holllandaise sauce has a mild creamy flavor with subtle tang, however Plow's hollandaise sauce has a robust tang that overpowers the other mildly flavored components. I suspect a heavy hand in lemon juice. Poached eggs cooked to perfection. 

"The Plow" is a good way to sample all of their good things (it comes with lemon ricotta pancakes -smaller version). The potatoes are tasty but their inconsistent size makes the large pieces stand out in buttery goodness and the tiny bits too burnt to eat. Their homemade sausages are a bit dry. However, you can't go wrong with the chicken apple sausages (yum). 

The house made organic yogurt + granola with fresh fruit is not worth it. I think that it could have used more berries and less citrus fruits in my honest opinion. 

The fried egg sandwich is okay. The nueske bacon makes it a tad better. The acme bun was lovely. Everything else was standard. 

The dungenous crab scramble was tasty. It had hearty pieces of crab meat. Definitely a go to dish to try. But I think it's a bit pricey at $17. 

The almond pancake was disappointing. I didn't taste any flavor of almond. But I suppose that it is a fan for gluten-free eaters. 

The counter seating is quite small and can be uncomfortable, however that's where you get to see the magic of everything being cooked. I like sitting outside because it's quieter. Inside its warm and loud. 

Price wise, I think it's expensive. IMO, I think that brunch should be $10 and under. Many of the dishes here can be made at home for the fraction of the price. The prices here $10-$17 per meal. Not including extra such as drinks or side dishes. The coffee alone is a whopping $3.75.

Overall, I think that the food is prepared well and presented beautifully. I will return because think their lemon ricotta pancakes are delicious. However, the prices, long wait, and hit-or-miss customer service pushes the over all rating down.

excerpts: The plow is two eggs, choice of house made pork sausage, Nueske bacon, or chicken apple sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes + crispy potatoes.
nueske bacon.author: Jayne A.
nueske bacon.review:
If you are indecisive (like me) get the plow so you can get a taste of everything. The plow is two eggs, choice of house made pork sausage, Nueske bacon, or chicken apple sausage, two lemon ricotta pancakes + crispy potatoes.

The pancakes sound weird but they are definitely worth trying. The home fries are unique since they have both crunchy and chunky pieces. There are small pieces that are basically French fries and others that are like home fries. It is an awesome mix since you usually only get home fries for breakfast. All in all a wonderful start to my Sunday. 

Although the wait was pretty long, the service was great so I am more than willing to come back for the plow anytime.

excerpts: In this case it was "The Plow" (two of their lemon ricotta pancakes, two eggs, Nueske bacon and crispy potatoes).
This is my usual breakfast choice anyways--like pancakes but gotta have breakfast meat and potatoes or hash browns!
Even though food took some time coming out, my table was happy with our orders.
The savory bread pudding was a hit as was the BLT, hamburger and egg sandwich.
The table also shared an order of the French toast which all seemed to enjoy and describe as a hybrid with bread pudding.
I was too full so resisted trying it.
nueske bacon.author: Christopher W.
nueske bacon.review:
First off, couldn't resist a "Go Aggies!"--I did not know that Plow was co-owned by a fellow Aggie, until my friend Mindy pointed it out.  Very cool to see Aggie alum out and doing what they are passionate about. :-)

I stumbled upon Plow using Yelp Nearby on my Android phone in Dec '10 when my buddies and I finished up the Anchor Steam brewery tour.  Unfortunately at that point people decided it was easier to go back to The Marina (joy.)  Since then I have been wanting to check out Plow purely for the solid reviews and the lemon ricotta pancakes! :-)

When we decided to grab breakfast in SF this weekend, I suggested it and even though it was off the beaten path, people thought we should check it out!  My buddy Richard made it on time (9:30am) when we said we would meet and put in our name for a table of 6.  A little over an hour later we sat down.  The kitchen was bustling and people seemed to be enjoying their food!

I usually order what I first put my eye on.  In this case it was "The Plow" (two of their lemon ricotta pancakes, two eggs, Nueske bacon and crispy potatoes).  This is my usual breakfast choice anyways--like pancakes but gotta have breakfast meat and potatoes or hash browns!  Even though food took some time coming out, my table was happy with our orders.  The savory bread pudding was a hit as was the BLT, hamburger and egg sandwich.  The table also shared an order of the French toast which all seemed to enjoy and describe as a hybrid with bread pudding.  I was too full so resisted trying it.  Next time.

One of the great perks (for all coffee drinkers) is that they allow you/and even offer you coffee while you are waiting!  Didn't see if they actually ended up charging for it.  Regardless it's a nice gesture.  

Great to see business so solid, and if there was a way to get the wait down, I will be highly likely to return!

excerpts: Because it's a small cafe, the noise factor in the restaurant can get high and wait on the weekends can be discouraging as families & couples from the neighborhood make their pilgrimage to 18th Street to get smooth roasted coffee, yummy lemon ricotta pancakes, zesty chicken tinga and Nueske bacon.
We left pleasantly content, not full or overwhelmed.
nueske bacon.author: Shari K.
nueske bacon.review:
A perfect quaint cafe in Potrero Hill.  Let's be honest, San Francisco is a breakfast city.  For Plow to be open for breakfast & lunch is just right.  Because it's a small cafe, the noise factor in the restaurant can get high and wait on the weekends can be discouraging as families & couples from the neighborhood make their pilgrimage to 18th Street to get smooth roasted coffee, yummy lemon ricotta pancakes, zesty chicken tinga and Nueske bacon.  We left pleasantly content, not full or overwhelmed.  If you're set on making a weekend visit, you'll need to find that sweet-spot of a time if you don't want to walk through an agility course of strollers and high-chairs to have your meal.

If you want to avoid the lines, your best bet is to go on a weekday.  Plow is open from 7am on the weekdays so you can still get your douse of a wonderful breakfast without the wait and bustle.  The staff is friendly.  Having come from the service industry myself, I'm quick to sense & appreciate it when people "like" what they do.  That makes the whole experience (and meal) that more enjoyable!

excerpts: Looking forward to coming back to Plow ASAP to try their Fried Egg Sandwich, The Plow (two eggs, choice of Nueske bacon, house made pork sausage, or chicken apple sausage, two pancakes & crispy potatoes), and/or a Chocolate Eclair.
nueske bacon.author: Tiffany M.
nueske bacon.review:
I'm not one to vouch for restaurants that often, but in Plow's case, I guarantee that you'll like it... in fact, you'll LOVE it. I should also note that I almost never rate a place 5 stars based on a first time visit, but Plow was so freakin' good, that I feel confident in giving them 5 shiny stars.

Everything at Plow tasted just as good as it looked.

Standouts included:
+Lemon Ricotta Pancakes (house made ricotta, lemon zest, pure maple syrup) 
+Tinga (chicken in tomato chipotle sauce, two crispy corn tortillas, avocado, creme fraiche, cilantro)
+Crispy Potatoes

Mid-conversation, my friend let out a big 'MMMM!!!!" when he bit into his pancakes. I couldn't have agreed more! 

I like the fact that they work w/ local purveyors such as Frog Hollow Farms, Cowgirl Creamery, Monterey Fish Co, Acme Bread & Tcho Chocolate. When you see that they work w/ such local all-stars, you know you're in for a treat. I also really enjoyed Plow's Equator coffee while I waited for our table. And that wait was long! We came in at 11:30 am and had to wait an hour until we were seated. Normally I'd shoot for a much earlier brunch time to avoid the wait, but given that I was prepared for a leisurely Sunday brunch, the wait was pretty painless.

I love the ambiance of this place. It's small, but w/ their high ceilings and all the light that shines in from their big windows, they're able to make the space work; especially decorated in its rustic, modern, simplistic fashion. I love their signage, logo and menu- all well done. They also have stool seating where you can watch the chefs work their magic (like we did!)

The host was cool and our server efficient. Parking was ample (not surprising for Portrero Hill ) and diners seemed to be all SF locals. 

Looking forward to coming back to Plow ASAP to try their Fried Egg Sandwich, The Plow (two eggs, choice of Nueske bacon, house made pork sausage, or chicken apple sausage, two pancakes & crispy potatoes), and/or a Chocolate Eclair.

This place makes me thankful for SF's amazing food scene!

excerpts: The nueske bacon was pretty good, too!
I would definitely go back...
maybe on a weekday when it may be a bit on the slower side of things.
nueske bacon.author: Racquel R.
nueske bacon.review:
Love, love, love this place!  Very easy access to get to off of the 280.  Cute quaint residential neighborhood.  Restaurant is at bottom of a hill. Got there at 8:30 am on a Sunday and there was already a line.  Parking was easy at that hour.  If you park on the hill, you park at 90 degrees to the curb. 
This was a birthday brunch with a girlfriend - based on review from other Yelpers and we expected a wait.  But it wasn't so bad. We were seated within a half an hour at the counter for the two of us.  No doubt about it, it's a small restaurant, but they've got their system down. The kitchen is busy and the owner and the wait staff have it down pat.  Service was quick and attentive.  We got our food quickly as well.
We both had the plow breakfast. I had it with scrambled eggs and the nueske bacon(applewood smoked bacon from Wisconsin -where the owner is from), and the best pancakes I've had in a long time. I love the lemon ricotta pancakes people have raved about!  I love the texture, flavor, and it's just amazing.  The nueske bacon was pretty good, too!  
I would definitely go back...maybe on a weekday when it may be a bit on the slower side of things.

excerpts: And override the ham on the Benedict w/ Nueske bacon.
Huge upgrade you'll thank me latr.
Best brunch ever
nueske bacon.author: Jeremy G.
